29.description: {meh, I've experienced better...}This place came recommended by a friend of mine.  After a perfect day at the beach we decided to head here for a quick bite to reenergize ourselves so we could continue on and enjoy our evening.  We arrived to an empty restaurant.  We asked to be seated outside and also asked for a phone charger...talk about attitude.  WOW.  Its 2015, is this not a common request?  anyway, our server continued on to deliver more than a lackluster service.  We asked for a mango/strawberry margarita but were told NO.  WHY you ask?  bc they use a pre-made mix...we also asked for Don Julio...you will get what they give you...period.  they also changed servers on us without telling us.  We had to flag them down for anything and everything we needed.  The food could've gotten 4 stars easily, but the poor service left me so distracted from actually enjoying my meal.  Adios Felipe.

42.description: Lovely outdoor seating area, byob, and great food! came here with my mom and had a great time. The food here is WAY better then the other Cesars resturants. I will definately be back to enjoy the patio!

23.description: This is my favorite place to eat. The servers are well spoken, sincere, and kind. The staff is always quick to greet and seat and satisfy. The outside area in the back has a nice atmosphere and is usually never crowded. The drink selection is ok, though I always just grab a Dos XX. No complaints.The food is memorising. My top orders are Fish tacos--the best you'll ever have--the Steak burrito, simply clean and delicious. And the mini burritos-slightly different, but delicious nonetheless.Lastly, all the food comes with a extraordinary house soup, and chips and salsa. Highly recommend this place.

8.description: The space is great--contemporary and comfortable, good lighting, inviting long bar, mix of high and low table. Overall nice vibe and very attentive service. But food is marginal at best. Local taquerias have such tasty Mexican delights, but here, the eats are bland as bland can be. My friend and I both agreed each of our entrees was pretty tasteless. Sorry, Cescas! We really enjoyed our evening but won't be back for the food.

31.description: We always have a good meal here.  Love their pork ribs with salsa verde sauce.  Very delicious!!  Great friendly & attentive service.  Salvador always takes good care of us.They do have a nice patio settings in the back.  Most people prefer to dine in the back.  Give them a try!!

34.description: I really liked this place.  The ambience is very laid back with nice touches like exposed brick, and cool modern hanging light fixtures.  They don't have a liquor license at this time, but bring your own tequila and they have the mixes on hand for your margaritas.  Our server was excellent and really went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable.  There were three people in my party and she brought out three complimentary bowls of chicken soup.  Oooops!  There were no meat-eaters at our table but we really appreciated that super nice gesture.  We had guacamole and salsa with chips as an appetizer.  The guac was really, really good, and is made fresh daily.  My veggie wrap was tasty and I liked that the spinach wrap was lightly grilled.  Unfortunately it was raining buckets so we couldn't sit out back on the patio.  The sun came out when we were finished with the meal so we got to take a peek outside.  Let me tell you the patio area is really beautiful.  I'm sure having a cold one outside on the patio would be like a mini vacation.  I plan on heading back on a nice night to sit outside.

16.description: Great little place here in Andersonville.  Staff is very welcoming and very friendly. The owner is amazing and makes her way around the dining room to ensure everyone is having an amazing experience.  Food is great. Margaritas are AMAZING!

13.description: Cescas has better Mexican food than your standard taco/burrito place. The chips and salsa are good. The waiter offered us a complimentary house soup, chicken and noodles in a savory vegetable broth, which was much appreciated. The margaritas are huge, tasty, and made with big pieces of tasty fruit. I ordered the Costillas en Salsa Verde. I liked it but didn't love it (read about it below if interested). My wife got the taco dinner; she liked. The staff is friendly, the food is good, and the restaurant and bar are attractive. I would definitely come back. Long explanation of my thoughts on the costillas that you can skip without hurting my feelings:As the name says, it's ribs in a green sauce, served with tortillas and rice and beans on the side. Honestly, I don't really get this dish. There seems to be way more sauce than there is meat. But it doesn't lack meat. There's just a ton of sauce. Since it's served with tortillas, I ate it with tortillas but honestly I don't think a tortilla with a ton of sauce and a little meat brings much to the flavor game. And since it's supposed to end up in a tortilla anyways it makes me wonder why the meat is left on the bone anyways, because it's kind of burden cutting meat off ribs when you can't see where the bones are because, again, it's covered in sauce. And it's kind of hard to say how exactly the meat tastes because, again, it's covered in sauce, but the meat was tender enough. And this isn't really a complaint about the restaurant, because it was indeed ribs in green salsa competently prepared with quality ingredients. And the sauce was actually super tasty. And I know I'm doing a lot of complaining here, but I did like the dish; I just didn't love it.

11.description: WOW! I was so pleasantly surprised by my experience at Cescas. I am typically wary of more upscale Mexican places, as I frequent hole in the wall spots for my taco cravings. But the food at Cescas is both delicious and reasonably priced, with huge portions! I had the fish tacos and they were fantastic. The interior is nice and they were great about accommodating our large part of around ten. The owner is also the sweetest. The only downer about our dinner was that  the service was super slow, but I'm hoping that's due to their being fairly new. BYOB for now, this new restaurant is definitely worth checking out!

39.description: WOW! I was so pleasantly surprised by my experience at Cescas. I am typically wary of more upscale Mexican places, as I frequent hole in the wall spots for my taco cravings. But the food at Cescas is both delicious and reasonably priced, with huge portions! I had the fish tacos and they were fantastic. The interior is nice and they were great about accommodating our large part of around ten. The owner is also the sweetest. The only downer about our dinner was that  the service was super slow, but I'm hoping that's due to their being fairly new. BYOB for now, this new restaurant is definitely worth checking out!

37.description: This review is only for the next 10 days: They are byob for now so we asked if they had margarita mix. She said yes for seven dollars. So, we bought a bottle and ordered a pitcher. Turns out that seven dollars is for a glass of margarita mix. So how much for a pitcher? Twenty-four dollars. Our bill was over sixty dollars for two entrees and we paid another twenty-six for the tequila. Just fyi if you thought it would be an inexpensive dinner and drinks for two.

0.description: Nice little place, with very friendly and attentive service. Good atmosphere and vibe, and very reasonable prices. Chips and salsa were very good.  Lots of vegetarian options. Will defientley be going back and can't wait to see the patio in the summer.

38.description: Came here for lunch and had fish tacos and piña colada.Pro: the service was good and the server was friendlyCon : over price piña colada $5 and the food taste ok. Not coming back tho

27.description: I was kind of bummed out by this place. Went in on a Saturday night for margaritas. Tried ordering a margarita with Don Julio, and the bartender informed us that the margaritas are premixed with Sauza, and that there are no substitutions. What! This restaurant has the word 'Margarita' in their name, and are using a premix? I'm nearly certain that this premix is not made with Sauza, judging by the instaheadache I got halfway through it. The chips were OK - the salsa was watered down by way too much tomato sauce. We didn't order food since we were going to the Margarita Bar for margaritas. The bar shelves are also lined with 6 oz bottles of Sutter Home. So I guess we won't be having the wine either... Maybe the food is good, but this certainly is not a place you go for drinks.

32.description: The food and margaritas here are great!!! I don't understand why there is not a line around the block for people to get in. If you haven't been, you're missing out!

44.description: I went a few weeks ago, and here's the rundown...A whole lotta drama led Cesar (of Cesar's [killer margaritas the size of your head]) and his partner to open this place as he was suddenly no longer a part of his namesake restaurant. Then, he passed away :(. His partner has been running this restaurant ever since. Apparently, this is why there was (still may be) still a wait for the liquor license. The food is amazing! I had some chicken in mole which was delicious, my friends had some fish tacos and enchiladas. Everything was great. The food here is ON POINT! It's BYOB until they have a liquor license again, but worth a try still, especially since there aren't too many mex options in this area.

24.description: No, No, No.     One of the ethnic options in Andersonville.   We decided to try al fresco dining while getting some free chips and salsa.  The patio in the back is ample and well laid out, but the service and food are not very good.  It took forever for them to get us a basket of chips, the water glasses were never refilled, unless I flagged down the waitress, the service was very very slow.    My friend Kevin got at Margarita on the rocks, which was very good...but...the problem was the food.    I ordered the ribs and my friends each got fajitas...all three of them were Salty...Salty....Salty.   You would think these people have stock in the Morton Salt Company !!!    I could not eat my dish, so I asked the waiter to get me a bowl of hot water, so I can dunk my ribs in it and take some of the salt off.    He said, that he would fix it.    He took the plate back to the kitchen..and a while later...an equally salty plate was put in front of me. The waiter was nice enough to try to fix it, but I still had to dunk my ribs in my glass of cold water to get the salt off.     You know, salt shakers are on the table...salt is easy to add on.....it is more difficult to get rid off.      When I asked for the bill, I noticed that he took my meal off the bill, which is a nice gesture, but the food experience was so bad for me....Never, Never, Never again.

7.description: Went back on Friday. Had coconut margaritas and chicken mole nachos!!!! Holy cow they were really good. Then made the mistake of ordering a meal. We brought most of that home. We should have just had the appetizers. The service was great as always. Every time we finished a plate or bowl the servers came by at took it. We then ordered the flan of course we finished that. We plan on bringing our friends there. The place was busy but not crowded so we will not have to wait for a table. When we were leaving even the staff who didn't wait our table said goodbye.

40.description: We enjoyed the entrees we ordered... nice people working there.  Love the back patio.  We'll be back.

30.description: Wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. So I suggested to my friend this place. I'm all about service. We were greeted nicely and placed outside in the back. 5 stars on the table and rocking chairs. However, the 2 workers yesterday were off on their service. Our waitress was a young lady...we asked if we can get a classic margarita on the rocks made with Don Julio. Her answer was straight flat out NO. She said that all the margaritas were pre-made. But why is there a full bar with a bartender. Maybe only 7 people on the entire place. So time wasn't an issue ....She said said NO. Then i asked if we can have a strawberry mango blend margarita. She then replied. We can't do it. I'mSorry. I wasn't aware you can fill half of the cup with the PRE-MADE  margarita and the other half with PRE-MADE margarita. She was just rude so I asked for a strawberry one anyway. I give that a 2 stars. Chicken fajitas were at 4 stars. (Pretty good) Chips & Salsa fresh and yummy but they weren't replenishing as often and we always had to flag them down. Only nice thing they did was charge my phone but even then the guy that took it wasn't nice and a bit rude. Sorry for the 3 stars but that's what I rate the service. Maybe it was a bad and I just wanted a fresh amazing classic margarita. Hate to see what this place would be on a busy day or just with 5 tables booked. Sad but it's true. AdiosXo,Margarita babe

1.description: I went here with the wife for some much needed Mexican. The food was good, but it needed to be better seasoned. We had to add a lot of hot sauce.  I get that people in the Midwest can't handle spicy food, but this restaurant went too far in the mild direction.But that doesn't make this a bad restaurant.  I would probably go back.  We started with queso and it was very good - a delicious blob of cheese.  The cheese was served with tortillas that were excellent and arrived at the table hot.  I had tostadas and liked them.  The wife had tamales and said they were okay.  Service here is excellent.  We were here on a Monday and it was slow and quiet.  There is a nice bar and this place is billed as a margarita place, but we didn't try them.  I would need to come back here on a busier night to comment on this place as a night spot.

9.description: We always have a good meal here.  Love their pork ribs with salsa verde sauce.  Very delicious!!  Great friendly & attentive service.  Salvador always takes good care of us.They do have a nice patio settings in the back.  Most people prefer to dine in the back.  Give them a try!!

26.description: brought a group of 6 at 9ish they close at 10 - because - yes, we ARE that table and we were starved. Service was as pleasant as always, food rocked. Even our picky eater enjoyed his tamales.  I tried the steak burrito and shared tamales.  Plates were licked clean and everyone was happy with the choice - we will be backas to the Margaritas, when they first opened everything was fresh - but since losing and regaining their liquor licenses they went to pre-made and the quality as you would expect fell off. Not something I would order there.  Hopefully with liquor license back they will pick up where they left off and hire back the bartender and return to the type of margaritas we had when they first opened. and before the weather turns - have a meal outside on their patio - it's very nice

25.description: We went here for dinner and the food was amazing, the service was decent and everyone was very friendly. Good margarita selection and they were made very well! And, like many Mexican restaurants who do, they DIDN'T skimp out on cheese or sour cream! This place has my vote!

12.description: Love this place, we are super close and walk down all the time. The staff is great and super friendly. They know when my fam comes in to bring my girls some bean dip with the salsa. Margaritas are amazing, great price. The outside patio is so relaxing. Highly recommend!

21.description: Excellent food! They have someone who is cooking with love in here! Sit in the garden in the back if you can! Wonderful service always.

17.description: Service was accommodating and courteous.  I got a steak taco dinner after having a tough time deciding between numerous good sounding dishes.  The steak was surprisingly much better than I'd assumed it'd be.  It was very tender, juicy and seemed to have been marinated. I get steak tacos and burritos at almost every Mexican restaurant I visit and I can say the steak I had here is definitely toward the top! My plate was clean afterwards.

10.description: Went to dine in yesterday for the first time and am I glad I did! Great service, great Margaritas. descent prices!! Delicious shrimp tacos only $10!! So affordable. And we got free shots on the house. Well definitely be going back.

5.description: I'm a huge fan of sit down Mexican restaurants, and I was really excited that one was going to open up in A-ville. What I didn't expect was a beautiful outdoor patio that was nearly empty. I'm not sure how much longer they'll have it open, but it's perfect for these lovely fall days that we've been having. As for the food, I had the spinach wrap with chicken, and really loved it. The highlight of the evening, however was most likely the delicious pitcher of margarita (don't worry I shared). I think we all need to make sure that Cescas stays put in our neighborhood.

35.description: This place is wonderful. The kids menu has great choices that are actually delicious. I had a spinach wrap suizo style and it was amazing! It came with a heavenly side of creamy guacamole. My husband had steak tostadas which were also lovely. My daughter had kids steak taco. Loved it. They brought a complimentary cup of soup to start U.S. and when I tasted that, I was sold. The flavors are solid, authentic and the Portions generous. We will be back!

19.description: Wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. So I suggested to my friend this place. I'm all about service. We were greeted nicely and placed outside in the back. 5 stars on the table and rocking chairs. However, the 2 workers yesterday were off on their service. Our waitress was a young lady...we asked if we can get a classic margarita on the rocks made with Don Julio. Her answer was straight flat out NO. She said that all the margaritas were pre-made. But why is there a full bar with a bartender. Maybe only 7 people on the entire place. So time wasn't an issue ....She said said NO. Then i asked if we can have a strawberry mango blend margarita. She then replied. We can't do it. I'mSorry. I wasn't aware you can fill half of the cup with the PRE-MADE  margarita and the other half with PRE-MADE margarita. She was just rude so I asked for a strawberry one anyway. I give that a 2 stars. Chicken fajitas were at 4 stars. (Pretty good) Chips & Salsa fresh and yummy but they weren't replenishing as often and we always had to flag them down. Only nice thing they did was charge my phone but even then the guy that took it wasn't nice and a bit rude. Sorry for the 3 stars but that's what I rate the service. Maybe it was a bad and I just wanted a fresh amazing classic margarita. Hate to see what this place would be on a busy day or just with 5 tables booked. Sad but it's true. AdiosXo,Margarita babe

28.description: My husband and I were in the mood to sit outside and have a margarita the other day and found Cesca's on my iPhone map.  Yes, I did a local search for "margarita".  We only live about a mile north on Clark and somehow were unaware of Cesca's existence.  We loved the patio and the server was incredibly friendly.  We decided to eat and both ended up ordering shrimp tacos, which is rare since we never order the same thing.  So we can't speak for much else, but the margaritas and shrimp tacos were both fantastic.  We recommend paying the extra $2 for Grand Marnier in the margaritas.  Delicious.  This is our new favorite go-to place.

3.description: This is one of those places we passed by a few times after it opened and finally gave it a shot. They seem a bit lost on the full service bar concept. They push the premade margaritas and the first person we asked said you couldn't order a top shelf margarita cause they were already premade. If you probe a bit they are able to make a top shelf on rocks margarita so ask away. The food to me was very blahhhh. The chili relleno was as boring as can be bland and tasted like they use a mild mozzarella  but I am sure it was the Mexican mozzarella not the pizza kind. The fajitas where Mehhh. Overall the people are nice but quality of service and food is very average.

33.description: Went here with my good friend on a Friday evening. The customer service was exceptional. They have a beautiful patio. The drinks are pretty well made - love the lime margarita. I had two mega lime margaritas. They were delicious and I was feeling good for the night. We stayed there until they closed. The owner - I talked to her - right before I was about to leave. She was super friendly. The place was really. Got our drinks on time. I really don't have any complaints. Plus I live 10 mins away from it - now I have a place to go to for strong margarita drinks !!!! I have to try to their food tho!!

43.description: We live near here and have seen this Margarita bar/restaurant go from serving margaritas to a BYOB. Soon it will have its license again, but I have eaten here now 3 times and think the food is really good! It has a beautiful outdoor dining area and the interior is also very comfortable. The servings are very generous. I would recommend that you try it next time you have the craving for a good Mexican meal.

2.description: Review for the bar area only, no food and late night.We rolled in here one evening, for one of our famous "Just One More" nightcaps. Got an ENORMOUS margarita, poured by a friendly, great bartender. When informed that this would be the last call, he graciously gave us each a Tequila shot. I love the bar area, the decor is cute and dimly lit intimate. I'll be back. Great little place!

18.description: Great patio . I highly recommend the chicken mole' nachos. Good margaritas . Just wish we could watch the Blackhawks at the bar . No sports package on their satellite

41.description: My boyfriend and I decided it was the perfect night for margaritas so we headed to Cescas for the first time.  Wonderful service, beautiful outdoor patio, great margs, and decent food! The free chips and salsa were delish too!  Still currently BYO until they obtain their liquor license.  My only critique would be to put a nice shade in the window on the patio that looks right into the kitchen.  Overall good place and I wish the owner much success!

4.description: This places doesn't look like much from the outside, but WOW is it good food! The inside is really nice and they have a large patio in back.They also have a great variety of a menu, not like the other high end restaurant that just opened south of Clark. Plus we have a 2 yr old and they are so family friendly here. I would highly recommend to anyone who loves Mexican.

6.description: No, No, No.     One of the ethnic options in Andersonville.   We decided to try al fresco dining while getting some free chips and salsa.  The patio in the back is ample and well laid out, but the service and food are not very good.  It took forever for them to get us a basket of chips, the water glasses were never refilled, unless I flagged down the waitress, the service was very very slow.    My friend Kevin got at Margarita on the rocks, which was very good...but...the problem was the food.    I ordered the ribs and my friends each got fajitas...all three of them were Salty...Salty....Salty.   You would think these people have stock in the Morton Salt Company !!!    I could not eat my dish, so I asked the waiter to get me a bowl of hot water, so I can dunk my ribs in it and take some of the salt off.    He said, that he would fix it.    He took the plate back to the kitchen..and a while later...an equally salty plate was put in front of me. The waiter was nice enough to try to fix it, but I still had to dunk my ribs in my glass of cold water to get the salt off.     You know, salt shakers are on the table...salt is easy to add on.....it is more difficult to get rid off.      When I asked for the bill, I noticed that he took my meal off the bill, which is a nice gesture, but the food experience was so bad for me....Never, Never, Never again.

22.description: I love this place! It is definitely a go to for me when I have had a long day and could use some good food and a margarita. Some of my favorite items are the steak burrito, steak suiza enchiladas, steak fajitas, and the spinach wrap. They always give free chips and salsa and usually add a free bowl of tortilla soup. I have found the food quality to be incredibly consistent and I have never had problems with the service. Btw- if you're wavering, definitely go for the mas grande margarita. It's $12 and it is going to get you tipsy! I really like the mango margarita on the rocks, and i normally don't like flavored margaritas but i make an exception for this one. I have gone here 10+ times and I will continue to come here. Everyone I've brought here has loved it and wanted to come back. I'm surprised by the negative reviews but yelp does sometimes end up being a place to vent.

15.description: {meh, I've experienced better...}This place came recommended by a friend of mine.  After a perfect day at the beach we decided to head here for a quick bite to reenergize ourselves so we could continue on and enjoy our evening.  We arrived to an empty restaurant.  We asked to be seated outside and also asked for a phone charger...talk about attitude.  WOW.  Its 2015, is this not a common request?  anyway, our server continued on to deliver more than a lackluster service.  We asked for a mango/strawberry margarita but were told NO.  WHY you ask?  bc they use a pre-made mix...we also asked for Don Julio...you will get what they give you...period.  they also changed servers on us without telling us.  We had to flag them down for anything and everything we needed.  The food could've gotten 4 stars easily, but the poor service left me so distracted from actually enjoying my meal.  Adios Felipe.

20.description: I'm a huge fan of sit down Mexican restaurants, and I was really excited that one was going to open up in A-ville. What I didn't expect was a beautiful outdoor patio that was nearly empty. I'm not sure how much longer they'll have it open, but it's perfect for these lovely fall days that we've been having. As for the food, I had the spinach wrap with chicken, and really loved it. The highlight of the evening, however was most likely the delicious pitcher of margarita (don't worry I shared). I think we all need to make sure that Cescas stays put in our neighborhood.

36.description: The food is amazing!  Everything was fresh and delicious.   Staff was attentive and courteous.   We had the fajita quesadillas and the enchiladas suizas and it was ON POINT! The salsa verde was savory and spicy!  Highly recommend!

14.description: We've been avoiding this place because previous businesses at the same location did never seem to deliver. But we were positively surprised.Real good Mexican food, super friendly staff, freshly prepared Margarita creations. Frozen Coconut Margarita was a hit!Portions are big so consider sharing if you don't want leftovers. But who doesn't want leftovers :)Perfect Friday night spot!

58.description: Always excellent service and a fantastic product!  I stop here for holiday items and treats for work.  Never disappointed.

56.description: This bakery should be called the $wedi$h Bakery.  $4.14 for two sweet rolls--neither contained fruit, filling, frosting, or were Swedish specialties (e.g., containing cardamon).  Over $21 for a pound of biscotti. There is a large variety of breads, but no rolls, which seems odd. Their products  are tasty, but this bakery is trading on its well-established reputation and charges for it.

29.description: (NOTE: I translated this to Swedish for the Yelp 100 Challenge: Stockholm. For the English version of this review please scroll down to the original.)Kom hit för bästa traditionella europeiska bakverk i Chicago. Det är ofta trångt, särskilt runt jul. Svenskarna älskar att dricka en kopp kaffe och äta en bakelse på eftermiddagen, så mycket av priset här är för att: små läckra bakverk, kakor och krämer, som går bra med kaffe.Den svenska Bakery har också est Princess Torte jag har varje hade. Det är ett ljust grön ändå enkel tårta, rund, med en dubbel lager vit tårta och vispad grädde inuti, och en grön marsipan beläggning utanför (jag kan inte kalla det en glasyr eftersom du kan dra bort den som en hud).De erbjuder även kakor och bröd. Prova Limpa, det är smaskiga. Det finns också en lätt sötad kaffebröd kallas "Scorpa", som är smaksatt med kardemumma.Om det inte är alltför trångt att du kan ha din bakverk och kaffe här, medan du bestämmer hur många tusentals kalorier du ska ta med hem.

42.description: These guys are WONDERFUL! I worked with Lillan for about two months planing a surprise cake for my boyfriend. She was more than understanding (and SO patient) with me and my MANY emails and MANY questions. The cake was PERFECT! I ordered a TARDIS cake- so the details were important, and the decorators just nailed it! And of course the cake itself was SO tasty! I got a ton of compliments from friends for ordering half red velvet and half carrot cake. When you had both flavors on your plate at once the combo tasted amazing! I highly suggest both flavors with the cream cheese frosting! So good!I have never ordered a custom cake before so I was beyond nervous about it, but these guys made it so easy and stress-free! They do offer delivery which also made the whole situation/ birthday so much easier. I would for sure recommend these guys to family and friends!

23.description: LOVE! I'm not sure there is anything here that I don't like. This is a "real" bakery, not a little boutique type bakery. They have everything from amazing coffee cakes to sprinkle butter cookies by the pound to danish's to loaves of bread to custom bday cakes....everything is made fresh daily and the prices are reasonable! If you haven't been here I suggest you stop by this little gem bc you won't be disappointed.

47.description: I've lived in Chicago for 3 years and have used Swedish Bakery several times for birthday cakes and just to stop in for a treat. Their Triple Chocolate Ganache cake is the best cake in the city - a must have! Recently I had my first issue on an order I placed, but I was stunned at how fast the manager responded and helped out. I will definitely continue to use and recommend this place.

8.description: Swung by Swedish Bakery on Fat Tuesday 2/9 to pick up a Semla (Swedish specialty specifically eaten on Fat Tuesday). Was told by a lady behind the counter they were out. I asked her if it was possible they could make more since it was Fat Tuesday after all. She told me quite rudely that today was not a special day for Semlor but rather Paczki day. Didn't have the energy to inform her I lived my first 22 years in Sweden and never heard of Paczki day. Perhaps, I missed the part when the "Swedish Bakery" became the "Polish Bakery".

31.description: Service is great or very professional. Cakes are going from good to ok to it taste like any other bakery. I'm very sad that they are loosing taste. Recently bought a 6 inch red velvet with cream cheese filling, the cake was dry, and the filling tasted more like lard and powder sugar.... I really doubt they even used cream cheese at all. honestly box cake    Is better and cheaper.....

34.description: I recommend buying a semla and eating It in the storefront window, aside from whatever good things to take with you.

16.description: Ever since I saw British contestants on a PBS cooking contest attempt a "princess torte" I knew I would have to go over to the Swedish Bakery to try theirs.  It did not disappoint.  It was beautiful... and it was delicious.  Rich, creamy... a perfect birthday splurge.  I should also compliment the young man who served me, Erick, who was friendly, personable... and very attractive, I might add.:-)

13.description: I grew up going to this bakery. My friends worked here while we were in high school, back in the 90's. I hadn't been here in about 7 years and walking in again brought so many memories. It smells delicious, it was very busy, so many choices..... I bought a tart, a Napoleon, and some cookies. Those cookies are to die for!!!! Years ago I ordered my son his birthday cake from them and everyone raved on how great it was. I will always make a stop at the bakery whenever I'm in the area. Delicious treats at a very good price.

11.description: Never ever go here. The service is abysmal. The worst I've ever seen. They are disorganized and rude. And the cakes just aren't worth it. I have had just as good quality from Jewel with far less hassle. This was the last time I will buy anything from them. So much for trying to support local businesses.

39.description: Whenever I think of Swedish Bakery, I think of my childhood. Along with that comes the memories of the cake on my birthday and getting dessert with my grandparents. So because of this, I always loved and still love it a lot. In addition to this, the goods at this bakery are phenomenal. I can't even begin to explain how amazing this place is. My words do no justice. The cookies, coffee cake, truffles, everything is just beyond my expectations. The best part? Free samples of assorted coffee cakes! Let's put it this way....this is not the place to go if you're on a diet lol. I definitely recommend! Try the seven sisters cake!

37.description: Yummy

0.description: If you are within 30 minutes of the Swedish Bakery, divert and go directly to the Bakery, park in their private parking lot, proceed to the entrance and go in, grab a number and prepare for some mind blowing, scrumptious, artistically decorated desserts!The staff is super friendly and very patient while you hem and haw over which delights you want to bring home with you.This is my 3rd review for the Swedish Bakery and it just gets better and better. Stopped in right before Christmas (December 22) and loaded up with 2 stuffed boxes for the Holidays. Our treats stayed fresh in the fridge as they dwindled down to nothing.OMG, I can't wait to return but,  I kinda gained 10 lbs over the holidays. Totally worth it.

38.description: The Swedish Bakery is more than just a "Swedish" bakery; they have rather large assortment of cookies and pastries from many different parts of Europe. If you are looking for some particular type of European pastry in Chicago, this is probably the place to start. On my last visit, I tried both their version of the Swedish "semla" and the Polish equivalent, the "paczki". The semla was good, but unfortunately, it did not contain enough almond creme for my taste. It was also served in a strange paper cup. This is not the traditional way of serving a semla. Nonetheless, the semla would still be slightly above average compared to the ones you can find in Sweden.Where the Swedish Bakery really shines is with regards to the cookies. They sell a large number of traditional Swedish cookies by the pound. In many other places, these kinds of cookies are often quite dry and uninspiring. I am happy to report that this is not the case here! I tried about 7 different varieties, and all were very well made. The butter-to-sugar ratio was just right. As some other reviewers have noted, many of their products contain, or rather, consist of, marzipan. This may seem unappealing to many American consumers. But keep in mind that marzipan is to Europeans as peanut butter is to Americans. They put it on essentially everything! In addition, Scandinavian pastries are often less sweet than the American counterparts. As a result, you will not find many of the "large-size, extra cream, extra fudge" kind of treats that you might be used to. A final word of advice: the place is often quite crowded, so be prepared to wait about 10 to 15 minutes for service; particularly on weekends.

51.description: Dear friends got married last week and ordered their wedding cake from Swedish Bakery.  The happy couple loved the cake, and so did everyone else.  Not just the look of it, but the taste.  Sadly, the guests pretty much gobbled it all up and the hoped for leftovers didn't work out.

27.description: While Swedish Bakery is churning out some delicious baked goods, it's a little bit pricey compared to many other bakeries.  This is a bakery I would come back to for a small treat for myself or someone else, but probably not to cater an entire party.Everything we ate was so good!  I had to get the giant rainbow frosted cookie.  Even though it was just a sugar cookie, the cookie part and the frosting were so much better than I expected.  The Almond Tart was my favorite and would be perfect with a cup of tea.  The Rum Balls are also very good, dense little balls of chocolate which will totally satisfy in 2-3 bites.  Dominic P also picked out a cannoli, although I am not sure why a Swedish bakery makes cannoli...Our total for 2 Rum Balls,1 Rainbow Cookie, 1 Almond Tart, and 1 Cannoli was about $15.  Aside from the cookie, each treat was only a few bites and are not desserts meant to share.The service behind the counter was very attentive, and they didn't mind bouncing from counter to counter to help us.I would definitely come back here, but I would make sure to keep track of what I was spending.  During our visit, this could have easily spiraled out of control!

32.description: Horribly slow service. I realize it's Paczki day, but being use to going to webers and how efficient they are it's crazy for thee guys to take 25 minutes to serve 20 customers.

54.description: I love the Swedish Bakery so much. My boyfriend is Swedish and insisted we try it two years ago. It's an hour away from us...but so worth it!! The pastries and desserts are so, so, so yummy, and very reasonably priced. They even have shipping for some of their items! Which was very nice when I wanted to send some finals care packages. I have yet to try something that isn't delicious. And if you love almond/marzipan like I do, you'll find plenty of it here!

48.description: When I was younger, this was the place my parents ALWAYS got sweets from. We moved out of the area when I was five, so I thought maybe the deliciousness of Swedish Bakery was just a childhood dream, but I was wrong. I've recently gone back to this bakery a few times, and each time I have gotten wonderful baked goods. Additionally, I'm 100% sure the Swedish Bakery cake I bought for my boyfriend's birthday last August was what really helped me win over his mom. Thanks, Swedish Bakery! :)Consistent, authentic, and delicious - the Swedish Bakery is a must stop if you are in Andersonville.

44.description: Their butter cookies are wonderful.  And pricey at nearly $20 pound - fancy butter cookies are close to $22/pound.  But if you're trying to impress someone or bring a nice hostess gift - go for it.  I've had the petite pecan roll and it is also very good.  Their regular cake donuts are good, but nothing special.I recently had a mocha slice - chocolate cake with mocha mousse.  Oh my!  $4.50, but again worth it!

24.description: Great selection of tasty treats. Very welcoming and friendly people. Picked out a handful of butter cookies for the office and they were a hit!

7.description: The place was really warm and friendly, the service was on point, but the things that i bought weren't what i thought they would be. I bought 2 small cannoli Swedish, 2 biskvier and some chocolate dipped cookies. The cannoli were tasteless and the texture of the pastry was weird. I don't wanna talk about the biskvier because it made me regret i bought 2. I still havent tried the other stuff they offer but i will update the review once i try new ones.

49.description: They knocked it out of the park !! The cakes that they made for my wedding reception were incredible.  The manager was such a huge help in assisting me with choosing the right number of desserts for our reception.Every single person kept asking me where we had the cakes made. I told them I will never go anywhere else for desserts or cake for special occasions.... And I truly wish I lived closer. . As I would go there far more often. The input from the incredible staff there truly helped make my reception and especially my sweets table one that I will not forget.Hats off to all of the wonderful staff at swedish bakery. It could not have been any better !!!

40.description: Based on a recommendation from my fiancé's coworker, we scheduled a cake tasting on a Saturday morning. Going in early is definitely recommended because the place gets packed. We waited a little bit for Lilian. She came out and introduced herself and took us to a back room. Overall the experience was really good. We saved pictures of past cakes they made that we liked on their handy iPad, the cake flavors and fillings we chose were really good (their marble cake with salted caramel filling is amazing), and Lilian asked plenty of questions and gave us several options to make our wedding cake affordable. Although we haven't decided if they will be the bakery for us because we still have one more cake tasting, I know that we will be back because the cookies we purchased were delicious. If we do choose them, I'll write an updated review afterwards.

53.description: A total classic!  My grandma and grandfather are Swedish and we grew up going to the Swedish Bakery - Marzipan, Mazarines, Apple Boats, the Andersonville Coffee cake, and Limpa bread!!! It has changed hands over time, but still keeps baking our favorites and we have been very long time supporters.  Christmas time this place is so packed you have to wait for over 1 1/2 hours, but it is well worth it and the camaraderie with all the Swedes is fun!  For those of you lucky enough to go there in summer, enjoy the shorter lines and try the Mazarines.

30.description: I bought paczkis for Fat Tuesday. There was a long line when I arrived, but it moved quickly. There were samples of paczkis, which made me happy. I ordered 3 paczkis - fresh strawberry w/cream, blueberry and pineapple. All three were delicious! The fresh strawberry was my favorite because it wasn't too sweet. The woman who took my order was so nice and helpful. I want to come back and try their other baked treats!

46.description: As a disclaimer, I am very very sentimentally attached to this bakery, so this is, in fact, an incredibly biased review. The first non-Asian pastries and cakes I've had growing up are from this place and I still love them to death, so you can only imagine how pleasantly surprised I was to see that the yelp community shares my love for Swedish Bakery! I swung in here last week to pick up some goodies while en route to a good friend's house and the place was packed! Fortunately the staff is really efficient and helpful so I was in and out in no time. First off, you cannot go wrong with the raspberry napoleon. I also really like their carrot cake. I have never had any of their marzipan goods, but judging by everyone else's reviews, that seems to be THE thing here. I highly recommend checking this place out if you're in Andersonville. It definitely packs the full glory of an old world European bakery.

1.description: My hair salon is across the street, so once a month I treat myself here after my appointment. I am kinda obsessed with their cake balls. Cake balls became a "thing" on Yelp in 2007, so I am surprised that more bakeries do not carry them almost 10 years later. Swedish Bakery does a red velvet and a carrot cake version that are worth the splurge (calorie-wise, as they really aren't expensive). They have virtually every kind of bread, pastry, cookie and cake you could possibly want. And they are all delicious!

55.description: Yummy canolis and cookies. Red velvet cupcake ..not so yummy.

9.description: The cakes are amazing and so is the customer service. I always try to avoid rush hours because I don't want to wait in lines. Everybody talks about this "marzipan cake" and I decided to give it a go but it was so sweet. For now I will stay away from marzipan cake and enjoy other delicious bakeries.

26.description: Ridiculous, stupid delicious. I've had so many things there and it never disappoints. Tiny apple pies today, apple slices with gooey, flakey deliciousness. Cookies and cream truffles and frosted cookies mmmm!!!

25.description: Ever since I saw British contestants on a PBS cooking contest attempt a "princess torte" I knew I would have to go over to the Swedish Bakery to try theirs.  It did not disappoint.  It was beautiful... and it was delicious.  Rich, creamy... a perfect birthday splurge.  I should also compliment the young man who served me, Erick, who was friendly, personable... and very attractive, I might add.:-)

12.description: While Swedish Bakery is churning out some delicious baked goods, it's a little bit pricey compared to many other bakeries.  This is a bakery I would come back to for a small treat for myself or someone else, but probably not to cater an entire party.Everything we ate was so good!  I had to get the giant rainbow frosted cookie.  Even though it was just a sugar cookie, the cookie part and the frosting were so much better than I expected.  The Almond Tart was my favorite and would be perfect with a cup of tea.  The Rum Balls are also very good, dense little balls of chocolate which will totally satisfy in 2-3 bites.  Dominic P also picked out a cannoli, although I am not sure why a Swedish bakery makes cannoli...Our total for 2 Rum Balls,1 Rainbow Cookie, 1 Almond Tart, and 1 Cannoli was about $15.  Aside from the cookie, each treat was only a few bites and are not desserts meant to share.The service behind the counter was very attentive, and they didn't mind bouncing from counter to counter to help us.I would definitely come back here, but I would make sure to keep track of what I was spending.  During our visit, this could have easily spiraled out of control!

59.description: Swedish Bakery did our wedding cake. It was fantastic!  Lillian was very easy to work with and the cake was so amazingly delicious. Made the event more memorable!

21.description: They ripped me off. I ordered a treat off their menu, and they said it had to be special ordered (minimum of two days wait), and that even though I wanted only one or two, I had to order a minimum of four.  I accepted that. When I opened the box at home, I found that they'd gotten my order wrong. I called to have them replaced, but was told that they would not make them again until next year, and they would not fix the mistake, and no they would not give me my money back. In the end the manager said they would only give me half of my money back, but only in the form of store credit. (I will let you know if they actually follow through on that if I ever go back to this store) As if that weren't bad enough, the box of treats I was stuck with were two days old, and not as good as they should have been. (They weren't special order products either, they had been in the counter when I ordered them, days before.)$20 down the drain. Don't waste your money ordering from them.All that said, some of the products they sell are pretty good, if freshly made.

17.description: It might be sacrilegious, but one thing irks me about SB. We've made and paid for multiple advance orders. When returning to pick up your prepaid order, one must once again take a number and wait... and wait...  and continue to wait to have an employee simply hand you your order. It's the 21st century, people! When someone cares enough to think of the SB for their event/gathering and place an ADVANCE order, the SB should NOT make the same customer wait once again for their order. I'm voting with my feet and buying my pastries and desserts elsewhere until this policy changes.

10.description: "You get what you pay for" could never be more true than at Swedish Bakery. The staff (Hola, new girl Maria D.!), are so courteous and friendly, the selections are amazing, but if you're accustomed to the cheap, floury, greasy fried, sugar overkill of commercial doughnuts, you may be surprised and/or underwhelmed at the cake doughnuts. Also, if you want a twist on the old standard rye bread, you must try the Limpa Rye lLoaf. Sublime. WARNING!: NO DOUGHNUTS IN August!

5.description: It's nearly impossible to walk out without spending $25. They have the best of everything and I like trying their unique items. I always get a couple "frogs" for my mom, aka froggie. Their paczki's are amazing and they're actually too many flavors to decide... #oneofeach #paczkiday #fattuesday

3.description: This bakery is a staple in the Andersonville community. Came here to get some cookies before dinner. The smell walking through the doors is heavenly...and there were so many beautifully decorated treats to feast with the eyes. There weren't too many customers but it was night time so I think that is expected. We bought too many baked goods to take home including the picture attached. I am glad this place is far from my home or I would be morbidly obese.

35.description: The staff was very helpful and friendly in showing me around as a first timer. I got the cookies which were very good, as well as the small plain fudge cake

19.description: I recently stopped in to Swedish Bakery for the first time.  I bought a 1/4 box of mixed cookies and also ordered a Swedish Princess Cake for pick up a few days later.  The cookies were delightful, especially the two the lovely man behind the counter gave me to snack on while he filled up the box I ordered.  While the cookies were delicious, the most impressive thing about my experience was the service.  The gent behind the counter ( I think his name tag said Erik) was so pleasant, patient, knowledgeable, and helpful. It was such a nice experience! Then, on the day I was meant to pick up the cake, I spaced out, and someone called me to remind me, for which I was grateful. I'm sure I'll be enjoying many Swedish Bakery treats in the future.

28.description: Birthday cake was a complete disappointment. Special order of a marzipan cake with raspberry filling and chocolate cake. It was picked up March 21.The marzipan filling was dry and chewy, the cake was dry and was not chocolate, there was whip cream covering the outside of the cake, then it was covered in marzipan fondant. It was horrible. Not a tasty cake. It was difficult to cut as the marzipan fondant was dry and chewy. Tasted like hard paste with almond extract. Not authentic marzipan cake at all. We left a vm but have yet to hear back. The cake sits in the refrigerator as I am not dashing to eat it because the flavors and fillings are the worst! The pink flowers on the cake are hard and dry. This cake was not fresh at all.Unhappy!Owner wrote and only agreed to voucher $10.00 of items at the bakery, no refund- cake was over $25.00. TipAsk whats on a cake even if you special order it. There was whip cream under the chewy marzipan. I am allergic to whip cream. The cake basically was... Crap!It's prolly best just to order a cake that they are famous about. I am not sure what cake as I didn't order the cake. It was a surprise!A bad surprise. Since, no monetary refund was offered. I suggest asking what the polices before buying anything from this establishment. Also, ask for cake eating instructions, as that is what the owner stated. You have to eat certain cakes warm, even thou it has secret hidden whip cream.

45.description: *unleashes tsunami of drool* So yummy, excellent pastries! A bit too marzipan-y but I can put up with that. The cupcakes ROCK and the cake pops that are super large and uniquely decorated also ROCK! Recommend to the whole universe except my enemies :)

33.description: I recently stopped in to Swedish Bakery for the first time.  I bought a 1/4 box of mixed cookies and also ordered a Swedish Princess Cake for pick up a few days later.  The cookies were delightful, especially the two the lovely man behind the counter gave me to snack on while he filled up the box I ordered.  While the cookies were delicious, the most impressive thing about my experience was the service.  The gent behind the counter ( I think his name tag said Erik) was so pleasant, patient, knowledgeable, and helpful. It was such a nice experience! Then, on the day I was meant to pick up the cake, I spaced out, and someone called me to remind me, for which I was grateful. I'm sure I'll be enjoying many Swedish Bakery treats in the future.

43.description: What really stands out for me at Swedish Bakery are their freshly made breads and coffee cakes and danishes. Their limpa is my favorite, of course. They will slice and bag any bread for you, it's such a treat to take home.Their danish and coffee cakes are beautiful and a perfect gift, especially at the holidays. They have cardamom coffee cake people, with and without sanding sugar. They do have lots of sugar type cookies with sprinkles and great looking tarts and tortes with fruit and the like but a lot of their non-bread confections ALL have marzipan in them. COME ON. I actually do like marzipan, I do. But in intense moderation and while traveling abroad. I know this is Swedish, but .... I wanted to buy my landlord a nice box of freshly made chocolate truffles, not chocolate covered marzipan, god dangit. So really, I just want more confection variety in addition to the tons of marzipan. This place still rocks.

2.description: I waited an hour and 45 minutes for a prepaid pickup, would have been another hour if I hadn't found a discarded ticket from someone who gave up.  Line moved slowly, I calculated 1.7 minutes each number, and that includes people who baled.  There are way too few people working, and no "prepaid pickup" line.  I got waves out of the lot so had to keep pumping the meter.  Lots of unhappy people waiting for prepaid orders.  When I got to the front, I talked to the manager and asked why they didn't have an express line. "We tried that but it didn't work for us, people would jump into that line.". I asked "but why did you serve them".. She was curt: " you should be happy sometimes there's a 3 hour wait." Whatt?!  I don't care if it is an amazing coffee cake I won't be back. That is unacceptable.

18.description: Amazing bakery. Amazing service. Their cakes and Tortes are amazing - I highly recommend their hazelnut cake. It's outstanding. You guys do amazing work! Thanks for everything you do :) Also, get their cinnamon bread. It's the best for French toast in the city! I promise :)

41.description: I recently got my husbands birthday cake with a cricket bat and ball design from here, I got a prompt reply to my email enquiry. Lillian was extremely helpful in deciding my final cake ingredients and design. The cake itself was much appreciated by my husband and the guests!!! I will definitely look forward to more cakes from Swedish bakery!

52.description: My two dads just ordered their wedding cake from Swedish Bakery and I wanted everyone to know how wonderful they were to work with and how much help they provided through the whole process. As a puppy, I couldn't go in the store, but Dad said Karen was so helpful in making suggestions and also about listening to their wishes. With her assistance and guidance the wedding cake turned out to be absolutely beautiful (and delicious). I generally like steak, but Swedish Bakery has a carrot cake recipe that even a puppy can love. Sweet to taste, smooth texture and delicious icing. Can't go wrong with good icing. Thank you Swedish Bakery for helping make my dads' special day one they both and I will remember. Four paws up for you!

50.description: A few times a year, I go to swedish bakery for my marzipan fix- this is the best place to satisfy my craving. My favorite is the princess cake, but the marzipan cake slice and the swedish frog will suffice when I can't justify buying a whole cake. I've been to many occasions that have special ordered marzipan cakes from Swedish, and they are the best.   Most of my family are not marzipan lovers, so I have become very familiar with their buttercream and whipped cream cakes. You just cannot go wrong here, but I much prefer the regular (American?) buttercream to their European buttercream- it's such a great rendition of regular buttercream, it'll just spoil you from ever settling for less.  The white cake here is absolutely fantastic-- never dry like most are. I've had chocolate, lemon, and yellow- all great.   If you are a chocoholic, you've gotta try the ganache loaf-- two kinds- just chocolate or a raspberry ganache (which I prefer). They usually have it on the refrigerated shelves.   DO NOT WALK OUT OF THERE WITHOUT COOKIES!  They are all great; be sure to include some blondies!

4.description: Service has never fallen short of Amazing! My family have been customers of the Swedish Bakery for a really long time! I still remember being a kid and just going bananas for everything! Every family birthday party had a Swedish Bakery Cake to really top the night off. It wasn't official unless you had a Swedish Bakery Cake, seriously! Even the most special family occasions ended with a Swedish Bakery Cake! I'm not a big fan of dessert, seriously, when it comes to these desserts I'll never say no! Every bite reminds me of my childhood, the cakes tastes the same as it did when i was a kid! I recently turned 30 and you better believe I had a Swedish Bakery Cake, it was a surprise that had me in tears!! The quality they put into their baked goods is always on point, I have never once been disappointed by anything from this bakery! They consistently prove why they have been around for so long and you can't beat that! The service totally reflects the kind of care they put into their work, placing orders and picking up is always pleasant. The staff is always nice! One bite (of anything) and you will be hooked! You really get what you pay for and you'll definitely be back!! I definitely plan on continuing my families tradition with my friends and future family!

6.description: My experience with cakes there has been average, at best.  On two out of four or five tries over the years, the decorations have been sloppy.  When I questioned it one time, I literally got a shrug.  The requirement for payment-in-full when ordering really leaves the customer in a bind (a 50% deposit is fair, but more is a red flag for any business).  So, I now make the drive down to Bittersweet or Sweet Mandy B's for consistent, great quality.But the cookies and pastries in the cases are excellent, so it's always worth stopping in for some of those.

22.description: I've only tried a handful of the huge array of baked goods here, but my impression so far is that the Swedish pastries are the way to go: the last time I was here I had 2 Swedish almond tarts (a Marzariner tart and a Toska tart), and both were divine (although very expensive, nearly a dollar per bite), while my partner had a very lackluster (non-Swedish) donut.

15.description: Although I had a fantasy of a really charming swedish family running this business, the baked goods here and the service were amazing! Went here the other day for donuts and was absolutely delighted! The only thing that would make this place better would be if they served a great local coffee, like Metropolis. Huge fan of this place. Anytime I want to buy a cake or cookies or anything sweet, I'll stop in again.

57.description: Lillian was great to work with from the beginning when we went to do a cake tasting for our wedding. No pretense, no pressure, great cake and a nice presentation and way to peruse cake ideas (she had an iPad to glance through hundreds of cake ideas, having us click our interests along the way).We chose them, and we were so blown away! What we figured would be a fine choice for a small detail for the day turned out to be such a beautiful high point! We've used them for birthday cakes for years, and are so glad we continued with them for our wedding! Thanks!

20.description: I grew up going to this bakery. My friends worked here while we were in high school, back in the 90's. I hadn't been here in about 7 years and walking in again brought so many memories. It smells delicious, it was very busy, so many choices..... I bought a tart, a Napoleon, and some cookies. Those cookies are to die for!!!! Years ago I ordered my son his birthday cake from them and everyone raved on how great it was. I will always make a stop at the bakery whenever I'm in the area. Delicious treats at a very good price.

36.description: This bakery must not need to sell anything. I have attempted to go in to this location about 5 times over the past few months. Their hours are crazy!!! Its Saturday and they are closed today. They have bankers hours and are not in the business of selling to Customers. Obviously they don't need any money. Must be ancient rich owners.

14.description: Birthday cake was a complete disappointment. Special order of a marzipan cake with raspberry filling and chocolate cake. It was picked up March 21.The marzipan filling was dry and chewy, the cake was dry and was not chocolate, there was whip cream covering the outside of the cake, then it was covered in marzipan fondant. It was horrible. Not a tasty cake. It was difficult to cut as the marzipan fondant was dry and chewy. Tasted like hard paste with almond extract. Not authentic marzipan cake at all. We left a vm but have yet to hear back. The cake sits in the refrigerator as I am not dashing to eat it because the flavors and fillings are the worst! The pink flowers on the cake are hard and dry. This cake was not fresh at all.Unhappy!Owner wrote and only agreed to voucher $10.00 of items at the bakery, no refund- cake was over $25.00. TipAsk whats on a cake even if you special order it. There was whip cream under the chewy marzipan. I am allergic to whip cream. The cake basically was... Crap!It's prolly best just to order a cake that they are famous about. I am not sure what cake as I didn't order the cake. It was a surprise!A bad surprise. Since, no monetary refund was offered. I suggest asking what the polices before buying anything from this establishment. Also, ask for cake eating instructions, as that is what the owner stated. You have to eat certain cakes warm, even thou it has secret hidden whip cream.

58.description: Alma is still wonderful! Love this place. Been here over 4 times now. On my last appointment, I called last minute to get a hair cut and of course she was totally booked. But she wanted to accommodate me and so asked me to come an hour before the salon opened! She is awesome! :) I get compliments on my hair every single time I cut my hair! Thanks Alma!

56.description: Thank you Alma! After a very disastrous haircut at my mother's hairdresser I had to find someone else reliable to cut my hair. And thank goodness I came across Bello Hair Studio on Yelp. YES! I made an appointment over the phone and was booked for a haircut the next week. Upon arrival at the Hair Studio I was the very first client of the day. The salon is well kept. Simple yet chic. I showed Alma a picture of the type of haircut I wanted to get. She spent a good amount of time cutting and trimming my hair. After my very disastrous haircut my hair was so layered it was impossible to style and wear regularly. I wanted to get my hair more uni-layered, and decided on a simple classic bob haircut and that was what Alma gave me. Exactly what I wanted. Upon chatting with my friend over dinner at Panes Bread Cafe I found out that she recently went to Bello Hair Studio for a cut. She was raving about how great the place was and for a decent price too. Funny how we both came across Bello Hair Studio on Yelp, and are in love with this place! My hair is getting longer now, and that means a trip back to Bello Hair Studio for another amazing cut!

29.description: So it has taken me a couple years now to write a review because I don't want the whole city to find my secret gem. I absolutely love this salon. The first time I walked in I was a little hesitant because the decor is of a 2 star salon. BUT you sit in the chair and talk to the sweetest stylists and then get an amazing cut and color for such a reasonable price and it instantly becomes a 5 star salon. I have long hair and when I ask for a trim I get a trim. I have had so many salons take 3 to 4 inches off my hair and it drives me crazy! Here they listen and take 1 to 1.5 inches. And they do it for under 20 bucks. As long as I live in Chicago I won't ever go anywhere else.

42.description: I'm very often the only guy in the place. Alma is fantastic, and even though I moved out of the area, I make my way back there every two months for a great haircut. I even managed to pick up some croatian terms here and there.

23.description: My friends recommended this place, and ever since Bello salon is my place for haircut and haircolor. The stylists are very professional, and the prices!!! so affordable!Highly recommend!!!

47.description: Ok where do I start!!!  Good service - checkGood price - checkGood location - checkAwesome hair - CHECK!!!Emma and Alma have both done a fantastic job with my hair, and for the price I can go weekly for flat irons...  I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

8.description: Let me start off by saying I've only been here once. BUT...it was to fix a very horrible long bob my regular hair stylist (whom i've been going to for 3 years) royally messed up!  Alma fixed my hair like you wouldn't believe!  I didn't think my cut could be saved but she somehow did it! A good friend of mine has been going to Alma for a few years and her cuts are ALWAYS consistent. I usually bounce hair stylists every 3-5 years because they somehow loose their touch and things aren't as consistent as they could be.  I'm hoping this place isn't going to be the case because Alma won me over as a client!

31.description: Aida does a fantastic job.  She is thorough, and I feel she really listens to what I want.  I respect her opinion, and she gave me pointers on how I can best style my hair (always a challenge for me!).  When I needed a cut in Aida's absence, Geneva did a great job, too!Nothing fancy about the salon, but the price is right, especially when short hair needs frequent cutting.

34.description: This is how much I love Bello:1. I am willing to travel over an hour and 15 minutes there and back just to get my hair...trimmed.2. When I ring to make an appointment, and they ask me, "Who would you like to see?" I reply, "Anyone! Everyone is so good (and I should know because I've had them all!), that whoever has an opening this week, I'm A-Okay with!"3. I'd trade all of the free glasses of champagne, scalp massages, fancy blowouts, bells and whistles, and swanky ambiance to sit in that bare-bones shop KNOWING I'm going to leave with hair that looks amazing. Who cares about all the other crap if you come out looking terrible?!The price, $15 for a dry cut, is unbelievable, and even if I do take the L to get there ($2.25 one way, $.25 for a transfer back), $17.50 + tip is a STEAL for the most amazing hair cut you'll probably ever have.Cash only!

16.description: Definitely worth the wait and drive!Thanks ladies!

13.description: Ladies, you know the story - have  stylist, she/he does a great job then they don't.   I was in month 10  of growing out a disastrous cut - my stylist of 2 years suddenly decided to thin out my thick hair rather than lightly texturize the ends.  My back was to the mirror and when I saw this big chunk of hair fall on the floor I said what are you doing??!  At that point, V had thinned out half my hair.  She stopped, but the damage was done. Towards the end of May, Spring had sprung and  I was finally ready for a proper hair cut.  I searched Yelp for a place close by, found Bello, read all the great reviews, said a prayer and made an appointment with Aida. She did a GREAT job.  She understood what I wanted and expertly cut my hair.  And the wash! A mini spa in and of itself!  I will definitely go back.  I'm also saving up money to buy a Valeria Pro hair dryer she used.

11.description: I've been going here for 4 years now for haircuts and highlights. Emma is wonderful, is patient with me when I'm indecisive and always ensures I'm happy with the service.Affordable, no frills, efficient salon.Make your appointment well in advance, they fill up fast

39.description: I have seen both Aida and Geneva and both are great at color and cuts.  I change my color quite often and they always keep my hair's condition in mind and give great opinions on what would look best.  I never have an issue getting an appointment.  I highly recommend this place for their services and the price!  Just keep in  mind they only accept cash payments.

37.description: Unfortunately, I must weigh in on the side of earlier reviewers who booked appointments but never received services.Earlier this week, I called, spoke with Alema and booked an appointment for 11 am on Saturday. So I show up at the appointed time, but they have no record of me. One of the stylists (who turned out to be Alema) said I must have called the wrong salon. Finally, they found my name and phone number under a completely different day. They were quite put out at the idea of having to book me for a different time, so I left. Boo.

0.description: Emma was great!!!! My hair was dry and over processed from color she gave me the best haircut to clean up the mess .Awesome service

38.description: They need to take credit cards like every other salon.  Alma and other stylists are very good for cuts.  Alma is good for color, though I haven't tried the others.  Blow-outs are so-so.  Sometimes they forget your appointment, but will quickly get you in.  They are not late on a regular basis like other salons.  They are no frills, but nice and well-priced.  Please take credit cards again.  Running to get cash is very annoying.

51.description: Hooray for Bello & Aida!!  Walked in with some sun streaked strangeness from the summer and Aida just rolled with it.  Rockin some groovy strawberry and blonde streaks where my grey & brown & red used to be.  I think this is the beginning of a new and beautiful friendship!

27.description: I'm glad that I found this hair salon for my wife last year on yelp.com.  Now Bello is the only place she goes for a haircut, and she has not been consistently pleasedwith other hair salons.   She's there today by appointment.  She's over 60, has medium short hair, kind of "helmet" style fitting the head.  She will get a hair wash, which will make for a better cut.   Cost is important, she expects the charge will be about $18.  They take cash only, and of course she'll give a tip.

32.description: In my experience, it has been very difficult to find a hair salon where one can expect a consistently good hair cut.  Bello is effectively the final destination on what has seemingly been a life-long journey.I'm male and I would consider my hair style simple and comparatively easy to cut, yet I've had my mop thoroughly butchered at various locations in Chicago, often paying top dollar for the pleasure.  I have had my hair done by both Geneva and Alma on multiple occasions with great results, every time.  Every so often, I like the length a bit different or the sides thinned out more than on preceding visits.  They never assume, always asking what I would like done, and clearly listen based on the results.  I no longer live in the area, but will make the commute whenever necessary because I know precisely what I am getting.  All of the stylists are incredibly friendly and talented, although I have waited for a couple of minutes while appointments are being made on the phone.Prices, at least for just a simple hair cut, seem akin to robbery...me being the perpetrator.  For the quality I receive, the rates are incredibly low.  This is not a negative, because Bello is clearly quite popular, but ensure that you call for an appointment at least 4 or 5 days in advance to secure a weekend spot; they fill up quickly.

54.description: Unfortunately, I did not have a "wonderful" experience here that others were lucky to have.  I called in for an appointment and the earliest I could get with Alma (supposedly the best) was two weeks later.  I'm usually impulsive and would not wait, but I'm picky about my hair because it is so long and wanted a good haircut this time around. Good things about the place: Easy to find, Alma is very friendly, prices are good ($18 without wash/blowdry and $30 with), she takes her timeResults: Haircut was just EH.  I asked for volume and lots of layers but all I got was the same hair just two inches shorter.  I was expecting much more with all the great reviews.

48.description: I've been to Michael Anthony, Charles Ifergan, etc etc. This haircut (trimmed the bottom and shaped the side swept bangs) was on par with those. But it was $15. Seriously. I gave a $15 tip out of guilt because I felt like I was robbing the place. I particularly did like that in lieu of washing my hair, Aida did a thorough water spray. Honestly, if I wanted my hair washed, I'd get a blow out. I just want a haircut generally and the extra 20 minutes and $50 for the wash/dry/hand massage during wash/etc seems like a racket. Thanks for the great cut, Aida!

44.description: In all honesty, I cannot fairly judge their services, because I never received them.  I made an appointment to color my hair.  The lady told me to come at 4pm the following day.  I arrived at 4pm, and was greeted by one of the stylists.  I was not sure who was doing my hair;  there were 3 women with clients.  I waited,  4:15, 4:30, 4:45.... at 4:45 I told one of the women who had finished that I could not wait any longer.  Another stylist came forward and said, "I'm sorry, I didn't realize my appointment would take this long".  She apologized several times.   Frankly, I just wish someone had said something earlier, not 45 minutes after I got there when I was ready to leave.  I wish she said,  "this is going to take a while, do you want to wait?"   I was so irritated at that point that I rescheduled for another day, but I canceled when I found someone else to take me earlier.  Their hair services may be great; I don't know and I may never find out.  I made the appointment because of the reviews I read here on Yelp.  I can't say the Yelpers are wrong, but I didn't have a great experience.  In fairness many of the reviews mentioned no receptionist, small place, difiiculties scheduling,  etc.. but on balance I figured the glowing services outweighed everything else.

24.description: Like previous 'Reviewers' hate to tell you just how bloody good this salon is. There already booked up weeks in advance.Emma & Alma.........the best, love them. The best professionals I've had inyears. They will accommodate exactly what you want, without a flinch.

7.description: Made an appointment with them and ended up getting paired with Kristen. She was awesome and did my hair exactly the way I wanted! I wanted ombre and a trim, and she was able to finish everything in about 2.5 hours. I even got an excellent scalp massage, all for cheaper than I was quoted anywhere else. I definitely will be coming back for my future hair needs! Thanks Bello :)

49.description: Took my mother-in-law and wife here after reading the Yelp reviews.  Though I was just a spectator (and a male one at that ;) I liked the atmosphere, nice and quiet with no overwhelming or annoying music.  I was able to read my book and speak with everyone else with me without any real bother.  Most importantly they had places to sit down.  Parking was easy, especially if you plan on shopping at the new Dominick's right across the street.  They fit us in even though there was only room for one and everyone was satisfied.  My wife and mother-in-law were happy with the service and we will be coming back...

40.description: I've been here twice & have loved my cut from Alma every time. The prices are very affordable and the cut is always fast and looks great.  Even though I have to take 2 buses to get here, I will be back again!

53.description: Ok, so maybe I'll never find a place as amazing as where I got my hair cut in San Francisco:  Where my super gay man best friend would spend hours with me doing highlights, low lights, interesting textures and general awesomeness, all for the price of a bottle of wine.  I know that wouldn't be possible.  But at Bello, I know I'm going to get a really cute haircut, by someone who spends actual time with me, doesn't rush, and does a good job at color.  I've been going there for a year or so, and I don't even want to think about going anywhere else.  I usually see Emma, and I love what she does.  When she was away this summer, I saw Alma, and she did a great job too, although I like the way Emma cuts my bangs a smidge better.  Emma isn't too chatty, but pleasant to be around all the same.  Alma is way more outgoing and giggly.  It was fun!  I'm just sharing because I know some people love when a hairdresser lets them read a magazine, and others want to chat it up.  Your choice, but you'll never find another salon with two excellent stylists at this price!

30.description: I have been to Bello in the past and why I went anywhere else since then is beyond me - but I returned yesterday.  So happy I did.  My sad, shapeless, long, thin hair was beautifully reincarnated by Emma.  She has gorgeous, long hair and I asked her to cut my length, but give me layers like she has.  She worked quickly and confidently and - wow - my hair ended up having amazing bounce and volume.  She also gave me great advice on styling and coloring (which I do myself).  With the (relaxing, wonderful) shampoo and style, it was $30.  I have paid a lot more in the past for a lot less.   One more happy, loyal customer!

46.description: Alma is a life saver! I came in with a dreadful haircut & color and came out with something beautiful! I came out looking completely different! She is experienced and definitely knows what she is doing. She did a very good consultation with me. She captured exactly what I was going for. She colored my hair so that is looked natural. Then she gave me a lot of layers! My haircut looks so much better now. Thanks Alma!

1.description: Just recently got highlights and lowlights done by Alma. I have had so many compliments. She did a great job and I am very happy! :)

55.description: My husband and I have been coming here for about half a year and couldn't be happier. I get color, shampoo, cut, and blow-dry for $80, plus tip. They are fantastic with color, they get it exactly they way I want it. My cut is simple. However, my husband is another story. He has very thick and wavy hair that seems to intimidate most stylists. He has gotten many crappy haircuts from both cheapo and nicer salons. Thankfully it grows fast so he doesn't have to suffer too much. Alma asked him if she could try something a little different and she wouldn't charge if he didn't like it. He ended up really liking it and also loves that he can get a great cut for about $15. It's a clean and modern no-frills salon. No one is bringing you herbal fruit infusion or pushing overpriced products on you. It is just Alma and Emma running the show. They are not overly chatty, however, I don't mind that. We talk some, but often I just want to zone out.

9.description: I was a walk in. Needed a last minute blow dry and I recently moved up in the area. My hair wasn't as fluffy as I would have liked it to be. I need to find a new salon that has a rewards program since I like to get blow-drys often. It would be nice if they had a rewards program that after I spent a certain amount over time, I get rewarded for the next time I come.
