I will probably head back to @hushsalon where i used to live until I find a salon up here with the program that they use.

26.description: Adia was the salon lady who fixed my hair!

25.description: Aida did my hair and did a great job. I have thick curly hair and had a bad dye job curtesy of hair cuttery on lincoln and peterson. She was able to fix it and give me a good blow dry which is hard to get when most estheticians seem afraid of thick curly hair. She did a great job and the price was even better.

12.description: I went here on a whim after reading some Yelp reviews.  I wanted to get in for a haircut for Saturday and they were able to get me in same day! I saw Kristin, who might be a newer stylist there because I haven't noticed many reviews mentioning her, but she did a fantastic job! She knew that I meant a 1/2 inch when I said I wanted a trim and very nicely refreshed my layers and fixed an issue with my bangs from a previous cut! I mentioned that I had a date later that night and she went all out in styling my hair so I would be looking good! She even curled my hair!  I felt so pampered and could tell she really cared about her craft.  I appreciated the fact that I felt taken care of even though I was just getting a trim.  I've found that some places spend 5 minutes on a trim and barely dry your hair, so I enjoyed that I was taken care of so well.  Go see Kristin, she's really nice and awesome!

59.description: I've been coming here over a year.  I get a good hair cut for the price (up to $18 if shampooed and styled). Alma isn't chatty, but I'm ok with that.

21.description: I was looking for a hairdresser where I can get blond highlights at a reasonable price and this place was the best choice! Not only the outcome was perfect, but also Alma, the stylist, is really really nice. It kind of feels like you would go to one of your best friends and she does your hair. I will definitely come back! Thank you Alma and have a happy new year. See you again in 2014 :)

17.description: Aida was back for this visit, and she showed me again why I've adopted Bello Hair Studio for my go-to stylist.  She's helping me grow out to a bob and made it almost painless with her cut and style--plus we put some more warmth in my color and it looks great.  Plus she's so much fun to talk to, I like her on a personal basis.

10.description: I found this salon here on yelp. I made an appointment last minute the day before thanksgiving. They fit me in. Very friendly over the phone.  I got there and the lady Kristen was right in front at the desk to greet me. Absolutely friendly and welcoming. The place is clean and modern. Kristen did my hair cut and did a wonderful job. She takes her time and makes sure you get that hair cut you will absolutely love! My hair cut came out great! The owner of the salon was there as well and she's very friendly and also makes you feel very welcome. I will definitely be back.

5.description: My go to salon. They get you in quickly and all the stylists are great. Best of all they actually listen to what YOU want. Prices are also very fair.

3.description: Thanks Yelpers for directing me to this place. I have been many times for color and cut, and I can't remember having had as many compliments on my hair. Friendly, small studio with no frills, but the stylists are first rate. And very inexpensive. I was going to Salon 1800 for twice the price and parking hassles, etc. I think my hair looks better now than it did then. Highly recommend.

35.description: The stylist:Overall, my colorist (Alexandra, I believe--she's young and Spanish or of Latin descent I think) is very talented. She did an amazing corrective color and tone with highlights. However, my experience with having my roots bleached was painful, prolonged, and with unsatisfactory results. This was especially disappointing as their site states the salon's specialty is hair color. The developer used on my scalp was too strong (in my untrained opinion, based on some light internet research--she used 30%; I read you shouldn't use more than 20% on the scalp--on top of that, I have uber-sensitive skin), and it was left on way too long, and without any heat to activate (speed up) the treatment. It itched and burned like motherf----. Then my roots still ended up darker than the rest of my hair, and my scalp burned for the rest of the night. I wasn't able to come back till 2 weeks later, when she was more than willing to correct it at no charge. (Very sweet girl, btw).I insisted she use a weaker solution, but she wasn't comfortable doing that--I think she was afraid she'd have to leave it on longer and it would burn me. She did agree to use heat though (which helped a lot). She also used a different brand which didn't burn nearly as much. However, bc my roots were already blonde, this time they turned out too light. Gah!! Shoulda just gone with the 20% like I asked...Anyway, I would have given five stars if not for the bleach/roots issues. Alexandra is very talented and personable. I think the third time she would get it perfect and become my go-to colorist. However, I just moved to the northern burbs.The salon:As for the salon, it is very small and quiet, which I actually prefer. You'll need to make an appointment bc of the size, but I had no trouble getting one either time. The service chairs are seriously uncomfortable--expect your ass to fall asleep. The cushion feels like it's going to fall out of the chair bc of a gap behind it, lol. They have no receptionist, so your stylist may have to stop and answer the phone. They do not accept credit cards, but there is an ATM a block away. The prices are more than reasonable; they're a steal--they really should charge more and put the money back into the salon, as it could use some upgrades. There's no designated parking, but there's a grocery store right across the street, which is where I park. Plus there is a Starbuck's inside; I like to go in and grab a bev before heading over.

19.description: Loved this place. First time getting color in my hair and first time visiting. Very nice stylists and clean place. I loved how quick and well done it was. Loved my results. Coming back soon! Thank you.

28.description: Wow. After years of struggling to find a hair studio in chicago that was not only reliable, but well-priced, I've finally found Bello! The studio is nothing to write home about - bare bones, no frills. However, it's clean, stocked,  and and the two ladies working there definitely knew what they were doing! Alma was great, did a wonderful job on both the cut and color of my hair.I am tired of paying around $150 for a cut and all over color. My total last night was $80! Woo!I wil definitely be going back.

45.description: Just got my hair cut and styled today by Geneva. She gave me exactly what I asked for. I am so happy with my haircut. I am always nervous when trying out different salons but not this time. Thank you Geneva. I will definitely be back as a regular. Adam

33.description: I'm with them almost a year now and I can say ... Great location (easy to park without paying a parking), not expensive at all, great service. Alma is really professional!!! Fifth star to this salon because of her

43.description: I have been going here a year now.  My cuts are always great but I removed 1 star just because sometimes I get irritated by Alma always being on the Phone and another time I had to see a different girl while she finished up another customer.Alma is  a real pro but I am not to sure I will stay a loyal customerif I have another irritating experience.

2.description: I recently moved to Chicago and needed a hair stylist close by. Based on the reviews I decided to give this place a shot. I had Kristen as a hairstylist and she did a great job. She was very friendly and fun. At one point everyone in the salon was laughing and having a good time. She also told me to play with my hair a bit and if I want anything changed to come back in the next couple weeks. But I love my hair! The only reason they don't get 5 stars, is that it is a very modest place. But if you want a great haircut and friendly service this is your place. Remember to bring cash or check though. No credit cards accepted here.

18.description: I'm glad that I found this hair salon for my wife last year on yelp.com.  Now Bello is the only place she goes for a haircut, and she has not been consistently pleasedwith other hair salons.   She's there today by appointment.  She's over 60, has medium short hair, kind of "helmet" style fitting the head.  She will get a hair wash, which will make for a better cut.   Cost is important, she expects the charge will be about $18.  They take cash only, and of course she'll give a tip.

41.description: I went to this salon based purely on the other Yelp reviews and I am so glad I did!  I had the same stylist in Wisconsin for 4 years and when I moved here I thought A) I'm going to have to pay WAY more for the same services and B) It will take me forever to even find a stylist I like - And then I went to Bello.Aida was wonderful and made me the exact blonde I wanted (which involved a LOT of highlights) she also understands I'm the kind of client who is not real chatty and respected that.  The prices are fabulous!  She also gave me a beautiful blowout using NO product - that's how good the cut and her skills are.  I will definetly be going back again and again.** I removed one star because I do wish they would offer water or a magazine when your highlights take 3 hours (which is normal for my hair) BUT I'd rather have great prices and bring my own water and book.  Just a heads up for those that prefer a pampering experience - this is just great simplified hairstyling!

52.description: i hesitate to post a review, because i don't want more people going and making it harder for me to get in!  what can i say - $25 for a haircut, $50 for highlights and a good job on both.  how do you beat that?  it's a no-frills, hole in the wall up on lincoln in an unsuspecting area.  it's kind of a pain in the you-know-where to book an appointment because it's usually just alma in there trying to juggle two clients at once AND answer the phone.  she was literally washing my hair and talking on the phone at the same time.  so there are definitely times when she doesn't answer.  just keep calling!

50.description: Gentle Reader, I'm back and I'm blonde.Never let it be said that I rush to judgment. No sirree, not me. Not until today, when I had my third (but not last) appointment at Bello Hair Studio did I sit down in the crummy rocker, laptop appropriately in my lap, and shorter, blonder hair on my head, do I share my happiness about Bello Hair Studio, and the bombshell Bosnian sisters, Alma and Aida.I've had two haircuts and three highlight sessionsin 2010 from A+A, and they do good work. Although no one stopped me on Lincoln Avenue afterwards and demanded to know who did the work, no one screamed and jumped underneath a bus to get away either.The salon itself is quiet. When I arrived today, Aida was reading a magazine and waiting for me. She greeted me like an old friend, even though we have only met once before, and got started mixing the color right away. I trust these girls enough that I did not inquire about the color. She actually chose two different shades of blonde today, without asking me, but you know what? She chose correctly. It is a little bit blonder than I have had recently, but it looks good. So, point for Aida; she knows her products and her clients.There were no other clients while I was there, but the phone did ring quite a bit. They don't have a receptionist. Aida stopped a few times to answer the phone, but she finally just let it go into voice mail. That was a good choice.The whole treatment took 2 hours. The total cost was $75.00. I reflected on all the times in past years, when I had employment that actually paid me real cash money, and when I spent a fair amount of that money getting my hair done at Elizabeth Arden Spa on Michigan Avenue. I spent something like $200 each time, including all the tips. And you know what? I am just as happy with the work I get at Bello, and I am rocking with joy when I contemplate the reasonable prices. Such a deal!Today, with the gorgeous weather, I decided to walk. However, in the past, I have parked for free on the side streets, and it was easy parking. An added, and recent benefit: a brand-new Dominick's just opened directly across the street, and it has a Starbucks inside. You can get yourself something to eat and drink while you sit at Bello and wait for the hair color to cook.Nice people. Nice work. Nice products (my head doesn't stink). Nice location. Nice prices. I'm sold.

4.description: I made an appointment with Kristin to fix my faded out pink ombre to a dark brown. We looked through the different browns on the chart and I picked the shade I liked. Everyone in the shop is really nice and friendly and my hair turned out perfect! Exactly what I was hoping for.

6.description: Emma was amazing!! This was my first time getting my hair done in Chicago and I could not have had a better experience. Emma made me feel very comfortable and offered her opinion when I really needed it. The price is amazing and the service is even better. I will definitely be coming back. Thanks, Emma!!

22.description: I needed to find a place fast after realizing my $200 usual wasn't going to fly anymore.  I yelped it and found this place.  I was totally skeptical after reading the reviews...seeing the place and actually until the blow dryer turned off.  But, it's true, she did a really great job. I'm so used to going for the experience and this is NOT an experience.  You're definitely going for the haircut only.  Really nice people...the whole time I was daydreaming about Tabitha taking over.

15.description: Like previous 'Reviewers' hate to tell you just how bloody good this salon is. There already booked up weeks in advance.Emma & Alma.........the best, love them. The best professionals I've had inyears. They will accommodate exactly what you want, without a flinch.

57.description: This place is awesome!  I've been their client for nearly a year.  You can always  get a good haircut at a very affordable price. They are very professional, punctual, and nice people! I always recommend it to my friends and they end up very satisfied with the results.  Bello Hair Studio is good value, no need to spend a lot of money like in other places.

20.description: Definitely worth the wait and drive!Thanks ladies!

36.description: I have been to Bello Hair Studio for 3 years! The price is very affordable and the hair cut that Alma gave me is exceptional!

14.description: Just received a wonderful long haircut here, from Aida. I'm pretty plain when it comes to my hair (long, straight, no product use), but was in desperate need of a clean-up and some style to it for once. I'd brought in a couple photos of long and layered cuts with sideswept bangs, and that's exactly what she did - beautifully. She kept the length in the back as I'd asked, got rid of the unhealthy ends, and did her work gradually (so I had the option of choosing more or less layers and bangs). All for an affordable price at a clean, pleasant shop. Thanks Aida! Very pleased with the results :)

58.description: Well, it is the BEST espresso in Andersonville.  But that's not saying much.  Usually I get a VERY nice pour.  Most of the baristas are well trained. But then there's is the sometimes, when I get a sloppy coffee and some diffidence in the process.A little more customer service; a little more consistency and they can have 5 stars instead of 4.

56.description: Afternoon of December 14th, 2013.First and last time to visit this Coffee place. Ordered a Nutella Hot Chocolate it was cool to touch and warm to taste. Nothing to write home about being from a small town in Ohio. Decided while I was waiting, I would get a pound of coffee. They assisted me with picking out a blend that was mildly roasted. Then they offered to grind it up for me. Which, I thought was a nice gesture. They handed the ground bag of coffee over to me, then offered to put it in a larger shopping bag. Since I was still finishing my lukewarm supposedly hot chocolate I agreed. Smart move for the barista, bad business move, the reason she put it in the bag, I noticed after I arrived home was because she punctured the bag. I now have it in a zip lock bag to keep it fresh. There are plenty of other coffee houses that have treated me better. I do not need to waste my time with someone being inconsiderate. I am too old for this at 50 y/o I have done my time with poor customer service.

29.description: Super Awesome Place!  Love it here!  Earlier today we were driving by and noticed this coffee place.  I didn't want coffee yet was curious as it looked really cool from the outside.  So after passing it by and going for a few blocks we turned around and came back.  So happy we did.First, the atmosphere is modern contemporary and sleek.  So nice.  The menu board offers fantastic foodie selections, and the baked goods look crazy great.  I ordered and throughly enjoyed the fig and cardamom oatmeal and was impressed that they make it per order so the simple syrup can be eliminated.The staff is beyond friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  A Plus for hiring this great team.I won't be in Chicago much longer yet would love to come back before I leave town.You will be so happy if you go here.:+)

42.description: Really cute space invites you to stay longer but WEBeams limited WiFi pushes you away. Such a contradiction. Unfortunately won't be a regular here.

23.description: I was about to give The Coffee Studio 3 stars, but after seeing that Yelp suggested that 3 stars is equivalent to "A-OK" I just couldn't. It wouldn't be fair to the world.I love trying new cafes, and I've heard a few good things about The Coffee Studio so I thought I'd check it out. When I got there, I was pretty impressed with the atmosphere and thought it would be a nice place to sit and study for a while. I order my coffee, got some food, had myself a seat and hopped on my computer... Oh wait, I forgot a step... I also had to get a wifi code with my purchase which allowed me 1 hour of internet... I'm sorry, but this just isn't reasonable considering the price I pay for coffee and food at The Coffee Studio. I understand the logic that the internet should only be for paying customers, but I can find plenty of other cafes that don't suggest that I get the F out after an hour. I won't be returning

47.description: I've got to be honest, this was one of the most uncomfortable coffee shops I've walked into and I've read some other reviews here where people share my feelings. The baristas seemed unhappy to help and had no conversation whatsoever. I'm not suggesting that baristas are required to talk to you but even getting acknowledged here seemed like I was disturbing the people behind the counter. On top of it, their wifi is limited to 1 hour for a purchase so this is not a place I would recommend coming to sit and study for a while if you need the Internet. Just a general awkward sense the entire time I was here. The coffee was good, but everywhere has good coffee.

8.description: I wasn't impressed with my visit to the Coffee Studio and the only thing going for them is the décor and cute ambiance.  I stopped by for my second cup of coffee for the day and ordered an iced dolce coffee with soy.  The iced dolce coffee was described as their cold brewed coffee with a little of their house made sweetener.  Service also wasn't anything to brag about, the cashier wasn't very friendly and he messed up the order.  I ordered mine with soy milk but I don't think the guy was listening and when I got my drink it was black coffee.  The drink itself wasn't anything special, it barely had any flavor or sweetener and basically tasted as bad as the crappy cold brew I attempted to make at home before.  I should have stuck to a latte and probably would have had a better experience so it was partially on me for going rogue.

31.description: I really love the coffee, but I strongly dislike the vibe! They don't carry almond milk, which is fine, but it would be a nice option for the lactose intolerant and the Monsanto soy-averse. Also, you only get an hour of WiFi with a purchase, which is ridiculous when there are plenty of places in the area with free WiFi indefinitely. And it's just such a waste of time and paper to constantly get up to get another code. I have never felt like I could stay here all day, which I know plenty of people do-- but why would you? Good, overpriced food. Great espresso drinks, nice enough staff. I just wish it were a bit cozier.

34.description: Found this spot one cold snowy day a couple years ago. Loved the caramelatte they serve. Have only gone back a few times since as my commute to work leads me in a different direction, but I try to get over there when I can. I understand that pouring/brewing the perfect coffee is an art form, but it kind of stinks to have to stand around to wait for a latte to be poured with a cute little design on it. The baristas that I have encountered are not friendly at all, a smile goes a long way! Obviously, this has not been a deterrent for me, but just a heads up for people who are more impatient than me. You definitely get what you pay for here- in terms of quality.

16.description: My favorite coffee shop. Details: It's gorgeous inside. Fast wifi with purchase. Super friendly service. All of the baristas are so nice here. Seriously. Not one has been mean to me even when I think it's a good idea to go out into the world freshly rolled out of bed and looking that way too. Their black iced tea. I don't drink coffee so I always drink other things at a coffee shop and this tea. This tea. I'm not really sure what it is about it but it is so delicious. I crave it like some people crave coffee. And their flatbreads. So. Good. Get one.

13.description: Here's my checklist for how I determine how much I like a coffee shop:1. Great coffee 2. Super nice baristas3. Brick wall (I know, randomly specific)4. Plugs for your chargers5. Tables wide enough for your computer6. Convenient location7. Has wine/beer and eats for later in the evening8. Airy and spacious9. WIFI10. Cute boys (kidding...kind of)The Coffee Studio has it all!! It's a really wonderful coffee shop tucked away in Andersonville that is a great place to grab a quick coffee or to hang out and get some work done. Can't recommend it enough.

11.description: Friendly staff and great coffee!  There is a lot of seating, but people tend to camp out with their laptops.  You may have to share a table with someone.

39.description: I enjoy this coffee house very much.  I come in from the suburbs, and order the looseleaf green tea along with, usually, a small snack..  It is a pleasant environment, and I am able to concentrate on my studying without disturbing noise.  The music is low-key, and not disruptive at all.I have generally been able to get a table, even during the busiest hours.  In the rare instances that I couldn't, I sat at the counter, and a table soon became available.I have found the staff to be professional at all times -- I have never encountered any rudeness.

37.description: I'm always up for a cup of great red eye coffee, anytime of the day.  I was waiting for my hubby to finish up his service call nearby and found this place while yelping on the bus.  Got off at Mryn Bawr and Clark and walked diagonally across the street, there you were!  I finally was about to get my afternoon coffee fix.  I saw red eye coffee on the menu.  Great!  Even though it was a bit pricy (medium size for $3.85 as of 02/03/2015), it was more than a decent cup of bold black coffee.  I know it's a close call, but I still prefer the red eye from Baker&Nosh in Uptown.If you're planning on staying and using the wifi, be sure to ask for a free wifi code upon ordering.  You will receive a 60-minute free wifi.  Overall, it's great neighborhood coffee shop.  I was able to surf the web and had a quality cup of red eye.  The service was slower because there was one Barista on duty.  I didn't mind since I wasn't in a hurry.

0.description: I come here every week with my son beige school. It's much different now, or at least the morning crew is different. We have a great experience and the staff are very patient and let my 6 yr old place his order. The patience an stage smiles are appreciated. Thank you!

38.description: Very cozy coffee shop to chill with friends or study.  I like the fact that the areas are kind of separate. So you can chat and mingle with your friends at the tables or coffee bar.  Or you can choose to set up your own mobile office AKA laptop and wifi :)

51.description: Super amazing customer service! This is my second time visiting the Coffee Studio, and I've been pleased both times, but this visit made it a 5 star. I went in with an unusual request for a small amount of powdered espresso for a baking project and was in a bit of a time crunch. The manager at first seemed stressed but upon noticing I was in a hurry, asked what she could do for me. I asked for the espresso and even though they didn't have a price ready for the small amount I needed, she made it work! They were wonderfully accommodating and definitely went above and beyond for the customer. I'll totally be back.

27.description: Love the vibe here. Very laid back with hip contemporary aesthetic. A great place to sit down and relax or just to work on your laptop. Music isn't too loud and the baristas were really nice. Found a new favorite place to go.

32.description: Wonderful coffee shop in Andersonville. I'm here almost every weekend. The staff is so friendly and they have a great selection of drinks. I typically stick to just black coffee and the occasional latte, but they have a lot of interesting types of drinks on their menu. They also have some yummy looking treats that I've never had enough time to sample (vegan options too!)They have a lot of seating, but it's typically pretty crowded. They also have free wi-fi.

54.description: Got an Americano and a Monkey Bar. The monkey bar is an interesting glazed croissant creation. Internet's a little unreliable, and you only get an hour per purchase. Friendly place, but not necessarily worth the hike out.

48.description: I mean, of all the coffee shops I have discovered since moving here (probably 7-8), this is my favorite! Wonderful cappuccino, awesome staff, the layout was very well-done and tasteful, and the homemade donut topped it all off! There were lots of other free lancers there and a general conducive area for reading, writing or working. GET THE SOUR CREAM DONUT!!

44.description: Great coffee, yummy vegetarian nomnoms, very nice ambiance. the only letdown was the limited wifi. they were willing to give me another code for an extra hour but it's not convenient for long hours of working.

24.description: This is an Indie type of coffee shop. You sense that from the very moment you enter. Baristas, brick walls, stylish interior design are all indie type! and great espresso coffees! Seats are very comfortable and it's very conveniently located. It seems like they don't play music though!

7.description: I'm always up for a cup of great red eye coffee, anytime of the day.  I was waiting for my hubby to finish up his service call nearby and found this place while yelping on the bus.  Got off at Mryn Bawr and Clark and walked diagonally across the street, there you were!  I finally was about to get my afternoon coffee fix.  I saw red eye coffee on the menu.  Great!  Even though it was a bit pricy (medium size for $3.85 as of 02/03/2015), it was more than a decent cup of bold black coffee.  I know it's a close call, but I still prefer the red eye from Baker&Nosh in Uptown.If you're planning on staying and using the wifi, be sure to ask for a free wifi code upon ordering.  You will receive a 60-minute free wifi.  Overall, it's great neighborhood coffee shop.  I was able to surf the web and had a quality cup of red eye.  The service was slower because there was one Barista on duty.  I didn't mind since I wasn't in a hurry.

49.description: I don't understand why this cafe is so popular. The price for a regular cup of coffee is way too expensive, particularly compared to cafes similar to this one. And, they usually leave at least a fifth of the cup empty without even asking if you need room. Are the baristas told not to fill up the cup without even asking the customer first?I've asked the barista to fill it up all the way several times and was met with a bad attitude. If I'm paying for something, specifically a cup of regular coffee that costs close to four dollars, I don't think it's a lot to ask for a full serving without my request reluctantly being fulfilled.The general feeling of the place is annoying, and I would recommend going elsewhere. I don't like giving bad reviews, but I've tried several times with this place, hoping they would change for the better, but they haven't.

40.description: This place is hip and cool. Bring your lap top in and plop down for a business meeting, a friendly chat with a friend or for some quiet time to read or get things done.  Definitely the beginnings of a franchise-able coffee spot for any neighborhood not just Andersonville / Edgewater.

53.description: I absolutely love this little coffee spot in Andersonville. It's a place that gives you a real feel for the neighborhood and the people around. Limited seating so be sure to scour around for a good spot. Everything I have ever had here has been absolutely delicious. A great place to stop by on a cold day or when you need to study.

30.description: Here's my checklist for how I determine how much I like a coffee shop:1. Great coffee 2. Super nice baristas3. Brick wall (I know, randomly specific)4. Plugs for your chargers5. Tables wide enough for your computer6. Convenient location7. Has wine/beer and eats for later in the evening8. Airy and spacious9. WIFI10. Cute boys (kidding...kind of)The Coffee Studio has it all!! It's a really wonderful coffee shop tucked away in Andersonville that is a great place to grab a quick coffee or to hang out and get some work done. Can't recommend it enough.

46.description: Easily the best latte I've had in the city. Far and away. Been here a handful of times and my soy latte is always done beautifully. Not a real fast pace, but I appreciate them doing it right, rather than the Starbucks method of just serving hot milk. Here, the milk is steamed to a silky texture and a latte can easily be great without any sugar - no bitterness, no burnt taste.I'm rating it 5 stars due to the quality of the drink. However, I can't disagree with other reviews that the staff is unfriendly. It's just not something that bothers me too much, since I interact with them for 30 seconds and then get to enjoy my drink. No complaints about the atmosphere - seems like your average coffee shop. And they serve booze!

1.description: I really enjoy The Coffee Studio. Good coffee and always a fantastic playlist in the background. The wifi is hourly, but you can also access xfinity wifi from many parts of the coffee shop. They also seem to be pretty liberal about giving out the wifi slips. Why not 5 stars? First, there's a terrible draft from the door. It gets cold. Second, I would say the vast majority of the staff is lovely and professional, but one makes really pretentious, loud comments ("you know, like women who wear yoga pants and watch sitcom television shows"). Some people might find that charming, but it ruins the warm vibe that everyone else creates.

55.description: I hesitated between giving this place 1 or 2 stars, but I decided on 2 because the coffee was good. I wish I could say the same about the service. I was sitting in one of the 3 chairs in the small sitting area and moved my chair a bit in order to give my friend more space (she had sat on the ottoman across from me and space was a bit tight), a few moments later one of the baristas (a short girl) came by and told me to push the chair forward and added "it must sit directly on the carpet". Nothing to add, this speaks for itself.

9.description: I was in the area and needed to get some work done so I made a pit stop to the Coffee Studio. I almost took my coffee to go since the place was PACKED on a Saturday morning. My first impression was that it has such a cozy environment and the seats are really comfy! I also appreciate that I'm not freezing my butt off like at most other coffee shops. The price of the drinks are a tad steep....$4 for a teeny cappuccino I could down in 5 seconds. However, both the coffee and the tea are on point.

26.description: Good coffee, good service, nice ambiance but very limited food choices. Wi-fi crowd...

25.description: I really liked this place! Plenty of outlets, free wi-fi (1 hour from the store, an extra hour if you watch a brief ad). Their coffee was delicious, very open space and a cool crowd.

12.description: This place is super cute! There are banquettes, two-top tables, outdoor seating, a community table, and comfy chairs as far as seating options go. You can buy coffee and tea products, coffee beans, doughnuts, sandwiches, lattes, etc. The baristas greet you with a smile and a warm welcome. They're quick and efficient.I've been once before to redeem a popular pays for a free cold brew. It was really good. Strong flavor, like all good cold brews are. Pretty straight forward. This time, I got a 12oz (you can get that or 16oz) iced sugar free vanilla skim latte - judge my order. Do it. Please. ;) I chatted with the male barista while he made my drink. Super nice guy. I love when baristas are friendly and will chat with you. The drink tasted pretty good! Not too sweet. I'm giving this place 5 stars because of the ambience and the service. Service is a lot to me because I'm a server and a total people person. I love good experiences, and this place gave that. Thank you!

59.description: Another coffee shop with decent, over-priced coffee. Cute atmosphere. Seems to stay pretty busy and is in a decent neighborhood. Service was a little slow. The chai was good, but it was ordered extra hot and came out mildly warm. The nutella hot chocolate was pretty yummy and again, ordered extra hot and was only mildly warm... I would say they don't seem to care if they make anything how you order it. Had a cookie too; it was simple but nothing to get worked up over. I recommend getting your drink to go and walking across the street to Roost to browse the super cute antiques!

21.description: Places like these make me happy to be on earth. And the fact that the Coffee Studio is located on a street with a great brunch place, a great yarn shop, and a great barbecue restaurant make me wish I lived in Chicago. The Coffee Studio is a gorgeous space with a beautiful interior (modernist, exposed brick, all the style accoutrements of modern day hipster living) and an expansive menu of coffee drinks, breakfast items, and so forth. They use Intelligentsia beans, and while those are a bit overroasted for my taste (not that this is the Coffee Studio's fault), the coffee they brew is very nice. This is a great place to hang out, have a cup of coffee, and peruse the latest issue of ArtForum magazine.

17.description: Let's make one thing clear - I am a faithful patron of overpriced hipster coffee shops around Chicago and beyond. The Coffee Studio is not unique in its quality or pretentiousness. Yes, they make great espresso. Yes, their vegan fare and artisan ice-cream sandwiches are drool-inducing. But here's my gripe: you can be committed to serving quality coffee without being an asshole. The baristas themselves are okay. But come on, $4.50 for a teeny cappuccino the size of a shot glass? And that's the only size you serve? Because it's "traditional?" REALLY? That has to be AT LEAST a $3 profit margin. I may as well bend over and present my behind for a good kick. Also, no almond milk, which is lame for such a trendy place. Definitely fell short of expectations.

10.description: Wonderful coffee shop in Andersonville. I'm here almost every weekend. The staff is so friendly and they have a great selection of drinks. I typically stick to just black coffee and the occasional latte, but they have a lot of interesting types of drinks on their menu. They also have some yummy looking treats that I've never had enough time to sample (vegan options too!)They have a lot of seating, but it's typically pretty crowded. They also have free wi-fi.

5.description: I absolutely love this atmosphere, whether you want to get work done or catch up with a friend. This place is very clean the staff is amazing & attentive.

3.description: This place was awesome! Great environment and drinks. It's a place I would like to visit again. The employees were really nice and helpful in helping me and my friend decide what drinks would be our best. They have plenty of table space if you'll like to work. It is a bit quieter than Starbucks so me and my friend were talking low to not disturb others. I wouldn't encourage small groups to come if they want to meet or have a conversation. At least that was my experience.

35.description: Tried to go in at 7:50 pm on thursday evening since it says it opens until 9pm. The door was locked and the staff said they are closed. They need more accurate hours posted on the page. I won't bother coming in after 5pm. The coffee is not extraordinary anyway.

19.description: Ok, so the tea is pretty good and they have a decent selection and the decor is nice and the baristas are very friendly but I don't think I'll be coming back here. The reason why is that when you purchase something and ask for the wifi info you get a little slip with a complicated password that lets you use the wifi for an hour. Not the kind of vibe I want at a little neighborhood coffee shop.

28.description: My favorite coffee shop. Details: It's gorgeous inside. Fast wifi with purchase. Super friendly service. All of the baristas are so nice here. Seriously. Not one has been mean to me even when I think it's a good idea to go out into the world freshly rolled out of bed and looking that way too. Their black iced tea. I don't drink coffee so I always drink other things at a coffee shop and this tea. This tea. I'm not really sure what it is about it but it is so delicious. I crave it like some people crave coffee. And their flatbreads. So. Good. Get one.

45.description: It's an average fancy coffee place, pretty full of itself and full of hipsters, but the coffee is good, strong, and the milk is well frothed. They don't do tasty flavorings like, say, Ipsento, but for a good, basic coffee it works. It seemed more like a place to sit with friends than to wit and work. They also sell lots of overpriced coffee accoutrements.

33.description: Fantastic coffee served by baristas that know what they're doing. You won't be ever be served a bad coffee drink here. The modern design, wood aesthetics, and chill music make for a nice atmosphere.

43.description: I had a business meeting here once. I ordered an iced americano. It's a notch above Starbucks in quality and price.The ambiance is nice -- attracting a more 'indie' crowd of bicycle messengers, artists, and telecommuting workers. I would recommend this coffee shop to those interested in exploring beyond the Starbucks horizon.

2.description: This is my spot people.  The Coffee Studio is awesome with cozy places to sit, little art exhibits on the walls, a good little retail selection, vibrant energy and good coffee.  They sell Intelligencia.  They also offer a small assortment of beer and wine if you'd like to have a beer as you study or hang out.  Their pastry assortment is soso...Doughnuts are dry so you're better off going to DD.  They do have an almond croissant that rocks my world.  One of the best things is that they get the froth right on cappuccinos and lattes.  So many places screw that up.  They must put the staff through rigorous froth class.  I do wish they would stay open a bit later at least some of the week.  They are only open till 9pm.

18.description: I love the atmosphere here, along with the coffee! Solid food selections, and the pastries are always delicious. I'd be there every morning if it wasn't so far from me, but in the meantime I will cherish my impromptu visits here!

41.description: Discovered the Coffee Studio while antique shopping in the area. This will be my go-to spot in Andersonville moving forward. The Coffee Studio has delicious pastries, Intelligentsia coffee, and an upscale ambiance with an eye toward design. The staff here looks like the hipster trendy type but are friendly an unpretentious.

52.description: Just had a great coffee au lait at The Coffee Studio. Daughter and I went for breakfast on a wedding errand and crafting weekend. We each had a spinach and cheese croissant and our coffees. The barista asked if it would be alright if we waited to have our croissants toasted, as the oven had pizzas in it, with the heat cranked up and it would scorch the croissants.  I really appreciated her asking, the croissant was delicious!

50.description: This place and everyone in it will judge you! Starting with the two baristas, who stare at you and make you feel like you are doing something wrong just by walking in the door. They are not friendly at all. Then people who go here don't want to be disturbed and want to take up the biggest tables for their laptops. They will stare at you awkwardly over the top of their screens when you try and have a quiet conversation. If I wanted to pay money to be judged by people there are a million other places I would rather go to for that. The only reason for two stars is because the main reason to come here is for the coffee and the coffee/drinks are great.

4.description: 5 stars for for a cute, comfy environment with brick walls, comfy chairs and cute decor.4 stars for overpriced iced tea on a menu board with too-small font.3 stars for only getting an hour on the code-protected, moderate-speed wifi.

6.description: I was about to give The Coffee Studio 3 stars, but after seeing that Yelp suggested that 3 stars is equivalent to "A-OK" I just couldn't. It wouldn't be fair to the world.I love trying new cafes, and I've heard a few good things about The Coffee Studio so I thought I'd check it out. When I got there, I was pretty impressed with the atmosphere and thought it would be a nice place to sit and study for a while. I order my coffee, got some food, had myself a seat and hopped on my computer... Oh wait, I forgot a step... I also had to get a wifi code with my purchase which allowed me 1 hour of internet... I'm sorry, but this just isn't reasonable considering the price I pay for coffee and food at The Coffee Studio. I understand the logic that the internet should only be for paying customers, but I can find plenty of other cafes that don't suggest that I get the F out after an hour. I won't be returning

22.description: This place looks cool but it is nothing special for the following reasons:- the one hour of free wifi is ridiculous and didn't even work on my laptop- the prices are just terrible - more than $8 for a cup of tea and a chocolate croissant?- although the tea selection is decent it is very sad that they treat it as an ugly stepchild and have sad paper sleeves for the leaves. It's essentially just tea bags at that point. It would be so, so easy to improve your tea game! I do realize this is called the Coffee Studio, but if you're going to have tea on the menu, it's not hard to try.- the chocolate croissant I had was very poor and had the equivalent of only about 4 chocolate chips in it. Don't be fooled by the pretty egg wash.

15.description: Coffee is so delicious and an awesome atmosphere to get work done in. Very happy with my experience here. Definitely go!

57.description: I walked in and thought "wait, am I in wicker park?" Then a stroller bumped into me and I realized I was in fact in Andersonville. This is not just your average coffee shop. They truly care about crafting delicious, quality drinks. Not only that, they stock some of the best pastries a coffee shop can offer. And they have doughnut vault doughnuts. OK, count me in!The atmosphere is nice and mellow, but does tend to attract a large group of table hoarders that turn their table into their home office. It's not "I brought my iMac to the coffee shop" bad, but it is a bit annoying that they tend to hog much of the seating there.Despite that, the coffee studio is by far my favorite place to sit, chat and grab a coffee. Plus it's in Andersonville! How can you beat that?

20.description: Ok, so the tea is pretty good and they have a decent selection and the decor is nice and the baristas are very friendly but I don't think I'll be coming back here. The reason why is that when you purchase something and ask for the wifi info you get a little slip with a complicated password that lets you use the wifi for an hour. Not the kind of vibe I want at a little neighborhood coffee shop.

36.description: The space is nice and is laptop friendly (lots of outlets and single tables) The coffee is not good though,way to acidic.

14.description: Places like these make me happy to be on earth. And the fact that the Coffee Studio is located on a street with a great brunch place, a great yarn shop, and a great barbecue restaurant make me wish I lived in Chicago. The Coffee Studio is a gorgeous space with a beautiful interior (modernist, exposed brick, all the style accoutrements of modern day hipster living) and an expansive menu of coffee drinks, breakfast items, and so forth. They use Intelligentsia beans, and while those are a bit overroasted for my taste (not that this is the Coffee Studio's fault), the coffee they brew is very nice. This is a great place to hang out, have a cup of coffee, and peruse the latest issue of ArtForum magazine.

58.description: Okkkayyyy. Took quite a long break from Polygon after my last experience of terrible sushi that wasn't fresh and had hair in it.Foolishly went again tonight and thought I'd try their sushi again, it'd been over a year. Their sushi is still NOT FRESH and not good. Bad taste, bad texture, nauseating. I ordered the spicy tuna and New York maki, I'd advise against all their sushi. Plus it's wildly overpriced for what it is. We had an order of gyoza too. Just OK. Nothing special. Their Thai food is really mediocre too. I wish to sh*t this place was good since we live so close, I'd love it to be a regular spot for us but the food is bad, below mediocre and not fresh. The wait service is extremely lacking too. As in inattentive and not available. When someone finally showed up to notice I'd eaten almost none of my sushi and asked me why they argued with me about it. "We make rolls fresh everyday." I would hope you f*cking do. I'm not implying you roll these maki days in advance (although maybe they do, came out faster than a mcdouble at McDonalds). I'm implying the contents within are of very low quality. Your crummy fish is bad and has been sitting in saran wrap for God knows how long. Waitress made absolutely no apology or attempt at a concession. In the end our bill was $40. Christ what a waste. Nothing like feeling taken advantage of. Lastly the restaurant was filled with flies and fruit flies. Disgusting.I'm never coming back. Another restaurant that gets added to the NEVER AGAIN list.

56.description: Carefully prepared food with no flavor. We had high hopes for this place based on a few of the rave reviews here. We were disappointed. The crab rangoons are oddly sweet. The sprig rolls don't come as a roll but rather like a sliced and arranged sushi roll. The rice paper wrap is opaque and the entire dish has no flavor at all, save the bits lucky enough to have a thin slice of jalapeño on top. My boyfriend got the Chef's Choice sushi set which came with the most basic assortment of fish imaginable. It appears the chef doesn't want to make choices here. The last piece he ate had a terrible taste--a bummer to end on. I had the chicken Pad Thai, assuming that it should be something they would do well. I was wrong. The dish, like the others, was so utterly devoid of flavor that it was inedible and I went to hunt down a shot glass of hot pepper sauce. I've had great Pad Thai and the bland disaster I was served at Polygon left me wondering if the chef here has ever tasted Thai food. Adding insult to injury, the bill was $47. Never again! The only pros would be that the location and decor are nice. Maybe go here just for tea and to read a book?

29.description: Just popped in for a quick snack last night and drinks. Had the avocado maki and house saki which was surprisingly tasty for house saki! Prices were great. Ambiance was nice. Service was good and speedy. They are currently running a promotion on Yelp for a free drink or miso soup if you check in on Yelp, so be sure to do so! I will definitely be back for dinner sometime.

42.description: First time there today.  Very good and the server was friendly and explained all.  I had beef and broccoli and she had King Alaska.  We both were very full and enjoyed the experience.

23.description: The atmosphere is beautiful, with an open curbside dining room. I tried three different types of maki, all of which were delicious. The fish was exceptionally fresh, with pleasant flavor and texture. Presentation of the sushi was unique and artistic. The miso soup was flavorful and was the perfect temperature. The service was truly excellent; I was neither smothered nor ignored. The staff do an excellent job.

47.description: Great place for sushi and Thai food! They have alcohol for purchase but you can also BYOB (though there is a per-person corkage fee).  I love the vibe and have never had a problem getting a table. If you happen to be in the neighborhood during lunch hours, I hear they have great lunch specials!

8.description: Usually when I hang out with my dad, I eat Vietnamese food or gyros lol. But today, I wanted to try something new. So I decided to take my dad to this sushi place. I found it on yelp when searching for sushi places in the Chicagoland area. It had relatively good reviews and a 4/5 rating. When we walked in around 1pm today on a Monday, we were the only people in there. I was kind of skeptical about eating here since there were no other customers but I gave this restaurant the benefit of the doubt. I ordered several sushi rolls including shrimp tempura, Philadelphia, Mexican, and spider! Can you say quality rolls?!? Those were freakin delicious. They were made so perfectly. Each roll was about $7. No lunch time deals like other sushi places but one advantage is the quality. So soooooooo soooooo good! In addition to this, we got the pad Thai with chicken which was also bomb. The server was not the over friendly type. She just got the job done with a hint of friendliness. I really really love ginger with sushi. I always ask for extra (like a lot extra) but I've never been charged for extra ginger. When I asked her for extra ginger a second time, she was gonna charge me. I immediately said forget it. Moments later, she ended up bringing it out anyway for no cost. So in the end, I think it clicked for her. Otherwise, she was a decent server. All in all, I would recommend this place for sushi. Their lunch menu is okay. Check it out!

31.description: Ordered the calamari, edamame, pad-see-ew (not mind blowing) and a few sushi rolls. The food was good; however, the service during the week (when it gets busy) is very disappointing.

34.description: Oh my gosh, I'm having dreams about the panang curry noodles -- wide rice noodles with perfectly spicy/sweet sauce and plenty of good tofu and veggies. I haven't tried anything else, but I'll be back for this totally great dish, for sure.

16.description: Corkage fee is $3 a person!!!! Came in sat down and noticed the menu didn't have any alcohol. One of our friends wanted wine so she along with another friend go across the street to buy a bottle of wine. 2 out of 4 of us have a glass of wine and we  are charged $12 as a corkage fee!!!!

13.description: This place is really cute and located in the heart of Andersonville! They have proportionate entrees for a thai restaurant (not massively huge). The prices are very reasonable so this is a great place to do a girls night, which is what we did. They serve alcohol, which is convenient, since a lot of places around here are only BYOB! The pad khee mao is delicious and nice and spicy. I wish the chicken was a bit fresher though - I hate that frozen taste, which I think this is. I would stick to the veggie options here.

11.description: It took me way too long to try this place for how close it is to me.  My loss, because it's really solid.  Dine-in is a nice experience, but they also offer a good $7.50 or 7.95 weekday lunch special which sometimes tickles my fancy on work-from-home days.  With the exception of a spring roll--which came straight from the refrigerator and tasted as if it had been there for weeks--all of the food has been really good.  The pad thai is very nice, with thinner noodles than usual but good flavor and lots and lots of tofu.  Pad pak is even better; the vegetables carry a nice grilled taste.  The drunken noodles are excellent too.  My favorite dish so far is the delicious basil entree, so damn flavorful with an assertive but not overpowering heat.Tom kha soup gets a thumbs up, the garlic and ginger entrees are pretty decent, and even the humble egg roll is really, really good.

39.description: This place is one of my favorites.I usually just get the Pineapple fried rice..which is deliciousAlthough it tastes a little different lately- possibly a new chefIt's right down the street and the portions are pretty big.Overall this place is solid.

37.description: Great food! Lunch special is a steal- $7.50 for soup, starter, and entree!I would highly recommend.

0.description: Delicious and generous udon stir fry for a fair price (by Chicago standards anyhow). Good service

38.description: DELIGHTFUL little place on Clark in my FAVorite Andersonville.  Popped in for a quick lunch and the thai food was perfect. Will be back!

51.description: Among other sushi places I thought that this place was a little above decent. The rolls were pretty big, rice a bit over cooked and not the freshest fish but still good quality. I would like to go back to try other entrees other than the sushi- the other dishes seemed like they may be better. I would go back. The ambiance is romantic and trendy.

27.description: My boyfriend and I are obsessed with this place. We used to come here 3 times a week! Their lunch special is such a great deal. Appetizer and entree for only like 7.95 and then you can check in for a soup or drink. For appetizers, the crab rangoon is amazing. You will not be disappointed if you try it. It doesn't taste like the ones you have at a Chinese restaurant. The pad see eiw is very good and not too heavy in sauce. They also have a great selection of sushi and the chef designs it so beautifully. The restaurant itself has a great atmosphere. They play relaxing acoustic covers and in the summertime, they open the windows. Cannot talk enough about this place!

32.description: Polygon is pretty average, which is disappointing considering their fantastic location and high-ish prices (which I presume are due in part to the rent at said location). The fish isn't the freshest, the special rolls look great on the menu but are generally kind of bland, and the Thai dishes are uninspired (if nice and spicy). The real kicker is the three dollar per person corkage fee for BYOB. Our waitress the other evening also decided to track on 20% gratuity for our party of four plus one baby, which struck us as really presumptuous. It's a better deal during the week, either for their lunch specials or using one of their weeknight-only coupons.

54.description: Absolutely the  melt in your outh sushi.  wonderfuly attentive servce, and nicely priced.  Its not cheap, but it is definately worth it.

48.description: Usually when I hang out with my dad, I eat Vietnamese food or gyros lol. But today, I wanted to try something new. So I decided to take my dad to this sushi place. I found it on yelp when searching for sushi places in the Chicagoland area. It had relatively good reviews and a 4/5 rating. When we walked in around 1pm today on a Monday, we were the only people in there. I was kind of skeptical about eating here since there were no other customers but I gave this restaurant the benefit of the doubt. I ordered several sushi rolls including shrimp tempura, Philadelphia, Mexican, and spider! Can you say quality rolls?!? Those were freakin delicious. They were made so perfectly. Each roll was about $7. No lunch time deals like other sushi places but one advantage is the quality. So soooooooo soooooo good! In addition to this, we got the pad Thai with chicken which was also bomb. The server was not the over friendly type. She just got the job done with a hint of friendliness. I really really love ginger with sushi. I always ask for extra (like a lot extra) but I've never been charged for extra ginger. When I asked her for extra ginger a second time, she was gonna charge me. I immediately said forget it. Moments later, she ended up bringing it out anyway for no cost. So in the end, I think it clicked for her. Otherwise, she was a decent server. All in all, I would recommend this place for sushi. Their lunch menu is okay. Check it out!

44.description: It pains me to give this place only 3 stars. The staff is nice and the location and look of the place is nice too. But, sometimes the food is really good, and other times it's really not. There's nothing worse than biting into sushi and realizing its past its prime. Yuck. So for that reason, I've started going elsewhere in Andersonville when I'm craving sushi.

24.description: I love this place! The sushi is one of best I've had and the Thai food is great too. One of my favorite is the polygon wings...the only bad thing about this is the wait time.

7.description: A friend of mine was visiting from the 'burbs and wanted some sushi for lunch. You would be surprised at how many sushi places are not open for lunch on a Saturday! After realizing we couldn't go to one of my usual sushi joints, I went to Yelp in search of a noon-time sushi meal & you guys led me to Polygon.We did not participate in the BYOB, but I do agree with everyone else saying that if it really is $3 corkage/person, that's highway robbery. But, my 4 stars are for our meals... the sushi was delicious! Super fresh, presented nicely & very reasonably priced. I'm glad we ended up here and would definitely come back.

49.description: Nice casual spot for some Japanese food. It's byob but they charge a corking fee because they also sell some alcohol.

40.description: It took me way too long to try this place for how close it is to me.  My loss, because it's really solid.  Dine-in is a nice experience, but they also offer a good $7.50 or 7.95 weekday lunch special which sometimes tickles my fancy on work-from-home days.  With the exception of a spring roll--which came straight from the refrigerator and tasted as if it had been there for weeks--all of the food has been really good.  The pad thai is very nice, with thinner noodles than usual but good flavor and lots and lots of tofu.  Pad pak is even better; the vegetables carry a nice grilled taste.  The drunken noodles are excellent too.  My favorite dish so far is the delicious basil entree, so damn flavorful with an assertive but not overpowering heat.Tom kha soup gets a thumbs up, the garlic and ginger entrees are pretty decent, and even the humble egg roll is really, really good.

53.description: We have passed Polygon several times and finally decided to go in last night and we were very glad we did. Prompt service, great atmosphere, perfect lighting and excellent food. We ordered calamari to start with and 4 rolls. We could have easily skipped the appetizer or one roll based on the size of everything. We spent around $50 before tip including cork fee. They also have a killer lunch special that we are going to try very soon. Definitely will be going back for the deliciously fresh sushi!

30.description: Food is delicious and fast.  I highly recommend the Drunken Noodles (extra spicy). Also, the staff is very polite and friendly.  A great neighborhood spot.

46.description: I'll try eating in next time and trying other items, but I was not entirely impressed with my takeout from Polygon.  The pad thai and the crab fried rice were both exceptionally greasy tasting, though the spring rolls and crab rangoon were pretty fresh.  The fried rice had soft shell crab tempura on top which was nice, I was hoping for crab meat in the dish though.  Friendly staff.

1.description: Here's what I tried here:Chicken/Shrimp with Oyster SauceWingsCashew ChickenThe Magma Roll (Maki)Everything was excellent and the sauce was sauce on the chicken was DELICIOUS. The service was already really great (especially considering that we went on a Friday night).I am taking away 1 star because this restaurant does something that is an extreme pet peeve of mine--they charged a corkage fee for EVERYONE at the table...and didn't uncork anything for us...we did it ourselves. I have no objection to corkage fee's in general, but I kind of want to feel (at least be able to pretend) that I'm actually paying for a service and them not opening anything definitely made me feel like we got shorted. There were 12 people in my party so we paid an extra $12...essentially for a ice bucket...which just did not feel like a great value to me. When I go again (which I will, because the food was great) I think We'll just get drinks there to avoid this scendario.

55.description: Reallly nice staff and good sushi, pad thai. They have a great lunch special deal. Ambiance is very relaxing as well.

9.description: Just popped in for a quick snack last night and drinks. Had the avocado maki and house saki which was surprisingly tasty for house saki! Prices were great. Ambiance was nice. Service was good and speedy. They are currently running a promotion on Yelp for a free drink or miso soup if you check in on Yelp, so be sure to do so! I will definitely be back for dinner sometime.

26.description: My wife and I love Polygon Cafe. We used to get delivery from them all the time but don't live close enough any more . Eating in is a great experience too as the staff is friendly and its BYOB. I would recommend the noodle dishes(Pad see eiw being my favorite) and the sweet potato roll. Admittedly there are better places to get curry. You should definitely give Polygon a try if you haven't already!

25.description: Delicious! My go-to favorite.

12.description: My partner and I absolutely love this place! We've been coming here since they've opened and really appreciate the wonderful servers who are always so sweet, the food which is amazing, and the general lack of judgement when we order spicey mayo with everything :)I also have to say the wooden paneling in the place is awesome! I've been plotting to replicate it in our condo, because why not right!Highly recommend if you're venturing in the beautiful Andersonville neighborhood go the day.Don't forget to BYOB, but I do believe there is a $3 charge per person to do so.

59.description: A nice little Asian place on a great strip of Clark Street.  There's always great things to see and do in Andersonville.  I live in Andersonville but this is the first time I've actually walked down Clark Street and into one of its establishments.  The Polygon Cafe' is a great place to hide from the sweltering sun with a Tahi Iced Tea, or warm up with some Red Curry.  The restaurant is billed as a Thai restaurant, but a large portion of the menu is Japanese cuisine.  Regardless, the Yakisoba I had was wonderful.  It was a very slow day in the restaurant so my fiance and I relaxed to the soft music playing and rested our eyes in the dimly lit room.  Two dishes of Yakisoba and Red Curry plus drinks set us back $30, so it's not a place I'd eat at everyday.  But for the service, atmosphere, variety of dishes and the TASTE, I'll be stopping by again soon!

21.description: Corkage fee is $3 a person!!!! Came in sat down and noticed the menu didn't have any alcohol. One of our friends wanted wine so she along with another friend go across the street to buy a bottle of wine. 2 out of 4 of us have a glass of wine and we  are charged $12 as a corkage fee!!!!

17.description: This is a treasure! Great atmosphere and location in Andersonville. We had the Pad Thai and the Lad Nar they were delicious and on point. Oh did I mention it's a great value. We shall return!!!

10.description: This place has really great food and nice presentation. The staff is always nice and attentive  I have been here with my bf for dinner several times and I am always pleased. Pad thai is always great. The sushi is awesome .

5.description: We came in for a quick sushi fix. We got the salmon maki ($5) and nigiri ($2.5) as well as the escolar maki ($6). The sushi was prepared rather quickly - within 10 mins. It tasted fresh and the fish to rice ratio was fair. I would definitely come back again.

3.description: Oh my gosh I can't get over how delicious their lemon pepper crispy calamari appetizer was!  They are great to devour alone or with the honey wasabi dipping sauce.  We split an order with an order of edamame for our group of 6.  The main entrees were also good - lots to choose from since it's a Thai/pain Asian restaurant.  I was craving sashimi so I went for the sashimi bento box.  The pieces were surprisingly fresh.  The box came with house salad, tempura, and a California roll, so I was pretty full.  Reasonably priced too.  My brother tried one of the medium spiced curries - he said it was good in between sweating it out.Service was kind of slow, but there was only one person working and there were only two other parties besides us for a late mid-day lunch.  She was pretty friendly and patient with our rather boisterous and somewhat drunk group who just finished the Half Acre Brewery tour right before lunch.

35.description: Overall, a pretty average experience. We decided to try Polygon based on the great reviews and ordered delivery. The food came pretty quickly, which was nice, but I was thoroughly unimpressed with their red curry. I ordered it with tofu, and what I got tasted mostly like canned curry paste mixed with a ton of coconut milk, with some canned bamboo shoots, sliced raw tofu, and chopped raw bell peppers. No complexity of flavor - it was fairly hot (spicy) but I'm guessing that was just due to the few slices of jalapeño they threw in. Oh, and they charge extra for rice, which is a cheap move for a dish that pretty much requires rice. The food was not bad, and I may have had bad luck with this particular dish. However, I'm not in a hurry to try Polygon again.

19.description: We might as well just have a standing take-out order from this place ready to go whenever we don't feel like making dinner. It is amazingly good food, fast and the ambiance is perfect. They have the nicest patio/inside combo with large windows that open onto Clark St and provide breeze without having to deal with people tripping over your chair. The waitstaff is friendly and the food is delicious. There is a corkage fee, but you can bypass it by just trying a thai beer, which is delicious, too! All the noodle and curry dishes can be made vegetarian and its such a good place if you're avoiding gluten and/or dairy. Their dishes are perfectly spiced, never salty and just the right size.

28.description: I love Polygon. I'm moving back to Chicago in June and can't wait to go back. The food is excellent and very reasonably priced. The space is warm & cozy and the servers are so friendly.

45.description: Went there from the reviews... Food wasn't that good. The soup was bland and sushi was very small. Very pricey for what food was served and tasted. We were the only ones for lunch that day so service was good. Eh, I've had better or more like I can cook better..

33.description: Affordable and high quality.  I had a mix of thai and sushi and both were excellent.  Obviously a great location (Andersonville) and great service too.

43.description: Polygon has great Maki for great prices! A friend of mine orders from here all the time so I decided to try it out. I got the sweet potato tempura maki, Mexican maki, spicy tuna maki, and spicy scallop sashimi. My favorite Maki were the sweet potato and mexican, but everything was well made and well plated. Seafood was fresh. They also offer 10% off takeout and delivery if you pay cash, and a free appetizer for orders over 25$. I got the crab Rangoon,  which were ok but a little small.  I am definitely ordering here again.

2.description: Day 148: Where does one go to steel one's self against an apartment deathly in the grips of Whole30 madness? A magical place. A place of noodles, sugar, peanuts, and soy. Which is to say, a Thai restaurant. And the Polygon Cafe is quite a good one.So for my little lunch for one, I started off with Gyoza for an appetizer, then moved on to Beef Pad See-ew. Very tasty, and more than enough to take home for a 2nd meal in reserve. I had gone in-between the lunch and the dinner rushes, so service was prompt, though I hope I can go back when it's a little more atmospheric. Also, I didn't really see many Polygons there. That feels like false advertising.

18.description: I love the food here, but I have to say, the portions are drastically different when ordering delivery. Portions when dinning in are very generous, but quite small when ordering delivery. I still give them a solid 4 stars because I've never had a bad meal here. My absolute favorite dish here is the spicy udon noodle with tofu and the tempura. I also enjoy how the menu includes sushi! It's a cute, clean and modern looking restaurant. Unfortunately I never really see the restaurant busy, hopefully there delivery business is bringing in enough profit to keep them afloat!

41.description: Better to eat-in than order out. Food came luke warm for delivery, an hour later. Much better in store. Friendly staff.

52.description: We came here for dinner and I immediately liked the atmosphere, with its dimly lit dining area and an ambience quiet enough for diners to speak comfortably without having to yell, but not deathly silent that it makes the dinner awkward. Among the dishes we ordered included the crispy tofu, drunken noodles (with extra chillies & basil), miso soup, spicy scallop maki, King Alaska maki and nama sake (fresh salmon). With our Yelp check-ins we were also given free Thai iced teas.For a person who's lived in Bangkok for 4 years and whose favorite dish is PASTA KEE MAO (!!!!!!) -- a.k.a. drunken noodles -- I was very very very happy to find that Polygon Cafe's take on it was just as I wanted it to be. Spicy, flavorful, and full of basil scent + taste. Both the makis were also very good, and I'd definitely come back for them. The crispy tofu, nama sake, and miso soup were average--as in good, but nothing special. The Thai iced tea was way too sweet, but it was pre-made so waiters couldn't do anything about it. We just added quite a lot of water to the tea on our own.

50.description: Love it here - this is boyfriend and I's go-to spot for Thai food and our fav spot in Andersonville. In the summertime, the front face of the restaurant completely opens up - sitting by the window feels like an outdoor spot. All of the servers we have had here have been very fast, friendly, and straight to business. Everything we have tried has been great - Pad See Ew, Pad Thai, Chicken Curry, Gyoza, Spring Rolls, all have been great. Thai iced tea is great too, and comes in a mason jar mug - check in on Yelp for a free one! One star taken off because they used to be BYOB. With the liquor store across the street, it was the perfect set up. Now you can bring in your own bottle, but there is a corkage fee. :(

4.description: Absolutely the best sweet potato tempura maki rolls I've ever tasted.  Fantastic service, also!

6.description: Pure, simple perfection.  The food is clean, simple and fresh, and it's beautifully presented.  I had tofu and veggies with a light nutty garlic sauce.  When I ordered it I was concerned that the garlic would be overpowering.  This was not the case at all.  The sauce was flavorful yet mellow.  The tofu was soft and the broccoli and carrots al dente.  Perfect and comforting.  My friend had the red curry and loved it.  Portions are not huge but the quality is high.  Service was super attentive.  Clark St.  In Andersonville is a good place to walk around.  There's lots to see and do.  Make sure you stop in at Polygon Cafe.

22.description: Some of the best Thai food on the north side. We ordered California rolls, Basil Chicken, Drunken noodles and Crab Rangoon. A feast. The Basil Chicken was particularly tasty with lots of vegetables and just the right amount of spiciness.

15.description: This is definitely my go-to take out place from now on. I've gotten take-out from here twice in two weeks because the food is so good. My favorite is the Spicy Udon noodles, but the Yakisoba noodles are delicious, too! Also, received a $10 off GrubHub coupon which is a perk! The place is super cute so I'm sure at some point I'll actually dine in.

57.description: very pretty if simple room, very friendly staff, very quick (we had to be out by 7:45) and food that was very tasty. I plan to be a regular at Polygon.

20.description: The restaurant has an awesome location and looks nice and clean inside and out.  I got the Thai Fried Rice and it was great for only $8!!!

36.description: I come here weekly and am never disappointed! The atmosphere is intimate, the prices and portions are wonderful, and everything comes out quick and piping hot! The thai iced tea is some of the best as well!

14.description: A few nights ago my family was visiting from out of town. We all wanted sushi and we tried two other places. One had a two hour wait and the other was closed for the holiday. I'm really happy the other two didn't work out or we never would've tried Polygon! This place was delicious.To start, the atmosphere was great. They have a great layout and each table is placed perfectly within the small space. We sat by the big open windows. It was just as good as sitting on a patio. The energy from the neighborhood was electric.I ordered three hand rolls...the same three hand rolls I order at every sushi restaurant: salmon skin, spicy tuna and negi hamachi. They were great. Some of the best i've had in Chicago. My family all ordered different maki and they loved their orders. I don't remember what they had because I was too wrapped up in my own delicious feast. Right now they're still byob but they do serve alcohol. The corkage fee is minimal compared to the price of wine so I gladly accepted it. Our waitress was great. She seated us instantly and served us promptly. She helped my gluten-free mother order from the menu and was very attentive. I can't wait to go back!

58.description: there is a deli with amazing meats and cheeses (my finace thinks one of the salamis is like "stained glass" when you hold it up to the light...now that is some food porn taken to a new level). but seriously, wonderful sandwiches and then the store has tastey imports. i like to get panettone every xmas and i know i can get that there. really there are so many reasons to stop there and get things...which is funny cause i never see many people in there and just down the street the subway is packed. prices for the sandwiches and soup (italian wedding my fav) are really reasonable.

56.description: Terrible service. We ordered the rollup with the oven roasted chicken. Avocado, Italian dressing, havarti and gouda. We received ham with honey mustard dressing and no cheese. We contacted grubhub to let them know that we received the wrong order and the asshole at the restaurant told them he sent us chicken. Is sliced chicken pink? Someone explain please! Worst customer service. Took my $24 refused to refund it and was rude as hell when we called them. Never order here again for delivery. Jackasses! I wish yelp let us give 0 stars.

29.description: Delicious sandwiches!  The Boss, Chicken Parm, and Amy's are my faves.  The bread, meats and cheeses are always fresh.  Great customer service too!

42.description: Stopped in here with my parents when they visited school and dropped about 100 dollars on unbelievable meats, pastas, sauces, and fresh veggies... so worth it. I definitely have a soft spot for little Italian deli's, but this place was great. Also the prosciottu sandwich was off the chain.

23.description: Delicious. Cheap. Friendly. Authentic.

47.description: I wanted t wait until I actually visited Piatto Pronto to review. The first time I tried this place, it was through delivery. I got their version of the Cuban sandwich and it was delicious. I was craving a sandwich today and stopped by the actual store. This place is tiny, but I got in line and this guy got in line behind me. So...why did the guy ringing people up check him out before taking my order, not even acknowledging me? So bizarre. I went with the Il Milano, which I've heard good things about. The verdict? Bland. It really wasn't anything special, especially the bread. If I do go back, I'll probably stick to their hot sandwiches.

8.description: Great food and people. Can't want to got back. Prices are excellent and the chicken parm is by far the best in the city

31.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Everything I've had has been phenomenal and you can't beat the prices! Their enchilada soup is unbelievably good. You have to eat here more than once just because it's so hard to decide what to get! Their delivery is quick and always correct.

34.description: I ordered my food. The sandwich was excellent, it's the sandwich you crave when you go to a sub shop but it never is as amazing as you hoped it would be. Wonderful. I also ordered two soups, both soups were a little too salty. I was impressed with the delivery time and the food, I think Ill just skip the soup next time.

16.description: Not sure why anyone would eat at subway, this place is great!  Sandwiches comes with tons of meat and are excellent.  Friendly staff also.

13.description: Hands down the best delicatessen this side of the Ohio Valley.  The staff greats everyone the second you step foot inside. Ok full disclosure...No self respecting Joisey Gal would ever eat at Potbellys, et al. The quality and quantity of theirs "hoagies" are second to none. A 6" hoagie is enough for two people for $6, you can't get this style of goodness anywhere else. Fresh roasted meats, crisp vegetable toppings, incredible bread !  All prepared foods are homemade with a nice variety of meals and soups. Here's the best part for my fellow foodies....wait for it.....an array of imported Mediterranean products at domestic prices.

11.description: Gave Piatto Pronto a second chance with a pickup order, and was satisfied this time on all counts: value, timing and quality were all above average. My friends who shared the sandwiches also gave them a thumbs up. Revised to 4 stars
