Out in the front of their building, there is a common parking lot that the neighboring businesses adjacent to them use as well.  Anyway, I have been using the services in the professional building next door for many years, and if there wasn't any parking available immediately in front, we've always been able to park in front of Koval with no problems.  Until yesterday.As I left from my appointment next door, I happened upon a parking ticket on my vehicle.  The police officer who had just written it was pulling away, saw me, and got back out of his car to tell me that the workers in the Koval business "have been complaining a lot" about cars that apparently are "too far onto the sidewalk" when pulling into a space.  I re-examined my parking job, and decided that this was probably one of the most nit-picky, senseless reasons to ever receive a parking ticket.  Every other time I have parked here, my car has been in the same exact non-pedestrian-impeding distance from the rest of the sidewalk--as has everyone else's--without any problems.  The front of my car was not preventing anyone's passage as far as blocking the sidewalk goes.  As I found it odd that a police officer would have the time and gumption to get out of his vehicle during a shift to examine the fronts of vehicles parked at a business and determine whether a violation occurred, I contacted the business I frequent next door to delve a little deeper.  The much kinder practitioners in the adjacent building have informed me that Koval and its workers also tried to hog this public lot as their own by attempting to put up a "tow-zone" sign in order to bogart all the spots.  Real, real neighborly, guys. (By the way, they couldn't legally keep that sign up it turns out).  And if you come in the winter time, good luck trudging through the snow they never shovel.  Because when I arrive in front of the neighboring building, the walkway has always been salted and the sidewalk is safely clear.  It's like a tale of two buildings.What a petty, shameful act on the part of a business that shares a lot with many others.  I will make sure to tell everyone I know what the priorities are of the people who work here, and what is most important to them--bothering the police who could be out stopping real crime.

5.description: Fantastic tour!  I live in the neighborhood and have always been curious about the tiny little neighborhood distillery, I'm so glad I checked it out!The staff are VERY knowledgeable about the distilling process from start to finish.  I have been on several winery tours, but never a distillery.  They explained everything and didn't make us feel ignorant when asking questions.  I've even come away with some trivia I have impressed my friends with!The highlight is naturally the tasting.  You get to try about 8 varieties of whiskey, plus their vodka (surprisingly refreshing), gin (AH-MAZING!  I bought a bottle!) and a couple of their liqueurs.  The tour is a great value, plus you get 20% off your purchase that night.  I highly recommend checking it out!

3.description: As a holiday gift (2014) I received a ticket for a tour of the KOVAL distillery with my son. We went on a Sunday afternoon in January.As far as distilleries go, Chicago has lacked them since prohibition. KOVAL claims to have started the return of the Chicago distillery and several others have followed. They have this location, where they do make some spirits, store barrels as they age, and have a liquor store/gift shop.Our tour guide was very knowledgeable about the distilling processes and their products. During the tour, he explains the mechanics of the distillation process. All throughout, you sample a variety of items including whiskeys made with several different grains, rye, bourbon, vodka and gin, as well as a few liqueurs.I have to say, I did enjoy the tasting immensely. When done, if there was anything they didn't have for sampling in the tour, they would pour for you. We walked out of there with a T-Shirt, a bottle of Bourbon and a bottle of Vodka.This was a great experience, and one I would really recommend that people try. If you are a drinker, at least occasionally, or have ever wondered how spirits are made, they do an amazing job of showing you and keeping you entertained at the same time. If you do go, plan to eat afterwards. They serve you the samples in a shot glass and only fill it a little but, but you probably go through at least 10 of these throughout the one hours tour. Before you hop into a car, it's a good idea to let the alcohol work through your system.

35.description: I loved the tour we took.  Our guide did an amazing job of blending entertainment and information.  She took us step by step through the production process and we tasted what the liquor is like at each step.  I learned so much and will recommend it to anyone visiting Chicago!

19.description: It's cool that there's a distillery in Chicago again, they had to get some laws changed that had been in place since prohibition. They stick to local Midwestern ingredients as much as possible, althogyh some things like coffee just don't grow in the Midwest. Their stuff isn't cheap, but it's not ridiculous for nice smallbatch drinks. Their tours, when you can get one, are really good. It's not fluff information, and we learned about the machines and the process and what double-distilled, etc., means. We smelled heads vs. hearts vs. tails. They make drinks from a few different types of grains, including spelt. Their liqueurs are very tasty, especially the coffee. The building where they do sales and tours is very small, with some storage, but they do most of the work in a building down the street. Oh, and everything they make is kosher, so that's kind of neat. It's nice to support a real local business, which this is. They have a little parking area, and there's plenty of free street parking.

28.description: The Tour is about education, information and understanding the legacy of Koval.I am a fan of Koval due to its commitment to community, cooperative betterment for all and quality (organic, kosher, gluten-free) ingredients.The Tour makes you appreciate Whiskey, Bourbon and Liquor.  An excellent strategic tasting of 8 products, totaling 1 oz.  So, you don't come here to get drunk!  *wink*  But, a wonderful break-the-ice conversation on a first date that leaves good lasting memory.Seats requested due to 1 hr lecture type tour.  The mock-up distillery doesn't have the wow effect of a working/operating distillery.

45.description: The Wednesday before Thanksgiving a group of friends and I went to the Koval for a tour of the distillery. What a cool experience. Seeing the custom copper vats from Germany and all the spirits aging in the barrels was awesome. And what they produce was even better. We got to taste a variety of spirits, some of which I had never had. I especially enjoyed the toasted Rye, so much so that I bought a bottle before we left.The one thing I was not a fan of was our "tour guide". She did sales for the company, which is fine if I wanted to hear about where to order a Koval cocktail. I would have preferred hearing about the distilling process from someone who actually does it. She just was not that insightful and at some point the line between tour guide and sales person was erased. But overall it was an interesting experience. I recommend peeking into the barrel they have on display. I had no idea about what goes into making to aging barrels!!!

33.description: So we had an Amazon local voucher to burn and decided on a whim to go last Sunday (02/09.) We sketched together a last minute plan and emailed the distillery on Saturday (more than 24 hours out) that we had a voucher which we'd like to redeem on Sunday. When we neglected to receive a reply I became worried that whomever we'd emailed worked Mon-Fri so we called and left a message. I figured we might as well go there and try to take the 4pm tour. Nothing ventured, nothing gained.It turns out that the 4pm tour was the right choice. Our tour guide informed us that the 2pm tour had about 50 people on it  when 20 people would be a more reasonable number. She told us that she hadn't had time to check her email but she graciously allowed us to redeem our voucher. It's nice when things work out :-)The tour itself was interesting- it contained a nice mixture of information about the owners and also about the distillery process- although if you've been on brewery tours/distillery tours before there's not too much additional light being shed on the process. We were given a generous splash of nine different samples which I would estimate to add up to about 2 or 2.5 shots. If you're not too much into whiskey we also sampled three liqueurs with coffee being my favorite.The only real downside was the extended time spent standing on the concrete floors which made my preternaturally old knees hurt.

43.description: Gilt City recently had a great offer for a private tasting for 10 so I bought it for my husband's birthday party.  We had a great time!  It was a private tasting (which you can set up outside of the Gilt deal) and they allowed us to bring in a birthday cake to celebrate.  Annie was our tour guide and she was amazing - really nice.  It's a small space so there isn't much to "tour", but she gave us a history of the company and we got to sample 9 different products the company offered.  I personally really liked the flavored liquors (rose hip, ginger).  Some of the people in our group bought whiskey there and we had it with our cake.  We had a great time and would definitely recommend this tour to others.  54/365

2.description: For $10/person, we probably did not get more than two shots' worth of a very nice alcohol, but Tristan the tour guide was funny, knowledgeable, and great at imparting interesting information. This was a great opportunity to try all of KOVAL's most popular products side-by-side and get access to their liqueurs. There was a 10% discount for post-tour purchases. Definitely a good choice for the whiskey lover(s) in your life.

18.description: I would not recommend touring Koval at all. I have been on many distillery tours. We paid $30 per person to tour the Distillery. If i could rate my experience on the product itself, it would be a 5 star review. All I felt was gauged by the experience. The facility is very clean and is well set for a large group tour. When we arrived we were greeted at the check out stand by a lovely girl. I cannot remember her name. She was it,, There were multiple people already waiting for the tour to commence. I had inquired about the Bourbon and was informed there was only one bottle left. I quickly secured the bottle and paid $52.99. Lovely girl started the tour and we all shuffled into the room closer to the equipment where she could explain how it all works. This was fine and good but her delivery came across as a little bored and rote... No humor at all..there were multiple samples of all the product but not the bourbon.All samples were two sips at the most. I have since discovered that I can buy the very same bottle of bourbon at Binnys for $49.99 and at Mariano's for $44.99. Lesson learned. Do your research before hand.. Do not buy bourbon at the distillery unless they do something personal like engraving or numbered or signed by the master distiller. No tasting glass or souvenir provided for the $60 we gave this business.

41.description: It seems like everyone had a great time during their tour as I read the other reviews. Only makes me feel even more jipped by my underwhelming experience at Koval. They probably got their minds right and now have a female guide because the guy we had last summer was the absolute pits!  I don't remember the name of our guide since it has been almost a year but I remember how bored, hot, and un-tipsy I was when I left.  I've been to tastings all over Chicago but this had to be the worst one yet.First, we get there and we are standing around listening to our guy in a hot -a$$ room with no chairs.  I began to get whoozy and needed to leave the room several times to get air and had to eventually bring in a chair.  Others just began to sit on the floor b/c their legs were getting tired.  We listened to him talk at least 30 min before we got to taste anything.  When we did taste the product, there was so little in the mini plastic cup that it actually absorbed into my lips before it even reached my pallet. Like, this is a true story people.  The liquor did not reach my tongue b/c this guy put a "droplet" of whiskey in my cup.  This foolery went on for what seemed like hours.  I tried to leave but my friends didn't want me to because we paid our money.  Plus I didn't drive.  At that point they could have kept my money because I was hot, irritated and about to faint in that chair-less inferno they call a distillery.I thanked baby Jesus and all his angels when it as over. I couln't listen to this guy laugh at his own dry jokes any longer.  I actually bought a bottle of booze when we left so I could "finally" taste what they were pushing since we didn't really get a good taste while on the tour.  They have a good product, but they need to reevaluate the tour. 2 thumbs down!

52.description: I've been on brewery and winery tours before so it was time to check out a distillery! The tour here is about an hour long and we were able to taste 9 (six whiskeys and three liquors) of their products. The pours are very small so don't worry about being drunk on a Saturday afternoon! The office manager led the tour and he was very knowledgeable about the process. I like that the group was small because it gave a more intimate feel. Overall it was an interesting tour and a fun way to spend an afternoon. I would definitely come back for one of their events.

50.description: As a lover of all things whiskey, I was excited to hear that Koval distillery was right in my neighborhood. I took the distillery tour, where you hear about the history of Koval, the distilling process, and get to try several types of whiskey and liqueurs. I thought $10 was very reasonable. The distillery is small, and there isn't much to see as far as the process, but getting to taste whiskeys made from different grains and processes was interesting. Besides the on-site offerings, Koval does a lot of promotional events at local venues and is now selling mini bottles of some of their items at the Logan Square farmers market.

4.description: Fun local distillery. Make sure to make a reservation as they fill up, especially on the weekends. They give you 10% off your purchase of merchandise if you do the tasting. They give you quite a few and you get to learn quite a bit. I like this because it is quick and to the point maybe 45 minutes. The people working there know what they are taking about and very knowledgeable.

6.description: Koval makes some darn good liquor and everything is organic which is fabulous. That being said, the tour is A-OK but not something I'd really recommend to others. It's interesting if you're really into hard liquor and distilling but if you're not so much (like moi), you may not be overly interested.KOVAL has some parking right outside the distillery so that part of things is nice. My tour had about 30 people on it and with just one person working (reception / tour guide / I'm sure many other duties), when people came late, it meant she kept having to stop to let them in & check them in. The tour itself is quite informative, prob just 30-45 minutes long. I've been on a couple of distillery tours before and still picked up some new information.Throughout the tour, you get samples of each liquor available. The sample, mind you, is a quick pour, each pour equal to just about 1/8 of a shot. So when all is said and done, you've maybe had what equates to one shot though I think it's even less than that. One reviewer said they got as many samples as they liked at the end, not the case for our group.I loved the dessert liquors we sampled - orange blossom & rose hip - yum, yum, yum! Good liquor, not so good tour, stick to buying their boos to go.

22.description: I would not recommend touring Koval at all. I have been on many distillery tours. We paid $30 per person to tour the Distillery. If i could rate my experience on the product itself, it would be a 5 star review. All I felt was gauged by the experience. The facility is very clean and is well set for a large group tour. When we arrived we were greeted at the check out stand by a lovely girl. I cannot remember her name. She was it,, There were multiple people already waiting for the tour to commence. I had inquired about the Bourbon and was informed there was only one bottle left. I quickly secured the bottle and paid $52.99. Lovely girl started the tour and we all shuffled into the room closer to the equipment where she could explain how it all works. This was fine and good but her delivery came across as a little bored and rote... No humor at all..there were multiple samples of all the product but not the bourbon.All samples were two sips at the most. I have since discovered that I can buy the very same bottle of bourbon at Binnys for $49.99 and at Mariano's for $44.99. Lesson learned. Do your research before hand.. Do not buy bourbon at the distillery unless they do something personal like engraving or numbered or signed by the master distiller. No tasting glass or souvenir provided for the $60 we gave this business.

15.description: The Tour is about education, information and understanding the legacy of Koval.I am a fan of Koval due to its commitment to community, cooperative betterment for all and quality (organic, kosher, gluten-free) ingredients.The Tour makes you appreciate Whiskey, Bourbon and Liquor.  An excellent strategic tasting of 8 products, totaling 1 oz.  So, you don't come here to get drunk!  *wink*  But, a wonderful break-the-ice conversation on a first date that leaves good lasting memory.Seats requested due to 1 hr lecture type tour.  The mock-up distillery doesn't have the wow effect of a working/operating distillery.

57.description: I went back this morning but before you start thinking that I have a drinking problem (and  I actually do, I always spill when I drink, hehehe) let me tell you that I was there for hard work and for your very own pleasure, ladies and gentlemen.I bottled 85 cases of 47th Ward whiskey.Well - not all by myself but with 9 other brave souls like mine who didn't mind getting up early on a Sunday morning to get things done. Taking bottles out of a box, filling them, corking them, labeling them, putting the little plastic ring around them (I am sure that a more PC word for it, but hey!) and putting them back in a box, shiny, full and happy.Best Sunday morning ever!PS - Get a bottle. It's quite delicious.

20.description: The KOVAL tour in a nutshell: $10 per person, ~20 spots per session, and it lasts ~45 minutes.Mallory was our tour guide. She did a good job with her speech and answering questions, however her presentation manner was somewhat disinterested and unenthusiastic. Late-comers were allowed to join the group (Mallory clearly found it annoying to answer the door to get these people), but none of the tour was made up for their sake.During the tour, we tasted 4 whiskeys and 2 liqueurs, each of which we received a very small sample (on the order of a few milliliters). Products not shown during the tour were not available to sample afterward. There was no pressure to purchase KOVAL's products. The samples were integrated into the tour fluidly; I especially liked the head/heart/tail samples. As a chemist, I can say that the scientific details were presented well enough for a lay person. Since I have some deeper knowledge, I can say that some parts of the tour weren't quite true if taken at face value. Compared to the tour of FEW in Evanston, KOVAL's tour was much more polished and catered to a general audience. FEW's tour was given by the distillers themselves (it was unclear if our tour guide was involved in the production of KOVAL's products) and tended to be more technical and detailed.TL;DR? If you're new to the concepts of distilling and want an overview, go on KOVAL's tour. If you're more experienced and want more details, go on FEW's tour.

36.description: Things started off on the wrong foot today.  We had a reservation through Gilt that didn't make it in to the tour calendar - initially the tour guide seemed a bit out of sorts about the whole thing but then she came up with a solution that worked.  So while we paid for a private tour, we got one with lots of other people but that was all right.  The tour, itself, is short and to the point about the history of Koval.  You get to learn a bit about how they make their goods while sampling a fair number if their products.  All told, we ended up with about two shots' worth of various goods.  Some if the other reviews say they got very little in their glasses but it was enough for all of us to get a taste.  The tour guide is knowledgeable and, as someone who likes to cook with beer, wine and other beverages, I liked her ideas for food and drinks. There is a small gift shop that you can stock up on goodies - ask if you don't see something as they may have it in back.  We were a big group so the shelves were pretty bare by the time we were done.** if you have a deal site coupon for a private tour, just make sure to confirm your day and time a day or two in advance.  According to the tour guide, she also handles the reservations so if she doesn't confirm the day before, get in touch with her.

14.description: Very cool local distillery.  I took a tour with some friends and we highly enjoyed it.  The tour is in their smaller "touring" distillery, complete with copper distiller and oak barrels.  I'm a big fan of their dessert liquors, not so much the whiskeys (though didn't get a chance to try the bourbon whiskey which is more my taste).  The Rose Hips liquor is excellent.  The tour guide seemed a little tired, but I had plenty of tastes.  Plus, Hopleaf is blocks away for afterwards!

58.description: I went to Esquire Barbershop this morning based on the reviews on Yelp. All the five star reviews said this was a great no-hassle place to get your hair cut. So, I walked into the barbershop. There was one gentleman in the chair and the barber cutting his hair. No one else was waiting in the shop. The barber asked me if I had an appointment; and when I said no he told me he wouldn't be able to cut my hair today. I pointed out the "No Appointment Necessary" sign on his front door. Then, he got angry and started arguing with me about how Mondays are busy, and it's my own fault for not making an appointment.Long story short, if you were looking for a place to just walk in and get your hair cut, this is not the place. This place may indeed be worth the wait, but if you don't have the time to wait, then I suggest somewhere else. And that's exactly what the barber told me too. So, this one star review is from his own lips.

56.description: Wonderful place to get a haircut - I'm sure the other services are just as great.  Friendly staff, online appointments.  And now that Gold Crown in Andersonville has just closed, there will be even more customers coming here.   Reasonably-priced.   Love the hot lather shave on the back of the neck.

29.description: 2 on the sides, finger length on top. It's a simple enough haircut that you think I'd be able to get it done at just about any shop, but you'd be wrong. Almost every other place I've gone to leaves my hair looking ok, until I take a shower and find how uneven and lazy they were with the cut.  I found this location here on Yelp, and the reviews were right. I got my haircut by Milosh, and he did a great job. It took him longer to get done, but that's a good thing. I'm so used to being rushed through and feeling the clippers fly through my hair that I wasn't sure he knew what he was doing at first. He's not slow and not inexperienced as I feared at first: He's thorough, and when you get a short cut like I do, it makes a big difference. My fade was immaculate, and when he got to cutting with the scissors, I watched as he methodically went through the top part of my hair like a grid, leaving no chunks of hair longer than the rest.    I can't speak for the rest of the barbers working there, but the one I did observe (with a cool beard) was working on a more complicated haircut, but was no less thorough. I feel confident that should I not be able to schedule an appointment with Milosh, any of the other professionals there would do just as well. I'm pretty certain I've found my go-to place for my haircuts.

42.description: This place is the perfect spot for a haircut in the city.  Aaron and Milosh NEVER let me down.  Good conversation and sports on the TV....  What more do you need?  A hot straight razor shave?  Yeah they have that too!  Do yourself a favor and book an appointment on line and reclaim your Saturday mornings.  No more waiting for an hour while your weekend slips away.  They have my business as long as I have hair!  Keep up the good work guys...

23.description: TLDR: Justin is a pompous ass who will insult you after he's kept you waiting long past your appointment time, and he also doesn't do a very good haircut.I made an appointment just to get a clean-up. Despite having an appointment and showing up precisely on time, I had a significant wait--frustrating, since I was trying to fit this into my lunch break.The haircut itself was not very good--he did not preserve the smooth transition between the shorter sides and the longer top, instead leaving a sharp line along the side of my head, not what I was going for at all. He cut the sides almost exclusively and took nearly nothing off the top, as though I were trying to grow it out, even though I told him that I was trying to keep the same general cut.Then he went for my eyebrows (without asking, as every other barber I've ever been to has done). I am perfectly happy with my eyebrows the way they are, so I said, "I don't need the eyebrows done." He loudly snorted, rolled his eyes, and said, "OK, if you say so."Then--again without asking or even warning me--he slathered my hair with probably half a bottle of gel and gave me a truly ridiculous pompadour type thing. Needless to say, this is not what I walked into the shop with, and I have no idea what possessed him to think it was OK to do this. I have never had this much product in my hair in my life. It stood a good three inches straight up off my head. You could have cracked an egg on my hair. It took two heavy shampooings to get all of the gel out.Dealing with this guy was so unpleasant that it is hard for me to credit the positive reviews here. Stay far away.

47.description: This place is as good as you're going to find in Chicago.  First rate, friendly and proffesional.  Aaron and his wife are engaging and make you feel right at home.  If you've never treated yourself to a shave - go for it - it's the consumate - no nonsense pampering, and great haircuts to boot.

8.description: It's 7:04 as I'm writing this. I walked in as a first time customer and politely asked "do you take walk-ins?"  Dude responds "yeeah, but we're closed right now. Here's a card to make sure we're open". He hands me a card. I look at their posted hours ON THE DOOR and it says they close at eight. Once again, its 7:04. I'm a bartender. If I ever did this to my customers is lose my job. Lost a potential customer.

31.description: I have had haircuts from Milosh range from great to fantastic! Go online and reserve an appointment and you will not be disappointed. Haircut includes a close neck shave and hot towel after. That's all you really need to know, but if not keep reading. I am probably like most guys and when I first chose my barber in Chicago I stuck with him. Well that was about 10 years ago and to be honest he wasn't very good. But I stuck with him because I was loyal and every once in a while it would turn out well. Finally, about 3 years ago I decided that I had had enough and set out to find a new barber. That journey lasted about a year and in the end I found the best barbershop experience and haircut in the city. Guys, you do not need to be stuck with an overly expensive or bad haircut out of some misplaced sense of loyalty. Come here, to Esquire Barbershop!I have been coming to Milosh for about 2 years now and could not be happier. I get a haircut about once every three or four weeks and am very satisfied with the consistently great results. If anything, haircuts have gotten even better. Milosh really cares about his customers, and maybe more importantly for some of you, about your haircut.

34.description: This has been my go-to barbershop now for over 6 months. Its a great place run by super nice people. They really take good care of you. Book your appt online a day or two in advance because all the slots fill up fast.First time I booked and appointment, Tara just happened to have the last available slot for that day. I've been loyal to her ever since because she now knows exactly how I like my hair cut, and its great to be able to rely on that. Although I haven't personally tried any of the other guys in the shop, I have no doubt that they are all equally excellent.  The only evidence you need is that every person working here is booked solid every day with loyal customers.Laid back vibe, exceptional service, Affordable prices. A++

16.description: I tried going here twice because I just moved into the neighborhood and it is very close to my apartment. I read the reviews and was excited for a friendly atmosphere where I could go regularly for a haircut and build a rapport with the staff. I gotta say I was pretty disappointed. The gentleman who cut my hair didn't even look at me or say hi when we met even though I said "hey, hows it going?". When I tried to describe what I wanted he cut me off and just said "so, shorter?" Both times I gave him a decent tip, I'm not sure why, I think I was just trying hard to like the place, and again he didn't even look at me or say anything to acknowledge me. The actual haircut was pretty terrible. It was hard to tell in the shop because he kept using a comb to slick the hair on my sides back, but when I got home and got a closer look he hard hardly cut any hair on one side of my head at all, but had cut the other side. So I guess the prices are cheap, but you might only get half a haircut. Strange way to run a barber shop.

13.description: I've been coming here to see Justin for about a year now and am nervous to write this review -- I don't want to make it harder to get an appointment! But seriously, if you're a dude with short hair and live anywhere near Andersonville, this is where you should be getting your hair cut.The plusses: Inexpensive, efficient (your cut takes about 20 minutes), precise and consistent cuts (from Justin), great online appointment scheduling system, cute pug usually sleeping in a dog bed by the door.The minuses: None.Sure, it's nothing fancy, but what more could you ask for at this price point? I understand they are upping the prices again soon, but it's not cheap to keep a storefront open in Chicago these days -- just look at all the vacant stores not far from here along Clark Street. It's worth the extra few bucks. Go here. Now.As for Eli N's review on Justin, it looks like most of that dude's Yelp reviews are one-star. Poor guy. Maybe, just maybe the problem isn't everyone else but him?

11.description: Over the past few weeks I have been going to get my beard trimmed and hot shaves done in this location by Josh. I thought my previous barber at another local salon was good until I started coming here. Josh is very friendly, listens to what I want exactly, and does fantastic job! While some people have said it is better to do this at home and get your own electric razor, I disagree. A good barber has skills I could never teach myself. Having a 30 minute shave and trim is an excellent way to relax and leave looking great. I absolutely  love how easy it is to book an appointment and how punctual every one is with their clients. Anyone looking for a great cut (I've seen their haircuts as well) and/or a great barber shop experience should consider coming to Esquire!

39.description: Great place; after Rex the barber left these guys made my grieving period very short. I love the apt. scheduling on line, makes it so much easier and hassle free. My haircut is always perfect and I love how much attention to detail they pay. I only wish they would do the same when it comes to cleanliness and taking care of their stations, the hair on the chairs and on the floor(this is the only reason I give them a low score). Last time I even saw a dead cucaracha under the waiting chairs. I understand how many people they need to take care of but taking 30 seconds or less to wipe the chair and sweep the floor will make everyone much happier.

37.description: I'm a guy with thick, curly hair and I am pretty picky when it comes to people cutting it as I have had some awful haircuts in the past.  You'd be surprised how many people don't know how to handle curls... kind of amazing.  Anyway, after searching for a barber shop that's actually open on a Monday I stumbled upon Esquire Barbershop.  So grateful that I did.I needed to get in for an appointment ASAP so I called them up.  I was a little wary about this place because a previous commenter wrote that they don't answer the phone and the voicemail was full.  Fortunately they picked up, asked if I wanted to come in sooner or later, and within an hour I was sitting in a chair getting my haircut. The place is really sweet and they have their own pug watchdog sitting in the window.  Plenty of room in the joint and it was really clean and neat.  They also have a huge HD flatscreen that was playing ESPN.  Can't complain about that at all.Tara cut my hair and we had some real nice small talk.  It was one of those situations that we talked a little bit and when there wasn't anything to say there was no awkwardness in the silence.  Tara really cared about what I wanted to do with my hair and she kept checking in to make sure that she was giving me what I needed.  The haircut finished with a straight razor shave of my neck which was awesome.  All in all, $15 for a really good haircut in a damn fine establishment.  I'll definitely be back next time I need a trim.  Thanks Esquire!!

0.description: Excellent neighborhood location and very talented barbers. Highly recommend Barber Justin. Punctual and precise. Involved and dedicated to the craft of barbering.

38.description: I had a great experience.  Great hair cut, talked sports, fixed my beard, shaved the back of my neck, hot towel, and that was that.  I will go again, and I am looking forward to my second visit.  Just remember to bring cash because they don't take cards, and you need to make an appointment online.  I walked in, but I guess that was rare.

51.description: Aaron gives a good haircut at a fair price.  I'm picky about who shapes my beard due to a bad experience at another place, but Aaron does a perfect job every time.  He listens to what you want and will make suggestions so you look good!  The shop is simple, old school, and welcoming.  Nyla, the shop's pug, is sweet and keeps an eye on things.  I highly recommend Esquire Barbershop.

27.description: I have been to a lot of barber shops since moving to Chicago 7 years ago. I don't plan on needing a new one anytime soon. Esquire barbershop is the best barbershop experience I have had in Chicago. Tara is laid back and gives a great haircut. Plus, they have an online scheduler that is very convenient. It takes 5 minutes to schedule an appointment and I can do it whenever I have time, I don't have to do it during business hours.

32.description: I concur with the other 5 star reviewers

54.description: A bit disappointed. Checked this place out on Yelp before I gave it a try. I like to support my neighborhood businesses. Even though the YELP profile says By Appointment Only: "NO", that isn't completely true. I went there as a walk in and was denied because they were completely booked on this Saturday. So in eesence unless their not busy you don't need an appointment or you can walk in, but in reality you really do need an appointment. GREAT CUSTOMER RELATIONS/FIRST IMPRESSION. I'll keep taking my business to LAKEVIEW.

48.description: First time here today and had a great haircut.   I was very impressed with their online booking system which made it very easy for me to book an appointment and even make a change.

44.description: Just made my first trip and I was really impressed. My dad was in town and had been talking about finding someone that still offered a straight razor shave, so after a little looking around I used Esquire's website to book two appointments. Knowing we wouldn't have to hop in a queue on a Saturday was a huge plus.Aaron runs a great shop, very friendly. I think he did a great job on the straight razor shave and my dad was equally pleased with his. Aaron clearly knew what he was doing, prepping my face with a couple hot towels before getting down to business. Coming here for a shave is a great treat, but at $30 one of the most reasonable straight razor shaves I came across when I went looking. Just keep in mind that it will take some time. This is not a 10 minute process. I will be heading back for a haircut in the near future for sure.Remember that it's cash only and a really good idea to book ahead of time online.

24.description: My husband gets his haircut by Justin and Milosh and loves them! Even after we moved from Andersonville, he still makes the drive out to get his haircut. And I can't complain- he looks great!

7.description: My husband just came home from Esquire Barbershop, and he looks SO GOOD!  This is a thank-you note to Justin who gave him a serious tune-up!A few months ago my hubby let himself go completely!  He didn't shave or get a haircut for 3 months... and he started getting mistaken for a homeless man!  Seriously, I posted a picture of him on instagram, and someone asked "who is that homeless guy?"  He finally came to his senses, and got an appointment!  Justin turned him from homeless into hunky!  I cant stop looking at him because he is so handsome now!  His hair is beautifully coiffed, and his beard is groomed to perfection.  THANK YOU JUSTIN!!!  Sincerely,Happy Wife

49.description: Excellent service at an even better price! Both guys are super cool and the environment is really laid back and comfortable. Esquire is the only place for me.

40.description: I've been coming here since it opened a few years ago with the current owner, Aaron. He's a great guy with a great staff. The shop recently expanded which will hopefully make it easier to get an appointment. This is, hands-down, the best place for a guy to get a haircut on the north side. Aaron and his staff take their time with what they're doing and, even though they have customers lining up, they don't rush. They finish each haircut with a hot lather shave on the back of the neck. Always have sports on the TV and they know just about everybody by their first name. I don't know what more a guy can ask for. Maybe strippers....but I'm sure they can't get the permits for that.

53.description: They two guys who do most of the cutting are cool... always a good football game or some sport on to watch.  I have a standard part-on-the-side haircut and wasn't very pleased with the two cuts I received.  I'm going back to Klassy Cut around the corner on Clark and Winona.

30.description: Great place for a haircut. Milosh does an excellent job.  Try to schedule your haircut  during a major tennis or golf tournament.  It will be playing on the big screen. And the advice is always free.

46.description: I used to wax awesome about Joe's in Logan Square.  A gruff biker works side by side with his father, an aging Italian with thick sideburns and a unique sense of humor and wait, wait, wait... they're sponsored by PBR!  Well, Joe's is great, but Esquire is the only place i'll get clipped.  I moved to the area about a year ago and come about once a month.  The clientele is eclectic and an old pug snoozes comfortably in the window.  While I think the place is charming, the real pull is a great haircut.  You've inevitably experienced a time in your life where, after getting a cut, the barber gives you a view of your neck and sideburns.  You say "looks great" knowing it's slightly off.  You can't really put a finger on it.  You know you'll notice after a shower.  You'll be disappointed.  Esquire Barbers, they leave you with the confidence that you look better, that you just got an amazing haircut.  Secondary are two things: The prices are great, and they work hard -- long days with equal attention to each cut.You can go to one of the other places in Andersonville and admire a teak and marble aesthetic, maybe pick up some tee-tree oil, or you can go to Esquire and know you'll walk around the rest of the month with an exceptional haircut, whatever your taste.  And when the guys at Esquire show you your neckline in the mirror, you'll say "looks great" but you'll really be thinking, "I look fucking awesome!"

1.description: I've passed this place a few times, and I really like the look of the place, it looks like an old school barbershop. I usually go to Father & Sons, on Broadway, but they close early during the week. Since I couldn't get out of work early I decided to try Esquire, since I know that they're open until 8p.I decided to just walked in since I've seen the sign outside that says "No Appointment Necessary", you'll see it on one of the Yelp photos. There was no one waiting inside, but the moment I got in I was asked if I made an appointment, and was told that they were booked until the weekend. I was tired and hungry so I didn't want to complain and just walked out. I thought you only needed to make an appointment at Salons...?

55.description: Trying to find a solid haircut for a man at a decent price is nearly impossible.  Thankfully, there's Esquire Barbershop.  Aaron does a great job with your hair.  I can count on him to know exactly what I want, and also make some suggestions that I wouldn't have normally thought of.  Either way, I always feel like I've just had the best haircut of my life.  And even better, a haircut costs $17.This is a no-frills old-school barbershop.  Don't expect ultra-contemporary decor, complete with massages and paraffin hand wax.  Here, you'll find sports on TV, men's magazines and newspapers hanging in the corner, a few comfy chairs for waiting, and one hell of a haircut once you leave.

9.description: Ryan is really good. He's been my barber since the first time I've found this place and haven't left disappointed

26.description: Go see Justin. He's the best and will give you a great haircut. No frills to this place. It's a old school barbershop. Sports on the tvs and Ali posters on the walls. This is where men go to get cut. You will not be disappointed. Seriously, these guys are the best!

25.description: Tried this place out. It's awesome, brings you to a place you are sure was gone. A very chill , skilled group of barbers who have a reasonable price. MAKE A RESERVATION ONLINE. No reason not too, and they get super busy on the weekends. I just stopped in firstly on a Saturday and they were booked for the day ,I love down the street so I just scheduled online for a later date. Already made my appt for next month. Shout out to Aaron, my barber of choice!

12.description: This barbershop is quick and Tara always gives me a great cut.  I also like that I can book an appointment on the website.

59.description: I found my haircut go-to in Chicago's northside! Having recently moved up and wanting to keep my haircut at a decent price (it's clippers and some cutting and that's about it), I wanted to find a barber shop or a salon that catered to me. I found Milos and Aaron today and it's a great place.A simple 2 chair shop (shared with a sweet little pug), this is throwback to barber shops of old. Here's what you'll find: Two chairs, two cool dudes, a tv with Sports on, Mens' mags (Maxim, Playboy, Golf, etc.) a few seats and that's about it. For 20 dollars (including tip) I got a great haircut (honestly one of the better ones I've ever had as Milos did some things with the clippers that only an Aveda salon technician ever took the time to do), a hot foam neck shave and my eyebrows trimmed, good conversation, friendly service.I was a walk in, but they do take appts. and do so even online, which is truly nice (old school meets new school). It's right off Clark on Foster so it's in an easy location. Thumbs up, guys. You're my new home for haircuts.

21.description: As a woman, I hadn't had occasion to use Esquire before. But as the mother of a two year old boy, we made our first trip a couple weeks ago to get a clean-up. We'd stopped in the week before and Aaron (I'm pretty sure it was Aaron, the owner) gave us an early-morning appointment the next week. I think he was a little worried about potential scenes (which, absolutely the right call when dealing with a toddler), but he was totally friendly about it. He was great with my son, got the clean-up done super-quickly and neatly, and - I suppose I don't really know what men pay for haircare - but my perception is that he charged me a really low amount for the work. And I love their dog, who is super laid-back. We'll definitely go back.I guess it's silly, but as a single mom, I'm psyched to have a place in the neighborhood where my son will be able to go as he gets older that's a "man" place - so please stay open for the next sixteen years, Esquire!

17.description: What a great little shop! Shauna (sp) did an amazing job! Great cut, great conversion, and ended with a relaxing hot shave. I'm definitely coming back and so should you!

10.description: Went to this barber shop for the first time after noticing it on my drive home one night! I booked online and set an appointment with Ryan Fields. I must say that I haven't been this excited about a haircut in a while. Ryan definitely hooked it up and I think I can finally say that I found my go-to barbershop! I also love that you not only get a haircut but a hot lather neck shave as well. For anyone who hasn't experienced a traditional barber shop experience, I suggest you check this place out!

5.description: This a 5 Star service, no bullshit, no attitude, come as you are kind of place. You'll see guys from all walks of life here getting their hair cut, which is pretty cool. Seems like Ryan and I tend to have the same schedule and I've liked him a lot, I don't think he can give a bad cut. The online scheduling system is cool, it makes going in a pretty no-stress situation.Why didn't I start coming here earlier???

3.description: It's funny how you arrive at a certain moment, and the trip it took to get there.  I have been going to the same barber for awhile now, but he went on a month long vacay so I had to find someone to give me a nice fade.  I googled barber shops that offer fades in Chicago, and quite a few popped up on the radar.I looked at them real quick and couldn't decide.  I wanted to try a particular cut that involved a razor part, so I ended up googling that.  The name that popped up is Justin Albrecht. I took a look at his Instagram page and I was impressed.  I saw that he works at Esquire Barber shop in Andersonville.  I made up my mind that I would have to give him a try, so I went on their website and made an appointment.I love that he is appointment only, and this is because sometimes I wait over an hour just to get a cut from my current barber.  He was pretty much booked up, but there was a final spot open on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving.  The first thing you need to know is that this place is cash only. So go ahead and bring that cash money, there is also a Chase Bank right around the corner if you forget.This place is old school, except for the flat screen TV's on the wall that was showing the game.  I walked in and was promptly and warmly greeted.  You can't miss Justin, he is the dude rocking the epic Rip Van Winkle beard.  I sat down, and waited for my turn, and he actually got to me 10 minutes early since he is so efficient.  I told him I wanted a high fade with a razor part. He looked at my oddly shaped head and got to work.He dropped some science on how my previous barber has been cutting my hair the wrong way, and I totally agreed with him.  First he faded me up and then he gave me a neck lather with a hot towel.  He also put some lather on the side of my head where he was going to do the razor part.  He expertly used the straight edge razor and put a nice part on the left side of my head.He finished up and then put some nice pomade on my hair and styled it up.  I wish I had somewhere important I had to go to afterwards since I was looking so fresh, and so clean.  It looks like I have found a new barber. His name is Justin, and he works at Esquire Barber Shop. He rocks an awesome beard, and he is a virtuoso with those hair clippers. Nuff said!!!

35.description: Justin is the man

19.description: Excellent work. Great little barbershop in heart of Andersonville. Convenient and reasonably priced.

28.description: If you're on yelp looking for a barber shop in Chicago, you can rest easy, you found it. Schedule you're appointment with Justin on esquirebarberchicago and call it a wrap. I originally found Justin on Instagram, (yea high tech I know.) I sent him an email with some questions as I just had gotten a jacked up haircut a few weeks ago. It was really bad, trust me. He told me to wait a little bit longer before coming to see him to let it grow some, instead of just saying come in and taking my money. I waited and a few weeks later went and saw him. The dude is chill and can shoot the shit well. It was apparent from the start that he is very passionate about his career. Took a couple minutes to inspect my hair and then began his magic. 20 minutes later I had the best haircut I ever had. He was always inspecting his work and making small adjustments until it was perfect. The dude is a master of his craft. He will be my go to barber whenever I'm in or near Chicago. Check him out on Instagram @barberjustin

45.description: This is my new haircut of choice in the greater Uptown/Andersonville/Edgewater area.  It's easy to set up an appointment online, and if you have some flexibility with time I've found that you can usually get in same-day.  For $17, the quality of cut you'll receive is exceptional.  The barbers here are meticulous and will never rush through a cut just to get to another customer.All in all, a nearly perfect haircut experience (especially given the price).  I will be back.

33.description: From my experience, best barbershop in Chicago. I've tried out Belmont Barbershop (not a bad spot) but overall, I prefer Esquire. I've been getting my hair cut by Milosh for about 2 years now, and have gotten an excellent hair cut every time. The staff's attention to detail, price, and overall quality can't be beat. I would recommend making an appointment online a few days beforehand, as they stay pretty busy.

43.description: After moving here from California, my hubby tried a few different barbershops in Chicago, but failed to find a place that gave a great cut at a great price.  I turned to my trusty yelpers and found esquire. He has been back 2x and each time has an amazing haircut.  The barbers really take their time and scheduling is a cinch with their online system.  My husband has had to book one week out - last minute reservations are nearly impossible.

2.description: The place is small and just wasn't feeling it. Has no register or place to sit for anyone waiting. I had Josh and he seemed new, I didn't like my haircut, especially because I told him I didn't want to cut the top at all and he literally cut most of it off. Other than the actual haircut, Josh didn't really talk much or try to create conversation or anything, I'm sure he was just paying attention and focused on my hair. The experience, place and haircut was not something I expected and just not a satisfying experience.

18.description: I concur with the other 5 star reviewers

41.description: Since moving into the city, and Lincoln Square area, I had not found a local place to get a good haircut.  I am not overly difficult to please, but I like a place that has character and an enjoyable place to go and get a haircut.  Well I stumbled across the great reviews here for Esquire and decided to give it a try!  Awesome Experience!  I went online and made an appointment with Tara and walked in to the old school barber shop with some Flat Screen TVs.  She was friendly and took her time to make sure I was happy with all aspects of my haircut!Highly recommend this place!  Make sure to go online to make an appointment as it is a popular spot, so I am glad I made my appt. ahead of timeI'll be back!

52.description: This barber shop is terrific.  The staff is friendly, professional and have great services.  I have been in to see Aaron many times now and will not go anywhere else.  There is always great relaxing conversation and a game (or golf) on the TV. This "traditional feel" barber shop is 2nd to none....I have found my Barbershop home in Chicago.  I highly recommend giving Esquire a try!

50.description: Great haircut for an even better price! My new barber starting today!

4.description: Thanks to @barberjustin for doing me a solid and squeezing me in for a haircut even though I was running late for my appointment. Check him out if you need a consistently great cut and/or hate yourself for getting your hair cut at a pretentious salon by some chick named 'Mandy' that doesn't know what a razor part is and talks with gum in her mouth and smacks her lips while telling you all about why she thinks Kylie Jenner is "lyke soooo much hotter" than Kim Kardashian. Tips: - Visit their website to make appointments online! Don't be the guy that interrupts a dude getting his hurr did because the barber has to stop to answer your phone call. - Street parking can be difficult to find at times especially during peak hours. So come early. Call if you're running late. - It helps to know what you want, example "high fade with a razor part. Or bring a picture.

6.description: I have been visiting this barber shop since the beginning of the year. Certainly, it hasn't been my last. I would recommend getting a haircut from Tara. She is very compassionate & detailed and highly skilled in her job. I can assure you that you won't leave her chair unless your hair looks perfect.- Don't forget to schedule your appointment online

22.description: Eli N must've been having a bad day, because Justin couldn't have been more friendly and helpful:I'm somewhat new to barbershops (I've only ever gone to cheap spots like Mastercuts), and I was looking for my first, really well-done haircut. I was pretty intimidated to walk into a barbershop; I pictured a bunch of old men smoking and throwing out sports lingo and the such, of which I have no knowledge. Everyone was friendly and inviting. I was greeted immediately upon arriving, and although I was 5 minutes early, was seated in the barber's chair. Justin was more than courteous and talked me through what he was going to do with my hair and my options. I was totally impressed because although I had a 20 minute time slot Justin took the first few minutes to assess my hair and ask questions. Not only was I extremely pleased with the quality of the haircut and attention to detail, the pricing is spot-on. For $18 to walk out of the barber feeling like a million bucks... you can't beat that. A+

15.description: My mom is a hairstylist and has been cutting my hair for...well, ever. Now that I have moved from my hometown getting back for a regular haircut has been getting harder and harder, so I was faced with the harsh reality that, after 25 years, I needed to find a place to get my hair cut and start paying for those haircuts. A tough pill to swallow.So I did what any normal person would do and went to Yelp. Decided to stop by after seeing the yelp reviews. Had Justin cut my hair and he did an amazing job. Made the "first haircut" painless and easy on the wallet. Definitely will be keeping him as my resident barber!  Due yourself a favor and book an appointment, you won't regret it!

57.description: Don't miss out on this old-school Andersonville gem. Aaron runs a fine shop with professional service, a friendly atmosphere, reading materials while you wait and good conversation and/or sports on the flat panel while you are in the chair. I have never seen such a casual yet professional barber where you can book your appointment online.

20.description: I've had cuts by Shawna and Milos. Both were nothing short of fantastic. And they're reasonably priced.

36.description: This place is awesome! After setting up an appointment on the same day, I came in and got a hair cut from Milosh. All the guys in there seemed pretty chill and the atmosphere was friendly. Whether you prefer to chat or not while getting a haircut or a shave, these guys seem to catch on to your preference and won't force you into unnecessary small talk. Cheap, good, and to the point!

14.description: If you're on yelp looking for a barber shop in Chicago, you can rest easy, you found it. Schedule you're appointment with Justin on esquirebarberchicago and call it a wrap. I originally found Justin on Instagram, (yea high tech I know.) I sent him an email with some questions as I just had gotten a jacked up haircut a few weeks ago. It was really bad, trust me. He told me to wait a little bit longer before coming to see him to let it grow some, instead of just saying come in and taking my money. I waited and a few weeks later went and saw him. The dude is chill and can shoot the shit well. It was apparent from the start that he is very passionate about his career. Took a couple minutes to inspect my hair and then began his magic. 20 minutes later I had the best haircut I ever had. He was always inspecting his work and making small adjustments until it was perfect. The dude is a master of his craft. He will be my go to barber whenever I'm in or near Chicago. Check him out on Instagram @barberjustin

58.description: 6 years!  It took me almost 6 years to go back... what an idiot I am!   The place was great!  Dick, the bartender, rocked out some phenomenal cocktails.  Our waiter was kind and attentive and the food was outstanding.  I do not understand why it was not packed on a Thursday unless it is just the average Chicagoan being unfamiliar, as was I, with Korean food.  Everything is super easy to understand and was really good.  Highly recommend

56.description: I went to Jin Ju at 8pm on a Tuesday, so of course the restaurant was not very busy. The food was fantastic, the drinks delicious, and the service was prompt.I tried two different soju cocktails- both of which were very tasty and did not have a strong alcohol flavor.The first one I tried was the lychee cocktail, so naturally it was love at first drink. Second, I tried the Jinjer which was very refreshing and perfect for after my meal.I had the Kim Chee Mandoo appetizer- steamed dumplings filled with kim chee, tofu, and veggies. They were tasty! The kim chee flavor was present but did not overpower. I also had the Chu Gu Mi Dol Sut Bi Bim Bap which has octopus and scallops in it. It comes in a sizzling stone rice bowl that cooks the raw egg and makes the rice nice and crispy on the side. Overall it was a delicious meal and I am VERY excited to eat my leftovers for dinner tonight :)

29.description: Nicely done.  Dumbed down K-town standards for others..  Very nice place--excellent service.  I prefer the typical Korean storefront, with the tons of free side dishes and no explanation for clueless white people.  I did not care for the fact that the waiter insisted on mixing up my Bim Bop stating that this is how is mother does it--I prefer to eat it separately.  Very good value--had a drink each, shared an app, $25 plus tip.If you are around here and want pan asian--this is a good choice

42.description: Went yesterday and loved it! Our server was nice and professional, our cocktails were not bad and the food was amazing. We had the pajun and the mandoo as appetizers and two versions of the Bi Bim Bap, the one with seafood was amazing! Definitely gonna come back again!

23.description: Great Korean food! Awesome flavor that is really deep and rich with our tasting like Panda Express. The service was OK, we had a long wait (45mins but it was a Saturday night) and the place was packed from 5:30-8:30. Our server was a little overwhelmed but very helpful. I will definitely be coming back. P.s, The prices are great!

47.description: Great food, great service (we also had a really cute waiter) and very good cocktails. The only thing I'd like to see different is more choices on the menu. Other than that, I highly recommend.

8.description: Even though it was super busy and very loud, the food was fantastic and the service was very nice and friendly! I would come back and try the other dishes.I really like a restaurant that gives good portions and this restaurant definitely did that! I liked the variety of the menu too! Ordered the "sushi" rolls and the miso soup! It was perfect. And my dining mates had the spicy chicken which was perfectly spiced and we'll presented. Can't wait to come back and get more food!

31.description: This place is so good it brings tears to my eyes!!! I wake up wanting to go here every day. I went with 5 other friends and they were very accommodating and fast, with amazing customer service. We ordered the Kim Chee Mondoo, they were hot, delicious and the best fried dumpling I have ever had. I ordered the Dak Bulgogi and the chicken was tender and seasoned just right. I tasted a little bit of everyone else's and it was all good!This place is a must try!

34.description: Wow! What a great find. My boyfriend and I try a new restaurant in Andersonville after our monthly massage, and we were absolutely delighted with our meal. We had tasty cocktails and appetizers and a fabulous meal. The service was impeccable. I can't wait to come back.

16.description: I expected Jin Ju to be a traditional Korean restaurant filled with middle aged Korean people and where a distressed Korean waitress seats you and places a hundred side dishes in front of you. However, I walked into a very dimly lit place, illuminated by a few candles. The first vibe you get is that it is a hip bar, but if you are here for the food, a host will seat you in another area. People in the restaurant were mostly young professional hipsters, mostly in groups of 2-5. The slim, 2-sided menu offered various options. They offered many appetizers including mandoo (dumplings), pajun (thin scallion pancakes), and tegim. We tried the hemul pajun, which was very fresh, simple, and delicious. They offered two soups: mandoo soup and miyuk soup. My friend, who never tried miyuk soup before, loved the miyuk soup. I ordered the yookgejang, and as it was spicy, I recommend it to people who can tolerate spice. It was very rich and savory, and it really cleared up my head. I was in love. My friend ordered the sanchae bibimbap, and she was in love with the blend of flavors and freshness.The side dishes were adorable- not really sure about why they chose The waiters were  friendly, and the place wasn't too loud or too quiet so we could chitter away. The music was calming, yet energetic and I really liked the mood lighting. Dining there was a wonderful way to destress on a Friday night.  I would love to try the drinks next time!!! Tips:-It's not a large space, and it's certainly not a place to go with a mass of people.-Not Korean BBQ-the only Vegetarian dish would be the bibimbap. It is not the most vegetarian-friendly restaurant.

13.description: The food was just OK considering the price. It made me wish I went to the "typical" mom/pop, more authentic (less fusion) Korean restaurant. Wish there were more pork dishes and less beef. Probably won't be back. But it was jus ok, so if your hungry and like more Americanized Asian cuisine, then give it a try.

11.description: Atmosphere was nice and more trendy compared to most Korean restaurants you find but the food is nothing to rave about. Bim bim bop was ok and the kal be was dry. They only provided a few small plate sides. There is way better Korean food in the city for less money.

39.description: Amazing food along with 5 star service. My husband and I have been there twice now and continued to be impressed. The staff is friendly and knowledgable- they all seem to love to work there. The food is delicious and we haven't had one thing we didn't like! What we highly recommend: Dak Gan Jang, Dol Sut Bi Bim Bap, Kalbi, Bulgogi, and their appetizer of pork belly and Brussels sprouts!

37.description: I'm Korean and I can say that the food here tastes Completely Authentic, even though it is presented in a more "Western" manner (which I like/prefer). If anyone asks me for a Korean Restaurant, this is my "Go-To Place." Staff is Friendly and Knowledgeable about the Menu. Cocktails here are Awesome! Only Downside is Parking (Street Parking can be Difficult, and No Valet), but I still go as often as I can.

0.description: Really my favorite restaurant in Chicago. Here's why:1. Excellent, friendly, speedy service. We never wait long for our appetizers, and the main dishes arrive on time and still fresh and hot. Even when they are busy.2. The AMAZING flavor of everything on the menu. We have tried too many dishes to name (most of which can be made vegetarian, which we really appreciate), and every one of them, no exception, has been out of this world. Just bursting with flavor but subtle enough not to overpower the palate. Not easy when you're dealing with kimchi and peppers, but these chefs know how to make Korean food right. Super impressive dishes, every one. Although our favorites are the Kimchi Pancake and the vegetarian Jab chae--you just can't go wrong if you order those.3. The atmosphere. It's a calming, dark, intimate setting for a date or a party. Not too loud, but not unnervingly quiet. My new hubby and I just had a private party here, and the service and execution of the entire 3 hours was far more than we expected. Everyone in our party proclaimed the food "amazing" and that they would be back. I love being able to introduce Jin Ju to people because (1) I know they will come back, and (2) this restaurant deserves to live long and prosper as one of the best in Chicago. Come in with high expectations and leave with all of those expectations satisfied. Enough said.

38.description: I had never been to a Korean restaurant before my visit to Jin Ju. My friend suggested it because he said it was his favorite Korean restaurant in all of Chicago. Now, I wholeheartedly agree with him....it IS fantastic.For starters we ordered the Mandoo (dumplings filled with beef, onions, scallions, bean sprouts and tofu). We ordered them steamed, not fried and they were wonderful. I enjoyed every bite. For dinner, I ordered the Bi Bim Bap. It came steaming in a hot stone pot and I luxuriated in every bite. It was so good! Why did it take me so long to go Korean? The spicy red pepper paste sauce made my eyes water and my nose run......it was fiery and delicious. My friend ordered the Bulgogi. He said it was delicious and it looked like something I would want to try. Our martini's were very good and I never had to ask for another......the service was swift and attentive.If you have never tried Korean food, or have but have never visited Jin Ju, I recommend that you go. Enjoy!

51.description: Jin Ju has been an Andersonville staple for many years.  They were certainly a destination early on and have created a following that continues to be strong.  My favorite dish here is the Bi Bim Bop, I know if may not be the most authentic but it sure does taste good.They do have a full bar as well but be careful around those Sojutinis.  They are tasty and have this incredible ability to sneak up on you.I have found this place to be ideal for a nice dinner for two and I have also been here with a group.

27.description: One of my favorite meals out. The spicy sojutinis are killer and the food is amazing. I looooooove the bi bum bap in the stone dish. When you mix it all together the rice on the side is carmelized and crunchy. They also take reservations which is really nice for a weekend night.

32.description: The resturant had really cool ambience. I liked it the Food was good. Service was good to except I did feel a little annoyed when the waitress was being ignorant. This is not my first time eating Korean food. I've been to New York and Cali and had Korean food from their they have better service. Recent I felt annoyed by the waitress is because I ordered a dolsot  Bibimbap. Once the food came out she told me if I had it before I said yes she still didnt let me mix my bowl instead she did it for me she also ask me if I like spicy uhhh yeah why would I order it then. I felt like I was  being profile because I was not Asian im latina and my bf is asian he was there with me. Its not my first time eating asian food or mixing my own bowl done it so many times. I am always careful even when the bowl is hot. I love spicy food hence im half mexican we eat really spicy food. But I liked the place but didnt like the staff. I would not want to go back because of this.

54.description: I was taken as a guest as someone who frequents Jim Ju regularly and he ordered food and drinks for the table and there's everything about the experience was excellent. Especially the cocktails. Oh, the cocktails. I started with a Sojutini which I'm told will not give one a hangover the next day ... unfortunately, I switched to some margarita martini awesomeoness/catastrophe that does, in fact, give quite powerful hangovers. But it was worth it. Not a great menu for vegetarians, but the chef whipped up some veggie dish that wasn't on the menu when I asked about it and I LOVED IT. I can't wait to bring back friends so I look like I know what's up.

48.description: love their spicy chicken appetizer. the ambience is great.

44.description: Amazing food! I had the chicken wings and pork belly for appetizers. For entree I had the octopus and scallops bi bim bop bowl. The Kim chi in the bowl totally made it! Every time I come to Chicago I seek out new Korean food and this is the best I've had. My new favorite!! Great service and fun intimate atmosphere.

24.description: Food was delicious and totally new to me and my girlfriend. Unlike anything we've had before (and we make a point of eating a wide array of cuisine), but I know we'll be coming back for more! Service was great. Our waiter was really nice, gave us lots of attention and answered every question we had about the menu. Great dining experience.

7.description: Hands down top 3 meals of my life! I can't wait to go back here again and again! Make reservations! I have heard it's always packed. We had the chicken wings (life changing), 2 orders of dumplings (steamed and pan fried?), spicy tofu stew (so amazing), some chicken and beef dishes both served with rice. I can't quite remember what they were called. I wanted to eat like an animal and lick the plates! The service is amazing! The owners are adorable! I would eat here every single night if it weren't such a drive for me. The service at the small bar was wonderful too. Everyone was so happy and inviting. Speaking of bar. Make sure to try the vodka made from sweet potatoes. Just be careful on the amazing martinis. They sneak up on you.

49.description: It's a nice little Korean fusion restaurant. The environment is a little dark, not much light and a little noisy. Service was great and the food was very good. Their menu had a lot of stuff I've found in Korea, but also a few things I haven't. They do have awesome mixed drinks and they even have soju! Good place if you're craving Korean and in the area.

40.description: Excellent Authentic Korean Food with Great Service!  The place seems trendy, and Americanized (easier to go in for white people) but the food is still authentic and super delicious.  I recommend Bibimbap (For the crunchy rice goodness, do order it in the sizzling stone bowl!)  & Scallion Pancakes!

53.description: I had a great time at Jin Ju.  They have a few delicious gluten free options (that can be made vegetarian).  I ate Kim Chee soup - and I love Kim Chee - and it was great!  The server was friendly and made lots of recommendations and just made us feel so welcome there!!  A great place for food, drinks (cocktails are $9ish), friendly banter and great service.  I can't wait to go back and try more things!!

30.description: I would recommend this place to anyone. Great for a date night or celebrating a birthday with friends. Food is amazing. Drinks are pricey, but delicious.

46.description: Great,

1.description: Overall, food was great, but the service was lacking. My group made a reservation for 7:30 since it was all of our first times there and upon our prompt arrival, there was no one to greet us and guide us to our table. Along with this, our server took quite some time and flagging down to take our orders.We ordered the Regular Pajun to start, the Dol Sut (Stone Bowl) Bibimbap, Seafood Bibimbap, Yuk Gae Jang, and the Dak Tori Tang. All of the food was delicious, kudos to the chefs! After finishing our meal and having had out tanker cleared by the busser, our server never came back to check on us. We had to flag him down yet again to get our bill. FANTASTIC FOOD but really could have better service.

55.description: Had a great dinner here for a friend's birthday. Always enjoy the food and service here on other visits. Creative cocktail menu is worth a look. Generous pours, and tasty. Was very quiet on a Sunday evening, which was nice. But also a bit concerning - as it's been dead here as of late, even on weekend nights. Mandoo (steamed) and Dolsot bibimbop were delicious- and reasonably priced. Definitely get the Dolsot! Creates yummy crisp flavors on the rice and veggies.Received comp sorbet for birthday- nice end of the meal.

9.description: I recently went to Jin Ju for dinner as a party of 6.  The server was friendly - the food was great and the overall experience was really positive.  I'll certainly be back again in the future!

26.description: I'm looking forward to going back to Jin Ju, because it was so good! Definitely get the Daeji Kalbi (bbq spare ribs) to start! So crispy, crackly, and scrumptious- my favorite item we ordered. We started with that plus the three free side dishes they serve each table. One complaint may be that they only bring you three, and apparently there are usually more in other Korean restaurants. But really, we had so much food, that we didn't need any more. For my entree, I got the Chap Chae dish with beef and vermicelli noodles.  Nice and thin stretchy noodles with a tasty sweet, soy sauce. My friend got the Dak Bulgogi. He's a regular here, and that is his go-to choice. They have a cute, small room in the back with a full bar if you're ever looking to throw a party, as well. Definitely give this place a go!

25.description: I expected Jin Ju to be a traditional Korean restaurant filled with middle aged Korean people and where a distressed Korean waitress seats you and places a hundred side dishes in front of you. However, I walked into a very dimly lit place, illuminated by a few candles. The first vibe you get is that it is a hip bar, but if you are here for the food, a host will seat you in another area. People in the restaurant were mostly young professional hipsters, mostly in groups of 2-5. The slim, 2-sided menu offered various options. They offered many appetizers including mandoo (dumplings), pajun (thin scallion pancakes), and tegim. We tried the hemul pajun, which was very fresh, simple, and delicious. They offered two soups: mandoo soup and miyuk soup. My friend, who never tried miyuk soup before, loved the miyuk soup. I ordered the yookgejang, and as it was spicy, I recommend it to people who can tolerate spice. It was very rich and savory, and it really cleared up my head. I was in love. My friend ordered the sanchae bibimbap, and she was in love with the blend of flavors and freshness.The side dishes were adorable- not really sure about why they chose The waiters were  friendly, and the place wasn't too loud or too quiet so we could chitter away. The music was calming, yet energetic and I really liked the mood lighting. Dining there was a wonderful way to destress on a Friday night.  I would love to try the drinks next time!!! Tips:-It's not a large space, and it's certainly not a place to go with a mass of people.-Not Korean BBQ-the only Vegetarian dish would be the bibimbap. It is not the most vegetarian-friendly restaurant.

12.description: Nicely done.  Dumbed down K-town standards for others..  Very nice place--excellent service.  I prefer the typical Korean storefront, with the tons of free side dishes and no explanation for clueless white people.  I did not care for the fact that the waiter insisted on mixing up my Bim Bop stating that this is how is mother does it--I prefer to eat it separately.  Very good value--had a drink each, shared an app, $25 plus tip.If you are around here and want pan asian--this is a good choice

59.description: I had Jin Ju on my bookmarks for quite some time now and so happy that we finally ventured out to the city to have some great, contemporary Korean cuisine. I have to say it isn't the best that I've had but I absolutely loved the trendy atmosphere with the brick walls and the dim lighting and the open window to the restaurant. Oh and the service was phenomenal, loved our server, he really was on top of everything and made sure everything was brought out fast and timely as well as gave us some wonderful recommendations. Also, they do take reservations as it can get pretty busy on a late Saturday night so don't forget to do that in advance. Here are the goodies we tried and enjoyed at Jin Ju:-Mandoo- Dumplings filled with beef, onions, scallions, bean sprouts and tofu served fried or steamed but we had to go with fried obviously and they were super yummy and flavorful-Kim Bap- Seaweed roll filled with rice, bulgogi, spinach, carrots, cucumbers, yellow pickled radish, crab stick and egg. This was just a okay, I know a lot of reviewers rave about this but I supposed the only thing I prefer in my seaweed rolls is raw fish.-Yook Gae Jang- A soup filled with spicy beef broth with beef, bean sprouts, scallions and clear vermicelli noodles. Now this was delicious, super spicy so be prepared but full of flavor and texture. Definitely enjoyed it and would recommend it.-Bulgogi- Thinly sliced ribeye beef marinated in a mild soy sauce and sauteed with onions, shitake mushrooms, carrots and scallions. Also served with sticky white rice. This was tasty, but I felt like the portion wasn't as big as I would have liked it to be since it had the veggies. It was yummy, but would have preferred a little more. So overall, Jin Ju didn't wow us off our feet but it was definitely tasty and if you're in the mood for contemporary Korean in the area, than come here for a fun night out with tasty food.
