21.description: Jinju has always been one of our favorite places to go. The ambiance is perfect for a night out - but we went for a family dinner all the same. The waiters have always been phenomenal! They were eager to make recommendations and to make conversation. They were also super accommodating and cleared the table and gave us fresh dessert plates when we pulled out a cake. The food itself is great! I've always been a fan of the cocktails. The chicken wings are a MUST have as they are lollipop-ed and some of the best I've had in the Chicago area.

17.description: Great Korean food! Awesome flavor that is really deep and rich with our tasting like Panda Express. The service was OK, we had a long wait (45mins but it was a Saturday night) and the place was packed from 5:30-8:30. Our server was a little overwhelmed but very helpful. I will definitely be coming back. P.s, The prices are great!

10.description: Love this place!  Not traditional sushi but unlike many authentic Korean restaurants, this place actually has ambiance.  Great wait staff and service.  Always a pleasant experience.  The food is Korean based but with a flair.  I am not Korean but had enough to know the flavors are good and the recipes are original and tasty.  Love the spicy soup, the Korean pancakes, in fact I love everything.  never had a bad dish.

5.description: Food was great! We got in around six, just before the rush. Very dim lighting to get you in the romantic mood. Server was very knowledgable about the menu. I would come back any day!

3.description: Came here with some friends for dinner.  It's one of those places that's pretty solid all around but doesn't have much of a wow factor.  Definitely somewhere I would suggest going back to with friends if we're craving Korean food, but not somewhere I would immediately think about recommending to people who are interested in dining in the area.We were there maybe a week or two ago and I basically can't remember much of the experience at all.

35.description: This is not your typical Mom and Pop Korean restaurant - gone are the picture menus and TVs playing Korean soaps or pop music videos.  The interior has a cool vibe - we sat at the front corner booth.  The weather was so nice they opened up the large front windows.We started with the super tasty Dak Gan Jang (fried chicken wings).  It had just the right amount of spice for me.  How do they keep the skin so crispy despite the sauce?  I also wanted to try the Pajun (scallion pancake), but our server dissuaded us because of the amount of food we wanted to order for 2 people.  The house salad was perfect for the summer weather.  I liked the tempura battered mushrooms.  For the main course, Hubby had the Kim Chee Chigae (spicy kim chee soup), and I had the Bulgogi.  I was kinda confused because the meat sat on a bed of chopped lettuce.  Usually the lettuce leaves are big enough to wrap several pieces of meat.  The meat was just okay.  We were also disappointed at the Pan Chan.  There were only 4 small items, one of which was a room temp egg salad.  We are used to seeing a minimum of 6 different things.  I wish I ordered the Pajun instead!  My go to Korean dish, Galbi Tang, was also noticeably missing from the menu.Service was great!  The drinks were also good - soju cocktails anyone?

19.description: This is not your typical Mom and Pop Korean restaurant - gone are the picture menus and TVs playing Korean soaps or pop music videos.  The interior has a cool vibe - we sat at the front corner booth.  The weather was so nice they opened up the large front windows.We started with the super tasty Dak Gan Jang (fried chicken wings).  It had just the right amount of spice for me.  How do they keep the skin so crispy despite the sauce?  I also wanted to try the Pajun (scallion pancake), but our server dissuaded us because of the amount of food we wanted to order for 2 people.  The house salad was perfect for the summer weather.  I liked the tempura battered mushrooms.  For the main course, Hubby had the Kim Chee Chigae (spicy kim chee soup), and I had the Bulgogi.  I was kinda confused because the meat sat on a bed of chopped lettuce.  Usually the lettuce leaves are big enough to wrap several pieces of meat.  The meat was just okay.  We were also disappointed at the Pan Chan.  There were only 4 small items, one of which was a room temp egg salad.  We are used to seeing a minimum of 6 different things.  I wish I ordered the Pajun instead!  My go to Korean dish, Galbi Tang, was also noticeably missing from the menu.Service was great!  The drinks were also good - soju cocktails anyone?

28.description: I'm so happy I found this place!  I often find the drinks are amazing, food is fresh (and spicy!!), and the service is great.  Great trendy ambiance.  Exactly what Andersonville needs more of!

45.description: My first visit to a Korean restaurant.  Really enjoyed the food and atmosphere at Jin Ju.  Split the chicken wings, scallion pancake and fried fish.  All were really tasty and filling.  Although I don't live in Chicago, I would definitely recommend Jin Ju for locals and visitors.

33.description: The Korean food here is perfect.  I took my mother here, who is very squeamish about Korean food, remembering only tasting garlic and chillies, and this place convinced her to think otherwise about Korean food (a total 180 degrees).For me, the food, though Westernized a bit, is very similar to what I have eaten in Seoul.  I enjoyed the Kimchee Chigae, but then I am a kimchee fan.  My wife and I make our own kimchee.

43.description: Came here on a Saturday night. Surprisingly, the place was not too busy. Came here with my fiance and his parents. We all got the bibimbap, cocktails, and an appetizer. Once seated, we waited about 10-15 minutes before our waiter even got to our tables and asked if we wanted drinks. After our orders were in, our drinks came within 10 minutes, but our appetizer didn't come for another 20 or so minutes after receiving our drinks.The bibimbap comes with banchan, which are the traditional small-plated sides that come with Korean meals. After our appetizer, our waiter never came to our table to check in (another 15 minutes after we had finished our appetizers) until he served us an individual serving each of kimchi, potato salad, and pickled cucumber slices. He told us it was "to share". However, the portion size was lacking for the banchan considering that four of us ordered entrees that came with it and we only had enough for one person; it was less than the one order of appetizers we had shared. After he served us the banchan, our waiter quickly left before we could even get a word in and order more drinks. I looked around and, again, the place was not that busy so we don't know why we scarcely saw our waiter if at all. We had to actually ask a different waiter if we could order more drinks. Again, it was another waiting game for our bibimbap. After we had finished the banchan, which didn't take long, we waited another 20 or so minutes until our bibimbaps came to our table. Overall, the food was decent, but the service was lacking. It took over an hour to get our entrees after ordering. Also, our waiter never checked in on us in between courses and we had to actually ask someone else in order to order more drinks.I might try this place again, but considering the countless authentic Korean restaurants located all over the city that offer better (and timely) service, similar if not better quality food, and better banchan, maybe not.

2.description: My fiancé and I came to Jin Ju thinking it was a sushi restaurant. We were pleasantly surprised to fine this small Korean restaurant tucked away in Andersonville. For starters we ordered the SAM GYUP SAL. It was slicked pork belly with roasted garlic and brussel sprouts.  If you're at all familiar with brussel sprouts you are well aware they aren't anyone's favorite food. Yet Jin Ju found a way to make them a delicious addition to this dish without making them unhealthy. Needless to say my first impression was a good one.For the main dish I had one of my favorite Korean dishes Chap Chea. This is a colorless vermicelli noodle usually served in a sauce with mushrooms, onions, and chicken, pork, or beef. Jin Ju choose beef, roasted red peppers, sesame seed oil, spinach, Shiitake mushrooms, and carrots. It was a truly wonderful and well thought out dish. My one complaints is that it wasn't quite flavorful enough. My experience with Chap Chea from other Korean restaurants is that it's a spicy option. Jin Ju made a very tasty entree that I felt could have had a little more kick. But, if spicy isn't your think, then I definitely recommend this item.My fiancé ordered the O Jinga Bokum. It's a sautéed squid dish with veggies in a red pepper sauce. Now this was a meal with a kick!  It had a heat that built up over time making you take a time out to cool your mouth with a drink. But the heat didn't linger and he was back to eating not long after. The squid was prepared perfectly which is hard to find. Overall Jin Ju was our happy mistake for a Saturday evening meal. We will definitely be back to try some famous Korean staples as well as their more inventive dishes. Jin Ju make instant fans of of these hungry boys.

18.description: Food was delicious and totally new to me and my girlfriend. Unlike anything we've had before (and we make a point of eating a wide array of cuisine), but I know we'll be coming back for more! Service was great. Our waiter was really nice, gave us lots of attention and answered every question we had about the menu. Great dining experience.

41.description: I have lived in Andersonville for the past two and a half years and can't believe it took me so long to discover this neighborhood gem! I can honestly say I've been here five times in the past five weeks. I've had basically every appetizer, the Kim Chee Pajun, the Daeji Kalbi; which is my partner's favorite, the Mandoo, and MY personal favorite; the Dak Gan Jang chicken wings! I don't know what spices they put in these, but they're just as addictive as crack. Not that I've tried crack, but I find myself craving these on the daily-so I can only imagine!As far as dinner goes, I've only had the Dak Bulgogi. It's. That. Good. It has this mildish firey flavored seasoning (how can that even exist) that is so damn delicious, my mouth is watering now just thinking about it. How could I forget the drinks!?!? I've never experienced soju vodka before, so imagine my surprise as to how smooth their sojutinis go down. So light and so smooth, hardly sugary or overly sweet.  The Pear is my favorite, with the Jinger coming in second. It's easy to down 3 or 4... Okay, 4-and I'm hardly a lush. Aside from the food and drinks, what I really like about this place is the atmosphere and staff. It's totally casual, with a chic urban feel that's just as comfortable as it is stylish. The feel is easy, and the staff doesn't rush you to eat, drink and get the eff out. Randa has been our server, as well as our bartender on occasion, and is totally impeccable at what she does. Her and Armando give great service and I look forward to seeing them every time I go in!Do yourself a favor and go!

52.description: Me and two of my friends went there after work Friday. Really love the environment, cosy and comfy. Especially a thumb up for the waiters! They gave us a lot of good suggestions, and obviously they know their food very well. I will call the food a more modern version of Korean cuisine, since you can find several western cooking styles in the dish. But all the dishes were amazing! I didn't try their cocktails, but based on the amount the other diners ordered, I'm sure it's worth trying!

50.description: I came here for the first time with a big group of friends for a birthday party. We had about 26 people. Besides what you see in the front there is a back room for big groups I think. We had the whole room to ourselves. They had a bar back there too although it was occupied at the time. But it's a good place for big groups! The hostess (waitress) was very friendly and helpful. I like their pancakes, bi bim bop and the tempuras. It's not very cheap compare to the places in Korea town of course. But it's reasonably price and everything is very fresh. I like the side dishes that comes with every single order (and it's unlimited). Usually comes with a few pieces of tofu, broccoli and eggplant. Even though it's not as much as the 10 side dishes a regular Korean restaurant would give but they home made everything and it's all freshly made (that's what the waitress told me at least). They also have good fruity martinis, definitely get one of those if you like martini type of drinks. It's street parking (easy to find), free street parking on Sundays.

4.description: We went here as recommended by a friend of mine...Seating was pretty quick...Lighting not too dim but not too bright either. I can see this place being more appealing to couples related distance of tables from each other as well as candle on table....Music was appropriate for setting. Unfortunately the price was not reasonable for portions if each dish and I felt banchans should have been more and something that should be endless like "bottomless fries" or "unlimited refills" Food wasnt bad but it wasnt special either it just was alright. We tried the Dol Sut Bi Bim Bap which is essentially the warmer served Bi Bim Bap, both of which were delicious when you mix it with the spicy red bean sauce, Kalbi had most flavor and very tender, Bulgogi was alright but the Dak Bulgogi probably wouldn't been better as spicy pork as opposed to chicken...

6.description: I love Jin Ju's contemporary twist on Korean food.  We started with the Korean chicken wings in sweet-spicy sauce, and this appetizer was perfection.  Between two people, we shared the spicy beef noodle soup and seafood bim bim bap for dinner.  Included were a trio of banchan (side dishes).  The soup was extremely flavorful and had wonderful complex flavors.  I would order again in a heartbeat.  Our waiter offered to mix the bim bim bap for us when it arrived at our table, and it may have been done too maturely.  It was too moist and didn't have the burnt bottoms on the rice.  The flavor primary came from the red sauce, and it was on the sweet side.  I don't think it was worth the price.The restaurant was busy, but not packed on a Saturday night.  Service was seamless.  It is dark inside, which seemed appropriate for dinner dates, but the noise level is high.  We were seated near the front of the restaurant, so close to the couple on our left that it almost felt like we were a group of four.  I could hear everything from their conversation.  Despite some reservations about the seating, I truly enjoyed the meal and would recommend for anyone looking for a change from typical Korean food.

22.description: Went to jin ju on a Sunday night. Able to be seated right away for a party of 5. The service was excellent.  Very friendly staff! Offered any explanations for menu items. Nice assortment of specialty drinks. I had the ginger liqueur one. Dont recall everything we ordered but the Bi Bim Bop was very good. First time having that. Appetizers included a fried piece of fish and small dumpling type of thing.

15.description: The food at Jin Ju is very good. Sushi in the Midwest has come a long way over the past decade and I feel there is always an interest to keep making it better.Now drill down to Chicago and you will see pockets where sushi places are strong, but most people do not think Andersonville (or for that matter places north of Fullerton) have something of high quality.  Jin Ju proves that this is not the case. One can clearly see that they are concerned about quality and have a simple but focused menu.  It would probably get 5 stars from me if the restaurant itself was bigger and brighter, it has sort of a dark feel to it.  Nonetheless, it is worth the visit.

57.description: Jin Ju is the most modern and romantic Korean place I have been to.  The place is dimly lit where the only lighting is from the candles on the tables and street lamps streaming in through the big open window.  The exposed bricks and the huge display of liquor at the bar give off a trendy ambience.Our waiter here was great, very attentive and knowledgeable.  When the food came out, he asked each of us if we were familiar with these dishes and how they are traditionally eaten.  I thought that was nice of him.  Although I loved the atmosphere and service, the food was nothing spectacular.  It wasn't bad though, but just didn't measure up to the vibe they were trying to present.  We started off with the kim bap.  If you aren't familiar with kim bap, it is like sushi but without the fish.  It was good, but kind of expensive for a roll of vegetables, rice, and seaweed.  For the entree, I ordered the domi (lightly battered tilapia filet served with eggplant, mushrooms, and carrots.)  I thought this dish was phenomenal.  I loved how the different flavors from the ginger, hot mustard, and soy sauce came together to give it a nice sauce that wasn't too overwhelming.  But the awe stopped there for our entrees, the rest of the dishes (dol sut bi bim bap, yook gae jang, and bulgogi) ordered was just ok.  I had similar dishes elsewhere that taste a lot better at a more affordable price.    Overall, we did enjoy ourselves and the food.  We just had better Korean food elsewhere.  Also the banchan (side dishes) didn't have much of a variety like I'm used to.  But if you were looking for a more contemporary spin on Korean food definitely check this place out.  It is a good place to kick back and relax over drinks and food.

20.description: Highly reco this delish Korean joint in Andersonville. Attentive service, delish / authentic food and fitting decor. A touch on the expensive side but we will be going back soon.

36.description: Best. Korean. Ever. I've been a regular for years. My "go to": Kim Chee Mandoo (steam veggie dumplings), Dak Gan Jang (to call this a fried chicken wing is almost condescending), and Dak Bulgogi (chicken). Order any martini that appeals to you. All are brilliant. And the staff are wonderful. If you're thinking about it, stop. Just go. Now.

14.description: Rkdkdkdkk

58.description: Since moving out of Andersonville, there is plenty I miss about the neighborhood. At the top of that list is Taste of Lebanon. Owned and operated by a local family, this place is as authentic as it gets.The ambiance leaves little to be desired, but that's also part of its charm. It's all about cheap, tasty Mediterranean fare at a fair price.Try the stuffed grape leaves, chicken shawarma wrap, and fatoush salad. They are exquisite and what keeps me coming back every so often. This place is the only place worth eating in Andersonville.

56.description: Great authentic flavors! If you have limited lunch hour, this is your spot. Hot and fresh meal ready in less than five minutes. The wraps are $3.99. I'm also a fan of the lentil soup. Give this place a try, you won't be sorry.

29.description: Love this place. CASH ONLY! I know we're used to swiping and paying with phones but you have to go withdraw a $20 bill(which is enough for 2 people seriously!) and go to this place. In an area like Andersonville, which has myriads of hidden gems, this might be the best gem. Ambiance is "hole in the wallish" if you know what I mean. The Food however is 5 stars it's always good/comforting. Best lentil soup and I grew up eating lentils. My usual order is 2 lentil soups(1 for now 1 for later)/falafel plate(comes with 6 falafels and salad)/and chicken kabob wrap or Lebanese chicken salad...like I said everything is good just point at something if you don't know what to get and it will be good. Please go and support these hidden neighborhood gems and have an awesome meal while you're at it.

42.description: Cash only.  Big fan of the falafel and lentil soup, although the soup can be a bit heavy.The shawarma wraps, however, left a bit to be desired - while they're definitely cheap, the portions aren't huge - the wraps are not really stuffed.  I don't usually have huge meals but I can easily put down a couple wraps on my own.  I noticed that the wraps usually aren't served warm, and sometimes the meat, be it chicken or beef, ends up being really dry.  That said, for the other items I mentioned, I'm happy to get a quick take-out dinner from Taste of Lebanon if I can get there by 7 during the week.

23.description: I really used to like this place but unfortunately the quality went down.I am speaking on my last cpl visits . I usually get the lentil soup and chicken salad. The portions on both are smaller chicken was dry nearly burned  the last two times and they packed my soup wrong half spilled . I hope they get it together.

47.description: This place is amazing! Great food, and great prices! Try the Fattoush Salad and the lentil soup! So good!!!

8.description: I absolutely love this place! It's my middle eastern heaven. Everything is always so fresh and so yummy, I could eat it every day!The lentils soup is divine, the beef shawarma is amazing and the falafel is probably the best I've ever had.Their veggie combos are worth it, so much food for only $5 or $6.

31.description: KAFTA MEI walked in wanting either a beef or chicken shawarma. I asked the nice man at the counter which one was his favorite and he told me that both were good but chicken is the most popular. I then pressed him for his favorite and he suggested the lamb kafta. Why didn't I think of that? I looked at him and said, "Yes let's do that!"I also asked if he could make it spicy and he said yes. The prices weren't bad either. A Lamb Kafta wrap was only $3.99 which is a great deal. My wife went with the vegetarian combo special #1 for $5.99 which included Falafel, hummus, Baba Ghanoush, fresh vegetables, tahina sauce & pita bread. We also ordered a bowl of Fresh Lentil Soup for only $2.49. After placing our order we went to our table and waited. The nice man who took our order also delivered our food to us. We had arrived before lunch which was nice and relaxed but the closer we got to noon the larger the crowd got. I was so glad that we didn't come during the lunch rush. We were able to relax and enjoy our food. Our lentil soup with pita bread arrived first. I really liked it but I would not say it was the best lentil soup I've ever had. I liked the fact that it was not boiling hot. I hate getting soup that takes two days to cool off. I enjoyed the sweetness of the red lentils and it gave this soup a uniqueness. I really loved my lamb kafta. I was so happy he suggested it. I was very happy that there was lamb in every bite. I've had kafta wraps before where it's mostly veggies and no meat. That drives me crazy. I was also happy with the level of spiciness and the freshness of the vegetables. I would definitely come back for this. My wife loved her vegetarian combo. I was a lucky recipient of the food she couldn't finish. The hummus was very good. I loved the level of smokey flavor and believe it must be the smoked paprika that was served with it. I must also give high marks for the falafel. I love falafel but finding a good one is hard. This falafel was moist and soft on the inside. I hate it when falafels are dry and taste like gritty sand inside. This place gets how to make a good falafel. I was also impressed with the nice crispy outside and the yummy tahina sauce on top. I would also come back for the hummus and the falafel. I saw a wrap that includes both and I may have to try that. This place was a hidden gem. Thanks to all of the Yelpers that directed me here. Your reviews and photos really made me want to eat here and you did not steer me wrong. I just wish that this place was closer to where I lived because I would be a regular.

34.description: Money vs. value, this place is 5 star. Nothing too fancy on the inside. Cash only, order at the counter. Food is fantastic and plentiful, and prices are so friendly. This a go-to spot when you want Mediterranean food now! Not open Sunday.

16.description: Cash only.  Big fan of the falafel and lentil soup, although the soup can be a bit heavy.The shawarma wraps, however, left a bit to be desired - while they're definitely cheap, the portions aren't huge - the wraps are not really stuffed.  I don't usually have huge meals but I can easily put down a couple wraps on my own.  I noticed that the wraps usually aren't served warm, and sometimes the meat, be it chicken or beef, ends up being really dry.  That said, for the other items I mentioned, I'm happy to get a quick take-out dinner from Taste of Lebanon if I can get there by 7 during the week.

13.description: Excellent lentil soup and the best falafel!

11.description: Really good lebanese food. Special Kudos for lamb wrap and baba ghanoush. Super simple place, not anything fancy but the quality of the food and price make it worth!

39.description: Taste of Lebanon is terrific. In short, it's cheap, delicious, healthy food made and served promptly by great people.  They have solid options for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike (I love the Veggie Combo #1, the lentil soup, the falafel wrap) and every time I visit the employee running the register is friendly, cheerful and asks about my day. I leave feeling glad to be part of the neighborhood and psyched about whatever's in my takeout bag. Definitely worth a visit. Just remember it's cash-only!

37.description: I'm Lebanese and grew up with authentic Lebanese food.  Let me tell you, this place is legit.  Seasoning is awesome, tahini is on point, and veggies taste amazingly fresh.  They can also custom your food (i.e. Don't add pita to fattoush).  If you're in the area and want a quick, cheap, good dinner, stop by.  It'll be worth it!

0.description: This tiny "hole in the wall" place is fantastic.  Cashier/staff is always very friendly. Prices are fantastic. Portions are large. And the food is some of the best of its kind that I have ever had. The falafel was smoother than what I typically get at Falafel and Grill and is probably the best I've had, the Lentil Soup is bar none the best soup I've ever had, and I have no complaints about the Chicken Wrap. I'd highly recommend you visit Taste of Lebanon.

38.description: THE BEST AUTHENTIC Lebanese food I've had besides my mom and dads kitchen!!!! Great prices and fast service!!! I lived in the city and have been eating there for over 10 years but moved to Des Plaines but I still go there a few times a month.

51.description: Love the homemade Lentil soup and falafel sandwich. Cheap, fresh and consistently really good when I'm in the mood for middle eastern food in the neighborhood. Cash only.

27.description: I lived in Andersonville, home of Taste of Lebanon, for about a year. This neighborhood is BOOMING with delicious eats. However, I must say that along side with Icosium Kafe (now closed, R.I.P.), this place was my go-to when in the mood for something satisfying, though not quite sure what that may be. Or when craving pickles turnips (this happens weekly) or lentil soup! A shawarma , accompanied by creamy tahini and salty pickled turnips, to fill me up & a light salad tossed in olive oil with lemon juice and oregano to get that fresh crispy texture in. Don't forget the side of lentil soup!!!! Hands down, hats off, scouts honor, BEST lentil soup ever. Little side of Sambal to get my spicy on and it's a completely balanced meal, which are indeed the most satisfying. Fast service, fresh food, awesome prices, & great location--the corner of Clark & Foster!!! Oh yeah, homemade baklava too.Yeah. Baklava. Homemade. Need I say more?Eat here now.

32.description: Still coming here, still fantastic! They recently added a "Hummous & Shawarma" appetizer for all you people who claim to have a gluten allergy!

54.description: Chicken shawarma's, Falafel's, and hummus soup is worth a five star dinner. You won't be sorry. The authentic flavors and small sweet spot. Great for a first date or just to hang out with good company!

48.description: I drive for lyft part time and whenever I need something good and tasty, I call them up to let them know that I'm picking up and it's always ready. Except the other day when I tool too long... They made me a fresh sandwich so it wasn't cold, and it was done in a flash. Tried their lentil soup for the first time and it was great! These guys rock!

44.description: My go to place for affordable Middle Eastern food is Sultans in Wicker Park, but a close friend of mine highly recommended this place to me since I am house sitting literally around the corner. I usually stick with what I know I will enjoy, that being a falafel. Since I was trying this place for the first time I figured I would step outside of my comfort zone and try something else. I decided to get the beef schwarma wrap, no onions because I pretty much loathe them. My friend got the same thing. The first few bites were good but after that I kinda got bored with it and the sauce was a bit too tangy in a sense for my taste(I am very picky when it comes to sauces and such). On the other hand my friend was crazy about his wrap. The wrap was put together nicely, just the right amount of everything and the beef was good. It just wasn't for me, but I can be a stickler when it comes to food. Next time my friend and I return here, because he has been dying to do so, I am going to try their falafel which I am sure I will love. I wish the inside of this place was a little more welcoming vs seeming like a hole in the wall. It is a small place and can get pretty busy so expect to wait a bit in line.

24.description: The taboouli was great! I'll be back for that. But my falafal was salty and a little burnt tasting. That was a disappointment.

7.description: Simply the best quick cheap delicious eats in the city. Their wraps are my go-to but th have a delicious lentil soup and all types of plates that hit the spot

49.description: Taste of Lebanon is an absolute treasure. I'm sure everyone has talked about the ridiculously low prices, but really, if you're a broke ass mother like I am, a filling falafel & baba ghanoush sandwich for $3.79 is a big deal, especially as Andersonville gets bourgier and costlier. It's also just a great sandwich, at least as good as the more expensive ones you can get at fast casual falafel chain like I Dream of Falafel and Roti. The fattoush salad (which has crunchy pita chips in it) is also brilliant and highly recommended. The fries are solid and $1.79 easily buys enough for two or three, though that certainly didn't stop me from having to force myself not to finish them all by myself. This place better not get pushed out of A-ville in favor of another bulls**t $12 burger joint. The world needs more glorious, friendly hole-in-the-walls like this.

40.description: The LEGENDARY Taste of Lebanon. LENTIL SOUP. ANY WRAP. A CAN OF SODA. It doesn't get much better. I love the guy at the register too. Super nice and he also turned me on to getting the wraps with sport peppers on the side (pro tip).

53.description: Very good food

30.description: 255 five star reviews, this place must be good, right? Wrong. This place is fast, friendly and cheap. That's the good news. But looking around the bare-bones storefront space, I just don't get it -- five star reviews for what? What am I missing? "Well, you have to rate it as an example of its type, not against some Michelin-starred restaurant downtown." OK, so how does it compare to any other storefront falafel joint? In other words, how's the food? I've lived in the Middle East and I eat this food all the time. The food here is very ordinary. The lentil soup is pretty common. Yes, I know what folks write about the lentil soup here--it can't be taken seriously. Maybe they add a little more cumin or turmeric than usual--not a big deal in my book. I had the Vegetarian Combo No. 2. Falafel, ordinary. Stuffed grape leaves, mushy and off-tasting. (Search "mushy" in TOL's reviews & you'll see what I'm talking about.) Tahini sauce, ordinary. Tabouli, wrong ratio of parsley to bulgur wheat. And the same hard unripe tomatoes and unpeeled cucumber as everywhere else. So I say, if you're hungry and tired of waiting for the Foster bus, you can eat here. Otherwise you'd be better off shopping at the Middle East Grocery store directly across the street and eating at home. Guys, up your game.  My advice for people wanting to sample Middle Eastern food--give Dawali or Sultan's Market a try.

46.description: After a long day of walking around my two friends and I were absolutely starving. Being vegetarians, it can be hard to find good food without spending all the money in your wallet or settling for straight carbs. When I first walked in I wasn't quite sure, it's pretty small and didn't seem too modern. My opinion changed, however, as soon as I noticed a huge sign saying "vegetarian special." We were all overjoyed. The service was a lovely and polite staff that was able to answer any questions. The food was excellent. Next time I'm in the neighborhood, I'll definitely be getting more hummus and falafel.

1.description: This place is one of the bang for your buck restaurants I've been to in Chicagoland. Each wrap is about $4 ($3.79 for Falafel wrap with Hummus, and $3.99 for Chicken wrap and all the other ones with meat). Each wrap that I've had at this place has been quite satisfying and the economics of it all was even more satisfying. There isn't that much space in the restaurant, only about 7-8 tables. But from when I've been there, it seems like most people who come in order take-out. Also, the guy behind the counter is pretty helpful if you have any questions or concerns.  Overall, eating here has been a worthwhile and highly pleasing experience.

55.description: The lentil soup alone is worth 5 stars. Add the other great food, the low prices and amiable staff and you've got a clear winner.

9.description: If you dig simple Middle Eastern fare that's as tasty as it is easy on your wallet, this is your (and my) kind of place. Friendly and speedy service, too. The place itself isn't much to look at, but I'm usually too busy gorging myself on their delicious hummus or falafel wraps to care about the surroundings. And my wife swears by their lentil soup!

26.description: Falafel is delicious The service is good , they are kind and generous, they gave me free  baklava .. Its Cash only

25.description: Good-good chicken shawarma. Fries is delisious.Thanks))))))

12.description: I took my wife to work yesterday.  After I dropped her off I looked for an inexpensive restaurant on Yelp w/a good rating.  Taste of Lebanon @ 1509 W Foster has a 4 1/2 star rating and for a good reason.  This is a tiny little store front with great food at very reasonable prices.  The interior is no frills, but the food I tried was excellent and very inexpensive.  This is a great combination in my book.I ordered the lentil soup.  The soup was only $2.49 & came with pita bread.  This was the best lentil soup I ever ate.  I also got the chicken shawarma wrap.  This was also delicious.I plan on going back and trying some other items on the menu.  This restaurant is a winning combination GREAT food @ REASONABLE prices.

59.description: Pretty good for vegetarian stuff. I would not get meat there. Ambiance is very basic. Parking is not bad for Andersonville.

21.description: It's a hole in the wall, no-frills joint that gets it RIGHT!  If you're reading this review, it's because you're wondering whether it's worth a visit...  It is.

17.description: Voted best cheap eats 2005 by aolcityguide!. I know so old, but still hanging on the wall!

10.description: Love this place. Falafal is amazing and get the #1 vegetarian combo.  The guy that works the front isnt too hard on the eyes either ;) I eat here AT LEAST once a week.

5.description: KAFTA MEI walked in wanting either a beef or chicken shawarma. I asked the nice man at the counter which one was his favorite and he told me that both were good but chicken is the most popular. I then pressed him for his favorite and he suggested the lamb kafta. Why didn't I think of that? I looked at him and said, "Yes let's do that!"I also asked if he could make it spicy and he said yes. The prices weren't bad either. A Lamb Kafta wrap was only $3.99 which is a great deal. My wife went with the vegetarian combo special #1 for $5.99 which included Falafel, hummus, Baba Ghanoush, fresh vegetables, tahina sauce & pita bread. We also ordered a bowl of Fresh Lentil Soup for only $2.49. After placing our order we went to our table and waited. The nice man who took our order also delivered our food to us. We had arrived before lunch which was nice and relaxed but the closer we got to noon the larger the crowd got. I was so glad that we didn't come during the lunch rush. We were able to relax and enjoy our food. Our lentil soup with pita bread arrived first. I really liked it but I would not say it was the best lentil soup I've ever had. I liked the fact that it was not boiling hot. I hate getting soup that takes two days to cool off. I enjoyed the sweetness of the red lentils and it gave this soup a uniqueness. I really loved my lamb kafta. I was so happy he suggested it. I was very happy that there was lamb in every bite. I've had kafta wraps before where it's mostly veggies and no meat. That drives me crazy. I was also happy with the level of spiciness and the freshness of the vegetables. I would definitely come back for this. My wife loved her vegetarian combo. I was a lucky recipient of the food she couldn't finish. The hummus was very good. I loved the level of smokey flavor and believe it must be the smoked paprika that was served with it. I must also give high marks for the falafel. I love falafel but finding a good one is hard. This falafel was moist and soft on the inside. I hate it when falafels are dry and taste like gritty sand inside. This place gets how to make a good falafel. I was also impressed with the nice crispy outside and the yummy tahina sauce on top. I would also come back for the hummus and the falafel. I saw a wrap that includes both and I may have to try that. This place was a hidden gem. Thanks to all of the Yelpers that directed me here. Your reviews and photos really made me want to eat here and you did not steer me wrong. I just wish that this place was closer to where I lived because I would be a regular.

3.description: These guys are a solid 4 stars and easily could be 5. I've been coming here for years and they are a model for quick, inexpensive, and quality Lebanese food.I've had their lentil soup, lamb/kafta kebob wrap, beef wrap, chicken wrap, falafel wrap, hummus, baba ghanoush, and all are solid. My personal favorite is their chicken shawarma wrap. It does a great job of blending chunks of juicy chicken with super flavorful crisped up pieces and it's seasoned perfectly.The meal wouldn't be complete without their complimentary hot sauce, sport peppers, and pickled radishes. I recommend putting it all together and dipping the chicken wrap in some of their baba ghanoush, adding a sport pepper, pickled radish, and some of their hot sauce and then going to town.

35.description: Wow I do not know how else to put it, but you can not find better food at cheaper prices anywhere! I got the number 1 vegetarian special and also the lentil soup. Both items were delicious and my girlfriend got the chicken salad which she devoured. I will be stopping by this place whenever I'm in the area. Great service and atmosphere!

19.description: 255 five star reviews, this place must be good, right? Wrong. This place is fast, friendly and cheap. That's the good news. But looking around the bare-bones storefront space, I just don't get it -- five star reviews for what? What am I missing? "Well, you have to rate it as an example of its type, not against some Michelin-starred restaurant downtown." OK, so how does it compare to any other storefront falafel joint? In other words, how's the food? I've lived in the Middle East and I eat this food all the time. The food here is very ordinary. The lentil soup is pretty common. Yes, I know what folks write about the lentil soup here--it can't be taken seriously. Maybe they add a little more cumin or turmeric than usual--not a big deal in my book. I had the Vegetarian Combo No. 2. Falafel, ordinary. Stuffed grape leaves, mushy and off-tasting. (Search "mushy" in TOL's reviews & you'll see what I'm talking about.) Tahini sauce, ordinary. Tabouli, wrong ratio of parsley to bulgur wheat. And the same hard unripe tomatoes and unpeeled cucumber as everywhere else. So I say, if you're hungry and tired of waiting for the Foster bus, you can eat here. Otherwise you'd be better off shopping at the Middle East Grocery store directly across the street and eating at home. Guys, up your game.  My advice for people wanting to sample Middle Eastern food--give Dawali or Sultan's Market a try.

28.description: Not a flamboyant storefront, but the food is delicious and a good price! Cash only. We came on a Thurs early afternoon. Limited seating inside, but it seems most people come in and pick something up and then leave. The seating also has relatively quick turnover. The falafel appetizer plus lentil soup came out to be $6. The lentil soup was absolutely amazing. The spices were just right. And there was pita that came worth it to be used for dipping. I would highly recommend this combination, as it was filling, cheap, and tasty.

45.description: Every year I write Bon Appétit and submit a request (no, more accurately it could be described as a plea) to find out the recipe for the lentil soup. Here's the backstory. . . For a few sad years of my life, I lived in the southwest where I woefully could not access the deliciousness of Taste of Lebanon's lentil soup and spent time in my New Mexico kitchen trying to recreate that magic. However, like trying your hand at alchemy there is nothing like the real thing. If you are in Chicago, go here and find the lentil gold for yourself.

33.description: Best swarma in the whole city. The lentil soup is amazing. Let be real this place is great across the board hands down the best. Cash only and quick.

43.description: You can tell these guys are Lebanese. Best Middle Eastern food I have had in the US. Everything is really good - and really cheap. Try the baklava and tell me it isn't perfect. Hummus perfect. Shwarma just the right amount of sauce (but could use a pickle). Also, one of the only places you can get fool mudammas which is my favorite breakfast food. Shukran, Taste of Lebanon.

2.description: The staff at this middle eastern restaurant are very friendly. A fair warning though, it is cash only. There are many ATM options nearby. I came here looking for a quick lunch, and this place did just that. The prices are affordable, the staff was very welcoming, offering a washroom although it wasn't open to the public. Also, the speed was very quick! I would highly recommend this to anyone in the uptown/Andersonville area.

18.description: Food was delicious! Great for vegetarians lovers. Prices are super affordable. This is a small little Lebanese restaurant with some serious flavors. My friends had the specials that came with rice, hummus, babagnosh, pickled veggies, falafels, kabobs, chicken wrap, and pita bread. Just remember this is cash only!

41.description: Among the best falafel I've had in Chicago. Fast, friendly and inexpensive.   First time here, but I'll be back.

52.description: My favorite chicken shawarma in the city. Always excellent service and a smile from the gentleman at the counter.

50.description: An absolute gem. Everything they do is with incredible care and attention. The ingredients are fresh and delicious, and the service is so quick and thoughtful. We get this at least once a week if not more often. Healthy, yummy, convenient!

4.description: I think this place got overhyped for me. I was so excited for cheap, cash only Lebanese food. But sometimes you get what you pay for. The wraps here were minimal and the meat's flavor was obscured. The falafel was so full of cilantro, that was the only flavor I could taste. I would drop by on my way home from work with a craving, but probably not otherwise.

6.description: Not a flamboyant storefront, but the food is delicious and a good price! Cash only. We came on a Thurs early afternoon. Limited seating inside, but it seems most people come in and pick something up and then leave. The seating also has relatively quick turnover. The falafel appetizer plus lentil soup came out to be $6. The lentil soup was absolutely amazing. The spices were just right. And there was pita that came worth it to be used for dipping. I would highly recommend this combination, as it was filling, cheap, and tasty.

22.description: I had their lentil soup for lunch today and can't stop thinking about how good it was. I could eat it every day! Definitely going back in a few days!

15.description: My go to place for affordable Middle Eastern food is Sultans in Wicker Park, but a close friend of mine highly recommended this place to me since I am house sitting literally around the corner. I usually stick with what I know I will enjoy, that being a falafel. Since I was trying this place for the first time I figured I would step outside of my comfort zone and try something else. I decided to get the beef schwarma wrap, no onions because I pretty much loathe them. My friend got the same thing. The first few bites were good but after that I kinda got bored with it and the sauce was a bit too tangy in a sense for my taste(I am very picky when it comes to sauces and such). On the other hand my friend was crazy about his wrap. The wrap was put together nicely, just the right amount of everything and the beef was good. It just wasn't for me, but I can be a stickler when it comes to food. Next time my friend and I return here, because he has been dying to do so, I am going to try their falafel which I am sure I will love. I wish the inside of this place was a little more welcoming vs seeming like a hole in the wall. It is a small place and can get pretty busy so expect to wait a bit in line.

57.description: I'm not sure I understand all these stellar ratings.  I tried the supposedly fabulous lentil soup... and it was alright.  The flavors seemed a little muted, and I prefer my own version(s).My partner got the falafel wrap and fries and said there wasn't much falafel in the sandwich, and the fries were only OK.The place is really cheap, fast, and friendly, so they do have that going for them... but I prioritize tasty food over all of those points.  I'd be willing to come back and try other things on the menu, but honestly that's not likely to happen with Middle East Bakery right across the street.

20.description: Great neighborhood spot. friendly staff. Love the Lentil soup and wraps.

36.description: This is a great hole-in-the-wall lunch place. Super convenient, but cash only. Veggie platter #1 is the bomb. It even came with complimentary baklava! Unfortunately, I've discovered I don't like baba ghanoush (sp?) but maybe they will be so kind as to let me sub for extra hummus next time...? :)

14.description: It's a hole in the wall, no-frills joint that gets it RIGHT!  If you're reading this review, it's because you're wondering whether it's worth a visit...  It is.

12.description: aAwesome experience!Dr Ela is very  friendly and provides excellent service , aLso awesome staff. My spine has improved a lot  after an injury last year,my back feels stronger, and my body is feeling better than ever.Highly recommend this location.

7.description: If you are looking for a chiropractic adjustment from an actual chiropractor, DO NOT GO HERE. Due to the time of day and proximity, my wife made the mistake of booking a "walk-in" appointment this morning to get an adjustment because of some specific neck pain. Payment is required up front, which as we'll see, is for good reason. Her assessment began with a tour, and "treatments" being performed as the tour proceeded. After a relatively reassuring intake: height, weight, footfall analysis, medical history, x-ray, and range of motion test... That was it. No adjustment or correction, just the requirement to return for an hour-long followup. After some self-education, it became apparent this followup includes watching a movie, and can very likely be conducted in a group setting. What? Other than telling her what was happening as it was being done, there was no explanation as to what today's "treatment" would (and would NOT!) entail, which is a foundation to any health care practice. Moreover, she left the clinic in MORE PAIN than when she arrived. What self-respecting practitioner allows that? Luckily, by this time our regular chiropractor was open and got her worked right in (and happily accommodated me as well). He also said that manipulation without adjustment and correction is one of the WORST things to do. Chiro One is clearly providing a disservice to those seeking relief from pain.

3.description: Was planning on just going in for a free consultation; but figured out why I was having some back pain & soreness in the neck. (Just figured it was from working out.)  In the end, I was so happy I went in. They were able to correct my alignment with regular adjustments. And I don't have any discomfort in my neck/back.   Love the crew they have at this location and they have parking.

1.description: I woke up one morning about a year ago with terrible lower right back pain from a previous sacroiliac injury years and years ago. I could barely walk so my boyfriend got on the phone and started looking for a chiropractor who could get me in that day. The friendly staff at Chiro One Andersonville (at the time, Will, Kristi and Kale) were more than accommodating. I will say, it took some time for me to really feel and notice a difference. But it has been a full year of treatment since my first consultation and adjustment and I am feeling no back pain for the first time in 7 years. Dr. Mark and his staff are kind, knowledgeable and funny. I enjoy seeing them every time I go in to the office and I could not ask for better results. I am so happy my boyfriend made that call back in February 2015. Thank you Chiro One Andersonville!

2.description: I began a treatment plan with Dr. Mark in May 2015. I had numbness in my thumb and at times in my arm. It was my first experience with Chiropractic care so I was nervous. Some thirty-eight treatments later, the problems that brought me in are all but gone. Hardly ever do symptoms show themselves anymore.I can feel the results and there is evidence of improvement from x-rays and other clues. I know I have underlying issues that caused my symptoms and now that I'm comfortable with Dr. Mark I look forward to working with him in partnership to get further improvements in my wellness.Dr. Mark does not work alone he has a staff of three other people that support him and his patients. In every time that I have been in for my session I have benefited from the professionalism and compassion shown by Colleen, Kristy, and William. They do a great job in making things easier during a time when one might be dealing with pain, fear, and uncertainty.It's been a great experience for me. These are talented people that can really help you if you trust them and commit to a process that seems to work.As long as I need Chiropractic work this is my team. I'm happy. Many thanks.

9.description: I started going here three weeks ago after my sister recommended I go. Although I didn't suffer from any back pain or other body aches on a daily basis, I did experience some discomfort once in a while and was curious to see how my spine looked on the X-rays. I had no idea I was actually way worse than I thought! After viewing the films and speaking with Dr. Mark I knew that if I didn't do something about my issues I would eventually be paying for it down the road and the problems would be harder to fix. I'm excited to see my improvements in the next few months... I just wish Dr. Mark were closer to Lakeview, I would go everyday!!

10.description: Worst place ever. They insult your intelligence. It is a mockery. Never ever go there

13.description: I was a bit skeptical about coming here. That is cause I had a number of bad chiropratic experiences. All the same, when I was leaving Dominicks and some people offered $20 x-rays and consulation, I was desperate.  My left leg was numb when I walked and I had horrible migraines that left me  taking a hot bath in the dark for hours each night. When I started everyone is nice...scarey nice...but then I am just grumpy. I work part-time and don't have insurance and they worked with me. I have made it a point to never miss an appointment. Over a year later, I am headache-free and I can feel my leg. Also the cheerfullness isn't as scarey as it use to be. The proof is in the pudding...or in my x-rays.

16.description: I feel compelled to write a review here because the reality is, my health and well-being is improving in ways that I had no idea was possible, and it's because of the thoroughness and generosity of Dr. Mark and the treatment plan at ChiroOne.I remember walking in to the office several months ago, in pain, and I had an expectation that I would walk in, get on the table, get cracked, and leave pain free.  You know...."fast food/instant gratification chiropractic."  While I was disappointed about not getting an adjustment immediately, I am now in better health, both mentally and physically, because of the care I am receiving at Dr. Mark's clinic and ChiroOne's intentional approach to chiropractic care.  I feel that Dr. Mark really has my long-term health in mind, not just short-term cessation of pain, and I now experience my visits as one of the most self-loving actions I take each week. I have seen chiropractors for over 15 years, and even planned to become one, back in the day.  One of my closest friends was a chiropractor so I was sold.  For years, I would come into chiropractic clinics in pain, I'd get my immediate adjustment, and would leave feeling better, only to return a week to two weeks later when the pain returned. I was passively involved in my improvement, and I never really knew the cause of the chronic lower back pain and depression, which has been a struggle for over 22 years. I thought of the spine as a static structure that I had no responsibility for and the depression as an inescapable family trait.  All I thought I needed was a doctor's tweak on a stubborn vertebrae every so often, and all would be well.  I was ok with that plan....UNTIL IN LEARNED THAT MORE WAS POSSIBLE!!!At Dr. Mark's clinic, I actually got x-rays of my spine so that we could see what was going on inside.  It was only because of these x-rays that we discovered I had mild scoliosis in my lumbar spine.  WTF?  I saw the films myself and was shocked.  Back story: I teach a form of movement education that is all about spine-health and posture, so I am the last person in the world who should have anything wrong with his spine.  But, voila, the x-rays and thoroughness of testing and palpation of Dr. Mark made clear for the first time, the probable cause of my back pain and that has literally altered the course of my treatment into ACTUAL WELLNESS!  I just got new films after several months of consistent treatments with Dr. Mark, and for the first time in my adult life, I am consistently pain free, AND, my lumbar spine is improving.  The lateral curve is almost gone and the twist is barely noticeable.  I would consider this a flipping MIRACLE. On another note.....Dr. Mark mentioned that adjustments to the angle of my C1 vertebrae (which was not in its ideal carriage), might result in an improvement in my mental health.  I was entirely skeptical at first, but after 1 month of cervical adjustments, I started to notice that I had more access to joy, which would last, sometimes, through an entire day.  I also noticed that I was far less anxious in crowded environments.  Now THAT'S crazy!!!  This was a benefit I did not expect, and I look forward to continuing to improve that area of health with my continued treatment plan at ChiroOne!  There is not a day I leave Dr. Mark's clinic feeling anything but more educated and moving forward in my overall health.  In short (ha ha), I walked in with "fast food chiropractic" expectations, and what I got was something FAR greater and more beneficial to my long-term health.  Dr. Mark is a first rate D.C. and he is one of the most thorough chiropractors I've experienced.  I never feel like he's in a rush to get me adjusted and out.  He manages his time well enough that he can take time with me when I have a special concern or question.  I really value a doctor who makes me feel like I matter.  Long winded.....but I had to share with anyone who may be on the fence or are curious about chiropractic.  Dr. Mark is the bomb!

17.description: First off: No Chiropractor at Chiro One is a DOCTOR! They should correct every person who calls one of the adjusters a DR. It is misleading and inappropriate for anyone who received their degree from the "Cleveland Chiropratic school of LA" WHAT?! They do not go to medical school and are NOT doctors.Secondly: Chiro One is set up as a "cult". You MUST drink the "cool aid". You must commit. You must suspend any disbelief. Third: You CANNOT regenerate cartilage! So, the most that anyone with a degenerative condition, which produced or produces cartilage damage will NEVER be cured! Regardless, of whatever treatment program Chiro One tries to put you on there will always be pain. It just has to be managed the best way possible. In other words, the cult (Chiro One) wants you to believe that "if you have pain, you will be sick", and that they can EVENTUALLY cure your pain through continued treatments! That is Reverend "Jim Jones" talk! Don't drink the cool aid!....which brings me to my main point. I went to Chiro One because I wanted to see a Chiropractitioner, and I felt that the stretching and moderate workout would be a good way to start my day. After the first adjustment I felt GREAT. The "slipped disk" or whatever was repositioned. However, every adjustment after that was painful and a set-back. On many occasions, I could not make it in for an adjustment. Weeks would go by, and I felt perfectly fine. ...but then I would return for an adjustment. It would hurt and I would suffer lower back pain again. I spoke with the adjuster many times, who always told me that "sometimes the process of healing was painful" (paraphrase). On my last adjustment, I was feeling fine, no lower back pain at all. The adjuster (Dr. Mark) chastised me for not coming in 2-3 times a week, and because I was not there for two weeks. He hurt me during the adjustment that took place, while he was telling me "I should have dropped you from the program". It has taken me over three weeks to recover. I now feel good again, and will NEVER return.I wrote a negative review on the evaluation report and spoke to a person at the front desk who told me that I could fill out a form to have my upfront payment remaining balance refunded. I was skeptical because I had signed forms saying that, if I stop treatment my remaining money may not be returned, but I filled out the form, including a 2nd negative review, and stopped treatment.Three weeks later, I received a letter stating that I paid $500 (CASH) for 24 treatments but that I actually received over $3000.00 in "services", so none of my money will be refunded. That is like trying to return an item that you bought for $50, and being told that you received "service" from your cashier for over the purchase price, so you can't have a refund. In other words, Chiro One has NO right to claim that, even though I didn't pay $3k, I should have been charged 3K. I will to try and get my "records" from Chiro One but expect that they will NOT turn them over to me. If they do, they will not contain my complaint(s).I knew Chiro One was a scam from the start, but I wanted to see a Chiropractor to relieve my back pain, and get my blood flowing in the morning by stretching and doing some stair stepping. They helped me initially, but eventually the adjustments hurt, caused pain, and caused lower back pain that would last for weeks. I was not able to keep appointments because of work, and because I was feeling great. After suffering through painful adjustments and the aftermath, I really tried to make it in at least once a week. However, I was rudely chastised by Dr. Mark who said, that "he should have dropped me" while making an adjustment that was particularly painful. He might have done it intentially!? Three weeks later (without an adjustment) and I'm feeling perfectly fine!

15.description: I wish I could review the actual chiropractor sessions but I wasn't able to make it that far due to policies and "group" nature of this chiropractor. I gave only one star because I was turned away for being 8 minutes late and the enormous difficulty scheduling the initial consultation.I came across Chiro One at a health fair at my place of employment. The representatives were nice and were able to schedule appointments on the spot, giving priority to new clients which I though was a great idea. They did charge $20 for the consultation but it did include the x-rays. I went to my first visit and I was given a tour and had several tests done before meeting with the chiropractor. All the information and long introduction session seemed like a bit overkill. You get treated like the practice was just invented. I finally met with the Chiropractor who was very nice and pleasant to talk to. I did feel that the couple minutes spent with him were 10x more helpful than the previous hour. Of course I had to make another appointment to get "my results". Being a financial adviser and dancing in the evenings with a professional dance company (plus the holidays) I had no matching availability which was really frustrating. I ended up having to miss a rehearsal for an upcoming show...which was also frustrating for my dance company.Then I showed up to "results" session two weeks later (already...this is becoming ridiculously a long process). I called beforehand and confirmed the time. Unfortunately no one ever mentioned if you were late in anyway you would be turned away. I walked into the office and was immediately met with a disapproving glare from the male clerk. He told me that the group session already started....which I replied "so...". He said we would just have to reschedule. I stared at him for a second and stated "but I'm here now". I literally didn't have anymore availability till January and this guy was informing me I was not only wasting my time but the time I took off to be there. He then informed me "thats why its important to be on time".  I told him I was deeply frustrated but neither clerk offered any sympathy or alternative means to keep my appointment. Its like they have never heard of someone being late...8 minutes late.I can't say how frustrated I was. I had already put down money, they had billed my insurance for additional x-rays they needed and were holding all the information hostage. The front desk people were rude and didn't treat me as if I was an actual client that was paying them for a service.  Being grilled for being on time is not something I need from a service that I pay for. On top of everything I called to see how I could get my x-rays and informed them that I won't be returning. Chelsea, the other receptionist replied with "ok great"....

0.description: I have had back issues my whole life and finally decided to do something about it. During Market Days on North Halsted Street, I noticed a Chiro One booth and stopped to talk to them. I am so glad I did. Not only have I had decreased back pain, but my condition is noticeably improved. Dr. Mark is a great practitioner and really gets to know his patients and always has something interesting to have a conversation about. If you're looking for a great chiropractor, visit Dr. Mark at the Chiro One location on N. Clark Street. P.S. I have even gotten an inch taller! J/k

5.description: I just started seeing Dr Mark at Chiro One and so far I am extremely happy with the entire staff's performance, professionalism, and courtesy. I have felt welcome and taken care of by everyone I have worked with. They have also worked with my budget and my schedule to help me get the help my body so desperately needs. So far, a big thank you to everyone at Chiro One Andersonville. I can't wait to see growth and positive change from my treatment plan! Also, I wanted a holistic way of getting healthy and did NOT want any sort of medication or surgeries for my back, neck, knee and hip pain. Happy I am going the natural route for self-care! Thank you Dr Mark and staff!

11.description: My experience at Chiro-One has been a continuing awesome experience!a very loving, and friendly atmosphere with an awesome staff. The X-Rays of my spine & neck (before and after) speak for themselves, HUGE IMPROVEMENT!I feel GREAT, and my back feels stronger, and my body is communicating better than ever!Maybe chiropractic isn't for everyone, but for those who are willing to try it out will NOT BE DISAPPOINTED! Thank you SO MUCH Chiro One!

8.description: I became a client of the Andersonville Chiro One location when I moved to the Lincoln Square area and have nothing but praise for Dr Mark and his team.Consistently friendly,empathetic service,expert adjustments  and a great resource for ongoing health education. From a practical standpoint, a good sized parking lot which affords the rare opportunity of free parking in a busy area. Highly recommended.

4.description: I've been coming here for a month and I'm glad I made the choice to invest in chiropractic care with Dr. Mark and this practice. They have an open space design which at first was unnerving, but I appreciate it now that I've been coming. It makes it easy to engage in conversation with other patients and we even team up on the daily trivia questions they have. The staff are very friendly and inviting, and really add to the community feel. The best thing is that they are really willing to work with your budget whether that means payment plans or additional at home work to reduce in clinic costs. This alone has made a lasting positive impression on me and Dr. Mark's commitment to health.

14.description: I'm not reviewing the treatment received as I am not officially a client, however, I will cover the first initial visit and consultation.I found them through a community outreach event at Dominick's.  I knew nothing about chiropractic care, but I was experiencing some bodily discomfort, so I listened.  What they said sounded plausible as a treatment modality.  I'm also kind of a new-age-y type that eschews conventional medicine and they said it was only $20 for the consultation so I said, "what the hell...."(As I research different Chicago chiropractors, I find a lot of them do the first visit for free, wink, wink, nudge, nudge.)At my appointment, I was enthusiastically greeted by Chelsea.  She went over my paperwork and within 10 minutes began my battery of tests.  She explained everything as we went along (it sort of went in one ear and out the other, but it sounded good) and reviewed with me what concerns I had physically.  After those 10 minutes, she popped out and in popped Dr. Mark.  He reviewed her notes and then examined me for about 4 minutes.  Then it was on to the x-rays.  He showed immediate concern right after I did them, but he said he would discuss it with me in full at my consultation.  Scheduling worked out fine and I was off.At the consultation, I sat in a room with two other people and Dr. Mark spoke about the method and goals of chiropractic care versus traditional western medicine.  By this time, I had already read some books about this, so it seemed like he was preaching to the choir.  Then after a short wait, he called me in to speak privately about the results."Holy smokes," he exclaimed.Yeah, I'm pretty jacked up when I compared my results to what is considered an optimum musculoskeletal alignment.  He discussed what he would propose for treatment (3x/week for 12 weeks, then as needed for maintenance) and answered all of my questions satisfactorily.In the end, I told him that since I'm new to this field, I'd like to get a second opinion for comparison.  This is where he shined.  He said that I absolutely should go do that and that he will give me a copy of my x-rays on a flash drive to take to the next doctor to save me some money.Wow.So, that's it.  Super-friendly staff, knowledgeable, caring and accommodating doctor, good location, and easy scheduling.  If I become a patient, I'll update this to let you know how that goes, too.

6.description: Dr. Mark gave back my ability to walk straight again !  I walked in with an excruciating and debilitating back pain that hurt me with every step i took, and kept me up all night in pain. Although I was hesitant in science of healing behind chripractice, I preferred them over surgery. Although their original tour seemed a bit unnecessary, it became useful when I was there for almost 4 weeks, 4 times a week. I found Dr. Mark's ability to remove pain and heal me amazong. His staff patiently reviewed my insurance for coverage ( my primary physician didn't do it) and Dr. Mark, carefully advised me on his findings with options up to me. Of course the outcome was i could walk straight and without a limp after my first visit. AMAZING  work. By the way, I am father of two young kids and once again able to chase them around. Amazing work !

29.description: Fun place to go and have a drink and some great bar food. Cheese curds are great and all the burgers are worth trying. For dessert, the s'mores really are great at your table - just be prepared for the burner at your table. Of course, it is great that it is an SEC school except for the fact the owners are from Auburn. That's the only drawback I have found so far. ROLL TIDE!!

42.description: I stopped in one night for a drink on the way home from dinner with friends. Been going back ever since. The food is great and the drink selection  is large but it's the bartenders that make it a place to return to. On my second visit three weeks later , John , the manager brought me my favorite drink before I asked. He remembered my drink and my name. He sets the friendly tone for the whole place. He  makes you feel right at home. Meredith, is the other great bartender. She is so friendly and always makes an effort to chat even when it's busy. I've never been one to hang out in bars but they make you wanna do just that.

23.description: Mama like.I don't head to Andersonville often, but when I do I'm always surprised by how much I LIKE it here.  Loving Andersonville Brewing.  Swift service.  Pricing isn't offensive.  The apps are good.  I'm down.

47.description: I was very happy to hear that Hamburger Marys was taking over the Tomboy spot and making it into a sports oriented bar.  While there is much to chose from,  Andersonville lacked at that time a bar that had multiple TV's that were capable of playing multiple games.I have been there several times and have always enjoyed myself.  The staff has always been extremely hospitable and accommodating.  The crowd has always been enjoyable and very in to the games being shown.Just some pointers...it is a sports bar so there will be a large crowd for sporting events such as the Bears, Hawks, College Football, March Madness...I think you are getting my point.  Don't show up at 2:00 when the Bears started at Noon and 1. think you are going to get a seat and 2. think that you will be able to have a quiet afternoon.  Just cozy up to the nearest Grabowski you see, slam some beer and cheer on your favorite team.In my opinion it is a great addition to the neighborhood.

8.description: Mary's food without the hassle. Wound up on the trivia night, which was fun. Probably good beers, but I'm not a beer drinker, so don't trust me on those reviews. Food is wonderful bar food with some nice twists. Otherwise have a great time.

31.description: Checked out this place last night for trivia night and decide to have dinner while playing trivia. The trivia was great...the questions were challenging and fun and the pace was perfect. We couldn't say the same for the food. My husband and I both got the Guacamole BJ burger. We waited 40 minutes for our burgers to arrive, and when they did, we found them to be very uneventful. They were about as good as a typical burger you can get at a greasy spoon. The bun was the worst part though. It tasted like your run of the mill bun you can buy at the grocery store for a backyard barbecue. If you are going to offer a bunch of specialty burgers with unique ingredients, I think the bun should also be special in some way. Our waiter was very apologetic about the wait and brought us a free dessert which we appreciated. However, with all the great burgers in this city, I won't be choosing to go back there for one.

34.description: I really like coming to this place for a good beer, big burger, and some entertainment whether it's a tranny Bingo host, or a good football game on one of their 6 televisions.   Weekend afternoons tend to be a good time (save for a much anticipated football game), and they have $2 mimosas until 3pm.  The food is good, the service is usually good, and they have their own beer which is tasty and strong.  I prefer this more laid-back atmosphere than the dining room, and just can't get enough of their Guacamole B.J. Burger!

16.description: This review would reflect my third time in a "Mary's" facility, and as they say, Third Time is a Charm! My boyfriend and I went there on a Saturday night at midnight. Kitchen closes at 1 am so that really worked for our situation last night. The interior was nicely decorated sports bar- We loves their bottle cap table tops!We ordered a quesadilla and mini burgers! Quesadillas are such a simple appetizer but Mary's does it so right!! Also their brownie sundaes are super delicious! Our waitress Lori recommended putting caramel and graham crackers in it, do it!! Or customize it your own way!Service was phenomenal thanks to our waitress LORI. She was absolutely a delight: helpful, fun, and nice! It is refreshing to interact with someone who loves their job! You can tell through her service and attentiveness!  Next time you are at "Mary's" ask for LORI! You wont regret it! Loved her!

13.description: I went in with a friend to watch the Sunday Superbowl, the place was packed and cozy. Butt to butt here. With such a small space, it felt like I walked into a tiny coffee shop, not a bar. Also full of people who've never seen a minority before I'm guessing? lol. Everybody literally stared wide-eyed at me and my friend. That's how small the place is, and how weird the people there were. With no seats left and the weird vibe, we left immediately.

11.description: Mama like.I don't head to Andersonville often, but when I do I'm always surprised by how much I LIKE it here.  Loving Andersonville Brewing.  Swift service.  Pricing isn't offensive.  The apps are good.  I'm down.

39.description: This place blows, take your business elsewhere.

37.description: This is a cozy sports with a very warm and friendly environment.  Solid food and beer selection.   Angela the bartender is the best.

0.description: was there thursday night and i have to say im a fan. the beer was great, i had the 4 beer flight and i liked all of their beers. the atmosphere was chill. MY kind of place! the bartender (James I think was his name) was very nice and attentive, the waitresses were also very friendly, which is what i like in a brewery. cant wait to be back and try some more of the beers they have.

38.description: I enjoy coming to Mary's Rec Room. I usually go for Tuesday Trivias which is pretty great. $2 PBR's and compliments well with their $6 cheese curds. I like coming here for casual drinks with friends. We usually like to split their $16 cocktail pitchers. It's strong enough to give you a nice buzz just in case you want to head upstairs to Mary's Attic to dance. Their servers are great. I've never had a bad experience with their service. At one point we knew this one server by name but I don't think she works there anymore. She was great though. I recommend going to their Trivia night, the host is hilarious.

51.description: For a sports bar, I guess this is OK.  This was not one of my favorite places to hang out.  I came here after having dinner with some friends.  It seemed very loud, and it was very crowded, but that is what you have to expect for any bar on a Saturday night in Chicago.  The drinks were good, the bartenders very friendly.  I definitely enjoy Mary's Attic a little bit better, but if you like Sports bars and beer, then this is worth checking out.

27.description: Had to give Mary's a try, since I live close and had never been to a 'gay bar' before. Funny thing is Mary's doesn't feel any different from your typical sports bar, there just happens to be awesome 80s and 90s music videos playing instead of the game and gay couples instead of jocks populating the tables. I've been there twice now and our servers were both friendly, helpful, and quick. For drinks I have gotten Mary's punch which is everything I would want in a punch; fruity and filled with barely detectable vodka. Perfect. But then I also got a hot toddy which was disgusting. A friend of mine got a cucumber mojito which was tasty and refreshing!Our food has been hit or miss also. Everyone raves about their burgers but I wasn't thrilled with their menu selection or the burger I ended up with. Huge, greasy, and boring flavors. I've had much better burgers in the city. Their sweet potato fries are awesome though, super crispy without that cornstarchy taste.I'd love to come back to Mary's for more punch and a visit to the Attic

32.description: Great fun place. Trivia night on Tuesdays is always something to look forward to each week. Friendly atmosphere. Food is from Hamburger Mary's (next door) and has the same hours of food service. Drinks are fairly priced. Beer drafts are plenty but other drinks are limited. Otherwise, a great place.

48.description: I have to admit, I love this place. Maybe it's because its location and atmosphere bring my eclectic group of friends ranging in age from 23 to 43 together under one roof but there is more to it than that. Friday and Saturday nights the Rec Room can get crowded but the place is great for watching the game, with reasonably priced beer and some unique in-house brew selections. They also have some decent specials on mixed drinks here and there. Oh and all the perks of Mary's food! I love the Mary's Taco Wrap and the Mac 'n' Cheese bites. Salads are also fresh and hearty and the burgers... if you are a fan of Mary's that should hook you on the Rec Room's food as well! The wait staff is usually prompt and fun, even when busy they try their best to get to you as much as possible and keep good tabs on your drink levels. I have gotten the occasional hyperactive server, unfortunately to the point of annoyance a time or two during the week for dinner. Nice as could be but loud outbursts of crazy song and dance when there isn't more than 7 people in the bar can be annoying and distracting.
