And the strange "we're friends" buddy buddy chit chat can sometimes be a bit much, perhaps a few too many pixi-stix before work? People here are usually very friendly too, we've had people nice enough to move tables when our party suddenly grew beyond our expected number and during games there can be high fives all around and lots of friendly banter. Overall, great place for a yummy dinner or to catch a game and a bite to eat with friends!

44.description: I went to Mary's Rec Room a few weekends ago for some pre-birthday drinking.  Here's how it went:Things I don't remember:-our awesome bartender's name-she was the best!-other ingredients in the fantastic elderflower liquor cocktail she made me.Things I do remember:-aforementioned bartender had awesome (purple?) hair and had a great sense of humor while taking care of our lively group.-reasonably priced drinks and good beer specials.-the cucumber mojito was phenomenal.-a welcoming, laid back vibe with clean bathrooms.  In summation, this is a great extension of Hamburger Mary's next door and I'll definitely be back!

24.description: Ok seriously, loved, loved, loved this place so much.  Let's talk about the staff for a minute.  So, so friendly and happy and gay!!  And they fix a KILLER Mary's fruit punch!!  I would recommend the large!!  Also had a hamburger that was to die for in fact, I am craving one now.  This is one of my new favorite places!!

7.description: Stopped by Saturday afternoon for some beer flights. Casual, dimly lit, neighborhood bar. Our server seemed distracted and beer was just okay. Was in good company so that helped! Perhaps an off day at the establishment. There are lots of TVs with various sports games on.

49.description: The Rec Room has the same food as Mary's, but is a more chill place to have drinks. Super friendly staff and great drinks. The Berry Punch special on Friday is wonderful.A great addition to the neighborhood!

40.description: I love this place.  It's a casual place to go meet friends or casual dates for drinks.  I like the servers.  I like the food/drinks.  The environment is that of a sports bar with TVs and such, and if you like that, you will like this.

53.description: I'm surprised that this is only the second review of what seems like a pretty excellent establishment. I don't usually hang out in Andersonville, and I've never been to any of the other Mary's establishments, but this place was A+. I came here with some co-workers after our holiday party and we had an excellent time. The Mary's microbrews were great and decent'y priced, and the beer cocktails were an interesting addition to the drink menu. The bar had a nice relaxed vibe, and the staff was attentive and laid back. There seems to be a lot of potential to enjoy the hell out of this place on a game day and there's a pool table, which is always good. Definitely looking forward to coming back.

30.description: This review would reflect my third time in a "Mary's" facility, and as they say, Third Time is a Charm! My boyfriend and I went there on a Saturday night at midnight. Kitchen closes at 1 am so that really worked for our situation last night. The interior was nicely decorated sports bar- We loves their bottle cap table tops!We ordered a quesadilla and mini burgers! Quesadillas are such a simple appetizer but Mary's does it so right!! Also their brownie sundaes are super delicious! Our waitress Lori recommended putting caramel and graham crackers in it, do it!! Or customize it your own way!Service was phenomenal thanks to our waitress LORI. She was absolutely a delight: helpful, fun, and nice! It is refreshing to interact with someone who loves their job! You can tell through her service and attentiveness!  Next time you are at "Mary's" ask for LORI! You wont regret it! Loved her!

46.description: The Rec Room is more than a great place to grab a drink and eat a bite, either alone or with pals. Heck, even show up with a little Viking early in the evening and they're cool with it. I love the staff for that.If you're looking for a place to watch a game, grab a seat. If you're looking for a place to have a drink, grab a seat. Either way, they serve the same home brew and food as next door, just with a more sports bar feel, all without the frat house attitude.

1.description: Visited this place on Halloween. First thing to note, service was just awful. We were there for about an hour and our server only came to us twice, and didn't even check in with us when running to other tables. It wasn't too busy either. For the first time in my life I encouraged my group to leave some cash on the table to bail since the server wasn't interested in bringing our check.The first thing we were told was they were out of ginger beer and this was after a friend tried to order one of the drinks with ginger beer in it and no suggestion was made as a replacement. The server made us feel unwelcome the entire visit, not even giving us a "I'll be right back" or even spot checking to make sure we still had drinks left.On top of the poor service, the beer was just awful and made me sick. It was completely flat and had absolutely no flavor values except gross.And as a PS I was once a server at a sports bar so I'm familiar with the industry and bad days, but with how poor the beer was I will not be back unless I am checking out Hamburger Mary's.

9.description: They have some good in house beers my favorite of which is the marry hoppins, pale ale. They do seasonal brews and some rotations but they stick to four beers total that they brew themselves. They also have in house cocktails and the standard bar variety of everything else. They do serve food here and I havent tried their whole menu but their loaded ta-tas are amazing. It's basically nachos made with tater tots instead of tortilla chips.

26.description: Can someone tell me why this place has 4 stars?! I've been here a few times, the food is awful, the bartenders are total inattentive snobs, and the house beers are mediocre at best. It is a disappointment every time! Gave it one more chance tonight, ended up leaving without spending a dime since the bartender basically chose to completely ignore us, and they weren't busy at all.

25.description: Went here last night for a ladies night. Mixed drinks were tasty and nice size. The special was $2 off pints, with lots of options. LOVED the flights of their beer - all were interesting and tasty. Server was a little slow, but friendly and attentive. I'll be back for some more beers!

12.description: Yesterday was our second visit to Andersonville Brewing.  It will be our last.  Totally not impressed.  When you walk in the door, you are immediately met with a very stale, dirty bar smell.  Ick.No beer flights available yesterday.  They were out of one of the beers and when we asked if they could substitute a beer, we were told no and that "they" (whoever that is) don't like to substitute.  Okay.  Nothing like being at a place that brews their own beer and you can't sample.My boyfriend ordered the Hippity Hoppity IPA.  He loves IPAs and said it was the worst IPA he had ever had.  He thought there was a mistake because the IPA was super smoky tasting.  I tried it.  Definitely did not have the hoppy IPA characteristics.  I ordered the spicy bloody mary.  That was supposed to be a house speciality.  Worst bloody mary I have ever had.  Totally bland.  I thought our server was very nice and I felt bad that he was put in a position of having to tell the customers "no."  He was the only saving grace about our visit.  The rest--eh...won't be back.

21.description: First of all, the time on Yelp here says you open at 5am- fix that since you open at 5pm. Second- I called today asking for Andersonville Brewing and the lady says yes we are open now. My friends and I get to the door at 2pm and you are closed. I call again and find out that It's closed and Hamburger Mary's is open now- which I like but reAlly? My friends and I wanted to try the Brewing company. Fix your advertising and your customer service so customers don't have to question if you are open. Thank you Maryann

17.description: I am a proud M2F trans Latina and feel good here, despite competition.I like the sports on TV and the cute bartender.Soy una trans-latina orgullosa y siento bien aquí, a pesar de la competencia. Me gustan los deportes en la televisión y el barman lindo.

10.description: Sadly, I have to update my previously glowing review downward.  It's just not what it was.  The former Rec Room has been on a downward slide since changing to the new name.  The portion sizes of the food kept shrinking, and beers kept being out or unavailable.  The last straw for me was when I had a rancid glass of Gangster Ale.  I've enjoyed this beer many, many times, and I know what it should taste like.  The server said the brewer was trying to increase the size of their batches and was having trouble getting things right.  I understand not wanting to dump a batch of beer, but serving bad booze is just inexcusable.  If I hear they turn things around I'd try it again, but as it is I'll go elsewhere to watch games and eat some food.

5.description: I was excited to see this is affiliated with Hamburger Mary's. I came with a few people to get drinks and watch a football game. Our server was very personable and attentive. We ordered the Mary Tyler S'Mores and were really surprised when a tray with a mini fire and all the fixin's came out and we could roast our own marshmallows! Very cool experience.

3.description: Stopped in to try a few of their beers. The Frank Lloyd Rye was fine, but the Rye of Tiger was foul. I've never been served a craft beer before that was undrinkable, but this was undrinkable. They really need to work on quality control for their beer. The bartender was really nice though.

35.description: Interesting crowd, pretty busy on a Friday night, and they pour a strong cocktail!  I had a Basil/Cucumber martini that was the perfect refreshment on a hot July night in Chicago!  I would definitely return to try more of their cocktails, or one of their beers they brew in house.

19.description: Andersonville Brewing Company's bartenders really know their beer, and the service was fast and competent. I was surprised at how few people were present at the brewery, but it might have just been that most were in the Mary's portion of the establishment. I tried the Mary Hoppins APA, which was full flavored, a good balance of crisp yet musky. They have outdoor (sidewalk tables) seating both in front of the brewing company and on the Hamburger Mary's side. I will definitely go there again.

28.description: I like Mary's-- I forgive the mediocre food and inconsistent service because its fun and cheap. Made the mistake of coming to the rec room after dinner the other night when the game was on. It's such a pet peeve when bartenders stand watching the tv while you're waiting to order. And when he finally dragged himself away from tv he had an attitude with us like we were bothering him. Ugh, I'd rather have a Mimosa with a drag queen on the other side.

45.description: My favorite bartender in the whole world works at the Rec Room.  If you're ever waited on by John K., he makes the most delectable Old Fashioneds you'll ever imbibe, and he's the sweetest fellow in the world.  Ask him about otters -- You won't be disappointed.  (And you'll learn something!)Beyond that, it can get loud on game nights.  It's pretty much a sexy sports bar.  I'm fine with that, but I can see being surprised if you show up in the middle of a playoffs season not expecting it.  Also, Sunday nights are karaoke nights at the Attic upstairs.  Take that as you will.

33.description: My friends and I came here on Saturday for watch the footballs games and pretty much spent the entire day eating, drinking, screaming at the TVs and playing pool.  The game started around 3:30pm, so we were happy to discover there were plenty of tables to choose from.  Our server, who rocked the entire night, was helpful in putting two tables together for our group of 7 and made sure we always had drinks and food throughout the course of our stay here. We tried so many different things, since we were here for about 7 hours (insane, I know).Here's a list of everything we had:- Fried Pickle Spears - awesome, definitely get these!- Beer n' Cheese dip - also awesome, but order some extra pretzels or fries because there is so much dip!- Potato skins - I didn't eat these, but our friends loved them-Mary Burger - this is what I had and it was awesome, huge and juicy.  I got it with tatter tots, which were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside-Turkey Burger - my friend got this and loved it-Hawaiian Burger - a few of my friends got this and loved it.  The pineapple looked really good.- Breakfast Burger - someone else got this and literally ate the whole thing (as if that's possible with how huge these things are).  The egg was cooked perfectly and it was spilling over with cheese-All American Stuffed Burger - my fiance got this and was head over heels for it.  It's stuffed with cheese and bacon.  Pretty much a heart attack on a plate-Vanilla Milk Shake w/ Honey - someone ordered this and raved about it, it was huge and creamy.Beer!  They have a great selection of beer here.  I was all about their wheats in the bottle.  I wasn't a huge fan of their drafts, some of them seemed a little flat to me but perhaps it was just me.  Everyone was getting the draft, so its possible I was being picky.  I also had a bloody mary, which was really good, for those interested in something a little stronger than beer.The pool table is fun, but in a weird spot to play.  I felt bad disrupting the staff since its situated where they come out from the kitchen and near the wait station.  They never seemed annoyed, but I still felt bad.The staff was just super nice throughout the whole time here.  Our server was on top of everything and funny to hang out with.They also have a million high definition TVs, so if you want to see the game - this is a great place to watch.  And for anyone who gets sick of watching TV (like my lady friends and I were), we went for a walk in the hood and left the boys to their football.

43.description: Mary's is a great fun and crazy Enviroment and I love that.  If you are looking to chill out, the rec room is for you.  It has a sports vibe but you will not feel out of place is you are not watching the game.  You can also get the same food and drinks that Mary's serves next door.

2.description: This is more of a warning on the poutine...IT WAS DISGUSTING....never had it and sounds like you cant go wrong with fries, melted cheese curds and gravy BUT after eating some i had to vomit....the gravy tasted like it came from a can..over salty and metal taste to it....and the cheese curds all melted was just like eating a giant congealed blob of cheese that didn't break very easy...would have been better off just ordering fries and cheese curds separatelyOther than that i love Hamburger Mary's and the rec room...just no poutine for me anymore

18.description: Fun, friendly, awesome beers, stellar food. Just a great place to go for lunch or dinner.

41.description: Another solid five stars for this place. I'm a regular here every Sunday night with my Andersonville homegirls. I'm either chowing down a burger, or munching a salad at the bar, flanked by the usual suspects.Burgers: I can't get away from Buffy the Hamburger Slayer, it is too good. If I'm feeling lighter, a Cheeseburger Salad - Caesar salad with a couple of Blue Boy mini cheeseburgers. They brew their own beers - including a couple Gluten Free beers, and also pour a mean vodka tonic. The bartenders - John and Meredith, and the manager - Other Erika are FABULOUS! Friendly, hysterical, sassy, and hot. Super hot!And doesn't everyone end up here on their birthday sprawled on the pool table at 3 AM laughing hysterically? If you don't you should!

52.description: I don't know exactly why, but I'm really drawn to the Mary's places. They all have the same relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, I guess. I really liked the Rec Room. Their own beers are really good, and you can get a tasters flight for pretty cheap. The food menu is the same as Hamburger Mary's, but the tables are smaller and if you really want a full, sit-down meal just go next door. The cocktail menu is very interesting, my friend ordered and liked the Butter-beer, which was beer with butterscotch schnapps in it. It wasn't my thing but there are a lot of choices. I enjoyed the very strong and delicious Arnold Palmer. yum.

50.description: It's open later than In Fine Spirits?  I can't conjure much else positive about this bar.I only award the second star because they attempt (which is the operative term) to brew their own beer in-house.  However, I sampled two ales (the Mary Hoppins Pale Ale and the Peach Wheat), and I can honestly say that I've personally brewed mistakes better than each.They do have a pool table, and their ambience could be worse, but I haven't identified any sound reason to return.

4.description: I changed my mind. This place is actually pretty fun. I've been back a couple times and their apps are generally good. They have nice drink specials and a good atmosphere. It's a fun place to watch a game. The Ginger Rogers is a great cocktail. The Mac and cheese bites are tops. Give this place a try!

6.description: I found their beer just barely tolerable. I hate to say it, but I was not a fan.The few redeeming aspects of my evening out where the following:the bartender, she was attentive but not overly attentivethe location, it is centrally located between myself and my friend i went there withthe vodka martini

22.description: The server was rude and had something against my boyfriend right from the start. First we couldn't have our drinks from the Midsommarfest on the patio but the next couple was allowed to. Then the server had asked to hold our credit card bc people were dining and dashing so without a doubt we gave it to him but then realized people that came after us didn't get asked for their card. I work in the industry and I know how it is but seriously one of the worst experience I've ever had. Only reason they even get a star is bc of their beer samples. The poutine was not good.

15.description: I'm awarding this place 3 stars because of 3 reasons: great staff, yummy fries and $3 mimosas. Other than that, nothing special. I was extremely disappointed with their chicken & waffles.

20.description: I am a proud M2F trans Latina and feel good here, despite competition.I like the sports on TV and the cute bartender.Soy una trans-latina orgullosa y siento bien aquí, a pesar de la competencia. Me gustan los deportes en la televisión y el barman lindo.

36.description: typical bar food, good drinks, diverse crowd, and fun staff... for the most part.

14.description: Good place, nice, clean, friendly service, beer not the best, but good!, the most recomendable their blonde lager or some like that, fair prices, tolerable noise. Good place to watch sports lot of TVs. And the food It's good! The burguers awesome!

3.description: I came here for  a "Chef's Table" event thanks to The Local Tourist. I really had a great time. The food and drinks were perfectly paired. They have a wonderful, knowledgeable mixologist (try "Milk"; it was my favorite drink). We had amazing dishes ( the short ribs, the mushroom pasta, the bread pudding) and we laughed and drank and talked. The staff is super friendly. They are very welcoming and attentive. They were constantly making sure to clear our table and checked to make sure we had anything that we wanted or needed. We kept letting them take our silverware with each course and they were mindful to bring us new silverware with each new course. I honestly would not have ever noticed this place if not for The Local Tourist. I'm so glad that I was invited and that I was able to go. I am looking forward to going back again soon!!

1.description: Wow.  Random Thursday after work needing a drink.  I got more then a way to forget my day.First off, Thad was knowledgable on every question I asked and is a natural teacher of liquor.  Second, the seasonal old fashion was yummy and you need to get the Japanese Cold Drip Mai Tai is so interesting.  It was dripped through fermented limes.Giggity!!!!

0.description: We popped in here on Valentine's Day when Marty's was way, way, way too crowded. So glad we did, what a gem and a great addition to the neighborhood. Typical crowd of handsome men and pretty people, that's how we roll in A'ville.Vlad, the adorabs bartender took great care of us. We started with one of the custom Valentine's Day drinks, and they were great. "Roses are Red" and "Honey is Sweet" or something like that. Both were wonderful. After that, we went to our more typical Martinis. Me, Vodka martini and he a real martini with Gin. Both expertly prepared and delicious. Had a great time chatting with Vlad, the font of knowledge for all things booze-related. This is a bartender that loves his job, and I learned a few things (my beloved Kraken is not the best rum, not by a long shot!). We had a snack, the Brussels Sprouts, made in the adjacent Replay. While they were a bit underdone, I loved the taste and the mushroom sauce, so I'm a fan.Incredible fun custom cocktail menu, I'll definitely be back. Welcome to Andersonville!

2.description: I'll leave this bar to the lovely men in the neighborhood. If you're a female, your service will be disappointing and half-assed. I went in their with my wife and 3 of our female friends to celebrate a promotion and a building a purchase. We were thrilled to be together and celebrating our accomplishments in our neighborhood. We grabbed a table and ordered a bottle of wine and a couple craft cocktails. We waited over 15 minutes for our drinks and were ignored long after we had finished all our drinks. We wanted another round, but we decided to just go up to the bar and get our check and venture elsewhere so we could actually drink and have a good time.Needless to say, I won't be back. There are too many other bars in Andersonville that are welcoming and friendly.

5.description: I had the opportunity to attend this Past Wednesday, September 30th a private  event at elixir called "Angel's envy Bourbon dinner"Such a great experience considering the fact that it was also my first time at this elixir location.The evening was quiet lovely, the menu for the night very much exciting and tasty. The drinks absolutely to die for, and the experience overall defiantly made that Wednesday night fabulous. The Chef's work absolutely amazing, taking his time to greed everyone, explaining in simple detail what we were just about to taste. I remember everyone in my table expressing in between bits how delish everything was!The drinks... Well, we couldn't get enough. Too good! Very intimate atmosphere, not just for an event like this but definitely for a a casual night with friends or a date! Highly recommended.

6.description: Very nice atmosphere. Cozy bar but didn't feel crowded by other tables and the seats were comfy (had backs on them too) and the drinks were yummy. Only criticism is the choice of mint for mojito, tasted a little "weedy" instead of sweet mint and the mint wasn't muddled which is like mojito 101 but other than that were were impressed. A great alternative if Marty's is too full

7.description: We went in with no expectations (as one should do when visiting a new establishment), and we left having had a wonderful experience!  The food was so amazing!  We had a lovely gazpacho followed by crispy pork belly.  For dinner we had a perfectly cooked salmon, and we had cheesecake (a freaking enormous serving) with a caramel glaze for dessert.  The service was great, and Elixir's bar manager must be quite experienced, because the drinks were great.  I am somewhat of a beverage expert ;)  Overall, Elixir was great, and it will be on our list of regular haunts from now on!

8.description: The standard for a craft cocktail lounge. High quality mixology great service. So happy it's in my neighborhood.

9.description: I've been waiting for a place like this in Andersonville.   I started with brunch and enjoyed it so much that I came back two days later for dinner.

10.description: Great environment. Vlad is a great host. One problem: not having a sauvignon blanc from New Zealand Is a joke. No one drinks that crap from California.

4.description: Robyn, the owners of Elixir saw your review and responded!! Elixir now has two of the most beautiful womyn in Andersonville, and they are the PERFECT addition to this place! They're professional, efficient, and clearly knowledgable about the menu and cocktail selection. Now the service is as terrific as the drinks here!! BRAVO!!

58.description: After our initial bonding over Iowa City two years ago, I haven't gone to anyone else but Chris. He always listens to what I'm looking for, while giving suggestions that may make the style better. Free bang trims as well. The salon itself is great. Everyone's extremely friendly and with complimentary wine, what's not to like?

56.description: Wonderful! Best hair cut I've had..ever I think.  I called from across the street hoping to get an appointment, as I woke up realizing I hadn't had a cut in 8 months. Jim gave me an amazing cut and blow dry that lasted for three days. He was very friendly and funny and put me at ease, and I'm sure the wine didn't hurt either ( and they were quite generous with the pours)The salon was really nice, but also laid back and comfortable. I'll definitely be back

29.description: I don't know why it's taken me so long to write a review, but it really needs to be done.  I have been getting my hair done from Carmelo for 6 years. I even followed him to Restoration from another salon. I love to try new cuts and colors and he knows exactly what I want, when I didn't even know I wanted it yet. Every time he does my hair is better than the next. My husband laughs at me because I come home and say "This is my favorite haircut ever" then I say it again the next time. My friends go to him now, which is awesome. It's also great that he's at Restoration, I really like going there. Everyone is really friendly and goes above and beyond to make you feel good.

42.description: i only come here for Daniel, my sister brought me to him two years ago and i'll never go to anyone else.He understands our crazy thick hair and does wonders!I really like this salon, its cozy and pretty inside, everyone is really friendly and they offer you a drink when you come in! i'm not a big wine person (yet) i tried my sisters white wine and it was soo good, i got one for myself.I also love the products they use, they smell good and make my hair feel soft and shiny. it's awesome.oh by the way, they have a small parking lot in the back where you can park for freeeeee!

23.description: I came back for my second cut with Chris to keep up my style. This time we went shorter, thinned out a lot of hair for a lighter, summer look and went more extreme with layers and bangs. I cannot tell you how many compliments I have received on my new do! I work at a job where I see a lot of people on a reoccurring basis so they walk in and go "Oh my gosh I love your new hair cut!" and gush on and on and so forth. It's a great feeling. I look hot. Or at least my hair does. I love Chris! I can't wait for another few weeks to get everything freshened up. Plus he is super sweet and funny.

47.description: This salon is amazing. Super reasonably priced and every time I leave feeling like a queen. Jim is a hair god period.He is the only person I will let color my hair. I love his highlighting technique. It never looks overdone just super natural and pretty. My husband makes me go to the salon, since he knows how happy I am when I see Jim the miracle worker :)He also does the best blowout in the city. Think celebrity/sex kitten hair,full of volume and sexy movement that last  for days. Or at least until your next yoga class ;)Love, love Restoration

8.description: I had my first cut at Restoration about a week ago with Romy. My hair was below my shoulders and I wanted to go to a chin-length bob. Romy was very thorough. She gave a great shampoo, neck and head massage. She was very careful and precise with my cut. And she was great to talk to.I noticed after my first shampoo at home that my hair was falling funny. Romy had given me a blunt bob and to no fault of her own (I have VERY thick hair), it felt really heavy and awkward. So, I called the studio to ask what could be done. Colleen was so understanding and made me a follow up appointment with Romy the next day. I asked if it would cost anything and she said, "of course not! if you're not happy, we'll take a look at it and fix it." Wow - I've never had such great customer service from a salon.Today I went back and told Romy how I was feeling about it. She was so sweet about the whole thing. She spent another hour flat ironing my hair and giving me layers. I thanked her at the end of the appointment and she said, "of course! it's my job!"I'm much more happy with this style. Above everything else, no one ever made me feel bad or awkward for wanting something different and they didn't charge me at all, though I gave her a tip.I will definitely be back! Thanks, Romy!

31.description: My first time at Restration salon. Romy took care of me. She did excellent job. I love my new short hair style. I definitely go back.

34.description: I have a love/hate relationship with Chris at Restoration.  Love: His color is insane.  He's so wickedly talented.  He's fixed horrendous color, taken me from dark brown to super light blonde and back again, and given me fantastic highlights.  Hate:  NO ONE NOTICES WHEN I GET MY HAIR DONE BECAUSE IT LOOKS SO FREAKING NATURAL.  Seriously.  When I get highlights, people ask me if I just returned from vacation.  When I go super blonde (after having super dark hair), people don't say a word because it looks like it's always been this way.  It's the craziest thing and also a testament to how fantastic Chris is.  (Okay, okay, it's just the narcissist side of me that wants to be noticed, but really this quality could filed under "love"...)Chris rocks.  The fact they hand you a glass of wine when you walk in rocks.  The location rocks.  The fact that I leave feeling like a million bucks rocks.  MY HAIR ROCKS.

16.description: i only come here for Daniel, my sister brought me to him two years ago and i'll never go to anyone else.He understands our crazy thick hair and does wonders!I really like this salon, its cozy and pretty inside, everyone is really friendly and they offer you a drink when you come in! i'm not a big wine person (yet) i tried my sisters white wine and it was soo good, i got one for myself.I also love the products they use, they smell good and make my hair feel soft and shiny. it's awesome.oh by the way, they have a small parking lot in the back where you can park for freeeeee!

13.description: By the time I made it to this place, I was starting to get discouraged on my hairstylist hunt.  It had been several months and I'd already been to three other places, with varying results.  None had been disasters, though, and with the memory of my fantastic Arizona stylist and our amazing chemistry fading fast, I was beginning to wonder if I was simply being too picky.  Maybe I should just pick a place and settle down, and not worry so much about finding The One?I found myself hoping hard that I would click here.  The decor was a nifty combination of chic and class - great exposed brick and vintage-looking fixtures and carved-wood-frame mirrors.  The girl who cut my hair (and I'm kicking myself - I lost her card and honestly can't remember her name, she was slight and had longish red hair) chatted pleasantly with me as she touched up my pixie cut, giving it some pretty layers in the process.  It was a perfectly nice time, she did a perfectly fine job, and I had no complaints.But...no spark.  There wasn't that *zing* of shared artistic vision and common purpose.  And discouraged as I was, I'm even more ridiculously picky - so ultimately I decided to go elsewhere.  Still, that was no fault of hers, or the salon's.  I would absolutely recommend trying this place if you're chair-hopping in the area.

11.description: Very expensive $210 Carol Brady haircut, very disappointed

39.description: Chris lived up to all of his great reviews!  My 17 year old son has very fine hair (like me), and we have ALWAYS had a hard time getting a good haircut for him.  He was changing styles this time, and Chris listened to him and then gave him a FABULOUS haircut.  I may even try going to him myself.Definitely worth the $50 price tag.

37.description: Best haircut in 7 years!Nicci was my hairstylist back when she worked at fuga. I moved away for school and  we lost touch, but I never forgot about her. Many haircuts later no one has ever managed to make me feel like a million dollars. I finally moved back to Chicago and a few so so haircuts later I decided I needed to find her. thank goodness for yelp and google. My awesome or creepy spy skills found her at restoration salon. I got in very quickly on a friday afternoon. Again I got the best haircut ever, my coarse dull curly hair transformed into the most sexy shag that styles in 15 minutes. I feel great and beautiful. I truly feel she knows what she is doing. I highly recommend. This is the cut I got. beautyriot.com/celebriti…

0.description: Tim is so talented and friendly!! I love the way he colored my hair. My girlfriend said my highlights made my hair look the best she's ever seen it! He blends the colors so well. My color is shades lighter but looks so natural. Tim is so easy to talk to and hilarious. Also, they offer you wine?!  hell yes! Look beautiful and get tipsy doing it!?I will return!

38.description: I go to Chris and he is AWESOME!  I have been going there for about 3 years now and adore him.  He does everything for me from styling to highlighting to cuts.  And I do love that I get to sit and have a glass of wine while I am getting my hair done! :)  Highly recommend the salon and Chris to anyone!

51.description: Mirror Mirror...Every time I look into the mirror, I sing the praises of Daniel...the only person I let touch my hair.  Great job every time.  No question about it.Some guys can't fathom paying more than $12 for a  haircut.  So for you guys...just stick to Great Clips.  You look fine and they're doing a great job.  For everyone else willing to spend $40++ on a haircut that everyone will compliment you on...head over to Restoration.(Note: the free glass of wine had no affect on the star rating of this review.)

27.description: Rachel cut my hair. She had to clean up a real mess that someone had made of my hair and she did a great job. She was much too hard on herself - my hair looks really good!  She cleaned up the mess as best as possible. I would definitely return to Rachel for a haircut.

32.description: Niccii has saved my life.  I walked in a hot mess 5 years ago with self dyed hair.  She never made me feel bad about it and has nurtured my hair back to a great cut and color.  I really felt like she listened to what I wanted and shared what would look best for my hair type.  Love that they always remember me, call me with a reminder apt, and serve wine. It is a great place and she has it going on.

54.description: I went back against my better judgment, and now I regret it.  I did get a great haircut, but the colorist did not do a satisfactory job and I ended up having to go back a few days later to get it corrected.  Not once did I ever receive an apology for the inconvenience.  Also, this was a colorist who charges $100 for a single-process color, which I find ridiculous unless you are one of the top colorists at your salon (which she clearly was not).  I would have also appreciated knowing that it was going to be $100 while booking, but oh well.  Never going back.  Red 7 Salon is the place for me!!!

48.description: Love my Daniel.  He not only listens to what you want, but also uses his creative license to make your 'do even better.  Plus he's fun to talk to.  All around an incredible experience.  I highly recommend him.  :)

44.description: Went to Carmelo last week for a men's cut.  Offered wine or water, then discussed the haircut. I gave a general outline but really have no idea.  Then he washed my hair - the shampoo smelled extremely good.  I would like to find out what they use.  He took his time, looked at my face and head from all angles, noticed my collics and the way my hair falls.  Every snip was deliberateIt was a bit shorter than what I had in mind, but after a week I can tell it was a really quality cut.  I dont have to do anything to it and it falls very nicely.   The most competent stylist I have been to.  I'll be going back.

24.description: I'm always willing to follow a great stylist and this time was no different...I'm so happy I was able to get in touch with Samuel after he left Tou Jours and thank god I did...as usual, the balayage ( color placement technique that gives a natural highlight effect) looked amazing after he was done...and Restoration definitely has a great ambience to it...:-)

7.description: Sam is the bomb! Can't drink yet because I'm pregnant but love the offer of wine during a hair service. Finally a hair stylist that took control when I told him I didn't know what to do. My cut was gorgeous and my ballayge was perfection! Will be sending my Husband to Sam too. Sam is pricey but absolutely worth it and a pleasure to talk to.

49.description: This review is for Dennis Neva:He is great! I'm so happy to have found him. He fixed my f'd up hair from a previous place, and did it with ease! Dennis did both my cut (a little longer than shoulder length with layers) and color (from light brown to golden highlights). Dennis was funny, professional, and quick! He was done with my cut and full highlight in less than 2 hours! He did an awesome job and I will be back to see him again for sure.

40.description: I love Carmelo! He makes me feel like a rock star every time I get my hair done. At Restoration they serve you wine, water or tea and everyone act genuinely excited to see you. I don't need my stylist to be my bff but with Carmelo I can tell he really cares about me and cares how happy I am with my hair. We day dream out loud the whole time about all the future hair styles I could rock and I leave feeling like a hot celebrity. If you want someone to make you feel like a sexy hair model, go meet Carmelo. He loves hair and is on the cutting edge (pun intended) of hair fashion!

53.description: I walked into Restoration last year on a whim. Christopha gave me a great cut and blowout and I haven't been to another salon since. One year later, he's done great color and even some just right highlights that last forever. And now Jim has cut my sons' hair a few times and they're so pleased with the results they refuse to go back to the barber with dad!

30.description: So happy to have finally found my go to hairstylist in Chicago! After many disappointing experiences at other salons I came to Christopha; not only nervous but with a big chunk cut out of my hair due to a recent gum incident. Don't ask. Chris made me feel comfortable, asked what I was looking for, and seemed to know exactly what my hair needed. He was also the first hairstylist I've had that actually taught me how to style my hair the right way to take advantage of my natural waves. He also gave me a small sample of a product so I could try it out at home before buying it. How nice is that?!

46.description: I love Jim Cains. Period. And I don't mind telling you, it was in fact love at first cut. You know when your beloved hairdresser moves and you think you'll never recover?Well, after losing my stylist of the last 4 years to LA I rolled the dice and found Jim. It really can happen again.First-the hair. He took the time to listen to what I wanted and went above and beyond. I have fine, straight hair so one wrong cut and I'm in hair hell. I wanted something easy, breezy while still having fun growing my hair longer and that is exactly what he created for me! He had great suggestions for how to care for my hair that weren't high maintenance and I came out feeling fabulous!Second-Jim. He's friendly and funny and makes the time in the salon fly by. He just takes good care of you all around. I couldn't be happier. I'm in hair heaven once again!

1.description: Had a fantastic experience with Restoration Salon in Andersonville yesterday! Romy was a wonderful stylist and I can't wait to go back for my next appointment in December. My hair looks GREAT!! :)**I also wanted to shout-out the receptionist who booked me (sorry I don't remember her name)...I called Restoration around 1 and said, "I'm sorry, I know this is totally last minute...do you have any walk-in availability this afternoon?" Restoration was kind, the receptionist looked thoughtfully through the books, and I got very lucky despite trying to jump in on a Saturday afternoon. What Restoration did SO right was a blessing because I had called another Andersonville salon right before and was rudely told, "ummmmmmmmmmmm yeaaaaaaah, we dooooooon't..." without any hint of empathy or an offer to book at another time. The whole appointment at Restoration was fate and I'm thrilled I've found my new neighborhood spot. I'll definitely be sharing with my friends. Woohoo!

55.description: This is a great salon - service, decor and most importantly cut is fantastic! Don't walk, RUN to make an appointment with Tim Weber!

9.description: Walking in for my appointment, I was offered a glass of wine. If it was later in the day, I just might've taken them up on their offer. My appointment was made with Romy. It was well over a year since my last cut. There wasn't much style. I had made the appointment before I knew exactly what I wanted done. I still wasn't sure when I got there. I told Romy that I wanted the split ends cut and then some layers of some sort to give my hair more style. After that I let her roll with it. And roll with it she did. Right near the end, she asked about my opinion on bangs. Having not had bangs since I was little, we went with a slight swooping bang I can tuck behind my ear. Overall the experience was really good. Highly recommend going. The shampoo was fantastic/relaxing. And the decor was very cool.

26.description: I'm not one to usually leave reviews unless I absolutely love something. All I can say is that Romy did an amazing job. She was not only very professional but very attentive and really listened to the look I was going for. The staff is very friendly and the location can't be beat. I will definitely be coming back again!!

25.description: By the time I made it to this place, I was starting to get discouraged on my hairstylist hunt.  It had been several months and I'd already been to three other places, with varying results.  None had been disasters, though, and with the memory of my fantastic Arizona stylist and our amazing chemistry fading fast, I was beginning to wonder if I was simply being too picky.  Maybe I should just pick a place and settle down, and not worry so much about finding The One?I found myself hoping hard that I would click here.  The decor was a nifty combination of chic and class - great exposed brick and vintage-looking fixtures and carved-wood-frame mirrors.  The girl who cut my hair (and I'm kicking myself - I lost her card and honestly can't remember her name, she was slight and had longish red hair) chatted pleasantly with me as she touched up my pixie cut, giving it some pretty layers in the process.  It was a perfectly nice time, she did a perfectly fine job, and I had no complaints.But...no spark.  There wasn't that *zing* of shared artistic vision and common purpose.  And discouraged as I was, I'm even more ridiculously picky - so ultimately I decided to go elsewhere.  Still, that was no fault of hers, or the salon's.  I would absolutely recommend trying this place if you're chair-hopping in the area.

12.description: I came back for my second cut with Chris to keep up my style. This time we went shorter, thinned out a lot of hair for a lighter, summer look and went more extreme with layers and bangs. I cannot tell you how many compliments I have received on my new do! I work at a job where I see a lot of people on a reoccurring basis so they walk in and go "Oh my gosh I love your new hair cut!" and gush on and on and so forth. It's a great feeling. I look hot. Or at least my hair does. I love Chris! I can't wait for another few weeks to get everything freshened up. Plus he is super sweet and funny.

59.description: I'm relatively new to the neighborhood, and have been struggling to find a new stylist since I arrived. Four months ago, I got a cut in the salon down the street, and was horrified at how short my hair was when I left. It's just now gotten to the point where it's too long to work with.I went to Restoration's website yesterday, and got an appointment this morning, which was pretty surprising. I walked in, and Jim greeted me at the door. He seemed friendly and professional, listening very closely when I explained to him how I wanted it to look. He immediately put me at ease.I have very thick hair (read: takes forever to thin to the point where it's manageable). Jim took his time, checked with me often to see if the length was going where I wanted it, and made me feel very comfortable - I'm not generally a high-maintenance person, but it's been so long since I had a great haircut that I was probably visibly worried. He was great. When he finished, I was stunned. This is the best cut I have had in years (even though I've been a regular at several high-end salons). I will be back without a doubt.Also worth mentioning - the atmosphere at Restoration is fabulous. It's a beautiful shop, the music was a blend of great mellow trip hop, and everyone was exceedingly friendly. I also fell in love with the Moroccan Oil treatment Jim used. It put a great shine on my hair, and smells amazing. I bought a small bottle to try for myself - it may well replace the Aveda product I've been using for years.Prices aren't cheap, but in this case, you truly get what you pay for. Well worth the cost!

21.description: My experience with Samuel at Restoration Salon was wonderful. I had the Liscio Straightening Treatment which turned out beautifully sleek and smooth. This was my second treatment by Samuel and both times I was beyond happy with the results. For someone who has frizzy, curly hair this treatment is a miracle and huge time-saver on styling. I have been getting this treatment for over 10 years and honestly the results have been the best with Samuel. That speaks for his attention to detail and perfected skill to carry out every step as it should be. I followed Samuel to Restoration Salon because he is an amazing hair stylist. I am moving to Omaha but I will still fly to Chicago every 6 months so that I can receive the Liscio Treatment by Samuel. That should speak for itself!

17.description: I have had the same stylist Samuel for over 5 years now and I plan on him doing my hair when I am needing curlers in the nursing home. He is just that wonderful. I have always been complimented on my hair. Especially recently, when I decided to cut over a foot off to donate to Locks of Love. That was a HUGE step for me and I couldn't have loved the results more. I also recently had to spend a month in the hospital (long story) but he visited often and even painted my nails, so I would still be looking my best in ICU. Even though he started off as just my stylist, he quickly became a wonderful friend because he is just an awesome person and I am so lucky to have him in my life. I will always look pretty and have an amazing friend in Samuel and that makes me feel all warm and fuzzy. Quick FYI- He only does women's hair and he is a balayage specialist. You MUST try balayage highlights. They make your hair look naturally kissed from the sun. Just say no to foil!

10.description: A great experience from the moment my husband and I walked in the door!!! We felt very welcomed. We walked in without an appointment on a Friday afternoon. I had read here some reviews here on yelp about Romy, and I wanted to ask for her. To my surprise, she was available for both my husband and me. I have very short wavy hair and am in the process of growing it out to a longer short style. It definitely needed some work.  Romy did something no other stylist has ever done before. After talking to me, she washed my hair and dried it to really understand my hair before cutting it. She did the same for my husband who has curly hair. We both left feeling like we were on the Red Carpet, as we both liked our cuts so much. Romy is super attentive to every detail of your hair, and she makes sure you leave perfectly happy. I also learned from her that I have not been using the right kind of brush on my hair...well with super short hair I never needed one. I also liked that she was not pushy trying to sell you any products. She showed me what she was using with my hair, and at checkout, my husband and I asked for the products on our own. When your hair comes out looking like out did, no words to sell need to be spoken.  She has gotten herself two more clients!!!

5.description: I moved to the area last year and have had the most terrible experiences with my hair. I have been salon hopping in the area and no one has gotten my hair color remotely close to what it has been and the hair cuts have been just "mehh" at best of not totally screwed up. And believe me I am not a difficult client, I have short dark dark brown almost black hair. The past 3 salons have colored my hair either an ash blonde or an auburn, and my hair is only short bc of all the bad haircuts I have received. Well yesterday I decided to call Restoration, last minute of course. Everything from the phone call until the minute I walked out of the salon has been an amazing experience. Colleen, the receptionist was so accommodating and booked me in for probably more time than needed because I had no idea what they would need to do to fix my hair. She was so pleasant it made me more comfortable when going in because I was still so nervous that I may have yet another bad experience. I booked my appointment for the same day with Samuel. And Oh my Gosh I am so glad I did! He is fabulous! He did exactly what I needed and what I asked him to do. He made me feel so comfortable and told me what needed to be done to fix my hair in order for me to grow it out again. I could not stop smiling when he finished. My hair is the exact color I have been wanting it to be for the past year and my haircut is short bouncy sassy and just amazing. Before I was constantly wearing my hair up because I was so embarrassed by how hideous but when I woke up this morning it still look so good! I even booked my next appointment! The only thing I regret is wasting so much time with other salons when I should've come here in the first place!!! Don't make the same mistake, if you want amazing hair go see Samuel before you ruin it somewhere else. P.s. Prices are average for the amazing work that everyone here does. I have been to salons that charge way more and have gotten crappy results.

3.description: The staff is amazingly attentive... and friendly... but the quality is not that great for the price. To echo other reviewers - there is better quality out there. I have been going mostly for convenience, but the balayage here is just ok.

35.description: I asked for a very basic trim with some slight layering.  The trim included the use of an electric razor (?), and the layering I asked for was denied as she didn't think it was necessary (wrong), and way more was cut off the length than I had asked . After I washed and styled it myself a few days later, I noticed a bunch of scraggly hair in the back that needed to be trimmed off, so I called the next Saturday and asked if I could come in and get a some tweaking done but was told the stylist was booked up but I could come in the following Tuesday.  Really?  I spent close to $80 on a hair cut and that's the customer service they provide?  I'm intentionally not mentioning who cut my hair by name because (a) I hate to directly effect someone's reputation and she was very nice, (b) I think the problem is more about the way Tim Weber's salons are managed (I read a very similar review about his Lincoln Park location).  I really believe he needs to adjust the pricing for the skill level and, more importantly, consider putting the customers' overall satisfaction above the stylists who work at his salons.

19.description: This place is amazing super friendly staff, great prices !! Always will squeeze you in and the sell my favorite, Kevin Murphy. But my stylist left so sad

28.description: Romy is the best! I love what she does with color and with my curly hair. My son also would rather wait for an appt with Romy than trust another stylist. He has had so many bad haircuts from other stylists just for wanting to get a hip style.I also love the salon. They always make you feel welcomed!

As my partner and I left the store, bag in hand smile on our faces I noticed my gym teacher across the street! What a fun filled day.

8.description: In Mid-October, I ventured into this store location with my friend who was visiting from out of town.  She is an "adventurous" girl, and expressed to me her desire to go to a "really good sex shop" where she could stock up on some items before her road trip with her boyfriend.   I believe the person working that day was named Lauren and she was absolutely helpful.  She was not uncomfortable with our questions, she had personal recommendations, looked up questions she did not know the answer to (which was one), and helped make the experience pleasant and normal, however deviant it may be to shop at Tulip.       This is a great location.

3.description: The new beau took me here for a little birthday surprise.  While I enjoy a people watching trip to the sleazy joints off the highway in Wisconsin, when it comes to buying, I'd prefer the gentle environs of a store where I won't be ogled by dirty old men, leering at me over the sticky pages of dime store novels with titles like "Corporate Slut."  Tulip had a nice little selection of toys, books, dvds, and other goodies for straight boys and girls, gay boys and girls, and all the people who fall somewhere else on the sex spectrum.  There were some futuristic vibrators that were way too expensive, but seemed like the space age answer to evenings of lonely boredom.  Oh Santa....I found some birthday goodies, and the sales guy was extremely helpful, personable, and not at all shy.  I wish they had a larger selection of sexy undies, but we can't have it all.

14.description: To be clear I do recommend checking out Tulip.Over the last 2 years I came to dislike going into Tulip. I'm a guy and being there, even with my girlfriend, I  frequently felt unwelcome. Hey, even I can enjoy the right thing in a good place sometimes, right? The staff used to be (except once) rather unhelpful and not particularly nice.Maybe it's the summer weather, but over the last few days they have been wonderful. My girlfriend and I finally picked up a bigger item we've been looking at for a while. When I asked about a dildo in the 1/2 price bin I was informed it was $23. The next day when I went back? $35. I mentioned this to the (different) salesperson and she changed the price back, no hassle or anything. Thank you!I've had issues with their slightly pricier fare, and the staff sometimes seems aloof (which can actually be good at times). However, their approachable attitude lately is sure to bring more people around. We felt comfy enough to flip through some "experimental" books, try the lube, and have a smile together. We finally felt comfortable with our neighborhood sex shop and to these customers that's the most important thing, so your mileage may vary.Overall: Thanks for the great experience!

58.description: I went to get my hair cut at the last minute and I am SO glad I ended up here. It's a sweet little space in Andersonville, the staff are really friendly, and I love my haircut.I went for a BIG chop, and Ken was great! Finally - a stylist who can cut hair to look good both curly AND straight.  I had some ideas, he had some suggestions, too, and I'm thrilled with the results.  A side note: my scalp massage during the shampoo was sooooo relaxing, the products had lovely scents, and I felt great about the whole experience.  The price ($45) is just a plus - it's hard to find personal, professional service for reasonable rates, and Salon 10 definitely met all my expectations for a salon-quality haircut with a little luxury, too.  Highly recommended!

56.description: After reading so many raving reviews on here and in desperate need of a new stylist, I decided to check Salon 10 out and was VERY happy. I was set up with Jennifer, the owner, who is not only very knowledgeable but also very warm and friendly. The whole session started with a luxurious hair wash complete with a soothing head massage. I was in heaven! That alone was worth the $45 price. But then Jennifer took the time to discuss my hair with me and exactly what I was going for. She also gave me tips on how to blow it dry and style it. I will definitely be back!

29.description: I received two hair cuts and one color at this salon. The first cut was a B and the second was a D-. I asked for about an inch off and received over 3 inches off in some areas. Stylist was punctual and friendly, but it doesn't make up for the cut. Receptionist was friendly too. Also, there is a very strong scent of cigarette smoke, which I find nauseating.

42.description: I went in here on my way home one day and decided on a whim to get bangs (I've done this before). I said I'd like thick, long bangs that curve at the cheeckbones, and left with straight, short, thin bangs. I went to my regular stylist days later and he fixed them for free...that'll teach me to ever cheat on my normal guy. I'm just speaking on one experience, and I will say that the people were very nice and accomodating offering to take my jacket and offered a selection of beverages. I may try them for another service one day. 2 stars to match "Meh, I've experienced better" but perhaps a little better than that, yet not quite "A-OK"

23.description: Book with Jennifer, the salon's owner!  You will get a celebrity style that you can re-create at home (she'll show you how to fix it).  She'll tell you how to color and/or repair your hair so you look your best.     And you pay a reasonable price.

47.description: I have been a client of Fred's for over four years and I just can't go to anyone else.  Before I went to Fred I didn't know what to do with my fine and straight hair.  Needless to say Fred was able to transform my hair and now it never looks dull and boring.  He is not only great at what he does but he is an awesome person.  I love getting my hair cut by Fred and would never go to anyone else!

8.description: I really can't say enough good things about this place. I have been going to Salon 10 for a few years and have never been disappointed.I live in Andersonville and, of course, love to support any local business. However, Jennifer and the gang make it SO easy. From the receptionists to the stylists, they just couldn't be nicer.When you walk in, they'll take your coat and offer you a drink. You can get a cut by Fred, Ken or Jennifer (the owner). Jennifer is my gal, but I've heard wonderful things about all 3 of them. You know the kind of hair salons you see in the movies where they remember your name and where the stylists are great conversationalists? This is that place! I actually look forward to getting my hair cut and highlighted. Not to mention, I get TONS of compliments on my hair all the time.Oh, and you just wait for the shampoo. You'll get the best head massage you've EVER had. The only problem with this place is trying not to fall asleep from being too relaxed. My only hesitation in giving 5 stars is revealing a place that is such a great secret.

31.description: I had my first appointment with Vicky today and am a new devotee.  I divide my time between San Francisco (land of BAD $200 haircuts - stay away!) and Chicago, and will now time my haircuts to coincide with Chicago travel, just so I can see Vicky.  She's THAT good.  The situation was as such: On September 5, I went to an Aveda Institute in San Francisco for low lights and highlights (any why does spell check make "low lights" two words while "highlights" is one?).  My color has held and looks good, but my ash blonde roots were starting to show a little.  They blended OK, but *I* could see them, so nothing else mattered.I made an appointment at Salon 10 on a whim for cut and color, but later canceled my color appointment because I just didn't know what to do with those barely there roots.  How do you get roots to match the rest of your hair that is two color without forking over $100+ just for highlights?  I couldn't figure it out so I kept the cut appointment and canceled the color.I saw Vicky, explained what I wanted after past San Francisco trauma (which was one full year of growing out hair that a crazy lady chopped down to literally 2" in some places and got all razor happy with so I looked like I was going through chemo).  Vicky listened, looked at a combination photos and seemingly READ MY MIND.  My cut is PERFECT - and it was $36 because I went on Sunday!  I felt BAD for paying so little for the most amazing haircut ever!  Vicky also noticed my roots and said she could do a "kiss" of touch-up color that would take about 10 minutes, and make it match the rest of my hair.  She did!  And it ALL BLENDS.  I do NOT know how she did it, but she did.  She's a godsend.  I didn't even have a color appointment and she just worked in 10 minutes of root work, even after I'd been all flaky and uncertain and canceled a prior color appointment.Grand total: $86 ($50 for color and $36 for the haircut).  I've been going to beauty schools since my traumatic experience and have been paying about $50, but I will GLADLY pay a piddly $36 more for this kind of quality.  And salons are SO much faster than beauty schools - I saved two hours by going here instead.Bonuses: Vicky did a great blow out that didn't take an hour.  I get SO impatient during blow dry sessions!  The shampoo (both of them) were wonderful with great scalp massage and I was kept well stocked with cinnamon tea.  All of this in a place that is super nice without being over-the-top hip and over decorated.I defend my dissertation tomorrow and am now SO much more confident because I saw Vicky today.  Heaven sent!

34.description: The best facial I have ever had in my life! Worth every cent and more! Have a facial with Nijole and you will never go to anyone else. I have seen her twice now in one month because it is just so amazing.  People at work tell me I have a glow now but I haven't told them my secret. With Nijole's facial I feel like I am on vacation in a 5 star resort getting a $300 facial, am so lucky to find her. Not only that but the staff at Salon 10 is super friendly and accommodating. Last visit after facial had my hair done by Melissa and she did an amazing job and is so super nice!

16.description: Up until a month ago, I'd lived in Edgewater for 13 years.  However, for most of those 13 years I used to make the mistake of trekking all the way to Wicker Park for a haircut.In desperation one day, I did a little yelp search and stumbled onto all of the rave reviews that Ken had received.  So I went to him and got a bunch of great and still economical haircuts.Unfortunately, I just learned that Ken is no longer with Salon 10.  Everyone there was always super nice and I'd still recommend the salon, but, Ken, oh, Ken, where did you go???

13.description: Everything you've heard or read is true. Ken is fantastic! I had been seeking a new stylist for, well, years. And I believe I've finally found my match.I made a Friday afternoon appointment last minute (hooray!) and hurried into Salon 10 to fix up my bedraggled mane.  Ken was immediately so gracious, even after I pointedly apologized for sweating profusely on my jog over to the salon. He pulled his fingers through my hair and checked out the sitch.Now, here's the thing: I have long and straight hair. It's too easy for me to end up at a salon where a few snips just take off dead ends, but there's no magic. I walk out of many salons having dropped lotsa bucks for little-to-no effort. I explained to Ken that I wanted to keep my basic look--long and straight--but somehow add some oomph. More layers, he suggested.After a quick lather and rinse by another employee, Ken was at work, taking his time with my hair while making me feel completely comfortable and confident. I even learned that Ken has been cutting hair since age 12 when the neighborhood kids would turn to him for 5 buck cuts. The man found his calling early in life, and it shows. It is so reassuring to sit in the chair of a stylist who you know cares about what he's doing and will do it really well.I left the salon completely thrilled with my cut. Ken's work on my layers lightened my step up, and I've felt more confident in my look since. My only itsy-bitsy complaint would be that during my shampoo, there was no towel underneath my neck so the sink painfully dug into the top of my spine, and I wasn't given any robe, so my clothes got a bit splashed. I suppose I could have asked for a change while it was happening, and it was not enough of a problem to make me dock any stars. If you live nearby (or even if you don't), definitely give Ken a call.

11.description: The people here are really nice. I've been here twice for a haircut by Ted and twice for a straight perm (I somehow have naturally wavy Asian hair). I had just moved to Chicago and from talking to the hair stylists, I feel like I know them personally and I got great recommendations for restaurants and other venues to try. I was very happy with the haircuts that Ted did but didn't love the way he would style it at the end - I have a small head and flat hair accentuates that. At my last salon, I had the opposite problem of my stylist making my hair so puffy and short on the top that I felt like my head was a flower. Since my hair was layered kind of funny at the time and had to wait for the really short areas to grow out, I wanted to straighten my hair so I didn't have to deal with the uneven waviness every day. Because of formaldehyde concerns, this salon never jumped on the trendy Brazilian keratin treatments. So, I opted for a straight perm. The salon owner did the perms. The first time, she messed up the order of the treatment applications. Instead of lying about it, she apologized profusely and called customer service to find out if anything bad would happen from the mistake. Nothing bad happened, we rescheduled and she came in on her day off and straightened my hair free of charge. That perm turned out well. Second time I went in for a straightening, I'm not sure what happened but I ended up with a permanent kink near the hair roots. I guess my hair is... well, different... so it might just be some quirk and I've had problems before with chemical damage. I'm just pretty upset that I have to grow out these kinks now that my hair is the length I like.

39.description: Had a very excellent experience at Salon 10 getting a cut.  Though I didn't book Ken, whom everyone has raved about, I was very happy with Vicky.  She listened to my "wants" and interpreted them into haircut language.  She really took her time making sure everything was even and fresh looking.  I haven't been happy with a haircut in a long time, and this one was great.  I'm def going back to get highlights as Vicky promised she can do mine in an hour rather than the 3 hour hell I normally sit through.  A cut goes for $45, but went on a weekday before 6pm so it was $36 + tip.

37.description: I have lived in Chicago for almost three years, and with the exception of my appointment with Ken last week, I had only gotten a haircut anywhere in this city twice (and was extremely disappointed both times).  I conveniently book my hair appts with my stylist in Arizona, which, needless to say, leaves me desperate for a haircut more often than not!  After reading the fantastic reviews about Salon 10 and Ken, I booked a haircut with him last week.  I have always been a bit "tired" of my hair and find myself putting it up more often than actually spending the time to do it.  After debating back and forth with Ken about possibilities, I decided to be gutsty and go for a short A-line cut.  Needless to say, this was a risk because my hair had never been as short as it would be after he finished cutting it, but I was ready to give it a shot.  I AM SO GLAD I DID!!!  Ken's haircut is BY FAR the best haircut I have EVER had, and I have seen the same stylist in Arizona for going on 6 years.  He listened, he tailored his approach to my face shape/wants, he asked me my opinions before actually cutting anything, and he thanked me for taking a chance with him.  I have gotten more compliments on my hair in less than a week than I ever have in the past!   I am thrilled!  To top it off .... $36 dollars (20% off for a first time client - normally $45).  You can't beat those prices for an amazing haircut!  I'm going back for color as soon as I can get in!  I can't say enough about the Salon or about Ken.

0.description: I've been coming to Salon 10 since Ted started working there - around 2011 I think, and I always leave extremely happy and relaxed. As others have noted, the head-massage is amazing (don't miss the tip jar!), and I really appreciate, on a grad student stipend, having Ted - an experienced stylist who has a vision for my hair, and who always helps me decide what cut will look best, for a $50 rate (for above the shoulders cut, no coloring etc.) - this is really uncommon these days in Chicago! I highly recommend this salon - lovely people, relaxing atmosphere, and I'll certainly be booking my next appointment with Ted.

38.description: Amazing! I got a terrific cut from Ken for a very reasonable price.

51.description: I saw all the great reviews and decided to give it a shot. I was pretty pleased to hear that I'd be getting Ken who'd gotten all those raves.I had a great hair wash - the head massage was just what I needed after a long week, then Ken gave me exactly the kind of cut I asked for - taking some length off, plus some layering. When he was done he asked if I'd like to try blowing some curls into my hair for fun - and it was fun, and the results were great! (I posted a picture as I promised Ken I would do)Thanks! I'll be back again!

27.description: Why 4 stars you ask? Location, location, LOCATION!Don't get me wrong, its not that Salon 10 is in a bad area, not at all. Its that the salon is located upstairs from a separate retail store. You have to walk in the store, then go up the stairs to the salon. Not brain surgery, but not totally clear either.Aside from that...The salon itself is lovely. Cozy, comfy, and calming.  :) The shampoo girl gave me an incredible scalp massage. Normally, I don't care for such things, but wasn't sure how to say so without seeming rude, so I let her do her thing. Glad I did! I went in that day for a simple cut, nothing fancy. Got set up with Ken, which turned out to be serendipitous!  After a slew of disappointing cuts & colors in my personal 'hair history', I've learned to keep my expectations at a medium level the first time I see a new stylist. There was no need for such caution with Ken. I walked in there hoping (at the very least) that I wouldn't walk out crying. Fast forward an hour or so, & I walked out of that salon feeling like a DIVA! Simple cut? Yep. But, as it turned out, even a simple cut, when well done, can make a big difference. I vowed then & there Ken was my stylist from then on. Period. However, when I logged in to write my review, I noticed another reviewer had mentioned Ken had left, and is now at T Salon. So, nothing against Salon 10, but I will be seeking Ken out at his new location. I mean, finding a good stylist is kinda like finding a good man...hard to do. Honestly, this decision has nothing to do with Salon 10 itself. It is a great place (once you realize its up the stairs), and they do have a massage special that's only $50 for one whole hour. Not a bad deal!All in all, I can easily recommend this salon. I may still go there for other services, but I will definitely go looking for Ken for hair related issues.

32.description: So sad to hear Frederico is no longer working there. Will have to find a new place.

54.description: I'd been reluctant to find a new stylist, treasuring the memory of going to Sana when I lived in DC, but at long last the split ends got to be a bit much, and I took a chance on Salon 10 in light of its nearness to my home and because of the reviews of my fellow Yelpers. As a matter of fortune, I drew Ken, and I couldn't be happier. He was careful, attentive, a light touch, and fun to talk to. I couldn't help but feel delighted by the results--I walked out with a head full of long, loose curls that definitely had me feeling better set for the summer's heat. At long last, I've found someone to take Sana's place--at long last, I've found my Chicago stylist. To paraphrase "Casablanca," here's to the beginning of a beautiful relationship.

48.description: I've been dying to review Salon 10 and Fred, since I got my first cut with him back in September, but wanted to wait until I'd visited at least twice.  The fact that I was able to go 3.5 months without a trim for my short hair should tell you something.  Dude is good.Fred is meticulous, without taking forever, and is great for not trying to talk you into styles you aren't comfortable with, or sell you on products.  He's super nice and funny, but won't try to talk your ear off if you're not feeling it.  He'll readily show you how to do certain things with your hair if you ask, and he's not one to judge if you tell him you want something low maintenance.  And to confirm that I'm not irrationally in awe of super Fred, he gave my sister a cut recently, and she's now in love, too.  So glad to have found this place, I'm now a devotee.

44.description: Fred is my latin hero!  First cut was fabulous.  He totally fixed the bangs that I hacked.  All of you out there - resist the scissors in your hand and call Salon 10.  You can thank me afterwards.

24.description: Vickie is about 7 different kinds of awesome. After a traumatic experience with a super short cut I got at another salon, I've been frantically willing my hair to grow out. Unfortunately, it's been choosing to do so in a way vaguely reminiscent of a mullet. Vickie gave me a sassy new 'do that I can enjoy while waiting for my hair to get to the length God intended it to be. Will definitely be going back.

7.description: I just moved to Chicago and have been looking for a great place to get my hair cut.Ted at Salon 10 was a rock star. He was very thorough, hilarious and sweet.He explained why I was losing so much volume and what we can do to get this mane of mine some spunk! Very reasonably priced. $50 for wash/massage, cut, and style. Offered me tea or H2O as well.You must check it out if you're in Andersonville or anywhere in the city.Its worth the travel.

49.description: Let me just say this right off the bat: no dire economic conditions can justify a grown woman trying to cut her own hair. Now on to the review. KEN is a dreamboat. He fixed my terrible self-trim and gave me advice on non-salon hair coloring options, and I have found my new Chicago hair home. My two roommates also go to Ken (one of my roomies is a bona fide hair OBSESSIVE and she worships him) and we all think he's the bomb.

40.description: I'd been wanting a haircut for a week or so. I thought I was going to grow out my already grown out bob, but alas, I'm just not into long hair anymore. So off I went to Yelp, to search out a new place with fabu recommendations. Salon 10? Yes! Vicki was my stylist, and I am IN LOVE with my hair! Is it possible to stare at oneself in the mirror too much? I'm just super super happy! Very welcoming staff, everyone was smiling at me, and Vicki was very helpful, and had such great input! Even went for a color change! I'm loving Salon 10, and I will be back!

53.description: I was referred to Ken through a friend and am so thankful. He is quick, efficient, perfectionist an above all an awesome guy. Everytime my hair is done by him I get stopped on the streets with compliments. I will go to Ken as long as I live in Chicago. He is truly a professional. You will not be disappointed. Thanks Ken...

30.description: Though I live in Wicker Park, I really am not quite fashion forward enough for their hair salons.  After trying a place and walking out business in the front and party in the back, I knew I had to go somewhere a little more laid back. So after my hair grew out, I yelped "Wavy hair" and open on Sundays I came across Salon 10.  I have seen Vicky at Salon 10 a couple of times and have not ever left disappointed.  I have thick wavy hair and usually have to intro my hair to a stylist.  You know the usuals, "Please don't give me a mullet", "Please don't make me look like triangle-head", etc.  She sat me down and looked at my hair dry before she washed and cut it.  Vicky definitely took her time and gave me a cut that even grew out well!  In my opinion, the service here really does set it apart.  I feel relaxed and never pressured to make idle conversation.  The only downfall is how far the salon is for me.  Darn you Andersonville for having some of that best brunch spots and Salon 10!

46.description: Love. Like the song says "All you need is love..."And I love Ken. Which basically means that all I need in life is Ken. Because Ken does great hair. Sorry, let me rephrase that- Ken is MOTHER F-ING AWESOME at doing hair. I first went to him last October to fix my terribly flat and terribly misbehaving hair. My hair is....schizophrenic would be the best and most favored term. It does the whole "I can't decide between being straight, curly, or wavy" thing. Which means that every morning I usually do the whole "Bitch I'm bunning you" thing. (Bunning=Putting hair in a bun. It also sounds like some sort of sexual perversion.)Ken fixed it. He trimmed it, layered it, did some Ken Magic and everything was wonderful.I held off on reviewing until Haircut # 2. And I'm actually really glad I did. Because if I thought Haircut # 1 was awesome, Haircut # 2 was PURE GENIUS.I decided on a Tuesday that I was sick of my nasty frizz mop for good so I called Ken and booked an appointment for the next day. Walked into the salon, told him I was "Chopping this shit off" and that he could do what he wanted. Which he did (although not without discussing it with me first to make sure I was down). Any man that can make my hair look this FABULOUS deserves...I don't know...a special place in heaven or a mansion in Miami.
