Or something.He made suggestions, took charge, made sure I was OKAY with the suggestions, took charge some more and a few (okay many) snippity snips later I walked out of the salon feeling like a Sex Goddess (minus the ability to orgasm on command). On the train ride home men kept staring at me (okay it was one man in an empty train car but he was pretty cute albeit a little on the young side). I haven't felt this stunningly fabulous in years and three weeks later I am STILL loving the sex that is my hair. So basically Ken=Love. And we could all use a little more of that.

1.description: I never leave reviews this quickly after service but honestly I feel robbed. I was quoted $30-$35 for a blow out. I explained to the receptionist I had extensions that were down to the middle of my back. After telling the stylist I wanted waves (that I know can easily be created by a round brush) he led me to believe curling my hair with a curling iron would be best. Extra $15. Fine. Seriously I've never seen such horrible, hard brushes used by stylists anywhere!! Bristles literally ripped out my natural hair! The hair products and iron were from a different generation. I believe this salon could be great for other treatments, but a blowout, no thanks. My total for a blowout and style was $70!!!!! If I would have known it was going to be this much I would have gone to a real salon downtown and sipped champagne with my beautiful hair. I'm sorry, but needless to say NEVER AGAIN!!!

55.description: I have lived in Chicago for 5 years and, until today, had not found somewhere to get my hair cut that I liked and could afford.  I've reached the end of my quest with Salon 10 and Ken.  The atmosphere put me at ease right away with comfy chairs and nice simple decor that reminded me of a beach house.  All the staff members were friendly and helpful.  I biked there so was a bit out of breath and I was immediately given a glass of cold water.  Not only was it just what I needed, but I they won points with me by not using disposable cups.  I hate it when I go to get my hair cut and they rush through the shampoo, but here I got a nice scalp massage that almost put me to sleep!  Ken and I discussed exactly what I wanted and he executed it beautifully.  Now I have a great summer haircut, and a stylist I'll return to.  And at $45, you can't beat that.

9.description: I have to update my review from before. I loved this place and Ken gave me fantastic haircuts. However he, and other other woman that I used once when he was sick (who was also great), have left. The last time I went, the manager cut my hair and I was not happy with it. She admitted that her background is mostly in coloring, and even though I thoroughly described the cut I usually get, she was not able to layer and thin it well. There may be other good stylists that have since been hired, but when looking at these reviews remember that all the praise about Ken is no longer relevant...

26.description: I have been here twice now, and love this place!  It's not like a high-end salon with loud bumping music and b*tchy stylists.  The receptionists/hair washers are always friendly and accomodating.Vickie has done my hair twice, with two different cuts, and I loved them both.  I'm so happy I found a salon in my neighborhood that not only has wonderful talent, but is also a calming, inviting place.  I can't say enough about how much I like their staff!

25.description: Words cannot describe the mourning I have that Ken has left.. (p.s. he's at T. Salon on Damen!)The one thing that will keep me coming back is that I have been getting massages from Roger- holy moses, he's got magical hands!!

12.description: Words cannot describe the mourning I have that Ken has left.. (p.s. he's at T. Salon on Damen!)The one thing that will keep me coming back is that I have been getting massages from Roger- holy moses, he's got magical hands!!

59.description: run, run, run to this classy and simultaneously cozy salon! i was treated like a princess (took my coat, offered me tea) for all of $45. the best hair cut i've ever had, i tell you that! ken (my new hair god) sat me down and we discussed what i'd like: he executed it perfectly and went above and beyond my styling expectations. i now have the most adorable hair (complete with curls) for that perfect 60's sex kitten look.i am so, so happy with this place. they were able to fit me in last minute, and everyone there was delightful. upscale without pretension? amen!

21.description: I have been a customer of salon 10 for a year now. The salon is nice but more so then the salon I went their to see Vicky who was one of their stylist. She always takes her time while she works  making sure the haircut comes out just right. You could imagine how dissappointed I was 2 weeks before my appointment when Salon 10 called me to tell me she was no longer working there.Luckily 2 days before my haircut I ran into her on my bus ride to work. She is now working in a Salon in Edgewater called Laws of Hair. just across the street from the Jewel osco on Broadway and Balmoral. This is wonderful for me because the Salon is actually closer tome than Salon 10.  I re booked with her their and it was a beautiful Salon (you can see my review on it on yelp at Laws of Hair). I have no qualms with Salon 10, but Vicky was truly wonderful and I look forward to her styling my hair for years to come.

17.description: Had a great experience with Vicky at Salon 10. She really listened to what I wanted and worked with my hair texture (coarse and thick). She gave me a great layered, shoulder-length shag with long bangs. She was extra-careful about the cut itself, blowing my hair dry to check the shape and making some adjustments as needed. I really appreciated how she communicated with me throughout the cutting process, letting me know what she was doing and reassuring me that I wasn't losing any length, just gaining shape and texture from what she was doing. She also complimented my DIY color job! The receptionist/shampoo girl was also very friendly and professional. My only (tiny) complaint was that the music was a little loud for such a small space--I had trouble hearing the stylist sometimes. Maybe turn the radio down a notch? Otherwise, a super experience!!!!!!!

10.description: I should start by admitting that I rarely have my hair cut. Usually its an annual event, so I appreciate a haircut that looks good at the beginning, and continues to look good while it grows out. Last summer, after listening to much complaining about the state of my hair, my boyfriend bought me a haircut for my birthday - at any place I wanted to go. I looked on Yelp (it usually sends me in the right direction) and found this place, and two hours later I was sat in the chair while Don fixed the mess on my head. Can I write a review for Don, and give him 5 stars?? He was awesome. Even my boyfriend was impressed (and he's the kind of boyfriend who takes two weeks to notice that I dyed my hair a completely different color). It was possibly the best haircut I've ever had.So a year later, when it was time for my annual haircut, I naturally thought of this place again. This time, unfortunately, Don wasn't working on the day I went in. I had a pretty clear idea of the haircut I wanted, but the hairdresser who looked after me talked me out of it. I'm all for being talked out of a haircut - seriously, if someone who does this every day has a better idea, I'm all for it. Unfortunately the idea was not better than mine. Last time I had that haircut, I was nine. And my mother did it. I was not a happy camper. At all. (This, alone, is the reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars)Since I didn't have the time, or money (its a little more than I would usually pay), to go back and get it fixed, I waited for it to grow out. After two months or so it still wasn't any better, so I called and checked Don was working, and, since he was, I sucked it up and booked another appointment. What can I say? I will be going back to Don for my annual haircut next year. My hair looks great!! And Don was, once again, lovely. He gave me all sorts of good advice (both times) about how to look after my hair, and how to style it.Overall, this place is good, its just a shame that (in my experience) its so hit or miss. Still, I suppose as long as I stick with Don, I can count it as a hit!

5.description: A few weeks ago I purchased a Groupon to a salon that shall remain nameless and received one of the worst haircuts of my life. The woman actually burned a chunk of my hair right off! So, after way too many frustrating bad hair days waiting for it to grow out (and looking like one of the little rascals in the meantime), I finally gave in and called Salon10 yesterday afternoon. They were nice enough to fit me in at the last minute for an appointment with Ted. The whole experience was wonderful. Everyone who works here was so friendly and helpful, including Ted. He listened to what I wanted and made me feel right at ease. I normally feel a bit awkward trying to make conversation with hair stylists, but Ted was so genuine that I didn't feel uncomfortable at all. As for the haircut, I walked out feeling so much better! I will definitely be going back :)

3.description: This was my second stop on the Great Hairstylist Hunt.  I immediately liked the serene atmosphere and wood-tone decor.  It feels like a quiet little getaway - right above a busy street!I really enjoyed having my hair washed here - they have a dedicated person doing it who also gives you a scalp massage.  Mmmm, luxury.  Ted cut my hair a couple of different times and did a very nice job; ultimately, the chemistry didn't *quite* click, but he definitely gets the runner-up spot.The real standout experience, though, was when I went in for a massage.  Kristina fit me in on the spur of the moment, and turned out to be incredibly skilled.  Her technique was interesting - not super-deep like some therapists I've been to, and in fact I at first thought she wasn't having much of an effect at all.  Then I tried moving my neck and shoulders after she'd worked on them, and my range of motion had increased by 40%. I don't even have words for how much better I felt after she was done.Good place for hair, *great* place for a massage.  One of these days I may get brave and try a facial, too.  And the best part - they're all $50!  As my friend Kate put it, "I'll have one of each, please."

35.description: I've had my hair cut and highlighted/colored twice with Ken.  He was great!  Both times with him were seriously the only times that I didn't  feel like crying after getting my hair done.  It was perfect both times and he has great instincts so I don't have to worry about saying the wrong thing and ending up with a messed up do.  I'm so excited to have a regular stylist.  This is a first for me!

19.description: I loved my visit- the scalp massage during the shampooing was so relaxing it even made me stop talking! Ted does an excellent job and the atmosphere was just right!

28.description: Up until a month ago, I'd lived in Edgewater for 13 years.  However, for most of those 13 years I used to make the mistake of trekking all the way to Wicker Park for a haircut.In desperation one day, I did a little yelp search and stumbled onto all of the rave reviews that Ken had received.  So I went to him and got a bunch of great and still economical haircuts.Unfortunately, I just learned that Ken is no longer with Salon 10.  Everyone there was always super nice and I'd still recommend the salon, but, Ken, oh, Ken, where did you go???

45.description: Fantastic place. Fred is great! I usually just let him do what he thinks would look best and it has always looked fantastic. Fred pays attention to detail and never rushes, but doesn't take forever. Even when he's backed up he does rush you out.The price is good for the quality of cut. Everyone there is really nice and the space itself is cute. The shampoo girl is great too. No matter who cuts your hair you will probably love it.

33.description: I just came back from Salon 10. My first experience there and it won't be my last. Everyone there was very friendly and social. It was really quaint and comfortable. When I called this morning I was amazed at how lucky I was to get an appointment for the same day!! I didn't have to wait 4 weeks HOW NICE! Ken was my stylist, he was AMAZING!!! I know he wasn't feeling well but he was nothing but funny, professional and charming. I work in a service industry and really appreciate good client service. Great price point in these hard economic times. EVERYONE SHOULD GO AND ENJOY A FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE!!

43.description: Everything you've heard or read is true. Ken is fantastic! I had been seeking a new stylist for, well, years. And I believe I've finally found my match.I made a Friday afternoon appointment last minute (hooray!) and hurried into Salon 10 to fix up my bedraggled mane.  Ken was immediately so gracious, even after I pointedly apologized for sweating profusely on my jog over to the salon. He pulled his fingers through my hair and checked out the sitch.Now, here's the thing: I have long and straight hair. It's too easy for me to end up at a salon where a few snips just take off dead ends, but there's no magic. I walk out of many salons having dropped lotsa bucks for little-to-no effort. I explained to Ken that I wanted to keep my basic look--long and straight--but somehow add some oomph. More layers, he suggested.After a quick lather and rinse by another employee, Ken was at work, taking his time with my hair while making me feel completely comfortable and confident. I even learned that Ken has been cutting hair since age 12 when the neighborhood kids would turn to him for 5 buck cuts. The man found his calling early in life, and it shows. It is so reassuring to sit in the chair of a stylist who you know cares about what he's doing and will do it really well.I left the salon completely thrilled with my cut. Ken's work on my layers lightened my step up, and I've felt more confident in my look since. My only itsy-bitsy complaint would be that during my shampoo, there was no towel underneath my neck so the sink painfully dug into the top of my spine, and I wasn't given any robe, so my clothes got a bit splashed. I suppose I could have asked for a change while it was happening, and it was not enough of a problem to make me dock any stars. If you live nearby (or even if you don't), definitely give Ken a call.

2.description: Don't even bothering booking an appointment with this salon. I called to ask about having a french twist done for a bridal party of 3 girls and they I formed me that they don't do them. Last I checked a french twist is a standard Updo how can a salon like this stay in business if they can not perform simple hair styles.

18.description: -After my Hair Stylist Jane closed down her shop and started working out of Salon 10 I began coming for my bi-monthly hair cuts and beard trimmings.  I still continue to see Jane.  She is by far my favorite stylist of all time!. I couldn't find a stylist that I really liked that could give me great hair cut and knew how to cut facial hair.  My old roommate introduced me to her about 3 years ago and since then I've been hooked! -Salon 10 has a great space located in the Heart of Andersonville.  Whenever I come in the store is clean and the ambiance is super relaxing.  -I want to give a special shout-out to Shannon who works reception and does the shampooing.  (I'm sure she also does a lot more for the business)  When Shannon gives a shampoo she also gives the MOST relaxing head massage.  Plus Shannon is super sweet and fun to talk to.  -Great job Salon 10.  I'm glad you brought on Jane and that you exist in my life!

41.description: I really can't say enough good things about this place. I have been going to Salon 10 for a few years and have never been disappointed.I live in Andersonville and, of course, love to support any local business. However, Jennifer and the gang make it SO easy. From the receptionists to the stylists, they just couldn't be nicer.When you walk in, they'll take your coat and offer you a drink. You can get a cut by Fred, Ken or Jennifer (the owner). Jennifer is my gal, but I've heard wonderful things about all 3 of them. You know the kind of hair salons you see in the movies where they remember your name and where the stylists are great conversationalists? This is that place! I actually look forward to getting my hair cut and highlighted. Not to mention, I get TONS of compliments on my hair all the time.Oh, and you just wait for the shampoo. You'll get the best head massage you've EVER had. The only problem with this place is trying not to fall asleep from being too relaxed. My only hesitation in giving 5 stars is revealing a place that is such a great secret.

52.description: Man, did I get lucky. I've been straightening my (very thick, unruly, coarse, curly) hair for years, and I finally decided to start embracing my curl. Accordingly, I needed a new haircut that would allow me to do this. I found Salon 10 through Yelp and luckily got an appointment with Ken, who has tons of raves here.Ken has raves for a reason. He's easy to talk to, knows what he's doing, and isn't snooty at all, which is a consistent problem I've had with Chicago salons. I have problem hair, and I'm really touchy about my haircuts. Even though my hair was straight when I came in, Ken was still able to figure out its totally crazy curl pattern once it was washed. He explained everything he was doing and took his time telling me how to style my new curly mane. He didn't push product on me, which was really, really nice. Add to this the extremely reasonable price ($45, can't beat it) and the shampoo and relaxing head massage, as well as the friendly receptionist, and I'll definitely be back. This place is a gem.

50.description: I just fell in love with this little place! I am pretty phobic  about getting my hair cut and haven't found someone I've been comfortable with since I got to Chicago a year ago.  That all changed today. Fred was charming, respectful and super talented. He went to town and I walked out a new person less than an hour later.  The shampoo and scalp massage?Cherry. Sundae. You get it.The price ($45) was more than reasonable to feel pampered and taken care of.  I love love love my new haircut and was so thrilled to have a positive experience right out of the gate.  It's also easy to make a little day of it because of all the other fun stuff to do in A'ville.  Got a delicious Svea breakfast beforehand and an $8 pair of jeans at Brown Elephant afterwards.Anyway, every other client seemed to be receiving the same level of attention and care from other staff members. I can't wait to go back.

4.description: I went to Salon 10 for about two years to have Jane take care of my hair.  Being a guy there isn't that much to cut but she always did an amazing job with it and also helped me dye it a couple of times!  She has a quirky personality I like and interestingly for a year I didn't even realize we were connected through a mutual friend (small world)!  I always felt treated well by her and the other folks that run the place.  Only place I can ding them on is the cost of a guy's haircut is just a hair (pun intended) more than I would typically expect to pay.  Location is amazing and I encourage others to support another great local business in Andersonville!

6.description: When I decided to get my first real haircut in several years it was a major commitment that called for careful research! Having just recently moved to Andersonville I decided to explore my options locally in the hopes of finding a go-to neighborhood stylist. I think I've found him in Ted at Salon 10!I came in on a lazy Sunday and was lucky to have the place to myself :) The receptionist/shampoo girl was lovely (and gave a great head/neck massage). The atmosphere of the salon itself is relaxed and homey- I'm not a fan of the more uptight, sterile feel of more "posh" places. Ted was friendly and an easy conversationalist without pushing it when I had my moments of silence during the hour-long procedure. He also shared some great tips about places to eat around the neighborhood. I loved how invested he was in supporting the local community.I let go of about 9+ inches for an angled cut that stops just below my shoulders. Ted was meticulous, and took the time to give me a great blowdry (which is quite a feat with my thick hair). I seriously anticipated that I might leave the salon in tears (it's always sad to say goodbye), but I walked out feeling fabulous!It's been a month. Am I a fan of short hair? Ehhh...still adjusting. But definitely a fan of Salon 10 and Ted!

22.description: I was scared to try out a new stylist because my super thick, straight, short hair makes it easy to spot any little mistakes or crookedness. But Jenn, the owner, did a fabulous job. She actually cut all my hair, and then I said I wanted it a little shorter (because I'm anal, not because she didn't do what I had asked)... so she went back and cut my hair all over again! A little pricey, but worth every penny!

15.description: Love. Like the song says "All you need is love..."And I love Ken. Which basically means that all I need in life is Ken. Because Ken does great hair. Sorry, let me rephrase that- Ken is MOTHER F-ING AWESOME at doing hair. I first went to him last October to fix my terribly flat and terribly misbehaving hair. My hair is....schizophrenic would be the best and most favored term. It does the whole "I can't decide between being straight, curly, or wavy" thing. Which means that every morning I usually do the whole "Bitch I'm bunning you" thing. (Bunning=Putting hair in a bun. It also sounds like some sort of sexual perversion.)Ken fixed it. He trimmed it, layered it, did some Ken Magic and everything was wonderful.I held off on reviewing until Haircut # 2. And I'm actually really glad I did. Because if I thought Haircut # 1 was awesome, Haircut # 2 was PURE GENIUS.I decided on a Tuesday that I was sick of my nasty frizz mop for good so I called Ken and booked an appointment for the next day. Walked into the salon, told him I was "Chopping this shit off" and that he could do what he wanted. Which he did (although not without discussing it with me first to make sure I was down). Any man that can make my hair look this FABULOUS deserves...I don't know...a special place in heaven or a mansion in Miami. Or something.He made suggestions, took charge, made sure I was OKAY with the suggestions, took charge some more and a few (okay many) snippity snips later I walked out of the salon feeling like a Sex Goddess (minus the ability to orgasm on command). On the train ride home men kept staring at me (okay it was one man in an empty train car but he was pretty cute albeit a little on the young side). I haven't felt this stunningly fabulous in years and three weeks later I am STILL loving the sex that is my hair. So basically Ken=Love. And we could all use a little more of that.

57.description: This place was amazing!!! I actually found it on here and decided to try it out because they had such stellar reviews!I'm very particular about who does my hair, and have been going to the same girl for five years. When it came time to find a new salon, I did my homework. I finally decided to go to Salon 10 because it was near my house, and they had nothing but great reviews. Not  to mention the haircut was only $45!!!!!!I didn't have any problem making an appointment, and when I walked in I was greeted with hot tea and a magazine. The atmosphere is great! It's cozy and small, with only a few stylists, which makes it that much more personal.Ken was amaaaaaaaaazing! He gave me five star treatment, and he was super friendly and easy to talk to (which is good when you're sitting in a chair for several hours). I explained to him what I wanted to do with my hair, and he met my expectations and then some! He did things to my style that I wasn't even able to communicate! He just knew. I walked out of there with the best hair cut/color I've had in a decade! I won't go to anyone/anywhere else as long as I live in Chicago!! You're awesome Ken!!

20.description: I have to update my review from before. I loved this place and Ken gave me fantastic haircuts. However he, and other other woman that I used once when he was sick (who was also great), have left. The last time I went, the manager cut my hair and I was not happy with it. She admitted that her background is mostly in coloring, and even though I thoroughly described the cut I usually get, she was not able to layer and thin it well. There may be other good stylists that have since been hired, but when looking at these reviews remember that all the praise about Ken is no longer relevant...

36.description: Had a great experience with Vicky at Salon 10. She really listened to what I wanted and worked with my hair texture (coarse and thick). She gave me a great layered, shoulder-length shag with long bangs. She was extra-careful about the cut itself, blowing my hair dry to check the shape and making some adjustments as needed. I really appreciated how she communicated with me throughout the cutting process, letting me know what she was doing and reassuring me that I wasn't losing any length, just gaining shape and texture from what she was doing. She also complimented my DIY color job! The receptionist/shampoo girl was also very friendly and professional. My only (tiny) complaint was that the music was a little loud for such a small space--I had trouble hearing the stylist sometimes. Maybe turn the radio down a notch? Otherwise, a super experience!!!!!!!

14.description: Though I live in Wicker Park, I really am not quite fashion forward enough for their hair salons.  After trying a place and walking out business in the front and party in the back, I knew I had to go somewhere a little more laid back. So after my hair grew out, I yelped "Wavy hair" and open on Sundays I came across Salon 10.  I have seen Vicky at Salon 10 a couple of times and have not ever left disappointed.  I have thick wavy hair and usually have to intro my hair to a stylist.  You know the usuals, "Please don't give me a mullet", "Please don't make me look like triangle-head", etc.  She sat me down and looked at my hair dry before she washed and cut it.  Vicky definitely took her time and gave me a cut that even grew out well!  In my opinion, the service here really does set it apart.  I feel relaxed and never pressured to make idle conversation.  The only downfall is how far the salon is for me.  Darn you Andersonville for having some of that best brunch spots and Salon 10!

58.description: Oh man, the food sucks. I ate there once and don't want to go back. The burger was tasteless and the fries not worth the calories. Service average. Ambiance pretty good

56.description: Unfortunately, I feel compelled to give Mary's only one star after a few bad experiences. We have been going to Mary's for the past few years, since moving to the neighborhood. The kid loves it because of the fries and cartoons, but they give  us a hard time each time we order gluten free buns for him. Yes, we know it is bigger than the small burger you make for the kiddos. Just give us the gf bun like you did last time, please. We got another sour look from the waiter like we were crazy for ordering it. They gave us the gf toast instead and charged us extra.And I just can't shake the fact that I saw one of the servers stick her finger up another server's nether regions. Totally inappropriate. I also noticed this particular server also was giving her tables bad looks. When my mother took my son to the   bathroom she overheard the servers using inappropriate language and the bathroom was dirty as well.Back to our server, we waited 15 min, standing and waving him down and I still had to walk over to him to request our check while he was standing at the bar talking to the other servers. The food is ok...I just got such a negative vibe from the experience overall that we will not be going back.  It is too bad since I know they try to be "green" and make good meat choices. But they really have no room to be slacking after the health code violations they just received.

29.description: We recently came here with a party of four, for lunch. We overall, thought that it was just ok, not great. For lunch selections, we opted for the following: Hummus Wrap, which looked good, and tasted pretty good as well, according to the person in our party that ordered it. Another person in our party elected to have the Fish Sandwich, which he said was good. My partner had the Mary Burger, which said was good, and cooked just right. I had the Sloppy Mary, thinking that this was going to be of a sloppy joe consistency, and structure, but was not at all, it was a burger, with some chili on it. I also had mac and cheese as a side, overall, the burger was good, but I thought that it was a bit ill advertised per the menu description, the mac and cheese was just lukewarm. Not a fan. The service was good, and very attentive. I would be willing to give them another shot, just would not order the same thing again.

42.description: Gay enclaves are tired and unnecessary, so this place is just a relic. The menu would be fine if meals didn't start with rude service, and end with a fucking shoe on the table - a "cute" way to deliver the check that I think is appalling. Kindly gut the restaurant, replace the staff, clean the kitchen, and send up a few flares so I know it's safe to return.

23.description: Had the fries, so good! Leave room for a burger and some beers! Great food and atmosphere.

47.description: I just went there on a Monday at noon.  Shame on me for returning.  My last two experiences weren't very good.  Today was awful.  The booth seats were covered in crumbs.  The waitress told me I couldn't have bacon on my burger because they were out.  Though I very clearly specified no bun, my burger arrived on a bun.  The sweet potato fries were limp, soggy, and undercooked.  The server dropped the food off and did not provide us with napkins or flatware.  I had to wait more than 5 minutes to catch another servers attention so that I could ask for these items.  My companion's burger was drenched in "Mary Sauce".  Our barely adequate server finally asked how things were when I asked for the check.  I told her about the things that I was unhappy about and she took away my plate with all of the uneaten fries.  She didn't even take the cost of the fries off.  I will definitely not make the mistake of returning to that dump again!

8.description: I'm so bummed about this past visit. I have so many fond memories of this place, however it has been a few years. SO I'm assuming things have changed a wee-bit? We initially came here for Bingo this past Monday. Unfortunately we were denied our bingo :( - apparently it was cancelled due to the New Years? 2 days later? Now we're super disappointed, so we order a round of drinks. It was $6 margarita night. I LOVE margaritas. I did NOT love whatever slightly-flavored-ice that I was given. Literally friends - this drink came out and half the cup was pure shaved ice. It wasn't even mixed. The entire bottom half was ice. The crappy thing was I didn't have a chance to really change my drink until the burgers came out, since our waitress didn't come back until the food was done. So I sat there for 20ish minutes not enjoying a much needed cocktail. Burgers were fine. Not as amazing as I remembered. Follow up drink wasn't good either, I think it was the Mary Punch or something? It was way stronger, but it tasted like straight up cough syrup to me. All and all, Mary you should post on your social networks if an event is cancelled or on your website. And fix the margaritas please. I really, really want to come back here....

31.description: I love Hamburger Mary's. Being here reminded me of how much I miss having one in Cincinnati. We arrived just in time, before the second wave lunch rush came in. Our waiter, I think his name was Oliver(?), was very kind to us. One of the people I came with had a negative experience at this location before, but I think Oliver flipped her back to the positive side. I was surprised to see a lot of people coming in with their children. In my initial check in, I said I wasn't sure if it was a place to bring kids, but I think it seemed okay! I was leaving town shortly after, so I didn't get to try any of the Andersonville Brews. My only complaint and the reason I am giving 3 stars is because my seasoned fries weren't very good (but they normally are!) and the bathroom was pretty dirty. To be fair though, they were busy. I'll be back.

34.description: This is one of those places in Chicago that does not get much of the new buzz about burgers and they should.  There burgers are pretty straight forward and pretty damn good!  The service is laid back and spunky which fits the neighborhood.  The place could use a bit of a deep clean or new coat of paint.  Fun place to take friends and always a solid burger choice!

16.description: My fiance and I LOVE Hamburger Mary's. The kitschy decor, the delicious adult beverages and Oh, the burgers! These crazy bastards will slap a dollop of cheesy Mac-n-Cheese on your burger and serve it to you hot and delicious! I have to will myself NOT to order that, every time we visit. Luckily for me, every other burger I've had there has been equally delicious. Get up on Hamburger Mary's!

13.description: Great burgers and finger food. :) I loved the evening performances! :D

11.description: Andersonville is full of great places to eat.  Then, there's Hamburger Mary's.  Why it's still in the neighborhood is nothing short of amazing. What's wrong with this place, you might ask?   1.  Medium is 'pink' not grey;  2.  Macaroni and Cheese eaten out should be made from scratch and not out of a box;  3.  A stuffed cheese burger should be stuffed with cheese; and  4. Service should be attentive.  'Average' is as best as it can ever get and, sadly, as good as it likely will ever be.

39.description: Amazing food !! The cheese quesadillas were so tasty! I had a mini black bean burger and it was made so well. Awesome vegetarian options :)

37.description: I have been coming to hamburger Mary's ever since I moved into the area. Some days it can be a hit or miss on the quality of your food. I usually order a turkey burger or a regular cheese burger. Sometimes it's seasoned really well and cooked perfectly. Other times it's been cooked for to long and becomes dried out. The only thing that they keep consistent is the sweet potato fries. Those are really good along with the tater tots.Their drinks are Also a fan favorite amongst me and my friends.  However Ordering Take Out Might take a while....with the wait time you might as well just eat your food there. The location is perfect and the staff is really nice. When you get your receipt it comes in a high heel, which is so cute. I have went upstairs to Mary's attic once after having dinner and it wasn't many people up there so me and my friends left. I would say if your looking for just a nice laid back kinda of night go try hamburger Mary's.

0.description: Great burgers. Perfectly cooked. Lots of interesting choices in toppings and specialty burgers. Lively entertainment during your meal.

38.description: Everyyyyy single time I come here, each burger I've ordered has been so good that I've ended up uncomfortably full (but in a totally satisfied way) with a smile stuck on my face bc of the entertaining, adorable servers and bartenders. I love it here. I'll be back again and again! Love you guys and gals :-*

51.description: Service is bad. I had burger and it was huge and tasty. Everybody at the table were happy with their food and sides. Mac and cheese is delicious. If you're a man, go there but if you're a woman, don't bother, you'll have bad service. Just sayin'!

27.description: Went there yesterday for an early dinner. Maybe our experience would have been better if we sat on the patio but we didn't... The host that sat us seemed disinterested at best.  The place was mostly empty, dark and sticky and tired. Our table seemed sticky, the ladies room door was sticky, the bathroom dark and messy, the menu sticky. Now, we had been seated a few minutes before I got up to use the ladies room, I passed and made eye contact with our waitress. So, when I get back she's finally at the table trying to take my boyfriend's order and seems genuinely irritated that I'm not ready to order as I walk over and sit back down. I tell her I need a minute which gets a mumble and her back. She could barely make eye contact or say two words without attitude the rest of our time there. Now other tables being seated were getting "honeys" and a pep in her voice. Not us. The food was just meh. I ate some of it because I was hungry but it won't be bringing me back for seconds. The sweet potato fries were chewy and barely warm. The ketchup was gross. I've never commented on ketchup before but it was off. The burger looked promising, it was just ok, but had a great bun ( got to find the positives). Beer selection could have more options. Overall, it was disappointing and I couldn't wait to leave...which we did and had dessert elsewhere.

32.description: Our waiter was the best. He was one of the best waiters I've ever had. Our hamburgers were wonderful. The fries were delicious. And the onion rings were so good! The cocktails were strong! What more do you need??! We loved how quirky the decor is. And Mary...oh Mary...

54.description: A trip to Hamburger Mary's always makes for a fun time. I've had plenty of delicious burgers and sandwiches at Mary's, but my go to will always be the Barbara-Q Bacon Cheeseburger with sweet potato fries. Just thinking about it make me want one right now...To wash that down, you MUST try the Fuzzy Tea Bag. This is one of my favorite drink recipes of all time, and makes for a truly fantastic summer cocktail. As for service at Mary's, some of the waitresses are absolutely a hoot. You should probably ask for Linda because she is amazing. Have fun, and be sure to get a picture with Mary on your way out!

48.description: Good burgers, friendly service, it's a bit close quarters so if you have a toddler like us, you may be banging chairs with the table next to you. We'll definitely be going back and putting it in our rotation.If nothing else, we will always remember our fist visit to HM as also being our 2 year old son's first drag show!! It was an amazing moment to watch him, and the other kids in the place, clapping and dancing along with the performers, judgement free. Hope springs eternal.

44.description: My server was so rude and so dismissive.  He/she spent a large portion of the evening referring to himself as "Queen Ariana Grande" or something like that.  During dinner, our son, asked if our server was a boy or a girl.  Queen Ariana must have heard this as we heard him several times say to one of the other servers that that kid is "pushing it".  He/she and another server had terrible mouths and used bad language and once he/she heard my son's remarks the service became worse and worse.  We were fearful to order dessert after this.  Our server was African-American and although she was dressed as a woman I am confident it was a man and he/she made us feel very unsafe.  If we return, we will make sure to look in and see that he/she is not working.

24.description: We loved our experience at Hamburger Mary's. We went with a large group and they were super accommodating. The staff were incredibly friendly and made us feel right at home. We were joking around and having a great time. The beers from the Andersonville Brewery were very tasty and the Sunday morning $3 mimosa deal was a steal! My Pig and Goat burger was incredible. The fig caramel glaze and the goat cheese were the perfect combination toppers! Plus the seasoned fries were amazing. I can't wait to go back!

7.description: I love hamburger Mary's! The only thing is that the service sucks, but the servers are great individuals nonetheless, just wish they were more attentive and ask more frequently if I need another drink or a re-fill. Either way, their food rocks and the brews too! :)

49.description: Yum! Really good, and fun environment.

40.description: Decent food, prices are right, and nice atmosphere. However they seem to be under staffed.

53.description: Unfortunately, have to give one of the worst reviews I've ever given to this place tonight.Our experience started as soon as we walked in the door. We asked to move to a new table, as it was cold by the door.  The place was relatively empty at the time, so the host said it was OK. It then took over 10 minutes for someone, who was not even our server to as U.S. If we had been helped yet.  She even said flat out the she was not our server.  She ended up taking our order.  About 5-7 minutes later, our actual server dropped off our drinks.  The iced tea was the weakest tea I've had in quite a while.  About five minutes later, someone else dropped off our order, which my burger was not right. The same person, not our server, came back and dropped off the corrected order, only a few minutes later.  It was about five minutes later that our server came back to out table and apologized for the "confusion" about my order. We didn't see our server again until we asked for the bill, which took another 5-7 to drop off.  We hot our change back, but it was only bills, and no receipt!It will be a long time before we go back again.

30.description: Just wanted to write a quick review for Hamburger Mary's. Been to this place a few times over the years and it has always been a positively memorable experience. Stopped by here a week or so ago and ordered the Queen Mary burger. One of the best on their menu! So juicy. Bacon. Yummy. Fries were great. Server was kind and attentive. My partner Chris and I were bobbing our heads to the music that was playing. :) Fun lively place. xoxo

46.description: All I wanted was just wanted a couple of Mini Mary's Hamburgers done medium rare with bacon and fries.  Nothing complicated.  That should have been easy for a hamburger restaurant that specializes in hamburgers, right?  Instead I received two mini-burgers that were overcooked and dried out without bacon, along with fries that were greasy and what seemed to be the "bottom of the barrel fries" since there were many short broken pieces among the crumbs.  The menu advertises the mini-hamburgers to be the little version of the Mary Burger.  Not really.  The buns were not particularly fresh.   A minor point: They don't even give the lettuce the Mary Burger has. Not very friendly or attentive service from our server.  Neat atmosphere with a great decor.  I just can't recommend this hamburger eatery since there are so many others to patronize.

1.description: Really, anyplace that'll cook a burger medium-rare at all earns some love, but this place also has the campiest, most fabulous decor ever, music to match, a burlesque show in the evenings, and to top it all off, Lost in Space (original '60s version) playing on the TV. What's not to love?As for the food itself, the beer cheese mac wasn't really to our taste, but the burger itself (the Steak Oscar--burger of the month--with asparagus and Hollandaise) was awesome.

55.description: The decore is cute and the staff is friendly but the food is terrible. Absolutely terrible. Yesterday my family swore that would be our last trip. Soggy pretzels & discolored/crusted hummus.... never again. Food is often over cooked but served cold?There are numerous amazing restaurants on the same block in the same price range. Tihs place is great for drinks or people watching on the patio but NOT for food.

9.description: We loved our experience at Hamburger Mary's. We went with a large group and they were super accommodating. The staff were incredibly friendly and made us feel right at home. We were joking around and having a great time. The beers from the Andersonville Brewery were very tasty and the Sunday morning $3 mimosa deal was a steal! My Pig and Goat burger was incredible. The fig caramel glaze and the goat cheese were the perfect combination toppers! Plus the seasoned fries were amazing. I can't wait to go back!

26.description: Went there last night to celebrate my birthday. Drag queen bingo was a blast! Food was great too, as was the service! They didn't hover over us and they didn't ignore us, which we like. Despite what how it says they it's good for kids, perhaps it is on other nights, but NOT bingo nights. It gets VERY risqué, but it's a lot of fun. Leave the kids at home and find a sitter. :)

25.description: Fun place. My friend ordered the chicken and waffles and the waffles were cold. They took them back to the kitchen and just nuked them. I had the daddy Mac burger which was really good, but the bus boy took my place before I was finished.

12.description: I was a bit skeptical to try this after reading some of the recent reviews based on the health violations, but alas, my family and I had already sat down and ordered our drinks before I started perusing Yelp for pictures and recommendations. With that said, I'm glad I didn't check them out before we came, otherwise we may have missed this place!Full disclosure: I am a Chicago tourist so I'd never actually heard of, nor formed an opinion on Hamburger Mary's prior to our visit. However, upon walking through the doors and suddenly realizing where it got its moniker, I was amused and ready to dive in. Everyone in my party ordered something different. The tots and potato salad were both excellent sides. I had the steakhouse burger and while it was good, I had a bite of my husband's Buffy burger and liked that one better. The service was great and friendly, and the food came out promptly. I also tried a cocoa hazelnut beer that was different, yet tasty. I'd definitely be back to try the other burgers on the menu!

59.description: First off, I had no idea this place was a chain until looking at their website. It just doesn't seem like that kind of a place. They even have a location in Germany! Very interesting...Anyway, onto the review. I live close to Mary's, so I've been several times now and unfortunately, I seem to like this place less and less the more I go. I do appreciate having a place like this nearby. It's fun, lively and they have "adult bingo" hosted by a drag queen who often dresses up as Mary herself. Sounds like the perfect place if you ask me! However, the food can be really hit or miss. You can't really go wrong with the burgers. They seem to be pretty consistent. On the other hand, every time I try to branch out and try something new, I end up disappointed.  Undercooked tots, salad that tasted more like dessert (caramel chicken salad)...I still can't get the taste out of my mouth. I don't know what I was thinking when I ordered that salad, but I certainly did not expect it to be doused in caramel sauce. Makes me cringe just thinking about it.On the bright side, I haven't had bad service yet (unlike other Yelpers) and the drinks are cheap and STRONG, just the way I like them. Overall, I'd say this is the kind of place you come to if you want to hangout with friends, have some drinks, people watch, or watch whatever game or event they have on. It's not the kind of place I would go for a relaxing dinner. It's a little too loud for one-on-one conversation.Just for clarification, Mary's has 3 sections. It's a pretty big place. The main room is family friendly (before Bingo). The other side of the 1st floor has a kind of sport's bar vibe with plenty of large TVs showing whatever game happens to be on. To my knowledge, this is the side of the restaurant that is called Andersonville Brewing (yes, they brew their own beer and yes, it's pretty good). I wonder if all of the locations have on-site brewing and if they are all named after whatever town/neighborhood they happen to be in. The upstairs, which I believe is called Mary's Attic, is a bar with live music (sometimes). The upstairs section is the only section that I have yet to visit. Maybe next time.

21.description: Not so Good Experience at Mary's Burger the women  bathroom  was worst than a fast food restaurant  bathroom.  SO BEFORE YOU ORDER CHECK THE BATHROOM. Spoke with the one of the Managers he didn't seem to think it was a big deal that on his watch the Bathroom  was nasty he was making light of the situation. They just lost a long time customer that lives in the area.

17.description: A trip to Hamburger Mary's always makes for a fun time. I've had plenty of delicious burgers and sandwiches at Mary's, but my go to will always be the Barbara-Q Bacon Cheeseburger with sweet potato fries. Just thinking about it make me want one right now...To wash that down, you MUST try the Fuzzy Tea Bag. This is one of my favorite drink recipes of all time, and makes for a truly fantastic summer cocktail. As for service at Mary's, some of the waitresses are absolutely a hoot. You should probably ask for Linda because she is amazing. Have fun, and be sure to get a picture with Mary on your way out!

10.description: My boyfriend and I went here today for a late lunch. The food we ordered just wasnt that good. I ordered the pink panther, a sandwich with salmon and bacon. The salmon tasted like the catfood salmon. Literally, it was like someone just opened a can of fancy feast and served it to me. I had my bf try it and he agreed with me as well...My boyfriend asked for crispy fries. Crispy. I wish I took a picture of what we received but we literally got burnt fries. They were nearly black and withered and were disgusting. I'm usually very forgiving when I go out to eat because sometimes you just dont choose the best dish on the menu. But how do you just serve burnt fries and think thats ok?

5.description: Went here with the nephew and wife for dinner. This is a good restaurant with a fun atmosphere. We always have a good time with the staff/servers, who are friendly and competent.  The beer menu is fun/local. I ordered the spicy Mary.  It was good, but a little heavy on the ranch dressing.  We also had a standard burger (forget what it's called) and a BBQ burger.  The wife said her burger was over cooked, but this may be because one cretin in our party ordered his medium well done and that may have affected the entire order.  Overall the meal was good and we will likely be back.

3.description: Overall: Fun spot for some tasty burgers that are wild and wacky.The good: Tasty burgers with so many different combinations. They are good sized and not too overwhelming. Huge menu overall, lots of options. The service was great; friendly, attentive, and accommodating. Atmosphere was cool with all the knick-knacks and funky music.The bad: The burgers could've been a little bit better. Their brew wasn't as good as I thought it'd be. Music was a little loudAtmosphere: 9/10Service: 9/10Food: 8/10

35.description: Had some burgers here yesterday. 1. The woman at the hostess podium was rude and seemed put upon by having to seat us in the nearly empty restaurant around 3:00pm.2. Sat down to a filthy table. The lamp was caked in dust and crumbs, and the window sill and seat had crumbs. The table was sticky and dirty. 3. Why did we stay? We were really hungry.4. Ordered a burger and asked for medium. The menu states that all burgers will be cooked medium unless otherwise specified.5. The burger was well done.6. Our server was nice but seemed like she was overcompensating for this establishment that seems to have gone way downhill.Overall we decided we wouldn't come back.We had planned on going to the Little Bad Wolf but they were closed for an event so we decided on HM our old favorite and were so disappointed!

19.description: I love Hamburger Mary's. Being here reminded me of how much I miss having one in Cincinnati. We arrived just in time, before the second wave lunch rush came in. Our waiter, I think his name was Oliver(?), was very kind to us. One of the people I came with had a negative experience at this location before, but I think Oliver flipped her back to the positive side. I was surprised to see a lot of people coming in with their children. In my initial check in, I said I wasn't sure if it was a place to bring kids, but I think it seemed okay! I was leaving town shortly after, so I didn't get to try any of the Andersonville Brews. My only complaint and the reason I am giving 3 stars is because my seasoned fries weren't very good (but they normally are!) and the bathroom was pretty dirty. To be fair though, they were busy. I'll be back.

28.description: Went here with the nephew and wife for dinner. This is a good restaurant with a fun atmosphere. We always have a good time with the staff/servers, who are friendly and competent.  The beer menu is fun/local. I ordered the spicy Mary.  It was good, but a little heavy on the ranch dressing.  We also had a standard burger (forget what it's called) and a BBQ burger.  The wife said her burger was over cooked, but this may be because one cretin in our party ordered his medium well done and that may have affected the entire order.  Overall the meal was good and we will likely be back.

45.description: Might be the worse service I've ever had anywhere. The food was ok but took forever. We were there at off hours, was not at all busy. Will never go back.

33.description: One of my favorite places in the city.  Delicious food (Burger wise my personal favorites are the Buffy, the big Kahuna, and the date w/ a pig and a goat).  Service is generally pretty good, never had to wait very long for anything.  The outdoor patio is quite pleasant, and the inside is full of fun kitschy decor.  I have been a regular since my first visit, and even had my first date with my boyfriend there.

43.description: Absolutely horrible.No service, rude service, slow service.  Take your pick.  The place was virtually empty when we arrived and it still took 5 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us.  Menus arrive and immediately we get "do you need a minute to decide?".  Um...yes, we would actually like to look at the menu.After placing our order, we took a look around.  Filthy is an understatement.  Not sure if the ripped chairs and battered tables were an intentional look or not, but the place looks so sad if it isn't filled with people.  EVERYTHING had a grease film to it.  The bathroom should have police tape around it.  I hate to "go there" we the staff, but boy or boy, it looked like a 12 step drug program.  The highlight was watching a waiter pick his nose off in a corner.  Yum, can't wait for my burger.The burger, to be honest, was good, and made to order.  But then again, it's a burger after all.  How can you mess it up.  This is the type of place that has such a rude wait staff you don't dare send an order back for fear of retribution in the kitchen.  If they're willing to pick their nose in the dining area, imagine what they are capable of doing in the kitchen.Couldn't get out of their quick enough.  But that would take time.  While waiting over 10 minutes for someone to clear away our plates, a waiter came by to drop off someone else's order.  Seriously, do you not see our empty plates piled with used napkins?  Finally the check arrives.  I notice in the money holder a credit card stuffed down inside.  Some other patron left it behind.  Foolishly the friend I was with gave it to the waiter when he came back to get our money.  He looked "shocked".  I told my friend we would have been better off to take it and cut it up.  God only knows what this staff did with a live credit card.I don't believe this was a one-off experience.  Filth and rudeness seem to be be the daily special.

2.description: I'm reviewing 2 venues in one review: Hamburger Mary's (HM), a restaurant and Mary's Attic located above HM, which is a theater.We love the casual atmosphere of Hamburger Mary's, it is very eclectic. It is known as being a gay bar but, warmly welcomes all people. The wait staff are always super friendly and they keep an eye and ear tuned to your table to make sure you are doing ok.We usually get the burgers which come stacked very tall with a steak knife stuck in the center. They get a little messy eating them but, that's what napkins are for.Come hungry and start with an order of the pretzels and hot beer cheese. We've never made it to the dessert menu cause we're usually pretty full. I would like to try the retro deep fried twinkie, maybe next time.The down side to our visit this time: all our burgers were supposed to be cooked medium with some pink in them. However, ALL our burgers were well done, ick!My next review is for Mary's Attic:Mary's Attic is a small theater venue located upstairs from Hamburger Mary's. Since our last visit in 2014, the seating area has been re-modeled. It is more audience friendly. They removed the bar from the middle of the room and pushed it to the back of the theater. This allows more space and easier to view the show. They've added some cushy chairs. Seating is always 1st come, 1st served.Plays are put on by local performers. For a small venue, it's a good, cheap enjoyable evening. We saw Christmas Dearest. Hilarious! It's based on "loving" mom Joan Crawford and her interaction with fellow actors, her assistant and her "lovely" (crazy) daughter. Grab a burger 1st at Hamburger Mary's and then venture upstairs to Mary's Attic. Check their website for upcoming shows. Oh and if you like BINGO, they have weekly BINGO games.

18.description: First off, I had no idea this place was a chain until looking at their website. It just doesn't seem like that kind of a place. They even have a location in Germany! Very interesting...Anyway, onto the review. I live close to Mary's, so I've been several times now and unfortunately, I seem to like this place less and less the more I go. I do appreciate having a place like this nearby. It's fun, lively and they have "adult bingo" hosted by a drag queen who often dresses up as Mary herself. Sounds like the perfect place if you ask me! However, the food can be really hit or miss. You can't really go wrong with the burgers. They seem to be pretty consistent. On the other hand, every time I try to branch out and try something new, I end up disappointed.  Undercooked tots, salad that tasted more like dessert (caramel chicken salad)...I still can't get the taste out of my mouth. I don't know what I was thinking when I ordered that salad, but I certainly did not expect it to be doused in caramel sauce. Makes me cringe just thinking about it.On the bright side, I haven't had bad service yet (unlike other Yelpers) and the drinks are cheap and STRONG, just the way I like them. Overall, I'd say this is the kind of place you come to if you want to hangout with friends, have some drinks, people watch, or watch whatever game or event they have on. It's not the kind of place I would go for a relaxing dinner. It's a little too loud for one-on-one conversation.Just for clarification, Mary's has 3 sections. It's a pretty big place. The main room is family friendly (before Bingo). The other side of the 1st floor has a kind of sport's bar vibe with plenty of large TVs showing whatever game happens to be on. To my knowledge, this is the side of the restaurant that is called Andersonville Brewing (yes, they brew their own beer and yes, it's pretty good). I wonder if all of the locations have on-site brewing and if they are all named after whatever town/neighborhood they happen to be in. The upstairs, which I believe is called Mary's Attic, is a bar with live music (sometimes). The upstairs section is the only section that I have yet to visit. Maybe next time.

41.description: The first time my boyfriend and I tried this place was in Florida. Once we heard there was one in Chicago we had to go. The place is funky and the atmosphere is relaxing. I love their chicken chipotle wrap, it's delicious. It's just a fun place to eat at. Good place for children in my opinion.

52.description: Would give no stars if I could. Service was slow, took us 20 minutes at LEAST until our drink order was taken, and even longer after that we finally got our drinks. Also, burger gave me food poisoning. What a wasted evening. Had to call off work the next day.

50.description: I do have to say that the food here is great. I am putting down a 2 star rating because the service is terrible. I have been here numerous times and the service has declined on each visit. On my most recent visit, the server barely listened to my order, as if I was wasting their time. When it was brought to us and it was incorrect, I was treated as inconvenience for pointing it out. It was not busy when we were in so don't think that I don't take that into consideration when rating a place. I have to say that I won't be back, which saddens me because the food is really good. However, if I am paying more than $10 for a burger, I want the service to reflect that.

4.description: I can't believe I didn't know this place existed. Apparently my father's girlfriend took him here for a date and he thought I'd like the ambiance and staff. Not sure what that's supposed to mean entirely, but nonetheless I was happy to agree when he took me here to try it for myself. The place is impossible to miss, as it's on the corner and decked out in bright purple. It starts out fun before you even set foot in the door. We got lucky and found a parking spot right nearby without a wait. We were seated right away too, and both our hostess and our server were friendly and attentive. The decor is fun and bright, with lots of different colors, kitsch, and wall hangings. There's a lot to look at while you're waiting for your food. There's also patio seating (seasonally) and a bar with chairs as well, if you don't want to be in the dining room. There's also fun music playing, which adds to the charm of the place.Then there's the food. My dad got a Meaty Mushroom burger which is topped with Swiss and a trio of mushrooms, and since he's a man of few words, it was "good." I got the Daddy Mac burger, which came topped with beer-cheese mac. It's beer, cheese, noodles, and beef, what's not to love? Both burgers were well cooked and tasty. We also both got seasoned fries. Each of these burgers was somewhere in the $13 ballpark. We got a few drinks and dessert as well. He got a glass of wine and I got a "Pretty in Pink", which is raspberry vodka, raspberry liq, lemonade & sour. I'd order it again. One of the times I was there, I had a fried peanut butter and jelly, but it doesn't seem to be on the menu anymore, sadly (at least online). I settled for a honey-vanilla milkshake, which I think was $6 or so dollars. It was super creamy and the perfect sweet treat. We got our bill in a high heeled shoe, which was a fun little way to end the meal. This place is worth checking out if you're in the area, if you want a good burger and a fun atmosphere. They have daily drink specials online, so be sure to check those out too. This place is a chain, but I've only ever been to this one, and I had a pleasant experience.

6.description: Had some burgers here yesterday. 1. The woman at the hostess podium was rude and seemed put upon by having to seat us in the nearly empty restaurant around 3:00pm.2. Sat down to a filthy table. The lamp was caked in dust and crumbs, and the window sill and seat had crumbs. The table was sticky and dirty. 3. Why did we stay? We were really hungry.4. Ordered a burger and asked for medium. The menu states that all burgers will be cooked medium unless otherwise specified.5. The burger was well done.6. Our server was nice but seemed like she was overcompensating for this establishment that seems to have gone way downhill.Overall we decided we wouldn't come back.We had planned on going to the Little Bad Wolf but they were closed for an event so we decided on HM our old favorite and were so disappointed!

22.description: Another great hamburger place; so many options and add-on's it will take you 45 mins to order your first (cpl) time(s) there and your head will hurt, but the payoff is more than worth the pain. They brew their own beer and have a plethora of specialty drinks too. Fun lively atmosphere, trivia on Tues.

15.description: Not so Good Experience at Mary's Burger the women  bathroom  was worst than a fast food restaurant  bathroom.  SO BEFORE YOU ORDER CHECK THE BATHROOM. Spoke with the one of the Managers he didn't seem to think it was a big deal that on his watch the Bathroom  was nasty he was making light of the situation. They just lost a long time customer that lives in the area.

57.description: Went here based on past experience,  group of 6 could not be accommodated due to waitress boundry lines. Food took forever,stuffed cheeseburger was served with no stuffings and macaroni w/cheese did not taste well.

20.description: The staff is beyond nice. Thank you for printing out directions as my cell phone failed me. Great pretzel buns!

36.description: In one word, Hamburger Mary's is FABULOUS!!!We had a bachelorette party here on Monday night for dinner and bingo to follow. To start things off, they were very accommodating for our large group. The staff were so friendly and attentive and had us laughing all night long. TJ and Jason really bent over backwards to make our time there a memorable one. The food was ridiculously delicious and very reasonably priced. The drinks were strong and the vibe was electric. Velicity Metropolis was an excellent entertainer, and had everyone in the restaurant in stitches all night. This was such a fun place to kick off a wedding week, and we will definitely be back in the future!!

14.description: Great burger & beer selection, family friendly joint. Would definitely make a return visit.

58.description: The location is on point for boutique shopping, a nice stroll or local bars. The restaurant itself has fantastic service. The food tastes very authentic to Italian cooking... The menu is more varied with respect to the appetizers but still, everything is incredible!

56.description: Service:  Ask for the server, Ryan. He's great! You can't go wrong with him. He was attentive, helpful and friendly. We had a little one with us, and he was good with kids and made sure he was taken care of. Food:  It was ok.  It was not amazing. I did, however, enjoy the Goat Cheese Truffles. They had three different flavors served with arugula and thinly sliced and toasted bread yummies. The salmon was cooked nicely and juicy. It was served on a bed of mushrooms and asparagus. It was tasty, but not amazing. My friend had the pizza, and it was "ok". Wine:  Ryan had great suggestions, and I enjoyed the one he recommended. Ambiance:  The place looked like it has been repurposed. It's not fancy. It was a casual ambiance and it felt welcoming. Seating 411:  While we had our own table, there were some folks who are seated together at the larger tables in the middle. They had some space between them, but they shared a long table. That wouldn't be my preferred seating arrangement.

29.description: I absolutely love this place. Since my first time, I've been back about 10 times. Their wood fired pizzas are delicious (Diavola is my favorite), the decor is super warm and comfortable, I've never had bad service, they have some pretty good wines to choose from, and it's reasonable priced! Doesn't get much better than that!Oh, and every time, I get the Polenta Fries. Do. Not. Skip. Them!

42.description: When walking up to the restaurant it can get very confusing.  Facing the building you are immediately required to choose to through the left doors (Acre) or the right doors which is (Ombra).  We chose Ombra and it was a great choice!The place is small and intimate.  However, because how each of the seating areas are designed it feels very private.  I loved how I knew the place was crowded but I felt that we had our very own part of the restaurant. The service is fast, attentive and friendly.  We started with the calamari (wow, must get) and the meatballs.  Both were very good and tasty.  Keep in mind the appetizers are small plates so if you are super hungry or with a large group you may need to get more.Our table split 2 pizzas.  We got a salciccia (red pizza) and a carbonara (white pizza).  The carbonara was my favorite.  It was topped with pancetta, roasted garlic, farm egg, black pepper, mozzarella, and pecorino romano.  This was an amazing good pizza!If you are in the Andersonville area and want a very good meal, you gotta check this place out!

23.description: Love the place, love the staff, love the food.   An amazing dining treasure!!  If you need a drink, or dinner, or a place to chill - Ombra is it!!

47.description: Had a great time last night celebrating a best friend's birthday.  Enjoyed an outside table and the pleasant, friendly service combined with delicious food (prosciutto wrapped figs, polenta fries, olive tapenade bruschetone and margarita pizza) made for a memorable evening.

8.description: My gal pal asked if I wanted to go with her to Bar Ombra in Andersonville. I'm always game to try out a new place, so we agreed to go on a somewhat mild Sunday evening with the slight hint of a drizzle falling. I was surprised at the light crowd inside Ombra at this time, and I am sure that the tiny drizzle was not holding down the attendance but rather the Bears-Packers blowout that we were fortunate to have missed. The booths are decorated with a cowboy bar - meets - retro Italian look, as the Italian newsprint wallpaper jockeys with the custom leather seating pieces for your attention (am I sitting on a fragment of a leather jacket - including what looks like an old pocket?). Our hipster-ish waiter is apparently an acquired taste, for although I did not mind him too much, my gal pal developed a distaste for him. The "cicchetti" is a list of small bites, and perhaps we selected the largest of them - the arancini. The plate came with three rice balls, with a crunchy fried shell on the outside and the tasty rice ball with mushroom and porcini cream inside. We selected one red and one white pizza, and the two wood-fired pizzas came out in rapid-fire fashion. We both agreed that the red boscaiola was the better of the two, with a slew of toppings (mushroom, tomato, fontina, prosciutto, arugula, parmigiano). The overall taste was good, though all of these loose ingredients resulted in a virtual salad atop a crust rather than a pizza. The white ortolano also had a heap of ingredients (roasted garlic, fontina, asiago, mixed greens, parmigiano, balsamic) but it surprisingly did not add up to much in the flavor department. For dessert we shared a slice of an apple tart-like dessert with cranberries, caramel sauce and a dab of cream (and we think the apple peels were retained in the filling). It was fine but not memorable, as this dessert did not quite hit my cavity-ravaged sweet tooth. All in all I liked Ombra more than my dining companion. The pizza is fine but does not come close to that served by places like Spacca Napoli or Forno Rosso.

31.description: Here's the skinny on Bar Ombra.They have wood-fired pizzas.  I LOVE wood fired pizzas.  They have a seriously solid interior.  The booths are all made from reclaimed leather scraps and it looks cool as hell.  Excellent music ranging from Ellie Goulding to Passion Pit to Lana Del Rey - dig it.Very, very friendly service.So where did we go from cool to mediocre?Well... a few things.  The Three P's, if you will.1. The pizza.  While I appreciate a good wood-fired pizza, the crust wasn't all that.  It was kind of doughy and didn't get any kind of crisp.  And while I liked the house-made sausage, I didn't think it had any heat or spice.  Kick it up a notch, chefs.  I also think I would go vegetarian and just avoid the meats.2. The pacing.  Everything came SUPER fast.  Like, so fast that we had apps, drinks, dinner and dessert and were out of there in well under an hour.  On a Friday night.  Let me enjoy my meal.  Don't force the food on me quite so quickly.3. The pricing.  Everything was just a little overpriced.  Several bucks more than I would expect for a pizza.  Drinks were a lot.  But most insulting was the pasta.  A meatless pesto cavatelli was $14.  For the tiniest serving ever.  My fiancee and I had one spoonful each of pasta (we shared) and that was it.  I mean... I'm clearly not cheap by any means, but a fair warning to all: The value isn't there on the pastas.Would I go back?  Yes.  They have $10 pizzas and $5 wine of Tuesday, which is great.  I live about a block away.  And let's be real: I LOVE wood-fired pizzas.  It's just not as good as some other options.

34.description: Phenomenal service, great cocktails, and unbelievable food.  Everything is clearly made to order, fresh and delicious. All the bruschettas are fantastic, mussels were delicious.  Will be coming back here many times.

16.description: I absolutely love this place. Since my first time, I've been back about 10 times. Their wood fired pizzas are delicious (Diavola is my favorite), the decor is super warm and comfortable, I've never had bad service, they have some pretty good wines to choose from, and it's reasonable priced! Doesn't get much better than that!Oh, and every time, I get the Polenta Fries. Do. Not. Skip. Them!

13.description: Incredibly knowledgeable staff who was very attentive despite how busy the rest of the restaurant was.  The oysters were described expertly and came out deliciously and well prepared.  The wine selection was absolutely excellent.  The pizza was delightful and very flavorful.  The only things keeping it from being a 5 star is the service that was a little less attentive than it could have been (but I recognize that the bartender, who was also taking care of our table, had the entire bar and several tables on her own!).

11.description: Meh. This place was just okay. The pasta was fresh and tasty, but the service was a little......strange. Our server would randomly be absent for extended periods of time and seemed to be too busy flirting with the other servers to really care that we were there. Based on the somewhat upscale atmosphere, I expected a little more enthusiasm. And crappy coffee to top it all off? C'mon! If you're going to serve fancy-ish dessert, you need to at least serve a decent cup of joe. Not some crap that comes out of a Mr. Coffee machine.

39.description: My gal pal asked if I wanted to go with her to Bar Ombra in Andersonville. I'm always game to try out a new place, so we agreed to go on a somewhat mild Sunday evening with the slight hint of a drizzle falling. I was surprised at the light crowd inside Ombra at this time, and I am sure that the tiny drizzle was not holding down the attendance but rather the Bears-Packers blowout that we were fortunate to have missed. The booths are decorated with a cowboy bar - meets - retro Italian look, as the Italian newsprint wallpaper jockeys with the custom leather seating pieces for your attention (am I sitting on a fragment of a leather jacket - including what looks like an old pocket?). Our hipster-ish waiter is apparently an acquired taste, for although I did not mind him too much, my gal pal developed a distaste for him. The "cicchetti" is a list of small bites, and perhaps we selected the largest of them - the arancini. The plate came with three rice balls, with a crunchy fried shell on the outside and the tasty rice ball with mushroom and porcini cream inside. We selected one red and one white pizza, and the two wood-fired pizzas came out in rapid-fire fashion. We both agreed that the red boscaiola was the better of the two, with a slew of toppings (mushroom, tomato, fontina, prosciutto, arugula, parmigiano). The overall taste was good, though all of these loose ingredients resulted in a virtual salad atop a crust rather than a pizza. The white ortolano also had a heap of ingredients (roasted garlic, fontina, asiago, mixed greens, parmigiano, balsamic) but it surprisingly did not add up to much in the flavor department. For dessert we shared a slice of an apple tart-like dessert with cranberries, caramel sauce and a dab of cream (and we think the apple peels were retained in the filling). It was fine but not memorable, as this dessert did not quite hit my cavity-ravaged sweet tooth. All in all I liked Ombra more than my dining companion. The pizza is fine but does not come close to that served by places like Spacca Napoli or Forno Rosso.

37.description: great atmosphere, tapas and service is excellent. a neighborhood fav. the Martinis were tasty. I'd recommend the meatballs.

0.description: Did I die and go to food heaven here? It's possible. We tried to get into Anteprima at 6PM on a Saturday night and they couldn't take up so they directed us to Ombra. All I can say is Spaghetti Carbonara. Get it. Don't think twice about it. The portion was some would deem as small but really it's probably what a normal portion of pasta should be. None the less, I could have licked the bowl. Perhaps next time I will?One thing that would keep me from going at a peak hour is you sort of have to share the tables. The table that we sat in was essentially a long booth with some kind of partition in the middle of it to make it two tables. That's a little too close for comfort for me. So I plan to keep it early and keep coming back to Ombra for some Spag Carb.

38.description: The review is for the service. Which sucked, The waiter snobbishly and answered our questions and made us feel like we couldn't talk to him. The food was amazing I ordered the Amish chicken and my wife got the gnocchi they were both delicious. The salad was salty though I liked it but it was a little weird. All in all we had a good time and the food was good but again the service sucked.

51.description: This place is amazing! Been here twice and was not disappointed. Service is terrific and the food is the best!! My friends and I had Jonathin as a server and he was wonderful! So attentive, nice, funny, and made it a pleasant experience! I would recommend this place to anyone!

27.description: terrible service,  terrible food,  what happened to this place?  Never again.

32.description: My feelings on this place are mixed. I wanted to really like this place, but I walked away just kind of "meh", indifferent.The look is great. My friend described it as "woody" and after laughing I came to realize he was correct. It's like inside a hipster log cabin. It's cute, cozy, and fun.The food was just OK. We got a smattering of appetizers and a pizza. The goat cheese truffles  were so lackluster, which was disappointing because I really was looking forward to them the most. In my head I thought they were going to be a fun take on goat cheese and truffles and offer some interesting tastes. Instead, they were goat cheese rolled into TINY balls and dusted with some different spices. Were they bad? No. Were they creative? No. I feel like I would have made them in a crunch when having friends over and trying to make my baron fridge look like it's stocked with amazing stuff. I'd take goat cheese (that I would have), roll it into a ball, and then roll that in paprika and BOOM. The roasted vegetables were good. The polenta fries were also really good and I enjoy the dipping sauce. The pizza was also pretty decent, but not memorable. It was wood fired, but kind of bland overall.
