I didn't hate it and it was tasty, but I guess I was just hoping something was going to hook me.The service was really good and I felt the prices were reasonable overall.I'd give Ombra a second chance, but I wouldn't go out of my way to get there again. I think for the price it's somewhere I won't say no to, but probably not a top of mind spot.

54.description: I've been a couple times and have loved it on both occasions.  All the staff is very well informed on the menu and drinks available.  On my most recent visit last night, my friend and I sat at the bar for a bite and a drink. One of the servers/bartenders made a really good recommendation on wine after telling him what I was looking for.  I got the Gavi, an italian white which was perfect.  Meredith is the bartender and she couldn't be a better one, very polite and and definitely took GREAT care of us.  I will absolutely be coming back.

48.description: There's good and there's bad.We stopped to grab a quick dinner on Monday night. Originally we were going to do just small bites, but the wood fired pizza was calling my name. We decided on 1 small bite, and 1 pizza to share between two people.We ordered the stuffed zucchini flower, and the ortolano pizza ( roasted garlic, fontina, asiago, mixed greens, parmigiano, balsamic).The waiter returned a few seconds later to inform us it's buy one pizza get one free from Sunday - Thursday. Do we want another? Yeeeeeeeeeeees!!!!!I went with the piccante (spicy rapini, smoked mozzarella, pine nuts, calabrian chilli vinaigrette).First the bad - the stuffed zucchini flower for $10 consisted of 2 pieces. One was smaller than my thumb, and I have dainty hands. The other was about the size of my dainty handed thumb.  Was it good? Yes. But I took the smaller of the two because I'm nice to my husband, and I honestly don't even feel it was a full bite. So we were disappointed.Now the good - the pizza is fantastic! The crust was very crisp, no soggy bottoms here. We had 2 white pizzas, so I can't vouch if the red sauce ups the ante on the soggy factor.Husband loved the ortolano, I thought it was just alright, but good on me, I got to chow down on the piccante. Yes, it's spicy, yes, it's delicious, and for the love of god, it was FREE!So I forgive them their terrible small zucchini flower bite, and congratulate them on 1. Having fantastic pizza2. Having a beautiful inviting space. Really, take a peek in the window, it's warm and lovely3. Having nice, accommodating servers4. Having a decently priced while plentiful wine list - my borgonero was SO good5. Being my new go to pizza place

44.description: Great welcoming staff and service, but I left hungry. I had pasta with spicy greens and homemade sausage, which was a decent portion, but I couldn't eat because of the bitterness of greens, meatballs (appetizer) that were ok, and three tiny but tasty figs (appetizer) with mascarpone cheese. Come here if it's dinner time and you're not super hungry, or if you're into the small plate dining.

24.description: We came in 15 minutes before the posted closing time .. My bf found this place after our New Orleans trip !!! He knows that I only ate oyster that time in New Orleans!!!  The staff who attended to us that night was super friendly and very much attentive . She sat us up and was able to get our order before the kitchen closed .. The oysters were good !! The selection of wine I would say is great .. Well even though I'mNot a wine taste authority but I can say if the wine is good !!! .. The ambience is eclectic with a twist of musculinity .. There are fusion of leather everywhere .. Which made the place sexy and hot !!!

7.description: I had a reservation for four on a Saturday night. Two of us arrived together, and were told we couldn't be seated until our party was complete (common practice and not a problem). I then see a group of people breeze right past me and tell the hostess, "We're 7 now, but we'll probably be about 9 or 10". The hostess grabbed some menus and quickly led them to the back of the restaurant. When she returned, I tried to point out what had just happened - an incomplete party had just been seated, while I had been told to wait until the rest of my group arrived. The hostess turned me and said, "They're regulars, ok? And they're a party of 10". She then directed me to the bar and told me to wait. I go to Ombra once every few weeks. If I have people visiting who enjoy Italian food, I make a point of taking them there. I don't know how often I need to go somewhere to be considered a "regular", but I know I won't be going back to Ombra.

49.description: My first time at Ombra tonight, we joined friends at a table outside, we all had a horrible experience at the end of our time tonight, apparently we stayed too long because the manager! asked us to leave ! We won't be back and won't recommend it to anyone.

40.description: Rustic romance could best describe this place. I wasn't here on a date, and as I ventured through by myself to meet up with my group of friends, I was initially intimidated by an initial vibe of exclusivity. It's rustic, but smooth, dark and romantic and I felt like I was walking into a private club for which I had no membership.  I don't know why I felt that way because it turned out to be a nice place with friendly patrons.  Service was at a relaxed pace, but that was fine considering how enjoyable their drinks and wine are. I had wine, my friends ordered a variety of drinks, all very tasty. I liked their wine glasses -- wide mouths and cut edges are what I seek. The small plates of food were tasty and presented beautifully, but very little food for the money. I would definitely not advise bringing a big appetite, or else will need to go through a lot of plates!  --But then again, if you don't mind spending the money, I guess having to order a tonne of plates is not such a bad thing, because the food here is fresh and delicious!

53.description: Daughter and I just had an amazing meal at Ombra in Andersonville. They offer small plate options for many Italian favorites. Their wine selection is amazing, and all of their wines were expertly selected and available by the glass. I started with a Rossi di Montepulciano la Bertille Tuscano which was delectable. We sampled their meatballs, which were a mix of beef and pork, served with a light marinara sauce; they were delicious! We followed with roasted beet and arugula salad and a terrine of wood fired cauliflower with parmesan cheese, both were perfect. We split their wood fired seared Scottish salmon entree, served with arugula, asparagus and shitake mushrooms. What can I say? The salmon was seared to perfection, seasoned perfectly, while still moist. Along the way I had a glass of valpolicella Ripaso, Tomassi Veneto - it was like drinking red velvet. We  split a pannicotta with strawberry reduction dessert, creamy heavenly perfection. Our waiter, Jonathan was the best. He gave excellent recommendations throughout the meal. I give this restaurant my highest recommendation.

30.description: Had Valentine's dinner at Ombra with my wife last night. Had an 8pm reservation and was seated immediately. The decor of the restaurant is kind of hard to describe. Kind of Old Italian meets old west. The way the booths are set up make you feel like you have your own private book which is nice. We ordered the salciccia wood fired pizza which was great. It had a nice smoky flavor and the house made Italian sausage was terrific. We also got the shrimp cocktail, root vegetables, and pancetta wrapped dates, all of which were really good Since it was Valentine's Day, we decided to splurge on dessert. My wife got the apple-cranberry bread pudding and I got tiramisu. They were both amazing!!Our server was very friendly and attentive and all of the food came fairly quickly, especially for a busy Saturday night. The price was great. For everything above and a couple of sodas, it was less than $65.   Very reasonable in my opinion. We will definitely be back.

46.description: Great ambience and wood fired pizza!. Friendly, woofy staff of furry fun waiters and bartenders. Great food! Try the pancetta and arugula pizza. The strawberry bellini cocktail was also awesome.

1.description: We were at Ombra for the first time, earlier this month, with friends.  It was a very disappointing experience, to say the least.  When my "pizza" was served, it was clearly burned to a cinder like object.  The waiter was nice, and apologetic, and comped the pizza and offered a substitute appetizer, and Limoncello shots for the 4 of us.  This was handled properly, but still made for a miserable dinner for all of us.Also, the atmosphere is absolutely hideous and makes no sense.  Uncomfortabel and claustrophobic seating, and just really an unpleasant environment.  It's hard to believe that it has any relation to Anteprima or Acre.  To be clear, I felt the service, though somewhat slow, did handle the situation in a proper manner.

55.description: Enjoying Italian tapas with friends in a restaurant that has a relaxed, Western vibe was definitely a one-of-a-kind experience. Out of all the cicchetti we tried, I especially liked the polenta fries. The goat cheese truffles paired well with the brut rose sparkling wine. The baby spinach salad with roasted beets, toasted walnuts, and gorgonzola was also very refreshing. Since I'm a vegetarian in a group of carnivores, we got boscaiola pizza, but I requested the waiter to omit prosciutto from 1/4 of the pizza. He happily obliged, and the pizza turned out deliciously! The only strange thing is that Bar Ombra shares a bathroom with Acre next door. Despite that, I'd definitely come back again.

9.description: I think Ombra wins as my favorite Andersonville restaurant. I feel the perfect meal starts with a dozen oysters, 2-3 of the small plates and at least one wood-fired pizza (depending on the size of your group). I especially like that Ombra has one of the better oyster deals in the city without skimping on quality!

26.description: If I gave this review just on food and atmosphere, I would give Bar Ombra five stars. I loved the baked goat cheese and Margherita pizza. Both were so delicious, and the bread in both were addicting. The Castello was a yummy blend of bourbon and Amaretto. The service at Bar Ombra is sub par. Our waiter was horrible - only showed up twice and never asked what we wanted. We had to flag him down several times to put in our order. He did not seem to care that we existed, and made us feel unappreciated as customers. I'll go back knowing that I can save money by not leaving any tip for the awful service we'll get.

25.description: Horrible service -- just nonexistent. Our pizza was just bread: almost no sauce or toppings. What a waste.

12.description: Food was very tasty and homemade pasta dishes (gnocchi yum!) were fantastic.  Polenta fries (looks more like a bread stick) were delicious and a bit of spicy kick!  Salads were average but were very fresh.   Pizza was pretty good and chewy crust as coal oven style.  Service was spotty but overall pretty good.

59.description: This review is past due.  It was one of the first warm nights in April and everyone, I mean everyone was sitting outside at all the Andersonville Restaurants.  Wait times for an outside table were at least an hour at all other restaurants told to us by all snooty hostesses at all restaurants with an attitude.  As my partner and I were walking down Clark Street with our puppy, we saw there was an outside table available at Ombra. I went inside and there was a man seating people. First of all I was greeted with a smile, and then I asked him if we could sit at the table outside that seemed available. He was so nice and told me without hesitation go ahead and sit at the table and he'll send someone out to wait on us. That was great!  With an attitude like that I knew I was going to like this restaurant.Point I am trying to make: 1) I had no idea he was the owner Tim, until I just read an article about his restaurant and recognized him in the picture.2) He was so kind and pleasant, and had a great smile and very accomodating at seating us, not like any of the other restaurants.It was one of the most enjoyable outdoor dinners, food was delicious and because of his great customer service and his way made the evening eating outside very enjoyable.By the way, after the meal, I went in the restaurant to try to thank him for such a nice experience and meal, but I couldn't find him.He is a perfect example of how restaurant people, owners, waitstaff, should treat their customers.Because of our experience at his restaurant we have returned again and will continue to return in the future.One suggestion to the owners.  I didn't know what some of your small plates were and not familiar with all the Italian names and ingredients.  Maybe when you redo your menu, you could explain with a little description of each entree, appetizer, etc.

21.description: Meh. This place was just okay. The pasta was fresh and tasty, but the service was a little......strange. Our server would randomly be absent for extended periods of time and seemed to be too busy flirting with the other servers to really care that we were there. Based on the somewhat upscale atmosphere, I expected a little more enthusiasm. And crappy coffee to top it all off? C'mon! If you're going to serve fancy-ish dessert, you need to at least serve a decent cup of joe. Not some crap that comes out of a Mr. Coffee machine.

17.description: Just got back from dinner at Bar Ombra and I will be honest - we were a difficult table and our waiter handled it perfectly. We arrived fairly early on Friday night to beat the rush, but one member of our party informed us she would be late. We were seated almost immediately regardless so we could order drinks while we waited at our table. I wish I knew our waiter's name, because he did an excellent job all night and was very attentive. He made recommendations on the wine, kept tabs on our table without being disruptive, and when the last member of our party arrived nearly an hour(!!!) late, he was ready to make suggestions on what to order. We split a margherita pizza as an appetizer and, while I prefer my crust to be a little crispier, it was tasty and really hit the spot. We each got a pasta dish as an entree. I got the tagliatelle, which was hearty and beefy.The pasta tasted fresh and was cooked really well. We also ordered the gnocchi and orecchiette. Everyone was very happy with their food! I was hesitant to try this place due to a few reviews about the service, but we honestly could not have asked for better. I'm really glad we gave Bar Ombra a try and had a great night out because of it.

10.description: Really like this place. Have been here probably 6 times, a couple times at the bar during summer which is lovely and more recently dined inside at booths. Have never been disappointed. The pizza is excellent. Not the best I have ever had but a solid 8, whatever that means, and I am pretty picky about this type of pizza. Better than many who have a reputation for being the best, etc. The small plates have all been great. Great take on veggie dishes, about which I commented that it was nice to have a place with that going on. The mussels are first rate with a great light red sauce based with pancetta. I asked for non-spicy and was obliged. Tasty and bacony. The wait staff is super friendly and on top of things. Try the brussel sprout dish. It will get you to eat your veggies. The squash caponata was excellent. And, of course the polenta sticks are the bomb. It's all super tasty, reasonable, and you can order healthfully if you wish. Until the bread pudding, that is. Which is delish and of course not light. Good house-made limoncello and other 'cellos with unique flavors. My only complaint is that the booths are so private I can't spy and snoop on other people, which for them is definitely a benefit. BTW the decor is very cool with endless layers of interest to explore. Great place!

5.description: The food was okay-to-good, but the service was very inattentive--when does a waiter not check whether you want another drink?!--and the space (while aesthetically pleasing) is not air-conditioned. I would say: definitely don't go if it's more than 75 degrees, and other than that only go if you're in the neighborhood, and it's convenient. The best thing I tasted (and I was at dinner with 10 people, so I tasted many things) was the mercato pizza. Which was good. But you shouldn't go in the summer, and I imagine it's not available in the winter (since it features summer squash). So.

3.description: The most horrible service i have had. Our server hipsterish ,snobby ,unfriendly guy was rude!! We felt like we weren't welcome and rushed.   The food was ok and portions are very small. We asked for bread with parmesan cheese which was brought by busboy. That bread was dried out like 5 months old. Very disappoint ing-(

35.description: The only reason this place gets two stars is because the wine was great. I'm going to make this short and not so sweet because I don't want to spend any more time thinking about the crap food.#1 Oysters. If you have oysters on your menu, they better be freaking good. They should not be the size of my thumbnail and/or be translucent and stringy. Don't bother with them. Canned oysters at Mariano's would do you better. #2 Goat cheese truffle. We misread. We thought it was to be goat cheese in truffle oil. So we were disappointed when three balls of cheese showed up. The crustini was tasty, but the cheese was hard and too cold. #3 Dates wrapped in bacon with gorgonzola cheese. I make these, so I know how they should be. They, like the oysters, were made for the Oompa Loompas or Mini Me. So small, you hardly got any taste. They were, however, drenched in enough grease to give me an oil change.#4 Special whitefish with spinach and fingerling potatoes. Soggy, soggy, soggy. Again, swimming (haha...see what I did there...whitefish, swimming) in oils and butter. We did each get two glasses of wine that were great. Our bill was 85 bucks without tip. I would have rather have just gotten the wine and given the 50 bucks to a Street Wise vendor. I have no idea why this place gets four stars when there are so many other places to visit in Andersonville. Their pizza in wood oven? Maybe. We didn't get that. My husband said we should go back. I told him he'd be going on his own. I will frequent Spacca Napoli for wood fired pizza as I know the other items on their menu are also delicious. Other places in Andersonville that are better you ask? Big Jones, Anteprima, Kopi Cafe, Lady Gregory's, Hoppin' Hots, Pot Belly. Jeez. I'd even go to Konak for food before I'd go back to Ombra.

19.description: Impressive!Bar Ombra, while definitely, trendy and for the younger crowd, was pleasantly friendly towards the 50+ visitors. The food was tasty and seasoned well. The atmosphere was very eye appealing, and the noise level rather bearable. The only down side of the evening - was the price of everything. Ok, call me cheap. I have no problem paying a well earned dollar for a high quality meal, however, what it was, was rather pricey. Why, is that every nice place out there now a days; has to seemingly - price gouge. Whatever happened to the day when the goal was to get customers to return because the quality of the food was outstanding and complemented the atmosphere?Is the goal only to get while the getting is good and stand and wait for the next sucker - I mean customer. (Yes, I am referring to myself and hubby as suckers). We should have seen this one coming a mile off, but since it was a birthday gathering... You get the picture. The neighborhood is interesting and nice to walk around in - it's rather quaint.If you're looking for a nice restaurant to impress someone - Bar Ombra would definitely make the list. However, it's good enough, for turning around and marching right out the bar after viewing the menu .....

28.description: Extremely disappointing.I was expecting great food after a friend told me about this place. The food was just average. The caponata was made of carrots instead of tomatoes, everything was very salty. The best dish, the cauliflower. The wines super expensive for this kind of place. The host lovely, the waiter extremely rude. I would never go back.

45.description: LOVED the cauliflower gratin and polenta fries, but especially the atmosphere. People appear to come here to enjoy themselves, boisterously and lovingly. Everyone was buoyant - starting with every member of the waitstaff who visited our table - and it was contagious. The 16-year-old among us found it to be perfection, and we all know how hard it is at 16 to be happy and impressed by anything. The decor is wonderfully whimsical and the seating is comfortable, with a foot-rest in the booths. And finally, my martini (should I be embarrassed to say it was a Cosmo?) was delicious - not cloyingly sweet as they so often are (not that that stops me from drinking them!). Thank you for a wonderful night. We will make this a regular stop when we visit Andersonville, and will make it a destination if our plans would not otherwise take us to Andersonville.

33.description: I love this place.  I love the original decor, the less-than-perfect wood floors, the cozy nook-like booths, the faded Italian newspapers that cover the walls.  The food is a really good modern interpretation of Italian cuisine.  As an appetizer the polenta fries were crunchy and amazing, and the wood fired veggies with balsamic were rich and tasty. The pizza is wood-fired and thin, yet has a nice chewy and lightly charred crust around it.  I had a veggie pizza with a somewhat spicy tomato sauce.   The chef actually surprised me with seasonal veggies.  It was really delicious and how nice that the chef took the time to make something special.  Another standout was the arugula salad.  It was fresh and lightly dressed.  The service was attentive and friendly.  I'd go back to Ombra in a heartbeat.  It's warm and cozy and a good place to spend a cold evening.

43.description: Corn salad. Amazing! Still thinking about it a week later. Spinach with beets. Great, and I don't even like beets. 4 cheese pizza. Awesome! Added basil to it and it was to die for. Anteprima is a favorite of mine so I am happy that this place is just as amazing. Next stop, Acre!

2.description: Tried the red pizza - amatriciana,and love the crispy wood fired style of the pizza.  Not sure if the rest of the group liked or wanted to try the pizza though as we had a lot left over and it was fairly small, yet we had a group of 7 of us. The orecchiette pasta dish was OK, but a bit small for the price.  Service for us was decent.  I think if we go back, again, (not sure if my friends were crazy about the place), I would have small plates and skip the pricier entrees which are really not much bigger than the small plates. For dessert, the Chocolate Salami, looked awesome, but was a bust when it came to taste. A bit dry... again, a lot left over so this was a case of presentation outdoing the taste.

18.description: I love this place.  I love the original decor, the less-than-perfect wood floors, the cozy nook-like booths, the faded Italian newspapers that cover the walls.  The food is a really good modern interpretation of Italian cuisine.  As an appetizer the polenta fries were crunchy and amazing, and the wood fired veggies with balsamic were rich and tasty. The pizza is wood-fired and thin, yet has a nice chewy and lightly charred crust around it.  I had a veggie pizza with a somewhat spicy tomato sauce.   The chef actually surprised me with seasonal veggies.  It was really delicious and how nice that the chef took the time to make something special.  Another standout was the arugula salad.  It was fresh and lightly dressed.  The service was attentive and friendly.  I'd go back to Ombra in a heartbeat.  It's warm and cozy and a good place to spend a cold evening.

41.description: Social Media lead me to Bar Ombra. I had been to restaurants in this area before and loved them. I've just come to assume that anything along this strip would be fantastic. At Bar Ombra, not so much. I also feel like the layout of the menu was even a little disorganized but maybe there is some kind of logic involved that I don't understand. I definitely brought my appetite, and I am fully aware of what it means to be hungry.Go for any of the items under the Cicchetti section. I think the restaurant likes to invest more of their time in these tiny little dishes resembling tapas. I cannot deny the irony there, considering their wood fired items, the pizzas, did not turn out even a fraction to what I have had elsewhere. Then they want to charge $15 for the tiny little pizzas just because they decide to throw a few pieces of high-quality greens over the top, then call it a day. My white pizza Ortolano, tasted like a dry piece of cardboard with a house salad thrown over the top of it. The red pizza Boscaiola, was better, but only because they added meat, and the sauce itself was a little spicy, but it didn't taste like it was from scratch. I wanted to taste olive oil, and basil or oregano. The bread was dry, too tough on the outside and flavorless on the inside. The waiter did bring oregano and crushed red peppers, but dry oregano doesn't really open up with flavor unless it gets moist with whatever you're cooking it in.The Farro Arancini appetizer/tapas was the best out of everything we had, but honestly, I make a mean chicken and rice dish at home that tastes just the same if not better. The rice is exactly the same. Lets face it, any of us should be able to accomplish this same dish in the kitchen. It was good, but not some epic culinary adventure in my mouth.Last, I was not impressed with the service. My waiter must have walked by my table twice without even noticing my empty wine glass. Then walked by my table once when I was ready for him to take the bill. The second time I had to stop him. He even had the audacity to snap at me, asking me if everything was okay with a snarky tone. I barely finished asking him to take the check before he cut me off. I would have given him a piece of my mind had I not had a dinner date (a friend I respect) with me who hates confrontation. The waiter was lucky I tipped him 20%. I tried to exercise as much grace as I could but this guy had me fuming. He was even wearing a hat the entire time he served our table. Last I checked, old school class is making a comeback. Take your hat off, bro.I should have listened to my coworker. He warned me that he felt the food went down in quality. I think he said it changed owners. He wasn't lying. Also, the footrest under my seat had broken so I was left to swing my legs under the table. The seats are high for some reason, so no one's legs reach the ground. After working 7 hours on my feet, that seriously disappointed me. There are plenty of wonderful reviews here, but don't come here expecting much. I have to agree with one Yelper, the music they play is really good, I enjoyed listening to Tove lo, Habits (Oliver nelson remix, which is my favorite) while I was there. But really, I didn't come here to pay as much as I did to only listen to good music.

52.description: This is a difficult review to write because I love Bar Ombra. The food is wonderful and the staff has always been informed, relaxed and cheerful.  I especially love their fresh, reasonably-priced salads.  I love all their Italian (?) waiters. And their gregarious, light-hearted bartender with the blond mohawk is one of the best in Andersonville.  However, I've had very bad experiences at Ombra lately.  The manager hovers over tables, interjecting at strange times and following around our server with a strange sense of distrust. It just feels awkward.  I've been in there with big groups and intimate groups and he has given me (and my friends) the same bizarre attention each time. It's hawkish and also fake...a strange combo.  It has made me STOP wanting to go to Ombra.  Some of my lesbian friends are convinced he hates women.  My straight friends with kids have said that he makes them feel like an inconvenience. It's strange. But other than that - Ombra is a bright terrific spot in Andersonville and I'm glad it exists.

50.description: We tried the new Ombra the other night and I highly recommend it.  We had two different wood fired pizzas  - one with red sauce and one white, and both were excellent.  They have really change the food menu, but the cocktails are still innovative and tasty.

4.description: Here's the skinny on Bar Ombra.They have wood-fired pizzas.  I LOVE wood fired pizzas.  They have a seriously solid interior.  The booths are all made from reclaimed leather scraps and it looks cool as hell.  Excellent music ranging from Ellie Goulding to Passion Pit to Lana Del Rey - dig it.Very, very friendly service.So where did we go from cool to mediocre?Well... a few things.  The Three P's, if you will.1. The pizza.  While I appreciate a good wood-fired pizza, the crust wasn't all that.  It was kind of doughy and didn't get any kind of crisp.  And while I liked the house-made sausage, I didn't think it had any heat or spice.  Kick it up a notch, chefs.  I also think I would go vegetarian and just avoid the meats.2. The pacing.  Everything came SUPER fast.  Like, so fast that we had apps, drinks, dinner and dessert and were out of there in well under an hour.  On a Friday night.  Let me enjoy my meal.  Don't force the food on me quite so quickly.3. The pricing.  Everything was just a little overpriced.  Several bucks more than I would expect for a pizza.  Drinks were a lot.  But most insulting was the pasta.  A meatless pesto cavatelli was $14.  For the tiniest serving ever.  My fiancee and I had one spoonful each of pasta (we shared) and that was it.  I mean... I'm clearly not cheap by any means, but a fair warning to all: The value isn't there on the pastas.Would I go back?  Yes.  They have $10 pizzas and $5 wine of Tuesday, which is great.  I live about a block away.  And let's be real: I LOVE wood-fired pizzas.  It's just not as good as some other options.

6.description: We came in 15 minutes before the posted closing time .. My bf found this place after our New Orleans trip !!! He knows that I only ate oyster that time in New Orleans!!!  The staff who attended to us that night was super friendly and very much attentive . She sat us up and was able to get our order before the kitchen closed .. The oysters were good !! The selection of wine I would say is great .. Well even though I'mNot a wine taste authority but I can say if the wine is good !!! .. The ambience is eclectic with a twist of musculinity .. There are fusion of leather everywhere .. Which made the place sexy and hot !!!

22.description: Ombra is one of my favorite places in the city. Always consistently tasty, with plenty of options. You never get the same meal twice. Highly recommend the cavatelli, artichoke caponata, chicken Milanese (I usually don't order breaded things, but it was worth the carbs) and chocolate salami for dessert. Jeremy was our server this evening and he was so knowledgeable about each dish, which enhanced what is always a culinary delight. He felt bad about rushing us because the kitchen closes at 11 (we got there at 10:30, but the search results on Google said they were open til midnight) so he gave us a little treat as an apology. Perfect way to cap off the meal, and I think I need to book a trip to Italy ASAP.

15.description: Things change. Sometimes for the better, sometimes in the other direction. When Ombra opened it was superb. It's become rather mediocre at best, and the warmth is no longer there.

57.description: I've only been living in Chicago for 6 months, but from my experience most of the restaurants in Chicago are decent - or else they don't last.This restaurant was a SHAME! Little quantity of food is good enough for a gastronomic restaurant, but to give such a little quantity of pasta for $15.00 is very CHEAP.  My wife and I were still hungry, so we tried a pizza. It was 95% dough with tiny pieces of meat and vegetables.  Average, nothing special at all.  Dine here only if you are NOT hungry or if you are drunk!!!  This is supposed to be an Italian restaurant?  If you're Italian, try this place and see what you think...

20.description: We made reservations and were still seated at a communal booth while people who just came in and were seated in private booths. Super annoying, as it was our anniversary. Our service was not exactly stellar, either. The waiter dealing with private booths was excellent-we figured out everything we need to know from listening to him explain everything to the table across from us. Also, super annoying. The food was nothing to write home about...especially for north of $200. Throwing salt into the wound was that we wandered over to Acre for a post-dinner drink we found it be wayyyy more our speed-better menu, better decor, better everything. We will DEFINITELY try Acre-and yes, I know they're affilated with Ombra, but I liken that to Old Navy (Ombra) & Banana Republic (Acre). You know they're under the umbrella,  but one is way better quality.

36.description: Great wood oven pizza! They've perfected their dough since they first installed the oven. No longer doughy.  Nice and thin and perfect rim of crust now. Love the small plates. Favorites are polenta fries, farRo arancini balls, pancetta wrapped Gorgonzola filled dates, & deviled eggs.Great cocktails made by Meredith the experienced and cheerful bartender. She makes a great Manhattan, negroni or a number of specialty cocktails.In the warmer months they open the front windows and have seating outside on the sidewalk. It feels like your on vacation.

14.description: Very tasty food, a little on the expensive side. I would recommend the baked goat cheese. It was super delicious.  This place is also perfect for snacking on lots of different dishes since its tapas style.Unfortunately, the server was fairly rude to my friend, which is why I am giving this review three stars instead of four. I think he may have been upset at first because it seemed like we were just having drinks, but we all ended up ordering fairly generous amounts of food. His mood lifted the more orders we placed, but it would have been nice to be treated well no matter how much money he thought we were spending there.Because I didn't feel valued as a customer, I doubt I'll return -- there are so many other places to go in Andersonville!

28.description: specialty is right.  what do you want?  they've got it.  yeah they do.  seriously, they do.  what film are you looking for?  "the lost skeleton of cadavra"??? hm.  oh .... wait.... here it is.  that'll be $4.

1.description: It's not often I go to a video store, but I prefer this one for the times I do.  I recently got a dvd that did not play, and returned it the same day.  They will check to see if it plays on their end and refund me if it doesn't.  I'd prefer the refund upfront since it didn't play on my machines that play other discs (unless they are inviting us to watch it in their place), but I understand that some dvd's are old and scratched from regular use.  They have a decent selection when you don't feel like RedBox, Netflix, Hulu, or other streaming sites and are pleasant enough you can just walk in and ask for what you want or what you're in the mood for.

9.description: I called ahead to find a  certain movie. Dude said he had it. When I got there, he couldnt find it.Therefore making my call ahead useless and a waste of time.I've been burned.

29.description: so far so good, I personally have liked the documentary selections there. It's great to walk in and go through their stacks of documentaries and find that the ones they have are selectively stocked. For those that are interested, there's a large porn section in the back mostly geared towards a gay crowd. Go on a Monday for their $2 deal, new movies are $2 for two days and old movies are $2 for 3 days!

23.description: This place is fantastic, they have an incredible selection of movies that I highly enjoy and care about most: horror and cult movies. Their prices are pretty reasonable and I definitely see myself using this place quite often to discover movies on a regular basis. But watch out they have a massive selection of gay porn. Holy geez it's huge. Watch out for the Cyberbears.

5.description: There is something about Specialty Video that makes me feel like everything is going to be OK. Maybe its the novelty of actually going into a video store now that most have vanished from the earth. I just feel good when I am here. Specialty Video has a huge selection, all their new releases for movies and TV shows line their walls but there are endless classics to choose from. To me, going to Specialty Video is like an activity. Something to do on Saturday night. Wade through their video selection in a way that Netflix does not allow. Speaking of, while Netflix is convenient, they limit so much of what you can see because of their stupid genres they have determined you like. Specialty Video allows you to look through all the genres and movies and tv shows made over the last 60 or 70 years and see all those Schwarzenegger titles that Netflix is hiding from you. Forgot that The Critic existed? Specialty Video wont let you forget because they have all their cartoons ready for you, waiting. It's the best way to remind yourself there is so much more out there to watch and Netflix is keeping it from you. Thats part of the fun, what will I find at Specialty Video today? I almost never go in with a particular title in mind. I let their selection guide. I am always rewarded. Plus if you're feeling subversive you can go to their back section and get all the porn and butt plugs you can handle!  Everyone wins!

31.description: This indie retailer kicks Blockbuster's ass. Specialty has a great selection, and stocks the kind of stuff the chains don't. And not just esoteric stuff. Recently, a friend and I wanted to rent some classic films: Marx Brothers, screwball comedy, that sort. We went to Hollywood video first, and while they had a fine selection of everything that had played in the multiplex for the past year, they had nothing we were looking for. This, despite the fact that a collection of Thin Man movies had been released on DVD in 2005, and two collections of Marx Brothers movies were released in 2004. (Which is why I thought Hollywood might have them.) Needless to say, Specialty had all we wanted and more. We ended up renting The Thin Man, Duck Soup, and Twentieth Century (original release 1934, DVD release 2005, nowhere in sight at Hollywood.)They do carry the new releases as well, including foreign and indie films you might or might not find at the big stores. They don't censor their films, like Blockbuster. And they have a great selection of older films, classics, and cult films -- some even on (gasp) video.Their staff is very knowledgeable, even if sometimes their taste is questionable. Once when I was in the store, they were playing "The Island," the Ewan McGregor sci-fi romp, which one guy referred to as "not bad." Oh come on, if that movie is anything, it's bad.Specialty is pricier than some video stores, and their new films are only 1 day rentals (older films are 2 days, still not so great). But Monday rentals are 2 days, 2 bucks. Deal!

25.description: What is the deal with the crappy attitudes at locally owned video stores? Yeah, my DVDs are late. I was under the impression that the consequences were paying the steep late fees, not a phone call from a disgruntled employee. These guys have a decent selection, but they're pricey and you can't keep the movies for long before they start racking up late charges. The only way they can make up for it is by offering some kick-ass customer service. Also, how about allowing us to return videos through the slot during business hours? I left Darkstar Video for Specialty Video and now I'm considering Netflix.Good luck, Specialty Video.

12.description: Okay, I actually kind of love Specialty Video and I think the two stores do a good job in filling in each other's gaps.   I mean, I think I prefer the Broadway store but I'll always check here if that store doesn't have something.  One unfortunate thing is that the stores don't have the same rental policies so it's sometimes hard to keep them straight.One thing about this place though is that while I know that they'll generally have most things I'll reasonably expect this kind of video store to have, with a large selection of foreign and independent titles, I know going in the door not to talk to the staff because they are quite often the kind of hipstery snobbish you expect in a video store but they don't usually seem to know much about film so it's all empty show-ponying.  I usually just tune out while I'm in there so I don't have to roll my eyes and snarl to myself, "Can the attitude, Ginger, you don't even know what you're talking about.   It's nice that you got a job here after your Blockbuster closed up shop but get a grip, okay?"BTW, if you're looking for the APU trilogy on DVD it's here.  But don't steal it because I need it.  MMkay?  Also, if you're looking for rare titles on VHS, they have some here but you might have better luck at the store on Broadway, or, I've heard, Odd Obsession in Wicker Park.

37.description: The place to go for hard to find videos. Gay, foreign, documentary and super obscure stuff. I've got Netflix now, but this is the place I'd go to if I was looking for something super unique to watch.

21.description: The video stores I've been to don't seem to know what they're talking about and have a terrible selection. I wouldn't fault somebody for just downloading stuff off the internet with the terrible shape of most video stores.This place is different, though. they have an INCREDIBLE selection of classics, rarities and obscurities for EVERY taste in movies.  Most of the clerks seem helpful and nice, too. To address someone else's comment on parking? Try turning down a side street. No permit parking, and there's always a free space within at least a couple blocks of where you want to be.Prices seem reasonable, esp. given the rarity of a lot of these flicks. Cheaper than blockbuster. We went ahead and bought some movie credits to make it cheaper.

16.description: Specialty Video has an awesome selection of independent, foreign and campy/cult films....however, specialty video is a bit expensive and if you're late with returning your DVD, they automatically charge your credit card upon return (fair enough) but because I am habitually late returning DVDs this can become expensive and very annoying...thus, I broke up with Specialty Video and got back together with Netflix. Some of the people who worked there were a bit rude...but kinda funny-rude, kinda like, you're pretty sure you're being talked down too...but you're not positive...but what the fuck, it's kinda funny.Oh, and very good "back-room" that appeals to all interests...if you know what I mean *wink-wink*

17.description: The video stores I've been to don't seem to know what they're talking about and have a terrible selection. I wouldn't fault somebody for just downloading stuff off the internet with the terrible shape of most video stores.This place is different, though. they have an INCREDIBLE selection of classics, rarities and obscurities for EVERY taste in movies.  Most of the clerks seem helpful and nice, too. To address someone else's comment on parking? Try turning down a side street. No permit parking, and there's always a free space within at least a couple blocks of where you want to be.Prices seem reasonable, esp. given the rarity of a lot of these flicks. Cheaper than blockbuster. We went ahead and bought some movie credits to make it cheaper.

10.description: I'm a new transplant to Andersonville from Boystown.  Maybe it's what one does after you cross the 30 yrs old line....  Anyway, I digress.  I was so happy to find a video store within walking distance.  Yes I said VIDEO STORE.  It's nice to be able to chat with a staff and get some good recommendations (from an actual person and not a computer that compiles your rental history...ahem Netflix).   And they have a wide selection of titles  Besides any store that files 'Midnight Cowboy' and ' Taxi Driver' under 'Hooker/Johns', is okay in my book.

11.description: This indie retailer kicks Blockbuster's ass. Specialty has a great selection, and stocks the kind of stuff the chains don't. And not just esoteric stuff. Recently, a friend and I wanted to rent some classic films: Marx Brothers, screwball comedy, that sort. We went to Hollywood video first, and while they had a fine selection of everything that had played in the multiplex for the past year, they had nothing we were looking for. This, despite the fact that a collection of Thin Man movies had been released on DVD in 2005, and two collections of Marx Brothers movies were released in 2004. (Which is why I thought Hollywood might have them.) Needless to say, Specialty had all we wanted and more. We ended up renting The Thin Man, Duck Soup, and Twentieth Century (original release 1934, DVD release 2005, nowhere in sight at Hollywood.)They do carry the new releases as well, including foreign and indie films you might or might not find at the big stores. They don't censor their films, like Blockbuster. And they have a great selection of older films, classics, and cult films -- some even on (gasp) video.Their staff is very knowledgeable, even if sometimes their taste is questionable. Once when I was in the store, they were playing "The Island," the Ewan McGregor sci-fi romp, which one guy referred to as "not bad." Oh come on, if that movie is anything, it's bad.Specialty is pricier than some video stores, and their new films are only 1 day rentals (older films are 2 days, still not so great). But Monday rentals are 2 days, 2 bucks. Deal!

26.description: Specialty Video has an awesome selection of independent, foreign and campy/cult films....however, specialty video is a bit expensive and if you're late with returning your DVD, they automatically charge your credit card upon return (fair enough) but because I am habitually late returning DVDs this can become expensive and very annoying...thus, I broke up with Specialty Video and got back together with Netflix. Some of the people who worked there were a bit rude...but kinda funny-rude, kinda like, you're pretty sure you're being talked down too...but you're not positive...but what the fuck, it's kinda funny.Oh, and very good "back-room" that appeals to all interests...if you know what I mean *wink-wink*

27.description: Fantastic foreign film selection.  Don't let the staff get surly with you, though--snap right back at them, I think they appreciate it.  I promise you'll always leave with something good.

35.description: Pretty extensive selection of Horror, SciFi and Cult DVD's for when Netflix just isn't fast enough for a fix.  Yeah, I'm a junkie too.

8.description: This place is great, especially if you're looking for foreign films or something a little more obscure (they've got all the new releases and popular movies as well). They also have great deals on certain days of the week.However, the movies are not perfectly alphabetized which has caused problems for me on more than one occasion when I was trying to find a movie that they said was not checked out yet.

0.description: When Netflix and HuluPlus can't get you what you want, Specialty Video has everything. From weird foreign films to brand new dumb action movies they seriously have everything. Plus they have an amazing independent and LGBTQ section, as well as stocking movies from years and years ago, not just brand new. If you can't find something, the employees will always help you look. It's the best neighborhood video store since JC Flicks.

20.description: A small neighbourhood video store that has good videos and even some foreign ones. It feels like in the good old days kind of store with narrow rows and packed videos instead of commercialized Blockbuster bright colour supermarket style shops.

19.description: Pretty extensive selection of Horror, SciFi and Cult DVD's for when Netflix just isn't fast enough for a fix.  Yeah, I'm a junkie too.

33.description: Nice staff and selection of otherwise hard to find movies, documentaries, cult classics, etc.  Most of the selection in the store is devoted to the adult section (which is mostly devoted to the man on man variety).  Late fees are steep, but they have to charge them to keep the movies in stock and keep in business, so it is okay by me.

2.description: Had a desire to get an old school movie that is not on Netflix called and they had it. For a rental shop they are okay, customer service was all right, and the selection seems broad. I get most of my entertainment from the Web these days, nice to see there are still these shop around.

34.description: love this place! great selection and nice folks working behind the counter. this is probably the number one reason why i do not have netflix. i'd rather stop in, browse around, see what's playing on the screen at the counter, check out the staff picks, and pick up a flick. it's nice to have a place with a little human interaction that can recommend a great film. one of the jewels of andersonville.

32.description: Love me some Speciality Video. Love their horror selection. Love their foreign movie selections. Love their independent selection. Love the helpful, friendly staff. I can always find a movie here no matter what kind of movie mood I'm in.

18.description: This place needs some pussy.Their adult section is probably about 90% gay male (and those who enjoy gay male porn) and 10% everyone else.  Which is fine, appealing to the clientle is all good with me.They are very accommodating to their gay male audience, providing rows upon rows of selections, as well as baskets that I'm sure would be fun to bend over and peruse in front of a potential suitor.  They've got their sections divided into Amatuer, Vintage, Bi, Fetish and even a special area designated just for Falcon flicks.Like I said before, all other porn is mushed together in a melting pot of sorts.  At least they did have a "Lesbian" section where they featured GirlFriends Films...films that want to depict actual lesbians, but usually just get one femmey butch and call it a night.They also have all the movies everyone looks for:- One night in Paris- The Pam and Tommy Lee home video- Deep Throat- Debbie Does Dallas- Girls Gone Wild SeriesAs well as about one or two selections of all the other straight genres.  I was happy to see a few Shane's World and Dirty Debs.They also provide lube (both oil and water based), butt plugs and cockrings.  But suprise suprise, no vibrators or dildos!Oh well.  You can't always get what you want.

13.description: have not been in a long time because use red box but this is a very great place not just to rent but buy used they keep in stock and are well kept . its a great store and i still go out of my way to go there even thou don't live in the naborhood.

4.description: A little pricey, but a gigantic collection and instant gratification make for a very happy movie nerd.

24.description: Oh how I love the animation selection here. Employees are always helpful and friendly. They have some of the coolest Italian animated features. The prices and rental times are reasonable. The Japanese animation selections are nothing to sneeze at either. I've found every movie I've ever wanted to see _again_ here, and then had decision paralysis 'cos there's always a new arrival you want to see, if only to have something to talk about with co-workers. Oh, and the stop-motion selections leave little to be desired.Specialty has one of the best blends of classic and camp horror collections I've ever seen. They even have Aeon Flux and Beavis & Butthead to round it all out. This place is a tiny, grey-carpeted, fluorescent-lit heaven.

6.description: After years of being a loyal customer to my locally-owned video store, I'm afraid all patronage must end. After getting home to see a DVD I rented was damaged (although hard to see unless held in the correct light), I decided to be honest and let them know I was given a damaged DVD...as opposed to just returning it and screwing the customer after me.The young guy at the counter told me the manager would be back in a few days and would call me regarding the DVD. Great. Well, all that happened a few days later was a charge of nearly $30 to my debit card. (They insist you keep a card on file with them). No call. No attempt to hear my story. No customer is always right. No trust that I was not, in fact, the one who damaged the DVD. Does it make any sense that I would draw your attention to the damage if I was, in fact, the one who did it? And if so, why wouldn't I just pay for it then and there, whilst telling you about the damage, if I was responsible? Wtf.Unbelievably horrible customer service. For a dying breed of a business, it would seem customer service should be at the top of their list. The manager did not bother to call. The manager charged me without ever hearing the story. The manager/owner has lost two long-time customers. For good. And will be finding a disputed charge...we'll see if they actually bother to pick up the phone at that point.So sad for a local business. Sad and shameful. Thanks for understanding I did the right thing by being honest. I guess I should have just returned the damaged DVD without a word, like the person before me.Peace out, Specialty Video. Too bad.

22.description: Wait a minute, isn't attitude what one is looking for in their video store clerk? Hand it to them for breadth and depth of selection. Foreign, hard to find TV series, cruel clerks who look disdainfully at you when you return (late) the Paul Rudd vehicle - what more can you ask for.

15.description: Oh how I love the animation selection here. Employees are always helpful and friendly. They have some of the coolest Italian animated features. The prices and rental times are reasonable. The Japanese animation selections are nothing to sneeze at either. I've found every movie I've ever wanted to see _again_ here, and then had decision paralysis 'cos there's always a new arrival you want to see, if only to have something to talk about with co-workers. Oh, and the stop-motion selections leave little to be desired.Specialty has one of the best blends of classic and camp horror collections I've ever seen. They even have Aeon Flux and Beavis & Butthead to round it all out. This place is a tiny, grey-carpeted, fluorescent-lit heaven.

7.description: This is a terrific shop. Broad selection of things not found on Netflix or Amazon. They always seem to have something I haven't seen but am interested in playing while I'm shopping. Go by bike if possible or look for parking on a side street. Ashland avenue is a short block away and there's good parking there, especially if you're spending more than a minute in Andersonville.

36.description: One of the great joys of Andersonville is living walking distance from this video store. Damn fine selection (rivaled only by Facets) & nice guys manning the counter. In addition to all the usual new releases, they keep a varied stock of indie & foreign & classics - plus a stack from the Criterion Collection large enough to keep any film lover busy for months. (Please please don't let Netflix drive these guys out of business!)

30.description: This place needs some pussy.Their adult section is probably about 90% gay male (and those who enjoy gay male porn) and 10% everyone else.  Which is fine, appealing to the clientle is all good with me.They are very accommodating to their gay male audience, providing rows upon rows of selections, as well as baskets that I'm sure would be fun to bend over and peruse in front of a potential suitor.  They've got their sections divided into Amatuer, Vintage, Bi, Fetish and even a special area designated just for Falcon flicks.Like I said before, all other porn is mushed together in a melting pot of sorts.  At least they did have a "Lesbian" section where they featured GirlFriends Films...films that want to depict actual lesbians, but usually just get one femmey butch and call it a night.They also have all the movies everyone looks for:- One night in Paris- The Pam and Tommy Lee home video- Deep Throat- Debbie Does Dallas- Girls Gone Wild SeriesAs well as about one or two selections of all the other straight genres.  I was happy to see a few Shane's World and Dirty Debs.They also provide lube (both oil and water based), butt plugs and cockrings.  But suprise suprise, no vibrators or dildos!Oh well.  You can't always get what you want.

3.description: When people tell me that the era of the video rental store is over, I tell them to go to Andersonville's Specialty Video & DVD.  They have excellent selections of new releases, documentaries, foreign films, classics, and everything in between.  Prices are reasonable and staff is friendly.The only downside that I see is their cataloguing system leaves a bit to be desired.  Within genres, films are "alphabetized..." which is to say that titles are loosely grouped together by first letter and not too much after that.At the end of the day, it's a better selection than Redbox, less wait time than Netflix, and cheaper than iTunes.  There is clearly reason to rent here.

14.description: I tried this place because they're near me. The prices seemed fair and they had a reasonable selection. I rented one movie, but it wouldn't play in my computer. Tried another one and it just skipped through half the scenes. Unfortunately, this was right before we went away for Christmas, so it ends up sitting around my house for a couple weeks. When I got back, I returned it. Figured they'd charge some reasonable amount for a late fee and we'd be done with it. Turns out they want $40 for the movie I never got to play. Amazon rents that movie for $3 or I could buy the DVD for $10. Apparently their policy is to just keep racking up late fees without any sort of maximum. Looks like I'm going back to amazon/redbox/etc.

58.description: I had a Groupon for a manicure/pedicure that I redeemed last week. The salon itself is very meh.  Strange decor, very cramped, nail stations all over the place. I was greeted by Sonia and told to pick out my nail colors, which is right by a pedicure station. Sonia was very friendly and offered me soda or juice to drink, which is a nice amenity. I was pretty much hovering over this girl doing nails to pick out a color, which was awkward and I felt rushed because of it.  Aleena (not sure if that's how you spell it) did my nails and I was surprised at how wonderful they turned out.  She was really nice, but not too chatty, which I like. I'm there to get my nails done, not make a new friend. Manicures never last more than a couple days at best on me, my manicure lasted about 5 days, which is impressive.  My pedicure still looks great.  They have massaging chairs for pedicures, but mine was missing the right arm of it and had no controller, so no massaging there.  I think this is a good place if you're on a budget. If you're willing to fork over a little more cash for a better experience and nails just as good, if not better, go to Nail Palette.

56.description: I recently found Sonia Salon as my new go-to salon. I tried a groupon deal a few months back and was pleased. The prices are great, no groupon needed. I was never a gal to go for manicures and I never had a no-chip until I came here. Now I'm hooked!The salon is small and definitely no-frills. But for the price, I'm not expecting much more. The quality of my manicures and pedicures has been great (slow, don't expect to be in and out). I also like the eyebrow threading, always turns out great. Most of the staff is friendly, minus a couple girls who sit on their phones the whole time. My only recent disappointment is the ability to get an appointment. I used to be able to walk in and always get in. Now, it's almost impossible for a same-day apopointment. A sign of good business, but not great for me.

29.description: Best and most affordable eyebrow threading in the city! I am not sure about other services, asI only go there for my eyebrows!

42.description: Wonderful! I walked in at 4:30--they close at 5:00--and was happily welcomed in for an eyebrow threading. I've never had my eyebrows threaded before, and I loved it. It was quick, about as painful as a waxing, if not less, and the lovely woman who helped me was great. Highly recommended!

23.description: So friendly. So accommodating. They do a great job!  You will leave refreshed and happy!

47.description: This is a great salon for waxing services--fairly cheap and fast!. I normally go to Fatima--I haven't yet had the pleasure of getting Sonia. Fatima is quick, although not the most painless that I've ever had. But I'm usually out of there in under 20 minutes! Just a couple tips: the wax is not the most soothing--I've had to mix it up and go to other salons to give my skin a break (mostly the reason why I didn't give the salon more stars). In addition, the waxing room is adjacent to the foot baths and separate from them only by one of those folding plastic separators. If you don't like the idea of people hearing you get your lady hairs ripped off, this is not the place for you.Other than those two things, you can't beat the price and the convenience!

8.description: Hands down--the best place to get threaded in Chicago!They even have Ayurvedic products that are 100% natural, and the salon is always running amazing specials.

31.description: I've been going to Sonia Salon for about a year. They do amazing and affordable no-cip manicures and are always very helpful with choosing a great color. My last no-chip lasted three weeks!

34.description: I Love this Salon so much!  The environment is very welcoming and relaxing. I have been going to Sonia's Salon for a few years and have been very happy with every visit.  Great job with services, environment, and staff! It's always a great pleasure going in. Thanks!

16.description: I converted to threading several years ago when a miracle worker on Devon managed to minimize the visibility of a little eyebrow scar by removing hair.  How?  I don't know, that's why I called her a miracle worker.  Also you should know that my eyebrows are naturally pretty good in terms of shape, color, thickness, not being connected, etc.  I tend to strut them around like a show dog on a leash.  That said, they still need a little maintenance, as we all do.  After shopping around a little, I have found that the price is typically low everywhere, but the atmosphere and technician skill varies.  Some places show Bollywood music videos, some suggest an upper lip threading (upselling through paranoia), some seem a little less than pristine, and some believe you're down with getting groomed at a kiosk in the middle of the mall where who knows who can see you.  No thanks, I'm good.    Fast forward to now, when I still get 'em threaded periodically but perhaps not as often as I should.  I've trusted them to a few different women at Sonia, and have never been disappointed.  I've had to wait, but only once.  The salon is somewhat laid back, on the no-frills side of the spectrum, and I think does mostly local business.  They also do nails and I think some skincare.  I've also had a couple waxes but in the interest of not mortifying my husband as he reads this, I will omit those details.  Overall, solid results, quick service, competitive prices.  Recommend!

13.description: I've been going to Sonia's for three or four months now. I absolutely love it. The minute you walk in you can tell who Sonia is. She's very friendly, and will often offer a warm or cold beverage if available. My latest pedicure was on Friday. It was fast, and I felt like a got a great spa treatment complete with a warm towel, lotion and mini massage. I don't think I have liked pedicures until coming here. At other places, they will nickel and done you and charge you way more for a lesser experience. It's not a huge place ( four pedicure chairs and maybe 6 manicure  booths) but I like that. I highly recommend this place.

11.description: This review is solely for the Mani pedi I got done here... SUB-PAR. it was rushed, sloppy and I'm pretty sure several steps were missed in the process. There is also a very poor color selection. Just spend ten more dollars and go somewhere they know what they're doing. Please.

39.description: I just had my first pedicure in this salon by Naya and it's perfect! I've had lots of pedis in my 55 years and this rates as one of the very best. Naya was very pleasant, careful and not too chatty (I like that). I had my eyebrows threaded  and this well done too. The cost of each were very reasonable.

37.description: I honestly can't believe I haven't written a review sooner. I first started going to Sonia after I purchased a groupon three years ago when my regular aesthetician got sick. Best find ever! I started at the Clark street location which I believe has the best prices (since the rent isn't so high). I have never had a bad service and i am extremely picky and you cannot beat the prices for the quality you are getting. Sonia keeps the prices down by not having a super fancy salon but still uses the best products. I've also visited the North Ave salon many times and the staff there are just as good. I highly recommend their threading. waxing, no chip manicures and mani/pedis. It seems like there is always a deal on their chalkboard outside. You do have to pay for parking unless you walk a bit but it's very convenient metered parking. You can even e-mail to make an appointment or just walk in. You can also leave gratuity on your card which is nice if you're like me and never have cash.

0.description: Best manicure ever!I had Irena and she is a pro at french manicures.  She was incredibly thorough and free handed the white tips.  My nails have never looked better.

38.description: Fatima is very unpleasant and tries to rush people out. Today, she was trying to get me to leave before my pedicure was dry; she then added another layer of something (I assume some drying product) and she damaged three nails. Another woman had to add another layer and top coat. Then the waiting started all over again. Very frustrating. She walks around the shop like a bulldog policing the joint. She's not the only unpleasant person, but she is the worst.

51.description: I've been trying to find a new place in Chicago for bikini waxes. I had gone to Toujours Salon in Andersonville, but found it to be quite expensive, so I tried this place due to the less expensive pricing and good yelp reviews.Unfortunately, my experience was not positive. I made an appointment ahead of time. When I walked in the door, the receptionist said loudly in front of all the other customers, "Are you here for the bikini wax?" Granted, it is a salon and many people get waxes, I still do appreciate a bit of privacy.The room in which they take you for waxing is not private at all. It has a creaky, sliding door that doesn't even close all the way. The women doing my wax didn't even wait for me to undress before she walked in nor did she walk out after my wax to give me the courtesy of redressing privately (this has not been my past experience.)To top it off, and probably the worst part, the wax was the most painful I have had and it was not at all thorough or even. Not going to headed back to Sonia any time soon.

27.description: I'm pretty excited that this place is around the corner from my house.  The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was laid back and my pedicurist did a great job.

32.description: Sonia is sweet, but most of the others are huge crabs. The last few times Fatima has done my threading and 1) does them way too thin and 2) leaves too many random hairs that I have to go home and tweeze them myself.  It would also be nice if you used a tissue to wipe the random loose hair off of my eyelids and face.  Yes, they are reasonably priced and fit you in right away, but to get a half assed job and just be grunted at isn't worth it for the drive or dollars saved.

54.description: Sonia Salon is such a life saver! They are kind, friendly, and proficient; everything you'd want from a salon.Last night I found out that I got cast in a TV show. WOO! And I'm playing a bartender. At a strip club. In my underwear. Imagine my distress after work today when I discovered that my regular salon is closed for the weekend. My fitting is tomorrow, so a bikini wax had to happen tonight. I found Sonia Salon and read a couple of reviews. I noticed that all of the 1 star reviews contained the word "Groupon" and immediately discounted them. Take a look. You'll see a pattern, too. The rest of the reviews were glowing. I called and they got me in right away! I basically walked in the door and straight into the waxing room. The owner was fantastic. She took the time to get to know a little about me and seemed genuinely excited that her bikini wax was going to be on TV :) She was efficient and generally charming. This place is no chic Gold Coast salon. If you want to sip champagne and have your nether regions rubbed with cashmere oil, go spend $200 downtown. For a quick and flawless brazilian from honest, hardworking people, go to Sonia.

48.description: I have refrained from reviewing salons where I get waxed, mostly to spare myself and my male friends who read my reviews some embarrassment. However, I decided to break from this rule to review Sonia's because I feel like they've really earned my five stars.On my first visit Fatima did my brazilian and I had no complaints. However, it was during my second, most recent visit that I struck gold with Sonia, who I ended up having by a stroke of random luck it seems, as she is usually quite busy. What stands out to me is that she threads after waxing, so that every single hair is removed. The level of pain (ha) is the same or less as many of the pricier salons I've visited (Charles Ifergen, for example). Sonia is quick, skilled, and lovely to talk to. While I appreciate the little luxuries at nice salons, I am also definitely willing to forgo them to save some $$, and you can't beat a $35 brazilian. I will definitely be explicitly requesting Sonia from now on.

44.description: I have been going to this salon for the last six years, and I will not be going there anymore. I get an eyebrow wax every 6 weeks or so, and while Sonia does a good job with the eyebrow wax, she is constantly distracted when doing the wax. I stopped going on saturday because she is always so busy, but even when you go on a Tues night after work, she is constantly distracted and leaves you mid wax to advise a customer (who is not hers) on manicure colors, or other things. I feel that when someone is pouring hot wax on my face, I want them to pay attention. I will say buyer beware. Yes, you will get a good cheap wax, but you will be frustrated by her constant distraction.

24.description: I love this place. PROS:It's very close to my house It's affordable FATIMA is very fast (you need to be fast in this business)I seem to be able to walk in when I can/want (mostly Fridays around 3-4pm) CONS- this is tough because it's relative, I like this place but I can see how some people wouldn't. - there are ZERO "frills." It's a wax job not a date. It's not crispy clean, it's clean, but it's not eat off the floor clean. Pro tip: they sell the best foot skin file things- it looks like a paddle. Use it between pedis to keep the bottom of your feet smooth. It's only $6. She imports them. For some reason this is the only place I've been able to find them. Buy one!

7.description: first time there ever today and I have got to say it was amazing!I was recovering from a BAD Brazilian from a month before when I came in. Not only did I get a good wax but Sonia, the owner, THREADED me to get rid of the in growns, broken hairs, etc. I'd never heard of someone doing that but it was honestly painless and amazing. Also she said she will give me a touch up for the hairs she didn't grab for free!recommend highly

49.description: Awesome eyebrow threading in 3 minutes for $8. I'll be back.

40.description: Sonia is the best when it cone to threading . She is the master ! It doesn't even hurt. .

53.description: One week after getting an OPI no-chip mani here my nails still look great! My manicurist, Luba (sp?) did an excellent job with the polish. She was bit rough on my cuticles, though. The shop is no-frills but a good value for the price. I used a Groupon, but even without one the no-chips are competitively prices.  The had a decent range of no-chip colors available and I'll definitely be back.

30.description: I was a loyal patron of the salon for nearly four years--faithfully getting threaded once or twice a month. After moving north and finding an amazing spot (Deeba Beauty Salon on Devon), I've realized I was faithful for too long to Sonia. Threading was always painful, it was pricey, and I never appreciated being shamed for waiting too long to come in. You should treat your customers like guests and not guilt them for having hair grow out. To the salon's credit, I always enjoyed the young woman who threaded me (not sure of her name). She was quick and pleasant. And I never had to wait more than 3-5 minutes to be in the chair. Fortunately, I won't have to wait anymore since I have a new salon in town. Be kinder to your guests, Sonia!

46.description: I don't know about all their services but I just had the BEST THREADING EVER.  Fast, affordable, and done perfectly!

1.description: Bought a Groupon for this place. Went to get my fingers and toes done for my wedding. My wife and a bridesmaid went along. The wife and I had appointments, my bridesmaid did not. They got her in with us, which was awesome, and gave her the Groupon price even though she had yet to buy it. The service was fantastic at first. The owner is terrific! We were immediately given one person to work on us. We were given tea while we chose our color. At this point, the experience differs. My wife and bridesmaid were with 2 wonderful ladies who not only worked professionally on them, but were polite and conversational. The person I was given lacked any personable skills. I asked if I could have different colors for my nails and toes and was harshly told no. That was fine, one color works, it's a Groupon. I sat next to my wife while our feet were pampered. As we went, I noticed that the woman working on me skipped steps and hurried through my treatment. She did get all the necessary parts, but I watched my wife get a massage, lotion, and much more attention. She painted my toes properly enough. I was passed to another woman who threaded my whole face. She was awesome!Then it was time for my hands. I was pointed back to the woman with long black hair and she proceeded to ignore anything that wasn't my fingers and chat with the other lady working next to her the whole time. This would have been fine if the paint job was terrific, which it was not. Any time she needed to give me instructions it was harsh few word commands. She rushed through the manicure and stuck me under some dryers and left to go smoke or get food or something. My bridesmaid and wife were still being pampered at this time. She was back when my timers went off and put me through another dry cycle. She then sprawled out on a couch and played with her phone. My timers went off again and she did nothing. After a bit I got up and sat on the couch next to her with my phone, waiting for the others. Eventually she got up and left for good. The woman who ran the register was very polite. My wife and friend were treated well, so I'd consider going back, but I'd refuse to be put with the lady with long black hair again. She should not work in a business where customer service is key.

55.description: I was shocked when my mani pedi took an hour and 45 minutes! As another reviewer wrote, the pedicure was a actually little painful when they were cutting my cuticles, which I've never experienced before. One of my fingernails was actually crooked after the manicure. The manicure chipped in less than 24 hours and the pedicure chipped after 4 days.My biggest concern about this place is how dirty it is. Messy is one thing, which it is, but when you look around you can see layers of dust and the manicure stations look like they never wipe them down. When the manicurist pulled out a dryer and placed it on the station, the dryer looked like something that had been sitting in a basement, it was covered with thick dust and had little bits on top that looked like parts of people's nails that had been taken off during a manicure. I started to feel like I was going to be really fortunate if I left there without getting some type of staph infection.Comments from other reviews:I had the $22 Groupon for the mani pedi and whenever I called they couldn't get me in for days. Then when it got close to the expiration date, I called again and they couldn't get me in until the day after it expired. They then tried to tell me they'd honor the Groupon for a pedi only, but I insisted it cover both since they didn't have any appointments open. Then they tried to say I'd have to pay $3 more - really, you are going to turn off a new customer over $3?? They ended up honoring the Groupon, but the whole thing was crazy because their regular special is $28 for a mani pedi. I can definitely see how they tried to get more money from the other Groupon user. They have added music, so the place isn't as silent, but the atmosphere is still kind of odd and not somewhere you want to hang out at for almost 2 hours.The owner and staff were all very friendly and did offer refreshments, although that doesn't make up for the bad service and unsanitary conditions.They charge $5 for gel manicure removal for manicures that were not done by them.

9.description: The customer service was great! However, the no-chip was not up to standard. The price is fair but I've gotten better for the same price.

26.description: I came here for a Brazillian and a mani/pedi....Sonia was extremely nice to talk to and did a decent job with the waxing. When I got home to inspect her work, I noticed that she missed a spot but it was still an overall good job, especially for the price! The mani/pedi was just "meh" imo. The girl wasn't very talkative and I feel like she rushed my pedicure. I will definitely be back to see Sonia but I'll pass on any other services.
