25.description: I converted to threading several years ago when a miracle worker on Devon managed to minimize the visibility of a little eyebrow scar by removing hair.  How?  I don't know, that's why I called her a miracle worker.  Also you should know that my eyebrows are naturally pretty good in terms of shape, color, thickness, not being connected, etc.  I tend to strut them around like a show dog on a leash.  That said, they still need a little maintenance, as we all do.  After shopping around a little, I have found that the price is typically low everywhere, but the atmosphere and technician skill varies.  Some places show Bollywood music videos, some suggest an upper lip threading (upselling through paranoia), some seem a little less than pristine, and some believe you're down with getting groomed at a kiosk in the middle of the mall where who knows who can see you.  No thanks, I'm good.    Fast forward to now, when I still get 'em threaded periodically but perhaps not as often as I should.  I've trusted them to a few different women at Sonia, and have never been disappointed.  I've had to wait, but only once.  The salon is somewhat laid back, on the no-frills side of the spectrum, and I think does mostly local business.  They also do nails and I think some skincare.  I've also had a couple waxes but in the interest of not mortifying my husband as he reads this, I will omit those details.  Overall, solid results, quick service, competitive prices.  Recommend!

12.description: Due to moving out of Chicago it's been a while since I've been here, but OMG how much do I miss these talented & uber sweet ladies! I had been getting eyebrow & Brazilian waxes for years before moving to Chicago, and just kind of picked this salon randomly out of necessity (it IS!) shortly after moving to the city. One of the luckiest picks ever.As she was finishing my first Brazilian there, Sonia verified that I wanted my eyebrows done too and I thought I'd ask about threading as I had never tried it before. Deciding to try it that day has resulted in never waxing them again, I am a total threading convert for life. Imo, threading is slightly better than waxing b/c unlike wax which roughly pulls the (delicate eye) skin as well as the hair up, threading just pulls the hair. TOTALLY not sure if this is an actual benefit, it just kinda makes sense to me.Let's face it, hair removal of any kind done anywhere is more than likely gonna hurt like a bitch, so there's nothing anyone can really do about that, for me what made this place really special out of the dozens & dozens of places I've been to in my life, was the staff who are not only talented and skilled at what they do, but clearly enjoy what they're doing and care about their customers.I use Yelp all the time but have never taken the time to write a review before, I'm really glad I did it for here...even if it did become a short book... :-P

59.description: I am now going to Fatima for my Brazilian waxes and she's really good too.  Very fast and will re-do an area if you are not satisfied without any qualms.

21.description: I got a Brazilian wax here a few months ago and it was ok. I think the owner actually did it. She was quick and personable, and I only noticed a few strays she missed. Fast forward to last week when I went back for just a bikini wax and upper thigh wax. This time I had a younger lady who was nice, but did not understand what I was asking for because she took too much off of my bikini. Also, my thigh wax was ineffective as there was just a bunch of breakage instead of from the root. I had pricklies 5 days later. I noticed she used one wax strip for many yanks and I was skeptical that it was uprooting the hair. Also, she used about half a container of baby powder on me! It was everywhere!End of story: I'm going to try to find somewhere that is a bit more modern and thorough rather than trying to save a few bucks.

17.description: I got a Brazilian wax here a few months ago and it was ok. I think the owner actually did it. She was quick and personable, and I only noticed a few strays she missed. Fast forward to last week when I went back for just a bikini wax and upper thigh wax. This time I had a younger lady who was nice, but did not understand what I was asking for because she took too much off of my bikini. Also, my thigh wax was ineffective as there was just a bunch of breakage instead of from the root. I had pricklies 5 days later. I noticed she used one wax strip for many yanks and I was skeptical that it was uprooting the hair. Also, she used about half a container of baby powder on me! It was everywhere!End of story: I'm going to try to find somewhere that is a bit more modern and thorough rather than trying to save a few bucks.

10.description: I usually go for eyebrow threading which is perfect every time. They know when I say "just a clean up" that means "please don't over thread and arch my brows". They get it. Sculpted, full brows every time. But wait...there's more! Yesterday I spontaneously decided to get a pedicure along with my brows. Best decision ever. HELEN did an excellent job and took her time. I was so relaxed. She was really paying attention to what she was doing. Will be going back for more nail services.

5.description: When it comes to manicures and pedicures ALERTT BEWARE SKIP !!!! Horrible no chip! Went in a Sunday afternoon to get a no chip and it cracked in a matter of hours. They don't specialize in nails probably bc theyre all Indian. Not one Asian. Very crowded bc the space is soooo small, I'm sure their threading service is great BUT NAILS.. No gooood!!!!

3.description: I come here only for eyebrow threading and I only have it done by Sonia. ..not because the other employees aren't good I just adore Sonia so much that I can't not see her! I love Sonia and the amazing work she does. Plus it's affordable!

35.description: I'm basing this on Sonia's eyebrow threading.  Perfection!  I had been going to a top salon in the Gold Coast and spending much more on my eyebrows until I found this place.  I'm extremely particular about my brow so I was hesitant but now I'm totally hooked!

19.description: I love this salon for a few reasons: - reasonably priced for waxes and mani/pedis - walk ins are accepted  - FAST waxings.  I do not like to be pampered, I just want to get in and out and each wax I have gotten was super fast. - threading is tough on me always but I have recently started to get threading done too and it's been fast and great.

28.description: Sonia Salon does a good job with eyebrow threading. I go to them at least every 2-3 wks to get it done. They are fast too!

45.description: I discovered Sonia Salon through an instant Groupon. It was late afternoon on a Sunday. I called them and they were able to accommodate me although I got the impression it took a little bit of work to do it, so I appreciated their efforts there. I was nervous to get a Shellac manicure because I had been going to my previous manicurist for over 10 years and she was one of the few people who could shape my nails right. Plus, not everyone does no-chip the right way. My manicurist was Aisha. Not only did she shape my nails perfectly, she also convinced me to get my eyebrows threaded when I expressed interest in it but told her I was nervous because they are sparse to begin with. So glad I did it! My brows indeed have a better shape now and look great! I have since been back and had Nadia do my nail. She was great as well, so, I am left with the impression that qualified people work here.This is a no frills place for sure. It is a little cramped, not too much friendly banter among the employees, not such great colors on the walls, and portable ultra-violet drying stations for when you get your no-chip (I am used to the kind that is built in to the table). But the prices are really good and if you want good service for a good price, this is your place!

33.description: Wahooo! Well I've ticked something off the bucket list that most women have dealt with by now .... Full leg wax and bikini. Fatima did a really excellent job. She was fast but thorough and I felt totally comfortable. I'm not going to pretend this whole process felt good, because girl, that sh*t smarts but the pain doesn't linger long. I ended the session with a much needed brow wax. Excellent service and kind staff, all for only $75.00. You ain't gonna find that at other salons in Aville but Sonia salon isn't as "upscale". Unpretentious, good service at reasonable prices.

43.description: I won't go anywhere else in the city if Sonia is available to do my eyebrows!

2.description: Thank you, Sonia Dua, for taking what was supposed to be a gift of a relaxing evening (after dealing with 3 year old twins and a husband in the hospital, I needed this), and instead making it one of the most frustrating experiences I've had with a business.I received a Groupon as a gift.  I'll upload a photo of the voucher so you can see the terms.  It said "one choice of spa services".  The only restrictions in the fine print were that you had to be a client who hadn't been there in the last 6 months, and there were extra fees for French Tips.Silly me, I assumed this could be used for something on their list of services at the spa.  Apparently I was very wrong, as Sonia told me a hundred times last night.  Looks like they had a Groupon for a manicure/pedicure combo, but that didn't print out on the gift voucher.  I understand her dilemma--there's a printed voucher with her salon's name on it and terms that she didn't really agree to.  That's a problem to bring up with Groupon for sure.  But I'm not sure how it became my problem.  The voucher should have been honored, especially if she ever wanted me to come back as a new client.  She tried to call Groupon to have them explain it to me (really???), but they didn't answer.After going back and forth with her quite a bit and her asking me to call the person who gave me the gift to explain it to me (yeah, let me call them and tell them they gave me a crappy gift...I'll get right on that...), I finally gave in and said that I'd agree to just using the value of the voucher towards the other service.  Since it clearly states on the voucher "The amount paid will never expire and may be applied toward any goods or services offered by the merchant".  Nope, she was not having that either.  Sonia stated that she would only get $16 for the voucher, and that wasn't enough.  Here's the funny thing--the service I was asking for was cheaper than the manicure/pedicure combo!!  So, I'm not sure what kind of pricing system is in place there, but it sure doesn't make sense to me.  In the end, she refused to compromise in any way, so I had to head home even more frustrated than when I got there, the opposite of what I had been hoping for.I'd also like to thank you, Sonia (salon owner), for having this long, drawn out conversation in the middle of your salon so everyone there had to listen to us.  Sorry for ruining a relaxing evening for you ladies as well!  If I had been given an option to go anywhere else, I would have, but I wasn't allowed more than 5 feet from the front door.

18.description: I love this place. PROS:It's very close to my house It's affordable FATIMA is very fast (you need to be fast in this business)I seem to be able to walk in when I can/want (mostly Fridays around 3-4pm) CONS- this is tough because it's relative, I like this place but I can see how some people wouldn't. - there are ZERO "frills." It's a wax job not a date. It's not crispy clean, it's clean, but it's not eat off the floor clean. Pro tip: they sell the best foot skin file things- it looks like a paddle. Use it between pedis to keep the bottom of your feet smooth. It's only $6. She imports them. For some reason this is the only place I've been able to find them. Buy one!

41.description: I was a newby to threading before I came to Sonia's salon, they converted me. At the time a friend recommended the place because pricing was great and I lived just down the street. Now, while I no longer live just down the street and the trip isn't easy, every other week you'll see me dutifully putting my time in the threading chair. At this point I've tried all their threading technicians and have my favorites. My personal favorite is Nisha, who manages to keep my man brows in check. I should point out that each technician has their skill whether its shaping or the actual threading part, so you really can't go wrong.Whether new to threading or not, I would encourage you to check this place out. I have yet to find a place that does as good of a job.

52.description: ****TMI ALERT****Single or in a relationship, I have come to embrace the importance of waxing your nether-regions. Why, I don't know? The issue I have, as many of my posts have indicated before, is that I'm frugal. Of course when it comes to having hot wax put so close to your nether-regions it's probably not the best idea to cheap out and go with some skeevy place. I have learned this.So I've tried a variety of places - some cheap, thanks to Groupons or LivingSocial deals - and others more expensive, at fancy spa salons. I have found the outcomes to be relatively the same whether I paid $25 or $75. Granted $75 gets scented candles, relaxing music and the ambiance, but who the heck cares when someone you don't know is pulling hair from down there??Enter Sonia Salon. I came across the salon thanks to a Groupon deal and have found the work to be just fine and the price even finer. Can't complain. The first few times Sonia did the work, and as much as the other girl does a good job, I found I was much less sore and bruised after Sonia. The room where the waxing is done is cleaner some days than others, and it is a little weird that no music is playing. Given how thin the walls are I'm fairly certain girls getting manis or having their eyebrows threaded can hear the "riiiping noise" of the waxing. Awkward.In any case, they do a decent enough job for a reasonable price. I learned that there's another waxing salon on Damen about equal distance from me, which I may check out. I wouldn't mind being a little less bruised after being waxed!

50.description: i've gotten brazilians and eyebrow threading here and both of them were fantastic! the place itself isn't very fancy, but everyone was nice, and the service was fantastic. since i live a little far, i don't come here very much, but I'd have to say this is my favorite place to get my eyebrows threaded. as for brazilians, i'd say it was pretty thorough, and instead of using a tweezer for the finishing touch, she used thread. it was less painful, in my opinion.

4.description: I am giving this salon 4 stars as the work they do is definitely 5 stars but the service can be a little weird, and it's not the most modern, up to date fancy salon ever. Honestly that's fine with me and that is the price you pay to get a cheap mani pedi! The owner, Sonia, is super friendly and very nice to talk to.I live down the street and am always walking by the super inciting '$25 no chip' sandwich board that stands outside. Finally I decided just to try it and see what happens! I got a no chip mani and regular pedi for like $45 bucks. This would run you $60-70 anywhere else in the neighborhood. The nail techs I've worked with are sweet Eastern European girls that don't speak much English, but that is fine since they know the motions and words that are important! The polish selection is what I'd expect at any salon. They have all of the usual brands. My only complaint about the no chip is that they don't have the little chips to show the colors and so you have to open a lot of the bottles but whatever. They keep them organized (reds, pinks, blues etc together) so it's not hard if you have an idea of the color you're looking for going in.So far I've had one regular pedicure, and two no chip manis from this salon. My first no chip lasted a long time and would have lasted longer if I hadn't started to pick at it once it chipped! I wanted to keep my nails long and lovely so I got a second no chip right on top of that one but my nails are SO weak and brittle, that second manicure wore off in like 8 days or something. Each time, the girls have done a great job at shaping my nails and not cutting my  toenails too short or anything. They always ask before they do something so you have the opportunity to tell them what you want which I really appreciate. Both of the techs that I have worked with did a very good, efficient job.I would definitely recommend this to a friend! You can't beat $25 for a no chip! This will be my go-to salon from now on.

6.description: I got an eye brow threading (not from Sonia) and it wasn't the best. The lady left a lot of stray hairs and my left eye brow was uneven (possibly the worst thing possible). However, friends have said Sonia does an amazing job so I'll give it a try one more time. My manicure and pedicure were great, but it felt very rushed. I was one of the last clients of the evening so again, I'll give it one more chance. I'm hoping after my next visit I can update this review!

22.description: Nope.Sorry to want to write a review. This is my second yelp review ever. Pleasant nice woman but that was the worst Brazilian wax I've ever experienced....INCLUDING when I bought my own kit and my ex and I decided to learn. My hard to irritate skin is irritated, hair broken but not extracted, the top layer of my skin is peeling and super sticky. Lesson learned. I've been apologizing to my nether regions all day since.... Sigh.

15.description: Great experience each time. Very accommodating on timing and just a friendly group here. Ive been offered tea or water or soda every time I'm there .

57.description: Day 5 since mani-pedi and nails are ragged, peeling, hang nails have formed.It's really too bad to have to write this small business a poor review, the ladies were very nice and kind, the owner gave out refreshments, but the final results are... it is what it is.My mani-pedi took about 2hours. One would think that taking this much time was due to careful precision, but unfortunately it  seemed like a lack of expertise. There wasn't any nail polish to remove or cut. Filing was done in all sorts of direction, I kinda knew my nails were going to be torn. Getting those nail beds pushed was sort of painful and a few fingers bled from getting trimmed. If one had to be picky, the paint job was a bit shabby. Yes, some of it is my fault for not speaking up, but I also think I shouldn't have to when this is their primary job.

20.description: I love this salon for a few reasons: - reasonably priced for waxes and mani/pedis - walk ins are accepted  - FAST waxings.  I do not like to be pampered, I just want to get in and out and each wax I have gotten was super fast. - threading is tough on me always but I have recently started to get threading done too and it's been fast and great.

36.description: The owner is really nice and did the threading on me herself.  However, the salon is a little dingy and the light is so dim.  I think that is the reason why she did such a poor job on my eyebrows.  When I woke up the next morning, most of the fine hairs had not been threaded off.  She only took off a few of the major hairs and left all the other hair there.  What a waste of time and money.

14.description: Sonia's is my go-to for a no-chip mani!I get a no chip manicure and regular pedicure for $46.My manicure's always last around 3 weeks. The service is great. All of the women here are polite and kind!Sonia's is located on Clark street right in the heart of Andersonville. There is always street parking available.

58.description: I would give it a five star review if it wasn't for the $10 corkage fee. We had a large group there, half of the table are regulars. So we had a bit of the "special treatment". Calamari and grilled octopus were fresh and light. We shared a parmagiana pizza and pesto egg noodle w shrimp (instead of scallops). Simply amazing. The sauce is light, ingredients are fresh and the pasta are al dente just right. Others all enjoyed their food. It's definitely more of a neighbourhood place, expect warm service, average decor but great food.

56.description: I had a really rough and not delicious experience here, and sadly will not be coming back and am sharing this review with my friends. Admittedly, I might be a semi pizza snob because we make our own thin crust at home a lot. But holy cow how do you f*** up a pizza this badly... We ordered the Fattoressa pizza to-go because it sounded different. We also got split pea soup which was meh. I couldn't even eat the pizza. And I really tried. And I eat pretty much everything. But I just... couldn't... do it. :( Really friendly staff, just not yummy... at all. Eep.

29.description: As of  a few months ago, this place is no longer BYOB. Makes no difference to me but actually makes it easier for my friends who like to all drink different things with their meal. I continue to be impressed by Mario and his staff as they always ensure an outstanding dining experience.

42.description: I have been here twice and both times it was delicious.  Everything is homemade with quality ingredients.  They made us feel right at home (even though we had my 17 month old daughter with us).  We will be back!

23.description: I have always been a fan of this restaurant. The whole menu is delicious, from their pastas to their pizzas, and so on. I just recently dined here last weekend, after not visiting for close to two years. The food did not disappoint yet again. I did, however, become a little irritated about one thing. Since the place is BYOB, and always has been, they decided to start charging a corkage fee (the server said they started it about a year ago). This is not stated on their website, which is frustrating. We had a table of six on Saturday night, so had a couple bottles of wine with us. They then stated that they charge per bottle as well, not just a one time fee for corkage. It is $15 per normal sized bottle, and $20 per larger bottle. I understand restaurants needing to do this since they are BYOB, but let's not get carried away now. So our table ended up just opening up one of the bottles for dinner and took the other one back home. You are a great restaurant, Antica, but please fix your new rules with your BYOB (that are not stated on your website either).Thank you.

8.description: We enjoyed the experience at this restaurant (located north side -quite side of Andersonville).We had grilled calamari, Fattoressa piza ( the Sicilian special) and the pasta Penn con crema di pistachio!Food: Excellent Service : Excellent Ambience : GreatPrice: Fair We recommend to others and will go back there again soon.

31.description: Wow, give me the Isola Bella pizza as a gift if you ever want to woo me - because that 'za was some of the most delicious I've ever had. The butternut squash played off the olives and tomatoes in a wonderful way; sweetness mixing with the acidity of the tomatoes and salt of the olives. I drool at the thought.We waltzed in at 7 p.m. on Friday night (5 of us) and were promptly seated and welcomed by our friendly server. It's a little loud inside, due to the open nature of the restaurant, but it's cozy and dimly lit, so what's a little noise? We did have to wave our waiter down for wine he forgot and then to get the bill, but I'm not letting that knock my experience too much - I'll definitely be back!

34.description: Here is the basics:Loved: the staff (they are fantastic), BYOB, atmosphere, fresh fresh calamari, pizza (we tried two different ones and went with the staff recommendations)The negative was the tart for dessert. It just wasn't that good.  We will be back, I'd like to try the pasta and a different dessert.

16.description: FYI: They were taking reservations in Oct 2013. Not sure of that is still the case.On our first visit in July 2013, enjoyed 2 of the best Neopolitan pizzas I've had in Chicago- the Margherita and a special summer/fall pizza with sweet potatoes and fennel sausage. Everything was perfect- from food, service, timing, and ambiance, up to and including payment and boxing my (extensive) left-over pizza. The prices are very reasonable and the pizzas were just the right size for a single meal or sharing. On the second visit with a group of 5 in October 2013, we brought our own bottle, not realizing the policy had changed. We did not realize they took reservations when we decided to come in on a Friday with no reservation. Manager seemed irritated but he accommodated us. The food was even better than we remembered- Pere e Gorgonzola, Pappardelle con Costicine di Manzo, and two other pizzas. I don't remember exactly which pizzas, but I do know they were still the best I've had in Chicago. Our server was great and the manager (Mario) was very friendly, with the exception of his initial annoyance at our being there without a reservation. Next time, and I hope it is soon, I'll be sure to make a reservation.

13.description: Wow, give me the Isola Bella pizza as a gift if you ever want to woo me - because that 'za was some of the most delicious I've ever had. The butternut squash played off the olives and tomatoes in a wonderful way; sweetness mixing with the acidity of the tomatoes and salt of the olives. I drool at the thought.We waltzed in at 7 p.m. on Friday night (5 of us) and were promptly seated and welcomed by our friendly server. It's a little loud inside, due to the open nature of the restaurant, but it's cozy and dimly lit, so what's a little noise? We did have to wave our waiter down for wine he forgot and then to get the bill, but I'm not letting that knock my experience too much - I'll definitely be back!

11.description: OMG! Loved the pizza at Antica Pizzeria. Had been trying to make my way here, and when Pork Shoppe opened the other night and we couldn't wait 1/2 hour, then we just walked on over. The pistachio, arugula and speck pizza was beyond delicious. The thin crust was blistered, crispy and chewy -- all at the same time -- I'm longing for one right now. I ordered a bowl of zucchini soup, which was good, especially with the roasted crouton on top.And the waiter, while busy with our table of five and other customers, was helpful. We had to hurry to get to a play at Raven, and really forgot to mention that up front -- our bad:-)

39.description: No longer BYOB.  Dock 1 star for that plus the fact that our waitress was very rude about it when we showed up with wine - sorry we didn't get the memo!  She was also  giving me skeptical looks about my request for no cheese on anything, mild dairy intolerance over here.... thanks. I'm chalking that one up to an off night, because we come here a decent amount. Otherwise, this is still a great place for Italian. I'm partial to the pizza and appetizers.  Haven't experimented with much the entrees but I'm sure they are yummy as well.  Seating wise, it can be crowded on the weekends, so make a reservation if you are coming during prime hours.  There isn't really a good waiting area if you are a walk-in.

37.description: F this place. Haven't been in for a while but always liked it because the pizza was excellent, they were BYOB and they were usually not too crowded. The staff was always pleasant, the owner slung pizza in the back, always visited the tables to check on patron's meals. After having not been in over a year we came in tonight and brought some beer. We learned that they now had wine (fairly expensive) and beer (crap and Italian). We also couldn't get a straight answer about the fees to bring our own, other than an exorbitant $15 corkage fee for wine. Turns out there was a $3 per beer fee. We ordered, we ate, it was all very quick because that's how you go to restaurants when you have a 2-year-old. He was well-behaved, he wasn't screaming or yelling, he wasn't walking around, he wasn't throwing stuff. I'm not one of those halfwits who thinks their child doesn't misbehave, or who thinks every scream and yell should be recorded for posterity because it's so precious. But my son was not misbehaving. Towards the end of the meal, as we waited for a rather long time for them to take our check and give us change our son started to get antsy. He yelled a few times, so my wife took him out of his chair and he walked towards the front door where he stood waving goodbye to people, or rather persons because the place was pretty empty. In fact he waved goodbye to two people who left. At this time the owner was standing at the hostess station, leaning on it, looking not amused because a child was standing there really doing nothing. He frankly looked pretty annoyed. He was wincing like he was getting a rectal exam actually. My son let out a few more yells and that's when the owner decided that he needed to tell us that we need to keep our child quiet, because people were trying to enjoy their meal. He had made a few noises, I didn't see anyone complain and I think I would have known because there were only two other occupied tables and one of them also had a young child at their table. So my wife picked our son up and told the owner that we were just trying to pay our check, and the owner kept hounding us about keeping our son quiet. Again, I'm not some halfwit who can't recognize when my child is misbehaving. I'm not the kind of idiot who would bring a toddler to Alinea, or any kind of fancy, quiet restaurant. But this place has many high chairs, and often has many kids in the restaurant when we have been in the past. I'm not sure if business is bad and the owner just feels like being a smug dick to everyone, but that's what we experienced tonight and it was unfortunate, because I would tell anyone I knew about how great their brick-oven pizza was, how it wasn't anywhere near as crowded as some of the other brick-oven places in Chicago, how they were BYOB and it was a very casual, friendly environment. So in closing a big F you to the prick owner of this place, who is shown in the foreground of at least one of the photos on the Yelp review. Don't go here if you have kids who make a few noises during dinner because you'll incur the wrath of an asshole who seems mad that his restaurant isn't very full, or that people don't want to spend way too much money on his wine and bad beer.

0.description: yum yum yummy food with the most charming service... if you're not in the neighborhood it is totally worth traveling to... the food is very fresh and prepared daily... the ambience is casual and dimly lit good for a date or a relaxing meal with friends the tables can easily be pushed together to accommodate larger parties

38.description: Their pizza really is authentic Napoli style pizza. It's thin and taste fresh out of the oven! The toppings offer a wide variety of flavors, from meaty and salty to cheesy and savory. The sauce tastes great and fresh as well. There is nothing I can complain about except for the fact that the amount of toppings and freshness kinda leaves the crust too soft to pick up a slice without everything sliding off of it or it falling apart. This seems to be a natural part of the Napoli style, as it happened when I had some at Eately. The best thing to do is eat it with a knife and fork. It's that good!I will be back and might try the pasta, but the pizza is so darn good it's hard to pass up. The food isn't the only thing about this place that makes it so wonderful to visit. The people make you feel like family with their warm, welcoming spirit and service. I highly recommend this place especially if you are not the deep dish kinda pizza guy or gal.

51.description: SO happy I finally made it into Antica after walking past it many many times. Definitely exceeded my expectations and I will be back for more! The atmosphere is cozy even though the dining room is a pretty big space. The large brick pizza oven in the back draws you in and had me instantly wanting pizza. We ordered the margarita pizza as an appetizer to share, the bolognese, and a chicken dish that was on special. The pizza was awesome! Super thin crust, fresh perfectly melted mozzarella, and the right amount of basil and tomatoes.Bolognese was good but not the best. Loved the fresh made pasta and while the sauce was good there weren't any carrots..which is what I crave in a bolognese. I wish I could remember the name of that chicken dish because it was amazing. The chicken was super moist and flavorful while the potatoes on the side were crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. Apparently this place used to be BYOB but is no longer. Kinda bummed I missed out on that but that won't keep me from coming back!

27.description: This place is great! Went here last night with a friend for the first time. We started off with the bruschetta appetizer, and it was amazing. I loved how it was actually real chunks of tomato, instead of the random, perfectly formed cubes of tomato like at some other places. The pizza was also amazing; crispy crust with a soft middle was perfect!It's a quaint little place where everyone is friendly, the waitress was awesome, and you can tell they really care about their business and know their way around Italian food. I'll definitely be back!

32.description: I have been here twice. First time I had pizza. It was fabulous. Crust is crisp but soggy in the middle. Yum. Second time I had bolognese. It was good but a little acidic for bolognese. My boyfriend gets the Amatriciana. It's good. Downside-no longer BYOB. It would be cool, but the wine list is lacking. Corkage fee is $15. Ummm. How about not.

54.description: I love this place.Service is super friendly, owner recognizes his regulars and new comers.Food is prepared fresh and thoughtfully with obvious attention to quality ingredients.It's BYOB with a nominal corkage fee, which is completely reasonable IMO.  They open your bottles for you, pour the wine, keep the glasses re-filled and also provide glass ware - none of that comes for free to them...Also, they will keep your beer or white wines cold in the back until you are ready or bring beers out one by one as you need them, complete service!Last time I was in, which is admittedly too long, they were talking about starting beer and wine service, which I think will be fantastic.  They said they would still keep BYOB as option for customers, that's very nice.  I love the BYOB option, but sometimes just ordering what a place has is nicer and easier.We like the pizzas, and pastas, and the salads, and the fish, and the... well you get the point.  Grilled octopus is especially wonderful.  We can come for a multi-course extravaganza or pop in quick for a lite meal - the perfect neighborhood spot.

48.description: Great atmosphere with wonderful servers!!  I felt so welcomed into this restaurant...almost like it was someone's home.  The pizza was exactly like the pizza I had when I was in Naples, Italy...super authentic.  I had the vegetarian pizza and very much enjoyed it.  Give this play a try for sure!

44.description: Amazing pasta, pizza and specials!This is true italian food and Mario and his staff are wonderful. Our go-to Italian restaurant.

24.description: The quality is still there, but the prices have gone up significantly and the quantity has gone down substantially.

7.description: Are you short on time and money and can't get over to Italy for a good pizza? No worries! Stop by Antica Pizzeria. I've been to this establishment twice now, and can say both times I felt like I was back in Italy enjoying a really special pizza. On my latest trip, my group split the Panna (green peas, heavy cream, sausage), the Fattoressa (ham, eggs, green peas, mushrooms), and the agnolotti pasticciati. As much as I wanted something basic like a bolognese, I'm glad my sister urged us to order less-traditional fare. Each of those choices was delicious and unique, especially the Panna. Prices are reasonable, $15 corkage fee. I'll be back!

49.description: I trusted Yelp (and Mario's Italian accent over the phone), and we were rewarded handsomely with a wonderful dinner. We were made to feel extremely welcome, and the food was just the right style and portion. Nothing was overly ornate, but everything was full of flavor. Thus is now my go-to Italian restaurant in Chicago.

40.description: Amazing Italian thin crust. Eat here quite often. Great selection of wines. Their appetizer bread is also a standard of any visit here. The owner is very friendly and the service is always impeccable. Recommend the Margarita pizza.1 star off for not staying BYOB. Prefer my own selection of alcohol to their menu now.

53.description: Heads up: They are no longer BYOB. They have wines by the bottle and glass available and I believe they have beer on the menu as well.Went for dinner and had an excellent meal and good service. I ordered the Papperdelle with porcini and asparagus. I also sampled a friend's gnocchi. Both were excellent. We ordered two desserts: tira misu and cannoli. The cannoli had a harder shell than I'm used to, but was very tasty. Tira misu was great.The atmosphere is quaint, casual Italian dining, the dining room is bigger than some comparable bistros so it doesn't feel overly crowded. Meals seemed reasonably priced and were all presented well. Overall, I'd definitely recommend it.

30.description: I really enjoyed my overall experience from the service to the food. I was greeted  promptly and seated for my reservation and the waitress could not have been nicer or more authentic; real Italian that knows her food and wine.  So don't be afraid to ask for recommendations. The pizza was excellent thin-woodfired-goodness. The salads were fresh and delicious. And the pastas are really well done and flavorful.  It's nice to experience such a well run family run establishment. I will definitely be back.

46.description: I went to Antica couple of months ago with my friend and her husband and they both are in love with it.  I got to meet the owner and the food was delicious. I decided to try it the second time to see the consistency (we all know it changes).  The food was just deliciousssssss even the second time and the freshly baked bread is just awesome. From what I have heard and seen the owner is always there to greet you, talk to you about likes and dislikes and making changes accordingly.  Hey full stars from me.  The server were nice the food is delicious, the ambiance is cozy how much more greedy can one get?  Definitely going back again.

1.description: To the owner: not sure if you've actually read some of the other reviews but there at least 2 that have commented on your anti-sound policy coming out of children. To refresh your memory, here are some quotes: "My son let out a few more yells and that's when the owner decided that he needed to tell us that we need to keep our child quiet, because people were trying to enjoy their meal...I'm not sure if business is bad and the owner just feels like being a smug dick to everyone, but that's what we experienced tonight and it was unfortunate." "Sometimes a business has to have a little people manners and its not always about the food."

55.description: Very nice place.  Great pizza, service, and dessert.  They do serve beer and wine,not a huge selection of beer, but it worked for an Italian restaurant. The pizzas were ready very quickly, barely time to enjoy the awesome bread and olive oil.  Great authentic Italian pizza

9.description: Delicious authentic Italian pizza! The crust was perfect. The toppings were fresh and flavorful.  We also tried the asparagus salad which was so good! I am so glad we found this place and will definitely be going back!

26.description: While looking for a place on my phone using Yelp app in Andersonville, I found this Pizza place to be best rated. As I sit on the table super high price on corkage fee was very surprising. 15$ for corkage fee is little too over priced in my opinion. Second very surprising fact of this night was the fact waitress trying so hard to talk to a point that I could tell she was not Italian, which is not a big deal, in fact nice that she tries for working at an Italian restaurant but this made it impossible for me to communicate with her. I got Spinach salad, which was to be honest interesting for the fact that it had some crispy walnuts. Pizza I ordered was Pepperoni and Red pepper Pizza. It was around 14" good for one person or along with a salad can fill two person comfortably. Though, there were around 4-5 slices of pepperoni on the pizza in total so their pizza did not make me happy either. Overall my experience with this place was not good. It's very discouraging to check new restaurants in my neighborhood with their rating nowadays since, I have no idea how, some restaurants get higher rating but provide more expensive, money oriented and customer satisfaction is not as important, as I had this impression.

25.description: Antica Pizzeria is one of the best pizza places I've been to in the city! It's an authentic Italian style pizza on an artisan crust. The crust is crispy on the bottom, soft on the top and very light.The atmosphere is very warm and cozy. This place would be perfect for a date, a romantic evening or a small party with friends.  It's in the north part of Andersonville so you'll find a good mix of people and ages.I went with the pizza because it's a pizzeria.  I got the margarita pizza and it was simply amazing.  The mozzarella cheese was in the perfect amount making it a perfect addition to the overall flavor.  They have some Italian beers in the bottle if you're interested in something crisp and light.I would recommend trying it if your in the area or even if your not. It's a good pizza that won't leave you feeling weighed down.

12.description: I really enjoyed my overall experience from the service to the food. I was greeted  promptly and seated for my reservation and the waitress could not have been nicer or more authentic; real Italian that knows her food and wine.  So don't be afraid to ask for recommendations. The pizza was excellent thin-woodfired-goodness. The salads were fresh and delicious. And the pastas are really well done and flavorful.  It's nice to experience such a well run family run establishment. I will definitely be back.

59.description: I went to try the pizza on a Saturday night. Had no reservations, but didn't wait long at all.   I got served bread with olive oil and it was starting off to be a good night. Ordered the fried calamari and it was pretty bad. It tasted either as if had been frozen or over cooked either way it was bad. I tried the La Bottegaia pizza, it was all right. The problem was that the middle was soggy-and cold and the black olives really were too salty and that's all I tasted. I took off the olives and it tasted a whole lot better. The ends of the crust were good and if the whole pizza had the crispness of ends it would've been better.I'd like to give it another try since the place had a lot of  great reviews. But I wasn't blown away by the food I ordered.

21.description: This is one of those reviews that I'm afraid to write. I'm fiercely protective of what is really our favorite neighborhood restaurant, but they deserve the business. So, here I am.We've lived in Andersonville for years, and this is one of the places we go to again and again and again. In fact, it's probably one of the places we've been to the most in Chicago, and that's saying a lot; we like to try new eats, and we don't often go back to the same place twice.However, several times a year--and when we have company in town--we often find ourselves making our way down to Antica.Why do we love it so much? Oh, let me count the ways.First, the service is OUTSTANDING. I mean, really, they fawn over you. The waitstaff is professional and kind and efficient. My mom dropped something out of her purse while we were dining there today, and our waiter came over to pick it up before she even had a chance to bend over.Also, Mario, the owner, is always there. He will great you with a smile and a buttery Italian accent as soon as you walk in the door, and he'll make sure you've had a good time.The vibe of the restaurant is cozy and homey and oh-so-welcoming. It really feels like a family-owned neighborhood restaurant.But the food, of course, is the real star. The pizza, which is fired in their large pizza oven, is my favorite in the city. The crust is thin and floppy, the edges are blistered, and the toppings are fresh.They also have the best Italian salads and pastas I've had in the city. Every time I go, I find myself saying, "This is just like the Italian food I grew up with!"They regularly change specials, have a large menu, have delicious homemade desserts, and are reasonably priced. Truthfully, I can't think of a bad thing to say about this place. Just go--you'll have a good time and a great meal. And you, too, will be back!

17.description: My favorite Neapolitan style pizza in Chicago.  Other places, including Coalfire and Spacca, are a bit overrated.   I get a food high every time I eat here.

10.description: Antica Pizzeria is one of the best pizza places I've been to in the city! It's an authentic Italian style pizza on an artisan crust. The crust is crispy on the bottom, soft on the top and very light.The atmosphere is very warm and cozy. This place would be perfect for a date, a romantic evening or a small party with friends.  It's in the north part of Andersonville so you'll find a good mix of people and ages.I went with the pizza because it's a pizzeria.  I got the margarita pizza and it was simply amazing.  The mozzarella cheese was in the perfect amount making it a perfect addition to the overall flavor.  They have some Italian beers in the bottle if you're interested in something crisp and light.I would recommend trying it if your in the area or even if your not. It's a good pizza that won't leave you feeling weighed down.

5.description: First of all . . . a $15 corkage fee?! I actually asked the waiter if he was kidding on that one. He wasn't. That part is WAY out of line when you're toting a $7.99 bottle of wine. So, we saved our wine and got vodka drinks there instead, for what we would have paid for a corkage fee - and all was right again. It's almost like they're trying to phase out the BYOB aspect of this restaurant, and that's a shame.That said, we came here on a reco of friends (M&L!) who know their pizza. And the pizza was spot on. We got the ham, artichoke, mushroom - and it was delicious. The bread was great too, made in the same brick over as the pizza. Absolutely loved it - the pizza was juicy, cheesy and piping hot. Really great - it rivals Apart for my favorite pizza in the neighborhood. Prices were great too, we got out of there for under $50 for two. Waiter was friendly and attentive. The decor . . . whatever, it's a real nothing there - but you aren't eating the decor. You should come here and eat their pizza, it's worth visiting again for that.

3.description: This is one of those reviews that I'm afraid to write. I'm fiercely protective of what is really our favorite neighborhood restaurant, but they deserve the business. So, here I am.We've lived in Andersonville for years, and this is one of the places we go to again and again and again. In fact, it's probably one of the places we've been to the most in Chicago, and that's saying a lot; we like to try new eats, and we don't often go back to the same place twice.However, several times a year--and when we have company in town--we often find ourselves making our way down to Antica.Why do we love it so much? Oh, let me count the ways.First, the service is OUTSTANDING. I mean, really, they fawn over you. The waitstaff is professional and kind and efficient. My mom dropped something out of her purse while we were dining there today, and our waiter came over to pick it up before she even had a chance to bend over.Also, Mario, the owner, is always there. He will great you with a smile and a buttery Italian accent as soon as you walk in the door, and he'll make sure you've had a good time.The vibe of the restaurant is cozy and homey and oh-so-welcoming. It really feels like a family-owned neighborhood restaurant.But the food, of course, is the real star. The pizza, which is fired in their large pizza oven, is my favorite in the city. The crust is thin and floppy, the edges are blistered, and the toppings are fresh.They also have the best Italian salads and pastas I've had in the city. Every time I go, I find myself saying, "This is just like the Italian food I grew up with!"They regularly change specials, have a large menu, have delicious homemade desserts, and are reasonably priced. Truthfully, I can't think of a bad thing to say about this place. Just go--you'll have a good time and a great meal. And you, too, will be back!

35.description: Very poor service and used to be a BYOB and major attitude if you didn't know and happen to bring in a bottle. The staff will get to you eventually, if they aren't busy talking. There are much better places to go in Andersonville.I wouldn't recommend it unless you are walking, no transportation, and are already a few glasses in.

19.description: Their pizza really is authentic Napoli style pizza. It's thin and taste fresh out of the oven! The toppings offer a wide variety of flavors, from meaty and salty to cheesy and savory. The sauce tastes great and fresh as well. There is nothing I can complain about except for the fact that the amount of toppings and freshness kinda leaves the crust too soft to pick up a slice without everything sliding off of it or it falling apart. This seems to be a natural part of the Napoli style, as it happened when I had some at Eately. The best thing to do is eat it with a knife and fork. It's that good!I will be back and might try the pasta, but the pizza is so darn good it's hard to pass up. The food isn't the only thing about this place that makes it so wonderful to visit. The people make you feel like family with their warm, welcoming spirit and service. I highly recommend this place especially if you are not the deep dish kinda pizza guy or gal.

28.description: Nothing negative to say. A few friends and I went out originally looking to go to Leonardo's Ristorante, located next door to Antica's. Upon seeing it was closed due to the owners being on vacation, we ducked into the Pizzeria next door. We were immediately welcomed warmly by everyone. We took a seat and realized we were the only patrons there, but it was near closing time. The place is beautiful, brick and low light. We ordered wine and food, and everything came out fast and absolutely delicious. I had shrimp penne, others had pizza and the filet and nobody had any complaints. The staff was very animated, talking in loud Italian and laughing and drinking wine themselves. We wanted to head out as not to keep the staff past closing, but they heard we were celebrating a birthday and brought us tiramisu with a candle and sang happy birthday in Italian. Our waitress was so fun, she said her English wasn't great, and the next minute she was singing a Kansas song that came over the speakers. So glad we ended up here, would recommend to anyone.

45.description: So dependable, so enjoyable, and now they serve alcohol. Yay! We love bringing guests, or just heading in for an early meal with our kids. Have never had a bad meal here.

33.description: Ordered to pick up margherita, sausage and mushroom, and ham. Coming from ny with high pizza standards, this was delicious! Classic style Italian pizza.

43.description: I've been here several times and this place just keeps getting better!! The ingredients are so high quality that  you really taste the difference. We were a group of ten and tried several appetizers and pizzas, the Padania was out of this world and so the Pistacchio and Speck! Tortino di zucchini was the most delicious appetizers and we end up ordering two extra.The wine selection is so well made. We loved our sparkling Prosecco we started with and the Stefano Farina Primitivo. For only $26 x bottle you'll think you're drinking a $75 bottle of wine!!Service was attentive and efficient. Mario, the owner, supervises everything, greeting every single guest and making sure everyone has the perfect experience.Great job Mario!! keep up the good work.

2.description: I just ordered again from here and the service and food was way below average. Last time I ordered a pizza and they forgot some of the ingredients. This time I ordered the lasagna and it was not what it described on the menu. This is cafeteria quality at best or by can Chef Boyardee. I paid $5 to have it delivered by Door Dash. No napkins, nothing. I just called the restaurant and the manager yelled over the noise and told me"if you don't like it don't order from here." He then hung up the phone on me.There food may be better at the restaurant but I live in the neighborhood and will never order here again based on the their rudeness and poor quality of food. Btw-I got a large slice of lasagna with no cheese that cost me $25. I wouldn't even give them 1 star but you have to select one. Not a happy camper on a cold night looking for some authentic, Italian food.

18.description: While looking for a place on my phone using Yelp app in Andersonville, I found this Pizza place to be best rated. As I sit on the table super high price on corkage fee was very surprising. 15$ for corkage fee is little too over priced in my opinion. Second very surprising fact of this night was the fact waitress trying so hard to talk to a point that I could tell she was not Italian, which is not a big deal, in fact nice that she tries for working at an Italian restaurant but this made it impossible for me to communicate with her. I got Spinach salad, which was to be honest interesting for the fact that it had some crispy walnuts. Pizza I ordered was Pepperoni and Red pepper Pizza. It was around 14" good for one person or along with a salad can fill two person comfortably. Though, there were around 4-5 slices of pepperoni on the pizza in total so their pizza did not make me happy either. Overall my experience with this place was not good. It's very discouraging to check new restaurants in my neighborhood with their rating nowadays since, I have no idea how, some restaurants get higher rating but provide more expensive, money oriented and customer satisfaction is not as important, as I had this impression.

41.description: Before theater, I was looking for a place to dine. There were surprisingly few dining options and we happened upon here while walking. It was great! Having been to Sicily, it was as if we returned. The owner greeted us and checked on us frequently. The service was attentive. The food great! I had a pasta dish and my wife, pizza. Both were out of this world. I highly recommend.

52.description: FYI: They were taking reservations in Oct 2013. Not sure of that is still the case.On our first visit in July 2013, enjoyed 2 of the best Neopolitan pizzas I've had in Chicago- the Margherita and a special summer/fall pizza with sweet potatoes and fennel sausage. Everything was perfect- from food, service, timing, and ambiance, up to and including payment and boxing my (extensive) left-over pizza. The prices are very reasonable and the pizzas were just the right size for a single meal or sharing. On the second visit with a group of 5 in October 2013, we brought our own bottle, not realizing the policy had changed. We did not realize they took reservations when we decided to come in on a Friday with no reservation. Manager seemed irritated but he accommodated us. The food was even better than we remembered- Pere e Gorgonzola, Pappardelle con Costicine di Manzo, and two other pizzas. I don't remember exactly which pizzas, but I do know they were still the best I've had in Chicago. Our server was great and the manager (Mario) was very friendly, with the exception of his initial annoyance at our being there without a reservation. Next time, and I hope it is soon, I'll be sure to make a reservation.

50.description: An intimate restaurant with generally fantastic salads, pastas, fish, brick oven pizzas, etc. The owner is usually at the restaurant and will likely stop by your table to see if you are enjoying your meal. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the food is very good. This establishment was BYOB, but the last time I was there they offered wine and beer for sale. I'm unsure if they still allow you to bring in your own bottle for a corkage fee. I think the prices are a bit high for Italian, but I keep coming back because I the food is great.

4.description: Whoa. This is seriously good pizza.We ordered the Pistachio and the Parma.  First off, this dough is incredibly tasty. Now, you would not think about arugula and pistachios on a white pizza, but PLEASE try this.The Parma pizza is a meaty, yet delicate meal. The beet salad was beautiful, the lemon vinegrete was perfect for it. We had it delivered from Grub Hub,  it was still hot! Thank you for restoring my faith in pizza.

6.description: The feel is so Italian and very warmth .. When you get in .. The owner working as a host, waiter, etc will personally sit you down .. And will give you the details of the specials and other relevant info and answer your queries !!!  I had the best calamari that night .. And all the other food we ordered were very good .. And I was so impressed of the service .... We went back today .. But Tuesday they are closed ... But then I'mLooking forward to go back to this restaurant !!!

22.description: Wow.  Surly greeting when we byob and argument with owner over what website we looked at that still indicated byob.  He blamed Google which is not his official site.  What a putz.  Shitty attitude continued with server who informed us corking fee is $20 per bottle.  Long wait for wood oven pizza with moist flimsy crust.  Will not be going back.

15.description: It's our second kitchen...with a Sicilian chef. Incredible food! Flavors. Authentic. Treated like family. Warmest place in Chicago. Mario food home and keeps close to his roots. XOXO

57.description: The reviews look terrific, and I have faithreviewers here are accurate, and trustworthy.  However, we didn't get that far. I called to see if we needed reservations for a party of four.  Yes;  I gave the time as  6:30, party of 4, and my name.  We got there just past 6, to wait for our friends.  Our reservation was in the books, but for 6:00.  Mistakes happen, we're adaptable.  If I DID make a mistake, fine - I want that pizza!He told us, yes, he could seat us when our friends arrived at 6:30, but we would need to be out of the restaurant by 8:00.We said that limits time for drinks and dessert.  He said, I don't want you staying until 11:00!  We said we wouldn't do that.  He said, "I can't trust that you won't. this is very inconvenient for me!We left. I have exaggerated nothing here.To the person-reading-this: would you have stayed?  The restaurant business is a service industry, I do not want to inconvenience anyone.  Even in very good restaurants there are ways to move people on, but not this way.  I'm sorry i never got to try his food, but I'm not disappointed that he didn't get my money either.   We did just fine at Hopleaf, had a great time, good food, beer.  It was a good night. I hope Mr. Antica turns over a new leaf himself.  Okay, did I call him any names/ Was I fair?  I tried to give him zero stars, can't do that evidently. Oh well.

20.description: Went there for dinner on Saturday night.  It wasn't full, and we were given a table by the kitchen.  All was well... pretty good starter, and then a steak with spinach.  Both tasted good.  But halfway through my entree there was a huge wave of cleaning fluid smell -- they had started to clean the kitchen at 10 pm on a Saturday night.  It was pretty nauseating, and put me right off my food.  The bus boy came by, and I asked him to wrap what I hadn't had a chance to eat.  I told our waiter what had happened, and he apologized and said that the kitchen "did what they wanted!"  He asked if I'd like to speak to the manager (owner?).  When he came over he was immediately aggressive.  I told him what happened, and he started yelling at me that I should have asked to be moved when the cleaning fluids started to mess with my senses, that this was my own fault, and that he bore no responsibility!  What a thoroughly unpleasant person.  That guy needs to do a refresher course at charm school.  Definitely my first and last time at Antica.

36.description: Okay...definitely one of the best italian restaurants in Chicago...didn't get to the pizza but we had an amazing barley soup and beet salad followed by roast rack of lamb...just incredible. Clean clear flavors. Amazing staff and owners. Can't wait to become one of their regulars.

14.description: This is NOT a kid friendly restaurant. My husband and I came here today with our 13 month old and 4 year old because, per Yelp, this place fit the criteria for close by, good pizza, casual and kid friendly. I guess I should have known when they didn't have a kids menu. Everything was going fine till my 13 month old started fussing a bit because he was hungry. I had nothing to give him (No, they don't even provide bread or anything.) but after a bit was unable to distract him. The maître D starts coming over and I thought at first he was going to offer help (the other "kid friendly" places I've been to either helped or ignored a fussy baby) but then he instead tells us that some customers (as though we weren't) had complained and would we please please do something about the baby.I took him outside to wait till our food arrived, since that felt like my only option under the circumstances.  When my husband came to get us, my 4 year old started yelling. At that point, we decided to get everything to go.When we got home we discovered they hadn't even cut our pizzas they were in such a hurry to get us out.The food was good but there are plenty of other good pizza places in Chicago that won't treat you like a second class citizen for having children. We will NOT be returning.

3.description: I am entirely charmed by this shop. Entirely. After a wonderful lunch at Andersonville's Hopleaf, my dear friend Rob and I decided to spend the day antiquing and thrift shopping through Chicago's lesbian Mecca. We hit all of the regular haunts: Brimfield for horrifyingly overpriced bric-a-brac; Brownstone to dig for buried treasure, and then we landed softly here: Ya Ya's. Of all the antique stores I have visited in Chicago (and there have been many, expect more reviews soon, dear readers), this has been my best experience so far. It could be that my friend is in great standing with the owners and they welcomed us warmly. It could be that both of the owners are delightful and dashingly handsome (what's up, boys?). But one thing is certain: it is definitely because this store has been built, arranged, and priced with the customer in mind. All pieces are displayed comfortably and priced at a level that is attainable. The same teacup that would run 50-60 dollars at Brimfield is 5.00 here. A plate made of carnival glass runs a reasonable 12.00. Examples of moderate, level-headed pricing abound and not a one sacrifices quality for affordability. For those of us who are young, scratching our empty wallets, and wanting to outfit our homes and lives with the very best that can be stolen from Gramma Mammy's house, this shop is heaven. I can't afford to drop a few hundred dollars on my auntie's full-length fur coat. I have to fill my china hutch and I don't want to empty my bank account doing it. Thanks to the fine gentlemen at Ya Ya's, now I won't have to. Cheers, boys!

1.description: awesome. that's it.Nice meeting you Ellen and Miguel.

2.description: One of my favorite shops in Andersonville. Paul and Miguel are sweet, down-to-earth, friendly, and laid back. The guys are always willing to negotiate prices and offer discounts. There is always at least one treasure I find while perusing their store, and in true shopping fashion, I always leave with something new for me or my home.

5.description: It's a small place with a nice selection of stuff at good prices.  I've wandered through many such shops in the area and left empty-handed because a) they didn't have anything I liked, or b) they did have things I liked, but they were way over-priced.  Ya Ya's hits just the right balance between smartly-chosen items and reasonable pricing.The owner is friendly and not pushy.  I love looking at all the items, and I almost always find something great.  If you haven't been inside yet, give it a look!

6.description: I was on a mission with my partner and brother to find a decorative box of a very specific size for a project.On the sidewalk in front of the shop the owners had arranged a number of interesting and tasteful chairs to attract attention. It worked - we looked up to see what the store was about then walked in to crack a lame joke ("Get yer yaya's here!"). We were promptly greeted by a friendly gentleman, and then were left to browse. No-pressure shopping is my bag! Antique shops can feel cluttered and distracting, but I found the place easily browse-able and not at all claustrophobic. We ended up finding something that will work beautifully for our project that was reasonably priced (although admittedly we know very little about antiquing). After a hassel-free transaction and engaging interaction with the owners, we left feeling accomplished and pretty proud of ourselves.

7.description: I love this little store..its a great place to walk in and find something intresting...the other day i walked in to this store to find a side table or some pedastls..couldnt fing but there was this other stuff lovely..honestly a little over priced ..but negotiable ...definetly a place that gives feel good factor..

8.description: I have been to this place 5 or 6 times. Great selection, reasonable prices, and interesting stuff.  I like stuff from the 40's to 70's. he does have older items in the store also. This is my favoriate shop on Clark street in andersenville.

0.description: I think of Ya Ya's as a magical thrift store from which someone has removed 99% of the crap and left only the best vintage-to-antique finds that I may plausibly love--AND afford to take home. Ya Ya's is not an emporium of magnificent 19th century investments (Chicago has plenty of those already); it's a friendly little shop with nice old things at unpretentious prices.Selection, in my experience, favors early 20th century with an emphasis on dishes, tableware, jewelry, art, and occasional furniture.

4.description: When this place opened I was thinking, "Great, just what Andersonville needs, ANOTHER overpriced antique store."  However, I really love it there! At first they only carried items that I could never afford in my wildest dreams, but now that they have been there a few months things have changed a little.  They have a great selection of many different items at many different price ranges.  They have cool legit vintage stuff, and fun and funky costume jewelry too.  I went in there today to look for a few small dishes to put my rings in at night or while I'm doing the dishes and I struck gold!  I found many different options all reasonably priced.  I also found some earrings, a necklace, a set of tea cups and a serving dish I wanted to buy as well!  Not to mention an amazing vintage make up table for me to lust after...*le sigh*The owners are very nice and are definitely no pressure.  And even though there is a TON of stuff in there it all seemed very clean, spacious and well organized.  I was wearing a winter coat and a back pack today and I was never worried that I would knock something down.  I am very glad Ya Ya moved into my neighborhood.  I will definitely be back!

28.description: Cool space and awesome job grooming.  I had chest, arm and back wax, it was great.  Matt also has recommendations for post wax care, which is critical for somebody like me.The space is super cool, very RL.  I highly recommend if you need this type of service.  Also, Matt is funny, which kept me entertained while he was ripping the hair off my chest.

1.description: Matt is great, felt very comfortable despite being half clothed with a stranger. Use the web site to make an appointment, I sent two emails without success not sure on who's part. Will be back! Thanks

9.description: MATT IS THE BEST!  Let's face it....anytime you are getting yourself waxed, it's not always the most comfortable situation, but Matt is GREAT!  He is friendly, funny and great at what he does!  It is comfortable from the minute you walk in until the minute you leave - he is just the best!  I will NEVER go to anyone else - he has another new loyal customer!

29.description: This is as good as it gets, starting with the ease of use of the online booking system to the warm, delectable, outstandingly designed space of the 'parlor'.  Matt himself is a very knowledgeable, entertaining and talented esthetician, making you feel at ease for any service you come there for.  Comparable to other spas, the price of services are very reasonable, especially since the products used are top notch!  You come walking out feeling like a million bucks!

23.description: I will never go anywhere else. Matt is a wizard of hair removal. He is friendly, his space is warm and comfortable and it makes an appointment  I wouldn't generally look forward to a more pleasurable experience. On top of all that I've found his prices to be on the low side of the city average.

5.description: Although Matt may be good at what he does, he has flaked on me twice. Once when he 'forgot' he had vacation planned and informed me last minute and again today, where he never even showed up. With the large amount of salons offering these services, I will not risk going to him again. I had an excellent experience at the Painless Waxing Boutique. I recommend going there.

31.description: Matt is a master of his craft.  After every appointment i not only leave feeling like my skin is brand new I also leave with helpful tips on how to maintain it.  Matt really has amazing hands that feel like magic when he is working on your skin, not to mention a voice that is so relaxing. Matt is also very good at explaining what he is doing and the purpose of that particular step to the health of your skin.  The new location is also an amazingly appointed place that is soothing and relaxing in such a masculine way.  Matt will always greet you with a smile and a hug (if you want one) and makes sure that you are really pampered from the moment you walk into the door until you leave, feeling like a million dollars!   You must see Matt if you would like to have a really great experience in skin care.  You are the center of attention while under his care, no other people around, no waiting between services, etc.  This is like a spa that is reserved just for you!   Do yourself a favor, go see Matt, now!

25.description: Matt is fantastic. Period. Having gone to other grooming places, I cannot say enough about Matt's personalism and professionalism. And he is cheaper in price than many of the chain aesthetic businesses in Chicago.The studio is very easy to get to in the Andersonville neighborhood and is very professionally decorated (masculine, relaxing - I agree with Dennis B. - very Ralph Lauren).

12.description: I had my first wax experience with Matt today. He did an awesome job. Great personality and made me feel very comfortable. I got the executive wax, nose, ears and eyebrows. Eyebrows look great, not too thin, just clean. Ears were painless. Nose is the only part of the wax that was a little painful, but he did a wonderful job. I'll keep coming back! Thanks Matt!

21.description: Amazing! My first time ever getting waxed, and Matt is phenomenal at making his clients feel comfortable. Very professional and efficient! I can't recommend his services enough...

16.description: Great location. Easy on line appointment option. I'm a repeat customer for over four years now. Matt's the best!

17.description: This place is the best- I found used to go to The Waxing Room, I will only go here. He does a great job on my eye brows- and keeps them from going too thin. He truly understands what he is doing.

10.description: Matt is fast and entertaining, but professional and his prices are reasonable.  He schedules appointments back to back, but allows you to enter and exit privately.  The waiting room will make you want a cocktail.

11.description: I just needed to re-up my review. Matt continues to be amazing. I recently moved away from Chicago and I have been lost without him. The others I have been forced to try have been abysmal at best. In fact I have to come into Chicago to see Matt. He continues to be fun, friendly, courteous and just plain excellent.  Go to the men's grooming parlour.

26.description: Matt is absolutely the best. He is a friendly and highly skilled provider who can take care of all of your grooming needs. I have been seeing him for well over a year and go back every 2 months or so. Waxing was the first step, but now he has be hooked on facials as well. I never knew how great they could be. Matt is going to be my guy without fail. Plus he has a great website for booking that makes it absolutely simple.

27.description: I would not usually recommend someone who rips hair off of my body, but Matt did it expertly.  He gave recommendations for skin care follow up that will help keep his work looking its best.  Totally appreciate the bond he created and the humor with which he worked.Majorly recommend.

35.description: With licensed esthetician and savvy businessman Matt Leyes running the show, you know it's going to be classy and first rate.  His clientele will follow him anywhere, and I am happy to go along with him.  Since moving north to Andersonville (where those bears need a place to go for periodic manscaping), Matt's taken his expertise in waxing and skin care to a higher level.  The shop couldn't be cuter either.

0.description: In this instance, short and sweet says it all. Ambiance, personality, courtesy, and professionalism. Thank you Matt for turning an uncomfortable necessity into a pleasant experience. You have yourself a new and loyal client!

20.description: I think I am addicted!

19.description: Matt is fantastic. Period. Having gone to other grooming places, I cannot say enough about Matt's personalism and professionalism. And he is cheaper in price than many of the chain aesthetic businesses in Chicago.The studio is very easy to get to in the Andersonville neighborhood and is very professionally decorated (masculine, relaxing - I agree with Dennis B. - very Ralph Lauren).

33.description: Awesome!  The online appointment booking system is revolutionary.  Love everything about it.

2.description: Thanks to great reviews on yelp, I've found a new go-to spot for waxing services.Matt is everything you could ask for in an esthetician: warm, friendly, professional and efficient.I got a men's back wax, which by its nature isn't necessarily comfortable.  Matt made the service easy and as quick and pain-free as possible.  Work was top notch.Very cool aesthetic at the salon: 1970s private men's club??  When I arrived this afternoon, some chill bossa nova (Bebel Gilberto) was playing and I wanted a rum cocktail to go along with my wax!The salon is actually a converted condo above Antiprima italian restaurant in Andersonville.  Matt mentioned it used to be a brothel used by the men's strip club downstairs.  If the walls could talk...Price ($51 + tip for men's back wax) was commensurate with the quality of service received.I'm a fan and will most definitely be back.

34.description: Although his doors have been open for several months, today was my first visit to see Matt since he opened his own business.In short, he does great work.  He has a wonderful sense of humor.When my back needs a waxin', I will always turn to Matt!

32.description: The quality of Matt's work is the reason that I kept coming back to him. There are plenty of places to go and get manscaped but Matt has taken the experience to a whole other level.  His treatments are relatively painless ( I've had others that were extremely painful) due to the quality of his products.  Using higher quality products results in less skin irritation-so I've been told and witnessed!The new location is absolutely gorgeous!  His attention to detail is reflected here.  If you are considering body/skin treatments, at least give MGP a try.

18.description: First time, today.....but it won't be my last!!!    I finally have found a place that is NOT intimidating at all!!!!   I was welcomed in at the door, personally, by Matt.  He showed me into a waiting area that was warm and welcoming.  It was filled with pictures, books, and some great music!!!  When it came time for my waxing (I got "The Executive".....eyebrows, nose, and ears), I could tell Matt was very professional as he asked me about allergies and medications I might be taking at the time.  When that was all clear, he then started the wax.  Matt is friendly, professional, and truly makes you feel important!  He keeps the conversation going and takes your mind off of what could be a painful experience.  I can honestly tell you I did NOT feel a thing!!!  He was quick and completely done within TEN MINUTES!!  I was pleasantly surprised!!  Matt has several ways to receive payment which is helpful, too (cash; credit; check)   I have NEVER experienced such a great waxing service.  Matt, you are AMAZING!  THANK YOU!!

13.description: Unfortunately, I've not had the best experiences with customer service in salons in Andersonville, an admission that is really disappointing to make because part of the appeal of the area is its unpretentious aura. Matt at Mens Grooming Parlor is the refreshing exception.I'm not going into the services I've received; I think that's a little tacky and inappropriate. (If you have to tell the world about your ball wax in a review, you're desperately pining for attention.) I can say that Matt has been exceptional every time. He is punctual, accommodating, and very professional. He explains procedures and pricing, sets appropriate expectations, and is very fastidious on protecting each clue t's privacy.I could continually rave, but sometimes the best things are said in the least words possible. Summarily, Matt and his business are perfect and the ideal experience. Most of all, he values his customers. That seems to be a novel concept in this era of attitude.
