4.description: I had an appointment with Matt at the end of May.  This was a new experience for me; I was facing back surgery, so I thought I would take care of business before my procedure by having my back waxed (a task I was dreading).  Matt did an excellent job, he made me feel as comfortable as possible, and he completed the process very quickly.  While I was there I also took advantage of the Executive Wax, which takes care of the nose, ears and brows - I found this to be painless.  The online appointment process worked well, and Matt's prices are very reasonable.  Matt treated me with great respect, and he appreciated my business.  Matt is also a great conversationalist, which helps while you are going through this process.  I highly recommend Matt's services to anyone interested in waxing.  As being middle-aged man and not in the best shape, I am probably not in Matt's typical cliental demographic, but I do plan to return for future appointments.

24.description: I've been going to Matt for about a year now.  All I can say is that he is wonderful!  The space is well decorated and comfortable and Matt is a consummate professional.  Any guy looking for grooming services should seriously consider him.

6.description: I can't say I am a frequenter, but whenever I am in the need of some good man maintenance I am going Mens Grooming Parlor. I have gone to a few spas for wax or skin treatments and feel like I am treated (and being charged) like a different species. The job is typically half done and expensive. Matt at Mens Grooming is extremely knowledgable, passionate, and reasonable for his services. Exactly what I am looking for. You just have to be able to withstand framed pictures of Tom Selik and Sting. Great times!

22.description: I've known Matt for almost 5 years and despite moving to NYC, I still come back whenever I'm in town. No one comes close to the quality Matt provides. Not to mention he makes what should be an uncomfortable experience as painless and relaxing as possible. From the minute you walk in you can tell Matt cares about his business and clients. There is absolutely no where else to go.

15.description: if you are going to have any waxing, on any part of your body, this is the guy and the place to do it.  Matt's been working on me for a couple of years and he's the best in town and delightful as well.  The only thing you have to lose here is hair.

7.description: I will dive in with another 5 star review for Matt and his services. Absolutely the best in Chicago! I've been going to Matt for many years now and this review is sadly, long overdue. Book in advance because business is rightfully booming. I've been to many other skin care/wax establishments in Chicago and none can match the professionalism, care and attention to detail (from the services to the interior to Matt's welcoming and warm demeanor).  Don't even get me started about Chicago Male on Halsted (avoid at all costs in my opinion). His prices are competitive if not better than other establishments of the same caliber.

8.description: Matt is a very nice guy, and the operation is run very smoothly through online appointments. The waiting area is very nice and comfortable, and the back wax I received was quick (about 10 minutes), painless, and about the same price that you would find in your standard men's spa. And in my opinion, the work Matt does is top-notch.I don't usually carry cash, and unfortunately I didn't know ahead of time that Matt would prefer tips in cash. So I'll have to hit him up with that next time. He was totally cool about it though. Other than that, everything went great. I'm happy to have found my new go-to for these services!

30.description: from start to finish, it's all good. easy to use online booking system.  email reminder/confirmation. comfortable waiting area. and then there's matt.  a great conversationalist, matt can make you forget that waxing, in spite of comments to the contrary, is not without a bit of pain.  it hurts to look good, and matt will make you look your best.  the price is reasonable.  the conversation is great, and the results are fabulous!

3.description: Five minutes. $40. Onto the next person. And unnecessarily painful.  What a disappointment.Matt is a nice guy, has a beautiful place. I was looking forward to this!  I ran into Matt on the street the week before and explained how I had a critical meeting coming up.  He suggested the "Executive Wax" and that I schedule a time with him, so I did.My experience (first visit too) was not so great and nothing close to what I expected - I absolutely felt like he rushed me through, as he looked surprised as I came to the locked door for my scheduled appointment.  It was obvious he was in a hurry as another customer showed up a minute later.  Matt asked if I had scheduled an appointment, even though the web site clearly says to schedule a week ahead, which I did.  He obviously did not look at his calendar. It was easily the most painful wax I've had, and I think that's because he was rushing through it.  He barely checked his work, I don't recall any tweezers used, and no oil, sanitizer or anything similar after the wax, then went straight to the credit card machine.  Easily the most rushed I've wax I've ever had.  He did the bare minimum.  As The door closed behind me, I could hear him giggling with his next customer. Simply awful.When I asked him for a recommendation for a haircutter, that fell flat as well.  He didn't know but just one.For a guy who is supposed to be so good at this, I would expect him not to rush me out the door, especially as a first-time customer. This was definitely no Trunk Club!  Sorry, Matt, this was an awful experience. Very sloppy.

14.description: I have looked for a while to find someone that is exceptional at waxing.  My previous esthetician was outstanding but when she moved I was stuck.  I tried other places and some were adequate others were not. Especially when some waxes broke off more hair than they removed and it grew back in a flash. Nothing seemed to be worth the money.  That is until matt.  He explains what is going on.  You are comfortable and you feel confident that he knows what his is doing.  And he does.  I am so glad that I found someone exceptional again.  I am a big fan.  Only downside is that he is so good that it is hard to get an appointment.  Thanks matt.

28.description: Best wax experience ever!

1.description: Careful, this chic is aloof with her hours of business. Yelp says she's open til 5p but when I walked in @1 she said she was done for the day. If it wasn't for the other negative reviews I just read, I would have immediately thought racism. Turns out she's just a flake. 0 stars#WTF

39.description: I met Beth when she was working for a salon in Andersonville. When she moved to Ravenswood, I moved with her. She is so amazing! She has been working on my eye brows for years. I will trust them to no other. Her new space is great, clean, calm and comfortable. She goes above and beyond to make sure that you have the best experience ever. She's the best!

9.description: I work at a salon down the street and I have heard raves from clients and coworkers about how amazing Beth is with waxing. I have been doing my own eyebrows for years and I finally gave in and took my unkempt brows to Beth to see if she can work her magic. I have gotten so many compliments since she did them. She also got me to wax my underarms and I must say that it was pretty painless. She pays attention to detail and does not miss a thing.She makes the experience very comfortable by chatting and being really friendly. The space is lovely and relaxing. I have recommended her to so many people and will continue to do so. Go see Beth she is amazing.

29.description: Beth is great! She is very through and painless!She's really fun to talk to as well. She has me in ROTF everytime.Her studio is CLEAN and very plesant. I love these little shops that are opening up i the area!Go see Beth at Studio B!!! Do ittttt!!

23.description: What a great find!!!! Beth was great and prices are reasonable as well. She did a great job on my brows, very thorough! So glad to have found this place, this is my new wax place!

5.description: Beth is the best waxer I've ever seen. She always does a flawless job with my eyebrows, she's always cheerful, and her studio is always immaculate. From what I understand, she's not currently taking on new people because her client list is full. I'm just grateful I got on that list in time. Words of advice: If her client list does have an opening, pounce on it.

31.description: I cannot recommend Beth and Studio B enough.  She's the best waxer I've ever been to (thorough, fast, pretty painless) and a wonderful person to boot.  And her new digs on Lincoln are beautiful.

25.description: Finding a good waxer can be tricky. After reading reviews on Yelp I made an appointment with Beth and I was so happy I did. Beth was very friendly and welcoming from the first minute I stepped foot into her shop. Although it wasn't my first wax appointment, she made me feel very comfortable and kept reassuring me that I was doing great (in terms of handling the pain). Studio B was very clean and bright, and she was super friendly - we chatted the entire time.She was very efficient and gentle and I was so happy with her work. I was amazed to learn that she handles everything from waxing to answering the phones (but she doesn't answer during an appointment - I love that she's so focused on the customer).

12.description: The establishment only accepts cash, limited hours, difficult to schedule appointments. Decent service if you are able to actually schedule an appointment besides those difficulties.

37.description: A couple days ago I went to Studio B for the first time for a lower leg and bikini wax. I've never had so little irritation. She met all of my expectations-no double-dipping, once over with tweezers, asked me to look over and make sure she didn't miss anything. Beth is professional, thorough, and efficient. I am thrilled that I found out about this place. The prices are reasonable and Beth does a great job. Fortunately, I live nearby. However, I understand why other reviewers are willing to travel from other neighborhoods for Beth's services.

21.description: thanks yelp for leading me to studio b!it'd been far far too long since my last bikini wax AND i was looking for a new waxer so i was a littler nervous. beth was super nice on the phone and really friendly and fun to talk to during the waxing process...which is awesome. i'm coming in and taking my pants off within minutes of meeting you, we better be comfy together.but the getting down to business, i mean that's the important part, right?... she used a combo of soft and hard wax (different types on different spots) followed by tweezing. i'd never used a hard wax before and it was great! much less painful because it doesn't tug at your skin. hooray!all in all...great little place. really cute. great service. i'll be back!!!

16.description: I'm a believer!So my eyebrows are NUTSO - like Chewbacca nutso. They twist and curl and reject the ideas of symmetry and order. No more. Beth is a genius and a miracle worker.I am shocked in the best way possible, and I'll be back.

17.description: thanks yelp for leading me to studio b!it'd been far far too long since my last bikini wax AND i was looking for a new waxer so i was a littler nervous. beth was super nice on the phone and really friendly and fun to talk to during the waxing process...which is awesome. i'm coming in and taking my pants off within minutes of meeting you, we better be comfy together.but the getting down to business, i mean that's the important part, right?... she used a combo of soft and hard wax (different types on different spots) followed by tweezing. i'd never used a hard wax before and it was great! much less painful because it doesn't tug at your skin. hooray!all in all...great little place. really cute. great service. i'll be back!!!

10.description: Another 5 star review. When my prior waxer decided to go into a different field, I felt lost. I mean who could I trust with my brows and my holiest of holiest of areas? Then, as I was getting my hair cut, by Lou of Roki Boki, she had mentioned that she had an amazing new waxer she went to named Beth. Well, my brows were starting to look like Bert's of Bert and Ernie and I decided to book an appointment with Beth. She returned my call immediately, informed me of where free parking is, told me what I needed to know and within a few days I was at Studio B. Beth has an amazing personality and she really did a great job with my brows and bikini area. She made me comfortable, and I wasn't in any pain when I left. She is very professional, real and knows her business.

11.description: Beth is fantastic.  This is a really well run studio.  I like that it is small and a one person shop.  You never get lost in the shuffle.  It keeps the place neat and clean which is essential in this particular field.  She is easy to book appointments with too for being solo.  Just be patient people, you'll get in!!  I am a loyal customer now!!!

26.description: I love this place! Usually getting waxed is not what one would call "relaxing," but somehow this was! Beth took her time and the results were awesome and pretty painless. I definitely plan on going back!

27.description: I'm a believer!So my eyebrows are NUTSO - like Chewbacca nutso. They twist and curl and reject the ideas of symmetry and order. No more. Beth is a genius and a miracle worker.I am shocked in the best way possible, and I'll be back.

35.description: I have been to my fair share of waxing salons over the years looking for a good fit.  Beth is great!  She is friendly and so thorough!  She loves what she does and it shows.  Her prices are reasonable and the results are fantastic!  I have finally found a regular place!

8.description: I absolutely ADORE this place!!!! Beth is wonderful, professional, CLEAN, HYGIENIC, FAST and a lot of fun. I feel absolutely comfortable and confident before and after a visit with her. She's really funny too. Unfortunately, because she's so effin' awesome...I can hardly ever get in to see her. (insert whimper) So, I'm a lot furrier than I want to be. So on that note, be on time, make your appointment PRIOR to going to the salon....no walk in's y'all. Enjoy your time then get the heck out so I can get in!!!!  ;-)

0.description: Beth is wonderful. There's a reason it can be hard to get an appointment with her - she's the best!I recently booked my first appointment with her, a brazilian, right before a trip to the beach. I found Studio B after my previous waxer suddenly started getting sloppy. That's a lot of pain for to go through for less than stellar results. Lucky for me, Beth is fabulous! She has the best qualities for a waxer: she's a perfectionist who makes you feel comfortable. Let's face it, this is already a pretty awkward situation and the wrong person could make it so much worse. Other reviews do mention the difficulty of scheduling (and so did I), but if you book 2-3 weeks in advance she should be able to fit you in.

38.description: As the two reviews before me, I too followed Beth from her last location.  I waited almost an entire year to have my eyebrows done, doing simple home maintenance waiting for her studio to open.  As soon as I walked in the door, the space was immediately welcoming and I was very impressed with the mesh of modern and vintage decor.  She has kept the space intimate yet airy and her attention to detail extends all the way to her windows with the original copper seals.  As usual I felt relaxed when I was on her table and enjoyed the feeling of knowing I was her only client and there was no need to rush.  She has always kept my brows pretty full, not pencil thin as so many women have, and I am grateful that she continues to keep my brows as natural looking as possible.  I trust her and feel that she has a great eye for knowing what works best to bring out the eyes, and compliment ones natural bone structure.  Without hesitation I recommend Studio B Waxing.  It's a great location, right near Over Easy and decent street parking.  Make a fun Sunday with some girlfriends for Brunch, and then a wax!

20.description: I work at a salon down the street and I have heard raves from clients and coworkers about how amazing Beth is with waxing. I have been doing my own eyebrows for years and I finally gave in and took my unkempt brows to Beth to see if she can work her magic. I have gotten so many compliments since she did them. She also got me to wax my underarms and I must say that it was pretty painless. She pays attention to detail and does not miss a thing.She makes the experience very comfortable by chatting and being really friendly. The space is lovely and relaxing. I have recommended her to so many people and will continue to do so. Go see Beth she is amazing.

19.description: Easily 5 Stars...Beth is friendly and did a great job! Clean, quiet spa and very relaxing. Support small businesses in Chicago!

33.description: Beth is the bomb.com! I went for the first time yesterday and as she worked on me I would be including her in my monthly budget. Eyebrows are fantastic (which haven't been done in over a year after the last person burned the skin of of my lids!) and my bikini wax was super! Even if you're not in the neighborhood, she is worth the travel!

2.description: Long story short, she's as good as it gets and worth the wait. Yeah, it sucks that she's so booked she's often not accepting new clients; that would frustrate me to. But, once you get in you'll realize there's really nothing else like her out there especially at her competitive pricing. I'm grateful I found her, and effing ticked every time I go somewhere else (because, to be honest her schedule can be tough) and get horrible treatment. I always always come running back!

34.description: wow.most attentive, careful, and delightfully chatty waxing experience of my life.  The studio is very clean and appropriately lit and Beth is very good at what she does.  It is clear she pays very close attention to her client's needs and takes her time to get the business done right.  At first I thought things were taking too long- not used to so much time being spent on my DTA but eventually I relaxed and surrendered myself to her expertise.  Definitely will be back!

32.description: Leaving behind my wonderful friend and owner of La Papillon Spa in Maryland was traumatic for me. Enter Beth. When it comes to the nether-regions, experience and expertise are so important. Quick, relatively painless, thorough!!! Her prices are very reasonable. I was paying 50% more at my original place and would gladly pay that again here.She's a fantastic person as well and shared so many great insights and tips for me as a newcomer to the city.I'm adding her to my regular schedule and am actually looking forward to my next visit back! (not in a skeevie way, it was just that easy).

18.description: Finding a good waxer can be tricky. After reading reviews on Yelp I made an appointment with Beth and I was so happy I did. Beth was very friendly and welcoming from the first minute I stepped foot into her shop. Although it wasn't my first wax appointment, she made me feel very comfortable and kept reassuring me that I was doing great (in terms of handling the pain). Studio B was very clean and bright, and she was super friendly - we chatted the entire time.She was very efficient and gentle and I was so happy with her work. I was amazed to learn that she handles everything from waxing to answering the phones (but she doesn't answer during an appointment - I love that she's so focused on the customer).

13.description: Ladies!Beth is truly the best hair removal expert in the city.  it's as though your best friend is waxing you, so there's no need to feel embarrassed by your excess amount o' lady hair or the fact that you're a big ol' baby as she removes it.  it's rare that an aesthetician is so flagrantly intelligent.  Not to mention the fact that she is a perfectionist and will see that every hair that needs to be taken care of is taken care of.also, she keeps that place CLEAN:  no double-dipping of the wax sticks.  gloves.  a clean floor.  a clean "bed."  you are in the best hands.  i leave her feeling rejuvenated and so happy that there are people like this in the world.

4.description: I recently moved to the area, and found this studio on my walk home from the train.  I walked in looking for information, as I'd been searching for a new wax studio to call home since my favorite wax technician left her salon to pursue a nursing career about a year ago.  After a long year of trying different places, I was excited to find a small business to support.  I stood in the empty lobby and was soon greeted by a woman I will assume was the owner, based on what came next.  I explained the purpose of my visit, and she replied, in all politeness, that she was not currently accepting new customers, but that I should feel free to keep checking the Web site to see if/when she resumed.Please.   I can certainly understand that your schedule is booked, but to suggest that I'd keep trying, after making absolutely no effort to discern what my needs would be - uhm, no. I've found another wax studio.  The review is for the attitude underlying the proprietor's casual dismissal of a potential new client.

24.description: As everyone else has said, Beth is great. She is very professional but also makes you feel totally comfortable. Or, as comfortable as one can feel while getting their lady bits waxed!! She did a fantastic job on my brazilian, very thorough and went over the area with a tweezer after the wax. She also made a point of asking multiple times if I was doing Ok and how the pain level was. Getting waxed is never an enjoyable experience, but Beth does a great job of making it as calm and relaxing as it can be. I had zero complaints after my first appointment, and I most definitely will be back.

6.description: Beth is fantastic! I found Studio B through Yelp and was so impressed after my first appointment. She is so detail-oriented and made my brows look perfect. I'm so happy with the experience and will be returning in the future. It's difficult to find someone with the ability to create brow shapes based on personal features. Beth definitely does that and more. I'm so pleased and highly recommend her for your waxing needs.

22.description: An excellent place to get hairless!  Friendly, discreet, and very close to Charm Boutique - double up and get your pretty on.

15.description: Beth is great! She is very through and painless!She's really fun to talk to as well. She has me in ROTF everytime.Her studio is CLEAN and very plesant. I love these little shops that are opening up i the area!Go see Beth at Studio B!!! Do ittttt!!

40.description: I have followed Beth from Andersonville to her own place in Ravenswood. First of all, the important part is that she's an amazing waxer and skin care specialist who has been wrangling my challenging brows (and other places) for years. Now that she's in her own shop, the salon drama is gone, and Beth's sunny personality and calm demeanor are present throughout the new space. The waxing room is private, scrupulously clean, and comfortable. The waiting area is bright and cozy. I trust Beth to use the best and freshest products on my skin, and I have never had a bad reaction, funky mismatched brows (which has happened at other places) or uneccessary discomfort.Parking is usually plentiful, and her prices are insanely reasonable.

7.description: Leaving behind my wonderful friend and owner of La Papillon Spa in Maryland was traumatic for me. Enter Beth. When it comes to the nether-regions, experience and expertise are so important. Quick, relatively painless, thorough!!! Her prices are very reasonable. I was paying 50% more at my original place and would gladly pay that again here.She's a fantastic person as well and shared so many great insights and tips for me as a newcomer to the city.I'm adding her to my regular schedule and am actually looking forward to my next visit back! (not in a skeevie way, it was just that easy).

36.description: Never thought I'd say this, but: incredibly pleasant waxing experience. The interior is gorgeous, and Beth is wonderful personally (wax-bed-side manner?) and great at her work. Without hesitation, I would recommend Studio B to anyone, and wish her the best! I already have my next appt. booked...

30.description: Ladies!Beth is truly the best hair removal expert in the city.  it's as though your best friend is waxing you, so there's no need to feel embarrassed by your excess amount o' lady hair or the fact that you're a big ol' baby as she removes it.  it's rare that an aesthetician is so flagrantly intelligent.  Not to mention the fact that she is a perfectionist and will see that every hair that needs to be taken care of is taken care of.also, she keeps that place CLEAN:  no double-dipping of the wax sticks.  gloves.  a clean floor.  a clean "bed."  you are in the best hands.  i leave her feeling rejuvenated and so happy that there are people like this in the world.

3.description: I just called this studio and the voice mail says she is not accepting any new clients. Lame.

14.description: Beth is fabulous. Reasonably priced, clean, friendly, excellent all around. I recently moved to Chicago and was hesitant to try a new waxing salon, since I had been going to the same person for years. A friend recommended this studio to me, and now I will not go anywhere else.

58.description: This place is so simple to review. JUST WALK IN AND BUY EVERYTHING!No seriously, it is just that good. Spicy Hummus is out of this world and Soups are home made and delicious.

56.description: Clean, well-stocked across the street from the taste of lebanon and is situated in a happening neighborhood. The only complaint is the prices here is higher than other middle eastern grocer I have been to in Chicago.

29.description: This place is fun to explore. I've bought flatbreads and chocolate baklava and both were tastey!

42.description: First of all, there is a credit card minimum of $7. This is important because you have to *try* to spend that much here.  Second of all, there are few other places where you'll get a lunch that good for that cheap.  I had a spinach pie and a chicken pie, each of which checks in under $2. Both were amazing, although the spinach left a longer lasting impression.  You can also get homemade pitas, which are WAY better and WAY cheaper than store brand. (5/$1.45. Really.) It's a little bit out of the way, but if you're in A-ville, make the stop.

23.description: I am crazy about this place.  I love the vegan pizzas.  It is so tasty and there are so many vegetables on it. I like that they put so many on it. The dough is great. When you heat it up, it is so delicious.  I think it's much better than ordering a vegetable pizza elsewhere. I also like the friendly man behind the counter of the pizzas.  You can also eat it not heated.  I sometimes take it to work, where a microwave is not available and it is still fantastic.  It's just as tasty.  The olives in the container are a terrific selection and taste great, and also the dark chocolate cherries, mixed fruit, and other selections they have are terrific to snack on.  I really love this place because it is one of the few places where I know whatever I get the quality is good and I don't have to worry.  I also know everything is fresh too. There are so many things to discover here.  When I'm not in a hurry, I'm going to take my time and really check out their other items because I keep getting the same things over again, which is not a bad thing, but I need to start tasting the other things like their different kinds of hummus, teas, and pies also.

47.description: This place is filled with all sorts of goodies. It is definitely one of my favourite places in Chicago to pick up groceries and snacks. I always stock up when I go there. Great Zatar bread, great dips. My favourite are the spicy babaganoush and the imam bayeldi. Oh and the dill hummus. ALL so good. I wished I lived next to it. If you have not been here, you are missing out.

8.description: This authentic grocery store is so awesome.  It reminds me of the the places I visited while in Jerusalem.  It smelled so good from the first step into the store.  I love how the hummus, baba ganoush, dips, tapenades, cheeses, deli items, and other delicious and super healthy bakery goods are so natural with no preservatives.  You can get Hummus any way you like, spicy, dill, garlic, red pepper, you name it!  There are a variety of other natural dips which I can't wait to go back and try.  I was so thrilled by the variety of choices of super fresh bread!  I love my pita bread right out of the oven.  I am so happy to have stumbled apon this gem!  I know I will be back again for my middle eastern grocery shopping.

31.description: 20 minute weekly walk to pick up a steady supply of homemade hummus, olive tapenade, pita chips and various other items ... baklava, olive salads etc. I'd walk 45 minutes every day, if I had too. I'd never shopped at any other middle eastern grocer before, so I don't have anything to compare it too... and I hope I never have too.  I could live on their hummus and tapenade (sometimes I think I already do)

34.description: This my favorite grocery. From staple items ( grains, spices, coffee) to prepared foods I have never been disappointed. Great prices too. I have turned my friends on to this spot and now we all sing their praises. If you haven't stopped in it is a must for a quick lunch or to stock your pantry.

16.description: Great neighborhood gem that was recommended by a colleague, and I'm so glad I finally paid them a visit! They have every spice imaginable, as well as teas, pastries, pastas, and food to grab on the go, which I plan to try on my next trip. I was so glad to find some of the teas and honeys, and hazelnut spreads that I grew so fond of when visiting Istanbul a few years ago, so this place is a must if you're looking for ingredients/items that aren't carried by grocery chains.

13.description: Spinach cheese pies.  Years ago, I used to live in Hyde Park, and relished any trip to far-away Andersonville so I could get these spinach cheese pies.  And artichoke pies, and parsley olive pies... but the spinach cheese pies are the best (I don't eat meat, so possibly the meat pies are just as good).Then I moved away from Chicago and on my yearly-or-so return trips to Chicago, I would try to finagle a trip to the Middle Eastern Bakery so I could get more pies.And now I live within walking distance, and my life feels charmed.  For it's not just the savory pies that I have unlimited access to now, but the makings of a picnic or meal in with such little effort and such big flavors: multiple kinds of hummus and baba ghanoush, multiple kinds of fresh pita, tzatziki, lentil soup, olives, zaatar flat bread, cheeses, sweets, etc.At least stop in for a spinach cheese pie: they will warm it up for you if you ask, so you can eat it on your way out the door.  Also, if you're like me, you'll possibly walk away with sour cherry jam and preserved lemons, even though you only came in for a snack.

11.description: I visit this place as often as possible and have dreams about the delicious savory baked goods! Have your coffee beans ground with cardamom! The loose tea mixes are better (IMO) than fancy tea houses and more affordable too. Butter beans, tabouli, hummus and other mixed dips or salads are delicious- great to take to dinner parties! Vegan friendly pizza, and gluten free friendly crackers. They are opening a restaurant next door and I am looking forward to it. The staff is always kind and attentive.

39.description: This place is fantastic! Was introduced to this wonderful store on a chilly afternoon. It's kind of hidden on a side street of Andersonville. Got a bottle of siracha, and more than a few of their "pizzas." They have a wide selection of various kinds of rice, seasonings, and a lot of pre-packaged salads.Not a place to get all of your grocery shopping done, but a definate option for picking up some great options for dinner!

37.description: I went here today to buy some of their pies. I originally bought them with my late mother who got them at Whole Foods Market. It wasn't until today which was the first time going back in several years. I also like the fact that they carry a lot of things to make middle eastern dishes with. Its not hard to find this place since its conveniently located on Foster Avenue just a couple steps from Clark Street to the east and Ashland Avenue to the west. Its near bus lines and you may want to keep in mind that they do not have a lot so you will be parking on the street.  Its worth a visit for these pies they are delicious when gently warmed up. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

0.description: Snack? Done.  Lunch?  Done.  Stuff for entertaining your guests?  Done. Ingredients for multiple dinner options?  Done!!Get:- anything from the back/east refrigerated section (baba ganouj, hummus, LENTIL SOUP, dolmas, guacamole, harissa, etc.) - anything from the falafel/savory pies/"pizzas," flatbreads counter- small fresh bread rolls and pita from the wall along the front windows by the door- pilaf with roasted vermicelli - red lentilsAffordable prices, always fresh baked items, friendly staff.

38.description: We love this place!  Great for stocking up on farro, rice, grains, and spices for CHEAP.We stopped by and picked up farro, aleppo pepper, veggie flatbreads, some pies, fig rolls, etc etc etc. and hardly spent $30.  We've been feasting on our finds ever since.  It's wonderful.  Wander around and find some stuff to put together a delicious dinner.  Go home and don't leave for two days.  Subsist on farro salad, eggs on pita, veggie pies.  Drink wine.  Sleep lots.  Highly recommend it.

51.description: Who knew so many varieties of lentils existed?Who knew that I'd enjoy all of them?

27.description: I've been stopping by Middle East Bakery and Grocery about once a month for over three years.  The foods I like have been consistently good, and I've only noticed the price going up on their pies.The place is on the smaller side, which is fine, because I can buy my staple goods and am out in time to catch the next bus.  I regularly get the "vegan pizza" and thyme "pizza", both of which are by the pies.  I also like the garlic hummus and Jerusalem salad, which are refrigerated.  In addition, the freshly made pitas and breads are good, as are the pita chips.  They also have a large variety of dried spices, lentils, fruits, and coffee beans.  If you're near Andersonville, you have to check this place out!

32.description: I love this place.  Everything is so good!! I love the spinach Kibbi!

54.description: I do not live in Andersonville but I wish I do so that I could be closer to this gem! This place is big on variety and on quality.  There are few things I love more than a quality dip/spread and does this place ever have some of the best in the city! I love it so much I even buy them to bring with me when I go the suburbs to have dinner with the family.  Some people might be embarrassed showing up with food prepared by others and clearly purchased just minutes before heading out to a family gathering. But when it is hard to tear people away from the goods, I think anyone will look past taking the easy way out.

48.description: I came here on an empty stomach and couldn't decided what to get so I got an assortment. If you get one thing, get the spicy baba ganoush! I bought the small container of that and a big container of hummus and the eggplant dip. Both were good too but I really wished I had more of the spicy baba ganoush.  Also tried an eggplant pie, an olive, parsley, feta pie, sesame bread, pitas, olives, and honey cake. The only thing I didn't care for was the honey cake. Keep in mind, I had never had it before and didn't know what to expect.Prices are reasonable. The small dips are about $3 and larger size is $5. I think the pies are $1.75. They also have a great assortment of beans. I'm sure they have other stuff too but that is all that sticks out in my mind.

44.description: Spicy baba gaboush: WOW to die forGreat foods, so reasonable and like being in an intimate neighborhood.Love it

24.description: This place deserves 5 stars for the spicy babaghanuge alone.  It no joke changed my life.  I like to buy a bunch of the savory pies (I've tried most of their varieties and haven't found a dud yet--favorites are the meat pie and the spinach with cheese) and dip them in the spicy babaghanuge.  Throw in a cup of their fresh lentil soup and you've got a mindblowingly yummy lunch!If I can tear myself away from the prepared foods part of the store, I'd love to scoop up some of their other items like spices, teas, etc.  Staff has always been friendly when I've been there.

7.description: I can't say enough good things. I've been shopping at Middle East for at least 20 years.. The selection is amazing! Falafel, olives, meat pies, hummus, breads, spices and tons of snacks!! I could go on and on!And the owner is super, super nice.  He's adding on a restaurant. I can't wait!!!!!

49.description: I keep making the drive here for their excellent hummous and other fresh  dips. Thanks fellow Yeelpers for this exvellent recommendation!

40.description: This place is fantastic!  amazing foods.  try all the pies, and the dill Hummus is The Best I've ever had.  Seriously dangerous.  Great candies, dried fruit, nuts and jordan almonds. My one complaint, is that the prices of nuts and fruits are a little high.  Perhaps the best thing about this place is the family that runs it.  Terrific people and real pillars of Andersonville.

53.description: This place really knocked me right out of my socks.  Not filled with massive knowledge on Middle Eastern food - other than liking to gorge myself on it - so I can't be an authority.  However, whomever wants to keep buying that crappy hummus and tzatziki at the overly-crappy jewel on Clark and Bryn Mawr, be my guest.  More for me!  What can I say?  A wall of spices, homemade sauces, great prices, falafel, na'an, great prices, friendly people...I will definitely be back.

30.description: Thanks to all of the reviews that mention it, I had to try the dill hummus. It's pretty solid. I think I like hummus with a bit more oil than this has, but that's easy - just pour a bit more on top! I also tried the spicy hummus (good) and an eggplant dip (so-so.) I have an eggplant pie & spinach pie to try later. The medium sized pitas I bought (5/$1.45) are a little dense and dry for my taste. I thought about getting the minis, which looked much fluffier, but for some reason I didn't. My mistake on that one. Some of the other breads looked amazing!For $3 you get a delicious 8 ounce container of hummus or dip, that's much better than grocery store brands, and if the pies are good (I'll know later) they will totally be worth the price (under $2 each.)Their spice selection is big and has some hard to find items (that you won't get at the regular grocery store.) I would definitely recommend this place for the hummus and dip selection!

46.description: I think I could live off of their mini pizzas. I got five and ate them all in two days. (They're especially good when reheated in the oven!)Middle East Bakery is a plethora of spices and yummy goodies. This place is a gem, and I am so happy to have found it. Everything is delicious and very reasonably priced. Go here. Seriously. This place is worth it.

1.description: I've been here many times for the bread , they have good arabic bread but one time I was hungry and I ordered cheese and oliv e pies ,I took them and went home when I started eating I was  surprised they were both  spinach Pies and I had severe diarrhea after eating it . It's weird the guy who was standing there doesn't know what inside the pies !!! I think their Falafel and Pies are old and not clean .Some stuff are overpriced , I can find them cheaper in other middle eastern groceries.Otherwise it would be a good place for shopping don't try to eat from them .My one star for the fresh bread only .

55.description: Love this little middle eastern grocery / bakery.  I was doing long walking-around-neighborhood today so did not buy anything heavy or need refrigeration,  but looks like they have nice variety of home made foods such as hummus.  Bough stainless steel cezve to make Turkish coffee at home :-)     Would like to try their baked items next time.

9.description: I love this place, I go once a week for a number of things. I am really looking forward to their expansion. I like to get my hummus, dips and gluteen free chips there. I also like the patties. Lamb and potato as well as the bean and lentil!

26.description: This is the 2nd time my older sister has taken me here just to get her meat pies, Lamb & Potatoes, pickled turnips & beets. We were here on 10-3-14. I got to try 2 meatless pies one had feta cheese & olives & something else. My 2nd one was Spinach & Feta. Oh my, oh my. These are actually good. I like the  Spinach & Feta with a bit of sour cream. My sister says to try it with some pickled turnips & beets along with it. They are good also but so salty. I LOVE FETA CHEESE but a little goes a long way. When you walk in the store look to your right and go to the back of the store and you will see the metal counter that has the yummy meat pies. They make all of them in the store. They sell assorted teas, coffee's. herbs, spices, pita breads, assorted breads, candy ,nuts.

25.description: One visit. Multiple yums. I needed preserved lemons for a dish I was making Christmas Eve.  Whole Paycheck was my first thought but then I thought I should check Yelp first.  I'm glad I did because  not only did I find I could purchase the preserved lemons here, but it looked like I could get more of the items I needed here as well.  The store is full of Middle eastern food staples as well as a counter/fridge for prepared items. My list:Preserved lemons Large grain couscousZaa'tar seasoningHummusFresh PitaDried fruitsPistachiosMy impulse buys:Baba GhannoujZaa'tar breadLamb and potato hand pie (2)Cheese and artichoke hand pie (1)feta cheeseolivesEverything I purchased was delicious. The hummus and baba ghannouj was well seasoned and flavorful. Hummus super smooth and creamy; the BG a little chunky but the perfect consistency for me. The hand pies were yummy and well-made--great crust and fillings. The cheese, fruits, nuts, olives were great quality as well. I love trying new foods and Zaa'tar was a great discovery for me. I needed the spice blend for a vinaigrette I was making and just about fell in love with it. I arrived there shortly after opening and the bread racks weren't filled yet.  I asked the friendly staff if there was more pita bread and they said it would be about 10 minutes.  My tip to you, if you have 10 minutes and can wait for the fresh pita, DO IT. because it was so very very good.  The aroma of fresh bread is heavenly and I didn't mind browsing the store while I waited for fresh pita. I already have the falafel sandwich on my list for my next visit as well as more baba ghannouj.  Love this store.

12.description: Stopped in yesterday to pick up some goodies.  The love hasn't died and in fact it's stronger than ever.  Try the lentil soup that's in the refrigerator case.  It's delightfully light, clean and lemony.  The lemony artichoke spread is addictive and wonderful on pita bread or pita chips.   I also got the lentil pie, as well as the spinach and onion pie.  So much portable tastiness in a neat little pocket.  I'm looking forward to the cafe opening, which they said should be open early summer.   It will be a great addition to the corner of Foster and Clark!

59.description: One of my best finds in five years living in Chicago! Took me too long to get here.

21.description: I have been going to the Middle Eastern bakery for practically my whole life. In that time I don't think their food has changed at all, and why should it? It's already some of the best (and cheapest and freshest) middle eastern food in the city. My personal faves are the tabouleh, the baba ganough, and the dolmades. They also sell whole coffee beans, basic groceries, and fresh olives and cheese. So glad they are expanding!!

17.description: Falafel sandwich, you complete me. Love the hand pies and the fact that I can never remember which hand pie (olive or artichoke) is which in the bag. It is like the most successful and tasty game of Russian roulette ever. Yep, I'm a rebel living on the edge.

10.description: We recently ordered all the food for what we called my mom's "Bon Voyage Party" - her memorial service  -- from the Middle Eastern Bakery. Mom's happiest time of her life was when she and my dad lived in the Middle East when he was in the service, and Middle Eastern food always was one of the most visceral ways she connected to that time of her life. Two years ago, I moved her to Chicago because her Alzheimer's disease was progressing to the point she needed round the clock care - but also because I wanted her to experience some of the greater ethnic diversity that Chicago had to offer. One of the first places I took her in Chicago was the Middle Eastern Bakery, and she fell in love with it, and with the people, who were extremely kind to her. I knew her send-off couldn't be catered by anyone else! We got food for 45, and ended up with three times what we needed, for less than 300! And everyone was SO nice. Plus, this is the best Middle Eastern food I've had in Chicago -- they don't do everything, but what they do is SUPERB. AND they won over many of the party-goers to Middle Eastern cuisine. Thank you for helping my mom go out in the style she deserved, and would have wanted.

5.description: I now live in Albany Park and I am able to get most of the stuff closer to home.  But I don't have a place that makes pies like they do.  Their baked goods are why I make the trek to Foster.  They have decent hummus, but there are better places to get hummus in the city.  But the baked goods...yummmmm!  Oh yeah, and he makes a mean harrissa, imam Bayildi, and tapenade!

3.description: I always enjoy coming here,  especially for the delicious house blended middle eastern and other regional spice blends.  It still has a small grocery store feel despite the emergence of the incredibly more trendy and upscale Andersonville neighborhood. They are expanding into the building next door,  previously the Algerian Crepe place (which I loved and miss) and I suspect they will expand their selections spruce up their store in the process. Can't wait.

35.description: a little taste of dubai-home...a patron before my expat experience in the middle east,  i now have a special place in my heart for middle east bakery and grocery.  simple, straightforward name offering complex, authentic flavors.  i must add that you need NEED to also try their manakeesh (bread with zaatar and cheese).  it rivals some i've had overseas.  i can eat the spinach kibbeh by the boatload.  it was actually near impossible to find this treat overseas - probably because it's traditionally made with meat - so i'm so very grateful to middle east bakery for treating us vegetarians!

19.description: Amazing hummus - my favorite in Chicago. The tapenade, artichoke lemon spread, and baba ghanoush are all excellent too, as are the pies ... I've tried the spinach and cheese, olive and parsley, and meat - everything has been delicious, and even better if you ask them to warm it up for you. It's an $8 minimum to pay by card, but if you get a pie and a hummus or two, it's no problem. Easy street parking and/or bus lines nearby. I would highly recommend.

28.description: Wow this grocery store is amazing. It's an easy to miss storefront, and I can't believe it's taken me this long to get there. There are a ton of hard-to-find spices and dried goods. I found three kinds of gul receli, this amazing rose petal jam I had in Turkey. Never thought I would be able to find it stateside! Also they carry coffee from one of the most famous Turkish coffee roasters. The juices and spices are great - you will pay twice the price elsewhere. I didn't have a chance to try their pies or desserts, but I will definitely be back!

45.description: Love this place!!!  So fresh, delicious and authentic.  Wonderful freshly prepared foods and a fully stocked natural food market .  Who needs WHole F** Ds when you have this store in your neighborhood?  Also, friendly owner and staff and reasonable prices.  Support this wonderful local store!!!

33.description: I love to go here to get a lot of food when I know I am going to have a busy day or even a busy week. I can pick up plenty of snacks and good food to eat. My favorite is the smoky baba ganoush. I also really like the sesame seed flat bread, yum! I went there with my partner earlier this week to stock up for a day long road trip. We got our usual favorites, plus  one each of the new varieties of vegan hand pies they have. We had a great day eating all our wonderful snacks. I will continue to shopping here, and loving it.

43.description: I was already in major like with MEB.At least once a month, I make the trek, i.e., take the Red Line up north to the Berwyn stop, then on foot some more up Broadway, then Foster (though if you have patience, you can probably catch a bus) till I reached the hallowed, albeit nondescript, storefront that is MEB.Time to load up.Upon first impression, it might look like nothing, until you peruse the shelves, then there is always something.  I "discovered" Omur yogurt here. It is a plain Turkish yogurt with cream on the top.  Holy cow, this stuff is heavenly!  Brown Cow does not compare.  Sadly, on my most recent trip, they were out, and not sure when they would receive another shipment, though the order is in.  Hopefully, soon.  I love the deli in the back and the variety of savory pies they have to offer.  Thanks to this deli, I was finally able to try kibbeh. They offer the typical meat kibbeh, but also a vegetarian variety made with spinach.  I love the contents of the refrigerator case: vegetarian potato soup, THE BEST lentil soup, cheese, olives, dips, and more! But the icing on the cake of this experience was the customer service.  The family and staff that run MEB are just lovely.  Besides Omur yogurt and the other sundries I usually stock up on when I make this trip, I discovered (thanks to a Yelp review) they stock cardamom coffee.  I love a lot of things, like MEB, as anyone may have ascertained by now, but among my top loves, are coffee and cardamom. Coffee and cardamom TOGETHER?! Where have I been?! Insert an Elaine Benes "GET OUT!" exclamation.  For tea lovers, there is black tea and cardamom.  I purchased this too, duh. When I inquired, I believe it was the owner, who guided me to the shelf where two varieties were sold.  These were finely ground and meant for Turkish coffee.  Verging on crestfallen, because I just have a regular coffee maker, I declined, but the gentleman did not stop there.  He offered to grind up a pound of medium roast with cardamom mixed in. Although it was an arduous trek in the cold and snow, when I made my coffee this morning, it was worth it. Not only did my apartment smell delicious, but the coffee was divine.Andersonville is so lucky to have such a gem.

2.description: Yummy olives, dips, spreads, bread, cheese, and sweet treats. Check out the cured Turkish black olives in particular. They have a wide assortment of spices, lentils, rice, and other pantry staples too. Staff are very nice and helpful. I can't wait until they open the attached restaurant!!

18.description: This place deserves 5 stars for the spicy babaghanuge alone.  It no joke changed my life.  I like to buy a bunch of the savory pies (I've tried most of their varieties and haven't found a dud yet--favorites are the meat pie and the spinach with cheese) and dip them in the spicy babaghanuge.  Throw in a cup of their fresh lentil soup and you've got a mindblowingly yummy lunch!If I can tear myself away from the prepared foods part of the store, I'd love to scoop up some of their other items like spices, teas, etc.  Staff has always been friendly when I've been there.

41.description: If you are a fan of Middle Eastern fare, you need to make a trip to Middle Eastern Bakery. It's a small store stocked with spices, grains, coffee, prepared food, dried fruit and more. I get preserved lemons here that I use for cooking and can be hard to find. It also sells spices that are unavailable at your local grocery store. Their prepared deli and bakery food is excellent: spinach and feta pies, lentil soup, babaganoush, hummus, and more. It's also quite affordable. I'm so glad that I live within walking distance to this Andersonville gem. I heard they are expanding into the former crepe restaurant space and I'm looking forward to seeing their new expanded space.

52.description: Oh man, where to begin?! First of all, I'm not going to compare this place to Pars Persian Store up the road because Pars is more of a tea store with a little bit of groceries, while Middle East B&G is more of a grocer with a little bit of tea (though I do highly recommend Pars Persian).  Now that that's out of the way...For such a small corner-store this place has immense variety! There are several different types of filled pockets (meat & veggie), rice, genuine middle eastern yogurts, dips and spreads (including their hummus', which live up to the hype), nuts and seeds, dried fruits (including hard to find dried strawberries, which have healthfully replaced my wicked candy habit), spices and salts (did you know black salt exists?! well you do now!), desserts (baklavas, several varieties of butter cookies and pastries with pistachios, honey, and rosewater!).  They even sell Aleppo (bay leaf) soap, which is the first time I've seen it in the US - I've hunted everywhere for it!I can personally recommend their pita bread (made fresh daily without oils or preservatives), manaiesh thyme bread, mint tea, spicy hummus (hell, all of their varieties are delicious), tzatziki, house made smoked eggplant salad, cashew almond pumpkin seed clusters (gluten-free), pistachio nougat (mmm) and all of the aforementioned items above.In all honesty, I was never even that big a fan of middle eastern food before, but this grocer makes it so easy to create a quick, fresh, light, and healthy dinner that I'm HOOKED! I absolutely LOVE that the ingredients are clearly listen on the front label of their homemade and bulk products - it makes it so easy to shop.  The only negative aspect I can think of is that the place is a bit dusty at times, but as far as I can tell that's never effected the cleanliness of the food.

50.description: Oh man.Unsuspecting store front, potentially hidden on Foster to those who do not wander off Clark, make it your sole goal to visit this place next time you are wandering around Andyville.Everything I have purchased from here is absolutely delicious. Hit up the little "deli" counter in the back right corner where they have fresh made pies. When I say pie I do not mean PIE. I mean spinach and cheese pie, spinach and onion pie, lamb and onion pie, parsley and olive pie, etc. These bad boys are fresh, crazy delicious and cost about $1.75 and will fill you up. Quick, delicious, cheap lunch or dinner. Also behind this counter find olives and cheese. They have refrigerated cases filled with homemade soup, baba, hummus, taboulah, etc etc etc. Their vegetarian lentil soup is awesome. Don't miss the shelves of freshly made pita in all shapes and sizes. Oh, but you're not done there. There are also shelves filled with trays of the best sweets money can buy. Halva, honey cake, a thousand varieties of baklava in different shapes with different nuts. I don't care what anyone says, nuts, honey and rose water  = best desserts on earth. It's pretty hard to walk out of here without grabbing something sweet. There are other plastic containers with cookies, crackers, candied lemon, ginger and other stuff to drool over too. Grab a little copper coffee pot while you're here so you can make Turkish coffee at home. Get the small vacuumed sealed green and black coffee bag that says "With Cardamom" on it. TO DIE FOR. Fastest cup of coffee you'll ever make at home (well maybe, I don't have one of those K Cup Machines). Maybe I should say most rewarding cup for coffee you'll make at home with the richest, most delicious flavor. There are also aisles of dried beans, a million spices and herbs, and jars of tahini, honey, yogurt, hot pepper paste, rose water and more. It's basically the greatest place on earth and you should go here now. This place has changed my life.

4.description: Been shopping here for over 30 years. I'm Lebanese, know middle eastern cuisine. No other me grocery close except Feyrouz Bakery. Quality, consistency, variety, taste just way better than anywhere else. My favorites;  French feta, garlic hummus, many dif esfihas, uncooked felafel to make fresh at home, their meat grape leaves, Zdan yogurt, etc.

6.description: One visit. Multiple yums. I needed preserved lemons for a dish I was making Christmas Eve.  Whole Paycheck was my first thought but then I thought I should check Yelp first.  I'm glad I did because  not only did I find I could purchase the preserved lemons here, but it looked like I could get more of the items I needed here as well.  The store is full of Middle eastern food staples as well as a counter/fridge for prepared items. My list:Preserved lemons Large grain couscousZaa'tar seasoningHummusFresh PitaDried fruitsPistachiosMy impulse buys:Baba GhannoujZaa'tar breadLamb and potato hand pie (2)Cheese and artichoke hand pie (1)feta cheeseolivesEverything I purchased was delicious. The hummus and baba ghannouj was well seasoned and flavorful. Hummus super smooth and creamy; the BG a little chunky but the perfect consistency for me. The hand pies were yummy and well-made--great crust and fillings. The cheese, fruits, nuts, olives were great quality as well. I love trying new foods and Zaa'tar was a great discovery for me. I needed the spice blend for a vinaigrette I was making and just about fell in love with it. I arrived there shortly after opening and the bread racks weren't filled yet.  I asked the friendly staff if there was more pita bread and they said it would be about 10 minutes.  My tip to you, if you have 10 minutes and can wait for the fresh pita, DO IT. because it was so very very good.  The aroma of fresh bread is heavenly and I didn't mind browsing the store while I waited for fresh pita. I already have the falafel sandwich on my list for my next visit as well as more baba ghannouj.  Love this store.

22.description: Good store for take-out food for a picnic by the lake.

15.description: I try to make biweekly trips to the Middle East Bakery & Grocery to pick up hummus, spicy babaghanuge, and their spinach and cheese pies, and lentil soup. YUM. The spicy babaghanuge never lasts long because I put it on everything. The lentil soup is perfectly lemony, yet savory, and total comfort food for me. A pie dipped in the spicy babaghanuge accompanied by a bowl of lentil soup is a satisfying and filling meal.My only complaint, nitpicky as it is, is that the store itself is a little crowded. They are in the process of expanding, but they are trying to stay open as much as possible during the expansion, and don't anticipate being closed more than two or three days. This will remedy the issue of the cramped quarters. Because the change, they seem to be reorganizing the shop. This complaint is only a testament to the large variety they carry.All in all, I love this place, but I love the feeling when I get home with a bag of awesome noms even more.

57.description: I really love this place.  I mainly go for the pies that they sell at the counter in the back of the store.  Since it's far from where I live, I typically stock up and stash various varieties in my freezer.  Since I don't eat meat I've only tasted the veggie varieties, and I like them all:  spinach and feta is a classic and really well done, parsley and feta is a little different and very flavorful, and I really enjoy the eggplant one and the artichoke/cheese ones too.  They're really great for a quick snack or light meal.  After a visit to the oven, they emerge fragrant and crispy on the outside, with their olive oil-rich bread crust.  Mmmmmm.  Their grocery selection is fun too--lots of beans, rice, prepared dips, etc.  For any of you who live nearby: I am jealous.  For anyone who is wondering if it's worth the trip:  I vote a solid yes.  And you might just run into Puppet Bike too!  Hopefully you won't get smacked on the head by a snow avalanche like I did, though...

20.description: Spinach cheese pies.  Years ago, I used to live in Hyde Park, and relished any trip to far-away Andersonville so I could get these spinach cheese pies.  And artichoke pies, and parsley olive pies... but the spinach cheese pies are the best (I don't eat meat, so possibly the meat pies are just as good).Then I moved away from Chicago and on my yearly-or-so return trips to Chicago, I would try to finagle a trip to the Middle Eastern Bakery so I could get more pies.And now I live within walking distance, and my life feels charmed.  For it's not just the savory pies that I have unlimited access to now, but the makings of a picnic or meal in with such little effort and such big flavors: multiple kinds of hummus and baba ghanoush, multiple kinds of fresh pita, tzatziki, lentil soup, olives, zaatar flat bread, cheeses, sweets, etc.At least stop in for a spinach cheese pie: they will warm it up for you if you ask, so you can eat it on your way out the door.  Also, if you're like me, you'll possibly walk away with sour cherry jam and preserved lemons, even though you only came in for a snack.

36.description: Here is a secret - 3 mini vegan pizzas that'll melt in your mouth for $4

14.description: I'm a huge fan of this place. Their pastries pies are all delicious and at $2 each you can't go wrong. They have a wide variety of spices and that small neighborhood store vibe. Love it!!

1.description: Just for the record, lets keep focused on the items that are made here, and those which iare purchased from  outside sources.  Numerous reviewers have commented on the olives, cheeses, charcuterie and wine.  All of these items (save a few pates ) are made by artisanal purveyors, ( not made in the kitchen by Appellation or Pastoral. ).  So to give cred where cred is due, the "buyers"  (not the kitchen)  at this establishment do a terrific job at sourcing products made by smaller ( and a few local ) artisans.  Appellation/Pastoral is a nice addition to A'ville group of restaurants.  I'm personally still awaiting a 5 star venue, but  it hasn't arrived yet.    We started with the crispy white beans & chorizo which were very good, and a selection of U.S. made artisinal cheeses.  They kept the fresh bread coming, which was welcomed indeed.  Now let's talk about the main dishes at Appellation.  We sampled the grilled leg of lamb with squash , brussels sprouts and a yogurt sauce.  Veggies & protein  perfectly cooked, nicely plated.  The noodles with milk braised pork shoulder ragu and an assortment of veggies was good, but not exceptional.  Lastly, we had the dill ricotta gnudi with butter sauce, goat cheese & hazelnuts.  Nice combo, but gunudi must have caught a draft, (kind of room temp/tepid).  It took away from the dish.  Overall, my vote for food is 3.5 starsLastly, they might want to slap a menu page in their Yelp listing.  Like don't most of us check out a menu before we head over to a new place?    Not unlike any new restaurant, I think Appellation has a few kinks that need to be ironed out.  I'm going to give it another month and head back for another dose.

9.description: Absolutely amazing. I love this new restaurant in Andersonville. The cheese, beer, and wine are excellent. Astounding selection of cheeses, wines, and some truly specialty beers, several of which are only available in very small batches.

12.description: I agree with the previous posters here. Glad to have this place in my neighborhood! It's a loud-ish bistro that is perfect for a first date --  the tables are close and intimate, and the noise level means no one besides your date hears the personal stuff.   ;-) And on a friday night it was packed. The cheeses are really very good. And the food we had (a first date, too!) was la-te-da comfort food. Perfect.

21.description: Absolutely amazing. I love this new restaurant in Andersonville. The cheese, beer, and wine are excellent. Astounding selection of cheeses, wines, and some truly specialty beers, several of which are only available in very small batches.

16.description: short review: if you like cheese, eat here.longer review: i love cheese. so when news of a restaurant opening inside of a new cheese shop in the aville came around... welll, color me excited. came on a saturday night following a snow storm. we were there around 6, were able to get a table fairly quickly, but it also filled up fast while we were there. we sat in the front area by the window, and we noted that the acoustics are sort of strange - definitely much louder in that area than further back. so be prepared for a louder, vibrant area.food - yes! i think just about everything (if not EVERYTHING) had cheese in it! yum. there's a good variety of types (cow, sheep, water buffalo (!!) and the applications are good. quite a few vegetarian options available, which is always a plus. everyone was, for the most part, happy with their meal, and we all said we would return. there's also a bar area in case you just want to get drinks and small plates. extensive wine list, also quite a few beer, and a limited cocktail list. our server was nice, and if we had questions he didn't know the answer to, he went to find out for us rather than just making up an answer. so thank you for that. looking forward to a return visit where i just stuff my face in more cheese and call it a night.

17.description: Stopped in on opening night. Great selection for whatever you're in the mood for. Drinks, snacks or full blown dinner. Minus a star since our food wasn't very hot, but I'm sure they'll work the kinks out in time. Definitely will be back. Andersonville desperately needed a good wine bar and this fits the bill!

10.description: Really spectacular.  Been looking forward to this opening for a while - the food is imaginative, interesting, and chock full of interesting cheese from all over.  They offer a large selection of wine, and the space is really well thought out, comfortable and cozy.  Our waitress was extremely attentive, constantly making sure we were comfortable and well fed, and I couldn't have been more impressed, especially considering they just opened, with the flow of the whole restaurant.  I can easily see this becoming a staple destination for myself in the neighborhood.

5.description: This just opened up in my hood and I'm so thrilled after having dinner.The ambience is modern and just the kind of dim but not dark lighting I prefer.I'm a designer so all of those aesthetics are important to me.We sat at a table but the bar was packed with people oohing over their cheese flights and wine. Love the vibe here.We ordered 2 appetizers, the croque sandwich and a dessert. They were all an unmi experience! If you love cheese and wine and interesting pairings this is the place to go.For starters we had the seared cauliflower and the apple, sweet potato and onion tarte. We had the Croque Monsieur with prosciutto. So big we shared it. Amazing gooiness. We had a dessert our waiter recommended that was savory and sweet. Deliciousness again.John was our waiter and he was efficient, attentive and delightful.The cost was surprising reasonable for foodie quality food. We shared everything and portions were generous but not obnoxious.So, 5 stars for Interior design, Food, Service, Experience and Cost.Btw- their artisan deli, pastoral is really tasty too.

11.description: We came here for restaurant week with high expectations. We really, really wanted to enjoy Appellation, knowing how much we love Pastoral. Unfortunately, the experience was a disappointment. Our food came out in the wrong order, the waitress spilled wine on our menus/table without cleaning it up and the food was a bit salty. The wine selection is fantastic and the menu is affordable for the charm and atmosphere.

3.description: This is really a 3.5, but I'll round up because--Andersonville. :)Like many others in the 'hood, we've anxiously awaited the opening of this place. We are hardcore Andersonville loyalists--and foodies. So, any new restaurant in the neighborhood wins our instant loyalty.While walking around the neighborhood one late afternoon a few days after the opening, we decided to check it out. "Let's grab some wine and cheese,"  my wife said. I happened to have our 3-month old baby strapped to my chest, but he was fast asleep, and mommas needed a drink. (Don't get all self-righteous on me, here.) We walked in and were greeted by the older female hostess. She didn't smile. Didn't attempt to exchange any pleasantries--for show or not. We asked if we could get a small bite and a glass of wine. While she was looking around the nearly empty restaurant, I also asked her about whether or not she thought we'd be okay coming the next evening (which was a Tuesday) for early dinner. I explained that we'd have a stroller, and I asked if they had any tables that were roomy enough that we wouldn't get in the way.I was making casual conversation and excited to try the place; she was not amused. She looked utterly exasperated and, eventually, said that she guesses we could go "over there."She then directed us to the bar where, unbeknownst to us, we weren't allowed to sit "with a minor." I totally get it. It's the law. They are a new establishment. So, we left hungry, shamed, and a little miffed. The point is, they just weren't very warm or welcoming. Yet, we still went back for date night the following weekend. Sans baby.Again, we were put off by coldness of the two hosts--the older woman, again, and a younger dude. Neither of them seemed to like their job. Or us. Or anything. It was almost enough to make us leave again, but we decided to stick it out.We sat at the bar while we waited for a table. Things after that weren't perfect: it took nearly 10 minutes for the bartender, who was very kind but very busy, to give us menus. We placed an order for a cheese plate and he came back 15 minutes later and told us he forgot to put our order in, asking what we wanted, again.When we did finally get a table, it took a long time to get menus or water. They brought out a ham flight and our cheese plate without explaining what was on either--just drop and run. The cheeses were delicious and varied, though. The older gentleman who was our waiter was fantastic, even though he seemed to be waiting on a dozen tables at the same time. He was very charismatic and seemed genuinely excited about the menu.And the meal was a solid 4 stars. The tarte tatin, cauliflower, and gnudi were standouts. The desserts were all mediocre. Not bad--just clearly not made by a pastry chef. I know the first half of this is a little harsh, but I wanted to give the honest opinion of someone who was--and still is--very excited to have this place in the 'hood. There are definitely some kinks to work out--and some staff to train--but I think this place could be a great addition to Andersonville.We will give wine and cheese at the bar another try--without the baby, next time.

0.description: Amazing place, hands down. The chicken thighs are to die for and I've been craving them every since I had them. Their Manhattan is killer too! Appellation has become my go-to when I'm meeting people for dinner in Andersonville.

20.description: Really spectacular.  Been looking forward to this opening for a while - the food is imaginative, interesting, and chock full of interesting cheese from all over.  They offer a large selection of wine, and the space is really well thought out, comfortable and cozy.  Our waitress was extremely attentive, constantly making sure we were comfortable and well fed, and I couldn't have been more impressed, especially considering they just opened, with the flow of the whole restaurant.  I can easily see this becoming a staple destination for myself in the neighborhood.

19.description: I've had a mixed reaction across two experiences now.  First experience was a grab and go sandwich for lunch.  Overall, it was a good, tasty sandwich.  Counter servers were friendly and knowledgable and offered great, friendly service.  I enjoyed the sandwich at home and thought  - hmmm.... I must try them for dinner.  My second visit was not quite so welcoming.  With friends in from out of town, decided we would grab a glass of wine at the bar, check out the menu, and then grab a table for dinner.  It was Sunday evening and not all that busy as we arrived early and there was ample space at the bar and plenty of tables open.  We sat at the bar waiting to be greeted, and waited, and waited and finally said - excuse us - can we get some service.  We were completely disappointed that the server was completely unengaged - not a smile, not a welcome to Appellation, nothing.  If you are supposed to be an upscale wine bar and want to charge me $12+ for a glass of wine - engage me even if just for a moment by telling me something about the wine - asking if I like it - anything.  We ordered a round a cocktails and all decided that the cold shoulder service simply wasn't giving us a good vibe so we ended up heading down the street to Vincent for dinner (which in my book has consistenly excelled in the service department) .  I'll write this off as a bad experience or a server having a bad day and hope that they will strive to enhance the customer experience.

2.description: Appellation is so cute and TASTY!  If I could just eat cheese and drink wine forever I think I would be a very happy person.  Maybe I could just move in to Appellation?  Yeah?We went to Appellation in between lunch and dinner on a snowy Chicago afternoon.  I ordered a salad (olives, cheese, sundried tomatoes, mmm) and my husband ordered and sandwich.  We devoured them at the bar, and were super impressed.  Can't wait to go back!

18.description: the local itself, the atmosphere, the food and wine are excellent.they are new so they still have to work around the edges, but overall services was good.I am only giving them a 4 because of the clientele it will attract.I was there on Saturday to try it out for the first time.  We were seated between two tables of what seemed to be the crew and staff of the Real House Wives of Chicago-Andersonville (lol).I guess this is the type of client that can be expected here but these patrons were very condescending on the wait staff and it was just awful seeing the waitress, which by the way was her birthday, deal with these women.  besides they were all obviously intoxicated, which at that point was very loud and annoying.  I think respectfully management should have stepped in and not serve more alcohol to these women.I will definetly go back, I just know this is the kind of crow I'll have to encounter here.

13.description: Great addition to Andersonville! Great bar and good food in a very friendly atmosphere. I love the Pastoral that's downtown so I was super excited to see one opened in Andersonville. Didn't disappoint!

4.description: Great wine/bar and restaurant with prompt service. Tender Lamb pesto: 5Chunky chicken thighs: 5Assyritiko : 5Ambiance is fantastic; space is attractive; food is delicious.

6.description: I've been to this amazing wine bar & retail delicatessen many times since the opening last fall. I have yet to be disappointed! Lunch is fantastic and maintains all the quality and deliciousness of the other locations in the city. And if you're looking for a fantastic gift or something impressive to bring to a dinner party, this is the place to visit!! Wine, cheese, pate, olives, chutneys, the list goes on....everything they stock is insanely good. And reasonably priced! There are several bottles of wine under $15 and the other selections are well worth the price tag. A $29 bottle of wine could easily pass for a much higher-priced vintage! (note: prices for vino on the retail side are obviously much lower than purchasing them in the bar/restaurant - we usually enjoy some at the bar, then buy 1 or more to take home!)Sitting at the bar to sip on boutique wine and nosh on their charcuterie is now one of my favorite things to do pre or post-dinner when I'm strolling through Andersonville. And the dinner portion....where to begin?! I've had the pleasure of bringing a variety of friends, as well as out-of-towners here, and the experience has always been DIVINE! The service is absolutely impeccable, with perfect suggestions for our varying tastes and wine pairings that made us swoon. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly and buttoned up! The menu is creative, without being overly intimidating, and the European/simple approach to each dish is a welcome alternative to other offerings on Clark St. I can't recommend Appellation enough! It's a fabulous addition to Andersonville and I am so thrilled that I have a new favorite spot in the 'hood:)

15.description: This place is amazing. The atmosphere, the food and the service make it a great new addition to Andersonville. The chicken thighs were great. We ordered the chickpea appetizer and it was great too. This is going to be one of my new go-to restaurants.UPDATE: I visited this restaurant for the second time and was very disappointed. I remember the chicken thighs being amazing the first time, so I ordered them again. We also ordered the chickpea appetizer again. To our disappointment both of them did not come close to the first time we tasted them. The chicken thighs/mashed potatoes were swimming in gravy, the chicken actually looked a little pink and felt a bit chewy. The chickpea appetizer was not the same either. It had a sweet syrupy kind of flavor and not at all consistent with the previous time we had it. Not sure if it was a new cook or he was just having a bad day. We still like the ambience and the service so will try it once more. Will update my review accordingly. I am now giving it a 3 star.

7.description: I had an amazing experience here last night. The entire setup lends itself to a leisurely gourmet experience, I sat at the bar but there was the choice of tables or the very cool cheese bar.While waiting for food (not very long) I was able to check out the store side and browse the cheese and wine selection, which is well chosen and sophisticated.The server/bartender was prompt, attentive and knowlegable and let us taste wines before we chose, a point I always appreciate.Menu was well suited to a Chicago winter evening, braised lamb and pork shoulder, both were perfect.This one is a real winner for Andersonville.

8.description: I have ate at Appellation three times now and it is a great addition to the neighborhood.
