I have lived here for 15 years now and have seen places come and go and this place will be here for a long time.   The environment is very comfortable and not too loud, the staff are always very informative on the food and wine and the food tastes great while being reasonably priced.  I always leave full and satisfied and didn't break the bank.   Another added plus is with the attached store you can take things to go for home or gifts.   Fantastic!

14.description: Went there last night. While the place was cute, my friend and I were very clear when we ordered on the size of our glasses of wine. The "small". Each glass should have been $5. Much to our surprise each glass was $10. I said something to the server. She apologized but made no change to the check. I won't be back and I won't be recommending the new slot either. Too bad. I was excited to go back. But robbing customers without fixing it isn't right.

58.description: Absolutely Disgusting.  Just had to run up there for the weeks' provisions and couldn't believe the state of things.  I wanted to buy chicken brats, but they were past expiration.  I would never consider buying red meat here, but out of curiosity, looked at the ground beef (gray and nasty) which was 2 days past expiration.   This summer, Jewel blessed our neighborhood with a "remodeled store" which, in reality, means narrower aisles and a bigger liquor department. They should have just blown up the place, freeing god only knows how many mice.  I can only hope that someone at Trader Joe's pays attention to Yelp and realizes that they have a captive market of under served and under appreciated denizens of Andersonville/Edgewater.  Its going to take a lot more lipstick on this pig to bring me back.

56.description: I get it. I should just get my lazy ass over there and check if you sell candy melts. I didn't know it would take SIX transfers to only end up with no answer. what a bunch of idiots. i don't care if you don't know what that is, you just need to ask me. however, the six person transfer and silent hold time is pretty annoying.oh, they also took 10 minutes to find some risotto. another customer had to point it out for me.

29.description: Finally, they remodeled but...The aisles are so narrow, it's a head on collision with someone coming the opposite way.  The aisles extend so far out that they "butt up" against the cash register.  Imagine the cluster when a lot of people are trying to check out at once.  Simply, they are trying to fit way too much merchandise into the space they have.  Then put in the women handing out free snacks, totally in shoppers way, no clue what they are doing.  MAKE IT STOP!OMG. The deli dept. Okay I'm going to be mean for a second.... They are slllloooow. The blond with the pont tail ...it's almost comical that she screws up my order every time.  She doesn't listen and is more caught up with chatting with her friends than doing her job.  Help!Bring on Amazon Fresh so I don't have to experience this Jewel again!

42.description: Without a doubt, this is the filthiest and shoddiest Jewel Tea Store in Chicago. The pharmacy is not exactly filthy, but it sure is the slowest and least well stocked with drugs.Always have to come back next day to pick up medicine.If the whole place shut down.......who would miss the store??

23.description: The two stars here have mostly to do with the very bad decision of doing a remodel and removing the absolute best part of the store.. the self checkout.  Lines here are always very long but the self checkout always worked fine for me.  I have asked several times why they removed the self checkout and have received answers such as 'so we could add more registers'    Okay that's fine but the registers aren't open and the wait time has doubled.    I'm guessing that because of this alone business will go down by 30%.    Bad move Jewel.  Time to listen to your customers.

47.description: Yep, still terrible. I stopped in here after a few months hiatus and had unfortunately forgotten how bad it is. Fifteen minutes to buy one item which took four employees...it's Edgewater from now on.

8.description: This Jewel has morons for baggers, since the plastic bag issue I have had to deal with squashed fruit, mutilated boxes. Re-packaging my groceries properly, and surly people.Last week, I requested to bag my salad separately (these are my bags) so I  couldhand carry it home well she threw it in a bag and placed other stuff on top yelling at methat she bagged it properly.I absolutely hate this place but, unfortunately we don't drive so usually this is the only option.Do yourself a favor and stay away

31.description: You would think with the remodel this place would improve,WRONG. Walking in here makes me feel claustrophobic. I have to wander around looking for what I need since they rearranged everything. If you want something from the deli be prepared to wait at least twenty minutes. They don't have a number system so be ready for rude ass people trying to cut in front of you. Checkout is slow and the cashiers are not friendly at all. I don't expect a conversation but a Hi and Thank you wouldn't kill them.

34.description: Its improving, they seem to be doing some upgrades but its always a bit messy and their produce, meat dept and bakery needs some help

16.description: As other people have already said - check out Edgewater Produce across the street before you buy produce here.I almost never have a good experience at this Jewel. I find them to run out of very basic items more often than a grocery store should. The layout is just...weird (and constantly changing - so be prepared to never know where anything is).The one shining light of this place is the alcohol area. They typically have pretty good prices on liquor, and they recently installed a cooler with individual beers for you to mix and match your own 6 pack for $10.Never ever ever use the bathroom here. Ever.

13.description: It's so bad now. It used to be okay a year ago. Even had some perks. When they removed the self checkout, the waiting time tripled. Now everyone around you is angry and people cut in line. Even the employees will cut you in line so they can buy a pack of cigarettes for their break.

11.description: First off let me say i have family members and close friends who work at various Jewel ' s throughout the city. I have heard horror stories of the way "some" management treats their employees.  I know personally what it's like to work in a hostile environment. The attitude of this store just sucks!I recently seriously hurt my back and can't lift anything heavy....I needed to buy a lot of water, beer and pop for a huge party. I asked for help and the cashier just stared at me....After 7 min wait for assistance ( it was 6am)The gentleman who was to help me was obviously annoyed because I took him away from rounding up 3 carts in the lot. He then began to question me when I changed my mind, wanting 4 cases of beer instead of my original request of 3.After reluctantly placing my fourth case in the cart, he was more annoyed when I then said I needed water. I realized I felt really uncomfortable asking this employee to help me spend about 300 bucks on beverages at this jewel. ....so I politely thanked him, and said I no longer needed his help. He gruff ed and walked away. Then so did I..... I went to ....you guessed it, Marianos.My point to this tale is that their customer service sucks!It's really hard to get help in this jewel,  most of the time.

39.description: Yesterday was the final stray. I've shopped at this Jewels since I moved to Chicago. Lines are getting longer. Only three registers are open during 'busy time'.WTF?Don't get me started on their deceptive pricing. Pricing deli meat by the half pound making it appear like you're getting a deal? Such bull. So long Jewel-Osco.

37.description: As far as grocery stores go, this one is the pits. Although, to be fair, I don't really shop in the frozen/junk food isles which they do have plenty of. I'm more of a fresh food person.The produce section is tiny and doesn't have an amazing selection. The deli and fresh meat selection is not very good either-the rather limited amount of fresh meat is relegated to a quarter of an isle. The staff is helpful and always friendly though. If you want a really great selection of produce and fresh meat, go to the Dominicks on Foster.

0.description: Be prepared to spend eons in here when you come in - most of which is spent at the register waiting in line. They never have more than 2 people on a register at a time, and the cashiers don't really know what they're doing. Not to mention that the stuff must get stocked once a month, if that. So don't exit them to have what you're looking for. I only shop here because it's the closest grocery store near my apartment. Otherwise, you wouldn't see me caught dead in here...

38.description: If you are not Black and get a Black cashier be prepared to be treated like crap. Seen and experienced this a lot. Other than that it seems okay. Don't shop here for produce, and always watch signs. Deli prices are by the 1/2 pound and that can throw off the amazing deal you think you just scored. Also be careful leaving, as homeless people will ask you for money and keep your phone hidden, as phones are taken snatch and grab style in this area.

51.description: This Jewel kind of stinks.  Half the time we go and they don't have cilantro or the beer we want.  The produce isn't always the freshest either.  They recently gave this place a face lift but there's still a lot to be desired.

27.description: At our house, we refer to this Jewel as "Worst Jewel."  I've really, really tried to like this Jewel, because the checkers and floor people are so nice. I can't. I just can't.They just did a remodel and it still looks old and run down.  The only thing that improved was they added a salad bar and made the deli area really roomy. Roomy in  a wasted space kind of way.In fact, the remodel seems to have removed floor space that could be used to hold more product.You can never complete your shopping at the Jewel as they are constantly running out of the exotic things on your shopping list like Swiss Cheese Slices, Diet Pepsi, and Bread. I have been in this Jewel when it resembled the Cold War Bread Lines. "Excuse me ma'am! Do you work here? May I please just have a crust of bread?" Also, they've made it even more inconvenient to shop there by removing the self checkout stands, and then they have the same amount of staff working the registers. Go there at 11 pm, and the line will be backed up to the alcohol section, which is convenient because by the time you leave the store you will need a good stiff drink. After staying 20 minutes in a breadline late at night, it is even more irritating to have to exit the Ashland side of the store, when most of the shoppers are going to the Clark side to head home or to the bus.You can now buy an individual muffin though.The first time I called corporate they apologized and sent a gift card, which was a nice gesture.The second time I called was to tell them that even though I live basically across the street from them,  I would be going to Edgewater Produce for veggies and greens and then taking a cab to the Broadway and Foster Marianno's  that is a much more relaxing, complete, reasonable, and well-staffed shopping experience.  And ... They have bread ... Always.

32.description: As other people have already said - check out Edgewater Produce across the street before you buy produce here.I almost never have a good experience at this Jewel. I find them to run out of very basic items more often than a grocery store should. The layout is just...weird (and constantly changing - so be prepared to never know where anything is).The one shining light of this place is the alcohol area. They typically have pretty good prices on liquor, and they recently installed a cooler with individual beers for you to mix and match your own 6 pack for $10.Never ever ever use the bathroom here. Ever.

54.description: This Jewel always gives me a panic attack. As soon as I walk in, I want to leave. I went here recently looking for something they didn't even have. I should have just turned around and gone to Edgewater Produce, across the street.Speaking of which: produce. I had difficulty finding a firm green bell pepper. I had to rifle through the onion bin for yellow onions without soft spots. This is the middle of Christmas week. Surely product should be turning over quickly enough that it doesn't go bad.This store has recently undergone a renovation, which makes it look nicer than it is. You can put spats on a pig, but all you end up with is a pig in spats. It's still cramped and overcrowded and filled with extras from Night of the Living Dead.Coincidentally, I had shopped at Jewel on Lincoln Ave a week or so before I shopped here, and had a perfectly lovely experience. It's not Jewel, it's THIS Jewel.

48.description: So this place is an older store with a smaller selection of goods. not the cleanest, but has most of the basic items you may need.  best thing its open 24 hours and has a Pharmacy that is 24 hours.  Staff is very friendly.

44.description: They carry 40s!

24.description: Dreadful. Even after the recent re-do, its still just dreadful. Don't bother, unless its very late and you just need a couple things (they're open 24 hours, as long as you're willing to navigate aisles blocked with merchandise carts). Bad produce, often empty shelves of sale items, long waits at the deli counter, a salad bar with wilted lettuce and sad looking prepared salads, horrible check out service (why in the world did they get rid if the self checkouts?!)... You are much better off at Mariano's.

7.description: At around 10:00pm today my friend and I made a quick run to this place and I couldn't even tell u how disgusted I am. The entire experience would have been so unimportant but the shitty cashier definitely made the experience stand out! He had to be the rudest cashier I have ever interacted with! His snappy attitude is 100%uncalled for and honestly if he is that miserable he should quite or get fired! When we were at the register he was snappy about where our items were placed and when I asked for cash back he rudely replied "just follow the prompts on the screen!" Is he stupid, that is not how you should talk to your customers! He then proceeded to rush me into pressing the accept button like wtf! No! I think his name is Robert but I'm not sure he needs a legit lesson in customer service 101! He was the only other cashier aside from the customer service/ express line when we went at around 10:00! Just beware avoid this man he is unhappy  with his job and clearly his life. His social interactions are rude and tacky!

49.description: If there was a competition for "worst Jewel in Chicago" this guy might win the prize. The selection was terrible and the produce was gross. It was almost impossible to assemble a dinner here. Want a salad? You'll need to settle for a wilted, saggy, brown mixture. How about some fruit? Well, you might find a few non-moldy berries, but they'll cost you. A nice fish filet? No dice. i bought some ice cream which turned out to be freezer burned. Yeah, I'll take some ptomaine poisoning with my dinner. Just what I wanted. Thanks. Seriously, seriously terrible.  Do not make my mistake. Go to Edgewater Produce across the street. Save your money; save your sanity; go home with edible food.

40.description: Sucks! Went there to buy grilled en pieces from the deli and it was old and dry. The store is really congested and didn't have a large selection of food. Looks like they were out of everything in the store or very limited. The Jewel in Evanston on Howard street is much better and I think I will continue to shop there from now on.

53.description: Why does every jewel have 6 lanes when they only open 2. I would say install more self check-out lanes but it seems the people using these are all brain dead who need the cashier to help them. GET IN A AISLE. It's bad enough the understaffed employee decides to wander off. I don't need him/her scanning your groceries while I need a liquor check.

30.description: So Jewel Osco chose to re-design the store and make it better for its customers. I guess that is the reason why they got rid off the self-checkout lines and now it's 11 pm and around 15 people are standing in one line serviced by one employee and nothing is moving forward. Great move Jewel. Another reason why it sucks that Dominick's is gone.

46.description: Aisles are a little small but store is clean and organized

1.description: Terrible store.The produce is never ripe, and often bruised.  They don't have a huge selection because of their size, and it always seems pretty picked over.  Last time I was there every bag of potatoes I grabbed was sprouting significantly.The meat department is super small, and usually the item you want is out of stock.  If I want something from the seafood department there is never anyone there working the counter.  Recently I found out that I have to ring a doorbell for service.  Still took 5 minutes to get any help.The aisles are super tight, so it is hard to pass someone if you both have carts.When they are stocking they will bring out pallets that are completely full, and just drop them in the back aisle.  If they are in front of an item that you would like to grab, then you have to reach around at an awkward angle, or just walk away.  It makes it a giant hazard that blocks the dairy, juices, butter, and so on.  Last time they had 4 full pallets sitting in the back aisle, and a bunch of guys standing around talking.They always have a huge line to check out.  They have so many registers but there are 3 that I have never seen used.  They also have 4 express registers, but will only use 2 at a time.The only positive is that it is a 4 minute drive from my house. I'm not going to give them credit for that.

55.description: This is the closest grocery to my house and I never go here. Today I did, forgetting for a moment why I don't; they confused me for a moment with their slightly renovated exterior. This store is crowded, there are six registers plus a few self-checkouts, and there are always a million people and three registers open so it takes forever to check out. Glad I got the reminder not to shop here.

9.description: I normally wouldn't consider writing a review about a grocery store, but I'm so tired of this disastrously dysfunctional disorganized excuse for a grocery store, I cannot resist.  I have always avoided going to this store even though it is the closest store to my house.  So after several months to a year of not showing my face in the place.  I decided to take a new look at an old friend... Jewel.  I mean, I'm sure all the competition Mariano's is bringing to the table has forced them to up their game.  right?  WRONG!!!  It is worse now than it was a year ago.  WTF?This place makes Aldi look like Whole Foods.  Their slogan says, "Just Around the Corner Proudly serving Chicago communities for over one hundred years".  If you decide to "take a new look at this old friend..." You'll see that it has become a very old friend of whom you will want to cut ties as soon as you see how out of touch and crazy it is.  Disorganized Madness is the best way to describe it.  Like a friend who has no idea what is going on around them.  A friend who talks to their cats in baby voices while occasionally opening up a can of cat food and eating it: embarrassing to have around. Seriously, Who cares if it is just around the corner? To be frank, I would walk 500 miles and I would walk 500 more, just to be the man who walked a thousand miles to shop at another store.  Jus' sayin'.  The executives really need to fire the managers and rethink the concept of this store if they ever expect to compete with the likes of Mariano's and Whole Foods Markets opening up just around the other corners.  Buh bye old friend.  You're tired.

26.description: First off let me say i have family members and close friends who work at various Jewel ' s throughout the city. I have heard horror stories of the way "some" management treats their employees.  I know personally what it's like to work in a hostile environment. The attitude of this store just sucks!I recently seriously hurt my back and can't lift anything heavy....I needed to buy a lot of water, beer and pop for a huge party. I asked for help and the cashier just stared at me....After 7 min wait for assistance ( it was 6am)The gentleman who was to help me was obviously annoyed because I took him away from rounding up 3 carts in the lot. He then began to question me when I changed my mind, wanting 4 cases of beer instead of my original request of 3.After reluctantly placing my fourth case in the cart, he was more annoyed when I then said I needed water. I realized I felt really uncomfortable asking this employee to help me spend about 300 bucks on beverages at this jewel. ....so I politely thanked him, and said I no longer needed his help. He gruff ed and walked away. Then so did I..... I went to ....you guessed it, Marianos.My point to this tale is that their customer service sucks!It's really hard to get help in this jewel,  most of the time.

25.description: I rarely give 1 star but when you order a cake and the wording is unreadable that it looks like a two year old did it. I think we have a problem. I picked up my grandmother birthday cake mind you she was turning 101! I would have did it up just right knowing someone 101 was going to be eating my cake but I digress.... I look at the cake like noooo this has to be a joke. I go to the customer service counter and I proceed to tell them what's wrong with it and the lady looked at the cake and said...WHATS WRONG WITH IT? Even though she obviously had not had her V8 this morning I proceeded to tell her about what I thought was wrong with the cake. She called th bakery manager and then tells me go take it to him and see what he can do. I go back to the back he then looks it over and says oh ok. I'm like can it be fixed I can't serve this. He said let me try. No oh I'm sorry! Yep this looks terrible! Nothing. After waiting for about 20 mins or so he sends. Young lady out with the cake she says is this better? It definitely looked better but I was so disgusted with the service. I will never and do not recommend getting a cake from jewel.

12.description: This is the scene on a Tuesday night at midnight.  My groceries have melted and everyone is in disbelief.  Two long lines that don't move at all.  But.... It's open 24/7.  And they did really upgrade the produce and put in a salad bar to compete with Mariano's (as well as raise the prices).  This is the slutty, crack-smoking step sister of a regular Jewel.  I'm stuck with her.

59.description: Meh, it's a grocery store. Whatever. It doesn't always have what I need (vanilla mint toothpaste or salt and vinegar Pop Chips, for example), but when it has what I need, I'm satisfied enough.With that said, I detest the bank! I've been a customer of TCF for nigh onto five years and this location is just so...ugh. There's always some dingbat at the counter who doesn't have his crap organized and/or has a bunch of dumb questions about stupid stuff that anybody with half a brain would know. You over drafted because you didn't pay attention to your account balance, dummy! It's not the bank's fault that you bought a Nintendo Wii when you only had thirty bucks in your account! Yargh!

21.description: Worst shipping experience I've ever had. I  grew up on jewel and have remained loyal even with the temptation of a Marianos right next door from my job. However I stopped at deli for small chunk of pepperoni. It took the lady 5 minutes of walking back and forth opening cases to find it. I felt like an inconvenience. I showed her how much I wanted and she cuts a chunk 4 times bigger than I asked her for. The deli looked like everybody was on break. The guacamole was brown. The cashier took forever to ring out my 5 items. I've never seen a jewel in such ruin. Newsflash jewels,if they build a marianos close by,you guys are toast. Step up your game,the little produce market across the street has more stars than you,stop in there and figure out why. I so easily coulda went to the marianos as opposed to your store.

17.description: I would rather have a splinter on my private parts then shop here.  I avoid this store at all costs.  Why you may ask?  Is is the crappy layout of this store with tiny aisles ... Eh no I can deal with ant killer by the produce or the ever changing location of items at Devon market so that's  not it.  It comes down to this jewel is where customer service goes to die.  My tipping point was a Saturday morning three weeks ago.  My walked up to the deli counter where two individuals were having a lovely conversation.  I waited and was ready to order for two minutes in clear site but they kept talking.  I timed it because I was curious how long it would take.   I finally walked off and the store.   This is not the only incident but a pattern with this store.  The checkers rarely are friendly or even talk, no one is friendly or helpful and I take my business far out of the way to get basic service.   I am not a pretentious whole fooder or Mariano's queen but I do want a level of service that doesn't repulse me.

10.description: At our house, we refer to this Jewel as "Worst Jewel."  I've really, really tried to like this Jewel, because the checkers and floor people are so nice. I can't. I just can't.They just did a remodel and it still looks old and run down.  The only thing that improved was they added a salad bar and made the deli area really roomy. Roomy in  a wasted space kind of way.In fact, the remodel seems to have removed floor space that could be used to hold more product.You can never complete your shopping at the Jewel as they are constantly running out of the exotic things on your shopping list like Swiss Cheese Slices, Diet Pepsi, and Bread. I have been in this Jewel when it resembled the Cold War Bread Lines. "Excuse me ma'am! Do you work here? May I please just have a crust of bread?" Also, they've made it even more inconvenient to shop there by removing the self checkout stands, and then they have the same amount of staff working the registers. Go there at 11 pm, and the line will be backed up to the alcohol section, which is convenient because by the time you leave the store you will need a good stiff drink. After staying 20 minutes in a breadline late at night, it is even more irritating to have to exit the Ashland side of the store, when most of the shoppers are going to the Clark side to head home or to the bus.You can now buy an individual muffin though.The first time I called corporate they apologized and sent a gift card, which was a nice gesture.The second time I called was to tell them that even though I live basically across the street from them,  I would be going to Edgewater Produce for veggies and greens and then taking a cab to the Broadway and Foster Marianno's  that is a much more relaxing, complete, reasonable, and well-staffed shopping experience.  And ... They have bread ... Always.

5.description: I would run, not walk away from this Jewel. It's really a nightmare to shop. They keep moving things around the store so it's extremely hard to find what you are shopping for and if you want to have organic items you basically out of luck. And today they had only two lines open even though each line had over 10 people in it waiting to check out. It's a horrible experience shopping there - no one is happy in that store.

3.description: The location is good, smack dab between Clark St and Ashland. Large parking lot, which comes in handy if you are like me and can't give up driving a car in Chicago. The handful of times I have come here it was not surprisingly busy and the cashiers were friendly and prompt.

35.description: Booooo. Boo for so many reasons. Here's the bitchy, impatient, petty city girl in me coming out, but hey, whatever.Lets start with the shite parking lot. Enjoy never finding a spot and getting trapped behind IDIOTS who have parked their car in the aisles waiting for someone, anyone, to leave their spots. That's a neat and infuriating experience.Next, enjoy making your way through this horrible parking lot, dodging crazy drivers to enter what must be the worst, most crowded clusterf*ck of a store entrance this world has ever known. Sliding doors open and BOOM so much produce in your face and so many people dawdling around it mindlessly, trying to spot an organic label on their alfalfa sprouts. Also their selection and quality of "produce" is shit, and that's a generous assessment. Dont get me started on their prices for this partially rotting garbage. (Go to Edgewater Produce literally across the street for fresh produce at half the price).After you've escaped the produce gauntlet it doesn't get much better, charge through the bakery section and mindless moms blocking your path at every turn so you can maybe, just maybe, find some of the groceries you're looking for.It comes down to a store that is way way way too small, with a parking lot that is even more way way way way too small for a thriving neighborhood. This place is at capacity at all times and everyone shopping here brings me closer to death. Ive always disliked Jewels in Chicago, maybe they are better in the burbs. Find me at any local produce market or Aldi spending half the money and feeling half as suicidal.

19.description: Booooo. Boo for so many reasons. Here's the bitchy, impatient, petty city girl in me coming out, but hey, whatever.Lets start with the shite parking lot. Enjoy never finding a spot and getting trapped behind IDIOTS who have parked their car in the aisles waiting for someone, anyone, to leave their spots. That's a neat and infuriating experience.Next, enjoy making your way through this horrible parking lot, dodging crazy drivers to enter what must be the worst, most crowded clusterf*ck of a store entrance this world has ever known. Sliding doors open and BOOM so much produce in your face and so many people dawdling around it mindlessly, trying to spot an organic label on their alfalfa sprouts. Also their selection and quality of "produce" is shit, and that's a generous assessment. Dont get me started on their prices for this partially rotting garbage. (Go to Edgewater Produce literally across the street for fresh produce at half the price).After you've escaped the produce gauntlet it doesn't get much better, charge through the bakery section and mindless moms blocking your path at every turn so you can maybe, just maybe, find some of the groceries you're looking for.It comes down to a store that is way way way too small, with a parking lot that is even more way way way way too small for a thriving neighborhood. This place is at capacity at all times and everyone shopping here brings me closer to death. Ive always disliked Jewels in Chicago, maybe they are better in the burbs. Find me at any local produce market or Aldi spending half the money and feeling half as suicidal.

28.description: This is the scene on a Tuesday night at midnight.  My groceries have melted and everyone is in disbelief.  Two long lines that don't move at all.  But.... It's open 24/7.  And they did really upgrade the produce and put in a salad bar to compete with Mariano's (as well as raise the prices).  This is the slutty, crack-smoking step sister of a regular Jewel.  I'm stuck with her.

45.description: In the greater Chicagoland area, I'm generally more of a Dominick's man than Jewel.  I am even less a fan of this Andersonville store.  With Edgewater produce right across the street and Urban Orchard a few blocks south, I usually only make my way in here if I couldn't find everything on my shopping list at those two places.I also find the bathroom situation odd here.  For a very large store, they only have one single unisex stall.  That strikes me as odd and inconvenient.

33.description: I was in the Jewel this afternoon and this whole renovation process has thrown me through a loop. First of all, i feel they are handling the transition all wrong. As a customer i felt like I was in the way, which is never a sign of GOOD business. This is also a very regular occurrence. They did away with the self check out which i don't understand, unless you're going to increase the number of registers. Instead we have to wait on long lines. Those of us grabbing a few items, stuck behind those with cart fulls. Im a pretty easygoing person, but when your prices are reflective of the quality of product AND the quality of service being provided, i assume that the latter part is going to be addressed with conscious effort.   So today I was waiting in line at the "new" liquor department register. it was approximately 6:45 pm. I was behind 2 people and then there was a wayward woman, off to the left, with a half empty grocery cart. She hadn't completely decided if she was done shopping or not. So a young man, in a tie, who seemed to be on a managerial level of sorts jumped on a register. You would think he would request the very next customer ALREADY in line to come to the register...instead he just sends out an open invitation to whomever's next, and takes the woman with the shopping cart who jumps on the opportunity. I find this sort of practice to be a waste of MY time and MY dollar. With newer, more reputable chains like Mariano's moving in, i suggest that Jewel really strive to provide similar QUALITY service. They've lost my interest, and I've been a loyal customer for a decade. I'm not impressed.

43.description: Weird layout, crowded aisles, surly and kind of racist staff - black cashier was perfectly chatty and all smiles with black family in front of me, then totally short and brusque to my white self in response to my 'Hello'.And this place just had a make over? Ugh, no thanks. Apparently, I'm not the only one. Now I know why Jewel's profit margins are so thin.

2.description: I was here over the weekend and have visited here a few times (only when my husband needs to get his haircut at his barber nearby) While i'm waiting for him to come out, I come here to do some grocery shopping and kill time.  It just seems that every time i come here, this place is packed (especially at the checkout counters) where the lines move slower than molasses which adds to the frustration of shoppers and overall makes for nasty people.  I'm giving this place one star not for the slow lines but rather for the poor condition of their unisex bathroom.  Public bathrooms should have standards and this one fell way below them. As soon as I entered in the bathroom i was hit with the strong stench of rotted poo and methane gas.  It was as if this bathroom never had the pleasure of experiencing an air wick which it sooooo desperately needed.  I was so sick from the smell that i almost vomited from the offensive stink.  Even thinking about it gives me a headache.  Jewel clean up your act.  Literally....

18.description: This jewel is spectacular. The people at the customer service part of the store always make my day. :)

41.description: This is my least favorite Jewel-Osco store that I've ever visited.The store layout is horrible, and it is very difficult to find things.Part of the produce aisle cuts into part of a couple other aisles that are near the deli section, making it very difficult to navigate the store.  It is also difficult to know what items are in those "hidden" aisles.  The whole bread section is there, tucked away in a nook that is obstructed by the horribly placed sideways produce aisle.  It makes no sense, and is frustrated to spiral around to try to get there, dodging rude customers along the narrow aisleways.The fresh meat, deli, and produce sections are also pathetically small.And where the heck is the ezekiel bread?  I haven't seen it in the store for nearly a month.  I've all but given up shopping at this store.  The only reason I still stop by is because it is on the way for my drive home from work.  But it is much more pleasant to take a slight detour and hit up the Dominicks on Foster & Sheridan instead.  Or even Edgewater Produce if I don't need any specialty items.

52.description: I'm pretty sure the Jewel Osco in Andersonville was actually designed to make consumers break down in a mess of frustrated tears. I can never find what I want in there and it's hard to move around. I don't know what it is about the store design and layout but I just can't deal with it -- and neither can anyone else I know.

50.description: I'd give the store 1 star, but the staff is really friendly and accommodating. That said, I walked in yesterday only to find out that they had absolutely not ONE sales ad available to look at. Not one! None at the registers, none at the front of the store. Nada. So, I guess if I tried to buy a sales item that wasn't marked properly, I'd be SOL. Not good.Shame on you, Jewel! You love to boast about having the best prices, but then you hide them from customers? Seems just a bit passive-aggressive to me. You'd rather sell your higher priced items   Fact is, sale stuff is often buried. Sometimes it isn't even marked. I can't tell how many times I've had to point out a sales item to a sales clerk at the register. Better take your own ad into the Jewel if you expect to find the deals. Otherwise, you are SOL. This really is unfortunate, because everyone sometimes stops in without planning to. Everyone is on a budget these days, so it's a shame that Jewel can't at least have their own ads ready to peruse in their own stores.

4.description: Terribly managed store. No baggers at the check out, 3 non express registers open I spent over $140 here and I had to bag my own groceries. This was on Black Friday. I do my shopping on Saturdays usually and this is the same story. I have complained to the manager directly, called the store and  submitted complaints online and nothing has changed. It's a shame too, used to be a great store to shop in.

6.description: This review is for Ashley. She rang me up and bagged my groceries. She literally threw my five yogurts into the bag. I had a total of 11 items. Maybe she was pissed I had more than usual in the express lane but the other lines were backed up so badly that I made the best choice. And my other items were paper towels, T.P. and toothpaste. Not exactly hard to pack. She did the lousiest packing job I've ever seen (and I used to work at a grocery store!). I struggled home in 90 degree heat and had to repack halfway home and by the time I got home the yogurt had opened a hole in the bottom of the bag.

22.description: I'll be brief. The only advantage they had over Mariano's was the self-checkout lanes. Now they've replaced them with manned "express" lanes which are longer, confusing, and far less convenient. Bravo! The recent remodel was akin to rearranging the deck chairs on the Titanic. Jewel corporate, you fail. Maybe you should team up with Kmart and Sears, then you can all just ride that leaky ship down together.

15.description: This Jewel is smaller and feels congested and compact than the other Jewel in Broadway & Berwyn. They also seem to have less items on stock. I've been coming here regularly and I still get lost inside. The way their products are organize is so weird, especially the aisles where the breakfast and canned food items are. If it weren't for the nice people working in front, I would have give this just 1 star.

57.description: As far as JewelOsco's go, this one isn't that bad. It has food. It has lines. It has a subpar cheese collection.It also has the world's stupidest bike rack. I'd be happier locking my bike to the fence, which, in essence, was what I was forced to do today. If the holes/slots/whatever are too small to fit a normal-sized bike's wheels, then what is the point of existing? What am I supposed to do? Ended up awkwardly lifting bike over rack, fitting it partially through the fence and assuming that no bike thief would exert the energy in stealing my less than properly secured bike from it's strange balancing act. Maybe I'm the stupid one, but I genuinely thought that bike racks were supposed to fit bikes. So okay, this is an alright Jewel for the sorts  of things one only buys at Jewel, but if you're gonna remodel, do it right.

20.description: I normally wouldn't consider writing a review about a grocery store, but I'm so tired of this disastrously dysfunctional disorganized excuse for a grocery store, I cannot resist.  I have always avoided going to this store even though it is the closest store to my house.  So after several months to a year of not showing my face in the place.  I decided to take a new look at an old friend... Jewel.  I mean, I'm sure all the competition Mariano's is bringing to the table has forced them to up their game.  right?  WRONG!!!  It is worse now than it was a year ago.  WTF?This place makes Aldi look like Whole Foods.  Their slogan says, "Just Around the Corner Proudly serving Chicago communities for over one hundred years".  If you decide to "take a new look at this old friend..." You'll see that it has become a very old friend of whom you will want to cut ties as soon as you see how out of touch and crazy it is.  Disorganized Madness is the best way to describe it.  Like a friend who has no idea what is going on around them.  A friend who talks to their cats in baby voices while occasionally opening up a can of cat food and eating it: embarrassing to have around. Seriously, Who cares if it is just around the corner? To be frank, I would walk 500 miles and I would walk 500 more, just to be the man who walked a thousand miles to shop at another store.  Jus' sayin'.  The executives really need to fire the managers and rethink the concept of this store if they ever expect to compete with the likes of Mariano's and Whole Foods Markets opening up just around the other corners.  Buh bye old friend.  You're tired.

36.description: Best jewel near north side so far , clean ,and not crowded  much better that the ones from Broadway ,Sheridan and foster

14.description: I mostly go to this store late at night when they have very few cashiers and a lot of stockers. There is always a long line with one register open when i visit.  Maybe it's in my vibration, but then again so is this low rating. It's a shame this jewel didn't implement the self service check out lanes.  That way they could make better use of the over night clerk.

58.description: This place is dying a slow death.  I used to eat here about once a week but it has gradually fallen off in both quality and service.  The last straw was when I came in for dinner last week.  We were the only table in the entire place, yet the staff was painfully slow in greeting us.  Once we finally had menu's, we started giving staff "the look" as in, hey we're ready to order.  Ignored.  They were too concerned with eating their food at a table near the kitchen.  We got up and walked out, and headed down the street to a restaurant that actually deserves our business.Also, their pad thai is garbage.

56.description: I've had some dishes (like the duck lychee curry) that I really liked here, but the sushi was pretty mediocre.

29.description: Normally this place is a 3 at best and the main reason I order here is the low prices and quick delivery.  The food is generic tasting but passes as average asian fusionHowever, the last order I place by delivery was incorrect and I called to inform the staff.     I was placed on hold for a while and told that I need to bring it in.  I exclaimed that I had this delivered for a reason and paid as such.  They again put me on a long hold and told me they could resend the delivery guy out but it would be 45 minutes.  When I exclaimed that this was not acceptable, the woman on the phone started laughing at me.  At that point, I immediately told her I will be bringing all of the food in and taking a full refund but allowing the delivery driver to keep his end.  The woman on the phone didn't apologize or anything of the sort whatsoever.  I brought the food back, took my refund and decided to go with the higher priced, higher quality, and better customer serviced , Polygon Cafe.  I hate writing negative reviews but I felt that I would be doing everyone who rates this a 3 an injustice. NEVER will I ever visit Noodle Zone again.

42.description: Half price sushi every day?  Count me in.  While I can't make the weekday half price sushi happy hour (Mon - Thurs from 4-6PM), the Friday and weekend opening til 6PM is definitely doable.  Oddly, it's their smoothies and crab rangoon that really keep me coming back.Service started a little slow, but warmed up when we began ordering off the regular price menu.  Almost everything we ordered was a winner - the crab rangoon, the malibu freeze smoothie, the sushi.  Well...the sushi is more ok+ than a winner.  I'd say what do you expect for the price, but then again I've been to Lawrence Fish Market more than once.  The worst?  The beef fried rice was super bland.  Luckily, the boyfriend is knowledgeable on the cooking front, added some soy sauce, and made it doable.  Thank god one of us knows how to cook.

23.description: So we came to Noodle Zone over the weekend for a family birthday celebration.  I'll just say the food was good.  My curry was a bit soupy but still had good flavor.  The birthday boy put it this way;  It's not as good as Sticky Rice, but I like it a little better than Yes.  (I kind of disagree because I really like Yes, but you get the picture.)  The problem really wasn't the food, it was the service.  The server was nice and friendly, but our dishes came out one at a time.  Really, really one at a time.  There was a time lapse of 5 or 10 minutes between each person's order, so even though we were in a group we were kind of eating separately .  What's up with that?  Not sure I'd go back because of the service.

47.description: Ordered the Pho from a restaurant NOT on Argyle was probably a bad idea.  I was proven right - they seemed to use a generic beef stock that tasted nothing like typical pho.  The small bits of steak they included were way thin and overcooked - I'm fairly certain that it wasn't even the correct cut (flank).Appetizer platter was basically just a generic mix of "fried stuff".  All frozen and deep fried, nothing from scratch.  Pretty sure it's the same stuff you can buy at costco or jewel.Giving this place a second pity star because it wasn't awful, just bad.  And delivery was quick.  As another reviewer mentioned, stick to the generic asian food and you should be "alright".  Pad thai, etc.

8.description: Avoid curry dishes from here like the plague!How can you even call what you served beef or curry sauce?! The beef was these grey cubes - either they were incredibly old beef or fake low quality beef! The curry sauce (if you can even call it that!) was watered down milk. And it ain't even good milk! Where in the world did this chef learn to cook curry?! Any chef would know that the essence of curry is in the spices. The sushi were underwhelming tiny stingy portions. Needless to say, I will never be back. And you notice most of the good reviews are from non-Asians, there must be a clear misconception of what good Thai food is.

31.description: I would prefer to give 3.5 stars but this is not possible.The 2 soups we had were 4-5 stars, very good.However the starters did not taste fresh and I know the crab rangoon was out of a freezer bag, just not worth the price. 2 stars for thatHowever the service was friendly and helpful and that is a saving grace.

34.description: Ordered some egg rolls and pad see ew.  Price was good and portions were as well (not too huge, not too small).  I would HIGHLY recommend asking for light oil though.  I forgot to and my pad see ew was swimming in it (aside from that the flavor was okay).  Egg rolls were okay...not the best I've ever had, but far from the worst.  Sometimes they can have way too much wrapping compared to filling, but this was a good ratio and the texture of the filling was good as well.  Woman who helped me was super nice, which in my book makes a huge difference.  I'd go back but be more mindful of my order.

16.description: I've been looking for a good pad thai I could pick up in the area and I definitely found it here. Very decently priced, fast and tasted pretty good.  We ordered take out but noticed that it's BYOB so we'll definitely keep that in mind when we go back to dine in. It might be nice to have options for spicying it up as it was pretty mild.

13.description: We will not be returning. The service was mediocre at best. They never even asked us for a drink order and the server didn't say more than 2 words to us. He wasn't rude, just not there to ensure we enjoyed our experience. He was a glorified bus boy. The appetizer platter was tasty and a very good deal for the amount of food that comes on it. But our entrees were lackluster. The tempura shrimp and vegetables that accompanied my udon soup were lacking seasoning or flavor of any kind and the shrimp was so over cooked it was mushy and unrecognizable in my mouth against the tempura. My tempura udon looked nothing like the picture that accompanied it on the menu. The broth tasted and smelled like a bowl of soy sauce.

11.description: Hit or miss. Half price sushi a good deal, but let it be said...you get what you pay for. Annoyed that ive always asked to sit at the sushi bar with nice decor and open windows...and they always refuse, why have it there, why have the open panel windows if you dont allow your customers in?

39.description: sushi happy hr is where its atfuto vege...meh...not a fan of pickled thingssweet potato tempura roll was yummy but ive had way betterpresentation wasnt great and my plate was all sorts of dinged and chippedfriendly service

37.description: Noodle Zone may not be the most authentic Asian cuisine in Edgewater, but it does have significant advantages.  The menu includes a nice sampling of Japanese, Chinese, Korean, Thai, and Vietnamese dishes.  If you're feeling indecisive about what specific type of Asian food you (or your group) are looking for, this is a great compromise.I ordered Chap Chae with Tofu, which was really very good for a restaurant that did not specialize in Korean.  The Boba Tea Latte was also pretty good.  Overall, I would recommend all of the food that I have tried here.

0.description: I was in the area to hang out and have dinner with a friend. She'd originally suggested a Thai restaurant nearby that was mysteriously closed on a Saturday night, so she suggested Noodle Zone as another BYOB noodle/Asian place.The restaurant is not very big although I think they probably do a lot of takeout - eating in wasn't terribly busy. We sat down with our bomber of beer and bottle of wine and were presented with menus, wine glasses and a bottle opener.The menu is what I would call pan-Asian - everything from pad Thai to sushi to curry to potstickers. We started with potstickers and I ordered the drunken noodles with chicken. While they may not do everything well, the potstickers were crispy (deep fried) and juicy, and the drunken noodles were really good - not an enormous portion, but it was only about $9.Unfortunately I made a huge mess when we tried to open the beer - I guess it had gotten shaken up in my car more than I realized and it overflowed all over the table. The wait staff was very kind and helped us mop everything up, replacing napkins and sticky menus and telling us not to worry about it.And, they never bugged us to get out after we'd finished eating - we sat there a bit longer with our wine, in the relatively quiet restaurant, and they just kept refilling our water.This is not high-end cuisine, and it may not be the most authentic, but it's cozy, comfortable, friendly and the food is tasty and inexpensive. And BYOB!

38.description: First, be suspicious of any Thai place that also serves sushi. Or vice versa. On the plus side, the lady in charge was friendly and my food came out fast. Portions were good, and it was about as expensive as eating at Subway.The food just left something to be desired. It was a little on the greasy side, and it was kind of floating in brown sauce. Also, no chile condiments on the table to give it some kick, and the menu is sort of limited for lunch.I think the "meh" in the two star rating says it all.

51.description: Reasonably priced and a variety of options...except that they weren't serving sushi at all when I was there (which turned away only one customer). My advice - stick with the typical Asian-American options ie pad thai. I ordered Singaporean style roast duck w jasmin rice. The best part of my plate was the rice. Second best was ginger, which you'll inevitably need to help cleanse your palate from the rubbery, flavorless duck. Luckily, Clark is lined with Swedish bakeries - my next stop.

27.description: Good food with nice prices . Nothing fancy just good eats

32.description: 1/2 price sushi? YES!1/2 price sushi on the weekends? OH YES!And its good.  Not great, just good.  And that's all you can pretty much ask for when the price is that low.  If I'm in the neighborhood, craving fairly priced sushi, I'm stopping here.  It's a nice casual restaurant, and I feel I can either stop in for a quick meal or just chill out on a Saturday afternoon.

54.description: My new favorite local Thai restaurant plus it's BYOB, which is great. Try any of their basil dishes; they're out of this world!

48.description: I ate there the other day, I understand that they're doing this fusion between Thai and Japaneses. I decided to order some tom yum soup and cashew chicken. First of all the tom yum soup doesn't taste like it was made by Thai (I spent 1 month in Thailand). It was watered down, I ordered a small bowl and there was hardly any broth. When the cashew chicken came out it was more like green pepper chicken. There were not exaggerating prob two cashews in there, it had no taste to it. I felt the chef was like ok, lemme just throw some of these vegetables and add two cashews and call it a day. This is a CUSTOMER service business, I wonder why so many restaurants forget that. NOT GOING BACK.

44.description: This is bad bad bad. The food was NOT fresh and was way less than par. They run a half price sushi special for a reason.

24.description: Another gem for the A-ville massive.  Came here 6:30ish thinking 1/2 price sushi went til 7. Ends at 6p. No dice. No problem. Went w a "Thai" take on Pho which was outstanding. Crispy triangle Shrimp dumplings are a good start. The Crunch Crazy Maki: not as kray as it sounds but fantastic w Tuna, Salmon, Super White Tuna, Avocado etc was quite good.  [x] will be back

7.description: Don't bother trying it!The shrimp in the soup was bad and the chicken in the curry was freezer burnt! Skip it altogether! The service was slow at lunchtime and there was nobody in the restaurant. You can order sushi until after 4 o'clock FYI! I would not chance it though! That's all she wrote!

49.description: Very good for the price! I was very happy with my meal and of course it's BYOB, but guess what? they do not have a bottle fee! I was pleasantly surprised. Sushi is fresh, but I wouldn't get a main dish again ( i had the orange chicken). Stick to the sushi :)

40.description: I just move to the area couple months. So I am hunting for a good place to dine, and this is my favorite place to dine. Is decent price and the food is great. I am Asian so when I dine in Asian restaurant I dine their country dish. Meaning : Noodle zone is Thai and Japanese. So I won't bother ordering orange chicken or potsticker that is Chinese. I have went there couple times, I order Pad See Iuw and Pineapple fried rice (Thai famous for their pineapple fried rice). and I love them both. I guess, I have to tried their sushi to comment on their sushi. I am hesitant to order sushi because Thai are not famous for their sushi ....

53.description: Noodle Zone's one of my go-to standards if I want a good meal at a decent price.  The servers are pretty awesome and always seem happy to see us.One time when I was there, this couple didn't tip, so the waitress came over and asked if it was because there was a problem with the food of the service.  I thought it was pretty ballsy and it definitely surprised them.  I think those people just didn't tip period.  At any rate, with the cheap food prices, if you go you can afford to tip.Anyway, there's a good selection of veggie items, and unlike lots of similar places I've been, there's nothing I've ever had that's been bad.  The spring rolls are always a good place to start, and the fried tofu is good too.  For entrees, you can get a huge plate of sushi for next to nothing, and, of course, the noodle dishes are always a good bet.

30.description: Do not order the garlic shrimp... The bedding is iceberg lettuce with sliced tomatoes on the side. Now WHAT IN THE HECK chinese dish have you EVER seen in your ENTIRE LIFE that has iceberg lettuce and sliced tomatoes at the bedding of a garlic shrimp dish? That's crazzzyyyy.. Talk about a "filler". I asked for a separate place so that I could take it all out. When I was through, I had half a plate of food left. RIP OFF. On top of that, they charge you an additional $1 for rice with your entree? Um, at most places the rice is free and sometimes you even get a soup. NOT HERE!RIP OFF. Not to mention they have cheap posters of sushi on the walls... Not my style... will not be going here ever again.

46.description: Their 50% off sushi special gives you 50% of the fish that should be in the roll.  Some of the noodle dishes are pretty good, but this place is just average.

1.description: Ordered the Pork Won Ton Soup --- the wrappers had fallen apart and the filling was just hard & tough little meatballs and the shrimp I think were old, I ate one, spit it out and tossed the other. There were a lot of bean sprouts in the soup, I mean by volume the soup was probably 50% sprouts. I tried something I think was called Tangy Zone Noodles. The vegetables were over cooked and the tofu was just dipped in vinegar. Yeah, I get it's Tangy Zone Noodles, but the tofu tasted like sour and nothing else. The peanut sauce tasted nothing like peanuts, in fact it didn't taste like much of anything. Plus I didn't sleep well over night. I was up several times, and I'm not feeling too hot today. Something just wasn't right about this food. Moving forward, I'll take a pass.

55.description: I see the poor reviews for Noodle Zone and I'm wondering if these people are going to the same place that I am.  I moved to Andersonville recently and this was the first place I've tried.  In the next 30-40 days I've gone back 4 times!Every dish I've ordered has been delicious, especially any of their basil flavored chicken dishes.  Service has been prompt and food came out very quickly.  Absolutely no complaints here.Their sushi is always 1/2 off and is just average but what do you expect for that price?Maybe I'll have a bad dish if I venture away from their basil chicken dishes or their 'Five Star' (which are both fantastic btw) but as of right now, this is my fav Thai place in Chicago:  cheap, local, delicious and BYOB.

9.description: We just ate here for the first time today. It was SO GOOD! Had no clue what to expect, so when we found out they had half off sushi til close (today is Sunday), we were so happy! First time trying Pho and loved it. Loved chicken fried rice too. Super quaint, clean and relaxing. I wonder if they do BYOB? Will definitely be back again.

26.description: Pretty good food here, average pricing, friendly staff. We got our order to go since it was close to closing time. I really wish i wrote this review sooner so it was still fresh in my mind. all i remember is the food was good and their sweet n sour sauce they include with the crab rangoon was definitely the sweetest and thickest i have ever had, but still really good. It's out of my way but a friend is moving close by so i may have to go back just to update my review. Yelp on!

25.description: Ugh! Awful food. Pad Thai sauce tasted like it was made primarily with ketchup, with a generous glob of grape jelly and a squirt of balsamic vinegar. Did I taste a hint of sweet baby ray's in there too? The dish was purplish. The picture on the menu looked normal, so I don't know what was going on there. Tempura was heavily breaded and tasteless. Chicken satay was dry but not too bad in taste. Soggy mushy dumplings. Stay away!

12.description: Had the Tom yum noodle soup and it was delicious! I added tofu and that with the wheat noodles made it very filing. It's a large portion as it is so it's a great option if you're hungry on a cold and rainy day. Staff were friendly and kind and the place has a calm atmosphere. Will be coming back again for sure!

59.description: I frequently order from here because it is so close to my home, but it is usually a hit-or-miss with the Noodle Zone dishes. I really enjoy how they cook the tofu for the tofu dishes, since they are large, flavorful pieces. I do not enjoy that the several times I've ordered the tofu pad thai, the noodles had so much oil that when I had scooped them out of the bowl they came in, there was nearly a half cup of oil still in the bowl. The crab rangoon are good, and several of the rice and chicken dishes have been awesome. Beware that you need to buy steamed rice in addition to those dishes, which is a surprise, since I've come to expect that curry and meat dishes usually come with a side of rice.

21.description: My husband and I went there for half priced sushi tonight. The sushi was mediocre at best and the service was the kind of bad where you wouldn't necessarily mind if the food was amazing and the place was packed, but amazing it was NOT and my husband and I were two of only four patrons in the restaurant. Mediocre sushi and barely passable service is not my reason for giving this place 1 star, however. I left 3 pieces of spicy scallop maki on my plate because it was super fishy and I simply did not like it at all. No jokes here, when we got ready to pay our bill I was told if I did not eat them I would have to pay a buck per piece. Not a buck per piece that I took home, but a buck per piece that I did not choke down. So, choke it down I did, nearly gagging with each swallow. Bad food is SO much worse when you are made to eat it. So, now I feel a bit queazy and the thought of sushi, my favorite food, is a bit nauseating. And what I just don't understand is what exactly did they accomplished? Never, ever again.

17.description: Eh. We've ordered here a couple of times.  The pho is fantastic (pho-nomenal if you will). Everything else I've had is just okay. Can't really put my finger on it. Everything is just slightly...off. The crab Rangoon wasn't quite crunchy enough and the filling had a weird sort of mealy texture. The egg rolls were OK. Nothing special. My entrée, the three flavor chicken, was not great. The chicken tasted like something you buy out of the supermarket freezer case smothered in a pretty-good-but-overly-sweet sweet and sour sauce. The vegetables were cooked nicely-had a nice crunch to them-but they were overpowering. Over all, not bad but there are better places in the neighborhood.

10.description: Looked ok - huge menu. But whatever the pho is - I've been to several dozen pho restaurants and this isn't like any Pho I've ever seen - more like curry from a can.  The rest of the menu looked ok and I think this place would do in a pinch, but that pho has gotta go.

5.description: This place is so good , I tried their milk tea and it was pretty good , and I also tried their noodle soup, it was so good . You should definitely try out this place .

3.description: Just no...no to everything. The udon broth was thick and disgusting, the asparagus wrapped in beef was chewy and drenched in sauce, the tempura has WAY too heavy of a batter, sushi is sloppy but the only saving point. It's full of flavor, but this place has A LOT of work to do.

35.description: i think when you review a place, you have to put a context in place first. this is not a high-end sushi joint. it's not a full-fledged thai restaurant. i love the very friendly people who work here as well as the people who (seem to) own it. the food is good and i LOVE coming here for 1/2 price sushi....alll weekend til 6pm and weekdays 4-6pm. this place is super kid friendly. we live walking distance to this place and appreciate that we have access to "cheap eats" sorta sushi as well as have cooked food variety for our 2.y year old. can't say enough about how nice they always are to my family, especially my kid.

19.description: Pretty good food here, average pricing, friendly staff. We got our order to go since it was close to closing time. I really wish i wrote this review sooner so it was still fresh in my mind. all i remember is the food was good and their sweet n sour sauce they include with the crab rangoon was definitely the sweetest and thickest i have ever had, but still really good. It's out of my way but a friend is moving close by so i may have to go back just to update my review. Yelp on!

28.description: We visited this place for 1/2 price sushi. I'd rather call it "chineese sushi" but anyway. Food wasn't good but wasn't bad. For 1/2 price you might not be that disappointed.What sucks the most is customer service. When we got the receipt waitress was just coming to our table every 30 seconds to ask if we are ready to pay. I was finishing my coffee and decided to pay when I'm done. Waitress was a big pain in the ass so she got no tip. AND NOW IT'S LEGENDARYI paid and while we were leaving manager/owner came to me and asked if I haven't made a mistake... and she was pointing her finger at "TIP" place on the receipt. I said I didn't and told her that we didn't like waitress' behaviour. I should have told her that she must be out of her mind to act like that. I have never had situation like this before in Europe or in United States or anywhere.  Now I am always telling this story to my friends and still don't know if it's that funny or that pathetic how management of this place acted.

45.description: Lunch specials, and dinner specials is a plus! the food was good!

33.description: The other night I tried going to Sunshine Cafe. It was freaking packed. I had never been before and have been craving some homestyle Japanese food. I'm not even Japanese, I'm just weird like that, I know. Anyway, I glanced through the window and there wasn't an open table at all. I thought it was supposed to be some sort of hidden gem but I guess everyone knows about it. With that said, I didn't wanna be that dude going in there surrounded by all these people on dates and shit while I slurp on ramen by my lonesome. I was just hungry and didn't feel like being judged you know?So I U-turned my bike and went back south on Clark when I saw the neon sign. "Noodle Zone" it said. They gotta have ramen right? "Who cares! Just lock this bitch up and eat already!" my stomach growled. Inside was a table of loud, old, asian men shooting the shit. I'm guessing one of them was the owner and the rest were his homies. The cute waitress sat me down quickly; I was the only other person there. The menu was divided into two parts: all sorts of asian and sushi. Ramen was nowhere to be found. Oh well. They did have udon but I wasn't feelin' it. After perusing for a while I settled on the most intriguing thing on the menu: Argyle Roasted Duck Curry with Lychee. Why the hell not? I was feeling adventurous. Throw in a spicy salmon roll too just because. The sushi came first. It wasn't that all that and I can see why they have 1/2 off every day but it was edible and I wasn't sick the next morning. The curry however was quite interesting. I don't know where they get their duck from but for some reason this dish worked. The spiciness of the curry blended well with the sweetness of the lychee and pineapple and was salted just right with the duck. The veggies helped to round out the balance.Overall, the service was friendly, the food was decent, and the atmosphere was chill. I probably won't come back unless it's one of those: I-don't-know-what-to-eat-but-they-have-a-huge-menu type of nights.

43.description: So if your broke or just don't want to spend a lot but craving sushi.  They have happy hour sushi specials!!  Its pretty much all your basic rolls and pieces for half off.  Yes they are a little cheap with the amount of fish.  Its a win win situation!

2.description: A little something for everyone. Not the best food I've ever had, but it's a solid option.  The service was fast and friendly.  The egg roll, oddly enough, was excellent. Everything else was perfectly decent.Set your expectations accordingly.

18.description: I loved the pho and order from there whenever I want some tasty pho! Everything else I have had is decent. I haven't had the sushi, but would like to eventually!

41.description: This was our 1st time ordering from this place and we will not be going back for a second helping. We ordered the orange chicken, beef teriyaki an pot stickers. My orange chicken was a very small portion, covered with veggies and very small strips of chicken with little sauce. The beef teriyaki looked dry and reheated drowning in sauce. The pot stickers were soggy . And all of our food was cold! When we called we were told that this is how they cook food and to next time order medium rare. I told them that we will not be ordering from there again and hung up the phone. Horrible food that we did not even finish for $28 plus tip.

52.description: It's truly love at first bite!  The service is great and the food is comforting.  It reminds me of the sort of dishes that my Thai Grandmother would cook for us growing up. I can't wait to go back!(P.S. Their Pad Thai is the best in the city!)

50.description: I love my thai food and I love my basil fried rice. It was nicely priced for the amount they gave me. I thought it was something I could order again. The people were very nice and fast!I definitely will check them out again.

4.description: Grest Service, ver y friendly staff, decent food. More of a take out type of place I think. But overall, good.

6.description: Sushi, half the price, twice the rice.Very disappointed in the vast quantities of rice used.

22.description: Good cheap reliable food. Best sushi ever? No, but the quality is consistent, it's priced well and it always hits the spot. This is a solid neighborhood go-to.

15.description: Best Tom Kha soup I've had so far (no fish sauce). Curry fried rice is on point too. Very polite service and they don't cater to your every whim and come around every 5 seconds, which is great. That's all I've really ordered there. Haven't tried anything else. Oh yeah, really good Thai Tea.

57.description: Way too much sauce.  They should also tone down the portion sizes...  Service was fine.

20.description: Eh. We've ordered here a couple of times.  The pho is fantastic (pho-nomenal if you will). Everything else I've had is just okay. Can't really put my finger on it. Everything is just slightly...off. The crab Rangoon wasn't quite crunchy enough and the filling had a weird sort of mealy texture. The egg rolls were OK. Nothing special. My entrée, the three flavor chicken, was not great. The chicken tasted like something you buy out of the supermarket freezer case smothered in a pretty-good-but-overly-sweet sweet and sour sauce. The vegetables were cooked nicely-had a nice crunch to them-but they were overpowering. Over all, not bad but there are better places in the neighborhood.

36.description: When I lived in the area, I came here very frequently. The half price sushi deal is great, and their staff is always very friendly and pleasant. The udon is delicious, as is their appetizers. I've had many dishes, and liked them all.

14.description: The food is ok, diverse menu, but slightly over-priced. Not sure if the delivery was third party or the restaurant, but the food was delivered with a leaked soy sauce all over the bag, and part of our order was missing. When I called the restaurant they had a hard time understanding me because of a mislabeled receipt, and eventually made us come back down again after sending the driver back with our remaining order. That part too had leaked all over the bag. Over all not my favorite experience.

1.description: What a gem. :) I have been shopping the Andersonville Galleria since it opened and was thrilled to have found GREENOLA. Their knitwear is to die for. Not only is their hand-made accessories stylish, the mission their company makes it even better.

0.description: I've purchased jewelry and winter accessories from Greenola and have not been disappointed! Their pieces are modern and stylish, and the quality of the items I bought was very good. And everything is Fair Trade! More please! :)

58.description: 5/5!  Spicy pork taco fantastic, shredded marinated beef fries freaking good, their omelet is really good also. The place has a nice atmosphere, clean area, and very good service. Good for groups. Definitely would come back to eat.

56.description: The food is the bomb! They have really good burritos and tacos. I got the bulgogi burrito with kimchi rice and cheddar cheese, and it was a good size-- smaller than a chipotle burrito, but still filling. The tofu in the tacos was fried well-- soft on the inside, and crispy on the outside. The sauces (i.e. chipotle mayo) were very flavorful. I would come here again!

29.description: We love to support local businesses. We came here on a Friday night for carry out and I was excited to try their tacos. The tacos were kind of disappointed. They gave two different sauces. It was weird tasting. The kimchi fried rice were lack of flavor and it wasn't spicy at all. The potato salad that came with it was flavorless also. Overall, it was not a good experience.

42.description: I thought it was pretty good food and good service but I don't think it as insane as some people describe it as. It's basically what they say they are... a Korean/Mexican fusion joint. The biggest thing seems to be just how they prepare their meats and in my opinion there wasn't a big difference in taste. If you handed me a taco from there and didn't tell me where it was from I highly doubt I would recognize it as being a hardcore fusion place. I'd probably say "yeah that's a fancy taco" but that's about it.

23.description: I got the short rib tacos, so yummy! I'd recommend 3 tacos if your looking for something filling, yet light enough to go and venture out afterwards. The Burrito is for those with ravenous appetites. Remember it is BYOB and there are no liquor stores for blocks, I forgot my wine and then started to wine.

47.description: I've passed by this restaurant a few times and am always interested in Korean-Mexican fusion (I love Bellyshack and Del Seoul). The restaurant is spacious and the service is good. The servers are attentive and well informed of the menu. We ordered kimchi fries, which were a good sharing size for two people. I liked that the fries still maintained their crunchiness despite having kimchi and sour cream. However, I was disappointed that they weren't as flavorful as they appeared. They serve three types of sauces: mild, medium (a salsa verde), and spicy. I recommend trying all three if you can handle spice.I ordered the kalbi taco and shrimp taco. I found the kalbi taco to be delicious, especially with the medium and spicy sauces. The shrimp taco was a bit lacking in flavor and mostly comprised of breading. One thing I did find disappointing with both tacos were the small portions of meats, and with each bite you mostly taste tortilla. I will say that the tortillas are delicious though, they're sweet in a very subtle way.Overall, I was a bit disappointed during my visit, but the restaurant does have some highlights. It's also BYOB and cash only, which is important to know before you visit.

8.description: My friends and I dine here often because not only is the service fantastic and the food tasty, but it's also BYOB. I have been here with both groups small and large. Each and every time service has been attentive and patient. I usually get the kalbi barba burrito with kimchi rice and chipotle mayo and it is phenomenal. The head chef and owner is usually there and is very friendly and attentive. I've never had to wait for a seat either, and they do offer delivery. Their guacamole is fresh and tasty and I love their tortilla chips. I highly recommend.

31.description: Takos Koreanos is just down the street from me and I hadn't tried it before last night. I wasn't disappointed and I wish I'd come here sooner. The evening started a little rocky when our group arrived to discover they're cash only. We had to go hunt down an ATM which was annoying but something I can forgive because the food was really good. I had three tacos: the kalbi, miso tofu, and miso eggplant. The kalbi and tofu tacos were just okay but the eggplant taco was amazing. I could've eaten just three of those. It being so good more than made up for the other two tacos. I also tried the kimchi fries and they were very good. The kimchi was spicy and delicious. It tasted very freshly made. My friends had banh mi, taco and quesadillas and everyone enjoyed what they ordered. My only criticism would be that the tortillas aren't very warm. I'll definitely go back because the price is so good. My husband and I each had three tacos and kimchi fries and it was only $26.80! They are BYOB and don't charge a corkage fee! There aren't enough places in this neighborhood that have good food at this price. I'll be back to try the bulgogi burrito soon...

34.description: Everything I've ever had here has been muy sabrosa !! Burritos. Tacos. Shrimp. Kalbi barba. Kimchi fries. The sauces! Horchata. All the bomb. Only thing: they could toss an extra shrimp into the taco. It's a bit light for what you'd expect to get.  The staff is nice. And it's BYOB. Can't go wrong.

16.description: You can tell an Asian-Mexican Fusion place is committed when it has both Tamarind Jarritos AND Ramune Potential-Choking-Hazard Fizzy Drink in the same case.We only got take-out, but the selection of Tacos we got was excellent. The double tortillas on each one were a good stab at authenticity, though frankly they each could have used a little more meat instead, if only because the meat was so good. The Kimchi fries were also excellent, though could have used a bit more sour cream included to balance out the spiciness... get what we did and you'll be quite kimchi-ed out by the end. Overall, though, very pleased and will be definitely stopping to dine-in in the future.

13.description: Fries with short ribs and cheese - skinny crispy and delicious. Quesadilla - little pigs. big tortilla but not stuffed with a lot of filling. What's there is delicious and porky!Tacos 3 types - fish was fresh and mild 3 sauces - nice range, loved the spicy one. BYOB

11.description: I'm not sure how the tacos here compare to Del Seoul, but I really enjoyed the bulgolgi burrito I had here. It was stuffed with bulgolgi and kimchi rice (so good!) among other things. I believe it also had Siracha mayo which added a nice creaminess that mixed well with the other ingredients and kicked the taste up a notch. It was definitely plenty of food. I had to take home leftovers!
