39.description: Super tasty.  Went for a friend's birthday and wait staff was very accomodating to our large party.  Tacos and guacamole were very delicious and everyone left satisfied.  Will be returning soon.

37.description: Delicious fusion Korean Mexican style. They have bulgogi burritos, kimchi fries and shrimp tacos :) me and my best friend have been eying this place for a while because of the Lowkey location and it did not disappoint. No wait, price was very reasonable and the Korean tacos were excellent! :) definitely recommend this place for a nice afternoon lunch!

0.description: Yum.  I have been here for lunch with a bunch of international mothers and also ordered delivery.  At first several were skeptical, but when the food came, we all enjoyed the fusion food and great combination of kimchee with tacos in different variations.  The service was great!  Quick to respond and friendly even though some of our guests were late.Thought it was worth trying delivery and was not disappointed.  The food arrived hot and in only 35 minutes, for Chicago on the weekend, super quick!  My husband at first skeptical enjoyed all of our selections especially the Two Little Pigs!

38.description: An interesting fusion of mex-korean food. The staff was really nice and friendly. The resturant itself had a cozy feeling, but large enough to fit a lot of people (I went with a party of 13). Oh and there were pretty cool ceiling fans if you take the time to look up.I ordered the 2 little pigs quesodilla. Their guac mix took a little bit of dips to get use to, but it complemented the quesodilla nicely. The potato salad helped cool down the spicyness of the kimchi. Overall the quality of food was great and service was excellent. I can't wait to come back and try their fries! (Someone ordered them next to me, and looked delicious).They played kpop as background music :)

51.description: You're are not going to think highly of this place until you get there. You can't even imagine a world where you would accept a place like this.Tacos, banh-mi, quesadillas, KIM CHI FRIES!BYOB!The tacos I ordered were the kalbi and the kalbi barba Korea...both were very delicious, and so was the kim-chi fried rice.  I love anything with kim-chi on it and on that note, I can't wait to try their kim-chi fries!  Also, everything else I mentioned.  Needless to say, I will be back many more times.

27.description: Not bad, I've had better tacos. But then, I'm a bit of a taco snob. Right now, El'Patron holds the title. El'Patron's lumo (rib-eye) tacos trumps Takos Koreanos's signature taco (the kalbi). In Takos defense, I did enjoy the shrimp very much (though, strangely it tasted more like a fish taco to me). The Kinchi fries were quite nice.Waitress was very nice.Price was a bit much for tacos to me. I paid about $10 more than I would at El'Patron for the same quantity.

32.description: Beef Barba Korean fries are my new guilty pleasure. My boyfriend and I love this place! From the Kimchi fried rice to the tacos, everything we've ordered has been delicious. The service is fantastic and you can't go wrong with BYOB. The prices are very reasonable for this cash only establishment.

54.description: I'd like to give 4.5 stars. The flavors are great. We really enjoy the shredded beef fries. Taco dinner is a decent value but they are a bit stingy with the taco fillings. Service is really good-attentive, not pushy. BYOB and I think it's worth a try. cash only.

48.description: Well this is an interesting mix of two cultures. My wife found this place and I was excited to come. There is a bar that stretches around the restaurant, but we sat to the left of that area. We were in a group of six great friends and embarked on a journey of fusion heaven. We ordered an app of  traditional chips and guac along with some type of Asian rolls with fish sauce. The app was amazing and had the right consistency to it.I had a chicken and beef taco that had a blast of Mexican flavor to it. I wish I had actual names to the the dishes I had, but every bite was a breath of fresh air.I will definitely be back and recommend more people to come.

44.description: Please support this restaurant. The last two in this location have failed, and I really want to see this one thrive -- it's not a well-traversed section of Foster, so foot traffic is at a minimum.1.) This really is the best-of-class of food truck cuisine -- everything here is delicious and served quickly. I want to bathe in their chipotle mayo.2.) The Kim Chi fried rice is totally professional. I always get the tacos a la carte because I'd rather have those than side dishes, but nevertheless it's totally worth it.3.) Not feeling tacos? Get any of the many banh mi sandwiches offered. The kim chi isn't made on site but is clearly made locally in the classical tradition -- good crunch and could afford to be way spicier, but I totally get why it isn't.

24.description: I'm usually a big fan of Korean tacos, but this place just didn't do it for me.First, we ordered two appetizers- the two different types of egg rolls. These were the worst "egg rolls" I have ever had. They were basically fried wonton wrappers with a tiny little bit of filling- not even a third. Complete waste of money. Take a look at my picture to see- they are about the size of a cigarette each, and the front 1/3 and back 1/3 ends have no filling at all.The tacos themselves were okay, but I was already in a bad mood from the "egg rolls" that I couldn't even fully enjoy them. We got the Kalbi Barba"Korea", Spicy Pork, Honey chili Shrimp, and the Honey Chili Tilapia. These range from $3-$4.50 each. The best of these four was probably the tilapia. The sauce on the side was good, but that was probably the best part of our meal.They are cash only. Overall, would not recommend.

7.description: My second review of Takos Koreanos is specifically in regards to their carry out services/food. Overall, I would recommend eating at the restaurant rather than electing for carry-out, primarily because the food doesn't transfer as well being placed in a to-go box, rather than being eaten fresh in the restaurant. (Which is common for most places)I ordered the Spicy Pork Bahn Mi, and it was really well flavored but the bread was very disappointing. It unfortunately took away from the entire dish. I like this restaurant a lot, but having dined-in and carrying-out, I was definitely recommend dining in the restaurant and ordering the tacos.

49.description: If you're looking to adding a twist to your Taco Tuesday nights, stop by to Takos Koreanos!  Located in the Andersonville neighborhood, this Mexican-Asian fusion joint is one to please your palette and it's BYOB!  For starters, I tried the Beef Barba Korea Fries (well who doesn't love fries!?).   These narrow fries are topped with braised short ribs, cheddar cheese, grilled onions, tiny slices of scallions, and sour cream.  Delish!  The salty and sweet combo was great to start off, but can be a little filling if you accidentally eat the whole thing and forget you ordered dinner.  And that's what good about these fries, that it is loaded with the braised beef!What's even more interesting about their menu items is truly seeing the Mex-Asian fusion from quesadillas to banh mi and burritos to rice plates.  I ordered the Honey Chili Shrimp taco, which is served with their house vinaigrette slaw and roasted sesame seeds and the shrimp is breaded with panko bread crumbs and fried to perfection.  The Chicken Barba Korea was tasty, but for the meat lover the Kalbi Barba was delectable!  The taco plates are served with kimchi fried rice (nicely flavored and not to spicy or overwhelming) and potato salad.  Lastly, I tried their Kalbi Barba Korea Burrito that included their vinaigrette slaw, cheddar cheese, sour cream, and for $1 more kimchi fried rice.  The burrito meal included a side of guacamole (very good with a small kick of kimchi spice) with chips.  Although the Kalbi Barba Korea Burrito seemed a little too sweet at times (the meat), they provided a variety of sauces to add more pizazz.  Sauces such as salsa verde, chipotle mayo, korean chili paste, and habanero pepper mayo enhanced any menu item.  The interesting part of the menu is that they also included a kids section of tacos/quesadillas/mini burritos with fries.  So they definitely appeal to the local families.Overall the experience was great and would recommend the place to all my friends and family.  I'll be sure to return and try other menu items.

40.description: Korean/Mexican fusion....who knew!? I can't get their Beef Barba Korean fries out of my head!  Everything else we had was pretty tasty as well, I cannot wait to go back.  Remember, it's cash only & BYOB :)

53.description: BYOB & Cash Only! The deliver as well!Just thought I would get that out of the way so you would see it as soon as you saw my review.Great, really nice people that work here as there were really good with telling me whats good on the menu. I went with the tacos as that was the mood I was in. I got the short rib, grilled pork and shrimp tacos and all were equally good. The sauce they gave me was amazing! It was kind of a pinkish-orange like color and it was magnificent. The tacos were all around $3 each and well worth it.

30.description: You can tell an Asian-Mexican Fusion place is committed when it has both Tamarind Jarritos AND Ramune Potential-Choking-Hazard Fizzy Drink in the same case.We only got take-out, but the selection of Tacos we got was excellent. The double tortillas on each one were a good stab at authenticity, though frankly they each could have used a little more meat instead, if only because the meat was so good. The Kimchi fries were also excellent, though could have used a bit more sour cream included to balance out the spiciness... get what we did and you'll be quite kimchi-ed out by the end. Overall, though, very pleased and will be definitely stopping to dine-in in the future.

46.description: Very tasty Kalbi tacos, loved the rice that came with the taco plate, wonderful service, worth a try....

1.description: Starting with the positives, service was very attentive. Water glasses were consistently filled and our server thoroughly explained their condiments.  Speaking of, those sauces were delicious and went well with our food.  We ordered a bulgogi (marinated beef) bahn mi sandwich.  The meat tasted nice, but there wasn't much of it.  The bread it was served in was chewy, limp and unappetizing.  Nothing like the delicious, crisp on the outside and soft on the inside French rolls from Nhu Lan Bakery or Ba Le.We also ordered an assortment of tacos at $3.00 - $3.50 a piece.  They did taste good, but once again, severely lacked filling and were small.  You'll get very little protein from this restaurant.

55.description: i wish it wasn't so good so i don't have to keep thinking about the loaded fries!

9.description: Really tasty and different from all the other places around.  Very reasonably priced and great friendly service.

26.description: I want to give Takos Koreanos 5 stars but I cannot because they don't accept credit cards. They would have SO MUCH MORE business if they would accept cards - from me alone. I can't order from home for carry out or spontaneously drop by even though I have done both to only be rejected. The food is great and at a great price point but until they start accepting cards they can't get that 5 star rating.

25.description: Delicious tofu, tilapia, and Kalbi tacos. My family had the beef "Korea" fries and loved it.  Very attentive wait staff, efficient service.

12.description: I've been withholding my review because I keep wanting to love this place. I live in the neighborhood, I love Korean food, I love tacos, and I love Korean fusion tacos, but after giving TK 3 tries and coming away unimpressed each time, I'm done. It's not to say that their food isn't good. It's quite okay, but there are other places in the city that do pretty much the same thing much better than TK does. Del Seoul and En Hakkore are two off the top of my head. Why can't TK be as good as those spots?I'm reviewing based solely on their tacos... Because it's in their name and it's what they should be good at so that's what I get. The flavors are always good but their portions are just not enough to satisfy and I end up cutting the tortilla in half to get the ratio of tortilla to filling at what it should be. Their shrimp and fish were over crisped and skimpy as well. If I didn't know any better, I probably wouldn't mind so much but every time I come here I naturally compare TK to my other favorite fusion joints and it just doesn't stack up to the competition.

59.description: Solid flavors in the tacos but the quantity of filling was lacking so the ratio of meat to tortilla was off. The tacos fell a little bit flat because of this, being as much or more corn  tortilla as meat filling. The salsas for the tacos were good and the kimchi rice was a great accompaniment.  The shredded beef topped fries were good but also suffered from a shortage of toppings so the ratio of topping to fries was off. BYOB is always nice and service was friendly and fast. Bottom line, worth trying and form your own opinion, though come in with realistic expectations. I'll be going back to try the burrito which might just get the ratio of filling right (lots of meat and kimchi rice).

21.description: Fries with short ribs and cheese - skinny crispy and delicious. Quesadilla - little pigs. big tortilla but not stuffed with a lot of filling. What's there is delicious and porky!Tacos 3 types - fish was fresh and mild 3 sauces - nice range, loved the spicy one. BYOB

17.description: While passing through Andersonville on my way to the Argyle area to sample some Vietnamese pho, I saw taKO's KOreanos and though that Mexican-Asian was a rather different fusion combination. I shall conclude that it is a very, very good combination on the palate.Green tea. Beef barba Korean fries. Spicy chicken taco. Honey chili taco. Potato salad. Kimchi fried rice.The beef barba Korean fries reminded me of street food. The pulled beef had been seasoned such that it popped with enough sweetness to keep from biting the back of the tongue. Topped with sauteed onions, cheddar cheese, sour cream, and chives, the concept of chili cheese fries has been relegated to kids food.Having grown up eating very spicy food, the spicy chicken taco was an instant favourite. Not thinking that the honey chili shrimp would be as good, I was a bit shocked that I couldn't decide whether I liked the spicy chicken taco more or the honey chili taco. The accompanying potato salad didn't taste like fast food or "refrigerator section" potato salad. The kimchi fried rice was reminiscent of bibimbap and that was a hit.taKO's KOreanos has a cash-only policy. The good thing is the prices aren't so extreme that you need a credit card. Great service and outstanding food, I'm a fan, for sure.

10.description: Ca$h money only yo! They really need to start taking credit cards as a sit down restaurant (they also do carry out). Aside from that little bit, I'm down with Takos Koreanos. Honestly who doesn't love a good bulgoki or kalbi taco? KoKo as they call themselves for short doesn't even deal with that cheap stuff meat though and all I saw used in any of their recipes is Kalbi. And they actually have much more on their menu then just tacos - they have quesadillas, fries, korean style banh mi, and rice plates. My friend and I started with their Beef Barba 'Korea" Fries for $9. We gobbled them up mighty quickly...half due to being ravaged and half due to them being so friggin good. These fries were covered in braised short ribs (tender and delicious), cheese and sour cream. Normally the order comes with onions & scallions but we did ours sans those nasty little accessories. I highly recommend the fries and would get these again for sure.For my main dish, I had a couple of tacos the kalbi for $3.30 and the miso tofu taco for $3.50. I loved them both!  The miso tofu taco had just the right amount of kick to it for me and both tacos were cooked just perfectly.I will absolutely be coming back to Takos Koreanos (with my cash) and most likely getting some nummy takeout. Bonus Points: They played Kpop during our entire dining experience. A few less bonus points: Psy's Gangnam Style played, ugh. Reverse of the deleted bonus points: Free parking abound.

5.description: Takos Koreanos is just down the street from me and I hadn't tried it before last night. I wasn't disappointed and I wish I'd come here sooner. The evening started a little rocky when our group arrived to discover they're cash only. We had to go hunt down an ATM which was annoying but something I can forgive because the food was really good. I had three tacos: the kalbi, miso tofu, and miso eggplant. The kalbi and tofu tacos were just okay but the eggplant taco was amazing. I could've eaten just three of those. It being so good more than made up for the other two tacos. I also tried the kimchi fries and they were very good. The kimchi was spicy and delicious. It tasted very freshly made. My friends had banh mi, taco and quesadillas and everyone enjoyed what they ordered. My only criticism would be that the tortillas aren't very warm. I'll definitely go back because the price is so good. My husband and I each had three tacos and kimchi fries and it was only $26.80! They are BYOB and don't charge a corkage fee! There aren't enough places in this neighborhood that have good food at this price. I'll be back to try the bulgogi burrito soon...

3.description: I'm usually a big fan of Korean tacos, but this place just didn't do it for me.First, we ordered two appetizers- the two different types of egg rolls. These were the worst "egg rolls" I have ever had. They were basically fried wonton wrappers with a tiny little bit of filling- not even a third. Complete waste of money. Take a look at my picture to see- they are about the size of a cigarette each, and the front 1/3 and back 1/3 ends have no filling at all.The tacos themselves were okay, but I was already in a bad mood from the "egg rolls" that I couldn't even fully enjoy them. We got the Kalbi Barba"Korea", Spicy Pork, Honey chili Shrimp, and the Honey Chili Tilapia. These range from $3-$4.50 each. The best of these four was probably the tilapia. The sauce on the side was good, but that was probably the best part of our meal.They are cash only. Overall, would not recommend.

35.description: The service is fast and waitress is nice but they REALLY scrimp on the amount of meat, chicken, or fish in their tacos. I was really surprised. I got their honey chili fish, honey chili shrimp, and kalbi taco and they all barely had any protein in them. There was a really thin strip of fried tilapia, a few pieces of  tiny small shrimp and a few shreds of kalbi meat. There was however a lot of fluff like lettuce and sauce on the tacos but I actually left this place still feeling hungry. Definitely not worth the $3.50-4.00 per taco.

19.description: A fan of this hidden gem in Ravenswood/Andersonville. Have been here twice, and each time the food has been great - korean tacos are tasty, but the big winners are the bulgogi burrito and the kimchee guacamole. Bulgogi burrito is loaded with flavor, and you'll want to bottle up the marinade and take it home with you. Homemade chips are crispy and thick cut to dip all of that delicious guac & kimchee. Place is cash only and BYOB, so remember to come prepared. Staff is also super friendly, and brought us a knife for cutting limes and extra ice for our own DIY moscow mules!Big fan, will definitely be back again many times.

28.description: OMG I have been dying to get to Takos Koreanos ever since I saw it on Yelp.  Sometimes you go to a restaurant w/a high rating on Yelp and you can't understand why the rating is so high.In this case Takos Koreanos in my opinion not only lived up to the high rating they exceeded it.  I tried 3 different tacos to get a little different taste of different items (granted they're all tacos), but I can honestly say that they were the best tacos I ever had.The grilled Korean spicy pork taco was THE BOMB!  It was so tender I savored every bite.  It was perfectly seasoned with a spicy chili paste absolutely delicious.  The kalbi taco with beef short ribs was also delicious. They use a very good quality meat with no fat or gristle that you get at some restaurants.  It was also seasoned to perfection.  Once again I savored every bite.  The honey chili shrimp is breaded in Panko and seasoned with a honey chili sauce, very tasty, but I actually preferred the pork & rib tacos flavor wise.The cashier was very personable as was one of the owners that was there.  Takos Koreanos has a nice ambiance to go with the excellent tacos.  I can't wait to get back and try some of their other foods

45.description: Bulgogi + burrito = pure heaven.  Seriously, this place should be on everyone's radar when the taco night craving hits you.  The food comes out quick, tastes very fresh and is a fantastic break from the norm.  I highly recommend!

33.description: If you want some good tacos, guacamole,of a different flavor this is the place,great food great service,I have been here at least 5 times with a couple different people and they have all raved about it. Keep up the good work....

43.description: Was a little thrown off that it was cash only and they didn't have a cash machine on site, but a quick trip to the 7-Eleven down the block remedied that! Loved the Korea fries with braised short ribs, onions and cheese, but the bulgogi burrito was unexpected and delightful and...a steal at $12. Try it, you won't be disappointed, but don't forget to bring cash :)

2.description: We have gone several times, and we have always had great food and great service.I tend to go hot with my choices, and they tend to be a little bland for my tastes.  Most places can't keep up with my level of heat, so I can't fault them for that.I can't tell you if their Kimchi is authentic, because I have not idea, but it was delicious.Great place bring a couple of beers, and have some great fusion food.

18.description: LOVE this place.  Great food, great service.  SOOOOOOOOOO tasty and full of flavor.  Love that's a BYOB!  I will be back for years to come.

41.description: A fan of this hidden gem in Ravenswood/Andersonville. Have been here twice, and each time the food has been great - korean tacos are tasty, but the big winners are the bulgogi burrito and the kimchee guacamole. Bulgogi burrito is loaded with flavor, and you'll want to bottle up the marinade and take it home with you. Homemade chips are crispy and thick cut to dip all of that delicious guac & kimchee. Place is cash only and BYOB, so remember to come prepared. Staff is also super friendly, and brought us a knife for cutting limes and extra ice for our own DIY moscow mules!Big fan, will definitely be back again many times.

52.description: Awesome food! This place offers a fusion food that uniquely blends Korean and Latin food creating a burst of flavors!  Great place to go on a date and a great place to get a taste of 2 extraordinary cultures!

50.description: Tried this for the first time last Saturday for lunch - so good. Ordered the dos tacos combo which came a side of kimchi fried rice and potato salad. I tried the kalbi barab korea (braised marinated short ribs) and the chicken barab korea (slow cooked marinated chicken) tacos and both were amazing. They came with a choice of three sauces: a mild salsa, a spicy mayo time thing and a third milder red sauce I couldn't place. I would definitely come back and sample from around the menu. There was plenty of seating and the decor was nice, not a the hole in the wall taquerias. It's is cash only, which is kind of a pain. It's also BYOB but assume by the build out of a bar area they might offer drinks in the future.

4.description: OMG I have been dying to get to Takos Koreanos ever since I saw it on Yelp.  Sometimes you go to a restaurant w/a high rating on Yelp and you can't understand why the rating is so high.In this case Takos Koreanos in my opinion not only lived up to the high rating they exceeded it.  I tried 3 different tacos to get a little different taste of different items (granted they're all tacos), but I can honestly say that they were the best tacos I ever had.The grilled Korean spicy pork taco was THE BOMB!  It was so tender I savored every bite.  It was perfectly seasoned with a spicy chili paste absolutely delicious.  The kalbi taco with beef short ribs was also delicious. They use a very good quality meat with no fat or gristle that you get at some restaurants.  It was also seasoned to perfection.  Once again I savored every bite.  The honey chili shrimp is breaded in Panko and seasoned with a honey chili sauce, very tasty, but I actually preferred the pork & rib tacos flavor wise.The cashier was very personable as was one of the owners that was there.  Takos Koreanos has a nice ambiance to go with the excellent tacos.  I can't wait to get back and try some of their other foods

6.description: I had the tres combo. Shrimp taco split with my son , he must have got the shrimp because I didn't taste anything but the fried batter. The beef and spicy pork were nothing that great . Was tender and loaded with sugar. Small amount of beef . The spicy pork was better and had a lot of tender pork but again it was a little to sweet. Kimchi fried rice wasn't bad. Potato salad was okay.

22.description: The food and the service are fantastic... it's byob and a little out of the way, and they don't have a website, but the food more than makes up for it. The kimchi fries are really good...

15.description: Visited Chicago for a convention and came here with some friends. I really liked the Bulgogi fries, but I wish it came in a bigger size because I didn't want to share with my boyfriend. I should've just ordered a second. I ordered 3 different tacos (Galbi, Bulgogi, Shredded Pork) and they were a little on the small side for what they charge, but they were still tasty. Our server gave us a bunch of different sauces so that was fun trying all of them. I'd recommend it

57.description: The guac here will give any restaurant a run for their money! Amazing! Great korean tacos and cash only! Kimchi rice has the perfect amount of spicy to balance the rest of your meal. The owners remember returning clients which makes me feel at home. Love it!

20.description: The strength of this place is definitely their fusion and Korean dishes. The Barbi beef is fantastic, especially in the burrito and in the omelette. Their Korea fries are also solid, with a great flavor. Their enchiladas are excellent, but hard to separate from the pack with the Mexican options available. The service was friendly and helpful. Highly recommended if you're looking for something a bit different in the area.

36.description: I've been withholding my review because I keep wanting to love this place. I live in the neighborhood, I love Korean food, I love tacos, and I love Korean fusion tacos, but after giving TK 3 tries and coming away unimpressed each time, I'm done. It's not to say that their food isn't good. It's quite okay, but there are other places in the city that do pretty much the same thing much better than TK does. Del Seoul and En Hakkore are two off the top of my head. Why can't TK be as good as those spots?I'm reviewing based solely on their tacos... Because it's in their name and it's what they should be good at so that's what I get. The flavors are always good but their portions are just not enough to satisfy and I end up cutting the tortilla in half to get the ratio of tortilla to filling at what it should be. Their shrimp and fish were over crisped and skimpy as well. If I didn't know any better, I probably wouldn't mind so much but every time I come here I naturally compare TK to my other favorite fusion joints and it just doesn't stack up to the competition.

14.description: what more can you want for a chill dinner out with friends?- amazing korean tacos (and other fusion delights - quesadillas, etc)- the french fries with meat are out of this world- great value for your money- willingness to accommodate a large party- BYOB (and no corkage fee)I took a group of 10 friends - most of whom had never experienced Korean tacos. Everyone loved it - even the folks that don't eat a ton of meat. Service was a bit slow, especially at the end of the meal, but I think they were probably trying to just give us space. We clearly weren't in a hurry.

1.description: I debated writing this, as I've been coming here for a few years and was generally happy before my last cut. The woman who owns this place was always nice, she even seemed to remember me even though I came in maybe once a year. I have long hair and I would get my usual trim, long layers. She was always trying to talk me into shorter layers and one time, she wanted to go for bangs and I agreed. They looked great, I got compliments on the street. They were a pain to grow out, of course. According to the stylist at the fancy place I got my hair dyed (balayage at Epoch Salon) it was a good cut so I felt great about saving money. One time there was a bit of a wait, but not too bad. The owner is sweet, but the last time she was trying so hard to sell me some conditioner she's got, her comments and compliments felt forced and fake. But the main point is, I brought in a picture, discussed the cut in detail, we agreed on the length to cut very clearly, 4 inches, and then she cut off 8 inches. It was WAY shorter than what we agreed on. Also the layers were too long so I almost have triangle head and it's just basic (as in basic white girls) almost "the Rachel," which I'm always desperate to avoid and give lots of instructions not to angle down from the face and is not at all the cut my picture had. I just wanted to get out of there. When I said it was way shorter than I expected, she said I had a lot of dead ends, however, I wish I'd been told before the plan was changed! I asked about the long layers since she'd always been into cutting short layers, and she said, next time you can keep the shorter layers but the bottom part will have grown out. There won't be a next time, I feel betrayed.

9.description: I've been going to this place for years. Esther is efficient and thorough. She listens to your needs and never ends a haircut without double-checking with you several times to make sure the style and length are appropriate. Also, for less than $20 a haircut, it is really hard to find that type of service and consistency and hair stylist in this area.

23.description: Esther is super nice, efficient and gives a great haircut.  I never get anything more than a few layers so can't vouch for a more complicated cut, but for $10 and a consistently good job, it's a great deal.  Free street parking on Gregory (one block away) if you don't want to pay for a meter on Clark.

5.description: Yes yes yes!!! I've been in Chicago a year and finally have found a salon that I can't wait to come back to again and again. I don't have a particularly difficult style to work with and I'm very open minded, so I generally trust just about anyone with my hair, including Hair Cuttery. That being said, going to your run of the mill place always seems like such a chore and I've been yearning for a place that makes me leave feeling confident that I got a great deal by someone who gets it.Today I got a walk-in appointment and waited less than 15 minutes. My only concern was that perhaps I'm not their typical customer--I'm a 24-year old small town girl without a lick of Spanish knowledge--but it was soon clearly confirmed that this place knows how to work with anyone (an older lady was before me, and then a Hispanic woman, and then another young woman after). I showed Miriam (?) a picture of what I was thinking, and she didn't have to look twice to understand exactly what I needed. I also appreciated that she very clearly understood my type of hair (very fine!!!) and what it needed. She was fast, efficient, and happy. I liked that conversation was natural. We didn't talk a lot, but it didn't feel forced, and when we weren't talking I didn't feel super awkward about it.I'm so happy with how everything turned out. My hair is happy too!! Can't wait to go back!

25.description: This is a great place for a haircut!  Esther is fantastic.  She is quick, professional, and she does a great job.  And haircuts are only $10!  How can you beat that?

12.description: This place is great! Made an appointment that day and got right in. The hairdresser was friendly, quick and really got what style I was going for (I have a unique edgy haircut). Plus the very best part, $12! Like whaaaat?! I have never received a great haircut in the city for less than $30 and that was a steal! Totally going to go back for me next cut!

21.description: I have been going to Ester for 15 years she is a neighborhood business that I prefer to support, her pricing is totally awesomeIt is a no frills shop - but worth the home town atmosphere -

16.description: Wonderful as usual!  Esther know exactly what to do with my mane!  Is great with my boys! Fabulous price too. Glad we found her :)

17.description: Went today for my first time.  Esther (the owner) was very friendly, fast, and an affordable cut.  Posted an "after" picture on Facebook and was immediately complimented.  Extra bonus, I didn't have to wait or make an appointment that CTA might make me late for.

10.description: I will never go anywhere else in Chicago if I can help it!I stumbled upon this place in a desperate search for a haircut over the holidays, and they are incredible!Both ladies working at the time were delightful to talk with, and they were super professional when cutting hair. I haven't enjoyed a haircut nor salon experience this much in my life. They made it so easy, and they helped me find a great style.And with all of that positive feedback in mind, there's more: the price can't be beat!I'm looking forward to going back for another haircut!

11.description: I wanted to like this place because of all the supposedly great reviews...But I gave you a list of what I wanted done....how could you be this bad?I literally wrote it down and then went over it with you....- Don't use the razor around my ear- Which you did- Square in the back- Which you didn't- Only cut the tips off- You took off 2 inches- A 5 on the side- You didn't have that setting...how's that possible?Then you shaved off some of my beard....?Quality over Quantity - I should have realized it was empty for a reason.I'm throwing in a second star because the lady is nice...but common

26.description: Best budget haircut I know of.  Still only $10!  Esther and co are very helpful and do a good job.  A friend of mine likes the place too.

27.description: $10Esther.M-Sat.Open until 7pm M-F$10I went in after moving here from CA.  No job, nowhere to be, noone to comment, care, or judge my haircut.  and I needed a haircut--bad.I Highly recommend coming here.  I always get a professional cut fast and for the cheap.Don't be afraid, make the leap into not paying too much for a haircut.  In CA I was paying $50 on a discount.  If not here somewhere where you are not being ripped off for a trim, thin out, style...Live a little,Save a lot.I may have to give the $5 cut around the corner a try....

0.description: I get a simple men's haircut. It is done well and at the right price.The location - on the east side of the street - is very easy to miss Try it

20.description: First I should make clear that my rating is based on what a mid 20s girl is looking for. The price cannot be beat of course. 12 bucks is crazy, but the haircut kinda sucks. All I came in for was a bang trim. I had a pic with me so she could see exactly what I wanted. It was a sort of choppy, modern bangs look that drops at the edges. Nothing any medium rate salons didn't give me without a problem. I came out looking like a ten year old child with a moon shaped hairline. I went there to save money and because I didn't think someone could mess up bangs too much, especially if they have great yelp ratings. Perhaps for 'mature' ladies who want a cheap foofy cut it's fine. Don't suggest it for modern cuts for young adult women.

19.description: Near to a Jewel, I think it is the most economical hair cut place around. I just walked by and attracted by the $10 poster. It is really only 10 bucks include everything, everyone.As previewers said, it's quick and professional. I feel it's very good.

2.description: I called this place on a whim after not being able to go to my regular place. They got me in, and I love it here! Esther was fast, friendly, and attentive. I was in and out in about 20 minutes with no wash, but a couple of different styling options. The price is low but they make you feel like a high end customer.

18.description: A  neighborhood GEM. I stopped in here because I heard that they offer great hair cuts and were very inexpensive. I have chin-length hair, am in my mid-twenties and like bold but easy to maintain haircuts.  I have received two excellent, fun, neat, incredibly inexpensive hair cuts from Esther and her co-worker. I will keep coming here every month. Spread the word about this place. Plus, I'd like to think that supporting Sun Beauty helps to prevent the gentrification of Andersonville from more expensive, newer and wealthier businesses from pushing out older businesses that deserve to stay in the neighborhood.

13.description: This is an awesome place for an overpriced neighborhood.  You can get a haircut for $10, compared to some salons in the area which charge as much as $40.  The stylist is very quick and follows your instructions to the letter.  I was actually walking to another salon when I saw this place and decided to try it.  This is my new haircut place.

4.description: Best kept hair salon secret in Chicago? I think so. I just paid less than $20 for a haircut (INCLUDING tip!) by Esther that I routinely pay $60 for at another salon. Not to mention how fast it was! I didn't opt for a wash and I would say I was in and out in 25 minutes- including the time Esther took to show me easy different ways I could style my hair for different looks. You can't beat that kind of attention and talent. I'm very happy with this place and plan to return for every trim.

24.description: Near to a Jewel, I think it is the most economical hair cut place around. I just walked by and attracted by the $10 poster. It is really only 10 bucks include everything, everyone.As previewers said, it's quick and professional. I feel it's very good.

6.description: I've been coming here since for over 15 years and Esther is the best. She is a very skilled and fast but at the same time very attentive.  Wait times are low and the price is super reasonable. I recommend you pay Esther a visit. She is very friendly and will take care of you.

22.description: Esther is fast, friendly and does excellent work. She charges just  $10 and even with a good tip (that is well-deserved), it comes out to only $13. It's a fantastic deal and I highly recommend her!

15.description: The shop is dirty; the combs are dirty - there's no blue anticeptic (sic ?) liquid in the glass container; the scissors are dirty.  When I was there, two clients, a couple, walked in to have their hair cut.  As each sat in Esther's chair, Esther began combing their hair.  The horrible odor of dirty dirty hair emanated throughout the shop.  Esther did not wash their hair; rather, she cut their hair.  They paid and left.  Without cleaning her comb or scissors, she gestured to the next client to come and sit in her chair.  He did and she combed and cut his hair without cleaning her comb or scissors.  When it was my turn in her chair, I asked her to clean her comb and scissors.  She ran both under the water faucet, came back to her chair, and raised her arm to cut my hair.  I stopped her, got up and left without a hair cut or dye.

7.description: I hate having my hair cut, and I hate paying a lot for it even more.  Which is why for the first few years I lived in Chicago I went to supercuts and once even had my sideburns completely shaved off, among other nightmarish experiences.  I've been to Sun Beauty twice now and have had excellent haircuts both times, for a reasonable price.  Esther and her help (I've forgotten her name now, sadly) were both very good.  I walked in both times, and both times I felt like I was in experienced and caring hands.  This is my new go-to!

8.description: I love Esther and her team. They truly care that you get a good hair cut and walk out the door happy. She is skilled at what she does and doesn't need to fill your hair with fancy products , encourage that you need to buy any, or charge a fortune. I cannot wait to go back.

3.description: Best haircut ever! Inviting, accommodating, affordable! I was new to the neighborhood and dreaded going to one of those chain salons or over priced fancy places and luckily found Sun Beauty! I always get in when I want. The cut is efficient and skillfully done. I've never had more compliments on my hair, even by random strangers. Will continue to go here no matter where I live in the city!

14.description: Update since last review... 2 years later and still coming.  Ester does a great job and takes direction perfectly. Ask about her organic soaps too!

29.description: I haven't been into comics since I was a young child but with the success of recent movies and the need to read stuff on public transportation led me to Alleycat.  This throwback has a modern look to it with comics you've heard of and unheard.  Strategically placed between Starbucks and an alley, this hidden gem is a great Chicago experience.

42.description: Let me preface this by saying I know thismuch about comic books. (Imagine me holding a very small stretch of air between thumb and forefinger). That said the fates (ie the nerds/geeks/men who wear glasses who are currently populating my life) have been beating me over the head with comic books of late. I've been to more comic book stores in the past few months than in my whole life and this one is my favorite. Now I can't speak to the selection (they have these books with drawings and words in bubbles) but I can speak to how nice the staff seems to be, how clean and organized the store seems to be and the AWESOMENESS of its location. I kind of wish there was a door to a secret apartment in which I could live in this alley.  I could wear black leather pants and stiletto boots and...a mask? And I'd look really cool every time I stalked down the alley to my hidden home. And maybe I could like...fight crime or something? I guess. In my spare time? Or just read the comic book my cousin bought me today (it's my first one ever and I kind of get the appeal now).Probably the latter. And then if this one hooks me I might even be back for more...

23.description: I don't know what the one reviewer was talking about. They actually have a section of LGBT graphic novels, prominently labelled LGBT, with some good stuff in there. And I don't feel treated poorly for being a woman at all. The staff is very nice and friendly.The location is absolutely adorable. It really does feel like a secret passage to a clubhouse of awesome.They seem to have gotten better at ordering, because there's plenty of comics on the shelves now. Not just DC/Marvel, but a healthy selection of more indy comics. And like any comic shop, they're happy to order anything in Previews if you find something off the beaten path.I'd recommend checking this store out. It has a lot of heart, and felt more like home to me than some of the larger stores.

47.description: Do you read comic books? Would you like to meet artists? Would you enjoy a movie in Andersonville on a Saturday night? This place has everything. Go for the comics. Stay for the cute nerds. They have a great selection of new releases and the graphic novel choices are superb. Can't find it? It's down the alley next to Starbucks.

8.description: An awesome little comic shop, literally, hidden down the alley (as the name implies). I wish they had some more figurines but they did have some other cool swag (like a Doctor Who Tardis scarf).The staff was really friendly and knew their stuff.

31.description: As I walked through the little passage to get to AlleyCats I thought how cool to be off in the cut like they are. When you get pass the darkness you come into this little courtyard and then to this little gem of a comic book store waiting for you. I felt like Alice in Wonderland. The layout was nice and love they had all the back issues of WW I was looking for. The staff was very cool. We had cool convo about Katy Keene. My only gripe was they didnt take Amex oh well not every place does. I think I will definitely check them out again I really liked them.

34.description: GREAT store. Friendly, affordable and knowledgeable staff.  Too bad there is not an e-mail contact. I have six to seven ten gallon tubs filled with comic books (mostly X-Men), I would like to sell AS IS for $100. I did not keep my comics in covers. I have been a collector sine sixteen. Please contact me, if interested. Thanks.

16.description: Go. Take the kids. Get them addicted young. DO IT. 1. Place is awesome; location kick ass2. Staff is friendly. 3. They keep their pulls right behind the counter and know your name. 4. Awesome events 5. Great selection; don't see something you want? ASK! 6. So classy & funI wish this place continued success!

13.description: This has become our favorite comic book joint in Chicago. The proximity started it, but the kindness, accessibility, helpfulness, and super cool hidden passage location clinched it for us. Me and my 7 year old dig it!

11.description: Tucked into a little alley, this discrete little store offers a lot in its minimal space. Well-organized back issues, good current offerings, and nice selection of board games and statues make for a good selection. Personable staff know their stuff.

39.description: Totally hidden between two building you would not expect such a cool comic book store in the back with a huge library of comic books. We came by for their magic show on the weekend and it was entertaining.

37.description: Great selection in an excellent location.  The employees are always knowledgeable about when new issues are coming out :) I'll be back!

0.description: There are so many cool places in Andersonville and this one is hidden. Literally... you will pass it up. It's almost like that scene from Harry Potter going down a secret alley to a magical universe.... of Comics! Friendly staff and a memorable experience due to the unique location.

38.description: Been here only twice. Today was my first day as a actual customer. It seems like a nice little comic shop. There were a group of regulars who were talking and having a good time with the staff. I was greeted when I came in which is always nice to hear. I came here to look for certain issues I've been trying to track down. Sadly they didn't have them but I did find some other comics and was happy. Totally coming back.

51.description: A comic book store in A-ville... Hell yeah!!I was casually walking down the street with a few people when my senses started tingling. I jumped back expecting to hit a wall, but only found more sidewalk instead. "Holy, hole in the wall, Pants!!"They had me from the entrance, I'm a sucker for mysterious passage ways. It's down a sidewalk corridor on berwyn and clark, between Starbucks and Potbelly's. This story could write itself, the small business pinched between two corporate giants (dun dun dunnn). Immediately upon entering this square building of deadly paper cuts, I saw the Walking Dead. I leaped over the counter shouting "I guess you can call this a COUNTER-attack!!"**  This small garage turned modern store front complete with pull down glass garage door is super clean and they have made good use of their space. They stock a combination of new and old comics, plus a few odds and ends (t-shirts, toys, and figures). The prices are pretty standard compared to everywhere else. They were super busy when I stopped in so I didn't get a chance to chat with the staff but they did seem very helpful. Nice to have place so nearby. **May not of actually happened.

27.description: Homophobic? Maybe...Culturally insensitive?  No doubt.Despite asking three different employees on separate occasions for gay comics, I was told the demand did not exist. This store is located in Andersonville...Then the comment was made that gay comics were erotic/adult in nature and that AlleyCat Comics is a family store.My comments have been deleted from their Facebook page and I was blocked after being accused of "childish bickering" and being a bully.Today they told a fellow comic book queer that the whole thing had been a "misunderstanding".This dismissiveness reeks of intolerance.I urge all fans of comics and fairness to spend their $ elsewhere.

32.description: I came in on a cold February day and was immediately impressed with the selection and layout.  The employees were SUPER friendly and willing to chat with me about my nerdy questions.  Even the nice customers chimed in.  A nice little visit to a nice little store.

54.description: Just discovered that this place had opened up on my street.  Totally makes up for the fact that Walgreen's is going to be moving into the old Thybony store location a few blocks north.  I think that AlleyCat and Transistor could form a formidable alliance.I have to admit that I don't know much about comics.  But what I do know is that AlleyCat deserves to succeed.  The location, behind an alley, is ridiculously awesome.  They seem well-stocked and have a lot of back issues available.  The guy at the desk was really nice and helpful when my boyfriend asked him some questions.  Definitely plan to return if/when I develop a serious interest in graphic novels and of course for gifts for friends who already have!

48.description: It's great to see a store in Andersonville!  And right by my 2 nd favorite place (Starbucks..lol) (my 1st favorite are comic stores in general)  But it's a great store, great location and Nick and staff are just always full of energy and knowledge.  Even if your not into comics that much, you should still stop in there and check it out!  Ya never know..it may change your mind

44.description: Mama K told me we were going to a comic book store. She said it was like a book store but not like a regular book store. We walked and walked down a long alley to a door and we went inside the store. I saw superheros! Spiderman! Batman! Pow pow pow! Captain America! Wolverine! We looked at comic books. Hey hey hiyah! I liked the action figures. They had tiny ones and big ones and ones with arms that you can change. I saw a cowboy. Pow pow pow! For my special treat I picked out an Amazing Spiderman comic book. I told the owner it was my very first comic book and he gave it to me on the house. I said thank you because I use my manners. Zombie zombie pow hiyah! Thank you!Please don't tell Mama K I was typing on her computer because I'm not supposed to touch it. I wanted to tell you how cool the comic book store is and that you should go look at Spiderman or your favorite superhero. Mama K said if I am good we'll go back again on another day. She also told me that sometimes they show movies there so we might go watch one. I have a superhero name. Pow pow pow!

24.description: Go. Take the kids. Get them addicted young. DO IT. 1. Place is awesome; location kick ass2. Staff is friendly. 3. They keep their pulls right behind the counter and know your name. 4. Awesome events 5. Great selection; don't see something you want? ASK! 6. So classy & funI wish this place continued success!

7.description: Alley Cat is by far my favorite place in Andersonville! If you're looking for a hidden gem, this is quite literally the epitome of the phrase. The entrance in the gangway between starbucks and potbelly. It feels like you're going down diagon alley! The staff is ridiculously friendly and if you go often enough they learn your name like a little mom and pop shop. I have a pull list here for my weekly comic needs and what's nice is that they'll throw some things in there if they think you'll like it. Of course absolutely no obligation to buy it. Even if you're not a serious comic collector, the decor in here alone is pretty amazing. They have game nights, movie nights, and all sorts of fun events to bond with your fellow geek. Gotta love these guys!

49.description: Very aesthetically pleasing comic shop, you walk a narrow alley way to what used to be a garage which they rehabbed very nicely! inside the bright, clean interior there is a great selection of comics, books, t's. the staff is very friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. this shop is great addition to a-ville! :)

40.description: I absolutely love this place. Now, while I've read my share of comics in my life, I am by no means qualified to comment on how well curated the selection is, because I quite simply don't know enough. They certainly appear to have a delightfully wide selection of new comics, trade paperbacks, small-press curios, action figures, and other awesome hoo-hahs that you would want to exchange your money for and take home with you. The space is also beautifully set up: airy, light, welcoming. I would like, though, to make a special shout out to two things: the wonderful staff and the awesome stuff for kids. I have never had a bad customer service experience here; the staff has been welcoming, friendly, and helpful without being pushy or too cool for school (which isn't to say they don't appear decisively cool). Towards the back of the store they have an amazing selection of stuff age-appropriate for the younger set, which is super-cool and not cloying. My kids have delighted in Bone, Amulet, Little Lulu, Melvin Monster, and a horde of other comics they've found on the back shelves. And they've always been treated with respect and like valued customers/readers when they've interacted with the staff. AlleyCat Comics is a gem.

53.description: What a perfectly nestled nook of a space!  It is down a sidewalk corridor on berwyn and clark, between starbucks and potbelly's.  The comics are neatly displayed, drawing you in with the gloss, color and artistry.  I'm not a comic afficianado, but I saw a Star Wars series I may have to check out. They play movies on saturday night and there is an open air patio that gives thems a little more breathing room and a lot of charm.  Well done!

30.description: Amazing shop.  The cleanest and most organized comic shop I've ever been to.  The custom comic cabinets makes searching for back issues so much easier.  I'm giddy over this place.

46.description: Cool location, its really in an alley! Excluded and hard to find.Awesome selection of current comics. Good graphic novels, cool people and i think a family operation cuz i always see pops and his daughter!!!

1.description: First things first, I'd like to say is that to me, presentation is the first thing that makes the ambience of the place shine. The architecture of AlleyCats is outstanding. I want to say it's kind of a huge garage that's been flipped to a hip store. The place is real unique, super clean, with nice exposed brick walls, and modern shelves that display the comics. So to sum it up, shop is dope, fresh, fly and all that! lol   Shops got a real good selection of comics. They have games and actions figures too. The staff is awesome and friendly. Their real good people. This spot is definitely my home away home.

55.description: Tired of those grim and dirty local comic stores, with ceilings caving in run by the comic book guy from the Simpsons?  Girls?  Tired of creepy fanboys learing at you as you peruse for you local manga selction or Geoff Johns epic yarn?  Well, look no further!  Alley Cat is the jam, and even has cloth towels in the bathroom!  It's so awesome, it smells like a new car, and is run by some of the nicest guys in the city of Chicago.  Not only that, it's nestled between a Potbellys and a Starbucks, so literally, you can hangout out, all day, and talk about movies, books, comics ... whatever!

9.description: Alleycat, once you find it actually down a narrow alley, is a fantastic little gem. They have something for everyone with graphic novels, comics, cards and tabletop gaming. If you're looking for something in particular, they'd be more than happy to order it for you or hold a copy of the newest edition of your favorite comic.Whether you're stopping in just to pick up some comics or looking to hang out, Alleycat is a great place for it!

26.description: This is a wonderful shop, plain and simple. The employees are quite knowledgeable of their product and always seem friendly and willing to help. The selection is solid, especially for a neighborhood comic shop. Anytime I wanted something they don't stock they have always ordered it for me with no issue.Currently they have a Magic the Gathering community that is growing player by player. It's a friendly and warm atmosphere that caters to new, casual, and competitive players alike. They always have players willing to help new folks learn the game.Beyond that, they have events all the time including movie night on Saturdays and Karaoke towards the end of each month. These things aren't necessary but it's been an great way to connect with the staff that otherwise would not have been possible.I would recommend this shop to anyone.

25.description: I don't know anything about comics/graphic novels, but happened to be looking for a specific Astro City thing.  Selene and Bryan were super friendly, approachable and helpful.  The store is in such a cool location and is organized and bright. I'm such a fan of the store that I'll have to learn more about comics just to go there!

12.description: A HIDDEN GEM!This place is truly down an alley!   If you're searching for this place, it's located RIGHT NEXT to Starbucks.  It's the alley way between Starbucks and the business next door.This place wasn't huge but it was fun, inviting, and the two workers (maybe the owners) were SUPER nice and helpful.  The place itself isn't huge but they have a little bit of everything.   My boyfriend bought this Spiderman bank but was curious about a Venom one that was just like it.   They knew their inventory and told us it was sold out.  He then had a questions about a comic and the gentlemen was knowledgeable and walked us to where the series was.  They were out of what we wanted but knew it was coming in soon and offered the service of holding it for him when it arrive in store, what a great service!  By the time we went back to the front to buy the Spiderman bank, the lady had researched for the Venom bank without us asking and provided us information about that specific product.  She went out of her way to make sure we were highly informed and I truly appreciate the customer service they both provided us.   Even though we have a couple comic places near us, we'll be coming to AlleyCat Comics as our home comic store for now on.Thanks for the great service AlleyCat Comics!

21.description: It kind of sucks that such a mediocre comic shop has such a cool name and location. After the anticipation that builds from walking down the alley inside is a major let down. I'm not sure they had even your standard titles, but maybe that is the point? If it is, I don't get it.

17.description: Full on YES. For Alley Cat. Great people, very helpful and easy going. I take my kids and there's something for everyone. The owners kid is often there on weekends so kids are welcome. Go, just to sneak down the alley

10.description: Another place that, when I visit, I get this overwhelming sense that everything will be OK if I could just stay in their store forever. (Nothing crazy or delusional about that, nope).Alley Cat is so special, walk down tiny whimsical brick gangway to comic paradise. I'm not a big super hero person and my boyfriend isn't either but we have found comics to enjoy here. Half the fun is browsing their extremely huge selection of comics, admiring the art and picking up a new title to take home. If you are, or know someone who is, a huge comic freak they have some really great, although kind pricey, hardbound full color books that would make great gifts for a true collector. Many toys and games and paraphernalia line their shelves. They have a nice selection of comics and books for younger kids and an anime section of manga. They have boxes of what seem to be older publications of classic titles and plenty of nerdy card games like Magic the Gathering. I think they actually host Magic games here throughout the week and movie nights.The staff are all very friendly and never pressure you to buy anything, its a very welcoming environment to stop at and have a look around. A nice asset to the neighborhood and a favorite weekend stop for the bf and I.

5.description: What a great little store!  They are so friendly here, and you can find anything that you need.  I've been several times now.  My favorite part is how it doesn't feel like a lot of other comic shops -- it's very clean, clutter-free, and organized.

3.description: First off, points for having the comic shop be in an actual alleyway. And for said alleyway to be as neat as it can be. That being said, OH MY GOD! A little slice of comic book heaven. Great selection, friendly staff, and they have sales in most older comics. It's a great place to stop by and check out.

35.description: The people here are very helpful:-if they don't know something (even that's rare) they say, "I don't know, lemme look it up" and look it up and fill me in.-they always ask if they can help me find something if I can't seem to find what I need.-they will order anything you want and hold anything for you.The people here are sickly kind:-always cheerful-they seems like they like working there-they chat me up about about superhero/comic nerdomThere are ridiculously adorable children there:-sitting on counters-sitting on floors-walking around-talking to you-talking to themselvesLike like like.  Go here and get your fill of comics and picture books and stories and art.  Stay for the nice people.HOWEVER!  My only critique is that I wish they handled my comics a little more lightly and carefully.  I get that not everyone is a collector and wants pristine, NM contitions of their weekly issues but when I go up to pay, they batter the pretty little delicate spines of my issues.  Even so, this is still not enough to keep me away from this place.

19.description: I get that Andersonville is tiny and everyone gets excited about a new place opening up, but seriously?  Besides having an extremely cool location this place has nothing going for it.  And it's getting two strikes from me on big issues.First off, the selection is super duper tiny.  Went in on a Friday morning when they first opened and there were so many holes of things sold out.  I would say 'good for you' but instead I say 'shame on you for not ordering enough of what you customers want'.  Additionally, being in Andersonville, I didn't think I would feel like I would stick out like a sore thumb.  There's a weird thing that happens when a girl walks into a comic book stores - not all but some - and it's where all the boys stare like they're thinking I walked in the wrong place.  And then offers no hello, no help, and when I decide to check out after perusing their tiny selection, not a word. And when my wife compliments you on your space, you answer.  Don't just keep your eyes low and ring my credit card through.  Not. One. Word.  This is rude and I already wanted to tell the dude to forget it but my card had been processed.  Secondly, it's been brought to my attention that they refuse to carry gay and lesbian books because they're "family friendly".  To start, look at what neighborhood you're in.  And also, you have comic books that have porn in them.  Saga for instance is on the second to last shelf where any child could pick it up.  If you're SO worried about being family friendly, you would either ban that too or put it up higher.  I'm not sure if this is a business that doesn't want conflict.  Or if they're just altogether not gay friendly.  Perhaps this is why my wife and I got the cold shoulder when we entered even though we were spending money - and not on fluff either - I'm a Walking Dead girl!  I would advise my friends and other comic lovers to not enter this store though because they're using some crap business practices.  Go to Chicago Comics where you're not shunned just for being a girl or even being gay - this place is wack!

28.description: I get that Andersonville is tiny and everyone gets excited about a new place opening up, but seriously?  Besides having an extremely cool location this place has nothing going for it.  And it's getting two strikes from me on big issues.First off, the selection is super duper tiny.  Went in on a Friday morning when they first opened and there were so many holes of things sold out.  I would say 'good for you' but instead I say 'shame on you for not ordering enough of what you customers want'.  Additionally, being in Andersonville, I didn't think I would feel like I would stick out like a sore thumb.  There's a weird thing that happens when a girl walks into a comic book stores - not all but some - and it's where all the boys stare like they're thinking I walked in the wrong place.  And then offers no hello, no help, and when I decide to check out after perusing their tiny selection, not a word. And when my wife compliments you on your space, you answer.  Don't just keep your eyes low and ring my credit card through.  Not. One. Word.  This is rude and I already wanted to tell the dude to forget it but my card had been processed.  Secondly, it's been brought to my attention that they refuse to carry gay and lesbian books because they're "family friendly".  To start, look at what neighborhood you're in.  And also, you have comic books that have porn in them.  Saga for instance is on the second to last shelf where any child could pick it up.  If you're SO worried about being family friendly, you would either ban that too or put it up higher.  I'm not sure if this is a business that doesn't want conflict.  Or if they're just altogether not gay friendly.  Perhaps this is why my wife and I got the cold shoulder when we entered even though we were spending money - and not on fluff either - I'm a Walking Dead girl!  I would advise my friends and other comic lovers to not enter this store though because they're using some crap business practices.  Go to Chicago Comics where you're not shunned just for being a girl or even being gay - this place is wack!

45.description: Fantastic store. Great looking location and the staff there are very, very friendly and knowledgeable. Great selection too.

33.description: This place is great. A really good selection of weeklies and trades and if they don't have something they're happy to order it for you. Everyone is incredibly nice, Nick and Luke behind the counter are great and they really like working there and helping people find what they're looking for. It's well light, open, and family friendly. There's even usually a kid or two looking around and talking to whoever is around. They have movie nights and karaoke nights and are doing a great job of building a community in the area. If you're going to buy comic books, give this place a shot and see what you think.

43.description: Kids say cool!

2.description: "AlleyCat Comics is a gem; from the alley entrance you know this place is something special and the shop and staff make that assumption true. They have an excellent stock of new, indie, and past issue comics, as well as, a small but well curated selection of collectables."

18.description: Nothing but love for Alley Cat and all the great folks that work there. Friendly, knowledgeable, and needs, this is my favorite business to give my time as well as my money in all of Chicago.

41.description: This place is really cool and tucked into a hidden corner of Andersonville.  I can't say that I am a major comic book fan, and the first time I went in there was to just check out the new neighborhood store.  But they really do have something for everyone.  They are super friendly and willing to help you find what you are looking for.  It is more expensive than buying the comics online like off of amazing but I think it is great to support a local friendly business.One the wall to the right they have a big display of more special comics and it is great to look at just as a piece of wall art because of all the color and pattern that is going on.  I am a huge fan of the Parker books (that was my first comic purchase).  I will definitely be going back for more.I would recommend this place to anyone for a fun stop in Andersonville.

52.description: I've been going into comic book stores for decades.  Over the last few years, though, visits have become infrequent. I find myself departing the store feeling melancholy over the industry, and having purchased nothing. Not so with my first visit to Alley Cat.  I think it's the quality of the light in the space, and the way the shelves are arranged - browsing books here is pleasurable.  Enjoyed chatting with the knowledgable and genuinely friendly staff.  I bought probably more comics in my first visit to to this shop than I have in the last year since moving to Chicago.  Perhaps it's lack of clutter plus an interesting selection just put me in a better mood.I really want this place to succeed!  Make the effort to find AlleyCat. Then bring your comics into George's and read 'em over a chocolate malted.

50.description: Great modern comic book store.  Probably one if not the most aesthetically pleasing comic book stores in Chicago; converted from an old garage, accessible though a proper Chicago gangway.  At Alley Cat you'll find a very well organized selection of current releases, back issues, trades and toys.  Clean and well lit, with a solid competitive and versatile subscription service.  Not to mention a friendly and accommodating staff.I should also mention that they have a kid specific area stocked with the Archie, Disney, DC & Marvel children's titles and more.  Additionally it is behind an ice cream store.

4.description: AlleyCat is hands down, the best comic shop in Chicago. From a knowledgeable and funny staff to an insane selection, I drive out of my way all of the time to visit these cats.

6.description: Comic book stores don't get much cleaner and well-organized than this.  They aren't as large as a lot of other comic book stores in Chicago.  They don't have a lot of the "toys" you'll see jammed into nooks and crannies in other places.  I'm not into comic books as much as the people I was with, so I'll let others review the place in depth.

22.description: I am new to the world of comic books, even though I shouldn't be new. I have a MA degree in Popular Culture studies, and while I concentrated on film and TV, many friends worked with comics and comic book history and culture. Here's the thing: because I didn't grow up with it, it has always been difficult to go to a store and be taken seriously, as: 1. I'm a woman. 2. I admit to being a comic novice. 3. Again, I'm a woman. 4. I'm not a huge fan of superhero-based content. AlleyCat has changed all that, and now that I'm 30, I have finally found a place where I am comfortable and feel welcomed and not ostracized. I had gone in a few times with my husband (a huge comic book fan) and was, as usual, completely overwhelmed and way out of my element. I finally went in by myself, in the hopes of being able to find something that I would enjoy that wasn't just something my husband or friends told me I had to try. I wanted to find what works for me. Nick not only helped me find material, but asked what sorts of TV and film I watch to better assess things that would be good starts for me to read. He never pushed something on me, and I don't even think he was sure I'd buy anything, but he did spend about 20 minutes with me and actually listened. As in, he didn't flinch when I said I was a newbie and felt overwhelmed and didn't know what the hell I was doing. Instead, he listened carefully to my list of favorite shows and films and carefully selected items for me. The experience was so positive for me that not only did I walk out with about $50 worth of books (because they looked perfect), but that someone finally cared about what I was interested in and invested time on a busy night to help me out. My husband is a loyal customer, but they found a loyal customer in me as well. I can't wait to go back in this week and discuss how I felt about the selections I went home with (Saga, Chew, Gotham Central, Black Science, and Scalped) to better learn where my tastes lie.Bottom line: these people are wonderful and beyond helpful. If you have ever been afraid of walking into comic book store, this is the one to break you from that fear.

15.description: This is my Neighborhood Comicbook Shop. I'm here once a week spending all my hard-earned money on comics (don't judge me). The customer service is tops. Don't know what you're looking for? They'll happily recommend something that you'll end up loving. Remember a book you saw a few months ago and it was blue and about a superhero? They'll find it or die trying. Want to put a few books aside to pick up later? I'm almost 100% sure they'll do that. In short, they're extremely nice, and extremely knowledgeable, and would even probably help you deliver your child if the timing was right.Another thing I like about this store is that all are welcome. For all the time I've spent there I've never once seen a customer make it in the shop without being warmly greeted. No one is ignored; no one is slighted, and let's face it, you can't say that about a lot of comic shops. You're not going to get dissed for liking Bat Mite, or laughed at for digging Greg Land's art, or any other comic-related offense. Alley Cat just doesn't have that vibe.The vibe it DOES have, is clean, tidy, and warm. You won't be tripping over boxes of random crap, or accidentally knocking books off the shelves because they've been there for months and have started to warp. You won't smell that musty moldering old-book smell present in some shops (sorry, places who still sport the carpet you had when your store opened 25 years-ago, but you know it's true), And you won't run out of things to peruse until long after your parking meter has expired (be careful, this has happened to me a few times already) because the place is packed with great stuff.Not only do they carry all the titles from your Marvels and DC's (and all their imprints), but they treat independent /alternative/smaller-press comics with the equal reverence. They've got a huge selection of trades and graphic novels as well as a great selection of various games (Magic gatherings also happen here weekly, so, you can do that), statues, figures, shirts, magazine, AND a great kid's section! Can you even believe it? So much stuff...it's pretty amazing.Lastly, the neighborhood. It's a walking neighborhood as well as a parking, shopping, and driving-away neighborhood. Starbucks, Potbellies, lot's of eateries and ice creameries, and shops are within footsteps of AlleyCat (which is hidden at the end of a small. but completely safe alley between Starbucks and Potbellies). The only downside is that in the summer on Wednesdays - that's "comic book day" for those that don't know - there's a stupid old farmer's market half a block away (just kidding, it's excellent).  that makes parking a bit harder to find. Not nearly impossible, just a bit harrowing if you're running out of gas. Still, worth it though. Finally, you should really support your local comic shop. If you haven't been comic shopping since you were a kid (like in the 90's, like Youngblood, am I right?), or you fell out of it because you thought you'd set aside childish things for a job and a car and kids, well, you should go back NOW. Things have changed. This is the titanium age of comics (I think I just made that up). The art.is literally better now than it's ever been. The stories are amazing and encompass every imaginable genre and subject (including zombies). Amazing artists and writers are being employed by comic companies (or starting their own) in incredible numbers, and it makes the comic experience so much more fulfilling. You should re-check it out. It's awesome.

20.description: This place is awesome!!!   The staff are so nice - soooooo nice.  Chatty, funny, cool - to me, my 10 yo son, my mom, my husband.  Cannot recommend highly enough.  Go now!  Buy their stuff!   :-)

36.description: ADORBS little spot - follow the secret tunnel (not too secret - make sure they stay in business!) down off of the main Andersonville retail stretch to this little spot. All killer, no filler, the perfect proportion of current superhero floppies to legacy trade paperbacks and a respectable amount of indies. Bonus points to them for not pandering with a name like "Diagon Alley Comics" or something like that, because it feels like a hidden magical spot right out of Hairy Potters.

14.description: The staff is very helpful and friendly. Amazing customer service. I seen a ton of interesting comics, and although I'm not a comics person, I do enjoy certain shows (like Doctor Who and BTVS) that the store caters too. And there's comics and games you can ffind on those hip, campy, tongue-in cheek shows too ;pDefinitely give this place a try!

29.description: Here's my deal with this place:If you get flowers (I don't know from their plants), don't expect to spend less than like $60 and have it look like an actual bouquet.The flowers I got were nice, I asked for $25-$30 bouquet and got (literally) 4 flower stems, a starting to pass prime white bunch flower, and a more fancy version of baby's breath.that's like $6 a stem!I asked "are these really rare or something?" she said...no..OK, well then, WHAT THE F?Save your money and get flowers at Trader Joe's

42.description: I have been going to this place for the past three years.  Every time visited, the experience has been great.  The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable of the flowers they carry. Never did I feel pressured into getting something I did not want to purchase or get something I did not like in the arrangement.  Initially, I purchased flowers to go in my home for decoration. Then, I started buying cut flowers for my center pieces for parties.  The prices for what they offer are very reasonable.  I am a fan will continue supporting this local florist.

23.description: This beautiful store will inspire you, rejuvenate you, and make you want to pack your bags and move in. In another life, this is the store I'd open.The staff are knowledgeable and creative and can help you create beautiful arrangements--just tell them your price point and they will knock your socks off!

47.description: Great selection, a little pricey depending on the time of the year and what you are purchasing. They have great sales and friendly staff. Great addition to Andersonville. I picked up 4 long stem roses for $11 on sale on NYE.

8.description: I live right down the street from Marguerite Gardens, but somehow had never walked in.
