I stopped by to make a bouquet for a baby shower earlier this summer, and was immediately taken aback by how gorgeous this shop is. My mom was growing the flowers for the tables at my upcoming wedding, but I knew instantly this was the place to buy flowers for my bouquet! The day before my wedding I stopped in and Laura helped me pick out some incredible flowers to compliment the zinnias my mom had grown. My bouquet was unique and stunning and I got so many compliments, and the price was incredibly reasonable. This shop is not just beautiful, but warm and not as stuffy as some floral shops I've been into around the area. They seem like very kind women who love beautiful flowers, and that makes this one of the loveliest spots in Ukrainian Village. Thank you for adding some extra beauty to my wedding day!

31.description: We got some wedding flowers there. I have to say 'meh'. Overpriced for what we got. I wish we would've shopped around more.We got a $35 place setting with 12 more flowers than the $150 bridal bouquet using the exact same flowers. Just don't say the word 'wedding' and wrap it yourself.  Or go somewhere else.

34.description: Caution, when you order from this establishment and you tell them your budget is $2,500, you will be billed for $4,100!The reason: the owner has no idea what the employees are planting in your garden!The owner than will call you and say:" I don't know what to do, my employees planted more, you are not going to stick me with this expense"...And when you say:"sorry its not me who's running your business" the owner will slam the phone in your face and still send you a bill for $4,100!!!In addition, the plants were dying two weeks after they were planted, and the same owner ignores repeated calls to come and see the damage.They talk a nice talk, and they have nice employees, but the owner is a horrible business owner, has no idea how to treat customers, and  should go to gardening school.In short, never again!

16.description: This is a difficult review to write/rate because we really enjoy this shop. It's beautiful and everyone is very helpful. We love to choose our florals or branches or exotic leaves to use in our home. This is the first time I've used them for a delivery. While the delivery was prompt and on time the arrangement was not. I asked for something modern and masculine to compliment grey's, purples and whites. This floral arrangement arrived and looked like an English garden. While it was lovely, it was mostly white and blue and very heavy on the green fillers. I contacted Margurite Gardens immediately and they insisted on replacing this arrangement as soon as possible. I was pleased with this and the turn around time to receive the new arrangement. The new arrangement arrived and was better, but still a little too romantic for my taste. What disappointed me even more was that the next morning it was half dead. We contacted them again and they stated that the flowers that had died were new and also died in the shop. They refunded my money, which I did not anticipate, and apologized for our experience. I certainly appreciate their attention to customer service. They went above and beyond to accommodate me and even corrected the arrangement. In the end, it was a decent experience just not a decent product for what I was looking for.We will continue to purchase their selection of frills and fineries for our home, but think twice about using them to create an arrangement.

13.description: I went in a little after they opened on a Friday, and I really didn't know what I wanted, accept for I was getting married at city hall, and I wanted flowers for my partner. The florist that helped me was amazing. She picked through my scattered brain, and produced a beautiful floral arrangement that embodied the joy of my day and the beauty of the season.

11.description: What a beautiful shop! I told them how much i wanted to spend and they put together a beautiful bouquet for me. Their roses are the best i've seen in the city. I will definitely come back.

39.description: Not only is everyone who works there super nice, but the flowers are to die for! I had a bouquet delivered today to my BFF and my only requirement was that it be interesting and it was! Not to mention it was gorgeous. This is my new go to flower store!

37.description: My flowers still look awesome! I think they are worth the extra money...because they last so long! =)

0.description: This. place. is. the. jam.Straight men of Chicago: you want to really wow your lady love with flowers? Trust it all to Marguerite Gardens.  Fellow gays and female folk?  We may be more discerning, but they truly make art here and it's exceptional.Every time I want that #1 Stunner bouquet I walk in, talk with one of the folks, give them some vague notes, and the result is exceptional, unique, and beautiful.  I have never EVER sent someone a bouquet from here WITHOUT receiving immediate texts of absolute adoration, how the bouquet was the envy of their friends/co-workers, and how greatly it was received.My approach is always something akin to what I imagine a drug deal to go like, from TV:"Hey man you got flowers?""Yeah how much you got?""$100.""You want that to include delivery and a vase?""Yeah.""Ok man. Details?""Autumn Fantasy.""I got you."End scene.  Sound like a TV drug deal? Hah!I'm sure they could accommodate someone with very SPECIFIC tastes, but every time they surprised my intended recipients with something truly unique, fun, and fresh.I'll attach a pic of said "Autumn Fantasy" creation (photo not taken by me - I didn't receive it after all! And the card was something I asked incorporated as an anchor piece/motif and not something they added) and it was received like it was the best thing in the world.For Valentine's Day I asked for non-traditional love with "whimsical elements" and that my beau liked orchids and he was the envy of his entire corporate office today.Trust these guys to give you some of the best flowers in the game. Every time I want to drop a bill on flowers, I walk in, chat with them a bit, and unique art comes out.  I'm hoping for the day someone sends ME a bouquet from these guys!

38.description: I had the amazing opportunity to visit this shop while I was looking for Valentine's Day flowers for my girlfriend. They were very helpful in helping me create an arrangement for her, and didn't make me feel pressured at all. I will definitely be using them in the future.

27.description: I have been looking for a good northside florist ever since Gethsemane stopped doing floral arranging.   I have found it.    Stumbled across this litte gem after some waiter mentioned it.     Been a faithful customer since early 2010.   Great service with unusual and artistic arrangements is a staple here.   Prices are competetive and the loyalty program is great and keeps you coming back!!

32.description: I showed up at Marguerite Gardens this past July with a rather specific mission. Having recently landed A JOB, I wanted to make a nice terrarium to keep on my desk. I know VERY LITTLE about house plants. Luckily, there's the Internet.So I get there, with my list of possible plant options and some hope. I walk up to the gal in the store and lay out my list of requirements: slow growing, low light, small size, high-humidity tolerant. Without batting an eye, she shows me a couple plants that should do the trick.   (The names of the plants weren't on a tag in the pot, so I have no idea what I bought.)Here's the thing. I just had my 90 day review last week and the plants in my terrarium are looking AMAZING!Anyway, I was ready to buy the plants. I realized I had everything at home to make my terrarium, except potting soil. On a whim, I asked if I could buy a pound or so, and she said "Sure!"So I did. My experience at Marguerite Gardens was completely positive. There was no pressure, or making me feel bad for my botanical ignorance, just a great attitude about helping me find what I needed. (Completely opposite end of the spectrum to my experience at Gethsemane, down the street!)I can't speak as to the flowers, but they hooked me up with the plants I needed. I am very happy with this establishment.

48.description: You know how some people have a green thumb?  Well, I have a black thumb.  I have absolutely no talent for tending plants  (as a matter of fact, I excel at killing them), nor do I have ANY clue on how to plant a container garden.Luckily for me, Marguerite Gardens DOES know!  They were easy to work with, kept my budget in mind, and in general did a great job  creating a lovely garden on my rooftop.  Unfortunately I lost one of the hibiscus trees to a little bug infestation, but I don't think that was their fault....apparently bugs happen every now and then.  See, I told you I know nothing about gardening!  Anyway, the white shroud is upon us currently, but come next spring I'm definitely going to use Marguerite Garden again!

44.description: To start things off I'm not a flower snob. . .however my wife is. She is great and not snobbish except when it comes to flowers.  For example a high school boyfriend (or date or whatever) brought her carnations. She still resents them(the flowers that is, not the guy. ..). I entrust Marguerite Gardens with keeping my wife's high standards satisfied. . .and every once in a while they raise the bar just a bit.  The staff is great, super helpful and they have never once tried to pawn off some crappy hallmarkish babies-breath filled bouquet of . . .well you get the idea. You may end up paying a bit more here than jewel but by and large their flowers last a heck of a long time, and are totally worth the money.  This is a vignette of a typical experience:Me: Hey.Staff: Hey, your the best looking man ever! (that best looking man part is fabricated, but they are exceedingly helpful)Me: I'd like something (insert adjective here) for my wife around $x.xx dollars.Staff: Cool. We'll be super accommodating and fantastic. Oh yeah, and we'll make you look like you know what your doing with flowers.Me: Great.Staff: (after putting together a combination of stuff I'd never think of) Here you go, I hope she likes them.****At Home****Me: Honey, I got you some flowersWife: Holy Awesomeness! You, husband are so-so. But these flowers are the cats-meow!If you are in a relationship with a flower-snob and are not one yourself this crew will keep you out of any trouble. . .unless of course your significant other loves carnations and babies breath.

24.description: Thanks for the GREAT job on my last order.I will make a repeat order for Father's Day.The Staff is friendly, offer great prices and delivered my local order for free. They have a customer for LIFE.5 Stars+  easily.

7.description: Not sure what happened to this place. Marguerite Gardens has never been cheap, but at least it used to be really good, with distinctive, bountiful bouquets that justified the higher price. In the past year or so, though, the quality and the quantity of the flowers in their bouquets have noticeably deteriorated. You can easily spend $60 on a bouquet of okay-looking flowers that barely fill a standard vase. Plus, there's a manager or owner who's always there but never seems to acknowledge or even notice her customers; she just sullenly stares at her computer or the flowers. The shop itself is very cute, and it's great having a local florist in Andersonville, but as much as I hate to say it, I've decided I'd be better off just buying the standard $15 bouquets from a grocery store.

40.description: The shop in Andersonville is hands down my favorite store in the neighborhood.  Every time I go in there is something new, and usually some beautiful flowers that I've never even seen before.   I've bought flowers from them several times now.  In one case, I brought a bouquet to a work-related dinner party, and my colleague tracked me down a week later to ask where I got the flowers from because they were spectacular and lasted forever.  Most recently, I dropped a bunch of vases off at Marguerite and asked them to fill them for an engagement party I was throwing.  They turned out PERFECTLY.  I couldn't believe how many people went out of their way at the party to ask who had done the flowers.  Marguerite Garden does an amazing job and, unlike some other places I"ve been in the city, can really make your arrangements traditional, very contemporary, or anything in between.  I will definitely keep going back again and again.

30.description: The window displays earn them high marks alone; I used one of them as inspiration for my dining room when I moved into my new place. And from what I've seen, the quality is just top-notch. I must admit, I haven't often purchased bouquets directly from them. You see, my employer has a standing order for new arrangements every week, and when the lovely employees bring in the new flowers, they're kind enough to offer the old ones to any of us who are working. On several occasions now I've been lucky enough to snag a gorgeous arrangement that lasts a remarkably long time, especially considering that it's already been sitting out for a week.If I ever need an arrangement, either for a special occasion or just as a pick-me-up for my apartment, I will no doubt head straight to Marguerite Gardens.

46.description: I stopped in here a few weeks ago during the Andersonville sidewalk sale and decided to buy a bunch of flowers for my living room.  The associate was very helpful and together we created a lovely bunch of flowers in my budget that exactly fit my specifications (in terms of height, color, etc.) The bouquet lasted a week, and some flowers even looked fresh for two.  But the best part was how a vase full of lovely flowers brightened up my living room every time i glanced in it. My experience not only won me over as a customer of Marguerite Gardens, but has inspired me to bring flowers into my home more often.  For serious, you have no idea how nice it is to have a well designed bouquet of flowers in your house, i was pleasantly surprised.  Definitely worth the $30 i paid.  I'm going back today.

1.description: I can't say enough about this excellent flower shop!  We try our best to support our local businesses and there was no doubt in our minds to have Marguerite Gardens supply our wedding arrangements.  My husband has bought me flowers from their shop before so we knew how fresh and vibrant the flowers would be.  Paul was efficient, attentive, and made our visions come to life!  Our wedding flowers were absolutely gorgeous.

9.description: Incredibly happy with my experience here.  I came in to get flowers for my aunt's birthday.  They have a gorgeous selection of beautiful, unique and exotic flowers.  Both sales associates helped me team up to find the right flowers to create the perfect bouquet.  My aunt was very happy and so surprised!  It made a great experience even better.  I would definitely recommend getting flowers here.

26.description: This place rocks. Super cool stuff, beautiful flowers, nice people working here. If I were to send an arrangement, this would be a place I would do it from. Arrangements seem really modern and fresh.

25.description: By far my favorite florist in Chicago!  A wide selection of common and exotic flowers and plants with a very knowledgeable staff.  I'm always surprised at what I find in there.  My partner and I usually pick up flowers every week or two and we are never disappointed.  Their selection is perfect for everyday or for special occasions.

12.description: This place is definitely pricey, but for a good reason. I've bought flowers from different florists and they never smell as good as the ones from Marguerite.The space and decor is also inspiring. I love to stop by here just to look around when I'm nearby.

21.description: I needed arrangements for a memorial gathering, and was very unimpressed with what the standard florist shops were offering; everything looked generic and plastic.Based on its Yelp scores, I went to Marguerite Gardens, and spoke with a member of the staff.  First, she told me, "you know, we don't do typical 'flower arrangements.'"  I told her that was why I'd come there, and she began to ask questions - about the space, about the setting, about my late wife's preferences, and of course about budget.Even after I left the store, they kept paying attention.  They had me send them photos of vases I owned, in case they could use them.  They sent me a photo of one idea for the lectern, and listened to my suggestions for alterations.In the end, they produced truly lovely displays.  My wife was a perennial gardener, and what Marguerite Gardens created looked more like a wild garden 'in situ' than a cut flower arrangement.Others have mentioned the expense of getting flowers from Marguerite.  Based on my reviews of sites like Teleflora, it would have been just as expensive to get two canned displays as it was to get the unique and personal creations I received.

17.description: I showed up at Marguerite Gardens this past July with a rather specific mission. Having recently landed A JOB, I wanted to make a nice terrarium to keep on my desk. I know VERY LITTLE about house plants. Luckily, there's the Internet.So I get there, with my list of possible plant options and some hope. I walk up to the gal in the store and lay out my list of requirements: slow growing, low light, small size, high-humidity tolerant. Without batting an eye, she shows me a couple plants that should do the trick.   (The names of the plants weren't on a tag in the pot, so I have no idea what I bought.)Here's the thing. I just had my 90 day review last week and the plants in my terrarium are looking AMAZING!Anyway, I was ready to buy the plants. I realized I had everything at home to make my terrarium, except potting soil. On a whim, I asked if I could buy a pound or so, and she said "Sure!"So I did. My experience at Marguerite Gardens was completely positive. There was no pressure, or making me feel bad for my botanical ignorance, just a great attitude about helping me find what I needed. (Completely opposite end of the spectrum to my experience at Gethsemane, down the street!)I can't speak as to the flowers, but they hooked me up with the plants I needed. I am very happy with this establishment.

10.description: Disappointed! My two dads ordered three corsages and two boutonieres  for their wedding this past weekend. The flowers were kept in refrigeration over night as instructed but just two hours out they were already withered. The gardenia flower used for the two matching boutonieres appeared to have been one flower cut in half to make two items. Since this was their wedding, they were hoping for something more special. I admit that I have not spoken with them about this but there is very little that can be done at this time. The wedding day has passed, the costly price has been paid and it is over. This is just a caution to others to be sure you get what you think you are purchasing. I give them a snarl.

5.description: They helped me a month before my arrival [day after Xmas] to put together an arrangement for my memorial site. 1st time I have been back in almost 20 yrs. Asked for 5 Calla Lilies just like my G'ma had in her bridal bouquet when she married my G'pa.Flowers were awesome, thank you!

3.description: Marguerite Gardens another local spot I hadn't heard of until yesterday.  Located right on Clark St in Andersonville Marguerite Gardens is a boutique flower shop.  You can pick out your own flowers and arrange them yourself  - or their friendly staff will sort it out for you.  The space is very friendly and calming - and it certainly is a step above flower shops with pre-made bouquets.If you're looking for some flowers, with a personal touch, this is your spot!

35.description: A great big thank you to Ami (?) and the entire staff at Marguerite Gardens!  For our wedding on June 25, 2011, in Uptown, they prepared lovely gerber daisy centerpieces, rose corsages and boutonnieres, my bouquet, and a smaller bouquet at the last minute.  I put in various orders from Tues., June 21 - Fri., June 24, and they had everything ready by Saturday morning.  The staff was very patient and helpful and just lovely.  My family and guests were amazed by the beautiful colorful arrangements, and the flowers just brightened up the entire reception hall.  I will definitely be visiting Marguerite again.  Thank goodness they are in my neighborhood.

19.description: I've been here twice and will not go back. Both times I was refused service. Several salespeople walked right past me without asking if I needed any help or wanted to spend money in their store. This is despite direct eye contact. So i simply picked out what i wanted (some candles) and walked up to the counter. I stood there for an excess of 10 minutes while people came and went from behind the counter, including the owner herself. No one attended to me, again despite direct eye contact. I'm clearly too fat/gay/bald to shop there, so I won't. Ever.

28.description: they went a little over my budget, but they did a nice flower arrangement

45.description: I love to stop in this place whenever I'm in Andersonville. I live in a low-light apartment and they have an amazing selection of unique low light plants (most stores have the same, boring old options). They also sell containers for you and will pot your new plant on the spot, saving you money on potting soil and gravel. They have a huge selection of cute, teeny plants, too, especially succulents and air plants. I have never purchased their flowers, but they have a very unique selection of flowers by the stem and I am always tempted to buy an armful when I go in. Next time. But the staff is VERY nice and welcoming, which I like. I'm happy to give them business.

33.description: I love this shop! Their selection of flowers are gorgeous and incredibly healthy. I purchased some hydrangeas and roses for a brunch I was having and they lasted nearly two weeks! The girl working was also very helpful and guided me towards a grouping of flowers that I wouldn't have considered but turned out to be stunning.

43.description: Same 5 stars - just simplifying my review to say I still stop by after the gym and today added flowers to 4 rooms for 28$.  This place has friendly staff, nice and unusual selections of fresh flowers, and it is definately a great addition to the neighborhood.

2.description: If you do not suffer from any allergies related to flowers, pollen, etc. you will love this place.  I love the smell of fresh flowers!  They also have such great modern industrial pieces that are eye catching.  I love walking by here and seeing what window display they have going on.  I picked up some random pieces here last week from their sale cart.  They were unique finds!  In addition to flowers, they also have home goods and decorative items here.  This is one of my favorite shops on Clark.  Definitely stop by if you get the chance!

18.description: This is one of my favorite places in Andersonville- or in Chicago. It is a cute little shop with super friendly, helpful staff. I really like the ambiance of the place and I would buy fresh flowers from them every day if I had the money:)

41.description: Marguerite Gardens did the boquets, corsages, and boutonniers for my recent wedding. On the whole, the experience was good! The staff was pleasant to work with during the planning process, they didn't try to pressure us into centerpieces, and their prices were reasonable. We wanted something a little less traditional, and the arrangements they came up with were just gorgeous. The colors were beautiful and they used lots of interesting textures.However, there were a couple day-of issues. First, I asked a few days before if one of the corsages could be made into a wrist corsage -- when the flower arrived, they were ALL wrist corsages. Not the end of the world, but mildly annoying. Second, while the boutonniers were lovely, they looked nothing like the ones we were shown initially.

4.description: Best experience I've ever had with a flower shop, by far.  Staff was helpful and knowledgeable but not condescending, prices seem reasonable, and the selection was broad. Will return every time.

6.description: THIS FLOWER SHOP MAKES ME SO HAPPYEvery week I come in to purchase something to brighten up my living room. Their selection is beautiful ranging from classic to exotic. I just haven't seen better, more intriguing flowers. I always leave a little giddy, knowing how great my home will look with a few new stems from marguerite. The customer service is great. They'll let you be if you wanna do your thang. But if you need suggestions, they're very knowledgeable and friendly!GREAT FOR SUCCULENTS, TOO!

22.description: charming, sophisticated, elegant, but still adorable.   when you're stumped on finding a gift, go here.  fresh cut flowers make any occasion easy.

15.description: Ordered a rose flower arrangement for my girlfriend.  She received tulips instead of roses. We called their number and talked to manager Paul who was extremely rude and completely unaccomodating.  Worst customer service ever.  He said he would email the invoice and then hung up.

20.description: My husband had a bouquet delivered to the house as a surprise and boy was it. I've admired those flowers every morning since then! He told me he had asked them to do a northwest theme with the arrangements (how thoughtful!) Marguerite Gardens did a fantastic job capturing a northwest feel! They have beautiful and unique flowers not your typical dozen-roses-florist.

36.description: These guys are fantastic.  I love the European shop feel of the store, and the people there are beyond helpful.  I usually walk in with a price-point in mind and not much else, though even when I have a specific flower or theme (e.g. something tropical-y), they are able to throw together a beautiful bouquet.I don't get a snobby vibe or feel pressured into investing more money into flowers than I want to.  The bouquets always last a long time and never cease to earn me bonus points with Girlfriend.They also have a "frequent buyers" type of program, so I look forward to my $$ off of an arrangement soon!  I will continue to make Marguerite Gardens my go-to for flowers because of the quality of buds and service.

14.description: I called to order flowers for my mother for mothers day.  I live in LA so I yelped florists near Ravenswood and Marguerite Gardens came up with good reviews.  I checked their website and liked their aesthetic, so I gave them a call.They were very friendly on the phone.  Since they didn't have pre-canned arrangements to order by name (which is the type of place I was looking for--a place that does custom arrangements), it did make it a little hard to describe what I wanted.     Unfortunately, I don't know a lot of flowers by name (except roses, lilies, and the like), so it was hard to negotiate and understand what would be sent.But I think we worked it out.  I said I like the top photo on their website under arrangements in the birch wrapped vase, but I would like something not so prickly (as that picture).  I was also very clear that I didn't want pink. My mom is not a "pink" kind of a person. The flower arrangement was unique, but I wouldn't say it was my favorite.  And I'm sad to say, it had a lot of pink.  It also had a lot of crazy sticks everywhere, but now as I look at other customer photos here on yelp, that seems to be their thing.  If it's not yours, you may want to ask them to tone it down.  I was happy with the amount of flowers for the price, but I think the arrangement was a bit top-heavy.  My mom liked them, though, or least said she did, so that's what's important.  I would use them again, but if it's your first time and just calling in hopefully you can be more specific than I was.  I uploaded the arrangement to yelp so you can see (description says 'What I received for $100.")They also delivered same day, which was nice.

28.description: I love this place!  I got my haircut there for the first time about a week ago.  I loved my stylist, Kurt, and I got some great shampoo.  Yes $35 is a bit pricey but you're definitely getting your money's worth.

1.description: I just had my hair done and makeover at Styles.  Just check out my profile pic.  I look fabulous!  If you look just half as good as I do, this place is worth it.The owner understands the special needs of larger and trans clients.

9.description: Just went in to Styles on very short notice and got an appointment with Lauren. Sh made me feel very comfortable even though I was new to the salon. She made sure she understood what I was talking about and gave me advice for what would and wouldn't work with my hair type. I will definitely be going back, even though it was a hefty $52...wish they would have asked me if I needed some water or coffee...That is the only reason they didn't get 5 stars.

29.description: I have to give Styles 5 stars.  After living in Lakeview and getting average haircuts from snobby, pretentious hair stylists with no personality at ridiculous prices for many years it was a blessing to get a salon style haircut from a professional and fun hairstylist.  Their price is above average for the neighborhood in my opinion at $35 for men, but worth it.  I highly recommend Styles but can only speak from a male experience.  They seem to have a pretty solid female business as well though.

23.description: This place is great.  A former stylist myself, I was pleased with the attention and thought my stylist, Linda, gave my hair.  I went in a slight hot mess and walked out very chic.  Cut and color for only $95?  I dare you to find a price better than that a worthwhile salon!  I would have given five stars if I hadn't heard the entire Madonna catalog while I was there and if they had a website.  Otherwise, kudos to them!

5.description: I don't get regular haircuts, but when I do, it's a spur of the moment, need it done right now sort of thing. I called around to three other salons in the neighborhood on Valentine's Day (Saturday) to see if they had any last-minute appointments open. Everything was booked up for weeks. I called Styles and was told they had several openings for the day. I was kind of surprised when I heard that & even more so now that I've come back home after my haircut. This place uses only Aveda products, is clean & simply decorated. I saw Joe who warmly welcomed me and was great about striking up a lovely conversation. He is also the first stylist I've had who's actually listened to what I want for my hair & has done that, then more! He gave me my desired style and it ended up more amazing than I expected. I was expecting my bill to be pushing $90 based on my last haircut experience  downtown. BUT I only paid $55 plus tip for one of the best cuts I've ever had. That's why I am slightly shocked that I was able to get an appointment here! Super friendly and awesome service, very affordable & a wonderful hair cut! I'll definitely be going back to see Joe.

31.description: This is a clean salon and it is also an Aveda salon so you know you are going to get good products.  I live in San Francisco and was in Chicago for a visit and needed a haircut bad - so I found this place close to where I was staying and they had an appointment within an hour - so I booked it.  I met my stylist and she cut my hair and it all went fine.  However, the one thing that I was turned off with is the bickering between the two stylist  - they called it playful, but it seemed a little more real than that.  Who knows - the point is at the end is that the haircut was decent and for $30 for a Men's haircut is reasonable - so I was happy.  I give this 3 stars as the stylist also were answering the phones and a good amount of water spilled down my back while my hair was being washed - but I think it was the way I was sitting.

25.description: Thank you, Alan (Allen?), for a great color and haircut!  I don't know why I didn't try this place sooner.  I'll definitely be back.  I had no idea what I should do with my hair, but Alan did!  The staff is friendly.  The salon is clean and smells great. And it was cheaper than I expected, even with a $20 coupon!

12.description: Hi, I'm Kellie and I'm an Aveda junkie.(Hi, Kellie).You'll find me in here, not-so-secretly getting my fix. 'Tis true, I haven't yet tried any of the salon services. Who needs those when I have my pretty, pretty products? While they may not have everything under the Aveda sun, they have a hefty selection and almost always carry what I need. Yes, I may have a problem. Or do I?

21.description: I'd seen this place for years and when I needed to make a change I looked up Styles here on Yelp and decided to try Eric. I LOVE THIS SALON and LOVE ERIC!! Totally unpretentious, just skilled, talented people working in a well-managed salon!Can't say enough good things about Eric! I get my color done every other month and when I leave I can't even smell the color. I don't have that feeling like I just had intense chemicals all over my head. When I wash my hair the next day, I don't even see any wash-out. AMAZING! And Eric has found the perfect length my hair should be!Visiting Eric and Styles is always a great experience!

16.description: After putting up with terrible haircuts from the budget places for years, I decided to give it a shot, and spend a bit more to see if it's really worth it, and it is! I mean, my awkward curly, thin hair is not much hair to screw up, but it was nice to have someone cut it that totally knew what they were doing. I live just up the street, have walked by the place hundreds of times and liked the look of the place, and I was in desperate for a haircut, so I made a last minute appointment. They were able to accommodate within 30 minutes.  Styles was worth every dollar. I was a little nervous that they weren't going to make me feel comfortable while there, but my stylist Eric made me feel very welcome and chatted with me the whole time. He was very pleasant and did an excellent job and I will go back next time. I highly recommend Styles.

17.description: Let me just say.....as an Aveda junkie, there is no better salon in the city.

10.description: Regular customer of Alan since I moved to Chicago in 1998.  (I followed him from his prior employer once he opened Styles.)  Always frendly and always a perfectionist.  And when I had enough hair that I thought it mattered, he did my color/highlights as well which always looked terrific.He earns my business everytime I come back.  Have recommened to friends and a girl friend and they have all thanked me for the recommendationNow if he could only cure the ever growing bald spot on the top of my head, I'd give him a sixth star.

11.description: Ever since Alan cut my hair I've received numerous compliments.  I'll go back!

26.description: I love Eric! I had been growing out my hair for over a year (coming from 20 years of close-cropped hair) just to achieve a certain style. Eric listened to what I had to say and helped me create the exact look I wanted. The salon is very well-kept and quiet and the staff is friendly. Loved it all around.

27.description: After putting up with terrible haircuts from the budget places for years, I decided to give it a shot, and spend a bit more to see if it's really worth it, and it is! I mean, my awkward curly, thin hair is not much hair to screw up, but it was nice to have someone cut it that totally knew what they were doing. I live just up the street, have walked by the place hundreds of times and liked the look of the place, and I was in desperate for a haircut, so I made a last minute appointment. They were able to accommodate within 30 minutes.  Styles was worth every dollar. I was a little nervous that they weren't going to make me feel comfortable while there, but my stylist Eric made me feel very welcome and chatted with me the whole time. He was very pleasant and did an excellent job and I will go back next time. I highly recommend Styles.

0.description: It was my first time with Alan, my hair has been going through changes ( dry and breaking) and I was anxious about working with someone new. He listened to my concerns and what I wanted. He made a recommendation and explained why. I decided to go with his advice and I am very happy with the haircut. It looks right for the shape of my face and makes my hair look much healthier. I am a resident of Andersonville and wanted to give my business to a local salon. The salon was clean, modern, and the front desk was friendly and professional.  A good friend recommended Alan and I pass that on  via Yelp. I will return for color services in the future.

20.description: I am traditionally a salon jumper, but the casual nature of the salon has pushed me to settle down at one salon. Linda is wonderful with my curly locks. She listens to your requests and makes good recommendations (that's what your paying for right?).

19.description: I have to give Styles 5 stars.  After living in Lakeview and getting average haircuts from snobby, pretentious hair stylists with no personality at ridiculous prices for many years it was a blessing to get a salon style haircut from a professional and fun hairstylist.  Their price is above average for the neighborhood in my opinion at $35 for men, but worth it.  I highly recommend Styles but can only speak from a male experience.  They seem to have a pretty solid female business as well though.

2.description: I've been seeing Lynda for probably 12 years. She did my hair for my wedding, has seen me through many lengths and colors and new styles, and she's never steered me wrong. I can't recommend this place enough.

18.description: This place is great.  A former stylist myself, I was pleased with the attention and thought my stylist, Linda, gave my hair.  I went in a slight hot mess and walked out very chic.  Cut and color for only $95?  I dare you to find a price better than that a worthwhile salon!  I would have given five stars if I hadn't heard the entire Madonna catalog while I was there and if they had a website.  Otherwise, kudos to them!

13.description: I really wanted to like this place. I really did. However, I struggled with the ends of the spectrum here. At what point does focus and precision (for the most part) outweigh just not having any customer relations skills? That is my quandary about evaluating this place.Since moving here, I have found it very difficult to find a good male stylist who can do good men's hair. It shouldn't be a problem. Perhaps I was spoiled by my stylist in Atlanta, but men's hair is not too difficult, even when you throw in color. That being said, I believe that men, unless their hair is long, should not be charged the same color prices as a lady whose hair is ostensibly longer. My stylist in Atlanta felt that way, but they don't see it that way at Styles.I read some reviews on here (Yelp) and decided to give Styles a try. My first inkling should have been when I walked in and the receptionist, with whom I had booked the appointment the day before, said I was down for just a cut (I rarely, rarely, rarely, just get my hair cut, or colored, without getting the other done, especially when I am going out of town for a week or so, as I was that next day.) After some real huffy looks from the stylist, they finally decided they could work me in for both. Thank you, and I'm so sorry to have been an inconvenience as a paying customer.The stylist did good work, except for leaving my right ear full of color in spots where my partner could visibly see but I could not. The cut was fine, the color, except for the globs in my ear, was fine, and I was happy with the execution. The friendliness left something to be desired, as did the price ($105). I'm sorry, but that's a rip-off. I wanted to give it another try, so I did the next month.The stylist was a little friendlier, and perhaps because it was on a Saturday, I didn't leave with any color in my ear. Apparently Saturday is the receptionist's day off, as my stylist doubled as receptionist and often interrupted the cut with having to answer the phone. When I paid, and tipped him (15%, which is standard for standard salon service, not excellent or outstanding service), he looked at me as if he were insulted. He did hand me a small Aveda sample of hand lotion. I liked the cut, so I wanted to give it one more try.Third time did it for me. Stylist wasn't as friendly and precise. (Side note: I don't get people in their reviews on here who say they've been going to him for 20 years and how great he is...maybe I looked like someone he really hated or something.) He was in a little bit of a hurry, as he was leaving the next day to go out of the country. Color was again all over my ear, and luckily my partner had become pretty good at removing it for me. The few times I did try to engage the stylist, another woman of some British background interrupted, and as her voice carries, she made it very clear that she was running this or that half-marathon, and it was clearly a case of "those who have to boast that they're good at something usually are not," for if she's a competitive runner, then so is my great-grandmother (disclaimer, again: I ran cross-country collegiately, as in 70+ miles weekly, so I'm pretty good at identifying others who run, and knowing the language...not calling this lady a liar, but as Shakira says, "hips don't lie.") Most importantly, if she is doing those races, I didn't need to hear about them, and I didn't need to be interrupted with the little discourse I was able to pull from my stylist to hear about her adventures. This place just feels dated and old-fashioned. The customer bathroom looks worse than my first apartment's bathroom...you know, the one when you're first out of college. It could use a takeover by Tabitha. I hope while she's at it she inspires this stylist to have a little more personality. I'm not saying be over-the-top, but sometimes you just want your stylist to be friendly and not aloof, and especially not insulted when I tip you properly. I think this place has a lot of potential, but it needs some reinvestment. It was never busy when I was there, as I think the largest number of other customers I saw while I was there seriously was two. I have since found my stylist gem here, but I really, really wanted to like this place. I hate that I didn't.

4.description: Went back to try again, and this time Linda took me right away (thanks, Linda!) and the cut was GREAT.

24.description: Ugh.I got a card in the mail for a very good deal on color at Styles. I put on my "I Support Local Businesses" romper (it's in my mind) and went in for an all-over color. Not only was the staff totally distracted, my colorist (?) basically slopped color onto my head, stuck me in the corner, and set a timer. Nobody puts my glopped head in a corner -- or they shouldn't, anyway. Was it because I presented my promo card? If so, that's crazy. I'm not a cheapskate! I was responding to *their* promotion!Anyway, my hair was fubared. Flat, dead, brittle, and gross. I had to go to another place a week later for help. They said my hair hadn't been colored properly, that there was product underneath the color, and that it needed a deep conditioning in a bad way. They did it for me and now it's okay. Skip this place, at least for color jobs.

6.description: I got a cut here a few months ago. The lady was really sweet and you could tell she was nervous. I really wanted to NOT hate this cut. I kept hoping that it would grow out and be okay, but no. It is the worst cut I have ever had, sorry :(

22.description: I have coarse, curly hair that I've always hated. I've always struggled to find the right cut/length my whole life. I've been seeing Linda for about a year now and I never fail to walk out of Styles feeling like a million bucks. Styles is worth every penny. Thanks Linda!!

15.description: I'd seen this place for years and when I needed to make a change I looked up Styles here on Yelp and decided to try Eric. I LOVE THIS SALON and LOVE ERIC!! Totally unpretentious, just skilled, talented people working in a well-managed salon!Can't say enough good things about Eric! I get my color done every other month and when I leave I can't even smell the color. I don't have that feeling like I just had intense chemicals all over my head. When I wash my hair the next day, I don't even see any wash-out. AMAZING! And Eric has found the perfect length my hair should be!Visiting Eric and Styles is always a great experience!

7.description: I've been going to Linda at Styles for over 5 years and have always gotten great hair cuts. I don't dye my hair, so I can't comment on that, but she does a superb job with the cuts. My hair is wavy/curly and she has a very good understanding of what to do with it. Also, unlike a lot of stylists I've had in the past, she recommends products that fit my needs. I am very low-maintenance and hate products that leave residue in my hair. She always keeps that in mind when she does my hair and when she gives me tips on how to style it myself.Beyond her talent as a stylist, Linda is also a great conversationalist and is always very upbeat. I never feel like I have to struggle to figure out what to talk about.Styles is an Aveda salon so you can buy pretty much any Aveda product there. Also, unlike a lot of salons, they are open on Mondays. I usually go on weekends, but if I can't do that, I go after work during the week. I believe they stay open until 7, which is pretty convenient. A cut (for women) is 50 bucks, which is pretty reasonable I think.I would definitely recommend Styles and Linda to anyone who's looking for a salon.

8.description: If you have curly hair, finding the right stylist can be nerve wrecking...but thank goodness for Alan at Styles. I have been getting my curls snipped here for at least three years now. Great cuts and great color jobs...great service as well. All the stylists there are friendly, enjoy a good conversation, all while making you look good! Just FYI, bring cash for tip, can't put it in a credit card.

30.description: First of all, I learned that this place is actually "Styles" not "Styles Unlimited" which is what it used to be called before the new owners took over 6 years ago. It has NO connection to the "Styles Unlimited" in the burbs. FYI for anyone else who noticed the like-named salon in Cicero. I normally cut my own hair but was ready for a change. This place is close to my apartment and they use Aveda products so it seemed like the most logical decision. I was able to get in the same day, which is a plus because when I want a change of hair style, I want it now. While I was there most of the other clients were men - but don't let that deter you girls! I told my stylist, Christian, to just go for it and, like all good stylists should, he did! It came out much shorter than I had anticipated, but this is certainly not a bad thing. I LOVE the short haircut (which I could never have done on my own) and it was well worth the $40 I paid for it. Their Aveda products are cheaper than I'm used to paying too. The only remotely negative thing I have to say about this place is that they seemed to have over-booked Christian because halfway through my haircut his next appointment showed up. Perhaps they should schedule more than 30 minutes for each person. But this didn't seem to bother Christian. His overall demeanor was great. I'm not the kind of person who likes to chit-chat constantly while someone is cutting my hair, nor do I like to feel pressured to do so. While Christian was FAR from unfriendly, there was no awkwardness in the silences between conversations. So the five stars is really for Christian. I would give the establishment 4 for scheduling issues.Overall, a great experience! FIVE STARS!!

3.description: I want to start this off by saying that my hair wasn't in great shape when I went in. It had been over a year since I'd gone to a salon. While I'm not someone that normally spends a lot of time at a salon, this was atypical, as every 4-6 months is more common for me. So, I realize that my hair was very long and a bit of a mess. That said, I think it could have been handled better. When I came in, I explained that I wanted it cut so that my hair physically touched my shoulder and with bangs that moved to my left. He thought they should be to my right and I explained I really wanted them to my left. He agreed. He verified the length I wanted then, before brushing or washing my hair, pulled my hair back and promptly cut clear across with scissors. It was a blunt cut, and was much shorter than I had asked for. My hair was just barely below my ears. He then washed it. He did my bangs, which were on the opposite side of my face from what I thought we'd agreed on. All throughout the cut, he kept spontaneously explaining/justifying his cutting off my hair in one fell swoop like that. He told me it would make it easier to wash in his sink  (without my commenting on it), he told me that having it shorter would be good since I "only cut my hair once a year" (at which point I reminded him that I would get it cut more often with the right stylist), he informed my husband that my new style was "more modern and feminine" and, at one point, spontaneously tried to convince me that the length in the back was the length that I asked for (it wasn't). Note that I didn't complain about what he'd done, aside from asking him not to cut it any shorter than that. I won't claim that my hair was in great shape before I went in there or that giving it a good cut would be a quick or easy job. That said, as a professional, if he didn't have the time or ability to do what I was asking, it was his responsibility to tell me. If he needed to cut off part of it before we started, he could have cut more conservatively and if he _absolutely_ believed that he could not cut it without chopping that much off, he should have discussed that with me. It would have been different if it was a shorter-than-expected but otherwise competent cut. However, it was not. It actually _looks_ like someone just took a large pair of scissors and cut across. My husband, an optimistic man that generally insists that all of my haircuts are flattering, admitted today that it was poofy and the entirely wrong cut for my hair. Honestly, I could have had a friend with no experience cut my hair and had the same effect. Fortunately, I'm fairly low-maintenance about this sort of thing and can just toss a hat over it until it grows in, but I really shouldn't have to. In short, I'd say that if you want something really simple done and this place is in your immediate neighborhood, then you may be okay here. However, I wouldn't go here for anything remotely complex or time-consuming.

14.description: Ugh.I got a card in the mail for a very good deal on color at Styles. I put on my "I Support Local Businesses" romper (it's in my mind) and went in for an all-over color. Not only was the staff totally distracted, my colorist (?) basically slopped color onto my head, stuck me in the corner, and set a timer. Nobody puts my glopped head in a corner -- or they shouldn't, anyway. Was it because I presented my promo card? If so, that's crazy. I'm not a cheapskate! I was responding to *their* promotion!Anyway, my hair was fubared. Flat, dead, brittle, and gross. I had to go to another place a week later for help. They said my hair hadn't been colored properly, that there was product underneath the color, and that it needed a deep conditioning in a bad way. They did it for me and now it's okay. Skip this place, at least for color jobs.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring

58.description: The place is decent if you are looking for a quick clean cut. Personally, I have my own style and I like something a little more than your average fix-er up cut. I told my stylist exactly what I wanted. She did little-to-no texturizing and she shaved the back of my neck. She also barely touched the side of my head where my sideburns are. The top was way shorter than desired, but the stylist stuck a little closer to what she was use to I think. After 3 weeks of trying to let my hair grow I went to my regular girl to have her try to coreect what had been done wrong to my head.I may have came out with a little boy's haircut, but the wash was decent. This is probably the place to come if you're looking for smooth layers, a trim, or just looking for someone to wash your hair. And beware of what you have them do, every little bit costs extra.

56.description: i have been here twice and had Rosa both times. She is awful...1. she always slaps my forehead with water/shampoo when she is washing my hair2. she CANT CUT HAIR!!! im no genius but i do know you dont comb the hair straight down so its stuck to my head to trim the bottom of my hair.  needless to say by doing it this way when i got home my hair was all different lengths.3. i am deaf in one ear and this is always a 'thing' that people do when they are cutting my hair..they either dont say anything or politely ask what happened. i dont mind at all telling what happened to me. what i do mind is when you (rosa) make a weird face and say 'ooohhhhhh!!!!' really rosa? this is expected of children, not adults.

29.description: Horrible! They won't let you call and put your name in ahead of time (or so they told me when I called to do so). I got here and they put me off for someone else who had an apt with a "stylist" but I couldn't make an apt! Then they said someone else would take me but then an apt they "forgot" about came in and put me off even longer. Needless to say I walked out after I asked again and then explained my situation. All of this after I called... they said come now... I did, within five minutes and was never even seen!!! Horrible customer service! They didn't even seem to care...... :(

42.description: Loved getting my hair cut and colored by Rachel.  Rosa answers the phone and says that no one knows where she went.  That she quit a long time ago (hey I was just there last month!).  Anyone who has found THE person to do their hair knows that any information would be appreciated!  Thanks!

23.description: Had an amazing haircut by Viktor today. He spent almost 2 hours cutting and blow drying my long hair while chatting with me. For $24 I received a $80-$100 haircut. I tipped him very well and it was still cheaper than a lot of salons. I'll be asking for Viktor from now on. So happy with my look!

47.description: So, I have incredibly thick, wavy dark brown hair. Since it sprouted off my enormous baby head, I've needed it cut about every two to three weeks. With this in mind, I have no desire to pay over $20 at this frequency.Why anybody would go anywhere else than this Hair Cuttery is beyond me. Since I moved to Edgewater, this location has been my "go-to" to get my "hair did".Hands down, Rachel is my girl. Not only is she totally friendly and remembers you, she gives a darn good haircut. She's been the first stylist I've had to identify my hair does one thing only, and that's be uncooperative. And, now that she takes appointments, I can get in there when I need to and be assured she will take care of me.When I can't have Rachel, I've had Petra, Dee, Rosa and a few of the other stylists. Overall, they're great, but I'm partial to Rachel.Most of all, at $15 bucks, why on God's green earth would you go anywhere else?

8.description: I used to go to Great Clips and just let anyone cut my hair.  By doing that, my hair was good like half the time.  Now, I will only go here to see Kelly.  She is amazing!  She gives a great haircut and is very friendly.  I will never go to anybody else!  Kelly is the best!

31.description: Ella did an amazing job on my hair. I highly recommend her and the rest of the friendly staff their!

34.description: I decided to try another Hair Cuttery, this one on Clark.  I've been to the fancier salons on Clark, but I just needed a trim and thought I'd save a couple of bucks.  The BF and I called for an appointment.  When I got there, I was asked for name, phone number, zip code...all things I already gave to the last Hair Cuttery and said I didn't want to do it again.  They can't seem to give haircuts without imposing a Hair Cuttery card on you and I guess you have to do it every time you go in.  My stylist was pleasant and seemed to understand what I wanted.  He went o ver what he was doing and how it should be done at home for maximum volume, wow factor, etc.  So, why the one star?  Well...the place was a bit dirty with other people's hair on the floors and wall.  Not the end of the world, I know, but then when the stylist was finishing up and making straight lines on the cut, he used some clipper/razor thing, and cut my neck!  I felt a pinch, but did NOT think it was serious until I got home and saw it in the mirror.  The walk home in the cold must've numbed it a bit, but as the day went on it got irritated and painful.  I suppose if you go, you can just ask for that last part not to be done, but it's just common knowledge not to injur your clients.

16.description: In and out quickly. Normally shave my head. She went down to the skin. Different, but nice.

13.description: See Darren!  He is great- easy to talk to, efficient, and always gives a great haircut!

11.description: Hair Cuttery was an ok place.... But I need to follow Fernando to Slade's Barber Shop... He knows my hair!

39.description: Went there once. Haircut was ok. Tried to call and make an appointment for another and the staff on the phone was so rude that I ended up hanging up and not making an appointment. There are many other places to get an OK haircut.

37.description: LUIS - The best - Don't accept any other stylist!!!I waited till the last minute to get my hair cut prior to a week-long business trip.  Of course, my "usual guy" was booked solid - it is a Saturday.  I went into Hair Cuttery Andersonville with low expectations.  I had been there once and was not thrilled with the job - the stylist spent more time discussing their own self importance than cutting my hair.  Today, I had to wait and was concerned about who I would get.Luis - the stylist that saved the day.  What a professional he is!  Luis is on the quieter side... or I thought.  Turns out, he focuses on and engages with his customers rather than "entertaining" the entire salon.  And, he gave me a kick @$$ haircut to boot.  He listened to my needs and concerns, and my hair has never been more perfect.  Luis, you have a new customer.  I can't wait to come sit in your chair again.  Thanks for working your magic and making me... um, I mean, my hair look good!Mark S.REALLY TOO BAD that Luis left this salon.  I have had to find a new place.  :(

0.description: The star of this place is my stylist Rosa.  She has been cutting my hair for over 2 years now and has transformed my hair into what it is today!  She has helped me broaden my horizons and work towards a hair style that I sometime can't believe I have!  She is fun, personable, and professional.  I have very straight hair that is difficult to cut and style, but Rosa always finds a way to amaze me.I've always hated getting my hair cut until I met Rosa.  Now I look forward to every hair cut and sometime I will even go in early cause every time I leave I feel like a million bucks!If you go to this Hair Cuttery ask for Rosa!

38.description: Everyone here is super nice and seems to genuinely care about their customers and their work. I can speak particularly about Kelley as she was the first one to cut my hair here and I haven't gone to another stylist since. Kelley is a great listener and has a great ideas. She recently came up with the idea of doing a little blond in the "corner" of my do and I love love love it -- its perfect for me. She is also technically fantastic and very consistent and I'm very grateful to have found her!

51.description: I was going to come here to get my hair colored before I left town on a family vacation. I knew I wouldn't get there until late, so at around 6:30 I called ahead to make sure they would be able to take me. I told the lady I'd be there in around 45 minutes, and she sounded a little bored and was a little short with me, but she said it woul be fine.I showed up at 7:20 (granted, five minutes late, but I told the girl on the phone I'd be coming after 7.) only to be told my the manager that they didn't start chemical processes after 7, and he "couldn't just ask one of his stylists to stay late for me". So I left with no cut and no color. He apologized profusely for the confusion and tried to fit me in tomorrow morning, and I know no employee wants to stay late to help a customer, but frankly I was very irritated that I had just paid for street parking and had been told it was fine, and now was being turned away.I have no advice to offer on what their color or cut services are like, and although the place seems very clean and the manager did make an effort for me, the fact that their employees are unaware ofhow the shop operates is enough to keep me from giving this place a shot.

27.description: I've seen Kelly twice now, and couldn't be happier. Her consultations are thorough, and she gives me a great haircut. I was her last appointment on New Year's Eve for a cut and blowout, and thanks to the snow was running behind. I told her we could skip the haircut so she could leave on time (it was my fault for being late, after all), but she managed to fit in the full service with excellent results. My blowout was exactly what I wanted, perfect for New Year's Eve. It's hard to justify spending $60+ on a haircut when I can see Kelly for half of that and walk away happy.

32.description: I used to get my hair cut and colored by Tara, who is no longer there. She was great. But I LOVE what Fernando does to cover my gray, keep my hair color looking fresh, and really giving me a cut that fits with my regular low-maintenance lifestyle. He is super-sweet as well. I've paid more elsewhere for haircuts that didn't make me as happy. And the whole shop has a nice laid-back vibe -- no attitude.

54.description: I thought my hair cut was ok. I asked for a trim and was surprised at how much he took off. The hair just looked like I was shocked for 2 days afterward, but now it is going back to normal (thank goodness). After blow dry (not included in the dead of winter? seriously?) and tip it came up to $45 which is about how much a normal salon would be. I am still looking for my favorite stylist of all time, Carlos. If anyone knows his whereabouts, please let me know!

48.description: I would have given 4 or 5 stars if I had Dee the two times I visited.  Unfortunately, I was in a hurry the second time and couldn't wait for her return, so I went with Rosa.  If I only saw Rosa it would have been only 1 or 2 stars.  She used the clippers I asked, but when it was obviously not even she should have picked up the scissors.   One sideburn was cut at an angle and the other straight; I was surprised I had to point that out.  I had to make corrections in my car, luckily I had a bic in my gym bag.  I wish you can rate an individual person and not the entire establishment.  If you don't have a clue how to cut certain hair it's ok to admit it and let someone else do it.  I will probably return to my old barber across town where I used to live until I find a new place in the area.

44.description: I first went to this place to give Hair Cuttery another chance after a whole lot of fails at the one on Lincoln. Rosa was friendly enough, I ignored the fact that she slopped water all over my face while washing my hair. Even ignored when she repeatedly said my previous hair cut is so ugly. Yes, I know. It's uneven because of the ladies on Lincoln Ave. Thanks. Fix it. She seemed to be cutting kind of carelessly in my opinion.When all was said and done I asked her to blow dry it, because I could already tell it was uneven. She burned my scalp REPEATEDLY. When it was finally over I told her it's uneven. I showed her where it's uneven, and said she didn't want to cut anymore because it's even. I said that's great because I don't want YOU to cut anymore. We went back and forth a while about it - she never offered to have someone else look at it for me. Eventually I gave up and just wanted out of there. I came back 2 days later and saw Dee. Though, my cut is much shorter than I wanted, she made it acceptable. I think I'll return to see Dee again - she seems to understand my hair. It's worth giving her a shot at $15 + tip. Time will tell. :)

24.description: I showed up on Sunday at 10am without an appointment and was fit right in.  Krystal did a great job with my color.  I love it!  Great pricing, clean, and friendly environment.  I will definitely be back.

7.description: Needed a quick blowout before a trip, and decided to see what was available in the neighborhood. When I called, the pricing sounded great and I was able to walk-in with no wait. Peter was fabulous and did a great job with my blowout, knowing that I just wanted simple, clean hair for my 14-hour flight, that I could easily style with a curling iron I landed. He was awesome and listened to exactly what I wanted, and didn't at all seem bothered when I asked him to shampoo twice. I would definitely come back to see him.One thing to note is the pricing structure that Hair Cuttery has for blowouts is kinda confusing (to no fault of the employees there). They charge $17 for a regular blowout, and then $27 (+ $10 for long hair) for what they call a blowout-straight that uses a round brush. I thought all blowouts used a round brush, so when I initially inquired about a blowout I was quoted the $17 (+ $10 for length) price. A regular blowout is just dried with fingers and a hairdryer, which I didn't know was an actual service salons offered.The employees were super sweet about it, and honored that original price but noted that in the future I'd have to pay the $27. So when you factor in the cost for my hair length, $37 for a blowout puts them in the same pricing category as Drybar or Blowtique. Either way, it was a great experience and good to know I can get a nice blowout in the neighborhood.

49.description: The war rages on... until out of nowhere a shinning light, a stylist with magical hands and the patience of a saint. She says "how about I also trimmed that beard", I say "well, ok then" with a big smile on my face. Let's do this!! It may have been because I've been beaten around for so long, but Nada (stylist) gave me the best hair cut IN THE WORLD. Her soft hands rubbed and caressed every curve of my large head. Her attention to detail is unmatched and the tools of her trade were like extensions of herself. It felt as though she spent extra time on me but I'm she didn't. After all was said and done, she was VICTORIOUS and I was spent. From this day on I vow never to stray from Nada. She owns my hair now. My hair is her bitch. I only have hairs for her.        Other stylist there aren't so bad but they're no Nada.

40.description: Just got my hair cut by Laura.  It was a great experience, and a great deal.  Ever since Rex at Gold Crown Barber left, Andersonville has been devoid of a place for a guy to get a great cut for a great value.  The guy who took over at Gold Crown (now called Pop Salon) isn't very nice and doesn't listen and is overpriced and requires you to tip in cash...as someone who doesn't carry cash on hand that is lame.Laura at the Hair Cuttery on the other hand asked me what I was interested in and took it slow.  I was having a lot of length taken off as summer is here and it's short hair season, so she didn't take the length off all at once.  She also makes great conversation.  It is definitely no frills, in that at a "high end" salon you may get a hand massage and some tea, but this place is great for what it is, a hair cuttery.  I would recommend anyone to go check this place out.  Thanks Laura for a great new do.  I will definitely be back.

53.description: I went here as a walk in for my 'every six months hair cut.' The place wasn't busy when I arrived at 2pm on a Thursday but a few other customers came while I was in there. I was promptly greeted and seated. Not having a request for a stylist I got paired with Rachel. She was friendly and listened to what I wanted (more layers but only about a 1/2 inch off). She wasn't pushy about forcing a certain hair cut on me. She spent a good hour washing, cutting and drying my hair to sweet perfection. I've gotten many compliments on my haircut and it's passed the 'can I wash my hair and style it like the stylist did-test' Rachel made friendly hair stylist chit chat and caught me up on 'hair cuttery drama'  Oh! You can't beat the price $15 for cut and wash then $5 for blow dry (I have no idea why someone wouldn't want their hair dried..) Total: $24 well spent! You've got a new customer Rachel!

30.description: So..I got a 15$ haircut in Chicago and I'm a chickadee. That is a freakin steal. That said, this location looks like a $15 haircut. So, if you are coming for the $15 haircut don't be too shocked if it reminds you of an episode of Tabatha Takes Over!!! Despite my initial fear and horror when Fernando hilariously debated what Shampoo to use on me, then debated on brushes that looked "out of the corner of my eye," like I hoped to god I didn't get lice or Chicago bed bugs,  he then began to cut. I told him I wanted to go a bit shorter and to clean up my layers. He advised me to go with my gut on the 3 inches since there was a big gap between the length of my hair and my first layer. So glad I did. When he first put my hair in clips to begin cutting, his jokes and almost carelessness made me nervous he didn't know what he was doing, but he looked confident when he began to cut so I tried to remain calm. There were times that, because this was a 15$ hair cut people, that I remained pessimisstic and mistook his many lookovers and constant measuring and snipping, for someone lacking of skill or confidence. However, when it was over, it looked decent all the way around. I left without a blow dry, and once air dried I was so happy I swear I won't go back to 60$ salons and I hope Fernando doesn't either!!! I will try to post my picture. Even air dried it looked like a Jennifer Aniston cut. I'm so freaking happy! It's been a week and no lice baby! I'm going right back to magic hands Fernando! He's funny and easy to talk to,,,, and evidentally knows his hair cuttery! Thanks guys! Fernando Fernando!!!

46.description: So. I decided it was time to stop hacking at my hair with a manicure scissors and get it properly trimmed. I also decided, now that I am 50, that it was time for me to be a blue haired old lady. Hideable color streaks are very au courant right now. They're all over women's heads in Europe, so go in and get one now before everyone has one. Cobalt blue. I now have a cobalt blue streak in my otherwise light brown with increasing greys long, straight hair. It looks GREAT. Dee, Mistress of Hair Color and Amazing Products set me up, and I was out of there under $50 including trim and tip. Clean place, very busy salon, friendly staff, great prices - they take walk ins, but better to make an appointment!

1.description: There are a lot of problems here, and most probably have to do with the fact that it's a high-volume shop and store policies are dictated from above. There are some good stylists who come through here, but they rarely stay.The first problem is the apparent appointment policy: I was told one cannot make an appointment without having named a stylist. I called today for an appointment later in the week and was told that without a stylist's name, I would simply have to walk in and wait. Despite explaining twice that I'd like an appointment since I didn't have a lot of flexibility in my schedule, the stylist speaking with me either did not understand, or couldn't simply tell me, "We won't do that for you without a stylist's name. You have to walk in and perhaps wait for a chair on your lunch hour." Knowing about this can really save you some time and aggravation on the phone.The second is the sweatshop environment. It's often packed and always understaffed. There's no receptionist. All the stylists are multitasking. Working there is definitely not easy, especially in such a high-volume shop. This environment is also unpleasant for the customer. You can't really have a discussion about what's being done with your hair when your stylist has to walk away to answer the phone every two minutes because it rings non-stop.The third is the opaque service menu and pricing. Rather than have a menu clearly stating what the prices and services are in detail, there's a general menu and then upcharges for using a brush while blowdrying, for having long hair, for sitting with a master stylist (which you might not even know until you go up front to settle up!).There are a lot of reasonably priced mom & pop shops around the neighborhood. I'm gonna try them out.

55.description: I'm afraid that the only thing I can agree with Matthew S. on about Rosa is that she is friendly.I went to this Hair Cuttery location a few months ago and Rosa was assigned to my case. I wanted highlights and a cut, something that Hair Cuttery claims to offer regularly. She was so confused about how to do highlights, she had to have the Manager/Owner actually draw a diagram of a head to illustrate for her how to divide hair into sections. That scared me, but unfortunately I gave her the benefit of the doubt. She took FOREVER putting the foils in, and kept asking another woman in Spanish for advice, assuming I didn't know what she was saying. When my hair was rinsed I could barely notice a difference, other than a stray strand or two of blonde that looked as if it had been growing out for a month already. What is much worse is the cut she gave me. I told her I wanted layers, which I guess is also something she wasn't fully familiar with. She chopped off a huge thick layer at about ear level, one side significantly shorter than the other, and the rest of my hair is extremely long. It is ridiculous looking, and I can't even put my hair into a pony tail without half of it falling down into my face. It ended up being more costly than going to a reputable salon, and the only thing I gained was the ability to get a good laugh out of family and friends.  NEVER AGAIN!

9.description: I have had my hair cut here for years and been lucky to have many excellent stylists here. Today, Peter did a great job on my hair. He asked me how it looked and i pointed out i was not wearing my spectacles and I trusted him... He took an extra few minutes when i said this and examined from every angle and made a few adjustments before he was finished.  Very nice.

26.description: Love this place, in particular new hair dresser Darren. He cut my very long hair into a really fun shoulder lengths cut. He had great instincts about what hair cut was going to work for me and my  style. One of the best haircuts I have had in years!!!!!!

25.description: I have a graduated bob that I'm growing out but needed a trim with some variety. Douglas did a nice trim with a few layers in the front. He listened well and said that we could change anything after we got a good look at it after he washed and styled it. Nice cut!I arrived a little bit early for my appointment, and Douglas took me a little before 6. Just as I'd been hoping on that cold night.

12.description: Darren is a gem, and as professional and skilled as any stylist I've ever had! Really outstanding, and, on top of everything else, pretty nice to look at too! :-)

59.description: Went back for a cut before Christmas, and this is potentially the cutest cut I've had! Fun layers, and a sassy new 'do for the holidays. Rachel is great, and very friendly, and I love this new cut!

21.description: I am writing a review on Hair cuttery, but really on Rosemary- who works there.  I came to her in May 2013 with a need for touch up color. It was late at night and she sent me away knowing she could not do a good job that evening.  The scheduled appointment she matched my color perfectly and we clicked.  She took her time and really respected mine.  I liked that.  Since that time, I went back when she wasn't there and other stylists did my hair.  Jim probably did it the best, but to be honest Rosemary takes the time necessary to get the results that I want.  One stylist, Crystal, turned my hair greenish back in March.  She actually asked another to mix it and then pretended it looked good.  I had to go back a lot sooner and get a whole new look.  It is pretty hit or miss there at Hair Cuttery.  I would not trust just anyone with color.  5 stars for Rosemary- but not for HairCuttery.

17.description: I have a graduated bob that I'm growing out but needed a trim with some variety. Douglas did a nice trim with a few layers in the front. He listened well and said that we could change anything after we got a good look at it after he washed and styled it. Nice cut!I arrived a little bit early for my appointment, and Douglas took me a little before 6. Just as I'd been hoping on that cold night.

10.description: I've been to see Laura at this salon several times and she does a great job with my hair. She's always on time for my appointments and spends time before wash/cut to make sure she knows exactly what I'm looking for. She's very personable and I would definitely recommend.  Note: Laura is a Master Stylist, so there is a few dollar up-charge to see her. Worth it, in my opinion!My husband also comes to this salon and has received great haircuts from both Fernando and Viktor.  When he has to roll the dice and take whoever is available for a walk-in appointment, the results have been mixed. For this reason, I can only give this shop 4 stars.

5.description: Updating my review, although I haven't been there in almost a year.  I used to live around the corner from them until last year and went to Darren several times.  He is fantastic and always cut my hair so I walked out feeling great.  He is also really easy to talk to and open to input from me about my hair.  It reminded me that I need to go back to him.

3.description: I enjoyed having my haircut with Peter. At first he appears to be shy, but once you start engaging him in conversation, not only did he fade my hair well, he struck a great conversation like Shocantelle Brown would. It is customary for stylists at Hair Cuttery to shampoo and condition your hair, but Peter went above and beyond by massaging my scalp which was an extra perk of having him as my stylist.

35.description: Ranadal did a nice job on my color but was 30 mins late getting started. That made my brunch plans late and I had to feed the meter w/ color in my hair.He is nice, talkative, and wants you to like what he does w/ your hair. I'd consider going back. Approx 63 for all over color plus a color protectant cond he put on for 5mins and then rinsed. My hair was really smooth from it so that was nice.

19.description: Came in for a walk in early in the morning, and had no wait time. Laura cut my hair and she was awesome! Super friendly and easy to talk to. My hair came out awesome and just what I was looking for. She even let me try a bunch of products to see which one worked best for my hair. Definitely coming back and would recommend to anyone :)
