28.description: I love this hair cuttery- the staff is always friendly, and I've gotten some awesome cuts there.  I'm partial to Kelly and Laura (I always get compliments on my hair, and people are genuinely shocked when I tell them where I go), however, I think all of the stylists are great, and they will really take the time to listen to what you want, and will do whatever they need to in order to provide the best service possible.

45.description: I highly recommend Dee. My hair is pretty straightforward, so I can get a bit miserly when it comes to haircuts. She always does a great job, and it's the best deal in the city.

33.description: Went there today with my daughter for a hair reshape for me and a cut and style for her.  Absolutely wonderful!!!!  Laura cut my extremely thick naturally curly hair perfectly and Reida (sorry- spelling) cut my daughter's hair perfectly to match the Selena Gomez LOB (layered bob) that my daughter brought in a picture of.  We are both extremely extremely extremely happy customers!!!!  I could not be more pleased!  I am so impressed with Laura's technical expertise- not to mention her flawless consult. Am also impressed with Reida! Will be back!!!!

43.description: Randall is my one and ONLY stylist he's been working on my hair for just about four years. I actually followed him from an Evanston location to this one on Clark. The first time he cut my hair he stepped back said this doesn't fit your personality and went to work again. He has never once disappointed me and I must admit i'm VERY VERY picky. (he's more of a perfectionist though :) ). He both cuts and colors my hair (red I might add which can be very tricky because it can come out looking all sorts of ungodly unnatural shades) and on those special days styles it (updos) as well. He is extremely knowledgable and is constantly doing continuing education to improve upon his already tremendous skills and knowledge. He's super friendly has a great personality and will explain and educate without being rude or pushy. He's the only person who has done anything to my hair in almost four years and the person I trusted on important days such as my college graduation and my WEDDING! If you want the best then it's Randall your looking for.  He'll make you look and feel your absolute best. P.S. you'll have to book ahead his chair is usually booked up. :)

2.description: Liset is my hair and eyebrow saviour! She is the only person I trust with my eyebrows, haircuts and my perm. I have been going to her for 3 years now and i can't imagine allowing anyone else to mess with any of the above. She is reliable, consistent and an overall amazing threader and waxer you will not be disappointed! Even my boyfriend gets his hair cut by her and she is helping him work with his crazy curly hair as he grows it out.

18.description: I was inspired to write my first Yelp review. It was hard to find a new stylist after relocating from LA but Crystal is amazing.  She is so good with color- I love the base and highlights that she picked. And it's the most fun haircut I've had in a long time. I'm beyond happy with it and have been getting compliments non stop. Cannot recommend her enough. She's also delightful and whole experience was great. Thanks, Crystal!

41.description: I've been coming here to see Dee since last summer. She does a great job and she's fun to talk to. She was very helpful in giving me advice on how to change my hair color gradually. The place has magazines and products but not much else. Standard Hair Cuttery. The staff seems happy.

52.description: Came here first thing Saturday morning (open at 9a) and they already had three people in the chairs. I didn't have to wait very long though. The salon is a little on the smaller end (maybe eight chairs?) but I was really happy with my cut from Richard. He did all that I asked for: short on the sides, thin out the top (since I have extremely coarse and unruly hair), and he texturized it on top of that. Thank you!!!

50.description: DO NOT CALL PETRA!! SHE'S MY GAL AND I DON'T WANT EVERYONE GOING TO HER!! Just kidding, call Petra, she's great!  She listens to what I want and gives me exactly what I want! I tell her to leave the length in the front/sides, she leaves the length. I tell her I want to go super short in the back, she does it without blinking an eye (it is hot out, after all). She does a great job and really knows her stuff. Sometimes she can be a little rushed for time as she's a popular stylist (AGAIN, DO NOT CALL PETRA!), but she will do a complimentary bang clean up or quickie trim if it's not right the first time!

4.description: I have always had great service but Fernando was my guy. He is gone and at Slade's Barber Shop if your willing to make the ride he is worth it.  Petra, Victor and Darren are good if you can't make the trip.

6.description: My hair looks awful. I asked for long layers and I got one big choppy level of hair. :( that's what I get for going to a cheap place that is only known to do good men hair cuts. :(

22.description: See Fernando Vera is the BEST!!! Great service and price. Don't pay those other high priced salons! He takes appointments!

15.description: I have been to this location several times with few complaints until now. This last trip I had was the worst haircut I've ever had. When a customer specifically tells the stylist EXACTLY how they want their appearance to look they should be listened to, since the customer is the one walking around with the look. I gave specific instructions on what I would like and my "stylist" Vicky seemed to not care at all and just wanted me out the door asap. Buzzed my sides without precision and used scissors where I specified I'd like the buzzer to blend my sides in. She did such a shotty job my girlfriend (who doesn't cut hair) had to finish the job later that night. To make matters worse the back top of my head was uneven after she over cut on one side after she paid more attention to her phone ringing than my head. That trip was my last and will be taking my business else where and think you should too

57.description: Lets go back in time 10 years. I had a fancy pants job, and wanted a fancy pants hair cut. So I went to Mario Tricoci. I spent way to much money on the haircut...and I hated it. I went in wearing a tie, and asked for something fun and modern (I had major crazy Hugh Grant on Crack hair). The stylist decided for me that what I needed was something clean cut and conservative.  I walked up the street, mad that I'd wasted money and hating my hair cut. I walked all the way up Michigan Avenue - to South Michigan...and had a gal named Rosa cut my hair. She made it perfect. It was fun, and spikey and crazy...just how I wanted it.  She cut my hair until I moved far far away to work in a new library. FAST FORWARD to last January. I walked past the Hair Cuttery on North Clark- and I saw Rosa through the window. I walked in. Without missing a beat, she looked up and said "Matthew - where have you been?" Long lost client reunited with hair dresser. I might seem high maintenance, but I can not stomach paying $65 for a haircut. This shop is clean, and perhaps because I am a "regular", the staff is always friendly...though I'm only there to deal with Rosa. I am pleased with the haircuts I get here... and yes. Only on Yelp would my egotistical, and somewhat arrogant self admit that I get quicky haircuts at a quicky shop. Its the hairdresser. Not the shop that makes it work. And I am hot. So you know it works.

20.description: Came in for a walk in early in the morning, and had no wait time. Laura cut my hair and she was awesome! Super friendly and easy to talk to. My hair came out awesome and just what I was looking for. She even let me try a bunch of products to see which one worked best for my hair. Definitely coming back and would recommend to anyone :)

36.description: Walked in yesterday wanting a trim and was randomly paired with Randall. It was my good luck because he is everything I want in a stylist: listens well, offers good suggestions on hair care and styling, describes the products without being pushy or salesy, cuts nice layers in my thin curly hair, and chats to pass the time. He brought my hair back from disaster (it hadn't been cut in a really long time) and spent extra time on a dry cut and deep conditioning treatment. And compared to other salons in the area, what a bargain, even with his slightly more expensive "master stylist" price. I will be back.

14.description: I have always avoided using professionals for over 10 years to cut my hair since Denise quit (back in Philadelphia).But Bridget at this Hair Cuttery knew exactly what I was talking about and knew what I wanted and did it right the first time. I think I finally found a new person to cut my hair for me.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Coloring, Kids' Hair

58.description: Reviewing White Castle as "food" seems counter-intuitive as best, counter-productive at worst. Oh, it operates in much the same way as food. It goes into your mouth, you chew it and swallow it. I'm sure it even contains some smattering of "nutrition." But you don't go to White Castle because you are "hungry" and want "food." You go to White Castle because you are "drunk" and want "White Castle." Or if you are not drunk -- and I understand some people go to White Castle when they are not drunk -- you come here because it's "what you crave."Man, was there ever a more truthful advertising slogan? White Castle isn't about eating; it's about satisfying a craving. I suspect White Castle satisfies the same neurons that are assuaged by crack. Or chocolate. In fact, I think it makes more sense to discuss White Castle as candy than it does as food.Consider, if you will, the White Castle onion rings. To its credit, White Castle uses whole rings of onion in its onion ring, unlike Burger King or some other fast food joints, which use that minced onion crap. But the breading on those rings definitely contains some high fructose corn syrup, 'cause ring batter should not be so sweet. And an order of onion rings -- I hope you're sitting down -- has 430 calories. Unless you get the sack of onion rings, which has nearly 800. And fully half of those calories come from fat. What kind of food, outside of fat, gets half its calories from fat? Unless, of course, we're talking about the chicken rings, which get nearly two thirds of their calories from fat. There is, in fact, a higher percentage of fat in the chicken rings than in the mozzarella sticks.Despite this knowledge, now and then I crave White Castle. For the same reason I crave Entenmann's coffee cakes. And fortunately for me, Entenmann's coffee cakes are as inconvenient to get as White Castles. Which is to say, just inconvenient enough that I don't always give in to the craving, though convenient enough that I can if I choose to. This White Castle is fine. And the last time I was there, the girl with the heavily processed hair asked, "How was your day so far?" (it was late and I was drunk), which made me feel special.

56.description: All I have to say is wow, wow, wow.  This is the first and only White Castle I have ever been to and I must say, if all the locations are this fantastic, then watch out dining world!The Slyder is truly a thing of delight to the palette.  A patty of the finest beef, delicate and lacy, sits upon a bun of sheer, lightweight dreaminess.  The onions and pickle only enhance the taste of this complex, toasty nibblet.  You truly cannot eat just one!  Add the Jalapeno cheese and watch your taste buds dance with true happiness! Moving on to the incredible concoction of what is known as a Chicken Ring.  A thing of beauty, this side - NO, NO, it could ALSO be a main course - do you see the versatility?  The crisp coating, reminiscent of a light amaretto wafer, gives way to a juicy, plump, ever so tenderly smoked, chicken mixture within.  And the shape!  All the more agile to eat you with, my dear!  Oh, to what lengths will the masterminds at White Castles development department go through to bring you such a gastronomic delight!  Finally, FINALLY a place to call home.  There is a frozen variety in the supermarket available, but I don't recommend that.  It takes away from the whole experience and fresh aspect of the restaurant variety. I've long sought something like the Slyder for the tastebuds. Gustatory glasnost! An end to this totalitarian state of dining boredom! It is here, for you!  Thank heavens!(OK, to all the people who thought I was serious - this is an April Fool's Day satirical review - I cant believe I just had to add this in!)

29.description: I went to this location on a Saturday evening at 9:30.  The drive-thru looked like a graveyard for cars.  The line was not moving at all, so I figured that I'd just park and order in the restaurant.  Surprise, surprise: the line inside was just as stagnant.  In fact, two White Castle enthusiasts who arrived after me left because of the very visible gridlock.Finally, my order was taken.  I ordered five sliders and nothing else.  Pretty simple order, I thought.  Simple, yes.  Fast, no. A trip for five fast food hamburgers should not take 23 minutes.Now, to be fair, the workers were hustling!  I don't blame them.  I blame management.  This is obviously a location that should have several more staff members on duty on a Saturday evening.I also couldn't help but notice a rainbow-colored sign by the drive-thru window that reads "PLEASE," "THANK YOU," "YOUR (sic) WELCOME," "SORRY FOR THE WAIT" & "HAVE A GREAT DAY."  The main counter man continued to issue apologies for the wait, but does an apology really count when a crib sheet with said "sorry" is prominently displayed? Five sliders in 23 minutes is not a success where I come from. I won't be returning to this location.  Yours truly, Andy Rooney.

42.description: Service is consistently horrid, upwards of 2am the line inside or out is extreme. Regardless of the order size your waiting 10-20 minutes and what really blows, is when you receive your order and it's incorrect. Snotty ass window workers that acknowledge your requests with unprocessed "Yeah's and yeah yeah, I got it"' Obviously you didn't which is why I'm driving away without the sauce I requested and the wrong drinks.. Since they've got the most inconvenient location on that corner, it's gonna take some time to maneuver back into line to get the correct order. After you've had time to process all this because you didn't have enough booze to forget, you remember how crappy service was and the tedious wait it took. Which makes you think twice about future visits.. Main reason why there are years between my visits. Plus, I need spice.. and jalapeno cheese on the cheeseburger is a crazy additional charge, something like 40 cents extra per burger!! For example a ten sack combo with the 2 fries and drinks, almost doubles in charge with that add-on. Bloody hell, the price of early morning eating.

23.description: First thing I tried in Chicago, this place definitely is nasty. I won't trust Harold and Kumar anymore. If you're drunk or high, this place may be a 2 star.

47.description: Sack of sliders after a long night drinking is the BEST!!

8.description: The opposite of fast food. It should not take 25 min to go thru the drive thru but it did!  I'll pass on White Castle from now on. Nothing tastes that good...

31.description: This is an occasional treat usually after a late night out when no other convenient options are still open.  The sliders are easy food.  Everything about them is facile and yielding and comforting . . . almost creepily so.  I eat these quickly or else I start envisioning scenarios in which a worker has done something to befoul them.  The fries are crinkle cut, nicely salted, crispy on the outside, and hot and potatoey on the inside.  A nice complement to the sliders.The mozzarella sticks are standard fare - what you get at any fast food place that serves mozzarella sticks - and are reliably tasty.  Chicken rings are okay.  I usually eat only a few of them.  Sort of bland.The Diet Pepsi has a bit more ketone sweetness compared to standard Diet Pepsi.  I actually kind of like it. Overall, despite some of the foregoing description, it's a satisfying late night meal while eating it and only a mild regret after.The biggest negative is that the service is subpar - it's often slow and forgetful/careless (ordered items are often missing - e.g., the honey mustard requested both at the intercom and then at the drive-thru window, an order of fries, etc.).

34.description: I had to wake a drunk guy up that had passed out in the drive though here the other night by slapping him at least ten times. He could only pull ahead since we were all blocked in, and he smashed his side mirror when pulling up.I had hoped that they would keep him there until some cops showed up, but their customer service was so good that they tried to help him slide his card in the machine when he was too drunk to do it himself! They ended up having to take the card inside and run it when he couldn't figure out how to push the buttons.He took off after getting his food, and tore away at a high rate of speed. He ended up crashing into a pole a mile down Clark Street.I'm glad that it was a pole that he crashed into.

16.description: The employees may be missing more teeth than the entire Chicago Blackhawks squad, but when you're in the mood for some sliders this place will do nicely.

13.description: I love White Castle, I grew up with loving the burgers. But the quality of the food being served at this location is poor. The burgers are dark brown and look very old not the light brown color I am use to. The oil used made the fries taste very fishy, could that be the result of old oil. Yes I love White Castle but this location has issues that should be resolved to bring it up to the standards deserving of White Castle's amazing history.

11.description: Although their burgers are fairly cheap, I have to say that In-N-Out burgers tastes way better than White Castle burgers. Their burgers are decent, but definitely not something to go crazy for. I'd probably revisit this place again if I was back in the area, drunk, and wanted something quick and cheap to eat.

39.description: Come on, it's a White Castle, you know what you're getting when you walk through the door, delicious, delicious grease. Oh and that smell, can I get that as a popurri?I wouldn't recommend making these things a part of your regular diet, unless you know a good cardiologist, but after a long night of drinking there's nothing like a slider to sop up the booze.And if you have never had one you got to try it at least once, unless you're a vegetarian, or vegan, in which case stay far, far away.

37.description: Roto Rooter for the late night soul, baby!Burgers that work better than Ex-Lax, soak up that tummy full of alcohol, and leave you with a guilty conscience the next morning (for eating here- not for drinking).

0.description: This was a perfect cap to my late night, early morning. The burger was still hot when I got home, and although greasy it wasn't a nasty greasy & even better it didn't make me sick. I'm not a big fast food eater because it always makes me feel so bad. Good job White Castle.

38.description: Nuke it.  It's the only way to be sure that nothing- including their bad customer service, survives.

51.description: I'be become addicted to this place, I don't know how many times I have come here after a party/concert/movie etc. and absolutely CRAVED 4 little steamy damp cheeseburgers with pickle and onion, and a side of onion rings!

27.description: So occasionally I hit this place up for breakfast while working... White Castle actually has a great menu for breakfast.Pleasant staff.. clean and smells all too familiar :)  Can't go wrong with this place.. just be ready for the pain

32.description: I frequently stop by here before going to work to grab a quick bites and most of time, they have the best fast food chain service I've experienced.Driv-Thru staffs are almost always friendly and very prompt upon any request.

54.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE White Castle!!!  My mom got me hooked like 30 years ago, and I've been "craving" them ever since.  Must admit I've never tried the chicken rings - always stuck with my favorite cheeseburger sliders.  However, after reading all the positives about the chicken rings, I'll definitely be giving them a try next time around!  Also have to agree that WC is BY FAR THE BEST drunk/hangover food around.  I swear, they should promote it that way!  LOL!The shame of the matter is that I now live out in the burbs and the closest WC is 15 miles away in Gurnee :-(  Oh, the disappointment!

48.description: I really do not understand the appeal of White Castle. I have yet to be satisfied by these mini burgers. It is my least favorite fast food spots. Those lil sliders are expensive too. They are almost a dollar for ONE.

44.description: What can I say... It is the Castle...  The only time you go there is when you need to take a trip, late at night (or very early in the morning) when you know you should not be driving (after leaving the bars).  But it is so worth it!!  Just the smell of the onions, I love it!  Not only do you crave the food but the people who walk in there is a treat in itself.  Just to sit there and watch all the drunks stumble in and attempt to order and have a conversation is awesome. One of my favorites.  They are called Sliders for a reason.  I try to refrain to visiting this place but once a month. If you haven't gone to one, you must.....

24.description: It was my first time at white castle.  Great late night food!

7.description: It's a White Castle, not much more to say about the food. This location is one we always go to because of location to our house. The service is always friendly, but can be slow. The restrooms are relatively clean, I've never seen it totally gross.  The place is generally clean, but it is not located on the best corner.  If you don't approach from the right way you'll drive by it and leaving isn't easy either. This doesn't stop a big lunch rush so try to make it an early or late lunch.

49.description: Maybe I was starving?  Maybe I was hungover?  Regardless it was damn good.  Normally I don't like White Castle, but the burgers were perfectly steamed and the onions were super tasty.  The fries were fried to perfection.  I got the kids meal which is a great option if you're not too hungry.  Cheap too!  Under three bucks for a drink, fries, fruit snacks, and two burgers.

40.description: Lately the service has been getting better. The night crew still has a long way to go to get my approval but as for the day and evening. Keep up the good work.

53.description: The first time I ate at White Castle, I was not warned that the tiny little burgers would be damp. Use of steam or otherwise, it was truly a sick experience. Yet, I persevered. Now I get these bizarro cravings for a mini jalepeno cheeseburger in it's own protective cardboard wrapper, and fries, and the company of several of it's little burger friends, and a soda too! (Why not go for broke?!) I don't know how you wooed me, White Castle, but you did it. I am in the mood for something slightly damp, warm and salty right now!

30.description: OMG! I finally live near a White Castle! Laugh if you will, and I know you will, but my LOVE for White Castles goes back to childhood. Ah, memories. My mom worked late nights and me and my siblings would literally squeal with delight when I woke up in the AM and found a bag of whities on the table! Maybe that's why I still love them so. I am one of the few peeps who doesn't get drunk to eat Whities. I deliberately go there, stone cold sober. Sometimes I even add lettuce, tomato, mustard and mayo. I know that sounds weird, but they are such cute little gems, those sliders.When I moved to CA I really missed them and cherished the times I could get them when visiting. Then the frozen variety came out and I was grateful for that! I would even add my own little pickles.So then I move back out here, and live in the Gold Coast. No Whities within miles! So, I was STILL buying frozen ones! OMG! When I would visit friends on the south side, I'd always stop and get me a sack to take home and pop 'em in the freezer. Believe it or not, the freshly frozen ones stand up okay. And now they have those marvelous pulled pork sandwiches! Love them, too!And then, it happened! While looking at a place in Edgewater to rent, there it was .... on Ridge Ave.! Thought I'd died and gone to heaven. I know the rental agent thought I'd lost my mind when I asked her to swing thru the drive thru. But she admitted she liked 'em too, and I was buying, so, WTF? I took a sack home to the Gold Coast to celebrate the new apt. I found in the area ... and part of the reason it was okay with me to live a little further north than I had planned ...was White Castle! Yes, it is true. And I'm not ashamed to admit it. Me and Whities, we got a thing goin' on.

46.description: This White Castle gets 3 stars because it participates in the WC Valentine's Day dinner extravaganza. Reservations, tablecloths, being waited on, a souvenir polaroid - how could you ask for more?! I am not a big slider fan, per se, and the fish niblets are a little frightening, but Valentine's Day at the Castle was unbeatable, no joke.

1.description: I love me some White Castle...Placed my order online for a massive amount of food...$46...HA...dont judge me and my WC.The food was fantastic BUT they forgot a few of the sandwiches...BOO.  When I called to ask, they said I could come back in and get them...but I didnt want to go back out.  I absolutely love all of the disgustingness that are in these sliders, fries, chicken rings...yum.

55.description: I was a White Castle virgin, but no more.  I just moved down the street and on a late night we hit the drive thru.  It's good, I can't deny.  But, not fabulous and not nearly as great as my fave In-N-Out burgers on the west coast. The burgers were tasty, the fries were limp and not hot, but the onion rings.  Oh, the onion rings.  My taste buds sang!

9.description: I give white castle 5 stars and here's why....It's white castle....you either love it or hate it.It doesn't matter if the service sucks, there's only like 3 white castle's in driving range and two are really far. Service usually is pretty slow at this location , but this time I was in for a pleasant surprise. ..I had the crave and they fulfilled it!The young lady was very courteous and filled my order correctly. ...I had to laugh when checking in here and Yelp asked if "it was good for kids"....I checked no. White Castle isn't good for anyone,  but sometimes you just gotta have it.

26.description: Aw white castle, how you have fed me through intoxication.  You may not have the best food and the service is almost terrible, but fills the void after a night of drinking.

25.description: It was my first time.  It's just a crap burger but together that's awesome when intoxicated or as seen on tv.  Thank you Harold and Kumar for showing me White Castle!

12.description: Just a quick review from my experience this morning.  I was staying with friends nearby and walked over to get a cup of coffeeThe girl who took my order asked me 5 questions about my order. I said medium coffee.   She said What?  I repeated.  She said what?   I repeated.  She said what size?  I said medium.  She said medium coffee?  I said yes.  She asked if that was all?  I said yes.  She asked again if there was anything else.  I said no. Then she asked the other guy who was cooking where the cups were.   Then asked him again.   I am just saying....if you are gonna have someone at the register working with customers,  they should at least have a little training and basic customer advice skillsGlad I didn't order more or I might have been there all day clarifying things

59.description: This is the slowest, most unorganized and incompetent White Castle's in the entire city.Worst Service and they most likely will not get your order straight.Forget the drive through...Slower than molasses in January...Drive out to the one on west Addison if you have the time... much better!

21.description: Site castle is one of those places that you crave after a late night or a long night of drinking.  The only problem is you regret what you did the next morning.   Tis White Castle is very slow,  no matter what time of day or night, there will be 1 or 2 other cars in the drive through and you will have a 5-10 minute wait for your food.I this review was written late night I'm sure it would be 5 stars but written in the morning it will only be 3.I don't want to make the review sound too bad,  because I will probably be back here in the next week or so.This is great drunk food,  but you might be sorry in the morning, but not just for the burgers.

17.description: Sometimes you just have to have a couple of White Castle cheeseburgers. At least I do. This place is clean and maintained, but the service is pretty bad.

10.description: I have always loved White Castle burgers and this location did not disappoint during my last visit back home to Chicago. This place is friendly and clean and most importantly the sliders were great!

5.description: I would give zero stars if I could.   Albeit fast food, this place does not even try to produce any quality products.  The "meat" is left to sit out for hours and is very plastic in nature.  When called to complain, they said they would give additional burgers next time.

3.description: We were on our way home from the AC/DC concert at Wrigley field.  I Saw this white castle and decided to pull in through the drive through.   A man took my order, it was fine after that it was downhill.  Waited for a good 6 minutes for the car in front of me to get there food.   Then when it was our turn.    The lady mumbled the price. I said pardon then she yelled me i paid her she gave me change and then dissapearedAfter this we waited and waited and waited.  It must have taken 10 minutes finally a guy handed me our food, he didn't say thank you or anything.  I thought he was then gonna give us our sodas, but he walked off.  I had to knock on the window a couple of times,  I told him we didn't get our sodas.  He made the sodas and practically shoved them to me, no thank you or anything.  The food was fine, but the service was beyond slow and they service was very rude. I will never go back to that location.    Whatever they get paid is too much.

35.description: UGHYou know that feeling when they get your order wrong over drive-thru...we  ordered the "Any 3 for 2" value -- 3 chicken cheeseburgers and 3 jalapeno burgers plus cheese sticks and onion rings.First it took so long to get our food, we put the car in park and turned the engine off.  Then on our way home of course when we'd already passed Peterson Ave going up Clark (it's TOO FAR to go back if you have to bust a witch) I looked in only to see four out of our six burgers... which were all.. regular burgers -- no chicken no cheese no jalapenos.  So BOTH the type and number were wrong!? TIGHT..  I was a little happy when I saw they'd thrown in some fries we hadn't ordered, then pissed when I found no onion rings and only a half a container of cheese sticks.So we stopped by Little Caesar's on the way up and picked up a hot-n-ready (sitting-around-all-day-under-heat) pizza, garlic bread, and buffalo wings.The next morning around 5 AM I threw it all up.  Hot-n-ready to give you food poisoning!

19.description: It seems almost every review I can find on here is about "eating sliders while flat drunk". Honestly much like anything it's all opinion. I personally love White Castle. However I eat here for food not because I was recently drinking.Burgers are tiny, but they're supposed to be... they invented the slider (I think). Onion rings are great, always crispy, chicken rings are tasty.

28.description: Bring back the garlic cheese sliders! Never had a sack or case I didn't like. They occaisionally get condiment orders wrong or put cheese on the wrong burgers but hey, a bad White Castle is better than a good average burger elsewhere.

45.description: Don't listen to the other reviewers, White Castle sliders own your life.

33.description: I can only eat this stuff twice a year.Thats right, twice a year. So disgustingly good and terribly bad for you! Thats why I like to wait for a special occasion to eat this slop, like if somebody from out of town comes to visit and they don't have white castle where they're from, we always have to make a stop here!I always start feeling an extra inch of squish on me after downing their sliders, chicken rings and fries. Processed food galore! NOM NOM NOMZ!They have unbelievably tasty sweet tea! It's even better than the sweet tea at McDonalds! It actually tastes like tea!Do not buy their frozen burgers from the grocery store. Its just not the same!

43.description: I only go to white castle after midnight, so this is directed at the late night staff.... but they're rude, slow, and the place is always coated in some sticky substance. I love white castle, I just wish the service was a little better.

2.description: My 3 star rating for White Castle is not just for their food. It's for the whole experience, and yes, my trip to White Castle was an EVENT.I have been to a White Castle exactly once before my visit to this location. It was either 1993 or 1994 and I was quite young. I cannot remember it so it's basically like I've never been. I have been driving by this White Castle for like 5 or 6 years, always wondering about it. I've become more captivated with it in the last several months. Finally I pulled the trigger.Last night, completely sober, midnight. It is time. Get in the car honey, we are going to god damn White Castle! My boyfriend warns me it's terrible and not to expect much. I'm not really expecting anything but I assume the food will at least be "fast food good" ......... The interior is exactly what you want out of W.C. It's faded and pale. The sticker logos on the soda fountain machine faded beyond recognition. The little "bar" of plastic lids is covered in so much suspect liquid and wrappers that I don't even want to set my soda cup down on it. The floors are sticky. The wall paper is sad and all the booths are faded and tired. Almost none of the tables are clean. The lighting is institutional, both too bright and too dark at the same time. It's maybe one of the most depressing places on earth. The patrons are even better. Either drunk or high or just totally bored white dudes, alone and slumped over, waiting for their meal. I imagine they have a game of Dark Souls paused at home. The pizza faced lad behind the counter is nice enough but clearly disgruntled. He calls out my order to some unseen cook several times with great annoyance, like he is certain he will get the order wrong (he does not). They seem backed up, they seem unprepared for the inevitable busy time that is midnight and later. At some point they call out with great distress that a tour bus is arriving. They are not ready. The food itself is mostly completely and unbelievably terrible. Like I said, I thought the sliders would at least be "fast food good", they were TERRRRIBBBLLLEEEEE. Cheese and salt couldn't even save these. I got 4 sliders in an effort to try "one of everything". Whatever that means since they have other slider flavors. They were all bad, maybe the cheese and bacon and cheese being the better of the four. I didn't realize HOW SMALL and thin the patties were. There is certainly no actual beef in these. Compressed and colored soy product with binder perhaps. Just so bad. I'm pretty sure they are cooked in a microwave, the amount of condensation on the buns making them so extremely soggy. I ate bits and bobs but could not finish any one of the sliders completely.Their crinkle fries were decent, most of them were crispy and they had good salt. Boyfriend ordered their mozzarella sticks. I will say these are good. Like surprisingly good, better than what I get a lot of pizza and pub restaurants. We didn't order the chicken rings which I regret as it will probably be another 20 years before I go to a W.C. again. We leave as the tour bus of drunk ass bitches descends. So while the food, specifically the sliders, is more terrible than I could have thought possible, the whole process was so perfectly White Castle that I have to give the whole experience at least 3 stars.

18.description: Love this place - especially after watching the movie!Get the jalepeno cheese if you need the spicy kick.Get the combo which comes with 4 sliders, fries, and a drink (goes well with the grape Fanta) for around $5.Please open up a store in San Diego!

41.description: I am a regular here, as I live a few blocks away. They are SO NICE to me, and they gave me extra food when some freak just walked in and took our order from the counter (where they hand it to you) when we were sitting down waiting for it to be called. They have a hi-larious sticker vending machine. I've gotten many a temporary tattoo here, and I've been saved many a hangover from the jalapeno cheeseburgers in large volumes.

52.description: This was the second time that i've ever been to a white castle and wasn't impressed (same as what happened the first time i was in one). With poor drive-through service, and burgers that tasted like chicken, french fries, and onions, it was left to be desired. The prices have also certainly increased since it's more mainstream now. Walking in to here made me feel kind of dirty, since it's not well cleaned. I'm just going to stop ranting.

50.description: I wouldn't eat White Castle all the time, but sometimes I am in the mood. However, this White Castle's service sucks. It always take forever to get even a simple order.

4.description: I see many visits here, after leaving work, if im hungry and don't want to cook. I love the chicken, and waffle sliders. Yummy!

6.description: Very Poor customer service! Extremely slow, received the wrong order, and when I addressed the that the diet coke out of the pop machine tasted like flat fruit punch, they didn't say sorry or anything!! I requested a chocolate shake instead, and instead of just giving it to me for the inconvenience, they said there is an additional charge and I'd have to pay the difference! Just giving my own experience here. My grade, a big fat F-!!

22.description: Sometimes you just have to have a couple of White Castle cheeseburgers. At least I do. This place is clean and maintained, but the service is pretty bad.

15.description: It's White Castle, you can't expect too much for the food itself. The employee who served me was plenty polite and helpful, but it was a complete sh*t show in the back. They were very overwhelmed, drive through orders were going to the wrong car, the wait to have my order taken was pretty long. The store manager was very crass and impolite to her employees and customers and did not want to hear anything that the shift manager had to say, causing extra confusion in the kitchen. Store manager was also doting over every employee and micro managing pretty hard. But the line employees were fantastic.

57.description: Although I have a distinct feeling that my burgers have been spat in once or twice...I LOVE WHITE CASTLE!! Oh the moist toilet paper meat consistency, oh the extra pickle's a inherit from my friend's who remove them from their sliders, oh...the explosive diarrhea that follows about two hours later. I still can't get enough! And crinkle fries are pretty awesome too. So if you've got your depends ready, you're adventurous, enjoy french kisses, you're on your way to trying a wonderful, moist slider that could fit in the palm of your hand.

20.description: Love this place - especially after watching the movie!Get the jalepeno cheese if you need the spicy kick.Get the combo which comes with 4 sliders, fries, and a drink (goes well with the grape Fanta) for around $5.Please open up a store in San Diego!

36.description: I found myself on the North side today, and having been to only one Asshole Castle in my life prior to today, I had to stop for a quick slider and order of chicken rings. First of all, I'm pretty sure the fellow working there was about 11, and the only person working. Isn't there some OSHA or labor law in place to prevent this? The kid was holding his own, but it still took 6 or 7 minutes to get through the drive thru. Second, the food was fucking rank, and I now realize why there aren't more WCs around. I felt ill for several hours after.  Third, what in the blue hell is a chicken ring? Am I actually supposed to believe there is a body part of a chicken that is perfectly circular and edible? Nevermind, I don't want to know.Harold, Kumar, your movie is a sham.

14.description: I eat at this location probably 3 times a month. It's one of my favorite after work late night stops. However tonight as I attempted to dine with my bike like 100s of times before I was rejected. This makes me so sad.  :( I guess I'll have to find a new home.

12.description: This place is what makes a neighborhood so great!  Passionately skilled owner, excellent quality at a value.  Personal touch, she focusses on her skills and won't compromise quality through expansion of services.  Very charismatic, too!

3.description: Ohhhhh yes. This is oldskool skincare with no frills. Lilliana's spa is a bit outdated in the decor department, yes. But I'm not going here for expensive decor and stylish surroundings. I'm going here for skincare, man, SKINCARE. She's not spending her energy on weird, tinkly new-age music and foofy, expensive (which get passed on the patron in those other places) surroundings, she's spending her energy on keeping her skills and going to classes to keep her certifications fresh.What this place is, is a comfortable haven in Andersonville. A secret spot that one will duck in to keep their skin glowing and gorgeous. It's as if your stylish grandma, who has perfect skin, is taking care of your skin, with Old World sensibilities. There's a reason why European women frequently look better than their US counterparts. They don't tan, and they take care of their skin with products that are NOT filled with petroleum derivatives. And they realize that the skin on their face extends all the way down to their cleavage. Yes. You must moisturize this ENTIRE area.The facial was blissful. And it went on forever. My skin looked fabulous after, and a week later, it still looks fabulous. I got her toner and moisturizer - her products are reasonably priced - and like them. I would like an ingredient list on the products, but there's probably a proprietary ingredient list thing going on here, as her products are ordered from Vienna. Ah, Vienna. She does bikini waxes for $25 - what?! I'll be back for those, and lymphatic drainage massage also. Gotta maintain the cleavage.I also got a lip wax (nice), but I won't get the brow wax again. I just don't like to wax my brows. Lilliana is a great woman, who knows her stuff. And the fact that she tagged me as ". . . you are more European than American!" Well, who doesn't like that?This is my skincare mecca, right in Andersonville.

1.description: I hesitated to write this review because both the positive and negative reviews about Lilliana are accurate and I'm not quite sure how to feel.A few weeks ago, I went in for a Brazilian (I am no stranger to brazilians). People are right, this is not a glamorous place, it looks outdated and not your typical "spa" environment. Lilliana is GREAT. I felt like I was chatting with my grandma. She has perfect skin and you can see she has worked hard to establish herself and create her business.She did a very thorough job with me and made sure I  was comfortable, relaxed and that I left feeling like I got my money's worth. I appreciated her banter and transparency as a small business owner.Here are the things that left me a little unsettled:1. Double dipping. She used the same stick the ENTIRE wax. I tried to tell myself it was fine, but couldn't help but wonder how many other coochies that stick had touched that morning....cringe.2. She doesn't wear gloves. She's old school and I respect that. That being said, you are all up in my lady bits. Put some gloves on.3. The wax was HOT. I told her it was too hot and she didn't do anything to change it. I get that you're trying to be time efficient, but if you're burning my lips off, I can't show them off when they are nice and hairless.4. She was drying a few blue towels that didn't look especially fresh or new on her dryer in the corner. A VERY similar blue towel that came out of NOT a drawer (aka was laying around) was used to wipe me down. Refer to point one for cringing thoughts.5. She put product on my skin without asking. I have very sensitive skin and I breakout thinking about putting a new lotion on without testing it out first. My booty still has irritation and I am 3 weeks out.She semi-pressured me into booking a follow up appointment and I can't decide whether or not to show up. I would need the above mentioned things to be changed for me to rate this experience any higher, and I have a feeling those things are not changing any time soon.

2.description: I can't believe I ended up here.  My regular person is on vacation so thought I would try someplace close to my house.  I also should have read the previous reviews a little closer.Although the owner is a super sweet woman, she really needs to update her practice.  I came here for a Brazilian and had the same unsanitary experience as a few others.  Double dipping which I didn't notice until half way through.  Wax was too hot.  Wiped me down with some unknown product.  Just such a gross and uneasy experience.  To top it all off, I ended up with hair bumps and a few small burns.

9.description: A great lady, and very accommodating to her clients.  I have a changing schedule and she is very good about last minute changes when I need to move an appt.  Works very hard- should be a millionnaire if it were based on merit and not going up against the flash and glam of chain places.  An actual real person in business for herself- this is what the American dream is supposed to be about.  She will treat you like gold and has very reasonable prices.  Go to Liliana.

10.description: Wow, wow, wow!Three years I have been going to Lilliana now. I am hesitant to tell you all, because she might become so over-booked she might not have time for me. She's the little hidden gem in Andersonville!She's the greatest. From the moment you walk in the door, she's "mother hen" to you--and your skin!Her face is the best example of what she does, and she does it well.I work for a hair and beauty education publisher--we publish the books that cosmetologists, estheticians and nail technicians get their licenses from. I accidentally came upon Lilliana after moving to Andersonville 3 years ago, while looking for a local facial place.  A friend and I come in there now, every month or so, because we like her work so much.Her facials are SO relaxing. It's a time when I can meditate and stop the busy and she has classical music playing.  She does three or so masks, depending on skin type and needs, does a hand treatment  and massage at the end at no extra cost. She zaps problem spots with Galvanic at times. Sometimes I get a brow wax, and she's very good at shaping brows.Lilliana is such a great "mother hen" she notices everything you do, and is very intuitive and cognizant about what makes her clients most comfortable.My skin has never been happier.:)While her environment isn't plush with water-walls and expensive stuff, her quality skin care far outshines the need for any of this, by leaps and bounds!If you would like quality skin care, at a reasonable price, check Lilliana out! You won't be disappointed!M, a Very Happy Client

4.description: Liliana is great. I've only had a couple of brazilians before this one. She knew I was nervous and made me feel comfortable. It was far less painful than the others I've had. She did a great job, I'm very pleased with it. At the end, she gave me a big hug. Too cute. In terms of service its a 5. Decor is outdated like others mentioned, but not a crucial element of the the experience in my opinion. You feel like you've been cared for when you leave, it's a nice trip-to-grandma's kind of feeling. The price was $50 which I felt was fair and comparable to others in the area. I recommend an early AM appt, I got it out of the way before work.

6.description: Hello health violations! I made the mistake of making a bikini wax appointment here several months ago and was horrified afterward that I may have contracted some sort of disease. The biggest offense was DOUBLE DIPPING into the wax instead of reusing a new stick every time. I'm spelling it out for those that have posted glowing reviews for this place because that is what is SUPPOSED to be done for sanitary reasons. Think about it. The wax/applicator stick is applied to the crevices of my lady bits and then repeatedly re-dipping into the same bowl of wax that is applied to YOUR FACE during your eyebrow or upper lip wax immediately following my appointment = GROSS!! Other lowlights of my horrendous experience was when she trimmed my remaining landing strip with likely unsterilized electric clippers and wiped me down after with scary possible community wash cloth? My mind was only left to wonder about cleanliness after the waxing. The only thing to make this place earn its one star Yelp forces is that Liliana is really nice and means well, but someone needs to clue her in on being sanitary. Hopefully this review will help.

15.description: I've been going to Liliana's for years for facials, waxes, and recently, eyelash tinting.  I am incredibly picky, growing up with a mother and aunts with flawless skin who also worked in salons and schooled me in skin care practices. For those used to downtown spas with a lot of "ambiance" - you won't find it here. It's quite simple. But you will find Liliana, who's own skin looks amazing for her age - which says a lot - and she also uses natural, European products, and is incredibly thorough with her work. Facials include neck/shoulder massage (albeit brief) and moisturizing hands in hot pads while she works on your face - I like that she doesn't use metal instruments for extractions, which leave scars. She also tells you what each mask or lotions does (which she changes, depending on what your skin needs). She's very committed to skin care, and will tell you what products are good and bad for your skin (even over the counter products). And the price is fantastic - she's very economical. I highly recommend her for those that value quality of services vs. ambiance.

0.description: Someone said "oldskool" and they were right. Love this place, and love Lilliana's chic-free vibe. She's just a down-to-businesswoman with a friendly, warm demeanor. And she does it all on her own! The certificates on her wall attest to her continuous training, and it shows. Lilliana is skillful and attentive, very thorough, and even offered a detailed finish. Don't expect glamor or glitz; this is a great place for busy women, it's in, done, out. And, when I get some extra money, I'm definitely going to try the facial!

5.description: I have received several services from Liliana over the past 6 months, including waxing (bikini, Brazilian) and facials. With each service, she exceeds my expectations. Liliana's prices are more than reasonable, especially for the big city. So many places charge you for the ambience or the music or the receptionist to snobbily greet you...you don't have any of that at Liliana's, and I prefer it! This no-frills atmosphere definitely does not mean you don't receive superior service from a woman who knows what she is doing! Liliana herself is pleasant, talkative to the point of distraction (which is a VERY good thing during waxing!), and happy woman who treats you with respect and earns yours in return. She's also adorable:) She is happy to book appointments on your schedule, and will accommodate reschedules as needed/she can. Once you develop a relationship with her, it's even easier to get an appointment. And she doesn't give you the hard sell on her house-made products...which are, incidentally, worth the expense. I have recommended Liliana to three of my friends, and they are each regular customers now. And I highly recommend her to anyone who would like good service at good prices...although you have to promise not to take my regular appointment slots!:)

13.description: Lilliana is wonderful. She treats you like a member of her family. I have been going to her for over 2 years. Her facials are wonderful and she has a gentle hand when it comes to waxing. She always is accomodating regarding my availability and her hours. The shop is nothing fancy, but her work is extraordinary.  Highly recommended.

11.description: I had my first facial today by Liliana and my skin feels very soft and plumped. I also got one of the moisturizers and toner that she recommended and I am planning on using them every morning and every night. I really like the smell of the products which is natural, reminding me of plants. We have both Romanian origins and we had the opportunity to chat and exchange impressions about living in the US. She is an example to me of a person that knew what she wanted in life and made it. She is super sweet also!

8.description: I just completed my lymph massage with Lilliana. It was relaxing. We talked about varies subjects unrelated to the massage, and I was completely okay with it. She's very wise. A good conversation in caring hands is a dime a dozen. I'll have her facial next. She ripped my eyebrow skin off with wax.

14.description: Another great facial from Lilliana!  This time I had my eyebrows shaped and coloered, she's an artist, I love them.  I promise you if you go to Lilliana you won't be disappointed.  If your going for a bikini wax she makes you feel so at ease and comfortable and she is a perfectionist when it comes to skincare.  I'v been going to her for over 8 years, all her clients are loyal to her, which proves alot.  She's old school and doesn't have a website, it's mostly word of mouth.  Her prices are so affordable, a complete facial (90 mins) is $ 70.00 (extra for glycolic ect..).

7.description: I cannot believe I am the first person to write a non-glowing review. I went here yesterday for a waxing and I hesitate to say it was terrible, but it was terrible. The environment is very weird. It's very dark and dingy. Not very spa-esque to say the least. She was in a huge rush. Like other places I've been, she did not seem to "review" her work at all. She did pluck a few additional brow hairs, but did not do anything additional around my lips. I looked in the mirror there and had to have her redo a section of my brows. When I got home, I noticed that there were many other strays. In addition to the sloppy job, she made several comments about my skin, which left me feeling pretty bad. I'm not sure if she was just "pushing her product," but I won't be going back.

58.description: Terrible!! The mozzerella  sticks tasted like they were from a frozen box!! The pizza was okay but the mushrooms on it were terrible. Overall poor quality. Highly disappointed!!

56.description: I ordered mediterennean salad, minestrone soup, chicken alfredo spaghetti. The salad was raw from the bags- old! Soup was ok- nothing special. Not homemade. Spaghetti- grilled chicken too dry, alfredo sauce was too wet and over heated, spaghetti- over coocked. The service was blah- no comment. This was my first time visiting this restaurant and it will be my last. I was not impressed at all. The restaurant is way too overpriced for the service and food they offer.

29.description: Honestly we tried it because the wait was long at Calo's and Lady Gregory so the no wait sold us. Well there's a reason there is no wait. I should have just gotten a pizza but I ordered the ceaser salad. It was a pile of romaine with some eggs and tiny croutons, no dressing on it. They serve a side of dressing on top of salad-unsanitary. And no Parmesan cheese... Why is this called a ceaser? It was gross. The server asked us how everything was at the very end. When dropping our check. Mediocre service wouldn't be considered friendly but not rude either just blah. I guess the problem for me was the weird menu and trying to figure out what exactly they are good at. Just a confusing weird-american-italian-pizza-I don't know...still confused:(

42.description: The service is decent. The food is way to expensive for what it is. I ordered eggplant which tasted like oil, over a bed of white spaghetti and white bread. I think it cost $14. I'd rather pay more for gourmet, special food.

23.description: My girlfriend and I went here for lunch. There were maybe four other customers. We enjoyed the atmosphere inside, however we did not feel the service was up to par compared to the other local eateries. The waitress didn't wait for us to arrive at the table, but just rushed to the table threw the menus down and left before we arrived at the table. We felt like our presence was interrupting her day. Perhaps she was just having a bad day. Our italian beef half-sandwiches took about 30 minutes to arrive on our table from the time we placed the order. The sandwich was tasty as well as the minestrone soup, but my girlfriend who opted for the vesuvio potatoes only had a measly two french fries that came on her plate. We thought it was a prank by the cooks. We had our hopes up, but we don't plan on returning here with all of the other fine options in the area.

47.description: Pizza is delicious here! I don't get some of the negative reviews about it being as greasy or heavy as Giordano's. Nothing is as bland or overrated as Giordano's.

8.description: First off, it should be noted that I actually enjoy the food here. The pizza is good, I've had a salad that I really enjoyed, and the calamari isn't too bad either. The pizza is best when eaten at your home, however, as the service is a damn catastrophe. The first visit, service was slow. Our server kept forgetting to bring flatware, and would walk by and say things like "Oh, they still haven't brought it for you!" as we sat there staring at our salads. Was it the busser's job and not his, even though he saw twice that we had no plates & no flatware? The table next to us was in the same boat. It was annoying, but just a little slow. Second visit: slow again. But worse. After receiving our beverages, our server left for quite a long time. At the same time, eight 9-year old boys descended onto the two tables behind us and were shouting, fighting over toys, jumping around, and even pushed one set of table & chairs into our table and chairs. One member of my party left to find our server, and I darted to the bar after having a table slam into my chair. It was like being at a Chuck E. Cheese, but without the band, and without having a child of my own drag me there. I explained to the bar staff the loud, obnoxious group of kids and they said they'd talk to their parents. I head outside, and a woman who I infer was a manager had come to take our order. I mentioned the situation with the unattended kids to her, and her reply was, "Oh, they're with the birthday party inside. They should be leaving soon." The look on my face must have not been great, because a moment later she added "would you like to switch tables?" We switched tables, carrying everything on our own...I actually had to ask her to move so I could pull up an additional chair so everyone could sit at the new table. Placed our order and food came at a slow but not terrible speed. Our calamari and pizza were quite nice, too. We had a little hiccup with payment, though that's entirely forgivable...just an unfortunate concurrence with the other events. A restaurant should not allow one party to infringe upon the enjoyment of another party. They failed to control the situation - a group of loud, unsupervised, poorly behaved kids - and as a result, what should have been a nice summer evening on a patio, was a chaotic, shrieking mess. The parents are as much to blame here as well, but the staff could have gotten the parents to control their children. Saying that "they're leaving soon" is not a sufficient response to a complaint about a group that is behaving in a manner that is not acceptable in any restaurant. I'll only order delivery from here on out because the concept of dine-in guests seems to strain this place.

31.description: RelaxingAtmosphere,Nicest staff.Always Loving the portions,Loving the taste,I will return to eat the hugeSpinach salad.Really, go hereOn your nextCraving for pizza.KristinSays.

34.description: So this review is based on their delivery experience versus dining onsite. Order was accurate and arrived timely. Changed it up this time and got the chicken noodle soup as a side...extremely salty so I won't be rolling those dice again. The main dishes are good size and the food is well prepared. I'm a little confused as to the two little pieces of bread provided, seems a bit conservative considering that it's unlimited on the restaurant. The dishes aren't cheap so a full order of bread would be appropriate. Maybe the driver got hungry??  Also no condiments provided for delivery. No butter, grated cheese, etc. Clearly delivery and take out orders is not their focus but these are basic things in my view. It's worth another star at least....

16.description: Very disappointed today. I love the pizza here and I've never had an issue but today we walked in its like the waitress was bothered by our presence. I guess they were setting up for a party/ wedding rehearsal but they still have to run a buisness. A family of 4 came in at 5pm and she basically told them i can seat you here but i need the table back by 615pm. Uhhhhh I wouldve just said no thanks and left. The mom seemed annoyed at it but they still sat down. I honestly was annoyed by then and told my kids to finish their food so we can go. I don't think I'll be returning anytime soon. Too bad because it's so close to our house.

13.description: Honestly we tried it because the wait was long at Calo's and Lady Gregory so the no wait sold us. Well there's a reason there is no wait. I should have just gotten a pizza but I ordered the ceaser salad. It was a pile of romaine with some eggs and tiny croutons, no dressing on it. They serve a side of dressing on top of salad-unsanitary. And no Parmesan cheese... Why is this called a ceaser? It was gross. The server asked us how everything was at the very end. When dropping our check. Mediocre service wouldn't be considered friendly but not rude either just blah. I guess the problem for me was the weird menu and trying to figure out what exactly they are good at. Just a confusing weird-american-italian-pizza-I don't know...still confused:(

11.description: First night in Chicago we really wanted pizza but since I eat gluten free we had to search a bit. I found this place an easy walk from our stay and although it was late and few people still there, they were welcoming and provided excellent service by a delightful server. We shared the gluten free pizza with quinoa crust topped with mushroom and onion and it was absolutely fantastic -- whoever makes that crust is to be commended (a local baker, I believe). GREAT pizza. I enjoyed the GF beer they had available - wish I could find it in NYS. My boyfriend liked the porter he ordered but was really surprised it came in a can. We had the spinach and artichoke dip as a starter but weren't all that impressed by the taste or consistency and the tortilla chips were fried and a bit oil. Enjoyed the place's atmosphere and lighting and would eat here again if Chicago were home.

39.description: I was torn between 2 or 3 stars--meh seems harsh but A-OK is a little generous.  What I like is a lack of pretension, it's a pizza place, nice outside area, not trying to reinvent the wheel.  Delivery has been on time and friendly.  Pizza's good not great,hits the spot and seems like they care.  Salads are definitely so-so,although the caprese we ordered was good--though it's hard to go wrong with that one unless you're using bad tomatoes/cheese.   It's too pricey for what it is, but the location is fantastic and the outside seating is lovely in the summer.  Servers are friendly and helpful.

37.description: I went there with my kids on a Saturday afternoon. The food was good , the staff was awesome and the price was great ! I will be going back for sure ! The minestrone soup was the best according to my picky 13 year old daughter !

0.description: By far my favorite pizza hands down! The thin crust and pan are the best. So happy to have a good family pizza place in the neighborhood.Also love the outdoor seating, it's so nice to stop on a walk with a stroller :) lots of room outside. Pup friendly too

38.description: They have a decent gluten-free menu, which is the reason we ordered from here in the first place as my wife is on a strict diet.I ordered a regular pizza for myself and thought it was pretty good, but way overpriced. My wife's gluten-free pizza was even more expensive, but that is typical for gluten-free products. We were disappointed that they didn't have the German Chocolate Cake available. It is listed on their online menu, but we were told they don't offer it anymore.I'm not sure I would really order from here again unless they offer some good coupons in the future. It's decent food, but not a very good value for what it is. If you aren't eating with somebody on the gluten-free diet I would definitely go elsewhere.

51.description: I typically order pizza for pick up and it's always been good especially since I like a thin crust. I would give the pizza 3.5 stars. Today was the first time I actually dined in since I had a groupon. The waitress was very attentive which was a plus (I was also only one of 2 tables). I ordered a drink, appetizer, and meal. The drink was good. The calimari was swimming in oil. It was as though they didn't drain it from the fryer or at least pat some of the grease out. My meal was the BLT with pesto which was pretty tasty. However, my side of sautéed spinach was again swimming in oil. I had to drain it and transfer to a side plate. All in all 3 stars for good service and drinks but the food is relatively subpar compared to other Italian in the area.

27.description: How this restaurant stays in business is beyond me. I have been to this restaurant a few times and even ordered delivery from there. My experience every time has been mediocre to downright terrible. I was having friends over for my housewarming party and decided to order pizza from this place. I called the day before and placed an order for 5 XL pizzas to be delivered at 6:30 PM. The pizza didn't arrive until 7:30 PM and it took several calls and reminders before they delivered. After I tipped the delivery person, I brought the pizzas inside and opened the boxes. Turns out, she had decided it was ok to not hold the pizza boxes horizontally on her way to my place. Result? The pizzas had slid to the side and folded up and left with a soggy folded down pizza mush. My whole dinner idea was ruined after spending $120 on these clowns. I will update this review with some pictures if I can find them on my phone. Last night I decided to give them another chance and went in for dinner with a friend. We were two people. When we ordered drinks, I was told that their wine was $6 per glass. We were billed $8 for the cabernet. The veggie pizza for two people came to $21.50 and I barely saw any cheese on it. The base was so soggy that we had to use silverware to eat the pizza. Using our hands was out of question. The waitress' attitude was so indifferent towards us it was as if she was too good for her job or something. Never going back to this place again. I am all for local businesses, but a circus like this needs to go.

32.description: This place is absolutely amazing.   Their extra thin crust blows every other place out of the water.  They have a Monday special, extra large, thin crust, one topping for $10.  They also have a slice and a can of soda for $4.  Service is always great!

54.description: The spinach salad was fresh and tasted GREAT- ask to add red onions. The bread, which was served warm, was also VERY good. Unfortunately, the thin crust sausage & onion pizza was just OK. The crust was crispy, but the pizza itself tasted bland, which was disappointing because visually it looked delicious. With so many other pizza options in/around Chicago, I would not go back to Ranalli's.

48.description: I ordered my food through Grubhub, it was good, fast, and I appreciate that.  One problem though ... the delivery driver is a liar and a thief.  When asked if he could break a twenty for me to tip him, he then says "Yeah" so I said "Take five out of that" (he deserves less if not nothing). He gives me a ten and then says "We good?"  First of all, no, we're not good.  Second of all, what the hell you take me for?  That is insulting and you work in customer service?   How dare you!   Now, at first I didn't notice until about 5 seconds in did I run back to my door to stop him and yelled that he short changed me.  He gets out of his car and says "I thought you said we were good".  I then said "Yeah, sorry but it doesn't hurt to double check and I thought we were".  I couldn't believe what he says next, the nerve of this punk, ... "I was going to give you the extra five but you said we were good".  In my face this kid says that.  Unbelievable.  Okay, you don't give somebody that ten knowing you owe more and then say "We good?" and without budging.  So it was my fault for not checking before he left but he bundled my ten to appear the amount was more.  Still, no reason to play your customers.   One, you lied and two, you're a thief, even if you didn't succeed - you attempted to and that is enough to make for a cheat.  That is disrespectful and a bad name to all good and honest drivers not to mention customer service to which I'm a part of let alone manage.  That kid is despicable - I would never hire him.He was I believe white/Caucasian - delivered my food a little after one this morning.

44.description: If you want mediocre pizza for a high price, then Ranalli's is for you.  ($20+ for a 14" one topping thin crust pizza? Come on!!!) If you want cold pizza, even if you live a block away from the place, Ranalli's is for you.  If you want a cold order of chicken wings even though you placed your order just 10 minutes prior to receiving them, Ranalli's is for you.  (had to have had an order that wasn't picked up so they decided to pass it off on me.....)  I swear I'll never go back!!!

24.description: Place was great. Nice atmosphere, server Keith was the bomb, pizza was def good, warm bread was amazing, and on Monday nights they have $3 craft beers and $10 large thin crust one topping pizza. Not sure what some of these people are complaining about. So don't listen to the impossible to please ignorants on here. Def a great spot, especially on Monday nights but it appears they have specials all the time.

7.description: Thank God we aren't at war. The service is slow. I don't blame the server, but the kitchen staff.  Four customers, two of them children, should not swamp the kitchen.I ordered the lunch special - Italian beef half sandwich, sweet potato nuggets and a glass of the house wine. My companion ordered a personal pizza.I'm a patient man. But nearly an hour for half a beef sandwich is almost justifiable homicide. The capper was bringing out my half sandwich loaded with cheese. I did not order cheese. Dairy is no Bueno. Another sandwich was sent back out.I came for a quick bite to eat. Thank God for the wine and the complementary bread with olive oil.

49.description: WE ordered from GrubHub and the food came right around the promised time. First of all the Calamari was out of this world good! I am a VERY picky calamari eater because so often it is like rubber. However, Ranalli's calamari was FANTASTIC. Also really good was the fried cod, cole slaw, and buffalo wings. The fries were lukewarm and were clearly made from frozen. Same with Mozzarella sticks. The spinach artichoke dip had TONS of chunks of veggies, but was very thin on sauce to hold it together. I could have used more seasoning as well. Overall, though the food was VERY good and I would order there again. One note was it was a little high for my price range, but portion sizes were very good and the good food was VERY good.

40.description: I come here almost everyday for lunch!  The staff is really nice and friendly.And you can get a big slice of pizza and can of pop for 4 bucks! The only turn off is that during the day,it's super dark in there. Kind of reminds me of a bar. You have the option to sit outside but it gets hot in the summer and if you wanna sit somewhere well lit and cool it's kind of bothersome. Haven't tried many of their dishes but I have no complaints. It's a decent establishment.

53.description: Boo! Don't bother! Just ordered a pizza and it was forgotten. Showed up to pick up the pizza and they misplaced the order. Once they got it we ended up with a burnt pizza with the wrong toppings. My sis called and they said it be would be over an hour to get a new pizza, really?? Agree with other reviewers too many other places to get pizza to deal with this bad service.

30.description: Just ordered via grubhub. They forgot ranch on a sandwich, hot peppers on the italian beef. The absolute worst italian beef I've ever had it was tasteless, I might as well have been eating cardboard.

46.description: My experience was different than other reviewers. I did not have a problem with service, everyone was very nice. My problem was the food. We ordered a pizza which was OK (I'm being quite generous) but the spinach and artichoke dip was an absolute joke. It tasted horrible enough that it should have NEVER been sent out. Like the location and the servers but we will not be back.

1.description: I missed pizza and caved (2x since my last post) figuring that now that I knew it was a rice flour base I'd just ration out the pie. Worked the first time thou It's thick and rubbery. Last order the ribs were cruddy, super dry. This order (and my last, for real this time) I ordered a full slab, only got half (which I just realized this morning cause I didn't open it yesterday). I got the wrong salad dressing and Peace out

55.description: Not a good experience. We ordered Gluten free pizza, gluten free garlic bread and a chopped salad.  The pizza was ok the sausage was good but when it was delivered it was cold.  The garlic bread was a joke!  We had 5 pieces of bread about the size of a silver dollar and paid 5.50 for it I asked for light butter and it was full of butter and very cold, cold enough that the butter got hard again.  I also asked for marinara which isn't provided and still didn't receive it.  Lastly the salad was pretty good but had about 1 table spoon of chicken and a very little toppings. We waited over an hour to get the order so you can imagine our disappointment when it arrived.

9.description: Ordered from Ranalli's for the first time tonight. Pizza was great. Wings were really good, but I should've ordered hot rather than mild. I'll know better for the next time we order. Delivery was fast especially for a Friday at 7ish. We will definitely be ordering from here again.

26.description: The music they play in the restaurant is great,  the service is great,  you get a bread basket and the butter it comes with is actually room temperature,  not freezing,  the food is delicious and the ambiance is really nice.  I am so picky and I love Ranallis! It's my favorite place to eat in Andersonville.

25.description: Again... Commenting on food and and preparation only (we get a lot of delivery). The grilled wings are amazing, always done to perfection! Only thing is that you must get them sauce on the side because they douse the wings in sauce which can be overwhelming. Make sure that you specify this over the phone. The grilled chicken tenders with the honey mustard are also awesome! The pizza is definitely sub par, the crust and the sauce are quite tasteless and when we got a pizza from here it was so under cooked we actually threw it in the oven for good measure. The delivery serviceis awesome, they come quickly, the food is also hot. If they ever make a mistake they correct it immediately and bring the correct item in flash time! Definitely a repeat for grilled wings delivery.

12.description: Again... Commenting on food and and preparation only (we get a lot of delivery). The grilled wings are amazing, always done to perfection! Only thing is that you must get them sauce on the side because they douse the wings in sauce which can be overwhelming. Make sure that you specify this over the phone. The grilled chicken tenders with the honey mustard are also awesome! The pizza is definitely sub par, the crust and the sauce are quite tasteless and when we got a pizza from here it was so under cooked we actually threw it in the oven for good measure. The delivery serviceis awesome, they come quickly, the food is also hot. If they ever make a mistake they correct it immediately and bring the correct item in flash time! Definitely a repeat for grilled wings delivery.

59.description: Has a good lunch special for $8-9 which includes a personal pizza. Their slices of pizza are cheap but if you order a whole pizza, can be alittle expensive.

21.description: Ordered from Ranalli's for the first time tonight. Pizza was great. Wings were really good, but I should've ordered hot rather than mild. I'll know better for the next time we order. Delivery was fast especially for a Friday at 7ish. We will definitely be ordering from here again.

17.description: MASSIVE PORTIONS! The best part is the quality isnt sacrificed to create those portions. My date and I went in a little late and after a massive party had just left. The server was tired but he was still on-point. He was attentive, provided suggestions, and never once told us it was time to leave (we accidentally stayed a little late). The food was wonderful, it's not an epic amazing meal but it is what it claims to be- good food. My food was perfect, my dates food was perfect which again was surprising considered that kitchen had just been slammed. I will return to this restaurant again, and if I could remember the servers name I would for sure give him a shout out!

10.description: Had the calamari I loved the excellent platter filled with equal amounts of rings and tentacles! I think their fryer needs to be at a higher heat though as they were mighty greasy. Why do people think that marinara sauce is the only thing to automatically serve with calamari? I personally like cocktail sauce or hot sauce. Greek salad big enough for two to share and quite tasty . Then we got the Ranalis pizza thin crust topping mushroom onion green pecker sausage and pepperoni.- veggies were next to raw making it a bit difficult to eat . Flavorful sauce and sausage by the time we got to the last pieces crust was soggy and not crisp like at the start .
