Possible precooking vegetable toppings would eliminate some juices soaking through . I'll return tho as it was good pizza . Service was okay

5.description: OMGeeee! Where to start.. Umm.. Well, everything is amazing here! If I could eat here everyday I would!

3.description: Awesome place!! Order pizza frequently with the occasional appetizer. We have waited a bit when we've dined in (they were really busy) but their delivery service is fast.

35.description: Thank God we aren't at war. The service is slow. I don't blame the server, but the kitchen staff.  Four customers, two of them children, should not swamp the kitchen.I ordered the lunch special - Italian beef half sandwich, sweet potato nuggets and a glass of the house wine. My companion ordered a personal pizza.I'm a patient man. But nearly an hour for half a beef sandwich is almost justifiable homicide. The capper was bringing out my half sandwich loaded with cheese. I did not order cheese. Dairy is no Bueno. Another sandwich was sent back out.I came for a quick bite to eat. Thank God for the wine and the complementary bread with olive oil.

19.description: I have been hosting my monthly Business Networking Lunch 'n Learn here for years!!   I was looking up the address for someone and I saw that they have 3 stars - how sad!  I can not even tell you how many times I have eaten here and it is always wonderful.  When I started the group we went to another place in Andersonville and they were SO happy when I changed to Ranalli's.  Besides the great pizza and salad, Ranalli's gives us the whole place for my event - to help the community at NO Charge!!   After I had held the event at Calo's for two years - the owner decided I needed to pay for the space!  They wanted Hundreds to use their space and I am NOT kidding!!  They have Gluten Free desserts and Pizza too!  I highly recommend Ranalli's - Jennifer has made it warm and cozy - they even have a fireplace!!!

28.description: I forgot why I don't ever order from this place.  If you want over priced pizza that looks and tastes like cardboard, then this is your place.  I will remember not to order from here next time.

45.description: Slow service on a warm evening. Wasn't so slow on a Sunday afternoon visit we made though. Both times ordered pizza and both times left happy! The pan pizza has a delicious crust. The sangria is okay. Loves the pesto chicken pizza and the florentine. The grilled veggie was almost as delicious also!

33.description: Ordered there specialty Greek was blown away at how good it was. Such the perfect combination of tastes. I will deff get again.

43.description: My 1st time to eat here together with my daughter.  I ordered the Ranalli House Special, my daughter had Meat Ravioli. Both dishes were tasty a decent amount for a hungry person. Our server Keith was awesome, he made good suggestions. Service was fast and they were full. I will surely come back.

2.description: I called these folks to pick up a panzerotti.  I was craving one from Amato's out on Harlem Ave.  It was good, but not Amato's good.  That's OK because it's like asking someone to copy the Mona Lisa!The Pizza the other folks were eating looked fantastic!  Thin with well-done cheese.  Just my kind of thing.  Can't wait to go back and try it!

18.description: RelaxingAtmosphere,Nicest staff.Always Loving the portions,Loving the taste,I will return to eat the hugeSpinach salad.Really, go hereOn your nextCraving for pizza.KristinSays.

41.description: We had stopped by here once for a slice of pizza and decided to stop back for actual dinner this past week. The restaurant itselfIs nice. Casual but tasteful. We ordered the bruschetta and breadsticks to share, which were good...typical for a casual Italian place. My fiancé got the pasta with bolognese sauce and I got the eggplant parm. Again, not bad. The sauce was flavorful. If you want to go somewhere for a basic pasta dinner or pizza then this is an ok spot. Service was quick and friendly. May be back.

52.description: A neighborhood standby.  Until this weekend, I had only stopped for a greasy slice on my way home from long nights on the town.  I went with two friends on Valentine's evening without a reservation and had a good time.  We waited for about 20 minutes for a table, but the manager (?) made sure we knew where we stood on the waitlist, a nice touch.We ordered:- mozzarella sticks (for the simple reason that I hadn't had them in years), which came in a huge order or 10 or so-spinach artichoke dip - the dip is less creamy than usual, but was tangy and came with delicious house fried chips-Italian beef pizza on deep dish crust - we ordered this because none of us had heard of italian beef pizza.  It was good but not amazing.  A little light on the beef was one of the comments at the table.  The deep dish is not what you typically think of in Chicago, it was crusty and not greasy.  Thin would have been my choice, but such are the compromises you make in a group.Our server seemed to be the only one in the restaurant, so she was run ragged.  She was very friendly and apologetic for the wait, but we assured her we were in no rush.  She even gave us free gelato after our wait!  Of note: their sangria is delicious and I will definitely come back for some in the summer!

50.description: My girlfriend and I ordered pizza from here about a month ago via grubhub and I am not a big fan of giving bad reviews  on yelp but it was just so bad I have to share.We ordered a Buffalo chicken pizza  for me and a gluetin free pizza for my girlfriend. The total is $44, ridiculous. It took 1:45 to be delivered and was freezing cold when it got here. The only way the pizzas could have been as cold as they were is if they were left in a freezing cold car for a extended period of timeNow for the quality of the pizza, they should be ashamed of their product. The pizza was thin and tasteless. They skimped as much as possible on the toppings and it seems they use the cheapest ingredients they can find. We ate 3 piece toll between the two pizzas and then ordered elsewhere. When we called to complain we were offered credit for a future purchase which we refused, why on earth would we want this experience again? After some time trying to get our money back we finally conceded to the store credit. Needless to say, it has never been used.We will never order from or visit them again and you would be wise to do the sameBest of luck Ranalli's, you're certainly going to need it

4.description: How this restaurant stays in business is beyond me. I have been to this restaurant a few times and even ordered delivery from there. My experience every time has been mediocre to downright terrible. I was having friends over for my housewarming party and decided to order pizza from this place. I called the day before and placed an order for 5 XL pizzas to be delivered at 6:30 PM. The pizza didn't arrive until 7:30 PM and it took several calls and reminders before they delivered. After I tipped the delivery person, I brought the pizzas inside and opened the boxes. Turns out, she had decided it was ok to not hold the pizza boxes horizontally on her way to my place. Result? The pizzas had slid to the side and folded up and left with a soggy folded down pizza mush. My whole dinner idea was ruined after spending $120 on these clowns. I will update this review with some pictures if I can find them on my phone. Last night I decided to give them another chance and went in for dinner with a friend. We were two people. When we ordered drinks, I was told that their wine was $6 per glass. We were billed $8 for the cabernet. The veggie pizza for two people came to $21.50 and I barely saw any cheese on it. The base was so soggy that we had to use silverware to eat the pizza. Using our hands was out of question. The waitress' attitude was so indifferent towards us it was as if she was too good for her job or something. Never going back to this place again. I am all for local businesses, but a circus like this needs to go.

6.description: Wow. If you want cold and REALLY crappy pizza, this is the place for you. I you goto Walgreens and buy a frozen pizza, it might have better quality ingredients. The sausage on the pizza, whatever owner or chef thought this is good frozen pizza nuggets, a hot pocket is better. Supposed to get beef barley soup got a jug of Marinara. Avoid

22.description: Very disappointed today. I love the pizza here and I've never had an issue but today we walked in its like the waitress was bothered by our presence. I guess they were setting up for a party/ wedding rehearsal but they still have to run a buisness. A family of 4 came in at 5pm and she basically told them i can seat you here but i need the table back by 615pm. Uhhhhh I wouldve just said no thanks and left. The mom seemed annoyed at it but they still sat down. I honestly was annoyed by then and told my kids to finish their food so we can go. I don't think I'll be returning anytime soon. Too bad because it's so close to our house.

15.description: They have a nice friendly staff and good food . I always look forward to there pizza the bartenders are excellent

57.description: I just ordered pizza (sausage) and their chicken barbeque for delivery - just a few minutes ago.  It just arrived ... and lo and behold the pizza was cold and the chicken didn't have the side dish - cole slaw and salad.  It was my first time to order from them and it will be my last.   They totally failed to satisfy a first time customer and so I am going to stay away from them.  They'd better get their act together.  I am sure they are good and all others have great reviews about them, but not from me and my household.  It was embarrassing because I had a guest.

20.description: Went in for a late lunch around 3pm, service a bit slow as there were only 2 tables including myself; ordered lasagna and a side salad. They have amazing Italian dressing would totally buy this in a bottle but the lasagna its self was mediocre at best. I think they substituted mozz for all the other cheese in lasagna? Just strange wouldn't order again. Did get dessert and their tiramisu was really good so maybe just stop in for dessert?

36.description: Ranalli's has been a go-to place to me for years now.Prior to cutting my gluten intake, I would be at their window grabbing a slice more times than I care to admit.Ranalli's has had gluten free options way before most of the other pizza joints caught on.  Lucky for me, when I discovered I needed to cut the gluten, I did not have to cut out my Ranalli's.For me...it's all about the sauce.  The Ranalli's sauce is simply outstanding.  And they now have 2 gluten-free options.  Their traditional gluten-free as well as a quinoa crust.  I tend to eat the quinoa crust at the restaurant and when I order delivery, I get the traditional gluten free as I notice it seems to travel better.Their gluten free desserts and cookies are also delicious.  I sometimes pop in just for dessert.

14.description: I always get pizza extra thin crust pepperoni ! Specially with their Monday's special !

3.description: Very nice first experience.  Great atmosphere, clean and very friendly.  And the Wasabi wrap was delicious.  Yummy and more health-oriented than most places in the neighborhood.

1.description: I stopped in with a friend because a another friend had recommended I check it out, mainly because I am a health nut. So, I stopped in Sunday and it's the first time I have ever walked into a coffee house and felt like I was also in a supplement store, I then turned to the staff and asked "what's the concept here?". The person replied that the owner's take was to create a healthy/fitness minded cafe so, I thought to myself .. "that's cool" and I was a bit excited.So, I was pretty disappointed to find, if the concept was suppose to be truly a healthy alternative to the other multiple coffee houses in the area, why not offer organic milk options and why even offer soy, since it's one of the the unhealthiest things both men and women can consume to due to its effect on Estrogen levels; there are much better options is Almond or Coconut milk and your competitors down the street are offering it.The decor was nice and the staff friendly but, if this place is truly trying to differentiate itself from the all the other coffee houses with a health/fitness spin then that message needs to be pretty clearly communicated and the products served need to back up that concept with organics and choices; do that and I will gladly walk past the other coffee houses to come to yours.

2.description: Stopped by shortly after their grand opening. The staff was incredible friends and knowledgeable. I thought the food was delicious and very well executed. The Metropolis coffee they brew was a great accompaniment to my salad. Great spot to get work done away from home. They also sell protein and supplements! This place has it all!

0.description: A friendly neighborhood spot with a diverse pantry of goodies. If you lift, you can get your protein powder fix! Also, there is delicious local Metropolis coffee and even salads/wraps. Congrats to my good friend for making his dream come true.

58.description: Hmmm...I'm a fuller-figured girl, but I usually have no problem finding clothes that fit at Presence. Maybe it's just luck of the draw? Anyway, I love this place. Their jewelry is unique, fun, and pretty darn reasonable price-wise. I found an awesome James Dean bracelet that I have yet to see on anybody else and I love their selection of winter hats, gloves, and scarves. Plus there are nice gifts to buy for your friends and family! Oh, and the staff is super friendly. I've never had an unpleasant experience at Presence, though I was heartbroken this afternoon when I found I couldn't afford this cute, vintage-y dress.

56.description: I used to go to Presence every time I needed a dress...lately I have been a little unimpressed with their stock, but I'm hoping Spring brings some wonderful things! This is my favorite place to buy jewelry.  It is inexpensive and they have some really unique pieces.

29.description: They have a Frequent Buyers Card.  Thank heavens. I spend a ridiculous amount of time and money here, haha. I work at a salon down the street, so Presence is my go-to spot for a time-killer between clients, and I can ALWAYS find some accessory I must incorporate into my life immediately. This might be silly, but I also adore the window displays and sidewalk sign (someone there is clearly quite artistic). Clothes are trendy (slightly hipster in a good way/bohemian but not hippie/farmers market with a little basket and big hat kinda style) and inexpensive for the most part, with some costlier items, which of course are the ones I like best :(, but I haven't seen anything over $80 in there. On average, I'd say a dress is about $35ish. Not much for clubwear or officewear, if that's what you're into, but I love it for the big and always-changing selection of summer dresses, party dresses, floaty blouses, hats, scarves, and jewelry.  It's a big store but always tidy and attractive. I have trouble with the fit of many of the dresses, but that's a problem I have with clothes pretty much everywhere, and since they are fairly inexpensive here, I don't mind doing a little sew-job on 'em at home. The girls who work here are all really nice and helpful, but not TOO helpful ::coughcough-pushy-coughcough::, as is often my experience at Akira down the block. Fitting rooms are tidy and there's a big mirror for you to twirl around in front of, which I enjoy. I approve of the music selection too! Brava, girls!

42.description: They clearly have the same suppliers as retailers like Forever 21 or Discovery with prices more like Gap.  You can tell by the seams and fabric that they are over-pricing low-quality, factory made clothing.  The styles are cute, however.

23.description: I happened upon this cute little shop while looking for vintage shops.  They have tons of cute accessories, jewelry, tights, gloves, hats, tops, and dresses.  They had the cutest red dress in the window, but their dress prices were a little steep ($52 for a short, cotton spaghetti strap dress) for me to try it on.  Accessories and gifts are well priced though.  My favorite were the cheeky vintage scenes on their girly flasks!  Worth a visit if you're in the area.

47.description: I believe that I was a bit harsh in my previous review.  Granted, I'm still not a fan of the clothes per se, but I can say that I love their accesories!  I'm a scarf fanatic and was able to pick up some real nice ones for less than 10 bucks a pop!  Add to the list their beautiful purses, earrings and necklaces on TOP of the stellar sales staff I am quite happy to eat my words.Good job Presence!

8.description: My girl in to visit from DC and I happened upon this place as I was showing her Andersonville, as she has sen enough of South Loop. Since it was her birthday, I bought her a purse she eyed while she was on the changing room. She also tried on several dresses and we selected one. All in all, it started as a good experience. However, she flew back to DC later that evening and, while in the airport, the zipper broke. Upon her return to Chicago two weeks later, we made the trip back to Andersonville to return it. Turns out, the manager insisted she only could give us store credit because the purse had "been used" and they didn't believe the manufacturer of the one day's use zipper would take the purse back. Given that my girl lives in DC and I in South Loop, I asked for a refund thinking it would be more practical. Having insisted on store policy and taken my contact information for the owner to call me, we left. Well, the owner never called. While I'm not much of a shopper, my girl liked the store and the folks working there were helpful enough. That said, I think a purse lasting only one day is more than a little sketchy and I'd be reluctant to buy anything from there again....not to mention their attitude when in fact it's discovered they indeed sold a lemon. I just hope my girl's dress doesn't rip the first time she wears it.4 for style, 3 for service (overall) mitigated by 0 for dubious quality.

31.description: The only way to stop me in my tracks en route to Hopleaf is to tempt me with one bad ass window display. And Presence successfully lured two thirsty girls right on in!If I had to draw a comparison, I'd call this store the bastard lovechild of L.A.'s Kitson and unisex retailer darling, Urban Outfitters. The boutique is filled with boho fashions, indie jewelry, inexpensive accessories and eclectic gifts. From kitschy bathroom reads (the art of kissing, anyone?) to a cheeky vintage-styled condom case, just about anything and everything lives in this little shop of charm.Looking for a long, summery frock? Presence has them. They corner the casual dress category like a champ, rounding out their selection with a nod to business casual and nighttime looks as well. The prices? Surprisingly low. Presence, you've got presents. And your presents have presence, too.

34.description: I think I may be over Presence.  There has been a perceptible decline in the quality of their clothing over the last few years.  I don't mean fabric or cut - but rather, style.  This store has always excelled when it comes to cute, librarian-meets-hipster pieces.  But I have gone from buying most of my clothes here to averaging about one or two items per year (and I live a block south of it, so trust me, I'm around often).  Everything they sell looks dowdy and old-fashioned...old-fashioned in a bad way.  Who is selecting their inventory now?  Sometimes I just want to call them and offer myself up for hire.  There were so few stores in Chicago like Presence, and it makes me sad to see that they are no longer one of the best places in town.

16.description: I needed a new work wardrobe that consisted in tight black pencil skirt and Black button down top. I was only blocks away from this place after getting my haircut and I decided to give this spot a try. As soon as I walked in, I was gretted by a sales associated who asked if I needed any help looking for things. When I told her what I was looking for, she was very helpful and found me a skirt and two tops. Then I went into the dressing room to try them on. As I was changing, she handed me 3 more tops and a blazer with two more skirts! She patiently waited for me as I tried on different combos and gave me her opinions on what she thought was flattering. I overall found her to be very helpful and honest and Attentive to my needs and tastes and budget. I also found a lot of affordable items in there as well. A lot of the items were between $25 and $30, and very stylish.I usually hate shopping, but this experience has left wanting more! The cashier was very nice also.

13.description: This place sucks.  They have some cute items but the quality of everything is TERRIBLE.  I tried to return a dress today because there was a flaw in the fabric.  I had just bought it there last week and still had the tags but because I lost the receipt, they would not even let me make an exchange.  I bought it on a credit card and they could access that information but they didn't want to bother with it.  They could care less about return business.  I will not be shopping there again.

11.description: So incredibly cute! Great quality clothing, too. The staff is friendly and helpful, especially when trying to decide between options!

39.description: I absolutely love this place.  I always find a number of cute, unique options no matter what I went in searching for.  Prices are reasonable, especially considering the neighborhood.I've never had issues with quality here, and the staff is friendly and not at all pushy.  I like a very hands-off approach when I'm shopping for casual clothes, so Presence is perfect.  If you like more attention when you shop it might not be the place for you.

37.description: I was in Andersonville with a girlfriend after brunch this past Sunday, so we stopped in here on our stroll down Clark.  There are a variety of delicious fashion finds here, and I saw one sweater in particular up on a mannequin that I knew I had to have. I searched for the same sweater on a rack, but it was a size larger than I would normally wear. I asked a sales associate if she could check the size on the mannequin and pull it down if it was the right size. Once she had done so she gave me the thumbs-up - it was indeed a size small. After waiting in line for about six or seven minutes I was helped and rung up, and the associate apologized for the wait. No problem!A nice little extra was that there was apple cider up front for customers/visitors. My girlfriend and I left with a cup of warm cider in each of our hands.

0.description: The girls that work here are always super friendly and helpful, never pushy or annoying. Fair prices, nice selection. Love their accessories too.

38.description: The ladies who work at Presence must know that if I walk into their store, I must have something going on that very night, probably in just a few hours, and I want--no, NEED--to throw an outfit together ASAP.  A sampling of the occasions that have brought me to Presence:-A fancy fundraiser gala-My birthday-A job interview-Halloween-The premiere of a movie I directed-A big date-A Yelp party! :)No matter what, each time, the ladies at Presence help me out. I grab armfuls of clothing, they patiently organize them for me, and then I try on and on and on and on. Whenever I need an opinion, they've got an honest one for me and maybe even an accessory to boot.The garb here ranges from inexpensive and lovely (the brand Tulle is a personal favorite) to cheap and poorly-made (think dress that looks like a nightie). The trick is just to know the quality of the clothing you're trying on, not expect that synthetic material to last forever or find the items that are a bit on the higher end of Presence's stock and know they'll be your buds for a longer time.I have had the occasional extremely frustrating purchase where a garment feels particularly worn after one night out or washing, but these have been rare disappointments. Their $35/purchase punch card is a relatively good deal if you come here often enough, and decent coupons arrive in my email inbox regularly. But overall, it's the proximity and variety of clothing I find at Presence that keeps me coming back.

51.description: I'm a size 10 and rather busty.  Finding clothes is very hit and miss.  Everything looks much different on me than it does on the mannequin.  A lot of cuts that are meant to give shape to a skinny girl look awkward on someone bigger and curvy.  Clothes that would be cute on someone small can look sloppy/slutty on me with cleavage hanging out.  And forget about spaghetti straps, tube tops, or anything off the shoulder/strapless/backless. I need a serious bra, or I'm sagging halfway to my waist.  Now that I've given you too much information:I LOVE PRESENCE.  I've been going to this store since it was in the Evanston location.  I can go in, pull five size large dresses off the rack, go in the dressing room, and BAM, everything fits and flatters.  I swear they must have a buyer shaped like me.I'm stingy with shopping for clothes.  I shop at Forever 21 (cheap girl heaven), buy $20 jeans from a thrift store, and only hit Victoria's Secret during the semi-annual sale.  Today at Presence I got 2 tops and 3 dresses for $130.  Not bad for awesome clothes that I love and will wear again and again.  I have a pair of black pants from Presence that I've been wearing for 10 years now.Some poster mentioned that their clothes fall apart.  Wash them on the delicate setting, you guys.  Oh, and learn how to sew enough to fix a button or a ripped seam.  It's not that hard.

27.description: We were walking along Clark and I saw a cute striped dress in the window and had to check it out. I had walked in here thinking it was a vintage store but quickly learned it was a new retail store. I saw sale racks and immediately gravitated towards them. Lots of cute dresses and skirts, tops and pants for the hip modern city girl. I found a sweater and an awesome dress. Since it was sunny I bought a pair of $5 sunglasses and since it was cold I bought a $6 scarf. I found a cassette tape ring for $8 that gets me compliments everywhere I go. They have a pretty impressive selection of jewelry ranging from large metal chandelier earrings to wood carved necklaces. I spent quite a large amount of time in that section. I didn't make it to the other side of the store which housed full priced items. I'm cheap and am only looking for the sale rack but what I glanced at I found to be very stylish wears. Presence was a fun store with a great amount of sale items. The clothing was fun and geared toward a young on the go crowd.

32.description: I used to live a few blocks away and loved going here regularly... Now I have to find an excuse to swing by :)For me, this is a total hit or miss place in terms of clothes, but I can ALWAYS find several accessories I like that are reasonably priced.  Sales staff was super helpful when I was trying stuff on, suggesting accessories to match things I was trying on. I would be sure to look at what you are buying for clothes! I always inspect the seams, buttons, etc to be sure that my latest finds will last. I like the Tulle brand they carry, I have several shirts of theirs. Prices here can vary a lot, for the basics go somewhere else. I go for cute shirts and dresses. They  have the punchcards and also a clearance section and some good sales... The latest was 15% off all dresses.Definitely go for accessories, inspect clothes!

54.description: :Presence has a very bad return policy.  I bought a very cute jacket as a Christmas gift for my mother and they refused to exchange when it did not fit.  I bought the jacket on "Andersonville Night" in December and returned it within a few days after Christmas.  They insisted it was not within the 2 week time period needed to exchange an item.  The jacket was still in perfect shape.  I do think that Presence has very nicely styled clothing but with over inflated prices and poor customer service I cannot recommend them.  Do yourself a favor and get the same clothing at a much lower price at Hit or Miss.

48.description: I used to hate clothes shopping. I never knew what my style was and I had no idea what "looked good" on me. My friend and I decided to explore Andersonville when she moved to the neighborhood and we decided to meander into Presence. I am now a fan of clothes shopping.This store is huge and has a vast collection of cute, unique clothing. I love the indie, creative shirts and the beautiful dresses. Presence is affordable and the clothes range from casual to classy. They have a huge selection of accessories and fun jewelery. I had no idea how to clothes shop until I came to Presence. Awesome, different styles and nice, friendly staff.  Just walking past the window will draw you in.

44.description: Is there another word for 'meh' that can adequately describe the distinct, bored feeling of mehness? Indifferent, uninterested, apathetic, unmoved, or mediocre, perhaps? Those would all work as pertains to Presence and its stockpile of poorly made women's clothing and discount accessories. Yep, can ya tell, this store just did not do it for me. Granted, I'm all for bargain boutique-type shopping and love a deal, especially when it comes to dresses, but when you can't find just one darn dress to fit in a sea of zillions, it's disappointing and then some. Everything I pulled from the racks to try on looked cute and sassy to the eye, but fit like a slapdash, irregular, big 'ol heap of wrong. Uneven hems, itchy fabrics, see thru materials desperately in need of lining... just cheap, cheap, cheap (hi there, baby bird). The best find at Presence seemed to be their on-trend bags (hobo, slouchy, grommeted), fedoras-a-plenty and a bunch of fun boho mix 'n match chunky jewelery and baubles. The rest? Unsuitable for this dress diva. Pass on Presence.

24.description: I used to shop here when it was on Clark and St James across from the Lincoln Park Market.  It was such a great little place and the staff was always friendly and helpful.  I was so sad when it left the neighbor hood and I have never made it to the new location.  Recently a friend was talking about the store and I am just thrilled to know that it's still around.  I still have a messenger bag that I bought back in 2000 or so, that my now husband uses... had I known then...I would have bought two!  I can't wait to go shopping:-)

7.description: The lack of service from this store disappointed me.  I'm not sure if I wasn't approached because it A) didn't look like I needed help, B) was with my boyfriend or C) if I didn't look like the type of person who would shop at this type of store.  Either way, I wasn't even greeted when I entered the store on a Saturday afternoon.  The employees appeared to be busy socializing as opposed to greeting me, telling me about the sales, etc.With regard to the merchandise, the items I looked at looked pretty nice and appeared to be well priced.  I didn't find anything to buy through so I left empty handed.The real kicker was that they said bye to us, but didn't say hello.  What a turn off.  I do not think I will be returning no matter how cute the items looked.

49.description: This place is great !! Just a few block north of the whole sale district and right across from Ann Sathers so you can make a day out of it !They have lots of cute dresses and some accesories too, I found a few things there that I had just seen the day before at Akira. Interesting. They have some things that are more cheaply made but a lot of things were very well made with nice fabrics.The sales clerks were all very attentive an friendly !!

40.description: I've bought several sweaters here over the past couple of years, and also just recently bought my winter jacket here.  The prices are hit and miss.  I might see a really cute sweater, look at the price tag, and YEEKS!--it's $150!!  Although there are plenty of other clothes there that are in the $20 - $50 range, which is definitely more my speed.  It is really nice that they have very unique clothes, and you'll walk away with something special.  I haven't had any problem with the quality of the clothing here.  Everything that I've bought here, I still have and wear pretty regularly more than a year later.  I'm excited to have bought my winter coat here this year, because I feel confident that it will actually hold up through the season.Their jewelry and accessory selection is also wonderful, and if I had to guess, I think that's where they really make their money.

53.description: Presence has an amazing selection of jewelry and accessories, but I find the clothing to be mostly overpriced. The other problem is the sizes run on the small side. I'm not plus size, but I'm also not super petite and I find it really ridiculous that the average woman is excluded. Their merchandise tends to be on the trendier side, but you can find some classic pieces. They also have a nice selection of lovely handbags and hats. They do have a sale rack in the back, but it tends to be out-of-season merch. This is a cute store to browse, but it might be limited if you're looking for something really specific.

30.description: A lovely shop with a great selection and decent prices.  Look for the laser cut wood earrings - there's a huge selection of them, and they're very unique and beautiful.

46.description: Andersonville is definitely not shopping territory but with the little boutiques they really are a treat. I bought my favorite pair of sunglasses on sale for 10 bucks along with a cute top for 20.Not all the prices are wallet friendly but the selection varies in color, sizes, and a lot of "one of a kind".The staff is very informative and there's a little bit of everything from purses, to belts, tops, and shoes.

1.description: Everyone was friendly and helpful. They have super cute stuff at reasonable prices! And a couch for the boyfriends to sit! I walked out with four items and spent less than $100. I'll definitely go back next time I'm in town.

55.description: Again, this is more a 3.5-star review than a 4, but Yelp doesn't provide half stars.I like Presence. I look forward to the days I have to rehearse at the Swedish American Museum or go to the Brown Elephant or get groceries at Jewel and Edgewater Produce because it's always an excuse to swing by.To me, their clothes are skewing younger and younger. And so are their employees, who care more-than-slightly. I definitely picked up a few things here a year ago that wouldn't be found on their shelves today, so I guess they found their prime audience of 15-23, although, I believe, their prices don't align with that market. Cheaply made coats in today's styles for $88. That's ridiculous! And although I'm pretty small, I do mostly wear a small or medium here, which means other girls probably can't shop here at all.But if you need a funky coat, scarf, purse, accessory -- they have it. If you want a long-sleeve tee you could get at Old Navy? They have it. If you want a quality dress, they definitely don't carry that, but their assortment of funky dresses is always changing, so someone must not mind spending $45 on patchwork pieces of junk.Like Tomato on Belmont, the stuff seems to last 1-2 wearings. Yeah, not optimal. But I want to be clear: Though Presence is trying to compete with H&M, Urban Outfitters and even Anthropologie for the girl with less in her pocket, if you're going to spend $40 or more on something cute, either get it from Buffalo Exchange and get it cheaper used, or spend the money at Urban Outfitters to ensure you can at least get a season out of it.As for my sunglasses, my metallic-printed tee, my copper/gold/silver metal-studded bracelet: These get me compliments, and I got them all on sale. Each for under $10. And that's how I prefer to do Presence.P.S. Sign up for their mailing list and get coupons every month for $5 or 15% off. I got a bracelet for $5 this way, and I wear it out AND to work. Make your money work for you, girls!

9.description: This is possibly my favorite clothing store in Chicago. I never fail to find something I like here. The clothes are not all great quality, but they are always super cute and fresh, and for the most part they are fairly priced. Staff members are always helpful and attentive without being overbearing. I like that their stock changes frequently - I have fun coming in and browsing every few weeks when I'm in the neighborhood. My only issue is quality of merchandise - I've had a few things rip or fall apart or lose their shape after not much wear - but that's to be expected with anything under $50, I guess. Definitely recommended!

26.description: Cute pieces! Helpful Staff (Stephanie, the manager, is the best!) And really unique jewelry.  I have come here to find dresses for all sorts of occasions.  I love their belts and scarves too! While some of their stuff is not made for girls with boobs, it's worth the small dig.  I have also found great basic pieces too that go well under all sorts of things.  Come here if you need something cute in a hurry.  You're sure to find at least a dozen (really reasonably priced) things here that you NEED to add to your closet ;)

25.description: I've been coming here for a couple years now and finally decided to give this place the credit it deserves. I live in the neighborhood and work down the street and am often sucked in by the great window displays.  This store offers a great variety of trendy and very affordable clothing and accessories- all they need is SHOES!  The staff is super nice and helpful.  Also, they often have great promotions and do cute things like give out little pumpkins around halloween or hot tea during the holidays.   :)

12.description: I was SO happy to find this boutique in the dearth of women's shopping options that is Edgewater/Uptown/Rogers Park.  I usually shop at Banana Republic, but this past week at the last minute I needed a little red cocktail dress, had to go shopping after work, and didn't feel like fighting the downtown traffic/parking, making the hike to Evanston, or resorting to Marshall's.  Thank you, Yelp! Just my luck, they were having a dress sale and (maybe since I was the only shopper in the store?) the service was great.  I found exactly what I wanted, plus some. They had a large variety of options, styles and colors and the prices were surprisingly reasonable.  The store had a nice selection of jewelry and accessories also.  How awesome to know that I can shop for a cocktail dress in the comfort of my own neighborhood!

59.description: LOVE this store!!! I discovered this gem this past spring and can't wait to visit everytime I'm in the area. Their selection of clothes is great. Very unique things you can't find anywhere else. My only 2 complaints about the clothes is that they tend to run small. I am not a huge person, but sometimes I find it hard to find clothes my size. Also, the prices fluctuate...some clothes are super cheap and some are really expensive. But these are minor details.Can we talk about their jewlery!! Wow...they have so many cool pieces. Everytime I have shopped there I have bought some kind of jewlery. And sometimes they have sales like buy one get one half off. I love all their accessories...they are awesome!I have brought out of town guests here and friends and they have all had a great shopping experience. The girls who work here are great too. Help you with anything and don't push you into buying anything. I will be shopping here for a long time!

21.description: Quickly stopped into this store and I need so much more time! They have REALLY cute clothes, fair prices and then an AMAZING jewelry and accessory selection. I HAVE to remember to travel up here the next time I need a dress, cute outfit or a gift for someone!

17.description: The only way to stop me in my tracks en route to Hopleaf is to tempt me with one bad ass window display. And Presence successfully lured two thirsty girls right on in!If I had to draw a comparison, I'd call this store the bastard lovechild of L.A.'s Kitson and unisex retailer darling, Urban Outfitters. The boutique is filled with boho fashions, indie jewelry, inexpensive accessories and eclectic gifts. From kitschy bathroom reads (the art of kissing, anyone?) to a cheeky vintage-styled condom case, just about anything and everything lives in this little shop of charm.Looking for a long, summery frock? Presence has them. They corner the casual dress category like a champ, rounding out their selection with a nod to business casual and nighttime looks as well. The prices? Surprisingly low. Presence, you've got presents. And your presents have presence, too.

10.description: A friend told me to check this place out, so I did. They have a cute selection of clothes and accessories at reasonable prices. The two girls that were working were super friendly and nice! I didn't get the name of the girl that rang me up, but she was awesome. She complimented the dress I bought, explained their loyalty card to me, and even let me know that since I work in the area I get 10% off my purchases! It was a good experience that kept getting better.

5.description: I can't go here too often, because I WILL go broke if I do. I always find tons of things in the store I want, and everyone who works here is really friendly. They have a great selection of clothes, jewelry, purses, scarves, and cute/funny novelty items. Their clothing is all very well-made, so I wouldn't say they're overly priced for that reason. It is more than I'm typically used to spending on clothes, but for the quality, I'll spend it. I will say it'd be a little hard for me to spend too much time in here, because the employees are very attentive and constantly ask if they can help you with anything. It's not a bad thing, but sometimes I would like to just look for a while without being asked if I'm alright. Other than that, I love this place. I always know I'll find something here, so it's great for those days when I just need a little retail therapy or am looking for something specific. I don't know what I would do if it ever closed.

3.description: Lovely jewellery and bags, cheap prices but the quality was also a little flimsy, especially the sunglasses. A lot of them were already damaged or missing rhinestones, so it was a little off-putting. Would stop by again because there was some awesome edgy jewellery.  Clothes weren't anything special, the quality/price ratio was mediocre and style wasn't for my taste.

35.description: Love it here! Great clothes, fabulous purses, awesome jewelry, friendly staff, affordable prices. A shopaholic's dream. Only reason for 4 stars instead of 5? Sometimes I go in there and find NOTHING worth trying on. I guess this is just like any store. Sometimes you find a hundred things, sometimes you find nothing.

19.description: I happened upon this cute little shop while looking for vintage shops.  They have tons of cute accessories, jewelry, tights, gloves, hats, tops, and dresses.  They had the cutest red dress in the window, but their dress prices were a little steep ($52 for a short, cotton spaghetti strap dress) for me to try it on.  Accessories and gifts are well priced though.  My favorite were the cheeky vintage scenes on their girly flasks!  Worth a visit if you're in the area.

28.description: Presence is a great find right in the heart of Andersonville.  If you are looking for a cute outfit for the weekend, this is a great specialty shop to browse.  They have very unique pieces and a great selection of dresses.  They also carry great purses and jewelry.

45.description: this place has something for everyone.  the clothes are super cute, and no matter what your style, you can find something that is good quality and priced right.  not too cheap (think discovery prices) and not even as close to expensive as little boutiquey shops.  i wish i was in the area more to stop by!

33.description: I've been to Presence several times over the years and I do like them. The staff are friendly and I don't have a problem getting to a fitting room. I always find something I like here, though sometimes their prices are a little too expensive for clothes that are made cheaply or out of bad materials. Still, worth a look and visit!

43.description: I pop in here for a pick me up.  There's always something that catches my eye -sparkles or bright colors .. much of my accessory wardrobe has been gotten here for a song.  I get so many compliments on the jewelry and scarves.  The clothes are adorable, but not in my size.

2.description: You can always find something cute in here, and they've really stepped up their fashion game. Seriously, what cute accessories!  While some are a little too pricy for the quality, you can occasionally find a really good deal here. Love the selection.I took of one star for the employees. I get the impression that presence is going to go out of business soon because the sales girls are overbearing and won't let you shop in peace :(. There's a desperation in the air that becomes more and more apparent with every shopping interruption until finally you're just ready to freak out and tell them to back off.Is it the sales girl's faults? Probably not. I get the impression that someone is telling them they have to swoop in on people.  Unfortunately it's just making me frustrated.

18.description: We were walking along Clark and I saw a cute striped dress in the window and had to check it out. I had walked in here thinking it was a vintage store but quickly learned it was a new retail store. I saw sale racks and immediately gravitated towards them. Lots of cute dresses and skirts, tops and pants for the hip modern city girl. I found a sweater and an awesome dress. Since it was sunny I bought a pair of $5 sunglasses and since it was cold I bought a $6 scarf. I found a cassette tape ring for $8 that gets me compliments everywhere I go. They have a pretty impressive selection of jewelry ranging from large metal chandelier earrings to wood carved necklaces. I spent quite a large amount of time in that section. I didn't make it to the other side of the store which housed full priced items. I'm cheap and am only looking for the sale rack but what I glanced at I found to be very stylish wears. Presence was a fun store with a great amount of sale items. The clothing was fun and geared toward a young on the go crowd.

41.description: Accessories are chock full here:  costume jewelery, belts, bags, purses, hats, scarves, gloves, Chinese slippers etc. Lots of cute gift items catch the eye. The store does have a feeling of retro 1980's.The staff is always polite without being pushy or aggressive.  Clothing is affordable. However, the sizes run small/juniors and tend to be hobo-chic. I'd like to see more variety of styles and sizes. Presence should aim for a wide range of ages, not just teenagers or college students. I do agree with some of the reviews - quality of clothing is rather cheap and shoddy: buttons are loose, tiny holes, seams are uneven, zippers don't zip. Also, the displays need some attention - garments should be steamed! Who wants to try on a wrinkled garment? The window display looks outdated and the items tend to fade.  At times, I find the music is a bit loud and annoying.However, I remain a loyal and long time shopper!

52.description: I love to at least window shop here. They have fun jewelry and clothes and make a point to look in whenever I walk by. I have a cute red top I bought here years ago and still wear it out now and then. Staff is friendly and reasonable prices.

50.description: Over the past year or so, I've noticed that their clothes have gotten more casual and their selection has gotten less edited. How many cotton/knit floral dresses/blouses does a lady need? Sure it's fun, but they need some more sophisticated items in their selection, with better quality fabrics.Maybe I'm just disenchanted with the lack of upscale clothing options for women in Andersonville. There has GOT to be enough professional women in the area who are dying for a place to shop for work-wear and evening-wear to justify adding more options... what gives?

4.description: Presence was ok. While I didn't get wowed by the clothing selection I did find some great accessories. Two necklaces that were unique and well priced, and a jazzy little scarf that I am sure I will get a lot of use out of this winter. The clothing sizes were odd when I was there. Maybe there were low on stock? Everything seemed either XXL or SSS..

6.description: I love this place. Great clothes and jewelry at reasonable prices. Also gets bonus points for being locally owned.

22.description: Cute, fun little place to visit! If your ever just browsing around the neighborhood check this place out. Love the sales racks and you can always find some quirky and stylish jewelry there.. The sales associates are very nice and helpful too!

15.description: I'm too..erm...endowed to fit into any of this store's garments, and even if I could, there's a lot of Forever21 quality with a boutique price. No thanks. That said, this place is my first stop for affordable jewelry, scarves, and hats. A few weeks ago I bought a chunky knit olive infinity scarf for around $25, and I've worn it almost every day since. You have to do a bit of hunting, but when it's right, it's so right. Extra star for being a neighborhood fixture for 35 years!

57.description: Another curvy girl here, giving her opinion on Presence. I am a size 10/12 and have never found anything that fit me here. This pains me as every time I raise my hopes and go in, I find at least 3 or 4 darling dresses that I wish could adorn my body. I have yet to buy anything here, the accessories are cute but not really of a style that I wear/use, but I recognize that this is a good store for all the smaller gals that are tired of Forever 21/H&M/Urban Outfitters being their only options. Gotta agree with everyone else that the staff is so, so nice. Once they ask you if you need help, if you decline they leave you alone but are always ready to help if you change your mind! Seriously, if they had a wider selection of sizes I would rate this place 5 stars.

20.description: I can't walk by Presence without getting sucked inside.  Once I'm in, I can't walk out without making a purchase!  The store has a vintage feel with lots of new apparel and accessories.  Trendy, but not over the top.  A tad bit pricey, but usually worth the splurge.  It's a good thing I don't live in town, or Presence would probably take all my money (but give me a really great wardrobe in return).

36.description: I went in over the holidays to splurge on some new winter clothes, and was happily overwhelmed with all the clothing choices & prices.  I was underwhelmed by the customer service.  There were several girls working, and I was one of maybe 3 customers in there, and I couldn't catch anyone's attention for the life of me.  I stood there, outside of the fitting room practically flailing my arms to get some assistance.  Once I managed to track someone down, my experience was pretty positive.I'll go again for the clothes...but if I have another experience like my first one...I'm not going back.

14.description: I have been shopping at Presence for at least ten years. I can always find fun accessories and  cute dresses for any occasion at fairly reasonable prices. Presence carries some great names, like Everly, Tulle, and YA California. They frequently have great sales and I love taking advantage of the frequent buyers card.All that being said, the lack of customer service is a real downer here. The women working here used to be helpful. I've even had them help me put together outfits for special occasions. My experience yesterday left much to be desired. By the time someone came to check on me or ask if I needed another size in the dressing room, I had tried on all six dresses. The two ladies working clung together like girls in junior high. I had to interrupt them so that I could pay for my merchandise. And, when I did pay, I had to ask for a frequent buyers card... After spending around 100 bucks. I have never had to ask for a stamp or card. All the woman said in response was, "Oh, yeah." I understand people make mistakes. I understand people need to be trained to follow protocol but, after leaving yesterday, it felt like less of a pleasant and more of a diy shopping experience despite the fact that the shop was not busy.If my spending money at your boutique is putting your salespeople out, maybe I should go somewhere else. Even though I left with some cute merchandise, the way I was treated was a big disappointment.

3.description: Don't be put off by the teak-and-Buddha look of this store, which may recall bad Cost Plus experiences. Baan imports genuine Thai antiques and reproductions, many of which are made by hand. Yes, there are plenty of chests and vases, but there's also some fine furniture, similar to what's being offered up the street at Urbanest but much better made. If you're unwilling to go the whole Asian hog, Baan also sells candles, glasses, and spa goods, such as bath salts and all-natural soaps. It's a nice addition to the "housewares" strip of Clark south of Foster, which includes The Wooden Spoon, Foursided, and Marguerite Gardens.

1.description: Beautiful selection of paintings, oils, candles, knick-knacks, many items! I felt so peaceful at this store and really wanted to buy something! I'll return for sure :)

2.description: Asian imports and furniture. There are a lot of these shops, but this one looks as if some real care has gone into the selection. Many predictable objects, and some really unusual stuff - some gorgeous jewelry in the window is what pulled me in. Prices are not too bad, and the staff is friendly and helpful.

5.description: I really love this store.  Most of the items here are straight from Thailand.  My favorite items are the glassware.  I bought the best small hand-crafted glasses with a pale green tinted rim.  No two are exactly the same so they have a lot of character.  I think all the glassware is buy 5 get the 6th glass free (or something like that).

0.description: Very charming. The store is small, but it has a nice variety of items that can really make a room pop. They have a wonderful selection of drinking glass that are really unique and would match any decor. It's nice to find something that is truly different and still extremely sturdy. The wall art was also extremely attractive and gave me some great ideas about our home.Everything is priced extremely reasonably, and there are always wonderful sales going on. Right now, for example, everything is 20% off and there is a buy 5 get the 6th deal on the glasses.The gentleman that was running the shop yesterday was extremely friendly. He briefed us on the specials and chatted about the neighborhood. He also gave us copies of a Chicago magazine about interior decorating. The magazine was free, but I'm sure it would have been at least a $7 magazine if we had gone to Borders.I'll be back as soon as we need something for our new condo.

4.description: With the glut of faux-cultural imports flooding stores from Cost Plus to Target, it was an utter joy to find truly grounded Thai imports at this beautiful and peaceful little shop in Andersonville. The hand-chosen stock is beautiful and grounded, and the prices are excellent. Loved speaking with the staff, who offered advice not only on choosing the right statue, but lessons on proper placement in my home.Whether you're searching for exquisite Thai and Tibetan furniture, art or simple housewares, you must check this out.

58.description: What a Fun Place.. Now what Im about to say.. you're going to think "Yea Right" ... honestly... I went in to purchase a Bachelor Gift for a Friends Night Out Party .. I mean come on.. Prudish Me would NEVER go inside a store like this and purchase things for muah! ha ha ... I'd discreetly order online lol lol.. Love this place! the cashiers treated you as if it was no big deal that you were in there but it was extremely funny to watch some of the customers looking out the corners of their eyes the entire time that they were in there wondering if they appeared to look like Freaks! .. This place has Fun things. and the staff is very knowledgeable.

56.description: The staff are always knowledgeable and kind at early to bed. I have attended many after hours events that have ranged from classes to open mic, to fundraiser. Always clean and classy- we love going to Early to Bed!

29.description: Chicago is lucky to have a lot of options for places to buy sexytime toys, but the first woman-owned sex toy shop in the city is still the absolute best in my opinion. Great selection of products from a range of prices and appealing to a range of sexualities and genders. The staff is open and knowledgeable but never pushy. Plus they host great workshops several times a month on all topics. Searah the owner is also really involved in the local (and national) community and always looking to spread the good news of vibrators to everyone!

42.description: They sent me a more expensive product in place of a cheaper product I had bought. I was not charged for this upgrade; it was on the house. Fast shipping, too.

23.description: Definitely the best sex shop experience I've had. I didn't know it existed for a long time, and had been to the couple around Belmont on and off for years, despite their... how to put it... grunge. This place had none of that. It was clean, open, nice, and classy. The clerk was attentive and extremely helpful, smiley, and offered a lot of good advice that didn't come with the package. It's a little out of the way, but the hike is soooo worth it.

47.description: Excellent shop! It's refreshing to browse for sex toys and not be subjected to racks of puerile gag gifts and novelty items instead. Definitely a store for grown-ups.I was in the market for a cock ring and thought it would be a relatively easy purchase. I was surprised to see the number of choices available instead. The owner, Searah, helpfully walked me through the pros and cons of each: Snap attachments hold better, but velcro is easier to put on in a hurry. Huh! Who knew? I wound up purchasing two types, each for a different type of occasion.This shop bills itself as both women- and men-friendly, and I must say this is 100% accurate. I checked out their web site after my visit, and they do cater to a broad spectrum of sexualities.I'll definitely be back. The neighborhood also has some tasty restaurants nearby, and Searah's prices are so affordable that you and your partner(s) can grab a bite after shopping and gloat over your purchases together. Highly recommended.

8.description: I needed a body-stocking for my cute new two piece dress. I looked at a couple of places beforehand and they were either sold out, since it was right after Valentines Day, or WAY too expensive ($30?? No way!)! EtB is in my area, so I decided to try there as a last hope. The store is very comfortable and cute compared to places like Lovers Lane or Lovers Playground that make you feel like a perv. The selection and prices are great. They have something for everyone and if you want quality over quantity and they have that down pact. If you're looking for a HUGE selection, no dice. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. If you have ANY questions about anything there, they will definitely be able to help you as they know about everything they have, which is another big difference from most places.  So if you're in the area and in the market for anything, drop in and pay them a visit. You won't regret it.

31.description: If an asexual can walk into this store and feel comfortable, you KNOW that you've found a real gem of a sex store. I've been into quite a few sex stores. And I have never felt comfortable in one. But E2B changed that for me. It's very open and inviting, and the comfy chair and bookshelf in the back is a great place to sit and peek through books while your friend/partner/whatever is still browsing. This store is not only queer and lgbt friendly, it's also VEGAN friendly! They have an interesting selection of packages put together for different demographics -  my favorite being the vegan package, but the "first-timers" package was very cute as well, and would make an excellent gift. If you're nervous about visiting a sex store, give E2B a try. It surely will not disappoint!

34.description: LOVE LOVE LOVE!  I've been coming here for 7 years now and I just adore it.  Searah has all kinds of promotions, giveaways, and just good/fun info, especially on Facebook.The selection is great because they really care about getting you the highest quality, safest toys, but they also have less pricey items as well.  The atmosphere is welcoming and SAFE - not smutty, dark, or gross.  It's very womyn centered and friendly, but boys are always welcome too!  You can "try out" samples of everything they carry (with your HANDS.. ha), then they'll grab one from the back for you.  There's a section for customer feedback on items too.OMG I love this place.  Searah's earned my loyalty for good reason!

16.description: Prior to visiting Early to Bed, all of my experience with places to purchase sex toys from came from shops off the freeway just over the Wisconsin border. Those places, in addition to offering a broad range of toys and videos, also provided the female shopper with the opportunity to be mentally undressed and stared at creepily by vagrants.Needless to say, when I moved into the apartment building above Early to Bed, I had no idea what was inside. It seemed so quaint and the clientele always left happy. Shortly after lamenting to a friend that my Pocket Rocket had broken and that I didn't feel like venturing to the northlands to get a replacement, she informed me of the truth behind Early to Bed. Curiosity piqued, I went in that night. What a lovely little store! No sales people to pressure you and no sexual predators, just a calming and peaceful vibe and plenty of fun little toys and trinkets. Even though I live closer to the Kenosha shops, I still will head back to Early to Bed every time I need a little pick-me-up.

13.description: Love this place. Go out of my way to make any purchases here. Great staff. Great selection.  Clean and welcoming environment.  Can't say enough good things.

11.description: Gotta give props to Early to Bed for being a place where women can feel comfortable shopping for some pretty personal stuff!  Not long ago I made a vow not to patronize sex shops that make me feel gross - like if they've got porn posters everywhere, or creepy men hanging out in every aisle.  In some cities you don't have a choice, but you do in the Chi!  Enter - Early to Bed.An easy mosey from the Red Line, Early to Bed is a small, attractively arranged little store.  Everything is easy to see, and interactive - there are samples of all the toys sitting out - you can turn them on, feel the settings, etc - but if you buy one, you obviously get a brand spankin' new one in a box from the back.  The selection is small, but top-quality.  You get the sense they aren't just stocking the shelves with random crap - everything gets the owner's seal of approval.When I first walked in, the woman working there was talking to a man, helping him buy some toys to use with his girlfriend.  It was incredibly sweet, the way she helped him feel comfortable, answered his questions honestly, and really took the time to help him make a good purchase.  She applied the same friendliness and involvement with me, giving personal recommendations of certain products, and generally being incredibly knowledgeable about what was new and "hot" on the market.  And as everyone says, they are woman-positive (donation box to the Chicago Abortion Fund on the counter), queer-friendly, and believe that sex is a rockin' thing.  Nothing seedy or gross here at all.  It's a safe place, bottom line.

39.description: Been shopping here for years. Searah is wonderful and puts you at ease. Her how-to videos are fantastic. I've been to a few seminars as well. My only complaint: the display toys have been handled so many times - filthy! They need a good cleaning. Also on a recent visit, the sales person was uber shy and sat behind the counter  surfing the internet. She whispered over the counter "if you have any questions" Sales staff needs to be more present on the sales floor. Other than that, I enjoy E2B very much!

37.description: This is my sex shop!  I go here before anywhere else.  They're knowledgeable and have a conversation with you, the store is very community-oriented, and it's inexpensive.    Education and health come before a profit, which is incredible and rare.  One of my favorite books, Yes Means Yes! (amazon.com/Yes-Means-Vis…), mentions Early To Bed.  Read it, shop here, be happy!

0.description: Staff was awesome and prices were very reasonable. Was please with the selection and the fun bookshelf.

38.description: A rad sex shop that is all about supporting the female/transgender community! Husband and I have been going here for awhile now and I would never go anywhere else. Friendly staff, charming space & sells everything from DIY womens health zines to dildos. They host a variety of workshops every month leaving something for everyone. Though I have never attended, past workshops have included erotic writing, breast self exam, sexual revolution.. along with the traditional oral, bondage, burlesque workshops you can find in at other places.

51.description: The staff at Early to Bed is amazing.  As Chicago's first feminist sex shop, they really practice what they preach. It's not just about customer service (which they have), but they're incredibly patient, informative, and also do a great service to the community.  No question is too weird for them-- and if they can't help you, they're always willing to point you in the direction you need to be headed. I like their location- it's descreet. You're not walking into some big, neon flashing light "SEX SHOP"--- you're in a quiet neighborhood where if anyone (like your boss) saw you walk in, they'd probably just think you're buying pillow shams or a bed skirt. Love it.They do a ton of outreach in the community as well- and have all sorts of workshops. You can also buy things online off their website.I have been part of a film crew at the University of Chicago and we sort of made a 'fanumentary' about this place---And after seeing the documentary, their mission statement, and examples of customer interactions this is totally something that even my MOM would feel comfortable going to. There's NO SHAME in coming to Early To Bed.

27.description: Been a huge fan of this place since I moved out of Uptown in 2010.To this day it's the only shop I feel comfortable enough to physically walk into.  Their online videos are great too and so informative.  I really love this shop!  I feel like it's personally catered to me.What else is there to say?My boyfriend walked into the store with me once.  He was quiet the whole time until we approached the woman at the register.  He said, "Man.  It is SO chill in here." and she chuckled haha.

32.description: Fantastic service. Very helpful staff and great selection.

54.description: I wish they were open on Mondays, and that's the only negative thing I have to say about this place.They have a great selection, a variety of price points, knowledgeable staff, and exclusively body-safe goods. That means none of their toys will give you cancer. Hurrah! Go ahead, talk to the staff, too. There are no skeezy types to be found, and they know everything about everything. Regardless of your gender or sexual orientation, people are nice to you here.This place is also one of a few bricks and mortar shops to offer specialty vegan items. If you are a dirty, filthy vegan like me, you appreciate that.

48.description: Checking in for my update after another visit and reevaluation. I am pleased to see a woman owned sex shop but the store has a tiny selection. I do love however all the fun surprises! Gift boxes for a perfect night of lovin. Travel sets, yes travel sets for sex on the go he he. and of course you have a little something for everyone..The kinks, the hippies, the queer and all in between.Rock on!

44.description: By far, my favorite sex toy shop is Early to Bed.  EtB's boutique is fun, welcoming, informative, has quality merchandise, AND still sexyyy.Hold up, hold up, hold up...fun, welcoming, and informative for a sex toy shop?  Slather on some lube there's going to be a celebration!In store, EtB let's you see, touch, and read about before you buy.  Ever want to know what silicone vs. CyberSkin feels like...well now you can fondle them both.  All of their selection has a "display" version where you can actually hold (if you wish) the item you're interested in.  Many of the items also have attached customer reviews so you can get an idea of what you're in for by someone who has already given the toy a test drive.  In you're adventurous...or hungry...they'll even let you taste the lube if you ask.However, best of all EtB is budget friendly while also always going the extra mile to make sure their store has quality toys and porn.  Yes, they have expensive toys, but they also have very reasonably priced toys that won't break the day after you get them.  Their online store is just as great.  Most online sex shops just have 98792466 items and you have no idea what you're buying, where it's coming from, or if you're getting ripped off.  EtB's online store is smaller than most, but still has a sizable and diverse selection.  The only thing to note about their online store is that although their prices are reasonable they can't really compete with Amazon.com.  If you're like to support a kick ass store then spend the extra $10...if ya just want your toy then always check Amazon.com for the same item first.Have toy questions? Just check out their blog reviews or email them.  You'll get an actual response...probably from someone who has even tried the item themselves.  Ooooolalala.  Follow them on twitter @earlytobed to keep up with their weekly sales items and entertaining blog posts.

24.description: Shopping at Early to Bed was a great experience. Being a newbie to the sex toy scene, I was really nervous to go into a sex shop. After reading all the reviews and doing some researching online for female-friendly sex shops I was really excited to go check out Early to Bed. There's street parking out in front, so I easily found a spot and walked in. I was immediately greeted by a friendly woman in her 20's, despite there being other customers at the counter. As soon as she finished helping them she turned her attention back to me (I was the only other one in the store) and asked if I needed anything. Feeling a bit overwhelmed, I told her "not yet" and continued looking around. I circled the store once before she asked me again if there was anything I had questions about. We had some playful banter about it being my first time and she told me if there was anything I needed just to ask. After circling the store one more time I finally picked out a silk mask and tie set, a sexy board game, a bottle of flavored lube, and (the most exciting) vibrating cock ring. When I went up to the counter the associate asked if I wanted her to open the ring just to make sure it worked because of their strict return policy (which I appreciated and did), and afterwards she sealed it back up, rung me up (without making comments on what I had purchased, which being a little awkward already, I really appreciated), and we chatted a bit before I left.All in all, it was a great experience and definitely a store I will be going back to when I make the foray in to more varsity-level sex. The ONLY negative experience was that the store was pretty small, so initially I felt awkward about being so close to the cashier while looking around. I credit that to my (unneededly) nervousness about the whole shopping experience and doubt that I'll even register it the next time I go into the store. Definitely a great store!

7.description: Early to Bed is my favorite sex shop in the city. It's welcoming, non-judgemental, and in no way scummy. A really nice selection of various apparatuses and accouterments for your individual use, or with a friend, or with several friends. Check out their website for lots of tips and product reviews too!

49.description: I'm taking out my bad review and adding a star. I haven't gone back, but I think I will. After posting my review, I received a coupon in my email from the owner (I believe) apologizing for my bad experience and asking for a second chance. And while I wasn't looking for something like that, I do appreciate a business that pays attention to what customers say, and I think it shows good business sense, as well as human decency.Kudos from me.

40.description: A sex shop with, well, integrity. I first heard about Early to Bed when a friend retweeted several hilarious posts by their charming owner-- ah, the trials and travails of workin', educatin', and sellin' goods in that industry.Early to Bed is unique in that all items for sale are available not only to look at in packaging but also to touch, turn on, and toy around with, making the process of purchasing toys much less of a crap-shoot than it can be by ordering online or simply purchasing something off the self after only having seen it in a blister pack and cardboard box.Fantastic workshops. Fantastic selection. And, oh yeah, a dedication to supporting sex-positive, inclusive, and health-friendly producers. Shoulder the teensy tiny mark-up and support an excellent local business. C'mon, now. You know you deserve a gift.

53.description: another 5 stars for early to bed....and a huge HIP HIP HOORAY for owners who care about their business and customers, thanks for working out a product issue with me!

30.description: Gotta give props to Early to Bed for being a place where women can feel comfortable shopping for some pretty personal stuff!  Not long ago I made a vow not to patronize sex shops that make me feel gross - like if they've got porn posters everywhere, or creepy men hanging out in every aisle.  In some cities you don't have a choice, but you do in the Chi!  Enter - Early to Bed.An easy mosey from the Red Line, Early to Bed is a small, attractively arranged little store.  Everything is easy to see, and interactive - there are samples of all the toys sitting out - you can turn them on, feel the settings, etc - but if you buy one, you obviously get a brand spankin' new one in a box from the back.  The selection is small, but top-quality.  You get the sense they aren't just stocking the shelves with random crap - everything gets the owner's seal of approval.When I first walked in, the woman working there was talking to a man, helping him buy some toys to use with his girlfriend.  It was incredibly sweet, the way she helped him feel comfortable, answered his questions honestly, and really took the time to help him make a good purchase.  She applied the same friendliness and involvement with me, giving personal recommendations of certain products, and generally being incredibly knowledgeable about what was new and "hot" on the market.  And as everyone says, they are woman-positive (donation box to the Chicago Abortion Fund on the counter), queer-friendly, and believe that sex is a rockin' thing.  Nothing seedy or gross here at all.  It's a safe place, bottom line.

46.description: Comfortable, women friendly, and wonderful! I loved this store its very coffee shopesk lol and the woman on staff was very helpful and friendly!

1.description: Okay, look. LOOK.  I am not what you would call a particularly adventurous dude, in a sexual sense.  I would not call myself prudish exactly, but my experience of sex toys largely consists of putting on a blank look and saying "What are sex toys?"  Still, I strive to be a good partner, so I stood around making Jerry Lewis noises and tugging at my collar while my girlfriend shopped.  The staff seems very knowledgeable, the place is nicely arranged, there is lots of helpful information, and everything is HOYVEN GLAYVIN WHOO HA-HA NICE LAY-DIES

55.description: shiny. hard. purple. leather. bunny. gelatinous. dvd.all of these words are related by the sheer fancypantsthat is early to bed. the store is organized to be easy,accessible, and to motivate the sexy. the staff arearticulate and sensitive people who are approachableto any queer/gay/straight/kink/curious excitements youmay have. there is an array of merchandise for the readers,the watchers, and doers- all with reviews made by actual customers. early to bed is a giver and contributes to local organizationsby opening up their space, by giving sex toy donations,by being over all aware and accountable. if you want toshop sexy and critical, this is your best option.

9.description: Always a delight, and the new location isn't nearly as hard to park near. The standard to which I hold all other sex shops.

26.description: Prior to visiting Early to Bed, all of my experience with places to purchase sex toys from came from shops off the freeway just over the Wisconsin border. Those places, in addition to offering a broad range of toys and videos, also provided the female shopper with the opportunity to be mentally undressed and stared at creepily by vagrants.Needless to say, when I moved into the apartment building above Early to Bed, I had no idea what was inside. It seemed so quaint and the clientele always left happy. Shortly after lamenting to a friend that my Pocket Rocket had broken and that I didn't feel like venturing to the northlands to get a replacement, she informed me of the truth behind Early to Bed. Curiosity piqued, I went in that night. What a lovely little store! No sales people to pressure you and no sexual predators, just a calming and peaceful vibe and plenty of fun little toys and trinkets. Even though I live closer to the Kenosha shops, I still will head back to Early to Bed every time I need a little pick-me-up.

25.description: I recently bought my first real toy, some Luna Beads, and a book here. The salesperson was knowledgeable, relaxed, and down-to-earth. The only reason I don't give it five stars is I wish she'd told me more about the Luna Beads before I bought them - apparently the only Luna Beads they had for sale are generally for older women who have gone through pregnancy (I am not in this category now). This is widely available information online, and there are other sizes of Luna Beads for other categories of woman-bodies. I wish she had mentioned this. Possibly she assumed I knew more than i did. I haven't yet tried the Luna Beads and so they may work out - but I can't return them if they don't because this is Early to Bed's policy. No returns on books or toys. Other than this issue, I enjoy the store! I also appreciate the hours they're open. Thanks ETB!

12.description: So nice and unpretentious at all. And easy to get to. Love this place. I used the yelp deal and got some great gag gifts.  Highly recommend!

59.description: Awesome! I finally got to go to the actual store, when for years I had only been able to check it out online!
