The previous reviews do a far better job of describing the store and how cool it is. I will say my friend and I didn't have to break the bank to buy a load of fun ;) Bonus: I got a sweet tote bag for $2 extra with my purchase (which was only $15). Sweet atmosphere.

21.description: Great service in a quiet location.  On both occasions I felt comfortable asking questions which the knowledgeable sales person answered with respect and patience and gave suggestions. I will definitely return.

17.description: The staff here is super helpful, it doesn't have the creepy vibe of some other "adult" stores, and there is plenty of product to sample to find something to meet your needs. Definitely recommended.

10.description: The staff was amazing and friendly. They were very willing to answer any questions or help you pick out what was best for your needs and desires.The store is extremely clean and classy. It was an amazing atmosphere, and I found that it was unlike most shops that I had been to. It wasn't dark or cramped. The reason I knocked a star off was because of the limited parking and smaller toy selection. Obviously, it's Chicago, so parking was expected to be more limited. The two times that I've been there, the first time parking was so easy to find. The second time, it took us about 10 minutes to fine a spot. Now, the toy selection is great, but it is smaller. They do have something for everyone, but I do hope that the options expand in the future.

5.description: E2B is by far the best shop in the area. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and they work hard to keep the product accessible and non-intimidating. Plus, their prices are totally reasonable and they only sell quality product. Even though we've moved out of the city we still drive in to visit E2B when we have shopping to do. There's no place comparable in the city or 'burbs!

3.description: Early 2 Bed is a great resource for adult goodies, I've purchased many a vibrator and/or bachelorette party gift there!  A beautiful space with lovely service, I'm always happy when I get to pop in for visit!

35.description: My only previous experience with adult stores was a cramped, creepy place back home that was run by burly men who stared at me while I browsed in the one tiny corner devoted to women's fares. So I was nervous about visiting Early to Bed, and I almost convinced myself not to go in while circling the nearby church looking for a parking spot. But I'm so glad I did. This is a small but intimate store that caters to women. The selection isn't huge but everything is helpfully labeled and there are tips and advice on the wall. The girl behind the counter was really friendly and helpful. She knew her stuff, which was awesome. I left feeling great about my purchase. I'll definitely, definitely be returning here.

19.description: So helpful picking out new toys I've never tried. The ladies were wonderful and very informative. Great prices too!

28.description: Early to Bed is so much fun, I don't know where to start. First of all, if you are a middle aged, suburban lady like me (who wears navy blue Armani suits to work), this is the place to expand your sensual/sexual horizons. The atmosphere is warm and educational, you won't feel 'icky'.... The owner Seahra is delightful, Rebecca works on Thursday nights and is an amazing 'educator', the product line is deep and high end. Really, great fun, great products, great vibe. Highly recommended.

45.description: Beautiful shop full of helpful folks and fun things to try out. Not intimidating, easy to find what you might be looking for, or figure out what you're looking for if you don't yet know. Try it out.

33.description: You know what's remarkable about this place?  Yeah, it's a sex-positive, feminist-owned, passion-driven, queer-friendly sex toy shop that's close to everything and moderately-priced.  Everything you've heard is true.But...what really stuns me about Early to Bed is that staff really watch out for customers - "oh, let me check and see if this has batteries in the packaging," or "do you need any advice about how this works?" or "hey, you should do this when you get home." and they know the  products. "this fun factory is waterproof, but that one has a stronger vibrate," etc.I've lived in other cities and never found a store comparable to E2B, where you walk in and feel welcome, happy - no, GIDDY!  Excited!  It should always be a blast buying erotica or sex toys - yes! - and all too often it's creepy and off-putting.  I love that you can get a sense of the products without their packaging, feel how hard they go, or even ask questions.My friends and I make a pilgrimage here once a year to see what's "up" (get it?  God-damn, I am funny).  I highly recommend you do the same.  As soon as possible.

43.description: I love you, Early to Bed.The workshops. The quite friendly staff. A very accessible location. A clean and inviting storefront. And their products.This is what sex positive stores aspire to be.

2.description: This is my shop of choice. They're always very knowledgeable and super friendly. Their website is a handy tool with a shop and knowledge base. I like that my friend was able to order something for me long-distance and it didn't need to be shipped to me, I could just pick it up, since I'm local. So many businesses don't allow pickup if you order online. I remember hearing about the shop before I ever actually moved to Chicago. I think I read an article about it or by one of the staff in a feminist magazine. Always a good sign that the place will be female friendly and won't make me feel like a pervert for walking in with a vagina.

18.description: Been a huge fan of this place since I moved out of Uptown in 2010.To this day it's the only shop I feel comfortable enough to physically walk into.  Their online videos are great too and so informative.  I really love this shop!  I feel like it's personally catered to me.What else is there to say?My boyfriend walked into the store with me once.  He was quiet the whole time until we approached the woman at the register.  He said, "Man.  It is SO chill in here." and she chuckled haha.

41.description: This place is outstanding.  I feel like it's a curated show in there--someone has obviously picked the best of the best goods out of the millions of products available.  The staff is really friendly and open. And there are descriptions and reviews by staff and customers that are extremely helpful.  I love Early to Bed and only shop there--even though I moved away from Chicago a few years ago.

52.description: I would never go anywhere else for sex toys. I've had the most comfortable, fun and educational experiences at ETB! The staff is knowledgeable, but won't interfere unless you ask for help. They respect customers' privacy. However, they are happy to help you if you need to know what something is, want to feel it's vibration power or hear what people like and don't like. There is nothing at all skeezy about it (as is the case with most sex toy stores in Chicago) and you can tell that everyone who works there believes in sexual health and making sex toy shopping a fun experience, not an embarrassing one. LOVE LOVE LOVE! In fact, all this talk makes me want to go right now. BYE!

50.description: Okay, so going into an "adult store" can be scary and intimidating... I had butterflies in my stomach before stepping foot in the door -- but friends (who don't even live in the city) highly highly recommended E2B, so, yeah, had to give it a shot.The store is set up amazingly inside.  I love it.  Not overwhelming.  Not sketchy.  I mean, yes, there was a group of giggling (18+) kids... but meh.  My gut knew that was going to happen so I just ignored them.I got a first timers kit -- LOVE IT.  Lube, two vibes and some accessories.  Then I threw in another vibe (10 pulse settings.. TEN!), and some vegan cuffs for good measure.  They put the batteries in for me as well, so I was all set when I got home.I'll definitely be back.  I'm hooked!  PLUS -- this is the biggie... Got an old, dead vibe??  They have Vibe Trade-In days where you can get $10 towards a new toy... and they'll recycle your dearly departed vibe.I follow them on twitter (@Earlytobed) and they're always responsive and helpful.  LOVE LOVE LOVE.

4.description: I ordered through FTM Essentials, which is the same company but with a portion of their inventory specifically geared toward transgender individuals. I ordered a Masho Packer and an Aslan packing strap. They gave me 2-day shipping, everything was packaged very nicely in a sealed priority bag, and they even included a few pamphlets with resources for trans folks, and tips for how to keep my packer healthy. They also included a little candy! Awesome, guys! Great stuff. They also worked promptly with my pathetic, anxious butt when I messed up the order a little bit, and combined my two objects together and refunded the second shipping. Great work, buds!

6.description: Wonderful business, sex positive staff (of course..) and female-oriented- I've been a customer here for at least 5 years. They used to be on Sheridan, which was much closer to my house (*sniff*) but now I will totally trek out of the way to get what I...ahem... need.

22.description: Wonderful establishment. Staff was very knowledgeable, nice, and helpful. Very pleased with my experience, and I would certainly go back again. The shop is obviously very pro-feminism, but had a nice selection of products for men. All in all one of the best adult bookstores I've ever visited!

15.description: I recently bought my first real toy, some Luna Beads, and a book here. The salesperson was knowledgeable, relaxed, and down-to-earth. The only reason I don't give it five stars is I wish she'd told me more about the Luna Beads before I bought them - apparently the only Luna Beads they had for sale are generally for older women who have gone through pregnancy (I am not in this category now). This is widely available information online, and there are other sizes of Luna Beads for other categories of woman-bodies. I wish she had mentioned this. Possibly she assumed I knew more than i did. I haven't yet tried the Luna Beads and so they may work out - but I can't return them if they don't because this is Early to Bed's policy. No returns on books or toys. Other than this issue, I enjoy the store! I also appreciate the hours they're open. Thanks ETB!

57.description: Absolutely *fabulous* shop.  Incredibly helpful staff who are sensitive and knowledgable.  They're there for the kinky chick who's just looking for a new harness and the new guy or girl looking for their first toy.  They also offer an array of awesome classes that are fantastic- I highly suggest taking one!Take all of that, *plus* they support a number of local women's organizations in Chicago.  Incredible!!

20.description: I love early to bed! Such a friendly staff and awesome stuff! The manager Searah is amazing! Go here for all you adult needs!

36.description: Probably the least intimidating, and dare I say cute, sex boutique I've been in so far. It's smaller (and has possibly less variety) than other shops, but this is the one I feel best about supporting - Searah's shop is the most lgbtq-friendly and she might be the most knowledgeable. I absolutely love her posts and videos on the website and she seems down to earth. Plus, they have workshops - I haven't gone yet, but I plan to soon.The gal who was working there (not Searah) wasn't as approachable as I'd like...for some reason I like a little input before I buy something, but that won't stop me from coming back. Anywho, there's a little of everything in here - and a LOT of bondage tape! Also, you can buy online, which is great if you live towards the south end of the city. Love it!!

14.description: Early To Bed is wonderful. The staff and the reviews of each product are informative and helpful. I like that you can handle an example of what you purchase before you buy it. The prices are moderate, but you don't want cheap crap when it comes to sex supplies. You just don't. So Early To Bed's prices are exactly what you want - they don't break the bank severely but they don't sell cheap, flimsy crap either.Interesting tidbit, after I had a hysterectomy, I wondered whether I still had a Gspot. My knowledge of my parts was dismal at best at that time, and Early To Bed's friendly staff let me know that not only do I still have one, but there are a myriad of ways to make it feel awesome.I'm so blessed to live in Chicago where we have this sort of thing. Searah, the owner, is super nice too! Support your local businesses, people. You'll be glad you did!

1.description: I popped in this shop yesterday halfway through exploring the farmer's market right outside, drawn in by the rack of "3 for $10" vintage t-shirts right outside. As someone who usually shops thrift stores rather than vintage shops, I don't know if I was expecting anything truly great from this shop in particular. The shoe selection tended towards one type (lots of fringe and square toes here), and the rack of sales clothes was sadly outdated and, in the case of most of the sweaters, stretched out by the hangers. The dresses were equally uninspiring, and, other than the sale section, the prices were pretty high. Probably wouldn't return.

9.description: This place is badass.IT. WILL. MAKE. YOU. NOSTALGIC. If you were born in the 80's (and 70's), like me. Super cool T Shirts, awesome toys, a dazzling array of sunglasses and  GARFIELD FISH BOWL has made this place another landmark of Andersonville. It's pricey, but it caters to a niche market, so it is what it is. My one gripe is that when I was there, they didn't have too many ladies shirts/clothing/what have you. But! They were actually going to get in more women's t shirts this week, so the gripe has already been remedied. This is a really fun store. There aren't many places like this.

12.description: Dig it!Got my bro a sargent slaughter t-shirt. My sis found a post WWII jacket for sale for $10.

21.description: Rad Vintage recently opened up at 1511 W Berwyn (between Clark and Ashland) featuring vintage clothing, thowback sporting apparel and even your favorite childhood toys from the '80's. I had the opportunity to stop into Rad Vintage and while the selection of goods is spectacular, I felt the prices were not.  $20-25 for a used tee?   Sometimes a bit steep for worn used goods, but if you're looking for that hard to find rare item Rad Vintage fills a unique niche in the Andersonville shopping district.

16.description: I'll admit that I and probably most people don't have a need for this store. Still it's great for a trip down memory lane and if in need of a costume for a party, it is the place to go. Ok, fine most of the stuff is still pretty cool to me. Member's only jackets, old school rock t-shirts, WWII jackets, and come on... Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle baseball cards still wrapper up (I image that piece of gum might kill ya). I went in looking to create a Sid Vicious look for a punk costume party and not wanting to spend a lot for it (I mean Sid ripped up most of his shirts). Most of the prices are actually pretty reasonable. The guy working the store deserves a star all unto himself. He pulled up pics of Sid and we looked around the shop, later even he gave me ideas on accessories. Totally cool!! I'm sure I'll be back.

17.description: I scored an awesome vintage talking Alf. If you're into 80s toys, this is a great place to shop!The shopowner was super-friendly and I expect to be a repeat customer. I totally recommend stopping by...They also have vintage sports memorabilia...which would make unique birthday gifts!

10.description: Great selection of vintage clothing, though mainly for men, there weren't that many racks for women.  They have a wide range of:Pendletons and flannelLacosteMember's OnlyStarterWestern shirtsDown vestsAdidasOld t shirtsIn short, they hit a lot of the sweet spots for vintage.  Their specialty seems to be old school sports team clothing, vintage jackets, jerseys, etc.As noted by others, the prices are high.  Pendletons were high twenties, low thirties, same story with the western shirts.  BUT . . . this is not a thrift store, it's a vintage store.  The products are well edited and there is actually a lot of it.  When you go thrifting, one out of ten times you will find a good western shirt.  So I think the higher prices are justified for the amount of time you will save from not having to sift through a bunch of junk.  I've been to a few of the vintage stores in the Ukrainian Village and Wicker Park, and Rad Vintage is far superior, at least for men's clothing.

5.description: Found out about Rad Vintage through Instagram, and when I visited it happened to be closed. Again was contacted by owner through Instagram and he was very nice and gave me a great deal on some items I wanted due to an error on store hours.  Definitely nicely decorated (there was no vintage funk/thrift store smell I'm used to), and left a great impression on me. Definitely will be stopping by whenever in the area!

11.description: Walked in and greeted by a nice guy by the counter. We couldn't stop saying "Remember this?" or "Look!" and of course "Oh my God" with eyes wide open. There's a lot of sports jerseys and jackets and hats, including a few teams which don't exist anymore (Charlotte Hornets, Seattle Supersonics). I was hoping to find some vintage T-shirts, but maybe another day. Guy behind the counter said a lot of stuff is obviously donated and some of it is uncirculated overstock such as some Members Only jackets which appeared brand new. I spotted some trolls, GI Joe's, old board games, Garfield, and NKOTB trading cards among the collection of odds and ends. It's cool to just look at things you subconsciously forgot about when you were 10. I'll come back again, maybe have some luck with the clothing next time!

22.description: This is a great Vintage store!  It seriously has the greatest selection of Vintage clothing and toys!  I have and will continue to recommend this store!!!!

0.description: Awesome place in the center of Andersonville. Popped in here on Sunday having seen an ad in a local guide for the area - if you're a kid from the 80s, or into that era, this place will blow you away.They have STACKS of toys and clothing from the era and all sensibly priced. there's some top end toys which are collector money, but I managed to get a few gifts for friends and family [and myself] all pretty reasonably.Visited a few of the vintage shops in the immediate area and this was by far my favorite.Friendly staff and spacious interior, so browsing here was a no pressure pleasure - could easily have bankrupted myself on nostalgia!

20.description: The selection was well curated and diverse, but the prices for everything were RIDICULOUSLY high. So high, in fact, that I was so offended that I just walked out. C'mon guys, you're sucking all the life and fun out of the vintage experience with these prices.

19.description: Thank god this store exists in my hometown!  The selection and quality of items is astounding.  I try to stop in once a season to see what new vintage items are on the floor and I am always impressed.  I love out of town sports teams and there is nowhere else in Chicago where you can find a variety of hats, t-shirts, pennants and sweatshirts than at Rad Vintage.  And when it comes time for winter, there are so many jackets and coats to choose from, all at great prices.Love following the Rad Vintage Facebook Page, too.  RJ updates the latest stuff that he's able to find and always takes requests and usually comes through, if you are looking for something rare or you do not even know exists.I've picked up birthday gifts and even an ugly holiday sweater for a party last year.  I won 2nd place, too!I think Rad Vintage has a little for everyone, young and old, and I think it's pretty hard to leave without buying something each time you walk in.  There are a few vintage clothing/toy stores in Chicago, but there is really only one that does it right and does not charge you an arm and a leg.  Go check 'em out now, before that item that you've been looking for is bought by someone else.

2.description: I was walking down Berwyn the other day and came across Rad Vintage. I took a peek inside and immediately fell in love with the store and all of its wonderful merchandise. I ended up buying a few packs of Garbage Pail Kids stickers and some other G.P.K. related items. When I brought all of my things to the register, the gentleman behind the counter noticed my haul. Him and I had a short, friendly conversation about Garbage Pail Kids, and he even gave me a free G.P.K. movie poster. That was very nice of him. Rad Vintage is a lovely place with great customer service, and I will definitely be coming back.

18.description: Really awesome selection of 1990s stuff.  But, like most curated vintage stores, you pay a premium for them finding what you've been searching for.  I took off a star because it took me three visits during their regular posted hours before I found them open.

13.description: This place takes me back & makes me wish I never ever gave anything away and kept and took care of everything I had.  Love lookin at all the old school stuff that they have & hate to see the stuff that I HAD.  If u like old school vintage stuff, you gotta check this place out.

4.description: Cute little vintage store. Lots of variety. Mostly menswear items in clothing. Cute toys & memorabilia. It's a must check out shop in Andersonville.

6.description: I've been wanting to check out Rad Vintage for a while, since it seemed like a cool little shop and I was wondering if the stuff they were selling was as rad as they claimed it to be.  In terms of the fashions, I definitely wasn't disappointed. They've got a great selection of vintage clothing and an especially impressive collection of sports jerseys and jackets. It wasn't just a bunch of "vintage-meaning-crappy-and-old" junk with a couple cool pieces thrown in.  It was very well curated. That being said, I'm having a really hard time remembering an instance where I've encountered anyone as rude as the staff working today.  I walked in and said hi and was greeted with a bunch of blank stares by a crowd gathered by the front door.  I tried to squeeze past to actually enter in the store uttering a polite, "Excuse me," and got a very rude and pissy, "EXCUSE me", right back.  I browsed around for about 15 minutes but felt really uncomfortable the whole time.  I almost felt like asking if they were even open because I was getting the level of shade thrown at me like I was demanding to shop while they were about to close.  I just felt uncomfortable and unwelcome so after looking around a bit, I decided to head out.   As I was leaving I said, "Thanks for letting me look around", and got silence accompanied by a look of disgust.I work in retail and on my worst day I would never DREAM of treating a customer as disgustingly awful as I was made to feel at Rad Vintage.  It sucks because I really did think the store was cool, but I felt out-numbered and unwelcome.  Not sure if I'll ever go back.

15.description: this place is saving me so much money! ...because I never buy anything.their inventory consists of all kinds of 80's toy and sports memorabilia, plus some vintage clothes. they've gathered a great selection, i'll give 'em that. nkotb and 90210 dolls in the package! adorable sweaters. after my second visit here i remembered why i came home empty-handed the first time. super fun to browse, but i'm not gonna buy anything with these jacked up prices. i'd rather do the hunting myself.

7.description: This store represents a lot of what I despise about the new era of "vintage". The adjective "vintage" is incredibly misleading and it makes me sad that anyone younger than 25 will view this stuff as actual vintage.  Perhaps retro would be more suitable? This store is for hipsters that are completely unaware of the fact that you can find all of these items at garage stores and flea markets throughout the country. I get that the owner needs to make a profit, but most everything I've seen here is overpriced relative to its value. Admittedly, it can be worth overpaying for vintage if it's a real gem (i.e. a 30's gown or 20s flapper dress), but no one should be overpaying for an 80s windbreaker or a Ninja Turtles toy. And before you get snappy, yes, I was born in the mid-80's.  I remember all of this stuff.  I love Dr. Martens, Vans sneakers, high waisted 70's jeans, paper thin vtg tees, etc, but I get them cheaper and in better condition elsewhere.Note that I'm giving this place 2 stars because even though it's all junk, it's very well curated junk (there is an 80s toy section, an 80s jersey section, an 80's ugly sweater section, etc).

8.description: Aside from the too-high prices, this place rawks ("rawks?" who am I?). It's tucked off of the main Andersonville amble and features merchandise that's from mostly the 1970s to present. A few of the finds from Sunday:-Big cozy sweaters. TONS of them that were actually cute and not unraveling.-Plaid Wrangler button down for the man-Sports jerseys and team sweaters-Old Ninja Turtle action figures-Four 1988 Olympic Committee windbreakers (seriously)-A 1980s white, mock turtleneck ski sweater that just said "USA," issued from the Olympic ski teamIf any of the above interests you, you'll have no trouble finding something for yourself at Rad Vintage.

3.description: Were you born in the 70s 80s or 90s? Do you want your old toys back? Then this is the place for you. They have a lot of everything and the owner is awesome. My son found my old Castle Grayskull at my parents and fell for HeMan big time. I have amassed my old collection and then some at prices competitive with eBay. The owner will look out for what you're seeking and is just a great and knowledgeable guy. I love this store and can't say enough about the customer service. No complaints at all and this is the place for the cool the collectible and just plain fun!

14.description: Rad Vintage recently opened up at 1511 W Berwyn (between Clark and Ashland) featuring vintage clothing, thowback sporting apparel and even your favorite childhood toys from the '80's. I had the opportunity to stop into Rad Vintage and while the selection of goods is spectacular, I felt the prices were not.  $20-25 for a used tee?   Sometimes a bit steep for worn used goods, but if you're looking for that hard to find rare item Rad Vintage fills a unique niche in the Andersonville shopping district.

3.description: I've seen David twice and I'll continue to keep going back.  Probably the best overall massage that I've ever had.  He's incredibly talented and does great body work.  The environment is relaxing and for $80 you get an amazing treatment.

1.description: David is an outstanding massage therapist. I have been seeing him on a regular basis for massages for 3 1/2 years and he is the best!!!!!! I have a fair amount of arthritis in my neck and back and always feel  better after a therapeutic massage from him!  I would highly recommend him to anyone.

2.description: I love going for therapeutic massage with David at Session!  (My friends tell me Patrick is great, too.)The massage is great.  I am a long-distance runner, so I find regular massages helpful to my training and recovery program.  They are fully licensed and trained... I'm not sure if it's the training or his history as a dancer (I'm sure it's really both), but David really knows all the technical details of the human body.  It's also simply relaxing, and loosens me up.The environment at Session is private and relaxing.  David makes me feel at ease and we often get into good conversation.Booking an appointment is easy and convenient... In fact, I think I should book one now...

0.description: David and Patrick are the best therapists out there.  I have had work done by both, but now see David.  Their history as professional dancers in Chicago's top dance companies, therapeutic training and countless hours massage make them unbelievable.  I have had many massages at Athletico and several other spots and I must say ... I am always hoping they will be as good as these two.

58.description: I have been here so many times I've lost count. I have NEVER been disappointed. The food is absolutely amazing (I've been here so many times I went from vegetarian to eating meat, YEARS, and I've never been let down). The service is far superior to other places in the Chicago area. I have had a bar tender, Aaron, share with me the newest local liquors and tell me where I can purchase them on a Saturday with a full bar. If that's not incredible service I don't know what is. I came in a few weeks ago and we had a brand new waitress, Mel, step up and take her first (our) table because they were so slammed and she was flawless. The lure of Jerry's is that they know how to serve, what to serve, and how to make you feel like you're a regular that's dined in everyday for the last 10 years. Please, for your sake, don't listen to the reviews bashing them on a slammed Saturday (if you haven't been a server, you don't understand) and do yourself a favor and try this place. You'll thank me later.

56.description: I went to Jerry's on a late Sat afternoon and had one of their many selections of beer. The decor is nice with the sliding glass windows in the front and a nice patio in the back. The bartenders are nice and helpful. They have two big TV's at the bar which are good for watching a game. I will be back.

29.description: We all went to Jerry's on the recommendation of our daughter. It was a fun, great family outing. Their menu it outstanding - appetizers, salads and MANY sandwiches. They also have an extensive beer menu. They also have a premium beer menu containing very expensive beers I'm not familiar with. (but my son was...)My poor wife was the designated driver. I had a vodka martini, my son had some kind of IPA. And my daughter had a couple of exotic drinks. All were very good.We ordered pita and hummus as an appetizer. The hummus was fresh, plain, but very good. It came with both fresh pita and fried pita. It also included a pickle relish of some kind and a roasted poblano peppers.We each ordered something different for our meals, so I will only talk about mine. In addition to their regular menu, they had a menu of at least a dozen specials. I ordered the Korean Fried Chicken sandwich. The sandwiches come. With two sides - I had pickles and fresh fruit.First the chicken - I can't tell you everything that was on it. There were deep fried pickle chips, an aioli mayo and other items. There were two split chicken breasts. They were absolutely outstanding. They were crispy, but not at all greasy. The chicken meat was flavorful. The sauce, which on traditional Korean chicken can be very sweet, was only mildly sweet making it a great blend with the rest of the food.The fruit was a little disappointing. But, the pickles were an unexpected surprise. They were a combination of vegetables in a sweet, tangy pickle juice.This was a great experience. And, although I don't recall her name, our server was outstanding and that made the visit even more meaningful. We'll be back.

42.description: The biggest problem with Jerry's in the past was always their slow ass service.  It was a problem every single time I had been there until my most recent visit.  I never understood why it took half an hour to make a sandwich anyway. Well, they finally fixed that I guess but now they've gone too far the other way.  On my most recent visit I felt very rushed the whole time.  The waiter first tried to bring our check before I had even finished my first beer, and I said actually I am going to get more, so then he brought it again before I had finished my second beer.  I would have stayed and had a few more had he not clearly wanted to get us out of there.  I should point out that the place was half empty at the time so it's not like they needed the table.Also, we were there celebrating my birthday.  My girlfriend asked the waiter if they do anything for birthdays, and he said "sure, I'll bring you a dessert".  But then he ended up putting the dessert on our bill anyway.  While I guess he never said outright that it would be comped, I think that's pretty clearly what the implication was when he said that he would bring us a dessert.  If you're charging us for it, how is that doing anything for a birthday?  It's no different than any other table ordering a dessert.

23.description: It appears service is slowing down a bit, not sure if staffing is the issue or time management. Food was ok nothing special.  I was surprised to see the place barely occupied too despite the slower service. Other places around appeared to be more crowded which could be a sign.

47.description: Just, no. The menu really caught my eye as there are a lot of options - an extensive beer list, and seemingly so many delicious sounding food choices to choose from. That, and I live in the neighborhood, so I'm always eager to try and support local businesses. My boyfriend and I stopped in for dinner, and we were famished. Unfortunately, we were disappointed in all of the food that we chose despite being so hungry and so excited to try everything. To start with the positive: our server, Shannon, was friendly and we didn't experience the poor service many other reviewers mentioned. Long list of beer selection and some food tables by open air windows and outdoor seating make it a cool space.  Unfortunately the main reason why we were there - the food - left us horribly disappointed. We shared two apps: fried chicken BBQ poppers and crab dip. We really didn't care for either of them. The waitress mentioned the poppers were "Korean style" which I'm very familiar with and typically LOVE. What we got were Chicken poppers that were dressed in a glaze that was SO salty we couldn't eat more than a few bites. It tasted like they were doused in so much soy sauce without anything to balance all the salt. We tried dabbing the sauce off, disguising it with other sauces -- to no avail. The crab dip was also really hard to eat - didn't care for the flavors, and was really fishy tasting. We also shared the BLT which was a potato bun, fresh mozzarella, tomatoes and bacon. The bacon was one strip, not super crispy and the whole sandwich was just very soft and soggy in texture. The two sides that came with didn't help: the mashed potatoes were near liquid and the Mac n cheese was cold, extremely mushy and lacked any flavor whatsoever. Considering we were famished coming into he restaurant, we'd typically be the easiest to please but the food left us so disappointed we couldn't stop talking about it even the day after. Seeing the unprofessional and antagonistic tone in the management responses to other reviewers also leaves me with such a poor reflection on the business and there are too many outstanding restaurants and bars on the same street.

8.description: We stumbled in here during the Andersonville Midsommarfest. Blame it on the al al al al al alcohol. How does that song go?I wanted to try Hamburger Mary's across the street but my girlfriend doesn't eat meat and at the time, I could eat anywhere. So I thought.She chose Jerry's. We are locals and planned on eating our way down Clark St., sooner or later. One way or another.For it being fairly busy during the fest, the service was quick. The atmosphere was also aesthetically pleasing. One of the reasons which probably subconsciously drew us.The food looked good too but the taste was nothing flavorful to write about. Therefore I won't.The beer and whiskey selections are vast but on a strip of bars and restaurants that know how to do both, I would suggest another option.

31.description: Food was okay, but service sooooooooo needs attention.  A cobb salad took 25 MINUTES! Then waiter brought fries instead of mac and cheese for the side.  Really? On a Thursday? Place not packed so we don't get it. We think the waiter may have forgotten to put it in the order and was covering for that.  This is not acceptable.  Not so impressed with the required 20 % tip on a group of 6 or more when a wait for food takes this long. It was like "well I'm getting the tip anyways so who cares about the service I give them."  However the back garden is gorgeous.   I've waited tables for years --this place is mediocre at best for service and food. But again sit in the garden and you'll say it's worth the letdowns of the other aspects.  Jerrys you can do better.

34.description: I am giving this place 2 stars mostly because of the service. We came in with a party of about 7 people after a volleyball match and got seated near the back. The waitress was very friendly and we ordered drinks and put in our dinner orders. From here, it just seemed to become a failure.Our drink orders came and there was some confusion because we didn't see everything there. The man bringing it from the bar was extremely rude. I waited until the waitress came back (always very pleasant) and she investigated. The bar had run out of my drink and rather then let us know they just decided not to bring it out. I re-ordered and that eventually got fixed.While waiting, we had a waiter drop a tray which splattered ketchup on the back our chairs and on my leg. We actually had to notify a waitress before anyone apologized for that one. The food came in after around an hour at which time we had to have her flagged down to check on the meal. The bill automatically gains a 20% gratuity on the meal so I don't know if that is why they seemed to be lackluster tonight.Foodwise, the meal was excellent BUT they failed to warm up the sides they brought out. Big no no since we had waited a large amount of time. These were burgers so there was nothing exceptional or out of the ordinary to take that long and the restaurant itself wasn't terribly busy. I would definitely like to return based on the food alone but they really need better service regardless of how big or small the group is. I will say the waitress seemed nice enough throughout but she really needed to rally her troops.

16.description: Bad service horrible food =never coming back.  Menu looks promising but food i got was stale. Restaurant looks nice and I really wanted to like it but it fails on multiple levels. Never returning.

13.description: UPDATE: Sandwiches - delicious as ever. The mac & cheese hasn't yet hit the bar that was set during that first experience. The service has, unfortunately, been consistently inattentive over my past several visits, whether I'm with a party of 2 or a party of 10. Friendly, for sure, but inattentive - which can be an inconvenience when you want to order more tiny beers. Still a great place and well worth a visit.

11.description: I'm surprised this place doesn't have better reviews! I've been here twice in the past two weeks because my family and I had a great experience.Both times we sat on the back patio. So nice and welcoming and seats a lot of people. The service is also great. You just have to communicate if there is a problem and they will fix it. We didn't encounter any issues but writing this due to other reviewers who had some. The drinks are very good and there's definitely a huge variety of choices. Same with the food! It's so hard to decide. The BLT is one of my favorites! The fried green tomatoes are so yummy and a great change to the typical BLT. I love that you get to pick two sides and there's more than just 3 choices ;)So we will definitely be back! The atmosphere is nice, both inside and out, nice people, good service, great food and drinks. Keep it up, Jerry's!

39.description: I'm surprised this place doesn't have better reviews! I've been here twice in the past two weeks because my family and I had a great experience.Both times we sat on the back patio. So nice and welcoming and seats a lot of people. The service is also great. You just have to communicate if there is a problem and they will fix it. We didn't encounter any issues but writing this due to other reviewers who had some. The drinks are very good and there's definitely a huge variety of choices. Same with the food! It's so hard to decide. The BLT is one of my favorites! The fried green tomatoes are so yummy and a great change to the typical BLT. I love that you get to pick two sides and there's more than just 3 choices ;)So we will definitely be back! The atmosphere is nice, both inside and out, nice people, good service, great food and drinks. Keep it up, Jerry's!

37.description: Solid spot for our late night dinner.  Spacious, tidy place with lots of sandwich options, which come with sides as well.  (Also other offerings on the menu, but the sandwiches dominate.)We didn't partake of the beer offerings, but they have a number of those too.

0.description: Massive sandwiches.  Amazing sides.I recommend the crab dip it was amazing, but you don't need the potato chips just the fresh fried pita chips. Good selection of beers.They had TV and some football game was on, but I was on a 1st-ish/2nd-ish date.  My date offered to give me the TV view, but I chose to get to know her more instead.  Good place and comfortable atmosphere.

38.description: I'm surprised by how negative these reviews are. I visited Jerry's a few weeks ago on a beautiful Saturday afternoon, and although my server's section was busy, we were very well taken care of, and he walked us through all the questions we had about beers/ciders and made us feel very welcome.I reallllllly really love that they have ciders beyond the mass produced. I love trying new ones I've never seen and Jerry's was awesome for that! The food was great! My friend and I split the Jenny F grilled and were blown away. It was soooo good. We had fries and the homemade pickles as our sides and both were great! The pickles had a great crunch and were really just delicious. It was the perfect amount for two people who didn't want to walk away full enough to roll.Only knocked one star off because although we split the bill, it was still more expensive than I'd expect a vegetarian sandwich + 2 drinks to be.

51.description: Tried it for the first time on Sunday, Memorial Day weekend. Raining outside and I came in at an early dinner hour, so it wasn't too crowded. I came alone and sat at the bar. Very relaxed chill atomosphere. Not pretentious at all like some places like it that tout extensive beer and whiskey offerings. I was given the food and drink menus quickly with a glass of water without even asking for one, which was appreciated as I was parched.Great beer list. Looks like they have something for everybody as far as craft beers go. From listening to the bartender answer other patrons questions, seems like they are fairly knowledgeable about their offerings. Reasonably priced for Andersonville. Also a nice whiskey menu. Never had to wait for a refill. Service was quick but not necessarily warm and inviting.The menu is rather large, so I went with the Diego which was listed as a favorite. I did enjoy it. The bread was good, fresh avocados, and marinade was good. I'm not entirely convinced the meat was cooked to order but I'd order it again. Came with two sides, I got the fries and slaw. I liked the slaw because it wasn't completely drowned in sauce. The fries were great! Wish there was more of them. Not bad food but for a nearly $15 plate I think it could have been better.Overall I'm glad I finally tried this place, and I'll be back.

27.description: Two sandwiches took over a half hour and cost a parking ticket. Be sure to put the max time on that meter even if the restaurant is nearly empty!

32.description: I've been here approximately 1000 times and I've never been wowed by the sandwiches or sides. I come back because there are millions of options and they have a gigantic beer list. Several observations from this last visit: (1) the corn cob side is the most bland corn I've ever eaten. Put some seasoning on it. (2) this place hasn't been open for a decade or anything, so why does the inside need so much love already? Dusty lights, torn chairs, etc. (3) the burgers were delicious but also a mess. And they arrived that way. It wasn't busy, so slow down and make the food look pretty. Three stars - the food isn't outstanding, but it is tasty. This could easily be a favorite hangout for me -- I LOVE beer and sandwiches. Sadly, I only go once in a while.

54.description: We waited well over an hour after ordering our food which was finally brought out cold. This was on a Sunday night when the place was almost empty.Won't be eating here again. Waitress was incomprehensible absent and would not respond to multiple requests to check on our food. Side dishes of "greens" turned out to be lettuce shards

48.description: This place is delicious! Great and interesting food. Been there twice and only discovered it last month. Very chill place, easy to bring kids too. Very excited to go back:)I have the koren bbq fried chicken sandwich and the philly sandwich-both good--chicken was better. Cheese curds delicous! Also the koren bbq fried chicken salad with ranch dressing=love. Go go go!

44.description: Unfortunately a let down on what at first glance seems like a winner Let's start with the positive. I love the open air and overall modern ambiance of the establishment perfect for summer time! The next positive is their GINOURMOUS craft beer selection. It's great they offer smaller 6oz tasters which make it easy to try a few or a LOT of different tastee brewz!Now onto the disappointing. I was really excited for the food menu as they has a HUGE selection of vegetarian sandwiches which come with your choice of 2 sides. Unfortunately what on paper looks good didn't deliver. Beyond the fact one of the 2 sandwiches we order came out wrong, both were just blah. I anticipated the tofu sandwich to have a KICK with the inventive ingredients it offered but instead was just tasteless items on rye. The tuna sandwich (which first came out wrong as a hamburger) was a hole lotta moosh! The sides left us hangin too. To sum it up they have a lot going for them but someone in that kitchen needs to step it up and BRING IT! You have all the right tools you just aren't delivering.

24.description: Good food and menu. Pricey. Way too loud. Excruciatingly slow service. Will only return during off hours.

7.description: We all went to Jerry's on the recommendation of our daughter. It was a fun, great family outing. Their menu it outstanding - appetizers, salads and MANY sandwiches. They also have an extensive beer menu. They also have a premium beer menu containing very expensive beers I'm not familiar with. (but my son was...)My poor wife was the designated driver. I had a vodka martini, my son had some kind of IPA. And my daughter had a couple of exotic drinks. All were very good.We ordered pita and hummus as an appetizer. The hummus was fresh, plain, but very good. It came with both fresh pita and fried pita. It also included a pickle relish of some kind and a roasted poblano peppers.We each ordered something different for our meals, so I will only talk about mine. In addition to their regular menu, they had a menu of at least a dozen specials. I ordered the Korean Fried Chicken sandwich. The sandwiches come. With two sides - I had pickles and fresh fruit.First the chicken - I can't tell you everything that was on it. There were deep fried pickle chips, an aioli mayo and other items. There were two split chicken breasts. They were absolutely outstanding. They were crispy, but not at all greasy. The chicken meat was flavorful. The sauce, which on traditional Korean chicken can be very sweet, was only mildly sweet making it a great blend with the rest of the food.The fruit was a little disappointing. But, the pickles were an unexpected surprise. They were a combination of vegetables in a sweet, tangy pickle juice.This was a great experience. And, although I don't recall her name, our server was outstanding and that made the visit even more meaningful. We'll be back.

49.description: Beer selection was good. I would have preferred if the beer list was separated by type. The list was quite extensive and hard to read and get through. Grilled cheese with bacon was delicious and the Sante Fe burger was yummy.Our server, Dash, was awesome :)Overall I'd definitely visit again for dinner or drinks

40.description: The food was pretty good but the service was horrible!  It wasn't even that busy but our waitress kept disappearing for long periods of time.  I asked for recommendations for beer and both the beers I had weren't even close to what I requested and they were awful!   I've heard good things about jerry's but I think I'd choose somewhere else next time...

53.description: I'm giving two stars only because the food was, as usual, quite good. I ordered the usual Mushroom Burger with Cider Slaw and Fries and was very pleased. However, the service was just terrible, which was disappointing especially since I was looking forward to celebrating my birthday with friends. We have had our waiter several times before, and every time he has been rude, messed up our order, or acted like he had better things to do than wait on us. Unprovoked, several of my friends told me they had also had problems with this waiter before, but I figured it was my birthday, I wasn't going to worry about it. When we got there, he got us our drinks and told us everything could only be on one check. Understandable, we've got 20 people, that's a lot of checks to split, no worries, we can figure it out. He then proceeds to be short with many of my guests, and takes a substantially long amount of time to come back and check on us, often disappearing right before someone was about to order. If it had been busy, I would have been a little more understanding, but there were maybe four other tables full at this time, and they were all being served. But the kicker comes from the fact that the receipt was wrong three times. He had cashed out my friend when she left, and then left her meal on our ticket, even after my fiance, who is a mathematician, showed him that she had cashed out. He also left a salmon salad on the receipt which no one had ordered, but he took that off, so I can't be upset about that. He then argued with us that someone at our table had eaten a Cuban sandwich, even when I could tell him what everyone at the table ordered, and I knew that my friend who was sitting at a table who received a separate check had been the only one to order a Cuban. He insisted that he delivered one to our table, but everyone who sat there said that no one at that table had ordered a Cuban. He went and got his manager, who told us that his cook remembered preparing a Cuban for our table and therefore we needed to keep it on our bill. He told us he would take half off of the sandwich for our trouble. At this point, I was tired of arguing about a sandwich on my birthday, so I asked him how much the sandwich was ($12.50) and told him to take the money, anticipating that he would at some point take that half off and bring back change to me, which he never did. I am so disappointed. This was one of my favorite places to go in Andersonville up until this event. I had just had a fantastic afternoon at Jerry's the week before with a lovely waiter who I would have been happy to commend here had he waited on me on my birthday. Unfortunately, this particular waiter has ruined my Jerry's experience before, and it seems many of my friends previous experiences, and this time was no exception. I don't believe I, or any of my guests will be back to Jerry's any time soon. Oh, and waiter? We heard you complaining about us to your manager loud enough for us to hear, and yes, we did think it was necessary to argue about a sandwich on a $400 bill. Seems the customer is not always right. Bummer.

30.description: The food is always overwhelmingly mediocre. Service is hit or miss. Great beer selection.

46.description: Love the Turkey meatloaf, Reuben, Chicken sandwich and all the sides and soups are good. Especially the mash & poblano gravy. Consistently tasty. Delivery is pricey at $5. Pop is $3 per can.

1.description: Mediocre and over rated..Pricey for the quantity plus nothing special.. many better sandwich places here in Chicago..

55.description: During the warm months, I frequent Jerry's to enjoy their amazing patio, delicious sandwiches, refreshing cocktails, and extensive beer list. The service has always been quick, friendly, and honest-- let's be real it's hard to try all those sandwiches! Being a person that likes to try new things, I tend to get a different sandwich every time unless I need that Diego R in my life. Some sandwiches have missed the mark, but most hit it out of the park.When ordering from Jerry's just find what appeals to your palette and go with it! They are great with adding or taking away ingredients to customize your sandwich. My personal favorites at Jerry's are the Diego R, Ansel A, Jenny F, and let's not forget the jalepeno poppers-- they are awesome! Overall, Jerry's is a great place to relax on a patio, drink, and of course eat! Don't be overwhelmed by the menu and go with your gut!

9.description: I used to go to the Jerry's in Wicker Park years ago and remembered liking it so on a Saturday at 3:20 pm we stopped in to this location to get a mid-afternoon bite. It was about 80% full and the hostess seated us right away. Then waited 10 min before our server came by the table with waters, asked if we were ready to order and we placed our order right away (did not introduce himself and didn't seem remotely happy being there). Then we waited and finally at 3:50 I caught the eye of our server and kinda shrugged my arms like "what's going on here?" He didn't say anything, went back to the kitchen and we received our food at 3:57 with no explanation for the wait, an "anything else I can get for you?", etc. As we were unrolling our napkins and getting ready to finally dig in, another server comes by and grabs my buddy's fried chicken sandwich plate saying this is not yours and takes it into the kitchen. Another 30 sec later, he returns with the same plate (my buddy adjusted the bread on the sandwich before it was taken away so we know it's the same one) and says never mind, this is yours. No apologies, no explanation.I understand that sometimes the kitchen can be running slow and that sometimes the wrong (or in this case, right) order could be delivered. But then just tell me that the kitchen is running slow so I know you didn't forget about me. And just say "my apologies, this was your correct order all along."On top of the poor service, the fried chicken sandwich (dry chicken), sides of slaw and mac & cheese (both dry and had no flavor) and the gumbo (overly spicy) were all very mediocre at best.

26.description: I am a fan of the food at Jerry's but I have been really frustrated with the service lately. The last time some work people and I went for happy hour and wanted to sit on the patio, which was the entire reason why I suggested Jerry's. I told the host there was going to be 8 of us ...  he stated we had to order food to sit on the patio. I just stared at him... because the entire restaurant was empty... EMPTY! And there were only two parties already on the patio. It doesn't make any sense... you make money off of the eight of us ordering drinks for a couple of hours... or you make NOTHING... until the place fills up, which wouldn't have happened for another couple of hours because it was only 4:45 in the afternoon. That's just stupid business. Absolutely STUPID! The only reason they got two stars if because the few times I have gone for lunch the food was really good. Our service was slow but it was to be expected at this point. They have a great beer list as well. The only reason I would go back is because my work group wanted sandwiches at a sit down restaurant on the patio... other than that... go somewhere else in the area.

25.description: Service 2 stars - semi inattentive, very slow.Food 3 stars - for starters, cheese curds were AWESOME. Crispy on the outside, creamy deliciousness on the inside, with the teeniest hint of sweet. All other food (toasted beef pastrami, fries, Mac n cheese) was sub par. Fries were warm, not hot, lacked flavor and were kinda soggy/soft. Sandwich lacked flavor and also was just warm, not hot. Mac n cheese was an embarrassment. It practically apologized to me. The cheese was clumpy, bland, barely warm. Beer selection 3 stars - varied.My beer 4 stars - Great Lakes Alberta clipper was fab with cheese curds.Ambience - 4 stars I consider going back for apps and beers but not for a meal.

12.description: What is with this place??? The food was ok at best, but the service was absolutely HORRIBLE!!! It must be something in the water in Andersonville. We have visited restaurants in Andersonville  coming from the Lakeview area, and I have to say 50/50 as to what kind of service you will get at an Andersonville establishment it seems. We walked in and were seated promptly, which is a plus, but it really seemed to go downhill from the moment we set eyes on our server, Thomas. It seemed the moment I asked him his suggestion between the two options I was looking at on the menu, he flipped a switch, and became non-communicative, and seemed very annoyed. We brought this to the attention of the manager on duty, and he stated that he was surprised and that patrons ask for Thomas all the time, and it was the first time he had heard of any issues with Thomas. Seriously??? You really could have fooled me.When our food came, we were surprised at the portion size, could have been better, actually left still hungry, oh well, but Thomas never once came back to see how our food was to our liking....never once, he did however refill our drinks one time, any other interaction was non-existent. Thomas constantly walked around the restaurant with a huge chip on his shoulder, and we wondered what we had done to deserve such treatment. We do not ask for much when dining out, we are easy to get along with, and we just want decent service, this certainly was not the case. After we finished our meal Thomas proceeded to clear our dishes from the table in a way that said, here, get the hell out, and when he brought the check he threw it down on the table and did not say a word. One word, but if looks could kill, the coroner would have been called on the spot. We felt so unwelcomed by Thomas, we attempted to just give the check to the hostess, and when Thomas looked at me, he just turned his head, finally taking the check and my card after the hostess stuttered and stammered as to why I was bringing the check to her. We asked for the manager again, and low and behold he was no where to be seen, possibly down in the basement...avoiding the situation, avoidance is the best policy here! Just terrible!!!! We will never be back................:(

59.description: Great craft beer selection, including a variety of ciders. I've had a few of the vegetarian sandwiches, and have enjoyed each one. The poblano gravy mashed potatoes were delicious and the mac n cheese was average. Service is hit or miss, but the food and drink is good enough that I'll come back. It's a great place to have within walking distance of home.

21.description: I have been here a few times. This place has wonderful sandwich and beer options. Extensive menu. Back patio is lovely! However, my partner Chris and I have grown tired of the remarkably slow service. And I can tell I am not the only yelper who feels this way. Something needs to change. I understand that this place is not in bustling River North or the Loop but it's really quite bizarre. I love how Andersonville has all these new restaurants popping up. Very exciting for the neighborhood. However, I feel that Jerry's needs to pay attention to some of this agitation and take it seriously.

17.description: Unfortunately, two experiences and both were unsatisfactory in wildly different ways.On our first visit, after we were seated, our server never came to the table.  I had to ask for water from the guy sweeping.  After 25 minutes of trying to flag the server (actually impressive how he avoided eye contact), we left and went across the street to Mary's.  We told the hostess why we were leaving (so she wouldn't think we were skipping out on a check).  She seemed really sorry and offered to comp our drinks, but a) we didn't even have drinks to comp and b) we were really hungry and didn't want to wait any longer (and possibly have our food spit in).I went back a few months later at lunch.  The waiter this time was excellent.  My first sandwich (an avocado-based veg special of some type) was absolutely horrible.  He had come to ask after the food very soon after it was served.  I told him and he very quickly offered to bring something else.  The replacement (a more basic chicken) was also terrible (dry, flavorless), but I didn't want to be "that guy," especially to this nice guy, so I choked it down. So, Jerry's is permanently off the list.  Fortunately, there are lots of other options in the neighborhood.

10.description: Gluttons UNITE! Its always nice visiting the Midwest and getting a good, hearty 'Murica meal! Jerry's delivers what you would expect from most sandwich shops. Unique sandwich creations, gut busting sides and a butt load of beers! Leave your diets at the door! I can't say it was all fantastic or flavorful but it gets the job done when the munchies strike after a evening of drinking.

5.description: Unfortunately a let down on what at first glance seems like a winner Let's start with the positive. I love the open air and overall modern ambiance of the establishment perfect for summer time! The next positive is their GINOURMOUS craft beer selection. It's great they offer smaller 6oz tasters which make it easy to try a few or a LOT of different tastee brewz!Now onto the disappointing. I was really excited for the food menu as they has a HUGE selection of vegetarian sandwiches which come with your choice of 2 sides. Unfortunately what on paper looks good didn't deliver. Beyond the fact one of the 2 sandwiches we order came out wrong, both were just blah. I anticipated the tofu sandwich to have a KICK with the inventive ingredients it offered but instead was just tasteless items on rye. The tuna sandwich (which first came out wrong as a hamburger) was a hole lotta moosh! The sides left us hangin too. To sum it up they have a lot going for them but someone in that kitchen needs to step it up and BRING IT! You have all the right tools you just aren't delivering.

3.description: Visited their new location in Lincoln Square, nut it is not in Yelp yet.  The atmosphere is very nice. The menu is not what I expected for a sandwich restaurant in Lincoln Square...there is a SubWay, Potbelly and several great burger/pub places.  I attempted to order the gumbo, but was told, after the waiter went to get it, that they don't have it...because the menus are being reprinted.  They have been open 2 days!!! Also, the server should have known what was not available.Ordered the crab dip.  Taste was good but was not full of crab. Price $13Ordered shrimp/pork belly po-boy. I asked for no spice. Ordered baked beans and mashed potatoes. Beans were nice, not typical and had little sauce.  Mashed beans had a spicy, pepper gravy. I ordered no spice and the server didn't warn me about the pepper gravy! Partner had Jalapeño poppers (cheese sauce was watery) and a fried chicken sandwich.  The sandwich was served on cold, white bread!  Total spent before tax was $45.  I was appalled!  Don't think I'll be back.

35.description: Food was amazing. Service was better. Whiskey flights and all! Half a sandwich and a salad and a side for the price of a sandwich was SOOOOO worth it

19.description: I ordered a Nutball Grilled Cheese sandwich with a cup of Tomato Soup.  I was very underwhelmed.  For over $17, expected the sandwich to be huge.  It was small, the bread was boring, and the cheese was not melted all the way.  In addition, the bread was very wet and soggy.  Now a grilled cheese sandwich should come with a crunch and some stretchy-melty cheese.  It was a tasty sandwich, but I could have probably made it better myself.  Definitely not worth $17.  The whole meal shouldn't have cost more than $10.

28.description: Bar service is REALLY slow. Expect to wait for your drinks .... Not sure why. Food is OK.

45.description: Wow was this place a disappointment. To start with the positives, the atmosphere is good and we were seated promptly. The beer list is great! I think everyone in our party of 6 was happy with their drinks. Other than that, I really don't have much to say. The food is on the cusp of mediocre and bad and is way overpriced considering most of it is just fried or covered in condiments. We passed food around the table, and I wasn't impressed with anything anyone ordered. Finally, the fact that they don't split checks is really ridiculous in this day and age. Poor customer service, poor quality food. I wouldn't come here again.

33.description: I didn't have food,  just stopped in for drinks with a friend.  The bartenders were so friendly! My friend and I ordered margaritas and they were one of the best margaritas I've ever had!  They explained they do not use premade mixes,  all thier mixers/juices are freshly made in house.  Also,  they only carry local alcohol which I'm always a fan of supporting  local.  Only 4 stars because I didn't try thier food but will be back and I'm sure their food will be 5 star quality!

43.description: We stumbled in here during the Andersonville Midsommarfest. Blame it on the al al al al al alcohol. How does that song go?I wanted to try Hamburger Mary's across the street but my girlfriend doesn't eat meat and at the time, I could eat anywhere. So I thought.She chose Jerry's. We are locals and planned on eating our way down Clark St., sooner or later. One way or another.For it being fairly busy during the fest, the service was quick. The atmosphere was also aesthetically pleasing. One of the reasons which probably subconsciously drew us.The food looked good too but the taste was nothing flavorful to write about. Therefore I won't.The beer and whiskey selections are vast but on a strip of bars and restaurants that know how to do both, I would suggest another option.

2.description: So first of all their menu is so hard to read. So much stuff and not in a good way. You basically need to read the entire thing to understand how their plates workStarter: we got beer cheese with pretzels and pita. Cheese was more like a super cold mush and weird tasting. I don't recommend and we love beer cheese. Sandwiches: I got the Jerrys sandwich and it is huge. It was messy and not good. The bacon was like really hard leather. It was a little spicy if you are into that. My 'tasters' were Mac n cheese, super flour-y I don't recommend at all and potato salad which was ok. My boyfriend seemed ok with what he got. We had to track down our server for everything. we saw him twice our entire time. Overall not impressed and won't be coming back for below average food that is on the expensive side and bad service.I should mention I'm writing this while still in the restaurant waiting to pay. Smh

18.description: Fun atmosphere, great cocktails, wonderful patio, but the food still just leaves me disappointed. I go here fairly often with friends from the neighborhood, but I never expect a really good meal anymore. Now I just settle in for the good vibe and good drinks.

41.description: This is a shame. Such a great location, great patio and easy to get to but it's awful. Between the slow service, attitude and sub par food Jerry's is a huge disappointment. There are too many places in Andersonville to go where you can get something better.

52.description: Totally unimpressive. Holiday weekend afternoon. Special friend. Small crowd. Very nice outdoor eating area.1. Margaritas. Served as lime juice and tequila(not much). Our server explains that one bartender started the drinks and another finished them up, the server finally added triple sec. Says they are breaking in new bartenders for summer. Huh?2. Crab dip. not bad, made with horseradish. We like horseradish, but was odd in crab concoction.3. Burgers. Known as Angus Double burgers. Will not prepare any redder than medium, which is gray. No taste. Brings into question the meat. Just because it's Angus doesn't necessarily mean top quality. Plus some fairly odd combinations of toppings. Plus second server brought wrong order. Plus primary server informs they are breaking in new cook staff for summer. WAIT a minute! Can't imagine our service if they were busy.Pare down the menu, adjust the toppings, do a few things really well. PS, The trendy, ubiquitous Pretzel Roll that everybody seems to need to include on their menus has really run it's course, no? Potato roll was good, but a nice, fresh Kaiser would be a real plus.Like my high school essays, Needs Work! D+

50.description: Beautiful patio, extensive (almost overwhelming) menu and very knowledgeable servers! We had Tim L. who was extraordinarily accommodating and savvy with both food and beer recommendations.  We had a great time here on Memorial Day and will definitely be back.

4.description: I've been here approximately 1000 times and I've never been wowed by the sandwiches or sides. I come back because there are millions of options and they have a gigantic beer list. Several observations from this last visit: (1) the corn cob side is the most bland corn I've ever eaten. Put some seasoning on it. (2) this place hasn't been open for a decade or anything, so why does the inside need so much love already? Dusty lights, torn chairs, etc. (3) the burgers were delicious but also a mess. And they arrived that way. It wasn't busy, so slow down and make the food look pretty. Three stars - the food isn't outstanding, but it is tasty. This could easily be a favorite hangout for me -- I LOVE beer and sandwiches. Sadly, I only go once in a while.

6.description: Came in last night, greeted with a water right away. (Was skeptical because of recent reviews of horrible service). Bartender came back to me and asked me what I would like to drink, I said I was waiting on someone and asked if they had a certain liquor, he said no and I said, "okay, well can I have a daisy cutter?" Either he didn't hear me or ignored me. Five minutes later my boyfriend arrives. As soon as he arrives he says the person at the host stand didn't acknowledge him at all. He just decided to walk past him to the bar where I was sitting. Another ten minutes go by before the bartender even acknowledges us. (Not busy at all--we would know, we both are bartenders). Ordered one beer and laid down money and it took him awhile to even cash us out. Don't recommend.

22.description: The cheese curds are so good! We also had the buffalo chicken bites and they were delicious. I had the watermelon cocktail and it was so yummy! The service was friendly and fast!

15.description: Service is lacking and food is a bore fest.  Waiter only paid attention to my husband and ignored the fact that I was at the table.  Had to ask for refills of beverages and we watched as other people got their food prior to us who came in much later than us.I question the cleanliness of the restaurant as the condiments on the table appeared to have never been cleaned.  Ever.  I've been to Jerry's multiple times always thinking I'm ordering the wrong thing.  Nope, it's just everything tastes bland and boring.  At $50 for lunch it ain't cheap either, this came in $10 less than lunch at Gibsons... Insane.Sorry Jerry's I won't be back.

57.description: Only had drinks at the bar. Extensive beer list and friendly staff. The back patio looks nice too, though it was too cold to enjoy when we were there. Food that we saw coming out looked like decent bar & grill food, sandwiches and lots of fried snacks. Not anything fancy but a fine place to go if you are looking for a good beer or a place to watch a sporting event.

20.description: I enjoy a good sandwich and as such had reasonable hopes for this place.  If all you serve are sandwiches then they should be good.  Not the case at Jerry's.  While they have an extensive list of sandwiches I have yet to try anything that has wow'ed me.  I find most of their sandwiches lack sufficient meat - you are essentially eating bread with a "meat" condiment.  The other point that irks me about this place is their service.  It is often slow and inaccurate.  I doubt I will return.

36.description: Love this place! Great menu to explore. The John M and the Cuban are great. Charlie's tuna sandwich is one of our faves. Excellent service whether you dine in or take out.

14.description: During the warm months, I frequent Jerry's to enjoy their amazing patio, delicious sandwiches, refreshing cocktails, and extensive beer list. The service has always been quick, friendly, and honest-- let's be real it's hard to try all those sandwiches! Being a person that likes to try new things, I tend to get a different sandwich every time unless I need that Diego R in my life. Some sandwiches have missed the mark, but most hit it out of the park.When ordering from Jerry's just find what appeals to your palette and go with it! They are great with adding or taking away ingredients to customize your sandwich. My personal favorites at Jerry's are the Diego R, Ansel A, Jenny F, and let's not forget the jalepeno poppers-- they are awesome! Overall, Jerry's is a great place to relax on a patio, drink, and of course eat! Don't be overwhelmed by the menu and go with your gut!

58.description: This place is basically filled with shlock. it isn't that every single piece in this galleria is crap, but all the things that are sorta crappy or really over-priced or things that no one really needs or wants overpowers the items that are beautiful or useful or whatever. Simply put, it is stuff overload. All that being said, this is the perfect place to go to when you are really in the mood to buy something or you are in a pinch for a gift. There is so much stuff to choose from, you will always be able to find something you "need". On my last trip, I walked in not looking for anything in particular and left with a bracelet, a Chicago t-shirt, and a pregger's lady pampering kit (a gift). Woohoo!

56.description: I originally dropped in to kill a few minutes before meeting a couple ladybuds, but this was a very pleasant surprise.  I especially liked the jewelry - some lines which are sold elsewhere, and some that are vintage or otherwise unique finds.  The scarves and bags were cool too.  Since I'm always on the lookout for some cool wall pieces or tchotchkes, I browsed and found a few things I'm thinking of purchasing.  I stopped in just before they closed and so didn't actually have the optimal persue/decide/purchase time frame, but I'll be back.

29.description: Good stuff here! They have everything you need here art-wiseThey usually have great sales...I was lucky enough to get a nice sized Chicago city skyline picture on sale for $150.Definitely a must-see place if you are looking for some good artsy material for your home or apt.

42.description: Super cool shop in Andersonville. It's basically a large space for (mostly) local artists to rent and showcase their wares. It's 3 (or 4?) floors of sexy art. The people who work the front desk are super nice and will answer any questions you have. They have clothing, food, sculptures, coasters, photographs, paintings, jewelry...you name it, they probably it. Among other things, my favorite possession i've bought from here is a photograph of an old, mangy cat named Thomas.

23.description: Great place to find unique gifts on the north side. Anytime I have to find a gift or just wander around and look at art, this is my first destination.  This wonderful area houses a wide and unique selection of art, jewelry, clothing, some antiques, snacks, and accessories. I do love the art here. The prices are pretty good and one can find gifts that aren't of the cookie-cutter downtown variety.. Most of the items are hand-made by local artisans. I have always had great service here. I love this place

47.description: A couple of my friends recommended that I check this place out.Very nice selection of art, jewelry, gift items made by different artists and artist groups, each in their own little area. The items are unique and range from mosaic art for the wall, to handmade glass earrings and necklaces, to scarves and gift baskets. A little pricey, but worth it for supporting local artists and good causes instead of the Wal-Mart race to the bottom sweat shop labor in (China/Indonesia/Bangladesh/Vietman). Why only 3 stars? The people were not friendly at all. There were two women at the entrance when I walked in, who totally ignored me, and a man at the top level who also ignored me. I felt pretty unwelcomed and uncomfortable.The place winds around a lot like a maze, and there are about 3-4 sets of hard-to-find staircases to the next level, which was adventurous going up, but by the time I got to the top level and felt still so unwelcomed, and wanted to leave, it was a bit of a nightmare trying to escape out of there and wind my way back down.

8.description: A friend and I had stumbled upon this gem of a galleria in the Andersonville area.  Out of the four galleries that we had walked into, Andersonville Galleria had the most to offer to customers.When entering you will discover this galleria is made up of many, many mini kiosks of various artists and jewelry makers.  You can easily lose track of time since this store is multi leveled.  Just plan to spend some time here - it's not a sprint thru store.  I, personally enjoy looking at the prints while my friend was enjoying the jewelry displays.  BTW... prices weren't to bad.I would highly suggest Andersonville Galleria if you are looking for a piece of jewelry or an incredible print.  It is a place to visit!

31.description: What a cute, neat little shopping area. I went here with my roommate earlier this month for their "First Fridays" event. We got to sample some of the food stuff sold here and browse the handmade jewelry, knick knacks, and fair trade clothing. The galleria is HUGE and there's some really cool stuff being sold. I had a great time and can't wait to be back. The only downside is since it's locally made or fair trade, you may not find the cheapest or best-priced items here. If you're looking for a bargain, not sure how you'll make out. But if you're looking for an interesting art piece for your living room or a nice gift for a loved one (or yourself!) then stop by. It's worth checking out.

34.description: I am just happy places like this exist. This is a great place to kill time if you are in the neighborhood. It takes a while just to look at everything. I was blown away just by how huge this place is. Fringe candles, clothing, bags, stationary and artwork galore - there is a lot to see.There were some works here that I have seen at art fests around the city and it is great to have this place in the back of my mind for Christmas shopping later this year. They had some great mirrors and really unique things for the home and nothing was priced insanely.
