16.description: It's a cute place to walk around but it's a bit overpriced, but if you're into cute artsy things, it's worth a visit. Terry's toffee is pretty good (still very expensive) but they do sell unique, one-of-a-kind crafts.

13.description: Love this shop! Has so many different options and unique gifts. I love coming here for birthday gifts, baby shower presents and decorations for the home.

11.description: I was shocked by the size of this space when I first entered it and walked around.  There is such a wide variety of things to look at.  You have your pick of jewelry, art, clothing, decorative items, and even chocolate sauce.  It's pretty wild.  We brought some people who were from out of town, and they enjoyed picking out some unique Chicago souvenirs.  The prices definitely ranged from low to high, so someone with any budget could probably find something they like here.

39.description: My only complaint is that this place has too many amazing things to buy!  It is way to hard to choose. Local artists, sustainable items - this place is perfect for gifts.

37.description: Went here on a whim in hopes of walking out with some Christmas presents for some hard to buy for friends  Not only did I find a bunch of gifts but I found a bunch of artwork for myself as well!  And didn't spend a fortune either!So if you're in the area I'd highly recommend walking though even if you're just perusing. There's so much neat stuff to see. Jewelry, Art, Soaps, handmade goods, scarves, and so much more.  The store itself is a neat place consisting of 3 or 4 stories of local artist's goods with lots of vendors to choose from so there's something in here for everybody.   By far one of the best shops in Andersonville!

0.description: On my way to Women & Children Bookstore, I stumbled on this place.Seriously??? A year round art fair in one place!!! THE best place to find gifts. I found a couple of house warming gifts of original art featuring many Chicago landmarks. A MUST visit for anyone who loves Chicago art festivals & art shows, etc but HATES the downtown massive messy traffic. It's peaceful up here!!

38.description: Went here to scope out some possible Christmas stuff ... run by some really nice people selling sustainable hand crafted items.  I dunno how I missed this being in existence, but it's really neat, and one of the jewels of Andersonville.

51.description: I headed to Andersonville to do some shopping and for some drinks. It was a beautiful night to meander outside and enjoy the stuff of life. The streets were pretty crowded but not so much to aggravate me.After some food and ice cream, we were running short of time and went to the Galleria to check out the selections. We always have had good luck. I've said it before but this is the perfect store for men to buy gifts for women. It's a one-stop shop, good quality and reasonable prices... done, done and done.After a long time wandering the aisles finding nothing I wanted, I called my sister because I was desperate for help. In no time "elephants, she likes elephants". I guess it's a girl thing.Anyway, Elephants seems to get the ball rolling and imagination of the pleasant and more than helpful saleswoman. In no time, she had a large selection of all things elephants to present me. I especially like the journaling or scrap booking book process from elephant poop (yes, elephant poop).I spent more than I wanted but at least it was for a present for someone I liked.

27.description: WOW! This place is fantastic! I spent the afternoon browsing around the Galleria with my mom. This place has some gorgeous art, tasty snacks (I LOVED the toffee!), lovely jewelry, and delicious smelling soaps and body butters, plus much, much more.I took off a star because there was a little bit of pressure from a couple of vendors. Not cool. Just let me look because no matter how much you talk it up- if I don't love it, I'm not buying it.But all in all this is a great place, and it was a great way to spend a lazy afternoon!

32.description: Very cool place to check out with tons of unique handmade things. It's nice because people aren't sitting where you browse through things- you just can rome through and grab things you like and pay when you're on the way out. Nice so you're not pressured to buy anything. One couple did stand buy their chocolate they were selling have gave away samples- it was amazing!! I think the brand was kids toys for adults. It was in tubes so you could squeeze it on cakes, berries, ice cream,etc. I didn't have anyone to buy it for, but would definitely consider it the next time I needed to buy someone a gift! Cool paintings too, but a little out of my price range.

54.description: OMG--I just realized my pal, Erika, reviewed this place and I BOUGHT THE SAME ITEM SHE DID!  How funny is that?Well her review is spot on, except I don't know the history of this place.  A friend of mine and I spent a hard earned half-hour in here during a pouring rainstorm.  Refuge aside, this was one neat place.  Probably 20 or so "booths"--really, more like open closets without the door--set up with trinkety stuff, bric-a-brac, object d'art, whatever.  Just a lot of artisans trying to make a living selling home furnishings, jewelry and whatever else you want to spend your disposable income on.The shop was clean, inviting, filled with fun stuff (yes, I bought a $6 travel candle), and the ladies working the register were extremely pleasant.  Oh, they're closed Mondays...just like museums.  Go figure.  :)

48.description: Great place for gifts! Huge selection of jewelry.

44.description: i don't know how you couldn't like this place. wide variety of locally hand made clothes, accessories, canned/jarred food, or from sustainable eco-friendly, fair trade type imports.quality of the art is varietal: some good some not so good.i will go back periodically to see what is new at this place

24.description: The staff/cashiers at the front desk are not friendly or helpful. The two women working on Sunday afternoon were seriously lacking in good customer service. They do not greet people and barely smile. They were too busy burying their faces in their lunches. Seriously, get w/ it, the first weekend of the holiday shopping season. I have shopped here on several occassions and always terrible, grumpy, bitter staff. Never again. From now on, I will spend my money at the other great shops along Clark St. and not at Andersonville Galleria.

7.description: Unfortunately, among some interesting items made by local artists, there are items made in China, just re packed . There is no way to know- do I support an artist or another factory in China.Totally disappointed  by these kind of business practice.

49.description: cool place for trinkets, and unique gifts.like a mini street fair inside a building...good art, jewlery, and other items that you wont always find in a chain store.some items can be pricey but..its unique right...

40.description: I adore shopping here!!  Whether you need jewelry, toffee, wasabi salt, scarves, or note pads made out of recycled elephant poop, this place is for you!  If I need a gift quick, I know I will be able to find the perfect treasure here.  Maybe it has something to do with the twisting and turning of the stairs and various vendors; I feel as if I am trapped in some sort of Greek mythology labyrinth with gifts galore!Nick and I went there a few weeks ago (during their 4th anniversary celebration), and were welcomed with glasses of champagne and wine.  What a great way to spend money and support local vendors...with the added bonus of a complimentary cocktail!

53.description: Talk about making the mistake of judging a place by the front window. I totally thought this store was overpriced, girly kind of place... when in fact it is a moderately-priced, girly kind of place. Though is does tickle my inner decorator a little it with the art and photography, it mostly consists of trinkets, ceramics, jewelry, clothes, and candles. What I found amusing was that the whole building is like a giant maze, each artist or designer have there own sort of booth which makes you twist and turn in this three level building. I had the chance to visit during the A-ville wine tour and got to chat to a few of the artists who were manning their own booths. Everyone was extremely nice, one was cool enough to realize I was getting bored and decided to talk about the Blackhawk's game that was missing while I was on this tour. It was much appreciated!The prices all vary but I have to say I was really surprised at how affordable most things were. This is a place to add to my list of holiday or whatever gift shopping for others. I recommend you do the same.

30.description: A high-priced boutique that I just LOVE to visit. I have major buyers' remorse afterwards. But oh WTH! I have friends who consign here so always a win. But I think some of the art isnt really art, just a big "why?" Anyway so glad these places exist, I could spend hours there. They should really focus on getting out the non-handmade work out.

46.description: You remind me of the babe...Wanna little David Bowie Labyrinth action?  Then here's a fun place to get lost in.  There's so many unique vendors and so many different levels to the place it's easy to get lost in all the twists and turns.  I dig the fact that there's so many things in one place.  I've gotten lazy in my old age and with Galleria I no longer have to waste hours of shopping at a myriad of different places looking for the perfect gift for each and every person.  This place has everything - around ninety tenants offering jewelry, clothes, furniture, paintings, skincare, etc.  In one trip I found things for my mom, sister, and a number of friends.  It goes w/out saying that since they sell tasty edible treats I also found things for my father.  So yes, I will def make this a regular stop.  Sorry, Senor Wallet.Side Note:  Did not find Jareth, Hoggle, or Ludo.

1.description: The Andersonville Galleria is a shopping asset which I have overlooked for too long.  It is like a local artisan mini-mall, with a wide variety of options all under one roof.  I am convinced that a person could do the entirety of his or her holiday shopping in there.  Anything that you find at the Galleria is better for your soul--and the receiver's--than some cheap China-made garbage from Target.  It's an absolute treasure trove of (mostly?) local goods such as candles, greeting cards, snarky and/or inspirational magnets and signs, ceramics and glassware, lots and lots of jewelry and women's apparel, a wide variety of two-dimensional artwork, and on and on, as well as a few more unique finds.  Even high-end olive oil and chocolate sauce.  Chicago-centric goods abound, such as photographs and prints, gorgeous vintage maps, CTA station knick-knacks, t-shirts and baby onesies, etc etc.One of the coolest things that I saw there this season is the Sockitty and MyMouse cat toys, whose display includes a tablet showing a video of numerous shelter cats loving the bejeesus out of the toy.  It's too unique to describe, just check out the website:  gocattoys.com.Seriously, try the Galleria for any gift for any occasion or recipient--wife, sister, mother-in-law, nephew, boss, child's teacher, beloved aunt, realtor, third-string best friend, dog-walker, divorce attorney, Downton Abbey viewing club members, the firefighters who rescued you from your smashed-up car...whomever.  Even those token workplace gifts that everyone feels obligated to exchange at the end of the year.  (Bah humbug.)  The only thing better than a gift from a local artisan is a gift that you make with your own hands and/or feet.

55.description: I love this space!!! From the amazing artwork, photography, fair trade boothes, jewlery, gift items, clothing....wait, I can keep on writing about the amazing complexity of this space!!!!Very affordable and appreciate that they really support local artists. I brought my friend Wendy with me and we had a ball exploring each floor (3 floors of fabulous items). Very creative and unique space, the ladies who were working are just friendly and engaging. I'm falling in love with my new neighborhood and all that it has to offer!

9.description: There is so much stuff to look at here.  It's Etsy come to life, but you can taste and touch the products.  They have some super cute stuff here and some basics as well.  I like being able to touch and see the stuff I am going to purchase.  Some of the stuff is crazy prices and others are very reasonable. There are three floors in here so it can be kinda overwhelming.  I surprisingly get tired every time I come here.  Overall, a good place for craft, presents, upholstery or everyday  apparel.

26.description: All things considered, Galleria is a pretty cool place.  You can find all sorts of unique art by a number of established and starving artists.  It's pretty expensive, but worth it for the quality of inventory.  I like coming here for gifts if I don't have the slightest idea what I'm looking for.

25.description: Wonderful, unique, artsy co-op. This (surprisingly) large gallery features small stands from various local artists in the area. It's a great place to browse or buy that last-minute gift for someone (depends on how much you like them though...art is not cheap). Jewelry, painting, photography, clothing, hats, bags, magnets, etc.Additionally, they have fun events and sales every-so-often with the artists. Overall it's a fun way to be involved with and support the community.

12.description: This is where I get all my Christmas and other presents from! It's full of small local artists that sells anything from paintings to clothe and food! It's 3 stories of goodness!

59.description: Wooohooo, as an art geek, I am in love with this place now.  I came here for the first time this weekend, and I was very pleased with the concept this shop has.  It is one roof for many different vendors.  Inside you will find a multitude of things, from toffee, to photography, paintings, shirts, jewelry, makeup, etc.  The shops here just go on and on, as there are multiple floors of goodies!  Due to the vast selection, you can find many things in different price ranges.  Some vendors are reasonably priced, others are not.  I will be coming back again soon! :)

21.description: This place is one of Andersonville's MANY gems - Super excited they are opening in Evanston as my mother lives there and is a lover and maker of hand-crafted art. Her bday is Apr 15th and you better believe that her presents are all purchased there! As an artist in Chicago (actor), I have no choice but to support this place!

17.description: I am in love with this place! I can get lost in all the variety. This is a great place to support local merchants and artisans without breaking the bank. The customer service is great and I left with an amazing handcrafted, one of a kind leather bag that looks upscale without the upscale pricetag. And better yet, since it's not mass produced, you'll be sure that you're the only person wearing/carrying/owning the item.

10.description: Honestly, the Galleria has always been one of my favorite places to visit, especially at holiday time. Like an art show on steroids, my recent visit reminded me of how much respect I have for the independent artist. If you haven't been here, it's a place where independent businesses and local artists rent a monthly booth space and introduce their goods to the public. It's a brilliant concept, because the artist gets to test their product out and see what kind of reaction the public has without the commitment of an actual storefront.From Julius Meinl coffee, to flea market finds, to jewelry, to olive oil, to hand knitted sweaters, you can find a one-of-a-kind gift for every occasion...even when you don't have one! I am a huge fan of anything screen-printed and adore the variety of  printed towels, aprons, and totes.Featuring three levels of shopping greatness with more than 90 artists, plan to stay for awhile. The good thing is if you're hungry, Andersonville has a slew of restaurants and coffee shops where you can grab a nosh before or after the 'show'. Danger, danger! Proceed with caution, because you'll be hooked from the start and will no doubt look forward to your next return. I mean, how can you not want to come back?

5.description: This is a one-stop shop for one-of-a-kind gift shopping. There's something for every budget and make sure you don't miss the upper levels because there's plenty to see a few floors up. Even if you're not in the mood to buy, I'd recommend a visit here just to see the local talent on display. Check it out!

3.description: Really fun space with unique and interesting pieces.  I have to admit that I've never actually purchased anything from here before in the past but it's somewhere I like bringing my friends to if they're visiting or if we're in the neighborhood.

35.description: Wow, what an amazing place! Hubby and I wanted to go out for some local, independent shopping and it doesn't get any better than this. Each space was filled with wonderful, original art, jewelry and so much more. I bought two necklaces that I fell in love with and they were very reasonably priced. I know I will remember our visit every time I wear them. Btw, also had the most delicious burger ever at Hamburger Mary's. Next time we will come earlier and visit more shops. Can't wait!

19.description: This place is pretty big, but you wouldn't think so based on the entrance. I was looking for it and I walked by. But the inside is huge! Make sure you get to all the floors, as there are different artists throughout AND the space itself is in a very cool pieced-together building.They take credit cards which is nice if you stop in randomly and don't have cash, or if you fall in love with a $250 original (woops). I also went home with maple bacon lollipops...because obviously.This is a great place to browse on a weekend afternoon if you're bored OR a great place for gifts, cards, and gift ideas. Mother's Day is coming up!

28.description: What a lovely co-op! The way the space is used here is very cool. This place houses close to 100 artists. There is everything from vegan leather bags, handmade soaps and candles, one of a kind textiles, and lots and lots of jewelry. The concept is great....large 2 story retail space broken down into a bunch of small stalls and shops. Everything is well lit, nicely displayed. Some things were a bit pricey for what they were, but everything is very one of kind. Nice friendly greeting upon arrival from two fellas sitting at the front door.If your craft show inner beast is needing some feeding in a fun urban area, check this place out. Lots of nice smells, fun things to touch, lovely sights.

45.description: The Galleria is like a museum full of wonderful art. Everything in here is very unique and interesting however it does cost a pretty pennie. I have found that exploring the many levels is like a maze but there always seems to be something new around the next corner! If you enjoy art check this place out!

33.description: Fun place to shop for that "something something" you had no idea you needed!    Independent artists, foodies and shoppers unite for an enjoyable experience.

43.description: I love this addition to Andersonville.  It's an indoor craft market.There is something for everyone.  Art, jewelry, home decorations, clothes, even Terry's Toffee (impossible not to buy a bag every time I got in).  And something for every price range.  You can spend a pretty penny on a large canvas, or pick up some stocking stuffers.  Something new every time.  In addition, watch for their special nights, where they serve free wine and snacks.

2.description: The Andersonville Galleria is about 3x the size of the Evanston store.  I love this place, because it hosts many local artists which means a variety of merchandise and at many price points.The people who work here are very welcoming and friendly.  Of course we were encouraged to check out all 3 (or is it 4?) floors of the galleria, but we didn't have time.Chicago-centric art, jewelry and scarves, food including popcorn and oils, body lotion and candles, you might say that Andersonville Galleria has it all.  Good spot to pick up a unique gift or souvenir.  If you're drinking or dining in the area, why not add some shopping to the day?

18.description: You remind me of the babe...Wanna little David Bowie Labyrinth action?  Then here's a fun place to get lost in.  There's so many unique vendors and so many different levels to the place it's easy to get lost in all the twists and turns.  I dig the fact that there's so many things in one place.  I've gotten lazy in my old age and with Galleria I no longer have to waste hours of shopping at a myriad of different places looking for the perfect gift for each and every person.  This place has everything - around ninety tenants offering jewelry, clothes, furniture, paintings, skincare, etc.  In one trip I found things for my mom, sister, and a number of friends.  It goes w/out saying that since they sell tasty edible treats I also found things for my father.  So yes, I will def make this a regular stop.  Sorry, Senor Wallet.Side Note:  Did not find Jareth, Hoggle, or Ludo.

41.description: How did I live near here forever and not realize how cool this place is? Its like etsy.com, but in real life. Great wall art, including some really fantastic (and affordable!) photographic stuff, cute jewelry and accessories and even some clothes.  Overall just cool stuff, great for (self) gifting, with reasonable prices. It was crowded because we were in there for the Andersonville Art fair, so maybe I just missed some things, but my suggestion would be that I would have loved a little more ambiance (music maybe or a little corner with coffee or something) because I could see myself spending a lot of time meandering in here on a lazy day off or when looking for something special for someone.

52.description: This place has something for EVERYONE. You need a housewarming/ birthday/ mother's day/ goodbye/ father's day/ anything present? GO HERE.The fair trade and locally made items are great! I got a cute cute cute dress for thirty bucks! Amazing!!

50.description: A few hidden gems (e.g., expensive but delicious toffee), but for the most part a big building crammed full of street-fair style art either generic or hideous.

4.description: Awesome and very unique art mall in the Andersonville neighborhood of Chicago.  3 floors of local and regional arts and crafts ranging from clothing to water color paintings. The top floor has edibles and a booth of local soap bars. The ladies working the register were nice and seemed liked they really loved working there. Art is forever.

6.description: Great little art shop! So many nooks and crannies throughout the place. Each section of it has an artists work in a 5x5-ish space or little trinkets they're selling. Very inspiring work all over the place - lots of prints, paintings, and drawings featuring 100th anniversary of Wrigley. The ladies at the counter liked my Gloom Balloon shirt a lot and we talked about Des Moines and their recent performance at 80/35 with local artists painting a collaborative piece and they were very impressed. Great experience!

22.description: Honestly, the Galleria has always been one of my favorite places to visit, especially at holiday time. Like an art show on steroids, my recent visit reminded me of how much respect I have for the independent artist. If you haven't been here, it's a place where independent businesses and local artists rent a monthly booth space and introduce their goods to the public. It's a brilliant concept, because the artist gets to test their product out and see what kind of reaction the public has without the commitment of an actual storefront.From Julius Meinl coffee, to flea market finds, to jewelry, to olive oil, to hand knitted sweaters, you can find a one-of-a-kind gift for every occasion...even when you don't have one! I am a huge fan of anything screen-printed and adore the variety of  printed towels, aprons, and totes.Featuring three levels of shopping greatness with more than 90 artists, plan to stay for awhile. The good thing is if you're hungry, Andersonville has a slew of restaurants and coffee shops where you can grab a nosh before or after the 'show'. Danger, danger! Proceed with caution, because you'll be hooked from the start and will no doubt look forward to your next return. I mean, how can you not want to come back?

15.description: Really awesome collection of artsy/fartsy/local crafts. It looks super teeny from outside but is giant once you start roaming around.  They had a snack and wine tasting the night we visited, it was great to talk to the vendors about their treats.  Reasonably priced too. Great way to spend some time in this quaint town!

57.description: I love browsing the different booths looking for a gift or Nick knack.  You will always find something different and unique.  Plus Terry's Toffee has a booth so I don't have to travel far to get my fix!

20.description: This place is pretty big, but you wouldn't think so based on the entrance. I was looking for it and I walked by. But the inside is huge! Make sure you get to all the floors, as there are different artists throughout AND the space itself is in a very cool pieced-together building.They take credit cards which is nice if you stop in randomly and don't have cash, or if you fall in love with a $250 original (woops). I also went home with maple bacon lollipops...because obviously.This is a great place to browse on a weekend afternoon if you're bored OR a great place for gifts, cards, and gift ideas. Mother's Day is coming up!

36.description: Go here if you want a unique gift or piece of art.  Give yourself an hour because it's deceptively huge inside.  You'll find something every time.

14.description: Good stuff here! They have everything you need here art-wiseThey usually have great sales...I was lucky enough to get a nice sized Chicago city skyline picture on sale for $150.Definitely a must-see place if you are looking for some good artsy material for your home or apt.

58.description: Not worth the price. Great place to saddle up to the bar for the ambience, whiskey selection and inventive cocktails though the service was slow. Also had a nice beer selection. We decided to order dinner because for an Irish pub the menu was a cut above and had some eclectic choices. The main dishes were both disappointing. I ordered the salmon buerre blanc for $19.50. It came with brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes which were both pretty good, and would have been happy to stop there. I'm not sure what they consider a buerre blanc, but I couldn't decipher what type of sauce it was as it had zero flavor and was red. The salmon (if that's what it was) had been butchered down to a round, flat, 2 oz. patty and was overcooked. My husband ordered the chicken pot pie for $15.00.  The crust was a beautifully flaky golden brown on top and uncooked doughy mess underneath. The vegetables were tender crisp, but the cream sauce was watery with little flavor.  Oh and the chicken was MIA so basically spent $15 on flour, milk, potatoes and carrots.  So here's the rundown on the 3 star rating:Cocktails=4Ambience=4.5Service=4.5Food=2 (didn't get a 1 because the sides were good)

56.description: We have dined at lady Gregory 's for several years now and it never disappoints. The brunch is delicious and filling. Love their cheese grits! The lunch menu is recently revised. They have added one side with your meal. Soups are creative and tasty.

29.description: Love this place! One of my favorites in Andersonville. Good rotating beer list and great pub food. Love their atmosphere, with a cozy yet lively feel to it...especially perfect around the holidays.

42.description: Ordered the chicken pot pie and the chicken was undercooked:-/ the waitress was very apologetic and I was able to choose something else. I got the spinach and artichoke dip, I had to dig through the top layer of cheese because it wasn't melted. Not your best, Lady Gregory.

23.description: I don't write reviews often but think this place deserves one. My husband and I almost NEVER go to restaurants twice just simply because we like to try new things. However, this restaurant is different. We go here more than once a month and it never disappoints. I brought my native italian mother here who is VERY picky and she was impressed, especially with the crab cakes. I highly suggest this restaurant. Consistency and good tasting food!

47.description: Love the fish and chips and shephards pie. The waiter, Robert, left much to be desired. I get that it was busy-ish but only refilling my drink once and coming by once to take The order and once to bring me the check is unacceptable. Also, telling me that you haven't had any of the specials and you don't know which one is good isn't a great way to start the evening. PS, it's called a smile. Their food is fantastic but the waitstaff really made me not enjoy my time. At least the bus boys were courteous, smiled, and made polite conversation with me. I can't say the same for the waiter.

8.description: We had no idea walking in here that we would enjoy Lady Gregory's as much as we did. Having no idea where or what we wanted to eat on a Friday night, we walked by the cute patio and heard what sounded like a bunch of people enjoying themselves. We checked out the menu on the door and we're lucky enough to be seated within a couple of minutes, though the place was packed. I ordered a Stone Go To IPA and my boyfriend ordered a dirty martini on the rocks with blue cheese stuffed olives. They drinks came out quickly but his wasn't on the rocks and didn't have the olives, so he let the server know and they kindly took it back and made it right, and then included a little bottle with pretty much an extra drink in there. Great service.We started with the Brussels sprouts small plate and the truffle chips. Both were good but the chips were just a little greasy for my liking. I ordered the roasted beet salad which was a little heavy on the dressing but otherwise fantastic. My boyfriend ordered the chicken curry and thankfully it was huge so I got to help him eat it! The sauce was amazing and the chicken was very tender. They could've probably cut the potatoes and carrots into smaller pieces but it was still great. I would come back here for sure! Our table felt a little cramped but we both decided we would have rather been seated immediately like we were instead of having to wait longer for more room.

31.description: The place has a really cool atmosphere! The service is extremely slow and the servers are rude/ lost but the menu looks great, the beer selection is good, including a gluten-free beer that tastes like Guinness. Looking forward to coming back to try more food than onion rings and fries. We enjoyed the rings but the fries were okay, and served in small quantities.

34.description: Met some friends there for brunch with our 18 month old son. The staff helped us get situated and stash the stroller, in addition to providing coloring supplies for our son. The drinks took a bit longer than I would have thought but when they arrived at the table were tasty. The food was good but your typical breakfast affair - pancakes, eggs, sausage. I would go back simply because it's hard to find kid friendly places sometimes.

16.description: I love Andersonville and all of the different types of food in this area, but Lady Gregory's I do not think that your food is that amazing to be serving to any type of royal court with any ladys or gents. I mean don't get me wrong, the food here was decent, but the real reason to come here I think is actually for the ambiance of the restaurant. It has a great pub like atmosphere and we were not rushed in any way shape or form, so this is a place that I think I would come back to for drinks and an appetizer or something like that. Since I could see myself just hanging out at the bar or in one of their classic pub style wooden booths in the dim bar lighting and with their pretty good beer selection and their cocktails also were pretty tasty and fancy too, this would be a drinking spot for me more than an eating spot. We got their lobster corn dog appetizer special and they were so tiny! I know lobster is pricey, but I can't just eat deep fried batter---well yes I can, but I would prefer a little more lobster in that! I got their french onion soup too which was pretty good but nothing to order again since french onion soup is one of my favorite foods ever. Other people got some of their sandwiches which again were good but nothing super amazing. But their side of brussell sprouts were probably my favorite thing besides the drinks we got. And speaking of drinks, this probably wouldn't happen in bar seating, but it took quite some time for us to get our drinks as well, but patience is a virtue I've always been told!

13.description: Love, love, love! The cocktails are excellent and the food is delicious! I've been meaning to dine here and finally had the opportunity before a show at Mary's Attic. It has a nice atmosphere--classy but relaxed. I will surely be back. The Cavalo Nero was a standout!

11.description: Usually enjoy this place......   Nice environment and service is usually good. But today I ordered the chicken wings.   6 TINY overcooked pigeon wings.   $9.00. Seriously?  Never again.

39.description: Came here to take the whole family for dinner. Atmosphere was great, this place is very spacious,  they sat us to a little dining room which was really cute. I didn't think that they had great selection in menu but I'd take that back for their drinks selection. At first, the service was slow but it caught up once we got started.  I'd come back here for a drink, not sure about dinner.

37.description: Holy Gluten Free Lobster Mac & Cheese!!!  The best, most amazing, delicious lobster mac I've ever had.  We went in for an early dinner on Sunday night and out waitress was the best thing ever!  She asked about all my allergies and made sure I could eat everything I ordered without issues.  She even went back in the kitchen and went through the recipes with the chef to make sure there weren't any hidden allergens and had them bring me an ice tea from a different bar that didn't have nutmeg anywhere near it to make sure I'd be ok.  She was amazing!!!  And the food was just so.damn.good!  We'll be back here LOTS!

0.description: Amazing beer list. Great service. No wonder I come here a lot. The standouts are lobster mac-n-cheese, brussel sprouts, steakhouse salad, fish and chips. Truffle burger was a special tonight and I hope it is added to the main menu soon. Can get loud and crowded on weekends. But, if you can wait, they have a cell phone text program for wait list guests. When your table is ready, you can reply if you're on your way or if you want to cancel. So easy and convenient! We grabbed coffee across the street while we waited. Outdoor dining in summer is plentiful and well worth a weekend brunch wait.

38.description: We have passed by this place a few times in Andersonville, but we were intrigued to try it after seeing it on Check Please! The décor is great, and very inviting, and the wait staff is great! We had the pleasure of having Donovan for our waiter last night! The way he took care of us, should be the standard of how you should be cared for, while dining out, many restaurants should take note! The food....was another story....kind of a letdown! We ordered for an app the onion rings with creamy BBQ sauce, which was a great start to the meal. My partner ordered the fish and chips, while I ordered the shepherds pie. Both of these entrees came highly recommended by Check Please, which can be seen on WTTW Channel 11. When my partner received his entrée, the fish and the fries were lukewarm at best, we promptly sent this back, which Donovan took care of flawlessly! He even offered the tomato bisque soup to tie my partner over while they re-prepared his meal! Awesome!!! The soup was just delicious! When they brought back the new order of fish and chips, it was very tasty. The shepherds pie was more of a letdown for me. It tasted ok, but it seemed there was just too much seasoning, something that I did eat, but due to the over seasoning, I am not likely to get again. I also ordered a side of cole slaw, which was very good. The fish and chips came with a side of mush minty green peas, my partner does not care for peas, but I tasted them, and they were just not good at all....If I were to order the fish and chips on a return visit, I would opt for another side, they do have a mac and cheese option as a side as well, more than likely I would pair it with the cole slaw. Overall this is a solid 3 star review, with the service and the décor assisting in most of this rating. For the service alone, I would try this place again, maybe it was an off night in the kitchen, but this establishment deserves another chance.

51.description: Lady Gregory's is right up there with Hopleaf as my favorite spot in Andersonville.  It's got a great Irish pub vibe and you really do get a relaxed and causal feel once you step inside.  The thing about Lady Gregory's is that you'll be happy whether you're coming here for the food or just to have some beers.  I've never been disappointed by anything I've ordered here.  I will say the truffle chips are a classic and you need to try them.  Bleu cheese and truffle oil on homemade chips that are fried just right.  Two thumbs up here.  I also love the Lobster mac and cheese,  because sometimes I feel like pretending I'm fancy when eating kid food.  But seriously, with the mushrooms and more truffle it's a great bite.I've come in just to watch a game at the bar and have some beers too.  They have a rotating number of craft beers to pick from and I've always been able to get a few new beers.  And if there is one thing I love, it's trying new beers.If you're in Andersonville and looking for a neighborhood spot to get drinks and solid food, Lady Gregory's is your place.

27.description: I've been to Lady Gregory's at least once a month for the last several years and I've never thought to Yelp it. I'm sorry, favorite neighborhood restaurant. The food is excellent. I've only had one single thing here I didn't like (the mac n cheese). Everything else I've tried has been high quality, tasty, upscale pub food. I usually get a pint of Guinness but I'll sometimes try something new on tap. There's always something a little healthy on the menu, like the Buddha bowl, which you can get with chicken or tofu.Service is consistent and great, hosts are always friendly. I have no complaints, really. We've brought family here and everyone loves it. We even came for New Year's Eve one year and had a ton of fun.

32.description: Tonight It was one of the first cold nights of the year and we were under dressed. I was not excited when I saw the place was packed and a couple were waiting outside for a table... But I braved it and went inside to boldly ask the wait time. 25 minutes estimated. But there was a saving grace, I didn't have to wait out in the cold, they could just text me when they were ready. We walked across the street to Starbucks and enjoyed a hot tea in a relaxing butt-to-chair environment that was not standing, outside, or cold. Crisis averted.Food was good, although the prices weren't great. I also made a terrible decision pairing one of the drink specials with my food... but that was my bad. The drink turned out a lot different than I imagined it would.I guess none of the staff like Hockey. None of the TV were on the Blackhawks game and no one seemed interested in the college football blowout that was on all of the TVs, I probably could have asked to see if they would change it but I didn't want to be that guy.

54.description: Great!!! I stumbled upon this place by accident but visit now on purpose you won't be disappointed from the full bar to the specialty drinks amazing food and superb service you will enjoy yourself. I recommend going to the bar that way u get your drinks the fastest lol

48.description: Food tasted good, but we both ended up having diarrhea and puke. was not a pleasant visit at all ;(

44.description: Great place for a burger and beers with friends! Bartenders seemed knowledgeable of beers and menu items. They also gave us a few suggestions of other bars in the neighborhood to check out later as my friend and I were not super familiar with the area. They have a separate gluten free and vegetarian menus which I really appreciate. I'll be back!

24.description: This place is amazing! The food is very good with a variety of different breakfast items, burgers, Mac and cheese, etc. However, what makes this place stand out is their willingness to accommodate food restrictions. They already have a dedicated gluten free menu but a friend of mine is both gluten and dairy free and they cooked his dish with oil instead of butter and in a separate pan. The server asked the cooks about whether different dishes had dairy in it without any fuss. Thank you for making our dining experience so wonderful!

7.description: Back again for the chicken pot pie.   A perfect meal on a chilly January night.  I cant get enough of the tender moist chicken and the fresh veggies covered bt the flakey pastry.  The bartender makes a nice tart whisky sour.

49.description: I love Andersonville and all of the different types of food in this area, but Lady Gregory's I do not think that your food is that amazing to be serving to any type of royal court with any ladys or gents. I mean don't get me wrong, the food here was decent, but the real reason to come here I think is actually for the ambiance of the restaurant. It has a great pub like atmosphere and we were not rushed in any way shape or form, so this is a place that I think I would come back to for drinks and an appetizer or something like that. Since I could see myself just hanging out at the bar or in one of their classic pub style wooden booths in the dim bar lighting and with their pretty good beer selection and their cocktails also were pretty tasty and fancy too, this would be a drinking spot for me more than an eating spot. We got their lobster corn dog appetizer special and they were so tiny! I know lobster is pricey, but I can't just eat deep fried batter---well yes I can, but I would prefer a little more lobster in that! I got their french onion soup too which was pretty good but nothing to order again since french onion soup is one of my favorite foods ever. Other people got some of their sandwiches which again were good but nothing super amazing. But their side of brussell sprouts were probably my favorite thing besides the drinks we got. And speaking of drinks, this probably wouldn't happen in bar seating, but it took quite some time for us to get our drinks as well, but patience is a virtue I've always been told!

40.description: We live in the neighborhood so stopped by this place for dinner a week or so ago. The decor inside is pretty impressive. It kinda looks like a library or some old Victorian study in the far corner. They have a huge selection of beers and wines, so was pretty hard to decide. Usually when they have a novel-sized selection of drinks, I usually end up playing it safe just because I don't wanna spend forever reading a book. That's just me though.The food was pretty average. I ordered the chef's special burger which is tasty, but didn't have any real flair. The wife ordered the meatloaf sandwich which she said was pretty dry and just didn't taste good. I agreed. Although a small mistake, the waitress ended up overcharging us on the burger. I had to correct her and she made it right, though I fear for previous customers not noticing the error. Made me think it's programmed into their POS wrong...All being said, we will return as it's very convenient place to go. I think their other food options might be better.

53.description: Great find! Nice clean irish pub! Has seats by window, library, and huge wraparound bar. Very impressed with gluten free menu which included a big selection of gf beer. I had a double burger with Brussels sprouts-very good. Hubby had shepherd's pie which he liked. Staff very knowledgable about gf and friendly

30.description: Always my favorite for lunch. Crab cakes are my favorite and i always pair it with sweet potato fries. We also get good server. No complaints here. Check out the specials too...

46.description: Sad to write this, but Lady Gregory's has really gone downhill. For a couple of years we were semi-regulars, but our last two experiences were probably, well, our last.First, the good: The ambiance is cool, particularly the back room. The sandwiches and burgers now come with a side (it was ridiculous to pay an extra $3 or $4 for fries previously).Now the bad: The food is just not good. Something has changed in the past few months. Dined in and had a dry, tough chicken sandwich (which used to be one of my favorites) and came with an absolutely flavorless "house made" pickle. Gave it another shot last night with the Gastro Burger (another favorite), and while the "gastro" elements like the cheese, shallots, and tomato were fine, the burger patties were dry, crumbly, and clearly the frozen variety. I'd expect better at Wendy's. We won't be going back.

1.description: Overall: Great spot for a few pints, drinks, and/or great dinnerThe good: Great tasting food with a ton of different options. Portion sizes are very reasonable and the food was hot and fresh. Service was friendly. Atmosphere is awesome with a study-like feel.The bad: Service was iffy. Ordered a buddha bowl with chicken, except no chicken. After we ordered food took forever. Atmosphere: 9/10Service: 7/10Food: 8/10

55.description: Four stars for food, zero stars for service. Great burgers, and the cauliflower steak appetizer was to die for, but I can't remember the last time I experienced such witless and inattentive servers. Neither of our servers (trainer and trainee, apparently) seemed able to wrap their feeble minds around my wife's vodka and soda order, and they twice put in the order as vodka, soda and ginger beer. They also never checked to see how our food was, and never brought us our check even though we asked twice for it; they were too busy slamming drinks on the sly and chatting with their friends at the bar to even acknowledge that we were done with dinner and wanted to get out of there. We finally had to ask Kyle the bartender for our check, as he was the only one there who had his shit together. The food is good enough to go back for, but next time we'll sit at the bar and let Kyle take care of us.

9.description: I rolled in here with a crazy hangover. The food was so good, I  couldn't even focus on the hurt I was feeling. From the amazing steaks and eggs, to the heaven-in-your-mouth french toast. Also, the chicken tostada. We were hungry LOL. The cool atmosphere and warm fireplace made me feel at home. My super cute waiter Jesse made it that much better. I'll be back for sure!

26.description: I get takeout from here all the time and in the summer enjoy eating at their outside area. The food is pretty good. I wouldn't say it is fantastic but it is nice and reliable. The staff is normally very friendly. The prices are very reasonable. My one real complaint is lately it seems the pick-up has been very slow. I feel like the guy that has been working the pick-up station is constantly messing with the point of sale system. This was never an issue before. Not sure if it is the guy working it or if they have been having tech issues. Either way, something needs to be resolved. I don't want to end on a bad note because I like this place. I recommend the flat breads and the normal burger (not the gastro one as much). They are very good.

25.description: Lady Gregory's is not your standard Irish pub. Their beer and whisky selection is extensive and their menu has a lot of great choices. I love the wrap around bar that is in the center of the restaurant. It is clearly the focal point but also doesn't disrupt many tables surrounding it. They use a waitlist program that will text you when your table is ready and also how many people are ahead of you. It looks to get really busy around 7pm on a Friday night. We started with the artichoke dip which was definitely large enough to share with 3 or 4 people. For the main course, I ordered the fish n chips. The fish was fried perfectly and incredibly flavorful. I enjoyed the sides too. A good Friday night place if you want a nicer bar with good food and drink selection.

12.description: My experience was so much better than my first visit on 2011/8. We had few appetizers and drinks. Food: Good. I like the variety of drinks and food menu.Service: GreatPrice: AcceptableAmbience: Great. I enjoyed the Christmas decoration.

59.description: We had no idea walking in here that we would enjoy Lady Gregory's as much as we did. Having no idea where or what we wanted to eat on a Friday night, we walked by the cute patio and heard what sounded like a bunch of people enjoying themselves. We checked out the menu on the door and we're lucky enough to be seated within a couple of minutes, though the place was packed. I ordered a Stone Go To IPA and my boyfriend ordered a dirty martini on the rocks with blue cheese stuffed olives. They drinks came out quickly but his wasn't on the rocks and didn't have the olives, so he let the server know and they kindly took it back and made it right, and then included a little bottle with pretty much an extra drink in there. Great service.We started with the Brussels sprouts small plate and the truffle chips. Both were good but the chips were just a little greasy for my liking. I ordered the roasted beet salad which was a little heavy on the dressing but otherwise fantastic. My boyfriend ordered the chicken curry and thankfully it was huge so I got to help him eat it! The sauce was amazing and the chicken was very tender. They could've probably cut the potatoes and carrots into smaller pieces but it was still great. I would come back here for sure! Our table felt a little cramped but we both decided we would have rather been seated immediately like we were instead of having to wait longer for more room.

21.description: Ummmm did someone say Irish Cheddar Grits for brunch? Yes, please! Great beer & whiskey menus, and the food menu isn't too shabby, either. Lobster mac & cheese? See answer above.Great food, good service & good atmosphere. Can be a little loud at times, but that's pretty much what I'd expect for a place like this. Sometimes the wait can be a little long, but it's a big place so it seems to turn over quickly. Good stuff!

17.description: Great menu! It is upscale bar food. The lobster Mac and cheese is delightful!Service is great. Drink menu is good.Atmosphere is great, especially the library room!

10.description: Lady G's is just a fun time.  I always think to come here when - a friend is visiting from out of town- I want one drink before whatever I'm about to do- date night should happen- lobster mac 'n' cheese feels necessaryThe staff as a whole is friendly, food is good (not that cheap...think $20 minimum / person easily with drink + one item), atmosphere is festive and cozy.  Andersonville's Wilde.

5.description: I being here a few times and never had a bad meal.  Yesterday we ca,e for brunch with my kids. The lump crab Benedict was super delicious , my son had steak and eggs which he loved. And my little one had the French toast brioche that I ended up finishing ,yummmiiiii  for sure I will go back.

3.description: Ummmm did someone say Irish Cheddar Grits for brunch? Yes, please! Great beer & whiskey menus, and the food menu isn't too shabby, either. Lobster mac & cheese? See answer above.Great food, good service & good atmosphere. Can be a little loud at times, but that's pretty much what I'd expect for a place like this. Sometimes the wait can be a little long, but it's a big place so it seems to turn over quickly. Good stuff!

35.description: Lady Gregory is consistently "pretty good".  The food is all tasty, and they have a good selection of food including vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free option.It's always good, but I'm never "WOWED" - and the prices seem all a little high for what you receive.  $23 for a pot roast plate?  $18 for roast chicken?  A bit overkill, even if tasty.It's a good place for a group, with several long, Thanksgiving-style tables that can easily fit a dozen friends.

19.description: I LOVE Lady Gregory's! Such a warm, cozy atmosphere, like you're at you're relatives enjoying a holiday dinner in front of the fire! The food is hearty, well crafted and served generously (Large portions) If you're in the mood for a Bloody Mary, get one here, it comes with a beer! I've never had a bad meal here and cocktails are HUGE and STRONG! Wildes is equally as wonderful and is owned by same people. Both are perfect for a great time!

28.description: It's called Chicago and you are in a neighborhood called Andersonville... what to do? Hmmm...Go to Lady Greg's as some will call it.They got an awesome beer menu and bar tenders are cool guys. Wife almost left me because of their Irish Accent. Well damn.. said to much already. It's a joke. What's not a Joke is how awesome this place is. They got a cool little library looking section. Drinks are fair priced... I mean you can find a good Irish Beer from Ireland and that makes me happy. I will always make it a habit to visit this place whenever I can.Oh and I once had a Salad here that had a fried egg on it... I was drunk but it was great and I keep forgetting to try it again.

45.description: We walked up from our hotel down on Clarke and stumbled on the place. Asked to be seated so we could watch tennis game on screen over the bar. Great service. Great food. The drinks are superb. Wish we lived in the area so we could eat here every night.

33.description: Really cool center bar, comfortable booths and great homey Irish pub feel.  They have a great selection of gluten free food options, as well as beer and cider. The gluten free menu is large, however, if you're celiac make sure mention that as there can be cross contamination risks (not a gluten free kitchen). They servers are always willing to work with my demanding restrictions.

43.description: I went here a few times and wasn't impressed. The atmosphere is nice, charmingly fancy, and it left me feeling high end...the feeling...sure, it's nice...but the price also matches the atmosphere. The food and drinks, in regards to taste, texture, and portion size, are average at best, which makes the high end feeling, feel cheap.There were several bartenders tending the bar, but they barley approached anyone, let alone made sure drinks were coming steadily. It's a nice place to check out, but I don't really recommend it.

2.description: I'm highly confused why Lady G's only has 3.5/5 stars! What's going on here people!It is one of my absolute favorite restaurants in Andersonville. Not only is it a great 'fall back' plan if you can't think of a place to go that has something that will please everyone, or if the place you intended to go is busting full, it is a great FIRST choice for brunch, lunch, dinner, drinks, etc, etc. I love everything I have ever had here.I especially love the fish and chips. They are amazing, flaky, fresh, with yummy crispy breading. Their fries (and sweet potato fries) are great as well. A new favorite of mine is the Buddah Bowl with chicken. It's a HUGE serving and I took the rest for lunch the next day! It is a tad spicy so watch out if you're sensitive. We also love the truffle chips with tons of blue cheese all over them.They have a great beer selection which is a plus in this 'hood. After Hopleaf, there aren't many bars that have a lot of unique (and rotating) selections on tap. The atmosphere is great for a casual date, brunch, or a place to gather with friends.LG, I love, love LOVE you and hope you're around for many years to come!

18.description: Came here after a disappointing time from another restaurant down the street. Greeted right away. Bartender remembered us from  MONTHS before. Delicious food, as always.

41.description: My new favorite restaurant!  Everything was great, from food to service.  I got the Bison Burger and my mom got the shepherds pie (which I had quite a few bites of).  Soooo much meat which was lovely!  The bison burger was so juicy and seasoned beautifully.  The candied bacon and celery slaw were great on the burger, but it could've been better without the BBQ sauce.  It was still the best dang burger I've ever had!  We also got crab cakes and onion rings for appetizer.  The onion rings were the best onion rings I've ever eaten in my life!  My only criticism would be to add less salt and more crab to the crab cakes, seeing as they cost a pretty penny.  And for some reason, my moms drinks came out stronger than mine, which tasted watery each time I ordered.  I can't wait to go back to get my own dang shepherds pie lol.

52.description: The food quality is good but somehow I don't find the place to be all that comfortable.  They have a nice menu, both food and liquor.  The place is best IMHO late night for a cocktail and apps.

50.description: I've eaten outside at their restaurant several times and been satisfied with their food and service. Nothing amazing but dog and baby friendly, so, I go back. I ordered their cheeseburger for delivery through Grubhub, and it was great. I did not have high hopes, as IMO tacos and cheeseburgers don't travel well. But, the cheeseburger was awesome! It was topped with Brie and onions. It was cooked at my requested temp, it was still warm, and it was quick. Four stars (instead of five) because the burger was $17.50 (including extra for a pretzel bun and sweet potato fries), and that was before delivery charge. That seems kind of expensive.

4.description: I love the Ambiance and the gorgeous decor!  Service is always good and food always delish! Never disappointed. :)

6.description: Great atmosphere. We went on date night but big Cubs game was on but the privacy that set up affords made us feel completely alone in a crowded place great service & food.

22.description: Love, love, love! The cocktails are excellent and the food is delicious! I've been meaning to dine here and finally had the opportunity before a show at Mary's Attic. It has a nice atmosphere--classy but relaxed. I will surely be back. The Cavalo Nero was a standout!

15.description: Lady Gregory is consistently "pretty good".  The food is all tasty, and they have a good selection of food including vegetarian, vegan, and gluten-free option.It's always good, but I'm never "WOWED" - and the prices seem all a little high for what you receive.  $23 for a pot roast plate?  $18 for roast chicken?  A bit overkill, even if tasty.It's a good place for a group, with several long, Thanksgiving-style tables that can easily fit a dozen friends.

57.description: We have been here twice now. Love the drink selection. Being a whiskey fan it is a awesome selection of whiskeys. I enjoy that they have different pour selections to allow for more tasting on top shelf whiskeys and rare whiskeys. Well worth it. I had the lobster Benedict which was amazing with asparagus. First time having food there. It was really good.

20.description: First time here and the food is amazing, we had the fish and chips and lobster mac and cheese. We will be back

36.description: I went yesterday with a friend. She recommended the crab cakes which were excellent. She loves the beet salad. (I hate beets). I got the cauliflower steak and it is wonderful. Highly recommended. I wish I could do 4.5 starts. This is better than your average 4 star restaurant and I am still waiting for the 5 star experience.

14.description: this was one of my favorite places and I was a loyal customer. Every year...and mostly twice a year, I "reserve" the wine room for my group of friends and we do Secret Santa or have a nice discussion about dog rescue and just FINALLY catch up after work and life and dogs and stress and it is not loud and somewhat private. Never in the past had I had an issue "reserving" the wine room, until last Friday. I had it booked for over a month and was working on 2 HUGE work projects-this was my day to look forward to to catch up with my friends. We showed up and "they gave the room to a bigger party and bumped us out of the wine room for a table along the windows." They did not call, did not apologize---nothing. The woman said, "we do not guarantee any reservations and you should have spoken to the manager if you wanted to reserve that room." Since when????--we have not done that the past 4 years we booked this??? I was so upset that we ended up changing venues and crammed into some tables down the street at Replay---they were SO UNDERSTANDING and nice there... A+ for Replay. I am so disappointed because I love the servers there and I have always enjoyed the atmosphere and the food and everything about it. To give away a reservation that a loyal customer booked weeks in advance because you had  "3 tables of 12 come in last minute," is unacceptable. Sorry to see you go, LG.

3.description: When I die, I'm STILL going to have Charlotte cut my hair in heaven!

1.description: A random stranger stopped me on Clark St to say my hair looks gorgeous. Thank you, Charlotte!

2.description: Eric always gives me a good haircut even though I never know what I want and I am generally indifferent to my hair. He works with the raw material that resulted from my last cut growing out and manages to make something work. I insist on being able to walk out my door with my hair still wet from the shower and I have no desire to style or use product. I'm basically wash and go, and he always gives me a cut that is compatible with that.

9.description: The owners of this place rule! They run a great little operation, paying special attention to each and every client there. I come out loving my cut and color every time. I get exactly what I ask for (and a little teasing because I wait so long between visits). They build what is so important with stylists and their clients, trust. I've also felt that the prices charged are more than fair for the quality of service and products. I strongly debated on whether or not to let my beloved hair secret out, but Shine deserves a great review. It's an Andersonville gem. Heck, it's an Illinois gem!

10.description: After a bad haircut from a hair stylist I had been seeing for over five years, my search began for a new hair stylist.  I tried places all up and down the north shore for over two years.  I gave each stylist at least two to three appointments (color, hair cuts, blow out, etc.) before I moved on to the next one.I finally tried Charlotte at Salon Shine after my sister had been there a few times and really enjoyed her experience and came back with a really nice hair cut.  The hair cut I got wasn't amazing or trendy, but I felt like Charlotte really listened to me.  She understood the level of maintenance I could give a hair cut/style and what I wanted in terms in length and bangs.  I walked out of the salon with a polished and clean hair cut that lasted a really long time before I had to go back and get a cut.An extra plus for me, Charlotte is the first hair stylist to talk about more than just movies and what my weekend plans are.  She actually took some time to ask me questions about myself.  We ended up talking about the upcoming election at my first appointment and she shared with me how excited she was to vote for the first time (she just became an American).  On my second appointment (after the inauguration) we discussed the big day.  Go to Salon Shine for a solid, moderately priced hair cut, and a great conversation.

4.description: I have been a client of Eric's for several years at a couple of different salons and have always had a great experience! One if the things I enjoy most about his move to The Shop is that he now has the flexibility to tailor the products and techniques he uses to the individual client. For years - no matter who has colored my hair -- I have had a challenge of keeping my color from fading. Eric's succeeded in keeping my color looking fresh from visit to visit.

6.description: I used to go here bc the haircuts were great and Charlotte told the funniest jokes.  But then she had her teeth whitened so now its like gettin your hair done by a movie star...who tells great jokes!

12.description: Having just moved back to Chicago after 10 months away, I needed a haircut and did not feel like dealing with attitude and stuffiness.  After looking at reviews on Yelp, I called and was able to get in quickly.  Charlotte was an absolute pleasure!  Genuine and kind, the type of person you feel you have known for years.  She also knows what she is doing.  This is, by far, the best cut I have had in the area-and I have graced many notable salons.  Highly recommended if you are looking for brilliant service and a relaxed atmosphere.  Cheers, Charlotte!  I will be seeing you again soon!

5.description: I set up an appointment not knowing what to expect. I have really long hair so I don't get hair cuts often but I wanted a touch up and figured I would give them a try. Overall awesome people, great environment, and a very professional vibe. Didn't have to wait-as soon as I walked in I was seated. Did exactly what I asked and did it perfectly! Highly recommend them.

11.description: As a heterosexual male, I'm supposed to approach haircuts like oil changes or furnace maintenance.  It's something you just have to do from time to time, but it shouldn't be enjoyable and you should try to not spend a ton of money on it.That being said, Shine makes the experience enjoyable. I've never had a bad haircut here over the past couple years, and the last one (about a week ago) made my girlfriend surprisingly pleased, so that's cool.Also, they're always very accommodating when I miss my 6:30 appointment because the CTA can't get me there from downtown in an hour. What the hell.

8.description: I must admit that I never thought to review my hair salon on Yelp. I often review restaurants and look up info on restaurants, but when I saw this listing I had to act.I've had my hair colored at Shine for 8 years, since they first opened. Charlotte is my stylist and I don't know what I'd do if she left town. She always gets the color right and we discuss changes often to be sure I'm always happy. Charlotte goes above and beyond and always make accommodations for my wacky schedule.  Her business partner Shay is also extremely talented and an all around nice guy. They are always so pleasant and easy to be around.I know I can always count on a great hair result and a great conversation with both of them.  I highly recommend Salon Shine!

0.description: You need one of those uber-trendy see & be seen spots, then Shine isn't for you.  You want a haircut that brings you compliments like " you look great!  Have you been on a tropical vacation?", then Charlotte is the one to see!Finding a good hairstylist is rough, finding one like Charlotte is a needle-in-the-haystack kind of prize!  She makes me look and feel amazing and the cuts she performs grow out so nicely!  I have very fine hair that easily shows unskilled cuts and Charlotte takes her time to create perfection every time!I've never had SO many compliments on my hair than in the 4+ years I've been going to Salon Shine - & I drive all the way there from River West!!  Totally worth it!

7.description: Wonderful, friendly place to get a fabulous haircut. After I moved out to the 'burbs, I'm willing to drive 75 miles round trip just to get my hair cut!

58.description: Went here for a bday celebration, it was great! First warning is the place is small...but with that said who cares. In the end I liked the small feel. The food was great... the steak and shrimp baos where the hit of the group. For drinks the Not your Dads root beer kept the table happy! Elotes and roasted Brussels sprouts were a great addition. Overall we had a great experience and will be back. One last thing, we went on a Saturday night...the background music was AMAZING!!

56.description: We checked out this spot for a spur-of-the-moment Friday night date and it was heavenly. I had the Bad Burger and added an egg - hands down one of the best burgers I've had anywhere; it was melt-in-your-mouth good. He got the half fried chicken which was equally delictable. Don't go to this place if you want casual conversation over dinner, as we were too enraptured by our delicious meals to look up from the plate. The drinks were also on point, including non-alcoholic options. We had brewskies, but their walls(!) of spirits, including from some of the best local distilleries, were very intriguing. Trying some of their cocktails has officially been added to my bucket list. The service was A-OK; this is a small joint, yet somehow we were immediately seated at a peak hour on a weekend and even had our choice of where to sit. It seemed most parties had a similar experience, no matter their size. Being that this defies the laws of physics, I can only assume that this is due to their efficient and professional staff which provided prompt and comprehensive (albeit impersonal) service. I highly recommend this spot to anyone who has yet to visit, and can't wait to go back to discover more of their menu and drinks.

29.description: I've heard of LBW for the better part of year but haven't had the chance to visit--until today.  What TOOK me so long?First, the atmosphere.  Think of your hipster barista friend who grew up, got a better paying job (and a liquor license) and redecorated.  The place is funky chic. Great music, too. Next, the service. Friendly and knowledgable.  Props to Miranda for awesomeness. Empathy expressed for no iced tea on the menu.  Speaking of...The menu?  Eclectic.  Tacos, baos, salads, burgers, mac + cheese, among many other things.  Still, not a huge menu. We liked that.  That usually translates into fresher ingredients. Which leads me to... The food. I got smacked in the face with happiness just now (yes, I'm still sitting here eating).  The table ordered baos (shrimp and BBQ pork).  Mac + cheese with chicken. Crab cake and chopped salad.  All of it was great.  Wonderful.  Thank you, Little Bad Wolf!  We will return.

42.description: This place ambiance is cool but the food is not great. I tried a few things on the menu and it wasn't delicious at all. Their tacos was for the most part filled with oil and lacking in flavor.  Their fries hmmmm... no matter how much salt I added to it, didn't make any difference! I think for most part people probably go here for the ambiance and the drinks or maybe to meet people or something. But that's my opinion so give them shot and let me know what you think.

23.description: Mybe more like 3.5 stars.  The baos and burger are good.  With all the burger and bao places in Chicago, nothing to separate themselves from the pack.  A little pricey.  But I think if the food was a buck or two less we would go more often.

47.description: Fabulous food, drinks and atmosphere. I have been here so many times I probably have ordered everything on the menu. All of it is great. Yes all, I'm not exaggerating. The value is also wonderful as well. Since the portions are so generous a party of four can eat heartily for a decent price. The mussels and burgers will change your life. You will have dreams about tasting them again. I love that they always have water glasses filled as well. It's a simple thing but I appreciate it. They even have hand scrub in the ladies restroom. Like I said the little things make a difference at The Little Bad wolf.

8.description: We loved our experience! First and foremost, the server was wonderful! Even though we were at a corner of the bar, he was extremely attentive to our needs and made sure we were taken care of with kindness.Secondly, the food was great! We started out with the chips, Guac and salsa and really enjoyed ourselves. The hot salsa was scrumptious! The mild was too bland.I ate three different baos while my partner had two tacos and a baos. My favorites were the pork and steak baos, but the shrimp baos was wonderful, too! My partner loved his food! And we were stuffed! The menu looked absolutely delicious and we can't wait to go back and try more! Not to mention the extensive drink list! Yes please!And to top it all off, the atmosphere was totally rad. We got there early and had no trouble finding a seat, but people started to have to wait around peak dinner time. This is a must try!

31.description: Amazing bar ! I am a vegetarian and I always struggle for good veg food especially in bars.. LBW have couple of good options for vegetarians. I had Mac and cheese, potato tacos and veg baos.. All the three items I ordered were delicious and filling. I would definitely like to go to this place again.

34.description: I figured my first review in 2016 should be for this little gem. What a great place! The food, the drinks, the atmosphere and the people. Everything is top notch. Yes, it's a bit tiny, not a lot of seating. But it's really not an issue if you know that ahead of time and plan accordingly. Definitely get one of their cocktails. I don't remember which one I ordered but it was delicious. Also, the bao's and tacos are a must. Shrimp, steak, chicken, all amazing! So that's it! Make this one of your "musts" this year :)

16.description: Very, VERY crowded on a Saturday night! They don't take reservations, so expect to wait. We got there at about 6:45 and waited maybe 15-20 minutes, which is not that bad considering how tiny and cramped the space is. For food, we got the chicken and shrimp baos, which were pretty delicious. I liked the chicken better, it was a bit spicy and had a Thai-style taste to it. I could barely finish 2 baos, they were pretty filling.The noise level here is out of control. I could barely hear my friend across the table. Don't think I would come back on that basis alone.

13.description: YES. Everything about this is YES.Decor. I love the chill, loungy feel. I love the edison lights, the big bar, and small, cozy atmosphere.Service. The people are awesome here. They aren't afraid to give a beer sample or food suggestion. Just nice, real, down to earth people.Food. The diversity of food here is crazy. My usual rule of "pick one and do it well" does not apply here. They have tacos, burgers, fries, mussels, baos. Yes. All of them. We ordered the mac and cheese, fries, and mussels to share. All of them were SO good. I would eat it all again.Drink. BEER. If you love beer, you will love their menu. So many drafts and bottles to choose from. Not your regular stuff either. You can also order wine and cocktails...but seriously...the beer. I tried a few that I had never heard of before, all very good.So basically you need to come here. And eat. And drink. Because it's good.

11.description: The place is pretty dim lit and the music is pretty loud which can be annoying because everyone else dining there ends up speaking louder too so you end up screaming at your friends. They unfortunately don't take reservations so be prepared to wait! On a friday night for 2 people, i ended up waiting about 40ish minutes for a table. Let me start of by saying my friend and I definitely over ordered so definitely do not feel compelled to order as much as we did LOLWe got:Mussels - come in a green curry coconut broth and is served with bread. Probably one of the top 3 mussels i've ever had. The broth was absolutely deliciousssss. I was using my spoon and drinking the remaining broth cause it was that good! Elotes- sooooo goood!! The corn was sweet full of flavor and the beer battered avocado was soo good. The avocado wasnt mushy on the inside as I would have expected. mac & cheese- I had high hopes for this since the reviews raved about it but I wasn't too impressed. Tasted like regular mac and cheese to me. Nothing really stood out.Japanese BBQ Pork Bao- This was good! The pork was tender and had a crispy layer of skin which gave the boa that extra crunch. The bun was so light and fluffy.Steak-Shitake Bao- the meat tasted gooood but im not the biggest steak lover because i like my meat really tender but the flavor was definitely there.Fish taco- definitely my favorite! The fish had a crispy batter that wasn't overfried or soggy. Shrimp Taco- definitely did not skimp out on the shrimp! If you like seafood, you'll definitely like this.  pork al pastor taco- comes with jalapano and pineapple which definitely helped amplify the flavor. This was my second last taco so by then it was kinda cold but the taste wasnt as great as I was expecting but I think that is just because it got cold :( Lastly we got the steak taco- once again, wasn't too crazy about it because it is steak and this was my last taco so the meal was kinda cold and the taco shell had hardened. Overall the meal came out to around $30 per person after tip and tax which isn't too bad considering all the food we got. My biggest recommendation is to definitely get the mussels, fish taco and elotes!

39.description: This is a treat in an otherwise meh neighborhood. The food is innovative and the booze selection top notch. Avoid "obvious" times (Sunday brunch) for a calmer, more relaxed experience.

37.description: Super quaint and cool space, excellent service and great food! nuff said.

0.description: Holy crap!  I was not expecting this. Per the reviews I knew it would likely be good, but this was insanely good.Awesome drink list (per my husband). For food, we had:A grilled romaine salad - huge and very fillingGuacamole and chips - chips were yummy by themselves. Guac and salsa were delicious and fresh.Wolf Burger - Husband loved it. Could only fit half in his belly and took the other half home.Side of Mac and Cheese - OMG! OMG! OMG!Fish Bao - OrgasmicElotes - Even more orgasmic and one of the most delicious sides of food I have ever eaten.This is by far the best restaurant in Andersonville and that is saying a lot because there is some heavy competition just up the road.I miss you, LBW!  See you soon!P.S. Pay the guys in the kitchen whatever is necessary to keep them there forever.

38.description: YES. Everything about this is YES.Decor. I love the chill, loungy feel. I love the edison lights, the big bar, and small, cozy atmosphere.Service. The people are awesome here. They aren't afraid to give a beer sample or food suggestion. Just nice, real, down to earth people.Food. The diversity of food here is crazy. My usual rule of "pick one and do it well" does not apply here. They have tacos, burgers, fries, mussels, baos. Yes. All of them. We ordered the mac and cheese, fries, and mussels to share. All of them were SO good. I would eat it all again.Drink. BEER. If you love beer, you will love their menu. So many drafts and bottles to choose from. Not your regular stuff either. You can also order wine and cocktails...but seriously...the beer. I tried a few that I had never heard of before, all very good.So basically you need to come here. And eat. And drink. Because it's good.
