51.description: Yum yum yum yum. Best restaurant in Andersonville. Burgers and fries to die for! I take ANYONE who's visiting me from out of town to LBW! 5 stars without a doubt!

27.description: I came here on a Thursday night with a girlfriend. I probably should have seen if they were on open table before showing up because when I got there at 7, there was a half hour wait. While waiting, we went next door to the bar where the bartender gave us some great advice about what to order. He said we had to order a bao and a taco. When we came back to the restaurant half an hour later, they still weren't ready to seat us.  The place was packed and it's a very small restaurant. We waited about five minutes and we were sat.  I ordered the green eyes and omg it was the best cocktail I've had in awhile. My friend got their version of the Moscow mule and then switched to the green eyes. You can also order the green eyes up and it's made with egg whites. To eat, we took the bartender's advice and ordered a bao and a taco.  I ordered the shrimp bao and the potato taco and they both were just amazing!  I just loved the bread they used in the bao- it was so fluffy.  We also ordered the brussels sprouts which were full of flavor!Overall, I loved the food and the cocktails.  However, they need a bigger space because they're just so busy!

32.description: It's noisy.  Some tables are shared which I think is fun- if you don't, you might have to wait.  Staff is fun, drinks are great (cocktails, huge beer list, lots of ciders, great gourmet small-batch booze etc).  The FOOD is fabulous. The bao are a different shape than you're probably used to and are smallish but great. Best is the grilled romaine salad with chicken.  Friends loved Mac and cheese. Everything was great.  Some things are a little spicy so if you don't like that talk to your server (I found everything just great).  And get elote (corn with crumble of cheese) and the green eyes cocktail.

54.description: The fried chicken plate. Oh my god the fried chicken plate w/ the mashed potatoes. Solid comfort food for that late at night. I really didn't expect much coming in b/c it seemed like a place that was pushing sliders and tacos in a late night trendy bar w/ edison light bulb setting, but I had a really great meal here. The tacos are way overpriced for the quality, but the fried chicken was SUCH a deal given the portion size. Wouldn't expect such nice decor. Would definitely come back.

48.description: This place is great. Great place to sit down with friends. The food is all fantastic, the baos, tacos, entrees, etc.Problem is, the drinks are steeply priced. Best trick is what my wife and I do.  Just order Baos and Tacos, saves us a ton of money. This way we can also order drinks and then we're in the hole for no more than 40 bucks INCLUDING tip.Great place to sit and eat. Good location, great food, but a shade more expensive (entrees and drinks) than it should be.

44.description: Cute neighborhood place for drinks & dinner. The grilled Romaine was a stand out- we don't usually order salads, but this one was full of smoky flavor balanced out with sweet corn & feta cheese. Memorable salad, it exists! Service was very good as well. Staff was attentive & worked quickly to get us seated on a busy Friday night.

24.description: This was a cool, laid-back kind of place to get some good eats. I enjoyed a grilled romaine salad, but be warned, if you don't like the taste of balsamic, the sauce/vinegar they use to get the char on the romaine is strong in flavor, despite what your server might tell you. My husband got a burger after hearing of the many fantastic reviews, but he/we found it to be just a little drier than we expected. The couple we went with loved their burgers and the choice to get a side salad instead of fries. The fries my husband were disappointing; they were lukewarm at best and very limp. The very best part of Little Bad Wolf is the awesome soundtrack of oldies they play. (Well, at least they were playing the afternoon we had lunch.) I get to eat lunch while enjoying the talents of Diana Ross, Stevie Wonder, and the like? AMAZING.

7.description: I dined here over the weekend with a group of friends (about 15) and we ordered everything on the menu. Literally.  First - the ambiance is gorgeous.  Great music, great decor, I want to steal their tables.  Basically I'd like to live here.  Second - The food.  AMAZING.  My favorite was the Mac and Cheese.  Possibly the best mac i've ever tasted.  The crab cake was amazing.  Steak Frites were delicious, steak was perfectly cooked. The mussels were perfection.  My least favorite thing on the menu were the baos, but they were still great.  I am definitely coming back asap!

49.description: Food is very good. Lots of options, most of them excellent. Drink selection is impressive, but generally overpriced. Service is very helpful and attentive. Visual ambiance is nice and intimate, but the music almost counteracts it by being too loud and mostly "today's hits."Would love to see a dip in drink prices and a different playlist, but still a place well worth checking out.

40.description: The burger: wow!  Perfectly executed.   Delicious.  Chips and salsa with chips cooked to order.  Wonderful cocktails.   I will be back.

53.description: I was really looking forward to wolfing down some bao and tacos at this Andersonville hot spot but the nearly hour wait got the evening off on the wrong foot. The place is small and really loud. Service is a bit variable but not unfriendly. The french fries are delicious and the large is really large. The mussels were yummy and fresh tasting. The Brussels sprouts were flavorful but a little oily.  Tacos were generous but the bao were a little light on condiments which made them a little bland. I think if I avoided peak times and ordered better,  LBW could deliver an enjoyable dining experience.

30.description: Little bad wolf has the makings of a 5 star restaurant, besides one thing: the food.  We tried basically every Boa and Taco on their menu along with their Mac and cheese after reading other Yelp reviews, and they were all good, but none left a lasting impression. I felt the tacos/ baos were light on sauce and most were very dry and bland. The one exception to this review is the elotes corn. Go here and order this now! Might be the best I've ever had; creamy, buttery, and it comes with deep fried avocado on top. With that being said I loved the atmosphere, friendly service and extensive beer/ cocktail menu. I would go back for drinks and apps but probably not for their baos/ tacos.

46.description: The double burger is about as good as a classic cheese burger gets.  Perfectly cooked, juicy, flavorful, and a perfect balance of toppings.  Currently my favorite burger in the neighborhood.  Might be the best I've had in Chicago, but there are many places that I still need try!Great beer menu and really friendly staff make this a great place to get a drink and a burger.  I saw the salads and they were huger and really good looking.

1.description: Really great ambience, service, and best of all, drinks and food!! Definitely give this place a try!My group of 4 came in on a Thursday night around 7:30 and were told that there would be a 25 minute wait. That was no problem at all, because they have a full bar with specialty cocktails, draft beers, wines, it was extensive!We ordered the Black Chocolate Stout, Sofie, and the Hibernation Ale. The Stout paired well with the chocolate notes and made more a more smooth sip. The Hibernation Ale had a lot of delicious and deep hops flavor. The Sofie was a much lighter drink and great for anyone starting out with draft beer.For starters, we ordered a pound of the Fried Jumbo Shrimp, as we were told the 1/2 pound would come with 5-6 pieces of shrimp depending on their size. The Pound of shrimp was a good call as the 4 of us each got a good helping to it and the ketchup and radish sauce that accompanied it-super yummy and fried to perfection! For entrees, we ordered 4 of the Baos: Pork Shoulder, Shrimp, Steak, and Fish! The best was the Pork Shoulder, because of the slightly sweeter BBQ sauce. The Shrimp and Fish Baos were a bit on the dry side. The Steak was good but nothing surprising. We also ordered a side of elotes, and were delightfully surprised by the portion size. The dish was perfectly seasoned with some spice to give it a kick that makes you want more and the cheese mixed and sprinkled on top just makes every bite all the more savory. We will definitely be back to try the burgers!

55.description: I had pork bao and fish taco.  Having bao wrap is such a cool idea. Their salad has gigantic serving so i shared with friends. They have nice drink selection also. Dining room is quite small with about 10 tables. But nice enough neighborhood bar.

9.description: Cool little spot in Andersonville. The heart of the menu and the best things they have are the little tacos and steamed bao bun sandwiches. It's a weird combo, but both were awesome. They also had a nice beer list, this place really surprised me in a good way!Crab cake - BSalad - BPork taco - A-Shrimp taco - AShrimp bao bun - A

26.description: They aren't kidding when they say on here "Not Good for Kids" -- Not realizing this, we came here with our one year old on a Wednesday evening. We were seated at a booth and only realized after some time that they didn't have a booster seat or high chair to offer us. At that point we had ordered drinks & committed to just improvising in holding her and making sure she didn't slip off. Certainly a nice place to meet with friends or have a date night. The food was well worth coming back. Took stars away because we totally felt like we were being rushed & targeted by servers for having a kid and taking up prime corner seating because of her when a larger group was waiting to be seated at our spot.

25.description: Do yourself a favor and order the corn! Plus Bao and tacos All. Day. Long. So good! Also, when I was there the Fugees' version of Killing Me Softly started playing and- I'm not kidding-  the whole bar started singing. Not obnoxiously- magically.

12.description: This was a cool, laid-back kind of place to get some good eats. I enjoyed a grilled romaine salad, but be warned, if you don't like the taste of balsamic, the sauce/vinegar they use to get the char on the romaine is strong in flavor, despite what your server might tell you. My husband got a burger after hearing of the many fantastic reviews, but he/we found it to be just a little drier than we expected. The couple we went with loved their burgers and the choice to get a side salad instead of fries. The fries my husband were disappointing; they were lukewarm at best and very limp. The very best part of Little Bad Wolf is the awesome soundtrack of oldies they play. (Well, at least they were playing the afternoon we had lunch.) I get to eat lunch while enjoying the talents of Diana Ross, Stevie Wonder, and the like? AMAZING.

59.description: While I haven't been recently (early summer) I often find myself thinking about the Wolf and Red. It was such a well made cocktail I now have cravings for it, especially on those nice sunny go out and do something / "patio days."Sal is a great. Good service. Cool atmosphere. The other drinks look excellent. Yummy snacks. I'll be back FOR SURE.

21.description: The Bad Burger is just soooo ironically good. That and the chips with salsa + guac were both the best I've had in a long time. Get them. Everything is great here, though the waiter scared the crap out of me by coming up behind and very loudly asking if we were doing OK. Yep, doing great, please don't hurt me. Tip: this place isn't huge so get a reservation if you go on Saturday. Otherwise wait is only 15 min at the bar. They also have games!

17.description: Came here with my bf after seeing something on Eater Chicago. I got two tacos (the fish and chicken) and the pork bao. The pork bao was the highlight of the show and something I would definitely come back for. Take a pass on the chicken taco (I didn't find it very flavorful) but the fish taco was great (I couldn't believe how big the piece of fried fish was!) especially with some hot sauce thrown on. Unfortunately, the bartender (who was "taking care" of us) was less than stellar. His whole demeanor made us feel like serving us was an inconvenience. He didnt offer to explain any of the menu, or ask if we had any questions. He didn't ask to refill our water glasses nor ask how my bf wanted his burger cooked or what side he wanted. After getting our food he didn't check in on how we liked our meal. It just seemed like he was entirely absent. It was very disappointing.Would I come back? Yes. Would I sit at the bar? No. I'll opt for a table instead. 4.5 stars for the food, and 2 stars for the service.

10.description: It was my first here and I have mixed feelings. The food was delicious! We had the tacos, elotes, and bao buns. I highly recommend the elotes as an appetizer. It's like the ones you get from the Mexican carts on the streets of Chicago, but a little bit more refined. The tacos were also so amazing. The shrimp was probably the best one out of all of them. The bao buns were not for me, but my boyfriend loved it. The only downside of this place the ambience. It was really really loud. Granted it was partly a bar. But I couldn't even hear my boyfriend speak across the table. And because the tables are so close to each other, I felt like I was listening to the next table's conversation. Because it was so loud, it was super difficult to get the waiter's attention. I even screamed my waiter a few times, but he couldn't hear me. Maybe if they lowered the music volume a few notches would be helpful for a better experience. Other than that, the food was delicious!!

5.description: I figured my first review in 2016 should be for this little gem. What a great place! The food, the drinks, the atmosphere and the people. Everything is top notch. Yes, it's a bit tiny, not a lot of seating. But it's really not an issue if you know that ahead of time and plan accordingly. Definitely get one of their cocktails. I don't remember which one I ordered but it was delicious. Also, the bao's and tacos are a must. Shrimp, steak, chicken, all amazing! So that's it! Make this one of your "musts" this year :)

3.description: LBW is a pretty big and bad wolf. Thumbing through reviews I see I'm not the only one who made my way to Andersonville because I came across a sponsored IG post of the triple Wolf Burger. I scrolled past it at like 2am and knew I had to have it. One week later I was there.I walked in and was pleasantly surprised to see that LBW gives off an elegant look and feel but not stuffy. I make that remark because originally I thought LBW was just going to be a burger joint. The staff was all pretty cool. Now the space isn't huge with table seating and some bar space. I opted for the bar because there is a majority of table seating with backless stools and I find that to be bullshit choice. But really that's my only gripe. I actually enjoy sitting at the bar.As for the menu my original thought was identity crisis. It's American, Mexican, and Asian. I'm talking burgers, tacos, and baos. But I will say that I'm a fan of a small menu that's done to perfection which is called staying in your lane. Do a few things and do them well. LBW did just that.

35.description: Food: The food here is amazing, everything was well seasoned and reasonably priced. The boa tacos are delicious, the burgers are mouth watering, mac and cheese is a must if your feeling some comfort food. Establishment & Service: The place is very...very small. So if your looking for private dinning experience, this may not be the best choice.

19.description: This place is great. Sliders & Burgers = GREAT. Mussels = GREAT! Mac & Cheese = GREAT!I live in A-Ville and this is one of the top restaurants I always recommend when people ask me where they should go. They also have free wifi = GREAT!

28.description: I have been meaning to come here for a while, and finally went today. The place was much smaller than I expected it to be, and it was pretty crowded for a Sunday night. The music was also pretty loud, which made it hard to socialize with the people I was with. Luckily, the wait was only ten minutes. The service and food were great. However, I wish the waiter would have told us that the portions are huge. I was with three other people and we had to get to-go boxes for most of the food. The baos and mac and cheese are delicious.

45.description: I really love the fact that this place has over 4 pages of beers and liquors and 1 page for food!! I waited a little for my friend to arrive and watched every meal being served and it all looked and smelled amazing! I had a pork bao and a thai bao and my friend had the wolf burger sliders...all of it was really good! I really appreciated the server making stout recommendations as they were all good. Will definitely come again to try some other beers and food!

33.description: The fries are really really good, and are what keep us coming back for more. The service is great - we were told a 20 minute wait which turned into 45, but we received a complimentary appetizer for our troubles, which was delicious. We went back for the bao sandwiches, and the burgers are fantastic.A++

43.description: This place is a great combination of style and substance. They have a cool atmosphere/decor, tasty food, and a superb drink list. My first visit was 5 stars, my second visit was 4, mainly due to the service (service was excellent on my first visit). Despite the slower, less friendly service on my second visit, I'm a fan of this place. I've been for dinner and lunch.They have an extensive whiskey and beer list along with some fantastic cocktails. I had their barrel-aged manhattan and my cousin got their sazerac. Both were excellent. We did beer after and enjoyed those as well. For food, you can't go wrong with their sliders, any of the baos (especially the pork one), and their french fries are really good. Their mac n cheese is solid and while their tacos definitely aren't bad, I'd highly suggest their baos over their tacos.I'm glad I've come across this place and that it's walking distance from my brother's apartment. I'll be back for sure on future Chi visits.

2.description: I love you, Little Bad Wolf. You've made the awkward strip of Bryn Mawr so much more delicious. If you were a person, I'd kiss you.Seriously, go to Little Bad Wolf. Their tacos and bao are amazing: I usually get the fish and steak tacos and a cocktail - doesn't get any better than that. And while we're at it - a place in Edgewater that has Pappy Van Winkle? Yes please! I only wish they were bigger so you didn't have to wait so long to get a table.

18.description: Delicious & memorable food & drinks! The space is small & loud.  The hubs asked them to lower the volume and they did immediately!Bao.  There was a theme from our party of 6 that the meat ones were better than the fish/seafood options.  Loved the chicken & pork bao! Found them to be tasty & innovativeTacos.  Everyone loved the fish, steak & potato.  The guac was creamy yumminess. So much that we had to order another order of guac!The mussels in a creamy coconut broth was to die for! One of our friend had never had mussels before and fell in love! The mule drink was well made and served perfectly.  We will be back.   Probably on a weekday when it's not so crowded.  They don't take reservations so be prepared to wait on a weekend as we went at 7pm on a Saturday...prime time wait was 45 min!

41.description: Very, VERY crowded on a Saturday night! They don't take reservations, so expect to wait. We got there at about 6:45 and waited maybe 15-20 minutes, which is not that bad considering how tiny and cramped the space is. For food, we got the chicken and shrimp baos, which were pretty delicious. I liked the chicken better, it was a bit spicy and had a Thai-style taste to it. I could barely finish 2 baos, they were pretty filling.The noise level here is out of control. I could barely hear my friend across the table. Don't think I would come back on that basis alone.

52.description: This place has great food. One of the best burgers in the city.

50.description: Can't get enough of this place. Been here a number of times now and I have had a great experience every time. The Mussels and Shrimp Bao are my go-to. The Elotes as a side are my absolute favorite though. The fried avocado on top is delicious. My favoreite drink is the Green Eyes on their cocktail menu. If you love celery salt, this is your drink. Love it. Their beer menu is always on point as well. Will be back most definitely.

4.description: They got Burgers, Tacos, Boas, and a large Craft beer list, this place already won me over. When I went to visit a buddy of mine, and she suggested we come here for lunch I was excited. It was a place that I had bookmarked to try for a while. The place is low key, not that big, infact the seating inside is a little awkward. Wish the place was bigger. We started with elotes which were amazing, some of the best I have ever had. Then we got a variety of boas and tacos. My fav was the pork boa, and steak taco! Heard the Mac n Cheese n Burgers here are great as well, will deff be coming back.

6.description: This place is a great combination of style and substance. They have a cool atmosphere/decor, tasty food, and a superb drink list. My first visit was 5 stars, my second visit was 4, mainly due to the service (service was excellent on my first visit). Despite the slower, less friendly service on my second visit, I'm a fan of this place. I've been for dinner and lunch.They have an extensive whiskey and beer list along with some fantastic cocktails. I had their barrel-aged manhattan and my cousin got their sazerac. Both were excellent. We did beer after and enjoyed those as well. For food, you can't go wrong with their sliders, any of the baos (especially the pork one), and their french fries are really good. Their mac n cheese is solid and while their tacos definitely aren't bad, I'd highly suggest their baos over their tacos.I'm glad I've come across this place and that it's walking distance from my brother's apartment. I'll be back for sure on future Chi visits.

22.description: First, great welcoming staff and bartenders. And, great port taco along with the fries. Will make sure to return, great place to hang out!

15.description: I came here on a Thursday night with a girlfriend. I probably should have seen if they were on open table before showing up because when I got there at 7, there was a half hour wait. While waiting, we went next door to the bar where the bartender gave us some great advice about what to order. He said we had to order a bao and a taco. When we came back to the restaurant half an hour later, they still weren't ready to seat us.  The place was packed and it's a very small restaurant. We waited about five minutes and we were sat.  I ordered the green eyes and omg it was the best cocktail I've had in awhile. My friend got their version of the Moscow mule and then switched to the green eyes. You can also order the green eyes up and it's made with egg whites. To eat, we took the bartender's advice and ordered a bao and a taco.  I ordered the shrimp bao and the potato taco and they both were just amazing!  I just loved the bread they used in the bao- it was so fluffy.  We also ordered the brussels sprouts which were full of flavor!Overall, I loved the food and the cocktails.  However, they need a bigger space because they're just so busy!

57.description: Cool little spot in Andersonville. The heart of the menu and the best things they have are the little tacos and steamed bao bun sandwiches. It's a weird combo, but both were awesome. They also had a nice beer list, this place really surprised me in a good way!Crab cake - BSalad - BPork taco - A-Shrimp taco - AShrimp bao bun - A

20.description: LOVED the music:  The Fugees, Alisha Keys, Michael Jackson, Bobby Brown, Bruno Mars.  I was dancing/singing along as I ate!  Two baos and a side was more than enough for dinner.  I had the shrimp and the chicken bao - shrimp was better.  I also had a side of mac & cheese - loved the bacon bits.  For drinks I had the Green Eyes (no longer on the menu but you can ask) and the Duchess - so good.  I had to bring it down a star because they had no dessert!  Great little place with great service.

36.description: Mac and cheese is great, as are the mussels. Dishes seem needlessly heavy and greasy, even their white fish. Good ambiance and service. Will probably return.

14.description: Everything about this place makes me happy and want to come back. Their cocktails are on point and their food is incredible. Their burger is literally one of the best burgers in the city, on par with Au Cheval. Seriously It is a MUST! Pair with the mashed potatoes with bacon gravy! The shrimp and steak baos were also great but I dream about this burger!

1.description: Fun gear store with employees who are enthusiastic about the products they sell.

2.description: I really like Full Kit Gear. The employees are great and helpful. I'll be making lots of trips here.

0.description: Very friendly staff and great products. They make their own line of leather and they have beautiful harnesses. I bought a gray metallic harness and wanted the matching arm band and thigh harness. They did not have the material so they took another harness apart to build the products I wanted and in less than hour my items were ready.  Will always go back when visiting Chicago.

29.description: I use Yelp quite often, for everything from restaurants to car repair shops, but I've never written a review.  There's a first time for everything and my experience at Cassona compelled me to finally become a Yelp contributor.I have been shopping for a reasonably priced sofa throughout the last couple of months and was not terribly pleased with anything until I went into Roy's furniture last weekend.  I will not deride Roy's in a review of Cassona, but I was less than thrilled with the experience I had and decided to shop elsewhere.Fortunately, Cassona had the same make and model in their very nice store.  I called ahead to ask for the price and was initially disappointed to hear that the model I wanted was more expensive at Cassona, but the manager was willing to price match with absolutely no fuss, simply thanking me for bringing my business to her store.  Upon arriving, I was immediately greeted by a fantastic sales associate and the manager.  Now, I absolutely hate environments where salespeople are present, whether it be jewelery stores, car dealerships or furniture stores.  It always seems the associates are looking at me as though my presence is inconveniencing them unless I cash in my 401(k) to by an expensive item (I was overwhelmed by this sensation at Roy's).  Well, my experience at Cassona was perhaps the most pleasant "large" purchase transaction I've ever had.  Everyone was incredibly friendly without being overbearing and genuinely wanted the best for me, their customer.I was there to buy a sofa, of which they have a decent selection in the relatively small store.  They also have a decent selection of other furniture and rugs as well as some pretty unique pieces.I have yet to receive the couch I ordered and will update my review when I take delivery.  I expect that the sofa will arrive in the quoted 4-6 weeks and that any issues I have will be quickly addressed.  I'm not easily impressed, but Cassona delivers on all fronts and I had a truly wonderful buying experience.  I will definitely be back for any furniture needs in the future.

42.description: Who knew Andersonville had such cute shops?  Not I!  I need to head up this way more often, if only to come to places like Cassona.After brunch Sarah B and I walked around for a bit, and we popped in here to look around.  They have lots of great modern but classic furniture (which is what I like) at really inexpensive prices.  I immediately found many, many things that I loved...  but then my wallet remembered I'm unemployed.  (That's *really* starting to crimp my style, yo.)I actually found some really cool coasters that match some prints I have hanging in my living room so I ended up buying them since they were so inexpensive.The man working here was SO nice, and fun to talk to.  While we browsed and I admired a couch he pointed out some fun features of it (yeah, I'm SO coming back for it when I get a job!), and while he checked me out we talked about traveling.  When I said I was German and Irish, he laughed and said I must know how to party.  Hehe.  He was super fun, and I'll definitely be coming back here when I have paychecks again.

23.description: Stopped in the other day just to take a look around. They have a pretty good selection and some comfortable looking items. Also, the prices seemed reasonable. What I liked best was the staff. The guy was SO amazingly friendly I felt like I was on a hidden video show or something. Maybe it was the Zombie Pub Crawl that put everyone in a great mood. The guy definitely earned Cassona a spot on my "friendliest places" list

47.description: We bought a large furniture item here, and the price and service were great.  The price was not the cheapest out there, but the people that work here were so nice and helpful that it was worth the extra money.  the cassona in evanston is also good, though I think the selection in andersonville is better.

8.description: In pursuit of a couch for our new apartment, boyfriend and I wandered into Cassona yesterday afternoon and did some test sitting in couches. We had previously had a really rotten day of couch shopping at discount stores like Ashley, The Room Place and Value City Furniture, etc. These places did not have fabric options and I found, perhaps surprisingly, not that much cheaper than Cassona .... plus most of the couches were ungoldy uncomfortable and certainly of a lower quality. I wanted a gray couch which is apparently impossible, IMPOSSIBLE I tell you, to get at these aforementioned discount stores. Walking into Cassona I was presented with at least 3 beautiful gray couches plus tons and tons of fabric options. All the couches were very comfortable too, it was quite hard to decide since I was finally faced with beautiful couches in fabrics and colors I loved that had actual lumbar support. We ended up deciding on a 3 person sofa with chaise. The chaise is moveable/removable as it comes with a long cushion and an ottoman underneath that can be moved to the middle or other side of the couch, plus an extra cushion if you want to remove the ottoman entirely. The versatility to change the couch is a great option. The couches all seem to come with 2 accent pillows too and we got to choose through many many more fabrics for those. What I liked most about Cassona, other than the beautiful and not absurdly expensive furniture, was the helpfulness and honesty of the staff. John helped us yesterday and offered lots of helpful tips in choosing a couch and a fabric, explained the different kinds of fabric and how they wear and should be cleaned, explained the warranty and didn't pressure us to purchase. It was nice not feeling uncomfortable about coming back the next day to think it over through the night. We did in fact come back today and the owner helped us place our order and answered more questions. Everything about Cassona is class, from the style of furniture to the care from the staff. Quite a different experience from Ashley Furniture and Value City where I didn't have a singe sales rep offer any information on how the fabric wears or how one should clean it etc. I cannot wait for the couch to arrive! Living around the corner I will definitely be popping in to check out other pieces from time to time.

31.description: I can't say enough good things about my experience here, I would give 10 stars if I could. I moved to a new condo and abandoned a lot of old furniture starting off with a clean slate in the new pad. I needed a dining room set, a full bedroom set and complete furnishing for my new living room. Combine this with the fact that I am clueless and illiterate when it comes to interior design and that sort of thing, I didn't even have the terminology to say what I liked or wanted !! So it was a with a lot of trepidation I ventured into the store in Andersonville, the first encouraging sign was that they let me browse, a sales person checked in with me when I arrived and then let me explore and look for ideas. When I finally had some clue as to what I wanted I was lucky enough to be looked after by John who was amazing. He very patiently went through my lists, spent ages going through swatches with me, gently and diplomatically eased me away from my more horrendous choices and was genuinely interested in making the whole process work for me. At no point did I get the feeling that I was being encouraged to buy the more expensive choices and because of the size of the order he worked out a very generous discount. The furniture arrived this weekend and I could not be more pleased, I had brought some photographs with me of my new place on my first visit and that helped a lot, now that its all installed the entire package works. The delivery was efficient and very professional. My impression is that the philosophy in this store is that If they help you make good choices they will have a happy (return) customer and that's more effective in the long run than just selling you the most expensive item on the floor. It certainly worked for me, I'm back next week for round two, the rugs and tchotchkes and stuff to 'pull it together', under John Zotti's careful eye of course !! Awesome place, awesome people, I couldn't be happier with my experience.

34.description: I just purchased a sofa from Cassona, and again, the experience was everything I've learned to expect form Alma and Angel: perfect. Nowhere you find a more professional and friendly staff so willing to make sure you are completely satisfied with your purchase. Thank you Alma, Thank you Angel.

16.description: I love this store. The guys are really helpful. I usually spend a lot of time lurking before I come to a decision about buying a piece of furniture. I made my first "adult purchase" of a sofa from here a little over a year ago. Good, clean lines. I haven't had any problems with mine, but was assured that if there were, I could contact the store immediately for resolution. Today I just received delivery of my new coffee table. Delivery guys 15 minutes early even! They put the table together quickly with no fuss, and I am now typing out my review from the comfort of my awesome lift top coffee table!

13.description: While walking to Starbucks one day I went in here to browse and saw a beautiful painting that I was thinking I had to have. I talked to the staff and they were SO nice it was unbelievable how comfortable he made me feel. I came back with my GF so she could see how beautiful the painting was and he let me put money down and pick it up later. I finally got it home and it looks beautiful in our space. Highly recommend!!!!

11.description: Visited these guys twice over the past week (2 weekends in a row).  Worked with the manager (Angel).  He was very pleasant to work with, really just a nice experience.  They have a great selection of high quality modern furnishings and accessories.  Very reasonably priced as well.  I wish we had discovered this place earlier on in our shopping process, we likely would have bought a decent amount more furniture from them.

39.description: It's only in the last few years that I've graduated from Target and IKEA into the world of good furniture. In that brief time I've come to really appreciate the guys at Cassona in Andersonville. (Sergio and Tony I *think*).Totally helpful ... they deliver honest (not sales based) opinions when you ask, are very patient when you have color swatches spread out all over their floor, and are just fun to talk to.

37.description: Update.  Such contemporary, stylish, not over-the-top furniture at affordable prices.  Interesting accessories as well and the whole team is so friendly and helpful.  They provide great design suggestions and they are not pushy.  They were so patient with us as we shopped and even played with my daughter and helped her walk!  Tip:  They have a parking lot in the back.  Wish I had known!Didn't end up buying any furniture but the owner(?) was so friendly.  She even offered for us to bring the chair home to see if it looks good there.  For most of their furniture, they have many fabric choices to choose from.  Would love to go back for other furniture.

0.description: Jessica and I love working with the Cassona team - Alma, Angel, and John. They are very friendly and really know their stuff! We like that they work with domestic manufacturers as opposed to big box stores that source primarily from overseas. Not to mention, you can customize to your liking.We purchased a couch earlier this year and have been very pleased with the quality of the piece as well as the service delivered by the Cassona team. John guided us throughout the entire process from design to caring for the fabric.Currently, we are taking a look at purchasing a leather accent chair. We stopped by the shop last weekend to take a look. Alma and Angel took the time to educate us on the leather varieties and provided us with a couple of great options. We are so excited to purchase within the next few months!!Always a pleasure to stop by, say hello, and see what's new in the store!

38.description: Alma and her staff at Cassona will bend over backwards to make sure you get just the right furniture! The store was well lit and comfortable and the selection was great! My wife and I were in there last Saturday and we were greeted warmly by Alma and her friend who is a professional designer as well as a doctor! She was there to offer free decorating advice for the day. My wife kept her busy for well over an hour. The only thing we need to do now is make a decision.

51.description: Fun furniture, great accessories.  You will not find repeats of items found here- in other stores.  Some very interesting wall hangings hand created by traditional artisans in Mexico.  Fantastic colors in bed linens, custom orders.  My favorites?  Incredible, heavy, but well designed ceramic wall tiles in these funky red/mocha and bit of pumpkin colors with leaf designs. Sounds strange I know, but a fantastic accessory, they had 3 different tiles, at 19.95 each, they were an absolute steal!  I WILL be back!!

27.description: We love our new sofa from Cassona! The staff was super fun and very helpful. Totally check it out for all of your decorating needs in Andersonville.

32.description: I've been shopping here for accessories since I've moved to Chicago but recently decided to purchase a sofa for my new place. The small staff was beyond helpful and patient with all of my questions. It wasn't your typical furniture store environment. I spent what felt like hours going through sofa styles and swatches while the staff remained helpful, never making me feel pressured. The Sofa arrived last week (on time) and I couldn't be happier! Definitely  recommend this shop!

48.description: I recently purchased a love seat and end table from Cassona. The love seat arrived 2 weeks early and everything looks great in my apartment! Good selection and the guy that helped me was very nice. This seems like a locally owned business so it felt good supporting a neighborhood retailer over a big chain.

44.description: We've been in Cassona several times since this past summer.  Even though the first few times we were just browsing, we were greeted in an extremely friendly manner and made to feel welcome.  There were some great art prints that I wanted but just couldn't afford this past summer.  Yesterday, I walked in to find the paintings I wanted at a 30-40 percent discount.  I bought three.  The two gentlemen who work in the store are very personable, will chat with you about a multitude of topics, and be genuinely interested in anything you have to say.  I really love shopping and supporting local businesses; I will go back to Cassona and purchase other items as I can afford them ;-)(fyi-their fashionably classic items even non-sale priced are reasonably priced, but I'm on a budget)

24.description: I went back to Cassona and ordered a media console. The staff was very helpful and my furniture arrive early and the delivery men were on time! Another great experience with Cassona. If you are in Andersonville you should stop on this great shop.

7.description: Really like the contemporary yet warm-homey furniture, art and accessories here! I returned twice in two days!

49.description: I have bought 2 beautiful furniture pieces from Cassona, as well as a statue named Gorda. I love the furniture in this store. They were delivered very fast and on time. However, I tried to purchase an ottoman and placed the order. I put a deposit down and waited the 6-week estimated time. Then, I was told it would be another month. Then, I was told after that, another month. And so on, until 8 months passed and I finally got my money back because I was tired of waiting. The people are nice there, but the store needs to cut off their suppliers who can't produce. The store worked with me to decrease the cost for the delay and offered free delivery, but enough was enough. I'm bummed because I liked the ottoman. Long story short, I think the furniture is top notch. I wouldn't buy anything that wasn't in stock.

40.description: This review is based mainly on the great service I received. I've never actually visited the store; this is an online purchasing story. Here's what happened. Desperately in need of a bed frame, I'd scoured many affordable furniture stores in Chicago only to come up empty. Then, I found one I really liked at an outlet store in Evanston, but the price wasn't right. (I'm not spending thousands of dollars on a queen-sized bed frame that I'm exchanging for a king as soon as my bedroom gets bigger.) Back to my story. On a whim, I searched online and found my bed at Cassona -- and for much less! So, I called and Angel was so helpful with the order and scheduled the delivery within a couple of days. The delivery men arrived on said day promptly and were very professional. The bedframe was beautiful, but after they left, I noticed an imperfection in the staining of the wood. I called Angel and he ordered me a replacement, which was delivered about four weeks later. Based on this great service, I'll be back to Cassona for my next furniture purchase.

30.description: Potentially one of the best furniture stores in the city.  It's a small store, but wonderful taste, very high quality/unique pieces, and reasonable prices.   We just bought a really unique bedroom set and coffee table from there.  John and Angel are extremely helpful and knowledgeable (They even let you come in with your dogs if out on a walk).  I liked the style of something on the floor, but it wasn't the right piece.  John spent time with me going through their catalogs from that furniture maker as well as others until we found just the right pieces.   They were delivered last weekend and I'm in love with them. I also commissioned an independent furniture maker to design/build 4 custom pieces of furniture for me. While at my house, he commented on the high quality of the bedroom set from Cassona. If in the market for furniture, well worth the trip to Andersonville to check out their store.  Furniture is great, prices are great, and John and Angel are wonderful.

46.description: Purchased an ottoman/cocktail table from here and was told 6 weeks for delivery got it in 3! very helpful and friendly sales staff. I will be buying more furniture here in the future.

1.description: To begin, I do not yet have my couch but I have to compliment Cassona just for the experience of shopping for a couch.  At the beginning of my visits to the store it was just to enjoy the beauty of everything.  All the pieces are amazing!I visited this store many a time with various friends and family members - they agreed with my assessment.  Then there's John and Angel.  No matter the time or day I was there John and Angel were ready to help and just as ready to stay out of the way.  My father brings his own measuring tape holstered to his belt.  Angel remarked "They don't need our help. This man came prepared!"   However, their help and advice is invaluable and they think of every detail of which I had no idea could be involved in a couch. I'm fully confident that I'll love my couch and I'll update when I get it.

9.description: I've had nothing but excellent experiences with Cassona:1)  I purchased a Rowe sofa from Cassona a few years ago that I absolutely LOVE!  However, I've had some issues with the springs.  The parts are under warranty but full warranty service with labor is expired on the sofa.  I reached out to Cassona to ask them if they could assist me with figuring out how to get it repaired, and Alma not only first contacted Rowe and found out all of the details about what was and was not covered, and how to handle things through ROWE, if needed, but she actually spent the next month getting quotes from local repair shops and was able to help me find a very inexpensive, but highly qualified, in-home repair person.2)  I purchased a coffee table that was marked down to sell, first they gave me a huge discount on the delivery, and then, when the delivery person was out sick, Alma showed up with a young man from the shop.  They brought the table to me in her vehicle and assembled it for me instead of making me wait and reschedule with their delivery service.I love their interesting and beautiful furniture, and I can't say enough good things about their service.  This is truly a fantastic place to shop for furniture!

26.description: I recently bought a sofa here. Angel was super helpful when picking it out. There are a lot more things to choose when ordering than I had planned for, but they made it easy to do. The sofa is made in 'Merica, which is nice, and was custom made shipped in 6 weeks. The quality seems very good, and the guarantee was also pretty solid. They will replace the foam basically forever if it ever sags. The price was pretty decent too, certainly not IKEA, but quite a bit cheaper than Crate and Barrel and the like, and it looks great.

25.description: This review is long overdue, my new sofa arrived in October and I couldn't be happier.  Prices are better than most similar larger chains, and the quality is really good.  I was happy to support products that are made in the USA and certified sustainable.  The thing that will keep me returning to Cassona though is the amazing customer service.  John was amazing to work with, very patient with my million questions and helpful with fabric selections (especially something that would hold up to pets) and different options that he could work out with the manufacturer (things like tufting, pillow splits, leg design). I felt like a VIP customer even though I was only purchasing one sofa and I truely got a custom piece.  I called back with a few follow up questions and even the owner had knowledge of my order.  Angel provided great communication regarding delivery and the delivery people were helpful as well.  Overall great service from everyone at the store, I have recommended Cassona to everyone who asks about furniture and can't wait to go back when I'm able to make another purchase.

12.description: This is the first place that I check when I need any new furniture.  I bought my first "grown-up" sofa from John last year and have been a loyal customer ever since.  The reason is because of the staff (John has been my main salesman) and the care that is given to make sure that everything is perfect from the initial order to any issues that might come up once the pieces are in your home.  The prices are fair, the selection is great, and overall it is a fantastic place to find your new furniture.Michael B., Lincoln Park

21.description: Had a great experience at the store! John was knowledgeable about the furniture and very helpful in helping me choose the color for my couch and pillows. The store has a good selection of furniture from all over the world and I was very excited I finally found the couch I loved after looking for 2 months. I am definitely shopping there for more furniture when I need it!

17.description: I recently bought a sofa here. Angel was super helpful when picking it out. There are a lot more things to choose when ordering than I had planned for, but they made it easy to do. The sofa is made in 'Merica, which is nice, and was custom made shipped in 6 weeks. The quality seems very good, and the guarantee was also pretty solid. They will replace the foam basically forever if it ever sags. The price was pretty decent too, certainly not IKEA, but quite a bit cheaper than Crate and Barrel and the like, and it looks great.

10.description: I bought my furniture from them and they have such a great staff!

5.description: Just moved to the area and walked by the store a couple times. Window had great items so we went in. We really liked a lot of pieces, but I'm so indecisive so we went in another 4 times. Each time the staff was amazing, patient, helpful but not at all pushy. They gave you their honest opinion and let you go from there.  Angel and John are amazing. Finally on the 4th time in, we purchased our sectional sofa. John was so incredibly patient with me as I walked around the store a million times, carrying swatches all around, then he stayed late to make sure our order went in on the same day.  I highly recommend this place and plan to be back to get more items very soon.

3.description: John - you the MAN. This review is dedicated to John at Cassona. And so begins my letter (only slightly dramatized for effect).Dear John,Before I walked into Cassona I had the fear of the sofa gods wedged deep in my soul. Wash codes? Mid-century styling? Rolled arms? What is happening? Please no. You saw me for the deer-in-the-headlights I was and adapted accordingly. You did an outstanding job of giving me your best suggestions based on what I liked. As time went on, and you thought I could handle it, you slowly gave me information about why the couches you had suggested were high quality. All the while being patient with my naivety and indecisiveness. It was perfect.And in the end? I purchased an outstanding sofa. (Mid-century light grey with WS wash codes for those of you playing at home.)Thank you John!All my best,MattMy suggestion to you, reader? I think you know that I'll be back.

35.description: Modern but does not miss on function. Love the cleanly designed furniture and unique one of a kind accessories. Prices are reasonable for their quality, probably in between Crate and Barrel and Dania. I had a difficult time finding a buffet longer than 66" for my dining room and found the perfect one from here. I also bought the matching table. I ordered a backordered mirror and was worried about whether it would arrive before housewarming party. Alma (the owner) made sure it arrived a week before the party. Sometimes they sell floor samples for half the price if you don't mind minor, barely noticeable scratches. That means a few hundred dollars savings.

19.description: Lots of the standard, practical furniture pieces most people need at least a few of (yeah, I'd love to fill my place with Eames and Nelson, but I've got two college educations to fund) but lots of unique stuff.If you want something funky and modern but of decent quality, this is a destination store.  I fell in love with the chair/bench made from a gathered bundle of vertical wood.  Now that you know I'm not a furniture or architecture critic, check out the photo I uploaded - yelp.com/biz_photos/O4Xq….  This chair was incredibly comfortable and designed like nothing I've ever seen.Prices are fantastic!

28.description: I purchased a couch here 4 years ago and its the coziest coolest couch ever. Recently I decided to update my loft with a sectional and I knew exactly where to get it. The guys who work here are super helpful and fun. I had a minor problem with the button on my first couch coming loose and Angel said he would email the manufacturer about it to see what they could do. I noticed a huge stack of papers and notes behind the desk and I was thinking, he clearly has tons to do, i wonder if he will even remember this.This is what earns you 5 stars.. following through with what you say you will do and going above and beyond for your costumers. Within 2 days he had emailed the manufacturer and cced me on the email. The other thing that is impressive about Cassona is you are getting a custom made couch for a very good price. You choose your couch fabric, pillow fabric and what style of wood you want for the legs.  They also have some really neat lamps and picture frames. Thank you Cassona for making couch shopping enjoyable!

45.description: Got a couch and chair here with the fabric I wanted for about 1/3 the price of Crate and Barrel / Room and Board equivalents.  Delivery was prompt and as promised.A minor complaint - when they delivered the couch it baaaaarrrrely fit through our hall and scratched our wall.  Their initial call was to tell us that "our delivery driver told you it was a tight fit and you said to go ahead so we shouldn't be responsible."  Well, there was a language barrier there, so I'm not sure how that conversation could have occurred.  I just hate when, before getting the whole story,  a store manager sticks up for their employee at the expense of the customer.It took a couple of weeks, but at the end of the day the owner from the Evanston store came by to look at the minor damage and it was fixed appropriately at no cost to us, so was just a small deal in an overall smooth transaction.  If I needed something else to furnish my place I would probably check Cassona first and hope for another good deal.

33.description: Over the years, I have bought many beautiful items from Cassona and I would highly recommend anyone looking for furniture to stop in and have a look. The store is full of unique pieces at very reasonable prices. The owner, Alma, is very friendly and helpful, and can order many items not in the showroom, if necessary.  The mattresses were surprisingly affordable and comfortable; as a local chiropractor, this was of tremendous value to me!

43.description: This is a place that I really really like their style of furniture.  But there were some issues with out couch that caused the drop in price.My fiance and I buy a couch.  We select the style and fabric really really fast.  We already did research online and knew what we wanted.  Then we go and put a down payment.  We are given a 6-8 week window for our couch.  3 weeks pass (we're on vacation in Oklahoma visiting her family), and we get a call saying that the fabric we chose is from a fabric mill that is closed.  So we head back to Cassona right after we get back home.  We are informed that the manufacturer did not even start building the wood skeleton to put the fabric over so once we select the new fabric it will be another 6-8 weeks.  Then comes 4th of July week and the furniture maker is closed that entire week, and apparently that does not count as part of the 6-8 week deliverable window.All in all we get the couch about 12-14 weeks after we ordered it.  I do not think I will purchase from them again, unless there is a dirt cheap price.

2.description: After a nightmarish experience trying to buy a bed at Roy's (seven months after placing my order, we still didn't have anything, and they were dodging calls and emails), I emailed a bunch of other local Chicago furniture stores to see if any of them could special order the same bed.  Within 30 minutes of hitting "send" I received an email back from Alma, the owner of Cassona.  She said she could special order the bed, quoted us a price, and, after telling her about our problems getting the bed at Roy's, she "guaranteed" us that she could deliver the bed within 10-12 weeks and PROMISED that we would be completely satisfied with Cassona's customer service.  Even though the price was more than at Roy's, the reality was that Roy's price was irrelevant:  if they couldn't actually deliver the bed, then the incredibly low price didn't matter.  Despite not having stepped foot in the Cassona store, we took a chance and trusted Alma to make good on her promises.  She clearly wanted our business, seemed very organized and professional, and had the benefit of excellent reviews on Yelp to reinforce what she was promising us.The result:  Cassona has absolutely earned our business from now on.  And I say that despite the fact that we actually had some bumps in the road.  Not only did Alma stick to her delivery promise, but she was actually able to get the bed here earlier than expected.  Unfortunately, when the bed showed up, there was some damage to it (from the factory).  I informed Alma, sent her some quick cell phone pictures, and she promised us she'd get the damaged part replaced.  A few weeks later, a replacement footboard arrived (again...it had to be special ordered, so it wasn't like she could just swap it out from Cassona's own warehouse).  Unfortunately, that one was damaged as well (it was clear that there was a quality control issue at the manufacturer that had nothing to do with Cassona.  Because it was a special order, there was no way to check for damage before it arrived).  Shocked that this could happen twice, Alma kicked it into overdrive and worked with the manufacturer to get a second replacement footboard expedited, and in the end, we ended up with the bed we wanted.  It looks great and we're completely happy.Despite this longer-than-expected process, Alma provided AMAZING customer service.  She regularly emailed us with updates and kept us informed on progress, and even when she went on vacation, her staff picked up right where she left off and continued to stay in touch.  They were completely organized, and there was never a point where we felt like we had been forgotten about.  Each time we had a delivery, Alma was able to get us scheduled very quickly, and her delivery guys did a great job (they showed up on time, and were very efficient). Ordering furniture can be a bit of an adventure, and special ordering makes it even more so.  All you can ask of a retailer is that they keep their promises, do their best, and treat you properly.  Cassona did all of that.  The damage problems weren't their fault:  all they could do is react to those problems as quickly as possible and try to make things right.  And that's EXACTLY what they did.  If not for the manufacturer's quality issues, Cassona would have delivered the bed several weeks earlier than promised, and that's how they should be judged (along with how they worked to resolve the problems).  That's why I wanted to leave such a thorough review:  they deserved to be acknowledged for their excellent efforts.  I would ABSOLUTELY order from Cassona again, and if you're reading this, you should too.  They will do everything possible to make sure you have the best possible experience.

18.description: Stopped in the other day just to take a look around. They have a pretty good selection and some comfortable looking items. Also, the prices seemed reasonable. What I liked best was the staff. The guy was SO amazingly friendly I felt like I was on a hidden video show or something. Maybe it was the Zombie Pub Crawl that put everyone in a great mood. The guy definitely earned Cassona a spot on my "friendliest places" list

41.description: I really have to give props to this place.  Our sales guy, Angel, was not only patient and not pushy, he was truly helpful in assisting us in choosing some nice pieces, even dissuading us from several things because he didn't think we should spend that much, etc.  The best part?  After having already ordered a bed, sofa, and chair from Pottery Barn, we walked out with the same -- plus a rug and two lamps -- for $800 less than we spent at PB for those three items.  (Needless to say, I cancelled my PB order and went out for a nice dinner!)  Anyway, SUPPORT this local business -- you'll get a better deal, too.

52.description: Gorgeous furniture, v. unusual. Well made, sturdy - really unusual, creative pieces here.

50.description: Lots of the standard, practical furniture pieces most people need at least a few of (yeah, I'd love to fill my place with Eames and Nelson, but I've got two college educations to fund) but lots of unique stuff.If you want something funky and modern but of decent quality, this is a destination store.  I fell in love with the chair/bench made from a gathered bundle of vertical wood.  Now that you know I'm not a furniture or architecture critic, check out the photo I uploaded - yelp.com/biz_photos/O4Xq….  This chair was incredibly comfortable and designed like nothing I've ever seen.Prices are fantastic!

4.description: We have had our Rowe sectional from Cassona for almost a month, and are very happy with it.  It seems like the reviewers here, on the whole, have already nailed it: Angel and company are terrific. They're experts, and they really try to make you an expert, so that you can make informed decisions. I walked out of Cassona really feeling like we made a sound, informed decision, and I cannot say that about a lot of places. A truly rare, pleasant and ultimately rewarding experience.

6.description: I'll preface this review by saying this was among the last stops we went to when looking for a couch.  We tried everything from large chains to other small boutiques and everything in the middle.  John Zotti is by far the most helpful sales associate I have ever met in the history of my furniture buying life.  He went into specifics about the quality of each different manufacturer without being asked and possessed a level of knowledge that others did not come close to as well as informing us of what to look for if we were to buy elsewhere.  The store carries manufacturers that you can find in other local stores (Younger, Rowe, etc.), but the prices are comparable and the customer service is second to none.  If you want to find a great sofa and receive a free education on what to look for - go here and ask for John, you will not be disappointed!

22.description: You really get what you pay for in terms of quality here. My husband and I were able to find a quite affordable dining set here BUT it has not held up well at all. Just a bit more than a year later, two of the chairs are broken and the cheap finish on all of them has come off. They're also a non-standard size, so your typical dining chair covers don't work for them! Another issue we had with Cassona is that the merchandise was NOT delivered when promised. We ended up waiting for three months and were then delivered a dining table with warped wood on top. Another eight weeks later, we got the crappy set we'll soon have to trade in.Yes, the people who work here are nice, but why shouldn't they be? There are a lot of nice people in the world and being nice at what you do simply isn't the same at being good at what you do. Also, they are not so nice when you're calling to see where your furniture is or what can be done about the shoddy merchandise that's been delivered.

15.description: As my sister-in-law (and fellow Yelper, Elizabeth W.) said when she saw my Fiancée's and my condo for the first time, "Ahh, to be gay and fabulous...!"Well, I owe Cassona a thank you for the fabulous part!Having a partner who is a director of interior architecture makes picking out decor or furniture extra difficult.  While I love modernity, I also value comfort.  Decorating our new condo was not going to be an easy task.After chatting my favorite Yelper, Nicole V., we visited Cassona to look at their furniture pieces.We worked with Cassona's awesome duo, Angel and Jon, in selecting, personalizing, and purchasing a sofa.Our gorgeous klein sofa sectional was made of a tough and edgy, yet soft fabric, had an extra wide chaise perfect for naps or cuddling, and a possessed a modern look while still providing back support and having various pillows.  After our couch was delivered, we returned to Cassona to check out a bed frame we had seen.  Sure enough, we fell in love.  Our king sized bed frame was hand-crafted and stained by the talented Canadian manufacturer, Huppe.  We chose the Silk design due to its natural walnut material, and the headboard with five joint sections (or reveals) which peek through to the wall behind.  We felt obligated to also purchase two nightstands ("his" and "hers," if you will) which attach to the bed frame and float above the floor giving the entire piece a 'feng shui' feeling of warmth and relaxation.Cassona kept us up to date with when our furniture would arrive to their store and when it would be delivered to our condo.  The delivery guys were quick in setting up the pieces, cleaning up, and describing any details about the pieces (i.e. how to separate and combine the different sections of the sofa).Best of all, other than what has already been stated, they LOVE Yelpers.  I saved 10% off my entire purchase (trust me, it added up) simply by checking in to the store on the Yelp app.  I'm all about a good deal!  If you're looking for beautifully crafted, creative furniture pieces, be sure to visit Cassona.

20.description: Angel and his staff  are the best!!!  Courteous, competent, patient service, delivery as promised.  Merchandise is varied, fairly priced, and high quality.  I bought a sofa with which I am very happy.  Keep up the good work in Andersonville guys!!!

36.description: I recently bought a lovely set of dining room chairs that I had my eye on for ages.  The wait was worth it as the chairs are lovely and very comfortable. The staff, especially Angel, was very friendly and helpful and even assisted with putting a few of the chairs together when I was having trouble.  Well priced and unique furniture, great location and superb staff!

14.description: I just received my couches today . The customer service is good in the store not so great by phone . My order took a lot to be delivered . The quality it's average  to be honest I was expecting better quality. I will update my review once I get more use of my couch .

58.description: I didn't expect to find such a gritty dive in Andersonville.  After a nice dinner, we decided to find someplace nearby to shoot a game of pool and wandered into Farraguts. The bar itself was unremarkable but the clientele was slightly less trendy / affluent than you typically find in Andersonville. It seems like a place where people go to just drink and not worry about being part of any "scene". The drinks were cheap and we got seats down at the end of the bar by the pool table. The atmosphere was relaxed and we starting trading games with some of the other bar patrons. Everyone seemed friendly and we had a good time. There was one kind of seedy couple... both in their mid to late 50s... he had about 3 teeth and she was so drunk she could hardly stay on her stool. But no one seemed too put out by having to deal with them. I've been back once since and it was pretty much the same. Would I go back a third time? Maybe if nothing else was going on, but not a 'destination' bar.

56.description: Great bar, with very cheap pitchers (Leine's for $8? Awesome!) Great place to people watch, and although the jukebox is heavy on "greatest hits" it is only $1 for five plays! The awesome pictures on the wall show the bar in the 60s, when it was called the Andersonville Inn (which, I think is a much better name than the current one). Also, a great picture of Wrigley from the corner of Addison & Sheffield taken in 1915. One star, however, is taken off for the ubiqitous advertising.

29.description: This place used to scare me. But that's because we're fearful of the unknown. I didn't get it. But now I do.Farragut's is a neighborhood bar. It doesn't pretend to be anything else. Pool table, modern jukebox that'll gladly take that dollar off your hand for a song or two (if you're lucky), bartenders that aren't afraid to step out for a smoke, watch t.v. or play a game of darts (I mean that without sarcasm...I think it's perfectly cool since I always get my drink), and a few t.v.'s playing mostly sports.$4 for a tall vodka soda, light on the soda. Yes please and thank you. A friend of mine commented that one of the bartenders splits his pitcher up into pints, which he found pretty peachy.Quarters are plentiful and the crowd isn't so bad...

42.description: I've spent some excellent evenings at Farragut's.  Don't miss Tuesdays for $2.50 pints--decent beer on tap.  The juke box could be more interesting, but that's about the most critical comment I could manage.

23.description: Farragut's is cash only--be aware before you step in-- but the drink specials are the best you'll find in the area, and the bartenders are friendly and chatty. It's everything a neighborhood bar should be, minus the ability to take credit cards.If you don't mind paying the ATM fee, it's great place grab a beer and shoot some pool.

47.description: Shhhh...don't tell Simon's.  I've been here a few times since I wrote my initial review.  Heavenly $2.50 pints.I'm sneaking out the back door.  You never saw me.

8.description: Rude patrons and just as rude of a bartender.  Glogg sucks.  It's in a glass a little bigger than a thimble.  Don't bother coming-this place is not worth the trouble.Hold out for Simon's when it's not busy.  We asked for popcorn and she said, "I'm making it.  Then she said, "Here, I'm not bringing it to your table."  Who asked you???  Tip???- NOT!

31.description: Farraguts is a Tuesday night only for me.It's not the Tuesday night $2.50 pints deal (more like steal) that they have. It's not the pool table or juke box, or the small tv's (seriously not the jukebox, it's filled with nothing but pop crap). It's not that the windows open and you can watch the A-ville crowd stroll by (though that is nice, the place needs some fresh air).It's not the sometimes lazy bartender's who take forever to get your drink or the weirdo regulars that like to stare.I go to Farraguts on Tuesday because Mama K asks me to... and of course to see all the other pretty yelp faces.

34.description: A great, solid bar in Andersonville.  I've only been on Tuesdays for the $2.50 pints.  ANYTHING on tap.  That includes local brews too!  It's about the cheap beer here.  There's some dingy TVS, one pool table, and a so-so jukebox.  But it doesn't matter.  Because you can't get a pint of Metropolitan for $2.50 most places.  I'm coming in on a Monday soon for a $6 Leinie pitcher (or two).  Nice job Farraguts!  Thanks for the affordable brew and friendly service!

16.description: This is a great neighborhood establishment that sadly I do not frequent as much as I should.  Never had an issue and their beer specials are always dynamite!!Ever year for Midsomarfest this is our first stop to grab a beer and kick off the summer.  We will be there again this year.

13.description: Casual, friendly, good beer selection. lts not a destination, but I expect it's a favorite if you are local.

11.description: I called Farragut's a few minutes ago to see if they will be showing American Horror Story tonight.  The bartender said "are you f@cking kidding me?"  Thanks, Farragut's!

39.description: Full disclosure: I've never been here sober. Therefore, my fond memories may be a bit biased, but Farragut's has always been a good time.  It is definitely a "dive bar" but the pool table and juke box can provide hours of drunken entertainment.  Also a huge plus - they have one of those computers with Photo Hunt!  Love that game!  Not a place to go for a special night out, but there is cheap beer and fun games so it's a-ok in my book!

37.description: Checked out Farragut's the other night. It is a hop skip and a jump from my house, and given my bad experience at Hopleaf (review forthcoming) I was hoping for a nice relaxing night and this is the place for that. No pretension, no fancy decor, just nice chilled out staff with customers to match.Their beer selection is somewhat lacking compared to others around the neighborhood, but I found a few I liked well enough. Played some pool, met some nice people and had a great time.

0.description: Started yesterday at Bongo Room, moved on to Hopleaf for some good brews, then rolled into Farraguts with 10 people as some in the party wanted to check out the Masters.  Not one complaint.  -$5 Alpha Kings and $2 Miller Lites?  Yes please.-Free pool?  OK.-Free popcorn?  I'll take it.-Dog friendly?  Alright.  I like dogs but don't have one of my own to enjoy, but luckily one of the regs had me watch her pooch, Marvin, while she shot some pool.  Shout out to Marvin for being the chillest dog ever.-Monica was exceptionally nice, kept everyone in the party happy.  I don't get up this way often, but when I do I'll be stopping in to Farraguts.

38.description: I have to say I really enjoy this bar, it is never too crowded, the prices are great and the lady who is usually bartending (possibly the owner?) is friendly, fun, and pours a mean drink. The crowd is generally mixed but definitely resembles the neighborhood. Better to end a night here than to begin it but hey that totally works for me as it's only a block from my apartment. The only complaint I have is the jukebox doesn't always seem to work right and I have definitely had it eat some of money, and if people aren't paying there is no music which can be ackward.

51.description: Tina G. hit the nail on the head. This place is one of my favorite bars, but I think you really do have to be a "regular" to reap the benefits. And yes, Steve is great.Anecdote time: Once my girlfriend and I were sitting at the bar with friends, and a professional drinker (ok, wetbrain) sat down next to us. He nursed a beer for an hour or so and then started harassing my friend for a cigarette (a no-go), then a light (ditto), and then bus fare, which my friend (a little naively) gave him. A few minutes later he asked for and was declined more money at which point he started yelling. Steve appeared right away and told the guy to get out and followed him to the door until he did.

27.description: So the $2.50 pint deal is indeed impressive. The only problem is that I'm not really a beer drinker and there aren't really specials on other drinks. If you are a beer drinker though this is the place for you. A decent selection and pints for $2.50, what more could you want? More often that not when I'm here I just end up having diet coke or some sort of soft drink. They're cheap and the bartender is happy to give you refills. The service is always friendly which is a plus. Sometimes when bartenders discover you're not really drinking they don't pay much attention to you but not here, they're nice.The space is nice and I love that they have coat hangers on the wall. In the winter this comes in very handy since no one really wants to sit in a bar with all of their winter stuff on. I also hate finding a place for everyone to pile their coats, etc. In fact as I write this I'm liking the coat hangers even more.  More bars should have coat hangers on the wall!In terms of tables and chairs the stuff is pretty old and not in the best condition. Personally, I don't mind this and I feel it give the place some charm. But I'm not really a classy person so you may not share that opinion.  You'll have to go to Farraguts and see if you like it for yourself.

32.description: This is a great neighborhood establishment that sadly I do not frequent as much as I should.  Never had an issue and their beer specials are always dynamite!!Ever year for Midsomarfest this is our first stop to grab a beer and kick off the summer.  We will be there again this year.

54.description: Three and a half years ago I moved to Chicago. I was hanging out in Andersonville on Clark St. exploring the neighborhood. The first bar my roommate and I ended up at had us leaving angry after being ignored by a bartender, even though the bar was half empty. We headed about five doors North and wandered into Farraguts. We had been there once before, but didn't really have an opinion one way or another. The bartender was great with us. We got served right away and the drinks were cheap, cheap, cheap. Now, three years later I can say Farraguts is a great establishment, and my favorite bar in Chicago. The people are friendly, the beer is cold, and the mixed drinks are strong. If anyone is looking for a place to kick back with a few friends, I would highly recommend this spot.

48.description: An Englishman, a Spaniard, a German, and an Irishman walk into a bar. The bartender pulls pints for everyone, and the Englishman raises his glass and shouts, "Cheers!" The Spaniard nods and yells, "Salud!" The German laughs and screams, "Prost!"The Irishman asks, "Are we gonna talk or are we gonna drink?"That's Farragut's. It's for drinking.

44.description: Tuesdays = $2.50 pints of Alpha King.  What else do you need to know?

24.description: love it here! always a good pour... always decent specials....the staff is friendly and attentive.... and there's enough tv's for everybody to kinda watch what they want.

7.description: I come to Farraguts at least 3 times a week. The bartenders are so friendly and have really made my move to Andersonville that much better! It is quiet during the day but come late afternoon the jukebox is always playing. They have 2 TV's, a dart board and a pool table. The drink specials are on point every day of the week! My favorite bar in Andersonville!

49.description: $2.50 Pints of Stella Artois (or anything else on draught) on Tuesdays.  Nuff said.

40.description: After  the wedding at Reza's we knew we would go out in Andersonville, but had no definite plans.  People suggested Hopleaf, and I love Simon's but both were quite full when we arrived at 9 or so, so we headed to Farraguts, which ended up being a great choice.  They had a bunch of crowd-pleasing beers on tap, a jukebox of fun/ironic tunes at the ready, and there was plenty of space for the wedding party to socialize and drink until about midnight, when I was so tired I thought I would fall over. Bonuses:  easy to hail a cab afterward and plenty of space outside to throw your bouquet into a crowd of girls that don't want to get married.  Also, the big windows open on a warm summer night means you can still talk to/see your smoker friends outside.

53.description: Nice, old-school place in Andersonville - not too trendy, reasonably priced, comfortable. Great if you are in this 'hood.

30.description: Love $2.50 pints on Tuesdays! Internet jukebox, pool table, usually not too crowded. On nice nights they open the front window/doors so you can talk to smoking friends without really smelling the smoke. One of the first bars I went to in Chicago and am now a frequent patron.

46.description: the guti like it for getting drunk and playing pool.good specials and free food during bears games.dont expect special treatment bitches

1.description: I didn't actually drink at this bar, so I can't say anything of the service, but I had a good experience with the bar itself. It was just generally comfortable.
