The front doors were left open and we smoked on the street while keeping an eye on our stuff at an indoor table. As last call approached staff was nice about letting us know we needed to close tabs/dip out. Very chill place.

55.description: This is a pretty good bar.  I only went in because two of my more regular haunts were too packed.  The beer is cheap and there is a good selection.  The PBR I got was flat so I stuck to Alpha King the rest of the night.  I would say the biggest draw would be the juke box.  For five dollars me and my friends took it over for the entire time we were there.

9.description: Nice no frills and low key bar as others mentioned, with $2.50 pint specials on Tuesdays. Even the Three Floyds(Alpha King btw) on tap was $2.50 that night, which I was definitely not expecting! Good stuff, and I should've asked if this bar is BYO food. I'd assume the bartenders would allow you to bring in food, from the looks of other tables when I was here not long ago.Cash only, as well.

26.description: Most of the same comments as others...great $2.50 draft special on Tuesday (including quality beers like Bell's Two Hearted Ale & Ranger IPA), darts, laid-back atmosphere, etc.  The primary reason for my review is in response to the gentleman who criticized the jukebox as just a bunch of pop crap.  If you do not navigate away from the Top 40 tab, that is an accurate statement.  However, by using the search feature, you can find pretty much anything you are looking for.  I have found few jukeboxes where I can create a playlist of Rx Bandits, Aesop Rock, Souls of Mischief, and Waylon Jennings.  Granted, I typically end up spending enough on the jukebox that the beer special is essentially negated, but that is my fault, not Farraguts'.  Definitely give this place a try.

25.description: This area has a lot of charm, unfortunately Farraguts does not. It is very small and seating is a premium. The "bartender" is hard to find because she's often smoking out front with her euro-trash comrades. And best of all they do not accept debit or credit cards, but fail to mention this until after you order. There are plenty of great little bars up and down Clark, do yourself a favor and go to one of those.

12.description: Eh; it's an alright place.Where else can you go for an unpretencious drink at a decent price and yet have to wait as long as you might at a bustling downtown bar.Here.Other details.  A narrow pool table.  A jukebox.  & malort.  However, it's not as easy to con someone into doing a shot of one with you.

59.description: Ok, this three-starred review needs some explanation--as all do, I suppose. John M. and I went to Farraguts for some drinks and billiards one night. There's nothing I appreciate more than free pool, and on the contrary, there's nothing more irritating than paying upwards of $1.50 for a game. But, I digress. So, we played a couple games with Jesus (message me for pictures) and then wanted to leave. Well, being the huge Bears fan and fairly tipsy person that I was, I attempted to get the five-finger discount on the cool Bears pint glass I drank out of that night.As John and I made our getaway and got about halfway down the street, the Farraguts bartender swung the door open, yelled something, and demanded we walk the pint glass back to the bar. Needless to say it was humiliating.Probably a 4 or 5 star establishment. But I'm never showing up there again. At least, not until they hire a new bartender.

21.description: Very friendly neighborhood bar. Decent service though the beer selection was lacking. Can't complain much about that though given the $2.50 pints. Will be back.

17.description: So the $2.50 pint deal is indeed impressive. The only problem is that I'm not really a beer drinker and there aren't really specials on other drinks. If you are a beer drinker though this is the place for you. A decent selection and pints for $2.50, what more could you want? More often that not when I'm here I just end up having diet coke or some sort of soft drink. They're cheap and the bartender is happy to give you refills. The service is always friendly which is a plus. Sometimes when bartenders discover you're not really drinking they don't pay much attention to you but not here, they're nice.The space is nice and I love that they have coat hangers on the wall. In the winter this comes in very handy since no one really wants to sit in a bar with all of their winter stuff on. I also hate finding a place for everyone to pile their coats, etc. In fact as I write this I'm liking the coat hangers even more.  More bars should have coat hangers on the wall!In terms of tables and chairs the stuff is pretty old and not in the best condition. Personally, I don't mind this and I feel it give the place some charm. But I'm not really a classy person so you may not share that opinion.  You'll have to go to Farraguts and see if you like it for yourself.

10.description: I was vacationing in Chicago and staying with my friend in Andersonville. On my first night there I  was hanging out with a few new friends I made at another bar in the neighborhood, and they brought me to Farraguts. This bar is definitely a dive bar and full of regulars. The bartenders Steve, Brian and Monica were all super nice and talkative, It's nice when you are there alone and trying meet new people. Steve made me try the delicious stuff called Malort (sarcasm).The bar has decently priced drinks, a pool table and a dart board. Music is played from a jut box If your in the neighborhood stop by and tell them you want to try Malort and that Trish from LA sent you. They have specials on beer on Tuesdays $2.50 pints. Definitely was glad I was taken there I ended up going back every most of my nights while on vacation cause it was near.

5.description: No frills, no credit cards, no scary tab at the end of the night.I like Farraguts for what it is - a divey neighborhood joint where you can get a $3 beer, play a game of pool and watch the patrons of Clark St. stroll by.

3.description: Chill bar to grab a drink. Nothing fancy here. Cash only so bring some greens. ATM in the back. Pool table, dart board, and jukebox for entertainment with flats screen tvs. Great specials. Full bar with good variation on tap. Prices are good.

35.description: Simple pub with open front windows and great specials in a wonderful neighborhood. What else do you need?

19.description: Farragut's is cash only--be aware before you step in-- but the drink specials are the best you'll find in the area, and the bartenders are friendly and chatty. It's everything a neighborhood bar should be, minus the ability to take credit cards.If you don't mind paying the ATM fee, it's great place grab a beer and shoot some pool.

28.description: I've been frequenting this place frequently of late. $2.50 pints of Stella fit my mini budget, and they let you BYO food. Nice bartender too, and the tables up front cannot be beat, especially when filled with my friends! Yeah, you know who you are!

45.description: Perhaps the cleanest bar I have ever been in. I was there on a Monday night and the bar tender dusted all the booze bottles on the back bar, then cleaned the back bar mirror. Of course it was a slow night but she was always ready to refill my drink.  It gets crowded on weekend nights but so far not as crowded as Simon's. It use to be my fall back bar when Simon's was too packed but I find myself going here first more often than not. Full big windows open up on to Clark, great for watching the crowd strolling by or for the crowd to see you getting your noon beer buzz  on. My only concern is once they gave me a lemon instead of a lime for my gin and tonic. Maybe they were thinking of a gin rickey, but that is not a deal breaker and easily fixed. Plus any bar named after Admiral "Damn the torpedos full speed ahead" Farragut is okay in my books.

33.description: Helllllooooo new favorite!I had my first run-in with Farragut's yesterday as one of my favorite Yelpers was kind enough to set up an event to get people together!  I honestly didn't know what to expect.  I had walked by the bar a couple of times and never really paid much attention to it , but boy was I surprised.First off, it is a smaller bar - with a few tables in the front, a decently long bar and a pool table.  It has great old black and white photos on the wall from way back in the day of the Andersonville area.  I love pictures like that.  The bartender that was there was extremely nice and quick with the service.  The best part about it?  They have great beer specials, especially when you can have ANY,and I mean ANY draft you want for a TWO FIFTY!  That's only 50 cents more then TWO DOLLARS!  Well worth it people - especially since they have some great local craft beers on Tap.  Metropolitan Brew and some Alpha King - you can't go wrong!  They also have other favorites too - but come on, for this price on a Tuesday, you really can't go wrong.Hats off to the owners of this fine establishment.  They do it right!

43.description: Nice neighborhood bar.Pool Table- check.Good Bourbon-CheckWeathered faced bartendress-checkDarkness for snuggling-checkLocal color-check.Old school enough to be on my "yea" bar list? You betcha.

2.description: Side note: Anna is also the coolest! I could not ask for a better neighborhood bar...Monica and Anna are queens! Kepp them always.

18.description: Farragut's hosted our team for darts. It's not the best set-up for this. It seemed like a pleasant enough space and crowd for cocktail.

41.description: I have walked by this place a million times, and maybe because of it's proximity to all of the snobbish bastards at nearby Cheetah gym, I have stayed away. Well isn't that what St. Patrick's day weekend is for?  The lowering of inhibition, the expansion of boundaries? I came to Farraguts this past Saturday, as a way to begin the wind down of a busy St. Patrick's day.  In a related story, never, ever try and ride the Clark bus (22) north through Wrigleyville during St. Patrick's day.  Kelly green d-bag parade folks.  Don't do it.  A cab driver almost beat up our bus driver, not pretty.  Actually got out of his cab, as his frat-boy customers, crammed in the cab like sardines, looked on nervously.   Anyway, Farraguts was great, a small bar, complete with a full selection of adult beverages at reasonable prices.  A pool table crammed along the bar, love this.  I can definitely see myself capping a long night off here, rolling those little lacquered balls around that worn green felt.The atmosphere is a little dreary because of the lighting, but the place is really well kept up it would seem.  The bartender is all business, but not to the point of snobbery.  A short, dark, sleek woman, whose thick-framed glasses seem worn in earnest.  I watched a few times as she deemed the bar traffic minimal enough to grab a smoke.  It was one of those cigarettes that was so skinny, you thought it was about to disappear into the fabric of space and time.  Poof.  Virginia slims, is that what those are called?  Cheap beer (they actually have pitchers).  Good specials.  Not wrigleyville.  Four stars Farraguts, for not bein' a pretender.

52.description: After my first experience at farraguts last night, i will absolutely never be going back. the barrage of rudeness i encountered from the staff after being in the bar for less than five minutes was absolutely unbelievable. basically, i am going to echo julia a's comments. walked in with a group, one person in our party got a drink almost immediately, another in our group waited at an almost empty bar for at least 5 minutes without being served. upon returning to our table empty handed. the blond hag from behind the bar approached us demanding to see our ids. she snatched the ids from the two boys in the group and determined them to be legit. i handed her my wallet with the id in the see-thru window. she threw it back at me and harshly told me "take it out! i can't see it." i took it out and handed it to her, at which point she gave me a sneer and asked "is this you?!?" of course its me, bitch... i took the picture less than a month ago. needless to say. i did not, and will never spend any money in this bar.

50.description: This is my neighborhood tap, if you will. It's got a hell of a juke box (and not one of those new-fangled mp3 jukebox piece-o-craps either) , decent amount of beer on tap that is reasonably priced, and best of all - it lacks the pretentious hipster-ism of Simons! It also makes for a great place to drink in the summer as the windows can be fully opened. No food here, but that's not why you go to Farraguts. You go to drink.

4.description: Having never been here before, a friend and I were walking around when we decided to check it out. As soon as I realized that Farraguts serves Leffe I was in heaven. The bartenders were super nice, even if one of them did tease me about my post-Malört shot face.

6.description: Awesome down-to-earth bar to grab a decent draft! The bartender usually keeps the jukebox stocked with great music, ranging from classic/90's rock to punk. There's a pool table and a couple tables right by the open windows facing Clark street for some great people-watching and a nice breeze on cool nights.Definitely a perfect spot to chill and knock a few back with friends when you find yourself in A-Ville, especially when you don't want to deal with the crowds at Acre or Hopleaf.

22.description: A nice bar in the heart of Andersonville. Nothing too special as they have some good beers on tap.

15.description: They have a decent selection of beer on tap, but the real key to this place comes when you speak out loud the magic word..."MALORT"After trying to slyly convince my unsuspecting friend to give it a try, the bar tender slid on over and helped in my endeavor by trying to talk to said friend into it.Too bad though, since my friend was driving home and wanted to be responsible.I'm not sure if I should add a star for the bartender going along with my joke, or if I should take one away for him going along with my joke.Three stars in my book means this is a worthwhile place to spend some time!

57.description: Good beer selection.  Pool table.  Nice people hanging out.  A good place for a during the week drink.  May I suggest the $2.50 beers on tap Tuesday?  Blue Moon, Stella, 3 Floyd's, Guinness, etc,  Cannot go wrong, ya drunk.  Open air in the warm months, as well.

20.description: They have a decent selection of beer on tap, but the real key to this place comes when you speak out loud the magic word..."MALORT"After trying to slyly convince my unsuspecting friend to give it a try, the bar tender slid on over and helped in my endeavor by trying to talk to said friend into it.Too bad though, since my friend was driving home and wanted to be responsible.I'm not sure if I should add a star for the bartender going along with my joke, or if I should take one away for him going along with my joke.Three stars in my book means this is a worthwhile place to spend some time!

36.description: I thought this place would have way better reviews. What's with all the hateration?I happened to stop by on a Tuesday for $2.50 pint night, which is an awesome deal that includes every single beer they have on tap. The jukebox was fun to toy around with, and the pool table was in use all night. Bartender was extremely friendly. It never got crowded; we were two of maybe ten people in there all night. All in all, an excellent neighborhood bar.

14.description: Just had to update my review, they have Gumballhead in bottles ,cheers

58.description: Meh. We have made the tour of the pie palaces in the city, and had to try First Slice to see how it would compare.  If you really want good, delicious, sink your teeth into pie, this is not it. We had the Traditional Apple and the Michigan Sour Cherry.  While nice, the crust was thin and the fillings while good, were not outstanding. No offerTo warm up the apple pie. Cherry filling did have a pit, so it must be made fresh. Nice service and draws a crowd - but not fulfilling.

56.description: I love this little cafe!They have really great sandwiches, salads, & quiche. They are essentially a pie shop with lunch. I'm not a fan of pie, so I haven't tried their pies yet. All of their sandwiches come with a side salad & potato chips. I love the salad, it's dimple mixed greens with chunks if apple & a simple but flavorful vinaigrette.

29.description: I'll preface this review with the fact that I prefer a lighter flavor profile, and this extends to desserts as well--I tend to like less sweet desserts or desserts where the sweet is well balanced with bitter or sour flavors. I got two slices of pie--one, the famous Michigan cherry, and the other, the raspberry balsamic with pear. I thought both of them were far too sweet; so much in fact, that I couldn't have more than one tiny bite of each without breaking up the sweetness with coffee. I was expecting both to have a bit of a tang and was especially disappointed to find that the raspberry balsamic/pear pie came off as a raspberry only pie. I was also pretty disappointed with the crust; perhaps I had let it sit for too long since I had it to-go, but the crust was on the thin side and lacked the buttery flakiness that's typical at other pie shops. Quite disappointed--friendly service and cute shop, but just way too much sugar in the pies for me.

42.description: Wow the blueberry cheesecake pie is to die for and it is now one of my favorite pies of all time. This little shop is jewel in our neighborhood and I can't wait to return to try more of their delicious pies. I would definitely recommend them to all my friends and family.  I love their pies!!!

23.description: We definitely will be coming back. After a so so dinner experience at Hamburger Mary's around the corner we popped in for some pie to apologize to our appetites. We were rewarded! Everything looked good, the staff was friendly and helpful and, importantly, the pies were delicious. I tried a slice of the balsamic raspberry pear pie (warmed up a bit). The sweetness and tartness were well balanced and the crust was perfect. He tried the coffee toffee pie and oh it was so rich and good. If my slice didn't have me so lost in my own sweet comfort food fantasy world I would have kept "sampling" his too. The cafe options sounded promising though we didn't try them. Great little neighborhood treat.

47.description: Must have: French silkFirst Slice is fantastic.  In addition to having great pie choices, they also have a large sandwich and coffee shop menu if you were stopping in for a meal. They space is light and airy and has wifi, but is too popular and small to use as a coffee shop to work in.Each pie slice is $3.50 (full pies are available for takeout and range from $20-$25) and rich enough to split and be satisfied. Why would you want to split a piece of Fresh Slice pie though?? So I got to sample two between the Bf and I. The French Silk was fantastic! And I am not even a huge chocolate person! It had a slim crust and ample chocolate filling and cream topping. The filling was not a generic chocolate taste, but had the richness and depth of a good dark chocolate. The French Silk is a blue ribbon pie if there was one.I also had the chocolate peanut butter pie. Mounds if creamy peanut butter nested in a chocolate cracker crust. So rich, you need to accompany it with some milk or coffee to break up the peanut butter.Both pies were fantastic, but I would have loved a little more crust to filling ratio. That's a personal thang though, because  I think the crust is the best part.

8.description: Stopped in on a whim for dessert after dinner at another restaurant and was very pleasantly surprised with the raspberry pear balsamic pie which I would highly recommend.

31.description: This pie is always homemade with the freshest ingredients. I can't go to Chicago without stopping in for a slice!! If you go on Pie Day; the line is out the door and around the corner!

34.description: Still a three as I'm eating. The chili was cold. And the hostess slash front man didn't know the ingredients of the food. Whether it had dairy or not. The ingredients aren't posted so you can choose what not to eat. The cook was Spanish and the communication was not that great. I give it an mmmm

16.description: Delicious! I ordered a raspberry pie, a balsamic pear pie, apple pie and French silk and all of them where incredible. The French silk pie is probably the best I've ever had, and I'd highly recommend the balsamic pear as well! Just a heads up though, the apple pie top & crust wasn't as good the next day.

13.description: I'll preface this review with the fact that I prefer a lighter flavor profile, and this extends to desserts as well--I tend to like less sweet desserts or desserts where the sweet is well balanced with bitter or sour flavors. I got two slices of pie--one, the famous Michigan cherry, and the other, the raspberry balsamic with pear. I thought both of them were far too sweet; so much in fact, that I couldn't have more than one tiny bite of each without breaking up the sweetness with coffee. I was expecting both to have a bit of a tang and was especially disappointed to find that the raspberry balsamic/pear pie came off as a raspberry only pie. I was also pretty disappointed with the crust; perhaps I had let it sit for too long since I had it to-go, but the crust was on the thin side and lacked the buttery flakiness that's typical at other pie shops. Quite disappointed--friendly service and cute shop, but just way too much sugar in the pies for me.

11.description: Maybe I frequent more cozy cafes, but I like going to ones with comfy couches, a warm atmosphere, decor, etc. First Slice still felt nice. It's on the smaller size, but it gets pretty decent traffic of people coming in and out, and people sitting and working. My boyfriend and I really enjoy coming to Andersonville and decided to come here after dinner to grab some dessert and to read before heading home. I got the chocolate, raspberry cheesecake and he got the apple pie- both were so good. I especially liked the cheesecake because it tasted light and had the perfect amount of sweetness.

39.description: This place was incredible. The service was awesome and the food was incredible! The pie reminded me of my grandmas homemade pie! The goat cheese and pear sandwich was super tasty as well. They were out of the pie I wanted and offered me a free slice next time they have it! I would recommend this to anyone for many different occasions! You have to go!

37.description: This place is great for stopping by and taking some time to relax in the neighborhood. The cherry pie, cherry balsamic pear pie, and the coffee toffee are all delicious! The espresso was pretty good as well.

0.description: 3 words: PEANUT BUTTER PIE!This is hands down one of the best pies I have ever had.  I especially like that I cab buy a "mini" pie version for a very reasonable price.  I have tried a few other kinds of their pies, and wasn't a fan...but this little slice of heaven always keeps me coming back!

38.description: Ordered two pies from here (both were mini in size) but great for sharing among a couple of people. We tried the key lime and chocolate cream and both were great! This location is in harder to find location but I would come back in a heartbeat when I need my next pie fix.

51.description: christ on a cracker, i love this place. the staff are awesome and friendly.they offer mini pies and that are only 6 dollars.their slices are also relatively cheap and well made. they constantly have amazing selections and are pretty unique. i love, love, love this place. this is my go-to dessert place when i'm in andersonville!

27.description: Excellent pie selections, some are a little quirky in just the right way. Food options look good, it's a pretty quiet place and a bit small, so it might be fun to work out of here on a lazy afternoon. Guy behind the counter was a little standoffish, but not rude, so whatever.

32.description: Absolutely amazing apple pie, blueberry cheesecake pie, raspberry chocolate pie, pecan pie, and key lime pie. Their cookies are also pretty good. Coffee is fresh, staff is SUPER nice and friendly. We love coming here for a quick and tasty dessert paired with a cup of coffee and taking it all on a stroll around Andersonville! Come here- you'll truly enjoy it!

54.description: First Slice is an awesome little cafe over in Andersonville that specializes in about a dozen or so different kinds of pies and standard coffee shop fare you can find practically anywhere (salads, grain salads, coffee, tea, etc.)  It doesn't have the most ostentatious sign or advertising out front, but it is SO worth the visit every time.The staff are extremely friendly, the ambiance is very chill and it's just so lighthearted.  There's no pretentiousness to be found within any inch of the shop and the pies they serve are made correctly and deliciously.  I tried a slice of the coffee toffee pie and the flavor of both the caramel-y toffee and medium-roast (arguably slightly burned) coffee creams were outstanding, especially when eaten together with the chocolate cookie crust.  It never got loud the entire day I spent working there, and the only time it really got somewhat busy was during the lunch hour.  That said though, there were no interruptions in sight and I was able to work the day away with ease.  I would happily eat here again and even spend the day here again.  It's warm, friendly, comfortable, and no one tries to get in anyone's way.  Pair that with a lusciously thick slice of pie and that'll put a smile on anyone's face!

48.description: it's a damn good pie shop that happens to donate its profits to feed the hungry and the homeless. But don't come here for just for the charity. Come here for the French silk pie. Even Martha Stewart said it is one of the best in the US.

44.description: One of my favorite spots for lunch. Depending on the time of day, it can be a little cramped for seating - particularly around 3pm when the hoards of Andersonville parents bring their children here for an afternoon snack and let the kiddos run wild. This is not the kind of place that you should let your kids do that, FYI. I always find myself ordering the same thing here. Cappuccino with almond milk, Michigan cherry pie, and a tuna salad sandwich. The sandwich comes with chips and a delicious salad with sliced apple and some kind of vinaigrette. Most of their sandwiches are around $7 and are very filling. For all that comes with it, I think it's a great value. They also have some charitable meal subscription services that help provide meals to local families in need.

24.description: My friends and I stopped in on the last day of our road trip. Not only were the pies DELICIOUS but the quiches were a pleasant surprise! The woman working (owner?) was friendly and chatty...it seemed like a lot of locals were regulars. The brown line is just outside the door so it is a convenient first stop before a day spent in downtown chicago.

7.description: Cute place! Good pie, ok coffee, and an extensive lunch menu. Barista seemed stand-offish, but it's to be expected at local coffee shops.I got a small coffee and a "coffee-toffee" slice. Coffee was ok, and they have 50 cent refills, which is good. Coffee-toffee was a slight misnomer: it was more like a mocha-French silk pie. It seemed like the only toffee was sprinkled lightly on the top, but that was about it. That being said, it was REALLY good! The pie's consistency was thick and creamy, and the chocolate and coffee flavors were deep and delicious. Although I just got pie and coffee, their lunch options look soooo good! Curry chicken salad, Chicago vegetarian sandwich, mango jicama salad--the variety of options and flavors look great!Can't wait to come back to try more pie and some non-pie options!

49.description: Been here a few times and usually pretty good.  However most recent experience not so good.  Attaching a pic and not sure what to think.I think it's a good cause but when you pay $3.00+ for a smaller piece of pie compared to most places you really hope to get a full slice or something that resembles a slice and isn't smashed.Probably wouldn't be as much of a deal except when you order two and the don't compare.  The second one had none of the crumble on top.  Also brought to the individual serving us and the response was "eh, it does that sometimes because the way it was pulled apart.  Hope the other person enjoyed the extra pie from mine.I wonder if success is affecting their quality.

40.description: I've been here numerous times...way too many times.  Their chocolate pies are the best. Coffee Toffee, Chocolate Cream and the absolute best French Silk I've ever had.  My friend had the tart cherry and it was just ok.   All of their lunch items look great.

53.description: Oh My Gah!!! The French Silk Pie is soooooo gooooddddd!!!! It's look so French (what's French anyway) and so SILKY and so sexy!!! I had the Key Lime Pie too and it was so delicious (better than the one I had a week ago at Miami)....perfect balance between sweet and tangy!!

30.description: A poem on pie. I love pie. Pie is delicious. Come here if you like pie. The chocolate peanut butter is my favorite. Mmm girl. Fin.

46.description: Great neighborhood pie shop that also serves coffee and sandwich items. I was pleasantly surprised to find that it is also non-profit, with all proceeds going to help the homeless. The prices are reasonable, great pies, nice space and great employees.Definitely check this out and do some good for the community as well!

1.description: Great pie & coffee. Reasonably priced compared to other pie places and you get a delicious huge slice of pie. I had the french silk pie and it was delicious. Not overly sweet like most french silk pies, the chocolate was made with cocoa, you can tell by the taste. Paired it with a cafe au lait which was fresh and delicious. The staff was warm and welcoming. I will be back to try other pies!Will up it to a 5 star once I try other pies!

55.description: Oh My Pie! Got the mini pie flight: it's a mini pie made of 4 different pie flavors that you pick. I selected Michigan Sour Cherry, French Silk, Chocolate Peanut Butter, Coffee Toffee.  I absolutely love cherry pie, so I started with that one and almost melted in my chair. It was amazing. Best pie ever. It doesn't even need the sugar on top. Tied at 1st for best flavor of the four is coffee toffee. Most coffee flavored desserts are severely lacking. This pie makes up for every single lackluster coffee ice cream, coffee shake, cup of coffee, coffee flavored chocolate I've ever had...it's DELICIOUS!The French silk was good, a little frozen on the bottom. A very good combo of light/fluffy and creamy/rich. The chocolate peanut butter is great for those that like a dense pie and those that like Reese's peanut butter cup filling way more than the chocolate. Basically, it's more peanut butter than chocolate, but still good in its own right. I also got a chocolate cream pie to go. Have not tried it yet, but already salivating thinking about it. I'm going back to this place for every birthday, celebration, holiday, fake holiday, and half-birthday.

9.description: Best pie I've ever had and I don't even like pie. The crust is heavenly light, the chocolate is light, the sour cherry is amazing, not your usual cloyingly sweet, but just right. Makes you wanna go there and have pie all the time!

26.description: If I need to fulfill a salty/sweet craving?  Chocolate peanut butter pie.  Someone having a party?  Chocolate peanut butter pie.  If I feel like being nice and want to bring a treat to work?  Chocolate peanut butter pie.  In other words, the chocolate peanut butter pie is AMAZING!!  I've tried replicating this pie at home, but it doesn't even come close.  I don't know what First Slice does, but I'll just leave it to them and pay the 20-something dollars because it is totally worth it.  Everyone who has tried this also can't believe how delicious it is.  From the chocolate pie crust to the crushed peanuts on top, everything is perfection.  Other favorites of mine include the key lime and Michigan sour cherry pie.

25.description: OMGAH yes! I finally got the chance to stop by first slice pie and it was a great experience. Such a cute little boutique with yummy goodies. Upon arrival, we were greeted by an energetic cashier girl and she made sure if we needed any assistance, she was there to help. There were so many selections to choose from but we ended up getting a slice of blueberry cheesecake and chocolate peanut butter. I personally love the blueberry cheese cake pie and it was so delicious I wanted to have more. Surprisingly, the blueberry did not overpower the taste of the pie and it was amazing. It's a great cozy sweet treat shop. Pies weren't the only thing that they sold. There was many other great treats as well.

12.description: OMGAH yes! I finally got the chance to stop by first slice pie and it was a great experience. Such a cute little boutique with yummy goodies. Upon arrival, we were greeted by an energetic cashier girl and she made sure if we needed any assistance, she was there to help. There were so many selections to choose from but we ended up getting a slice of blueberry cheesecake and chocolate peanut butter. I personally love the blueberry cheese cake pie and it was so delicious I wanted to have more. Surprisingly, the blueberry did not overpower the taste of the pie and it was amazing. It's a great cozy sweet treat shop. Pies weren't the only thing that they sold. There was many other great treats as well.

59.description: Home made pies assored pastriesCoffee SoupsWrapsSandwiches  The staff nice friendlySee you soon

21.description: First and foremost, this place is such a quaint and adorable cafe. The interior is what I see on pinterest decorations. I had super high expectations in pie quality  for this place mainly because I always assume if a place specializes in one type of food then it should be way above average. Unfortunately, it wasn't the mind blowing pies I had expected. They were good pies don't get me wrong. But a bit too sweet for my taste buds and lacking that extra kick of homemade pies. Overall I would summarize this place as a cool fun place to hang out, has a good charity mission, and decent pies.

17.description: Wow the blueberry cheesecake pie is to die for and it is now one of my favorite pies of all time. This little shop is jewel in our neighborhood and I can't wait to return to try more of their delicious pies. I would definitely recommend them to all my friends and family.  I love their pies!!!

10.description: Must have: French silkFirst Slice is fantastic.  In addition to having great pie choices, they also have a large sandwich and coffee shop menu if you were stopping in for a meal. They space is light and airy and has wifi, but is too popular and small to use as a coffee shop to work in.Each pie slice is $3.50 (full pies are available for takeout and range from $20-$25) and rich enough to split and be satisfied. Why would you want to split a piece of Fresh Slice pie though?? So I got to sample two between the Bf and I. The French Silk was fantastic! And I am not even a huge chocolate person! It had a slim crust and ample chocolate filling and cream topping. The filling was not a generic chocolate taste, but had the richness and depth of a good dark chocolate. The French Silk is a blue ribbon pie if there was one.I also had the chocolate peanut butter pie. Mounds if creamy peanut butter nested in a chocolate cracker crust. So rich, you need to accompany it with some milk or coffee to break up the peanut butter.Both pies were fantastic, but I would have loved a little more crust to filling ratio. That's a personal thang though, because  I think the crust is the best part.

5.description: Bomb @ss pies.  $3.50 might be steep for a piece of pie, but haven't you paid he same for a cupcake?  I think the street price of a cupcake is $7.00 these days PIE greater than CupcakeThe French Silk makes a great late-night snack and their apple pie will conjure up thoughts of fall and the holidays anytime of year.

3.description: Charming place with good people, hence a 3 instead of a 2.Pie was ok.Tea was fine.Table was really sticky....so much so my napkins stock to the table.BangBang Pie is much much better.

35.description: Cute place! Good pie, ok coffee, and an extensive lunch menu. Barista seemed stand-offish, but it's to be expected at local coffee shops.I got a small coffee and a "coffee-toffee" slice. Coffee was ok, and they have 50 cent refills, which is good. Coffee-toffee was a slight misnomer: it was more like a mocha-French silk pie. It seemed like the only toffee was sprinkled lightly on the top, but that was about it. That being said, it was REALLY good! The pie's consistency was thick and creamy, and the chocolate and coffee flavors were deep and delicious. Although I just got pie and coffee, their lunch options look soooo good! Curry chicken salad, Chicago vegetarian sandwich, mango jicama salad--the variety of options and flavors look great!Can't wait to come back to try more pie and some non-pie options!

19.description: The peanut butter pie is sinfully good

28.description: Excellent pie, and even nicer people!  We decided against wedding cake for our wedding and instead opted for pie.  We ended up ordering four First Slice pies for our wedding (Michigan Sour Cherry, Apple, Pecan and Balsamic Raspberry Pear).  They were a HUGE hit with our guests!  I had no pie left over at the end of the night- everyone wanted to try all four, and I know many people took some home.  Sara Beth was extremely helpful in coordinating our order.  I think I emailed her three weeks before our wedding, and she immediately got us in for a tasting, set up our order and arranged for it to be delivered to our venue.  The whole thing was as easy as pie (pun intended!), and I appreciate the fact that the money I spent is helping those less fortunate.  I'm also thrilled that the Andersonville store is so close to me, so I can go buy pie for other family events, as I know it will now be requested of us often!  Thank you, First Slice, for being so awesome!

45.description: Worth the 30 minute drive! The pie was excellent! I had the raspberry chocolate cheesecake and my hubby had the traditional apple. I don't really like cheesecake but I do now! It was so light and fluffy. Apple pie was great next time getting it with ice cream. Defiantly looking forward to our next visit.

33.description: Pies are always on point, coffee is always fresh, so many different flavors to choose from and their service is great. Glad they're in the neighborhood

43.description: Visited for a second time last night. I had some family in from the suburbs for dinner and thought it would be nice to stop there for a slice of pie afterwards. We arrived at 8:30pm and by the time we were done ordering and paying it was 8:35pm. We were told that because the shop closes at 9pm we could not stay to eat the pie that we had just purchased. We hadn't planned on staying long, probably just 10 more minutes. This was very frustrating and a little embarrassing. Telling paying customers that they can't sit in the dining room shows poor customer service. I understand that you can't stay open all night but if the sign on your door states that you're open until 9pm then you should not turn away paying customers who want to eat in your dining room before that time. I won't be returning.

2.description: My husband and I stopped in at First Slice Pie Cafe after dinner one night.  My husband had some kind of fruit pie (I can't remember--maybe cherry?  That seems right).  I had the french silk pie, which is objectively the best kind of pie.The pie was really, really good.  I also had a decaf espresso with a little milk in it, which was a total highlight too.  It tasted so good next to the sweetness of the pie, and it made for a delicious dessert.  I would totally go back here!

18.description: How can you not love First Slice? Everything there is delicious from their lunch menu to of course the pie. My favorite lunch dish is the tuna salad sandwich. For real, it's the best tuna salad I have ever had in my life. I don't know why. It just is. The best pie is the chocolate cream pie. It doesn't try to be anything else; just a regular, yummy chocolate cream pie. To add to the glory they have Sprechers sodas for drinks. It's just too good to be true. If you have a hankering for pie and want to try a great neighborhood spot, go to First Slice. You'll have no regrets.

41.description: Excellent little pie shop. I've never disliked a single slice I've had. I've taken my pie to go enjoy at home and I've also had a seat outside enjoying a slice along with a cup of coffee. Both are great experiences. I'm determined to try every kind they have!

52.description: First slice pie is like a tasty tasty slice of heaven on your plate. I preordered and picked up six pies for an office party (early pi day celebration!) and couldn't be happier with the results. The folks that work there are super friendly and were helpful with all aspects of my order. The shop itself is way cute and I look forward to stopping in for a slice and some coffee on an upcoming beautiful spring day. Now, for the pies. I ordered six pies (peanut butter chocolate, apple, polka dot, key lime, French silk, and sour cherry. I of course had to try them all! Each pie was amazing and I had a hard time deciding which was my favorite. I know they are famous for their apple pie (and believe me it did not disappoint) but I think I might have loved the chocolate peanut butter the most. I am a sucker for peanut butter pies and this was one of the best I have ever had. There was a perfect balance of peanut butter and chocolate and it was clear that they use high quality ingredients -the result was out of control amazing! I obviously would recommend this ace to everyone! It is for sure my new favorite pie place in Chicago.

50.description: So...i got to First Slice, Andersonville 10 minutes before closing on a Tuesday night. At a lot of food places, it's super annoying to get customers right before closing since everyone is trying to clean up and get ready to close. but, the workers were SO SO FRIENDLY-- i didn't feel rushed at all. so thank you so much First Slice! plus, tuesdays they have a band perform- from the last 5 minutes that i caught, they were great too!oh.. and the pies (chocolate cream, coffee toffee, and French Silk) were so so so tasty, not overly sweet, perfectly creamy and crunchy and delicious. everything you would hope for in a pie.

4.description: The chocolate raspberry cheesecake will bring me back again and again. With a quaint atmosphere and cashiers who are just the right amount of snooty for working in a pie shop, I'd still probably get my pie to go. I'm intrigued by the sandwiches. But mostly the cheesecake.

6.description: There are way too many bakeries in this city that get carried away with niche pastries and "creative" new desserts that fail to do the one thing dessert is supposed to do: make you smile. First Slice does pie and they do it well! Their cherry pie is stellar. It's roll your eyes back in your head good. I only get one slice at a time because I know if I get a full pie I'll eat the whole thing in one sitting. I am not a fan of balsamic vinegar--especially in desserts--but I tried the balsamic pear pie and it was really pretty good. I probably won't get it again but I was impressed.Pie is the reason to go here but they do a few other things well. The quiche is very good. It's thickly sliced and rich the way quiche is supposed to be when you make it at home. Everything tastes like its homemade. I seriously think they might have somebody's grandma chained up in the back making pies. I've also had a ham sandwich from First Slice. It was crazy good. The cheese was rich and hearty and the ham was warm and really high quality. Go for lunch and stay for dessert! The best part is that I live so close I can go get a full picnic then bring it home to have with wine.

22.description: Came here with a friend ages ago and it is now our go to spot to catch up in this neighborhood. I really enjoyed their coconut pie and chocolate covered strawberry! You could definitely tell it was made fresh that morning. I really like this place, only drawback is that it is a bit of a walk from the train.

15.description: We definitely will be coming back. After a so so dinner experience at Hamburger Mary's around the corner we popped in for some pie to apologize to our appetites. We were rewarded! Everything looked good, the staff was friendly and helpful and, importantly, the pies were delicious. I tried a slice of the balsamic raspberry pear pie (warmed up a bit). The sweetness and tartness were well balanced and the crust was perfect. He tried the coffee toffee pie and oh it was so rich and good. If my slice didn't have me so lost in my own sweet comfort food fantasy world I would have kept "sampling" his too. The cafe options sounded promising though we didn't try them. Great little neighborhood treat.

57.description: Super cute spot.  Yummy pies.  I had the peach and blueberry.  I've also had the chocolate peanut butter pie which is out of this world.  I keep waiting for them to have the grasshopper because yum!

20.description: There are way too many bakeries in this city that get carried away with niche pastries and "creative" new desserts that fail to do the one thing dessert is supposed to do: make you smile. First Slice does pie and they do it well! Their cherry pie is stellar. It's roll your eyes back in your head good. I only get one slice at a time because I know if I get a full pie I'll eat the whole thing in one sitting. I am not a fan of balsamic vinegar--especially in desserts--but I tried the balsamic pear pie and it was really pretty good. I probably won't get it again but I was impressed.Pie is the reason to go here but they do a few other things well. The quiche is very good. It's thickly sliced and rich the way quiche is supposed to be when you make it at home. Everything tastes like its homemade. I seriously think they might have somebody's grandma chained up in the back making pies. I've also had a ham sandwich from First Slice. It was crazy good. The cheese was rich and hearty and the ham was warm and really high quality. Go for lunch and stay for dessert! The best part is that I live so close I can go get a full picnic then bring it home to have with wine.

36.description: Pies, guys! So many different pie options, by the slice and by the pie, inside a nice coffee/sandwich shop with wifi, outlets, and evening hours. This is basically the greatest thing since sliced...pie. The sandwiches are a bit pricey ($8-9) but surprisingly good (I recommend the chicken and guac) and served with a generous helping of salad and chips. I wish all coffee shops had this kind of general coffee shop goodness plus a specialization in bringing you a vast variety of some delicious dessert item, like cupcakes, donuts, deep-fried twinkies, whatever. My entire coffee shop work-life would be so much more sugary.

14.description: First Slice Pie Cafe is an adorable little shop on the corner that if you blink, you might just miss it. Thought I'd start this review with an overused cliche for all you folks out there in cyberland.  It really is a cute cafe though with many selections for pastries. Being a pie shop and all, I had a funny feeling pie was what they did best. So I took a risk and got just that.I had a slice of the Peanut Butter Chocolate pie. It was reasonably priced and looked a bit different than how I would normally imagine a pie of such a name. The crust was chocolate with an overloaded completely peanut buttery filling with a thin layer of chocolate on the top and what seemed to be crushed peanuts on top of that. It was rich and decadent...and I love peanut butter & chocolate to no end...but it was just too much peanut butter & not enough chocolate. It was good but to put it plainly I've had better. I tried my friend's after she had a bit and wanted no more. I agreed with her that it wasn't impressive. Meh.With so many pie shops in the city that blow my mind, I don't see much reason in coming back here outside of the convenience factor.

58.description: I saw Phrenzy Phucked here quite a while ago and it was possibly the single most un-funny improv show I have ever seen. Including my friend's "Intro to Improv" class showcase. The show does start late at night, and it is BYOB but seriously, there is no way that it is ever funny. The night I went the whole thing was themed around being trapped in a pizza parlor owner's house in Pakistan because his business was named the Pakistani Pizza Parlor (PPP) which is also the name of (now deceased) Benazir Bhutto's Independence Party and President Musharraf was outside with the tanks keeping him (and us) captive. Did you follow that?You'd have been the only one in the audience besides my companion and I. It was so excessively complex in an attempt to make up for the complete lack of talent in the cast.  It was PAINFUL. SO SO PAINFUL to sit though. Please take my advice, save yourself and just skip it.

56.description: I went to College Night a couple weeks ago.  At the new theatre (right in my neighborhood - I'm so happy!) Thursday at 10:30.  It was only $5 - can't beat that price!  The opening act was kinda slow, but the house teams Droppin Science and The Cosby Sweaters were great!You can totally tell it's BYOB.  Tons of college kids passing bottles around.  GET THERE EARLY because I don't know how many people were there but it looked like they ran out of chairs.  There were like 20 people sitting on the floor and standing in the back, but I think some of them were performers.  As I left they gave me a BOGO coupon for their $10 shows.  pH knows how to keep me coming back!

29.description: I went to the show sober, and was "that guy in the corner, not laughing."  Both my friend (who had imbibed before the show) and I were in agreement that this show was just not funny.I like comedy, musicals, and live theater in general.  I also prefer not to review something if I can't give it a positive review, but with these high ratings, I felt that a lot of people might be misled and expect more than they're gonna get.  "The Room" contained a bad theater hat-trick: bad writing, bad acting, and bad singing.  At the beginning, I thought we should give it a chance, because they seemed like some high school kids, trying to do something.  Cool.  It was painful, though and sometimes offensive.  Rather than going on about specific scenes that were in poor taste, I will just say that there were scenes that were just wrong, and not in a "so bad it's good" sort of way.  Looking around the room, it seemed like the people laughing might possibly be friends of the actors, or just inexperienced audience members who were just in a laughing-because-we-are-supposed-to-laugh mode.  We got the buy-one-get-one free special from yelp, so we felt OK about leaving at intermission.  If you get the deal, go ahead and decide for yourself; don't pay full price for these tickets, no matter how bored you are.  Go see the Neo-Futurists instead.

42.description: pH productions are hilarious.  The cast members are incredibly witty, you won't believe it's improv.  And with the theatre being byob - you can fit it perfectly into your weekend warrior plans.

23.description: Last year I attended The Assemblers, pH's Super Hero parody sketch show. It was the hardest I've laughed at a sketch or improv show since moving within the city limits in Spring '11.  That was only topped by the show I saw last night: Assemblers 2. The show is totally silly and artfully performed. The devil's in the details, and pH Productions really pulls it off with this one.

47.description: I saw Phrenzy Phucked here a while ago and it was one of the worst improv shows I've ever seen, and sadly I've seen a fair amount of bad improv shows.  Its been several months since I saw the show, who knows maybe they've improved.

8.description: Fun times! Came for the last Faceshow of the season and laughed our asses off. BYOB FYI

31.description: Just came back from The Room: The Musical.  It was hilarious, and everything was very well done!  The performances, writing, and music were all great.  In addition, there was an offer at the end of the show to see the midnight show (pHrenzy pHucked) for $5 (normally $10).The theater is very small, and there are four rows of seating.  The stage is about a foot higher than the seating area, but if you are short, you would probably sit in the first or second row.  Also, there is only one restroom at the theater, so you probably don't want to go there during intermission; instead, go to the Starbucks across the street (or any other business in the area).Finally, parking is very hard to find in the neighborhood.  If you decide to drive, leave an extra 15-20 minutes to find a spot and walk to the theater.5 stars/5

34.description: I saw the Room the Musical last night and my cheeks still hurt from laughing so hard!  It was brilliant!  Definitely a must see!

16.description: We went there last night for Phamily Reunion and it was fun (well worth the discounted price). Admittedly, they aren't as professional as the bigger names -like IO or second city improve- and some members could use singing lessons but it's fun, and having them in the neighborhood is a relief from the endless strip of bars and restaurant/bars the area has become.

13.description: It's a small theater but the performance was first-rate. First, it's byob so bring your own tasty drink of choice. Next, because it is a smaller theater it would be perfect to bring a large group of friends. That's what I plan on doing next time.

11.description: Loved the show they put on for my buddy nicks b day. awesome players and awesome venue I'll be back.  Thanks ph players. Shout out to Gordy sorry I couldn't chug fast enough!

39.description: Go with a light heart and have fun. I didn't have very high expectations, paid $5 for being a student, and loved it. I watched pHamily musical and it was a very small audience (about 15 people), but the crew did an amazing funny job. Just a request: Don't be a selfish audience member and get all pouty because the improv team didn't take your idea. (eh-hem, definitely had one of those in the crowd)

37.description: We saw The Room: The Musical which was hilarious. The singing was also very good. The musical comedy is a campy parody of the The Room which is supposedly the worst movie ever made. Still very funny if you haven't seen the movie (which I haven't). Would definitely like to come back and see more shows here.

0.description: Wonderful improv theatre! We went there to watch pHamily, an improv musical. The actors were enticing and fast in creating stories, rhymes and catchy tunes. The atmosphere was very involving and easy-going. Also, the songs were very well sung. A wonderful experience, a must-do in Chicago!

38.description: LMFAO.

51.description: My wedding was "seven times more awesome" because of pH Productions.  If you're having a Broadway musical themed wedding, then why not have a musical FOR the wedding?!  And we only knew of one musical show we'd want - pHamily the Musical that pH does!When we approached them with this idea they were excited!  And for us - the big day couldn't come fast enough!  Being frequenters of their shows at Studio Be, we had a good idea who we wanted.  For a low fee we got six cast members and the pianist for our wedding.  During the show they threw in small hints about us that only our closest friends would get.  They made our out of town friends, who didn't even know what improv was, laugh and cry!  They sang a song about how life is "seven times more awesome" which became the theme for the reception.If you have an event and want something different in the form of entertainment, you should go the improv route and go with pH.  These guys are hilarious in Studio Be and outside of it!!  It was the perfect way to show our families in Texas some true Chicago entertainment!

27.description: I love pH!!!  Where else can you see a show, bring in your own booze and laugh til your face hurts for under $15??  pHrenzy pHucked and pHamily The Musical are always hilarious, but the pHrenzy Bowl was one of the greatest shows I've seen there.  Sideline reporters, onstage commentators and a halftime show? Genius.  Don't forget to get your card punched so your fifth pH show is free!

32.description: Saw The Room: the Musical; could have died of laughter. I regret that I over-indulged a bit between a bar trip beforehand and the BYOB option here, because it's clouded my memory of the second act a bit and I regret losing a single second of this hilarious, incredibly well-done musical of my favorite bad movie. The performances, the writing, the music -- everything was flawless, impressive and way beyond my expectations. Claudette especially was astounding. I would seriously see this a second time.Also, to the actors I drunkenly spoke to while waiting for the bathroom during the intermission and offered my services as a lawyer (I think I may have specified "gay lawyer"), I'm sorry / you're welcome.

54.description: checked out the "it's only rock 'n' roll (but i like it)" show last thursday - which was FREE for yelpers! brett greeted us at the door and couldn't have been more excited we were there. we were also offered snacks on the house - quite the welcome!the show itself was good. being a huge music fan, my boyfriend was cracking up the whole time - particularly to the skit done to jimmy hendrix lyrics. even the people who didn't know the song were laughing - that says something. i also liked the variety of skits in terms of length and style. overall, a funny group, and i look forward to seeing more from them!oh yeah - and way more affordable than those other stuffy improv shows around town. plus, ph productions is BYOB! can't get any better than that.

48.description: A buddy was in town and took me down the street to pH for the midnight pHrenzy show.  We had already been drinking so we showed up a little late but they had no problem squeezing us in the front row for $10 a pop ($5 for students).  This place is BYO so we kept it classy by bringing a plastic bag with a few loose PBRs and three 4 Lokos (Note: we weren't the only people in the audience drinking 4 Loko).It took me a while to understand what was going on for obvious reasons.  The show is basically like Survivor, except imagine the contestants as improv comedians and imagine Jeff Probst as a woman wearing a giant nude body suite (still not sure what this was about).  After each "round" the audience votes off a member of the group and the show continues.  You could tell people were a little hesitant to vote people off - its such a small venue that the comedians can see you voting them off the show about five feet away....awkward....I will say the comedians were genuinely funny and I laughed my ass off several times.  I would put this somewhere in between the Playground and iO in terms what to expect in the range of Chicago improv venues.  It's in a great spot and I will definitely be back because of its value and laid back feel.  Keep in mind this probably isn't the place to bring your family, colleagues, or a first date because its extremely bizarre at times and there will probably be people drinking 4 Loko in the front row.

44.description: I went with a group of 9 and had so much fun. The host asked for enough audience involvement that it felt intimate but not so much that we felt uncomfortable. The troupe was very talented and funny. The host and the semi structured elimination improv were really helpful to get people more involved and interested in specific actors. When the elimination got down to just a few remaining it was painful to vote any of them off,  they were all too good.

24.description: Just saw Assemblers 2 and it was the funniest freaking show I have seen in a long time. I know nothing about comics, my husband knows everything about them, and we both laughed our asses off. What an awesome evening! Seriously, the Les Mis bit at the end--there are no words. You have to see this!!

7.description: I never realized how many small comedy clubs there were in Chicago - amazing! We came here the other night to support a friend that was doing his first stand-up comedy show. First off, *this place is BYOB*, so come prepared! It's a pretty small place (which means everyone gets a good seat). There is an open room when you first walk in that you can wait in/get your tickets/etc. Then there is another room with a small stage and 4 rows of seats. It was clean, the performers had a great energy, and the stand-up wasn't too dirty (which I'm learning is relatively hard to do/find). They kept things moving and we saw quite a few performers in an hour/hour and a half. We got in a lot of laughs, and we all thought it was worth every cent of the $15 we spent. Not too shabby! If you go to the first show of the night, they do try to get you out of there as soon as possible since they have another show almost right after. I would definitely come back!

49.description: Though I am very familiar with pH I am still overwhelmed by what an awesome show it was for my bachlorette party!  Knowing ahead of time that there would be a bachlorette party in the audienec they went all out with a great cast, asking me for the first suggestion and even having my on stage for a strip tease by the paraplegic, cop host.  Holy crap, my friends and I can not stop talking about it!!!!  What a great place for a BYOB show and bachlorette extravaganza!!!!

40.description: SO funny.I am so happy that we went here last night to see the 10 pm show of Phamily the musical. I was laughing the ENTIRE time and so were my friends that I brought from out of town. Loving the BYOB and the environment is incredibly chill. The location is right off the train and the improv artists are excellent!! Can't wait to see another show at pH!

53.description: We took a group of 13-14 year-olds to the pH Phamily show on Saturday for my daughter's 14th birthday party and had a great time. The show was funny, silly, smart and especially fun for a group. The show is billed as PG-13 and pretty much stuck to that rating, which is important when taking other people's kids along (although you might want to let the actors know if you're with young teens, just in case.) Definitely recommended for a group and for a cool party event.

30.description: My first visit was for New Years Eve at "The pH." The crew put on a great show and the theater is a great addition to the A-ville area. If you like laughing and seeing some funny people at work, it's definitely worth the nominal charge to be entertained. If you don't like laughing, I'm very sorry for you. But you could go and be "That" guy who doesn't laugh in the corner. Everyone loves him.

46.description: There was only 12 people in the smallish theater when we got there.  Uh oh.  Signs pointed to some really bad horseshit.  Served outlandish style with a side of spaz.  PH the Phamily Musical was the show.  An improv musical featuring nobodies who I predicted can -in all likelyhood -sing about as well as they can knock down a 360 dunk. Or build a rocket and fly to the moon.  Or make some big-ass lego model of lakeview complete with dominos and and a fireworks finale.  Or whatever..but the point being they probably sing terrible and aren't funny either.  I mean c'mon, 12 people showed up.  The market has spoken.Well...OMG LOL, turns out they was some funny stuff and things that happened. I've got take my hat off to all the performers. They were funny.  And they can kinda sing a little to boot. At one point, there was a scene where this dude went to home depot to buy straw for a made out of straw ark.  Also, the same dude played risk with his me-mah later on.  Also, the same dude had a heart to heart w his mom about his dad getting killed in a storm when going to get a slurpee (that was earlier on).  Plus, there was singing, rapping, and dancing.Improv, catch the Magic!!! (seriously was really funny)

1.description: Saw Assembler's 4.  Funny show, great for the price.  BYOB doesn't hurt, either.  Protip: place across the street gives you half off booze if you mention the theater.

55.description: Just went to the "It's Only Rock n Roll But I Like It!" show last night with a fairly large group... it was FREE for Yelpers.  Yes, free.  You know what else was free?  The goodies at the front door.  We were offered brownies, twinkies and Slim Jims!  Oh and it is BYOB.  This is recession heaven folks.The staff greeted us with big smiles and were happy to hear we came for the Yelp special. A lot of places seem bummed when they find out you're there for free but not pH.  The show itself was a lot of fun.  A team of 5 comedians performed a series of sketches over the course of an hour.  The accompanying video was really well-done and the pacing was spot-on.  A musical number would be followed by a short, awkward sketch, followed by a longer bit involving all 5 people.  It kept things interesting even if you didn't particularly like one segment or another.  Some of the rock n' roll humor went over my head since I'm not exactly well-versed in rock trivia, but overall it was a fun way to spend a Thursday night with friends.  I definitely recommend catching a pH show - and watch out for another free yelp deal :)

9.description: Went in expecting some sketch comedy, maybe a bit of standup. Got a full-length, sappy, drawn-out musical with terrible songs, singers, and actors. The plot could have been summed up in half an hour or less, and I wish it had been. I sat for two hours waiting to really laugh, and nothing. Let's just say there was a mother-daughter number with childhood pictures projected on the back curtain.... Shoot me. When the climax of your comedic musical is a bunch of pithy reunions with no comedic effect whatsoever, it's time for some fresh material and talent. Lesson learned: Don't go to "Don't Pass Go."

26.description: I live in the Andersonville neighborhood and was so excited when I heard pH was moving here! I have been to a few shows and have always laughed my ass off. Plus Ranalli's gives a great discount for your BYOB! A great place to bring out of town friends or family!

25.description: Phenomenal!  I went to a standup night here recently and was very impressed.  Suprisingly professional, the crew was very funny, high energy and was having a great time.  What's better than a BYOB comedy theatre - see you guys again soon!

12.description: I just attended "Bad Advice" last night and it was hilarious! First, the theater was great; it was designed well and had a nice ambiance for the audience to feel part of the experience. The four performers were talented! They worked so well together and you can tell that they put their hearts into making you laugh. It was a great hour of laughter and I recommend seeing their performances.The area where the theater (Clark and Berwyn) is located is awesome! I would recommend a dinner and drink plan before and/or after for a great night.

59.description: I caught the Halloween show this past weekend at StageLeft with about 15 friends.   We went ahead and bought tickets online, unlike most folks, and brought along some mixed drinks and cups (they can't provide any by city BYOB rules).   Nobody else showed up with tickets so they took care of us first, which was nice, and the house did fill up.The space is great, you can see from all the seats and the sound/volume was great even in our backrow seats.    We all really enjoyed the performers and definitely plan to return.    The staff was extremely friendly and really took care of us, despite the large and rowdy group.    Thanks!

21.description: I've seen almost every pH show over the past 5 years and never left disappointed! I recently saw Hint the Musical and loved another original musical parody from this troupe! pHamily the Musical is my favorite, but the best is that they have so many to choose from and new shows all the time! It's the perfect evening event! Go to dinner, grab some booze (cuz it's byob), and enjoy some fun times laughing your butt off!

17.description: I live close so I walked over to see the Night Night Show with my wife and college age daughter.  Very disappointing.  The show is a take off on the tonight show with a mono-log, some random conversation with the tech/sound girl, three quests and other stuff.  Best part of the show is the band Pork and Beans.  The rest is awful.The tech girl plays a bully butch woman and i found her character only to be annoying.  The lead actor who played Jay Leno and his side kick were boring and unimaginative.  The characters also drop random F Bombs in desperate attempts to be humorous. When we walked out I think my wife summed it up best.  The only good part about the show was that it was only 60 minutes long.  All of us agreed the showed was bad on all levels..

10.description: I went back in an attempt to see another show. They were very apologetic about not informing me about their cancelled show and gave me free tickets. I saw the musical improv show and it was pretty great! After I saw Manger Danger which is their Christmas special- I would avoid it. I don't know how I feel about their theater! Both shows I saw where complete opposite from one another.

5.description: The best comedy I've seen in a long time!  Both the shows I went to (Bad Advice and Phamily) were clever and wacky - the kind of humor that your remember.

3.description: Attended 'Game Night' with friends.  It was definitely a quirky, funny, and a pleasant surprise that there was a comedy club near us!  YAY!Will definitely keep an eye out for other shows that they will have!

35.description: Saw The Room: The Musical last weekend. By the time it was over, my face and stomach hurt from laughing. I have been subjected to so very much unfunny theatre in my time, and can't believe that a live show was THIS hilarious.The actors were fantastic, especially the three main females. Whoever wrote the music and lyrics for this needs an award. Maybe my utter lack of sobriety contributed, but every song was slightly better than the last. Spot on, brilliant counterparts for the horrible yet amazing movie lines that make up the dialogue.If you liked The Room, this is a DO NOT MISS. And if you haven't seen the movie, you should watch it and then go see this show! Or actually, you could probably see this show first, and then watch the movie after. Either way!  A total love letter to the amazing hilariousness and mind-blowing weirdness of absolutely rock-bottom terrible movies. I won't spoil it, but cheers to pH for their perfect new ending.

19.description: LOVED pHamily The Musical. The performers were great, and I was laughing so hard at certain points I couldn't breathe.2 stars off because this place touts being BYOB, so I brought a bottle of wine to share with some friends. I asked for some cups and they refused to give me them and said they "weren't allowed to." I was pretty confused and asked for an explanation how they could be BYOB, but refuse to give out cups. He had no answer for me. The worst part was there was a stack of cups sitting out in the open, so I was especially frustrated that they wouldn't give me them. Luckily Starbucks across the street came through for us. If you guys are going to tout being BYOB, a disclaimer that you should bring your own cups would be greatly appreciated.

28.description: LOVED pHamily The Musical. The performers were great, and I was laughing so hard at certain points I couldn't breathe.2 stars off because this place touts being BYOB, so I brought a bottle of wine to share with some friends. I asked for some cups and they refused to give me them and said they "weren't allowed to." I was pretty confused and asked for an explanation how they could be BYOB, but refuse to give out cups. He had no answer for me. The worst part was there was a stack of cups sitting out in the open, so I was especially frustrated that they wouldn't give me them. Luckily Starbucks across the street came through for us. If you guys are going to tout being BYOB, a disclaimer that you should bring your own cups would be greatly appreciated.

45.description: Isn't it funny?When you like a place enough that you can't wait to Yelp about it and tell others, or, when you like it SO much that you gently push (ask for months) your partner to go? Cuz you're that sure Yelpers and your arm candy will like it? Well, funny enough I did both. What's not so peculiar was that my nagging to him was correct (natch) and we had a BLAST. We saw PHamily the Musical. Now we love improv and comedy and go to a lot of shows. Comedy is important: laughter is the best medicine, it relieves stress, it allows one to better appreciate serious parts of life, being funny has helped unattractive people get laid for hundreds of years.... Anyways, the musical is hilarious!!! They take a lot, LOT, of suggestions and prompts and are pretty good singers and dancers. We were completely stunned and impressed.Ph Productions shows are a pretty good deal and they're BYOB! It's conveniently located close to the Belmont el stop. So, he ended up really liking it and writing a review/recommending it to others himself. Full circle. Isn't it funny?

33.description: This place is awesome. We saw the room the musical and loved it. The actors were all hilarious and so talented. Even though it was a joke show, their voices and music was outstanding! It's also great that the theatre is BYOB! Can't wait to come back!!!

43.description: My first introduction to pH Productions was last year at a wedding (of the fabulous Lindsay K. and Val S.), but I haven't been around to see them since. I was playing tour guide and thought this might be a fun and cost effective way to entertain my guest. I was right! We attended a performance of pHamily and it was hysterical. The performers possess a great amount of talent and are able to come up with dialog and song lyrics on the spot. Each show is different because the script and song ideas come from random Q&A's with the audience. Audience participation is HUGE at pH Productions, so bring your A game...you're part of the show!

2.description: Came with a group of friends to see Yes Andersonville and I wasn't expecting it to be very good but the show was hilarious. It was goofy and the humor varied and focused on several topics. Every actor added something to it and the environment was cozy and lax. We came pretty early and they recommended some places for us to go pick up food and drink before the show, great service and great show.

18.description: The pH Theater is solid. My girlfriend and I go here maybe 2 or so times a month and always have a great time. Cheap, BYOB, good vibe. The quality of the improv fluctuates -- it's a place for new comics and more seasoned types alike, so there's a dud or two in the mix now and then. But it's reliably more entertaining than not. Recommended.

41.description: went to see phrenzy phunked on saturday night it was hilarious. Probably the best improve show I have seen.Everyone made me laugh. The theater is a little small but it was nice because it had a more laid back feeling. And it's BYOB :) Will definitely be back.

52.description: Looking for something that us single folk could do on a night before V-Day, we stumbled upon "pHamily the musical" this fun Byob comedy show.  Let me tell you, it was funny. They do a good job of entertaining the crowds suggestions no matter how ridiculous or well thought out they were.  The tickets were only $10, with $2 coupons online that could be printed (meaning the $14 our group saved went straight to more booze-yay!)Thank you performers of pHamily, you started our lonely singles anti-vday saturday night party out right and I will definitely go back in the future with or without a date!Oh and a quick shot out to the pianist! - you rocked!!!

50.description: I should've written this  a while ago, but I should mention pH followed up with my following my negative review and explained that there were some emergencies so the cast we saw was not their a-team.Though I moved out of Chicago and never took them up on it, they did offer me free tickets to make up for the less-than-stellar experience.

4.description: Attended the Holiday Party show and had a great time! Fun show, good atmosphere, BYOB, and very affordable. Located in a very cool, eclectic neighborhood. Would recommend to anyone looking for a fun new comedy experience.

6.description: The bf and I came to watch Bad Advice on a Friday night at 8p. Bad Advice is essentially a Harold (long-form improv) which runs 45-60 minutes. We enjoyed the performance and were impressed with the talent of the four performers. We bought our tickets at the door, and while chatting with the house manager we found out that she recently setup up a cell phone charging station by the front desk for patrons to use. Even better, pH is BYOB, though I'd recommend bringing any cups/opening devices with you because I don't think they provide those items.I highly recommend checking out a show at pH!

22.description: I just attended "Bad Advice" last night and it was hilarious! First, the theater was great; it was designed well and had a nice ambiance for the audience to feel part of the experience. The four performers were talented! They worked so well together and you can tell that they put their hearts into making you laugh. It was a great hour of laughter and I recommend seeing their performances.The area where the theater (Clark and Berwyn) is located is awesome! I would recommend a dinner and drink plan before and/or after for a great night.

15.description: Lots of fun for kids and adults. Creative and engaging for all. I would recommend it for any number of kids and birthday party's and I will definitely go again. Thanks!

57.description: I went to see pH recently, and had a great time!  I went on a Saturday night to pHamily the Musical, and had a lot of fun, so I stayed for pHrenzy pHucked.  I'm pretty surprised by the negative review, but I suppose that was September from last year, and I think they just introduced a lot of new people on their cast because they're getting a new theatre or something.  StudioBe on Sheffield around Belmont?  I think that's what my flier said.In pHamily the musical, they have one person the show's about, that person is in the ENTIRE show, and they improvise songs!  Songs?!  Improvised?!  I had a lot of fun watching one particular character, who was this sort of angst teen struggling with identity.  There was also a very sweet (but funny) love song between the main character and an older man while they were bowling. pHrenzy pHucked is a much dirtier show, set up like Survivor, so you get to vote off people you like less in the beginning (which, I might add, is very uncomfortable, but the cast doesn't seem to take it to heart).  Then you vote for who you like best at the end!  It was and interesting concept, but overall, I had a great time.I would highly suggest going to see pH!
