20.description: Saw The Rocky Horror show on its opening night Friday October 4, 2013 and it was great!! Must see for the Halloween season! Great vocal talent I highly recommend this! Buy tickets in advance shows tend to sell out. Liked it so much I will go and see it again! They are also BYOB!!

36.description: Simply put, pH Comedy Theater's production of The Room: The Musical is a triumph of ambition, passion, talent, and hilarity.  One of the best times I've had in Chicago.  As a fan of the movie (also a triumph of ambition, passion, and hilarity - if unintentional), I was a bit reticent about the live show: how do you satirize that which is already considered a joke?  I was afraid it would just be easy potshots and hipster "above-it-all-ism."  Instead, it's a wildly fun, racy ride that uses the movie as inspiration, making fun of both it and musical theater conventions, all the while refusing to take itself too seriously.  Most of all, the performers go all out to sell it, leaving nothing behind.Highly recommended, and definitely deserving of a wider audience.

14.description: LMFAO.

28.description: I wouldn't go back here to save my life!  I went there this past Sunday.  A few things went wrong.  The girl was slow as snails.  I couldn't believe how unprofessional she was!  I think that I could have done a better job.  I just could tell that she didn't have very much experience.  She was really slow and didn't know how to file nails correctly.  She cut me and made me bleed.  Her response to that was, "Sorry... I have this, I have this", meaning she had some anti bacterial liquid.  I suppose that was supposed to make up for it cause she kept right on.  She even continued to apply painful liquid after liquid onto the cut even after I was asking her to stop.  She looked at me each time and said... "SORRY"Okay... after about 3 painful other experiences, I asked her why it hurt so much.  She said that it was because my skin was too thin.... (???) She quoted 30 minutes, it turned out to be over an hour.  I got a 50 dollar ticket for her mistake.  My nails look horrible.  Can't get worse right?  Wrong.  They overcharged me 16 dollars.  I think they must have added a tip onto the card (which I didn't write in) after I already tipped her 20 percent with cash.  I called in to compain and they can't understand what I'm talking about.  They asked me what day Sunday I'd like to come in.  When they finally understood they asked me to come in to talk about the transaction.  Uh, HELL NO.   You can keep it.  I'd rather pull my teeth out than to go back in there.

1.description: In search of the $8 manicures I'm used to from traveling to NYC, I was excited when I saw the Jade Nails price list. It was still nearly twice what I was used to paying but far less than the other place next to Jin Ju (where I had a bummer of a paint job done a few years ago).But at Jade Nails price sadly does equate to quality. The salon itself is dirty, in bad need of a coat of paint and some TLC. The polishes are many but at the expense of many colors being old and thick or gloppy. I kept hoping to hit the jackpot and find the right technician but each let me down. I would bring my own Seche Vite topcoat but would still have chips within a day or two. Almost always they left paint on my cuticles and their nail files are even such bad quality that usually the edges weren't even smooth and would snag things. I finally decided that $12 or $14 (I don't remember exactly how much I spent for a mani) was too much for this "digital" comedy and I started spending a few bucks more at 2x10 Nails three blocks north on Clark. It's clean (chic even! and I'm a tough critic), always has the latest colors and the ladies there are like artists with nimble hands for great hand and shoulder massages thrown in for free. Never again Jade!

39.description: Its that time ladies. You know, sandal season. I don't know about you, but after stuffing my tootsies in boots all winter without much regard for how they look its time for a pedicure at Jade's. There are other nail salons in the area that are a lot more expensive without a comparable difference in how the final outcome looks. When I get my nails done at Jade's they look fantastic and they usually look that way for a while, especially the pedicures. The only advantage the other nail salons in the vicinity have on Jade's is size. Jade's is on the smaller side and usually there's only three people working but those three women rock. If you want attitude free nail maintenance, Jade's is worth checking out.Edit-04/01/08Bah! My last few visits have resulted in cut cuticles and bleeding. Ouch and ick.

9.description: Went in for a manicure this week.  The man that did mine was perfect.  Finally found some place not over priced and real convenient. He does a GREAT job.

29.description: This is my #1 neighborhood spot for my mani/pedis, but what they are REALLY known for in MY book is the waxing! I went there this past Saturday for an emergency eyebrow wax. Shame on me for letting my brows grow to the point that I had 2 caterpillars sitting on my face, but what can I say, waxing fucking HURTS! After a quick 'tsk tsk' from the lady, she set to work. 10 painful minutes later, a beautiful, well groomed butterfly emerged from her cocoon! I swear I will NEVER allow my brows grow that wild, ever!

23.description: I gave this salon one star.  I went to Jade Nail Salon because I forgot to book an appointment with my regular salon and I like trying new places. I was looking for a fill-in and a pedicure.  All the techs were busy and I was asked to "pick my color" and have a seat.  The place is tiny.  It didn't take long to start feeling a little claustrophobic.  As more walk-in's were welcomed, the place got tighter.  The tech that did my fill-in kept trying to talk me into a new set which I kept refusing and my pedicure can be best described as a "quick job".  Final analysis:  too small, too crowded, lousy job, too expensive.  I will not go back.

5.description: I hate to change my rating and I've had my share of manicures at this place which were just fine but my most recent experience was not so great.I was going on a 10 day trip top Florida and wanted to try out a no chip manicure. Since I get my normal manicures at Jade's, I stopped in. The job was TERRIBLE and quite expensive. Huge bumpy nails and old polish that was not evenly put on, $40. Had to get them done elsewhere for WAY cheaper

31.description: 4+ I like the small nail shop. Family owned and nice staff. Very small place so the wait can be a lil' bit long but get there on a slow day, like mid-day or before quitting time, and you'll get a quick mani and pedi, but during high traffic time, you will wait a while... : ) Thanks Jade lov your staff and work!

25.description: I should have gone somewhere else! The tech was terrible: he spent maybe 10 minutes on me, total, and didn't even give me a topcoat (unless a clear topcoat magically comes out of the same bottle as the polish...you get the idea). He seemed really annoyed that I wouldn't let him scrape off a callous with his sketchy-looking razor, or let him add a manicure to my bill. Um, buddy? My toes look like I polished them myself, so stay away from my hands! While my friend's tech spent a good 30 minutes treating her right, I hung out feeling like an idiot and got a lot of crap from my tech because I wouldn't go sit up front while my friend finished. Since there was no one in the salon but us, I'm not sure what the problem was. Oh, and mu cuticles burned the whole way home. Freaking awesome.Never going back.

12.description: This is the place to go for a polish change!  I love to swing by here on my way home from work every 10-14 days because I know that my nails will stay nice and pretty until the next polish change or manicure.The ladies that work there are meticulous and have no problem jumping back and forth between customers and complete each service really well.  As for the cuticle oil they put on at the end of the service?!?  Amazing!  My cuticles tend to get dry and crack during the winter months, but not with this oil!  Yahoo!

37.description: Yikes.  I have been meaning to write this review for a few months now, ever since we had our first glimpse of summer weather and I went in for a pedicure.  Of course it snowed a few days later but anyways ...  A girlfriend and I walked in (without appointment and after trying to get into 2 X 10 down the street) and asked how long the wait would be for two pedicures.  The man working there told us there would be no wait at all and to pick out our color.  There was one other person in the place who had just sat down for a pedi as well.  As my friend and I sat down we soon began to realize that the man and one other woman (who was working on the other woman) were the only two working.  So by telling us that there was no wait he really meant that there was no wait to sit down and stick our feet in the water ... one of us got worked on while the other sat and sat and sat.  When the woman was done with the other lady's pedi she moved on to performing a manicure, which left my friend still waiting.  She had to sit through my whole pedicure before she could get hers and then I had to sit through hers before we could leave!Here is the real kicker - the water was COLD ... give me the shivers kind of cold.  When asked how I felt about the water temperature I spoke up and said it needed to be much warmer.  The water started to run and did warm up for about a second and then went back to freezing ... it was horrible.Needless to say I will never, ever be back and would much rather shell out the money for a "pampering" experience.

21.description: I returned to Jade after having problems at another local shop.  I have always gotten good service there -  Xuan and Kristin's no chip manicure have been among the best I've gotten.  A few of the techs for regular manicures can be slower, but it's always been a more pleasant experience than the ones that rush you through.

16.description: I wandered into this place for the first time a couple weeks ago.  My first experience was very good actually but my most recent visit was so unpleasant that it will surely be my last.I got a pedicure and no-chip mani.  It was pretty clear that my tech was new during the pedi but, it wasn't until the mani began that I learned it was her VERY FIRST DAY!  She has never done a no-chip/gel polish manicure before.  She also nicked me when she clipped my cuticles but it would have been negligible if everything else going on around me wasn't so horrible.In a nut shell - My toenail polish is messy.  Someone else had to step in and finish my manicure because she had no clue how to do it.  It started peeling up in less than 24hrs so I went back to have someone else do it over from scratch.  They were decent enough to do it over without charging me but the Vietnamese banter that went on throughout my visit was completely rude and on-called for.  Also, halfway through my "do-over" manicure, I was asked to sit at another techs booth so someone else could finish the work and whatever kind of polish they were using kept getting a weird "wave-like" effect after being in the UV light.  I was accused of bumping my nails on something inside this ancient UV contraption that would not stay on.  Anyway, I can go on and on...bottom line is...I wont be back.

17.description: I should have gone somewhere else! The tech was terrible: he spent maybe 10 minutes on me, total, and didn't even give me a topcoat (unless a clear topcoat magically comes out of the same bottle as the polish...you get the idea). He seemed really annoyed that I wouldn't let him scrape off a callous with his sketchy-looking razor, or let him add a manicure to my bill. Um, buddy? My toes look like I polished them myself, so stay away from my hands! While my friend's tech spent a good 30 minutes treating her right, I hung out feeling like an idiot and got a lot of crap from my tech because I wouldn't go sit up front while my friend finished. Since there was no one in the salon but us, I'm not sure what the problem was. Oh, and mu cuticles burned the whole way home. Freaking awesome.Never going back.

10.description: Don't Bother.

11.description: This place is terrible.  Go across the street for a quality manicure.  I get a manicure or pedicure service once every couple of weeks, and this ranks as one of the worst I've ever had.  I walked in w/ nails longer than my finger tips and left with shredded bloody lil nubs!  I started with a pedicure, which really was more like a polish change.  Seems like all of the exfoliating steps were skipped.  When I sat down for a manicure, I explained I did not want my nails cut, only filed.  She kept saying that she needed to make my nails even.  They really were not that uneven.  She then kept going back and forth b/w filing and ripping my cuticles off to the point they were shredded and bloody.  I told her she was hurting me, then she proceeded to start filing again and filed my nails down as short as they would go.  I asked her to stop and she just kept saying, "make even." When I pulled my hands away from her, someone else came over and picked up a nail file.  I told them I did not want my nails filed any more, and please cut the bits of skin from my fingers that were hanging off and paint my nails so I could leave.  That person got up and walked away and another woman came over, sat down and picked up the nail file.  I pulled my hands away again.  This went on until I had 4 persons come over and try to file my nails.  Then an older man (owner maybe) came over and sat next to me.  He asked me if I was from Chicago.  Then asked if I lived near by.  I said that I did.  Then he asked me if I drove a car.  When I said no, he got up and walked away.  Weird.Finally after 4 manicurists, I was able to get the bleeding to stop and got a bad paint job, that I had to ask them to remove the extra nail polish from my fingers. Manicure looks no better than me having done it myself.  This place is 2 blocks from home, but I won't go back here again.  Ever.  Never.

26.description: Hole in the wall....Literally.I love places that seem to be "realistic businesses" in my eyes. Meaning as long as you know how to do your job you won't need hi-tech, glamorous front for a store. Very tiny salon, family ran I assume and the prices are average. I need a quick Pedi for a hot date one night and saw there was a special. Perfect for money savers like me. I was seated immediately and sat nervously in my seat will the water filled the foot tub. Nervous why? because this is only my second pedi, I know I know you're thinking you don't take care of your feet?!. In fact I do very much so but myself because I hear horror stories of Salons and Salon Techs plus I'm super ticklish. Any who, I couldn't read the magazine I brought since I was stalking my Nail Tech to make sure she didn't have an accident. Long behold 30 minutes later I was at complete ease. My toes look great but they could have scrub my heels better. Other than that I will come back for emergencies.

27.description: So on a random Wednesday a few weeks ago I decided I needed a Pedi. I dont know why! So I went in search of a good reasonably priced Pedicure place. I had heard of Jade nails before and at about 2:30 PM I walked into their door. I was greeted by two very nice, not so fluent in English ladies. They must have thought I was crazy. So soak my feet, peel the dead skin (callus) off, trim and file and clip my nails, fix my cuticles, massage and lotion my legs and feet and paint my nails clear! Come 2.5 weeks later and they still look amazing. Very happy soon to be repeat customer!

35.description: I have been going to jade nails for the past few years. I have had my hit and miss experiences at various salons, but they have yet to miss on anything. The ladies are so nice and will do just whatever are in their means to fulfill your expectations. They have a great polish selection, the salon is very sterile (lots of places don't scrub the tubs and sterilize their materials) this place does! they are affordable, and overall awesome. sometimes they get very busy, but do their best to accomodate everyone. My advice, call ahead, even just 10 minutes ahead, to see if they have time, and make an appointment. Other than that, this place rocks and I give it 5 stars! I won't go anywhere else.

8.description: I was desperate for a pedicure, and the place where I'd done a walk-in manicure couldn't squeeze me in. I wandered down the street and stopped in Jade Nails. First impression: SO TINY. Plus, there is a lady sleeping in a massage chair. BUT, these toe nails (talons?) need to be taken care of. I picked out a color, chatted with my technician (who was very nice), sat and dried my toes under a rather janky drying station where I had to keep pressing a button every 2 minutes. I think the phrase "bare bones" is very adequate to describe this salon, but I am impressed to see what they can do in this tiny space. Okay for when you're in a pinch and have no other options, but the lack of top coat to finish off my pedicure is a big no-no (chipped the next day). Next time, I'll learn to make a reservation down the street.

0.description: I tried 3 places before finding this spot. I moved here from CA and had the same nail manicurist for 15 years so my expectation was high. I get the royal pedicure and will ever go back! Always feel relaxed and pampered.  I also get acrylics done here and have been satisfied

38.description: I love this place!  I live in Andersonville but my friends travel from other neighborhoods to meet here for mani/pedis.  It is small and can look a little strange from the outside but the staff is very friendly and they do great work.  The choice of nail polish colors is top notch and the prices make it a super value.

20.description: I've been getting pedicures here for about ten years. This salon is clean, and no-nonsense; the women who work here are down-to-earth, and the prices are great. They do a thorough job cleaning up your cuticles and sloughing away rough spots on your feet, which I haven't found to be the case in fancier shops. My pedicures usually last at least two weeks.

19.description: BEST MANICURE EVER! If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd be a regular. But since I don't, I owe it to Jade Nail Salon to give them the best review ever so that those of you who live in Andersonville will go and enjoy it!My manicure looked great for at least 10 days, he price was as good as it gets ($12), tand the manicurist gave me wonderful advice. I've been getting manicures for 10+ years and no one ever told me that I have thin cuticles or that putting Vaseline on my cuticles at night would help them out. Thank you for a wonderful manicure. I may not be able to go every week, but I'll definitely be back!

33.description: I went here on a whim last Saturday. Since I've never received a pedicure before, please keep my limited experience in mind as you read this review.The good: I stopped in on a complete whim and asked if they could accommodate a walk-in pedicure. They did so, graciously, and I was seated in 5 minutes. My pedicure began with water that was too hot, but it was adjusted quickly at my request. My pedicurist was very no-nonsense, and it only took about 20 minutes from start to finish, which is good if you're in a hurry. Prices are also very reasonable--about $10 cheaper than neighboring salons.The bad: My pedicurist was rather rough with my feet, and didn't seem to hesitate even when I said that something "tickled" or was rough. She seemed to want to rush me through the experience, which might have been a consequence of being a walk-in. The salon was also out of disposable flip-flops and I had to wait with bare feet under the dryers until my toes dried. Final verdict: For the price, I can't complain about my experience, but I think I'll try somewhere else for my next pedicure.Footnote: There is a $1 surcharge for using a credit card, so bring cash if you can.

2.description: For 20 dollars more I'll go to Tricoci or my hair salon next time.  I was looking for something on the fly so didn't have a lot of options.  This place didn't seem very clean and they didn't ask me anything about preferred nail shape or cutting my nails.  The application on toes and for mani no chip is pretty lackluster and it cost $56 for both. :|  The color selection was a mess so hard to find what you want and they use some kind of generic no chip which didn't go on evenly.

34.description: Can I give a place zero stars? Because if I could this place would definitely get that! I went with a girlfriend when it was a warm sunny day out that seemed like a good opportunity to get our nails done. After finding another place that was too crowded we wandered in here and were told that we could be helped immediately. We picked out our colors and were told to take   a seat. From then it just went downhill faster than I could blink. There were only 2 people in there working and there was already one person being worked on. My girlfriend was taken care of first while I soaked my feet in FREEZING cold water. I asked numerous times to change the temp and it never happened. I ended up sitting with my feet on the side of the tub while my friend got her nails done. Finally after she was finished they started on me and she had to sit and wait for me to get done. Needless to say I will never be going back here, I can think of at least a dozen other places I would rather go.

32.description: Ummm....went back and golly, it was packed. I sure wish when someone walks into a nail salon that specializes in acrylics and asks: "How long is the wait?" that the answer would be honest. "Fifteen minutes" is never honest. Good pedicure. Water too hot but I spoke up. Women literally lined up waiting and I could tell the three staffers were getting a little tweaky and rushed. When my nails were finished (very nicely shaped) the nail polish application was rushed and gloppy. Not good. In fact, the guy who was painting my nails knew he wasn't doing such a good job so he offered for me to come back the next day so he could redo them for free. That's nice, but hey....I needed them nice that day. I know the idea is to flip the client as soon as possible for little money, and I can dig it, but this wasn't such a good experience. Also a different staff of people. I miss the nice young lady who was there last time. For the price, it is what it is.

18.description: Meh. Not my favorite, but not the worst either. The place is tiny and cramped. They do not offer you a drink or anything. The older woman was friendly, but the woman who did my nails was just OK. She just chatted with her coworkers the entire time and laughed - I felt like I was in the Seinfeld episode. Just got a pedicure and time will tell how it holds up.

13.description: I went here a while back and could not be more disappointed. The woman who did my mani-pedi did such a crappy job. She barely scrubbed my feet, so they're still rough, she cut one of my cuticles until it bled and my polish looks terrible. I asked for a buff on my fingers, but she barely buffed them and the edges are crooked and ragged. I basically had to redo all my fingers when I got home and now my cuticles are torn and sore. Horrible. My friend got a great mani-pedi from Kristen, who might be the owner, but the older woman really sucks. I contacted the salon the next day to complain about the service. They let me come back in to redo everything, but I knew when I walked in that they thought I was just a complainer. Then they looked at my feet and acknowedged that I got a bad pedicure. They redid my toes and fingers to make them look decent, but I still won't ever go here again.

4.description: This is the biggest waste of money ever!  My nails have looked better painted by a child. I understand there are sometimes language barriers  , but this was more like I'm going to ignore you and not even try to give you what your asking for. I left there with polish on my skin, uneven cuticles , and $15 poorer. Go across the street to Palette, its more expensive for a reason.

24.description: BEST MANICURE EVER! If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd be a regular. But since I don't, I owe it to Jade Nail Salon to give them the best review ever so that those of you who live in Andersonville will go and enjoy it!My manicure looked great for at least 10 days, he price was as good as it gets ($12), tand the manicurist gave me wonderful advice. I've been getting manicures for 10+ years and no one ever told me that I have thin cuticles or that putting Vaseline on my cuticles at night would help them out. Thank you for a wonderful manicure. I may not be able to go every week, but I'll definitely be back!

6.description: HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE.  0stars if possible. Went in for a no-chip and the polish was uneven.  It was all over my cuticles and pooling in the corners. It didn't set and when she wiped it smeared. I heard ladies getting pedicure complaining about the polish job as well.

22.description: THIS PLACE WAS SO AWFUL! I tried to go to nail palette but they were booked so I tried this place. Big mistake! The woman who did manicure and pedicure was distracted and did a horrible job. My toe nails were cut way too short ( I didn't even ask for them to be cut) to the point where they hurt from the shortness. She answered her cell phone while scrubbing my feet and did a crap job. During the manicure she gave me freezing cold water to put my hands in to. The whole station looked dirty. The towel was used and old...how hard is it to change out the towels for each customer? She did half of my nails round and half square... I had to tell her to fix it and the my nails ended up way shorter than what I wanted. I will never go back to this place. Please go somewhere else if you can! Save your money and toes!

15.description: It's a very small place. I was passing by the street and walked in for $35 for pedi & mani. My nail is green this time!I thought service and technique was decent enough for the pricing.

7.description: I am not the type of girl prone to saying such things, but: worst manicure of my life.Day before Easter, first real springlike day of the year, obviously everyone's out and about and every nail salon is packed. I just needed a quick shape and polish and didn't want to wait, so I figured I'd just jump into the first place I could get in. Jade was empty--now I know why--so I gave it a shot. I have no problem with no-frills, small-scale operations like Jade... in fact, I was happy to support a business that surely gets overshadowed by the fancy-shmancy salons surrounding it. Again: there's a reason for that.First of all, the first question my technician asked as I sat down was whether I'd gone to church today, which, combined with the framed picture of Jesus over her head, made me very uncomfortable when I told her no. But whatever, no big deal. Then I told her I wanted to keep my nails long, even though I had one short one that had broken. I told her just trim them a little, but don't even them out. Well, she did anyway, chopping a good 1/4 inch off my nails, which I like to keep long. THEN, she cut me while clipping my cuticles. Twice. I should have left then--which is what the woman who was sitting next to me did, after she ALSO got cut several times--but I figured, hey, all that's left is the polish, that's the easy part, just stay and get what you can of your money's worth.Bad idea. I picked a semi-difficult polish to work with, admittedly--sheerish and shimmery, the type of polish that needs three coats to look good. Well, she only did two coats, getting polish all over my skin in the process. It's mottled and I can still see my nail line. I could have done a better job myself, and not been manhandled in the process. Oh yes: She was also very rough throughout, grabbing and yanking my hands all over the place, and arranging them in uncomfortable positions so they were in front of the one, tiny fan she refused to move. Oh, and after making sure I paid before the polish--no problem, good idea--she first questioned the amount I left--INCLUDING A 20 PERCENT TIP because I spent years in the service industry and can't not tip, it's a sickness--then insisted on also putting my coat and scarf on for me so I wouldn't have to do it afterward... because apparently she didn't want me hanging around long enough for them to dry, even though I was super-hot with the coat on. And then when it was FINALLY over, she just got up and walked away, not bothering to point me toward the fans or say goodbye. So I just left. It was awkward, she was awkward, it made me awkward. I WANTED this place to be good, I wanted to support the underdog, but there's a reason no one wants to go into Jade. Better to wait 20 minutes for an appointment at any of the multiple superior places within a 3 block radius.

36.description: Great and inexpensive place for a mani/pedi ($30). I have gone here over a handful of times and never have to wait more than 10 mins. I even go on a Sat. or Sun. The location is nice, and the ladies are soooo much more friendlier than some other nail places in the area. Sorry to say, but 2 X 10 ladies....not so friendly. Whenever my mom is in town we ALWAYS come here. They ask about her when I come in by myself! My only complaint is that they make you stay until your nails are completely dry. They insist on it. I tried to leave one time and they lady said no. Two more mins. Finally had to sneak out:)

30.description: I just went in for a rather last minute, emergency manicure since the digits were looking too Halloweenish for so early in October. The lady that did the work was very quick and thorough and I cant complain too much since I was seated immediately and the cost was just $12 + tip.  We shall see how the polish lasts and then rate accordingly.

3.description: I ended up here because my regular place was closed. The whole experience was so frustrating. The lady ruined my nails while painfully removing my old no-chip paint, did a miserable job at shaping them - they're uneven and she ignored what I asked for, the other lady told my friend she wasn't getting another coat because "you don't want TOO much glitter," my no-chip has already chipped (it's been 24 hours), and my nails feel so flimsy and thin.But there's was a guy who handed all the patrons hot green tea. That was nice. Then I had to pay. It was $15 more than my usual place.... For shitty nails and an overall stressful experience. Don't go!

14.description: You know.... At first look, it feels like a back-alley joint. They've done a great job dressing up their closet sized space though. As for the quality of the jobs done...... I have Zero complaints! They Always do a great job. My last pedicure lasted two months!! ..."

58.description: Love this neighborhood spot. Oysters daily, great, clean food. Healthy portions, no huge plates which is nice. Been here many times and always consistent. Fantastic beer selection, imports & craft.

56.description: Very small portions, overly pricy and terribly salty (and I love salt).  Perhaps the fourth time I've been here but definitely the last.  I live in the neighborhood and wish it was better.

29.description: Popped into Acre today for the first time. Sat at the oyster bar and was pleasantly surprise to find great oyster, unique menu and good Bloody Mary's.   Ordered the buffalo cauliflower with blue cheese dressing and fresh crumbled blue cheese. Wow what and awesome mid afternoon snack to go with our bloodys and oyster. Cant wait to come back for Sunday Brunch!  Was eyeing the griddles cheese for next time...

42.description: We really wanted to like this place, but you gotta question why some of the food was allowed out of the kitchen.Chicken pate - Served in a jar that had just come out of the fridge and was rock hard. After chiseling it out it tasted fine but had a grainy texture. Half the toasts were burned black on one side and untoasted on the other. After asking for more to replace the burned ones, we were brought (more) freshly burned toast.Shrimp cocktail - The cocktail sauce wasn't properly mixed, it was straight horseradish on the bottom. Sausage plate - Driest sausage ever. Had to ask for the mustard the goes with it. The cocktails were meh. Two stars because the waiter was good and the cornbread was tasty.

23.description: Walked in to experience something new. The brunch was excellent. I recommend the House sausages, thatwere outstanding. The chicken and was delicious. I definitely recommend this Restaurant.

47.description: We always really want to like this place. It has so much promise--a good selection of beers, the food is pretty solid, and the space is nice. The service, however, is awful. We went tonight for dinner, and the service was a disaster. The beers were slow to arrive, but the real problem was the food arrival. My boyfriend's burger arrived fifteen minutes before my flatbread (it was later explained that the flatbreads are cooked in the nextdoor kitchen so they can't be timed, but the waiter should have explained this issue when we ordered; I could have ordered something else). By the time mine arrived, my boyfried was just about done eating his, which was a little awkward.The thing is, it always feels like the service stinks here--we've tried it a few times, and have often had similar issues. Not a bad product, nice space, but not a place we like to go.

8.description: I was thrilled with my night at Acre.  My husband and I wanted a nice quiet annavirsary with good booze and fun flavors.   Home run!   We had such a good time.   Husband was all jacked up for oysters, he loved what was available.   I'm  alergic to shellfish but he said they were fresh and flavorful.  Next was charcuterie, omg the pate was so rich it almost had it's own zipcode.  I had the mushroom barley soup.  wow! the richness of this concoction is so full of flavor I was blown away.    We will be back, I hear the cheese curds are to die for.

31.description: I like Acre. I met up with some folks there over the holidays and aside from the terrific beer selection both draft and bottle. I seriously got some street cred with some beer aficionados. The oyster special was delicious enough that I managed to stuff myself with the bivalves and drank my fill for under 40 bucks. I had a whole bunch of fresh oysters and drank my share of Half Acre and Love Child before we headed out.

34.description: From the outside Acre seems like a place where you'd like to eat, maybe grab a pint or a few oysters.  The inside is pleasant enough with tall ceilings, an inviting bar and plenty of TVs to watch that week's game.  The menu, however leaves little to be desired.  My wife and I first popped in here during an Andersonville street festival, basically because we were hot and looking for a place to cool down for a bit with a cold beer.  While the beer was fine, the appetizers left little to be desired.  This weekend we were in the neighborhood and went back there for brunch, not having realized that this was the place with the less than appetizing appetizers.  The brunch menu is plentiful, that's about where the positive comments end.  Items ranged from buffalo "chicken" (fried cauliflower smothered in Franks Hot Sauce and bleu cheese) to a frittata to pumpkin pancakes and everything in between.  What's not on the menu is an egg any way you want dish; something I'd think would be a staple on any brunch menu.  We ordered the buffalo cauliflower, the BLT and the house made sausages.  I can't believe I'm saying this, but the best dish was the fake buffalo chicken.  I ordered the BLT with the egg.  The fried egg not only arrived cold, but on a different plate.  I wasn't aware this was a build your own sandwich kind of place; if I wanted that, I'd head to the nearest Build-A-Bear store and see if they could offer that to me in addition to a stuffed animal.  Now, the sandwich...it looked like the chef picked up a huge handful of arugula and just shoved it between the bread.  Apparently they also had a large stash of the tomato jam they were looking to offload on to my sandwich because that was globbed on as well.  Lastly, the bacon...oh the bacon...it was great...great if your thing is being able to grease your car with it, because that's about how much grease each piece of bacon had on it.  The BLT came with a side of fries, decent enough and a dipping sauce.  Get this....MORE TOMATO JAM!!!  You know what it's like to think you're getting ketchup, but instead being greeted with more of the jam you didn't want on the sandwich?!  Next came the home made sausages.  Apparently our waiter told the kitchen we had a toddler in tow (we did not), because the sausages came out pre-cut and pretty much, aside from the chicken sausage, indecipherable.  There was a blob of "mustard", that was chock full of vinegar, needless to say it tasted awful.  There were mustard seeds, that was the only we knew it was "mustard".  My wife suggested I try something that she described as scrapple.  Now, to be honest, I've never had scrapple, but I'm willing to bet that scrapple is better than whatever other version of sausage they were trying to serve us.  The beers were fine, probably because the kitchen couldn't get their hands on it.  Oh, also, remember how I said it's a decent place to come in for a beer and catch the game?  Plan on only watching one game, because every TV was tuned to the same channel; it was Sunday, we all know there are no less than half a dozen games you can watch at any one time.  Obviously that last part could have been changed if I asked, but I was too focused on trying to get out of there at that point.  We didn't have the oysters which is what they seem to like to be known for, but to be honest, there are a dozen places I'd head before sampling their oysters.

16.description: After moving to Andersonville last month I made a vow to try every brunch so it was only a matter of time before I made my way to Acre. My husband and I invited some friends of ours to try the place. We'd all been hopelessly monotonous going to Lady Gregory's every week and needed a change of pace. I could easily see Acre becoming a regular brunch spot for me.I ordered the chicken and waffles. I've never ordered this dish anywhere before. Honestly, growing up in the South I'd never seen it on a menu. I've always thought of it as something Northerners think Southerners eat. However, that day my personal bias was relaxed and I gave it a try. It was delicious! The waffles were fluffy and crispy at the same time. The chicken was very good as well, though it was deboned. I don't know who started the deboning trend but it needs to stop. The sole reason this place isn't getting five stars from me is that fried chicken should never deprive one of the delicious sensation of licking the meat off the bone. A friend ordered the fried green tomatoes benedict and it was very good as well. My husband and her husband both ordered burgers. I suppose they liked them as they devoured them leaving no trace of their existence. The cocktails were also quite good.The prices were surprisingly low for brunch in Andersonville. Although, maybe the high price point exists only in my mind because I've never broken my budget on a Sunday morning in this neighborhood. I can't wait to go back and try more of their selections...if I can manage not to order the chicken and waffles every time.UPDATE: I've been back and ordered the corn cakes. These were amazing. They were rich and delicious. They almost reminded me of pineapple upside-down cake. They paired really well with the chorizo and pork confit. The deviled eggs are really good, too and they give you four halves! Also, the service was amazing. They brought share plates without us asking.Go to this place for brunch. DO IT!

13.description: Staff was great and had a lot of beer on tap. Bartender was very knowledgable about beer. Oyster bar connected to the bar. Small plates that were perfect for sharing

11.description: I like Acre. I met up with some folks there over the holidays and aside from the terrific beer selection both draft and bottle. I seriously got some street cred with some beer aficionados. The oyster special was delicious enough that I managed to stuff myself with the bivalves and drank my fill for under 40 bucks. I had a whole bunch of fresh oysters and drank my share of Half Acre and Love Child before we headed out.

39.description: Good food and Beer selection and great atmosphere.  We tried this place despite all the poor reviews for service.  We didn't have any problems with our server, he even talked to us for a bit about the other restaurants the owner of Acre owns. We started with oysters and the server took the time to tell us where they are from and how they are different.  For my entree  I had the pork burger and it was cooked perfectly and seasoned well.  We will go back.

37.description: I am flummoxed. Are we all talking about the same restaurant? Friends and I wound up here the other night -- we'd never been, or really heard of it, but by the end of the meal, we were all convinced we had "discovered" something. We were seated for dinner immediately. The menu was succinct, so we shared a bunch of plates to get a good sampling of what was on order. The oysters were lovely, the sausages snappy, the squash pizza delightful (I don't even like squash), the pate smooth, and the beet salad...well, it was a beet salad. Our waiter was warm, friendly, and efficient. The place was clean, nicely laid out, and the lighting was correct -- low enough to be cozy, but not so dark as to make reading menus difficult. I basically took away one star for the tv (tvs are not for dinner time) and the mustard, which was a bit overpowering. But that really should only be half a star.  Perhaps we went on a good night...but they certainly seem to have it in them. I'm only sorry for them that they haven't managed to be more consistent!

0.description: Guys, guys. The Andersonville renaissance is on in full force. The dual hitter of Acre/Ombre (the two sister restaurants share a front door and kitchen, if nothing else) is at the heart of it.After living abroad for nearly five years, I was shocked to see all the new upstarts on North Clark. On a lovely late October Sunday afternoon, we strolled along the beat looking for brunch. The only difficulty was choice.We decided on Acre (even waited an extra 45 minutes for them to open) because this joint just looked worth it. Aesthetically amazing. The crew here renovated a beautiful old warehouse with amazingly high ceilings and original woodwork. The dark, smokey-without-the-smoke dining room gives the illusion that you're the only table in the place. Perfect for nursing a Sunday morning hangover.The grub is the cuisine-du-jour of the Andersonville/Edgewater drag: elevated Southern soul food. They've definitely nailed it here. The three of us split the chilaquiles (damn hot, so beware), biscuits and gravy and chicken n' waffles. Conservative portions but rich flavors mean you get exactly what you need: delicious, handcrafted flavors that still allow you to slip out of the booth when you're finished.Next up for us is coming in for dinner or slipping next door to the sister Italian bistro for fire-oven pizza and pastas. Come up on North Clark and check out Acre... if you can make it past the other dozen new joints that you have to ramble by.

38.description: My hubby and I had a gift certificate for this restaurant, but after reading some of the reviews we had average expectations for the night.  Boy were we pleasantly surprised.  Great, cozy atmosphere, perfect for chilly Chicago nights.  Amazingly attentive service - Mike C. was beyond helpful, funny and charming. And we had great food to boot.  Cheese curds are always good, but these are exceptional.  Light batter crust and melted cheese inside that is very close to liquid gold.  Grilled marinated shrimp - might seem like a weird flavor combo in writing, but it is so interesting in your mouth.  Porkburger is great and, again, different from what we've tried at other places.  I had the brisket. There is some secret chef maneuver in that brisket and it is amazing.  Don't be scared by the horseradish cream, it is nowhere near overpowering.  My best advice: Give this place a try.  You will not be disappointed.

51.description: Food was just ok, I think is overpriced. I had a couple of small dishes with my girlfriend, the crab cake was ok, and the pierogi was good, nothing special. We also had a salad (artisanal greens), it was a shame for 7 dollars you get a very small salad with two tiny pieces of avocado a couple of radishes and the lemon vinaigrette but  they put it for you and it does not have any special flavor. Then the BBq ribs were ok, but 20 dollars for just three bones, that's an assault specially when their recipe is nothing awesome.Positive: the service was very good, and the cocktails too.

27.description: So, we live in the hood, and we've been to Acre many times.  The usual service is great...I'm terribly sorry, but I don't know the name of our usual bartender.  He (our usual bartender) is great.  We've had the oysters, which we've never had any complaints about, and the beer on tap changes weekly (nice addition).  Today, however, we had a less than lovely experience.  Chelaea, our bartender, obviously didn't want to be at work today.  I get that today is St. Patrick's day - the bar wasn't busier than usual - and perhaps those who had to work would rather be out drinking; however, when 1/4 of my pilsner is head and I'm told, "The beers are foamy today."  I'm a bit turned off.  Approximately 3 minutes after being asked if we want food, Chelaea says (verbatim), "To answer my question, do you want food?"  No Chelaea, we don't want food...in fact, we don't want the drinks we just ordered.  Will we be back? We will, but if that bartender is serving, we will certainly leave and go elsewhere.  Sad, cause we used to enjoy this place.

32.description: My partner and I ate here for the first time tonight and I'm torn about how to rate. We started with the cheese curds and pirogies which were amazing. I had the beef burger with the fried egg which was also very tasty. My partner had the pulled pork sandwich that unfortunately had no flavor along with flavorless coleslaw and the cold bun on which it was served - maybe it was an off night for that particular item. The fries served with our meal were delicious, but a little heavy and greasy. Our waiter was very polite and engaging. The host asked us how the meal was and we politely gave him honest feedback. He apologized, which was nice - but we're not sure if we'll come back. I didn't care for the music they were playing - sort of sounded like some indie burnout/depressing music - it did nothing for the ambiance. As well, the menu selection is quite limited so if we do go again, it will probably be for drinks and appetizers. Maybe not.

54.description: I like the atmosphere here and our service was top-notch. However the food was all bland. We got a few small plates (tartinas, crudo, crab cake) and shared the pork burger. All of it was unbalanced (lots of fat, little flavor) and forgettable. Also, while I'm aware that people don't go there for cocktails, they were still "meh" enough to warrant mentioning that this is an area of weakness for Acre. Stick with the beer.I may go again, if I'm in the area, because of the atmopshere and service, but for the food or drink.

48.description: I had heard good reports about Acre ... but was very disappointed. Went for brunch..the Bloody Marys were just awful...there is no excuse for a bad bloody mary in my opinion...sent them back...my friends corned beef hash was terribly greasy with very little hash and my chilaquiles were ok. Coffee was good. Server was very nice (Charles). I know they were finishing up brunch but I couldnt help but feel the place was a bit dirty...sorry...no way would return.

44.description: Our initial impression of this restaurant was great.  The menu looked delicious and the ambiance was decent.  However, I prefer to eat and not just stare at my menu and drink warm water.  We left after 15 minutes of not being helped or acknowledged.  If you like reading menus, check this place out.  If you like eating, pass.

24.description: I really want to like this place but continues to disappoint. Stopped for brunch Sunday. Limited options with an attempt to be creative, but nothing jumped out as "oh that sound great". I opted for cornbread with some pork topping they gave a fancy name to with soft boiled egg on top. The cornbread was very dry and crumbly, the little bits of pork consisted of mini chunks of fat and leaner bits. About 50/50. Could not even eat the fat bits and the lean bits did not have a good flavor. My son had breakfast burger that he said was ok. Had an egg on it and a tomato relish. His friend had chicken and waffles. Waffles were dried out but said chicken was flavorful. It was a boneless breaded breast. Service is always friendly and attentive but the food has been inconsistent. They should take some cues from the Bongo  Room. There is a reason there is always a long wait there!

7.description: Have passed Acre many, many times and so wanted those $1.50 oysters but, I'm always to early! Usually walking by in the morning before they even open. This evening I stopped in, sat at the bar. BJ, terrific bartender, courteous, very knowledgeable, personable, made me an awesome martini! And really took care of me with the various seafood items I ordered. All the cold things first. 4 kinds of tasty oysters, Delaware, Maryland, Deer Creek, and the Stingray. Really depends what flavors you like. After trying all 4, I landed on the Maryland. Really plump, just a little briny- I'm not big on salty tastes, so the Maryland's were just right! Then I had the shrimp cocktail, really nice size shrimp, umm, tasty. I had to have some greens, so I ordered the Roasted Beet Salad, very hearty, lovely flavors and dressing. After an Oyster Shooter- yummy! I followed with a Chopin (yummy potato vodka) very dry martini- again very tasty and BJ, the barkeep took superb care of me.! Well, it's obvious it's a seafood evening. So, I'm on to the Mussels, Spicy Steamed P.E.I. ( Prince Edward Island) Mussels. Yummy, terrific flavors, lots of mussels, grilled bread. The broth of the mussels dish is soooo tasty! I'm so happy!! Ya gotta try Acre, that's all there is to it!

49.description: Booked an open table reservation. Rode our bikes 45 min to get here. Thought we would reward ourselves with a nice brunch. But unfortunately it just was not good. Salmon hash was greasy and soggy and flavorless. The accompanying salad way to salty. Chilaquiles was average at best. Had to ask for water. Had to ask for coffee refills. By the way everything is a little overpriced. the coffee is 4 bucks. Perhaps this is better place for a beer and oysters?  Cute name. Good location. Bad execution.

40.description: Something about this place is just not quite good enough. Bf and I had a few dinners here when we moved into the neighborhood but always left rather unimpressed. It's overpriced and the entree selection is strangely limited and not that good. Their ketchup is horrible for some reason. Service is slow as well.I think this place is better for drinks than dinner. They do have a nice bar and pour a nice glass of wine. They have some small plates that seem a little better than their entrees in our experience. Not all are that great but maybe a little nosh with a drink is the way to go. I cannot ever see us coming back for dinner unfortunately.

53.description: They have $1.25 oysters daily now. Let me know if you find a better deal in the city. It used to be a happy hour thing and now its all the time. The service can be amazing at busy times and slow during slow times. If you want to sit outside there is great seating. Great beer selection. Also enjoy the fried cheese curds. They will change your life.

30.description: We dined at Acre anticipating a nice food experience at a farm-to-table restaurant but the overall experience, and menu, is much more akin to a pub than a culinary experience.Check-in for our reservation was smooth and a table was immediately available.  Impressive list of beers, and a beer flight, which I tried.  Wine list is less extensive but adequate.  Hence, the beginning of a more pub-like experience.Tables are pretty close together which, again, is okay for a pub.  Menu has a nice variety of small plates.  We tried the spicy cauliflower and the mac n cheese.  The cauliflower, frankly, was disappointing.  We were expecting crispy oven-baked with a tangy dipping sauce and what was served was coated cauliflower in a hot sauce.  The mac n cheese was good but not particularly memorable.  Oysters are a big feature here but not really our thing so can't comment on them.I bet the best items on the menu are the burgers, chicken sandwich or roast chicken.  We both had the trout dish which was served on spinach with fried potatoes.  The flavor of the trout was very good but, yikes, the spinach and potatoes were super salty.    Good thing that I had beer to relieve the salty taste.  Food service was fast but not particularly careful.  Waiter was friendly and available.Also disappointing were the dessert choices - chocolate cake with strawberry sauce, tiramisu and bread pudding.   Slim pickings and nothing particularly inventive.  Again, okay for a pub but we were expecting something else.  No dessert wines are available.Only street parking is available. We found a spot within 3 blocks on a Saturday night which isn't so bad for the area.Glad we tried Acre but I don't think that we'll be back again, unless we're craving a burger and beer.

46.description: My 3 friends and I wanted to try a different place, so we landed on Acre after looking at the menu online. We sat on the patio and decided to order small plates. This ended up being a great choice!First round: Jumbo shrimp - (count 4) a little on the small side but tastyHouse sausages - a plate-full of flavorBuffalo cauliflower - added a bit of crunch (being battered) Second round: Wood oven corn pizza - this has a nice, spicy cayenne kick to itPierogi- (count 4) creamy and a good palette cleanserCarnitas tacos - (count 4) I could have eaten all four, really goodOrdered the Chinon Cuvee Mathilde - such a beautiful rose that we ordered three bottles! We had a bit of a wait once we first sat down before our waiter officially greeted us and took our drink order, but then he was more attentive throughout the meal.

1.description: We have 3 small plates, the Buffalo cauliflower was excellent, is just like chicken wins but vegetarian style, the smoke salmon was really taste and made in house, also the grilled sausage was good for the different mix sausages. Service was good, he give us a good recommendations. we will be back!

55.description: It's just not good. Service and quality of food leaves much to be desired.  Should have known better when we walked in and were sat immediately for Sunday Brunch.

9.description: We dined at Acre anticipating a nice food experience at a farm-to-table restaurant but the overall experience, and menu, is much more akin to a pub than a culinary experience.Check-in for our reservation was smooth and a table was immediately available.  Impressive list of beers, and a beer flight, which I tried.  Wine list is less extensive but adequate.  Hence, the beginning of a more pub-like experience.Tables are pretty close together which, again, is okay for a pub.  Menu has a nice variety of small plates.  We tried the spicy cauliflower and the mac n cheese.  The cauliflower, frankly, was disappointing.  We were expecting crispy oven-baked with a tangy dipping sauce and what was served was coated cauliflower in a hot sauce.  The mac n cheese was good but not particularly memorable.  Oysters are a big feature here but not really our thing so can't comment on them.I bet the best items on the menu are the burgers, chicken sandwich or roast chicken.  We both had the trout dish which was served on spinach with fried potatoes.  The flavor of the trout was very good but, yikes, the spinach and potatoes were super salty.    Good thing that I had beer to relieve the salty taste.  Food service was fast but not particularly careful.  Waiter was friendly and available.Also disappointing were the dessert choices - chocolate cake with strawberry sauce, tiramisu and bread pudding.   Slim pickings and nothing particularly inventive.  Again, okay for a pub but we were expecting something else.  No dessert wines are available.Only street parking is available. We found a spot within 3 blocks on a Saturday night which isn't so bad for the area.Glad we tried Acre but I don't think that we'll be back again, unless we're craving a burger and beer.

26.description: I've gone here a few times with my young son.  Not the most kid friendly place, but they are always welcoming and accommodating when I bring him since he's rambunctious.  Although they do have a children's menu, which is nice.I have always gotten the burgers when I've come.  Which were always cooked perfectly and come with a side of fries.  I order the cheese curds every time, and they're such a delicious sin!  Beer selection is just okay, mostly local breweries, which matches there local menu.  I want to try the oyster bar, but have yet to do so.  You'll end up spending $10-15/plate plus $5-15 for appetizers.  So reasonable given the quality.Love the staff here.  Love the atmosphere.  To the guy complaining that they were expecting some farm-to-table experience, but instead got more of a pub feel...go to Cracker Barrel for that.  It might have farm décor, but it's an oyster bar.  It's good pub food...Also, of course there is not a parking lot....this is the city and it's a congested neighborhood.  What do you expect?  There's always plenty of parking along Clark, even if you have to walk a bit.  Maybe you should have read reviews before stopping in, or maybe called the restaurant to see if they would meet you dining atmosphere expectations.  This is why they have Yelp reviews and menu's available online.

25.description: First time I've been here. I had a pierogi and it was decent. My friend ordered pancakes but they tasted like oysters. It was like they had cooked some sort of seafood on the grill and hadn't cleaned it and then just cooked the pancakes there. It took awhile to get water and the check. My friend remarked when we sat down that there weren't very many people here compared to every other brunch place.  Now we know why. As we sit here waiting and waiting to pay, I've had time to write this review.

12.description: Popped into Acre today for the first time. Sat at the oyster bar and was pleasantly surprise to find great oyster, unique menu and good Bloody Mary's.   Ordered the buffalo cauliflower with blue cheese dressing and fresh crumbled blue cheese. Wow what and awesome mid afternoon snack to go with our bloodys and oyster. Cant wait to come back for Sunday Brunch!  Was eyeing the griddles cheese for next time...

59.description: Oysters!  Oysters!  Oysters!  I'm one happy happy happy lady.

21.description: Acre reminds me of the old adage, if it ain't broke don't fix it. Everything on their menu is a classic that they tried to make better and failed. Ketchup! It's been perfected! Why f*ck with it? But Acre did. The burger! It's been perfected! Why f*ck with it? But Acre did. If it's a classic, just do it well, don't change it.Also, a lot of reviewers said their service wasn't the best. This was also my experience. If it's not busy, I shouldn't have to hunt down my server for more water or the check. Nothing will turn people away from your establishment quicker than poor service, well maybe rat droppings, but rat sh*t shouldn't be the baseline for your service.I brought my mom here for Mother's Day and now its going to take a Cartier Watch to make up for this. #ThanksObama Serious though, there are a lot of great places to eat in Andersonville, it's a shame Acre isn't one of them. Also, don't f*ck with ketchup!

17.description: Went early for dinner with 2 others. We ordered a few of the small plates to share to start: The sausage potatoes were delish, and the pierogis were sooo good, but not at all what I was expecting for a pierogi. Beet salad was ok. Oysters were excellent!For entrees we had the flank steak, BBQ pork ribs, and the griddled cheese with tomato soup. All 3 were good. Not great.Tiramisu and coffee drinks for dessert. Good. Not great.Food and drinks were overall 3 stars, but I gave an extra star just because the staff was so friendly, very knowledgeable, and just a pleasure to be served by :) We stayed for hours and they didn't mind one bit. Would go back, but after checking out some of the restaurants around that lil gem of an area

10.description: I had brunch at Acre and thought it was great.  We were in the area at another restaurant that left us hungry (see my review of Cantina 1910), so we decided to stop into Acre for drinks and more food.  I have no idea what Acre was so empty on a Friday night.  There were two people at the bar.  That was it.  The good news for our group of four people was that we could sit anywhere and it was not loud.  Just strange to be so quiet.We ordered the cheese curds and the Lagunitas fondue.  Those cheese curds are AMAZING.  The batter is light, so you actually taste the cheese curd.  Usually when you think of cheese curds, you think of heavy little plops of something battered.  These are so puffy and fluffy and just amazingly good..  The fondue was okay.  I really ordered the fondue appetizer though for the pretzel rolls.  They were tasty but disappointingly small.  Miniscule.  And you only get four of them with some pickled vegetables (what is it with the pickled veggie movement?).  Hardly enough dippers for all that fondue.  So that was a waste.Our server was okay.  I don't think he felt like being there on a Friday night.  Drink menu was okay.  Nothing to write home about.Overall, I think we will stick to brunch only at Acre.

5.description: Came for brunch on a Sunday afternoon. Very courteous servers and piping hot food. We had a "beermosa" w/ white ale.... and excellent fried green tomatoes. Great burger and homemade fries plus a farmers skillet. The place restored a lot of original elements (wood bar, tile, tin roof, booths, stools, etc.)that add a touch of class. A few TVS so you can keep up with the game. Not the most ideal place for a huge group of people to dine at, but a great date or double date joint.

3.description: Stopped into this Andersonville two-fer during a morning's shopping and was pleasantly surprised if not completely overwhelmed.  Service was solid and it's a really lovely space; the food was prompt and delicious -- it's a very creative and delicious brunch menu, to be sure.  The beer list was not as robust as I'd been led to believe, but the cocktails were extraordinary and very nicely thought out.  Dunno if I'd make this a regular stop, but I'm curious to try it for dinner or lunch; if the service and menu is anything like what it was for our brunch date, it's definitely worth a return visit.

35.description: I want to give this more stars but the prices were a little nuts. I work at a highly rated oyster bar so I was coming in armed with some knowledge. The bad:- walked in for brunch at 2:30. Asked when oysters would be available. Hostess said 5pm. Was so disappointed until I learned it would be 3pm in reality. -My mom got the steak and eggs, steak was rather tough (however potatoes were good). -maybe it was plated strangely but the portions looked very small-my green salad was decent, nothing mind blowing. For the prices of both I expected more.-the cocktail sauce and mignonette were both kinda bad. Cocktail was flavorless and mignonette just tasted like straight up red wine vinegar. The good:-the service! I didn't catch our servers name (gentleman with a beard) but he was wonderful! Drinks refilled fast, checked in when needed, chatted about oysters. Great all around! - they shucked and served the oysters as soon as he was set up (right at 3). They were fresh and very reasonably priced. - decor is great. Overall the highlights were service and oysters themselves but for a $75 brunch for two (without booze) I expected more from the actual prepared food.

19.description: Oysters. Yep, oysters. I love em. Don't know that I've ever had my fill. Usually my oyster consumption is limited only by my wallet. But Acre has $1 oysters nightly from 5-7! Nightly!! And not just those mini oysters. No, these are sizable. There's a great selection and they're all fabulous!We went here the other night just to eat oysters and man, it was awesome! I can't vouch for the food but the oysters? Oh yeah!! My mouth is watering even now thinking about them. We ate dozens and dozens! Out waiter told us a table he served ordered over 380!! Now that's some eating! I felt sorry for the guy shucking! But I've put Acre on my must visit again list. And I will. I'm ordering oysters!Oh, and the beer selection is great too! What more could you want! Even Jimmy Buffet would be a fan - gimme oysters and beer, for dinner every night for a year!

28.description: We are so happy we came here for brunch!  The service and food were phenominal!  I would definitely come back for the breakfast tacos and my wife loved her shrimp and grits!  Come here for a great dining experience!

45.description: DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS PLACE.What a disappointment. The waiter did not know his menu. He did not know what their signature chow chow was made of. He had to take my menu to look if the fish and chips came with tarter sauce. He looked at the menu, said no it does not. When I looked at the menu it clearly said, yes, it came with tarter sauce. I asked for no dairy in my meal. My steak arrived with butter on it. I specifically mentioned to the waiter no butter on my steak. The two other people I was dining with had the fish and chips. The portions were totally different. This was brought to the waiter's attention. He came back from the kitchen to tell us that we were mistaken because they weight the fish. We could see that this was not true. Upon leaving the restaurant, I passed our waiter, who walked right by me and turned his face away. DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS PLACE.

33.description: Great neighborhood place!  $1 oysters after work and a nice Manhattan. Burger is good as is the Mac n cheese, the pierogi filled with potatoes, and the charcuterie board.

43.description: Tasty fresh farm to table style American food updated seasonally.  Outstanding beer selection, affordably priced wines.  Service is prompt and very professional.  Figure $40 per person with an appetizer, main and a few drinks.

2.description: Everything was great--the food, the service, and the ambiance. And, more importantly--the BEST Bloody Mary I've ever had.

18.description: Just returned home after our first night of dining at Acre and I am still full!  We started with an entree salad that had sweet potato pieces in it, like nothing I have had before. Learned from the Chef when he came out to greet us that this was created a while back as a spur of the moment addition when they ran short of another ingredient.  Don't change it back!  The sweet potato works and complements all of the other flavors.  Our party of 6 sampled every hot appetizer on the menu and I can truly say that they were all fantastic!  The buffalo cauliflower was to die for and would have been ordered a 2nd time if we didn't have so many other plates to come. Both the cajun shrimp, salmon and empanadas were big hits as well. Charlie, our server was great, and did the perfect amount of recommending and socializing with us.  Our first visit was a thumbs up and we will definitely return!

41.description: 2 years ago, I would have given Acre 2 stars for their high prices, bad service and limited menu. Thankfully, I gave it another try.  It's clear that this place has had some growing pains, but I think they have finally found their way. With their improved service and menu, Acre has become a goto spot for me. I usually go for dinner, but I've also had a nice time just having apps and drinks. The beet salad is fantastic!

52.description: Clearly, I'm not the only one who feels poorly about this place. Especially the service. Wow. Took about 15 minutes before the waiter came to our table. Kept saying, "I'll be back" or "So sorry". I got the vibe he was new. Never confirmed, but more happened through the night that confirmed this. Since it took so long for him to come, we were ready to order everything at once when he did come. We ordered drinks, oysters, small plates, and dinner at the same time. It took another 15 minutes for drinks to come. We actually were sitting near the bar and saw our drinks sitting on the bar for a while. We contemplated going up to the bar and grabbing them. But we knew that'd be uncool. Ok, finally, food. I did not eat the oysters but was told they were great. Great. We ordered pizza and that was okay, nothing special. Same with crab cake. The sausages were good, although my friend wasn't impressed. The best part of the meal actually were the cheese curds. Some of the best I've had. But everything else was average. And yeah, the service was pitiful.  There were several empty tables around us so it wasn't that he was swamped. And we watched him stare at our oysters at the bar before he brought them, looking at a menu making sure he knew which was which. Rookie move, right?  I remember my first day working in a restaurant, but come on now. I never really complain about service, but this was terrible.

50.description: The smoked trout hash (+ eggs benedict) was great. It helped with my slight hangover and was light enough not to regret eating it.

4.description: Acre reminds me of the old adage, if it ain't broke don't fix it. Everything on their menu is a classic that they tried to make better and failed. Ketchup! It's been perfected! Why f*ck with it? But Acre did. The burger! It's been perfected! Why f*ck with it? But Acre did. If it's a classic, just do it well, don't change it.Also, a lot of reviewers said their service wasn't the best. This was also my experience. If it's not busy, I shouldn't have to hunt down my server for more water or the check. Nothing will turn people away from your establishment quicker than poor service, well maybe rat droppings, but rat sh*t shouldn't be the baseline for your service.I brought my mom here for Mother's Day and now its going to take a Cartier Watch to make up for this. #ThanksObama Serious though, there are a lot of great places to eat in Andersonville, it's a shame Acre isn't one of them. Also, don't f*ck with ketchup!

6.description: I was skeptical at first seeing 3 stars on Yelp and knowing that Acre isn't a as busy as some of the other places in Andersonville.  After a few times eating here I can confidentially say this place is under rated.  The food I have had has been great as well as the service. The oysters in particular are very fresh and reasonably priced. I recommend giving this place a try. I have been very pleasantly surprised.

22.description: Surprised to see mixed reviews regarding Acre - but everyone has an opinion and different tastes and preferences.  My wife and I went here awhile back and I've been meaning to post a review.  First off, I love their food and the different items you can order.  I had their steak which was soooo good my wife and I ordered another one to take home.  All the different options and appetizers are insane, and I feel this would be the perfect place for a group.  The beer list is insane.  Has everything from everywhere and you really can't go wrong.  But what I most liked about the place was the atmosphere.  Charmy, warm, fun, lively, cosy, you name it.  Good music, full bar, crowded but not too crowded, and the server we had (so sorry - forgot name) was fantastic.  People mention prices, but I feel their prices are normal.  I mean heck, we are in Chicago - the third largest city in the U.S. and Edgewater is a nice area.  It drives me nuts when people complain about prices in the city...  I mean rents are high, taxes high, so how the heck do people expect businesses to stay around?  Anyways - sorry for digression.  But I love Acre.  I will be back soon to eat and also to drink some more of those yummy beers!

15.description: I was excited to try based on reviews, I think they just had an off night. Ordered a dozen oysters for my meal but it came after everyone was already done eating..they comped it which was nice. Didn't get drunk refills, appetizers were a bit underwhelming. Just an off night I think, hope. I will try again sometime:)

57.description: Still a fan of this place!  Came here on Easter Sunday for brunch and had a lovely experience.  The bottomless mimosa's are $18 and worth every penny.  I had three in a wine sized glass and they do a great ratio of OJ to bubbly.Brisket has was great but the friend chicken and waffles were our favorite.

20.description: I wish I lived closer, so I could come here every day. The oysters are AMAZING! And you can't beat the price either - $1.50 each. They have a great variety and I've probably tried all of them at one point in time. Their menu changes often but that's a good thing because you get to try different things. Some of my favorites include mac & cheese with crimini mushrooms, wood-oven pizzas (from prosciutto to squash), and the grilled Scottish salmon. They have an awesome beer selection, too! Can't go wrong! Definitely a neighborhood gem!

36.description: I feel like Acre is a bit under rated. They are great for lunch, brunch, dinner and appetizers. The oyster special is also a must do! I also really like that they have oyster wine flights. Never had anything there I didn't like. The pierogi starter, calamari, buffalo cauliflower, pork burger and shrimp are my favorite items.The service is always good and I don't know that we've ever waited for a table!

14.description: I feel like Acre is a bit under rated. They are great for lunch, brunch, dinner and appetizers. The oyster special is also a must do! I also really like that they have oyster wine flights. Never had anything there I didn't like. The pierogi starter, calamari, buffalo cauliflower, pork burger and shrimp are my favorite items.The service is always good and I don't know that we've ever waited for a table!

58.description: Great favors - smokey flavor on the meats and the sides are so yummy. The bartender sure knows how to make a drink and the waitstaff are so attentive!  Love this atmosphere!  I like to mix the sweet  and spicy sauces together to get a sauce to slather over everything!

56.description: Great place, Thank you Steve Ford for bringing it to Edgewater! Had the spare ribs and pulled pork, excellently prepared. Pickles are great. The beer  selection also great. Definitely a new neighborhood hangout for us.

29.description: I came here with a pretty large group for a friend's birthday and really enjoyed it. I didn't know much of anything about the restaurant, so I came in with no previously formed opinion of the place. Our server was friendly and did a great job of handling such a large party, divvying up checks for everyone, and making sure everyone was taken care of. That alone is very impressive. I had moved from cocktails to beer by the time we got here, so I don't recall the cocktail list, but the beer menu was pretty solid. The food - we had nachos, which were good...about what you'd expect. We did have them with no meat, so that may be why I'm not raving about them, but I'd get them again. For our meal, we split brisket, ribs, and pulled pork, along with cornbread, mac & cheese, slaw, and fries. All of the meat was pretty good. The one area for improvement would be the sauces, which were not bad by any means, but just could have been better. Would have loved to see a Carolina Gold. The sides were pretty well done too, but the portions weren't as big as I'd have expected. The cornbread was the size of a large muffin, the mac & cheese was definitely too small for 6 people to share. The slaw was really good and a great complement to the meat. We all left feeling pretty full & satisfied. Definitely got some bang for the buck. I'll be back and am very interested to see what brunch is like.

42.description: Menu was a little limited but food was pretty good and so were the BBQ sauce options. Kind of pricey and sandwich quantity wasn't huge which was disappointing for the price. Great decor, GREAT SERVICE. If you like BBQ it's worth a visit.

23.description: Great food. Great atmosphere.

47.description: The music, decor, and food were all excellent. The Short Rib Hash was delicious, very flavorful and filling. I think the prices are spot on. I love BBQ and this place delivered all the great flavors I would expect. I brought my family here for brunch and we all enjoyed our dishes. I will return, many many times.

8.description: First of all I have to clarify, this is for the Andersonville location.  And this review is for food delivered from the restaurant.  We did not actually dine-in.We ordered two pulled-pork sandwich combos, with two sides each.  My husband ordered the fries and beans, and I ordered the potato salad and beans.  We shared the pimiento cheese as an appetizer.  The meat in the sandwiches was interchangeable, because only the sauce that you add changes the flavor; your choices are sweet/sticky, tangy, and spicy.  We tried the sweet and the tangy...neither very flavorful.  Underseasoning seems to be a major theme here.  The pimiento cheese, which neither of us had before, was a dollop of a Cheez-Wiz like mix, accompanied by toast rounds.  Very, very bland, but ok, I guess.The potato salad was also extremely bland...nothing crunchy, nothing piquant, just red potatoes and mayo.  The fries were also bland, and rather...stiff. Not stale...just stiff.The beans were the best side....although they contain shreds of pork, which I found a little odd.  This may have been mentioned in the description, but we didn't notice.  I personally didn't see the need for more meat in a side dish to accompany a meaty entrée.As to the pork itself it was all right.  Again, bland.  My portion was chewy and had hard little pieces in it, but my husband said his did not. Overall rating...two stars.  Suggestions to the restaurant:  develop tastier/more authentic sides; more vegetarian options aside from salads; create better barbecue sauces; take the meat out of the baked beans.

31.description: What a great space up at the northern end of Andersonville, open airy and comfortable. Helpful staff can walk you through the menu if you have any questions as to how to order the food. Pulled Pork, Beef Tri Tip and a Cornbread muffin followed by some Blueberry pie was a perfect size meal to fill out tummy's.  Good BBQ for a decent price.

34.description: Good BBQ joints are hard to find. This place was a little disappointing. First, what self-respecting BBQ restaurant doesn't serve sweet tea?  Secondly, BBQ should come WITH sides, they should not be extra.
