22.description: This is what I want out of an antique store.  Stuffed piled onto stuff, which means you have dig sometimes to find treasures.  But that's part of the fun right?  You can pretend you're on American Pickers.  Wife dug through a plastic bin and found a fabulous vintage hat.  Owners are friendly and knowledgeable and will help you find what you're looking for.  Prices are extremely reasonable too.

15.description: I really do love this place, I do. It's like a surprise every time I go in. There are piles of antiques, literally piles, precariously arranged. You have to dig around and often there is stuff you just can't get to... just look at it and wonder whats behind it. They have something for everyone price wise, I got a beautiful vase for $15 but then they have oil paintings for hundreds of dollars. This is a great place to get a solid piece of antique furniture for a good price. The guy that usually works behind the counter is not super friendly, the customer might not always be right, but he will answer a question if you have the balls to ask. What I like the most is that it doesn't have that stuffy pricey antique store feel, it's a little dangerous.

40.description: I found some great Waterford pieces. They gave me a great price. It's a little cluttered, that is why I gave them only  3 stars. It's like a big treasure hunt. I hope you find a treasure on your next outing their.

7.description: Great prices, cool stuff, great resource for dealers searching to complete sets of china and lamps love this place

36.description: This place is pretty cool.  We found an old, heavy, awesome dresser for about $100 -- something that would easily sell for triple that at any other place in town.  Like others suggested, we bought it right away knowing it'd be gone if we didn't.  After getting it home (they delivered; $20) we put a few coats of white paint on the drawers and it was looking like an $800 piece from White Attic across the street.The space is small, but there's lots of things to look at.  It reminded me of a small town flea market with the prices to match.My one disappointment was a couple pieces of wood that would have been perfect for wall shelves.  I found them leaning up against a wall near the back, and when I went to buy them I was told they weren't for sale as-is because they were a part of a larger bookshelf.  Shucks.Definitely a place to go to every once in a while to see what's new.

30.description: Most thrift and antique shopping leaves me feeling like my hands are covered in grime. Brownstone leaves me feeling like I just snorted dust straight off that mid-century vanity in the corner and rubbed my face all up in some estate sale fur. In short, it's a bit of dirty experience. But that's okay, cause that's the way I like it.Prices are, for the most part, reasonable. I've scored wall art, vintage coats and random trinkets for decent prices. Expect some of the pieces to be in need of repair/refurbishing, but every once in a while, you'll find a perfect gem at a price you can't refuse.The staff stays out of your business which is nice, though I've had them shove my purchases into itsy-bitsy bags which is not as nice.Look out for the goods on the street and don't hesitate. I've had many an item nearly snatched up straight from my hands. It's a thrifter-eat-thrifter world out there on Clark Street--just keep your hands, noses and mouths off the aisle lined with china cabinets and hutches. That's all mine for after I rub my face in the furs.

3.description: Wow, this place is a gold mine. I walked past casually and when I saw a gorgeous solid wood trunk outside for $65, I had to see what else was inside. Considering, Brown Elephant had something similar for over $150 just up the block. I was in here for well over an hour, it got to the point I was on my butt looking through baskets of knobs and all sorts of really interesting things. The prices are so reasonable and some of the stuff they have is just stellar. We saw old movie or film cameras, they had to be several decades old for $150. Considering you can go to a store like C&B and buy a fake camera for around the same price, that's a damn steal. If I had a car, I would have bought furniture. I told my wife, we NEED to come here when we rent our moving truck the night before because there is so much in there that I'd love to make room for in our future :) I ended up walking out with some license plates and door knobs that said "1610" on the back. Pretty cool if you ask me :)

14.description: So let's just acknowledge that there's a difference among antique stores, thrift shops, and junk stores. Brownstone is really more in the thrift/junk camp -- and don't get my wrong: there's a place for junk in my world. Here's the good -- it's eclectic and there are bargains. Here's the truth -- this place is a catch all for all things that one would normally find at a garage sale but in worse shape.Again, there are bargains. But - for those of you who haven't been --the place is a mess.I'm fully cognizant about how some patrons might find this joint "funky." But it is also a place with broken glass, dirt and dust and grime. Most anything I saw that was tempting would require a garage (I don't have one) and a few weekends of sanding, screw tightening, and repainting.If you want eclectic and clean (and believe me both can be had) get over to Broadway Antiques (near Granville). That is a paradise compared to Brownstone.

3.description: What a wonderful little shop!  I came in here on a whim looking for last-minute wedding jewelry and I walked out with a beautiful necklace and purse that ended up looking stunning.  I showed the owner a picture of my dress and she picked out a necklace I never would have picked out myself, and it worked so beautifully!  Plus it was a thoroughly pleasant experience - the owner is extremely knowledgeable and friendly, and she's got a whole array of adorable items.  I will definitely be back.

1.description: Came in here looking for a purse but walked out with jewelry. The owner (Susan) is extremely knowledgeable about vintage items, and was able to pinpoint decades and time periods in which the items derived from. It was pretty impressive. She made sure to take time and help me find what I was looking for. She was really friendly as well. She had a large variety of jewelry, clothes and purses. Definitely recommend this spot for gift items or if you want a unique vintage piece for yourself.

2.description: Susan is the best! She clearly loves what she does and has the best Rolodex when it comes to chic, immaculate vintage finds. She is extremely knowledgeable and honest; if something doesn't (or never will) fit, she'll tell you! She's got a great eye and knows what she's talking about. The prices here are totally reasonable given the wonderful condition of the clothing and accessories. This is a total gem, Chicago is lucky to have Susan and her shop!

0.description: Tilly has beautifully curiated vintage clothing, jewelry and accessories. I have been buying vintage since I was a teenager and her dresses are the best. Lots of choices for tiny girls, too. Susan really knows her merchandise, and shares what she knows. I love buying things with stories. Check it out for the holidays...great glitz and its very affordable.

4.description: Most amazing vintage shop ever!  Excellent quality and variety of vintage pieces. A great shopping experience with personal - friendly - outstanding service, fantastic finds, and unique stories to make your purchase memorable.  Susan is Awesome!

12.description: Wonderful service! Walked by on a Saturday night when the store was closed, but had to have something I saw in the window. I called and was able to pay for the item over the phone. I live downtown and don't have a car, so I asked if there was any way the item could be delivered if they were making other stops in the area (I wasn't in a huge hurry to get the item, as long as I did eventually!). The item was delivered to my door the following week at no additional cost. Excellent customer service!  I'd definitely do business with this store and owner again!

3.description: I came to Mercantile M for the first time last night and I think I'm in love. For a small shop, it's variety of items is impressive. I also like that the pricing is good and there's some wiggle room for negotiation. I must have spent over an hour in there because the owner is such a nice guy and helped me think through my notorious indecisiveness. I came in there for a decanter to add to my barware collection and left with the decanter and a distressed bookshelf made from a crate (I plan to turn it into a mounted hutch in the little dining corner of my living room). Together, we took measurements from 4 different cabinet/bookshelf units. He helped me think through how I would mount it on my wall and the different ways I could refinish the piece. He's even so good he suggested another store in Andersonville (Good Deal Garage) that I could go to maybe find a new shelf for the piece. I feel horribly for forgetting his name, but he offered some of the best customer service I've ever experienced. I had to force myself to leave before I bought even more. But who am I kidding? I'll be back another day to get that metal milk crate and painting.

1.description: If you're looking for phenomenal vintage pieces at a fantastic price, look no further than Mercantile M! The bustling commercial district of Andersonville is home to numerous vintage, antique, and thrift shops, but Mercantile M is certainly one of its jewels. I have visited this shop a couple of times before but never had the time to really look at everything. The shop is moderately sized but filled with a variety of vintage and antique treasures, knick-knacks, and furniture. The store is clean and organized and the pieces cleverly displayed. For the most part, prices are some of the best I've seen in Andersonville. A few items are well out of my price range, but definitely cool to look at. I stopped in one evening on a whim and ended up chatting with Sherman, one of the owners. He is obviously very passionate about his shop and the items he sells, and was a delight to talk to. The shop brings in new items about 3 times a week, so there's always something new to see! Long story short, I ended up leaving with an awesome mid-century lamp with a tall shade for only $25!

2.description: Sherman and Mark are the nicest guys.  My partner and I have bought so many pieces from them in the last couple of years -- abstract artwork for my private practice, vintage end tables, a 1950s drafting table, lamps, a Russian samovar, and more.  These super sweet guys are constantly turning over their stock because they're always on the hunt and are not interested in gauging the shopper with exorbitant prices -- always reasonable and always fun to talk to them both.  And the Donna Summer, Pet Shop Boys, or Pat Benatar playing in the shop always makes me smile!  Bravo guys, we love having you in the neighborhood!

9.description: Sherman is a super nice guy! The selection is very affordable, always changing and really cool.

10.description: Our new favorite store in Andersonville. Got a great deal on the type of dining table my wife has always wanted. Feel like the pricing is very fair. Service is great. Mark and Sherman went above and beyond call of normal duty helping us from the purchase to the delivery. Also bought a great nightstand here in late August.

13.description: I'm happy to have Mercantile M in the neighborhood! The owner is incredibly nice and the items he sells are well priced. The buyers for the store have a good eye for unique design! Definitely worth checking out.

16.description: Loved this place! Was just there last night and their prices are amazing! It's small, but filled with such interesting items. I'm so excited for this new addition to the neighborhood!

6.description: A fantastic little store filled with all sorts of vintage goodies at very reasonable prices. Mark and Sherman are really friendly and fun to talk to, and they always seem to have good tunes playing, giving you a dynamite soundtrack to shop to. My wife and I found a great mid-century office desk here at a really nice price, and Mark was incredibly gracious about helping me get it up to our apartment. This will definitely be a regular stop during our weekly Clark St. wanderings!

15.description: This is an excellent antique/thrift store, one of my favorites around. It is very small, but they have an ever-shifting supply of furniture, art, antiques, etc. The owner is very kind and knowledgeable, and will always give you background historical information on whatever piece you're interested in if he happens to know, which he usually does. The best thing about this place is that the guys who own it have TASTE. Everything they have is always so beautiful. They have a certain sensibility, and it is so hard to come here and not buy everything. But it is also very reasonably priced, especially for the quality and vintage of some of the items, and also compared to the Brown Elephant across the street. Great place!

0.description: Mercantile M is a smaller storefront, but my goodness is it packed with amazing value.  I was looking for a very specific item and they had it!  It was amazingly under my budget and Sherman helped me load it into my wagon.  I couldn't be happier with the friendly service, selection, and incredible deal I got.Thanks!

5.description: This delightful little furniture store is fun to visit, because there are so many interesting and unique pieces in here. It is a bit above my price range, with furniture pieces being in the hundreds. I wouldn't say that I could find a good 'deal' here on my budget, but there are some interesting home decor items that would add character into a room for sure.

11.description: The man who runs it a a total dove!  He will gladly tell you about the pieces.* good prices [for Chicago]* cool stuff* sweet art!Love that this place is here!  It's like Grey Gardens has a sane nephew who they give stuff to and he sells it at reasonable prices.  VERY enjoyable shopping!!

8.description: Really nice furniture and home décor! The owner is really nice and really honest. While I was in the store, two guys from a delivery service came in to explain their services. The owner was really kind to the guys - a lot of store owners would not have been that cool. Like this place a lot!

4.description: Absolutely love this store! The owners are kind and will talk to you pretty much about anything; very friendly sort! They always have a good mix of things and are very reasonably priced.I've purchased some interesting things here, from a nude painting to a vintage earring display. All have garnered many compliments.Things move fast here so if you love it, get it before it's gone!

14.description: Small store, but great selection and cheap prices. Maybe the best antique store in Andersonville.

7.description: These guys are super awesome. I bought a cool antique schoolhouse light from them and had it installed by an electrician. Almost a year later, the lightbulb went out and, for the life of me, I couldn't figure out how to replace it - even after multiple google searches. We finally called the store to see if they knew. They remembered selling us the fixture and walked us through how to replace the bulb. They even had us email photos to help over the phone. Super appreciative for the service, and they have cool products!

1.description: NOT A VAPE SHOP AT ALL!!!! 99% tobacco have a very small actual juice selection.

9.description: I reserve the right to change the rating of this review at a later date.   This place has potential.  But the first impression left a lot to be desired.  A very small selection, Arab music blasting from the front counter and bare, white walls that made the store look like Hannibal Lectur's cell.   They had a nice humidor, but the cigar stock was predictable.  The guy behind the counter didn't seem to know anything about cigars, but he was pleasant enough.    The one positive was that the man who was working the counter said that they wanted feedback from the cigar smokers in the area, so that they can decide what cigars to stock in the future.  If that is the case, this could end up being a nice shop for the cigar smoker.  They have only been open a month, so I will try them again sometime down the road.

12.description: I'm a spoiled dude.I've been to the Humidor in Westmont and know what a GOOD shop is, and this is not one of em.Yes they have cigars in a room (not really a humidor if the door is a porch door) but are mainly mid to low tier. Grabbed my two and left.This is also a spot for you to go for all your one hitters and such.

21.description: This store is only a month old, and is still trying to find its niche. Is it a tobacconist or is it a head shop? Only time will tell. They've set up a humidor in the back of the shop, with a (still fairly small) selection of cigars. The front window is filled with hookahs. And a side case displays a variety of glass pipes and dugouts. Overall, the store is still pretty empty. I think the owner is just trying to hold on until he can build some sort of clientele. Good luck with that. I don't smoke, but I was intrigued by the possibility of a good tobacco shop on the Clark Strip. But trying to build up a serious cigar and pipe shop while still playing to the toker crowd seems an uphill struggle. For now, I'll withhold judgment and give the third star.

16.description: This is an update: I have recently given them a second chance when I went in to buy some pipe tobacco. The guy was helpful and nice, but he still needs to learn more about the products he carries. I honestly believe he doesn't smoke. Oh well, this place is still very convenient for me. They carry a variety of products from glass pipes, dugouts, one-hitters, and also regular briar tobacco pipes, cigars, cigarettes, and loose cigarette and pipe tobacco. So I have upped the rating from one to three stars. My original review is still here in it's entirety (I was a little bit emotional at the time).---------------------------I usually buy my tobacco from Andersonville Wine and Spirits on the corner, but sometimes I buy something at Ash's when the mood strikes. My wife and I try to shop locally, so we were excited to see a little tobacco shop pop up in our neighborhood. We mainly buy incense from this shop, but I have bought some loose tobacco and a cheap pipe from them.When they first opened the place was bare, but lately they have added some comfy chairs with little side tables, and some art on the wall. It is a little more inviting now, but I still don't see too many people go in there.The reason I am giving them one star is because of an incident I had with them on Christmas Eve. I bought a necklace for my wife as a little "extra" fun gift. I know I shouldn't expect much from a inexpensive necklace bought at a head-uh I mean tobacco-shop, but I didn't expect the item to literally fall apart as I took it out of the bag when I got home.So I decided to take it back and exchange it for something else. The guy behind the counter wouldn't take it back. He remembered me, and I had the receipt, but he refused to work with me. He kept insisting that the necklace was fine when he put it in the bag. He did offer to sell me something else at a discount, but I didn't want to spend more money, I just wanted to exchange the item. After more haggling, he pointed to a sign on the wall that says "All Sales Are Final." I can understand the sale being final for a pipe or a cigar, but a necklace is a different story altogether. These guys clearly have a few things to learn about customer service.As I walked out the door, I told the guy that he just lost two customers. We can buy cheap jewelry and incense from another shop down the street, and tobacco from Andersonville Wine and Spirits, who have exchanged defective items for me on several occasions.

17.description: I'm a big cigar lover, too big to buy locally (can't smoke 30%+ tobacco tax!). But there are times when I end up without a stogie. I was glad to find a place, in walking distance, to purchase a few cigars when the need struck. But there is very little selection here and frankly, the humidor is so humid that all the cigars are overly moist, soft & spongy. Some ppl like their cigars like that --- I'm not one of them.I don't like the fact that I have to let the cigars dryout before I can smoke them. There is a proper humidity to age cigars and another for smoking 'em.. cigar shops have to walk the fine line between the two.Now, the best place to buy cigars in Chicago (IMHO) is Binney's (cigars ready to smoke -- re: properly cared for -- at a good price) or better, Cigar King (ok, it's in Evanston, but just a quick trip over the border)... they have the best prices and good selections. Blue Havana and Rwies have good selections also, but at a premium price.As a cigar fan, I'm not a fan of Ashes... too limited a selection, too high in price, too poorly cared for cigars.

10.description: This place is a fucking gem for Wicker Park, that's for sure. I slipped in here randomly to grab some filtered tobacco tubes. $3 for a box of 250, which is a pretty damn awesome price. The guy in there also mentioned a 20% off sale for glass, and after a quick glance at the glass pieces they had to offer, I was already salivating. The pieces looked top-notch, very clear, clean designs. Didn't catch any initial prices on anything but the tubes I bought, however. I have a feeling they are quite reasonable, though. They haven't quite filled out their shelf space (seemingly because they are so new) but I'm looking forward to seeing how this place will grow. I was so in-and-out I didn't really assess prices of tobacco or anything. I do remember them having some novelty ashtrays. Definitely must go back.

5.description: I wish I could leave a review without a star because that is how much this business has offended me. I have come into this business numerous times and a middle eastern man behind the counter has been on the phone SCREAMING at someone using terms like "faggot" "nigger" and "mother fucker" in the middle of the day. I live in the area and have walked by this business numerous times and heard the same screaming and terrible language. I have also dealt with other employees in there before the first screaming incident and they have been uniformed and extremely rude. I will MOST DEFINITELY never shop there, ever and will happily go out of my way to a smoke shop in a different neighborhood to avoid supporting this business. I have never wanted a store to go out of business as badly as I do this one.

11.description: So it was crowded at Empire Liquors across the street and it felt like I was intruding on an all-girls event with my group. Decided to step outside to get some air and saw Ash's.Apparently they just opened that location. Seems to be owned by the same people that own the other Ash's. The guy who is running this store seemed really nice and I appreciated that they had Nat Sherman's there. Although, I don't smoke much if at all anymore I couldn't refuse buying a pack as it was very cheap and they gave me a free lighter. The guy also showed me his humidor and the selection wasn't the best, but it wasn't shabby either. If I actually wanted to kill myself earlier via smoking, I think I'd come here again..

3.description: The prices are decent, but the service is not. I have a lot of patience for retail. When customer volume is low, simple requests aren't too tough. It's an ok place.

0.description: this smoke shop (by clark & foster) is cheaper than the one in wicker park.i love me some hookah. and i pretty much refuse to smoke anything besides fantasia or starbuzz (bad experiences, gross flavors, headaches with other brands).a small pack of the fantasia will run me about $4 here, but they asked me for $6 in wicker park. although..wicker park has a MUCH larger selection of flavors (including red velvet..yuuuum.).also, i have one of the small colorful hookahs..$25 here. $40 in WP. say whaaaat?anyways..decent shop. they lack in variety, but always have something that i'm atleast interested in trying.the guy at the counter will ALWAYS ask you to pay with cash. every single time. THAT is annoying.but it's conveniently located, and my cheapest route. so i'll deal with having to tell him no every time.

20.description: Living just 2 minutes away from here, I really adore this shop. The owner is very personable and gives his customers a lot of personal attention. But, as the reviewer before me said, clearly it is still in a transitional phase, trying to figure out where it belongs in the world of tobacco and head shops. Personally, I use it as a head shop. There are some beautiful glass pipes in the store, but on my first visit, I wasn't able to find just the right one. I told the owner what sort of style I was looking for and by the end of the week, he had a larger selection for me to choose from, and I found just the right pipe for me! To help him out, I threw in a pack of cloves and some incense. I just think he needs to find a way to make the store look more full, because right now there is a lot of unused space which looks almost depressing. I hope they do well here!

19.description: This store is only a month old, and is still trying to find its niche. Is it a tobacconist or is it a head shop? Only time will tell. They've set up a humidor in the back of the shop, with a (still fairly small) selection of cigars. The front window is filled with hookahs. And a side case displays a variety of glass pipes and dugouts. Overall, the store is still pretty empty. I think the owner is just trying to hold on until he can build some sort of clientele. Good luck with that. I don't smoke, but I was intrigued by the possibility of a good tobacco shop on the Clark Strip. But trying to build up a serious cigar and pipe shop while still playing to the toker crowd seems an uphill struggle. For now, I'll withhold judgment and give the third star.

2.description: These guys are crooks, bought an expensive vaporizer. 2 days later it stopped working, tried to exchange. they were less than helpful. even when I purchased it, they refused to give me a receipt. don't waste your time or money.

18.description: Nice selection of hookas, tobacco, pipes...My friend and I stopped here and was fun to look at the assortment of tobacco and hookas! Very fun stuff : )

13.description: This place carries a lot of products that I was having to go all the way to Boystown to get...and they have great prices. They have just about a ton of glass pipes and some great metal pipes, too. A great addition to the store would be to carry Lava Lamps. Great local smoke shop.

4.description: Though this establishment had good low prices and adequateservice. Two times that i have used my credit card for purchases, within a week there have been fraudulent activity on my account. CC user's beware.

6.description: Been sitting waiting for them to open at 11 am per their website - it's now 11:39 am - do they even care?

15.description: Most stores try to gain customer trust and loyalty. This is not one of those stores. Every time I've purchased hardware from this store I've had to correct the clerk about the price tag. Sometimes they argue with me by telling me that they mislabeled it. Sometimes I'll negotiate until I get the real price and sometimes I'm too tired to argue about it. I come here about once a week, too.Most small purchases here are just a little overpriced which is valid, because there's no competition nearby. They'll have what you need. Don't buy pieces here, though. They're cheap-looking, poor-quality pieces that don't deserve your lips. Also, go next door for cigars. They don't know how to preserve them here. This place is just another example of a lazy store that needs a dose of old fashioned capitalist competition to inspire itself to become a neighborhood favorite. But until then, they get 2 stars for convenience.

7.description: It's like visiting a neighbor.  Their hours are perfect, and they don't act as it's a privilege just to be in their store.  Other places started out the same, but today they let you know who they prefer as customers.  Another cigar shop, not far away, will ring you up in a hurry, and say, "Okay, see you later.", after you have bought a sale priced cigar.  This other shop allows you to stay and smoke, but it's obvious they prefer the high priced cigar customers to hang around.  Ash's is the place to go for quality merchandise, staff who dispenses dignity and respect, and where they are always glad you came in.  Joe

8.description: "Do you smoke??" Always an awkward question. But I do know someone who does smoke. And she rolls her own. And she's European. Buying a pack of Camel Light 100's at Walgreen's doesn't cut it for her. We needed a place that could provide filters, papers, and a tobacco that she considered quality.   Ash's is really quite near my flat. And despite the fact that there is a war on, she decided to splurge and use up her rations.   She was very pleased with this shop, and I brought her here dozens of times.The shop clerk was very friendly, and rather handsome. There was some loud music playing, which surprised me...given the fact that he was on his mobile part of the time. Cigarettes are expensive. Period. Somehow rolling your own just makes it seem cheaper. Maybe it actually is. I do know that seeing my Euro friend roll a cigarette, or eine zigarette, as she called it, in front of an outdoor cafe is super hot. Should you need smokey supplies, I suggest visiting Ash's. He sells other things too...water pipes, regular pipes, cigars, and kittens. Just kidding. They don't sell kittens. You can't smoke them in a hookah.

14.description: To give them a fair shake, I've stopped back in a few times since my original review and admit that they're growing. I was on a hunt for a pack of smokes (which may or not have been for me) and was able to find what I needed just a tad cheaper than another place up the street. Plus, they always throw in a free, albeit cheapo, lighter, so I count that as a bonus. They also offer the $1-off discount when you purchase 2 packs. All that earns them a bump up to at least a mediocre rating. I don't know if they had it before or not, but they do carry loose tobacco. Makes sense to go with the hookahs, right??  Frankly, I only noticed it because on one of my visits, someone else requested some of it.  The selection certainly doesn't stand out unless you're browsing the entire store.I'm still traumatized by the last humidor experience, though I may ease myself back that way again to revisit it and see what's new. Look for yet another update in the future.

3.description: The love and artistry that is put into every project I've had done here is top of the line.  Barb is a master of her craft, her shop is lovely in its own right, and it seems like no odd request is beyond her ability.  If you have memories to frame or even a unique piece that needs an artist's touch, you will not be disappointed in the results from Painted Light.

1.description: We finally stopped in after breakfast at Pauline's today. The shop is very small but filled with so many unique finds. Barb was so welcoming and knowledgable about her products and their artists. We ended up getting a soy candle and we also walked away with the most unique lighter I've ever seen. Even though it was her last one from a few years ago and was used for the shop, she was willing to sell it to us for a "used" price! The framing she had displayed looked great as well, which is definitely her forte. All in all it's a great spot in the neighborhood to keep in mind and is worth the stop inside.

2.description: Barbara has framed six or seven pieces of art/photographs for us over the years, ranging from street art pieces brought back from vacation to wedding pictures. Every piece she has framed for us is beautiful and original. Her eye for detail and creativity is amazing and her work is impeccable. In addition to framing and art, the store has artisan gifts for the home and some jewelry. I can't recommend Painted Lights highly enough-thanks Barbara (and Duke the dog) for your great work!

0.description: Barb Laing is an artist.  I have had many things beautifully framed, restored and hand colored by this gifted artist.  We work together on many things (picking the best frame & mats) but I have also just dropped pieces off and said: "do your thing!" and I have never been disappointed!  She will frame anything and make it a true piece of art, plus she has a retail store that offers unique, wondrous gift items.

3.description: Carmelo Pena recently moved to Karma Salon to work with a wonderful team!  Carmelo has been a dear friend of mine for a very long time, and is also my hair stylist. Carmelo is never in a rush with his clients. His work is very detailed and I promise you will leave Karma a happy person. Carmelo specializes in women and men haircuts and color. You will have a fabulous experience with Carmelo at Karma!

1.description: I get my hair cut and colored by Christopha. He consistently does an amazing job and is a talented colorist. Every time I come in I always see his female clients leaving with beautiful hair color. Get in touch with him and book an appointment at christopha.com

2.description: Followed my beloved Daniel here and im so glad he's happy here at this salon. Its small but very nice! there's a cute breakfast/lunch diner next door.Not the easiest to get to by public transportation but daniel is worth it.Afterwards you can walk down the street for a slice of pie!!! =)

5.description: For a good "men's cut" or fade there is no one better than Chris. Extremely knowledgeable and friendly made the experience all the better. I will not go to anyone else. TOP NOTCH!

6.description: Christopha is the best. I followed him when he moved to Karma. I am always really pleased with my color and cut. He has a great designer's eye and a lot of fun too. Karma has a great, relaxed vibe.

7.description: I followed Chris Zamastil here from Restoration salon. I have very curly hair and it takes a really good stylist to cut it so it isn't boxy or over-layered. He is such an expert and gives the best cuts!I have been keeping my natural color for years, so getting my hair dyed red was a little scary. Chris gave me the most amazing highlights. I have never had anyone do my highlights and not have them look somewhat streaky. These blonde highlights look so natural! Really impressive. And he nailed the red color completely. Red is hard to master and I have reddish tones already, so it is a challenge to color. He is SO good at what he does.His prices are reasonable. And he is very friendly and sweet. What more could you ask for?

8.description: Love this place. I get my hair done (color and cut) by Brad. Brad does an amazing job every time. I like to try new things and he is very helpful guiding me to what I want but also respecting my opinion. He gives me advice when I want it, but when it comes down to it, he will do what I ask.I like coming to this salon because there is easy parking, the salon itself is not busy or rushed and everyone there is so laid back. I don't feel that it is overpriced for the service and quality that I am getting. It's easy to get an appointment, even on a Saturday.

9.description: I've always avoided hair salons that didn't actually have some sort of the word "cut" in their name.  It's probably the feeling like I don't belong there...amongst the pretty people dressed in designer black turtlenecks.Well, now I've found a place where I feel comfy.I think I've finally formed a relationship with my hairdresser, Miss Tori...we're going on over a year now and I think she might be the one.  I was refered to her from a friend, and she was very tender with me after I told her of a bad haircut experience I had months prior.  She was always careful not to cut beyond my comfort level, and as finally wanted to go shorter...she eased me nicely into it.Part of me was weary of sharing Tori, and Karma with you all...since I'll probably have to make my appointments months in advance, but hey they deserve it.

0.description: I go to Karma to see Christopha, who has been taking care of my hair for 10 years now. It's quite amazing each time I see him he has some fresh ideas on how to get the next fab look. He's extremely skilled colorist: we went from several different shades of blond to pinks, purpure, blue, navy, many pastel shades to highlights, to multi tones, yet my hair is healthy and soft in touch.I appreciate that each time I come for my appointment, Christopha takes into account several factors: season, weather, my schedule, the condition of my hair. As an introvert and not really chatty person, I'm happy that he doesn't have overwhelming, drama personality you can often see at the hair salon. Finally, the online booking tool is super convenient and Christopha responses quickly.Booking via christopha.com or 7734942290.

4.description: Great salon. I'm a masculine-presenting queer-identified woman, and I travel for business -- I knew Karma was lesbian-owned, and I was overjoyed to get an absolutely smashing and handsome haircut there. Skilled, professional, and friendly.

1.description: I have been going to this Salon for over 10 years. I gladly drive over 45 miles to get this level of service. They are excellent  at what they do and an excellent  team. Their Salon is extremely  neat and they are very particular  with cleanliness.Tania is a fabulous at threading/waxing and is a perfectionist,  so you will never walk away disappointed.  Edwin is great with his cuts and threading. I highly  recommend Rehab!

9.description: Tanya has been doing my eyebrows for over 7  years and I love her.  I occasionally do my eyebrows by a friend when I can't make it to the salon but I rarely trust anyone with my eyebrows. She's quick, clean, and does an amazing job. She's an amazing person and I don't know what I would do if she stopped doing my eyebrows!!!

23.description: I was a client of Tonya's (the owner) when she worked at another salon and I stayed with her when she opened Rehab.  Her prices are awesome and she works quickly to get you through the various waxing services that we ladies put ourselves through in a professional and comfortable manner.  She always accomodates my schedule too and has stayed open late to take my appointments when I couldn't get there earlier.  She is really great to her clients.  She's awesome, and the salon is not huge but modern and nice.

25.description: I love Rehab Salon!If you go there you must ask for Tanya she does an incredible job with eyebrows, upper lip and waxing!  Parking can be tough around the area, but you will likely find a spot one block away.

12.description: So...my eyebrow lady whom I have been faithful to for years decided to go to India and didn't notify any customers. I of course, having the bushy eyebrows that I have and being the pickiest gal---I totally FREAKED! Eyebrows are serious business, the wrong person can make you or break you, trust me, I have been there. I asked my aunt (who is also very particular about her eyebrows) and she recommended Tanya from Rehab Salon. So, I went --parking was awesome, the salon is open until 8pm, it is super clean and smells good. I got my eyebrows threaded and they look amazing! Feel beautiful all over again. Sigh* Tanya is better than my farewell Indian lady. She takes her time on each side to acheive perfection and believe me she does. Price: only $7--a steal!  She is such a sweetheart. If you are looking for someone to shape your eyebrows nicely, take their time and not leave your eyebrows so thin that you will need a sharpie--Tanya is your lady! She is awesome! I know a ton of people who go there and strongly recommend her for waxing as well. I will be going there forever for eyebrows and wax!

21.description: So...my eyebrow lady whom I have been faithful to for years decided to go to India and didn't notify any customers. I of course, having the bushy eyebrows that I have and being the pickiest gal---I totally FREAKED! Eyebrows are serious business, the wrong person can make you or break you, trust me, I have been there. I asked my aunt (who is also very particular about her eyebrows) and she recommended Tanya from Rehab Salon. So, I went --parking was awesome, the salon is open until 8pm, it is super clean and smells good. I got my eyebrows threaded and they look amazing! Feel beautiful all over again. Sigh* Tanya is better than my farewell Indian lady. She takes her time on each side to acheive perfection and believe me she does. Price: only $7--a steal!  She is such a sweetheart. If you are looking for someone to shape your eyebrows nicely, take their time and not leave your eyebrows so thin that you will need a sharpie--Tanya is your lady! She is awesome! I know a ton of people who go there and strongly recommend her for waxing as well. I will be going there forever for eyebrows and wax!

16.description: AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE!  Tanya was not there....I had scheduled an appt with the girl replacing her not sure what her name is...I go there a few min before my appt and shes like 'oh I thought you're appt was an hour ago'.  I know that's not true because I knew I wasnt getting off work by that time. I think she overbooked and tried to make up an excuse. I asked if I should come back at a later time and she said I can take you in 30 min - I said okay...however by the time that rolled around she had other clients and asked me to come in at a later time.... Pissed off is an understatement...if you already know how many ppl you have waiting on you - how hard is it to do the math? I suggested to come in at a later time from the getgo. I have a full time job and two kids wasting 30-40 min of my time is like wasting days

17.description: Edwin rocks !!!!! Go here and you'll be happy  ! :)

10.description: Edwin (hair cut and color) and Tanya (eyebrow threading) are great at what they do. Highly recommended :)

5.description: Edwin gave me one of my fave haircuts I've ever had and for an unbeatable price. I called for an appointment and he got me in that day. He was very attentive to what I was asking for and really cares about making his clients happy. I was in and out in an hour and felt like a million bucks!

11.description: I work in the area and Rehab was suggested to me by a friend. I got to my appointment about ten mine early and my stylist was not there. In fact there was no one there. I was greeted and told to wait and that was it. The woman working took someone in the back and i sat out front for ten minutes alone. My stylist was ten or fifteen minutes late and came in right when I was going to walk out. Which I probably should have done. He washed my hair with cold water, basically scolded me for the way my hair was, tried to sell me on getting color and cut way too much off. He basically didnt listen to me at all and I will not be going back there again. The salon still looks super unfinished and I went there out of a recommendation which turned out to be a bad one.

22.description: $30 Brazilian Wax....all the time! Crazy, right? It was an okay experience because I think you get what you pay for. She wasn't very sympathetic to my pain (my arms were shaking and feeling the throbbing in my head) and double dipped with the applicator. That seemed kind of shady, but the salon and the room were very clean. She did a very fast job...pretty quick and dirty. If you're strapped for cash, but need to freshen up, this is a decent alternative to those $80 waxes....

0.description: I had my eyebrows threaded by Tania. She's quick, efficient, and very nice. Plus, you really can't beat the price for the quality of work she does. I will be returning!

20.description: I got my eye brows threaded and my legs waxed by Tanya and she is absolutely amazing, efficient, and sooo quick.

19.description: I got my eye brows threaded and my legs waxed by Tanya and she is absolutely amazing, efficient, and sooo quick.

2.description: Tania is the best at what she does!!!!!She always does my eyebrows and I WOULD NOT trust anyone else!They are very friendly, both Edwin and Tania are nice to customers at all times

18.description: The threading and the waxing is phenomenal. I have super-sensitive skin, so a lot of times waxing leaves me very red and puffy, and usually with breakouts as well. She did a great job waxing and threading, the place is very clean and nice, and I cannot believe how inexpensive everything was compared to other places in the area. Plus, my skin reacted very well. Definitely recommend!

13.description: Edwin is a rare find - he does an absolute amazing job and I couldn't think of ever going anywhere else for a haircut. The straight razor at the end of the haircut is a great touch, he's very affordable and very accommodating. My wife sees him and Tanya for eyebrow threading and is amazed at the job everytime she goes. It's great shop, very new and modern.

4.description: I love this place! In and out in under 10 mins. For eyebrow thread! Everyone that works there is super sweet and delicate with my sensitive skin, plus it's a great deal compared to some threading/waxing$ in the area! Seriously don't pass this place up!

24.description: Tanya is Excellent I have been a client of hers for years now, and she is professional and great at what she does!!!!!!! :) Artist  parking isnt great but well worth it!

6.description: I went here today to clean up my eyebrows at around noon. I've never been here before and they didn't have their own website so to be on the safe side I called them the day before to make an appointment. Atmosphere: Very clean and spacious with good lighting. It wasn't very busy. There was only one worker (who I'm assuming was Edwin based on the other reviews here. He didn't introduce himself) and one customer when I walked in. Experience: Edwin did a good and quick job on my brows. My eyebrows were nicely shaped and neat, however it was not the most painless threading experience that I've had (but it wasn't any crazy pain, just some pinching here and there). When I went home I realized that I got a very small nick above my left lid, but I can easily cover it up with makeup.Overall, I'm mostly satisfied. I might come back here again to see how Tania/Tanya would do my eyebrows.

15.description: Tania is phenomenal. I am a stylist but work out in the suburbs. I have had some TERRIBLE experiences with my thick unruly brows. I've seen the salon (catchy name lol)  but never thought to go in until I found the reviews on yelp. I went in today and the customer service sucks but I got in w Tania and I have to say she did a fantastic, quick and painless job... So I let her do my lip. Painless. she's a master at threading! All for just $10. I'm happy.

7.description: Just an update to say that the last two times I went in, I needed a daytime eyebrow threading appointment when Tanya wasn't there and Edwin was great!  Rehab is the best for brows.

8.description: Wonderful haircut by Edwin. Down to earth people who do high quality haircuts for a fair price. I felt very taken care of. I came in with an idea for my long hair and Edwin had lots of advice for the style and care of my hair, especially for when I was home to do it myself. 100% going back and suggesting this place to everyone.

3.description: Edwin is amazing!!!!!!!!! I went to him for his services about once every 2 weeks. He is very friendly and completed my hair and makeup eyebrows very quickly! I left his salon each time feeling fabulous!!! I wouldn't get off work til late in Deerfield, so I traveled an hour to go see him and it was always worth it. I've r century moved to Atlanta GA and I wish he could open up shop here lol

14.description: Tanya does the best threading! She always leaves my eyebrows looking great. I always get compliments on them. :)

1.description: Shamrock Shakes are back!Already?And man are they cheap--$2.62 for a medium.  We are a long way from the five-dollar milkshake.  Why it costs less money to employ chemical engineers rather than actual dairy farmers I'll never understand.  But since I don't want to turn green like the color of the shake, I limit myself to one of these things per year.  But holy chromosomal damage Batman, they are so goddamn good.

9.description: Today I patronized this McDonals to try out their new CBO burgers.  Before doing, I ran across the street to check to see the hours of operation on the window of a neighboring business.  After eating my sandwhich in the store I came out to my car to find a boot on it for which I had to pay $140 to remove.  Worse yet, there was absolutely "nothing that anyone could do" to address the situation.  This includes the management of the restaurant as well as the employees of the parking company who applied the boot.  It is honestly the most outrageus thing that has EVER happened to me.

12.description: I bet you're asking yourself, "McDonald's, why the hell is this big-headed douche bag reviewing McDonald's?  What a douche."Well just hold on a minute.  This McDonald's is like no other I've ever been to.  The kitchen is wide, the staff extremely capable.The food...I don't order.  I'll get a coffee, maybe a hash brown, that's it.  The big draw for me is the clientele.  I'm telling you, this place is like the friggin' UN.  All shapes and sizes, gathered together for the senior citizen's discount and the ample seating.  Just make sure you show up on a weekend morning.  Men from the Korean delegation sit around long tables and sip coffee, having impassioned conversations in a language I can't understand, but love to listen to.  As I sip crappy coffee, and slather cheap hash browns in ketchup.  I'm also convinced that homeless people come here to kill time (shocker I know).  This seems non threatening enough, but sometimes it smells a bit like urine.  Nothing a little bleach can't fix.It feels strange to say this, but this McDonalds feels very European to me, lots of people packed into a little dining room, presiding over their dollar menu items.  Not so much eating, as considering.  Wondering what language the guy sitting next to them is speaking.For my dollar, not much more fun to be had on the North side of Chicago on a cold Sunday morning.  So dig deep into your change jar and get ready to have your preconceived notions of what a McDonald's SHOULD look like completely obliterated.

21.description: I try to avoid this place as much as possible because every Happy Meal adds a centimeter to my waist, but occasionally I succumb (particularly during hangovers).This McDonald's is your average Mickey Dee's with one aesthetic twist: it's Olympic-themed. And not just Olympic-themed, but spewing multi-colored rings from every direction, over-the-top photos/memorabilia in glass cases Olympic-themed. Given the decorations in other McDonalds' I've been to, it's not such a bad look. The employees are also pretty on top of things. My only major gripe is that the tables are rarely wiped down. This is not really a huge surprise, but still.

16.description: I'll admit it, sometimes I tell myself if I get out of bed at that exact moment, I can reward myself with McDonald's breakfast.It's a typical McDonald's... sometimes the service is efficient and polite. Sometimes the service is terribly slow and you get the wrong food (like a sausage biscuit with no sausage...sad).This McDonald's definitely attracts some interesting clientele. But, if you've convinced yourself to get out of bed and go to work, the sausage biscuit will be delicious regardless of conditions.

17.description: I try to avoid this place as much as possible because every Happy Meal adds a centimeter to my waist, but occasionally I succumb (particularly during hangovers).This McDonald's is your average Mickey Dee's with one aesthetic twist: it's Olympic-themed. And not just Olympic-themed, but spewing multi-colored rings from every direction, over-the-top photos/memorabilia in glass cases Olympic-themed. Given the decorations in other McDonalds' I've been to, it's not such a bad look. The employees are also pretty on top of things. My only major gripe is that the tables are rarely wiped down. This is not really a huge surprise, but still.

10.description: If you plan to grow old alone, come here for a preview of your future. This store probably sells more small coffees than any other McDonald's in the city. And I'm still giving it 3 stars, because despite the old, and the tribes of teenagers who descend every weekday afternoon, it's a pretty decent McD's.

5.description: This place sucks.  They hired power washers to clean their building at 1am during the summer which kept or woke up a lot of neighbors from the loud motor running.  Someone eventually called the cops and they sat around doing a whole lot of nothing.  God bless America, amiright?!

11.description: Pretty dirty for a McDonalds - maybe I'm just used to ones downstate where everything is spotless?  Went on a saturday around 4pm - way after the lunch rush - and most of the tables still had crap on them.

22.description: I normally despise everything about McDonald's; its politics, its business plan to take over the world, its offerings that are just a notch above soup kitchen.  However, they recently changed their coffee from a horrific, thin & watery dishwater to something akin to "gourmet" (their words).  So of course, me being the coffee addict and snob I decide to take a whack at it.This McDonalds appears to have been remodeled within the last few years.  The exterior is very cheery and neat.  The drive thru lanes, albeit arranged for the most illiterate of the population, are clear and well-marked.  The girl on the speaker actually got my order correct on the first try!  Yay!  And a small coffee cost all of $1 (plus tax).So I drive around to pay.  Like most fast-food joints with a drive-thru, the person who takes your money is also the one who takes the order from the cars.  So I hand over my money, wait for change, and ignore the girl taking the order from the car behind me.  Suddenly I hear a sharp tone in her voice.  I look up and realize she has stopped communicating with the other car and is now addressing me.  Well, sorry sweetheart, but you are in the same category as those folks who use little ear-piece cell phones.  I have no idea when you have stopped talking to the other person and now want to chat it up with me.  She seemed peeved by my obliviousness.  Oh well.I get my coffee and while it is better than the old swill that used to be served, it still is very sub-par. Drinkable but only in that "I've been on the road for 12 hours with no decent coffee places in sight and will die without caffeine now" way.  I cannot vouch for the food as I'd rather not eat than order a Big Mac.

0.description: There's a few things about this McDonald's that get me down. First, like many McDonald's they don't seem to care who sits in their booths or for how long. Many times I've gone in, and seen the booths all filled, one customer a piece, nursing only a small coffee, but clearly in it for the long haul reading a paper, staring vacantly out the window, or going through one of their bags of belongings. I feel bad for these folks as they don't seem to have anywhere to go or anywhere to be, but sometimes it would be nice to find a booth for my family. It's okay, it's like that in McDonalds around the country, maybe the world, it's just annoying how often it happens. Another annoyance, as of a few months ago at least, they were employing some jackass to sit in their car all day to monitor whether or not people were parking in their lot then going elsewhere, ready to pounce and give them an expensive boot. So beware, you will most certainly be booted if you even go next door for a second. Crappy business practice in my view but whatever, it's their place. Before they employed this goon I've never seen the lot completely full ever, so I'm not sure what happened. From what I understand though this boot company approaches businesses with an offer to monitor their lot, and perhaps give McDs a cut of the profits I don't know. That's vulture capitalism for you. Hopefully this kind of practice will be outlawed some day but for right now they've got a zero tolerance policy.The food here is standard, nothing special, nothing gross. The staff is always courteous, if not friendly. They've messed up my order many times when I've come through the drive through, but isn't that normal for McDonalds?It's usually fairly clean though they do seem to have trouble cleaning off the unused tables sometimes. Maybe they're just completely surprised when a table is vacated. Overall, you know, it's a McDonalds. It's not dirty or dangerous, the lot is clean and safe (just not for cars whose owners leave to go next door for a minute). You'll get your fast food fast, and you won't lose any fingers.

20.description: I guess if you're looking for McDonald's, this is McDonald's.  I ate here once before the far superior quick sandwich option "Piatto Pronto" was open literally next door (to the north on Clark). Quoth the raven, `Nevermore.'

19.description: Its clean, fast, and friendly.  Can't ask for more at a MickyD's

2.description: Still never fails to upset me. still no ice cream, no pies, no parfaits.dont waste your time. I am giving up on this location, I will find another location.

18.description: It's a McDonald's. Do you really need a review on a McDonald's?

13.description: All I wanted was a chocolate shake and some fries. I couldn't wait! "We don't serve shakes at this time." WHAT?! I know, it was 3 am on a weekend, but that is exactly when they *should* serve shakes! I settled for a soda with the fries, pull up to the window and... "Sorry. Cash Only." What kind of McDonald's doesn't take credit? (you might be asking yourself, what kind of person doesn't carry enough cash to cover soda and fries... whatever) Luckily it was one occasion where I actually did have cash. But still, what kind of McDonald's is this?! I will say, the fries were delicious.

4.description: I was there this morning to get some breakfast, and the manager name Carlos was very nasty person. And this was not the first time he done this. I will never come back to this place again  and I think it's a good think

6.description: Oh McDonald's... a guilty pleasure to be sure. I eat here far more often than I should. For some reason, something is always wrong with the dispensers. There are two soda machines, one will dispense soda but no ice, the other ice but no soda. Usually only one of the ketchup dispensers is working. It's a crap shoot as to whether or not they will mess up your order, though the service is always friendly. The patrons often times provide some entertainment, though you will also probably get asked for change by a few of them.

15.description: I normally despise everything about McDonald's; its politics, its business plan to take over the world, its offerings that are just a notch above soup kitchen.  However, they recently changed their coffee from a horrific, thin & watery dishwater to something akin to "gourmet" (their words).  So of course, me being the coffee addict and snob I decide to take a whack at it.This McDonalds appears to have been remodeled within the last few years.  The exterior is very cheery and neat.  The drive thru lanes, albeit arranged for the most illiterate of the population, are clear and well-marked.  The girl on the speaker actually got my order correct on the first try!  Yay!  And a small coffee cost all of $1 (plus tax).So I drive around to pay.  Like most fast-food joints with a drive-thru, the person who takes your money is also the one who takes the order from the cars.  So I hand over my money, wait for change, and ignore the girl taking the order from the car behind me.  Suddenly I hear a sharp tone in her voice.  I look up and realize she has stopped communicating with the other car and is now addressing me.  Well, sorry sweetheart, but you are in the same category as those folks who use little ear-piece cell phones.  I have no idea when you have stopped talking to the other person and now want to chat it up with me.  She seemed peeved by my obliviousness.  Oh well.I get my coffee and while it is better than the old swill that used to be served, it still is very sub-par. Drinkable but only in that "I've been on the road for 12 hours with no decent coffee places in sight and will die without caffeine now" way.  I cannot vouch for the food as I'd rather not eat than order a Big Mac.

7.description: Avoid this place like a plague. I'll admit that because its McDonalds, you should know what you getting into. Got fast food, be prepared to wait a while at the drive thru.  Going inside isn't better. It's like an insane asylum. There has to be another place closer. I find it hard to realize corporate keeps this place open. I guess the homeless trash that yells at the counter has enough change to keep the place profitable.

8.description: DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS YOUR FAST FOOD IS WORTH THE $140 "PRIVATE BUSINESS" PARKING FINE!!!  The Management has an arrangement with the parking lot company to boot any cars parked there if you leave without your car - regardless of whether or not you've bought food there. After buying food at McDonald's, I went next store to pick up some pre-made soup from the business next store for a sick family member at home.  I returned 5 minutes later to find my car booted and the parking lot attendant demanding $140 to remove the boot before I could leave. This is an OUTRAGEOUS practice and is ABSOLUTELY no way to treat your customers!  I live in the area and I will *NOT* be returning to this franchise ever and will ensure that no one I know does either. DO NOT GO HERE - there are plenty of other McDonald's locations that know how to treat a customer!!  I'd give them negative stars if I could.

3.description: McDonalds is McDonalds and this one had a bathroom open to the public near Midsommarfest.

14.description: it's a Mcdonalds.BUT They have sparkly chairs that i really enjoy.Anyone know why its an Olympic themed one?

58.description: I must say I loved this place! They have a great amount of vegan/ veggie dishes and a very Ethiopian atmosphere. I came here for lunch and order the vegan platter. I got the Duba Wat, Gomen, Tikil Gomen and the Ye-Shembera Asa Wat. All of which were amazing but my favorite was the chickpea dumplings (Ye...)! They had great texture and the spices in the thick sauce were perfectly balanced.. spicy but flavorful! The injera (Ethiopian crepe-like bread meant to be used for eating with instead of silverware) was perfectly sour and spongy for each of the dishes. Yum!Just as other reviewers have stated though, the one reason why they didn't get a full 5 starts is because service was slow and clueless at times. I would love to come back with a bottle of wine (BYOB) and simply enjoy the atmosphere, food and time with my friends!

56.description: Lalibela Ethoipian was pretty good. I've been to Demera and Ethiopian Diamond and I think  the food at those establishments is more flavorful. I was somewhat disappointed with the Ye-Shembera Asa Wat, which I Iove at Ethiopian Diamond. However, we were generally pleased with the food. Where Lalibela shines is  atmosphere and it's BYOB policy. It's a cozy, uncrowded space and our bill was unbelievably cheap because we brought out own wine.

29.description: After finding this place on yelp, I went last night for my birthday with a group of seven people and had a blast. Similar to what some people said, service is great, but meal preparation can be slow. Before the other guests arrived, I simply told the woman how many people were coming, how many of us ate meat, and that I trusted her to pick whatever she thought was best. She did great.Everything worked out splendidly - food came about thirty minutes after my friends showed up, we enjoyed very affordable BYOB ($3.50 per wine bottle), and our entire meal came out to $15 a person, including tip. If you're looking for an affordable, delicious Ethiopian for a group, I think this is the best option in the city.

42.description: I knew things were going well when I asked how many options we could select if we were each sharing a vegetarian sampler and the waiter told us that they were flexible and we could pretty much tell him what we wanted. As we were constructing our platter we asked for a range of spiciness with the dishes they thought would be appropriate to be really spicy to come out really spicy. They didn't hold back as the Te-Shembera Asa Wat (ground chickpea dumplings) was super spicy (I loved it, my dining companion who doesn't have my same threshold for spicy food found it a little too spicy but loved the dish besides that). Moral of the story is that they will definitely deliver when it comes to spicy if that's what you want. Fortunately for my dining companion they did a great job offering mixing up the level of spice across the dishes. We also really liked the okra, the diblik atkilt, and the duba wat. The injera was delicious and this place is BYOB!!!!Great service, great value, and a BYOB Ethiopian, this will definitely be our go to place when we're craving Ethiopian food.

23.description: YUM. I went here on a wintry Saturday with friends and am glad that I did. A family owned and operated BYOB spot, it was full to the brim. While service was a little slow since there were just 2 people, I didn't mind because we were able to eat at a leisurely pace and not feel rushed. The staff were super friendly and helpful with answering questions about the food. I'd definitely come back here, and they also had larger groups in addition to small parties.This place is adorable and although it may be a trek for some, completely worth it. Plus, it's BYOB, they have neat carved wooden chairs, and the staff is friendly and helpful with choosing dishes that complement one another. A place with such a welcoming atmosphere, Lalibela's a great spot to go here and have a long meal with loved ones and friends.We ordered 1 vegetarian platter, a shrimp entree and a lamb dish (both the shrimp and lamb dishes come with your choice of vegetables, so for the vegetarian platter we chose things that weren't on it) and managed to be fully satiated without being overly full - definitely a good idea to just get 3 entrees for 4 people as injera can be quite filling. The injera bread here is darker (maybe whole wheat or a different style from what I've had at any other Ethiopian restaurant in Chicago or NYC) and delicious. Although I don't remember everything we ordered regarding the vegetables, I know that the chickpeas, okra and collard greens are delicious.One more thing: if you like spicy food, definitely ask for heat! The next time I'm here I will; since it was our first go-round as a group we didn't ask but will definitely do so. The food was delicious without it, but I would have enjoyed some additional heat.

47.description: I tried venturing out of my usual ethiopian places (Ras Dashen and Ethiopian Diamond) and had a mixed experience. Their Doro Wat was amazing - best i've had in chicago!  I wasn't a big fan of the gored gored. The injera was ok, but not as godo as the other places (and not as fresh). The prices are a little less than at  Ras Dashen and Ethiopian Diamond (and it's BYOB). I'll definitely go back for the Doro Wat!

8.description: Lalibela Ethiopian continues to be an excellent choice in Andersonville.   We've eaten here every week for the last several months and it is consistently good and the service very friendly.

31.description: Delicious. Really funky interior, delicious food, and VERY cheap. Previous reviews mentioned very slow service, which we were lucky enough not to experience. Our server was very nice and helpful and everything we ate was amazing. Will definitely be going back again and again!We ate the tomato salad, dandelion greens, a beef dish, and a chicken dish. Needless to say, we finished almost all the injera as well. It was a perfect meal.

34.description: ok lets start off with the lack of waitstaff. I get that its a small place and they might want to cut back on labor costs....but one older gentleman for a 50 seat restaurant? We were greeted right away and seated as there were only a few people there. about 10 mins went by before we even saw someone to ask for menu. It  says "it takes time to make fresh food so please be patient."  well was an hour from the time we sat down to when the food came. The food: So I really dont know why Ethiopian restaurants seem to charge so much more than any restaurant for less the food. We had the Kefta...which are supposed to be special meatballs....totally not made in house....in fact I will go as far as to say they are GFS frozen meatballs.....They were noway homemade....VERY DISAPPONTED since the app was 4.00 for four meatballs with toothpicks.....they need a lesson in plating. I will say that the rest of the meal was really good . I had shrimp and my partner had lamb. I will say with definity that I will not be returning to this establishment.

16.description: ok lets start off with the lack of waitstaff. I get that its a small place and they might want to cut back on labor costs....but one older gentleman for a 50 seat restaurant? We were greeted right away and seated as there were only a few people there. about 10 mins went by before we even saw someone to ask for menu. It  says "it takes time to make fresh food so please be patient."  well was an hour from the time we sat down to when the food came. The food: So I really dont know why Ethiopian restaurants seem to charge so much more than any restaurant for less the food. We had the Kefta...which are supposed to be special meatballs....totally not made in house....in fact I will go as far as to say they are GFS frozen meatballs.....They were noway homemade....VERY DISAPPONTED since the app was 4.00 for four meatballs with toothpicks.....they need a lesson in plating. I will say that the rest of the meal was really good . I had shrimp and my partner had lamb. I will say with definity that I will not be returning to this establishment.

13.description: I tried Lalibela for the first time last week and I am so happy to have found this hidden gem in Andersonville. I have been to many Ethiopian restaurants, but the food and atmosphere here is amazing! Our food was very fresh, flavorful and the spices on point. Our meal was made to order and the smell of the food when we walked in immediately had us drooling. The server was incredibly friendly and the background music was great for relaxing. We loved the huge seats and decor. The place is intimate and you feel like you have it all to yourself - great for a date night or a small get together with friends. Prices are reasonable and it's BYOB. Lalibela makes me crave Ethiopian food, and will probably make you too! Highly recommend the Yebeg Tibs (lamb dish) and Yesiga Sambusas. Delicious!

11.description: I tried this place for the first time and had a blast. I had no problems with service. The host was very accommodating and offered his favorite choices. We had the vegetarian combo along with a lamb and chicken dish. I loved everything. It was also my birthday and the restaurant brought out a large slice of delicious cake. This night was fabulous. I will be back again to explore more of the menu.

39.description: This place is really a 3.5 But it is oooh so cute!Okay with 100 reviews it wasn't exactly lost but it was new me and oh so good.What we ordered:EverythingAppetizer:Yemser ~ pastry filled with lentils ~ pretty goodSpinach Sambusa ~ decentSalads:Lalibela Selata ~ awesomely lightly dressed Entrees:Lentil salad ~ nice blendYesmer Wat ~ flavorfulAter Kik ~ I love yellow split peas ~ but I thought these was a little too cruchy.Gomen ~ collards were goodDefen Yemiser Wat ~ green lentils were good. Seasoned well.Duba Wat ~ this was the banger. I was pleasently surprised by the sweetness and the spiceness of this dishShuro~ these chickpeas were good but not the best.Quosta ~ the spinach was decent but didn't stand outYe-Shembera Asa Wat ~

37.description: Lalibela's owners obviously love what they do. The care they put into preparing their food as well as into the presentation and ambience clearly come through. The host was most courteous and she helped put together a combo vegetarian plate with a range of lentils and vegetables, with injera. The vegetables included a beautifully cooked butternut squash, a green bean/zucchini preparation, collard greens, and a subtle mushroom preparation - each of them complementing the other in flavour and texture. The host also was most helpful in giving me info about the excellent traditional music they had playing. Highly recommended!

0.description: Loved the veggie combo (and how you can choose 4 types of dishes what you want in your combo) and beef tibs here.  We originally ordered chicken tibs but the waiter messed up and gave us beef.  That was actually good, found the beef tibs to be much better than the chicken.  Love to come back again and again. Service is somewhat slow, it took a long time to get the waiters' attention to order, refill water, get the check, and everything that you need them to do.

38.description: I find it hard to knock a place with so many veggie options BUT the food was mostly just okay (the shiro was gross and reminded me of spaghetti), the service was friendly but terribly slow and inattentive, and there are just so many cheaper and better options!

51.description: I loved it.  My wife was a little less impressed.  The food was very unique and flavorful.  Service was on the slow side.  BYOB is a plus.

27.description: Injera was very tasty: I guess the teff makes a big difference? It looked really appetizing, which might have added to the overall effect. The lentil appetizer was delicious, making me wish we'd ordered a lentil entree.  I liked the squash entree a lot, too. The mushroom and spinach entrees were decent comfort-food. The chickpea in berebere sauce I thought confusing (what...is...that texture?) but my companion liked it quite a bit.Two problems: cleaning the tables with Windex means that you seat people in an area that stinks like solvent. It was really offputting. Also, if neither my card nor her card will run, the problem isn't our cards, it's your machine. At least have the good grace to admit that, and suggest a solution (closest ATM?) rather than shrugging and walking away.

32.description: I really enjoyed last night's excursion out to the one Ethiopian place I know *not* on Broadway. The food was delicious! I especially loved the Duba Wat (butternut squash) and the Yesega Wat (beef). The price is perfect. Two of us ate to fullness and didn't pay more than $35.The staff (a family, I believe) was very kind, and we enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant.It would have been nice to have them leave water jugs on the tables because I was constantly thirsty with an empty glass. Service is slow and relaxed, and this extends to even the drinks.I would certainly go again, but I would bring my own extra drinks; it's BYOB!

54.description: I may need to try this place out again because we may have had an atypical experience. We went in starving on a Thursday evening and the place, though it looked empty from outside, was packed inside with two large groups and maybe four other tables of two.  We stood in the doorway, waiting to be seated, with no hostess or waitstaff in sight for at least 3-4 minutes. Finally a waitress came and acknowledged us and sat us at a table with menus.  And there we sat while she attempted to serve food to the two huge tables.  We sat with the menus for probably close to ten minutes; we were about to walk out (we were starving and had we gone to our favorite Ethiopian place, we would have already had honeywine and food by then), then she came and took our order.  They didn't have any honeywine, though she said they'd have it in a couple week's time because they had just gotten their liquor license.  Once our order was taken, our food came out pretty quickly.  The injera is darker and somehow "pungier" than it is at other Ethiopian places and it was cold; I personally didn't like it as much as the lighter version at other places and didn't appreciate that it was cold.  The wine my partner ordered (a white wine), however, came out at room temperature.  The food was good.  We had more choices for a vegetarian combo than we do at other places (could chose any veggie option instead of just certain numbers), so that was nice.  Out of four veggie choices, two we liked better than our typical place, two we liked less, so it was a horse-a-piece.  So perhaps, if there was MORE THAN one waitress working a full dining room and if they had chilled honeywine and not cold injera, it might be a good contender.  The ambiance is good (minus the TV in the corner - a pet peeve of mine) and the place cozy, but needs some polishing to hold up to it's contenders on Broadway.  The prices are reasonable and comparable to other places, maybe slightly less for a combo and a few dollars less for individual veggie choices too.  And the wine my partner got was $3.75, so even though it was warm, at least it was cheap.

48.description: Love the BYOB! The food is delicious, and the staff is extremely friendly. My friends and I ordered a combination platter, and our waiter offered to give us more of whichever dish we liked the best. Also, the pricing is reasonable!

44.description: I love eating with my hands and I love trying all kinds of food but there is something about Ethiopian food that I'm never 100 % behind. I don't hate it, I'm just not that into it. I only have ethiopian maybe once a year mainly because I'm never that excited after I eat it. There are different color piles of food that I rarely know which one is which and it often looks a lot like baby food.  But there was something about Lalibela that made my previous experience with ethiopian food a little better. We had a big group and got a few combination plates of the vegetarian dishes. Everything was pretty different and you could tell what was what. Then on the side we got a few different meat dishes which were all outstanding. The Injera... the bread you use to eat with was much lighter tasting then I've had before, so it was easier to eat, which made the food shine. I'm still not won over by ethiopian food. You won't see me at Lalibela next weekend but next time I'll be a little more excited about the idea of getting Ethiopian.

24.description: This restaurant is a hidden gem. It is a bit off the beaten path in Andersonville on Ashland rather than Clark. It is a mom-and-pop operation, so with that in mind, the service can be a tad slow but the food is on par with any other Ethiopian restaurant in Chicago. The place is very clean and has a homey feel. The squash entree was definitely the favorite. The injera is somewhat different texture and flavor than the other Ethiopian restaurants and much tastier.

7.description: Ethiopian food is a wonderful experience, and I am so glad that we finally came here for dinner! For starters, I love that it has a BYOB concept so this alone receives a 5-star rating.
