We ordered two appetizers --  Yesiga Sambusa which is like an empanada -- only it is not -- it is two thin shells hand-wrapped and stuffed with a blend of minced beef, onions, peppers and wonderful herbs. We also tried the Kefta meatballs made from lean ground beef. The amalgamation of the crushed peppers, onions and spices and other traditional herbs were ethereal. They have an exceptional selection of vegan and vegetarian dishes here. In fact, we counted 13 items for vegans and 16 items for vegetarians! You can order a side of rice for two bucks.  We ordered the Awaze Tibs which consisted of tender cubed beef marinated in a fantastic broth with a touch of tomatoes, onions and jalapeño and just the right hint of fresh garlic and berbere sauce. I rate this dish with 4-1/2 stars. The beef was a little bit too fatty for my taste, but I know it is "fat" that gives meat tenderness as well as flavor. We also tried the Doro Tibs and this was my favorite dish. We shared both dishes. This dish was boneless pieces of chicken sautéed in seasoned butter with hot pepper and onions and awaze sauce. What we enjoyed most is that they will make the food as spicy (that is, heat wise) mild, medium or extra hot. This is good for those of us who do not like super spicy foods that clean out our sinuses!The traditional dish of Ethiopia is wat. I saw a few dishes on their menu containing wat. Wat is a a hot spicy stew which is accompanied by injera (this is a traditional large spongy pancake made of teff flour and water). Think of injera as their version of bread. There are varieties of wat, such as, chicken, beef, lamb, vegetables, lentils, and ground split peas stewed with hot spice known as Berbere. The Berbere here is truly bold, and made with dried red hot pepper, herbs, spices, dried onions, dried garlic and salt. The Wat is served by placing it on top of the injera and the food is eaten with fingers by tearing off a piece of injera and dipping it in the broth of the Wat. Service was very slow, but hospitable and kind. This is a family-owned restaurant. Portions are generous and the price-point is affordable. Our total came to $33 and change (excluding tip). You can share several dishes if you go with a group. Although the meat dishes are served individually you can still share them! They also offer weekend specials, so we'd like to come back for their weekend specials. For example, I would like to try the Doro Wat (tender chicken marinated in lemon sautéed in seasoned butter and stewed in a red pepper sauce, onions, garlic and ginger with a pinch of cardamoms and nutmeg). We enjoyed the experience and the food was worthy of 4-1/2 to 5 stars. We can't wait to return!Wine Recommendations -- if you order a lamb or beef dish I recommend Kadette Pinotage Rosé (about $15) which offers lovely floral aromas and juicy raspberry flavors. Dry and full-bodied in the mouth, it pairs perfectly with veal, beef and other tender steaks. OTHER WINES: You can't go wrong with a good red Bordeaux, a California or Australian Cabernet Sauvignon, a Washington state Merlot, an Argentine Malbec or a Spanish Rioja.

49.description: Everything was fast and tasted great!

40.description: We went to Lalibela this past Saturday and have fallen in love.  We are big fans of Demera and Ethiopian Diamond, so we didn't know what to expect.  Highlights of the evening included:-BYOB-BEST Injera I've EVER tasted-2 entrees and 2 sides, an appetizer, coke, tax and tip for $37-BEST kitfo I've had in Chicago-The lamb was like butter - I've never had lamb so tender and well seasoned-My boyfriend offered to pay me so he could finish the lentils.. they were unbelievableThe service was slow - they actually warn you on the menu because of the preparation time needed in the kitchen - but it was worth the wait.  I also felt perfectly full afterwards. I forgot to BYOB so I ordered a coke and they ran to the store to get me one (as they didn't have any in house) which was greatly appreciated.  I believe it's a family that works there, but regardless, they were so friendly, great with recommendations, and lovely people.I HIGHLY recommend Lalibela as it was inexpensive, delicious, and lovely.

53.description: OMG AMAZING!!! This place I have been to twice now, and the food is so DELICIOUS and lots of vegetarian options which is obviously a huge plus for me!! BYOB is a plus! The chairs and tables are very cool and look to be homemade which I think is really cool :)

30.description: Food was so delicious! The owner was so great with helping us pick our food out. 4 of us ordered the vegetarian combo & when we ordered the 4 entrees we decided on, he said he would pick a few more for us so we could try a few others too since there were 4 of us! All the food was so tasty- especially the mushrooms, spinach, and butternut squash. The vibe and decorations were so cool and we had a great time sitting for hours over our huge sharing plate & bottle of wine. Also the price can't be beat- under $12 ea for all the different entrees we tried! Will definitely come back.

46.description: I went a second time for lunch and the food was really bland.  I tried to give them a 3rd try by ordering something more spicy.  This was our conversation:Me: Hello, I'd like to place a pickup order for lunch.Lalibela: What?  I don't know.Me: I want to order food for lunch and come pick it up.Lalibela: Maybe in an hour.  I don't know.Me: Your website says you open at 11:30 and it's after noon.Lalibela: I don't know.  She's not here ok thank you.  (hangs up)

1.description: I've been to numerous Ethiopian restaurants in the area, if not to all of them. I always enjoy Ethiopian cuisine. This place did not disappoint me. The friendly personnel and the delectable food, the beautifully decorate ambience all made it a memorable moment for me. I highly recommend it for those who like to explore something delicious and different.  The spices will awaken you.

55.description: It's mid-January and the day of the first heavy snow fall.  Naturally, a girl's mind turns to Ethiopia.  I had recently reacquainted myself with Ethiopian cuisine thanks to a Groupon offered by another local restaurant.  (I'd been off the stuff for a long time thanks to an experience that went down in family lore as The Papaya Juice Incident.)  But on this occasion, my fearless dining companion suggested Lalibela since she'd heard good things, as had I.  The hostess/server greeted us warmly and said we could sit wherever we wanted, except apparently the table where a staff member had left their dinner halfway through eating it.  The plate was next to the remote for the flat-screen TV on the wall.  Small point, but this kind of super-casual approach is what could hold a place back from being great.   We settled on the vegetarian combination plate because we each had two things we were itching for: defen yemiser wat (lentils in mild sauce), duba wat (butternut squash stew), tikil gomen (curried vegetable stew), and shuro (chickpeas in berbere).  The platter came with their tomato salad in the center as well, which was fortuitous for my friend because she'd wanted one and I'd strong-armed her like a bully into getting the combo plate instead.  I'm a greedy B for good food, man.  And it was gooood.So again my favorite was the defen yemiser wat, but all four items were excellent and we made a good combination in terms of flavors and heat.  The butternut squash stew was sweet (dyuh), the lentils and tikil gomen were mild and the shuro had heat but nothing overwhelming.  Good on us.  The one other note about service was the lack of water refills.  We had a lot to talk about, and then I was stuffing my face, so I emptied my glass early.  Our server never came back but I kept reflexively reaching for my glass and slurping the melted ice.  On the one hand, she was on her own, but on the other hand, the place was less than a quarter full at its busiest.        Overall, a 4 for food and a 3.5 for intent and a 2.5 for execution.

9.description: Went with a friend on a Sunday for lunch- we were the only people there (I wasn't even sure they were open because it looked so deserted) so I guess if you don't like crowds, that's the time to go!We did a veg combo- between the two of us we could choose 8 total items. We did a good assortment of the veg options- I liked the butternut squash dish a lot (super flavorful and spicy) and the ye shimbra asa. I sometimes find those chickpea dumplings are hard (I'm looking at you, Demera!) but here they were really tender and the sauce was great. The only thing I didn't love was the mushroom curry- just not something I'd pick again. But the yemsir wot was great, kik was great. All in all very flavorful. I'd definitely come back.The service was spotty though. I know we were the only ones there, but it really did seem like they forgot ANYONE was there. I had to walk back to the kitchen to find someone and ask for more injera. But the people who worked there were all really friendly and nice. And the food really was good. I am usually a Demera devotee but I would come back to Lalibela in a heartbeat!

26.description: This was a mission and for research. I'm obsessed with cooking Ethiopian food and frequenting joints for study.  The food was AMAZINGLY delicious.  Owner was a lovely lady. the chairs are epic and very good for the low back (btw).  We shared veggie combo consisting of YESHINBERA, Duba wot, INGUDAY TIB, and salad.  the injera was perfectly sour and spongy.  good prices too.  I asked the owner how I can learn to cook Ethiopian and she said internet :( I was hoping she would invite me back to the kitchen haha.

25.description: OK, I had my go to spot at Den Den, but then a friend of mine wanted to try here. Let me tell you, the atmosphere is great. I want to know where did they get all those heavy, lovely chairs. They should sell them.  We went on a Sunday at about 5pm. Now it was the recent Sunday of the horrible tornadoes, so we were the only ones in the restaurant at first. I ordered a coffee which came in this awesome little coffee service set up, and they had incense burning in a little container, this unique coffee carafe, I'm guessing native to Eritrea, and cream! I always have to ask for cream in other Ethiopian restaurants and they act as if I've asked for a child sacrifice. Here, I didn't have to ask, they just brought it! Ordered a Veggie combo and a chicken dish. Everything was deliciously awesome. Very laid back atmosphere. More people came when they realized that Dorothy and Toto were safe, at least in Chicago. Very clean bathrooms, decent parking for the north side.

12.description: Came here for a large birthday dinner and it was the perfect venue. We were able to fit 25 people by adjoining several tables together. It's BYOB. It's not expensive - it was a set menu & price for everyone, which makes for a MUCH easier bill at the end. They set up our food buffet style so we could get up and grab as much as we wanted. And they gladly kept the bday cake and champagne cooled in the fridge.This was my first experience with Ethiopian food so I'm no expert. But everyone enjoyed their meal. It was salty for some, but everyone still gobbled it up. I can't recommend anything in particular because I just threw a little bit of everything on my plate, not knowing what they were. I'd definitely recommend this place for large groups. Just be sure to make a reservation.

59.description: This is the first time I have had Ethiopian food and I am now a fan. I thought Ethiopian Food was scary sounding, but it's actually delicious comfort food. Yummy savory meat and vegetable stews.  They have spicy, medium or mild options.  I had Doro Tibs which is chicken marinated in fresh lemon juice and garlic, sauteed with finely diced onions and green pepper slow cooked until it becomes a fragrant tender stew. Our table shared three vegetables. Tikel Gomen: sliced cabbage, potatoes and carrots cooked in a mild sauce. Gomen: Chopped collard greens simmered in a mild sauce of onions and fresh garlic. Dinich Alicha: Sweet potato cubes and carrots cooked in a mild sauce of onions, garlic, ginger and Ethiopian spices.These dishes may sound very exotic or scary to some, but they tasted wonderful.  Everyone enjoyed the meal and I will be going back soon.

21.description: Came here for a large birthday dinner and it was the perfect venue. We were able to fit 25 people by adjoining several tables together. It's BYOB. It's not expensive - it was a set menu & price for everyone, which makes for a MUCH easier bill at the end. They set up our food buffet style so we could get up and grab as much as we wanted. And they gladly kept the bday cake and champagne cooled in the fridge.This was my first experience with Ethiopian food so I'm no expert. But everyone enjoyed their meal. It was salty for some, but everyone still gobbled it up. I can't recommend anything in particular because I just threw a little bit of everything on my plate, not knowing what they were. I'd definitely recommend this place for large groups. Just be sure to make a reservation.

17.description: YUM. I went here on a wintry Saturday with friends and am glad that I did. A family owned and operated BYOB spot, it was full to the brim. While service was a little slow since there were just 2 people, I didn't mind because we were able to eat at a leisurely pace and not feel rushed. The staff were super friendly and helpful with answering questions about the food. I'd definitely come back here, and they also had larger groups in addition to small parties.This place is adorable and although it may be a trek for some, completely worth it. Plus, it's BYOB, they have neat carved wooden chairs, and the staff is friendly and helpful with choosing dishes that complement one another. A place with such a welcoming atmosphere, Lalibela's a great spot to go here and have a long meal with loved ones and friends.We ordered 1 vegetarian platter, a shrimp entree and a lamb dish (both the shrimp and lamb dishes come with your choice of vegetables, so for the vegetarian platter we chose things that weren't on it) and managed to be fully satiated without being overly full - definitely a good idea to just get 3 entrees for 4 people as injera can be quite filling. The injera bread here is darker (maybe whole wheat or a different style from what I've had at any other Ethiopian restaurant in Chicago or NYC) and delicious. Although I don't remember everything we ordered regarding the vegetables, I know that the chickpeas, okra and collard greens are delicious.One more thing: if you like spicy food, definitely ask for heat! The next time I'm here I will; since it was our first go-round as a group we didn't ask but will definitely do so. The food was delicious without it, but I would have enjoyed some additional heat.

10.description: This is my favorite Ethiopian place in Chicago! Try the Shrimp Tibs and the Duba Wat- perfection. Its BYOB and a really clean, cute place with friendly staff. I only put 4 stars because I had to flag down a waiter multiple times to ask them to refill my water cup.. the food is spicy! But delicious :)

5.description: This is definitely the place to take the spice lover in your life. When you order something spicy, they take it seriously. The Gored Gored was a real treat - flavorful and plenty of meat. (Note that meat dishes are served individually and veggie ones are served communally. This can lead to the meat portions looking smaller than at other restaurants, but it was actually a very filling portion.) The menu is different than other Ethiopian places I have tried - no honey wine here, only a few lamb dishes but lots of beef, few potato or spinach dishes. You may have to try something outside your comfort zone, but it was uniformly delicious. Plus, despite reasonable prices and pretty good food, the place was basically deserted when we went. So we got a great, intimate experience with our friends!

3.description: To kick off this review, this was my first time having Ethiopian food and Lalibela did not disappoint. An added benefit is this is a BYOB restaurant which we took advantage of. I believe it says $1 per bottle of beer, but they did not charge by each bottle, but by one BYOB price.I went here with a group of 4 people and ordered the #7-#13 for the table with the kitfo and doro wat. The injera was awesome and since this was my first time eating I thought this was almost close to a pancake. I tried all of the vegetarian options as they all came out on one platter. If you aren't a spicy fan ask for the #9 Yemser Wat to come less spicy. The doro wat (chicken) was fairly spicy but delicious. The sauce almost reminded me of sauce you would use in a spicy chicken quesadilla. The kitfo was great as well, but not what I was expecting. This was mainly seasoned ground beef, but with delicious flavor. All in all, I will come back here and definitely eat Ethiopian food again. The only reason why I did not rate this 5 stars is the service is amazing, but a little slow. You shouldn't come here if you are in a hurry, but the food is worth it.

35.description: Veeerrryyy slllooooowwww sseeeeerrrrvvviiiccceee...I understand it states that on the menu, but this was too much. We arrived at 8:30 on a Friday, were able to sit immediately, but then no one took our order for another 30+ min's. No one even checked on us. They weren't very friendly or mean - just very bland and uninterested. We weren't even offered water. We ended up ordering a Vegetarian combo that was a selection of 4 entrees. The waitress tried to argue that I could only choose 2, but then gave up when I pointed to the menu. We didn't end up getting our food until after 10pm, and it was sub par- partially cold, partially warm, and not as tasty as other Ethiopian food I've had. Also, not to be graphic, but it gave me the WORST explosive stomach issues I have possibly ever had from a bad meal. I won't ever return here.Ethiopian Diamond for life.

19.description: Good food.  Lovely service.  Decent prices.  My friends and I always choose Lalibela when we have a craving for ethiopian food.  The owners are super nice and if you call ahead they have gluten free injera.  Writing this review is making me want to go eat there right now.  Try it out next time you are hungry!

28.description: Excellent - best Ethiopian cuisine I've had in Chicago.  They use teff for their injera which is so much better than the wheat variety found at the places on Broadway.  They have an excellent variety and with the less filling injera, you're free to experience more of it and dodge a food coma.It was byob and you still can, but you can also order alcohol there now.A new favorite.

45.description: I have been to Lalibela a few times and every time it's a great experience.I've been to this restaurant with meat-eaters and vegetarians, and both agree it's delicious. The menu is huge but the waitresses are always super nice and friendly and will instruct you on what to get based on your preferences. I can't emphasize how nice the staff is.The BYOB nature is also a plus.The prices are really reasonable. It doesn't seem filling until you end up over-ordering and realize the entrees are deceptively filling.As far as Ethiopian food goes, it's a place you should definitely check out.

33.description: Service: Slow, as others have said. But the staff was pretty nice. (Although he did just throw down a corkscrew for our wine.)Price: Not bad, but you don't get a lot of food. We were all still hungry at the end.BYOB: Yes, but $3.50 for wine and a dollar a bottle for beer fees.Food: Injera was good. All our meat dishes were fine, but it's really not a lot of food. It was about a third less than I expected, sadly. If there was more, it'd definitely get a higher rating.Overall, probably won't go again, but a cute place.

43.description: Our favorite place.  We eat here weekly.  We used to go to Diamond weekly, but their food is too variable on spice/heat.  Sometimes their "mild dishes were mild, sometimes incredibly hot".  And service at Diamond was sometimes really spotty.  We tend to like our food  with lighter heat.  But if you want heat, she'll make it that way.  She's a fabulous cook...the vegetable are always ideally cooked (we only do the veggie dishes).   Also, they have more veggie options than Diamond for foods that are not on the Dirty Dozen.  And the owners are friendly, kind, accommodating.  Prices are better than Diamond, and it is BYOB for those that drink.  I rarely ate Ethiopian - "too weird eating with your hands, weird bread and spices".  That was my OLD preconception.  Now, I can't imagine any other way, and the food is both delicious and healthy.  Great for vegans, vegetarians and nutritarians.  And those that do the meat/fish dishes seem to enjoy it as well.

2.description: Place is great - the owners are incredibly sweet and the food and vibes are awesome. If you enjoy culture and experiencing different things, you should fall in love with this place too.

18.description: I've been to Lalibela three times in 3 weeks. It pains me to see it near empty, we were one of two tables each time, when the food is so delicious, and the owners, a husband and wife team, are so warm, gracious, and attentive. The wife cooks, she said because  she loves to cook and it makes her happy. The menu offers lots of choices, though my favorite is the Lalibela special tibs, tender cubes of beef sauteed and glazed in a delicious tomato, jalapeno, rosemary, garlic and onion sauce. I had it with a vegetable combination platter (you can pick 4 veggie dishes from a selection of 12) and it came with delicious injera, a spongy, fermented ie. sour dough risen flat bread. It's BYOB. So yummy. Check out Lalibela.  chicagoethiopianrestaura…Go hungry, and after you leave, tell your family, friends, and neighbors. It's that good.It would be a shame for Lalibela, a work of joy and love, to fold because of lack of customers.

41.description: We love Lalibela!  This is our favorite Ethiopian restaurant and we eat there every week, literally.  The food is consistently excellent.  They have a huge selection of vegetarian options which are all delicious AND healthy, not dripping in oil like Demera (the worst) and Ethiopian Diamond.  They have many more options of tasty, non-spicy vegetarian dishes than any of the other Ethiopian restaurants in Chicago.  We used to go to Ethiopian Diamond but the food was too inconsistent... sometimes the spiciness was okay or tolerable but, often, dishes were so spicy hot that they were too painful for me to eat, and I could only eat a few things on the platter.  At Lalibela I can count on a great meal every time I eat there, which is why we go weekly!You can call beforehand to request 100% teff injera, which is gluten-free and delicious.  The prices are very reasonable and parking is easy.  And the owners, who serve you, are super nice people, too.  I couldn't ask for anything more.

52.description: I've been to this place twice, and both times the food was excellent!  Everything is just delicious there, from what I've had.  It's BYOB (you'll want to check for yourself, but I do not believe they charge a corking fee), which is great, too.  The staff is nice as well.I was there very recently, with 7 other people.  We were offered a fixed-price option that included "a little of everything", including 2 salads, veggie dishes and meat dishes.  It was affordable, and everyone stuffed their faces.  Great deal!The only thing about this place that isn't perfect is the slow-ish service.  But I had to give Lalibela 5 stars anyway, because I must stress how fricking delicious it is!  Gather some friends, bring some drinks, relax and spend some time there.  You won't regret it...FOOD IS AWESOME.

50.description: Could not have been better!  Went for my birthday with 12 friends, they had a nice big table and massive chairs.  With a big group byob is great, they had a ton of bottle openers on the table ready for us.  Food was delicious and fast, i asked my wife to find us a good Ethiopian place and she picked this place based on the other yelp reviews and we were very happy.  The even brought me out a birthday Cake!  no one special requested it or anything, so i am told.  Spicey was spicey, mild was mild - true to form.  Definitely a great place for big groups.

4.description: I used the Groupon coupon for food for two people (27$) and came here not expecting much since the place seemed empty. It's a family run place with the wife cooking the food and the son doing the waiting. The food was excellent. The coupon allowed us to select 4 vegetarian dishes, 1 chicken, 1 beef along with 2 sambusas ( Triangular Patty filled with spinach/lentil) and a salad. All of this was served on a large pan cake like sour bread. Several of these breads were given on the side too. It was a good experience and the chef came and spoke to us and explained the food to us.

6.description: This is my favorite Ethiopian restaurant in Chicago.  Surprisingly it's right in my neighborhood (Andersonville, although it's on Ashland so it's easy to miss if you're passing through on the Clark side).  It seems to be run by an older couple who are very friendly.  It has glass tabletops with pictures underneath.  Paper napkins.  Plastic(?) plates.  Heavy wood chairs.  At the end of the meal they provide wet naps although they also have a public use sink next to the bathrooms if you get a little too messy.They do BYOB and will bring you wine glasses and a corkscrew to your table.We had Veggie Messob which was delicious and they provide a fresh salad in the middle which was a lovely contrast to the rest of the portions.  I'm not sure what the meat dishes are like but as a vegetarian, I loved it.  Here were the dishes we enjoyed:GomenCollard green sautéed with onions, fresh garlic, ginger and spicesDuba WatA savory stew of butternut squash prepared with  garlic, ginger, onions, peppers, and spices..Diblik atkiltGreen beans, zucchini, carrots, green peppers and onions. Sautéed in garlic, ginger and tomatoes. Tikil GomenDelicious curried vegetable stew made with carrots, potatoes, cabbage, peppers and onionsAnd a eggplant dish and then a beets dish.

22.description: We were excited to try Lalibela after reading so many positive reviews on Yelp. We arrived on a Friday around 6:30PM. When we arrived, the entire restaurant was completely empty. We entered but there werent any employees present until a woman came out from the kitchen and assured us they were open. Since they open at 4PM, this was very confusing.It took 10 minutes to get a menu and water and when we finally told her we were ready to order, she disappeared. 5 minutes later, a different man came from the back to take our order.The food was OK - nothing spectacular but not completely fine. If service wasn't an issue I still would not come back because there are so many other delicious options nearby. The injera was cold as were many of the dishes and flavors were rather bland.The waiter never came back during the meal to ask if everything was OK or to refill water. I had to get up multiple times during the meal to notify them that the CD playing was skipping, to ask for water, and to ask for the check.It was clear that Lalibela did not value us as customers or choose to make an effort to make us feel welcome. We highly recommend trying many other Andersonville restaurants and to take your business somewhere you'll be welcomed and not burdensome.

15.description: It takes a lot to haul me out of the house with a world cup on, but after a day of rain, we opted to take the long trek out to Lalibela. What can I say besides it was worth it! We have tried a number of different Ethiopian spots in the past which are a wee closer to home, but this is our new favorite!Without a doubt, this place serves the best injera I've ever had. After the first mouthful, followed half a roll, at which point I realized there might be a problem, but polished off the other half while attempting to assess the situation - even though we had just finished our appetizer and the entrees had arrived. Besides, of course, injera, we had spinach sambusa, kitfo, and Lalibela special tibs. For the non-vegetarians among us, regular entrees (i.e. non-combination platters) are also served with two sides per table. As with nearly all Ethiopian restaurant experiences, the portions are larger than they first appear. This was especially true of the meat dishes. Most generous serving of kitfo I've ever had and the special tibs was fantastic, by which I mean in that I'm-so-full-oh-why-am-I-still-eating-this-I-hate-myself-just-a-little-more sort of way. (Note: the kitfo here is a little denser than at some of the other places. Pro: There is actually a lot more than you think there is. Con: There is actually a lot more than you think there is.)The owner is thoroughly lovely and helpful, chatting with customers while they were waiting for their dining partner to return from the restroom. We actually arrived at an odd time of day, between normal lunch and dinner hours, but were seated immediately and did not feel awkward.Although cats are of the order carnivora and cannot sustain life without meat, lolcats are well known to consume vegetable matter for stupidity and pleasure. Given the great positive experience here, another hour's drive may be in order soon - even though they do serve vegetarian(s?).

57.description: This is the 3rd Ethiopian restaurant I have been to now and I loved it. The atmosphere was perfect, warm and cozy with great music. The food was great too!  My wife and I ordered the veggie platter along with a lamb dish. One of the options in the veggie platter, #9 i believe, was amazing. I loved the berbere sauce they used. Will be going back!

20.description: I wanted to give Lalibela four and a half stars, so I rounded up. The service was immensely pleasant (not even as slow as a lot of Ethiopian spots), the food was terrific, the space is clean and well decorated, and it's BYO ($3.50 corkage, $1 per beer bottle), which is my favorite. We ordered eight items from the vegetarian menu, and they were all delicious. In particular, the green bean dish diblik atkilt was some of the best I've had. The first-timer cabbage standby, tikel gomen, held its own as well. If you want a more affordable Ethiopian food option, I highly recommend Lalibela.

36.description: Update- June, 2014.  The food here has gotten even better.   If you haven't been here in a while, give it a try.  I think it has improved because the owners are playing a greater role in the cooking/food prep.  My new favorites are Diblik Atlkilt (sauted green beens, zucchini, carrots, green peppers and onions and Tikil Gomen (curried vegetable stew with carrots, potatoes, cabbage, peppers, and onions.).All of the vegetables are fresh and freshly prepared.My older review is still true, too- They have an excellent selection of vegetarian/vegan items.   I would particularly recommend the Yemser Wat and the Gomen.  Prior to eating here, I didn't think I liked greens, but theirs are awesome.  The owners are very friendly and nice, and the service is very fast.

14.description: I thought we had a $ 40 deal; server stated " about $ 40 big plate sampler ."  But when the bill came , it was a la carte menu pricing at $ 53 & tax.  We asked then , & he said that was "about $ 40." So the tip was negligible then. Food itself  was average Ethiopian food. 2 Sudanese guys w/ me agreed on these points. Ethiopian Diamond is better.

58.description: The food is consistently good and worth the wait. The pancakes with berries & mascarpone sauce are delicious!

56.description: Delightful and unique atmosphere with creative use of beautiful hanging windows and doors to create open space that provides privacy without a sense of isolation. The food is fresh and delicious, and is also uniquely presented. Yep, be ready to post on Instagram! Moderate prices, too! Can't wait to go back!

29.description: I never thought that any restaurant could take Tweet's place in my heart, but my new favorite breakfast place is now m. henry.Everything was amazingly tasty, from the mug of steaming Metropolis coffee that they let me drink as I waited outside in the unseasonably warm and sunny December weather, to the half order of Blackberry Bliss Pancakes that was the perfect accompaniment to 'jorge's black bean cakes & huevos borrachos' for a killer combo of sweet and savory that made my stomach sing with delight.The wait was reasonable for a Saturday afternoon around 1pm, about 20 minutes - my only complaint was the 10-15 minute wait after being seated before we were able to place our order, as we were already ravenous and everything being consumed around us looked SO GOOD.I'll definitely be back to try the Sunday morning specials, and the treats in the dessert case that looked equally great. (sour cherry handpie? YES PLEASE!)

42.description: All of their food is really good. My favorite is the jerk chicken sandwich. Be careful though because it has a pretty good kick.

23.description: Delicious pastries, cakes, turkey burger and excellent service!! Want to go back and try other items from menu!!

47.description: So delicious! Some of the best food ever, and the wait wasn't too long. If you can sit outside, because the back is super cute. The bread pudding is one of the best I've ever had. Highly recommend!

8.description: Smells like heaven as soon as you walk in! Their menu is not the largest but there's plenty of options. All of the food we got tasted fantastic! The serving staff was very friendly. They were attentive and quick. Our server was very sweet with my little girl. The only thing I'd say to watch out for is the size of the group. The table/area wasn't the largest. We did each have two side plates but the table was 100% full. There wasn't too much extra elbow room or space on the table. This in no way took away from the experience but I figured it's worth mentioning. Wouldn't recommend for a large group.

31.description: Simply the very best breakfast spots ever!  I had the roasted vegetable quiche and a side of turkey sausage. The quiche was so delicious, even the mixed green salad on the side was well dressed , green and tasty! The turkey sausage patties were house made not the typical frozen patties they serve at every other breakfast spot! Can't say enough about this place! Went on a Saturday morning around 10:30ish waited only 10 minutes for a table and the place was hopping! Service was superb! Will definitely be going back! Yummy!:)

34.description: Great food!!! Too bad it is so busy and I don't always feel like waiting in line, but the food is really good.

16.description: I like small menus with colorful food that stimulate your appetite and m.henry has just that. We stopped in for breakfast on our way into the 'burbs. If you come early, I believe the pay to park meters don't start running until 9am on Saturdays. Yay for free parking!We walked in and there was a small line...I don't understand why there wasn't a hostess standing there. It was probably a 10 minute wait before someone showed up. I mean, the front dining area was completely empty and the main area in the back wasn't even full.We were seated near the back with the booths. The booth seat is highly uncomfortable for short people like me...legs danging and falling asleep. I really hoped the breakfast made up for it. I know they have specials here listed on the black board, but it really would've been nice if the waitress announced specials of the day rather than what would you like? I really really wanted pancakes so I went with the blackberry bliss hotcakes. My boyfriend got a cinnamon roll french toast. Within 5 miinutes of ordering, the server brings another table's order out by mistake. I was like, that's lighting fast service, only to wait another 10 mins or so before our food came.So the hotcakes were super fluffy layered w/warm blackberries & vanilla mascarpone cream, & topped w/a brown sugar & oat crust. You can totally eat this sans syrup with the delicious berry sauce that gives it the perfect hint of sweetness. Of course I got a side of candied applewood bacon as a savory item to go with it. It's a delicious sticky mess, but I wish it was a tad bit more crunchy. Nonetheless, still good. The house baked cinnamon roll dressed with warm fruit, vanilla neufchatel creme was also topped with a granola crust. It wasn't overly sweet and the mixture of textures was lovely.A very good breakfast option in the Andersonville/Edgewater area. A bit pricey (~$35 w/tips for 2), but the generous toppings of fresh fruits and homemade bakery items justifies quality. We went in at 8am and left by 9:05am, just 5 minutes after the meters took effect.

13.description: we went on a Saturday around 11:30am, and the wait is for 20 minutes, which is not bad at all for a place as good as thiswe ordered a turkey sandwich, and it was literary LOADED with turkey (see pic), the flavour was ok, just very generous portionthe openface chicken sandwich is pretty good, a very balanced flavour, really liked the asian sesame slaw, not too sour or too creamy, very refreshing for the morningthe dandelion omelette is great too

11.description: I never thought that any restaurant could take Tweet's place in my heart, but my new favorite breakfast place is now m. henry.Everything was amazingly tasty, from the mug of steaming Metropolis coffee that they let me drink as I waited outside in the unseasonably warm and sunny December weather, to the half order of Blackberry Bliss Pancakes that was the perfect accompaniment to 'jorge's black bean cakes & huevos borrachos' for a killer combo of sweet and savory that made my stomach sing with delight.The wait was reasonable for a Saturday afternoon around 1pm, about 20 minutes - my only complaint was the 10-15 minute wait after being seated before we were able to place our order, as we were already ravenous and everything being consumed around us looked SO GOOD.I'll definitely be back to try the Sunday morning specials, and the treats in the dessert case that looked equally great. (sour cherry handpie? YES PLEASE!)

39.description: This place deserves several more visits!! The cinnamon roll French toast was delicious! The vanilla yogurt cream was ridiculous and really set the did apart. The fresh, crisp pears were a nice delicate touch too. The omelettes were good but not fantastic; my daughter was under-whelmed. She had the basic omelette and I had the Latina. I'm going back because I love the space (very nice) and I have a feeling their lunch menu is da bomb!!

37.description: Just not what it used to be. Food served cold. Tasteless. Clueless waiters. Very unimpressed with this place. Maybe new owners would help?

0.description: If I'm in Chicago, I try to go to breakfast/brunch here if possible. Bonus points if it's on a weekday so that we don't have to wait in line. Protip: while they generally don't take reservations for brunch, they will do so if the group is large enough...which meant that one time I roped people I met at a wedding into joining us at brunch the next morning.The pancakes are my favorite restaurant pancakes of everywhere (take that, Bongo Room; take that, other cities). I've had bliss cakes and hot cakes (can someone please tell me what the difference is?) in rhubarb, blackberry, etc. The best strategy so that you don't get sick from sugar overload is to split an omelette and a stack of (bliss, hot) cakes with someone else. Make sure you ask for hot sauce for your omelette.

38.description: I love their food! The French toast here are amazing. This place is second to bongo room for me for sweet brunch. Overall everything was great. One less star for average slow service.

51.description: One of my favorite breakfast places. Their quiche is amazing... And one of their most popular is the berry bliss pancakes - they're the best I've ever had in Chicago. Highly recommend. It does get slammed and loud so be cognizant of that when you go especially weekends, but at least you know it's busy for a reason :) Give it a try! You'll love it!

27.description: I love this place, first time here... had the veggie quiche (quiche period first time ever) and it was great! The ambience was great too as well, made it much easier for the brunch/date to go on smoothly.

32.description: Where do I start? As we entered the front we received blank stares. The three young ladies were engaged in a conversation. One hesitantly asked for our names. I must admit that Christen saved the day. Such a sweet lady with a radiant smile. She made sure we had great seats and we watched her bless the whole place with her supreme service. Caesar took our orders. He was nice and fast. Then came the food. Wow...it was so... good. The turkey breakfast sausage is like no other. This is a place I will visit over and over. I want to try everything on the menu. Yum.

54.description: Going out to eat is never an easy task with a 9 month old. Our little one really set out to make that a known fact when within 30 seconds of getting a table she lunged for a glass of water, spilling it everywhere. Cannot thank the staff enough for swooping in and handling it like it happens all the time. Their patience and friendliness was amazing in an otherwise really embarrassing, messy moment. Then the thoughtfulness of being offered a tiny bowl of sliced fresh fruit for the little troublemaker! We ordered the bliss cakes, quiche, and candied bacon. All so very good. So happy we decided on trying m.henry's as our first breakfast spot since moving to the area.. Only regret was not getting some dessert to go. Great food, great staff!

48.description: Great food, great service! My coffee was refilled throughout my breakfast. The food came out promptly. The appearance and food taste was exceptional. All the waiters and staff were delightful. The only downside-finding parking in the area!

44.description: Was in town visiting a friend.  He had to go to work so I found a place to eat.  I found this place.  I walked in and it was packed.  Since I was a single they sat me at the counter.  Even though they were packed I was attended to right away. I ordered some eggs and bacon and the food was great.  If you are in town stop by and get a great meal.

24.description: Aaaaaaah, brunch heaven! After you get in, that is... Waits can get hefty, but I've always found it worth it. My faves are the blackberry bliss cakes, which are seriously out of this world, and a killer egg sandwich. (Incidentally, that its name. Killer Fried Egg Sandwich.) It's BYOB, from what I seem to recall observing. I can't speak to their lunch. The inside is usually crowded but cute, with window frame hanging as whimsical separators between sections of tables.

7.description: Went to the rock shop next door and was recommended to eat at m.henry...An amazing recommendation. We went around lunch time, as for perfect timing; this place is only open for breakfast/brunch. I had the best tasting Mexican breakfast I've ever consumed. Huevos borrachos (drunken eggs). It was carefully crafted for maximum deliciousness. My date got a chicken caprese sandwich. It was deluxe.We will be back

49.description: We met friends here for brunch one day, and it did not disappoint one bit. I ate the vegan meal option, and it was delicious. Everyone else ate up their food quickly and wanted more! You might wait in line for a bit (well worth it), but you can get coffee while you wait (thankfully)!

40.description: Finally had the chance to visit this adorable restaurant with some friends this week. The restaurant looks fun and it's decorated very tastefully to resemble a bright/happy cafe. We had to wait for about 15-20 minutes before we got seated, which is not bad at all for brunch.I loved the food and presentation - I shared a Fried Egg sandwich and "Latina Omeletta" with my husband. Both were good, but I loved the Latina Omeletta. (It had fried plantains in it - which made the taste more unique). I wasn't too please with their coffee though! It tasted so bitter and two portions of cream couldn't save it. (I usually have 2 cups during brunch, however I really struggled to have half a cup this time!)Their prices are comparable to other brunch places and their cafe is adorable. Food is commendable so I would be back! :)

53.description: There is a reason why people from all over the city come to Andersonville for M Henry. It offers the most consistent, fresh, and delicious brunch in the city hands down. There are plenty of good brunch places in the city, but I have never had a bad or even average meal here. Get there early for breakfast; once 9 am hits, your long wait for a table is assuredly so.

30.description: I've been here couple of times and M. Henry was one of my favorite brunch places but my last visit was total disappointing. Just not what it used to be. First of all, its famous French toast was too dry and cold seriously what happened? It's supposed to be fluffy and full of flavor but it was tasteless and dry that I had to ask for more syrup. Poor plating. Egg Benedict was mediocre at best. The pancake restaurant near my house is much better.

46.description: I love M. Henry!  First off, it is adorable.  You walk in and it just feels like home.  Yes, it can be pretty crowded, but I believe that just speaks to how wonderful the food is.  And the wait is never very long.  I enjoy the fact that you can walk in here to enjoy breakfast/brunch/lunch, or if you want to just grab a coffee and a pastry at the coffee bar you can do that as well.  I have had really great service each time that I have gone and the food always comes out very quickly.I get the ice tea every time I go because it is delicious!  I have no idea what brand of ice tea they use, but the flavor is absolutely wonderful.  The jerk spiced chicken sandwich with the mango ketchup is an amazing choice if you are stopping by for lunch.  However if you are interested in breakfast I would strongly recommend the lemon raspberry brioche French toast.  The perfect mix of sweet and tart.If you are in the Andersonville area and looking for a spot to grab a bite, visit M. Henry, I promise it will not disappoint!

1.description: We came in for Valentine's Day brunch, when it was snowing and freezing outside, and there were about fifteen other couples, but it was a pleasant experience given the circumstances. The host was lovely and eccentric, and we were welcome to order some coffee and some of their fresh baked pastries (which looked amazing). After about 20 minutes, we were also offered a sample of their sour cherry cupcake, which was delicious, and then were seated 10 minutes after.I ordered a cinnamon roll French toast, which was warm, smothered in fresh berries and fruit, and coated in a crunchy oat crust, something that I will dream about for years to come. I'm fairly sensitive to sweetness, but even with the cream hidden inside the roll, it was just the right amount of sugar. The boyfriend ordered a smoked salmon rotolone with mixed field greens, which was an absolutely delicious omelette stuffed with salmon and respectably sized slices of avocado. We also got a side of apple-chicken sausage and their house made sausage patties, which were really nice, but the patties were much more flavorful than the sausages.The decor was warm and inviting, the service was fairly quick once we got in, and even though there was strange house music in the background, this is our absolutely favorite brunch place. And we don't even live in Chicago. We will miss you, cinnamon roll french toast.

55.description: They have very tasty food (candied bacon, hello!), with exceptionally friendly and attentive service in a lovely down to earth setting. This is my go-to brunch spot in Andersonville.

9.description: Great service and food. Service is quick and friendly. My favorite are the blackberry bliss cakes which are pancakes served in a blackberry sauce with vanilla mascarpone and oats sooo good. With a side of their house potatoes. Definitely recommend.

26.description: The popular restaurant m. Henry was a Michelin Bib Gourmand. It was also featured as the best breakfast in the USA on the food network. We had two flavorful brunches in the bright decor. The Latina omelette and the rustic quiche lorraine with mixed greens were delicious. The ingredients were extremely fresh. The size portions were fair.The restrooms were clean.

25.description: Very good breakfast. They have an interesting menu. With a limited about of choices. Be sure to look for the specials board. We were not told about them and didn't spot the board until halfway through our meal, which was a little disappointing. But the food was great.

12.description: Finally had the chance to visit this adorable restaurant with some friends this week. The restaurant looks fun and it's decorated very tastefully to resemble a bright/happy cafe. We had to wait for about 15-20 minutes before we got seated, which is not bad at all for brunch.I loved the food and presentation - I shared a Fried Egg sandwich and "Latina Omeletta" with my husband. Both were good, but I loved the Latina Omeletta. (It had fried plantains in it - which made the taste more unique). I wasn't too please with their coffee though! It tasted so bitter and two portions of cream couldn't save it. (I usually have 2 cups during brunch, however I really struggled to have half a cup this time!)Their prices are comparable to other brunch places and their cafe is adorable. Food is commendable so I would be back! :)

59.description: This place is the yummiest breakfast in chicago I had berry bliss cake which was delicious The omlete also was cheesy and yummmy too.What i liked the most is the side potato .

21.description: Went to the rock shop next door and was recommended to eat at m.henry...An amazing recommendation. We went around lunch time, as for perfect timing; this place is only open for breakfast/brunch. I had the best tasting Mexican breakfast I've ever consumed. Huevos borrachos (drunken eggs). It was carefully crafted for maximum deliciousness. My date got a chicken caprese sandwich. It was deluxe.We will be back

17.description: Greeted by a pastry case with hand pies and muffins that put cupcakes to shame, you are soon transported to a farm-like breakfast nook. Classic brick on one side with clever windowpanes hanging in a few spots to offer more window seats, the setting was appealing and the friendly service was quick.You could come back just for that, but why not thrill your palate as well? The Jorge's Drunken Eggs and the Classic Egg Sandwich are both deserving of your time. Go there now. And don't skip the fried plantains. You would be foolish.

10.description: By far the best breakfast place I've ever been to!!!! Amazing!!!! The pancakes were fluffy and on point delicious! I had the berries and Creme pancakes with a side of potatoes. My husband got the dandelion omelette with a side salad. The kiddos got pancakes, eggs, and fruit cups from the kids menu. They gobbled everything up! Definitely a kid friendly place! The ambiance is a little loud but perfect for our family! It's a beautiful place with amazing service! Will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone! It's definitely our families new breakfast spot! Also there's lots of street parking nearby for free!

5.description: Literally my favorite Chicago brunch spot. This place will blow your mind. Everything is so freaking delicious. My favorite is the dandelion omelette though, the quiches come to a close second. I always recommend coming with friends, everyone ordering an entree and then ordering a crepe/french toast to share for the table. Parking is little difficult so I recommend coming at a non-peak time. It's also a 10-15 minute from the closest CTA station. Lot's a space inside, but sometimes it's still packed! Their bakery items are delicious as well :). You will not be disappointed!

3.description: Whoaaaa - you will not go hungry here. So much food. Came with a party of 5 for brunch and everyone loved what they ordered. I had the blackberry bliss cakes with a side of apple & chicken sausage. It was delicious. Next time I will probably order Jorge's black bean cakes and huevos borrachos, because my friend ordered that dish and I couldn't take my eyes off it, before he completed devoured it.Service was excellent!

35.description: I don't know why anyone gives this place less than five stars.The portions are sizable, price is fair, and food is delicious. I would particularly recommend their sweet brunch, especially the pancakes.

19.description: My best friend from middle school just happens to also live in Chicago, and in a neighborhood right up the street from mine!  We met at m.henry for brunch with our hubbies on a Sunday morning in Andersonville and both gushed over the food and the atmosphere... and each other... Catching up with her I couldn't help but be amazed by our ever consistent similarities even after all of these years. I had the vanilla latte, the bread pudding with fruit, and the traditional eggs and house potatoes with cheddar cheese and chives to top it off... Lovely... Everyone else at our table was happy, as well. The service was great, but be warned they do not take reservations so you will wait outside, as you must at most decent joints in the city, and wait to be called.. Worth it, especially when you have good company to pass the time with.

28.description: Literally my favorite Chicago brunch spot. This place will blow your mind. Everything is so freaking delicious. My favorite is the dandelion omelette though, the quiches come to a close second. I always recommend coming with friends, everyone ordering an entree and then ordering a crepe/french toast to share for the table. Parking is little difficult so I recommend coming at a non-peak time. It's also a 10-15 minute from the closest CTA station. Lot's a space inside, but sometimes it's still packed! Their bakery items are delicious as well :). You will not be disappointed!

45.description: One of my favorite brunch places. It is popular so arrive early or there might be some wait. I have tried several dishes both savory (bean bean cakes, Latina omeletta and etc) and sweet (blackberry bliss and etc) are both delicious. The best part is the bread pudding.

33.description: By far the best breakfast place I've ever been to!!!! Amazing!!!! The pancakes were fluffy and on point delicious! I had the berries and Creme pancakes with a side of potatoes. My husband got the dandelion omelette with a side salad. The kiddos got pancakes, eggs, and fruit cups from the kids menu. They gobbled everything up! Definitely a kid friendly place! The ambiance is a little loud but perfect for our family! It's a beautiful place with amazing service! Will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone! It's definitely our families new breakfast spot! Also there's lots of street parking nearby for free!

43.description: This place is worth 5 stars. Food is absolutely delicious and they are super fast about everything. You won't feel rushed, but their staff will have you seated and fed in no time! Went there for an early saturday breakfast and we were super pleased with the experience. Very cozy design inside as well. Awesome work!

2.description: I wanted to update my review because I've been to m.henry a few times for brunch more recently and I had a very good experience.I like the open layout and the decor. The service is excellent. The food is very well prepared and attractive.My only disappointment was that there were no mimosas.

18.description: The popular restaurant m. Henry was a Michelin Bib Gourmand. It was also featured as the best breakfast in the USA on the food network. We had two flavorful brunches in the bright decor. The Latina omelette and the rustic quiche lorraine with mixed greens were delicious. The ingredients were extremely fresh. The size portions were fair.The restrooms were clean.

41.description: The best pancakes you will ever have.

52.description: This place is a hidden gem! I have been in Chicago for almost a year and I actively look for good eataries around the city yet I've never heard or read any yelpers mention M Henry's! This place is such a cute little settlement in Andersonville! The place smells of delicious food as soon as you walk in, very appetizing! We ordered Latina omeletta with chicken sausage and mango-blueberry brioche french toast. Both the dishes were outstanding especially the omelet was delicious and very flavorful! I love when I don't have to add loads of salt and pepper or hot sauces to my food for added flavor! The potatoes were really yummy and so was the sausage.  French toast was really good as well but I've had better. Regardless, the food was on point. Service was really fast and the waiters were very attentive! Servings are huge, 2 of us shared both dishes and were full by the end of the meal. I am a very happy girl to have found an amazing breakfast place walking distance to my house! Cannot wait to return!!

50.description: Disclaimer: Not food related. Food is great.When we put in our names I said I was happy to put my daughter's car seat on the floor, but the hostess said we needed a high chair so had to wait extra for a table that accommodated one. I'm new to this and had no idea why a 3 month old would need a high chair since she can't sit up yet, but I figured she misspoke. When seated I was directed to put the car seat propped between the legs of a wooden high chair that had been flipped over and was all wobbly, with the high chair warning in full view "Never use this chair in the upside down position. Serious injury may occur etc etc."  I guess this is not uncommon in the restaurant industry, especially in the US which is not very kid friendly, but it is incredibly dangerous.

4.description: We took some friends to here on Sunday. We expect it would be really busy and it was. We arrived around 11am and got a table half hour later. This was so far the best brunch I have never had around Chicago. Pancakes were so fluffy and delicious, my boyfriend ordered the Jorge's beans and he was super happy whit it. My friends want to get back while they are in the city.

6.description: I couldn't have been happier with my decision to come here. I bookmarked awhile ago but just found the time to go and boy am I glad I did. It's no wonder M. Henry's House baked Brioche Cinnamon Roll French Toast layered with Seasonal Fruit, Vanilla Neufchâtel Crème & topped with Granola Crust was rated the #1 brunch plate in America according to Food Network. There were so many flavors and textures that really made this dish. The crunch of the granola was perfect. The Crème was the perfect balance of smooth and depth. The entire meal was not too sweet. And the roll itself was not too cinnamon-y. The cafe is super quaint and sweet. The service was unbelievably fast. I can't wait to get back. I'm literally still thinking about how much I enjoyed my meal and need it again. Like now!!! You can't go wrong with going for brunch. I HIGHLY recommend. Maybe I'll get to go back in the morning. Fingers crossed...

22.description: So good! Everything my friends and I tried was amazing. I had the blackberry bliss cakes which seems to be one of their more popular items. Did not disappoint. It was not too sweet making it more breakfast than dessert like it looks to be. Unfortunately they do not take reservations and I can only imagine the long waits that must accompany weekend brunches. My group of 15 were sat in a tight room during lunch amongst tiny tables pushed together. Go early or odd hours. A definite try while in Chicago.

15.description: I love their food! The French toast here are amazing. This place is second to bongo room for me for sweet brunch. Overall everything was great. One less star for average slow service.

57.description: Good food, nice atmosphere, and great for brunch but extremely and unapologetically slow service. If our food is going to take 45 minutes, an explanation would be appreciated. At least acknowledge the fact that the 3 tables that came after us who got their food before us.

20.description: Deserves the #1 brunch rating in the country by the Food Network.Excellent service.  Owners are hands on deck waiting on customers and have great attitudes.Food is outstanding.  Original dishes.  Enjoy!

36.description: we went on a Saturday around 11:30am, and the wait is for 20 minutes, which is not bad at all for a place as good as thiswe ordered a turkey sandwich, and it was literary LOADED with turkey (see pic), the flavour was ok, just very generous portionthe openface chicken sandwich is pretty good, a very balanced flavour, really liked the asian sesame slaw, not too sour or too creamy, very refreshing for the morningthe dandelion omelette is great too

14.description: I was so excited to try this place for brunch after looking at all the delicious pictures. The restaurant itself is very cute, and we got seated right away on a Tuesday morning. I got their special french toast with mango and blueberry and the bf got the drunken eggs. The french toast came with sweet mangoes and a good amount of this sweet cream sauce. I cut my french toast up and dipped it in the sauce, making the bread super soft. I kind of wish I got the pancakes, because that's what they''re known for, but the mangoes sounded too tempting. The drunken eggs is a spanish breakfast with black bean pancakes and tortilla, chorizo and avocado on top. The back bean pancakes were unique and really good. Overall, a great option for brunch!

58.description: Holy shit!  I FINALLY found my hair boo (Jill) after years of searching this city.  I have not had cute hair in years.  Soemtimes, I would go back to my college city just to get a haircut.My hair texture: WavyBefore: Long with crappy layers from bad styling.  Sat flat.  Waves a disaster if present at all.During:  Jill listened while I literally went on a tirade about shitty salon experiences and how I hate my hair.  I told her I'd give her an award if she could give me a decent haircut.  She said she had a great idea in mind that was textured, piecey, different.  It would enhance my waves.  SHe was very specific about the exact length I wanted it and explored my comfort level.I didn't believe she could do it but I gave her a chance.  During the hair cut, we laughed as though we knew each other for years.  What a great personality!  She's charming! After:  WHAT?  She did it!  She gave me body, waves and coolness back!  I have already done it myself and it requires little effort on my part to have wonderful hair!  She got the award!  Wavy haired girls need Jill!

56.description: A seasoned stylist friend of mine moved away and told me to go to Jill at Sine Qua Non (since they trained together)- she was right!  I have had consistently great cuts with Jill.  The best part is that she is available at both Andersonville or Lincoln Park locations.  She kind of knows what works best for me and really nails it- every time.

29.description: Great service from the time I booked the appointment to the final check out.....and my new haircut is terrific! Now I need color too, and can't wait to return for an all new me! Thanks, this is my new salon!

42.description: just ok and get ready to wait. a cut and color (no highlights) will run you over 2 hours. at my last visit, the stylist was running 15 minutes late and was double-booked. i had to wait an additional 10 minutes after the timer went off before the dye was rinsed from my hair and another 10 minutes waiting for my cut. then, i felt like the stylist rushed through my cut to try to catch up. i liked this place at first because the stylist said they don't double book, except for quick bang trims. she should have specified that she didn't double-book that day. if you're like me, your time is very limited and extremely valuable. Waiting for over 30 minutes unnecessarily just seems like a waste of my time. also, they book quickly, so schedule in advance. i do like the products (aveda and b&b) and parking is always available.

23.description: When you find a fabulous person, you will pretty much go anywhere to get your haircut/colored by them! I absolutely LOVE Jenny, she's awesome - so friendly, always listens, but doesn't talk my ear off if I just want to relax when getting my hair done.I have very fine blonde hair, she knows how to cut it to put some texture and volume in it, and highlight the blonde so I always look sunkissed.The staff at the salon has always been friendly and helpful in scheduling and if I'm running late. Love the hair products they use and how I feel when I walk out.For me, the price is worth it and pretty average for a full cut and highlight. Well worth a visit!

47.description: I booked an appointment with Anna at the Andersonville location based off of Yelp reviews.Anna was fantastic. She listened to what I wanted, gave suggestions, and one of the best haircuts I've ever had. Usually I leave the hairdressers in tears because I have curly hair that is always, ALWAYS cut too short, no matter what I say. However, Anna has had training with curly hair (and informed me that all stylists at SIne Qua Non have) and cut it perfectly, keeping the length exactly as it should be, while cutting off the dried out, unhealthy parts, and thinning out other areas to avoid poof.At first I thought the color was too dark, but felt reassured by Anna's promise that I could call if I didn't like it, and she would fix it up. However, after a few days it has leveled out and I really like it.Just to note, Anna is really personable, and a pleasure to spend a few hours with. She is knowledgable, nice, and fantastic at what she does. I will definitely be back.

8.description: Nate is the curly-hair whisperer. Mine is a hot mess and he manages to shape it and tame it and order it to behave. For curly tresses a good stylist is a rare find...Nate is a gem. Additionally, the service at the salon is top notch. They're exceedingly polite, generous with the coffee, and on one occasion gave me a steep discount after a disastrous blow out by a junior stylist. I can't speak to other locations, but this one is great.

31.description: Libby moved back to Michigan! I miss her very much, but now have my hair cut by Yola. She also does a very good job. She's patient and a lovely person, and is especially good with color.

34.description: I'm kind of a serial dater when it comes to stylists. But, get your congrats ready, I've finally settled down and couldn't be happier. Since JB started doing my hair, she's given me a fantastic haircut, perm, and birthday hairdo. She listens, is incredibly knowledgeable, and always makes me feel at ease. The only downside is that I'm fairly sure she uses the fact that she's so pleasant to chat with to lure her customers back in unnecessarily. I've never gotten my hair styled before a birthday or actually taken advantage of a free bang trim before. This might actually say more about me than JB...But! After seeing how amazing my hair looked after a rather raucous birthday weekend, I'll be making it a habit.Anyway, JB is awesome and I have no intention of straying anytime soon.

16.description: I went here based on the previous reviewer who said Nate was a curly hair whisperer. Sadly, he was not able to whisper my hair into submission. I can only call this haircut mediocre to poor. I have thick, wavy hair with a lot of body, and the shape he gave me just doesn't work, definitely more of a christmas tree shape than the cute curls I was hoping for. I won't be back.

13.description: Jac gave me a phenomenal haircut.  I have wicked curly hair, and she knew EXACTLY how to maximize its potential. I have never been so happy with a haircut in my life! It was my first time meeting her, and she took an hour and a half to make sure it looked awesome (and she gave me hints for humid weather that WORK).  Heck yeah, I'll be going back.

11.description: Anna is awesome!  After having a not so great experience elsewhere I wanted to do something different with my hair.  I'm super picky and spent so much time researching someone new and figuring out exactly how I wanted my hair cut.  I have pretty curly hair and was planning to go from a below shoulder length to kind of chin length bob.  When I met Anna I was amazed by her confidence--  not cocky confidence at all, but it's like she really knew exactly what I wanted without me having to go into a detailed explanation of the cut i had in mind and I didn't have to show her any pictures.  I immediately felt comfortable and trusted her.  Her skill level is really excellent.  She cut most of my hair with a razor which totally blew my mind!  I wound up leaving with a way cooler cut than I even knew I could have.  2-3 weeks later I am still getting tons of compliments.  Thanks so much, Anna!!

39.description: 3.5 actually.....Found JB using Salon Apprentice.  Again, I find myself at an Aveda salon...which I am not the biggest fan of.  I just dont like them.  I didnt realize it until I walked in and it was too late to cancel.She was very receptive via email and got an apptmt booked ASAP.I went during the day and on all of the side streets, you can park for free or there is easy metered parking right outside of the salon.JB was friendly and nice.Hair...she did a good job.  I wouldnt say fantastic.  I thought that the low lights were a little to dark, but hey its the price you pay for a deal sometimes.  Also, she kind of went overboard with the foils.  I think I had a bizillion in my head...hahaha.  I know she was trying to be precise so that was nice.  The other thing that was slightly annoying was that since she did a full and a lot of foils, I was there forever...like 3.5-4 hours.   Again, price you pay for a deal.  She quoted me $35 in the email and when I was finished at the salon it was $45.  Still cheap as heck, but slightly annoyed with the increase in price.  So overall, easy parking, easy booking, cheap price (despite the increase), and long service.  For my wait, they did give me a deep condition, which was really nice.  I probably wouldnt go all the way back up to Andersonville for this service but I think if you live in the area, looking for a deal, and have lots of time...its worth it.

37.description: The salon seems like a really nice place, and the people were helpful and friendly, but I'm very frustrated with the hair cut I got there yesterday. I specifically told Michael that I wanted to be able to tuck my hair behind my ears because I can't stand having it hang in my face, and that I don't use product or blow dry my hair. I walked out with my hair cut short enough in the front that now I'm having to bobby pin it back--a problem which was hidden at the time by the sticky product that he put in it and the diffuser he used to give it an unnatural curl. Upon washing all of the product out, I discovered that he had layered it so drastically that there were unflattering long panels of hair that hang around the side of my face. I don't know if this was intentional or not, but it's not what I was expecting and looked like an accident. I wouldn't be so bummed out about this if not for the fact that the haircut cost $70!!!!--a hair cut that I had to spend half an hour fixing myself over the bathroom sink. The reason that I went here in the first place was because I needed to find a new salon after Bathsheba at Sparrow gave me the same horrendous haircut with the same excessive product, diffuser, and layering last November. I don't understand why it's so hard to find someone to listen well enough to not cut the hair short in the front and not overly style it!

0.description: I've been seeing Valerie at Sine since i moved to Chicago. She does the best haircuts ever. Seriously. I'm a 24 year old male and am very squeamish about people cutting my hair. She does it perfectly every time. When she cuts your hair you can just tell the technique and talent while she works. She always has the best recommendations. And always wants to make sure that what she's doing is what you want. I absolutely love her!! It's a little treat to see her every 2 weeks :) and the customer service by the amazing receptionist at differing locations are all amazing too! Thanks Sinequanon and Valerie! You all are amazing

38.description: Not only does JB give great haircuts, but she is also knowledgeable about products and full of hair tips! I am so happy with the service I receive by her. I found this salon on yelp because I have naturally wavy hair and was tired of going to salons that would cut my hair for straight styles when I told them I wore it wavy. When I called, the receptionist asked about my hair and recommended JB. She listens and just gets my hair! In addition, she has sampled things for me which I have later bought because I loved. She also it full of tips, showing me how to fix some of my flat waves with a curling iron, and last time showed me how to braid me hair. Just amazing value!!!

51.description: Just received my second cut from Anna.  It is equally awesome as the first and she is just a lovely gal to talk to.  I literally asked her if she was planning on moving anytime soon because I will be a happy loyal customer as long as I have hair to cut.  She said she is not going anywhere.  Yipee!!!

27.description: I have been going to Josie for years. She is amazing. I have yet to have a bad hair cut from this sexy broad. :-) She is always making me fabulous! She is a pleasure to be around! Love her!!

32.description: In need of a quick last minute hair cut I called Sine Qua Non and they informed me that they had a cancelation and could fit me in that night! Perfect. I arrived there and was warmly greeted and served a hot cup of tea from the receptionist. She offered me some things to do while waiting including flipping through an IPad full of inspiring hair cuts on Pinterest (loved that) although my two minute wait didn't allow me time to flip through things.I sat down with Nate where I gave him a general direction with what I wanted to do with my hair. After discussing specifics he gave me recommendations on what he thought would look good and made sure I gave the okay on everything before he started snipping (also something I very much appreciate). I was Nate's last appointment of the day, and he did not rush by any means. He was relaxed and took his time from the washing, cutting, blow drying and styling. There is nothing worse to me then when you sit down for an expensive hair cut and you feel as if the stylist wants you out of there chair in record time! He gave me some recommendations on products and after using them on my hair I was sold, he was not pushy with selling them to me at all which made me more comfortable with purchasing them. I was very happy with how my hair turned out, he nailed the look I was going for!As for the salon goes, I liked that it was very open and clutter free. It was clean and I enjoyed the music playing. They leave you with a little gift bag of things your first time there, and you get a choice of a free treatment on your birthday. What I love most about the salon is that it is not a gossip hall, everyone seems to be relaxed and genuinely nice. I will be back and am working on sending my boyfriend there!

54.description: I've been looking for a salon that I can trust and continue to go back to each time I need something done, and I think I've found it. I'd been letting my hair grow out as naturally as possible after shaving most of it off, but decided the natural color thing and mullet in the back look was getting a little old. I went in not completely sure if I wanted to go darker or lighter (I'm a light blonde naturally), but Yola helped me to decide that lighter would be a better way to go. I could always go darker later if I still wanted something different. She was very nice, helpful and not overly chatty, which is better for me.The cut that I got was perfect right off the bat. The color was a subtle change, however, and at first I was a little unsure. When I decided later that day that it wasn't quite what I was looking for I started stressing out a bit because I had paid $180 (!) total for my look. I called them up the next day and they offered a complimentary recolor! I went in the next day and got it redone and it turned out perfect. I was so, SO relieved that they could do this without charging me and that they weren't snooty about my change of mind.Considering it's my first time going to this salon I was going to give it 4 stars, but I'm so glad they can stand behind their salon (and prices) and didn't leave me let down at all that they get a 5. Overall: -My stylist (Yola) was very friendly and helpful, not overly talkative so you can relax. -The prices are definitely higher than I would normally pay, but I knew this ahead of time so I was prepared.-They stand behind their salon and are ready to satisfy!

48.description: I went to Sine Qua Non to fix a hideous cut I got somewhere else. I called to schedule my appointment, and the receptionist was very helpful. She asked what my hair was like and what kind of cut I wanted. I explained that I had long, thick hair and had gotten a haircut that was making me cry. She suggested Yola.Yola is fantastic. She listened to my story, found out exactly what I wanted to do with my hair, and then she did some magic. She's a good listener, and was very empathetic since she has long hair as well. I've never had someone work so intently on my hair before. Yola is an incredibly skilled and talented stylist. The bad haircut I had gotten earlier left my hair much shorter, even though I'd told the previous stylist I was growing it out. She cut odd, super-short layers and I felt like I had lost most of my hair. Somehow, after cutting off a good inch or two in order to repair the weird layers, Yola made my hair look longer than when I came in. I honestly felt like she had given me my hair back.The salon itself is small and bright inside. The receptionist offers you tea or water right when you walk in. Oh! The shampoo is so relaxing. The man who washed my hair gave me a scalp massage. It. was. so. good.I've gone in a second time, and everything was just as lovely. I'm a teacher and my second visit was during the first week of school. I was on the waiting list to see Yola (she was booked up for weeks) and I got a last minute call to take a cancellation spot on a Thursday. All I wanted to do was go home and sleep after my cut, but my hair looked so great that I was really bummed I didn't have anywhere to go. It still looked great the next morning (flat-ironed poker-straight, which I can never do) and I was able to wear it to work after simply running a brush through it. The prices are completely reasonable for the quality of the work. I never used to pay more than $35-40 to get my hair cut, but I am not going anywhere else from now on. I feel like I finally have a stylist I can trust.

44.description: I've been coming here ever since the first location opened in the early '90s.  In my judgment, the staff is dedicated to providing first rate service and comfort.  I always feel taken care of and the quality of the stylists is first-rate.  I get the sense they are always trying to find ways to improve.

24.description: I don't know why it's taken me so long to write a review, probably because I procrastinate. Nate and I have been in a committed haircutting relationship since March of this year.
