I first went to see him because people on yelp raved about his skill with curly hair. I had sort of long hair and at the first appointment I wanted to do the full choppery, but I had had short hair as a kid and it was an afro. An afro as an 8 year old in the 90's... it was a hard time in my life. Nate convinced me to wait and see how the first cut went. So we waited. Cut to June- In a moment of drunken courage and stupidity I decided to let my equally drunk friend cut my hair (I probably wouldn't have had the guts to do it sober).I came in to see Nate with some trepidation, but he was totally awesome. He liked the length and did a wonderful job at damage control. I walked out of there feeling dapper as hell. We played with it in the summer, doing fun fauxhawks and other cuts. Now we've got this down to a fine art. A cut every five weeks and an arsenal of Bumble and Bumble products (the sumo wax is a Godsend). Seriously guys, the products are no joke, it makes SUCH a big difference in your hair. The nice part is that every single time I go in, we sit down first and decide what the plan of action is. Nate always makes sure that I'm good with what we're doing before we even wash my hair. He's also very meticulous, making sure that my hair is evenly cut every step of the way. I can't even begin to rant and rave about Nate enough. He's amazing and I'm so glad that I found him. I get compliments on my hair pretty much daily, and let me tell you, it feels good.

7.description: Finally, finally, FINALLY - after eight months and five salons of searching, after haircuts ranging from "good" to "meh", after hours spent in the chairs of different stylists of differing levels of skill and sociability - I HAVE A STYLIST!  This was, in all seriousness, going to be my Last Stop - I think I may actually have run out of salons in the area to try.  And they've all been good!  Or at least good enough.  But hairstyling is an art, and a very personal form of art, at that - and "good enough" just doesn't cut it (no pun intended) for me.  I regularly spend a lot of time coloring my hair, and I want a stylist who cares as much about making it look awesome as I do, who gives input and makes suggestions and hopefully is a halfway interesting conversationalist to boot.  As a friend of mine put it, "I don't want a servant, I want a collaborator."And I'll be damned if I didn't find one.  JB was everything I hoped for and more - when she saw how much I cared about the particulars of my hair, she talked with me very specifically about what I wanted, and made suggestions for modifications here and there, all of which worked out beautifully.  And when she turned me around to see the back and sides, and then proceeded to *explain everything that she'd done*, I looked up at her with starry eyes.  "Do you want to go steady with me?  Pretty please?  Please say yes."I walked out with precisely the cut I love, after an hour of chatting with someone I click with.  I'd nearly forgotten what a thoroughly fantastic feeling that is.A standout point for the salon:  While they do sell styling products, and JB did show me which ones she was using, I didn't feel pressured to buy any of them - in fact, she gave me samples of the ones she used, so I could play around and see if they were worth the investment to me.  Now *that's* how you sell products!Also note that they don't allow tips on credit cards - you can run a debit card and put a tip on that, or tip cash.

49.description: I feel so good! I literally have been to a salon maybe 3 times in my life, but I woke up the other day thinking "I need a big girl hair cut" I am sick of cutting my own damn hair! I called and was able to get in to see Jill within a few hours-AWESOME, I love immediate gratification! I have curly hair and maybe that's another reason I have been scared to get it done, but I could not be happier. My hair looks so good! Jill spent an hour just cutting it, she took her time and put in so many layers that it literally rejuvenated my curls. I just got back and I am so happy that the first thing I did was pee, grab a saltine (welcome to pregnancy) and write this review :) My hair was really long, it only cost $50 for the cut, I tipped $20 and I bought a leave in oil treatment for $25. I figured what the hell, I never splurge on anything and I know she probably get's a little sumthin sumthin for me buying the stuff. Overall, $100 for the best haircut of my life!

40.description: There is much to love about Sine Qua Non. Let me list just a few: locally based; female owned; an Aveda salon...Those three things make me brag about it to my friends. Add on that SQN gives continuing education to its stylists & offers Aveda and Bumble& Bumble products, and you should be sold. SQN has a great website & returning products that turn out to be a dud is never a problem. Appointment reminders are sent out via email.  I've had my hair cut & styled at all the SQN locations by several stylists & have always been pleased with the results. Even more impressive -- no one has ever said they couldn't work with my curly hair. You will see clients with all types of hair which is another clue that this is a well rounded salon. I now see Michael & Stevie for cut & color, respectively. They are both Art Directors, educators, & level 5 stylists. I have never been happier with my hair since I started seeing Michael & Stevie. I am constantly stopped on the street & CTA and asked about my hair. It grows out beautifully & I now spend only minutes styling it.   I also adore the Andersonville location as it is the least salon-like salon I've ever been in. It's very quiet and has less than a dozen chairs.  TLDR: go for the great stylists; Andersonville location is great

53.description: ANNA gives the most amazing haircuts.They are literally perfection. All haircuts pre-Anna looked slightly awkward to me. I am super picky about my hair, especially when I wear it short, and I am a former hairstylist so I really notice anything that is "off" about haircuts. They are so good that after 3 months the shape still holds (this is on chin length hair ladies) and I really only have to go in to cut off split ends. She is very good at giving suggestions too. I don't have to explain for hours what it is that I want (even in hairdresser language this can be tough) and she listens when I do have direction. She will let me know what products she is using, but is never pushy about selling them. And of course, as the cherry on top, she is also just a nice person and pretty easy to talk to.GO to Anna for all your haircutting needs!

30.description: I received a cut and a color.  I wanted to touch up my ombre hair color.  I have long hair and I have only use aveda for the last 4 years.  I went to sine qua non salon for aveda color. I did tell the colorist that I only use aveda, but she didn't use aveda color.  She backed comed my hair and put on the color. the color was pretty however, she need to cut more hair off than I requested due to damage. When I touched my hair it didn't feel good.  I just thought it was the products she put in my hair.  When I washed my hair it was so damaged it curled up by 3 inches. I needed to get to hair cuts, because there has been so much breakage.  I am deep conditioning my hair 5 times a week and my hair is still falling out.... Buyer beware.... I miss my pretty, shining soft hair... I have been told it will take several months.  never again....

46.description: This Salon has a lot .. I mean loooooot of attitude. They believe that they are the only ones in the city who are hair dressers and are outright RUDE, inconsiderate and Arrogant. There are other hair dressers in the city who do a far better job with a great customer service than these guys.The manager at the Lincoln park location Chris - in particular is very rude.

1.description: Nate just cut my hair at the Andersonville location and he did such an excellent job. I went in with pictures from Pinterest to show him my dream hair cut and he did just that. He has given me such an amazing haircut! He was so focused all through and put in so much time and attention into it. And he gave me great tips on how to take care of my hair too so I can maintain the look. Very professional :) thanks Nate!

55.description: Jennifer is amazing!  Thank goodness for finally finding a Chicago hairstylist that is 100% consistently awesome.  Prices seem average for Chicago (around $160 for cut and partial highlights). Her cuts and color have all really grown out well for me so it is ok if I can't get back as often as I should.  Easy street parking and nice, calming salon.

9.description: Finally found a new stylist! I was in hair mourning since my regular lady moved away. I know some of you can feel my pain on the finding of the new hair person. Searched and searched for a few months and decided to give a nice place in my neighborhood a try. Based on the stylist profiles, I chose Jennifer. Completely sweet and listened to everything I said. I even took a chance with color! This is probably one of my favorite haircuts and colors of all time. All the staff is great too.

26.description: I was looking for a new salon closer to home and I came across Sine Qua Non, read some positive reviews on Yelp and took a chance. As it turns out the great risk came with great reward-a stellar hair cut. Nate was my stylist and he did a fantastic job. I really appreciated his suggestions. I was nervous to cut my long hair and he suggested that we give my hair a trim this time, get to know one another and next time see what happens. He was very sweet and he really paid very close attention to what he was doing with my hair. The appearance of the salon is beautiful and clean and the receptionist(s) were very helpful. I will definitely be back!

25.description: I have curly hair, and as anyone with curly hair knows, finding (and trusting!) a good stylist is a nightmare. Summer is amazing and is probably the best stylist I've ever had. If you have curly hair, go see Summer. She is familiar with Devacurl, so she helps me figure out to style it. She cuts it wet, but I don't care because it's a good cut. She also offers to rewash after the cut so that it styles normally, which is genius. It's expensive, but about average for a high quality women's cut and the cuts last me almost 6 months. Just make sure to schedule sooner than later because she books up quickly! She also gave me great product recommendations but I didn't feel pressured to buy. I had no problem returning a product that I bought there but didn't end up working like I wanted.

12.description: When you find a fabulous person, you will pretty much go anywhere to get your haircut/colored by them! I absolutely LOVE Jenny, she's awesome - so friendly, always listens, but doesn't talk my ear off if I just want to relax when getting my hair done.I have very fine blonde hair, she knows how to cut it to put some texture and volume in it, and highlight the blonde so I always look sunkissed.The staff at the salon has always been friendly and helpful in scheduling and if I'm running late. Love the hair products they use and how I feel when I walk out.For me, the price is worth it and pretty average for a full cut and highlight. Well worth a visit!

59.description: i still love Sine Qua Non, after having been a customer there for going on four...five years now? Scary, but it proves that I CAN be in a committed relationship! ha.

21.description: Finally, finally, FINALLY - after eight months and five salons of searching, after haircuts ranging from "good" to "meh", after hours spent in the chairs of different stylists of differing levels of skill and sociability - I HAVE A STYLIST!  This was, in all seriousness, going to be my Last Stop - I think I may actually have run out of salons in the area to try.  And they've all been good!  Or at least good enough.  But hairstyling is an art, and a very personal form of art, at that - and "good enough" just doesn't cut it (no pun intended) for me.  I regularly spend a lot of time coloring my hair, and I want a stylist who cares as much about making it look awesome as I do, who gives input and makes suggestions and hopefully is a halfway interesting conversationalist to boot.  As a friend of mine put it, "I don't want a servant, I want a collaborator."And I'll be damned if I didn't find one.  JB was everything I hoped for and more - when she saw how much I cared about the particulars of my hair, she talked with me very specifically about what I wanted, and made suggestions for modifications here and there, all of which worked out beautifully.  And when she turned me around to see the back and sides, and then proceeded to *explain everything that she'd done*, I looked up at her with starry eyes.  "Do you want to go steady with me?  Pretty please?  Please say yes."I walked out with precisely the cut I love, after an hour of chatting with someone I click with.  I'd nearly forgotten what a thoroughly fantastic feeling that is.A standout point for the salon:  While they do sell styling products, and JB did show me which ones she was using, I didn't feel pressured to buy any of them - in fact, she gave me samples of the ones she used, so I could play around and see if they were worth the investment to me.  Now *that's* how you sell products!Also note that they don't allow tips on credit cards - you can run a debit card and put a tip on that, or tip cash.

17.description: Just went to Sine Qua Non as a walk-in on a Friday afternoon. I doubted they would be able to fit me in, but much to my surprise they happily accommodated me. Everyone was extremely friendly, the place was clean and I got an excellent haircut. I've been looking for a new stylist for quite some time and I'm glad to say that I think I finally found the right place.

10.description: I've been going to Jennie for years and absolutely love her! I recommend her to all my friends and co-workers and they all love her too! Our conversations are always great and I always walk out feeling refreshed and ready to show off my new do. Jennie has had really great ideas when I feel like a change and I always trust her judgement. I get constant compliments on my hair (cut and color) and was so grateful she was able to do my hair and my bridal party's hair on my wedding day. I couldn't imagine having to change stylists or salons...

5.description: I've been to Sine Qua Non several times now and seen two stylists, Nate and Jack (she's a lady!). I have curly hair that is the opposite of cooperative, so I'm selective about stylists. Lucky for me, Sine did not disappoint. My first cut was with Nate, who is just the most dapper man I've ever met. He did an incredibly adorable short bob for me, and didn't mind at all when I whipped out my phone to show him pics of Lizzy Caplan as inspiration.  He was interesting to talk to, too, and didn't push products. He gave me tips on the best ways to style it quickly (cuz I'm lazy), too. Best of all, he didn't discourage me from certain styles! He seemed to know intuitively how my hair would actually behave with certain cuts, rather than assuming like some past experiences I've had, and he was not wrong. Also? Epic shampoo. My second visit was quite a few months later, and he seemed to remember me, which I loved. Also, he didn't push talking when I wasn't feeling talkative. This is huge to me. I'm sure some women enjoy the social aspects of talking to their stylists, but I talk for work - I love being able to quietly enjoy my cut more often than not. But like I said, when we did talk, it was awesome and he's just a great guy. Jack! Jack is wonderful. I snuck in an appointment the day of a wedding in mid June. My hair was getting shaggy and I lucked out because she had a cancelation and the wonderful receptionist (I believe her name is Katie) hooked it up pretty last minute. I was nervous because of the aforementioned finicky hair, plus I love Nate already and have some serious stylist loyalty. But my hair needed to go, so I took the shot and man. Bullseye, my friends. Jack is, first of all, just a joyous magical person. She also has curly hair, so we discussed ways she keeps hers so tame and lovely. I went in with a kind of vague idea that I wanted a pixie style that would look cute when I put like 2 minutes into it. She totally ran with it, and it looks amazing. She also recommended one product, a pretty inexpensive Aveda liquid gel. I was hesitant at first because gel and my hair have never mixed well before but yay for Jack - This stuff is great! I swipe it through my hair with my fingertips and comb my bangs straight, then absentmindedly scrunch the gel soft when it has mostly dried. Also, shout out to the guy at the desk that was patient while I fumbled in my purse and forgot my debit pin. You're a classy gent! I'm satisfied with having two amazing people I can trust with my untrustworthy mop of hair, and can't recommend Sine Qua Non enough. It's just a fantastic, professional environment.

3.description: I was really excited about my haircut. I called to make the appointment and questioned how much it would be. I was told $50. After spending a total of 25 minutes in the chair I was charged $75 and then asked if I would like to add gratuity, right in front of the stylist who cut my hair. Really disappointed. When questioned they said $50 was an estimate. I can't imagine how a haircut that took less than a half an hour could be worth $75. My hair length is above my shoulders.

35.description: just got a kick ass ombre!   Loving my stylist!

19.description: The hair cut I received was fine, all but my bangs were to bluntly cut, I prefer a cleaner look to them. The stylist was very pretentious, only tried to up sell me products, and let me sit there for about an hour not once offering a magazine, water, etc. Thankfully I had my phone I could read the news, etc. at least.He barely talked to me at all expect to ask what I wanted in my cut and to again try to up sell me products. Ask your clients how their day is or something! I felt like I was a bother that he had to cut my hair at all.I won't be back.

28.description: The hair cut I received was fine, all but my bangs were to bluntly cut, I prefer a cleaner look to them. The stylist was very pretentious, only tried to up sell me products, and let me sit there for about an hour not once offering a magazine, water, etc. Thankfully I had my phone I could read the news, etc. at least.He barely talked to me at all expect to ask what I wanted in my cut and to again try to up sell me products. Ask your clients how their day is or something! I felt like I was a bother that he had to cut my hair at all.I won't be back.

45.description: Went to Sine non Qua to get out of a rut with my curly hair.  Saw David - he was fantastic!  Great new cut, easy to talk to.  Excellent experience, excellent salon and my new haircut of choice!  LOVE IT!

33.description: I waited 6 weeks for a Saturday haircut appointment with Yola - why? - my waitress at the Grafton has the best haircut and told me that Yola was the reason her hair looks so awesome.  I called and booked my appointment and waited - I wasn't disappointed! My hair looks fabulous! I told her what I wanted and she delivered that and more.  She explained the products she used but didn't pressure me to buy anything, which I totally dug since I have a bunch of hair products cluttering my bathroom now as it is.

43.description: After looking in Chicago magazine and doing some online research, I decided to book in with David, as I had read good things. Unfortunately, the first time I tried he was on holiday and I ended up going with another stylist instead, at their Lincoln Park salon. This didn't work out well, I really didn't like the cut and also found her a bit pushy with the salon products.Since I still hadn't tried David, I thought I'd give the West Town salon a go, and I'm glad that I did! David definitely knows what he's doing and really listened, as well as giving me some good suggestions. He is just awesome and I also really like the look and feel of the West Town location. I have quite thick, unruly hair and admit I am a perfectionist when it comes to haircuts. I'm so glad I've found a fantastic stylist!David's based at Lincoln Park most of the week, but is at West Town on Wednesdays.

2.description: This is a long-overdue RAVE about this salon and its staff - especially Yola.  As a middle-age woman with long brown hair that needs grey covered, I've been a customer here for several years, after decades of experiences here in Chicago and downstate,  The only time I've been this pleased before was in Springfield, IL when my stylist Bernie Koch was the founder of both the school and his salon.  Here at Sine Qua Non with Yola I have consistently received the best cut and color from a stylist who is exceptionally professional.  She actually cares about listening to what I want, not judging, remembering me and specific requests even if it's been months, and making sure I was taken care of seamlessly when she went on maternity leave.  The manager and the receptionists are also friendly and professional, and the interns all do a good job.  I like that they make sure you know in advance you'll have a service from an intern, and they work with challenging schedules (both mine and a very popular Yola's).  This is not an inexpensive salon - you get what you pay for - but I've been to Oak Street, Oak Brook and Lincoln Park and paid more and received much less service.  Kudos!

18.description: I'm not someone who gets her hair done often, mostly because it tends to give me anxiety and I am usually very attached to my hair. But my boyfriend and I both decided to do some major changes with our hair-- him donating 15 inches -- and me, well I had no idea what I was going to do. I met with Jill who was hilarious, fun, easy going and knew just how to make me feel at ease about taking a big risk. Not to mention she did an AMAZING job on both our hairs (I got a long bob). I've been spreading the word to all my friends about how wonderful she is so I figure why not share that with yelpers?! Such a great experience.

41.description: I am very picky with haircuts. I do not have a lot of hair, it grows very slowly and its thin..  J.B. cut my hair after a disastrous $20 haircut in logan square and she more than fixed it!  She made suggestions and really listened to what I wanted.  I will for sure be going back!

52.description: I have very wavy, fairly thick hair, and it seems many people have a problem cutting it correctly. Not Anna!  I just got such an awesome cut from her.  The curls have come to life.  She was great at talking me through exactly what I wanted and then totally delivering.Also, Anna is friendly and kind but does not feel the need to talk non-stop throughout the cut.  I love this in a stylist.  I asked what products she used so she showed me but there was absolutely no pressure to buy anything.Everyone I've dealt with at Sine Qua Non has been friendly and helpful.  The overall vibe is very nice and comfortable and not at all pretentious.

50.description: 5 years and my love is stronger than ever. :)just walked out of here feeling fabulous, yet again. it must have been shortly after my previous review that i finally found my girl, and i've stuck with her ever since. that would be jenna. she just gets me. i'm sure it's difficult to decipher what your customers want, but somehow she always figures out what the hell i'm trying to describe and knows how to execute it perfectly. and she's just so darn sweet! she remembers the stupid sh*t i talked about 4 months ago which makes me wonder, "does she make little notes for herself after i leave?" i don't know and i don't care. that's just damn good service if you ask me.

4.description: The best. I will never go to another salon if I can help it. Absolute wizards when it comes to short (and in my case, receding) hair.

6.description: I called them and left a message and no one returned my call. Big turn off!!

22.description: I really cannot say enough about Trisha Vallone. She's an amazing colorist and has taken me from deep deep brown to fire engine red and even bright violet. Trisha constantly has great ideas for updating my look. About a year ago I proposed we chop my shoulder length hair to a short pixie. She gave me the best cut of my life and everyone raves about my short hair. I highly recommend Sine and Trisha.

15.description: After months of looking, I found this place which is near my house and decided to give it a try. I went to get my hair done a few months ago and upon going in I didn't know what to expect. I must admit I was a bit intimidated when entering, but soon after I was greeted by the front desk and my stylist (JB). She was very friendly, she seated me and asked me what I wanted. I wasn't too sure so I showed her a couple options I had and told her what I would like. She made some recommendations and soon she was styling my hair. The end result was great, I was extremely happy with it and would definitely go back. Thanks JB!

57.description: I had been going to the same salon for 10 years and was having a hard time getting an appointment because the hours are sort of limited.  So, I decided to finally try a place in my north side neighborhood.  I had read great reviews on Sine Qua Non so I thought I'd give it a shot.  It was not quite as friendly as other yelpers promised.  When I arrived I waited several minutes before the receptionist welcomed me.  I had an appointment with Libby for a cut and full highlights.  One thing that really bugged me was that she was going back and forth between me and another girl.  If I'm paying $170 (which is exactly what I paid for PARTIAL highlights and a straight across trim of my hair), I really expect your undivided attention.  In light of the heavy price tag and feeling like I was just a number, I don't think I'd go back.

20.description: I'm not someone who gets her hair done often, mostly because it tends to give me anxiety and I am usually very attached to my hair. But my boyfriend and I both decided to do some major changes with our hair-- him donating 15 inches -- and me, well I had no idea what I was going to do. I met with Jill who was hilarious, fun, easy going and knew just how to make me feel at ease about taking a big risk. Not to mention she did an AMAZING job on both our hairs (I got a long bob). I've been spreading the word to all my friends about how wonderful she is so I figure why not share that with yelpers?! Such a great experience.

36.description: A couple of appointments ago Kenny Rogers was playing in the salon, and Brad, one of the stylists, proclaimed his Kenny Rogers fandom.  I threatened to tell everyone about this, and he joked, "yeah, put it in a Yelp review."  We both laughed.Brad is not actually my stylist, though.  That honor belongs to Yola, who is very mellow, professional, conscientious, and willing to humor me when I bluff (at least every other appointment) about her giving me a mohawk or shaving off all of my hair.  She's been cutting my hair for a few years now.  The salon itself is pretty cool--always clean and stylish without seeming uber trendy or precious, and the people are always friendly and helpful.Kenny Rogers music is not the typical musical faire at Sine, by the way--most of the stuff is much hipper than that, though Brad might disagree  that Kenny Rogers' music is any less hip than any other.

14.description: This salon is terrific - the owner is a badass, and JB has taken care of me terrifically. I also really appreciate the free touch-up they offer between cuts. Thanks guys, keep being awesome!

12.description: The place was full and ordered drinks at the bar. The wine selections have three price points, which we were unaware of and erroneously assumed the first price was for a glass. BEWARE. The first price is for 1/2 a glass and the servings are small anyway. So not sure who would order 1/2 a glass of wine unless you wanted to do a flight I suppose. Thinking since it was European style in concept..it would be glass/Carafe/bottle instead of 1/2 glass of wine/not really a full glass/bottle....instead of $5-$6 a glass it was $10-$12 and that left you unsatisfied.The new wine portions at restaurants is really getting irritating.The full glass portion would have been worth it for $5 to $6.  No wonder craft beer is hot.Take a photo of the wine list and order a beer. The wine was really good but no one likes to feel taken advantage of/lying by omission and since the place is new, I would think the bartender would explain things about alcohol pricing since most customers are brand new? Felt shady yet presumptuous because of that maneuver. Otherwise, the cheese flights were really good. Small portions of baguette are served, so you can ask for more bread if you like bread. I think using the wine menu as well as the cheese menu to order your own take away selections is the best way to make the most of the place. Has a lot of potential to be great but needs better staff training.

3.description: I stumbled upon Pastoral while exploring Andersonville, and I was impressed with the selection of wine/cheese/specialty items that I haven't been able to find elsewhere. I was even excited to have noticed a Basque cheese (Ossau Iraty) as I have yet to find any on the North Side. I'll be returning soon to refill on the cheese and wine.

1.description: Great place, glad to have it in my neighborhood -- but they seriously need to improve their check-out concept.There are always several knowledgeable and helpful staffers behind the main counter, but there's (apparently) only one register. This often results in a semi-chaotic cluster of customers at the front of the shop asking questions, placing orders, and trying to make purchases. There is also a register all the way at the back of the shop, which is largely obscured by wine shelves; on several occasions, while trying to purchase something at the front counter, I've been redirected to the back register where -- in theory -- it will be quicker to check out. Unfortunately, the folks at the front counter can't really see how many people are lined up at the back register, and today I once again found myself in a line four-deep at the latter, which wasn't moving at all because the person at the front of the line wanted to ask the person on the register everything about everything. After ten minutes of that, I eventually just went back to the front register and waited another five minutes to pay for my purchase there; if the items hadn't been things I needed for tonight's dinner, I would have just left without them.Again, I like this place, and love their bread, cheese and wine selection. But their customer service would be vastly improved by at least one other register at the front counter, as well as better communication between the front and back registers so that they're not sending shoppers from one frustrating check-out gridlock to another.

2.description: What a fascinating little experience Pastoral is.  The 4 stars is earned through the quality of the product and the OUTSTANDING service at the cheese counter.  Per the other reviews the bartenders are indifferent at best and waiters quick to have anyone but them help you.You have to prepare yourself to be confused.  Do I order at the counter in the back? At the bar?  Is there table service?  After our visit I still am not sure.  We went in wanting to sit in the Appelation side which has beautiful leather half booths and small but comfy four seat tables.  After dancing around the bar and seating area we ended up just getting a cocktail and stuff to go.  We wanted to stay but we live a half mile out and none of the waiters or the bartenders seemed interested in us.The cheese counter attendants are the reason we bought anything more than the cocktails.  Literally all of the 6 staff members on this afternoon went above and beyond to demystify Pastoral's products and experience.  $200 on cheese, wine, mustards, pickles, pate and we left happy and really enjoyed every product at home.Long story short- get stuff to go it is worth it.  Want to stay? Recommendation to the bar and waiters...be more informative and welcoming.  Felt a wee bit judged for my beanie and thermal, I mean it's Andersonville, it's still girlstown, be welcoming if you want to be welcomed.

9.description: Went here for the first time on 11/12/2015. Great decor, atmosphere and service. The cheese case and retail section were amazing to browse. I had high hopes for the restaurant but the food was only okay. I ordered the roast beef which was cooked very unevenly medium (perfect) in the middle but a bit overdone and dry at the ends. The cheese turnover accompaniment was amazing though. My dining companion ordered the egg noodles. He commented that it was not good because the meat in the dish was very fatty and the pasta was inconsistent, as if someone added uncooked pasta to the water after the existing pasta had been cooking for a while. My share of the meal with glass of wine came to around $37. I could have had a much better meal up the street at Johnny Brown Bag for half the price. Sorry guys - I hope your chefs improve. Beautiful space but meals need improvement.

10.description: I'm confused, not quite sure if this is a deli, wine bar, retail, restaurant.We stopped by for a sandwich yesterday which was under whelming. The blonde bartender couldn't be less interested and  her service was pretty awful. The dinner menu didn't look to interesting.I think we are getting screwed on the wine poursMaybe I will purchase cheese or meat but that is only a maybe.

4.description: Lots of staff but none of them want to actually wait on customers.  Sat at the bar 15 minutes without even being acknowledged.  There were only 6 other people sitting there.  The bar back wiped the same glass for 8 1/2 minutes staring off into space.  I gave up and left.  I won't be backGreat looking place but the idea is to buy stuff and I can't do that when they don't want to sell anything.

6.description: Delicious cheese and charcuterie plates. Lovely selection of beer and wine. Try their own prosecco on tap. Service needs some work but they are new to the neighborhood so I'll cut them some slack.  Great date place!

15.description: Myself and a few friends wanted to have a drink after having dinner out at a Thai restaurant last night.  We thought we would stop by the new Pastoral Bar and Restaurant - Appellation, for a late night drink.  Kaitlin's big smile greeted us at the door and she walked us over to the bar and we sat at a corner seat with a great view of the entire restaurant and kitchen.  She asked us what we were in the mood for, and we said "red wine".  She was extremely knowledgeable and offered a few suggestions.  She poured us some samples and answered our questions without hesitations.  She was  lovely.  The bartender took over from there.  The place has a great wine selection, which was reasonably priced, and most importantly, was very enjoyable.  This new space has a great cool vib.  Our next trip back we will definitely try out the starters and the dinner menu.  This place is a great new addition to Andersonville.

0.description: Discovered the Loop location, and have been a fan since. To make clear, I am not a fan of cheese, but I do enjoy the wine/artisanal cheese pairings here. 3 Cheese platter options (two platters with 5 various cheeses and the third platter with 3 cheese variations), and a nice wine menu.Entre's:Lamb and brussel sprouts Dish: 5Chicken thighs/mashed potatoes: 5 (owner's favorite)Counter Culture Coffee: 4

5.description: A sumptuous experience without the pretense and at reasonable expense: delicious exotic, artisanal cheeses and charcuterie,  DEEP selection of wines for all palates, and very satisfying small plates.  I can't speak for the bigger courses - always too full from the side dishes and cheese flights.  Read a negative review by people upset that they didn't have high chairs for their kids.  How horrible of the owners not to cater their restaurant to the experience you and your little brood expect.  On second thought, take the smaller versions of yourselves to Hamburger Mary's down the street and spare the rest of us.The staff is rather well educated and can help you select a nice pairing of flavors to suit your tastes.  Excellent choice for a date night or a great evening out with friends.

13.description: Excellent addition to Andersonville. Their selection of cheese, beer, and wine is great. I can't wait for the holidays to have a chance to splurge.

11.description: I stopped by for a Sunday evening wine and snack and was blown away.  Very well done, very fine.  The classic cheese plate and its pairing were a wonderful way to end my weekend, and afterward I was able to purchase my favorite cheese from the plate at their accompanying store.

8.description: My wife and I love the other locations and we live around the corner from this new Clark spot so we were excited to give it a try on Saturday.  Unfortunately we had a really strange unwelcoming experience. When our group of three adults and 2 young kids walked in around 5pm we were greeted with a strange apprehension. The host and hostess spent a few minutes talking in the corner and pointing over at us and then they advised us that "the owners have not made an investment in booster chairs and therefore they could not seat us."  We hadn't even asked for booster chairs. We are not the type of parents who expect our kids or family to receive special treatment. We are highly sensitive to how they can impact the environment around them in public places, and we think they are very well behaved because of that. But this took us by surprise and changed our mood instantly from excited to embarrassed and disappointed. Two stars for a beautiful build out. Wish we could have enjoyed it.

14.description: I hope I can change this review to more stars in the future and that they are just working out the kinks of a new opening. I love the other locations and I was excited when they came to my neighborhood. In trying to place a catering order I was told I could pick up at 10:30am by one person and then I couldn't by another, I was bounced around and told to call back to finalize the order making me nervous about getting my order finalized. On another occasion they completely neglected to include something we ordered in a pick up order. The food is great once you get it but I sure hope they work out the kinks in their system because I won't return with this type of service !

7.description: Pastoral's cheese-and-wine shop and the wine bar share the same lovely space, but the experience of each is so different they might as well be in different stores altogether. In the cheese-and-wine area, the staff is friendly, welcoming and solicitous. At the wine bar, it's just the opposite: The servers there are indifferent at best. After we sat down at the wine bar, we waited a long while for the bartender to notice us -- even though there were maybe four other customers seated at the bar. He finally handed us a drink list while barely muttering "hi." No questions asked about the kinds of wine we might like, no information provided about the kinds of wine they offered. I might expect that disinterest at a dive bar selling well drinks, but not at a wine bar charging $10-$14 a glass. The wine I did have was fine but I would've liked to try something else. Unfortunately, I didn't trust that the bartender would know what wine to recommend or would be interested in doing so. The whole time he seemed more intent on what he was doing (mostly talking with the other bartender) than with what his customers were experiencing. Since then, there've been a couple of times when we walked by Pastoral thinking it might be nice to stop in for a glass of wine, but then we see the same bartender there and just keep on walking. Until Pastoral gets bartenders who know how to treat customers, or trains them better, I'll just stick to picking up some of its delicious cheese and wine to go.

12.description: This store offers lots of entertainment for both a one-year old and a 30-something.  One of us definitely had so much fun because we explored the entire store and in the aftermath, nearly all of the stuffed animals were pulled off the shelf.  Out of sheer embarrassment, I don't think my niece will take me back ever again.  However, when she's not looking, I'll sneak over all by myself.  The toys are that much fun.  Look out stuffed animals!The free gift-wrap with your purchase is a super perk.  It's not cheaply done, either, with nice ribbons and paper.  I despise wrapping, so for that alone, I'll shop here.Go play!  Just promise my niece that you'll pick up after yourself and don't tell her you're going without her.  Oh, and if you think you saw me in there by myself, it never happened (shhhh!).

3.description: Very nice toy store. Great mix of higher end brands (Haba, Plan Toys, etc) and the classic Fisher Price stuff. Good gift options at different price points. The staff were super helpful and willing to answer questions and suggest gifts. There is a lot packed into this store! If you are looking for kids books for 5 and under I'd suggest going to Women and Children First (feminist book store a bit south on Clark) instead though.

1.description: I live right by timeless toys so that's usually my go to toy store for unique children's gifts but yesterday, I was looking for something very specific and timeless did not have it but toys etc did. They were very friendly over the phone and said they'd have it all gift wrapped and ready to go for me before you getting in the store.That is exactly how it went down! I walked in there with my four kids and the gift was gift wrapped and bagged and ready to go they were very very very friendly! My baby was wailing quite a bit because he wanted to get out of the stroller so the sales associate started to play guitar and sing softly which calmed my baby down!I loved the customer service so much that it makes me want to support this local businesses and make a point to drive the extra mile to this store because they went above and beyond :)Thanks toys etc.

2.description: OMG. I parked in front of this place on my way to Women & Children Bookstore. The toys in the window enticed me to venture inside.. $150 later.. I found some of the most unique gifts for people in my life. As a former art teacher.. I was so thrilled to find the most awesome 6 sided contemporary & fine art puzzles not even seen at any art museum!!! LOVE this store!!!!

9.description: What an awesome neighborhood toy store. Toys et Cetera has such a variety of toys for all ages that it was hard for me to decide what to buy as a gift for a toddler! Everything seemed great. The selection is not lacking at all. In addition to newer toys they also carry some great classics. What truly makes this store awesome though is the staff. They are so helpful, not pushy, and seem to enjoy working there...but why wouldn't they ? Its a toy store!  Last but not least, gift wrapping is free. Good times.

10.description: Such a cute, independent shop for last-minute gifts and collectibles. My friend went crazy over the lego's and will be bringing her nephew in here when she wants to take him shopping.

4.description: I like shopping local, and when it came time for another nephew's bday...I thought, Toys et Cetera would at least be my first stop before Target for another Lego set.  We got an air hockey table ($30), which the 7 year old loved!  Their stuff is more pricey than what you're going to find at Target or Toys R us, but they have optional gift wrap and really know their toys.  The staff is friendly, and you can find a bigger selection of younger kids toys, but they do carry some science games, some Egyptian chess laser game, and things like that.  You might not be able to afford all of your Christmas shopping here, say, but it's a great place when you have some dough and want to get a nice gift.

6.description: I love independent toy stores. This place has a great selection of toys and games that go beyond your usual plastic crap from the big stores. There's a nice selection of puzzles that Lenny jr is now into. Lots of Melissa and Doug stuff, craft kits, train set and much more. The staff is really nice. Prices are on par with other independent toy stores.

0.description: Awesome store! My husband and I shopped at the Hyde Park location often when we lived there. We went into this store the other day to look at games and buy a kite. The salesperson was very friendly and informative. He knew about a lot of the games. As we were checking out, my husband mentioned we were "poor students" and they took a couple dollars off of our total :)

5.description: Once again this store provided that last minute gift we needed and with excellent advice and the free wrapping took them less than a minute.  It would have taken me 30 minutes and would never have looked as good as theirs did.This store carries a more unique variety of toys and games for various ages.  If you are looking for the run of the mill Toys R Us stuff you will not find it here.The staff is very helpful and equally friendly and don't seem to midn the screaming munchkins roaming their store.

13.description: Fantastic independent toy store in the heart of Andersonville. I had to stop myself from running around the store to explore all the goodies and I'm three decades old...I know that any kid younger than me would have an equally good time.I bought a gift for my 3 year old nephew that helps to inspire some creative storytelling but it was a tough decision with all the beautiful toys and gifts. On top of everything there was free gift wrap. Love it!

11.description: Adults in this store will find themselves playing as much as the children with the hands-on educational and developmental toys on hand. The store carrys a lot of unique specialty items that you may not find a big box retailer or toy store. We will warn you, the store is small, cramped and can get busy - but its all worth it to find that perfect unique gift for the little one on your lists.

8.description: This place is a true gem. I love the variety of toys here, a great selection for various ages. Perfect place to shop for gifts for the little ones. But the thing that stands out the most is the outstanding customer service. I had a toy that I purchased 9 months ago stop working and was able to go in and exchange for a brand new one. There's also a music time Tues at 11:30 and again at 4 - the children could play along with the instruments while the musician (store employee) play. Will definitely be supporting this business again and again.

14.description: This place is small, but stocked full of good quality items. My daughter and I love to pop in and see the new selections. The people that work here really make all the difference. They are helpful and super sweet with the children. This store also has a frequent buyer program, which comes in handy with a child who makes frequent trips.

7.description: When I need a toy for "the Viking" (Sorry, inside thing with Mama K) this is always where I go. One because I don't really know a lot of kids to buy toys for. Two because it's a small business in my hood. And third because I know that they have loud obnoxious toys to drive his parents nuts with. Sorry, I'm evil that way (evil laugh begins here). But seriously, they have anything you can think of when you're not going for major labels. Toys for all ages and a ton of smart toys for kids to learn. The staff is always nice and helpful which I don't know how they do it. There is always kids running around when I'm there. Prices aren't so bad here and they do free gift wrapping. I can't wait till "the Viking" needs some drums (evil laugh ends here)!!Shop local!!!

58.description: I've stumbled in this place twice. It's got a really nice vibe when you walk in. Franz Ferdinand is playing and there are Scrabble letters littered on every corner table you can spot. Since I don't have any nice paintings to frame, I ignored the front of the store and walked to the back. Passing the knick knacks of every card imaginable and pins, I found the greeting cards. Every single greeting card is adorable and a hoot. I probably looked at every single one (every occasion) at least once. But when I turned over the card, the price turned me off. Still, I couldn't resist picking out a birthday card for my mom and walking up to the counter.The employees from the start had been strange. They kept eyeing me an smiling, but not saying anything.So I expected to be waited on right away. Wrong. They were moving a table and said they would be with me in a few minutes. Several minutes later, the girl comes over and informs me that my $4 card cannot be paid with a credit card due to the minimum card amount.I understand this policy completely, but what was next makes me re-consider purchasing anything there.She then told me I should buy something else, possibly an overpriced pin at $1.25 or a flashcard for "varying prices starting at 60 cents" to bring my total over $5. Look, I'm not a walking money tree. Paying four bucks for a birthday card is outrageous in the first place, and I thought I would give this place business, but not after being pressured to buy something I don't even want. I left and I don't know if I'll be back.

56.description: Foursided is definitely a unique gem in the arena of home decor and framing.  What I love about Foursided, aside from the craftsmanship, is the huge selection of custom frames.  I've always received really friendly and especially helpful service from the staff.  Whenever I've had a question about framing options, I've received excellent framing consultation.  The only downside is that it is pricey, but what do you expect from a top-notch framing store with every imaginable frame option you could possibly ever want?  There's no other place that I'd rather go for my framing.

29.description: Absolutely love this place! If you need gift ideas, their quirky and varied inventory has plenty of options for anyone who loves nostalgia. Framing options are incredible too.

42.description: As soon as I stumbled into this place a few summers ago I knew I was in trouble.  If you don't know what to do for an afternoon, just stop in to this place.  There is everything you could ever want from mini anvils to cards to scrap watch parts to foreign language learning flash cards with insanely unique pictures on them.  Even the bathroom is sporting the decor throughout the store!I love coming here, but I never have enough money to spend.  If you have not been in here yet, do it.  It is totally worth it and you will not regret it one bit!

23.description: I love this place!!! The best birthday/anytime cards ever. Creative, funny and tastefully filthy ...This place is stupid cute.

47.description: This place has soooooooo much! Me and my friend giggled our way through the humorous card section, the gorgeous giant posters of old Hollywood stars--i  have yet met someone whose admiration for old Hollywood matches mine,, the rings and the art. All super unique, all quirky random stuff. We had so much fun in that store and am real happy it exists in my neighborhood. LOVE IT!!!

8.description: Love this shop for gifties! Been here a bunch of times to get gifts. Bought myself a few too. Great Chicago stuff, from the high ball glasses to baby bibs....Chicago-centric designs are cool and unique.

31.description: Even better than the TwoSided on Wellington, if you ask me.  Love love love this place.

34.description: I haven't utilized their framing services, so I can't comment on that feature of this fantastic store, but I can gush about their selection of tchotchkes. I have often coveted their home decor items - ceramic birds, maps, photo blocks of Chicago landmarks, telegraphs - that are alas too expensive, but have given me inspiration for my apartment. Among the random odds and ends (Scrabble tiles, alphabet blocks, figurines) you'll find a wide selection of cheeky, adorable cards to suit any occasion. If you too are resisting the depersonalization of communication, and find cards to be as pleasant a surprise as I, get yourself to Foursided stat!

16.description: Five stars seems to be too conservative for this incredible, fun shop!!!There are just too many incredibly unique items to explain it.  You have to experience this store.As an artist, I love many of the vintage images, great papers and fun add ins for collage work.  Go with a group of friends and share some laughs as you read signs/greeting cards.It is a MUST if you are anywhere near Andersonville!

13.description: Foursided framing is absolutely incredible! If I could give them ten stars, I would.  I was given two pieces of art by my grandmother - one was a piece of vintage embroidery and the other a photograph. They had a similar subject matter, but of course couldn't be any different in material. I had a big idea to frame them together in a single frame with the mat between. I thought for sure a framing company would shy away from this weird challenge, but Foursided embraced it.The framing just took 2 weeks, and they did an incredible job. Their framers offered suggestions on the frame and mat that I never would have thought of but looked ten times better than the black and white frame and mat I had originally thought of. They really took care with something they knew was very very special to me.I would recommend them for any framing job!

11.description: I have been passing this store for the last 6 months wanting to find time to stop in. This past week I did that and spent over an hour in the store. There is so much to look at you could be in there forever and still find new things to see! I love the combination of vintage items for you to purchase, either for your own creations or with creative ideas they provide for you in tips and displays. I also felt their prices were fairly reasonable for framing, although I didn't pay much attention to the larger frames/project prices. I loved that they had several different vintage, repurposed frames to buy that offer a great look, and are being green/eco.They also have several unique items to buy for people visiting Chicago--dish towels, glasses, funny, unique postcards, definitely items that aren't your classic touristy, stopped-at-Wrigleyville-to-buy-a-shot-glass gift. They had great portraits, paintings, and pictures of different aspects of Chicago and neighborhoods that I appreciated. You can buy neighborhood items too to represent your part of Chicago or your most frequented L stop. Their cards and postcards are hilarious, creative, and they have a HUGE variety.The staff was also very friendly and kind! Will be shopping here frequently!

39.description: This is my go-to store for greeting cards - no matter the occasion.  Though the store is not incredibly large, their selection of unique cards, posters, and trinkets make this the ideal shop when you don't know exactly what type of gift you're looking for.I also recommend checking in at FourSided for your decorating needs.  The posters, maps, and lettering could go a long way in furnishing a new living space.

37.description: maybe i'm just uniquely their ideal customer, but i have been in a lot of cities and a lot of different stores, and i have to say that this is quite possibly the best store i have ever been in. i have not gotten anything framed there, but i did spend at least an hour poring over the various vintage odds and ends that really made that store as awesome as it was. sometimes prices seemed a little more than i thought they should be, but i just did a better job at asking myself if i really *had* to have something. and the cards - i challenge you to go in there and not find a good card for a good occasion.to top it off, they're dog friendly and just all around warm without being in your face invasive. i just can't imagine it any better than this!

0.description: My basic knowledge of Catholicism came in handy at Foursided.  I was shopping, minding my own business, when I heard a man ask the employee if they had baptism cards.  But he wasn't confident that's what he needed.  He struggled to find the word "sacrament," and asked her "which one comes first?" She struggled too.  I was apprehensive to interrupt, but felt like I might be able to help.  Yes, he meant baptism.  And no, Foursided does not have baptism cards - but many baby cards that can fit the bill!  Good deed for the day - check!Foursided is one the best boutique gift shops around!  It's a long way from home for me, but after reading a few reviews, into my bookmarks it went.  I was in the area last weekend (picked up a gorgeous area rug from Craigslist!) so I took full advantage of my time in Lakeview.There's street parking on Clark, but I felt rebellious and didn't pay the meter.  I was parked right outside the door and didn't think I'd stay as long as I did.  Just a guess - street parking on nearby side streets is probably free.What first caught my eye was the planter/vase with a cute vintage face painted on it.  I'd seen something similar on Pinterest that I'd wanted for my make-up brushes, but I lack ambition when it comes to DIY.  I was so happy to find something nearly identical and only $18.I also bought a dainty gold necklace shaped like an envelope (that my friends referred to as "e-mail" ugh), only $15!  It's lightweight but nice quality.  There's a nice variety of jewelry, especially with a Chicago or Illinois theme.Last into my basket was a coffee mug decorated with Pantone paint chip colors, also $18.  The theme here is affordable, adorable gifts - for yourself or someone else.  On this particular shopping binge, it was all for me!  There are lots of unique gifts, much of it has a vintage feel including Chicago-themed art, cocktail glasses, dog collars, cards and journals, candles - definitely check out the wine candles.  They're $28 but they really smell like wine - the chardonnay was my favorite scent.  The employees are nice and even wrapped my necklace in a box and my glass items in paper for secure transport back to the 'burbs.If you love shopping, especially artsy, vintage, unique boutiques, then bookmark this spot no matter where you live.

38.description: I have to thank Todd for doing a great job handling an unfortunate situation that arose with my framing project.  Weird ink/paper resulted in a blotchy finish on my prints.  Todd apologized, ordered replacements, the replacements were the wrong size, he re-ordered, and re-framed them using a different technique.What really stood out was the honesty and communication along the way.  I never had to throw a fit, I never had to debate anything.  Todd kept me up to date along the way, admitting when he had ordered the wrong sizes or when the prints reacted funny in the first place.  That's a kind of good, honest customer service that you just don't see every day.Todd really cares about the outcome of the projects and will be completely transparent with you if something goes awry.  Then, he will do everything he can to make things right.  So don't throw fits.  Be nice to Todd.  He and the folks at Foursided will take care of you!I also want to give a thanks to Jessica for helping me land on killer frames for my prints when I first came in.  They're up now, and they look so great!

51.description: Eclectic FUN....practically bought one of every Christmas ornament!!! They were way too cute to pass up.  Also found some funky Scrabble type tiles which I plan to use in a shadow box.  It was an inspiring shopping experience.  Had to go back a second day because I couldn't get a few items out out my mind.  I can't wait to go back after Christmas to see how the shop transforms itself.

27.description: Five stars seems to be too conservative for this incredible, fun shop!!!There are just too many incredibly unique items to explain it.  You have to experience this store.As an artist, I love many of the vintage images, great papers and fun add ins for collage work.  Go with a group of friends and share some laughs as you read signs/greeting cards.It is a MUST if you are anywhere near Andersonville!

32.description: I absolutely adore these greeting cards and wish I had a place like this close to home.  If I did, they definitely would be my go-to place for greeting cards.The cards are unique and I like the tongue-in-cheek ones that I found.  For example, the wedding and engagement cards are hilarious.  One was congratulating a couple on their wedding with an image of a shotgun.  There are cards that you can give your friends to ask them to be part of your wedding party.In addition to the greeting cards, the shop carries a great selection of candles and home decor.  They have a great selection of Chicago maps and images to decorate your walls.  Some of the images also don't require any additional framing, which is nice for those of us who don't want to deal with that.Overall, great card shop and I definitely will come back when I next visit the area so I can stock up on my card needs.

54.description: ive always been a fan of foursided...love browsing all their beautiful art and oddities.  so when i saw a groupon for framing services there, i jumped at the opportunity.  i believe the guy who helped me was the owner, and he was wonderful to work with.  he took alot of time with me to find the perfect frame options for the two pieces i brought in, was happy to honor my groupon, and offered some cheaper options when he saw my eyebrows raise a little.  he told me what i definitely needed and could do without...never felt like he was trying to upsell me.  fast forward a few months, and ive gotten sidetracked....came in to pick up my pieces waaayyyyy later than i should have.  and he was super nice about it.  also...the one piece i had framed i had been carting around with me to various apartments and it was looking a little worse for the wear....they cleaned it up for me and it now looks good as new...majorly impressed with that.  i will definitely continue to bring all my framing needs/business to foursided, groupon or not.

48.description: An ephemera junkie's dream. Especially if your taste is mid-century illustration.Everyone else mentioned the cards, the framing... nice, I'm sure. The guy at the frame counter seemed a bit hoity to the customer he was working with. That's OK, we were deep into piles of old flashcards. Lots of old paper from games. Letters galore. Everything is cheap enough on its own, but with so much can't miss, gotta have stuff, it added up for us.The person working the register was great, patient considering we had at least 50 different things from different boxes from all over the store, and not everything was marked. Can't wait to go back, but only when I got money to burn.

44.description: I have had numerous items framed at this location and every time the framing is top-knotch.  Yes, you may pay a little more than you would if you went to another frame shop, but the patience, time, consideration and workmanship you receive is absolutely worth the price you pay.  The people who work at the shop are delightful and are so creative.  When you aren't sure what to do with a flash card or a block with letters or shapes on it, they always have a really unique idea as to what can be done with it.  The cards are also some of my favorites.  No offense to Paper Trail (RIP), but the cards here are more my 'humor.'  I love this store and frequent it on a regular basis.

24.description: Great local gift shop, really funny cards for all occasions!

7.description: A very unique shop! Great for cards, knickknacks, and the best holiday decorations. This place is pretty great...it's a little dangerous for me now that I live a block away. They have some really cool vintage holiday items and they're a great place to start if you're looking to decorate your walls. The art is fantastic. Love love love this shop!

49.description: Let's cut right to the chase--you are going to come into this store for framing or for cards and tchotchkes.  You won't go wrong either way.  Their framing work is outstanding, but be forewarned that you will pay A LOT.  They have an enormous selection of frames, and the staff will dive in and work with you for as long as it takes to find the perfect combination (which could be thirty minutes or more if you are as particular as I am).  I have had two unusual items framed here--a jigsaw puzzle and a large quilt fragment--and in both cases the work was exquisite.  I hope to have those pieces in my family for a long time to come, so ultimately the expense will be worth it.And now that Paper Trail has closed, this will be my primary local source for cute and arty greeting cards.  They do pretty well with that too.

40.description: This place has a great collection of items. I found a wonderful housewarming gift. I love Tracy Capone's photography, available here. Friendly staff, too.

53.description: I'm so happy to have found Foursided after my go-to greeting card store (Paper Doll) in Andersonville closed! This is the perfect spot to stop in for a unique, beautifully-made greeting card and gift for someone - I've never been disappointed. The staff have always been GREAT, even letting me in while they were officially closed so that I could get an "emergency" card!  I've always been greeted and then left alone to browse - exactly what I want, especially when I plan to spend eons reading all the cards. Whenever I've asked for help, they've gone above and beyond, even helping me put together a last-minute gift bag.

30.description: We've had a number of pieces framed here, and they've always done a lovely job. I always end up buying more things than the framing job- bad for my wallet, good for Foursided!

46.description: Best card selection I've seen in a long time, I spent an hour browsing and laughing until my back hurt. Go and stock up for every occasion!

1.description: Foursided has been a great addition to the neighborhood.  We go there for unique cards and they also carry a decent amount of Chicago memorabilia.  We have also utilized them for framing and their cost are on point with other framing shops around.Some of the cards are on the pricier side but then again these are not your usual .99 cards found at Jewel or Walgreens.

55.description: I just had a large picture/poster framed at Foursided and could not be more pleased not only with the finished product, but also with the process.  I took my picture there because I wanted some expert/artistic advice as to choice of frame.  I've walked by the place numerous times and noted the "arty" way they do their windowscapes so I thought I would give them a try. I wanted a frame that would accentuate the beauty of the picture while also complementing the overall decor of the room in which it would hang.  The gentleman who helped me listened to what I wanted, made suggestions, and kept the potential frames within the amount I wanted to spend.  He was very patient while I considered potential frames which I really appreciated.  There was no rush to just write up a sale.  The frame I finally chose was one I never would have picked out on my own; yet, went beautifully with the picture.  I had to wait a week for the framing to be completed, but it was well worth the wait.    The newly framed picture looked just how I hoped it would both in the store and more importasntly on my wall at home.  I am happy!

9.description: I grew up in a house built in the early 1800's in Western NY.  When I moved to Chicago, my Mom moved to Florida.The new people that bought the house did a lot of "updating and modernizing" to the house, and I was really kind of sad.Then a package arrived at my flat in Chicago.  Because they were replacing the old front door, my Mom grabbed the key to the front door.  An old skeleton key.  Nickel coloured metal, with lots of evidence of being used and touched for over 100 years.I knew I wanted to show it off, but wasn't really sure how.  Foursided literally held the key to making my idea come to life.I went to Foursided, and found a small shadow box.  And an old map, and some vintage tiles that spelled out my house number.  I placed the key on a small pin inside the box, using the map as a back ground in the box.  I placed the tiles underneath.Once I had put all the pieces together, I had a real keepsake from the home I grew up in.  It now lives on my bureau, and everyday I am reminded of where I came from - and I can take it everywhere I go.The staff was exceptionally helpful in helping me find all the right parts, and pieces to make my idea come to life.You can spend hours going through the boxes and bins of what not they have in this shop.  And they are happy to answer questions for you, and if I would have asked, they could have done the whole project for me.While shadow boxes/framing are their thing, this is a great place to go for one of a kind gifts, greeting cards, and unique art work.I am glad that they are walking distance from my place - but they are also located walking distance from the Berwyn redline stop, and a myriad of Clark Street buses can take you there.The vintage charm of the shop was enough to pull me in off the street.  Now that I know what they have, I will be back for more!

26.description: I stopped into Foursided to browse around, an hour later I was still there admiring all the unique pieces. Great gift ideas that are truly one-of-a-kind!

25.description: You might be walking down Clark one day and suddenly realize, "Hey! I need some vintage typewriter keys!"You might be walking down Clark one day and say to yourself, "Uh oh! I forgot to get this woodblock print framed!"You might be walking down Clark one day and think, "Where am I going to get an expletive-laden letterpress card?"Maybe, just maybe, you're walking along on Clark and are saddened by your total lack of  tiny watch gears, skeleton keys, and miniature photographs of 1930's Chicago.Well! If you're walking down the the stretch of Clark where Four Sided stands, you're in luck! They can help you out with all that stuff. They also have pretty jewelry, holiday decor, and oodles of ephemera and miscellany, all served up by nice people. Some of the prices are a little higher than you might be expecting, but I don't mind giving a little extra to support my local botanical glass slide vendor.

12.description: Great inventory? Yes. But I was in here a couple days ago and the manager/owner was so nasty to his employees that I felt compelled to leave without buying anything. The irony of that was the manager was yelling at his employee regarding her not being aware of her surrounding customers:/

59.description: It was hard to choose between 3 or 4 stars, and it mostly comes down to price. I know this store handpicks items and is a curated decor and design shop but sometimes the prices make me balk. One of a kind, mod and modern, vintage and child-like - it's all here,  but it will cost you an arm and a leg. It takes a while to really rifle through all the unique items they sell, and really get in there and touch. Move things around, play with the frames, build words with vintage letter blocks - have fun! They can frame for you if you have a picture, or like me, put together some trinkets in a frame for a low price. They are very creative, so I would probably trust them to do most stuff by instinct.

21.description: Excellent frame work at this place. I Have had 4 items framed here and each one was more exquisite than I expected.  The people working here do a really good job of matching styles. A plus is all the interesting and one of a kind items for sale in this shop. 4 stars because even though their items and services are great, they are a tad pricey.

17.description: This place is awesome! I'd bet good money that you could buy a great gift for everyone in your life at this store. There is literally something for everyone. It goes way beyond typical scented candles and cards (though they have an EXCELLENT assortment of both) that typical gift stores have. The items range from meaningful to quirky and the prices are fair. A neighborhood fave.

10.description: I will start off with a simple, what a great shop. Do you have a birthday/shower/holiday gift need and no idea what to do? Well they have a load of unique gift ideas for just about every taste and price point with the added bonus of a great card selection.How about a bare wall and a need to fill it with a piece of art or perhaps your own picture/piece that needs a frame? What a fun selection of framed art work showcasing Chicago and Midwestern art works as well as some neat pieces that involve some everyday objects fashioned into interesting pieces to have on the wall. For those that are more into their own tastes and pieces I have picked up a few frames from here from their fantastic selection. We have a few simple frames from their stock selection and two of their reclaimed/antique wood frames. I like to "bus my own table" and put together my own frames and ideas but sometimes it is nice to have a different set of eyes to offer up a new perspective. After picking up a small piece during Open House Chicago I popped in for assistance and  worked with their framers talking about my idea and they offering a few different thoughts that I had not considered. When all was said and done I walked out with a professionally completed reclaimed wood frame, mat, glass, and my piece mounted for less that the price I was quoted at Blick for a only thick piece of matting. With the holiday season upon us do yourself a favour and check these guys out for gift ideas or stop in and/or have them take care of your framing needs.

5.description: I already raved about the location on Clark in Lakeview. This one is like the Mama to the Clark St baby. Seriously. I love it all. Ron Swanson quote prints, YESSSSS. Eclectic ephemera. And of course, the smartass cards that I keep on hand. I could seriously go broke. I love that the non-card merchandise varies and you never know what you might find. A Leslie Knope Galentine's Day card, yep.  Breakfast Club reference birthday card, of course. Pop culture and attitude.  I bust out my wallet every time.I haven't used the framing services, but I trust that they'd be rave worthy as well.

3.description: A hipster hoarder's dream! This place is knick-knack central! We loved it. Located in the heart of Andersonville, this is far more than a frame shop. They have so many cool, eclectic prints, knick-knacks, and money wasters all over the damn place. I loved it. We bought things we didn't know we needed but related to. ha. Love this place, def check it out.

35.description: Love this place! I was more familiar with Twosided until recently, never having had an occasion to get anything framed until December. I think I worked with Sarah? She was great. I brought in a unique piece that I was gifting to someone and, never having been to the recipients' house, didn't know too much about where it was ultimately going to end up. I didn't really have a starting point, but she was great and had a number of suggestions; we ended up testing a few different things out and came up with a perfect idea. It was a little pricier than I had expected, but to be fair, she asked if I had a budget in mind and I said no (I've never had anything custom framed before, so I was clueless). And that's now a moot point - I'm in LOVE with the finished product! And sad that I'm giving it away :)Beyond that, ditto to the other positive reviews of the rest of the store - great cards (and they're not all that expensive), unique gifts, and tons of random stuff that I might never have any use for but still love browsing through anyway.

19.description: You might be walking down Clark one day and suddenly realize, "Hey! I need some vintage typewriter keys!"You might be walking down Clark one day and say to yourself, "Uh oh! I forgot to get this woodblock print framed!"You might be walking down Clark one day and think, "Where am I going to get an expletive-laden letterpress card?"Maybe, just maybe, you're walking along on Clark and are saddened by your total lack of  tiny watch gears, skeleton keys, and miniature photographs of 1930's Chicago.Well! If you're walking down the the stretch of Clark where Four Sided stands, you're in luck! They can help you out with all that stuff. They also have pretty jewelry, holiday decor, and oodles of ephemera and miscellany, all served up by nice people. Some of the prices are a little higher than you might be expecting, but I don't mind giving a little extra to support my local botanical glass slide vendor.

28.description: Have to say, I haven't had anything framed here but the gift and card ideas here are pretty awesome. This is the first store (of four) that now reside in the northern parts of Chicago. The shop is filled with unique gift ideas with local flair. A lot of the items are Chicago or Michigan themed (I believe the owner is from Michigan), which is great if you're looking for that type of gift. A myriad of unique and quirky cards can also be found in the rear of the store. I visited this location the Saturday after Christmas and much of their holiday merchandise was marked down. The store was pretty busy and the sales associates seemed to be working with the customers...although I wasn't greeted or assisted. They did have a multitude of framing options, from what was hanging on the walls, but I didn't inquire into the pricing.All in all, a good bet for some unique gift ideas. I'll definitely be back, and if I did need anything framed (custom or not) I would give this place a shot.

45.description: I love Foursided. I started going here after Paper Trail closed and, I have to say, I wish I would have been going here the whole time. They have a large selection of really cute cards for all sorts of occasions and they're way better than anything you'd find at Hallmark. It's also a great place to go if you need to buy a present for someone you don't how to shop for - meaning I go there for my dad's birthday and father's day. They have all sorts prints and knickknacks. Some of the stuff is kind of expensive, but if you shop smartly, you won't spend too much.

33.description: I've been to a lot of independent card stores and this one has the best selection! Note: much like me, their buyer prefers off-color humor. If you're looking for sappy cards, stick to Walmart. If you're looking for creative/hilarious cards, it's a one-stop shop!

43.description: I have always been in love with the FourSided and TwoSided brand. I am definitely, as some folks mention here, a paper junkie! One of the great things about the brand is that they have variety. If you've got a little extra change, you can buy that $6 card that is going to make up for not having a present. If not, select a card and envelope from the card stock options on the left-hand of the store (I am partial to the mint green, myself!), and run yourself a tab of under a buck, still saving yourself the embarrassment of using a yellow legal pad to draft a "Happy Birthday" on top of a gift card pouch. Also- check out the selection of Chicago-based cards, posters, WRAPPING PAPER. I'm not kidding, this place has everything. I can't say that I have ever used the custom framing, but if I needed it, I would come here.Last but not least: the staff. AMAZING.
