Ask them anything and they are not only super informed, they understand that times are tough and that you may feel a little bashful about a card purchase. ($$) Seriously guys, a card from here still costs around the price of our precious Starbucks lattes, but they probably get the "it's too expensive" jibe 24/7. Give them a break, shoot them a smile, and ask how they're doing. :)

2.description: Great spot to stop in for after breakfast at the bongo room.I was quite impressed with this shop. Most of these kind of stationary, knock knack shops are overpriced with only a few interesting things. I felt like everything here was unique and fun to look at. From the candles, to greeting cards, and from the posters to the jewelry, this place was cool. I will definitely be visiting again with a bit more cash ;)

18.description: I love and miss this place soooo much!!!!! I used to live in Lakeview and this was my go to spot for last minute gifts. They always have the coolest things. Their cards are funny and they always have the best prints. I recently broke a Christmas Tree ornament, after insisting on paying for it, the store keeper refused. I recommend this place for anybody shopping for a female loved one!

41.description: My favorite store in the city. Best for last minute super unique gifts. Love it love it loveit.Weird vintage school flashcards and awesome stuff.

52.description: I could spend days in this place.  Stationary, trinkets, art, framing, candles.  Nothing you need, but everything you should have.  Fantastic.

50.description: I found this place when I lived in Chi-town and since I have moved it is always on my MUST GO TO list when I am in Chicago. There is never a lack of inspiration at either location. The stores are of decent size and full of fun, quirky, and original design concepts/ideas, products, etc., etc., And the featured products/design seem to change on a fairly regular basis, so there is typically something new and different every time I go there; which is refreshing. The owners and/or buyers have a keen eye for design that is current, eclectic, refined and smart. This is my go-to place for original, non-cookie cutter gifts, cards, as well as for inspiration for those extra special touches to my own interior design work and artwork. While I have not had the pleasure of having anything framed there, I have seen the work that they do, first hand, and it is of high quality. They frame for several artists in Chicago. The only down side, for me, is that some items are a little pricey, depending on what you are seeking. There were things there I would have purchased if the price was right for my budget. (Perhaps I just have expensive taste =p )I have never tried to barter or "haggle" on prices, so I am not certain if they are flexible on this or not. That is something to take up with the owner(s), not the general staff who are usually there. When in Lakeview or Andersonville, Check this place out!! **The store in Andersonville (on Clark) is my fav. between the two. Both locations carry  the same vein of design and products, but do vary from one another, so see them both!**   Due to not (personally) utilizing all of their services/products, i.e. framing, I gave them 4 stars but have no doubt that this is Five-Star establishment.  An online store would be great too. (Hint*Hint*)

4.description: If you're looking for anything Chi-town related to hang on the wall or set on a shelf, look no further.  A mind-boggling assortment of art, books, cards, candles, magnets, you name it, Foursided has it all.  I stood in the doorway for a long moment just to get my bearings and decide what to look at first.  And the employees are smart and friendly, too.  I will be back to buy some fun art for our Chicago apartment, but I'll have to bring my boyfriend to help me pick from the selection, because there's just so much to choose from!

6.description: Framing is not what this store is about

22.description: Foursided (and Twosided) are the best card shops in Chicago. They have a wide variety of cards from many sellers across the country. In addition to their amazing cards and prints, they also have a bunch of random things that you can use to decorate your place. It is hard to describe until you go and see for yourself but I can assure you that you will love it and not walk out empty handed.

15.description: A lot of fun stuff to look at!

57.description: Online they indicate they are open till 6p. Right now it is 5 and I have dragged myself and my poster here and they are closed. Super lame!

20.description: I really love this store unfortunately I will not be returning. I bought a novelty coffee mug which was then wrapped and placed in a small bag. Upon walking home my bag broke at the seams allowing my mug to break on the concrete. I walked all the way back (about a mile) to exchange it for another one (seeing as how I had a faulty bag). The manager refused to make an exchange but offered $4 (25%) off another one if I would like to purchase it. Absolutely disappointed.

36.description: I have somewhat of a rather large art collection (over 100 pieces) and had tried a handful of framing places since I first started collecting in the mid-90's. I found this place maybe 5-10 years ago and have not had a reason to go anywhere else. Todd has  a great eye for choosing the perfect frame for any piece of art. They have a wide selection of frames to suit just about any-ones taste and they provide excellent service . They also have the best selection of cards in the area since Paper Trails in Andersonville closed..

14.description: I absolutely adore these greeting cards and wish I had a place like this close to home.  If I did, they definitely would be my go-to place for greeting cards.The cards are unique and I like the tongue-in-cheek ones that I found.  For example, the wedding and engagement cards are hilarious.  One was congratulating a couple on their wedding with an image of a shotgun.  There are cards that you can give your friends to ask them to be part of your wedding party.In addition to the greeting cards, the shop carries a great selection of candles and home decor.  They have a great selection of Chicago maps and images to decorate your walls.  Some of the images also don't require any additional framing, which is nice for those of us who don't want to deal with that.Overall, great card shop and I definitely will come back when I next visit the area so I can stock up on my card needs.

58.description: The owner of Toujours contacted me on Yelp and offered me a free facial with Ally, her other esthetician.  I was a bit wary, but a couple months later I decided to go back.  Ally was awesome. The facial was so relaxing and enjoyable, and my skin felt amazing afterward.  She was also super fun to talk to, and listened while I yammered on and on.  Yet didn't say anything when I was in the mood to be quiet and just enjoy my facial.  You can tell she's an experienced and thoughtful facialist - her expertise definitely showed.I'm very happy with the professional response of this spa.  I've had a handful of good and bad experiences in this city, but when a business stands up and responds to a customer complaint and feels the need to make the situation right, it says a lot about the quality of the business Thank you Toujours!

56.description: I'm probably a bit of a nightmare hair client.  I typically don't have specific ideas of what I want, yet I expect a stylist's training and eye to give me something I'll adore.  I've had very few professional cuts - I've almost always cut my own hair - and I'm super-curly.At this point in my life, after not having a decent haircut in literally over a YEAR, and having my hair get pretty dang scraggly while I'm trying to grow it out, I decided to go for something quality and even get a Devachan cut (for us naturally curly girls).  The interwebs pointed me this-a-way, and the friendly reception guy set me up with Gabriel - bonus points for getting me in the day I called, I love that.I got there early, and Gabriel went ahead and got me started.  I was really tired today and not chatty at all - and I totally appreciated that Gabriel didn't push me into lots of small talk.  In fact, he let me sit there and zone while he did his work.  He also told me exactly what he was doing and why it was good for my hair.  Another plus for Gabriel - I had slept on my hair, shoved it under a hat, and pulled them back into a ponytail, so the curls were flattened and wacko.  Gabriel was smart enough to realize that we had to wet my hair down for the first cuts, then dry it to do the Deva.  And it looked great.  He showed me the products he had used, recommended a few, and also made suggestions for what I could use if I stayed with basic Walgreens-types hair product.  I really appreciated this - not suggestive selling.  I actually went with a couple of DevaCurl products that I was eager to try.  I couldn't decide between the gel and the foam, and Gabriel said that if I tried the gel, which we'd used, and didn't like it, I could bring it in for an exchange.  That was unexpected!So all in all, thumbs up.  The cut looks great, especially after I re-washed it and let it dry naturally, and I've received lots of compliments.  Everyone there was nice & thoughtful.  I'll definitely be back!  Thanks, guys!

29.description: So I'm always looking for someone to place random strands of color all over, but the problem I always had when going to a salon was that my previous dye job was too dark ...never could get the look that I wanted no matter how much I was willing to pay...after reading a few yelp reviews I figured I'll try this place out ...I had previously purchased some Kerastase and Oribe products so it looked good, and the reviews that I read about balayage (hair painting) sounded like what I wanted...and they all kept mentioning Samuel...so I made an appointment, didn't get my hopes up because it never looked the way I wanted so figured nothing would change no matter where I went...man, was I wrong...thanks to Samuel..:-)...I finally love my color...looks so subtle, yet amazing!!!

42.description: Eyebrow wax was okay for the price, nothing extraordinary.  What I definitely could have done without was the nonstop and nonconstructive nitpicking over my skin during the service - I got a lot of "concern" about my mild adult-onset acne.  The esthetician's solution?  Why, regular facials at Toujours, of course!  I tried to explain that my sensitive skin gets really inflamed after facials and I was trying to take it easy on it since recent life stress has been making things worse, but she wouldn't drop it.  I am not thin-skinned by any means (no pun intended...) but I felt a bit bullied and downright self-conscious by the time I walked out.  I get that they are trying to sell services, but it would be nice if they could find a way to accomplish this without describing everything little thing that's "wrong" with your appearance!

23.description: Stopped by without an appointment and was welcomed.  Old-school hair salon setting (with sort of a vintage vibe) and being a product junkie couldn't help but notice all the amazing products they had for sale that are difficult to find elsewhere.   Mari was my stylist and was spot on with delivering the vision I had in mind.  Received a ton of compliments and the up-do held up the entire day.  All of the staff were so friendly and professional.  Couldn't have been more pleased with my experience at Toujours.  The price was right too! What a neighborhood gem!

47.description: This salon is excellent!  I always see Elizabeth and she is fantastic.  I recently got a cut and color that she recommended and love it!  I don't trust my hair to anyone else.  The atmosphere is relaxed and comfortable and the staff are very nice.  If you go I strongly recommend Elizabeth!

8.description: Sarry took my hot mess of hair and really transformed it into a stylish mens haircut. I normally hate getting styled at salon because I have horrible cowlicks but when Sarry started cutting my hair, he seemed to do it just right! I was visiting and this was a refreshing surprise but now I am planning to move back and Toujours Spa and Salon will be my go-to! Sorry will be my go-to! Thanks so much!

31.description: The staff is hospitable. I was there a few weeks ago and my stylist Ljay Go was great!!! He did my subtle brown highlights and I love them. He's very passionate about his craft and I trust him with my hair.

34.description: Do you want Victoria's Secret supermodel hair? Like this bestbalayagedenver.com/m…?Of course you do! All you need is a balayage highlights / long layers specialist and it just so happens that I got a guy for that. Samuel is the absolute best hair stylist I have  ever had. I am a hair snob that has been to some of the top salons in the city and he is just as good with color as he is with cutting, where so many others are either/or. Being the dashing southern gentleman that he is, he really has an appreciation for women having long, sexy hair with movement and natural colors. I couldn't be happier with how he makes my hair look and being constantly complimented for having "good hair" isn't so bad, either.Also, balayage still hasn't gotten as mainstream as it is in NYC and LA. Not many salons have specialists for it yet. It's basically random, scattered "painted" highlights that when done correctly, make you look like you have been on a beach for 2 weeks. Perfect for summer! I will never go back to foils again. I am so happy that Samuel has moved back to the northside. I don't want to have to deal with going to the loop if I don't have to, so when he said he was moving to Toujours, I jumped for joy. Much easier (and less expensive!) so I can have pretty hair  24/7. You can, too.

16.description: This was not the worst haircut I have had in my life...its the second worst. If I wanted to look like a soccer mom, I would have gone to the hair cuttery and at least there they would have made sure the ends were even on both sides. (there is probably an inch difference between the right and left). Sarry was very pleasant despite the product/service pushing. And he told me that if I didn't like anything I could come back and redo it. But after this experience, I have vowed never to let any midwesterner near my hair with a shears again.Update: someone I don't know very well just pointed out to me that my hair is cut uneven.

13.description: Called to reschedule my appointment bc my babysitter fell through. Toujours charged me a 100% service charge as part of their "cancellation policy." I have never encountered a cancellation policy like this before. A rude way to start one's weekend! So bc of this outrageous policy they have lost my business forever and the aesthetician lost her tip. This business seems like it's on life support anyways. I can foresee them going flatline soon if they stick to such rigid policies. Who wants to bother with that when you're gracious enough to call versus being a no show. There's too much competition to bother with that kind of unforgiving customer service, (or lack thereof.)

11.description: I purchased a groupon for a facial and Lily was my aesthetician. The facial room was downstairs. It was clean and comfortable. However, the lights remained on during the entire time of my facial, so it was difficult to relax because I was facing upward toward bright lights the entire time. During my skin 'consultation', I felt that little time was spent discussing my skin and that  recommendations were general/not helpful. I was also told my skin was dry and that I have small pores, when it is obvious that the only concern on my face is larger pores and oily skin.I was also told extractions were an additional $15, which is odd because every facial I have gotten included extractions...I basically paid for 50 minutes (supposed to be 60) for someone to wash the makeup off my face and massage it.

39.description: After a very, very, very bad hair cut at a  Michigan Ave Salon, I stopped in here on my way home from the bus stop to see if someone was avaialble to fix me at some point today.  Originally they gave me an appointment for 5 pm (it was 1:30) and I was happy to have a light at the end of this horrific hair tunnel.  As I was walking out, though, one of the stylists, Elizabeth, stopped me and sais she was avaialble now if I wanted to stay.  YES!  As i took off my coat, the look of confusion on her face was evident.  So it wasn't just me who couldn't figure out what was going on with my "layers".  She was up to the challenge, thoguh and Elizabeth fixed my hair beautifully :D  The layers are perfectly blended and my bangs look awesome!!  So very happy with her and the salon - everyone is very nice.  I made another appointment for highlights in 2 weeks.  Just a lovely place to go with lovely people.  Thanks for fitting me in and making my hair look amazing!!  Can't wait for the color :)

37.description: I love this place.  The people are super nice, and Gabriel was able to convince me, after years and years, to actually make appointments in advance and go to one person consistently.  I also like that the people there are not pushy up-sellers!

0.description: I can't say enough good things about my experience at Toujours Spa and Salon. wonderfully pleasant staff. My stylists Lee and manager Amanda did a knockout job with my hair. I was cutting off 8 inches to donate (which could have been an anxiety-inducing experience, as I was essentially transitioning from a long-locked gal to a short, no-locked gal), and once Amanda got wind of that, she made sure I had the best haircut of my life. My long mane had become unruly and difficult manage, but thanks to Lee I now have the cutest mod-esque bob. And Amanda spent some time to texturize my thick hair just right. I can't thank them enough for their efforts to make me look and feel great. I used a Groupon for my first experience, but I will definitely be back.  Thanks Toujours!Should also mention that Toujours is under new management, so they will be changing their name soon.

38.description: Not impressed with customer service or atmosphere at all.  Stylist running 2-3 hours late and we didn't get a call, instead got passed off to another stylist after waiting 10 minutes anyway, without a question of if it was agreeable to have a different person.  The stylist didn't do a horrible job, but certainly not a very good one with his specific hair type, which is exactly WHY we made the appt with the original stylist (Karina is purported to have special curly hair techniques).When we called to inquire what happenned we were offered: either a complimentary 'fix cut' or we could 'choose not to go there.'  Literally that was what she said- sort of lame if you ask me.  So, not highly recommended at all.

51.description: I came here because they were one of two salons I could find in Chicago that advertise a Devachan-style curly haircut.  I've been very pleased with my curly cuts in the past at the Devachan Spas in New York, so I thought I'd give this place a go.  I found the place itself fine and Eric was very kind to me, but all in all I didn't feel I got the haircut I paid for.  Less than a month went by before I felt my hair needed another cut, it was just looking eh and drab.... and for the price I paid, I expected to be more satisfied with the cut.Nice location and welcoming staff, but I won't be back.

27.description: You know that feeling when you leave the salon and feel like a million bucks because you love your hair? You don't? Well, then you need to go see Samuel at Toujours Salon in Andersonville. He's a hair genius!I walked into Toujours with a horrible haircut that I received at a different salon in Andersonville. I was feeling deflated and unsure if anything could be done to fix both the color and the cut. Then I was introduced to Samuel. During our consultation he told me an easy fix for the color and explained what he would do to adjust the cut. He was knowledgeable, sweet, and had a great confidence about him. During my appointment he really took the time to fix everything about the previous cut and color that I didn't like. This man knows his color! He also knows how to transform a blah bob into a sleek, layered masterpiece. He could tell me what needed to be done with my thick and sometimes frizzy hair to make it manageable and I appreciated that - he'll be honest with you and most of all he'll make sure you love the hair you leave with. I'm thrilled to have found a great stylist and colorist in my neighborhood salon! Yippee!

32.description: I walked in just for a trim- my bangs. There were no customers, a very slow Friday seemed like. I usually see Sammy, who is excellent! The Lady at the FD told me that Sammy is on vacation and I could see Louie. Right after I said sure I'll see Louie for a trim, Louie who was sitting in his chair said: "oh just so you know you have to pay". What?! Very rude and unprofessional. I sat down, he was very unfriendly, no please or thank you whatsoever. I paid $10 on my way out. I told the Ladies up front that he was very rude. They agreed with me without saying a word. Their look was enough and said a lot. I'm very disappointed of my visit today and wont go there again. Oh yeah, I'll make sure my friends know of this as well.

54.description: Love my stylist, Gabriel. He (and Rosio) have kept me coming back for years.    Gabriel is laid back, and does not get into ridiculous chit chat if you are not in the mood for it, but is engaging and courteous.  He does keep me up on movies.  He always tries to accommodate my style wishes, and offers suggestions that make sense for my hair type.  Every time I leave I feel like that "just stepped out of a salon" commercial...and have a smile on my face.

48.description: This place is growing on me and it's all because of Ally. She is so good at what she does and she is SO gentle and kind! I can't wait to go back!

44.description: I left here with a flattering, polished haircut and couldn't be happier. Erin made it look easy! Definitely going back.

24.description: What a shamble of a place...So sorry to see Samuel go because that was the last haircut that made me smile...This place is going under like cars on lower wacker drive...Hopefully people go to another salon..Not worth the time and not worth my dime..

7.description: Short story: Got curly hair? Go in for a consultation. If the stylist doesn't answer your questions the way you think they should or suggests anything you know from years of curly cuts shouldn't be done to curly hair - walk out IMMEDIATELY. Like I should have.Long story:I have super-thick curly hair. I used to see someone at Toujours who was wonderful - the first cut she ever gave me was the only time in my adult life that I walked out of the salon and didn't immediately go home to play with it (instead, I went out for drinks in Andersonville, confident and happy!). Alas, that wonderful stylist is no longer cutting hair at Toujours. And I did not leave confident and happy this time around.As with all tales of hair woe, I did the thing I told myself I shouldn't do: I went in for a cut instead of a consultation, and I didn't leave when my head and my gut told me to.I called the salon to book, so I could check up on the other stylists who were cutting curly hair. I asked what kind of techniques the salon employed in cutting curly hair (knowing that my last stylist knew how to cut using Devachan and using carve/slice techniques). The receptionist said, "We don't limit ourselves to one style of curly hair technique."She was right: because my stylist didn't use one style curly hair technique. Not a single one.Here are the Pros of what happened during my appointment with Sarry: * Sarry is personable and enthusiastic. He's good at keeping clients engaged.* He made a few adjustments to my hair after I protested a bit on my way to pay. * After the cut was done, he was insistent that if I didn't like it, I should come back and he'd fix it. Which is nice and professional of him, but I won't let him touch it again.Now for the Cons:* He was ten minutes late in starting the appointment - he had run over with another client. He was apologetic, but came off as frazzled.* He cut my hair wet. I have been getting dry cuts since 2007, so I found this more than a little weird. When asked if he cut curly hair dry - or if he would dry-cut it while fixing it - he said he could only cut it wet.* After shampooing me, he proceeded to give me a blunt bob - the kind that people with thin, stick-straight hair get ('cause it looks super-cool on them!), where the stylist meticulously measures each side and cuts the ends while they're stretched out over a fine-tooth comb. The kind of cut that, when done on a head of thick, curly hair, gives the curly girl a different classic look: triangle hair. The kind that plagued my teen years in the late 90s and has made this summer's go-to hairdo a topknot.* For all of this, I was charged $75 for a "curly" cut that didn't employ any of the techniques that my old curly stylists would use, and took about 30 minutes (not counting the fix). It was a straight cut, and I should have been charged accordingly.I won't be back.

49.description: Very nice salon. Love my hair cut. Got a men's cut and style by Gabriel and was pretty impressed. Very reasonable price too. Not the best salon experience ever, but was definitely satisfied.

40.description: I had a very good base color touch-up yesterday with Rachel, a salon apprentice. Rachel worked with her instructor there (whose name I've unfortunately forgotten, but she's very important for this good review!) to give me a warm color to update my brunette base. The last time I'd had it colored, it was done too dark. The instructor saw this and discussed it with Rachel and they decided on brightening up my hair. It's really a detail, but it makes a big difference. They were very thoughtful with their process, and it shows. I'm more satisfied than I've been with my color in a long time. Thanks, Toujours!And also since I did this with a salon apprentice, the cost was very low. And for this type of service, Toujours was even more fair that the other salons I've been to.

53.description: Since there were so many grammatical errors in my original review I thought I would redo it. I do not know how the other stylists are, but the one I went to, Karina, did not know what she was doing. She was not educated at all about curly hair. After doing some research on my own, I found out the information she gave me was incorrect. For example, a product that contains keratin does *not* put moisture into the hair or make it curly. It is an ingredient that helps repair damage hair or helps prevent breakage when applying heat. If you have healthy hair it will dry it out and make it stiff or hard. I talked to a cosmetic chemist who use to work for L'Oreal, and she said in this country what most people want is to have straight hair, so the keratin infused products are design to add strength (providing protection to the hair shaft while breaking down the bonds to make curly/coarse hair straight) when putting heat on  it, or as I mention earlier help repair damage hair; if your hair is healthy it will dry it out and/or make it hard--- which is what happened to mine.  She also kept putting products in my hair that dried it out even more, and then she stuck me under more heat after the shampoo woman completely ringed all the water out my hair (for you non-curlies, curly/coarse needs water to keep it moisturized and heat is a big no-no because it gets the moisture out). It took me a good 3 months to put back the moisture in my hair. Once I got the moisture back I noticed my hair cut was uneven. To top it off Karina kept saying "this is what you wanted" obviously blaming me for her poor performance.  When I felt the shorter side was long enough, I went back to my old salon in my hometown  and had one of the stylist correct the cut. It is still not where I want it to be, but it is a lot better. I ended up paying, but really wish that I refused to pay. At the time I was angry, but I let it go, because I thought with a quick deep conditioning treatment it would be okay. After spending lots of money to correct it I wish I demanded my $70 plus dollars back. I strongly believe I would have gotten refund.   Karina may be a senior stylist and "Deva Certified" but she needs A LOT more education when it comes to curly hair. She needs to understand hair and not parrot what the large beauty companies say about their product.I do not like mention specific people in my reviews, unless it is positive, but I had such a bad experience and spent so much money to correct my hair I just had to get it out.

30.description: I had to write this review as I had the best experience today at Toujours and came home with a fantastic haircut and color.I had done a little bit of research before booking my appointment, looking on Yelp for a great salon that would suit me and had good positive reviews, I already knew about Toujours as I follow them on Facebook but I finally took the chance with them from the yelp reviews and I am so glad I did. My stylist Samuel was fantastic, not only great with hair and color but an interesting person too, I had such a great time being his client, he certainly knew what he was doing and I entrusted myself or rather my hair completely to him, I told him and showed him what I was after and what colors I was thinking about and left it up to his professional opinion to do the best with my hair.And he did, he thoroughly exceeded my expectations, my appointment was just great, we weren't rushed, he got me, we had great conversations and I came away feeling a million dollars always a plus.I will be back, I am so happy to have found such a great hairdresser that is fun, interesting and very very talented.Not only was I impressed with my fabulous hairdresser Samuel, but the place was very clean, the rest of the staff very friendly and so nice (especially when my young girls came in and played in the chairs) everyone was so accommodating no big ego's just great service and a fantastic haircut to boot.What more can a girl want, I came away with a great fantastic hair do, and a good feeling that I had found a great hairdresser.Thanks Samuel

46.description: Toujours Spa & Salon is exceptional...and let me tell you why, s'il vous plait!I discovered this heavenly place whilst strolling around Andersonville a couple weeks ago. First of all, upon entering the reception area you are welcomed to the salon in a very polite and gracious way, with warmth...then promtly offered coffee, water, or tea. It is a comfortable sitting area, surrounded by mouth watering hair care products, on clean shelves, current magazines that aren't falling apart, near a reception area where the assistants sitting there do not talk about what they ate for dinner last night, who they're mad at, or who is late. It was noticed and appreciated. First class!After being greeted by your stylist, you then collaborate about what you are trying to achieve with your hair. I was offered smart color options and simple yet fresh styling, and 90 minutes later me and my massaged temples, conditioned locks, and chestnut colored hair walked onto Clark street feeling like a model...from the neck up anyway. Julia made my color and blowout a very perfect experience!Toujours is a very good place to take proper care of yourself, get exceptional color styling, and attention to details that matter. You will enjoy every moment and dollar spent here. Tres jolie, Toujours!

1.description: So I was a huge fan of a salon in my old hood, Bucktown for my Brazilian.  Only I wanted to find a new place to go to since my move to Edgewater about a year ago.  I feel like the stars just aligned as I had been researching places in the area and Toujours was at the top off my list.  Then I saw a GROUPON for my Brazilian.Let me add the Groupon, total DEAL!. HOWEVER, no Groupon this place is the spot in Andersonville.Can I tell you first off the receptionist doing the scheduling is just pure joy to talk to.  She is super personable, knowledgeable on the product line offered at the salon.Now let's get Lily, who did my Brazilian.  I hate to be that person, but literally had to handle a call while getting the Brazilian.  Like what!?!. Who can get a Brazilian and be able to talk on the phone.  Yeah, well if you go to Lily I can tell tell you for FACT she is PAINLESS.Now that's just about the people and the services.  I haven't even mentioned Product Line offered for sale at the salon or the lux feel of the salon when you walk in the door.Yeah, SOLD here.  I can't wait to go back and see how they can handle my pixie cut and color. .... More to come, but I'm just saying, already impressed.

55.description: I love this salon! Perfect hair every time. Katie is amazing and always gets my hilights just right. (I'm kind of picky.) I have also had a massage with John-Michael. He's so sweet, and asks you a ton of questions in an effort to completely customize your massage. Heaven. Also, go see Ally for all of your waxing needs.A couple of other perks... the front desk staff is super attentive and very polite, and they're totally cool with it if you bring your dog in. I love supporting local businesses, and this place has been going strong for over 10 years. The owner (who has been there from the start) is often hanging out by the front desk, and if you get the chance to chat with her, you will no doubt leave with a smile on your face. Parking is not always easy on Clark/Foster, but I won't let that keep me from giving this place 5 stars.

9.description: 5 stars for Melissa, the new esthetician. So nice, personable, listens and gives honest suggestions if needed.

26.description: Toujours is the type of place I send my friends to. It's just that good. The prices are reasonable and the service (the ladies at the front desk are always so nice!) is the best of any salons I've visited in Chicago.Specifically, Elizabeth is my hair (and potentially life) guru. She's amazingly talented, really honest, and keeps me laughing when I'm in her chair. Exactly like another reviewer, I walked into Toujours with a horrible haircut that I received from a different salon (four inches shorter than what I asked for! gaps in my hair! eek!). Elizabeth was there to fix what had happened, and even a week later when I was struggling to figure out how to style my hair, she (for no charge) had me come in and spent almost an hour with me to give me the confidence and education I needed to style my new 'do. The shampooers are also really great, too- seriously the best scalp massages I've ever had. I leave here feeling like a million dollars and think you will too!

25.description: Go to Toujours and ask for Elizabeth!! She is incredibly talented and sweet, smart and thoughtful. She expertly cut and colored my hair and did a drop dead Gorgeous up do for my wedding. The whole salon itself is staffed with friendly and accommodating people from the stylists who came to beautify the rest of the bridal party and family (Rachel specifically) to the friendly receptionists. It's also a really pretty building in a great location..I love to grab coffee after my appointment or go shopping in the neighborhood --but who doesn't!? Seriously, get over to Toujours and have yourself a "me day".

12.description: Very friendly staff! The person who did my waxing was incredibly nice (it made up for the pain haha) and quite easy to talk to. Great business in the Andersonville area. Also participates in Belly loyalty program according to my app. Thank you, guys!

59.description: Great new look. Very open and bright. I recently came back to the salon after Eric, who had cut my hair for many years, had returned. My last visit was just as great as it had been in the past. The receptionist was very friendly and professional and the woman who shampooed my hair gave me such a great scalp massage that I could have fallen asleep.  Eric has always done an amazing job on my hair and I would definitely recommend him to anyone!!!!

21.description: I found this salon on Yelp when I needed a wax and didn't have have a neighborhood spot, yet! It was also my first eyebrow wax in years and I was getting my arms done for the first time. Emma was so friendly and comforting from the beginning. She also clearly takes her profession seriously, shows care and competency. The service was a success and so I booked a leg and bikini wax for later in the week and she was just as great. It made the pain and experience much more pleasant to know I was in a comfortable environment with someone who was very familiar with the service.

17.description: Today I waltzed during a snowstorm for a quick style re-set and had an amazing experience.  Tuba cut my hair.  She's a talented stylist and lovely person.  I always appreciate when a stylist listens!  She made my hair look AMAZING. Lily also did a very nice job with my eyebrows.  I think I may have to defect from my regular salon!  Thanks Toujours!

10.description: If you have long hair, don't waste your money!I came here with a $25 Groupon.  All I had done was add layers to my hair...not an actual cut.  Took the stylist ten minutes max to do this.  I was told at the check out an extra $10 fee would be added for my long hair which isn't even THAT long.  I went home and read the Groupon and sure enough under the FINE PRINT it said extra fee for long hair.  How sheisty.  Lesson learned: always read the fine print.

5.description: I went back and forth about writing this review, but here it is. This was probably the worst Brazilian wax of my life. Now, they are never pleasant. It's not like getting a massage, but the reason why I (and probably most who get them) do get them is because they're fast. Such was not the case. I wanted to save some money and bought a Groupon for a $25 wax. The appointment started out well enough, and Lily was sweet, but man oh man. 1. This wax took THIRTY minutes. If you're getting hair ripped out of you, this better be fast. I've never had a wax last longer than 15 minutes. 2. It probably took so long because she kept going over the same areas over and over again. This makes for super sore and sensitive skin. 3. Just wax it all at once, not one side at a time. Again, we could've been done by now. 4. Look, I don't need to be BFFs with the people giving me my wax, but if we're gonna be hanging out for this long, just...make some small talk to distract me from the...5. Burning hot wax you're using. Not for me, will not be going back.

3.description: Giving a thumbs up to the new esthetician Jessie! Paid attention to my skin, and gave me tips on how I can better it! Went in there embarrassed cause of how course and overall crappy my skin has been feeling and walked out feeling comfortable with no makeup! Still 4 days later my skin is soft & my breakouts have now cleared! I'll be coming back again :D

35.description: I try to support neighborhood businesses whenever possible and my family has given Toujours a try twice. Both times we were disappointed. The location is great, the staff seems friendly, it's light-filled and nice inside, but the services are not great. My husband had a haircut a few months ago and it was uninspired and pretty dated looking. He wound up having to get another cut within a few weeks to undo the Toujours cut. I was also very unimpressed with my massage. The masseur was friendly and nice but seemed inexperienced. I came in with pain and specific issues I wanted addressed. I was clear about my priorities and needs and I communicated regularly during the massage to make sure there was time to really get into the areas I was having trouble with. Unfortunately he never thoroughly work on these areas to my satisfaction and at the end I felt vaguely more relaxed but still in discomfort and pain. I left and immediately booked another massage somewhere else to address my issues and pain.I won't be giving Toujours a third try.

19.description: Stopped by without an appointment and was welcomed.  Old-school hair salon setting (with sort of a vintage vibe) and being a product junkie couldn't help but notice all the amazing products they had for sale that are difficult to find elsewhere.   Mari was my stylist and was spot on with delivering the vision I had in mind.  Received a ton of compliments and the up-do held up the entire day.  All of the staff were so friendly and professional.  Couldn't have been more pleased with my experience at Toujours.  The price was right too! What a neighborhood gem!

28.description: I recieved the worst haircolor and highlights ever! The cut was good, but the color was too brassy and the highlights were too thin and stringy. I was not happy with the mediocre job. Not worth the price.

45.description: As one of the few salons actually open on a Monday, my wedding day hair salon choices were limited. (Yep, got married on a Monday). So I went in with my pictures and scheduled a trial with Elizabeth. I knew what I wanted the front to look like, but I wasn't sure about the back and that was no problem because she had her ipad there, loaded with ideas on her pinterest. She nailed it on the second go, and listened to my criticism on the first one very well. Then they told me they'd be willing to come in an hour and a half before they actually opened, to accommodate my busy wedding day schedule.  All this for only $120 for both updo's. Hot damn, that place is awesome.

33.description: I've been meaning to write a review for this place for some time and was finally unselfish enough to do so.  I used to go out in the sun a lot and not wear sunscreen--a definite NO NO! After noticing more and more sun spots on the side of my face from golf addiction, my sister recommended getting microdermabrasion and got me an Xmas gift certificate here for a few sessions. The lady who serviced me was I think Jessica, who was sensational. Not only did she do a professional job and was passionate about it, but she talked about the skin as if she were a dermatologist. I was quite impressed. My face felt like a newborn after each session and I walked around with a glow. The equipment used was top of the line and they did not skimp on this in order to give customers the best service possible. Another thing that impressed me about Toujours how clean it is. Someone someone was always cleaning the place to make it spotless. I even saw Larry, the co-owner or manager of some sort, on his hands and knees one day wiping the baseboards. The workers there seem very pleasant and accommodating and I would not hesitate to recommend someone to try them.

43.description: I've only been here for eyebrow waxes, but they have always done a great job. The spa is small, but in a good, cozy welcoming way. Also, everyone that works there seems happy and that is unusual in this industry.And they give you free yummy hot tea!

2.description: Lee has been doing an excellent job on my hair! I went to Toujours a few months ago with a Groupon when I decided I wanted to try bangs. I was a little nervous, but Lee did an excellent job. He's meticulous and very gentle. My hair looks great! I have since gone back for several bang trims (I'm scared to trim them myself!) and a full cut. Before Toujours, I had been bouncing around to different salons with Groupons, but then could never afford to go back: I love that I have found "my" salon, with reasonable prices!

18.description: Been using their waxing services for several years (Lily and Emma) and I'm always happy with the end result.   I've seen Sarry (3 or 4X now)  for color and cut and was happy.  Recently had experience with another stylist, Louie, (Sarry was booked) and wasn't happy with the color, which was very uneven and just weird looking, or the cut.  I was also supposed to get 20% off for referring a friend, but at checkout was told I couldn't. I emailed the owner, Mohammed, about the bad experience and he said Sarry would work with me (for free) and get the discount I should have on my next paid service.  Sarry was awesome and stayed late to get me in- a very last minute accommodation - and I love my hair.  I think the customer service was great in trying to keep me a satisfied customer, and I am and will be returning.

41.description: I love this place b'coz there're many great products for hair & skin care selling at this salon! So, I don't have to go to buy it from somewhere else. Especially, the staffs are very helpful and the salon looks clean. It will be perfect, if they can provide some discount for their members. I'll definitely come back soon!

52.description: Toujours I love you so...the staff is professional, friendly and accommodating and I always feel so relaxed when I am there...but what keeps me coming back is Eric. I absolutely will not let anyone else touch my hair. He always does an amazing job and I get tons of compliments after each trip to the salon. Eric has never done me wrong with the color and highlighting technique. I adore the Wella color. The red does not fade quickly (unlike Aveda) and I'm happy to say my hair still looks great weeks after he cut and colored it. He is truly a gem. Thanks Toujours and Eric!

50.description: I was so pleasantly surprised when I walked in this salon. It looks really nice and I thought they would be snooty... Not at all !! Gabriel did my mothers hair and he was simply wonderful! Ally has worked on me and mom and she was fantastic! She said, she loved waxing people and it shows . Her work is painless ;)

4.description: Eeek...it pains me to write this. In fact, I waited two weeks, hoping by now I'd accept my new do, but alas every single time someone says "oh, you have bangs now" I want to cry because I am noting that they aren't saying "I like your new bangs." The reason you ask? Because my three year old daughter and I are twins with our matching hairstyles. Here's the kicker - I did not ask for bangs. I haven't had bangs since I was a preteen. Okay, here's how it went down. I went in with my groupon and the man who I met with was very friendly, although his English was not very good and wouldn't you know it's the one time I didn't bring in a picture. All I was intending on having done was a trim, just clean it up. He clearly didn't understand me, even when I tried to demonstrate with hand gestures, demonstrating the length I wanted it cut to. Instead, I closed my eyes and could feel him in front of my face, I knew it was going to happen, I just knew it, but didn't have the heart to stop him and to my horror - sure enough, blunt bangs. The sad thing is not only were they blunt bangs, but they were uneven and he took the hair for the middle of my hairline to make the bangs fuller so not only am I waiting for the bangs to grow out, but it seems that my already really thin hair is less than when I started. I hate writing this because he was so sweet and nice and gave me a hug when I left and I gave him a good tip because I just felt bad and hoped that I would just need to get used to it, but alas, I haven't and I just want others to be careful. If you have a gut feeling that you aren't being heard or understood, it's best to speak up before you end up looking like your three year old's twinzie!

6.description: this review is for Melissa the esthetician and Front staff... Both are great! I just left a wonderful facial service and had to write a review. I had an expired groupon and they accommodated me - no problem or attitude.  Melissa did a wonderful job and I felt so comfortable and no product pushing. I feel awesome and my skin looks great! I booked another appointment right then. 5 stars all the way !

22.description: Today I waltzed during a snowstorm for a quick style re-set and had an amazing experience.  Tuba cut my hair.  She's a talented stylist and lovely person.  I always appreciate when a stylist listens!  She made my hair look AMAZING. Lily also did a very nice job with my eyebrows.  I think I may have to defect from my regular salon!  Thanks Toujours!

15.description: Don't book this salon through Yelp. Toujours will NOT honor your appointment.

57.description: woe is me, who hoards daily deals for mani/pedis. there seems to be a million daily deal sites and im a sucker for a mani/pedi deal especially with my 99+ weeks unemployed situation going on. now i must admit the deal expired but damn im flexible willing to come whenever you can fit me in but no i snoozed so i lost, even asked to switch it to a regular mani which is similar in price to what i actually paid for the voucher a big ole no so a big ole middle finger to toujours

20.description: I went back and forth about writing this review, but here it is. This was probably the worst Brazilian wax of my life. Now, they are never pleasant. It's not like getting a massage, but the reason why I (and probably most who get them) do get them is because they're fast. Such was not the case. I wanted to save some money and bought a Groupon for a $25 wax. The appointment started out well enough, and Lily was sweet, but man oh man. 1. This wax took THIRTY minutes. If you're getting hair ripped out of you, this better be fast. I've never had a wax last longer than 15 minutes. 2. It probably took so long because she kept going over the same areas over and over again. This makes for super sore and sensitive skin. 3. Just wax it all at once, not one side at a time. Again, we could've been done by now. 4. Look, I don't need to be BFFs with the people giving me my wax, but if we're gonna be hanging out for this long, just...make some small talk to distract me from the...5. Burning hot wax you're using. Not for me, will not be going back.

36.description: Elizabeth was the first person to cut my hair in the city and (hopefully) will be the only one! With short hair, the details of the cut are so important and she is always right on the mark! Each time I come in I undoubtedly want to adjust something, and she is always so fantastic with not only the professional input she gives, but then executes flawlessly. The salon itself is beautiful and I always feel so taken care of and pampered!

14.description: I've waited a couple of days to write this review to see if I could work with my new hair cut, but it is just a disaster.  I had hair to the middle of my back and asked for a shorter style.  All in all I would say my haircut took less than 15 minutes by Sarry.  The layers are incredibly blunt and do not blend together what so ever.  I can literally see where each layer ends and have even had some friends comment on how noticeable and uneven it all looks.  Then when he was blow drying my hair he burned my scalp, twice.Also what I found incredibly awkward and have never encountered at any other salon is when I was finished he waited at the front desk while I paid and did not leave until I gave him his tip!In addition, when you walk by this salon it is usually empty and there is a hairdresser who stands out in front and takes his cigarette break, and he does so often.  He should be going in the back.  Also when we walked in another hairdresser was slouched in his chair on his cell phone, and when they weren't sitting they were by the reception talking.  The music was loud and the music variety was terrible and at times raunchy (so if you have children I would not bring them here).  I am only giving this one star because the girl at the reception was very friendly.  A waste of my hard earned money for sure.  I will never recommend this salon and am confused as to why an employee can write a 5 star review on their yelp page.  No wonder there are no real pictures on their yelp page.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

58.description: I'm a big fan of Brown Elephant for many reasons.  While I have it on high authority that the Boystown location is better for certain men's fashion items, I've always been pleasantly surprised by hidden gems at this Andersonville store.The venue itself is one of the highlights.  Located in a historic theater, there is more than enough room on the showroom floor for all of the donated furniture.  When moving into a new apartment in the area, I was able to find a number of affordable pieces in acceptable condition.It is also incredibly easy to donate any unwanted items.  I've given a few bags of clothing and other miscellaneous items in the past few months.  Not only can you feel good about donating to support a worthy cause, but they'll also hook you up with a coupon to save 25% off your next order.

56.description: Shortly before a move and after reading the reviews on Yelp, I e-mailed The Brown Elephant to pick up a futon and an old desk of my husbands. An employee provided me with a time frame on a Saturday - 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM. The movers showed up around 11:00 AM ish after calling around 9:00 AM to confirm the pick up. Three guys showed up, took our furniture and went on their way. They were courteous and professional. When you schedule a pick up, they request a small donation, which I had no problems with at all. I hope to use The Brown Elephant in the future. Great concept.

29.description: Nothing too special. I have heard people talk about Brown Elephant for a long time and how great it is but I was less than impressed. Maybe I came on a off day but I say nothing that wowed me. Hopefully next time I come by something will actually catch my eye.

42.description: Every time I go here, I am hoping to find something fun.  Instead, I am disappointed by high prices.  I'm sure that some people are willing to pay some sort of premium for used merchandise, but it won't be me.

23.description: Went shopping today for furniture. Ended up find a nice couch for $125 (they dropped the price to $100), but once we got it into the car, we realized the bottom was broken. They told us they don't normally do refunds, but since it just happened, they would allow it. They even help you load & unload furniture. They gave me my money back. The only thing I'm disappointed about was that it was broken, but they were super nice & helpful. I will definitely be returning.

47.description: I emailed the Brown Elephant to schedule a furniture donation pick up. It was very easy online and they confirmed via email and gave me available date options and told me exactly when they would call and provide me a 1hr window.  It all went as they stated, the only glitch was they ended up with a full truck from earlier pick ups and had to unload before they arrived at my place but overall it was a great experience and for a good cause.  I would recommend.

8.description: To all those people complaining about how overpriced Howard Brown is. Let me remind you it's a charity folks! God forbid you donate a little extra money to a organization that does a lot of good. If you want something for nothing maybe you should try dumpster diving.

31.description: The problem with Brown Elephant is I can't help but wander in on any given day (without having something in mind) yet here I am, walking out, laden with bags like a burro. It's impossible to not find SOMETHING at the various resale shops, and with specials every day (like today, for instance, a brand-new, still boxed frame at 50% off = $2.50), you can't lose. What makes this Andersonville locale special, though, is the people. There's something about the various employees working that adds the charm desperately needed to all the thrift-shops around. Always bouncing around, working, willing to share a tale or too, and somehow picking the best music for your (my) mood ... you can't help but leave smiling. Sure, things range in price from dirt cheap to catastrophic to one's bank account (almost assuredly for good reason) but how can you beat a limited edition Battlestar Galactica "Emmy Consideration" package for $10, a complete works of William Shakespeare from 1934 for $3, or even a USS Enterprise bottle opener for $1 (!!!)?WARNING: Beware the book section, especially if you're an avid reader. I'm still trying to work through my latest haul, an impressive 15 books that totalled $8; one of the books was even signed. It wasn't even a Book Special day! The selection is beyond your average dime-store romance novels; the best variety in a resale shop by far. Let's not forget, these purchases go towards funding health services for the underprivileged in our LGBTQ community at all the Howard Brown Centers. Without it, over 50% of their clientele will go without receiving the care they deserve. In my eyes, any day at the Brown Elephant is a win/win.

34.description: I have bought and sold and bought and sold four aprtments worth of cool things here.  The space is rocking. The prices are just fine.  the staff is mostly way cool.  if you get a grump, just look for the kess grumpy person in the buildingh and work with them.  Some peeps get funny when the volunteer; some don't.

16.description: I have always had  good experiences at the Brown Elephant but today was pretty outstanding. Willie, a store rep. Helped me to measure, try out if a piece of furniture would fit in my car, load the furniture into my car, and set up my sale. He was wonderful! I love my beautiful piece of furniture!! Thank you, Willie!

13.description: Just went for the first time. Stopped after visiting a couple of Salvation Army stores and thought this store was way more reasonably priced and had better quality items. I was surprised to read in some of these reviews that people felt the store was over priced. I actually had the opposite reaction. I plan on going back frequently...

11.description: I always find something interesting here. It's not the best place for a huge selection of clothes, but is great for random home items and furniture. I've found some really unique original art here as well. Plus, there's always great music playing, which gives the place a friendly, upbeat vibe. Prices aren't super cheap for a second hand store, but proceeds help fund medical care for the uninsured .

39.description: Not what I expected. The clothing selection is extremely small and expensive, don't even bother. May be good for furniture, but not for anything else.

37.description: Upgraded to five stars as the team that came to pick up my furniture was great, friendly, careful and on time. Original post: This post is with regard to donations.  I just had a terrible experience with Salvation Army not taking a great condition couch and loveseat... because I own a dog.  The driver and his sidekick said they wouldn't take the furniture BEFORE they even saw it.  Crazy in this day and age when you try and donate, some in need make it so hard. All it would have taken is for one of the THREE people I spoke to on the phone to tell me this is the policy- would have saved a lot of time on both sides. So I went on line and saw the great reviews on The Brown Elephant, clearly I should have contacted them first.  So far the experience has been great and the scheduled pick-up is luckily in the next couple of days which is awesome.  This post might go up to 5 stars after the pick up.  If you would like to avoid a high level of frustration, donate to this organization and NOT TO SALVATION ARMY at least if you are donating via pick up. Brown Elephant you now have another fan and I will definitely be donating to you more often.

0.description: It's a beautiful place. I love second hand stores. The Interior is worth seeing if you are a fan of old buildings. I never got lucky on video game stuff here, you just got to be lucky on what comes in. I found an awesome DVD set for my dad and the next day it was gone. Duh, silly me. Anyway. As a Wiccan I got lucky on finding a very particular item. My daughter was the one to spot it out as it was on display to be sold for Halloween season. I guess the dude who worked there knew I had something precious in my hand that was marked 5 dollars. He seen me through his Fabulous gray hair almost covering his eyes... I Seen't it.I put it back on the shelf and wandered off with my 3 year old daughter to find the wife and beg to buy this Witchy thing. Wife seemed interested too... Jackpot! We return and it's not on display anymore. All of us were like "Oh Well."But upon returning back to browsing... The Witchy thing was in a pile to be Re-Priced... OH NO!! And I knew it was Mr. Fabulous's idea. He knew I needed it. It was my precious. Well... My daughter was quick because she recognized it and grabbed it before it could be unfairly Re-Priced. Shame on that Man. But my Wife loves the place and I do too. That was my only incident ever and it would of got a 5 Star review but 4 is still good. I will for sure get some furniture from here and check back as much as I can for goodies.

38.description: This is my go to for cheap, unique furniture. If you can look past the handful of shoddy employees and look toward the handful of helpful employees, you'll go back week after week for great deals.

51.description: On Saturday my husband and i were around the neighborhood and we decided to check this place out. You never know what treasure you might find in a thrift shop. We went in and everyone in line and on the counter stare at us like we were some kind of aliens from another planet!. I should of taken that as bad sign and walk right out. Since we didn't care we walked in an looked around their clothes selection is about 4 little racks here and there nothing BIG. The racks has signs 2 dollar shirts 4 dollar long shirts 6 dollar sweaters. I found 2 cute shirts and i said 2 dollars each why not. A few minutes later the girl announce that they were closing and we walk to the longgggggg line to the "register" everyone was paying cheap stuff for the items they had picked up. So it was our turn, there were 2 guys one African American in the register and an older man that looked Native American with a navy sweat shirt. He looked and me and my husband up and down i guess to decide the price and he told me the shirts were 6 dollars each. I mean really nothing in your racks said 6 dollar shirt only sweaters and i told him about the signs on top of the racks and he said 6 dollars each!!!  I bought them because i was in line for so long. But i will never go back to this place. If you look put together or decent do not go here they will charge you and arm and a leg. If you look like you slept on the street and walked in to the store you will get everything CHEAP... HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE

27.description: Awesome spot to find gems for your home.  The turnover in here is daily.  So if you need something and don't see it the first time just go back the following day.  There will be new stuff.I have purchased  a table, coat rack, dishes, clothes, and jewelry. All for dirt cheap like $20 or less per item.Now here are a few important things to know.  If you want to transport a piece of furniture you must have a means to get it to your home as they do not deliver items for you.  They do provide names and phone numbers for people you can call to deliver.  I got some guy  for $30 to deliver an item for me and he carried it up the three flights of stairs for me.Second, if you donate an item to them such as furniture, they will pick it up from your home.Third, the money they collect goes to HIV/AIDS Research at Howard Brown.Stop by.  You are bound to find a gem for you or someone else.

32.description: This location in the city has the best selection. There is a ton of stuff to look through when it comes to furniture and kitchen supplies and that is where I think it excels. However, there is an extremely low variety of nice clothing, although the price is right, and the music selection (records) is terrible. Like a bad garage sale. Overall it's a mixed bag. You'll probably leave with what you were looking for when it comes to the home supplies.

54.description: While this place has a smaller selection of clothes and shoes than Goodwill, and is also slightly pricier, the money goes towards a good cause. I think they have staff that actually will research the donations, especially the furniture and price them near or slightly below market value (vs Goodwill where everything is a set price.) I saw an almost new espresso maker that was gone when I did a second lap 10 minutes later. The store itself is located in this old theater, which gives it a grand old air.

48.description: The best second hand shop in the worrrllldddd!!!! You can find amazing deals there and the stuff is clean and in good shape. Nothing is over priced and you can always make an offer if you think it is.

44.description: Great prices, amazing selection on furniture and knick-knacks. I can't believe it took me so long to visit this place since I grew up in this neighborhood. First time there this weekend and already found two great furniture pieces (computer desk/console and tv stand) both in amazing condition for two amazing prices. I highly recommend this places. Especially because "the revenue generated by donations and purchases at the Brown Elephant Shops help fund services for the more than 50% of Howard Brown Health Center clients who are under or uninsured."AMAZING!!!

24.description: I adore this place it's clean neat and friendly and I always seem to find something for my ever changing home decor needs. There's more home stuff than clothes as well as a great book selection and it changes daily which is nice/terrible for the thrifting addict in me.

7.description: Ridiculous prices!!! Almost all books i looked at were around 6$, and checking on ebay reveals that you could buy them new with almost the same money!Clothes... oh well.. half of them didn't have tags on or the tags didn't have a price. When there was a price, it was on the high side and whenever I found a nice dress for 8$ (lowest price that there was on dresses) it had stains or rips in clearly visible places! I will never step into this place again. Even decorative items and cheap china was hugely overpriced.  I wouldn't even want to donate anything here, to be sold with ripoff prices..

49.description: Just moved to Andersonville from the Lakeview area, so I'm used to their Brown Elephant. I stopped in at my new one this weekend and was pleasantly surprised. This one is cleaner (and somewhat cheaper, unless I'm crazy) than the Brown Elephant in Lakeview. The selection seems to be curated here, where the Lakeview store is all over the place and kind of a mess. I love that in a thrift store, but it's nice to know that I can walk into this one and find quality stuff. I grabbed two matching bowls for $3 and a stack of six or so books for way cheap. Grand total = $7.10. Hell yes.

40.description: Love this place! Before my move to Chicago I did my research on thrift stores and was lucky enough to move into a place within walking distance of this gem! On my third day in the city I decided to venture out and I ended up buying a complete dish set and a beer mug for $18. Not bad. The prices are great and the staff is friendly. Great furniture and awesome book selection - quarter books!

53.description: Parking is hard to find!... but once inside, you might find some deals you like. Some priced reasonably and some a little over-priced. I wanted office chairs that they had-- wasn't new or in excellent condition-- but I had doubt about its durability for the price. Nonetheless, I went home with one pretty shirt for a very good deal. I think I'll be back again when I'm in the area.

30.description: Big fan of this place.  Thrift-store shopping is always a crapshoot - has anyone your size recently donated anything?  Do they believe in purchasing quality garments?  Do they have an eye for style, or do their tastes run more towards Trendy Vintage Awful? - but good curation does wonders, and these folks are very on-the-ball.  I've only rarely found anything either overly worn or hideous (or both) on their racks, and I've far more often found some awesomely classy stuff.The selection's a bit small, true, but it gets rotated out with some regularity.  And the book and CD collections are always worth browsing through.  I think that's what I like about this place, actually - it's not for Serious Thrifters who plan to devote their entire day to fighting over stuff at rummage sales.  Rather, it's a great place to stop by when you're in the neighborhood; there's a good chance you'll find something you like, but if you don't, you haven't wasted more than a half-hour or so going through it all.  And best of all, your money goes to a great cause.

46.description: Overpriced. I went looking to teacups and teapots for an Alice in Wonderland themed party I'm planning, and they wanted between $10 and $20 for a teapot. Ummm, if I wanted to pay that much for a teapot, I'd go to Target.

1.description: The good cause/ public benefit nature of this store bumps it up from what would ordinarily be a three star for me.  A lot of the bigger pieces are a bit overpriced for what you get which makes me hesitant to purchase anything there, but, as with any thrift store, there's a treasure trove that needs to be discovered through careful digging and constant browsing.The biggest problem I have is with the customer service.  It is incredibly inconsistent and more often than not, it doesn't exist.  There have been plenty of times in the past couple of months where I've been in there to drop items off and have had no direction from the staff, not a word said to me, and no help offered to bring bags and bags of clothing and item in.  The donation drop-off needs to be better marked and there needs to be someone who is committed and dedicated to receiving items.

55.description: Love this iteration of the BE.  It is always a fun experience going there. Makes it even more fun, as the proceeds support a great cause.

9.description: I am a thrift store fan, and I love that this location is set up in an old movie theatre. I will say, however, that I don't really seem to find anything I like most times I stop in. The clothing selection is sparse, and I find myself hard-pressed to find a book I want to take home, even at their very reasonable prices.The staff is very friendly, and I do occasionally find a gem in the DVD bins, but nothing else really grabs me here. I guess that's the fun of thrifting though, coming back until you find that magical item that destiny steers your way.

26.description: My daughter and I had a great time looking for a larger desk/work table for her room.  We didn't find one, but she got two dresses for $8 each, and I got 4 vintage martini glasses for $4 total.  Perfect for my husband's and my pineapple-infused vodkas tonight!

25.description: This is my favorite thrift shop in Chicago! They put out new things everyday and always have a large selection of nice furniture. I usually go once weekly and rarely do I walk out empty-handed. They do a lot of different sales, such was 50% of furniture and home goods. Great place - definitely check it out!

12.description: The space is unique and beautiful.  The furniture can be interesting.  However, the customer service is non-existent (not like I expect much from a thrift store, but still...) and the prices on furniture are a joke.  Honestly, it seems like you are being punked the prices are that outrageous.  Even with the funds going to a good cause, this is a thrift store, not an antique mall.  Pass.  No need to ever go back.

59.description: This review is entirely about the pick up donation process.I just moved and had a bunch of stuff to donate.  I looked online for places that would come pick up a donation for me since there was a sofa and I also was looking to exert as little effort as possible.  I submitted an online form at both Brown Elephant and the Salvation Army.  BE called me back immediately to set up an appointment, I never heard back from SA.  The soonest Saturday that worked for me was about 3 weeks out, so planning ahead would be key if you don't have storage space in the meantime (which I do so not a problem)  They gave me a window of 10-1.The day of the donation they called me at 9 to tell me they would be there between 12 and 1 and ask where they should bring the truck (alley).  Two guys arrived promptly at 12:15 and loaded everything up in less than 15 minutes.  They were really friendly and polite and efficient!Overall, this was a stellar experience - I'd have been willing to pay to have someone come get all this stuff out of my basement, but instead, not only did BE do it for free, but I also had the opportunity to support a great charity!Thanks, Brown Elephant!  You'll be my go-to donation spot forever more.

21.description: I am a thrift store fan, and I love that this location is set up in an old movie theatre. I will say, however, that I don't really seem to find anything I like most times I stop in. The clothing selection is sparse, and I find myself hard-pressed to find a book I want to take home, even at their very reasonable prices.The staff is very friendly, and I do occasionally find a gem in the DVD bins, but nothing else really grabs me here. I guess that's the fun of thrifting though, coming back until you find that magical item that destiny steers your way.

17.description: This place has great prices on furniture! They are willing to bargain too! I haven't found anything I want to buy there yet, but I'm going to keep coming back to look.

10.description: I always come to the brown elephant optimistic that I'll find a hidden gem, but so far have left empty handed. I'm usually here to look at the furniture selection, and so far the sparse offerings have missed the mark. There are some great deals to be had, like the overstuffed chair and matching ottoman for $50 that I saw last time. But there's just something a little dated and clunky about a lot of the furniture here that have left me somewhat disappointed each time...

5.description: Everything is extremely overpriced. I laughed when I saw a used scratched up Nintendo wii selling for $60. For that price I would rather go to ebay and get a brand new one for the same price with all the accessories. What a joke and a rip off...Sooner or later, they will go out of business.Good Riddins

3.description: I have been coming to the Brown Elephant in this location for several years now. I always stop in when I'm in Andersonville, and never leave empty handed. Great quality furniture and decorations if you're into the antique/vintage stuff. I love that it is inside am old building with minimal remodeling, it really adds that extra touch to thrifting. I am always amazed at the sales I get. More recently, I got a pair of brand new Anthropologie pants for $3.... The original was......GUESS? Wait for it.................. $128!I rarely but brand new things, and usually get used items for even jewelry, and household furniture. This place is great.

35.description: I think sometime last year that Brown Elephant started reading their own headlines, because they're not the same Brown Elephant anymore.  As a few others have stated, their prices are off the charts and no longer thrift store prices, more like secondhand prices from Neiman Marcus.The inventory has been reduced, the prices have gone up and the quality is no better off.  I'm not sure what the reasoning is, but its changed, and not a place that I go out of my way to visit anymore.

19.description: Went shopping today for furniture. Ended up find a nice couch for $125 (they dropped the price to $100), but once we got it into the car, we realized the bottom was broken. They told us they don't normally do refunds, but since it just happened, they would allow it. They even help you load & unload furniture. They gave me my money back. The only thing I'm disappointed about was that it was broken, but they were super nice & helpful. I will definitely be returning.

28.description: This store is great for what it is. It happened to have a great 50% off furniture (wood only, I think) sale and I found a great TV stand for just $8.The service was fine, nothing special but friendly enough!The other location didn't seem as good but I also came away with a $40 desk that I look forward to using!

45.description: The Brown Elephant of Andyville is an excellent way to kill an afternoon perusing things you probably do not need. They have a really impressive book selection that is constantly being replenished. I've recently been spending way too much time scouring their book selection and getting great books for $1. The thrill of the hunt is addictive, I can never buy another book at full price again. They also have a really nice selection of dishware, kitchen items and knickknacks. You never really need more tea cups but how can you resist for a few bucks? I can't. Their furniture is worth looking at if you are in the market for a couch or a dining room table but the competition for the best furniture seems pretty steep among shoppers and I am not prepared to lay on top of a dining room table to claim it as my own. They have a small-ish selection of decent looking clothes but the prices aren't dirt cheap like at Village Discount Outlet several blocks south on Clark.The staff is extremely friendly, the entire complex is very clean and well organized. Some things may be a bit overpriced but all in all I think it's pretty fair. Plus you are giving your money to a good charity when all is said and done. For me Brown Elephant is all about the books. I love this place!

33.description: This is the best thrift store by far. Solid pricing, $2 for all shirts, $6 for dresses and $8 for sweaters and jackets no matter the designer. Snagged an Anthropologie coat for $8 and some assorted dresses and sweaters and boots all for $40. They also have great furniture and decor. This place is super rad.

43.description: I have gone here multiple times--always hopeful for a different experience.  However, I usually find myself laughing at the high prices and leaving empty-handed.  Andersonville has so many great thrift stores and antique shops to choose from...Brown Elephant just can't compete.  Most recently I stopped by to look for old picture frames for a project I was working on--I found the average price of a beat up 4x6 frame was about $5.  Really?  I think you can buy a brand new frame for that much at Target.  They have a wide selection of books which are priced well (0.25-$1), but that's really the only section I would recommend.  Even their kitchen selection is comprised of miscellaneous cups and mugs for $3 each.  With all the other stores to choose from, Brown Elephant needs to be a little more reasonable with their pricing--they'd have a lot more business!

2.description: New to Chicago I was told to visit this location and check-out their selection for possible furniture finds. I thought it was great that much of the money goes to funding a good charity. Now the selection were fair, nothing amazing. The pieces were of "Good Will" standard which was fine. Then I saw the prices and like some of the other reviews on here-I was slightly shocked that some of the prices seem a bit inflated for the item. I think their appraiser might want to do some research to get an appropriate price-point.All-in-all, If all your looking for are some tchotchkes then stop by on a lazy Sunday, other then that I can't imagine finding a great furniture pieces at the right price.Maybe their second location might have a better selection.
