18.description: Awesome spot to find gems for your home.  The turnover in here is daily.  So if you need something and don't see it the first time just go back the following day.  There will be new stuff.I have purchased  a table, coat rack, dishes, clothes, and jewelry. All for dirt cheap like $20 or less per item.Now here are a few important things to know.  If you want to transport a piece of furniture you must have a means to get it to your home as they do not deliver items for you.  They do provide names and phone numbers for people you can call to deliver.  I got some guy  for $30 to deliver an item for me and he carried it up the three flights of stairs for me.Second, if you donate an item to them such as furniture, they will pick it up from your home.Third, the money they collect goes to HIV/AIDS Research at Howard Brown.Stop by.  You are bound to find a gem for you or someone else.

41.description: Great second hand store for furniture.  They have good inventory here and I believe you can bargain.  They also have clothes and accessories.  Things are organized and easy to get around.  They also have a seasonal section.

52.description: The joys of thrift store shopping - hours spent rifling through used books, kitchenware, art posters, clothes, daydreaming about making-over the second-hand furniture.  If you're like me, it's an afternoon well spent; a little piece of heaven.   Affordable, of course, and all of the money goes to a good cause, so if you buy something you like, there's a good karma bonus!So why only three stars?  Because I recently walked into the Brown El and almost had a panic attack - the store was half empty!!  I ran over to an employee and asked if they were going out of business.  He said no, but that they were trying to focus on quality rather than quantity.Quality over quantity?  At the Brown Elephant?  Are you insane?  No, no, no!!!  Gimme back my quantity!  I want those aisles PACKED to the rafters with goodies.  Part of the joy of thrift store hunting is the panning for gold - finding that gem that you just can't live without.  Why oh why the big change? This used to be the one place in town where a person could furnish a kitchen for a handful of bucks, and have a good time doing it - now we can only oggle stray pieces of fiestaware?And who exactly is pre-judging the so-called quality?  You know what they say about one man's trash ...   Please get this place fully stocked with mountains of stuff, like it used to be.  Do that, and I'll give ya yer 5 stars.

50.description: This place is great for when you want something new for your home, but you don't know what you want.  They have a large selection of plates, platters, glasses, furniture, artwork and furniture.  And they have lots of books, cd's, records, and oh yeah clothes, too.  The workers are friendly, and they make you want to donate your stuff here.  They even give a 25% off coupon to anyone who donates, and you can fill out a tax form easily while you're there.  They play at least one The Smiths song while you're in there, which just makes it that much more fun.

4.description: A+ for their furniture. A++ for their proceeds going to Howard Brown. Also amazing - the people who work in the donation area! They never let you carry your own donations and are the friendliest people. Their clothing selection is solid, though smaller than the other location. It's also great for used queer books and DVDs! Sometimes their prices are a little expensive for me, but hey, I'm just thrifty.

6.description: Pulled up to the loading dock to drop 15 bags of clothes as well as a couple of boxes. Pro: Nobody blinked an eye at the huge amount of stuff. One person in the area answered questions when we posed them. Con: The other person in the area didn't even make eye contact. Nobody went out of their way to be helpful. These two cons are the only reason I debated between 3 and 4 stars. I rounded up.Went in after the drop-off and parking (street parking which was fairly convenient considering what a bustling neighborhood this is). The space is totally cool; the building used to be a theater. The staff on the floor was friendly. I found a beautiful 100% silk necktie for $3.My family and I are doing a massive clean-out of our house. It's good to know that we can bring the stuff here. It's a well-run operation for a good cause.

22.description: Love this place. Easy to find practical stuff at a cheap place for your home, yard or apartment. Everyone is friendly and they are volunteering their time for good use.

15.description: This store is great for what it is. It happened to have a great 50% off furniture (wood only, I think) sale and I found a great TV stand for just $8.The service was fine, nothing special but friendly enough!The other location didn't seem as good but I also came away with a $40 desk that I look forward to using!

57.description: I love the Brown Elephant and all that it stands for. I first stumbled upon the resale shop a few years ago, and my intention to just browse ended up in a purchase that greatly expanded my record collection, but cost me next to nothing. I have also donated several larger items to Brown Elephant, and have always had an easy time scheduling pick-ups around my crazy schedule. Every employee I've crossed paths with has been very friendly and helpful.

20.description: I always come to the brown elephant optimistic that I'll find a hidden gem, but so far have left empty handed. I'm usually here to look at the furniture selection, and so far the sparse offerings have missed the mark. There are some great deals to be had, like the overstuffed chair and matching ottoman for $50 that I saw last time. But there's just something a little dated and clunky about a lot of the furniture here that have left me somewhat disappointed each time...

36.description: Once upon a time, the selection of just about everything was fantastic, and the prices were what you'd expect at a thrift store.  Those days are long gone, as the prices are ridiculous!   A vintage ash tray for $55?  A vintage desk for $795?   Badly beat-up picture frames for $15?  Have no idea if donations are down, but the selection of everything (except clothes) isn't what it used to be.The only deal to be found is their used books, the selection of which can be great.This is too bad, as shopping there is for a good cause.  They would be wise to lower their prices to something more in line with what a thrift store should charge.

14.description: Great place to find unique items for the home. At reasonable prices, too. Selection of items changes each time I visit. Staff very friendly and helpful. Will be a continuing shopper here for  many more return trips.

58.description: Looking for someone new to do your hair is no small feat.  Price, skill as well as location are all considerations.  Happily, all three were found for me with Josh at the Robert Jeffrey Hair Studio.  From my consultation to the final shake of my smock, Josh was professional, warm and super cool to boot!  He took his time with my keratin treatment and really made me feel special.Located on Clark in Andersonville makes getting there really easy, and who wouldn't enjoy taking a walk in such a cute neighborhood afterwards, showing off your shiny locks?

56.description: Nice salon. Very helpful people, the lady at the counter made me a cup of coffee!I took my mother here for a mother's day cut and although they changed her hairstylist at last minute, her hairstylist as friendly, funny and consulted both me and her about her hair. Originally my mom asked for a style that the stylist deemed unflattering, but said he would do it for her anyway if she had her hopes set on it. We all talked it over and went for his look, but kept the bangs she wanted. She was very happy with the final result and even got looks from younger, cute men, which made her happy : )The big plus?Since we were first-time clients, I only had to pay $40 over the $65 it originally would've cost! LOVE this spot!

29.description: Robert Jeffrey is a nice salon in Andersonville.  I have gone there for the last few years, and both my significant other and I even switched stylists when a couple of them left the salon.  There are many professional and very good stylists at this salon.  Shout out to Nick.  He's been doing a great job on my hair for about a year.  He takes his time and pays attention to detail.The most fun part of Robert Jeffrey is that it is next door to a world class beer bar.  Be sure to have a post-haircut beer!

42.description: I have gotten my haircut with Evelyn a few times now and she is awesome. I love how she styles my hair. She really takes the time to make sure my hair is the way I want it.  I will definitely continue going here.

23.description: I am updating my review to rave about the stylist I started seeing after Martin: Nick! I would give him 5 out of 5 based solely on the quality of our conversations. As luck would have it, I can also give him the same review on the quality of the cuts and color that I get from him. I like him so much that even though I moved a significant distance from this salon, I still trek up to Andersonville so that I can see Nick. He is awesome. If you're looking for a new stylist, check him out.

47.description: Ken Maddex is my rock star stylist that  I've been following for years. On my first visit I said, "Please give me a cut for my face instead of what I ask for". And I've never looked back. I *constantly* get compliments about my hair--even that day we had crazy fun and finished it Jersey "bump-it" style.Having been with Ken through his transitions, Robert Jeffrey is a great fit for him and I am happy to be a member of this salon. The salon is cool, hip and clean and the staff us always friendly and helpful. You always hear people leaving happy!Note: Make sure you have cash for the tip.

8.description: In my ever-long quest to find the perfect salon and stylist, I came upon Robert Jeffrey whilst walking to Hopleaf one night. "Oh, looks like some fun stuff going on in there," my mind chirped. So, much in need of thinning out my helmet-esque-looking-mop, I made an appt and was scheduled to be seen by owner/senior stylist Rosa.Everything was lovely - the salon is clean, the front desk super helpful and nice, the decor is modern and inviting. But, holy sticker shock, shit! When I did the research into RJ's prices, I saw mens cuts for $35 and womens for $45. Now, I have short, short hair. Like a man. Man hair on my female body. So, one would assume I'd fall somewhere between the $35 and $45 price range. "That'll be $65," the friendly front dude said to me. I almost fell over. With a $15 tip, I spent $80 on something I assumed (sigh) would only cost about $40.Yes, I realize Rosa is the owner and a senior stylist (senior stylists = more $$$ than junior stylists, generally.) And, yes, she used nothing but scissors on my hair (versus some of the younger, less-experienced stylists I've been to lately who use buzzers) and it came out pretty dang great. And, yes, she offers free touch-ups so when my neck hair is longer than it should ever be, I can go back and get a quick fix for zero dinero.But, I'm still kinda blown by the price. No where on the website does it say it will cost that much, AND, I'm so against charging women more than men for haircuts  - it's just stupid and sexist. I should be able to walk into any salon where men get the same cut as I do, and pay the same price as they do. There is no difference between my disconnected 'do and his. (The beauty industry seriously needs to modernize their pricing scheme.) So, that's that. I'm not sure if I'll continue my quest or stay settled here.... stay tuned.

31.description: I just recently moved to the city and was looking for a hairstylist and stopped in and was referred to Sarry. Not only was he polite and respectful, he listened to what I wanted and gave me the best cut! We also had a pretty awesome conversation! I would absolutely recommend him and I got a 20% discount for my first time and 10% for making my next appointment!

34.description: I went to Chicago with my friend and thought I'd get my hair cut/colored. Yelp found me this place. I made my appointment the day before. I loved the clean atmosphere. Very professional. I had Sarry Yono, and he was fabulous. So easy to talk to, and really listened to what I had wanted. My cut and highlights (after the 15% discount for being a brand new customer) was $104 and I have really long, extremely thick hair. I would definitely recommend Sarry for sure! :)

16.description: Yes!  I have finally found my go-to salon!I have lived in the area for 3 years and couldn't find a salon to my liking.  I often found myself going home to the suburbs for a cut.  But I am happy to say this place changed my mind.I went in this evening for a trim and to add some bangs for that x-factor.  I am starting a new job with a performing arts organization in a few weeks so I needed something that conveyed class, elegance and chic, not the "I work from home" style I had been sporting for awhile now.   I was booked with Alexandra and found her friendly, accommodating and very good with understanding my needs.  Plus, she instantly knew what celebrity hairstyles I was referencing without even showing her pics -- we agreed I was more of a Selena Gomez and less of a Taylor Swift.   I hate to come across as vacuous, but it has always annoyed me when high-end salon stylists don't recognize well-known celebs and their trendy cuts.  Has the "Rachel" not taught us anything about pop culture influence on hairstyles?! For the record, I always bring in a pic for reference, but that never stopped the dumbfounded looks in the past.  But Alexandra got me, and she was very quick and efficient with cutting/drying (my hair is very, very thick and usually takes longer).  The final product was gorgeous and worthy of a shampoo commercial.  Okay, maybe I exaggerate, but I did get a few winks while walking home.  In addition to the great cut and style, I found the prices very reasonable and the front desk was very nice.  I will definitely be referring this place to my network!

13.description: Being new to the general area after moving from the North Shore, I was more than a bit concerned with finding a new hairdresser.  It seems that salons are a dime a dozen in the city. I guess the planets aligned perfectly because I lucked out on my first visit to Robert Jeffrey.  Of course I did check the salon out thoroughly online before calling to make an appt. So I did do my homework, but honestly...I have never had such an easy first experience.I was set up with Theo. An edgy rockstar kind of guy...with a great smile, a nice European accent, and a fun personality.  He spent time with me to identify what I wanted and what I liked...then he promptly put me in the shampoo chair and gave me the best wash and scalp massage of my life. Definitely worth the appointment regardless of how my cut might turn out.Theo nailed it....he took his time, was meticulous in his attention to detail, and made sure I was satisfied before getting out of the chair.I ended up with a slightly younger look for my almost 50 year old face. lol. I love it...and was so confident that I rebooked for another session in 3 weeks.I am so happy I took a leap of faith, called Robert Jeffrey and met Theo.  You rock, THEO!!

11.description: I had a reservation at another neighborhood salon for my son to get his haircut that got cancelled due to the stylist being sick. I called Robert Jeffery hoping they could get him and they gave me multiple times we could come in. If Theo has an opening, I highly suggest you book him. Gave my picky 12 year old a great haircut that left him smiling the rest of the day. It was so good, I asked if he could cut my daughter's hair and he got her in too. She's been admiring herself in the mirror all night. Forget the place we used to go to, Theo will be getting all my families business from now on!

39.description: I had my hair and makeup done here for my wedding....The studio:  Scheduling was a breeze, the staff is super friendly and helpful, and they don't charge extra for wedding appointments like most salons.  Also, the studio and their bathroom are very clean.ROSA:  She is extremely gifted with her makeup and hair styling skills.  I have unusually shaped eyelids and never wear eye makeup, but she was able to adjust the usual techniques to create a very flattering look for me.  She listened to me and gave me exactly what I wanted.  You can always tell when skills come naturally to someone by how long it takes them to do something, and Rosa always effortlessly finishes in half the time it takes most stylists.  I've already gone back for a hair cut, and will continue to do so.

37.description: Owner and Senior Stylist- Rosa is pretty amazing. There aren't a lot of stylist who can work with curly, frizzy Hispanic hair, except for her. Unlike most stylist, she actually listens to what you want and gets it done. She's fast and good at what she does. What would take a regular stylist about 45 minutes to an hour to blow out my hair, she does it in half the time. My hair color and cut always looks flawless when I leave. Not to mention her UPDO's! They look amazing and stay up all night even if you dance the night away. There's a reason why I've been going to Rosa for years and will continue to do so. She's very talented!

0.description: Making it a regular appointment with Theo.

38.description: I love this salon!  Ken is a incredible artist with both color and cuts!  He has transformed my appearance with his amazing eye for detail.  He's creative, but super-conscientious about listening to what I want and need in a hair style.  He is up-to-the-minute when it comes to the latest, greatest techniques, but never over-the-top.If I walk in feeling "meh," I always leave feeling va-va-va-voom!

51.description: I think that this is a very good hair salon.   Ken did my hair and I highly recommend him.  He is a good guy and knows his stuff.  Great cut and color from him.  They are very understanding and did everything they could to accommodate me.  So, a thumbs up on customer service.

27.description: Stop #3 in my eight-month hunt for a local stylist.  My experience is obviously in the minority, here, so the standard disclaimers apply - your mileage may vary, I might have shown up on an off day, etc.  But I've been to several studios in this area during my hunt for a stylist I clicked with, and while most fell into the "good place, just not for me" category, this was the only one that really felt like a negative experience.Don't get me wrong, it was far from awful - I made an appointment and went in, and the girl gave me a perfectly fine haircut that was exactly what I asked for.  But there was no enthusiasm in it, no real artistry.  She didn't seem interested in creating something awesome like the best hairstylists do.  It just felt like she was marking time until she could go home.Admittedly, this was just based on the one impression - it might have been wrong.  In fact, it probably is wrong, because the most puzzling/off-putting part was how she just *wouldn't talk*.  She didn't seem to mind if I did, but she didn't seem interested at all in what I had to say.  So I thought, hey, fine, maybe she prefers to talk about herself, and asked her a couple questions about her hobbies.  She gave three- and four-word answers, and then shut up completely.  Eventually I gave up and just let her finish in peace, which felt the tiniest bit awkward given that she had a razor very close to my neck for much of that time.The salon itself is nice, but (at least on the day I showed up) they had the radio turned up so loud that it was a little hard to hear anything else. (Come to think of it, maybe that's why the stylist didn't talk much.)  I like music as much as the next person, but come on, hairstyling is a social industry.  Communication is part of the job, and it seems to me like actively discouraging that is going to put customers off.  But maybe this place is just looking for a different type of customer than I am.I wasn't precisely unhappy about my experience here, and it's worth noting that it was also the cheapest of the five studios I went to.  But definitely didn't feel bad about not going back.

32.description: I just left my first visit to this salon.  Not only did they get me in at the very last minute, but Ken provided a warm welcome, gave excellent advice and created a unique, stylish, and absolutely perfect new cut for me.After experiencing nightmare cuts at other salons, I can honestly say Ken has a new client for life!!  I also enjoyed a first visit discount, and plan to spread the word about the top notch service and professionalism at Robert Jeffrey Salon in Andersonville.

54.description: I love my hair! I called in yesterday (yes, a Sunday) and was able to get in and get my hair done on a whim. I was freaking out about my worn out ombre mop but Kisha hooked it up and gave me gorgeous, highlighted tendrils instead. I am a FREAK about my hair and I usually keep it as natural as possible. I trust very few people to cut it let alone color it but Kisha did me right. Thanks girl!!! I totally recommend Kisha and will definitely be coming back. Sincerely,One happy camper.

48.description: Probably the best of all Robert Jeffrey locations in Chicago. Wonderfully attentive staff and willingness to ensure your experience is quality. Though there are a number of very professional and talented stylists, I have had a great history with Chris G.

44.description: This is a fabulous salon! I have been going to Kisha for 6+ months. She colors and keratins my hair. My hair has never looked better. I have had people stop and compliment me on the beautiful, shiny color. Kisha is also great at educating me on hair care strategies to maintain the keratin. Last but not least she (and the whole staff) are so pleasant and run on time. I highly recommend this business and stylist Kisha!

24.description: I went to Martin again 2 weeks ago, and received a hair cut.  Later that week, a friend told me that she is jealous of my hair because it always looks like model hair!  This cracked me up, but I guess it is true!

7.description: Haven't gotten the hair finished yet. But I'm here with my mom and she is getting her hair stripped. I have never felt more unaccommodated for ever. No one greets you and makes you feel welcomed at all. There is coffee in the corner that looks like it might be something that is supposed to be served to the guests but that never happened. Then I sat in the chair next to my mom and apparently it was someone's work chair so the employee walks over to me and says "this is my chair" so I get up and stand next to my mom for about 30 mins before my mom finally asks if there is any place I can sit. I feel like the employees here actually don't like me which is weird considering I've never met them and haven't spoken to them because they haven't spoken to me. This place seriously needs to work on customer service. I won't be back.

49.description: Love how comfortable I feel here. Everybody has a down to earth attitude. They alway take my coat, offer me something to drink. It's like your being invited Into someone's home. Kisha is great and she is good at what she does. Not only is she good with my haircut she is outstanding with men's eyebrow waxing too. She does magic and I love it.

40.description: I wanted to like this salon based on all of the great Yelp reviews, but I will not be going back.Pros: I called at the last minute and they got me in same day.Cons: The washcloth on the counter that held the comb and scissors had clumps of hair on it-- before I sat down-- so this wasn't my hair. After I noticed this, I could not get comfortable. Haircut is just ok.

53.description: Great service! Upbeat staff. Both my husband and I got great cuts. Thanks Rosa and Charlie.

30.description: I'm very particular about how I like my hair. I'm new to the city and a friend recommended sarry at this salon. He is wonderful! He listened to everything I told him and kept me entertained. He is so funny and very knowledgeable about hair and beauty. I would definitely recommend him!

46.description: Wonderful place.  My partner and I have been getting our hairs did here for years.  We've never had a "mishap" or bad experience.  Evelyn is incredible!

1.description: 5 stars to Martin, as my hair was just cut by him for the first time last night and it was great! He is very knowledgable about what he does and is very friendly. He gave me some great tips for my hair and explained why could/couldn't not do certain things I wanted because of my thinner hair (which is super helpful instead of just saying No). He even styled my hair for me afterwards and made me look like a million bucks! I will definitely be going back just to have my hair done by him again!The only reason I give 4 stars for the salon is for a few reasons. While the staff is always friendly, my first experience there about 2.5 months ago was not that positive. I wanted a hair trim and fringe, and the stylist (not Martin) just told me 'No' for my request in getting bangs. He said I would look too young and didn't necessarily suggest anything aside from that. I told him I was interested in getting Balayage done in the near future, and he said that they have a Groupon that I should buy for this. I thought that was helpful in itself, and purchased it as I was in the chair during my haircut. After I got my haircut from Martin just yesterday, I went to go pay at the desk and also to set up my Balayage appointment. To my surprise when I mentioned the Groupon, they let me know that it's for NEW clients only. -- It is slightly my fault for not reading the fine print of the Groupon, but was disappointed that the stylist I had last time told me I should buy it when I can't actually use it. :( Because I loved Martin so much, I will likely go back to get my hair done by him for my balayage, but would've preferred knowing I couldn't use the Groupon before being prompted to buy it by another employee knowing I couldn't use it.

55.description: There are those times in your life when you look in the mirror and think to yourself, "Wow.  My hair is looking kind of drab these days."  There are also those times in your life when you're talking about your hair with a friend that's a hairdresser, but doesn't currently do your hair and he says, "Yes, I've been thinking your hair has been looking a little dull."Brutal honesty.  But I like it.So I made an appointment with my friend, the lovely and talented Josh Groce for a cut and color.  I figured it was high time to take his advice and de-dullify myself.  Like, immediately.Robert Jeffrey is definitely not one of those impersonal, behemoth salons.  It's smallish and cozy, but also impeccably clean and up-to-date.  I loved the atmosphere.  They also have all the current magazines.  Critical for those of us spending some time under a dryer.  I know you feel me, ladies.Working with Josh was a dream.  He spent some time examining my hair in it's current state, taking in the texture, etc.  He talked to me in detail about what I wanted out of a hairstyle, how I style my hair, color choices, etc.  We decided to bring up the length, but still keep it long enough for my ubiquitous summer do, the high bun, and lighten it up quite a bit.The results are fab!  I feel so much brighter and happier with my newly blondish do.  The cut is incredibly versatile, too.  I have fine hair that's curly, so basically it's a nightmare to style, but Josh gave me a cut that works in both a curly and straightened capacity.  Very nice!I don't know why I waited so long to see Josh.  He's amazing, ladies!  And gents, I've witnessed his handiwork with mens' haircuts, too.  The guy knows how to make a man look hot.  Do it.

9.description: Let me say first that the demeanor and bedside manner of my stylist, Alexandra, was wonderful. She was kind and personable, and the only reason I'm giving the salon two stars instead of one.Unfortunately for me, the stylist was either rushed, or inexperienced, and I ended up with a color that not only was NOTHING like I asked for, but a color that I really, really do not like. And before a business trip. AND after asking three times prior to starting the color process, "Are you SURE you can get me the color I'm looking for...?" "Yes", I was told each time.Very, very disappointed.Here's the summary:1. I walk in and say, "do you have time for a cut and color? If not the color - I definitely don't want to rush that- I'll just take the cut." One stylist declines and the other says she'll do it. I DOUBLE check again, "are you sure you have time to do the color now?" Yes, I'm assured she does. Great! 2. I point to two pictures in a magazine that showcase the two colors in which I'm interested. We narrow it down to the dark blonde, which I'm super psyched about. I ask, "Are you sure we can get this color today?" Yes. 3. I trust her and let her do her thing. Fast forward to her blow drying my hair. It is _bright orange_. It is not  blonde, or any shade of that, it is ORANGE hair. Literally. 4. My face is completely shocked, obviously conveyed to stylist, because she says, "is something wrong?"5. "Um, yes, my hair is orange." She looks concerned, somewhat uncomfortable, and picks up the magazine again. "Hmmm. Yeah. Well here let me tone it down with some toner shampoo."6. "That will give me the color we talked about that we are looking at in the magazine?" "Um yeah, it'll be like that. It should." 8. "So I'll walk out with the color in the picture based on what you are telling me you're about to do?" I am not an expert, so I am completely relying on her expertise here, remember. "Um, yeah." She says.9. She puts more stuff on my hair, lets it sit, and we rinse it out. It is STILL orange. She looks awkwardly at me and I just stare at the awful mess that is my hair. I feel bad, because she is a nice girl, but I am completely disappointed with the experience and pretty upset that I did not walk out of the salon with the hair color I wanted and was assured I would get. Moreover, I have ORANGE hair, which is one of my least favorite hair colors, personally. 10. She knows she completely messed up and says, "I'll only charge you for the cut. We can make another appointment with a master colorist assisting to get what you want." While she was nice, I am thinking, "I just paid my babysitter three hours to watch my kids, to waste my afternoon, to walk out of here with a color I both did not request and  am completely not happy with." I appreciate her offer, but I feel like more that just a promise of making it better - at full price for a mistake that you made- was not enough. And they couldn't even fit me in until a week after I got back from my trip. Make an exception when it's your mistake maybe....?Because I was headed on a business trip with colleagues, I could not wait until I returned to fix my colossal wreck of a head. I was able to get to get into another salon the next evening to correct what they could, but because it was such a horrible color to begin with, they could only to so much in one sitting to make the orange palatable. $150 to fix Robert Jeffrey's mistake.So, I wasted three hours at Robert Jeffrey to get a base of orange when asked for dark blonde, and wasted $150 to correct as much as I could at another salon, and STILL have to go back to process my hair again at Robert's and pay full price to again fix their mistake??Crazy.I don't have a problem spending the necessary dollars to get a result I want and am promised. I have a problem double paying to fix the mistake of someone else.Hopefully, when I go in and talk to them today, they'll be able to right their wrong.Keep you updated. So disappointed, was looking for a salon I could stick with and thought the girl was so nice and friendly. Nothing worth this much trouble and bad hair color, though!

26.description: New to the neighborhood and booked an appointment with Sarry based on reviews on Yelp. I don't know what happened, but I did NOT experience what everyone else did. I gave one star because he's very friendly (and yelp requires at least one star), but the actual cut and color are a disaster. We had a long discussion about what I wanted and it seemed that we were on the exact same page. We agreed on long layers and caramel highlights. Somewhere between that conversation and my blow dry, I ended up with what is a cross between the Carol Brady mullet and the Rachel haircut. "The shortest layer starting below your shoulders" ended up being a chunk of hair in the back that starts at my ears. I'm super sad about it. This is going to be a nightmare to grow out and I don't see being able to wear my hair down for a long time. As for the color? Two people have asked me if I recently used sun-in. As in, the drug store stuff you use in middle school that turns your hair orange. I will be wearing my hair up in awkward ponytails for at least 6 months and that sucks :(

25.description: Addendum: found out the colorist didn't put  a base coat on to get rid of my blonde undertones. He just colored once over the old color. Now it looks faded and green. Sadly the cheap decor is sign that staff does not know what they are doing.

12.description: Was not happy with my result. My stylist was nice but after sitting in a chair for almost five hours I was left unsatisfied. Maybe someone else will have better luck then me.

59.description: Eeehh... $40 for a wash and style? For my mom's super short hair? While the guy who did it was super cool and nice but that price is absolutely ridiculous. I have paid up to $32 before at high end salons, but $40 is pushing it, considering she has really short hair. And I really wanted to like this place :/

21.description: Hey, I'm a dude so it shouldn't be that big of a deal that I get a great haircut. But with the litany of embarrassingly bad haircuts I have had....when a stylists gets it right 2 times in a row...I have to share. Rosa is a great stylist. You can feel how good she is with the  scissors as she cuts. Do I like having to pay a salon a lot of money just  to get a decent cut? NO. But its worth it if its a superb cut. Rose is superb!

17.description: It was my second time. Both times I think they booked me with someone who is inexperienced. First time it was for color last year. I had to go back and get it fixed. After that my hair was burnt and damaged. This time I was kind of scared but since I needed hair cut that day and they were the only one with opening and open late. So I walked in hoping this time it'll go better. Mistake. I kind of knew my stylist was a beginner even tho after my cut I asked them and they said he is not. He was so nervous and shaking while he was giving me a cut. I have thick long hair that needed little trim just enough to get rid of my split ends. And I wanted to get bangs. That was it. I've tried to be nice and told him just don't be afraid I'm ok n stuff but just so disappointing. He cut my bangs first then shampood my hair blow dried it and starting to flat iron it without any heat protectant product. I finally asked for it since he was using such high heat on my hair it was smoking. Then he started cutting. Today I washed my hair and my dry ends are still there. I didn't wanna lose too much length but hey I totally don't wanna have my dry ends after hair cut. I tried to be nice and really trying to like his job but it is just not happening. So I need to go get another haircut after just 3 days of getting a haircut. Can it be anymore ridiculous? Both times my stylist needed to call someone else to help them with my hair. I am never returning to this salon ever even if they offer free service. Just really disappointed.

10.description: My wedding was a year ago, so I'm now able to make this long (literally, 5+ hours of the 24 hours before my wedding was sucked into this salon) story short (er). I brought multiple pictures to Alexandra. I have very curly, thick, red hair. That said, it will do what you want it to when handled correctly. Alexandra took over 2 hours to straighten it the night before my wedding. An expert stylist can do this in about 30-40 minutes. It got frizzy immediately. No hold, whatsoever. But I tried not to worry, it was August in Chicago. Things happen. Unfortunately, the pictures from my rehearsal dinner prove it. I was unimpressed, but too happy/busy/tired to worry about it. My 5 bridesmaids and I arrived the next day, and even though my hair was straight (just needed some going over), all 5 of them were done and dusted with beautiful up-do's before I was. It was about 2 hours in when I really started to panic and my maid of honor looked at me and said, "here, have some chocolate" and handed me a glass of champagne. She's a champ. I asked how much longer, and the frazzled stylist scoffed and kept going.Probably the worst part of the experience was that Alexandra did the EXACT same style 3 times, completely the same, and it never worked. It was a fish tail, and my hair is too heavy. I had mentioned I wouldn't mind a braid but that I wanted a curly, romantic look. Not my vision at all. She was clearly frustrated and panicking. Luckily, Rosa finally stepped in (looking worried and annoyed) and churned out a great up-do in about 20 minutes (exactly what I had envisioned), as that was all the time I had and the other 5 girls were finished. While it looked beautiful, and I am FOREVER grateful that she saved the day, there were a few strands that fell out later in the day :( That said, the up-do's she did for my bridesmaids as well as myself did look beautiful and I'm confident with more time everything would have stayed in place. She was a god send that day, but I just wished she had intervened sooner.To boot, when I initially inquired about bridal hair and then when I booked the appointments, I was told that the bridesmaids would all get 20% off as first time customers. None of them did, and I was too frazzled and trying to remain calm to ask until later in the day. I e-mailed the salon and no one ever gotten back to me. Brides, unless you book with Rosa, run. This place wasted not only my money, but the worst thing of all is that they wasted my time. Alexandra was very inexperienced. I can deal with that when you don't do the same thing that doesn't work over and over and hope for the same result. While Rosa stepped in, it was very, very late in the appointment. In addition, they did not honor their word and even charged me full price for the terrible service I received the morning of my wedding, knowing full well that it was not okay. Overall, while I think Rosa is extremely talented, I would not recommend.

5.description: Just got my color done today by Jessie. She was very personable and she did a great job on my balayage. Jessie is creative and seems passionate about cut and color as well as making her clients happy. I would recommend you check her out. I have dense, fine hair and she offered to thin it out a bit so the color and style would look even better. She went way above and beyond to make me happy. On a side note, she also gave me an awesome shampoo. Thanks Jessie!

3.description: Totally ruined/fried my hair :(

35.description: I unfortunately didn't have as good of an experience as the other yelp reviewers. I called the morning of needing a cut and was grateful they could get me in quickly. The man I spoke to on the phone and greeted me when I came in was friendly and warm but my appointment was with Rosa, who seemed to be in a bad mood before I even sat down in the chair. The consultation she gave me was short and much less involved than previous stylists I had worked with. Then she washed my hair..ugh. Water was cold and I'm almost positive she didn't even condition my hair much less massage my scalp which I would expect from a nice salon. It took her less than 10 minutes to cut my hair then she started styling which took about 15 minutes. Throughout the process she pulled my hair multiple times and didn't say a word. Nothing! When I went to pay they gave me 20% off since it was my first cut which was nice. I will admit I did like my hair when everything was said and done but when I'm paying over $60 for a haircut I expect my experience to be enjoyable too..it wasn't. Won't be back.

19.description: I visited Robert Jeffrey for a cut and highlights with Alexandra. I had a Groupon which made the this an exteremly affordable experience. I literally live four blocks from this salon but had always traveled to Lincoln Park or River North for a haircut. However, I think I found my new salon!I have very thick, unruly hair and was desperately in need of a trim. I showed Alexandra some photos of both the haircut and highlights I wanted and she got right to work. Instead of traditional foils she used the balayage technique on my hair which turned out exactly as I wanted. She was very friendly and understanding as I almost fell asleep on her a few times in the chair (it had been a long week). I will definitely be back in the future, especially since they gave me a coupon for my next visit!

28.description: Mother's Day Gift from my daughters was a visit to Robert Jeffrey Hair Studio, in Andersonville - appointment with Sarry Yono. I told him colors I like, he shared his ideas and I was amazed of how good my hair looked when he was all done! Great job!I loved his work - colored and trimmed my hair and I was happy and my daughters loved that I will be going back to see Sarry Yono. Sarry is very creative and am looking forward to today's appointment with him.

45.description: I do not remember how many hair salons I have changed over the years in Chicago for color, even the 'best' rated ones in Chicago - every time something was off, until I met Charlie! I wanted to get highlights, but mandatory was 'no red hint' in them, and no streaks obviously - in the past every time I got highlights, I ended up going back to my dark brunette hair color because they ended up looking awful.I read about Charlie on yelp and decided to go two months ago. He was so personable and patient, and listened to my wants carefully. When I asked if we should lighten my overall color, he said no because he didn't want to harm my hair. Then...he gave me the best subtle sun kissed highlights - no reds, and they are darker on the roots and lighter on the ends  - they look so sweet and I love them everyday! I am definitely going back!

33.description: Needed my hair highlighted and wanted to find a salon in my neighborhood.  Went to Robert Jeffrey and KEN did my hair. I love it! He listened to what I wanted, gave a couple suggestions and love the result! Staff is very friendly.  So happy to find this salon and Ken!!! Will return to Robert Jeffrey in Andersonville

43.description: I asked a woman in my neighborhood the other day where she gets her hair cut (cute style/looked like a good cut) and she said Evelyn at the Robert Jeffrey in Andersonville, as I needed my most recent cut tweaked.  I'm pretty thrilled to report that Evelyn is very talented.  I told her what my goal is, what I needed that day, and she got it done.  The salon is unpretentious, friendly and I think they're pricing is  reasonable ($45.00).  Subsequent to that appt., met another woman in the 'hood with a very cute cut (I have dogs, so constantly meeting folks) who said she's also been going to Evelyn for a few years.  Halleluyer!!!  I think I've fiiiiiiiiinalyeeeeee found my permanent stylist -- who by the way is really nice and easy to chat with.  It's all good...

2.description: The haircut was really good

18.description: I had an appointment with Ken at four on Tuesday October 6th, I was originally going to get highlights but we discovered I had 50 shades of blonde so then I choose to go gray/platinum. The process took almost five hours but he was patients and he delivered what I asked for. I will be going back because he's awesome! Nick is awesome too!

41.description: Its been a month since I had both a color & much needed cut at Robert Jeffrey's and I'm still receiving compliments. After years of short hair & angeled cuts, I opted to grow my hair out ... That was 6 yrs ago. My hair started resembling an onion when I pulled it up so I decided it was time for a change and I couldn't be happier. Patrick was very sweet & patient as I anxiously scheduled my appt., my heart beating out of my chest. I was able to schedule an appt for that very day & powerwalked it there within 10 mins. Immediately, with my hair flying, I was seated, there was no turning back now. I had never been to Jeffrey's but living in the neighborhood I've passed it (with my hood up) numerous times. I was immediately relaxed by the space & found it to be quite comfortable & not overbearing. I then met my stylist Ken who I cannot praise enough & owe all of the compliments comin my way to him. He not only gave me an amazing cut & color but I was relieved to not get any sort of lecture or be overwehlmed with off the wall suggestions. He explained every cut & listened to what I wanted. On top of that he didn't rush me, he took the time & actually taught me various techniques & he did not try to sell me on a myriad of products.  This was quite possibly the best haircut experience I've ever had! I was even given a cup of tea & had a guilty selection of tabloids to lead through as I sat underneath the dryer. The price was a steal for nearly 2 hrs of pampering & I left feeling very fancy (especially since the errand after my hair appt was to the hardware store for a lightbulb). I will definitely be back & this time I won't wait 6 yrs.

52.description: Late one night, many (4 years) moons ago, I randomly decided I wanted to chop off my long blond hair to my chin and dye it brown.  I googled for salons that were open on Mondays (many aren't) and came across Robert Jeffrey and so was the beginning of a beautiful love story.Adam (AKA my hair god) has been doing my hair since.  When just months after he cut and dyed it dark and I decided I wanted to grow it back out and dye it nearly platinum blond, we did it in steps so's not to ruin my healthy hair.  When I was leaving the country for almost a year and couldn't bear the thought of trusting anyone else with my precious locks, he PERFECTLY matched my dirty blond roots and ombre'd (is that even a word?) my hair so I didn't look like a skunk when it grew 6 inches.  And when I came back earlier this summer (and had made an appointment with him from halfway across the globe for the day after I got back) he gleefully chopped off over 10 inches and transformed me yet again into a 60's blond bombshell.  My friends and mother are now faithful customers as well.  A friend of mine was here visiting for a weekend and did not like the way her own stylist had dyed her hair.  She knew how much I love Adam and so I made an appointment for her.  She was over joyed and floored by how much time he spent high lighting thin sections of her dark hair honey blond to create a natural multi toned look.  She had never had anyone put  so much time into her hair.Everyone at this salon is great.  I have been a faithful customer for 4 years now and love my visits.  Adam and I now have an easy friendship and I completely trust him with all my hair (and pop culture) needs. Also, Andersonville is one of the greatest neighborhoods in the city so you can easily spend the day there shopping and eating and drinking before or after your visits.

50.description: I have been in Chicago for 2 years and ever since I have searched for someone who listens to what I want, and who doesn't cut off 5 inches when I really only asked for a trim. I have finally found that at RJ salon with Chris (Andersonville). He cut my hair so beautifully, and corrected my blotchy home-dye job. Thankfully the price was super reasonable ($70) for cut and some color (He matched the color PERFECTLY to my hair color, by the way, so my hair looks shiny and normal now! yay!)He was also super friendly! Which is a plus. I love my hair cut, it's never looked healthier.He did a wonderful blow-dry which stayed frizz- free throughout a trip to the store in the pouring rain.I will definitely be returning.

4.description: I followed Martin from a previous salon and I always loved this work. He is very passionate and creative on what he does. I wanted something different with my hair..possibly have my color a little lighter. Martin did a balayage and it turned out amazing. My roots blended very well with the tips of my hair. I absolutely love it!!! He also trimmed my hair to get rid of my nasty split ends and he managed to keep some of the length which I really wanted. Other stylists would chop it short and was not mindful of my "keeping some length" request. I would definitely come back. Thanks Martin!

6.description: I had a great experience here. I used the Groupon for a ombré and Elena, my stylist, did a really nice job. She really listened to what I had to say, especially when it came to the cut that I had done. I have been trying for some time to grow my layers out longer. Often times people don't really get the point when I say "just a trim," but Elena really got it! She did an amazing job and blended my blunt layers into my hair that had grown longer. The color was also done well too. She recommended their purple shampoo to keep the brassy tones down and their color safe conditioner. I got the small sample sizes because I wasn't sure if I'd like them but they're AMAZING. My hair doesn't pick up brassy tones and it smells great and is soft. I'll be back to get more soon!

22.description: I visited Robert Jeffrey for a cut and highlights with Alexandra. I had a Groupon which made the this an exteremly affordable experience. I literally live four blocks from this salon but had always traveled to Lincoln Park or River North for a haircut. However, I think I found my new salon!I have very thick, unruly hair and was desperately in need of a trim. I showed Alexandra some photos of both the haircut and highlights I wanted and she got right to work. Instead of traditional foils she used the balayage technique on my hair which turned out exactly as I wanted. She was very friendly and understanding as I almost fell asleep on her a few times in the chair (it had been a long week). I will definitely be back in the future, especially since they gave me a coupon for my next visit!

15.description: This review should have been written 8 years ago, but I'm finally getting it done. I've been going to Brandon since I moved to Chicago and can't say enough positive things! I'll never forget the first time I went to him. I walk in, and say "do what you want". He gave me the best haircut and color I've ever gotten! The color was amazing, and my coworkers were even impressed. Brandon is awesome- he listens to what you want/don't want, consults before styling/cutting, and really individualizes your haircut. Every time I go there, I walk out with an innovative style. He takes his time and won't let you leave until it looks perfect! I was always one of those people who was scared to speak up, but now I confidently work with Brandon to get the best color/style. On another note, Brandon is hilarious, has great stories to share, and often serves as my therapist! He's wonderful and you won't walk out of there unsatisfied. I can't wait to get another haircut!!

57.description: Ken has been my hair stylist for over two years.  I stayed with him when he recently moved to Robert Jeffrey, which is a really nice salon.  Prior to meeting Ken I had a really hard time finding a stylist I liked and rarely made a return appointment with anyone.  In fact, I usually left hair appointments in tears!  Ken is really talented.  I've never had anyone who could do highlights so precisely.  I feel like I can wait at least a week or two longer between visits because of how closely he gets the highlights to my scalp.  Ken definitely listens and works with me and he's never given me a bad haircut.  I originally found him because of rave reviews he had at another establishment.  He's great with wavy and curly hair which is a major plus.

20.description: Yes!  I have finally found my go-to salon!I have lived in the area for 3 years and couldn't find a salon to my liking.  I often found myself going home to the suburbs for a cut.  But I am happy to say this place changed my mind.I went in this evening for a trim and to add some bangs for that x-factor.  I am starting a new job with a performing arts organization in a few weeks so I needed something that conveyed class, elegance and chic, not the "I work from home" style I had been sporting for awhile now.   I was booked with Alexandra and found her friendly, accommodating and very good with understanding my needs.  Plus, she instantly knew what celebrity hairstyles I was referencing without even showing her pics -- we agreed I was more of a Selena Gomez and less of a Taylor Swift.   I hate to come across as vacuous, but it has always annoyed me when high-end salon stylists don't recognize well-known celebs and their trendy cuts.  Has the "Rachel" not taught us anything about pop culture influence on hairstyles?! For the record, I always bring in a pic for reference, but that never stopped the dumbfounded looks in the past.  But Alexandra got me, and she was very quick and efficient with cutting/drying (my hair is very, very thick and usually takes longer).  The final product was gorgeous and worthy of a shampoo commercial.  Okay, maybe I exaggerate, but I did get a few winks while walking home.  In addition to the great cut and style, I found the prices very reasonable and the front desk was very nice.  I will definitely be referring this place to my network!

36.description: Love this place. I made the mistake of attempting an ombre highlight on my middle school aged daughter and they were able to get us in right away so she wouldn't have to go to school with bright orange hair. Angie is a pro and like an artist, effortlessly created the perfect ombre highlight, my daughter loves it and I love the reasonable rate, especially considering the extensive work involved. We also made a new discovery, the Robert Jeffrey Hair Product line is the best EVER, and it is free of the nasty chemicals. We both have frizzy wavy hair, really frizzy. We went in last night, it rained all day today, and while my hair is a giant frizz ball tonight, my daughters hair remains shiny and frizz free... AMAZING. Remember to bring cash for a tip. They do accept credit and debit cards, but you cannot put the tip on them.

14.description: I get consistent service every time I come. I have never had an issue scheduling an appointment, and Theo is incredibly thorough and understanding of how to cut hair

1.description: I received a massage from Jaye last December for the first time as she offered an introductory special of 90 minutes for $75. It was close to my house and it was a great massage. I've received many massages and this one was good, although not the best I've ever received. But it's so dependent on preference and communication. Jaye was great and listened to my lifestyle/habits to understand where I hold stress, and she was able to detect where I was sore throughout my body. I haven't been back but it has nothing to do with my rating of the Jaye, and more to do with my schedule and finances. I enjoyed my massage with her and when I am able to get another one I will definitely reconsider going back.

9.description: Typically I'll grab whatever specials or deals ( ie Groupon, Yelp ) and get massage therapy from people with ok results. Getting one from Yelp with Jaye at BodyTrippin' was one of the best ones I've had so far where now I am a repeat client. Jaye really knows and understands the body. Like any expert, you tell them what ails you and they know exactly how to remedy the situation efficiently and effectively. She's also flexible with her schedule, really friendly and always gives good deals occasionally.I'm a pretty active person and to have someone like Jaye available when you strain or spend too much time sitting in an office is a great relief.Highly recommended.

23.description: I have been going to Jaye for massage therapy since she was in massage school.  She has continually improved and gotten better each time I've gone to her.  I go mainly for pain relief from running/biking exercise.  She always addresses the specific issues I have and I always go away feeling much better than before.

12.description: I'd never had, nor really considered, getting a massage until I got a gift certificate here. everything was perfect. I was made to feel totally comfortable and the session time just flew by. I could lay there all damn day. highly recommended.

21.description: The place had a great atmosphere with a variety of holistic healing practitioners. Jaye is an excellent therapist. I walked in with a lot of neck tension and lower back pain and left completely relaxed and pain free.

16.description: After being tired of giving me massages and hearing about my back pain complaints, my girlfriend convinced me to get a professional massage. She suggested a few salons and what not, but after searching on yelp this place seemed to be more my type of thing. A little more relaxed and less commercial. It was a good atmosphere, very relaxing, and a great massage.

17.description: I had a great bodywork person in LA till she followed her "lover" to Prague.  Since then I have been getting crappy massage after mediocre massage. That is until I moved to Chicago and found Jaye. She actually understands what a deep tissue massage is and can tell where I need the work most on her own. If you are feeling tight and crunchy you MUST call Jaye.

10.description: So I'd been working 12-16 hour days for weeks straight, sometimes with weekends off, but other times not.  Mama's don't let your babies grow up to be advertising producers.  But I digress...ANYWAY, my back and neck were so knotted up on top that I'd had a severe headache for days that only opiates could combat.Because I didn't want to have to develop a habit and find myself checking into Betty Ford, I checked in with BodyTrippin' simply because it was a few minutes from my house and had good Yelp reviews.This is easily of the best massages I've ever had and I've had a lot (hundreds, probably): everything from ashiatsu (where the therapist walks on your back) at an solid old school Korean spa to the more laid back types you get at places like Burke Williams or other higher end spas. Jaye worked out all of the knots that had been making me nuts for days (maybe even a week), and even found a few more and knocked those out too.  Her bodywork was strong and solid without feeling rough.  Strength in massage therapy is really important to me because wussier massages do absolutely nothing for my pain; the great part is when I told Jaye that, she listened, and the massage was perfect.  I did take a look at her site in advance and figured out what I needed... apparently Trigger Point Therapy is the trick.My bet is that whatever style of massage therapy you prefer would be executed superbly.

5.description: I've been to Jaye a few times now - including for an outstanding massage today.  She has a great touch and excellent assessment skills.  I highly recommend her!

11.description: Back in the days when she was working under the old Holistic Healing Chicagoland title, Jaye was my go-to massage therapist.  The name change closely reflects her philosophy about her clients' needs and its exciting, I plan on coming back.  And about Jaye... this girl is definitely a trip!  With the soothing reggae beats in the background, I could feel myself relaxing away.. much cheaper than a vacation.  As a teacher and marathoner, my body and sanity takes a beating on a regular basis.  I've been a regular client for a couple of years and she helped me out on numerous occasions.  She ironed me out many times, from a debilitating stiff neck strain to my must have post-marathon massages. I was up and about in no time!Jaye is extremely professional, considerate of her clients' needs, goes out of her way to make them feel comfortable and builds an excellent rapport. Most of all, she doesn't take herself too seriously and knows how to have fun.  I'm very picky about my massage therapist and she stands out from the rest.I would highly recommend her to anyone that needs quality care for a decent price. It's a serious body trip.. its so worth it!

22.description: Jaye receives 5 stars for totally massaging away my extremely painful neck pain in one session

0.description: Jaye was fabulous! I've had chronic pain in my upper back for years and I've never been to a massage therapist who was able to relieve the pain after only 1 session.  Jaye was able to relieve the pain in my upper back and a trigger point in my lower back that I didn't even know I had. She even gave me suggestions for things to try at home between sessions.I will definitely go back to see Jaye! I would highly recommend her to anyone!

20.description: I've been seeing Jaye for my massages before she ventured out on her own. Before she did, there was some lag time on response and her availability was limited. Now her response time is very quick. I contacted Jaye about a possible massage and she responded the same day and I got a massage scheduled the very next day. No waiting in discomfort!! The environment is very calm and peaceful and the background music is very relaxing as well. Jaye is very good at listening to what your needs are, and with my current back issues, her massages do a great deal of help for me. I refuse to go see anyone else for my massages now. If you haven't had one or are looking for a place to go, please contact her and get a massage in!

19.description: Jaye is a highly experienced and talented massage therapist. I say this as not only a client, but a fellow massage therapist. As you can imagine, I am rather picky about the bodywork I receive. She's confident, knowledgeable, thorough and super-fun to chat with. Whether it's basic relaxation or a more clinical approach, Jaye is the therapist for you. I highly recommend her services.

2.description: I am so glad I live so close to her now! I went to her a few years back for some stubborn knots around my shoulders, and it was great. Fast forward to now, knots are even worse and take up most of my back and neck. She used a hot stone which was seriously amazing. I have some really rough spots on my back and my neck, and although discomfort is inevitable, she did a phenomenal job not making me want to cry. It was still super relaxing and felt really good. Pressure was perfect. There is no reason I'd go to anyone else! Parking out front too. Winning.

18.description: I went in with some serious neck pain and left feeling great.  Jaye is very professional, friendly and nice.  I would highly recommend her to anyone looking for some relaxation and/or relief from pain.

13.description: This review is long over due.  I went a couple months ago when I was having terrible pain in my shoulder and neck.  Jaye was very professional, and made me feel at ease right away about getting my first massage.  She reminded me that it may take a few days for the pain to go away, but to give it time.  She was exactly right.  The pain was gone in two days, and I felt so much better.

4.description: I recommend Jaye without reservation. I went in thinking what I needed was a relaxing massage but what I really needed was some deep muscle work to deal with multiple tension points and lingering effects from a back injury.  Her approach, concern, and avenue of treatment were both professional and generous.  I left feeling much better and look forward to my next session.

24.description: Back in the days when she was working under the old Holistic Healing Chicagoland title, Jaye was my go-to massage therapist.  The name change closely reflects her philosophy about her clients' needs and its exciting, I plan on coming back.  And about Jaye... this girl is definitely a trip!  With the soothing reggae beats in the background, I could feel myself relaxing away.. much cheaper than a vacation.  As a teacher and marathoner, my body and sanity takes a beating on a regular basis.  I've been a regular client for a couple of years and she helped me out on numerous occasions.  She ironed me out many times, from a debilitating stiff neck strain to my must have post-marathon massages. I was up and about in no time!Jaye is extremely professional, considerate of her clients' needs, goes out of her way to make them feel comfortable and builds an excellent rapport. Most of all, she doesn't take herself too seriously and knows how to have fun.  I'm very picky about my massage therapist and she stands out from the rest.I would highly recommend her to anyone that needs quality care for a decent price. It's a serious body trip.. its so worth it!

6.description: Jaye has a fantastic set-up! We graduated from the same class at Cortiva/Chicago School of Massage Therapy and am so happy that she has this successful business. Her office is warm and inviting and her table is an awesome motorized/adjustable table, which was pretty great for my wrenched back. As a fellow Massage Therapist that works hard and needs regular bodywork, I know a great massage...Jaye gets an A+

15.description: Jaye is the best! I came in with a knot as big as a walnut in my calf from a running injury and she patiently and as painlessly as possible spent an hour working it out.  I have a half-marathon to run in 11 days and I'm only going to be able to run because of Jaye.  I've also seem Jay for regular relaxation massage and for Thai massage and she's also excellent in both fields.  Her office is very quiet and conveniently located - give her a try!

7.description: Do yourself a favor and book an appointment today!

8.description: I work long hours in corporate america and I run marathons. After my last marathon - Fox Valley 9/16 - I wanted to find a new massage therapist close to my home in Edgewater. After seeing the excellent reviews on Body Trippin. I decided to head there. I took Foster 92 bus West to Ravenswood to find nice quiet building where I met Jaye. After a quick consulation and a great intro rate - I left feeling refreshed. I will be back -A+

3.description: Jaye gave me one of the best massages I've ever had! My husband gave me a 90 minute massage as a gift and I used it yesterday. She has a room in a building with other businesses, but once you are settled, you feel like you are in a spa. The right amount of pressure and focus on problem areas, but also very relaxing. I hope to return soon!

14.description: The massage was good; the instructor was a bit curt and seemed to not really want to be there, which was weird because the room had a lot of decorations and a spiritual vibe. Maybe she was having an off day. I guess I expected a little more because it was a private company and not a place like massage envy.

3.description: The first several times I walked by this store, it was closed.  I always found that strange and couldn't quite understand why it even existed if it was never open.  Now that I've been inside, I get it.  This is a great store.Lots of unique, local, and sustainable products that would make excellent gifts or conversation pieces around your home.  The owner can tell you a little bit more about all of the products for sale and really makes you feel welcome in her store.So stop by and check it out, but verify before you go that it will in fact be open.

1.description: Lovely gift shop in Andersonville for fair trade and/or local gifts. A variety of price ranges and great stories on how the items were made. I appreciate the owner taking the time to explain the stories behind the items I was looking at and offered similar items in the store. I bought a lovely kitty cat blanket for my baby niece for her upcoming baptism. Hopefully this will become the baby blanket she can't live without and will cherish for a long while.

2.description: This is a wonderful and unique shop to get green gifts or items for your household.  You also can benefit local charities and good causes with your purchases.My boyfriend and I saw some beer bottles that were made into tumblers.  We thought that they looked really interesting and we liked them a lot.  We ended up buying three tumblers as well as an awesome soy candle in a repurposed juice bottle.The best part was that sales from the candle benefit Bright Endeavors, which is a local nonprofit organization that helps young mothers get job training and skills that can translate into permanent employment with other companies.  I liked knowing that I was helping out with my purchase.  The candle's scent, citrus blossom, smells awesome.  I highly recommend checking it out if you stop by the shop.The shop is super cute as well and was once an old apartment building.  It totally fits into their theme of reusing and repurposing items.  The store owner is very friendly and helpful.This is a great unique shop to check out if you're in the area!

9.description: I am very impressed with the above and beyond service Nadine provided when I was looking at purchasing eco-friendly PolyWood furniture for my city balcony. There are several combinations of options and she even worked it out so I could have a custom option not listed in their catalog. The prices are VERY reasonable - I did thorough research.Aside from the great Poly-Wood outdoor furniture check out everything else. See all the other Yelps. Great merchandise.

10.description: The bamboo bath towels they sell are ridiculously silky. They'd be nice to line a pet bed with too or to give to a child as a binky. The birdhouses that look like campers are hard to pass up, very whimsical.There's a selection of glasses made from wine bottles--good colors and very sturdy with a few different styles. The shop has state maps and a U.S. map made of license plates from the applicable state(s)--another good gift for a kid. Lip glosses from an Edgewater woman (yeah! local!), picture frames lined with pebbles from Lake Superior, purses, gloves.For Christmas there were some very sweet clay ornaments and festive pressed glasses trees and stars. Lots of whimsy. It's a fun store. There's a door on the Balmoral side too that goes right into the shop.

4.description: Great little store full of wonderful & unique gifts.  Most is eco-friendly, upcycled, fair trade, and/or made by participants in various nonprofit social programs.  There are lovely art pieces, handbags, glassware (some really cute pieces made from beer bottles), scarves & mittens, bamboo towels, birdhouses, journals made from old storybooks, reusable aluminum water bottles, beautiful soaps, and more.  The ladies who worked there were very well-informed about their inventory and like to tell you each product's story as you browse.  They were very helpful & friendly.The down side is that things are on the expensive side.  For example, the mittens, which are super warm (I have a pair I received for Chrismas once) are nearly $50.  There are a few more affordable things.  I'd be more likely to purchase something as a gift than for myself (and not frequently)  due to the cost, but I do still recommend the store, and highly.

6.description: Gosh, I'm not sure how I could ever write a review for Green Sky without rewording everything in John B's review (yelp.com/biz/greensky-ch…).  They have a lot of great home decor that is perfect for your home or as a gift for a friend.  It's great to know that everything they sell is eco-friendly by being created with reused or renewably resources.  Also, many artists are Fair Trade or Not-For-Profit businesses.  A few items that stuck out to me were: -License Plate art-Gorgeous wood cutting boards-Folded newspaper wallets/business card holders-Stone 'ice cubes' for your drink of choice-Rainbow colored lawn chairs made of milk jugs!  They even sell composters and rain barrels to work on Mother Nature's side!  I was blown away by how large this store actually was inside, and it opens up to the Sunburst Flowers & Gifts shop.  Perfect to find a unique, reasonably priced gift for someone.

12.description: If you're looking for local sustainable items, this is the place!  I especially like the repurposed  art.  Plus, the service is good.  It is a great place to buy gifts.

5.description: Very cute boutique! Kinda pricey. Cute & crafty selection. The cucumber soap is probably the most amazing thing I've ever smelled!

13.description: Tucked away behind Sunburst Flowers & Gifts in the beautifully restored building at Ashland and Balmoral is GreenSky, a little gift shop with a conscience. Most of the products at GreenSky are hand made, and many are eco-friendly, made from reused or renewable resources. The selection is small, it changes regularly, and many items are one-of-a-kind, so it's hard to say what you'll find when you visit. Clocks and birdhouses seem to be a staple, along with the requisite candles and candle holders. They carry bath products from The Enterprising Kitchen, a local business that provides training and transitional employment for Chicago women in Uptown. They are also an outlet for Polywood furniture, which is yard and patio furniture made from recycled milk jugs. This stuff is very cool, and much sturdier than you would expect. The staff is very helpful, and as you would expect from a store like this, very enthusiastic. The store is cute, the people are nice, and the 4th star is in support of their mission.

11.description: I love this shop!  Not only are there unique gifts and items for the home, but the eco-friendly, hand made, local, recycled/reused/repurposed items are creative and lovely.  Shopping here does three worthy things -- it supports a local business (Nadeen is terrific!), it supports the environment, and it supports the small crafty businesses and artisans who create the items.  What could be better?

8.description: I can't sing enough positive praise about GreenSky!The owner Nadeen is extremely friendly and helpful.  She prides herself that everything in her store has a story and she is more than willing to tell you that story if you are interested.  I highly recommend listening to the stories because they are fascinating.  Try to shop when Nadeen is working.  She will walk you around and help you as little or as much as you desire.  The other employees are kind too, but Nadeen is fabulous!  Plus, she is a fellow Spartan so extra points.  : )There is a wide range of products in the store.  Some functional, some decorative, but all ecofriendly and sustainable.  Many of them are fair trade and benefit various nonprofits.  The products are unique and unlike anything I have seen elsewhere.  I could try to tell you their stories, but I wouldn't do it justice.  Ask Nadeen.  It is a great place to shop for gifts or for yourself.  Most products are local or at least Midwestern.  Variety of prices that could really fit any budget.  Basically it's a store you can feel great about shopping in!  Just visit and you'll see why I'm raving about it!

0.description: Note that they're only open Thursday - Sunday.This places has many unique items you cannot find anywhere else, re-used and recycled with a great atmosphere or otherwise sourced!It's a nice casual place to drop in.

7.description: Add Green Sky to your list when holiday shopping! They have cute decorative art and my favorite were the birdhouses made out of old barns. My favorite birdhouse was one that was in the design of a camper. The friendly woman working said that these are not just decorative, they are functional (birds do make homes out of them). I'll have to agree with Richie in that the beautiful cutting boards really caught my eye. Grab a bite to eat in Andersonville and then walk off of the Clarke strip to visit this gem.

29.description: Highly recommended! Jeff provides firm and consistent pressure and is able to address all my problem areas. I appreciate his ability to listen and react. During sessions, he checks in periodically to make sure if the pressure is right. He is professional, personable, and on top of it all, his rates are so affordable.

42.description: Jeff does amazing massages! I injured my spine when i was a gymnast and I often have terrible back and shoulder pain.  I went in for an hour massage and he used just the right pressure and it really helped. i will definitely recomend him to my friends and will be going back for another massage asap :)

23.description: This massage was ok. It wasn't the best and it wasn't the worst. I felt like Jeff's strokes were less of kneading and more of just stroking the muscles. I did not feel he improved my muscle knots in my shoulders or neck. I also didn't get the feeling he understood my body. Maybe this massage could've been better if I gave him more direction. But sometimes I just don't feel like talking during a massage and believe that if you're really good you don't need to be constantly directed. He also didn't do a full 60 min and cut my massage short by about 5-7min. Not sure why but that's a little flaw I noticed. I would recommend that other people try him as he is dedicated to his work. However this just wasn't for me.

8.description: Jeff is so good at what he does.  I can't say enough good things about his massages.  He is totally dedicated and extremely talented.  When you're on his massage table you have his complete attention and energy.  He's helped me with lower back pain, hip pain, upper back pain.   He focuses on areas I ask for and also fixes problems I wasn't aware of until they were gone.  That's the important stuff.  Now for the unimportant stuff which I also like.  His office is minimally decorated and he plays classical music quietly.  No incense or other weird smells -- he uses organic shea butter when he needs oil.  He's happy to work quietly if you just want to tune out, or to chat if you're in a talkative mood.  In short -- a great massage, in a great setting, for a great price.  Win, win, win.

31.description: Jeff's professionalism is impeccable. He made me feel comfortable, and he is happy to chat or to let you relax quietly. Best of all, he's effective. He has tailored my massages to help me deal with ongoing shoulder and neck issues. I've gotten relief through regular sessions with him, and that speaks for itself.Kristi

34.description: I thought Jeff was great.  It was easy to set up an appointment; he quickly responded to email and had availability the same week.  There's easy free parking and he was waiting for me when I showed up for my appointment.  Jeff is very professional and clearly knows his business.  I told him where my problem areas are and he really focused on those.  I felt loads, loads better a couple days after (always a little sore the next day, but that's how you know it worked!).  It's also a really good price for an hour-long massage.  I've already recommended Jeff and The Art of Massage to people and won't hesitate to do so in the future.

16.description: I tried Jeff for the first time with a recent Groupon and will definitely be back. Excellent massage and his rates are quite reasonable.

13.description: I tried a Yelp deal for this massage and was very happy with it.The masseur was friendly and attentive and he had strong hands so it wasn't just one of those cheesy cheap massages.
