I found out why.  The food was absolutely terrible!  None of us had pizza, so I guess we should have went for that since they are a "pizza and grill".  My salad seemed like it had been frozen.  The app sampler my friend got was awful!  It looked like someone went out to the frozen aisle of a cvs to purchase these appetizers.  The drinks were fine but nothing to rave about or want to return for.  The bartender was really sweet after he realized we were sticking around but all in all there is nothing about this bar that makes me ever want to go back.  Sorry!

34.description: I've been to Konak several times. It's my go-to place when I just can't decide what I want to eat and drink. Every time I've been, the staff is just strange. They seem to stare a lot and speak to you as if you're crazy. I just always feel slightly uncomfortable whenever I walk in.The food is good and affordable. The last time I had the pizza, though, it was so hot my tongue and lower lip were burned for a few days because the cheese does not stay on. A bit messy, but the taste is good. Not a fantastic beer selection either. Honestly, Konak is good for a quick bite, maybe a little drink with friends, some pool, and then on to the next place.

16.description: Had the hummus plate on special one evening and enjoyed it. It was filling  along with a beer to wash it down. The bread on the plate was a tad dry, but the hummus and spinach made up for it. I have also had a boat another time and thought it was pretty good.

13.description: Review for pizza only.I tried their thin crust on our moving day, and honestly it was pretty bland. Nothing special, but I'm sure it would go okay with wings and a beer. I was pretty disappointed, as there wasn't much flavor to it. Wouldn't try their pizza again.

11.description: *Update, have to increase stars from 3 to 4 after trying their thin crust pizza. Delicious, better than Ranallis and Pizzeria Aroma which are similarly priced and serve similar style pizzas in the area. Delicious and inexpensive, not overly greasy, homemade thin crust, sausage had good flavor. The pizza was sturdy, as in the crust was crispy and not floppy or weighed down by excessive cheese or toppings. I really like Ranallis pizza because it's cheap and tasty but it's obvious Konak uses higher quality ingredients and are the same price point. When I need cheap pizza night Konak will be my go to over Ranallis now. I shouldn't have waited this long to try it!*  Konak is a nice neighborhood bar and grill that isn't divvy. Tables aren't sticky and dirty but no one is putting on airs either. They have very good bar food. Their fries are excellent, well battered and crispy. Really good in cheese sauce. This is a good spot for a nice juicy simple cheese burger too. In an age of too thick burgers topped with the kitchen sink you can get a normal and tasty burger here without all the fuss. You can also get the Konak Special burger with sauteed peppers, mushrooms and onion. That = yum. The Konak Special #1 burger is my favorite burger in Andersonville.They have a few Turkish offerings on the menu too that I'm determined to try but haven't. I like that I have the option of something more special than typical pub food should I venture outside the box someday.A huge draw are their generous drink and food specials. They have a daily meal special which is really impressively cheap and always have a few beer specials, usually coupled with a shot. Cool!It's a chill place to relax and throw a few back.

39.description: Great food, great bar selection, and wonderful staff that are always very helpful and smiling. Best bar in Andersonville, hands down!

37.description: Friendly enough service, but unimpressive beer list and pretty disappointing food.  Our skimpy "XL" pizza took an hour, even though it seemed to be a frozen pizza with toppings added, sandwiches had measly servings of fries, and the onion rings were the fake, processed onion kind.

0.description: One of the downsides in moving to a new neighborhood is that I don't get to stop by here as often as I used to. An unpretentious, cozy place. Their thin crust pizza is just fine.

38.description: "I used to Love her,.....but I had to kill her" is a Guns`n`Roses lyric. For me, Konak`s house special number 1 used to be cool`n`awesome, but I have to kill my desire for it. I told everyone about how great it was, and why they should order it. All of my friends in the arts ( yes, I have some, dont tell anyone) like the place cause its cheap, and they are broke. All my downtown corporate douche friends like it cause its "under the radar", its cheap, and they are stingy.I also like Efes beer a lot too. But, Konak`s pissed me off. Ive been ordering from them for 5 years. FIVE YEARS. I live off of Wilson AVe, they are at Foster. I called this Monday to order a tasty House Special Number 1 pizza to watch Monday Night Football with. But when I called, I was told that they "dont deliver Wilson". I . WAS. LIVID. Apparently they made a "delivery service change" that makes it PHYSICALLY IMPOSSIBLE for them to go south of Lawrence, not even for a long time customer. While I guess its important to stick to your guns in the service business, they lost a customer that day. But Apart Pizza gained one.....

51.description: Alright so normally, if I end up hating a place, I don't even bother to write a review, but for this one, I had to.First of all, we came into this place hoping to try a new fun place in the neighborhood. We ordered soda, and food. Simple as that. You refill soda, get the food, and give us a check...its simple, but some how, this waitress did not get it. I was a waitress for five years, and I know its tough, but when you are sitting watching baseball and people are waiting for their check with their credit cards out, there is something wrong. I feel bad because they all seemed friendly but I would never ever go there again.We ordered the combo which just consisted of fried food - which is fine, it said that - but the cheese sticks weren't cooked through, there were no onions in our onion rings and they all tasted the same. I understand it may be hard with fried food, and it could be that we ordered the wrong thing on the menu... That could be it...People could like Eating food that has no distinction from one another.. Fine. Feed us crappy food. Just have good service!! I'm so appalled by that waitress that to this day it makes me mad.

27.description: Konak's is.....Fine.The pizzas are pretty bland, but if you're hungry they're fine. They don't have much on tap, but the Hopleaf is right next door, so I guess trying to out-craft them on crafts would be silly. And the service is fine. I guess. I did have one issue where the waitress basically refused to split the bill for roughly 15 minutes and some people in our party had to go run out and get cash when she finally agreed to because there's a $10 minimum on cards which was not communicated beforehand. And on the whole the servers seem uninterested. But hey, they're not doing cutting edge research...they're taking your order so I don't mind the whole uninterested part as much.My favorite part about Konaks is that when the Neo-Futurists sell out. They order a pizza for the audience from here. Awesome.

32.description: I really don't like to have to wait only to be manipulated by cheap restaurants  and restaurant owners who like to play a shell game with their customers. You feel like they are trying to scam you or something. I ordered a bowl of lentil soup, waited forever for it, was charged $4.50 and only got a cup of soup. I literally waited 15 minutes for the soup.  I asked the waitress if the soup was made already made (thinking maybe she forgot about my order).  She said it was but they have to heat it up.  It takes 15 minutes to heat a cup of soup?? I don't think so. Waited another 5 minutes after that.  I finally just started to put on my jacket to walk out because it was taking way too long for soup (which is not made to order) and at that point I was getting really annoyed but then out came my "bowl" of soup. $4.50 for this??? Any decent restaurant that doesn't play games would charge maybe $2.50 or $3 tops for this amount of soup. They put a cup of soup in a bowl that was so small and shallow that it was only big enough to hold the equivalent of a cup of soup. Of course the rim of the bowl was big and stuck out only to give the illusion that the bowl was big when it really is small and shallow. I hate when restaurants try to manipulate their customers by serving something in a seemingly big plate or bowl so as to try to lead the customer to believe they're not being screwed when they really are.  I should have walked out.  That's just slimy and dishonest.  Nope.  That's not for me.

54.description: I thought this place was above average.I walked in on a Sunday afternoon and of course there were no drinkers at the bar. I took a look at the menu and it looked promising. I had take out to go. The chicken chops were quite good. It was a chicken thigh/leg that was cut up to look like a pork chop. The seasoning was very tastey with... is that a hint of cumin? We also had the bbq beef sandwich on a roll. I liked the texture and the bbq flavor. It was sweet and salty and a little nutty which was a bit surprising. The bartender was nice to me while I waited for the food to come out. She even changed the channel to something we both seemed to enjoy on a show of these people who bought junk and made it worth something. I believe that was either TLC or Discovery Channel. All the other televisions stayed on sports except the one right in front of me. Food came out in 15 minutes as the bartender promised.

48.description: We went to grab some food and a few drinks before the TMLMTBGB show on a Saturday night.  Had the super veggie pizza which was pretty good and wasn't as greasy as most pizza joints which was nice.  Beer list was really lacking.  The highlight of our visit was the waitress.  Both my boyfriend and I commented on how she was the best server we had in a long while.   Super attentive without hovering and didn't act like we were putting her out.  Over all it's a nice place to grab a cheap dinner and maybe play a game of pool.  Wouldn't go out of my way to go back, mostly because of the poor drink selection,  but will probably stop in next time we're in the area.

44.description: Konaks is one of my favorite places in Chicago! Great food! Wonderful service!

24.description: Friendly staff, fresh hot food, great prices!

7.description: Nice dive bar. Decent menu, not huge, but really good at what they do have. Staff is so very nice and genuine.  Love love love the atmosphere.  Great lighting(you'll see what I mean when you go in) and all around great atmosphere. Frequent stomping grounds of mine.

49.description: We came here after a drink at Hopleaf (which is see is kind of a pattern among reviews). The bartender was nice and attentive. The beer selection is minimal, but they did have Goose Island on tap. The pizza was excellent. We got the super veggie pizza and we ate the whole thing. I never knew I would love broccoli on pizza. They had a few tvs on and a few tables filled, but all in all a pretty quiet, laid back bar. I would recommend if you are looking for a quiet place to chat.

40.description: Service can take a while but the food (at least what I've had) is worth it!  Good thin-crust pizza - I always order the Konak Special #1: eggplant, garlic, and jalapenos.  Sounds crazy but it's just crazy DELICIOUS!  (Add sausage and even meat eaters will love it!)

53.description: For years, friends and I have nibbled at thin, crispy Konak pizzas at the Neo Futurists' sold out performances of Too Much Light Makes the Baby Go Blind. After the Halloween show (not sold out so no pizza!) we meandered around the corner to Hopleaf for a bite. Finding the trendy Belgian joint a little too crowded for our liking, we walked next door to the totally quiet Konak.Sitting down at a table in the back near the pool table, my friend and I waited patiently for service. And waited. And waited. Finally, "Would you like a drink?" We ordered water and sodas, it being late on a work night 'n all. It took ten minutes for our drinks to appear and another fifteen for someone to swing by and bother to take our food order. By this point, even with the hellish overcrowding, I could have been enjoying moules frites next door. My dining partner and I each ordered burgers (we'll try the chicken chops next time-- promise!) and both were outstanding. Cooked on a flattop to medium/medium-well, hers was a classic cheeseburger on a soft, sesame bun while I was presented an amazing, bunless Konak-style burger. Topped with at least a 1/3 of a pound of sauteed mushrooms, onions, green peppers, and some melted mozzarella, my plate easily weighed out at well over 2/3 of a pound. It was served with really crispy, thicker-cut fries and a nice salad with a peppery vinaigrette.Getting the bill at the end of the night was filled with trails and tribulations too, needless to say. My friend and I felt a little snubbed-- although we didn't order drinks, we easily spent more than one would've on two pitchers of beer with our food orders alone. So, Konak, I want to love you... but get your service issues straightened out. In the mean time, if I want a burger, I'll head down the street to Hamburger Mary's.

30.description: The bartender was a sweetheart. I'm a sucker for a sweetheart bartender.The food was...well it helped make it possible for me to continue drinking. Which I did a lot. It's not the first place I'd take people in the 'hood, but it is a bar. It serves alcohol. And sometimes...that is enough.

46.description: This was the only near by bar that was not crowded and I really appreciated that fact. it has one of the better pool tables I have seen in a bar. There is a fish tank and the sound system is too good. The food was good as I had the pasta and pizza dishes and this place is pretty cool. There is a Turkish flag in the bar so maybe this is an ethnic bar and explains why it is not as crowded as the others in Andersonville.

1.description: For too many years I've never taken Konak seriously enough.   With Hopleaf next door, Simon's down the road, and so many other places to eat and drink nearby, one could wonder why anyone would ever go in to Konak at all.    What do people see in this place?   How are they still in business?Best answer I can come up with:  This bar is the easiest place to be in Andersonville.   While other establishments nearby are crowded, overpriced, gimmicky, or endangered by newer developments, Konak suffers from none of these complications.    You can always get a table here, no matter what day or time.   The menu for food and beer is very uncomplicated, and reasonably priced.   The beer list, for example, covers whatever mood (and financial circumstance) you happen to be in.   Konak is also distinguished for being one of the very last Turkish bars in a neighborhood that used to have more of them.   But unlike some other past and present Turkish spots in Chicago, Konak doesn't go overboard.   They keep it subtle.   You may notice some Turkish decorations on the wall and Turkish beer on the menu, but that's really it.   No cheesy fabric on the wall or cushions on the floor.   It's just a regular place where you can meet your budies and drink.The food is sometimes a disappointment.    I wish it was better.   But there's plenty to choose from, and I plan to explore their food menu further.   They are famous for their "chicken chop," which I haven't tried yet.    The pizza could definitely be better.   However Konak is still a good place to catch dinner if you want to avoid paying so much more at other places nearby.   They are one of the last bars on Clark street where you can eat dinner for under $10.The servers and clientele are all friendly, and I've never had a bad time here.   If I were basing this review on sentiment alone, I would have to give four stars.    But in objectively comparing to other places, Konak is only average.    And as Andersonville changes, I'll come to appreciate that "average" even more.

55.description: Konak's to me is one of those random places you end up in. Very well known for their late-night kitchen and the not-so-sloppy second to go to if/when Hop Leaf is as packed as a can of sardines.$7 chicken tenders with super tangy honey mustard sauce (which by the way, I'm not sure I liked but was there and ate anyway) and $3.50 Bud Lights on a Fridays. There was also a very entertaining crowd playing pool and dancing their cabooses off next to us. Very spacious but got pretty humid towards the end of the night (blame the dancing machines). Although this wouldn't be my #1 bar in Andersonville, I have a feeling I will end up here time and time again when Hop Leaf is packed and/or to satisfy late night cravings when in the area.

9.description: Came in around 230pm today. Sat down in front and waited 20 minutes for service. Nobody behind the bar, nobody up front at all. Walked in the back by the pool table and the employee was hanging out by the pool table with what appears to be her family, since she was feeding a small child. This lack of service caused us to leave and take our business elsewhere.

26.description: Decent food, cheap beer, the bartender is a huge Bulls fan and hates Lebron James. What else could you ask for. Plus, I'm pretty sure if you go there enough, they'll put a picture of you on the wall. Either that, or they are in love with F list celebrities.

25.description: stick to the pizza and you will be fine. Start straying away to the other food items and you are on your own. Not that they were bad, but its not that they were good. Plus given the other dining options on the block I am just thinking you might be disappointed.

12.description: So much more than "the place you go to when Hopleaf is full." Let's get real, folks, Hopleaf ain't all that. Sure, gobs of rich white people go there and drink their $50 beers, but it has no color, and it has no soul. Konak, with its bizarre portrait wall, Moe's Tavern vibe, and cheap-looking Turkish lamps, is for the Hopleaf outcasts. Mixed drinks are stiff and cheap, the owner is drunk, and the pizza is legit. 'Nuff said.

59.description: Konak has a sweet pool table, excellent hummus, some tasty pizza, and about a dozen other awesome items on the menu. When my friends order they order a lot, so I've had a decent amount of dishes here.I like Konak, my friends and I will certainly be back time and time again.

21.description: Good pizza, we got the special #1 that had eggplant, garlic, and jalapeños. Pretty darn good. And this place has some of the last expensive drink prices in Andersonville. $2 Sam Adams. Staff is courteous, dive atmosphere but that is fine.

17.description: Konak is my favorite place to go after seeing Too Much Light at the Neofuturists or just in Andersonville when I don't wanna spend a lot of money. They always have a $2.50 special which is usually a cheap type of pilsner, or I've even seen Sam Adams Boston Lager. They don't have a huge selection, but you really don't need it here. The kitchen is open late, and they have the best cheese fries. I'm not kidding... get the cheese fries.

10.description: Good food, staff and patrons.

5.description: This place is special for me. Not only because it is a nice dive bar, it also is one of few places carrying my favorite beer, Efes (Turkish beer). Them having a pool table is a bonus!

3.description: I will say the food was not great. We got the appetizer platter, pretty Blah - except the chicken fingers, those were actually good! Also, the hot sauce - just some regular stuff - was great! I would not come and eat here again, but I would come for drinks. Super cheap daily special $2.50 Sam Adams on a Saturday night!

35.description: pizza was average, a bit better than apart over on broadway and brwyn mawr.service was pretty bad, place was empty on sunday afternoon and took 20 min for the food.i did like that it was pretty quiet in there. hodgepodge of decor, and their TVs suck. they have some decent TV sets but either they don't pay for HD service or they don't know how to get their TVs to broadcast in HD. they should pay the $10 a month to get HD service or figure out how to get it working on their TVs.then, to get the bill, even though it was empty, still took awhile to get the guys attention, and then he set the bill on the bar, even though we were sitting at a table.hey you lazy f***, how about you bring the bill over to me at our table since we are paying for your food and service and supporting you mom and pop business? that's what i though but i didn't say it.needless to say we probably won't be back.

19.description: Konak's is.....Fine.The pizzas are pretty bland, but if you're hungry they're fine. They don't have much on tap, but the Hopleaf is right next door, so I guess trying to out-craft them on crafts would be silly. And the service is fine. I guess. I did have one issue where the waitress basically refused to split the bill for roughly 15 minutes and some people in our party had to go run out and get cash when she finally agreed to because there's a $10 minimum on cards which was not communicated beforehand. And on the whole the servers seem uninterested. But hey, they're not doing cutting edge research...they're taking your order so I don't mind the whole uninterested part as much.My favorite part about Konaks is that when the Neo-Futurists sell out. They order a pizza for the audience from here. Awesome.

28.description: Loved this place until they overcharged me on  premise that i was drunk!!!  fuck konaks!!

45.description: Must add to my review to say, who knew they had such a delicious latenight burger here? Combine that with $3 Sam Adams, me, Kellie K., and Angela C. and you have a fun night out in Andersonville. Oh, add the charming and pulchritudinous staff here at Konak, of course!

33.description: Great late night place to get a drink, relax in a super chilled local environment and get a good bite to eat. The chicken chops are awesome and the pricing on the menu and drinks is super reasonable. One can grab a seat at the bar, a table or play some pool. The crowd is super mixed and unpretentious. The bar staff and owner are super friendly.

43.description: I like Konak for what it is - a no-frills, never-crowded, laid-back bar with A-OK food. Get the veggie pizza: i's probably the best item on the menu (sampler platters previously, erm, sampled couldn't hide the fact that they waltzed right outta the freezer into the oven and onto our plate.) The 'za has a nice homemade crust with lots of greens and a good amount of sauce.Drink specials are decent - usually they have a $3 beer. And although their overall beer selection won't require you to spend hours pouring over a menu with 100 brews, it is sufficient. Service always comes with a smile - and once you get to know the folks behind the bar, they'll sometimes sling an on-the-house shot your way. The pool table is pristine, darts are always open for play and the lounge area is strange (fish tank, couches) but has character. If you're looking for a place that's part dive, part chill, part sport and part easy as Sunday morning - stroll into Konak.

2.description: There's something very unsettling about a restaurant or bar that serves you water in a cheap styrofoam cup. I looked around and everyone else was drinking out of a glass. Anyway, I ordered a thin crust cheese pizza. It was acceptable for the price I paid. But truth be told, it's the kind of pizza you'd expect from a low class pool hall or truck stop. Made with industrial grade, corn oil based cheese.

18.description: Wow, to have pizza as part of your name and serve this... In Chicago...sad. Besides that, came here for a few beers, very minimal service. It appeared that the owner was sitting at the bar and the whole bar revolved around him. In my opinion, you're better off at hopleaf next door.

41.description: Once upon a time, there was a prince who loved pizza but his princess lived in Andersonville so they ended up ordering from select few places and life was good.... Until one day he asked her to go to a journey to a place she has never been before. She said yes but laid down her rules, one of which was she'd not eat anything from that unknown world. Prince said "fine!" and ordered himself a nice, large pizza. Little did he know, princess also was hungry but due to her selective nature, she didn't want to have anything from the new world. Until she saw the prince eating and having virtual orgasms while enjoying the pizza. Princess said "May I have a bite of your pizza?" and like a gentleman as he always, prince replied "Sure bitch, just don't be eating all of my shit".She had a bite and she fell inlove with it. And that's how the prince and princess broke up because pizza was so good and none of them wanted to share.True story. I swear.

52.description: GolTV, hummus plate, beer specials, and a crowd of one for the Barcelona vs Real Madrid match. Bien!

50.description: I happened upon this place when trying to find a quick snack and to get out of the rain and cold today.  I saw this place and went inside,  First off, it was very nice and warm, but the music was way too loud, playing everything from Elvis to Smashing Pumpkins and who knows what else.  It was a bar with a few seats and big pool table in back.  My friend and I ordered a medium super veggie pizza.  It wasn't bad but definitely could have used more tomato sauce.  The waitress, the only person there as far as service was concerned, wasn't the most friendliest or engaging.  We had to make contact with her first to get seated and then to order.  Being that it was out first time there, we didn't know we had to initiate contact with her first.  So we just sat there and waited until finally I said to my friend that perhaps we had to go up to her and place out order.  Even when I first walked in and was standing there for a few minutes, I had to ask her if we could just sit where we wanted.  Now the interesting thing about the service is, I could understand if the place was busy, but there was hardly anyone there, and by the time we left, we were the only ones leaving.  I can undertaken that maybe there aren't a lot of people out due to the bad weather today, but no one in the place at 6 p.m. on a Saturday night.  Ouch!

4.description: The food tastes like it should, and the bar service is good. The servers are good too from what I recall.  But  it's kind of a weird setup, with an awkward looking VIP section and what seems like an attempt to be a "bar club".  Keep up the food and beer and no more VIP stuff.

6.description: After having lived in Andersonville for over a year I finally got around to checking out Konak. The space is bigger than I imagined and the secluded pool table area in the back is a nice touch. The beer list is definitely sub par, but the prices are really good for the beers they have. The wife and I were there on a Friday night so we got to split the $7 doughboat special which was a great price for how big the thing was (see pic in gallery). The flavor wasn't jumping off the plate by any means, but it was still tasty and something that you can't get anywhere else in the neighborhood. I'm excited to get back to Konak and play a game of pool soon!

22.description: Konak is my favorite place to go after seeing Too Much Light at the Neofuturists or just in Andersonville when I don't wanna spend a lot of money. They always have a $2.50 special which is usually a cheap type of pilsner, or I've even seen Sam Adams Boston Lager. They don't have a huge selection, but you really don't need it here. The kitchen is open late, and they have the best cheese fries. I'm not kidding... get the cheese fries.

15.description: I come here quite often and enjoy it every time. Now that summer is coming around it is warm inside though. I enjoy the food, the pool and the staff. I've had the pizza a couple of times and have enjoyed it but have to say it isn't anything special and for the price along with being in the area, it's good. The fries and cheese sauce is a must and they have Louisiana hot sauce to top with. The  Chicken Arturo for $9.95 (Lightly broiled chicken breast, accompanied with pan sauteed mushrooms, onions and green peppers, topped with blend of cheeses and melted in the oven.) was my favorite I've tried there. The music isn't always on point but have been able to play some songs off of my phone before which was cool.If you are looking for cheap drinks and food with an inviting staff that serves you promptly, this is the place to go especially if you like to play pool.

57.description: I have been in Andersonville for nearly three years now, and this is the spot I hang out most often besides Starbucks and my living room. I can't believe that I haven't written a review for this place yet. Maybe I was trying to keep it a secret.Konak would get my first 5 star review if they improved the food. My favorite is the 1/3 lb. burger Konak Style® and the Chicken Chops® are well seasoned, but some things seem to fall a little flat. All in all, most of the menu is OK. I have always been a half-notch above ambivalent about the pizza here, but lately, it has been slightly improved (I think they got a new guy in the kitchen who knows about pizza spices or something).To sum up: if you like a low key place with a cool vibe (thanks to the blue lighting), where cool people hang out, the service is friendly, and the food is good, then give Konak a try. There's really not much else I can add. I love this place and I wish I could take it with me when we move back to Texas.

20.description: Review for pizza only.I tried their thin crust on our moving day, and honestly it was pretty bland. Nothing special, but I'm sure it would go okay with wings and a beer. I was pretty disappointed, as there wasn't much flavor to it. Wouldn't try their pizza again.

36.description: If I had written this review on my first visit, I would have rated it much higher. However, I've picked up many pizzas for the last couple of months and now say it's decent pizza for a pretty good price.I can't vouch for anything else on the menu except for their pizzas. I like not paying much for a no non-sense pie that just needs to not suck. They do this good and as I said before cheap. Although, lately they have been taking forever to have it ready when I go to pick it up but I'm hoping that is just temporary.

14.description: Awesome beer-no one is ever here and they have a pool table. Super trashy but worth the regrets. Order pizza, it's great.

3.description: I recently went in to have a chain replaced. They were able to give me a very honest quote over the phone and answer all of my questions. I went into the store and the workers were all very friendly and serviced my bike right away. It didn't take more than 15 minutes. The mechanic who worked on my bike was even nice enough to show me what exactly was wrong with the chain so that I could diagnose it in the future.

1.description: I'm a new biker and had them make some repairs on my old schwinn. Cheaper than other places that had quoted me, speedy service and friendly staff. I'll be back! Thanks guys!

2.description: I have been riding for a couple years now and keep returning to Johnny Sprockets for all my bicycle needs. I couldn't afford a brand new bike when starting out, so I bought a used Raleigh in decent shape that needed some new parts and repairs. Phil took great care of the bike and told me what really needed doing and what could wait. He got me up and running the same day and for a very reasonable price. Went back today with a minor issue and he took care of it in five minutes and didn't charge. I will always give my bike business to these folks. Class act local business.

9.description: Best bike shop around.  I've been to several shops in the area as well as the burbs and this shop is by far the best.  Great customer service and great advice.  They always give good advice for your bike.  They never try to upsell me.  Their waranty and customer service is the best around.  My favorite bike shop.  Also they sell the best stuff around.  Best bikes and accessories.  Always have what I need and more.

10.description: Great guys, very helpful and polite! They helped me get my bike ready for summer riding and showed me how to oil my gears.

4.description: Top notch service. If you want the job done right, this is the spot.  No attitude, fair prices, nice variety of products. My go-to LBS.

6.description: My go-to place whenever I've banged up my bike pretty badly. These guys have saved my butt many many times.

11.description: W0W. HORRIBLE!!!!!!!  DONT GO HERE. I live five blocks away from this shop.  I have been putting in 6,000 miles a year on my bikes and have recently moved to Andersonville in Chicago.  I strive to give my business to my local bike shop (LBS).  # 1.  I rode up to this shop 3 weeks ago at closing time to hopefully drop off my bike for repairs.  I didn't care when the job got done I just wanted to have it fixed.  (Some new shift cables and brake adjustments).  I was told that I needed an appointment.  So I set up an appointment (Seriously, Work Order #34300) to bring in the bikes (2) on August 18th.  # 2.  On that day we were short of staff at work s o I CALLED the shop to let them know I would not be able to bring in the bikes.  They said to bring them in as soon as I could. Today, August 24, I walk BOTH bikes over to this shop to drop them off for repairs.  I was told NO, I WOULD HAVE TO MAKE AN APPOINTMENT AND BRING THEM BACK!!!!!!!!   OMG!!!!   Is the bike shop business really this good that you can turn down business TWICE?????

5.description: I went here once and they took care of me and were reasonable on price. Helpful and timely. Thanks guys , Andersonville deserves a good bike shop. I've only been in once for a small repair,otherwise it would be a 5star in my mind.

7.description: We ride bikes simply for leisure and needed some general work--and a baby seat installed and had THE BEST experience with these guys. They understood our novice needs--made suggestions, yet were never pushy and always made us feel like we were as important as the guys buying the $1000+ bike. Our little guy LOVES his WeeRide seat and we feel comfortable knowing the experts installed it. Thanks so much!

8.description: Great group of guys.  I've been going to this shop for four years now, and I always get excellent service.  They never try to sell me something I don't need.

0.description: My wife and I went in looking for a new bike for her. They do not have a large number of bikes on display, but the guy showed us a few examples that match the style of biking she intends to do. She's very short (5 ') and so bike size was a big issue to overcome. He was very knowledgeable and did not try to sell us more bike than she needed. He asked us what our budget was and worked with us on some possibilities. We were able to select a bike that's perfect for her. I was so impressed that I ordered a second bike for me.  Fast forward to yesterday, having ordered two bikes we went in and they were waiting for us assembled (with accessories) and we were on our way within minutes. We get a free tune up in the first year and free adjustments (cables, brakes, derailleurs, etc) for 2 years. We love the new bikes. These guys made the bike buying process easy and pleasant.

58.description: Delicious ice cream in an adorable store with excellent customer service in the heart of Andersonville.  In addition to unique and classic ice cream flavors, they also offer dairy-free soy, vegan, and even Italian Ice flavors. They also have a ton of specialty sundaes, shakes, and even a case full of cupcakes and pastries in the back.I almost cried when I found out that they have Gluten Free sugar & wafer cones! They are kept in a separate box and away from the other cones so it's safe. My favorite flavor by far has been the Horchata ice cream - delicious! Note: their ice cream is on the soft side so eat up quick!Plenty of seating if you want to enjoy your sweets at George's, but they also have packed pints and half gallons for you to indulge at home.  Every single time I've been here the staff is super friendly and attentive, no matter how crazy busy it is. Love this place!

56.description: Overpriced is an understatement. Almost $5 for a single. Most of the staff was nice but the person working the register was clearly having a bad night and taking it out in customers. Save your money and indulge your sweet tooth elsewhere.

29.description: Swung by here with a Popular Pays comp for two cones. Nothing like homemade ice cream, and the atmosphere and neighborhood are great. I'll be back when the weather settles into toasty summer temperatures and I'm craving more cold treats.

42.description: I have lost track how often I come here!  I do know that its George's Ice Cream that helps me make sure I hit the gym.I love neighborhood gems and George's is one of the gems in Andersonville.  For me the go to a massive helping of Kitty Kitty Bang Bang (cheese cake, raspberry swirls and chocolate chips) on a waffle cone.  Its pure happiness.I have also had the Raspberry Rhapsody (I think its called that) and Snap Dragon.    Still have not be disappointed.  When in Andersonville its a crime not to stop here.

23.description: It was love at first scoop.  My cousin introduced me to the wonder that is George's.  I ordered one scoop of Cherry Amaretto on a sugar cone.  The girl behind the counter gave me the biggest scoop that the little cone could handle.  I had to hurry up and eat the excess before it hit the floor.  Tough job, but I was up for it!  It was then that I decided Cherry Amaretto is my new favorite ice cream.  Well, at least until my next trip to George's.I will definitely be back to see what flavor I will fall in love with next!

47.description: I come here all the time and it is always delicious. The line is sometimes long but it's because the service and ice cream are always on point!

8.description: Flavored twinkles, peanut butter s'mores and amazing ice cream flavors?WHAT IN THE WORLD?! I didn't even know what to do with myself. They have peanut butter, oreo, and chocolate twinkles. DEAD. They also have s'mores with and without peanut butter - with though, duh. They have cake balls (heh) and they even had blue ones :P Some interesting ice cream flavors, crazy sundaes and to top it all off - Dark Matter coffee. This place is a solid winner all around. Something for everybody. And all of it for me! YUMMMM!

31.description: A classic ice cream shop with dairy free options! Yay! A sugar cone with a single scoop of espresso Oreo soy ice cream, please :)

34.description: Absolutely love Georgie's! It's old school charm really makes you feel like you're a child again. And the Nutella shake is amazing. I always have it made with regular vanilla ice cream and it's so addictive it's not even funny. We've also had their brownies and they're yummy too. I love the ice cream with brownies-I think its called the Zanzibar? So so good!

16.description: As Ice Cream shops go, this one is one of the more solid.  As many have noted, the price for a scoop or two of ice cream is pretty high.  I'm not sure why perhaps we're paying for the extra rent since the place is pretty large inside for an ice cream shoppe.  The decor I found a little dark, particularly since it was a bright and sunny day.  But enough with that.  Down to the real business.The ice cream was delicious.  I had the strawberry cheesecake and it was amazing.  There are more options than you can hope to reasonably eat and not become morbidly obese, so there's something for everyone.   They also have a large selection of other sweets and baked goods.  Next on my list is one of the amazing looking milk shakes. The staff was great and super helpful.  Despite it being a little crowded they were patient with everyone and made sure you got to sample whatever it is you were interested in.

13.description: When it comes to ice cream, my sweet tooth prefers artisanal. I blame it on living close to a Jeni's during my formative years. Now nothing says dessert like an obscurely complex scoop featuring a trifecta of locally sourced ingredients. Since it was close to midnight on Friday, I'd managed to get my fix at George's. For the kid at heart, there's Cotton Candy, Birthday Cake, and Zanzibar Chocolate. For the rest of us, it's the Exhausted Parent: coffee ice cream with bourbon. My junior scoop ended up as a triple. Thanks guy-behind-the-counter! Perhaps he took one look at my weary face and sensed that I needed a reprieve. My ice cream was really creamy, nicely spiked but with a muted coffee flavor. I tip my hat to George's as a neighborhood haunt. Great place for locals to stop by later in the evening, hang out and indulge on a variety of sweet options. As for me, not really worth the drive up from River North.

11.description: Super cute place. Plenty of flavors, and there are even board games to play with.

39.description: George's has fun flavors, lots of options, and very generous sized scoops.  I could barely finish my 2 scoop ice cream cone and I have a bottomless pit when it comes to sweets. Plan on that!  It's also nice that they have a lot of spacious seating, which I found unexpected for an ice cream place.

37.description: I honestly can't comment on too much from George's because I've only been here once, but that one visit was really, really nice.  I'm not sure how much they actually make in house, but the inside is like an adult's version of a candy store.  They've got a bunch of ice creams, chocolate covered treats, warm pies and cobblers, and cakes to go around and they've just managed to bring them all to the next level. Specifically I had a scoop of ginger-honey ice cream here and it was awesome.  There were chunks of sugared ginger (maybe crystallized ginger?) in the ice cream and both the ginger and honey flavors were prominent and right in your face.  The ice cream base was smooth and creamy, and even despite it being winter, I finished that whole cup in probably 5 minutes.  It was simply sublime.Other than that, they had a bunch of other flavors I'd want to try like horchata, black raspberry, and fat Elvis (banana/chocolate/peanut butter), so you can just imagine how awesome this place would be in the summer!The next time I visit Chicago I will have to stop by again.  Their flavors are great.  The staff is friendly.  And who can resist pretzel waffle cones or pistachio cookies?!

0.description: I love this place.  I love it so much I feel bad for most of the restaurants in the area because I can't really think of many instances where I've stayed after dinner for dessert at the same location-- I usually just walk over to George's.No matter what you're craving, if it's sweet, George's will probably have you covered.  Their ice cream selection is fantastic, and as you've seen in other reviews, is from one of the best ice cream places in the world-- especially if you're a Badger and sometimes get nostalgic for Madison.The staff is super friendly and let's you try out as many flavors as you feel you need to before making a decision.  There's always plenty of seating which accommodates groups or individuals.  There's also wifi so if it's somewhere you want to stop in during the day to do work, it's really a great alternative to other places in the area which don't offer wifi.Totally a favorite in the city.

38.description: Absolutely loved George's! Such a cute little place, decor is cute, place is clean, staff was nice... We had a 3scoop sundae.. I'm not much of an ice cream person, but I've gotta say, I'd definitely come back for some! Next time I'll try some of the baked goods or maybe the chocolate dipped Twinkie!

51.description: This place is always great.  Many times the ice cream isn't frozen solid enough - sometimes, we can't make it to the door before it's running down your hand.

27.description: I've been to this place twice, both times to redeem a popular pays. The place is pretty big, which is good for ice cream parlors. The staff was friendly both times.The first time, my friend and I got 3 favors in their own cups - mint chocolate, some kind of brownie flavor, and one other that I cannot remember. This time, my friend and I got our own cones - mine had Yippee Skipee in it, and his has key lime pie. The key lime pie had crust/graham bits in it. Super limey but not artificial flavory! Mine had peanut butter and such in it. All of the flavors that I have had have been AMAZING. I love this place. Can't get enough. I recently moved down the street, so I'll be going often :)

32.description: Flavored twinkles, peanut butter s'mores and amazing ice cream flavors?WHAT IN THE WORLD?! I didn't even know what to do with myself. They have peanut butter, oreo, and chocolate twinkles. DEAD. They also have s'mores with and without peanut butter - with though, duh. They have cake balls (heh) and they even had blue ones :P Some interesting ice cream flavors, crazy sundaes and to top it all off - Dark Matter coffee. This place is a solid winner all around. Something for everybody. And all of it for me! YUMMMM!

54.description: This place is wonderful! It's decently priced and has a wide variety of flavors to choose from. You can get your ice cream in so many different ways - sundaes, milkshakes, in a cone, cup, or whatever.I got an Oreo Milkshake and it was awesome, and my friend got their Grasshopper ice cream and said it was amazing! Definitely going back to this little gem.They also have a great little sweets bar filled with cookies, cakes, etc. their cookies are pretty good, but there are better out there. If you do get a cookie just take it home and heat it up a little bit.The staff is very friendly and can give you recommendations on anything. There is usually a good amount of people working so if there's a line it won't last long.

48.description: Ice Cream and Sweets, Yup they have both of those. The ice cream flavors are of the super sweet, super manufactured, super nuts variety... I spotted marshmallows, caramels, brownie swirls, cheesecake bites, more brownies.. you get the point. I can only imagine they are all tasty. This isn't Jeni's with hibiscus or lavender. Points for dairy-free, Soy options.. I have too many friends who can't do 'Ice Cream'.I chose the green tea ice cream, it was actually very light and creamy with a slight green tea flavor, super good, not too rich. You can get the flavors in a cone, a sundae, a milkshake or choose from one of their pre-imagined concoctions.. which from what i saw look like a sweets overload.. never a bad thing. I did not make it the pastry case on the end as the store was very busy and I wanted to get to my ice cream.All in all, a tasty experience, in great location with a very friendly staff. Just beware there are a ton of flavors, and lots of options which might be hard to choose what you really want with a line out the door.

44.description: Love the quality and variety. Portions are generous. The staff can appear flustered when there's a crowd but dont let it dissuade you from stopping in!

24.description: Delicious flavors and cool artwork. There's also a great selection of cake and candies. There's a really pretty and relaxing patio in the back that you can enjoy during the summer, and it butts up against Alleycat Comics, so you can have coffee or ice cream and then stop in Alleycat to get something to read. The reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the lines are always really long, and they don't have a coffee grinder even though they sell some of the best coffee.

7.description: I've been to this place twice, both times to redeem a popular pays. The place is pretty big, which is good for ice cream parlors. The staff was friendly both times.The first time, my friend and I got 3 favors in their own cups - mint chocolate, some kind of brownie flavor, and one other that I cannot remember. This time, my friend and I got our own cones - mine had Yippee Skipee in it, and his has key lime pie. The key lime pie had crust/graham bits in it. Super limey but not artificial flavory! Mine had peanut butter and such in it. All of the flavors that I have had have been AMAZING. I love this place. Can't get enough. I recently moved down the street, so I'll be going often :)

49.description: This is a mixed review.On the surface George's is pretty incredible. Their ice cream tastes so good. They have so many flavors! Their sundaes are so childishly sinful and delicious. BUT ..... but, every single time, without fail, both my boyfriend and I feel unbelievably sick after eating their ice cream. Like, TMI sick. Get it? Immediate punishment. This is no good!I went here with 2 of my aunts once and they immediately commented on the old milk smell in the parlor and it is so true. There is a SMELL for sure in here. It's stale milk and refrigerator smell. It's so bad that you can smell it OUTSIDE the parlor, leaking through the door. It's nauseating. Am I getting sick because their ice cream is old, bad, spoiled, not stored at the proper temperature? I don't know. I will say many times the ice cream has been basically dripping melting the second they put it on a cone. Maybe they aren't keep their cooler/fridges at the right temp.An even bigger complaint than getting continually sick from their ice cream and a sign that something huge is wrong with their refrigerators is the taste of their refrigerated treats/baked goods.  One day I wanted some chocolate, not ice cream, and I remember George's has some such items along with cake and what not. I purchased a small baggie of foam candy, I think it's called Devil's food candy in some parts. It's caramelized foamy sugar in chunks, covered in chocolate. The sugar is delicious and dissolves in your mouth, or so it is supposed to. I got these bad boys home and took one bite and could not eat anymore. The taste of old fridge had so intensely permeated these treats that I could not eat another bite and threw them away. How old are these candies? When were they made? If they are fresh, when is the last time you cleaned out your fridge units?!??!?! With a taste like that I am absolutely 100% certain that absolutely all of their candies, cakes, chocolates also taste like fridge. And because this parlor continually smells stale I have to confidently assume their baked goods and treats ALWAYS taste like old, stale fridge. The taste was so god awful inedible, old and terrible. Yikes. I was so close to going back to return these disgusting treats but I just let it go because I didn't feel like losing it in public and yelling at hipsters about chocolate. I've been here many times and I am sure I'll cave again because for the 15 minutes before I get sick, their ice cream is good. I should really try to take my own advice though and avoid and visit Forever Yogurt across the street instead.

40.description: Drove by with my kids on an ice cream crave and they were closed even though it clearly says they're open. I thought maybe the location changed so I called while I was Infront and someone answered and said they're location hasn't changed but they were closed... OH AND that they'd b open after New Years. Maybe. Boo to you. Took our business across the street.

53.description: I like this place a lot and come here often! Sometimes the line is super long but their house chocolate ice cream (Zanzibar) in a pretzel cone is worth it.

30.description: Super cute store with delicious ice cream! I got the ginger honey on a waffle cone all indulgently after eating sushi at Ora.  What a freakin perfect meal! They have a bunch of other desserts as well in addition to coffee.  Some unique things like pretzel cones, which, I can only imagine, is great.

46.description: A girlfriend treated me to a scoop after we finished a long day of thrifting the vintage shops of Andersonville for baby shower decor, and it was the perfect sweet end to a lady date afternoon.I can only speak for the key lime, which is out of this world! Perfectly fitting for a summer day where some citrusy zing is a welcome note to offset the sugar-coated thirstiness precipitated by snacking on sweets, the key lime certainly delivers.The employees at George's were sweet and patient, offering samples and happy to offer advice on their favorites to boot.  And ice cream-induced thirst can easily and freely be quenched from a water cooler in the front of the store. All in all, a pleasurable experience, and one I'd be only too happy to repeat when in the area.

1.description: This is a fine place for ice cream. If you're in the area and are in the mood for the something sweet, this place is worth considering. However, I felt that there wasn't anything that really made it stand out. The flavors were good and priced reasonably, so it's good for the money. Also, there is ample seating area if you are coming with friends. It's good, but not great.

55.description: Just had a great ice cream cone at George's sweet shop on Clark. I had their peanut butter pretzel caramel in a waffle cone. It was a sweet, gooey treat.  The ambience is very relaxed, with leather couch seating.  It is a large, comfortable space.  You can try any flavor before buying. I will definitely be back

9.description: The scoop on George's is they serve Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream, which is based in Madison. Not too many places serve it. And it is damn good. I've gotten nothing else here, so consider this review one of ice cream, service and atmosphere.My favorite ice creams here are any of the vanilla based ones with tons of goodies mixed in. No point in telling you what they are because the flavors rotate often but Yippee Skippee and Zoreo are musts if in stock. Zoreo seriously changed my mind about chocolate ice cream. (Ok, maybe not, but it's the only chocolate based ice cream I've ever loved.) they also have really cool sundaes.The staff at George's is always friendly aka let you sample all the ice cream you want without giving you grief. I always enjoy sitting down there too or on their kind of hidden back patio. It's a fun atmosphere. Best of all, George's is one of few dessert places staying open past 11. In Chicago you can count those places on one hand. That makes them pretty much the best.

26.description: This place is fantastic! Tried the Zanzibar ice cream, red velvet cake bite, and triple chocolate cake bite. The ice cream was like cold molten brownies and the cake bites were so dense with ingredients they had some weight to them... It drowned my taste buds! Not to mention the people working there look like they are having a great time. Very kind and talkative. Music was a nice touch as well!

25.description: When it comes to ice cream, my sweet tooth prefers artisanal. I blame it on living close to a Jeni's during my formative years. Now nothing says dessert like an obscurely complex scoop featuring a trifecta of locally sourced ingredients. Since it was close to midnight on Friday, I'd managed to get my fix at George's. For the kid at heart, there's Cotton Candy, Birthday Cake, and Zanzibar Chocolate. For the rest of us, it's the Exhausted Parent: coffee ice cream with bourbon. My junior scoop ended up as a triple. Thanks guy-behind-the-counter! Perhaps he took one look at my weary face and sensed that I needed a reprieve. My ice cream was really creamy, nicely spiked but with a muted coffee flavor. I tip my hat to George's as a neighborhood haunt. Great place for locals to stop by later in the evening, hang out and indulge on a variety of sweet options. As for me, not really worth the drive up from River North.

12.description: It was love at first scoop.  My cousin introduced me to the wonder that is George's.  I ordered one scoop of Cherry Amaretto on a sugar cone.  The girl behind the counter gave me the biggest scoop that the little cone could handle.  I had to hurry up and eat the excess before it hit the floor.  Tough job, but I was up for it!  It was then that I decided Cherry Amaretto is my new favorite ice cream.  Well, at least until my next trip to George's.I will definitely be back to see what flavor I will fall in love with next!

59.description: This is great ice cream!It makes me happy!Go Georgie Porgies!!!!

21.description: Great ice cream. I don't love that there isn't a board with the ice cream flavors on the wall. If several people are in line you can't see the ice cream flavors until you get up to the counter but oh well. It's ice cream and it was good. They also run good deals through out the week.

17.description: I love having this spot so close to the restaurants. It is nice to skip the high priced deserts from wherever you are eating and stop in here on the way home. They have a great selection and fair prices. It can be busy at times during the summer but they do a pretty good job moving the line. It is normally the fault of a few dopes that need to try every flavor before making up their mind. The staff is normally very friendly but they do sometimes hire hipsters that are too cool for their own good.

10.description: I honestly can't comment on too much from George's because I've only been here once, but that one visit was really, really nice.  I'm not sure how much they actually make in house, but the inside is like an adult's version of a candy store.  They've got a bunch of ice creams, chocolate covered treats, warm pies and cobblers, and cakes to go around and they've just managed to bring them all to the next level. Specifically I had a scoop of ginger-honey ice cream here and it was awesome.  There were chunks of sugared ginger (maybe crystallized ginger?) in the ice cream and both the ginger and honey flavors were prominent and right in your face.  The ice cream base was smooth and creamy, and even despite it being winter, I finished that whole cup in probably 5 minutes.  It was simply sublime.Other than that, they had a bunch of other flavors I'd want to try like horchata, black raspberry, and fat Elvis (banana/chocolate/peanut butter), so you can just imagine how awesome this place would be in the summer!The next time I visit Chicago I will have to stop by again.  Their flavors are great.  The staff is friendly.  And who can resist pretzel waffle cones or pistachio cookies?!

5.description: My whole next paycheck will likely go to this place.We stopped in for some ice cream. Loads of options though, we opted for just cones, but next time, it's a sundae for sure!Junior cone was plenty to fill us up after dinner, and the flavor options were almost endless (tank goodness for sample spoons and patient staff!). The beau got the best mint chocolate chip he's ever had (with oreo bits instead of chocolate chips...yum!) and I got "blue moon" which is described as the flavor of fruit loops milk (true!).Super polite staff, lots of tables, free wifi, no complaints here!

3.description: Key word: PRICEY! (Bobtail and Windy City Sweets offer bigger portions for same price) Worth a 20min drive? NOPEI was a fan at first but after exploring many other ice cream shops in the city, this is no longer my top three. The ice cream brand they sell is called "Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream" which is made in Madison, WI. Their are three shops in/near Chicago that are actually named "Chocolate Shoppe Ice Cream" that sell this brand (Skokie, Forest Park, and one on the outskirts of Chicago). Besides that, George's is the only one I know that is not named "Chocolate Shoppe" that sells it. I love their service because they are super patient. My friend basically sampled half their ice creams  and they weren't even bothered by it. They just kept asking if he wanted to try something else. They were super inviting. They also reply to every comment you make in the most polite way possible. Almost as if the owner tells them they should always be the last one to respond. Pretty cool. Their service alone won me over. Another huge plus is that they are not underemployed. The line moves fast even though it looks long. I got 2 scoops of "Heaps of love" with Oreo, Nuts, and M&M toppings. It was good but, their scoops are SMALL. Something to note is that they keep rotating their ice cream flavors. So what they sell today may not be their tomorrow. I just wish it wasn't as PRICEY. It has a very chill ambiance and I have to mention the restrooms because it smells like cake. I don't know how they do that, but the smell of cake is so strong you can't smell anything else. I know I'm weird for pointing that out but usually any restrooms in the city are disgusting and smell like pee. So this stood out to me.

35.description: George's is pretty cool because they have good coffee, WiFi, and decadent snacks - so I can come here and work on my computer for an hour or 2 in comfort, and no one rushes you out (since it's usually not packed). I often end up here because the Starbucks a block away is always packed. I would recommend George's Red Velvet Cake, Carrot Cake, Smores Tart, a Vanilla Latte or any of their ice cream. I would warn against the fruit tarts, which are pretty hit or miss.Located in the heart of Andersonville, it's a cool location with good people watching, or a hot date (I've heard about those)....The only cons about the place are the somewhat pricey pricing on a lot of their items, and the big hit on my growing waist, which I need to see a therapist about....Other than that - indulge, hang out, enjoy, love, and celebrate at George's ;-)

19.description: They have a rotating selection of 2 soy flavors and a no sugar added option as well. Love the dairy free ice cream options. As someone who is allergic to milk, this place makes me feel like the average and is a great place to gather with friends in Andersonville. The team here is so pleasant and make getting ice cream even better. Good job!

28.description: They have been in the neighborhood for 50 years so if that alone isn't a testament to their success, just a glance at the menu will have you sold. This place is magical. It smells amazing when you walk in. You cannot go wrong with any flavor because they are all delicious. Their sundaes are all super fun. Sweet counter will have your mouth watering. They have colored changing spoons. Love this place. Such a great spot!!

45.description: Came in here for an impromptu dessert after a dinner outing with friends. It is definitely a nice location and the fact that it's open late really is a plus. This is my reasoning for only giving it 3 stars. I noticed that they had ice cream cookie sandwiches. I had been craving one of those suckers for a long time. However in the fridge they had an abundance of two flavors and the one that had the ice cream I wanted had a peanut butter cookie. I'm sure people love peanut butter cookies I'm just not one of those people. So I go to the counter and ask if they can make me one with a chocolate chip cookie instead and the guy looked at me like I just asked him for his first born. He started trying to come up with an explanation which kind of ended up sounding like he didn't want to make it. So to end his long speech I just asked so those are the only ones you have and he quickly responded yes. Hmm you would think something made in house would be easily made. Anywho I had the fat Elvis ice cream and it was delicious. I will definitely come back but probably earlier when they have different staff.

33.description: The ice cream selection wasn't great. They were out of almost all of their flavors on a Monday night. What gives? I ended up having to get one of their take-home options from the freezer and once I got home, I realized that the brand of ice cream wasn't even their own house brand. It was some brand from Wisconsin and it was awful. I couldn't even finish half of it. I'm just not sure why so many people seem to be impressed by this place but maybe I'll give it a second chance.

43.description: It's not the most cleanest but have so many choices. There was a homeless guy inside but the fact that they let him stayed inside while it was freezing cold was a nice thing to see.

2.description: "You salty!" If I were a novelist, I can only imagine the types of characters, situations, and places that would make those words come alive. But in my simple world of "I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream," those words--your name--are the only ones that come to my nervous tongue as my eyes absorb your creamy caramel texture; the only words I can purr as I run my tongue across your salty chocolate stripes; the only words that will pass through my lips as they absorb your salty caramel flavor; the only words that can pass my teeth as they nibble on your salty cashews, and the only words that I can sigh with resignation as I suck the last bit of melted goodness from the bottom of the moist sugar cone in which I held you. Oh, "You salty." You live in a tasteful, chef-inspired equivalent of a beauty pageant runway; yet after ogling all the others, and sampling quite a few, my heart remains with you. Even after taking home a pint of your goodness, I still didn't tire of you.You sweet. "You salty." I only have ice, in my freezer, for you.

18.description: Always great selection of ice cream with a couple of soy options. Nothing but polite employees :) And temperature color-changing straws!Got a root beer float using horchata ice cream

41.description: Friendly staff and best butter pecan ice cream I've ever tasted! An instant favorite on my list of places to get a treat.  A++

52.description: Ice cream! I was initially overwhelmed by the wide variety of flavors. But after assessing all they had to offer, I was quite pleased with my selection. I'm glad I went with the junior scoop. It was more than enough to satisfy my craving.

50.description: Fantastic! If you are looking for something sweet, look no further! Cookies, cakes, and decadent ice cream in many flavors!

4.description: Great ice cream shop if your in the area.  Cake desserts also.  The ice cream is Ice Cream Shoppe ice cream.  I wouldn't drive out of my way to visit but if you're in the immediate area this is a great place to relax in the coffee shop style seating while the kids play hop scotch on the pattern in the floor.  Parking situation is brutal in the area.

6.description: George's is a must-stop for me any time I'm hanging out in Andersonville. It's a really spacious ice cream parlor with tons of tables and even some couches for you to lounge on and enjoy your ice cream. It's in a great location right on Clark in the heart of Andersonville too!They offer a wide variety of ice cream flavors that change over time. I had an amazing super blueberry one the first time I ever visited. I also tried one of their pre-set sundaes that had everything chocolate all piled into a bowl. DELICIOUS! It's hard enough to choose a flavor or two without even considering all of the sundaes and shakes they offer too.Service has always been extremely friendly every time I've been. Definitely try a few flavors before deciding which ones you're going to devour.5 stars for this great ice cream shop!

22.description: Really happy with it. The vibe inside the shop is really great and we spent a good amount of time just sitting inside and eating... There are so many flavors to choose from and most of them are original mixes (not just the traditional chocolate/vanilla/cookies and cream/etc). I definitely felt like I got my money's worth

15.description: Absolutely loved George's! Such a cute little place, decor is cute, place is clean, staff was nice... We had a 3scoop sundae.. I'm not much of an ice cream person, but I've gotta say, I'd definitely come back for some! Next time I'll try some of the baked goods or maybe the chocolate dipped Twinkie!

57.description: Add me to the list of people who are head over heels in love with this place! Friendly, cheerful staff, a huge selection of delicious flavors (including soy flavors for those of us who can't do the "real" stuff), amazing looking baked goodies that I can't wait to try, plenty of room to sit, fun atmosphere with fun music, oh and tons of old school vintage CANDY. You just can't go wrong at George's. I kind of want to move in.

20.description: It was quite busy when we went, and the line could probably have moved a little faster (things got a little melty while we were waiting by the register to pay). But the ice cream and atmosphere was wonderful. Wouldn't be surprised if this is the best in the area.

36.description: We hit this place frequently during the summer months (at least once a week on our date night cap off)......okay winter months too. How can you not?

14.description: Delicious flavors and cool artwork. There's also a great selection of cake and candies. There's a really pretty and relaxing patio in the back that you can enjoy during the summer, and it butts up against Alleycat Comics, so you can have coffee or ice cream and then stop in Alleycat to get something to read. The reason it didn't get 5 stars is because the lines are always really long, and they don't have a coffee grinder even though they sell some of the best coffee.

28.description: Breads and jams and veggies and cheese oh my!!Andersonville Farmers Market is great. I love how many tents have food samples to try. Seriously, because of this I probably bought more than I should...well played! It's smaller than some markets, but has most everything you need. You could def make a meal with everything here, plus a few extras. It's Wednesdays from 3-8 so it's nice that I can go over after work. They even have live music! This will now be my go-to market for the summer!

1.description: You can't help but love classics like Goldfinger, and Secret Agent Man on an accordion.  That was the live music selection at today's winter farmer's market.  The market is small with maybe around 20 vendors.  They had homemade candies, pastries, soups, bread, and salsas.  I ended up with some great  organic winter spinach and winter radishes, and also some ciabatta bread.  (I think I see a sandwich in my near future.) I was also intrigued by the never-ending knowledge of the black garlic vendor, and ended up with some of that, too.  Though the market is  small it's a good place to pick up some fresh goods, and commune with your neighbors.  And, it gives you just a taste of summer when all the outdoor farmers markets are in full swing.

39.description: I think Mr John B. should give this Market another chance!! Though I do agree with him on the idiots that think bringing their double wide (but have only one kid) strollers is a good idea. Even at 6pm the tables were full of all kinds of delicious treats. Fresh fruits and vegetables, cheese (which I couldn't get enough of the samples... sorry), even some unique items like soap, dried herbs, and infused vinegars. Jarred goods galore, meats, and breads filled my eyes... note to self don't go hungry. All in all I walked away with a bottle of dill infused vinegar, a Santa Fe herb rub, zucchini and some squash. The best part is that it only cost me $12 dollars.I like to also mention that each and every both had the nicest people selling their product. This would normally give it five stars but it really was a pain to get in and out. If you have the time check it out for yourself.*** They also selling potted herbs so you can grow your own at home, well worth it for someone who cooks a lot.

9.description: This farmer's market is friendly, convenient, and has so many wonderful local and organic options.  The only downside is that it is very small.  If you can find whatever it is that you are looking for on the block between Clark and Ashland, then this is an excellent option.More so than other Farmers Markets that I have been to, this one hosts many vendors who do more than just raw goods.  You can usually find artisan bread, cheeses, tofu, pastries, and other local creations.  This is nice if you're trying to put together an entire meal from the market without rounding out your shopping list at a large supermarket.Some of the vendors can be a bit pricey... that's the cost of quality products.  Fortunately many are becoming credit-card friendly and if you should need cash there is a US Bank with an ATM just up the street.

29.description: This review is specifically for one of the Andersonville Farmer's Market vendors, Videnovich Farms. I just moved to the neighborhood this winter, and I'd really been looking forward to the farmers' market. It's been a busy summer, so I don't get to go as much as I'd like to, but the 2 times I've been so far, I've stopped at the Videnovich Farms stand, and both times it was my favorite vendor to stop at. I believe the person at the stand is Vera, and she's just awesome. She's a very personable person, she's quick with a smile, and she seems to really enjoy letting people know about her farm, the vegetables, and, the most interesting part, the yarn. Her farm has sheep and she creates skein's of wool that she hand-spins. She leaves the wool in its natural shades, and it's amazing the variety of shades the wool naturally comes in. She also dyes some of them using flowers, plants, etc, creating beautiful colors. Another great thing about Vera's stand are the smells! She's got cinnamon basil, lavender, and other things that smell so good. I felt like I was transported to the farm in Michigan. Part of what I enjoy about going to my local farmers' market is the opportunity to socialize and to interact with vendors. Vera, of Videnovich Farms, really seems to have quite a flair for talking with market goers with a friendly demeanor and a knack for providing information about her wares. I'm definitely thinking about buying some beautiful yarn from Vera and making a scarf, or giving a skein of yarn to a knitter-friend. I definitely recommend checking out her stand, at least to experience the evocative scents, or even a little chat, and, who knows, maybe you'll even end up taking home some lavender, yarn, or a pepper.

23.description: Hump Day only gets better during Andersonville summers. I adore this farmer's market most of all for the focaccia, berries & cherries, purple carrots, mushrooms, cave-aged cheeses, seasoned tofu, free samples. There is no need to buy your produce anywhere else during these months. You can make a single twenty-dollar bill stretch for you, OR trade many more bills than that for some of the finest delicacies wo/man can naturally grow or produce.Plus they accept credit cards. Plus the vendors love dogs.

5.description: This was the 2nd Farmers Market I've gone to in Chicago and again wasn't very impressed. Had less vendors than the Logan Square Farmers Market. I went on 6/4/14 and just felt the display by the vendors was thin overall. I arrived around 6:30p so with an hour and a half left I'm sure it's not uncommon to be out of product. I did take note that one vendor (Twin Garden Farms) wasn't present as they are advertised on the website. I was hoping they would be there because of their unique corn on the cob. I did not see any signs of them there. It was also a rather cool night and it had been raining most of the day so that could have impacted the overall sad feel to the market. I will give it a go again in a few weeks or so as I want to support local busniess.I was again disapointed with the lack of fresh cut flowers and one vendor with just potted ones for gardening.

31.description: Fantastic! Any time I want to spend $5 for a small jar of cheese spread, no scratch that . . . . any time I want to spend $5 for a small jar of SPREADABLE CRACK COCAINE, I'm coming to the AFM and Brunkow Cheese of Wisconsin (of course). Ohmyfreakinggawd. This stuff is so good, and they have a small hibachi on site, for grilled cheese curds. This cheesehead rejoiced. I was powerless, my wallet sprung open beyond my control.Also great Concord grapes, and apple cider. What was priceless was procuring really healthy, delicious snacks (grapes and free samples) for a hungryish "I want a snack!" kid.Great, small market in the best 'hood in Chicago. Pricey, but eh - every once in awhile, you have to indulge. Oh, and running into My Favorite Yelpers at the market? Priceless as well.

25.description: Love the hours, love the produce, jams, breads, ice cream, meats, juices, granolas...

12.description: I really like this farmers market. I don't feel overwhelmed with selection as I do at other farmers markets (not that I'm knocking you Daley Plaza, but sometimes I just leave with an apple because there are too many varieties of all produce) and there is a neighborhood feel to this farmers market. I've been here 4 weeks in a row and several tents know who I am as they start reaching for the honey crisps and the sun burst tomatoes. The prices are reasonable---I purchased slightly beat up honey crisps for $5 (I chose the second hand looking ones as they were $2 cheaper) and 1/2 pint of organic sunburst tomatoes for $2.50. It can get crowded as it's on a narrow strip of Berwyn and many people bring strollers and/or dogs, so be aware of that before heading in. Also, they have a token system in case you forget to bring cash (like me).

37.description: Uh....YUM!  There were samples everywhere!  And they worked because we left with bags and bags of goods, that's for sure!  Tofu, tea, cheese, and fruit samples galore! We were serenaded by some kiddos sing-a-long much to my ears disgust....but guess you have to make it a family affair!This is a great little market that is perfect for the after work crowd.  For that mid-week time where the produce you purchased on Saturday is no longer looking to pretty, or just gone altogether!The cheese man will be my new best friend and I love John B. for pointing him out in particular.  Everyone was so nice in explaining their products.  It was a great neighborhood market.  Although a bit cramped, especially with strollers and dogs everywhere.  If only all the booths could move back a foot, then I wouldn't feel like I was running into everyone with my backpack.Will be back again that's for sure.  And the fact that I have farm fresh produce in my fridge on a Thursday is wonderful!  What a great ending to a work hump-day!

21.description: I'm only able to make it here near the tail end of the market, which is unfortunate. They are open on Wednesdays from 3-7. Obviously, it's a farmers market, so all the food there is generally what's available AT THIS TIME. It's all local-ish vendors, as well. It's a nice market with nice vendors, but it's pricey. It's great supporting local farmers, but honestly, I wouldn't be here every week just because I can't afford to spend $30 on a few fruits and vegetables on a regular basis. Good quality stuff though. There were some SERIOUS blueberries last time I went. Super serious. And tomatoes. The tomatoes were superb.

16.description: My apartment smells fabulous right now, because I'm slow roasting tomatoes from the farmers market. Because they were "seconds" -- some overripe, some bruised, none perfect -- I got a 10 lb bag for 5 bucks. That's cheaper than The Jewels.I've fallen hard for my local farmers market. It's not big, and there isn't the variety of some markets, but to quote Spencer Tracy in "Pat and Mike," what's there is cherce.What is there? Well, the usual rundown of fruits and veggies, of course. Apples are coming in, and the beloved honey crisps are everywhere.
