($5/qt, which in my case was 7 apples, which is much better than The Jewels.) Though I'm a little put off by the winter squash. Too soon! But it's the non F&V stuff I tend to buy here. Great breads - if a little pricey - from Bennison's. Amazing fresh and aged cheeses from Brunkow Cheese in Wisconsin. They have a raw milk white cheddar and horseradish spread that is amazing. And an aged cheddar that is one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. And you know there's a lot of competition there. Preserves from Rare Bird which include - are you sitting down? - strawberry chocolate. And so much more. Infused vinegars, herb rubs, fresh eggs, fresh pasta. Goat meat! Krsna, are you listening?Of course, most of this stuff isn't cheap. Sure, there are bargains like the tomatoes and apples, but the eggs are $4.50 a dozen. But a half pound of 6 year aged cheddar for 12 bucks is more satisfying than a pound and a half from Kraft for the same price. Go for it.The market must be doing well, because it has been extended until Oct. 7. (Originally, Sept 9 was going to be the last day.) Hours are now 3 to 7. I assume this means they'll be back next year. Which is good news for all of us.

17.description: The Andersonville Farmer's Market is great for your dosage of local-produce-warm-fuzzies for the week. It's conveniently located (right off Clark), which is nice, but it's a little small (no parking lot for these guys, they have to make do with the side street).I feel it's friendlier and more intimate than other farmers markets I've been to in the city. They have a nice selection of produce, and you can certainly get a lot of your weekly (healthy) grocery shopping here with fruits, vegetables, eggs, cheeses, tofu, pastries and more!

10.description: This is one of my favorite things in the neighborhood, and there are a lot of things I like in the neighborhood. There's a solid variety of vendors (many of whom have free samples... just saying) and prices are fair.  If you know what's in season, you can probably get a deal. The focus is definitely on produce, which works for me.I also really like that it's in the evening, which helps me avoid the less-than-preferable scenario of hanging around with 3 pounds of apples and/or tomatoes after my lunch break/until I go home.

11.description: I finally made it the whole 7 blocks away to this farmers market. Andersonville is technically a part of Edgewater, but let me tell you, this farmers market rips the pants off of the Edgewater market! It is no jealous sibling, but a hulking behemoth of wonder! What a slacker I have been for not making it here sooner!! Oh. My. GOD! There must have been 7 or 8 stalls of fresh veggies. I have been craving tomatoes like a heroin/crack whore and supermarket tomatoes will not do it. I had to get my fix. And let me tell you, I have been nodding in tomato glory all week! They were not horridly expensive, and super wonderful!!! THE CHEESE, oh, the CHEESE is to die for. I came home with some fresh mozzarella and a wonderful horseradish cheddar spread. Spread? you may be thinking- Yes, add a dab of this to noodles and you have the best darn Mac-n-Cheese that you can imagine! Add some mixed mushrooms from the vendor (10$ for a really full bag) and you are set for some of the best Mac and Cheese that you can imagine! My mouth is watering just thinking about it again. I am going back this week, and next week, and every week until they close. Yes, they do sell bakery items, ice cream, meats, you name it. But between the cheese, shrooms, and tomatoes, I am the happiest person you can find! I wish they would teach the Edgewater people how to do it. This is two blocks worth of stands, delicious, wonderful stands!

26.description: as i write this, i'm eating a breakfast of cherry vanilla bean granola, fresh red raspberries, perfectly ripe peaches, and vanilla yogurt.  i know you're jealous, but don't worry!  you can have it all too!  all you have to do is go to the andersonville farmers market.it really rocked my world.  tons of amazing produce and handmade concoctions.  i loved the balance of fruits, veggies, breads, meat, cheeses, desserts, and even kombucha and ice cream!  also, they have a spot set up for local musician groups to play music, and a puppet show across the street.  i realize the puppet show is for kiddies, but i was thoroughly entertained.i thought i'd died and gone to heaven, until i checked my empty wallet.  it's a leetle pricey, but the quality is far above and beyond the store that it's worth it.  the only thing i didn't like was that i just found out about it a week ago!  ack!  must make up an entire summer's worth of farmers-marketing in the next couple weeks!  which should be simple, given that it runs from 3pm-8pm on wednesdays.  nice!

27.description: I've vowed to go to this wonderful farmer's market every Wednesday from now on.  I love it!!  The fruit is so sweet, juicy, and amazing that we finish it within 2 days.  The cheese spreads and breads are also delicious!  I've recently purchased an asiago-garlic loaf from Bennison's and it was soooo good....melted asiago cheese and chunks of garlic!  I'm so tempted to buy so many things from this market, but I'll just do it little by little and try something new every week.

35.description: I love the farmers market! I would highly recommend Videnovich Farms.  We have purchased their CSA box which we pick up each week at the market and have not been disappointed.

8.description: I appreciate the fact that this market is open into the early evening hours. This is really wonderful especially for people who work full-time during the week. This market features a myriad of produce items, many kinds of breads and excellent meat vendors. This Farmer's Market features a rotation of vendors (merchants), which s a great way to give new vendors an opportunity to participate every other week. You will see items, such as, baked goodies and fresh real fruit jams. Due to the "rotation" of vendors (merchants) you may not see a specific vendor the following week. One vendor that I was very happy to see this year was "Black Garlic North America" which offers aged, fermented garlic which has a sweet, delicate taste and balances most dishes perfectly. I love using this garlic in different meats as well as using it sparingly in salads, grilled salmon or broiled Talapia. I also purchased some organic vegetables and fruits. I even found corn, which is very hard to find at a Farmer's Market. Picked up a few ears for my husband who loves corn on the cob. This Farmer's Market is open through October 15, 2014 and every Wednesday from 3 to 7 pm. Gotta love it!Due to "space" this is not a huge Farmer's Market, however, it has some wonderful items. I like the size of this market, because it doesn't take long to get through the entire market and hit up most of the vendors here. I have been to many, many Farmer's Market over the years and most close by early afternoon. On the other hand, this Farmer's Market is open until 7 or 8 pm (depending upon the day of the week and time of month). This year the market opened two-weeks early, which was very exciting for those of us who enjoy a great Farmer's Market. There are nearly 30 vendors offering everything from fresh-cut flowers, wonderful bottles of wine to a myriad of cheese to honey and including fresh lamb, delicious ripe fruits and unique vegetables. If you enjoy tea in the fall and winter time (or year round) you must check out the gourmet tea vendors. There are pies, gourmet pasta sauce and unique salsas that you may not find any where else. I noticed some people brought their knives (yes, you heard correctly) -- knives -- and someone will sharpen your knives for FREE while you walk around the Farmer's Market and shop till you drop!I met Brady Bradine at the Farmer's Market. This is his fourth year being a vendor at the market. He sells all-natural, whole grain baked goods, which I can appreciate but can no longer eat. For example, Brady sells cookies, cupcakes, muffins and brownies from his bakery located in Oak Park, IL (it is called "B True Bakery"). I didn't purchase any items from the "B True Bakery" but my friend purchased a cupcake and cookie for her husband. I gave up sweets and anything that contains sugar, but I do admit my mouth was watering and everything looked fantastic and smelled super fresh. My friend rated the cupcake with 4-stars (as she ate it while we were walking around the market). Her husband enjoyed the cookie and said it was "very, very good." He didn't rate the cookie. However, he inhaled the cookie very quickly so I will take this to mean that maybe the cookie was/is 4 or 5-star worthy.If you have not been to a Farmer's Market this Summer, get your ass over to Berwyn Avenue (between Clark and Ashland Avenue) and treat yourself. This is their sixth year. I love a good Farmer's Market, and appreciate that they also offer organic products that will not break your budget. I also appreciate that they accept credit cards, debit and LINK cards which makes it very convenient for everyone to shop at this Farmer's Market. Some of the other Farmer's Market that I have shopped at this Summer are "cash only" but not the Andersonville Farmer's Market. Out of all the Farmer's Market that I have been to this Summer this is one of my favorite markets. It is such a great community of people and the vendors are fantastic and sell quality top-notch products. It is affordable so I can purchase healthy organic items for a lot less than I would pay at Whole Foods! Check out this market before it ends. You will not be disappointed!Hhhhm, I am not sure why someone voted this review as "Funny." Strange.

0.description: I am starting to be a bit of a meat/veggies snob. I don't get to Farmer's markets as often as I would like. Although this market is not the most conveniently located to where we live, I would go out of the way to do my shopping here. They have a good variety of vendors here. One can find almost every kind of perishable and it is all local! All of the vendors are friendly and more than happy to tell you about their wares. Not only are the vendors awesome, the crowd is also really cool. Started up a few conversations with folks just standing in line or browsing.. This is going to be on my rotating schedule of farmer's markets to attend!

38.description: Bread: $5Cheese samples: $0Tofu samples: $0Appreciating bright, colorful berries in the sun: $0Seeing lots of fine products, friendly people, and supporting local businesses and my neighborhood: pricelessWhen you can give up a Saturday morning and take at least one or two legs of public transportation to get to a decent farmers market, knock yourself out.  For me and everyone else, this is my market.

20.description: Sometimes, I forget that I live in the nation's third-largest city... and that sometimes usually happens when I'm perusing the Andersonville Farmers Market.As expected at a farmers market, there's free samples for the taking. I'm talking in-season jams, glorious cheeses grilled on the spot, handmade tofu, cardamom blueberry granola, banana foster-flavored popcorn, quickly-snapped-up ears of Iowa corn and juicy apricots. But, bet you didn't know real smiles were up for grabs, too! I'm wearing my ear-to-ear Sunday grin on a Wednesday... hump day, my dears, has never rocked this hard. Where's that apron?And when I awake tomorrow, I'll have my way with organic eggs, sweet gypsy peppers, oranges juiced by the hands of yours truly and a slice of zucchini bread. I believe this is what we Americans call "stopping to smell the roses" though more accurately, I'll be stopping to smell the heady fragrance of fresh-cut lilies (also purchased at the AFM).If you forget your cash, don't despair - you can buy tokens on your credit/debit card and they basically work like cash (you'll get hard change back). This small, easy-to-navigate open air market is open 'til 8pm every summer Wednesday, and they keep it going into the borrowed days of Indian summer, too.LOVE. That is all.

19.description: Ah, the midweek highlight that is the farmers market! I miss it already. I only moved to the neighborhood in the late summer, so I can speak more to the fall offerings than spring or early summer. My favorites: Apple cider from Michigan. The beautiful name-your-price flower arrangements, run by the friendliest young women. Homemade caramels in the most delicious flavor combinations, like honey vanilla or rose. Halloumi cheese and tofu. Squid ink pasta. Samples GALORE. Take a few laps to compare prices, then dive in. Enjoy the live music, the dog friendliness, cheerful vendors, and best of all, the late operating hours.

33.description: My apartment smells fabulous right now, because I'm slow roasting tomatoes from the farmers market. Because they were "seconds" -- some overripe, some bruised, none perfect -- I got a 10 lb bag for 5 bucks. That's cheaper than The Jewels.I've fallen hard for my local farmers market. It's not big, and there isn't the variety of some markets, but to quote Spencer Tracy in "Pat and Mike," what's there is cherce.What is there? Well, the usual rundown of fruits and veggies, of course. Apples are coming in, and the beloved honey crisps are everywhere. ($5/qt, which in my case was 7 apples, which is much better than The Jewels.) Though I'm a little put off by the winter squash. Too soon! But it's the non F&V stuff I tend to buy here. Great breads - if a little pricey - from Bennison's. Amazing fresh and aged cheeses from Brunkow Cheese in Wisconsin. They have a raw milk white cheddar and horseradish spread that is amazing. And an aged cheddar that is one of the best things I've ever put in my mouth. And you know there's a lot of competition there. Preserves from Rare Bird which include - are you sitting down? - strawberry chocolate. And so much more. Infused vinegars, herb rubs, fresh eggs, fresh pasta. Goat meat! Krsna, are you listening?Of course, most of this stuff isn't cheap. Sure, there are bargains like the tomatoes and apples, but the eggs are $4.50 a dozen. But a half pound of 6 year aged cheddar for 12 bucks is more satisfying than a pound and a half from Kraft for the same price. Go for it.The market must be doing well, because it has been extended until Oct. 7. (Originally, Sept 9 was going to be the last day.) Hours are now 3 to 7. I assume this means they'll be back next year. Which is good news for all of us.

2.description: My favorite local farmers market I've visited, by far. I've always wished the season would start a little sooner than the first week of June, though. Maybe they'll finally heed that advice, and start a few weeks earlier for 2014? I can understand the season ending in mid-October, due to the fact it starts to turn very cool enough right around that part of the fall. I still really wish their farmers market season would begin at least by mid-May, though.Though some of the vendors are a tad expensive, I always find something to enjoy about this farmers market every time I go. If you have a chance and a Wednesday afternoon/early evening to come by, check it out.

34.description: This is a great little farmers market that is being spoiled by inconsiderate patrons.People, please, it's a small area.  No, it's not OK if you run into me with your bike.  It's not OK if your dog gets startled in a small area and goes crazy.  It's not OK for yuppie mommy to assume that they have the right of way just because they're pushing around their little darling.Going to have to agree with the previous poster in regards to the hassle created by inconsiderate people that don't have the common sense to a) lock bike on uncrowded street b) leave fido at home or c) be considerate and not use their stroller as a battering ram (it's just plain rude to use a stroller to nudge someone out of the way!).As for the food, there is some great produce by a few vendors. It's nice to see Phoenix Bean have a stall.  There is meat/eggs available, however some vendors don't bring certain items because, as one vendor said tongue in cheek "the Green City Market is the best and that's where they sell most of it".Prices are a little high and you can tell that the vendors are setting prices together.  Coincidence that all vendors have the raspberries priced exactly the same?  I think not.  The convenience, in spite of the bad behavior demonstrated by selfish people, makes it worth the trip on Wednesdays.

32.description: Great place.  The staff works hard to make it very enjoyable and I love the samples.

18.description: Fantastic! Any time I want to spend $5 for a small jar of cheese spread, no scratch that . . . . any time I want to spend $5 for a small jar of SPREADABLE CRACK COCAINE, I'm coming to the AFM and Brunkow Cheese of Wisconsin (of course). Ohmyfreakinggawd. This stuff is so good, and they have a small hibachi on site, for grilled cheese curds. This cheesehead rejoiced. I was powerless, my wallet sprung open beyond my control.Also great Concord grapes, and apple cider. What was priceless was procuring really healthy, delicious snacks (grapes and free samples) for a hungryish "I want a snack!" kid.Great, small market in the best 'hood in Chicago. Pricey, but eh - every once in awhile, you have to indulge. Oh, and running into My Favorite Yelpers at the market? Priceless as well.

13.description: This is a nice addition to the neighborhood.  The vendors are friendly and there's a decent variety of organic meat, produce, and breads to purchase.  They even have knife sharpening while you shop!

4.description: The Andersonville Farmers' Market is just like the neighborhood (quaint, cozy and friendly). There's great selection for produce and other items (breads, meats, eggs, treats, etc.).The prices from vendors could be cheaper, but I guess the standard prices for Chicago farmers markets are marked up in general. Another recommendation would be if they had more vendors with made-to-order food. I love the market and it's a staple to my Wednesday evenings throughout the summer.

24.description: One of the best farmers markets in the city. Great variety of vendors from veggies and fruit to tofu and grass-fed beef. It's nice that this market is in the evening and more relaxed than crowded Saturday farmers markets.

6.description: This was my first time at the Andersonville Farmer's Market. It had most of the items that I was looking for.  Typical farmers market. The market is compact since it's only couple of blocks long.  There are plenty of options for veggies and fruits, but organic and non-organic.  The only item that I didn't find was corn.  The red and black berries are delicious.    The Bruni-Uusto cheese stand is incredible which you can taste before you buy a packet or two.It's great to have this market during the week to replenish your fruits and veggies that you have bought over the weekend.  The evening hours is a plus.Looking to return.

22.description: You can't beat the hours at this farmer's market - 3-9 for the working man.  Add in Phoenix Tofu w/the amazing tofu noodles for a few bucks, the stand that sells garlic dip to die for, lots of fresh produce, and music to accompany your buying frenzy = best way to spend an hour on a Wednesday.  I look forward to it every week!

15.description: Ok...Admittedly, maybe I'm just easy (when it comes to Farmers Markets), but I love this one.  Andersonville is a great area, the vendors are always super friendly, I meet fun people there, and they have goParking:  Street (meter) on Clark, but there are plenty of other options around (Ashland, Rascher, etc.) with free street parking in the neighborhood.Gluten Free Friends:  They have yummy GF options too.  Side Note:  Right nearby is Andie's.  They now have GF Pita to go with the hummus!  ;)

7.description: Sometimes, I forget that I live in the nation's third-largest city... and that sometimes usually happens when I'm perusing the Andersonville Farmers Market.As expected at a farmers market, there's free samples for the taking. I'm talking in-season jams, glorious cheeses grilled on the spot, handmade tofu, cardamom blueberry granola, banana foster-flavored popcorn, quickly-snapped-up ears of Iowa corn and juicy apricots. But, bet you didn't know real smiles were up for grabs, too! I'm wearing my ear-to-ear Sunday grin on a Wednesday... hump day, my dears, has never rocked this hard. Where's that apron?And when I awake tomorrow, I'll have my way with organic eggs, sweet gypsy peppers, oranges juiced by the hands of yours truly and a slice of zucchini bread. I believe this is what we Americans call "stopping to smell the roses" though more accurately, I'll be stopping to smell the heady fragrance of fresh-cut lilies (also purchased at the AFM).If you forget your cash, don't despair - you can buy tokens on your credit/debit card and they basically work like cash (you'll get hard change back). This small, easy-to-navigate open air market is open 'til 8pm every summer Wednesday, and they keep it going into the borrowed days of Indian summer, too.LOVE. That is all.

36.description: Is it Wednesday yet? Is it Wednesday YET (pants like a dog in anticipation)?!?!?! My tummy longs for the abundance of free samples and my eyes wish to feast on the all the super fresh veggies & fruit these farms have to offer. Oh and my wallet wishes to ache (yup ache) at being emptied at said farmers stands. You cannot see it, but I am doing the "raising the roof" gesture in my eagerness. Oh boy, oh boy do I get excited about Farmers markets--I absolutely LOVE them. To me it is a treat to talk to the farmers who are ever so proud of their wares & they should be. Nothing like fresh, local and in most cases organic produce. Plus, (HELLO!) you get to try all the stuff. The extrovert that resides in this body loves the crowd as well, they all seem pretty happy to be there & there is nothing I love more than things that foster community. This one does not fail in that department. I have to give it up for the A-ville farmers market, each week it gets better & better (I do agree with Nick--John B needs to give this bad boy another chance). For their 1st year in operation, they are running a very swell market. More farms get added & the organizers are getting a wee bit better with their spacing of the booths. Plus, now some of the farmers take credit card (phew!) which is a nice plus since I do not like carrying lots of cash. Now, there are some bad things about the market as well: *it gets massively crowded (especially after 5pm since the after work crowd starts arriving). *You could possibly get run over by a child or run on over in your rush to get to a booth. The kids are everywhere--so watch out. *The booths cannot be on the sidewalk, so it can be tough to maneuver around the market. Prepared to be jostled--that is the way it goes folks. I do look forward to this every week & highly recommend you check it out if you need some produce midweek and like Kelli said--especially if getting up early on a Saturday morning is not your thing.

30.description: I was walking down Clark St. on the hunt for post-work beer and not wanting to venture from my hood, and I happened across the farmers market. Did I NEED salsa? Nope. Did I NEED two types of grapes? Nope! Did I need bread? Nuh-unh! Did I NEED corn or apples? Well, I'm sure they're productive to a healthy diet....but no! And no, I didn't know what Kombucha even was before yesterday. And yet, there I was, 30 minutes later, hobbling back to my apartment with my hands full of bags of random produce. Never even got my beer. Had Kombucha instead.

3.description: I stopped by last week.  The Andersonville Farmers Market is a decent size with lots of samples to taste, and is far bigger than the tiny one in Edgewater and the so-so one by the Loyola el.  It might be around the same size as the Rogers Park one by the Morse el.  Like other Farmers Markets, they offer a LINK matching program.  In Andersonville's case, this means that they'll charge your LINK card a certain amount (say $10), and then give you $20 in cardboard tokens.  You then use the cardboard tokens to buy goods.  While this of course doesn't let you spend in denominations smaller than $1, so you can't buy taste portions, it avoids the nonsense I saw last night in the Rogers Park Farmers Market.  There, the two women operating the LINK machine couldn't figure out how to correctly bill the customer, and kept overcharging her.  In the end, I'm pretty sure they underpaid the vendor by $1.50.

14.description: Great way to spend a summer evening! Andersonville is such a great neighborhood so you can venture out to shop or dine when you are finished shopping.  Great produce from local farmers is the perfect match.  From farm to your table is a great feeling.

58.description: This is a place with intrinsic class, unlike most places here with superficial class. Class does not happen just by spending a lot of money, or creating  a decor or physical ambiance. It happens when you have a great concept, you find an intimate space, and you hire the right people. And those people are gracious, genuinely friendly, and accommodating. Lucas and the bartender belong here. They who know how to relate, and how to connect. The decor is classy and comfortable. It feels like Paris or New York- a fact I like very much. It doesn't feel like phony-exclusive Chicago. And the drinks...well, just the best $14 buzz I have had in awhile.That was one great martini. Still feeling it.

56.description: I simply adore this establishment. It is a gay bar, or gay-friendly bar, like no other in this city. It is chill, cozy, classy and laid back. It reminds me of several bars I frequented in Paris, France. The waiters all wear classy attire and the martinis are great and very strong, (1 and I am more than good to do). It gets crowded easily because of how small the place is, but instead of feeling crowded, it feels cozy to me. This place is unlike any other gay bar in Chicago.

29.description: I'm not sure if it's a good thing or not, I suppose it's all about how you look at it, but the drinks were poured very strong. 5 stars.

42.description: Yummy drinks, great atmosphere. They also host fundraiser in Sunday which is awesome.  They don't hold back on the alcohol, so pace yourself :-).

23.description: Good GOD- I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place.  Great atmosphere- always fun folks, really great professional bar servers- happy to whip up something not on menu, and gives back to the community.  Rule on the martinis- order a big or go home!!! ;-). Just don't order more than 3- !! Good wines too.

47.description: Amazing martinis & great service!! They're strong, yet still have plenty of flavor. I'm a moderate drinker & I always seem to be content here after two drinks.Be warned, it's a small place & can get rather crowded, especially on weekends. In my opinion, it's actually best earlier in the week, but no matter how busy they get, the drinks are always good.If you sign up for their emails, you get occasional $5 coupons. They usually come in for that evening or the next day, but it always gives a good excuse to go out!During the warmer months, the patio pretty much doubles their space so that helps too!!!

8.description: Great space - tight but worth it. Great drinks - strong. Super friendly and the  best waiters anywhere. No one can have a bad nite or time at Marty's. A most for friends - people watching  - always bring my out of town friends here!!!! Be prepared for very tight space or move on.

31.description: Expect to get hammered.Perfect martinis (and I'm a dick).  Caveat: make sure to tell them your gin, or you'll get well de facto.  Small space (don't go with a group), pretty much the gayest spot on earth - bartenders wear tuxedos and they're playing Donna Summer, except the crowd is average age 41, which is about perfect.  You can specially ask for small martinis.  You'll come out staggering and $100 lighter, but for atmosphere and fun bullshit chit chat, can't be beat.

34.description: While visiting this fine city my host brought is to have the best martini. Loved the speakeasy atmosphere and music.

16.description: best martini in ChicagoDon't drink more than 2 cause you will be on the floorsmall space - get there early or expect people to brush up against you all nightprofessional staff (not friendly but professional - they take what they do seriously)Strawberry Shortcake - perfect blend of cream and alcohol - so goodDirty Bird - I can eat those stuffed olives all nightGreat place for a drink or two before going out in the Andersonville neighborhood

13.description: Marty's makes EXCELLENT martinis.  We had The Dirty Bird,  vodka, olive juice with blue cheese stuffed olives. The Caramel Apple, chilled vodka, butterscotch,  sour apple in a caramel drizzled glass, The Apple martini,  and last but not least  The Funky Monkey, chilled vodka, cream, banana liquor and Irish cream, all were delish, but the last one is so strong that it will put you  on a***. ;)  Our bartender Brendan was the BEST!!! We will definitely be back.

11.description: Great outdoor patio, stylish and speedy bartenders, good selection and nice crowd. For a $14 martini, they use well vodka... which would be a problem if you could taste it. The French was very good and not too sweet. I'm wondering if they actually use real Chambord. I also had the funky monkey which was blended nicely as well. I would check it out if you live in the neighborhood.

39.description: Came here with friends, about 8 of us, for my birthday recently (4/4/14) and loved it. We were able to get a table though, which made it much easier to enjoy. Aiming for Andersonville sophistication, with a mahogany bar and waiters donning black vests, the martinis were excellent. The servers were really nice too. I loved the ambiance too... music playing and dimmed lighting. However, really small place and really crowded on the weekend. They are currently renovating their outdoor patio though, so once its ready it should be excellent for additional summer space.

37.description: Always great drinks, very crowded but we were able to get seats for 6 last night at around 11:30pm.  The service is quick and the bartender bought me a birthday shot so it was a definitely a great night =)

0.description: A totally cool martini bar catering to a mixed crowd in Andersonville with a great Prohibition-era feel serving up some incredibly well-crafted (and potent) cocktails.  We managed to snag the table right by the window, allowing us to enjoy our drinks and talk while taking in the fun vibe on a busy Saturday night.The drinks are made with top-shelf ingredients, and you can tell that the bartenders take great pride in their craft. For me, it was a negroni for starters (yeah, it's not a martini, but I guess everything becomes one at Marty's when served in a martini glass), with one of my friends then ordering me a chocolate martini. Both packed quite a whallop... let's just say that it was a late start on Sunday morning...It's a bit of a hike from the Loop or Mag Mile, but it's definitely worth the trip. A long-ish walk from the Berwyn Red Line station, but cabs are easy to find, or just grab yourself an Uber. You'll have a great night out, for sure!

38.description: My friend and I recently discovered this little gem just off of Clark on Balmoral. It is TINY and it was PACKED, but I had a fantastic time. Despite the noise level in this little pocket of a bar I was still able to carry on a conversation. Upon arrival we were standing in front of the bar but were able to get a seat at one of the little tables in the front within 20 minutes. The martini's were delectable, I enjoyed several. The table service was swift and friendly. I loved that the bartenders wore white shirts, black vests, and black ties....it made this little bar seem extra fancy. A word to the wise....when this bar is packed it becomes very difficult to get to the bathroom. Expect to be grinding on strangers the whole way there. Enjoy!

51.description: $14 for well-worth it martinis! Perfect place for pre-drinks before going out or getting saucy in an intimate environment. Small interior with dark lighting, attentive wait staff, and cute outdoor garden patio in the summer. Part of me wants it to expand (which I hear is the plan), but it's awesome just the way it is. Usually an older, more subdued crowd in contrast to the martini bars of Boystown.

27.description: Love this little bar. Perfect place to start out the evening before grabbing dinner in Andersonville. They are known for their cocktails but also have wines by the glass and a few (3 to be exact beer options). My suggestion to them would be to offer a few more beers and upgrade the wine selection slightly. The white and sparkling is fine but the red selection could use an upgrade. Anyway onto the positive the service here is upscale and highly professional in their appearance and their demeanor. It's a small place and popular but if you get there early you should luck into a seat. In the summer it had a wonderful patio. Last summer it was under construction so I am looking forward to seeing what they have done when the patio re-opens in 2015.

32.description: I had a minor heart attack when the bartender said $28 for two "tickle my pinky" martinis.

54.description: The bartenders know how to make a proper drink! I really love the atmosphere, however, seating is a slight issue.  I prefer one of the few tables to the tiny always packed bar.  They have a really nice patio that is suitable for spring, summer and early fall.  It's certainly a neighborhood haunt for us!

48.description: It's a small yet successful bar located just of the main strip. I have to say the drinks are amazing! Servers have been friendly thus far and the owner is a great guy and a hoot. I went with a few friends for a couple drinks before heading out to Sidetracks for s fun musical monday, and it is exactly we needed. It was relaxing and elegant. I would highly recommend checking it out!

44.description: Went back and ordered brand name booze. The upgrade only cost a dollar more. Drank heartily with no bad effects like last time. Steer far clear of the well liquor here! I asked the waiter what their well vodka was and I've never heard the brand before. Spend the dollar! Your Saturday morning will thank you.

24.description: best martini in ChicagoDon't drink more than 2 cause you will be on the floorsmall space - get there early or expect people to brush up against you all nightprofessional staff (not friendly but professional - they take what they do seriously)Strawberry Shortcake - perfect blend of cream and alcohol - so goodDirty Bird - I can eat those stuffed olives all nightGreat place for a drink or two before going out in the Andersonville neighborhood

7.description: The Good: Staff was friendly. Also good is if you're an actor and get a role in a movie playing a sardine, this is an excellent place to get into character. The Bad: Smallest place of business I've ever been in. It was so crowded I started having a panic attack. It had to be way beyond whatever fire code the city has in place. It took a coon's age to get our order, and the drinks were crazy expensive.

49.description: The decor is great. Place is small (which makes it intimate). Dave the door person is great. Bartenders? Eh!!  The short one acts like he hates the world (dude if you hate working with the public then get a job where you do not work with the public). A couple of bartenders are very accommodating.  A couple of them act like they have a hair up their a**.  Don't get me wrong I don't expect for anybody to kiss my ass, but at least acknowledge me when I sit down in front of you. Yeah I was the dude who took my tip back tonight when I left. I tip on service and service I did not get.

40.description: Great small bar, for a date night. Prices a little over the top. But once in a great while is a good thing

53.description: Great place for drinks.  I love the ambiance, bartenders, and the location.  A recent visit back brought back some good memories.  I'll be back for the patio or bar-top.

30.description: Great cocktails, big and strong. Excellent service. Super cute little cocktail bar for the jacket and tie crowd (and their boyfriends).

46.description: Oh my gosh!  I'm in love.  I came here with 3 girlfriends for Mommy Martini Night on a cold and snowy Friday.  But this place definitely warmed us up real quick!  The service is great, everyone was so friendly and having a good time. I had the Lemon Drop martini which was delicious, and then had a glass of Riesling.  So tasty.  This place is quite small, but that makes it much more cozy.  I'll definitely be back in the summer when the patio is open!

1.description: Delicious martinis and great friendly staff and very nice atmosphere , no tvs and very intimate A definite go to when friends and family in town

55.description: I love this place, was concerned when they first opened, but the waitstaff and bartending staff, and owner are just so darned awesome that they won me over.  politically active, intellectual conversationalists when appropriate, socially aware, and most importantly good martini makers...I can bring my friends here, my mom here, my sister here and they would all have a good time!

9.description: Lovely martini bar!  A bit on the small size and when it got busy, it was a bit uncomfortable as martinis arent necessarily the best to be in a busy crowd with.  However, excellent martinis and z great variety of them to enjoy.  Decently priced too.

26.description: Went to this bar for the first time this weekend and had an awesome time. They serve up all the traditional martinis - cosmo, dirty martini and french 75. They also serve some not so traditional ones i.e. peppermint patty. The latter is not my style but it's awesome that they have it as an option. Service was great, my friend I went with didn't enjoy what he ordered so they tossed it out and made him another one with no issue or complaint. Glad I tried this place out because I will definitely be back.

25.description: I absolutely love this place. I went here for my 21st birthday and I'm glad that it was my first bar experience. My birthday was on a Monday, so it was very chill. It's welcoming and comfortable. The bartender was awesome. The martinis were amazing. I had a Dirty Bird while my boyfriend had a Peppermint Patty (I think that's what it was called). We also shared a Tickled Pink, which was delicious. My favourite was the Dirty Bird and I kind of wanted an entire glass of those olives.Once the weather is more nice, I hope to be here often.

12.description: The Dirty Bird is the word! I love a good martini. I also love a bar that always makes them the same. Only once did I think it was too dirty. 1 out of 30 times= not bad at all! My only complaint is I can never pick up straight men there but I guess it is considered a gay bar so that's my problem really. Wont stop me from going! Looking forward to the new patio!

59.description: I love Marty's. I have been coming here for years and always appreciate how friendly the staff is and how willing they are to have a lively, personal conversation with you. In addition, they make a mean cocktail! It is a small establishment, so I personally like to visit during the week when it is less crowded.

21.description: This place is amazing wait for it... Fabulous!!! The staff is just stunning, gentle, and intuitive. Yes, there are times where it's frustrating because you can't get a seat. Yes it's crowded, but what can you expect from a place like this. You're treated amazing and the drinks are great, yes there will be a wait, and the crowd will deter you. However, please don't pass this place up. It's beyond worth it! Enjoy your bartender, and tip him well. You'll find a place that is welcoming and inviting. Marty's will always be a staple in this community, and I am proud to be one of their patrons. But, I had to add on thank you Luke!!!

17.description: Went to this bar for the first time this weekend and had an awesome time. They serve up all the traditional martinis - cosmo, dirty martini and french 75. They also serve some not so traditional ones i.e. peppermint patty. The latter is not my style but it's awesome that they have it as an option. Service was great, my friend I went with didn't enjoy what he ordered so they tossed it out and made him another one with no issue or complaint. Glad I tried this place out because I will definitely be back.

10.description: Love this little bar. Perfect place to start out the evening before grabbing dinner in Andersonville. They are known for their cocktails but also have wines by the glass and a few (3 to be exact beer options). My suggestion to them would be to offer a few more beers and upgrade the wine selection slightly. The white and sparkling is fine but the red selection could use an upgrade. Anyway onto the positive the service here is upscale and highly professional in their appearance and their demeanor. It's a small place and popular but if you get there early you should luck into a seat. In the summer it had a wonderful patio. Last summer it was under construction so I am looking forward to seeing what they have done when the patio re-opens in 2015.

5.description: Marty's makes some of the best martinis in the city.  Marty's doesn't cheap out and use pinnacle vodka for their flavors like some third rate lounges - their liquor quality level starts at absolute and moves up from there.  You will always get an expertly made, quality cocktail.  Marty's menu moves from traditional dirty, to fruit and sour, and finishes with a list of sweet and dessert cocktails.The bar's seating is limited.  Cocktail tables fill up fast and, in the summer, their lovely outdoor patio is always booming.  If you go in the evening, expect that you will likely have a wait for a table and, on busy nights, a wait for bar seating.

3.description: Cute martini bar on W Balmoral in Andersonville.    The patio is inviting and private.    Sting lights at night add a cozy and festive feel to the patio.   A small fireplace adds another touch of intimacy to the nice outdoor space.Service is prompt and friendly.    The inside is a bit small, but again, very inviting. They have a list of signature drinks and beers to choose from, or you can ask for your favorite and they will sure make it for you.

35.description: If you want to get him drunk, you're at the right place. This is an intimate space, serving up generous pours of potent martinis. My date and I stopped by for a drink. One martini between the two of us. That's all she said.

19.description: Expect to get hammered.Perfect martinis (and I'm a dick).  Caveat: make sure to tell them your gin, or you'll get well de facto.  Small space (don't go with a group), pretty much the gayest spot on earth - bartenders wear tuxedos and they're playing Donna Summer, except the crowd is average age 41, which is about perfect.  You can specially ask for small martinis.  You'll come out staggering and $100 lighter, but for atmosphere and fun bullshit chit chat, can't be beat.

28.description: LOVE this place! It is right in the heart of Andersonville, but after living here for several years it took me a while to find it!  Glad I did.  A great place to go with a small group, and during the summer to sit on the back patio.  Delicious drinks, a very cool atmosphere, and a very nice waitstaff.

45.description: An awesome little spot in Andersonville that could easily be missed if you don't look at the streets coming off of Clark. A great atmosphere and bustling most nights of the week. I have never had a bad martini here and they have such a great variety. Whether you come in for one drink or plan on spending the whole night here you are sure to have a good time.

33.description: We just left there... we attended a fundraiser.  While the space is quite small, they did a good job accommodating us all.   I had both a chocolate and a strawberry martini... both were amazing.  My boyfriend had a Manhattan, and it was strong for sure!  They definitely know how to mix!  If you want a good martini, check them out :-)

43.description: Two drinks and you're on the floor.  What's not to love.  Also, great secluded outdoor seating in warm weather and decent waitstaff!

2.description: Small place, but the martinis are large and delicious. Very cozy and warm, dark.You can tell they know how to make drinks - they have a lot of options for dinner or after dinner martinis. You won't even need more than one to really feel the alcohol.

18.description: As someone who works in the industry, I was just disappointed. First experience was terrible. Incredibly dark, tiny, crowded, and loud. Overall uncomfortable atmosphere. Had the Chocolate Valencia martini. Had two sips and didn't finish the rest because the cream in it was curdling and I didn't like the taste of it at all. Bartender didn't ask if there was anything wrong, instead he handed me our check. $42 for 3 martinis. $14 a martini. That's an incredibly top notch price for a bottom shelf drink. Oh, I also walked out and realized that there was gum on the stool I was sitting on that got stuck to my leg. Wonderful.

41.description: I really want to love this place. I've checked classy upscale for ambience, but unfortunately Marty's is behind the times when it comes to classy upscale cocktails. The flaw is they use house, yes house vodka which is Smirnoff for the martinis and charging upscale prices, $13 to $14. They charge more if you call it. If you go to any craft cocktail lounge in this city from Tiny Lounge near Lincoln Square, Elixer in Boystown or Billy Sundays in Logan Square you will get a classy drink made with fine ingredients for less. And it is too dang small for the crowd it attracts. Yes it is a popular place, but these new craft cocktail lounges are going to put Marty's out of business if it does not make fine ingredients a standard.

52.description: WOW! To say that Marty's martinis pack a punch is a severe understatement.  To say that I was drunk after 1/4 of a martini is not an understatement.  I thoroughly enjoyed the Godfather (vodka, amaretto, orange liqueur) and will be back soon to see what that lemon drop is about.Small, cozy establishment, but cute patio for soaking in some vitamin D and people watching!

50.description: The drinks here are strong and delicious. Bummed that they were out of apple mix because I wanted to try the Caramel Apple, but the Pineapple Upside-down did not disappoint! A previous reviewer cited possible drunkenness after 1/4 of a martini, and I can totally see why.. These babies pack some punch!

4.description: Expertly crafted martinis, no matter your martini style. Very stylish ambiance, but a cozy atmosphere and a popular spot, so seating gets scarce as the night gets later.I got an extra dry three olive gin martini and my lord it was delicious. A friend got the chocolate hazelnut martini and it was like a glorious dessert. I think all martinis on menu $9, which is very reasonable.Excellent service. The waiter walked through the menu, came back to check on us, and could transport a very full martini glass to our table when all of his tables were empty.

6.description: Amazing martinis.  Classy ambiance.  Cozy.  Wonderful Service.Marty's is absolutely a classic and throws in a twist on the classic martinis with some decadently tasty drinks.  But, be careful, if you're having more than one you might want to really consider if that's a wise choice.I love this place, and the only reason it doesn't get a 5 in my book is because of how "cozy" it can be when it's packed.  It's often shoulder to shoulder and the limited space really takes away from the feel of the bar.  Often times it's standing room only and in the close quarters it often means you're still accidentally sitting in someone's lap unintentionally.

22.description: Fantastic place. I live in Tallahassee now, and really miss the vibe/feel of Marty's.   I usually spend my NYE there and countdown to midnight right there! I  could walk to my home easily.  Everything is good there. I'm not a heavy drinker, so if you've not got the vodka-slurp gene, you can still be ok.  Stunning décor on the walls, kick-rump high energy Euro-music, great staff, place to "see and be seen."

15.description: A friend recommended this place.  So, I decided to check it out, but not before yelping it.  The place has great reviews.  My friend and I went on a Thursday evening around 6ish.  As stated by previous yelpers...its small, and quaint.  The waiter offered a seat at a small round table or alongside the window. We chose the window seating which is across from the bar. The waiter came over and asked if we needed a minute and we said yes.  We had a few questions / recommendations that we wanted to ask the waiter. However, he was engaged in conversation with one of the patrons at the bar for awhile. We waited thinking he would see us or remember to come over....he didn't.   Finally, he looked our way and I thought he was coming over, he took a few steps and said he couldn't get through to walk over to us, and to just give him our order.  Let me just say it wasn't that crowded that he couldn't get to us.  Secondly we had questions.  Lastly as we were kind of shouting our order and asking him what he thought. His response was very nonchalant and unfriendly (like yeah it's good). WTF. If you couldn't get through to talk to us , how were you going to deliver our drinks to us????????    We shouted to disregard our order and we left. I was sooooo freaking excited to try this place. However the service we encountered sucked, and we didn't feel welcomed  also I don't believe they gave a shit. It clearly hasn't been the same for the majority of the patrons here.  I will say this encounter lead us to a next door establishment called REPLAY BOURBON AND BEER...great service and drinks.

57.description: Marty's is my favorite bar in the neighborhood but I have one tiny critique that I probably wouldn't bother making if I weren't a semi-regular. Love the drinks, snacks and atmosphere there but in the last year or so I noticed something of a dishwater odor in the bar, like it wasn't properly cleared/aired out after the late night shift. Just something a little bit bleachy and stale. If management were able to amend this I'd basically say Marty's was perfect!

20.description: Gp with an open mind for a diverse customer base. Great place. Also bring your drinking boots as those martini's and made in what seems to be in bottomless glasses. Seriously 1 and you are toasty! Awesome hole in wall premier martini bar. A must see and enjoy spot.

36.description: Marty's is the place to be !!! If you wanna scape from these old played hole in the wall bars and those twinky over crowded obnoxious drunk night clubs wanna be... Then you should come to Marty's ! This place is nothing but a good neighborhood bar ! Is a great place for a date or meet and greet for your usual dating app lol Marty's is one the few places "gay " that you can go and relax and just chat, socialize with your friends or just go alone and sit by the bar after work, Martinis are great and good price and do my rule either one big martini or two little ones haha otherwise you are on your own sista!!!!

14.description: Gp with an open mind for a diverse customer base. Great place. Also bring your drinking boots as those martini's and made in what seems to be in bottomless glasses. Seriously 1 and you are toasty! Awesome hole in wall premier martini bar. A must see and enjoy spot.

58.description: Really great mini sausage ciabatta. Grabbed a $5 deviant dale ipa at in fine spirits next door and had an incredible $5 sandwich. Great value.

56.description: My friends and I have ordered from this place many times with excellent results. Their pizza is really, really good (try the quattro formaggi). Now I can fully review the place because I have also dined-in a couple of times. I've sampled their tower of eggplant, the Cesar salad, and the meatball panini. All were great and show that this place knows how to prepare really good food at great prices.Service has also been stellar the two times I have dined there.This is a safe bet for delivery or a casual dining experience.

29.description: This was by far the worst dining experience I've had in years. When the beet salad came with beets that tasted blah and a nasty vinegary dressing that clashed with the beets and almonds, we forced it down without saying anything.Then we ordered the Rustica pizza which had three ingredients: goat cheese, figs and caramelized onions. It would have been delicious if the cook would have included the caramelized onion. After each taking a couple of bites, we tried to get our waitress's attention. Her mission seemed to be avoiding eye contact.When we finally got her attention, she acted like it wasn't a big deal. I asked her to have the pizza re-made to include all ingredients. She refused and said we could have them on the side, a discount on the pizza or a dessert. We decided on a discount. What we got was a minor 25% off the pizza. I was irritated because we were actually missing 1/3rd of the ingredients. We didn't even eat half the pizza. $30 later. I feel majorly ripped off and angry. My partner and I were grumpy after the experience. I'm still hungry. And the worst part ... No one at Johnny Brown Bag cares. Not even a little.

42.description: Everything I've tried has been great and I've tried to order something new each time I place an order. Great take out restaurant with small seating area. I often order delivery and they are super fast.

23.description: Food is really good! And for a great price. Nice for a casual dinner out or for take out. Either way, very tasty and highly recommended!

47.description: Delicious, scrumptious, and affordable! Order and unbutton your top button cuz you are gunna stuff your face and be so full!

8.description: This cute place doesn't deserve bad review over a misunderstanding. It's worth to try their fried calamari and other sandwiches or pizzas. So I'll make another trip to Johnny Brown Bag. I very much enjoyed their Philly steak sandwich at my first visit. Nice and cozy. They have beer and wine. It's a place to have a causal and decent dinner.

31.description: I ordered the make your own pasta with pesto and meatballs.  It was very good.  I would go again.

34.description: Great food.  Love the daily specials and the fig pizza.

16.description: From the outside it doesn't look much, but don't judge a book by the cover. Menu  is varied and the food is delicious. As a plus, the wait stuff are not only accommodating, but very friendly and efficient. I definitely plan to visit again and sample more of the delicious dishes.Next time I will leave room for their homemade tiramisu

13.description: Watching the National Championship game my friends and I needed some grub.  All I can say is Wow, what a great surprise.  So the name has thrown me off for a long time but decided to take the plunge and man I wished I would have done it sooner. I ordered takeout via grubhub and it was delivered as promised and hot.  So here is what we got:Arancini - Rice balls were amaze balls! They had a very similar meatball taste, which I liked very much.  Love me some meatballs.  They were crunchy on the outside and soft and gooey on the inside.  I have never had these before anywhere and will be ordering them again without question from herePeperone Ripieno - Stuffed Peppers, were stuffed and cooked to perfection.  I could have have eaten 2 of these easily, but I saved most of it for laterThe Arancini and Peperone Ripieno are so good that I cooked some pasta, reheated what was leftover, and they were better then the night before.  Nothing better then when leftovers taste better the next day.Panzerotti - Basically a fried Stromboli, but not many people in Chicago have heard of these.  I guess the pizza puff is similar, but I wouldn't know, never ordered one.  This wasn't the best I ever had, since I am from south jersey, the home of the original Panzerotti.  Ever in south jersey go here - yelp.com/biz/panzarotti-….  Yes it's in sh*t hole Camden NJ, but your mind will be blown.  Anyway back to the review - so this was good.  Nice and cruncy on the outside from being fried, but not very greasy. Cheese was melted perfectly, but could have used a little more.Rigatoni with Vodka sauce - My friend was drooling over it and I am happy to say that she forgot her leftovers at my house.. Whoo Hooo, leftovers for lunch.Got to try the pizza next time, but with the way the sauce tasted in the Panzerotti, I don't think I will have an issue.

11.description: Wonderful service, great atmosphere & food was awesome!  True feeling of a neighborhood pub.    Immediate acknowledge when our party of 5 when we walked in.   No tables available but bar was offered. Great seats. Bar tender/waiter was fast & friendly.  Some of us were fri out of state so he helped with beer selection suggestions.   We couldn't decide on one pizza choice so he offered to customize half/half totally separate pizzas.    My hubs & I split the Rustica/Margherita added chicken combo.  My son & his boyfriend live in the neighborhood and ordered their favorite which was very basic with prosciutto.  My other friend ordered an awesome salad.    We basically watched them bake our pizzas.  Came out very timely. Hot, crisp crust with super fresh ingredients.    This is not the Traditonal Chicago deep dish.   This is a classic Italian thin & crispy slice of heaven!!!    Guy behind bar efficiently handled large volume of take out and ringing up customers but never missed a beat offering us refills or water or making us feel very well attended. It was during a special art night and busy busy.   Will def be back.  Service was quick & food was excellent and quick.

39.description: Eh. Just ordered a couple of pizzas to go (milano and margherita). Based on all the rave reviews of this place I was expecting something decent, not necessarily blow my socks off amazing, but good. I was really disappointed. First, they seem to cut the pizzas before they put the toppings on them. I'm not sure if there's some sort of restaurant reason for this but it means that if you try to lift a slice without cutting it again yourself, you lose all the toppings. The toppings themselves were only okay. The prosciutto was unpalatably salty and the plum tomatoes seemed canned. The crust was thin, chewy (not in the good way), and suuuuuper salty. I ordered more than I could eat for dinner tonight so that I would have leftovers for tomorrow but now I'm not sure if I'll even eat it. On the upside, the guy at the counter was really friendly. But I definitely won't go back just for that.

37.description: With my friend moving to the neighborhood in about a week, we decided to go walk up as down Clark street just checking out the shops and restaurants. Johnny brown bag looked very cute and appetizing. We started our meal with garlic bread and it was fantastic. My friend and I both ordered the personal pan pizza with one topping on each of the pizzas. The personal pan pizza was not what either one of us was expecting. It was deep dish and we were expecting thin crust like the picture on the menu shows. It was nearly impossible to eat without making a complete mess. Both pizzas basically fell apart and leaked sauce and cheese everywhere. We both has high hopes after the appetizer and reviews on here. There was one other table dining while we were in there and the owner (we believe) was sitting at the counter having a meeting or what looked and sounded like a meeting. The owner was so loud we could hear everything she was discussing and it was kind of obnoxious. Isn't there an office or a back area where she could have talked? Anyway, I think this place could have potential but we will not be rushing back but our server was very friendly and attentive!

0.description: Johnny Brown Bag completely exceeded our expectations, and we'll definitely be back soon. We were helped by a kind and friendly hostess/server (new from NY/Croatia) who seemed to being doing it all with a smile and great attitude. She got us a high chair for our son, and when we asked if the arancini were dipped in egg (our son has an egg allergy), the kitchen offered to make a batch without egg.We ordered beer, wine, arancini, the pork milanese sandwich, and the chicken milanese sandwich, and everything was crazy delicious. Zero complaints.My only recommendation would be changing the casual cartoon character branding and visuals because they don't match the setting, decor, and food at all. (This is a good thing!)

38.description: Watching the National Championship game my friends and I needed some grub.  All I can say is Wow, what a great surprise.  So the name has thrown me off for a long time but decided to take the plunge and man I wished I would have done it sooner. I ordered takeout via grubhub and it was delivered as promised and hot.  So here is what we got:Arancini - Rice balls were amaze balls! They had a very similar meatball taste, which I liked very much.  Love me some meatballs.  They were crunchy on the outside and soft and gooey on the inside.  I have never had these before anywhere and will be ordering them again without question from herePeperone Ripieno - Stuffed Peppers, were stuffed and cooked to perfection.  I could have have eaten 2 of these easily, but I saved most of it for laterThe Arancini and Peperone Ripieno are so good that I cooked some pasta, reheated what was leftover, and they were better then the night before.  Nothing better then when leftovers taste better the next day.Panzerotti - Basically a fried Stromboli, but not many people in Chicago have heard of these.  I guess the pizza puff is similar, but I wouldn't know, never ordered one.  This wasn't the best I ever had, since I am from south jersey, the home of the original Panzerotti.  Ever in south jersey go here - yelp.com/biz/panzarotti-….  Yes it's in sh*t hole Camden NJ, but your mind will be blown.  Anyway back to the review - so this was good.  Nice and cruncy on the outside from being fried, but not very greasy. Cheese was melted perfectly, but could have used a little more.Rigatoni with Vodka sauce - My friend was drooling over it and I am happy to say that she forgot her leftovers at my house.. Whoo Hooo, leftovers for lunch.Got to try the pizza next time, but with the way the sauce tasted in the Panzerotti, I don't think I will have an issue.

51.description: Cute place with excellent food. Have been here a few times and have never been disappointed. The pizza is VERY good. Specials, including the recent pesto salmon are great. The beet salad is perfect, as is the grilled calamari which is served in a tasty garlicky light tomato sauce. Also recently I had their eggplant tower something with goat cheese which is THE BOMB...like many layers of thin eggplant, with a light amount of cheese. Like the best eggplant parm ever...only better! Also the tasty arancini (rice balls) do not disappoint. Pleasant to dine outside here, wish they had a larger interior dining area! The staff is very friendly and helpful. The name almost misleads a bit, as it is much better than its name implies. Much better than the less than mediocre Jerry's staring it down from across the street. I wish it occupied its large space! (which is a waste of space). A new great Aville dining spot. Try this place! Only bad update is I was there the other day and the music they play is TERRIBLE. Bad B96, loud and lousy. Really worked my final nerve, couldn't wait to get out. Why not something chill, cool and mellow, people?! Never get why restaurants don't get that music is important. Not just for what the staff likes. They actually seem too hip for this.

27.description: Went here for dinner last night with a friend.  He got the stuffed pepper as an appetizer and I got the calamari.  The stuffed pepper was gigantic and the forkful I stole of it was very tasty.  My calamari was a bit overcooked and chewy, and the sauce was too much for the dish.  It was too salty and I guess I just expected something simpler.  I am accustomed to grilled calamari with just a bit of oil and herbs, and this sauce was just too heavy for the calamari.  It was okay and I ate it, but I was really hungry.  I wouldn't order this again - but that's because it differed from what I guess I expected.We also got the Roma pizza to split (Mushrooms, sausage, onions, mozzarella).  We requested to swap out the onions for green peppers instead and our waitress said it was no problem.  The pizza was delicious!  Perfect amount of everything.In all, I'm definitely a new fan of this restaurant and will without a doubt be coming back.  Yum!

32.description: I don't get the four and five star reviews on this place. Food is mediocre at best.

54.description: This is my favorite restaurant in Andersonville. They have a great chicken special, good pasta, and the best cannoli's in town. I'd recommend it highly for a casual dining experience. A tip would be to go in smaller groups to this place, since they have limited seating.

48.description: I ordered the salmon salad thinking I was getting grilled salad atop a baby greens salad.  Little did I know the salmon was not cooked. Rather a sushi like salmon. Kinda ruined my appetite. Especially cuz I ate it just being I spent $12 on it.  Service was nice,but I won't be going back

44.description: We like Johnny Brown Bag and often stop by for delicious quick Italian lunch on the weekend.  It's a fun place to sit around right in the heart of Andersonville.  We have tried several dishes and enjoyed all of them.  Also don't forget to try their tiramisu and cannoli...Deeelishhh!!!

24.description: Second time here and I have to say 10/10. Clean place, fast service and darn right perfect for a quick sandwich - I ordered the meatball sub on ciabatta. Meatballs are home made - yum!  Look at my pic for reference to the meatball sub.

7.description: A good place to go to for some quick Italian food. The last time I went here, I got a Caprese salad. My other friends also ordered salads, which were pretty solid. At a previous visit, I had the margherita pizza, which was alright. If I'm in the mood for pizza, I wouldn't mind going again to try something else.

49.description: Best lasagna since I've been to Florence, Italy. Definitely Italian, Italian food. Not American Italian. The lasagna was only2 layers all fresh ingredients, not as tall as the leaning tower of Pisa or canned sauce. I will be back to devour the rest of the menu. The drink selection is very diverse as well. A cool neighborhood gem of Andersonville that all in the city of Chicago should visit.

40.description: Most uninspired restaurant name ever, but  good food. Nothing memorable or outstanding, but decent. Renalli's has better pizza.

53.description: The inside and menu of this place seems to be at odds with the name/signage. I went there looking for a big sloppy sandwich, and I got exactly what I was looking for. I got Johnny's Philly Steak sandwich, it was delicious. The price was great too, only $8 for the sandwich and fries. I definitely want to come and try some of the dinner items sometime, the people around me seemed to be enjoying theirs.

30.description: This place is small and awesome! Also not to expensive for the amount that you get which is probably is enough to feed two people. I have had the lasagna and the chicken Alfredo so far and both are amazing. I haven't tried the pizza but I saw one when I was there and it looked really amazing so that will be the next thing I get.

46.description: I've been here a couple of times as it is an easy casual carry-out place in my neighborhood. I would recommend if you are going here to do the pizza or sandwich - good portion, reasonably priced for what you get. I would not recommend the pasta, not because it taste bad, but just because it's so simple and overpriced for what it is. I could easily buy some noodles and a jar of sauce and make at home. They do give big portions on the pasta, but it really is nothing special and cost extra to have any protein in it. Overall - get the pizza or sandwich if you come here.

1.description: I love this place! It's small and cozy, warm. I can always get a table and the food is AMAZING, EVERY time we've gone. I would recommend trying any of the daily specials, also the Insalata di Sesamo Pollo, also their Bruschetta is divine!!! It's Andersonville's best kept secret. A true gem!

55.description: Sadly the food is mediocre, which is not what I was expecting when I went there.. I ordered a personal pan pizza ($7), with only one ingredient sausage, which were so puny, you could barely taste it in the pizza.  I guess I was expecting better pizza, this being Chicago known for some of the best in the country.  Someone mentioned the sauce in another review?  With all due respect, it wasn't all that great, just average.  Maybe if you're from out-of-state you might think it's good, but not if your from Chicago, which I am!Seriously though, while perusing the menu I entertained thoughts of leaving, but chickened out because I was seated next to the cash register where the manager (or owner) and a few employees were milling around.  It would of looked too obvious.  Plus I was starved.  But in hindsight, I wished I had. What I don't like about this place is it's extremely uncomfortable.  It has a strange vibe to it.  It's very narrow and the tables are extremely close to one another, so much so, that I had to get up and move because the person behind me required more room to squeeze in.  I think there's only about 7 or 8 tables in the entire restaurant, the rest being outside.  Honestly, this place is not big enough for a restaurant.Next time I'll go to either Calo or Big Jones instead, for a memorable meal instead of a forgettable meal. Since this review was mostly negative, I should point out, the one highlight of JBB was my server, Craig, who couldn't have been nicer.  We actually had a pleasant conversation and I appreciated the all out effort he made.Finally, I'd like to make a prediction... this place is going to close!

9.description: I really like this place! I love their pizza and sandwiches . The pasta looks really really good but haven't ever ordered it. I have eaten onsite, carried out, and had it delivered. All really good experiences. It's a nice quirky small place with good Italian food, so the name makes sense.

26.description: Love this place. I come for lunch and always get whatever special they have; never been disappointed. Amazing staff and great music just add to the overall phenomenal experiences I've have each time.

25.description: I LOVE THIS PIZZA!!! The price is a little high for what is but I am willing to pay. The place is pretty small but they have outdoor seating in the summer and its a very cute atmosphere.

12.description: The food is great here. The staff gets to know you very quickly and are always friendly. Even the cooks are pleasant to deal with. The menu selection is incredibly extensive for such a small place. Food is ready quickly and can be taken to go in a snap. I've tried most of their sandwiches and pizzas as well as their luncheon specials. All are worth trying. Eat here!

59.description: This place is just outstanding.  I've been twice and have left a very happy guy both times.  The employees are very friendly and knowledgeable.  The food.... ohhhhh the food.  JBB takes it to the next level.  It is simply outstanding.  The Aranzini is a rice ball with peas, lightly breaded, and in a red sauce that I would put up against any in the city.  The mini-sausage sandwich was perfectly spiced and proportioned.  Those two dishes together were only $11 ($5 and $6 respectively), and was the best combination of food I have had in recent memory.  On another visit, the pizza rustico just blew my mind.  I also thinks it gives LM's a run for it's money, and speaking of money, JBB is much more affordable.  ($12 for a 12" thin crust in my case) The atmosphere seems a bit off, at first, especially in proportion to the outstanding quality of food, but I warmed up to it very quickly and soon 'got it.'  You'll be missing great pleasure if you do not try this place, but you'll be leaving an open seat for me.

21.description: What a great neighborhood spot! I got a sandwich to go today and it was delicious. The coleslaw had so much flavor, will come back soon!

17.description: Second time here and I have to say 10/10. Clean place, fast service and darn right perfect for a quick sandwich - I ordered the meatball sub on ciabatta. Meatballs are home made - yum!  Look at my pic for reference to the meatball sub.

10.description: Garlic breadsticks AMAZING!!!! Delivery was fast and the food was hot. Chicken fettuccine Alfredo was okay, but the paninis are extremely tasty. I will definitely be reordering! 5 STARS!

5.description: In general, I love the food at Johnny Brown Bag, but it seems that I have a very different experience when I dine in or carry out Vs when I get delivery:Dining In  / Carry Out - The food is fresh, tastes great and the staff is very friendly.   So far, I have had the salads, pasta, pizza and sandwiches.  Some of my favorite items are the: Chicken salad (with avocado), pasta with arrabbiata sauce, and any pizza with the roasted vegetables as a topping.Delivery - Very different experience. I've ordered delivery twice and have been disappointed with the food and service both times.  The first time it took over 2 hours for my food to arrive without much acknowledgement from the staff when I called to inquire about the status of my delivery.  The second time I ordered delivery, I ordered 2 pizzas. One arrived intact and the other looked like someone dropped it / flipped it over and then still delivered it.  Sure, Johnny Brown Bag replaced the destroyed pizza, but it still took 2 hours to get my food again. They did not discount the price or even apologize. In fact, the woman on the phone said "you would like a new pizza because your pizza is a little messed up, correct?"  I will post the picture of my pizza. you decide...In summary, Johnny Brown Bag has great food, just don't get delivery.

3.description: This place is great!  Great service and quick from order to eat. Been here several times and ordered something different each time. Pizza, sandwich, pastas and salad, all amazingly good. Price isn't too bad, especially for the area. It just might be my new go to.

35.description: Great food!  Their arancini are incredible.  It's worth getting an appetizer b/c the dinner sizes aren't out of control and super sized.  I had one of their sauceless pizza's, and it was not that great. To be positive, I could tell the ingredients used were top notch. So it's not a quality issue. I think I just wasn't feeling the cheese combo.

19.description: This was by far the worst dining experience I've had in years. When the beet salad came with beets that tasted blah and a nasty vinegary dressing that clashed with the beets and almonds, we forced it down without saying anything.Then we ordered the Rustica pizza which had three ingredients: goat cheese, figs and caramelized onions. It would have been delicious if the cook would have included the caramelized onion. After each taking a couple of bites, we tried to get our waitress's attention. Her mission seemed to be avoiding eye contact.When we finally got her attention, she acted like it wasn't a big deal. I asked her to have the pizza re-made to include all ingredients. She refused and said we could have them on the side, a discount on the pizza or a dessert. We decided on a discount. What we got was a minor 25% off the pizza. I was irritated because we were actually missing 1/3rd of the ingredients. We didn't even eat half the pizza. $30 later. I feel majorly ripped off and angry. My partner and I were grumpy after the experience. I'm still hungry. And the worst part ... No one at Johnny Brown Bag cares. Not even a little.

28.description: I grew up in a very Italian-American household and food was at the center of our family life. The best compliment I can pay is that the food at Johnny Brown Bag is just like grandma used to make. So far I've worked my way through most of the menu and have yet to be even remotely disappointed.  In fact, I'm a huge fan.  Equally as impressive as the food is the staff at Johnny Brown Bag.  I'm here often enough that I'm on a first name basis with folks like Stephanie, Ethan and Freddy, who always greet me with a smile and make me feel at home. The owner, Giovanni, clearly has trained his chefs well and taught them his family recipes and I highly recommend this place for simple, delicious food.

45.description: Each time I come, I order the personal pan pizza with pepperoni, mushrooms and sausage- absolutely amazing. Seriously, when I'm craving pizza in Chicago... this is the first place that pops into my head! Service is very friendly as well!

33.description: We passed by this place a few weeks ago and saw people on the sidewalk patio eating what looked like delicious food. So today we stopped in for lunch. We both ordered pastas...marinara over rigatoni ($9) with sausage ($3) and garlic oil broccoli over rigatoni ($9). Both were good but at $3 for sausage expected more that 3 or 4 slices than was served. Also there was a ton of leftover oil at the bottom of my bowl. I expected better as our total tab was over $27 for two. That includes two soft drinks. But this place, an Italian eatery, apparently doesn't serve a bread basket. So I am giving 2 stars because the value sucks. Also service was a downer. The two ladies working seemed to care more about the tv, their iPhones and gossip more than the customers. Perhaps your mileage may vary.

43.description: We love this place. Food is very tasty and served fairly quickly. Love to go here while out and about in Andersonville on the weekends. Great for lunch, casual dinner or just some cannoli or tiramisu. Very reasonably priced.

2.description: This is the best secret in Chicago..... Food is outstanding... Five Star ...and Juka is a fabulous server!

18.description: Good cheese steak sandwich. Simple menu but has daily specials. Small dining area but this strikes me as more of a takeout place. Fresh ingredients and reasonable prices make this a great lunch stop.

41.description: JBB is a great addition to Andersonville. I don't think there is another restaurant in the hood that does what Johnny does. This ain't no fancy sit down I-talian restaurant and it certainly isn't a sub-par pizza joint that also serves mediocre, oily, "pasta" a la Ranalli's, Giordanos etc. It is clear all their ingredients are very fresh and who ever is in charge of the menu or ordering the ingredients truly cares about quality. The big win for me at JBB is their pizza. Thin, chewy crust. Not too thick, certainly not thin cracker crust (I couldn't be more sick of this). They do not as a rule cut their pizza in squares. THANK YOU. I think they have a thicker crust, or a pan pizza but I have not tried it. Their thin pizzas are excellent however and they have a nice selection of specialty pizzas if you want someone to do the topping planning for you.
