Their pizza is one of the best in Andersonville for sure. My man and I have also had sandwiches here a few times which have all been delicious. A great lunch to split or a quick, inexpensive dinner. I've had their Panino di Pollo ePeperonata which is a grilled chicken and roasted pepper on focaccia with fresh mozz. Extremely delicious. I can't remember what my boyfriend had but he has stopped here for their sandwiches several times now and is always happy. Their fries are also very good. While this is a small joint and is geared toward grab and go (which they do really well and not at all in a fast food kind of way) they do have many tables and a nice warm atmosphere. It's great for casual dining but with good food that isn't just frozen food heated up in grease. Some actual skill is required to make their dishes successfully and that is a good thing.

52.description: Went again last night and feel the need to upgrade my rating to 5 stars.  They do have giardinara and I had the pizza last night.  OMG crispy crispy crispy crust - perfecto!  I'm a little scared though that the food is too good and soon we will have trouble getting in.  So please don't everyone go there ... Especially on Friday nights...

50.description: The staff was very friendly and the service was terrific but the food was rather disappointing.  I got my chicken sandwich to go and it didn't hold up well in the container... the bread was a soggy mess, the chicken rather tasteless and the fries weren't crisp.  I'll try again but I was not impressed the first go around.

4.description: Found this place off Yelp and decided to check it out with a few friends. The inside is pretty small but they managed to seat all 8 out of us together. The waitress was very deadpan in a kind of Aubrey Plaza way which made the whole experience very interesting. The food was really good (we got a mix of almost everything--sandwiches, salads, and pasta) but it seemed a bit overpriced for how much food we actually got.  It did come really quickly once we ordered which was nice. Other than the price, it seemed like a nice spot with funny staff and I'll definitely be back sometime.

6.description: I AM OBSESSED! I NEVER craved pizza until I met Johnny Brown Bag pizza! Crust is not too thin and not too thick (more towards thin side though) and magically manages to be both crispy and chewy. Toppings are fresh, gourmet and generous. My favorite combo is the 4 Cheese pizza with mushrooms and TONS of caramelized onions. Their caramelized onions are done the RIGHT way with brown sugar and butter. Also, French fries are super delicious here. They are super crispy and have the absolute best seasoning. Had a panini here as well and loved it, but have not ordered it since because the pizza outshines. OH! ALSO, coleslaw is homemade and so so yummy!!!

22.description: I've ordered from here for over a year. The food was better before. Recently we ordered the Italian Beef, Lasagna, Steak sandwich & Stuffed peppers. Everything is over salted. We couldn't even eat the lasagna and we usually put extra salt on our food. I mentioned it to them and it still is too salty.

15.description: Watching the cook snack while he prepares food, also did not wash hands one time after handling raw meat.  Pathetic honestly. I don't even need to review the food at this point do I?

57.description: We went on a Saturday for early lunch. We both had the philly sandwiches with fries. They were the best philly sandwiches we have ever had. The fries were awesome. We sat outside and the service was good, although it wasn't busy.

20.description: This place is my go to inexpensive sandwich place in the Andersonville neighborhood.  Staff is very friendly and the service is good.  I think this place is a hidden gem if you are looking for a good sandwich under ten dollars. My favorites are the Pork Milanese, and the Panino di Pollo e Peperonata. Much better food than big restaurant across the street. Great pizza too!

36.description: Best pesto in the city. All the way.

14.description: Don't judge a book by its cover is definitely something to remember when thinking about Johnny Brown Bag.  Service is just the way you want it and the food is always exceeding expectations.  The best time to visit is the summer when the accordion doors are open to the street to make the small dining space feel more spacious.  If you can't dine in- delivery is never a miss for their delicious pizzas.  This is a Via Carducci restaurant and that makes since once you have your first bite.

12.description: WOW! This shop is filled with beautiful, unique clothes and accessories! The hand-craftsmanship is apparent in how the clothes fit with many items looking great on everyone. The owner is very friendly and her customer service is superb. She knows her vendors well and she'll order things for you, even custom! Fabulous! I was visiting from another state for Memorial weekend and I wish we had a Milk Handmade!

3.description: Small business Saturday rocks!  Even though I was out shopping just last weekend in the Lincoln Square 'hood, I stopped in at Milk after having a drink at Hopleaf.I purchased a t-shirt with a big, red heart on it stating "Midwest is Best."  Although Macklemore would not approve of my overpriced ($30) t-shirt, it is super soft and I love it!  The girl working here was genuinely friendly and super helpful.  The t-shirt came in two styles.  In the first style, the XL wouldn't have fit me at all.  In the second style, much more loose-fitting and longer, I was SHOCKED when the girl offered the Medium to me to try on.  And it fit!I also tried on a cardigan, but at $128, I couldn't see myself wearing it frequently enough to justify the price tag.  However, it was a really well made item, so I still think the stuff is fairly priced.Milk Handmade is a small shop, so while it isn't a destination, it's definitely worth a look if you are in the area.

1.description: I heard they are in the final 5 for a contest that would give them a storefront downtown for the holiday season.  If they're good enough for downtown, they're good enough for me!  I decided to check them out and am glad I did!  It's a cute shop with a range of items from soaps to dresses with make-up bags in the middle.  I picked up an infinity scarf and felt pretty good about shopping local.  It's the kind of store that is for splurge purchases (for me), but I'll definitely stop by again.  Also, they have a wonderful pooch in there!

2.description: I loved this shop! It had all sorts of cool jewelry, accessories and clothing. My husband and I were exploring Andersonville and made sure to check this store out because of all the great Yelp reviews. I'm so glad I did. My husband bought me the coolest leather cuff for my birthday here. I absolutely love it. I loved the fragrant candles, the unique t-shirts and scarves, the cool clutches and pouches, and the one-of-a-kind jewelry. There's something for everyone here. I think this is one of the best shops in Andersonville. I'll definitely stop in again the next time I'm back in town.

9.description: I stumbled in here only to get away from the cold and then spent a week's salary. The clothing is original, well made and well priced! It doesn't hurt that the owner is super nice and patient. I will be back as soon as I am back in town!

10.description: Such a wonderful shop!  Hallie's got the eye; wide range of clothes and accessories, fresh new designs, and a great place to find that special something to spice up your wardrobe.  She's got everything from structured, modern dresses to t-shirts that feel 'oh so right,' and at great prices!  Hallie is usually sporting some of the digs which is nice to see bc she's got great style, and she's super helpful and sweet.  The store setup is comfortable and spacious, I had a very relaxing time shopping there.Definitely worth the trip to Andersonville if you're not already up that way!

13.description: My wife comes in here often to shop for cute items and accessories. It's really amazing in that you can find clothing unlike anything in the higher end boutiques or stores. Very comfortable and relaxed atmosphere. The only downside is that there's limited inventory, making it sometimes difficult to find clothing in the right size. That being said, the upside of buying local, handmade clothing makes it well worth it.

16.description: This is the store you've always wished existed and now it does. I came shopping here with my mom and we both walked away with several bags of unbelievable clothes and accessories. Milk had clothes that were beautiful, unique, well-made and age appropriate for both of us who have very different styles. There is a wide range of prices depending on what you're looking for, but I felt like I was having reverse sticker shock considering how reasonable the prices are for these beautifully crafted handmade clothes. These are the kinds of clothes that you can't wait to get out of bed in the morning to put on. Hallie, the owner, is very sweet and has such a good eye for fashion. She's also honest so you feel like you're shopping with your best friend who won't let you spend money on something that isn't perfect for you, and will lend a hand zipping you up. We also picked up several gifts for people here because they have amazing, reasonably priced accessories that look way more expensive than they are. The only thing that makes me unhappy is that I can't wear everything I got at once. I don't know how to choose.

6.description: Um, hello, new obsession. Nice to meet you!I'm beyond excited about Milk opening up across the street from my building. It's stocked with beautiful, handmade clothing (including from the etsysphere hit lamixx) and accessories that include fun jewelry and gorgeous clutches. I didn't happen to find anything today that was in my budget, but that's no surprise because it's the end of the month *and* I'm a student. In fact, this store does have a very affordable price point and my suspicion is that the inventory will rotate quickly. Major bonus: the owner's business partner, a very big, very sweet greyhound who was snoozing on a big pillow beside her.Love.

15.description: I really love this store.  I have been in 4 times in the last year and I have purchased something each and every time I have visited.  Today I bought easy to wear hemp pants for vacation and spring weather.  Their merchandise is unique, appropriately priced, and I find the sales people really helpful, attentive, and knowledgable without being pushy.  All ladies should shop here!

0.description: Beautiful clothing and jewelry. Great dog and friendly owner. My friend and I felt so zen here. Picked up a t-shirt for my sister and fun little ring for me.

5.description: I've come with my girlfriend a few times and she always finds something we both like. I love the things she buys there. And I always find some great soap there for myself!

11.description: Great local store with a good clothing selection.  Bought a skirt there and wore it on a work trip and received many compliments.  Looking forward to going back soon!  I love shopping and when I can support a small business owner and buy something I won't see everyone else wearing that is a great combination.

8.description: I love this new store in Andersonville. There are so many unique items and the owner is really knowledgeable about every piece. I like that everything is hand made and not the same old stuff you'll see everywhere else. It's pretty expensive, but if you found a really unique piece you loved it's worth it. I normally wouldn't spend almost $50 on a t-shirt...There aren't a ton of sizes of each item since it's a boutique, but the owner tries to be as accommodating as possible.I'll definitely be back to check out the jewelery and fall clothes!

4.description: When Shelly next door at Urban Mischief gave me a heads up on an amazing new clothing store opening next door, my ears perked up.  Everything handmade, cute, yet affordable?  Could it be true?  Umm, yes!I loved how there was a wide range of comfy tees - all adorable (think big heart with Midwest is Best on it), dressier business clothes, and adorable night out dresses.  Everything, and I mean everything, was so soft.  At one point I worried that I would be kicked out and forever known as The Toucher (I was gonna say rubber, but didn't want to dig myself that hole).  They also had an amazing collection of clutches, and the only reason I mention that is because I am so not a clutch person, but right now I'm plotting my next visit so I can pick one up.  They also had a selection of yummy whipped body creams from Bunny Butt.  Get one for the cute name, but keep it because really, who doesn't want to smell like birthday cake.Finally, as cool as the offerings are, Hallie, the owner, made this place stand out.  She answered all my questions, had no problem with me trying the same things on a million times as I decided between sizes, and gift boxed my purchases for me.  Milk, welcome to the neighborhood.

14.description: FINALLY!!!  A women's boutique in Andersonville that is for ladies under 90 (sorry Turley Road).  I love the vibe, the funky and unique clothes, the very cool owner and the affordable-for-a-boutique prices.   This is a very much needed and excellent addition to the neighborhood.  Now we just need one more shoe store and I will officially never need to leave Andersonville.

7.description: We came here randomly after our crazy experience in Wooly Mammoth - This was so much better for me. This store is great. It's a cute boutique, less than a year old, with a very sweet owner. Most of the pieces are local-made which is great to see the support for local artists.I bought a shirt that had a cool design on it that was local made and I was pretty glad I picked it up since I love to show my IL pride.I'd happily come back frequently if I lived in town!

28.description: I look forward to going to Chicago because it means a stop at Akira. I like this location because it's a little smaller and not as cramped or overwhelming as the bigger stores. They had some of the nicest friendliest employees I've ever encountered. And by nice, I don't mean pushing for sales either! They were so genuine. I had picked out a few dresses to try on and a guy offered to start a fitting room for me. I said sure, and when I was ready to go in, he said "Oh I also put these things in there because I thought they would match or you would like them." And he was spot on! He knew what I liked/needed just based on what I grabbed. I ended up leaving with a couple of the things he had chosen.

1.description: I had the absolute best experience shopping with Shani and Flo. They kept the store open late for me and helped me find some great outfits that were true to me. I sometimes find the staff at Akira a bit pretentious and pushy but these 2 were a breath of fresh air. Great attitudes, so helpful and didn't force me into a style! I'll be back just for them!

9.description: What a great experience. I usually shrink from the salespeople at stores, because I generally head for the clearance/sale rack to find a deal. Hannah was great! Not only did she help me find things in my size, she was very personable and steered me toward some OTHER sale items that were in the back. I paid 80$ for about 210$ worth of clothes and was thrilled to the gills. I will go back often and definitely recommend them to anyone who comes my way. Good on ya, Akira!

29.description: not so great. akira has gone down hill considerably, clearly they got greedy and realized they could sell cheaply made clothes for a lot more than what they were charging. i am more than willing to pay a premium for well-made clothes or at least decently made clothes. dresses used to be around $20 and double that for akira black label. now, the only thing that is around $20 is a tank top or a bandeau top. dresses were on average at $54 -79. akira's clothes are worse than forever 21. used to be a huge supporter and advocate of the chain. the salespeople have become so pushy and rude, not a good experience anymore.

23.description: Ok, so first off, I have to say, that like pretty much any girl, I LOVE to shop!!! I have been to other Akira stores numerous times, but after visiting this Akira twice last week I felt compelled to write a review for them.  I can honestly say, hands down, one of the BEST customer service experiences I have EVER had while shopping (which is saying a lot since most sales persons I normally deal with are total b*tches).  Every single person that helped me (on both visits) was extremely friendly, personable, and helpful.  They have an huge selection of dresses, and last week they were having an awesome deal on jeans (buy 1, get one for $40- which is like ah-maz-ing when you're talking higher-end jeans that run $150-200).  Being that this Akira is walking distance from my condo, I will never go to a different Akira from here on (sorry other Akira locations).

5.description: You stumble into Akira to find a world of color and cut.I'm fond of backless dresses and Akira had a trunk load ofunique backless and back cut dresses. Including dresses withside cuts!What's wonderful is that they care how items look on you. So don't hesitate to ask how you look in a certain item. I ended up with a very fun skirt that the salesperson help medecide on after trying on various items. =)Vintage, rouge, chic, classy -- it's all here with a distinct sense of unique style!It's definitely a young adult's store and fairly priced (dresses cost less than $50)!

31.description: I visited this location last Thursday, intending to just find a summer dress or two. What I left with was far more, but I'm not complaining.Valerie, dear, you were so helpful and accommodating. If you make it into this store, ask if she's working. I had picked out about half the store to try on, and one thing I loved about this store is they let me take EVERYTHING into the dressing room at the same time to try on. I dislike when stores only let you take in 5 or 6 things at a time when you've chosen 20 to try on. Ok, back to Val. I had mainly picked out dresses to try on, and I was striking out on my choices. Val brought me a few more selections to try on, and I ended up taking all but two of the things she chose for me. A belt loop on one of the dresses I bought was ripped, and she sewed it back on while I waited. And, she brought me this beautiful white linen boyfriend blazer to try on. It will definitely be my go-to this summer. This location is much easier to navigate than the one in Wicker Park (the only other one I've been to). Some of the items are a bit pricey, but I got a great silk dress for a very reasonable price, and their jeans are only $40. I wish they weren't boot cut, though. And they're sized in odd numbers, like junior sizes rather than women's (5, 7, 9 etc). So, if you're a 6, get the 5. PLUS, if you try on the jeans and model them, you get to reach into a fishbowl and choose a piece of paper that has a random discount on it. Score! (I don't know if this is a permanent promotion.)I am so glad that there is a store close to me now. And Val, don't you go anywhere! You may end up being my personal shopper.

25.description: In general, Akira has a ton of really beautiful occasion dresses at a decent price.  Though, I've tried to shop for other pieces for my wardrobe at this location (with an exchange credit because they don't do refunds) and I've had terrible luck.  The salespeople are totally friendly and well-meaning but they seemed to pick odd shapes for my body.

12.description: best Akira thus far! I go to all of them, but this Akira has the best service, and they always have deals going on. Super friendly employees. Wish I can remember the girl who always helps me out, she has a septum piercing, she is very helpful! look for her when shopping there.

21.description: You stumble into Akira to find a world of color and cut.I'm fond of backless dresses and Akira had a trunk load ofunique backless and back cut dresses. Including dresses withside cuts!What's wonderful is that they care how items look on you. So don't hesitate to ask how you look in a certain item. I ended up with a very fun skirt that the salesperson help medecide on after trying on various items. =)Vintage, rouge, chic, classy -- it's all here with a distinct sense of unique style!It's definitely a young adult's store and fairly priced (dresses cost less than $50)!

16.description: Inspect your clothes twice - maybe three times - before you leave the store with them.In mid January I went into Akira and asked to see the pair of jeans on one of the manneqins in the window.  The salesman tried to steer me towards a pair of $180 jeans.  When I told him that was out of my price range, he immediately said, "I can get you 20% off."  I said, "I'd rather see the ones in the window."  They were $99.I tried them on and they were exactly what I wanted.  Two weeks later I washed them after wearing them twice.  When I put them on again I noticed a hole in the stitching of the outside right leg.  Then I noticed a number of loose threads on the waist and belt loops.  I took them back, 3 weeks after purchase, and was told they had no more in my size, and neither did their other location.  They told me they could send them to their tailor and that it would cost me $5.  I thought it was pretty lame...remember the 20% off I was offered off $180?  That would have been $36...and yet they wouldn't pay a $5 tailor's bill for pants that weren't even a month old?  Their policy is "no refunds," but in this case, with $100 jeans falling apart after one wash and no stock for an exchange, they should have just refunded my card and send the jeans back to the company.  But no.I told them to go ahead and do it, because I really wanted the jeans.  Someone called me the next day and said they were ready for me to pick up.  I went and got them...it's my own fault I didn't check them at the store and just assumed they were fixed.  When I got home the hole was still there.  So I went back a THIRD TIME, and asked if they could order me another pair.  The manager took my info and said he'd get back to me.  Five days later, I still haven't heard anything.  I called in to see what was going on, and the manager who helped me isn't working today, and no one else knew what was going on.THOROUGHLY unimpressed, and I won't be back...if only they knew how much money I spend on clothes!

17.description: BUYERS BEWARE.  Chicagoans, heed my advice:  when you make a purchase from Akira, do yourself a favor -- the salesgirls are morons so check your receipt for return policies and check your bag to make sure your paid merchandise is actually IN there.I visited the pop up store on Granville (that I believe is managed by the Andersonville location) and bought a shirt and jewelry.  First, the jewelry didn't make it into the bag when I left the store and I needed to be chased down.  Well, that should have been my first clue that this purchase was a BAD idea.  Got home and the necklace I bought has a broken clasp that scratched the back of my neck and caused it to bleed.  FUN!  So, I checked my receipt, didn't see any kind of noted return policy and went to the Andersonville store to return.  No where on the receipt did it say Final Sale or no return policy.Got to the store, and it was "oh yeah, um... these are actually final sale."  I pointed out that no where on the receipt was this written nor was I told this at the time of purchase (cause hey, if I'm in the wrong, then it's my fault, live and learn).  I got an "I'm sorry, all jewelry is final sale."  Was there a sign up about that?  No.  I was told that they don't take jewelry back for "sanitary reasons".  Again I say "WHAT???" I've never had a store EVER offer that as a reason for no returns.  Then I was then told I was given a "really good price"... So because it was buy one get one 1/2 off that means I should be GRATEFUL you sold me crappy jewelry? I was so flabbergasted and ready to explode on these sales girls that I left.Oh, and by the way, they didn't take the alarm alert off so I set that off with my broken jewelry as I left.  Thanks for that.And I even tried the phone # on the receipt, which is for the web store and when I called there, I got more of the "oh, um... well... that's not me..."Who the f*** runs this company???  I guess if you're going to be a poor excuse for a business the best way to do it is make sure any customer service you have is hidden away so no one can complain and customers continue to get screwed.If Akira had just said they have a no return policy but would honor a return since there was NO documentation provided to me and refunded my $30 thus providing good customer service, I'd be glad to shop there again.  Now?  No way.  In this economic climate, and at a time when social networking and word of mouth are bigger than ever, you would think they would go out of their way to keep customers happy... especially when they don't have policies clearly stated.  Thanks for making up the rules as you go and for priding yourselves on customer dis-service.Save your time and money.

10.description: I look forward to going to Chicago because it means a stop at Akira. I like this location because it's a little smaller and not as cramped or overwhelming as the bigger stores. They had some of the nicest friendliest employees I've ever encountered. And by nice, I don't mean pushing for sales either! They were so genuine. I had picked out a few dresses to try on and a guy offered to start a fitting room for me. I said sure, and when I was ready to go in, he said "Oh I also put these things in there because I thought they would match or you would like them." And he was spot on! He knew what I liked/needed just based on what I grabbed. I ended up leaving with a couple of the things he had chosen.

11.description: Brand spankin new to Andersonville!!Although A-ville needs more variety in the clothing store experience, I fear the fallout of it becoming a major trendy spot to "consume". That being said I really dig Akira. The staff is beyond nice, being new to the area they are eager to learn about its locals. The clothing though a little expensive (mostly on the men's) is very new and trendy. I picked up a great spring jacket.My only issue is that the men's selection is not as vast as the women's (as usual). Women always seem to get the bigger selection and better pricing. Guys like options and don't want to pay out the bum too! My date picked up 2 awesome dresses for less then half of what I paid for my one jacket.I think they will do very well and I can't wait for the grand opening party!

26.description: Welcome to the hood!!  This shop has the best sales associates I've ever had. Felt like a private shopping event. Thanks Fontane for incredible service and even better style choice. We will be back.

27.description: I was going to write a review for this location when it first opened but I typically don't like to write bad reviews. (I had a better experience since so I decided to share.)  When I first heard that there was an Akira opening in the neighborhood I was stoked.  (We don't have too many clothing stores in A-ville.)  I walked in with headphones on and exchanged a quick smile with a girl hanging dresses by the front door.  Before I knew it, she was right next to me asking me if I needed any help.  I said no thank you and put my headphones back in and walked away.  A few minutes later she was back and motioned for me to take out my headphones... then proceeded to ask what my name was, where I worked, lived, ate, worked out...! I was pretty annoyed and even though I gave short answers and attempted to put my headphones in several times, she didn't seem to get the point.  I understand trying to be helpful and getting to know your clients but holy cow!  There was another time I walked in while having a conversation on my phone. I was of course interrupted and again played 20 questions with one of the workers.  I grabbed a few dresses and went to try them on.  Moments later another associate was by the fitting area with several dresses that he thought I should totally try on! Grrrr... OK. So, after a couple bad experiences why did I go back??  I needed to get a dress for a last minute event and didn't have time to drive anywhere.  I went in and decided to take advantage of the oh-so-helpful sales associates.  I was in the store for about 20 mins during which I spent the entire time in the fitting room while 3 of the workers brought over what seemed like every dress in the store for me to try on.   I did find a dress and was very grateful for all the running around they did. (I wonder who got the commission on that one?)

35.description: Brand spankin new to Andersonville!!Although A-ville needs more variety in the clothing store experience, I fear the fallout of it becoming a major trendy spot to "consume". That being said I really dig Akira. The staff is beyond nice, being new to the area they are eager to learn about its locals. The clothing though a little expensive (mostly on the men's) is very new and trendy. I picked up a great spring jacket.My only issue is that the men's selection is not as vast as the women's (as usual). Women always seem to get the bigger selection and better pricing. Guys like options and don't want to pay out the bum too! My date picked up 2 awesome dresses for less then half of what I paid for my one jacket.I think they will do very well and I can't wait for the grand opening party!

0.description: I cannot rave enough about this place. I am usually a tad uncomfortable going into a place like this because I'm not a size 2 and finding stuff that works on my curvy figure is frustrating at times. WELL, I was completely blown away. As I entered, Eleanor greeted me and immediately asked a couple of questions to understand my style. After seeing a couple of pieces I liked, she went to work grabbing stuff for me to try. The first couple pieces I tried were not working and I was going to just give up, but every time I would think about putting my clothes on and leaving, a new piece would appear for me to try. Somewhere along the way, Ruth appeared, and suffice it to say that she completely rocked my world. She pulled things for me that I would never pick for myself, yet looked awesome once I put them on. I ended up in Akira for at least 2 hours and was helped the entire time despite them being busy. I walked out with 3 solid outfits that included shoes and accessories which, because of the versatility of the individual pieces will actually make up to 8 different looks for $315. That is incredible considering I can barely get 1 outfit at Bebe for that price. The real selling point here though is how accommodating and just plain cool the associates were. Also, the music was fun and loud which I love when shopping. Kudos to Akira Andersonville. I will definitely be back!

20.description: I was originally going to give it 3 stars, because Akira is A-OK in my book. However...they have Tom's shoes, so they got bumped up to four. I love Tom's shoes. They're super comfy, they don't have laces and I feel so hip when I wear them. Then there's that part about them giving a pair of shoes to a child in need for every pair they sell...no big deal. In case you didn't see, my sarcasm font was ON. That's a big deal and I'm glad they do that. The service at Akira was quick to get me tryin' on some super sassy Toms and decided on the purple herringbone variety with the pink sole. With tax it was a little over $60, which is to be expected in Chicago. I like to buy stuff off websites to save money, but when it comes to shoes I usually like to try them ON before I buy because my feet are strange and gigantic. So, if I need any more Tom's I will be back to Akira, for sure. The rest of their clothes are kind of hit or miss for me, but that's more of a personal style thing than anything else.

19.description: I love Akira. This place in Andersonville have a good selection of clothes and the staff are really friendly and helpful,as well.

33.description: Though the salespeople are a little overly fawny, they are still very helpful. I was able to make over my wardrobe with about 6 new pieces for a very reasonable price.  The clothes at Akira are trendy while still being wearable by the average (or - in my case - over average, size 16) person). Also, be sure to try on their skinny jeans - surprisingly comfy and flattering on people of all shapes and sizes, and quite affordable at $30 a pair!

2.description: Style wasn't exactly for my taste, it was almost as if there was no middle ground for clothes, a lot of it was really plain and muted or waayyy over the top with deep cut back, sides AND front on the same dress.. but still found some lovely pieces on the sales rack, which was really big but also sizes were all mixed up and I couldn't find anything great in my size cause I didn't feel like going through the whole wall of clothes. Didn't buy anything but might come back with better time..

34.description: It's not like I haven't been to Akiras around the city, but this one has a particularly bad vibe. My disdain for the overpriced, gauzy (and -- I'll admit it -- sometimes super-rockin') clothing was amplified when I saw a mom dressing her 13-year-old in a slutty dress "because you said you wanted a red dress!" A handful of salespeople on the floor and two were fawning over her. No one was fawning over me. It's because I look like Andersonville -- and not like the kind of person who falls for whatever Akira is selling. I'm definitely not happy this place has come in -- and just a few doors down from Presence, which has been a staple for 34 years.

32.description: Unlike the other Akira stores, this location is manageable. I don't feel dizzy when I'm shopping there, and there aren't 500 people crammed into the store.  I really enjoy the Akira shopping experience, and find it hard to walk out empty-handed. Thank you for opening an Andersonville location and not stuffing it to the gills or making it feel like a rainbow exploded inside the store.

18.description: I nearly only shop here because of the customer service.  I am one that needs a person to pick stuff out for me and say go try it on.  If you are not one for that, then don't go.I enjoy supporting local businesses and great customer service will always get me back.  Also not everyone and their mother will be wearing the clothes that you have when you shop here.  They only make so many items.Im a fan.  Go if you want to be followed around a store and helped out immensely while shopping.

13.description: I was originally going to give it 3 stars, because Akira is A-OK in my book. However...they have Tom's shoes, so they got bumped up to four. I love Tom's shoes. They're super comfy, they don't have laces and I feel so hip when I wear them. Then there's that part about them giving a pair of shoes to a child in need for every pair they sell...no big deal. In case you didn't see, my sarcasm font was ON. That's a big deal and I'm glad they do that. The service at Akira was quick to get me tryin' on some super sassy Toms and decided on the purple herringbone variety with the pink sole. With tax it was a little over $60, which is to be expected in Chicago. I like to buy stuff off websites to save money, but when it comes to shoes I usually like to try them ON before I buy because my feet are strange and gigantic. So, if I need any more Tom's I will be back to Akira, for sure. The rest of their clothes are kind of hit or miss for me, but that's more of a personal style thing than anything else.

4.description: Worst Akira! I love Akira but after visiting this location and not being ask if I needed help as I walk around for 20+ minutes and not being acknowledged I decided not to shop at Akira any longer. The service at this location was just horrible. I clearly saw the gentleman offer help to another lady maybe it was the color of my skin? It's pretty sad. I walked out and decided NEVER to shop at another Akira store again. Oh well they lost a loyal customer.I usually visited the North ave location and never had a problem until recently at this location.

24.description: Inspect your clothes twice - maybe three times - before you leave the store with them.In mid January I went into Akira and asked to see the pair of jeans on one of the manneqins in the window.  The salesman tried to steer me towards a pair of $180 jeans.  When I told him that was out of my price range, he immediately said, "I can get you 20% off."  I said, "I'd rather see the ones in the window."  They were $99.I tried them on and they were exactly what I wanted.  Two weeks later I washed them after wearing them twice.  When I put them on again I noticed a hole in the stitching of the outside right leg.  Then I noticed a number of loose threads on the waist and belt loops.  I took them back, 3 weeks after purchase, and was told they had no more in my size, and neither did their other location.  They told me they could send them to their tailor and that it would cost me $5.  I thought it was pretty lame...remember the 20% off I was offered off $180?  That would have been $36...and yet they wouldn't pay a $5 tailor's bill for pants that weren't even a month old?  Their policy is "no refunds," but in this case, with $100 jeans falling apart after one wash and no stock for an exchange, they should have just refunded my card and send the jeans back to the company.  But no.I told them to go ahead and do it, because I really wanted the jeans.  Someone called me the next day and said they were ready for me to pick up.  I went and got them...it's my own fault I didn't check them at the store and just assumed they were fixed.  When I got home the hole was still there.  So I went back a THIRD TIME, and asked if they could order me another pair.  The manager took my info and said he'd get back to me.  Five days later, I still haven't heard anything.  I called in to see what was going on, and the manager who helped me isn't working today, and no one else knew what was going on.THOROUGHLY unimpressed, and I won't be back...if only they knew how much money I spend on clothes!

6.description: I tell you, this had to be my best shopping experience ever!! I was just shopping for dresses that day and was having no luck. Normally, I shop in the suburbs but when you shop in Chicago all the good stuff is gone or not my size. But, Akira surprisingly had a good stock of clothes and my sizes. So, Akira was my last stop. Immediately, one of the workers came up to me (I forgot her name) and started helping me pick out clothes. At first, I was nervous because I thought "I hope she's not a personal shopper and I'm going to get a huge bill at the end". LOL I didn't, but that's how good their customer service is that I felt like I had my own personal shopper.  I didn't really like her selections at first but when I tried  on everything, it looked amazing on me! Stuff I would have never chosen. The funny thing was everything I picked looked terrible on me. I guess my fashion sense is not as good as I thought it was. lol The con for Akira which is why I gave it 4 stars is that it is expensive. I normally don't spend that much on clothes but since I was having terrible luck finding clothes that day, I bought the $50 dress so it was a splurge for me. I wanted to buy 2 dresses but I did not want to spend 100 bucks on just 2 dresses!!!

22.description: This store had a smaller selection than the Akira I usually go to on Diversey but I like that it's more open and not as cramped as some of their other stores.  The sales woman was a little pushy (I didn't like that she put about 4 extra dresses that I had not picked up in my changing room..) but otherwise friendly and fairly helpful.  When I was checking out their computers were running painfully slow so they gave me and my sister $10 off cards for next time.  Overall, a good shopping experience!

15.description: I visited Chicago late last year & happened to wander in here with my brother. My brother is a very kind, smart, funny man...so why was he still single?! Maybe it's the baggy polo shirt - yuk! So we thought we would just see if they had anything nice there... and my brother ended up with a ton of nice shirts (perfect for going out & maybe even a casual work day) plus some pants & a hat! The sales staff were really great - they found the nicest things for him to try, & they told him what was good on him (or not). They have a decent price point and interesting styles, too. My brother is seeing someone now - did the clothes make a difference? :) The clothes for women cover a pretty wide range of tastes. They have a few wild things that I could not possibly wear without looking like a walking midlife crisis. That said though, I bought a cute lace top, chiffon-y pants, a black and gold tunic...nothing outrageous. Just some great separates!

7.description: I absolutely love Akira and specifically this location. I come here whenever I know I need (or sometimes want) something, but just not sure what. Everyone here is incredibly helpful and they always make me look wonderful!I usually don't write reviews, but this last particular visit yesterday was too fantastic not too. Dane helped me right when I walked in the door. I told him I was going on a date and wanted something cute, but casual and can wear all summer. Next thing you know I've got a dressing room full of great choices! Chris was also super helpful with one particular dress. Left with some fabulous options and great ideas on date locations! You guys are wonderful! I'll definitely be back again.

8.description: This is my favorite Akira, fo sho. I don't go for most of those club clothes, but I can appreciate them for what they are. They are ALWAYS on trend, especially at this store. I got this fabulous faux leather skirt with tooled detail at the hem, and I get so many compliments on it.Music is always great. The staff are a bunch of fashionable weirdos in the best of ways. They know their shizz. The managers are b****es, but they're really hot so it's ok in my book. PS - Their sales are ridiculous. 20 dollar beaded clutch? Shut yer mouth. Give me two!

30.description: BUYERS BEWARE.  Chicagoans, heed my advice:  when you make a purchase from Akira, do yourself a favor -- the salesgirls are morons so check your receipt for return policies and check your bag to make sure your paid merchandise is actually IN there.I visited the pop up store on Granville (that I believe is managed by the Andersonville location) and bought a shirt and jewelry.  First, the jewelry didn't make it into the bag when I left the store and I needed to be chased down.  Well, that should have been my first clue that this purchase was a BAD idea.  Got home and the necklace I bought has a broken clasp that scratched the back of my neck and caused it to bleed.  FUN!  So, I checked my receipt, didn't see any kind of noted return policy and went to the Andersonville store to return.  No where on the receipt did it say Final Sale or no return policy.Got to the store, and it was "oh yeah, um... these are actually final sale."  I pointed out that no where on the receipt was this written nor was I told this at the time of purchase (cause hey, if I'm in the wrong, then it's my fault, live and learn).  I got an "I'm sorry, all jewelry is final sale."  Was there a sign up about that?  No.  I was told that they don't take jewelry back for "sanitary reasons".  Again I say "WHAT???" I've never had a store EVER offer that as a reason for no returns.  Then I was then told I was given a "really good price"... So because it was buy one get one 1/2 off that means I should be GRATEFUL you sold me crappy jewelry? I was so flabbergasted and ready to explode on these sales girls that I left.Oh, and by the way, they didn't take the alarm alert off so I set that off with my broken jewelry as I left.  Thanks for that.And I even tried the phone # on the receipt, which is for the web store and when I called there, I got more of the "oh, um... well... that's not me..."Who the f*** runs this company???  I guess if you're going to be a poor excuse for a business the best way to do it is make sure any customer service you have is hidden away so no one can complain and customers continue to get screwed.If Akira had just said they have a no return policy but would honor a return since there was NO documentation provided to me and refunded my $30 thus providing good customer service, I'd be glad to shop there again.  Now?  No way.  In this economic climate, and at a time when social networking and word of mouth are bigger than ever, you would think they would go out of their way to keep customers happy... especially when they don't have policies clearly stated.  Thanks for making up the rules as you go and for priding yourselves on customer dis-service.Save your time and money.

3.description: So I love this store. I have been to a couple locations throughout the city and they are always super friendly and willing to help you out... besides this location. I have been here about 6 times now and I think I have been given attention to once. I hated giving the store 3 stars (when it should be 5) but their customer service in Andersonville sucks.

14.description: Today is a man named Dane help me out. He looked very put together with a little bit of an alternative edge, and was very confident that he can help me with sale that I needed. I came into akira for the first time in search of black clothing for an upcoming funeral and Dane went above and beyond what my expectations were. We had a friendly chat while he assisted me and finding articles of clothing for me to try on. I never really had someone talk to me through a curtain though while I was trying clothes on so that was a little different, but all in all it was a great experience. He was very assisting, very kind, and very easy on the eyes. (everything a sales person should be) he was a pleasure to talk to as well as a pretty brunette woman who started up conversation at the counter. I look forward to shopping more at akira, hopefully for other occasions though.

3.description: Yucky.

1.description: Well I never in 100 years knew that they existed until someone ordered at work so I had to try it myself . A very big $2.50 slice which was extremely good the crust was a little doughy but crunchy and very good

2.description: This is a good   pizza place.  I remember when I was on senn high school on  2006 and I was  broke  the only tink I can buy was a pizza from this place   ..   now is 12015  and I still buy pizza from this place  the pizza is good and cheap ..

9.description: I'm really surprised at some of the relatively unenthusiastic ratings for Pizza Mania. My family has ordered from Pizza Mania for years and it's one of our favorite places. The hand tossed style is some of the best I've had and the toppings are big and generous - last night we had a tomato and garlic pizza and the tomatoes were cut thick and tasted like fresh picked. The sauce is excellent, too, and in my opinion that can make or break a pizza. Not least of all, with their two for one routine you get two large two-topping pizzas and a free 2-liter soda for about 20 bucks!

10.description: Decent pizza for sure. You can usually walk in on a given evening and get a slice, but they don't have much in the way of a storefront. This is definitely a delivery-oriented establishment.

4.description: I don't understand the roller coaster of reviews, I can firmly say that Pizza Mania's pizza is shockingly good.That being said I've only stop by and pick up a slice of cheese on occasion. I'm extremely picky when it comes to my pizza. The sauce, the cheese, and the dough has to be just right. If one thing is off then why bother with it. Pizza Mania's has light sauce that's a little sweet (don't even really notice it), just the right amount of cheese, and the dough/ crust is awesome (doughy lovers dream). The best part is that a slice is only $2.00, yep only $2.00!! It's insane for how big of a slice you get too. Let's just say one slice even fills me up. One of these days I'll try to order a whole pizza and see how that goes but for now it's totally worth the stop in.

6.description: First time there. Definitely cheap eats. Good in a pinch. Pretty doughy crust but again for $2 a slice, not bad.

12.description: After hearing rave reviews from one of my brothers friends we picked up a few pizza's from Pizza Mania for a party we were having...think we would have been better off with just a few Tombstones from the grocery store.

5.description: After driving past this place for 30 years, I finally made it a point to try their pizza. To stay in biz for 30 years, they have to be doing something right.So I park the car around the corner (no parking on Ridge and don't try because cars are going by at 40 mph) and walk in. No seating at all so I order 3 slices sausage to go. No sausage was availble so I get 2 peperoni and 1 cheese. They were huge slices. Then I got their carry out menu where they offer 2 pizzas for the price of 1 ($14.95) and a bottle of soda ALL THE TIME.Pizza tasted good! Not the best or close to it but at these prices, my being a food snob comes down from my high horse pretty quick :)

13.description: Much better than I thought it would be considering the location,, Not the best bust good and great people.

11.description: This place sucks, but they sell pizza by the slice for very, very cheap.

8.description: Really guys?First off, someone wrote "much better than I thought...considering the location" (!!!) What? The neighborhood is actually really nice, except for Senn High School being there, but most of the crimes take place on school property, during school hours. I know, I lived around the corner from Pizza Mania for a year...Edgewater may not be the fabulous Lincoln Park (which has sparkling streets, and rapists in every alley), but it is pretty sweet having great neighbors and a huge apartment that youre not eating out of dumpsters to pay for.Second, uhhhh, did anyone take advantage of the buy one pizza, get one free deal they always offer?? I'd say thats an awesome deal. And if they have a crappy store front, who cares, its not like its a dine in 5 star restaurant. And third, I think their thin crust pizza is awesome. Considering the likes of Chicago Pizzas and other "gourmet" restaurants selling overpriced pizza on every corner, Pizza Mania is where tis at's.How can you review a place if you havent even eaten there? Dont judge a book by its cover, they say, but Im judging a reviewer by his review and R.K sucks.

0.description: Pizza mania.... Oh how I love thy pizza  I've been eating her since high school 6 plus years ago. The people that work there are nice and the pizza still the same good tasting as it was when I first tired it!! I love the 2 for one on the pizza with the free liter a must try when your in the neighborhood.

7.description: I remember ordering a slice from here.  I thought the delivery crew was entertaining.  the pizza was fairly quick and standard sausage.  The slice wasn't a gem with out any outstanding features.

28.description: Better than you would think for Domino's with their "revamped" options.  You can order online (I prefer this option over trying to make sure the person on the phone at a busy restaurant actually heard your order correctly!) easily with coupons available EVERY TIME and even an order "count down" to let you know EXACTLY where your pizza is at each step to plan for when it will arrive.  They have always come extremely quick and more timely than most of the other local pizza joints.  Definitely try the new robust tomato sauce and the new garlic parmesan crust.  My husband and I have tried the hand-tossed and thin options with positive results.  We enjoy the breadsticks with or without cheese.  Just make sure to get your dipping sauces!  The garlic is great for dipping the pieces of crust and the marinara is great for the cheesy breadsticks.  They have expanded their options to include sandwiches, pasta, wings, desserts, drinks, etc.  I would only recommend that they add a salad option.

1.description: Okay, so I'm going to get a little Nostalgic here, Domino's has beenaround for quite awhile and back in the 80's they decided theyneeded a Mascot so they developed this "Noid" to represent them.And, Boy, was this Noid irritating, he was this little guy who worea Superhero Cape, and he actually became pretty popular, theymade little toy figures of this guy and I'm pretty sure Nintendo developeda video game in his honor..I'm pretty sure of this because I had 2 young sons at the time and theypestered me until I went out and bought this Annoying little figure andthe Video Game.Boy, did my 2 sons have me whipped or what?But, after awhile, I guess other people found this little man annoying tooand he was no more.. Thank God!!Okay, now, I will fast forward to the other day when I stopped topick up a pizza from Domino's to take home..Now, the last pizza I had from Domino's was over a year ago, and Iremembered it being pretty good.So, I decided to order a Brooklyn Style Pizza again, and I was hopingthat it would be as good as I remembered it to be.Just a few things I noticed about Domino's..Menu prices have gone up significantly, and honestly if you are lookingto get a pizza on the cheap you may notice that Domino's menu pricesare pretty close to other Non Chain Pizza Spots.And, was my pizza as good as I remembered it to be?No, not even close.It was mediocre at best, and honestly for what I had paid for itI would have been better off going to another pizza place.Now, they do have some Coupons and Online Deals, so if youabsolutely must have Domino's make sure to check out those deals first.So, I don't think I'll have a desire to visit Domino's anymore,because honestly there are so many better places in Rogers Parkto choose from.I was disappointed by Domino's..And for me.. one disappointment  is enough...

9.description: I was having an awful no good very bad day. Feeling too lazy to cook, I ordered pizza online at noon on Friday. A medium 2-topping pizza with cheesy bread. Before I could do anything, my front door bell rings. The delivery man, Orlando, was here. I couldn't believe it. He was really nice and upbeat. He laughed when he saw how flabbergasted I was by the speedy delivery.How much time did the whole ordering process + delivery take? 20 minutes.Granted, I live near Hollywood and Broadway, about half a mile from the establishment, but that was seriously the FASTEST delivery I've EVER experienced in my life.5 STARS.

29.description: The past 3 times we've ordered from here, the bread bowls were uncooked, there were giant chunks of chicken in our VEGETARIAN breadbowls and the pizza was stone cold. Not going back and recommend you stay far away from here. We miss Randy at the one on Barry. :(

23.description: I purchased a Groupon recently and have had ZERO ability to be able to redeem it. I called my local Domino's and was told, "Yeah, we haven't been able to process those...I don't know what to tell you..." So in essence, despite the marketing blitz, NOTHING has changed at Domino's. It is still people working at a fast food place demonstrating WHY they are only able to work at a fast food place...

5.description: I order from here often.  I run an Airbnb and this is the go to cheap option for guests when they aren't getting Chicago style.  Always fast, always hot, always correct.  I haven't had an incorrect order in several months and it's always on time.  Keep up the good work guys.

31.description: I never orderd from Domino's before. My husband after seeing a TV add during football game decided to order from  them some pizzas and try their new pizza sauce. Yes the  TV commercial got him!!!However, I must tell you I was pretty immpressed. The online ordering is really cool. You can track your pizza on-line and see when it is made and out for delivery.We ordered online two medim thin crusts. One pinapple ham and the other spinach mushroom. Both were really really good for $15 total!!!!Delivery was slow we requested it to arrive at 7:30pm they did not get to our house until 7:55 pm. But just in time for Desperate Housewives.

25.description: Decent pizza, good price, and pretty fast.  General:Domino's fits a nice niche between frozen pizza and the better pizza places.  Yeah, they can't compete with Apart, Giordano's, Edwardo's, or any of the smaller joints across the city,  However, you can get a decent-good pizza for under $10.   Accessibility: You can order online, over the phone, or in person at the store.  I like the online ordering process as it allows you to use a credit card, price out the order, and find coupons.  They also have a Pizza Tracker that lets you know when to expect your pizza.  Delivery Time:They are the fastest and most consistent out of the places that I have tried.  It rarely takes longer than 30mins, most of the time it is closer to 20mins.The drivers are nice.Taste:It's a large chain that prides itself on being in the middle.  If you're looking for gourmet, or high end-why are you even reading this review?  If you're looking for a good pizza to get your fix or to buy in bulk for a pizza, they are great.  I really like their barbecue chicken pizzas.  Their new specialty pizzas are very good as well.  Memphis Barbecue Chicken, Cheeseburger Pizza, and the Buffalo Chicken pizzas are some favorites of mine.  Cost:Most of the time, you can get a medium 2 topping for under $10.  Coupons for the specialty pizzas take them down to $8-10 for a medium pretty regularly.

12.description: I've lived around the corner from this particular Domino's for six and a half years and have yet to have a bad order or any food that was less than very well made!I'm always satisfied with the food and the attitude of the delivery driver.

21.description: This review has nothing to do with the pizza offered, it is afterall only Domino's so the expectation is not high.  What the review IS about is the very poor customer service experience.  I have order from here quite abit and the pizza is meh, but again, it's Domino's.  Well tonight they delivered my pizzas to another address and offered to reorder my pizza's for me and an apology, that's it!  No offer to compensate for their error.  I understand that things happen, but come on!  I did ask the driver, do I not get anything for this? The driver was a very nice kid, but said he didn't know and wasn't sure if they do anything.  I did state that if it's not free then forget it.  Didn't recieve any call from the store, nothing.  I called to follow up if there was someone else to speak to and yes, got a manager on duty and when I asked about it he stated, that I had to to cancel the order.  I corrected him and said that was not the case and gave him an oppurtunity to try and correct it.  He said that he could maybe do 1/2 off.  Not trying to make it a big deal, but it was.  I was really put out by the mistake and error and still no apology from the manager on duty.   I order two to three times a month from here, done with that!  I am now going to Apart Pizza.  Great service and super fresh. Now, to the corporate site for Domino's!!

16.description: Writing this review from a hospital bed. Yep. It was that bad.I dealt with cross contamination issues from this location before... tasting peppers on my pineapple, for example, but tolerated it because cheap pizza is cheap. Sometimes it just hits the spot no matter how bad it is.Thanks to this Dominos location's pie I ordered last week, I got a nice case of food poisoning that led to severe dehydration and a 4 day hospital stay.Tasting other toppings I didn't order is one thing. Having the joy of being a human fountain of fluids coming out both ends is another. But if I want to relive that experience, I'll be sure to think of this Dominos location again!Update: Doctors were able to determine that it was fecal contamination resulting in cryptosporidiosis. Chicago Board of Health have been notified.

17.description: I've been ordering from this location for a while now. I live close to foster beach, and this location is the FASTEST delivery I've ever gotten from any other restaurant let alone pizza joints.The delivery drivers are very friendly, I always give them a tip for how fast they got my order to me. No complaints about the service here at all.

10.description: I've been a customer of this Domino's location many times. I have not had a problem with an order in regard to the food or the service. The delivery drivers that I have encountered have all been very courteous and get the delivery done quickly. The food is generally hot (there's been one or two times where it was just warm) and tasty.I would highly recommend for you to order from this location for great, fast service and really good food.

11.description: We order from this Domino's regularly -- probably once a month on average.  They're always fantastic!  Good prices, great quality/taste, friendly delivery drivers, and always delivered hot and fast.  Most places like to deliver cold, late pizza.  In the winter, I prefer ordering Domino's because they've done that.  Thanks guys!  Just ordered again tonight.  Looking forward to it!

26.description: Dominos are the pizza delivery kings! Hands down. No one does it better. Very tasty, reliable product. Im always satisfied!

27.description: Domino's is a great choice if you want cheap, fast, decent pizza.  It's definitely not gourmet, but you're not paying for gourmet.The BEST part is that you can order completely online, using their impressive website interface which allows you to choose perpetual "coupon" deals and customize your toppings, crust, and sauce.  And then you can follow your order as it's being prepared, baked, and sent out on delivery.  And if you need something to help you pass the time while you wait (wow, I'm more lame than I thought), you can play connect four on their website while you monitor your pizza's progress.Cheap. Fast. Tech-savvy.

0.description: I'm not a pizza snob, I like all kinds. I love the pizza we had on the little side street in Rome by the Vatican with fresh tomatoes, arugula and olive oil served room temp with a bottle of Peroni. The pizza we had in Sardinia with olives, onion & a fried egg was a piece of heaven. I love Calo's thin crust with prosciutto & mushroom. I go crazy over Apart's Capricosa. I will walk across broken glass to have my friend's Margerita pizza he makes in his custom built wood fire oven. I can even tolerate any number of stuffed pizza that all pretty much taste the same when out of town guests are visiting.And I like Domino's.There, I said it.Online ordering is a breeze, delivery is speedy, it hits the spot when I wanna binge on Netflix and the price can't be beat. I like this location. They are what they say they are, they deliver what I order and always on time.Also, I'm a sucker for gimmicks and marketing, and I've taken a shine to DJ Slow Pans. I like the online tracker system & progress videos. Yeah, I'm an easy target for Madison Ave.

20.description: Personally, I think the domino's customer service, price, taste, and speed of delivery make them a contender even in the Chicago market.  Upfront, I am not originally from Chicago, so anyone reading this that is a diehard deep dish fan, move on, we have different definitions of what is good.  Most of the smaller places in Chicago seemed to take forever to delivery AND the charge an arm and a leg.  You can get two larges from Domino's for the price of one at some of those smaller places.  This is definitely the place to order from if you are having a party.  I don't know, it really seems like they have worked to improve their product and because of that, I like them a lot.  If you haven't tried them in a while, give them another chance.  The bread bits are just small bread sticks though, lets be honest with each other.

19.description: I always get good service and the food is excellent.  On the other hand, the last two times I ordered, the food tracker wouldnt work properly.

33.description: For this one I wish 0 stars was an option. The employees here are rude as can be and the delivery drivers cannot seem to phathom how to not park in bus stop zone causing the #22 to pass me on several occasions. Sorry but i can never get a sandwich or pizza from here again.

2.description: Ordered my pizza online at 7:31 PM on a Monday night; pizza arrived at 7:48 PM. It's exactly what I ordered and I enjoyed every single bite of the four slices I inhaled as soon as the door closed. This is a great dominos!

34.description: OK -- I must state that Domino's is not the Holy Grail of the Heavenly Pizza Kingdom.  There are certainly better local pizza joints from which to find your true pizza epiphany.That said, this Dominos location does provide a solid product.  The toppings are fresh, the on-line ordering is meticulous yet easy to use and their "pizza tracker" keeps you in the know as to your pizza's progress from start to finish.It's not the world's best pizza, but it's certainly not the worst.  The Brooklyn crust is pretty darn tasty.  Also, the pizzas arrive quickly and are always hot.  Add to the mix some pretty amazing deals and you have stumbled upon a good value.In short, I think that Domino's is a decent option when you don't feel like cooking or heading out, don't feel like waiting and just want to eat some hot pizza and get on with your day. Yes, they are a chain, but the pricing and consistency are just fine.

32.description: i can't find the button to click to add the location of 3144 W Devon. i made the mistake of ordering pasta. wayyy too small for what i paid. stick to the cheap pizza.

18.description: Super FAST service, always piping hot and delucious!!!The perfect solution when you want pizza NOW and frozen pies just don't cut it.I used to use Domino's in the 'burbs and even though I lived closer in proximity to that one than I do this one, this crew is MUCH faster and always deliver food that doesn't disappoint.A+ folks, keep up the great work!

13.description: As someone who lives in Chicago, I feel a little weird about giving Domino's a 4 star rating - but this place never lets us down. Delivery is super fast and our order is always right. I get coupons emailed to me, which is the main reason for our consistent ordering. Also, I'm obsessed with their "tracker" feature (on the ap & online) so you can watch what's happening/who's doing what with your pizza.Food-wise, the pizza tastes like a Domino's pizza. A tasty Domino's pizza.one more thing: PARMESAN BITES I LOVE YOU.

4.description: the food was whatever. Like I wish that i could have gotten LESS BURN ON MY NOODLES. Oh and maybe more chicken with my batter wings.. Like damn. Please don't just reheat my food. Make it like you said you would...Honestly all I asked for was cheese on HALF OF MY SANDWICH and all I got was cheesy pepper grease bread. I'm done with you guys.. Thanks for clogging my arteries with shit..

24.description: Shocked I tell you, shocked! My mom wanted pizza and she wanted it on the cheap and delivered. WELL, hmmm... I knew about the 5.99 deal for mediums so I hooked up the on line deal. Who would have thunk it? Two pipping hot pizzas with a hand tossed garlic crust that were exactly as ordered, delivered in less than 40 minutes. Oh, it cost less than 18$ with delivery, for this price, taste and speed, I think I will be calling again. SHOCKED!

6.description: Long story, but I haven't ordered a delivery pizza in many years... but I just moved into a place that opened up the possibility to do so.  And this Domino's did fine.  It really hit the spot.:-)

22.description: why do you not deliver to foster/western.  it's not that far.

15.description: I been ordering from here for a long time and they never disappoint. Delivery is ultra fast, and I never had a pizza that came f**kd up. Only thing that I ordered from there that tasted horrible was the Mac n Cheese Breadbowl Pasta, and turns out that was a recipe issue, not the specific store. Glad Domino's Inc took that off the menu nationwide, it sucks rat balls. The guys there know me for years and they personally customize the Spinach Feta Artisan Pizza for me, even tho its against policy (oops). They are really good here and make all the pizzas taste much better than it should. I had the new Pan Pizza - it was simply OK, but a simple hand tossed with garlic-buttered crust still owns it. The only reason why I won't give it 5 stars because imma Chicagoan. You just don't give a commercial chain 5 stars after you been eating Giordanos and Gino's all your life.

7.description: Found a pubic hair in my pizza!

8.description: This is the best domino's I've ordered from so far. They've never messed up my order and they always have fast delivery. I've moved away and back and I can tell you that other Domino's locations don't have the same quality as this place.

30.description: The new advertising for Dominos, is JUST that. Advertising. We ordered 2 pizzas last night. There was no new crust, no new flavor, no new nothing. It went down ok but the next morning, all 3 of us we're sick. Heartburn and other things that I won't mention here.

3.description: Ok, still pondering this experience six years later . . . shudder. I feel my rectum losing control at the mere thought of eating this pizza again.

14.description: Edgar helped me with my order. I don't order here very often and didn't have a menu. He was knowledgeable about his specials and gave me two recommendations. Great customer service and even reminded me about the charity the store was helping with.facility was bright and clean.  My cheese sausage mushroom and green pepper pizza was what you'd expect from Domino's.

3.description: My wife and I were stumped on what to get for a quick bite to eat.  I had been recently introduced to Marko's by some friends of mine and decided to give it a try for carry-out.  We ordered two of the "three taco dinner" plates and a side of guacamole.  We were very happy-they were all very flavorful and everything seemed to be very fresh.  Can't wait to go back again-so happy it is in our neighborhood!

1.description: I just happened to be shopping in the area and the place I wanted to go was closed.  Hmmm... what can I say about Marko's Tacos without sounding ummm... harsh.  The place serves Mexican food.  But the quality is quite lacking.  I should have gotten a clue when I walked into the bathroom (ewwwhhh).  The waitress was very nice and friendly, but she got my order wrong.  I asked for cheese enchiladas and black beans... instead I got 2 veggie enchiladas (with broccoli & potatoes... I think) and refried beans.  I even asked her in Spanish and she concurred.  Nonetheless, I gave it the ole' college try and decided to eat what was presented to me.  Oh my goodness the food was so bland I had to drench it in hot sauce.  I left most of my food on the plate.. I felt so bad for wasting so much food!  Then when I asked for my receipt the waitress looked bewildered as if she had never been asked for a receipt.  I felt like I was in the twilight zone and someone was messing with my head.This definitely was not a typical dining experience for me.  Verdict - won't be going back to Marko's, you can believe that.

2.description: I was so sad when I realized Real Azteca was gone.We gave this place a try, but honestly, it was not very good.My vegetarian burrito contained broccoli (?!) and everything was all very "one flavor" - it was pretty bland.We won't go back.

5.description: not markos' anymore..it is diamond something..but tacos are yummy

6.description: The food was not only priced well and served in large quantity, but was also quite delicious.  I will definately be going back.

7.description: I was upset to learn that Real Azteca (which was amazing) was recently replaced by Markos Tacos but was willing to give it a try.When we arrived we were the only customers in the place.  Not so unusual for a cold weeknight.  The older woman behind the counter (in the kitchen area) did not greet us and looked pissed off at the world, but our waiter was friendly.  I ordered a steak super  burrito and an horchata, my partner ordered a pork burrito suizo without ranchero sauce and a side of beans and rice.When the food arrived I received the pork burrito swimming in ranchero with sour cream on top and no horchata.  My partner received a steak burrito with cheese melted on top (done in a microwave).  The only 2 customers in the place and the order was wrong?!?Well, they did fix the order for us but I have to say the burritos were nothing to get excited about.  Yes they are huge, but they are more than half filled with soggy lettuce.  I assume from the trip into the microwave.  Overall not the best.Too bad because Real Azteca was a slam dunk!  We used to go there often.  Markos fails to deliver the same great food and friendly service.  I would hesitate to return.

8.description: My gf and I went out to get some fresh air after being couped up these last few days with cold weather and while we were walking around we got hungry.  We were walking north on Clark St and stumbled upon Markos Tacos.  We wanted something cheap so we decided to check it out.  We ordered a Burrito Suizo to share.  They brought us chips and salsa that were very good and also they brought us each a cup of cream of broccoli soup which we found random but pretty decent.  A few mins later the server brought us our burrito and it was HUGE!  We cut it in half and each of us barely finished our portion before we we stuffed!  We both thought that it was very very good.  Was it the best mexican I have ever had? No but for $6.06 for my gf and I to each be completely stuffed it was definitely worth it.  Also, the server was very attentive and friendly.  This is definitely a little dive Mexican restaurant that is worth checking out.

0.description: Not going to lie and say this is one of the best taco joints in Chicago, but in terms of convenience, it's great. There is nothing more to Marko's but very cheap prices and decent home-style Mexican food. They do have the typical extensive Mexican-restaurant menu, but I stick with their tacos. Their taco de carne asada never fails. They load enough meat on to make a few tacos a decent meal. They also use El Popo tortillas, which are a favorite. Marko's is great for quick take-out, but give eating-in a chance. You can enjoy some tv novelas with your complimentary chips and salsa and, if you're lucky, they serve you a cup of home-made soup (always different).There isn't much for cheap Mexican tacos in Andersonville (El Norte doesn't beat Marko's) so I will continue to support this delightful neighborhood establishment.

4.description: This review is for the Marko's Tacos on newport. we have eaten here 3 times, and have some favorites now.  the echiladas mexicanas de pollo was oustanding.  you cant get red mole dishes just anywhere, ya know!  these were perfectly prepared with TASTY beans on the side.  rice is also good.  the torta puerco en mole was also outstanding.  their barbacoa tacos are among the best we have ever had anywhere in our travels, tho we cannot say the same for the tacos al pastor or the chiles rellenos, sadly. we will happily drive down from edgewater glen anytime except when cubbies are playing!

58.description: SO much potential. So cute. Located in the "attic" above Hamburger Mary's, this has all the possibility of being *the* place to meet up on any night of the week, and yet, maybe it's only the times I've been there, but it's consistently not fulfilling and hardly ever filled up. Their service is not consistent. I've been flat out ignored by bartenders three times I've been there, and treated like a VIP the other two times. I admit I like the special treatment, but would prefer a solid middle ground. A negative: $15 minimum for charging something to a card and an ATM that is often broken...

56.description: The ambiance and location are really great.  It looks like it'd be a great place to go dancing but when I went this last Saturday night it was practically empty.  Best thing about this place: The bartender Kelly is SMOKIN' hot and super friendly.

29.description: We have a lot of fun there. Great place to go on a Saturday nite when you don't want to fight the tourists and wedding parties in boystown. Luv DJ Oskar, always friendly and a DJ that actually plays requests! OMG.

42.description: I've always had a really good time at Mary's Attic.  I wish the drinks were a little stronger (I had four whiskey and cokes before I even felt buzzed) and were served in larger glasses (leaving my friends and the conversation every 10-15 minutes).The music is really fun and danceable, and seeing people go nuts on the stage can be really entertaining.  The bartenders are friendly cutie pies and the darts in the back room has the potential to be a blast for you and your friends.  The women's bathroom is adequate and clean.  And the random bed by the DJ booth?  Saucy.Mary's Attic, expect to see me on Fridays and/or Saturdays from now on, now that a lot of my friends just moved up to Andersonville.  We'll be the ones singing along to all the songs - ESPECIALLY the soft rock shit.

23.description: CTA-gay cabaret show?!?!  For $10????  I am in!So a friend of a friend performs in this show and we all trekked up there on a Wednesday night to support and get some good laughs. Man I was so glad I did!  This show was HILARIOUS.  It's all about what happens on the CTA.  Too funny and the performers were great.I never knew that Hamburger Mary's had an upstairs, etc.I also didnt know that they brewed their own beer.  I had the bombshell and it was light and refreshing as I was laughing my ass off at the show.  I would definitely go back.Check it out if you havent....a cheap night with a little different flair than a standard night :)

47.description: This place is truly one-of-a-kind: it's a freakin' purple attic.  The drinks are cray-cray strong, yet moderately priced. There's bangin'  bar eats downstairs, for cheap (good bad food). They help host the Zombie Bar Crawl, and a variety of caberet-style shows throughout the year. (You really should check their event calendar first, and then pick a specific night to go).  Added perk: the Clark bus is always running.

8.description: Came to Mary's Attic for the first time; didn't really know what to expect. We'd bought tickets online for "The Book of Merman", which is a spoof of "Book of Mormon" the Broadway musical, so it's really a spoof of a spoof. It's a small venue for live performances, but in my opinion, that wade it all the better! We had a great, great, great time.... the actors were top-notch and I'm probably going to come back and see this show again!!

31.description: I love Hamburger Mary's so naturally the first bar I wanted to go to kick of my 21st was her Attic. I went with my girlfriend on a Thursday night around 9:30 and there weren't too many people there but a few tables were filled. They had live music going on that sounded pretty good. We got drinks pretty quickly. I tried a few of their fruity drinks and they were delicious though a bit pricey ($18 for two drinks? Really?)
