39.description: This is a great little place to buy your food in Edgewater. Across the street is a Jewel Osco. But if you don't want to give your $$$ to the corporate fat cats - go here.  They have a nice section of fresh fruit /veggies and spices. The size of the store is no bigger than the cake/deli area at Jewel but you get a pretty good bargain. I had about 1/3 of my cart full - cost $30. Since I'm more of a Jewel person - I was taken back by the freshness of the meat - like it was too fresh :( I got the pork and started cooking it - YIKES - it smelled dead. I know you're like - duh...but seriously I buy meat from big corporate supermarkets and they put dyes in it and do something to hide the deadness of the meat  so it doesn't smell bad when you cook it. It probaby give us all cancer ... but maybe I'm just not cut out to get the real deal. Natural slaughted pork- is just gross - give me the fake stuff Good luck!

37.description: The best place to get meat and produce this far north.I used to go out of my way to grocery shop at Stanley's on North/Elston. This place is equally as good. I bike two miles to get here because they have way better produce than a supermarket, and usually for much cheaper.Meat is really inexpensive here, and the deli guys work pretty fast. They also have a great selection of bulk-store nuts, candy, wasabi peas, etc.Watch out for prices on toiletries and other stuff; sometimes they're more expensive than at the supermarket.

0.description: This place rocks.  While they dont have the square footage that their sister store "Harvest Time "has in Lincoln Square, they have an ample selection of items .   Their prices on produce are almost always lower then the Jewel across the street, and the quality is far superior.  The deli has a varied selection of Boar's Head, as well as some bulk smoked items such as bacon and pork chops.  Decent selection of cheeses from the usual suspects to 5-6 varieties of feta.  Small selection of  both domestic and imported grocery items, bulk nuts & fruits, and a packaged meat caseThe best part of Edgewater Produce is the staff.  This is the little neighborhood store where everyone from the management to the shelf stockers and cashiers treat you like you're part of the family . I'm really glad they are in my hood.

38.description: A much better product and price than the Jewel across the street! If you want to help out the local business, your pocket book and still get Terrific produce! This is where to stop.

51.description: I miss good produce. Growing up in California spoiled me rotten (or not rotten as the case may be) in regards to cheap, fresh produce that tastes as if it's just been plucked from the vine/ground/tree/stalk/whatever. So I am inordinately pleased to discover a produce store (within walking distance) that stocks cheap, fresh, tasty produce. And let's not even discuss how much cheaper a good avocado is here than it is anywhere else in the city. My only qualm is that their serrano chiles are severely lacking in spice (when will we ever learn that when it comes to chiles, smaller is almost ALWAYS better) but that's a grievance I hold with nearly every produce store in this city (La Casa del Pueblo in Pilsen being the only exception thus far). And when I stupidly left my wallet at home on a recent excursion, they very nicely held my bag of groceries for me while I ran home to retrieve it.

27.description: I'm a fan, but Edgewater Produce is less of a bargain lately. Everything other than produce seems to be cheaper across the street at Jewel. Jewel's produce has gone into the toilet, though, so this place is even more of a must-go-to. Wish they were open later!

32.description: I used to be a frequent Edgewater Produce shopper, but have since switched to Harvest Time for their location near my work and doctor. I actually think they are owned by the same company because I have seen things with Edgewater Produce stickers on them at Harvest Time.I stopped by last night to pick up a few things for my juice cleanse. Last time I did the cleanse, I got my produce from Harvest Time and it ran me about $55 for 5 days.  This time, the same amount of days ran me a little over $25 at Edgewater Produce. Here's what I got:10 big granny smith apples :: $6.243 loose beets :: $0.42A huge piece of ginger :: $1.522 celery stalks :: $2.384 cucumbers :: $2.64A bunch of mint :: $1.98A bag of carrots :: $0.695 lemons :: $2.005 limes :: $1.004 bunches of spinach :: $3.92A bunch of basil :: $1.99Some of the prices are high for the winter months (i.e limes are usually 10/$1 in the summer) but none of the items I got were on special. I guarantee you I would spend double or triple if I picked up this stuff at Dominick's or Jewel. I do get annoyed at how small EP is and how narrow the registers are. I have gotten meat from here before and it was decent and their spice rack is actually extremely impressive. Downsides: not a huge grocery or dairy section and the cashiers are lazy.

54.description: The produce is amazing, but they also have wonderful roasted chicken, speciality meats, and house-made guacamole.  The lines move quickly.

48.description: Love, love love my weekend routine that involves coming here.I can't get enough fruit; and EP satisfies my need! 8/10 times their fruit is delicious, and when it's less than great, it's still edible.I recommend the apples, mangoes, and all things berry. Their veggies (bag of spinach, celery, peppers, and sweet potatoes) are really well priced and tasty! They carry Boars Head meats, although they're lacking in the organic/humanely raised section. To be fair, they don't claim to be about that, so I stick with amazing produce.Thanks to this place, they are several times when I eat nothing but fruit and skip the unhealthy nighttime snacks!Extra perk: practicing spanish by trying to figure out what the cashiers are saying!A tip: they don't advertise it anymore, but they will give you a quarter back if you pay at the meter and bring in the small perforated side of the paybox ticket.

44.description: Certain neighborhoods on the northside, especially within Lincoln Square and Andersonville, have very few Mexican supermercados.  Edgewater Produce is one of the few that exists and continues to carry great, fresh products at reasonable prices.  Prior to have a taco dinner party at my house, I come here and purchase their aracheras en la maquina (tenderized skirt steaks) and fajita-style chicken with vegetables from the butcher.  It tastes extremely authentic compared to anything I would find at Jewel or Dominicks.  If you need anything found in Mexico or Latin America, you will most likely find it here (Chocolate Caliente, Jarritos, tropical fruits, Mexican Coca Cola [in the glass bottle of course]).  Heck, the tortillas come directly from the factories still piping warm off the press.  If you're looking to purchase produce for your house, or have a fiesta, this is the place.  Keep in mind that common house products like toilet paper and even Suavitel are cheaper elsewhere.

24.description: Produce is freshest in the area. Service is nice and prices are amazing. Check out their website for weekly/biweekly sales. It's worth it.

7.description: My go to store for produce. They carry the best freshest vegetables you can find.  You can find a respectable amount of other grocery needs as well. Puts Jewel and Marianos and even Whole Foods to shame. Too bad they don't carry more organic!

49.description: i bought 2 bags of produce, and paid $56 for it.  most of it went completely bad within 3 days.  not my favorite way to waste money.

40.description: Edgewater Produce is great for so many reasons and I do my shopping here whenever possible.  With Jewel-Osco directly across the street and a Dominick's much closer to where I live, they have won my business despite not being the most convenient option.For starters, it's great that they're locally owned.  As it becomes mega-chain supermarkets increasingly become the norm, it feels wonderful to give some business to mom & pop.  On top of that, you really can't beat the prices.  As the name would suggest, their specialty is produce, and they can provide you with lots of it without breaking the bank.You can also find a number of ethnic (particularly hispanic) specialty items.  A few weeks ago, my girlfriend and I were hosting a dinner party and had a hefty list of ingredients to buy.  Edgewater Produce was my first stop, and I got a huge kick out of the fact that I could buy Epazote (a stick-like spice), but I couldn't find cocoa powder.All raving aside, however, I am disappointed by their lack of effort to include organic products in their selection.  I realize that their store is small and having competitive prices is essential to their business.  Yet the type of people who pass up a chain supermarket to shop local are more than likely also interested in organic and more ethical foods.  That is the only reason that this is not a five-star review.In the end, I am still a huge fan and prefer to do my shopping here.  Unless the Andersonville Farmer's Market is on, there is not better place for fresh produce in the area.

53.description: I absolutely love this grocery store!  The produce is always fresh and very reasonably priced.  Friendly staff.  I never spend more than 15-20 dollars and leave with a week's worth of fruits and vegetables (and I eat a lot of produce!)  Definitely get more bang for your buck and better quality than from the Jewel across the street.

30.description: great prices, great produce. much better than the stuff across the street at jewels. Also makes you feel great to support a unique local market.

46.description: This is the smaller and slightly less awesome cousin of Harvest Time. The produce selection here is way better than the Jewel across the street, and the prices are better too. This place actually seems to take some pride in selling fruits and vegetables that are fit for human consumption, unlike some places ... (can you tell I h8 that Jewel?). You get a lot of food for your $ here if you're buying primarily fruits and veggies. The deli counter has pricey (but quality) Boar's Head cheeses. If it's time for a fancy pants picnic, this is where you should go. The canned and packaged stuff at Edgewater is a bit over-priced and they don't have a great selection. Go here for your fresh fruits and veggies for sure. Consider braving Jewel for a better price on the packaged stuff.

1.description: No problem with the produce, but today they had a sale on pork shoulder.  Stopped in and there was one in the display case.  Unfortunately the wrapping was wrecked.  "Juice" all over the tray, and a huge part of the plastic wrapping was torn away leaving a spot about the size of a baseball open to the air.  This area was clearly dried out and discolored so it wasn't recent.I asked the meat counter attendant if they had other pork shoulders.  He said there was one in the case that was ready to buy.  I told him that there was a torn wrapper and it was exposed to the air.  He took that one out of the case and went to the back to "check for more."  Miraculously they had one.  Freshly wrapped, looking great, that was the exact same weight and price.  It also had a huge discolored spot clearly visible through the plastic that was the exact size AND shape of the spot on the roast I had JUST alerted him to.  Obviously, he lied and pretended to look for a new one and just rewrapped the bad one with no regard for sanitation.Ended up going to another store and paying more for the meat (almost double) but at least I know I'm getting a safe product.  Don't cut costs at the expense of food safety, Edgewater Produce!  You won't see me in there again for a very long time.

55.description: My friends have been telling me to check out Edgewater Produce for months now and I am housesitting two blocks away so I decided to go check it out.  WOW!  The fact that I can get 2 avocados for $1.50 when they are $2 each at Jewel is just amazing!!  The green peppers were twice as big and half the price as the ones at Jewel.  Yes it may be a tad small and there are certain things that you can not get here but I can get all of my basics here.  I loved it and although it is a few extra blocks for me from my place I will definitely be hitting this place up for all of my produce!  It blows my mind that more people do not shop here...

9.description: Lets be clear, I am appreciative of a cheap, local market in Andersonville. I want to support such businesses as much as I can, especially when it's a market that can keep me out of the dreaded Jewel (shudder). Unfortunately Edgewater Produce falls a bit short of expectations after living near Morse Market in Rogers Park for so many years. Morse Market is just better and I am spoiled.Edgewater Produce does have a nice selection of fresh, inexpensive produce but it's slightly lacking and their layout is sort of disorganized. I can get over the layout but what kind of market doesn't have fresh okra?? No honey crisp apples either, for shame. Their prices, while cheap, are noticeably more expensive than Morse Market, I'm specifically thinking of kale, mushrooms, cilantro. Their deli/meat counter I won't even touch. It smells and looks bad. I was digging through chicken once and each package of chicken was just sitting in pools and pools of blood, leaking through the saran wrap. Eek. Again, Morse Market's meat and deli counter is WAY better. For me, it's not even an option to buy meat at Edgewater after some of the stuff I've seen and that makes this market a lot less useful if I'm not even comfortable picking up some chicken breast here. So yes, I will continue to come here for veggies and fruit but always a little reluctantly, knowing there are better, cheaper markets to be had elsewhere.

26.description: Love! Awesome prices and great customer service. The quality of meat and produce at Edgewater is unbeatable. PS try the guacamole they make in house. SO GOOD!

25.description: This is one of my neighborhood grocery stores.  They have the cheapest dozen of eggs around.  Produce is also fresh and fairly priced here.  They take credit cards too which is great for people who don't carry cash.  They are much friendly here than at the asian grocery stores that give you lip about using plastic.

12.description: Great place to shop pick up some groceries, specially fresh vegetables and fruits. I wish there are more stores like this around Chicago. Also very helpful staff.

59.description: Compared with the Dominicks I live very close to, produce and fruit at Edgewater Produce are practically HALF THE PRICE and often better quality! It's well worth the walk to me! Love it!This listing says it's open till 7pm on Sundays but I just called and was told 9pm. Unfortunately, their own website does not list their hours but it will let you know the current specials.

21.description: I absolutely love this place!  It's about 1/8 of the size of large grocery story but you can get almost everything you need here for a fraction of the price!  Staff is friendly.  Produce is awesome!

17.description: This is one of my neighborhood grocery stores.  They have the cheapest dozen of eggs around.  Produce is also fresh and fairly priced here.  They take credit cards too which is great for people who don't carry cash.  They are much friendly here than at the asian grocery stores that give you lip about using plastic.

10.description: Excellent selection and quality of produce. Just as you might expect given their name. Given that produce is in their name, this is their specialty. You won't find much else beyond the basics. There's some specialty food which seems to be mostly Polish and Mexican fare. However the produce I purchased was excellent and will be returning here from now on for all produce needs.

5.description: Hallelujah!No, I'm not kidding.Halle-fucking-lujah!When I moved to Andersonville this month I knew that I would be leaving behind my beloved Cermak Produce in Humboldt Park.  What I didn't know is that I would find Edgewater Produce just a hop-skip from my new pad.I eat a lot of produce.  I work from home and love to cook, so my grocery bills can get extreme.  I need places like Edgewater Produce to give me both excellent fruit and veg, but also keep my bills to a minimum.The lines are long, but it's OK.  Just relax.  Take a deep breath and know those gorgeous, plump red peppers and fragrant onions are going to make a slamming accompaniment to your dinner.They also have a pretty great deli meat counter.  Boarshead has awful radio commercial, but tasty meats.

3.description: Reasonably priced and fresh produce. Meats are ok but way cheaper than the grocery store. Best part of all, found some if my favorite hispanic brands: Bimbo, Goya, etc. I know where I am going to find all the ingredients to make my mothers  beef sancocho!

35.description: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!So cheap and perfect for living in the neighborhood! Staff isn't overly friendly, but I get over it and it's a tiny store so you won't have to spend much time to get great produce and get out of there :)

19.description: This place is great! Great produce and fresh food selection. Deli is good too. Sometimes their meat isn't the freshest and can turn fairly quickly after purchase.

28.description: Edgewater Produce has never let me down. They only stock the best, freshest produce in town and their prices are rock bottom cheap. Their fruit is always ripe and delicious and their herbs are fresh.They don't stock anything that didn't have a good crop, so if the quality wasn't there you might not find what you need that day. Their mangoes and avocados are the best. Not to mention their meat! Phenomenal prices on fresh meat that's extremely high quality. Don't waste your money at Jewel when you need some chicken - Edgewater is the place to go. Staff is always busy, but they'll take the time to point out what you need when you ask.

45.description: It's a bright spot in the neighborhood, for sure.  A bit pricey for the quality of the food but still generally cheaper than anything else around. Nice selection of produce and Mexican snacks, too.

33.description: This is a great local store that has far better prices for produce than the Jewel across the street.  However, for those of you looking for a northern version of Stanleys (amazing produce prices) this is not it!  There is more here than just produce, and the prices aren't reduced for quick sell the way that are at Stanley's

43.description: Love this grocery store!!  Great produce and an easy to maneuver store that doesn't advertise like crazy. I do 90% of my shopping here. The nuts and dried fruit mixes are a treat!

2.description: One of my favorite things to do is take a long stroll down Clark from my apartment through Andersonville, window shop, people watch, pet puppies, kiss babies, and carry non-disposable tote bags into Edgewater Produce to pick up one large cucumber, 3 lemons, 4 granny apples, a package of cherry tomatoes, and a bag of carrots, walk out roughly $10 lighter and repeat the long window-shopping/people-watching/puppy-petting/baby-kissing stroll back home.This is exactly why I love the 60640.And while I cannot get everything here that I can get at the larger grocers in the area, I can get the healthy things here, and that's all I should really be eating anyway.  Edgewater Produce, I luv you.

18.description: Love this place! The produce is fresh and cheap, and if you are a fan of Boar's Head meat and cheese, they always have an amazing sale on one of their products. This place is only really good for your fresh products, so sadly it's not a one stop shop for all your groceries. But the price beats Jewel hands down, so it is definitely worth making two stops for grocery shopping.

41.description: a bit small and not as clean as its big sister Harvest Time, but excellent competitively priced produce, salsas and fresh tortillas. Also rad  for bulk items like nuts, dried beans, seeds and canned tomatos. Much better prices than the JO and far more efficient way to shop. Not to mention- Edgewater staff  actually WANTS to help you - they are always restocking shelves, unlike Jewel where you get attitude, and backlash for basically being a customer...

52.description: Thank goodness I walk by this place before I head to Jewel as my wallet enjoys the diversion. They might not have everything I need but I sure can find most of what I do for a much much better price.I've been going to their other store, HarvesTime, for a while now but I'm starting to appreciate going to Edgewater since I live much closer to this location. I'm also starting to appreciate the lighter load on my wallet!

50.description: This place is very clean and well organized compared to some other low cost produce places I've been to. They have a good selection for the size of the store (hooray for not just having the bland apple trio of Granny Smiths, Red Delicious, and Golden Delicious!). For me, the thing that won me over was their cheap and very fresh heads of romaine lettuce that didn't force me to remove the first ten layers of wilted leaves. Sure, there's a Jewels across the street, but I doubt the produce would be this inexpensive or fresh.

4.description: Our first of what surely will be weekly visits. It's a great store very good prices and the produce is uber FRESH.  Its impeccable and far less than Whole Foods for better quality. It's a must!

6.description: I love this place, and it's so convenient for me to go here. They have pretty much everything you could need on a daily basis, as well as a selection of more ethnic food items. They also carry some really great baked goods and bagels.

22.description: The BEST produce, deli, and homemade items like salsas, guacamole, hot and spicy vegetable mix!  Very reasonable prices than any chain grocery store.  Cheeses, dairy items like sour cream, etc. just a couple bucks.  Spent $100 and walked out with more food that will feed for weeks!!  A must try for sure!!!

15.description: Salsa Ranchero Tortuga is out of this world!!  I just eat it with a spoon when I get home!Their guacamole is better than any other produce mart I've tried, in the city (I've tried many).  Produce is fresh. Cilantro smells like cilantro should and they have El Milagro flour tortillas!  They're a little higher priced on some things, than Devon Market, but not enough to notice.  GREAT PLACE!

57.description: The cheapest meat and produce around!

20.description: Extremely inexpensive alternative to Jewels. What can go wrong?

36.description: This little market is just right...70% of it is fresh fruits, veggies, and other great stuff. I came here determined to find the perfect apples for my latest batch of apple crisp, and boy oh boy, did I find em! And nice root veggies for roasting and salads. They also do terrific rotisserie chickens, baked to perfection. I like that this place is small and when you shop here you bring home good stuff and cook it, instead of eating out at some crazy expensive eatery and then reviewing it. What's the point of that, right?

14.description: Edgewater Produce has never let me down. They only stock the best, freshest produce in town and their prices are rock bottom cheap. Their fruit is always ripe and delicious and their herbs are fresh.They don't stock anything that didn't have a good crop, so if the quality wasn't there you might not find what you need that day. Their mangoes and avocados are the best. Not to mention their meat! Phenomenal prices on fresh meat that's extremely high quality. Don't waste your money at Jewel when you need some chicken - Edgewater is the place to go. Staff is always busy, but they'll take the time to point out what you need when you ask.

12.description: First timer here and have to say I was pleasantly surprised:  ever thought it's not "too of the line" decor, it's still quite cozy, clean and inviting-- will definitely do just fine for a long overdue catch-up dinner with a friend.  When we arrived (and for the duration of our visit) we were the only customers in the restaurant (which I normally take as a very bad sign, but to be fair, it was a Monday night, after 8:30p!). When we walked in, my friend and I were greeted warmly by the owner and told to choose any table we liked. As it was a bit too quiet with just the two of us in there, my friend asked if they could put on some music, which they quickly obliged. Granted, it was your standard muzak (elevator-style Kenny G-esque instrumental music, but it was better than nothing.  Beggars can't be choosers, ammiright?  After a bit, I think I heard a lil' Luther Vandross worked into the mix. Being the product of two parebts who are fans of soul music and R&B soul stylings, I wasn't mad! ). The waiter was friendly and came by to take our order right away. We both split an order of edamame and an order of vietnamese spring rolls for appetizers:  both were top notch!  Then for entrees, my pal had the ginger chicken stir fry, I the chicken green curry-- we were both blown away by how tasty, fresh and flavorful each entree was!  Delish!  Service was attentive without being intrusive and the check was very reasonable (about $15 each when split down the middle)!  We did bring in a bottle of wine (byob--Yeah!) for which we weren't charged any corkage fee (double Yeah!) ....Not really sure if that was because we'd already opened it ourselves before arriving thereby negating the "corkage" part of the corkage fee (hey, don't judge!), but I'm not one to look a gift horse in the mouth! When we left, we were thanked warmly for our patronage and invited back again. I'll definitely take them up on that-- I was very impressed!!

7.description: Friends and I stopped in and had a good expierence with excellent service and delicious appetizer's and entrees. I recommend the fried calamri with mild sauce, tasty dumplings and Pad Thai

3.description: My fav is the wonton soup. You know how sometimes you order wonton soup at other restaurants and you have no idea what's in there? Here, you will taste the distinct flavor or shrimp and chicken. And the broth rocks too. BBQ Pork fried rice is also delicious.Most of the rest of the menu is pretty good also, from appetizers to entrees. BUT if you are a fan of pho (tough pre-cooked beef) or the vietnamese sandwiches you may be disappointed (remove that mayo guys please!)

1.description: It's because of this place I had to start keeping a "DO NOT ORDER" list for when I'm in the mood for delivery.I ordered in twice with the same disappointing results. This last time, I received pungent salmon sushi that I took one bite of and spit out. It was very low quality and even the sushi rice seemed too hard (as if it was old/been in the fridge) and too vinegared. I also got chicken and rice soup which should be a safe bet. However, the rice in that was somehow also smelly...like it was old and had not been rinsed before use.The soda was the only tasty thing I received.

2.description: The Thai couple running this place are friendly. But they have no clue what they're doing in the kitchen. I feel so bad for them. Restaurant empty. For an obvious reason. I mean, if they can't get a simple Viet Spring Roll to be edible, and the green curry looks, feels and tastes like nothing proper (milky grey broth (not sauce) and tough tofu --say wuut?), all I can do is feel bad. The Vietnamese-style Sandwich did right disgusting. 2-day aged, tough chewy bread with a few limp, unseasoned slices of beef draped over it. Sandwich was garnished with angel hair shavings of daikon and carrot and everything was doused with a sweet, vinegary watered down (and running everywhere) mayo. I shuddered after both bites. And then gave up.

9.description: Unfortunately this is a pretty weak 3 star. We have been here once before when the restaurant was Yak Thai. The interior is much the same, clean, simple, sorta modern. We ordered 2 Bao to start. One filled with Mongolian beef and one with basil chicken. I had never had Bao before, believe it or not, and these (with nothing to compare them to) were GOOD. Really good. Soft, pillowy, delicate with really flavorful filling. The Mongolian beef was the best of the two, the beef was ground, which I was not picturing and sweet and spicy. Basil chicken was tasty too but not as flavorful as the M beef. Came with sweet dipping sauce. These were really very good but probably not healthy as I could see that orange grease pooling in the dipping sauce and in the beef. OH WELL, TASTY!The entrees were disappointing however. The menu looks great, some Thai, some Chinese, some Japanese. Hard to choose. Almost chose a squid dish and probably should have but I just wanted kind of typical "American Chinese" and so ordered the Orange Chicken. This was a mistake. While all the flavors were there the breading on the chicken was 100% wet and soggy, falling off the chicken. I was picturing sweet, crispy, fried, lacquered on breading like you get at most Chinese restaurants. I also found the white rice served with the dish to be QUITE mushy. Gummy mushy. Mushy rice with mushy soggy chicken was really not a great combo. Again, flavor wasn't bad but texture and appearance was meh. I was very disappointed. Boyfriend ordered crispy pork with Chinese broccoli which appeared to be better than mine. We've had this before off an authentic Thai menu at a restaurant off Argyle where the pork is MUCH crispier (more fried?) which I think we prefer. This was still good though and the greens were good. Boyfriend felt fat afterwards. Don't we always? So boyfriends dish was OK to good. Mine was pretty below average and the appetizer was deliciously awesome. Pretty mixed bag. I won't write them off completely because I really want all Andersonville restuarants to do well. When we try again I'll just order something a little more daring and less gringo. Maybe that was my mistake.

18.description: My friend and I visited for the first time last night.  The Thai papaya salad, which easily fed two, was very fresh and perfectly spiced.  I got Seafood Pad Ped for my entree, and my friend got a tofu red curry. Both were fabulous.  Mine had a generous serving of a variety of seafood plus vegetables, and its spiciness was really the "mild" that I had requested.  My friend reported she got the level of spiciness she requested, too.  I had the mango dessert, and my friend had green tea ice cream, both delicious.  Service was quick, attentive, and polite.  We will definitely be back, and we'll recommend this place to others, too.

10.description: We've been here twice and the service has been excellent both times. They had a special that included a free dessert (mango and sticky rice), which was incredibly tasty. I'd recommend the Vietnamese spring rolls and any of the curries.The place has been pretty empty the two times that we've visited--our neighbors (who have lived here for years) have told us that the location has changed ownership several times this year--I guess that's why it's not very populated. But, it's good Thai food in a great location, so, why not?

13.description: I rarely write reviews, but I felt this place deserved a great review. I ordered take-out from here. The food (chicken fried rice) was excellent. One of the best fried rice dishes I've had in the city. They were very friendly and very fast. The decor was simple, nice. The restaurant was extremely clean. I will certainly be back. This is a hidden gem at the north end of Andersonville.

16.description: I live two blocks from this place and have walked by many times and noticed that they don't seem to have a lot of business.  I have been meaning to figure out if that was justified or not.  I ordered takeout tonight and was very impressed with the food I ordered.  The price is as inexpensive as any hole in the wall Asian food takeout place and it is very good takeout food.  I guess the "problem" with this place is that it is probably the decor.  It is nice and clean inside, but something just seems a bit off.  I think it is trying to be a nicer restaurant with a lot of people eating in.  What it is, is a fantastic Asian food takeout place with much better than average takeout food and a very reasonable price.

17.description: Awesome food.  Ordered the Vietnamese spring rolls which were fresh and served with hoisin sauce.  My girlfriend got the Pad Thai and I ordered the Pad Kee Mao, both had fresh veggies, was not greasy and tasted great.

15.description: Great food, kind employees, and fast service!

0.description: I loved our food here and the prices are just great!My friend lives down the street, so we went here on a double date and brought a bottle of wine to split. This is actually my first BYOB place (I know, I know, get with the times already). And the experience was great!I know that many BYOB places charge a fee or a corking fee. Here they didn't add anything for bringing our own wine so that was nice.We ordered three appetizers and four entrees. The appetizers were all pretty good and nobody complained about their entree. I kind of order the same thing from all Chinese and Thai food places. I get the Orange Chicken and white rice. I know it sounds boring, but I like it.The Orange Chicken was awesome tasting. The breading was light and the sauce very sweet and the portion size was just right. I didn't have a ton of leftovers but I had plenty to eat.In the end, we split the check and each couple paid $27 plus a tip. That was the perfect amount and the quality of food was great. We came here on a Saturday night and pretty much had the place to ourselves.So our service was good while a bunch of people came in to pick up carry out. I'd recommend either dinning in or carrying out. I can't wait to come back some time soon!

5.description: I should have known this day would come. Like all addictions, my pho dependence has ended in my penury and ruin.*In a fruitless quest to sate my pho cravings, my husband ordered from Se'nse on GrubHub. It was the first order for both of us, and will be the last. Unlike the habit-forming aromatic broth from my usual joint (closed on Wednesdays, which is what precipitated this whole sad affair), the liquid in my faux pho from Se'nse seemed to be nothing more than water that had been sprinkled with green onions. The addition of the included garnishes, lime and  jalapeños, made me think they were peddling some sort of steaming Vietnamese take on the Master Cleanse. The rest of the meal was similarly disappointing: frozen, re-heated crab rangoon bereft of their crab but overflowing with gummy, sweet cream cheese, and an ostensibly spicy green curry that was treacly instead. *Okay, so I'm exaggerating. I didn't overdraw my account, but we're $30 poorer and still hungry.

11.description: Ordered the bao and the chicken pineapple fried rice.The bao was a joke- like a tasteless muffin. Which was followed by the Pineapple fried rice which lacked any flavor.The place was empty when I walked in but I figured maybe it was just the weather. I got fooled by the padded reviews. I'll stick with Polygon cafe down the street.

8.description: I will make it simple. The worst Thai Foods ever. I ordered the seafoods combo. Missing the squids and the shirmps were tiny. Nothing like the picture from the menu. Won't come back.

4.description: Picked up a To Go order last night.  Both the friendliness and helpful nature of the guy behind the counter are going to make me feel like a total jerk for what I'm about to write.  He was helpful and provided good customer service.  It's too bad the food is on par with mall food court Asian fast food.  Honestly, I actually wished that I could have a had the bourbon chicken from some mall spot rather than the sesame chicken I ordered at Se'nse.  I also ordered the Tai baby chicken egg rolls which were okay but not great.  Given the quality of the food I did get, I don't think it was just about what I ordered.  I'm not going to go back again.

14.description: I've been to Se'nse a handful of times now - for both dine-in and carry-out - and I can't say enough good things about it. The food is fantastic and consistent, the price is right, and the service is awesome. The same guy is always there to take our order, whether at the table or over the phone, and every time, he's got a huge smile, friendly and helpful attitude, and genuine appreciation for his customers. Seriously - he'll make you feel like you're the most important customer he's ever had.

6.description: All the food was not so great.  The shrimp crepes were bland and soggy. The pad Thai tasted like ketchup. The Thai spicy wings looked nothing like the picture on the menu. They were fried and not tasty.  The crab rangoon was baked and not fried. I won't be going back

58.description: While I've been to Andies several times in the past, this time around I went for a very unique Thanksgiving Dinner Buffet. Vegetarians and Carnivores alike will find many things to satisfy them at Andies. They have all the favorites: gyros, lamb, falafel, salads, and good hummus. For Thanksgiving, they also had all the traditional American fare: turkey, pork loin, ham, pumpkin pie, green beans, mashed potatoes, etc.There is a full bar, an excellent wine selection, and plenty of table and bar seating. The staff is attentive and the service has always been good. While not experts at making cranberry sauce, they are definitely experts at Turkish Coffee, and for that, I am always grateful.

56.description: Delicious and fresh. the tabouli salad is amazing, a perfect mixture of flavors.  First time trying the glogg and it was amazing as well.  Service was good, the only thing I didnt like was the chicken kabob, that was a little too salty for my taste.  Overall, great dinner experince; great food, great drinks, great service.

29.description: My wife and ordered delivery fromhere and were not impressed.  Andies had a 4th of July weekend special for 2.  The price was good and we soon found out why.For an appetizer we ordered spinach pie.  The pie involved three small wedges of spinach and dough.  Only one had any feta cheese in it.  The two others were essentially tasteless and soggy.We had lentil soup and lemon chicken soup.  The lentil soup was good.  The lemon chicken was a complete fail.  It tasted like nothing and I had to heavily salt it, add lemon and onion.  I usually leave the cooking to the professionals, but that was not an option here.For entrees we had beef shwerma and chicken curry.  The beef was dry with a lot of gristle and mostly inedible. It only tasted sweet and had no other flavor.  The chicken curry was okay.

42.description: One of the worse meals I've ever had. Food took forever, calamari was disgusting, chicken was dry and flavorless, potatoes were undercooked, vegetable moussaka was bland, even the saganaki was gross. How do you mess up saganaki? Questionable quality of ingredients. Gordon Ramsey save this restaurant from itself. Couldn't pay me to return, not even with the stack of $5 off coupons they gave us.

23.description: I ate her years ago pre-Yelp, but hadn't been back here in a long time until yesterday when I had lunch with a friend there.  What a great place to have lunch on a beautiful summer day.  We sat right by the open window with a nice breeze coming in.  I had the lentil soup (terrific) and the grilled asparagus salad which came topped with gorgonzola, tomatoes, and a lemon-lime vinaigrette.  It was a perfect combination.  My friend had the grilled shrimp salad and, when he asked for more shrimp, the brought out a skewer of grilled shrimp to add to his salad.  Perfect lunch spot.

47.description: On 3/08/2015, we were walking around Andersonville and came across this place.  We decided, "why not" and went in!  We were ever so happy that we did. As we walked in and was greeted by the nicest gentleman who escorted us to our table. We had a look at the menu but decided on the Sunday Brunch, and were not disappointed.  The food was delicious, the service was way above par, everything was clean, including the restrooms.  I can't wait go back and experience the menu.  Thank you Andies for an amazing brunch experience!OPA!

8.description: We decided to hit up Andersonville for some lunch and Sunday shopping.  There were quite a few restaurants to choose from, but after passing several and not being able to agree on where to go, we went with this one because they had some nice window seats.  It is a Mediterranean place and I noticed a couple other similar restaurants on the same street.  My hope is that those ones are better than this one.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive, she offered us the lunch buffet which they had going on.  However, when we looked at the buffet the food looked mostly picked over and not very appetizing.  We ordered a saganaki which was great and I got the beef kebabs.  The food was okay - nothing special, but certainly edible.  I wouldn't go here again if I were in the area - I'd try another place but if it were the only place open, I guess I would stop.

31.description: We Order lentil  soup salad and calamari ! Soup not that bad but calamari and Greek salad was terrible !! I heard lots of bad comments about here never ever come back ! Greek salad full of lettuce !!

34.description: Middle Eastern food fantasy!  What an incredible find - the shwarma were the best I've ever had.  Great falafel, hummus - everything is super fresh and gluten- free friendly.  Service was also excellent.  A new favorite for our whole family.

16.description: I regret giving this place another chance. I used to come here all the time years ago and it was always great. Then the service, quality, and quantity of food changed and I just stopped going.I came in on a Friday night by accident...so we decided to stay for dinner. The service was 2 stars, maybe 3 because of how they handled the following described experience. The food was 0.5-1 star.We ordered hummus and calamari for appetizer then the combination kabob. We received the hummus and pita...pita was stale and hard, hummus was ok but I noticed they only skim a thin layer of hummus on the plate then thicken it up around the circumference on the plate....so you don't get much hummus it just looks like a lot lol. The waitress asked if she should put our order in now because the calamari takes a long time to make. Which confused us because as soon as she walked away another waiter came to give us the calamari. The calamari was the worse I have ever had. It looked like it was fried in a ball, it looked awful on the plate and it tasted that way too. The calamari was hard, chewy, and tasted very fishy! I refused to eat the rest because I was scared to get sick. The waitress asked how we liked it and we shared our opinion. AND she admitted that most people say the same thing lol Then she asked if we wanted another one.....we said no.Our kabobs were ok. The steak kabob was hot and done to our liking. The veggies and rice were cold though. The dill rice seemed like they had regular long grain rice, went to their backyard to rip some dill leaves, then without chopping it just toss it together with the rice. I've had so much better from the restaurant next door to this place. The manager handled the situation well and offered desert on the house and took out the calamari off our order. When the waitress came with a platter of all the deserts they offered, my BF chose the tiramisu. 7 min later she came back and said they actually don't have any tiramisu. She offered something else and at that point we just really didn't care for desert and asked her for the check. She came back with the check and insisted we take a brownie to go. I'm just never coming back here again because of the food. I felt like I was on an episode of Hell's Kitchen lol

13.description: I haven't been here in a couple years before tonight.  My husband and I had a date night and it was a great as I remember it.  The restaurant wasn't too busy which was nice.  They had an option of having a pre-fix menu versus whatever was on the menu minus soup/salad, tea/coffee and dessert.  The price difference was about 4 bucks so we went for the pre-fix.  We started with the sagonoki.  It was really thin and was hard to get off the hot plate.  I would have expected it to be thicker and a little more than what was served.  It was good nonetheless.   We ate it with the warm pita bread they serve.  We both had the salad.  The dressing was delicious.  Some sort of vinegar type dressing.  The salad was a greek salad.  For dinner, I had beef sharemwa with dill rice.  It was so good!  It comes with a side of tahini and a few tomatoes and cucumbers.  That, along with the pita bread, was excellent!  The tea was good and there were free refills.  Perfect for a cold night like this.  Dessert was also included.  I had a piece of cheesecake with honey and pistachios.  It was so rich but very good.  The only reason I don't give five stars is because there were a couple of times I thought our waitress forgot about us.  She was nice and everything, but it was frustrating when she would disappear and the restaurant wasn't that busy.

11.description: This was a really good experience. Walking around Andersonville looking for something to eat. But there is no shortage of restaurants up that way. We came upon Andie's and looked over the menu in the window. There was standard Middle Eastern and Greek fare, but something told us to enter.It is dimly lit inside. The tables are white linen and the ambiance definitely Greek. While we were figuring out what we wanted we ordered hummus. It came out almost immediately. The way they serve it is with diced red onions, cucumber, kalamata olives and carrots. They serve it with a bowl of warm pita bread. And, wow, it was good.They have an extensive menu, and they also have a seasonal menu making the choice even harder. But, I settled on lamb cous-cous while my son chose a stuffed lamb burger. (Pictures of both were uploaded.) I have to say they food was outstanding. The service was also very good - I counted at least four different people who stopped by to make sure everything was up to par. The bowl of pita was constantly refilled as were our drinks.In an area where there are lots of restaurants, I would return to this one.

39.description: Andies is Amazing! From the wait staff, to the delicious food and drinks, to the phenomenal service. I went there for dinner with a few friends and we were just talking amongst ourselves that one of our friends is expecting a baby. The server overheard this and went above and beyond and exceeded our expectations by sending a nice desert saying congratulations. That small touch made a huge difference. It showed the staff cares for the customers. Their food was really delicious and fresh. It was as if the vegetables were grown in a garden in the back. I recommend the kefta kabob and the bread is to die for! Oh and can't forget about their Sangria...it's home made!

37.description: I was in the Andersonville nieghborhood and the only reason I ate here was because there was outdoor patio seating. The ownership is kind- and they are there to please you. It's a good chatty environment for families with young children and the buffet deal is so cheap so if you're not looking to eat anythign special, then just come here. The food is mediocre but it's not terrible. I would just never come back.

0.description: I came to this page just to look at pictures to decide what to order tonight, and was APPALLED to see so many bad reviews.  I read them out of curiosity.  A lot of people are saying the food here is bad.  I felt obliged to write a quick review because, in my opinion, Andies is easily one of the best restaurants in Chicago.  If you think the food is bad, then either something is wrong with your taste buds, or you aren't ordering the right things.As a vegetarian, this place is heavenly.  They have - by far - the best baba ganoush in the city.  I have had baba ganoush everywhere, and nothing comes close.  I think about it all of the time, and crave it.  It has just the right smokiness and creaminess.  They always garnish their appetizers with slices of pepper, cucumber, and olives.  Did I mention the pita bread is to DIE FOR?  Best pita bread ever.  Everything I've had there - from vegetarian combinations to pasta dishes to Morrocan Eggplant to mousaka to the delicious and nicely spiced vegetarian cous cous - has been outstanding.  I've been eating here for years and if there is every anything wrong with an order or missing or not quite right, the service response is impeccable.  My favorite dish here is the spinach pie, paired with the perfect Greek salad.  The yogurt sauce accompanying this dish is something I fantasize about on a regular basis.  One last tip:  Brunch.  They have a full buffet on Sundays that is good, but I actually prefer to go on Saturdays, when they serve truly delicious omelets and potatoes with a Mediterranean flair.  And it's usually empty, so don't tell anyone.  Brunching in this neighborhood can be pretty annoying.  Not at Andies, though.  Almost forgot - don't order the baklava unless you want to have a foodgasm.

38.description: This place has really gone down hill. I was there over the weekend. Food was just so so, service looked unhappy, and it's just not what it use to be.

51.description: Despite my coworker getting a severe allergic reaction to her meal, she actually liked the place a lot! The location, staff and atmosphere are all top notch. I actually don't get why people dislike this place. The food and drinks were good and the dessert was great! My coworker especially her tiramisu, and she's a dessert snob!

27.description: Love Andie's!  The food is fresh and excellent, service impeccable, helpful and always friendly. Holiday treat!

32.description: This is my third time here in 10 years as a group. It is always below mediocre. I don't know how this business survives while there is other places near by. The spinach pie was soggy.The kebaps are over cooked and tasteless.

54.description: This was a really good experience. Walking around Andersonville looking for something to eat. But there is no shortage of restaurants up that way. We came upon Andie's and looked over the menu in the window. There was standard Middle Eastern and Greek fare, but something told us to enter.It is dimly lit inside. The tables are white linen and the ambiance definitely Greek. While we were figuring out what we wanted we ordered hummus. It came out almost immediately. The way they serve it is with diced red onions, cucumber, kalamata olives and carrots. They serve it with a bowl of warm pita bread. And, wow, it was good.They have an extensive menu, and they also have a seasonal menu making the choice even harder. But, I settled on lamb cous-cous while my son chose a stuffed lamb burger. (Pictures of both were uploaded.) I have to say they food was outstanding. The service was also very good - I counted at least four different people who stopped by to make sure everything was up to par. The bowl of pita was constantly refilled as were our drinks.In an area where there are lots of restaurants, I would return to this one.

48.description: When I was a little girl, about 10 or so, I would anxiously await for my dad to come home from work. He would come through the door after a long hard day of work and bring us delicious food from Andies. One of my items on the menu were the chicken kebab over rice and the pita bread. I would ask my dad to bring some home for me almost every night. My dad worked long hours as a chef. He would go to work early in the morning and come home late at night. He believed in hard work and wanted to make sure everyone was satisfied with the food. My dad was a chef at Andies restaurant. I'm not exactly sure when he started working there but I believe he was there for a long time. Whenever I would go to Andies and request to see "Tony" my dad would come through the kitchen doors in his chef apron and chefs hat and I would give him a big hug. I loved calling Andies and asking to speak to Tony because I know that if ask for him now he wouldn't be there. My dad passed away in 2012. He was a hard working man. There was no stopping him. His name was Antonio. And he was the best chef Andies ever had.

44.description: It's so bad here. I had fond memories of this place from years ago but something is obviously amiss. The waitstaff is inattentive and appear miserable. The food is bad. We ordered calamari as an app and it seems old and over fried to mask the taste. It also appeared to come over a bed of generic bagged spring mix from the nearby Jewel. The soup was a watered down mess that tried to resembled chicken and rice. My entree hasn't arrived yet but I'm afraid. Part of me wants to cancel my order, pay for the apps and get the hell out of here, but I'm part of a bigger party and while everyone is disappointed, we aren't going to leave. I don't know what happened to this place but do yourself a favor and do not come here. You've been warned.UPDATEOur order took over an hour and we were only one of a handful of tables when we ordered. I had to send the risotto back. It was flavorless, no, that's not true, it had the flavor of a congealed rice cake. A sampling of other plates at the table included undercooked potatoes; dry, flavorless chicken; over salted dill rice; and overcooked shrimp.Adding insult to injury, we were seated at a broken table that sloped downward in each direction. That meant we had to take care that none of our plates or drinks rolled onto our laps. I will say that the Hellas beer seemed to be okay but not worth 5.75 a bottle.

24.description: I had such good hopes for this place as the service was really good from the minute we walked in. Food was lacklustre, the pita was kinda sad. My kebabs tasted alright, however they did not agree with my system one bit afterwards. I should have just gone with the familiar Reza's next door.

7.description: The family has been coming here for years and we've never been disappointed. Everything on the menu is perfect. Thank you, Andie's!

49.description: Valentine's Day menu fixed and very small. Disappointment for the person I took with me. Especially when I described all the great menu items they had . And what we did have was very very mediocre at best . Cold Pita bread . Tasteless salad dressing . Luke warm food . The Sangria tasted like all juice . Dried out chicken kabobs . Disappointed .

40.description: You do not want to miss out on a meal here!! We came in for dinner and had a fabulous time. The staff was so friendly, the food was amazing, and the sangria was so yummy! If you want a delicious meal and a good time you have to go to Andies!

53.description: Tonight was my first time here and I will definitely be back! The sangria was flavorful and not too sweet, and the Moroccan eggplant complemented it perfectly. Others in my party ordered shwarma and gyros, and everyone left full and happy

30.description: We stopped in here for vodka lemonades during Midsommarfest. The service was quick, the drinks were made to our specifications and everyone was pleasant. Good service and good prices.

46.description: It was quiet Thursday evening about 7.  Food and service was good.  I had the Chicken Kabob with dill rice and vegetables.  For an appetizer I had the grilled asparagus salad.Sometimes there are deals on livingsocial or Groupon.

1.description: We made reservations to enjoy Thanksgiving Dinner here. All I can say was big mistake, and never again....not even for a non-holiday dinner. We walked in and they did not have our reservation on file, come to find out they had it listed under the first name and not the last name. Really??? OK, things happen, but it should have given me a sign of things not going well.The waiter Derrick was great, I will say that the service was good. The dinner from a prix fixe menu included turkey, stuffing, green beans, sweet or mashed potatoes with cranberry sauce, and pumpkin pie. We started with butternut squash soup for my partner and a salad for myself. Both of these starters were really good, they also provided pita bread, complimentary, however if you wanted hummus to go with the bread, this is extra. This is a Mediterranean restaurant, this should be complimentary as well.....oh well...lesson learned. The turkey dinner came, and it was lackluster to say the least. The turkey was ok, but it was overwhelmingly dark meat.  The mashed potatoes actually had raw pieces of potato inside, and there was no gravy on the potatoes either!  Really??? The stuffing was ok, nothing to write home about. I did take a bite of something in the meal, thinking it was part of the dressing, and it was sprig of a seasoning bunch, which promptly got caught in my throat, I could not get this down and I began to choke. Very alarming. The manager did come to our table, and when we had spoken of all of the issues we were experiencing, and he did provide us with another serving of white meat turkey, as well as potatoes with gravy, however, there was yet another chunk of raw potato in the mashed....this is not acceptable.We found the staff to be accommodating , save for the hostess station, but with all the issues we had, we were really disappointed, and we will not be back.

55.description: So I came abut a month ago and the Brunch as ok ! I  decided to give it a second chance and this Time it was just like the old times Soooo Good , food fresh and healthy the service it's friendly and very helpful today Cassandra was my waitress and she was super nice . Good for you guys keep up the great work I definitely come back again.

9.description: While I've been to Andies several times in the past, this time around I went for a very unique Thanksgiving Dinner Buffet. Vegetarians and Carnivores alike will find many things to satisfy them at Andies. They have all the favorites: gyros, lamb, falafel, salads, and good hummus. For Thanksgiving, they also had all the traditional American fare: turkey, pork loin, ham, pumpkin pie, green beans, mashed potatoes, etc.There is a full bar, an excellent wine selection, and plenty of table and bar seating. The staff is attentive and the service has always been good. While not experts at making cranberry sauce, they are definitely experts at Turkish Coffee, and for that, I am always grateful.

26.description: I reviewed Andie's a couple of years ago with 5 stars, and they have only gotten better.  Great staff, the food is delicious with attractive presentation, and healthy(!) with a good number of gluten free options.  They continue to add new items to the menu over a period of time.  I've seen this place grow from it's original take out typical middle eastern menu, to an extensive menu of eclectic and multi-cultural options.  The lamb is grass-fed.  The salmon is wild caught, not farmed. High quality vegetables, including asparagus, and some good vegetarian options including a portobello lentil dish.  You can also get the old middle east standbys, such as hummous and falafel, and bthe way, the falafel is the least greasy falafel I've ever had. And, hooray hooray, the atmosphere is quiet and pleasing and a wonderful place to share with friends it you like to be able to enjoy a conversation with a meal without having to compete with loud noise.

25.description: This is a fantastic restaurant in Andersonville and one of our favorites for our neighborhood...for so many reasons. The food is fantastic! Fresh, classic and offers a lot of Gluten Free items...even homemade fresh GF pita bread which is really good! By the way my husband is not GF and still loves it, so it's not all about the GF here, but it certainly helps! The service is fantastic too! We have enjoyed all of the staff but happen to have enjoyed Cassandra's service more times than one. She is the best! My husband and I like to enjoy date nights alone, but sometimes we have to bring our 3.5 year old son. We couldn't believe the first two times we came in, the staff opened their arms to us and by the time our son was seated there was a brand new toy for him to play with, a bowl of crayons and a water cup with lid ready before we could even sit down. It's not a restaurant you would think is super kid friendly because there are usually adults with sans kids, but they went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and allow us to still enjoy a great "adult" evening. The atmosphere is great too! We love sitting by the open windows to take in the great restaurant ambiance but also to have the exposure to the sidewalk and people watching. Not only do we get to enjoy a great evening out with each other but with food and drinks we find ourselves craving throughout the week. It's nice to have a go-to restaurant in our neighborhood who is committed to great service AND great food. It's closely becoming our second home every weekend and we don't mind bringing our son. It's one of those restaurants on our neighborhood list that we would be really sad to ever see it go, so take our advice and go often and support local. Thanks Andies!

12.description: I came in for lunch and had the Chicken artichoke panini. Wow! Let me tell you...it was AMAZING. I was in panini heaven. The grilled chicken is so juicy and flavorful in a pomegranate sauce. It comes with, lettuce, tomato, onion, and mozzarella cheese. A side of chips or fries. Yummm

59.description: The gluten free selection is VERY large here! I had the stuffed lamb burger on a gluten free pita & was very full. My Indian boyfriend had the chicken and shrimp biryani (traditionally and Indian dish) and he was surprised at how well it was prepared.

21.description: My 10th visit. Food is usually good.   Today the steak kebabs were not up to par.  Dry.  Flavorless.  Old carrots.  .01 onion.  Ugh

17.description: After having a great experience at the Montrose Andies and a ho-hum experience at Reza's next door, we wandered into Andies. The service was very nice but the food just wasn't very good. My chicken kabob was super bland and not very hot although the rice was nice. My friend had the Moroccan chicken and it was very overcooked and just plain terrible. The atmosphere is nice but there weren't many people there for such a large place.

10.description: One of my favorite places. The food is phenomenal and the service was great. I love the ambience. Been there over 10 times so this vote counts!

5.description: Andies Restaurant in Andersonville is by far one of the BEST experiences I've had in a long time. It inspired me to start a yelp account, which I never thought I'd do. It was my second time at Andies. The first time was at lunch, which was delicious, but recently I had visitors in from out of town, and we went to Andies. I had a reservation for 8:00. We were greeted with warm smiles and sat promptly. We started with drinks. I had an Andies Speedbump Martini, my friends had Sangria and Glogg. All perfection!! Next, we were served Dip Samplers to go with the complementary warm toasted pita bread. Hummus, baba ganoush, a spicy roasted red pepper dip, called haressa and a garlic potato dip. All were super good, but the baba ganoush was out of this world!! Smokey flavor, easily the BEST IN CHICAGO. We also had the flaming cheese, Sakanaki and flaky Spinach pies. Thumbs up!!Time to order! One of my friends was gluten free and a vegetarian. She had an entire page of items to choose from and even homemade gluten free pita. (I was so relieved) After we ordered, the soups and salads came. Fresh, crisp greek salads with feta cheese! Mmmm. The Greek Avgalemono soup was also a hit. Next came our entrees. We shared everything. From the savory Tunisian Chicken, to the Beef Short Ribs, Vegetarian Mousaka, Asparagus Risotto, and spicy Curry Chicken and couscous. YUM YUM YUM!!! Every bite was hot, unique and DELICIOUS!! My friends came in from the burbs, so I was crossing my fingers to find a good place. We had so much fun. Thank you, Andies!! Also giving stars for the service. She had our back the entire night. Left her a great tip. Next time, I'm saving room for dessert!! My new favorite restaurant..

3.description: My wife and ordered delivery fromhere and were not impressed.  Andies had a 4th of July weekend special for 2.  The price was good and we soon found out why.For an appetizer we ordered spinach pie.  The pie involved three small wedges of spinach and dough.  Only one had any feta cheese in it.  The two others were essentially tasteless and soggy.We had lentil soup and lemon chicken soup.  The lentil soup was good.  The lemon chicken was a complete fail.  It tasted like nothing and I had to heavily salt it, add lemon and onion.  I usually leave the cooking to the professionals, but that was not an option here.For entrees we had beef shwerma and chicken curry.  The beef was dry with a lot of gristle and mostly inedible. It only tasted sweet and had no other flavor.  The chicken curry was okay.

35.description: This is one of my favorite restaurants, I've even driven from MN to eat here for my birthday. Stopped in first because it was near Too Much Light, a nearby theater. The Saganaki is good (I always order it), and I'm obsessed with their Pomegranate Chicken. They used to have an amazing Pomegranate Cheesecake, but I was told last time that it was taken off the menu. However, our waiter got the kitchen to make it for me anyway! (I once ordered 7 slices, one for their, and 6 for presents/later!) I've had their Glogg, which is also super good (and has pomegranate, ha). I also like their Avgolemono, though I like mine better (theirs is second best). Everyone I've brought here (save my picky boyfriend - he said it was OK) loved the food, my Israeli friend commented that while good, a lot of it is stuff you can just get from carts in Israel, at which point I said "Yeah, but I'm not IN Israel, how does it fair with comparative stuff in the U.S.?" He admitted that it's better than most. I've gotten to meet the owner's son, and it's his parents' interesting and eclectic background that influences their restaurant's style. He was super nice! I only wished I was closer to the city!

19.description: This is my third time here in 10 years as a group. It is always below mediocre. I don't know how this business survives while there is other places near by. The spinach pie was soggy.The kebaps are over cooked and tasteless.

28.description: Popped in on a weeknight for dinner and a bottle of wine.The food was unmemorable. At $15-20 per plate of kabobs, I'm not sure why I would come here over Reza's next door. Risotto was too creamy, and not very flavorful. Service was a little slow, as well. Won't be going back for dinner, which is a shame since I'm only a 10 minute walk away. I now understand why it's always empty when I walk by.

45.description: Used to love this place. But the last few times have been pretty awful. Last night both the service and food were completely off. The waitress apologized for my entree because she saw it was a disaster--- but then actually told me it was improperly cooked because I had ordered it without feta cheese. Oh okay, that's a stretch but at least they offered to comp it.

33.description: We decided to hit up Andersonville for some lunch and Sunday shopping.  There were quite a few restaurants to choose from, but after passing several and not being able to agree on where to go, we went with this one because they had some nice window seats.  It is a Mediterranean place and I noticed a couple other similar restaurants on the same street.  My hope is that those ones are better than this one.  Our waitress was friendly and attentive, she offered us the lunch buffet which they had going on.  However, when we looked at the buffet the food looked mostly picked over and not very appetizing.  We ordered a saganaki which was great and I got the beef kebabs.  The food was okay - nothing special, but certainly edible.  I wouldn't go here again if I were in the area - I'd try another place but if it were the only place open, I guess I would stop.

43.description: I've been to this place on multiple occasions and the service and food has yet to disappoint me. They make wonderful, homemade, authentic food along with delicious alcoholic beverages. And to top it off they also deliver. I've found the restaurant that makes me feel like I'm back in my mother's kitchen.

2.description: Ms T and I went to Andies for dinner while house sitting in A'ville.  It sounded good and came well recommended.  There was no problem getting a table even though it was a Saturday evening.  I started with a seasonal soup offering; Yellow Tomato with carrot threads and faro.  I found it harshly sour and one dimensional but it kind of grew on me and I did eat it all.  It just needed some balance.  I did like the texture that the faro added.  Ms T had a cup of the lentil soup, very simple.  She found it to be fine, nothing exceptional.  We shared a plate of Fried Calamari as we are wont to do.  Ms T thought it needed salt.  The calamari were fairly predictable except for the harissa that was almost like wing sauce, with vinegar in the chile.  I liked the change from the typical marinara that accompanies marinara.Ms T likes gyros and ordered the platter this time.  She ordered without onion, but it was delivered with onion anyway.  Fortunately the onion was extremely mild and did not stink up the table.  The serving of sliced meat was generous.  We both found it to be sliced too thin and dried out.  It was also too salty.  Flavor was rated OK, but this would be 2-1/2 stars on the gyro scale.  It was served with couscous.I decided on Chicken Breast Curry.  I do not know if curry in the Med area is typical, if so and if this is representative, it is certainly not like Indian curry.  It was in a clear-ish broth with lots and lots of the mild onion.  It was billed as being cooked with green and red bell peppers, but they were almost nonexistent.  There was a little summer squash.  It was served on the same couscous and the gyro platter.  This dish was also one dimensional, this time, just salt with some cumin.  To be honest, it was boring.We may always be expecting Greek style and flavors when we hear Mediterranean.  I wanted richer flavored dishes, kind of like when you want Hunan cuisine in a Chinese restaurant and get the Chicken in Snow Peas with the clear sauce.  I have it on good authority that this is a good place to eat and it warrants more sampling.  This meal was a weak three on the enjoyment scale.

18.description: This is my favorite place for authentic and natural Mediterranean food in Chicago. I've been to other places and there is no comparison. Loved the flaming saganaki dish and shawarma plate. Great wine selection. Whether you are coming on a date or with friends and family, the atmosphere is very nice and warm. Staff was super friendly !!!!

41.description: Awful experience. What happened to this establishment? Do you care about your customers at all? The service was awful and the food was worse! The waiter barely came around to check on our table. The food we ordered arrived over an hour after we ordered it. Tables that sat down after us we served before us and done with dinner by the time we got our food. We were told it was taking so long because they had to make more chicken for one dish we ordered. I hope so since that was what was ordered. Then we were told  that dessert was on them. At this point we didn't want to even stay. The risotto looked like kraft Mac and cheese and tasted like boxed rice.And  to add insult to injury, we were given a couple $5 off next visit coupons. What next visit? I'm never coming back here. So disappointed!!!

52.description: Sat for 20 minutes on a Saturday without even being acknowledged after they gave us water. There were probably 10 empty tables and 5 servers hanging out by the drink machine yet nobody would give us eye contact. It's a shame- the yelp reviews were great but maybe it was an off night? We left.

50.description: Was really looking forward to this first time on valentines but service was so slow and disinterested we left after a salad soooo disappointed :(

4.description: This place is HORRENDOUS for anyone looking to eat Gluten Free.  How dare this establishment advertise some meals as "Gluten Free", but only mean "portions of the meal are GF".  I ordered from Grubhub earlier this evening, what was clearly advertised as "chicken Kebab Gluten Free".  It came with rice, veggies, and pita.  Seeing as this establishment offers GF pita, I made sure to include in the notes to include the GF pita.  When I got my order, I noticed it came with a regular pita AND a GF pita.....along with a $2.73 adjustment charge.  I called Grubhub and explained the issue and the rep FULLY understood my gripe, so she called Andies to get the refund, and the told her they won't give it the $2.73 back, because "only the meal was GF, not the pita".  *confused face*.....Why would you label the WHOLE MEAL as GF when part of it isn't???  Luckily, Grubhub (with their amazing service) gave me a credit.  As someone who actually has Celiac Disease (recently diagnosed) and must eat GF, this is dangerous and misleading.  Clear case of False Advertising.  I will definitely report this to the Health and Safety Department.  Please take down the Gluten Free labeling from your menu.

6.description: Andies is a great place for Mediterranean food. Service was fast, and very good. You really feel like you're an appreciated customer by all staff. I went with a group of 3. We ordered a pitcher of the pomegranate sangria. I would say the pitcher size is a little low - it served about 3.5 glasses of sangria for 22 bucks. It would be nice if this were discounted or they increased the volume of sangria. other than the sangria, I felt the serving sizes and price points were pretty great. I had the house special kababs with dill rice. The flavors were on point. Overall, I had a great experience and I will certainly return. I'm excited to try takeout on a cold winter evening.

22.description: The atmosphere is cozy, the service is impeccable, and they serve the best baba ganouj I've ever tasted.

15.description: This is one of my favorite restaurants, I've even driven from MN to eat here for my birthday. Stopped in first because it was near Too Much Light, a nearby theater. The Saganaki is good (I always order it), and I'm obsessed with their Pomegranate Chicken. They used to have an amazing Pomegranate Cheesecake, but I was told last time that it was taken off the menu. However, our waiter got the kitchen to make it for me anyway! (I once ordered 7 slices, one for their, and 6 for presents/later!) I've had their Glogg, which is also super good (and has pomegranate, ha). I also like their Avgolemono, though I like mine better (theirs is second best). Everyone I've brought here (save my picky boyfriend - he said it was OK) loved the food, my Israeli friend commented that while good, a lot of it is stuff you can just get from carts in Israel, at which point I said "Yeah, but I'm not IN Israel, how does it fair with comparative stuff in the U.S.?" He admitted that it's better than most. I've gotten to meet the owner's son, and it's his parents' interesting and eclectic background that influences their restaurant's style. He was super nice! I only wished I was closer to the city!

57.description: I ordered stuffed artichoke which is one of my favorite Italian foods. First off, it seemed a bit too steamed, for it began falling apart as soon as I began to eat it and the artichoke heart was filled with water. The stuffing was a little plain as well. I do not recommend eating artichoke here.

20.description: The food was rather bland. Gyro meat was dry. I've had much better Mediterranean food.  The staff was very friendly.  Also: there is no sound diversion implements, the place has tile floors and it is LOUD.  We were in a group of about 40-50 people and I was having difficulty understanding the persons talking that were not immediately next to me.

36.description: Andies is by far the best restaurant in Chicago. Everything on the menu is delicious. What ever you're in the mood for, Andies has it. My go to is the Shawarma dinner. Everything they make is homemade and authentic. Not only do they have great food but the service is excellent and the restaurant is spacious and beautiful. I've been there many times and have had nothing but great experiences, you can tell they take pride in the excellence this restaurant provides! Come to Andies and I promise you will have no regrets, you'll want to come back and try more!

14.description: I'm not sure how to express my love for this place. Maybe I can tell you that I've spent numerous Christmas Eves here. Maybe I can mention the fact that when asked where I'd like to eat around North Side Chicago I always answer: "ANDIES!". Or maybe the dreams I have of their dill rice.Put simply, this place deserves 5 stars when it comes to their menu. My tastebuds are alway enlightened and somehow my guests and I always end up with something complimentary... Whether it be sangria, saganaki, or desert.I highly recommend ordering off of their Specials menu!!! Usually seasonal, the specials menu has become a good friend of mine along with allof the vegetarian entrees. The Moroccan Egglant being my favorite.Prior to my pescatarian declaration about 3 years ago, I experienced the bacon wrapped, chorizo stuffed dates in some sort of delightfully light tomato sauce. This is the last meat dish I remember eating, though I know many followed. Writing it now is almost enough to convince me to drop my lifestyle diet and indulge in these beautiful dates wrapped in things I haven't tasted for years. How lovely the flavor combination, along with texture. How tragic when the plate was scrapped clean. Ahhh, the emotions sizzling inside me all thanks to these dates!!Andies has a menu that can accommodate the American steak lover, the vegetarian, the GF cousin, the "I'm allergic to everything" individual, and even the pizza eating, overly picky friend we all have. The venue is spacious. The service is decent (though the owner/manager  and some of the servers provide impeccable service). The food is unforgettable! And rest assured knowing that Mediterranean food is good for the body ;)Opa!!

3.description: Just found this new salon in Andersonville and needed to find a new colorist.  I love my hair highlights and low lights that Jeannie gave me!  I am ME again!!  So happy to find this pretty convenient and clean salon right near home.

1.description: I went to this salon because of proximity to my house and the glowing yelp reviews. I have never gone to a salon without a referral. The reviews were right on! It is impeccably clean and it has a very comfortable ambience about it. But you still feel pampered. Rare combo. David is personable and funny and knows his stuff! The owner Michael is fun and you can tell knows how to run a business. I can't wait fir my next appointment!

2.description: David is fabulous! He knows his hair! He can cut any type of hair and make you laugh while doing it!

9.description: My husband got a haircut there a few days ago with David. It's fantastic. I think - no, I know - it's the best haircut he's gotten in a while. It was not a trim or reshaping of what he's had already. It was completely unchartered waters, from a longer mane-like hair to a short and stylish haircut.
