My husband is very happy with the new cut also. Without a doubt he is going back to David. I think this is also where I will be going in a few weeks.

10.description: I've been to a lot of places for a first haircut, not nearly as many for a second. I saw David a few weeks back, and will soon enough make my second appointment with him! He really took his time with me, was pleasant to be with, and did a great job on my hair.

4.description: A week into my new color- and holy moly I'm still in head-over-heels love with it. Michael is amazing. The technique he used for my hair was completely new (applying color on clean, wet hair) but he knows his color and his hair science because after numerous botched colors recently, my hair hasn't looked better in a long, long time.The salon is lovely. Beautiful, clean space. Great location with plenty of street parking. Good prices. Honestly- I've found my new hair home!

6.description: Love love love how great I feel and look when I leave Fuss. Jenny is awesome. I'm so excited to finally have such amazing service and know that I'm going to leave looking great!

12.description: This is a great little salon with a healthy product line, great service and no-nonsense prices.

5.description: I don't usually do repeat reviews, but I have to say David has truly been the BEST!!! I have been growing my hair out since the beginning of the year when I started seeing David.  We can all lament the growing out phase and how awful it can be, but not with David's help.  I have gotten more complements on my hair while it has been growing out than ever before.  David is so talented.  I always give him the credit.  Thank you, David!!!

11.description: I started going to Jennie a few years ago at blowtique, a hair blowout salon in the Gold Coast.  I was devastated when she left there in April, but found out she was going to a salon that she could use her skills outside of just hair blowouts.  I found out Jennie was at Fuss Salon, and made an appointment with her to get my hair done.  I was a little nervous at first because I'm really picky with my hair, and she had only ever really given it a good wash and blow out.  To my surprise she was just as wonderful at coloring as she was blowing it out.  She is very detailed with her work, and wants to do anything to make you happy, and make your hair exactly how you want it.  Having said that she will also let you know from an experts perspective if you are being unrealistic.  Which I like.  Jennie is great, love her!

8.description: I really like getting my haircut with David at Fuss Salon.  The atmosphere is very professional, but also relaxed and friendly.  They also use environmentally responsible hair products.  It's a bonus that it's in walking distance from my apt. in Andersonville.

0.description: David rocks!! He gave me a great modern, edgy bob and he's a really nice, smart person as well. Go check out Fuss Salon (and I'm not just saying that because Fuss is my maiden name).

7.description: Jennie saved me! I had a botched hair color which left me with intense orange/copper roots instead of auburn. I felt like bozo. what could be worse? I called around and spoke to Jennie who definitely seemed to be the right person for the job. She got me in right away.  She knows the science of coloring! she didn't just pick a new color but custom blended one that would work the best to cancel out the orange and leave me with a beautiful hair color. No traces of orange! she steamed my hair while the color was processing and used a few drops of oil when all was said and done and my hair feels great! I went from looking horrible to getting a nice wink from a cute guy at the bank an hour later.  what could be better? she's a keeper!

58.description: Great place, great food, awesome drinks, staff were great..this place is just great, recommended place to go to for a n awesome time.

56.description: Andersonville needed something like this a restaurant with a variety of foods and drinks. We have been here a few times with friends.  We were super happy with the service.  Foods were great and staffs were nice &  friendly. We also stopped in one Saturday night at Elixir for a few cocktails. Yes absolutely come back again. P.S. The Bacon Cubana and Lobster Benedict were so so good.

29.description: Ben the manager ROCKS!!!!!  He is attentive when the music is too slow and is a great supporter of the CTU!!!!!

42.description: It had just opened when I went with a couple of friends, so it was really busy. Our server was clearly overwhelmed with so many tables to help. Despite this, the customer service, food, and atmosphere was great. The owner of the place was also making rounds and checking in. He's a really friendly guy!

23.description: Went here to try Sunday brunch. It was OK, though I think a few of my nearby favorites have far, far, FAR superior food. The menu items looked promising, but this is Denny's style food, not unlike Mary's, their neighbor to the north. I could see this being a nice choice during summer, with the front windows open, etc. I don't give a rat's rump about games but my dining companions oohed and ahhed at the choices. Lots of 80s and 90s nostalgia.

47.description: Let me draw you a picture. Old school games all about, delicious food, and great drinks. Why aren't you in there?  It's amazing. A personal favorite.

8.description: We went for brunch last Sunday. It's a cool, fun place with indoor and outdoor seating and plenty of TVs to watch sports, but as others have said, they have some kinks to work out. We waited a crazy long time for our food, and when it finally came, mine was cold. We sent it back and they ended up discounting our bill, which was really nice. The food was pretty good - Replay Benedict was okay, but the bacon sausage wasn't as exciting as I had hoped, and the mustard hollandaise was kind of overpowering. It came with red potatoes (very good) and a random English muffin with nothing on it or with it. The bacon waffle was awesome, however. Really interesting flavors, loved the butter (can't remember what kind, but it was awesome). Lots of perfectly cooked bacon included. We actually tried going back later on Sunday to watch the 7:30pm football game, and they were out of almost everything, so we left. We will give them another shot in a month or so. The place has a great concept and lots of potential.

31.description: We are regulars here now. The fish tacos and Reuben are divine. The cocktails are amazing and there's a huge whisky and beer selection. It's fun to get up and play Ms Pac Man after having sat and watched the Hawks play. The service is great. A welcome addition to the hood.

34.description: This place had a great beer selection (was able to snag a limited one-time release from 3 floyds the other night on draft). The arcade games were a nice touch, though don't expect to play anything that works too well. Didn't have any food, so can't speak towards that. Overall, a great place to go for a night out in Andersonville.

16.description: Cute place with (mostly) free arcade games. Brings back the child in me - especially when we played a few levels of Rampage. Drinks were tasty and so were the chicken nachos - had the fried pickles which were very tasty, but the breading fell off very easily. We weren't there for very long but I could see myself returning to try out more of their beer selection. Seems like they will have a pretty decent amount of drinks on draft.

13.description: Free classic arcade game play how could it not be a good place.Big selection of craft beers.Don't forget to order nachos.Hope to be back soon.

11.description: Fun, but a little cramped. Good food and service.

39.description: This restaurant just opened, but we've already visited a number of times. Typically you'll experience a few hiccups when a place is just starting up, but not here. Extremely well trained staff that provides great service. Prompt seating, fast ordering, cold beer, tremendous food, and free 80's video games...what more could you ask for! Kudos the hard working servers and the attentive management.

37.description: Friendly, great-looking servers, and enjoyable cocktails.  But food quality is uneven.  1st time ordered the Nachos.  Toppings were interesting, but chips were cold & greasy--didn't sit well around 2 o'clock in the morning.  2nd visit ordered the Cubano sandwich--pretty good, but it took 45 minutes for it to arrive, and the server charged me only half the menu price as compensation.  3rd visit ordered the Caesar salad w/grilled chicken--very disappointing: the lettuce wasn't particularly crisp or chilled, and the handful of nondescript-looking cubes of cold chicken breast weren't appetizing (no indication it was ever grilled).  Suggestion to the kitchen: use an unsliced, half-breast of chicken, grill it, then slice it and serve it atop the Romaine.  THAT would be worth the $16 price.  Side note: during 3rd visit friends at the table next to me ordered before I did, but never received their orders until after I'd eaten my salad and was on my way out.  Bottom line: good place to drink & survey the hot guys.  But the kitchen needs work.

0.description: Just enjoyed a quiet Valentine's brunch with the boo at Replay Sunday and thought I'd give an update to my previous review.Replay was a bit crowded upon arrival but not bad (likely because of the bad weather) but nonetheless the host offered to seat us next door at Elixir which is what we opted to do. It was a nice quiet change of pace for a relaxed brunch! Our service was great as usual. I ordered the steak breakfast burrito, and BF got the Ruben again. The food was delicious and did not disappoint! My burrito was HUGE, and absolutely loaded with steak. So loaded in fact that I decided to just take the steak out and save it for Monday's lunch. Eggs don't keep that well, ya hear? The pico and beans were delightfully flavored and the whole wheat tortilla was good too, not grainy and cardboard-y as they can sometimes be. I got the smashed potatoes as my side and they were perfectly crispy and amazing. Of course BF enjoyed his Ruben again, which I tried and approved of as well! As I mentioned, I ate the steak on a salad yesterday for lunch. It was just as tender, juicy, and flavorful as it was on Sunday! Literally got two whole meals out of this.Since we were at Elixir, we were able to order cocktails off of that menu as well (by the way they have AMAZING handcrafted cocktails and super awesome bartenders but that's another review). I had a Kir Royale which was expertly crafted, balanced, and delicious.I love this place! It just keeps getting better!

38.description: This was by far the worst 44th B-Day experience. The only good thing about this experience was the fast seating for a party of 6 with 1 additional guest. In short, I lost 3 of my week days with food poisoning. I have filed a complaint with CCDPH and provided them with a list of the guests in attendance. The problems:1. We sat about 30min without being waited on by a server. The server, we thought would wait on our table waited on the table behind us, that arrive about 15 minutes after we were seated. The table behind us was all men, while our table was all women. I don't know if this had something to do with the crappy food or service we received but, we did notice they were ALL drinking and eating their meals almost immediately after being seated by the host. 2.We finally asked a random server, if we could please place our order. A server was finally assigned to our table and began to take our order. That is, until I asked about an item on the menu, and the server didn't know how to describe the preparation of the item excusing himself never to return.3. After our waiter never returned, and completely frustrated and hungry, I went to manager and explained what happened. I told him, we have been waiting forever, and the server that finally waited on us disappeared after asking a question about a menu item never to return.  The manager said he would take care of things. I went back to the table to wait. 4. The same server came back and completed our order and never did answer the question about the item menu--Go Figure!. Several minutes passed after he took our order, and again, I went to the manager and asked where our drinks and appetizers were. At this point  mind you, we didn't even have the basics WATER on the table and two people were missing cutlery. The manager said he would take care things again. I went back to the table to wait. 5.SURPRISE --- A new server arrived at our table without our pre-ordered drinks or appetizers. He told us that he would be replacing our server and would need to take our order. Felling like I was in the twilight zone, I said, "um, we already ordered with the previous server and we have been waiting a very long time". He seemed confused; why does that surprise me. He apologized and left us all sitting at the table wondering what was going on. I was ready to leave and go to Calo Ristorante across the street. My friends said to give the place a chance. Unfortunately, we stayed making the most of the bad service. 6. Moving on--About 10 minutes after the new server left us, he returned to our table with our drinks. The drinks were incorrect and so they needed to remake two. 7. Finally, our appetizers arrived, and the drinks issues were resolved-- Yippie!!!  The main meals came shortly after the drinks and appetizers. 8. More problems-- Go figure! My order was improperly made; the manager was called over again, and the food was sent back to the kitchen. My friend, ordered a simple burger MED - she received a burger that was way under-cooked and bright red. She had to eat around the uncooked meat. The manager was notified again, he said he would speak to the cook about the problem. The sad part about this entire ordeal is that the manager did not comp her burger after seeing the food preparation; nor, did he comp my meal considering all that had occurred. Instead, the manager offered ME one free drink, and a free birthday moose. I guess asking me what item I would have liked was not in the cards. 9. Sadly, the  initial bill for dinner was around $220 including 20% tip. I know, I don't know why I gave the server a reasonable tip considering the service and such. The second bill was for only drinks, and it  was about $130.00 including tip (approximately that amount).  Some b-day party! In closing,  this was the first time we were at this establishment-- that is 7 guests that live in ANDERSONVILLE, that will most likely never be back. If you are a woman (gay or straight) and are visiting in a large group; be forwarded, women are NOT wanted (my opinion and personal experience). This lesson was expensive, not to mention, I lost out on THREE days of my week from food poisoning. So you do the math-- Thanks Replay, for the free beverage and chocolate moose -- This is a birthday I will NEVER forget.

51.description: So excited about this place being in the neighborhood. Had beers on occasions but finally had brunch last weekend. The corn beef hash was amazing!!!  All four of us at the table really liked the food.  Was a great mix of people in there too making it a great neighborhood hangout.

27.description: Fast service with spot on wait staff. Great food: we had nachos and burger. Yum! Fantastic beer selection and free arcade gaming. Great concept and execution! Looking forward to next time I can suggest we stop by. Perfect for a weekend afternoon or a fun date.

32.description: Cute place with (mostly) free arcade games. Brings back the child in me - especially when we played a few levels of Rampage. Drinks were tasty and so were the chicken nachos - had the fried pickles which were very tasty, but the breading fell off very easily. We weren't there for very long but I could see myself returning to try out more of their beer selection. Seems like they will have a pretty decent amount of drinks on draft.

54.description: I've been there several times since it has opened at various times giving me the opportunity to try many of the items on the menu. The food was delicious but the Cuban was a standout. I sat at the bar all three times that I have been there and have had great service with all bar tenders.

48.description: I am so glad that I live far from Andersonville because if I lived close to Replay then I would probably lose contact with all of humanity, my boyfriend would break up with me, and I'd be fired from my job.This place is pretty great! We came in before a show at Mary's Attic. We were a group of 5 people and got a table with no problem. The service is prompt and friendly.I like that they play regular tv AND retro tv shows. We enjoyed the mullets on American Gladiator. I also love the free video games and pinball.But the best part is that its a bourbon and beer bar. They have a healthy list of both. The bourbon cocktails were a little on the too sweet side, but I was impressed by the options. Maybe you can order it with less sweet.We started with fried pickles which were fantastic. You can tell that they make them there. They're dipped in this corn meal batter, and served with ranch. They're the sandwich pickles.I ordered a turkey burger and it was also great. I think they make the patties there. They had a nice spice to it. Maybe sage and something else? I couldn't put my finger on it. Real nice for a bar burger.

44.description: Me and my boyfriend have been talking about this place for a month and when I came down from NY last wk to visit it was our first stop! The food was amazing and the service was great! We are definitely going back again!

24.description: Tried Replay again for brunch a few weeks ago and am happy to report back, kinks are fixed, food is spot-on and overall, this is a wonderful little addition to the Clark St. Andersonville scene.

7.description: Have been going to Replay in Boystown for a long time so I went here with a group of friends when they first opened. It look us nearly 3 hours to get our food, which was good, but not worth the wait. I decided to give it another chance and went back last weekend and the service was still awful. The food is pretty good, but don't go if you have any time constraints.

49.description: I'm very impressed with this place!!! Food is great service is spot on! VERY HAPPY CAMPER

40.description: Stopped here on a whim. Killer bloody Mary's and michiladas. Cobb salad was unique and delicious, kale spinach salad also very well executed. Hand cut fries were hot and crispy. Fun clean space and fast friendly service. A very pleasant surprise for just stumbling in. I'll be back for sure!

53.description: Been here for brunch and dinner - particular highlights were the biscuits, the fried chicken (super juicy) and the fried green tomatoes.  It was about two weeks from my first visit just after opening to my second this weekend and the service and timing issues seemed to be gone.  I was only sad that they ran out of decaf coffee.

30.description: My impression from any of the positive reviews here is that the reviewers have never been to any of the (far superior) barcades in Chicago. While indeed most of the games here are free, pinball costs a dollar and the selection of games in general is incredibly limited compared to similar concepts.My real issue is the fact that I came in to check this space out on a weeknight, and there were literally four other customers in the place, and we sat at the bar for what seemed like forever (probably 20 minutes in reality) before the bartender even pretended to notice us. He was clearly too busy talking with one particular customer to even bother greeting us. Once we finally were greeted and given a menu, we waited another 15 minutes while the bartender completely ignored us, and eventually *left to smoke a cigarette*. Right in front of the building. While we were waiting. He didn't even bother sneaking out the back. Totally unprofessional and unacceptable. How am I supposed to support a new local business when their employees literally refuse to take my money?The bartender walking out the door before even taking our order was definitely enough to encourage us to do the same. We won't be back.

46.description: Judging from the constant crowds here, Replay clearly fills a niche in Andersonville: a gay-friendly arcade sports bar with food that's one notch above standard bar fare. But just one notch. A few menu items like the tomato soup and hummus taste as if someone does care about the food they're putting out, and the fried pickles and fried tomatoes get a pass mostly because they're, well, fried. But the flavors and presentation of the burgers are fairly blah. Especially the veggie burger: two hard, bland frozen patties out of a box. And if they're not frozen? Yikes. As for the video games: great idea. It'd be even better if they all worked. And why are the video games free but the pinball machines take a dollar? Just make them all gratis.Still, Replay is a fun, lively space. It's super-loud and very cramped, but the big windows looking onto Clark and Balmoral give the space a light, open feel.

1.description: To the best of my knowledge they are known for brunch. So then why did I go for dinner when I had my eye on the bacon waffles. Stupid. Stupid. Stupid! I was so not impressed with the atmosphere. We went on a Sunday night and walked in to football playing on the TV with the speakers on blast. I can deal with a sports bar atmosphere but not when I can hear the TV and some clown at the table next to me screaming at the TV...right in my ear. This was his football game but it was MY  dinner. I had French onion soup. Nothing special. Not too bad. I also had a kale and beet salad which was pretty good. It didn't wow me but it was good and I was happy there was a healthy option.

55.description: Had brunch here a a couple weeks ago. What a great addition to Andersonville.  Food was great and the atmosphere was so inviting. I am excited to have both replay and elixir in the hood now

9.description: My friend and I went for the 1st time - It was a Monday so nothing major going on. Walked in and stood at the podium for a moment since the sign indicated "Please Wait" and after waiting for a few minutes we just took a seat. Joe came to our table and  welcomed us and made us feel welcomed.  Joe told us about the specials and took our orders, told us about the games and to have a good time. We had a great time and his service was fantastic. We only ordered appetizers and drinks which were great, Joe made a few suggestions based on our drink  request. We had a great time, Joe provided great service and because of that we will be back! Thanks Joe :)

26.description: First time here and it was great. The food and drinks are delicious and our waiter, Joe, was excellent!!  Will definitely go back!

25.description: Fabulous Food, Fabulous Service.....the potatoes are to die for!!  However, if you are looking for a place to watch football on a Sunday...not the place.  The TVs are on but music is blaring. and no sound for any of the games....

12.description: A cool bar that has unlimited free play arcade games. The games are mostly from the previous decade, but some are still really fun.As for drinks, the cocktails were nothing special, but they have a lot of craft beer selection. They also have some really interesting flavor infused shots which they claim that its just soaked in fruits/flavors for a long time to make the shots taste that way.

59.description: I've been at this new location quiet a few times.I live in the neighborhood and if there is something I keep telling friends that live and don't in the area is that Andersonville has been waiting long enough for a place like this. Our only options there were Marty's, hamburger Mary's, and @mospher, options that I honestly never been a big fan of. So boystow has been always ground zero for all my friends. Brunch was tasty, the menu seems full of different choices, defiantly there is something good for everyone. Fun atmosphere, perfect for a brunch date or with friends. Everyone is very friendly, always making sure you have everything you need on your table. The bar looks amazing, whoever designed the bar and the place in general did a great job. Love it. Highly recommended!! It's a place you must try.

21.description: Delicious, flavorful, and natural food.  Competent and friendly waitstaff.  Had an amazing turkey pot pie after thanksgiving that was so tasty, I got a second one to go.  The Strawberey Rhubarb French Toast was delicious too.  Will be back soon.

17.description: Tried Replay again for brunch a few weeks ago and am happy to report back, kinks are fixed, food is spot-on and overall, this is a wonderful little addition to the Clark St. Andersonville scene.

10.description: They got it together!  Just ate here for the second time and was totally impressed with the service, the menu and the taste of everything.  Nice job Replay!  We will be back for more.The food was hot and the drinks were cold and well made. Elixir is next on the list... I wish the restaurant a very successful life in Andersonville. YUMM!

5.description: A great addition to the neighborhood. Free arcade games. Good food menu with enough basics and some unique items. Great beer list. I like that you can go in and just have drinks and stand near the games or you can head in for dinner and sit down. The staff seems overwhelmed at times and bartenders can't always give you lots attention, but my only beef is that they seem just plain unhappy to be there a couple times I have been in. I have only had the fried pickles and a reuben but both were tasty and solid choices!

3.description: Very excited to update this review!After my two star review a month or so ago, the owner, Mark, invited us back to experience Replay again. Our service was a 180 from last time. Our server (I wish I remembered his name, please Mark, give this guy a pat on the back!), went above and beyond for us. The food was great. Cooked to order this time. We split the nachos (seriously...maybe the best thing on the menu), my boyfriend had a burger, I had the grilled chicken sandwich.We enjoyed food, drinks and (free!!) old school arcade games, and based on the experience we had tonight, I'd recommend anyone in the Andersonville area to stop in. Can't wait to give their brunch a try!

35.description: Simply Amazing!  Service is top notch.  And the food is amazing.  We had fried tomatoes & pork belly for appetizers. The pork belly was SOOOOO GOOD!  And I had the cubano sandwich which is HEAVEN on a plate.Can't wait to go back for brunch!!

19.description: Went here to try Sunday brunch. It was OK, though I think a few of my nearby favorites have far, far, FAR superior food. The menu items looked promising, but this is Denny's style food, not unlike Mary's, their neighbor to the north. I could see this being a nice choice during summer, with the front windows open, etc. I don't give a rat's rump about games but my dining companions oohed and ahhed at the choices. Lots of 80s and 90s nostalgia.

28.description: Fun. Overpriced but they know it. Stiff competition in the neighborhood. Food was very good, but the selection was lacking. Will definitely try it again, but I'm a hard sell on concept bars that don't quite meet the primary criteria of having good food. Great staff and service. I look forward to changing my opinion once they get it together. Overall wasn't bad, but I can get a good burger at a dozen other places.

45.description: Have been here a couple of times since they opened.  At first, there were some timing issues but the last time I went, they seemed to have resolved those issues.  My friends and I were there for the Cubs playoff game.  It got busy but our server, Mark, was attentive and took care of our needs.  The food has always been good.  We started with the fried pickles, which were tasty.  I had the Reuben, one friend had the Cubano, another friend had the nachos with chicken and another friend had the fried chicken.  All of us enjoyed what we ordered.  For brunch, the breakfast steak burrito is a great choice.  The drinks are tasty and who doesn't mind playing some Ms. Pac-Man or Dig Dug while waiting for your food.  Overall, a welcome addition to Andersonville!

33.description: Best gazpacho and hummus I've ever had. Great turkey and beef burgers. There's been a wait 2/4 times I've been there prob because it's still a new spot but the old video games make that not a pain. VERY nice servers every time.

43.description: I am digging the vibe at this bar. Replay in and of itself was a gay bar in Boystown but in Andersonville it is appealing to everyone and delivers regardless of sexuality. The food there is very good, the service is great and there are tons of interesting games to play. The decor has been tastefully done and the open windows adds a nice touch. The same amazing beer selection is present at this bar. We had a party of 8 come in impromptu and got seated in only 20 minutes! They were very gracious to work with.

2.description: So I finally tried the food a month ago, and since I liked it, I'll give them that coveted 4th star. The pork and beef burger patty is grinded in house(according to the server myself and my friend had), and I really enjoyed that burger a lot. I'm oddly forgetting what my friend ordered at the moment, but it was also good.Only thing for the most part I still don't like is their policy of charging for the pinball games while keeping the rest of the games free, which I confirmed after talking to an employee here. Or maybe they could borrow a page from Logan Arcade, and make those games free like 1 day a month? Otherwise, I'm a fan for the most part, despite it not having the number of games either location of Headquarters, Emporium Wicker Park, or Logan Arcade has.

18.description: Great place to watch a game! Big TVs everywhere!!!pretty good beer selection. Food was just ok. We had nachos first that were just ok. The chips were great. Then we had fried pickles that were just an epic fail. Never had fried pickles cut length wise. Nor ever had them breaded w corn meal. The breaking came off leaving you w this big piece of pickle. Not very good. The arcade games were great! Great whiskey menu. I will return but probably not to eat.

41.description: Really fun place with a great staff! All the classic video games are available to play at no cost! There is a huge beer menu with unique selections. I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a fun, laid-back night.

52.description: It was close, it could be a two stars as well, but the staff was nice and courteous and that's why it got the extra star. The concept is great and the list is unique along with the mixed media and entertainment. However the food was mediocre at best. The fries were overcooked with no seasoning (including salt), and the "gourmet" beef was nothing special. Also, none of the ketchup bottles on my table or the surrounding three tables had any ketchup in them as well, that has never happened to me. It looks like someone is not completing their checklist to cover quality issues both on the floor and in the kitchen.  I don't know if they will fix the issues or not.

50.description: Enjoyed Sunday brunch today with friends.   Straightforward menu -- sampled bloody marys, chilaquiles, biscuits & gravy and excellent coffee.  Place was packed, but the outdoor sidewalk seating was available so we only waited 5 minutes.   Friendly efficient service, large portions, fun vibe and good value.  Nice addition to the neighborhood -- could give Lady Gregory's and Hamburger Mary's some competition for the everyday "go to" spot.   Looking forward to returning to try more of the menu.

4.description: Fast service with spot on wait staff. Great food: we had nachos and burger. Yum! Fantastic beer selection and free arcade gaming. Great concept and execution! Looking forward to next time I can suggest we stop by. Perfect for a weekend afternoon or a fun date.

6.description: At first, the front was a little overwhelming because there was so many people, also being given a wait time of 35 min for a table, but then we realized we would much rather be at a place where people wanna be (which it looked like everyone was enjoying themselves).The place was also a little tight as far as tables but maybe they wanted us to make friends with the table next to us hahaGirl behind the bar was seriously killin it!!! And our server (can't remember his name) wore a hat but he was super smiley On to the food, the nachos were kind of hard to eat, nice that there was a mound of goods on top but also nothing when you get to the bottom, just the chips. And the Cubano was such a good recommendation!!! Almost instantly fell in love with the sand which. Will I be back? Yes please!

22.description: Just had a great meal with friends at Replay in Andersonville. The special  squash soup was delicious! Mark our server was really great and friendly. My burger was great too.

15.description: This was by far the worst 44th B-Day experience. The only good thing about this experience was the fast seating for a party of 6 with 1 additional guest. In short, I lost 3 of my week days with food poisoning. I have filed a complaint with CCDPH and provided them with a list of the guests in attendance. The problems:1. We sat about 30min without being waited on by a server. The server, we thought would wait on our table waited on the table behind us, that arrive about 15 minutes after we were seated. The table behind us was all men, while our table was all women. I don't know if this had something to do with the crappy food or service we received but, we did notice they were ALL drinking and eating their meals almost immediately after being seated by the host. 2.We finally asked a random server, if we could please place our order. A server was finally assigned to our table and began to take our order. That is, until I asked about an item on the menu, and the server didn't know how to describe the preparation of the item excusing himself never to return.3. After our waiter never returned, and completely frustrated and hungry, I went to manager and explained what happened. I told him, we have been waiting forever, and the server that finally waited on us disappeared after asking a question about a menu item never to return.  The manager said he would take care of things. I went back to the table to wait. 4. The same server came back and completed our order and never did answer the question about the item menu--Go Figure!. Several minutes passed after he took our order, and again, I went to the manager and asked where our drinks and appetizers were. At this point  mind you, we didn't even have the basics WATER on the table and two people were missing cutlery. The manager said he would take care things again. I went back to the table to wait. 5.SURPRISE --- A new server arrived at our table without our pre-ordered drinks or appetizers. He told us that he would be replacing our server and would need to take our order. Felling like I was in the twilight zone, I said, "um, we already ordered with the previous server and we have been waiting a very long time". He seemed confused; why does that surprise me. He apologized and left us all sitting at the table wondering what was going on. I was ready to leave and go to Calo Ristorante across the street. My friends said to give the place a chance. Unfortunately, we stayed making the most of the bad service. 6. Moving on--About 10 minutes after the new server left us, he returned to our table with our drinks. The drinks were incorrect and so they needed to remake two. 7. Finally, our appetizers arrived, and the drinks issues were resolved-- Yippie!!!  The main meals came shortly after the drinks and appetizers. 8. More problems-- Go figure! My order was improperly made; the manager was called over again, and the food was sent back to the kitchen. My friend, ordered a simple burger MED - she received a burger that was way under-cooked and bright red. She had to eat around the uncooked meat. The manager was notified again, he said he would speak to the cook about the problem. The sad part about this entire ordeal is that the manager did not comp her burger after seeing the food preparation; nor, did he comp my meal considering all that had occurred. Instead, the manager offered ME one free drink, and a free birthday moose. I guess asking me what item I would have liked was not in the cards. 9. Sadly, the  initial bill for dinner was around $220 including 20% tip. I know, I don't know why I gave the server a reasonable tip considering the service and such. The second bill was for only drinks, and it  was about $130.00 including tip (approximately that amount).  Some b-day party! In closing,  this was the first time we were at this establishment-- that is 7 guests that live in ANDERSONVILLE, that will most likely never be back. If you are a woman (gay or straight) and are visiting in a large group; be forwarded, women are NOT wanted (my opinion and personal experience). This lesson was expensive, not to mention, I lost out on THREE days of my week from food poisoning. So you do the math-- Thanks Replay, for the free beverage and chocolate moose -- This is a birthday I will NEVER forget.

57.description: A deft fit for Andersonville - fun, utterly lacking in pretension, good food, friendly service, healthy pours, open late, and FREE '80's video games.  'Nuff said.

20.description: What a delight to have this spot in Andersonville! I've gone several times , and each time i'm treated superbly by the staff. Craig ( I believe Collins last name) In particular is nice, attentive and always watching out for the customers . But that's NOT taking anything away from the rest ( just don't remember names well) . What's not to like really? Drinks are brought when you want one, popcorn bowls brought to everyone, good looking people everywhere... I could go on and on. The food I've had is quite good also. People who rate a place on one plate of food they've had , is selfish and unfair. It may be that your taste is different. Not that the food is bad. The overall feeling in this place is very good. I'm really happy it opened . We've needed a place like this north of BT.

36.description: Very excited for Replay to expand into my backyard.  As my favorite hang out in Lakeview, namely for the bourbon and IPA drink options and the relaxed, open air atmosphere it offers, I have been eagerly awaiting for Replay-Andersonville all summer.  Upon opening, I may have been there a handful of times in the opening week and have returned many times since.  My takeaway and why I write this review.1) The owners did a great job with creating a fun space and kept a bar/dining space separate from the gaming area. Best of both worlds.2) Windows on both street fronts makes for an open atmosphere3) The multitude of televisions and sports they play.  This is my favorite hang out for catching a beer and "the game" which is important to me as I don't have a live sports cable package at home.  4) The crowd...it has brought in a bunch of fun silly-hearted folks from the neighborhood and beyond that are out for a relaxed meal or drink and are okay with chatting it up with a neighbor.  Have meet a couple of great new neighbors, gay/straight/male/female.  5) Food...Nachos and burgers are great.  Have ordered it a couple times. I'm a creature of habit but am trying to taste other things.  The turkey burger was a so/so the first time I dined at Replay but the kitchen was also just a couple days old and others have enjoyed theirs since.  I'll give it a pass.  6) Service...again a little slow the first week as they work out the kinks but always service with a smile.  Most kinks and change suggestions appear to have been noted by management and have been resolved.  I even had a server remember and point out some improvements on a suggestion I made two visits earlier.7) Prices may be slightly high but they seem about on par with other quality restaurants in the area.  (ie-Calo / Lady Gregory's / Hop Leaf)  You pay for the atmosphere too.8) As a new neighbor, Replay-Andersonville also is taking part in the community.  From what I saw, they started their involvement with the neighborhood, including local business organizations and community event and sports team sponsorship, even as they were still building out the space prior to opening which also means something to me as a local resident.  They are investing in the betterment of our neighborhood.All new openings of a restaurant have their kinks and anyone who has only been to flawless openings should really start bringing me with.  I go into new locations knowing what I'm getting into.  Quality of an establishment is in the staff and how they respond to customer feedback.

14.description: We have eaten here more than a few, and I can tell you, I have never been disappointed. You would think, with free games, and an impressive beer list, exceptionally good food is just asking for too much. It's not. Chef Bernardo is the only chef on clark, who can doin it right! His chilaquiles are spot on amazing. Not only does my picky Mexican lady expect great taste, but she is also very hard to satisfy in terms of portions. Today she is leaving happy and full like her mama fed her. Shout out to Brandon too- not only helpful but also very entertaining. At night, Mike is our favorite bartender. Always great with recommending the right beer. The only think we don't understand is how the popcorn works?! Well done guys!

29.description: Great selection and a friendly staff! Had a great visit! Will be back.

42.description: Sigh.I hauled my ass out of the house last Saturday when it was 3 degrees out to go to Roost to shop for dining room chairs. Me and my husband spotted these super AWESOME firehouse chairs right off the bat. The person working there said that it was a set of 2 chairs and we bought them. However, only one chair was on display.We were told that they would drive the other chair over to our house later that day, since the other chair was locked in their storage facility and they needed the keys to go and get it. Fine.7pm rolls around, and we get a call saying that the chair isn't in the storage facility that they thought it was in, and that the other chair may not exist at all. WTFIt turned out that the other chair does not exist, and now we have one chair that has no friend. I mean, I'm not furious or anything, it's just kind of a let down. Roost has offered to take back the chair we have, which is nice of them...but....the whole experience was just irritating.

23.description: Cute little French Country decor inspired shop.  The inviting spill of furniture tumbling out the door and onto the sidewalk made me want to check it out.  I'm glad I did, it's packed with country-chic items, little jars filled with buttons, giant vintage scales, shabby chic stands with plastic dinosaurs in them.  Whoever does their decorating has a fabulous sense of humor.

47.description: I think the roost I visited this past Sunday is different than the ones that the reviewers went to. The merchandise here is mostly, actually all tableware. The owner is super friendly and told me about how and where he gets his tableware from. And everything here is cheap! I actually saw the same things in this store in other stores south in Andersonville that were $20+ higher. Though this store is a bit "dirty" for tableware, it is a charming place and I will come back definitely to get more sets. Oh, another plus is all the tableware is made in the USA, instead of the usual Made in China stuff at Crate and Barrell or Ikea. Not that there's anything wrong with that.

8.description: I love a good vintage kitchen/housewares store and LOVED Roost.  I live in California and am always shocked at what a good deal vintage are outside of my state.  We got an amazing dish here for a bit over $20.  Gorgeous pick with metallic overlay.   It is Christmas time so there were also some great ornaments and decorations scattered around the store.    I only wish I loved closer to visit more often!

31.description: I love Roost and here's why:1) It's an obsessive collector's dream.  Ever since I was little I've had a habit of collecting things...first it was Hello Kitty stickers, then He-Man cards and iron on patches (my favorite was the NASA one), then stuffed animals, then rocks (yes, rocks), then shells, then....well, hotel pens, costumes, buttons, books, hats from the 40s, you name it.  Roost brings it all together in an artistic way.  It's a nicely decorated celebration of weird.2) My entire family collects odd things, so it's the perfect place to shop for gifts!  I found an entire box of 1950s multi-colored glass Christmas ornaments...in an ornament box from the 1950s.  Aweseome!  Now I just have to figure out how to convince myself not to keep it.3) They have the *best* smelling long-burning soy candles I've ever encountered.  I bought shea honey, which is on the sweeter end (along with carrot cake and autumn cake), but there's stuff that's savory & refreshing, too (like cucumber wasabi and...dirt!).  The small ones are $12 and the large (70 hours) are $26.  I'm not typically a big candle buyer, but they were too good to pass up.  You can even bring a container and have them fill it with whatever candle scent you'd like....they're handmade by the owner's friend. :)Overall, I'd say that Roost is Anthropologie's cooler older brother, the one who doesn't try so hard (and minus the ridiculously expensive girly clothes).

34.description: Worth checking out, but not amazing.PROS: - A huge variety of vintage items for the home. - They don't just have one lone coffee mug or plate, they have the whole set. It's easy to build a collection at this shop, where at other antique and resale shops you can only buy odd pieces. - The man that runs the place is very friendly and knowledgeable about the inventory.CONS: - Everything is priced quite steep. That item you $30-love will be priced $60, and that mug that you $10-want-for-your-mom will be $15 - $25. - The building is very tight. It is so full of stuff that its hard to maneuver around without knocking something over with your purse. There are section of the store that are so narrow and oddly set up that you might assume it is an employee-only area for storage. - The smallness of the shop and the ever-present owner makes you feel like you are expected to make a purchase. His watchful eyes always make me feel uneasy just browsing. When it comes time to leave, I feel like I have to sneak out.

16.description: This has been the second time I have shown up during the advertised open hours to find the store locked up and dark, with nothing to indicate when, or whether, it might actually open. How much contempt do you have to have for your customers to be unwilling to spend 10 seconds to put a note up on Facebook to let people know that you'll be closed so they don't waste their time?

13.description: I love this store! It has very interesting little finds and has a very cool demeanor! I love the dog George who hangs out and sniffs you as you walk in. I love old, loved furniture and this place has it, I also get cool decorating ideas for my house as most of the decor is design on a dime!

11.description: I went into Roost a few months ago. Nice store with a lot of nice things, though freakishly expensive. I figured I'd give it another shot last week. So I checked the hours and went by. They were closed. No sign on the door. Nothing. Went back this morning at 11, when they were supposed to open. They weren't open, so I waited with two other people for 30 minutes outside in our car. Gave up. When we called at 1PM, they told us that they had opened at noon and that sometimes they make their deliveries early and they run late. Come on. Not how you should treat your customers (or potential customers). Your prices are high and you basically show up when you feel like it. Not a good business model.

39.description: I love Roost!  It is an extremely well-curated vintage store.  I found a beautiful set of dinner plates there when Daniel first opened the store.  I visited again last week and noticed that his prices have gone up quite a bit since I last shopped (dang!), he has expanded into the space next door (yay!), and he has a number of actual employees now (good for him!).  This time my boyfriend and I found a charming "fishing lodge" bench to cozy up to our dining table.  Just what we were looking for, a bit more than we wanted to pay, but still absolutely worth it!

37.description: OMG...I Absolutely love this store.  They have wonderful used and vintage merchandise.  They are so creative in the way the items are displayed.  I cannot walk in without buying something.  Truly one of my favorite places in Chicago.

0.description: I visited a lot of antiques shops in Chicago. Believe me, a lot! And I was impressed by this little gem! there are several antiques shop in Andersonville, but this was by far my favorite. Items are organized well, the space is thought well and the prices are not crazy! The other shops either are very cheap and nothing good or very expensive for a mid-century piece reclaimed after buying it on CL. At Roost, you can find something in between. The owner is extremely friendly,and the shop overall is not pretentious at all!

38.description: This store is beautiful! I wish I would have had more time to explore every nook. Whoever owns this store loves it and what they do. A very inspirational store with a wide variety of wares, art supplies, jewelry, and small furniture.

51.description: I love the old housewares up in this place.  I went in before he had everything priced and all that, but I'm guessing it's gonna be a little bit pricey, and probably worth it.  I already started saving for some pieces I know that I want.  It's in the vein of that place down the block, scout, but more country/ rustic.  But not too country/rustic.  Not at all!The guy who runs the place is really friendly too.

27.description: This place is THE BEST for accessories and small furniture items.  What I love about it compared to some of the Andersonville shops is that they have so much more variety, and everything is really reasonably priced.  Example: we went all over town looking for an industrial/rustic carpenter's box and found one in each shop we saw.  But we kept walking away because the size or finish would be just slightly off.  At Roost, the guy showed us like 15!  Climbed all up on his display to get us some more options and we found one!  Love it.

32.description: This place is the real deal. Daniel has an amazing selection of goods to bring that eclectic 'found object' look to your place. His eye and merchandising skills are second to none, and you'll surely be inspired just walking through his shop.From candles to dishes, and roosters to carts and tables you will undoubtedly find something to take home here, all the while not breaking the bank.

48.description: Yeah, I've experienced better. I think this spot is a wee bit dear. Let me translate: it's overpriced. Particularly since I have seen the owner bloke down the street buying some of the vintage-ey items at Brown Elephant. More than once, btw.Mind you, I'm not saying that's wrong per se, but we should be honest about what is really going on. I hope I'm not destroying his business model, and in fairness he does pick out things from BE that are quality. But he is marking them up by like, oh 1000%, give or take. Nonetheless, everything is attractively arranged and there are some kewl pieces to be had. But maybe cruise BE first.

44.description: This place makes me angryI hate seeing the owner down the street at Brown Elephant and thinking of the stupid people that will buy the marked up thrift store junk at his store, sadly there is a market for it though.

24.description: Adorable! It is a great little store packed with awesome finds. The workers are always very friendly, and they do not bother you. They usually ask if you are looking for anything in particular, and then leave you alone or show you what they have. They will also find you particular items or recommend other stores in the area that might have what you are looking for. Check this place out, don't pass by!

7.description: Not only does he get merchandise from Brown Elephant/Salvation Army, he gets all of the candles from Marshall's!  And sells them at a 300% markup?  $6.99 for the candle at Marshall's, and $25 at the shop.  Haha!!!  Feel bad for those dumb enough to pay this guy just for toting candles from Tj Maxx and Marshalls to his junk shop in Andersonville.  And even if you did want to pay extra for a bunch of TJ candles, good luck catching the store open during their "hours".  This place is for the birds.

49.description: To be honest Roost didn't grab me, I mean if you like farm animals and odd urban decor items then this is the place for you. I walked in because it is sort of out of place on the Clark strip and I was curious, but after walking in and turning only to see a large porcelain rooster in my face with those plastic Easter eggs around it nearly made me step back out the door. Suddenly I was greeted by a very nice elderly man and with Etta James playing in the back round, so I thought why not look around. Now I didn't find a whole lot but I did find a leather bound hard back of Jack London stories for $10.00 so it wasn't a complete waste. It just shows you that you never know what you'll find in places like this. Based on the service alone I'd go back.

40.description: This guy has an eye.

30.description: Ridiculous. The most overpriced thrift store I've ever been to. An insider review: prices are comparable to the White Attic down the street, but the refinishing and quality is more like the Brown Elephant. If you visit both of those stores, you'll see what I mean. That said, there is definitely an appealing aesthetic in the place. I have seen many things I wanted... but nothing worth paying for.

46.description: One reason to go to Roost: Daniel, the owner, is a doll--way more helpful than necessary but not in a cloying, are-ya-gonna-buy way. He genuinely seems to take pride in his shop and how he came about opening it--via lots of years behind a bar surprisingly--evident in his excitement about an upcoming merchandiser visit when I arrived. I'm not certain how the store looked back in November 2008 when he opened it, but it now has a friend-with-better-taste feel that's cozy while simultaneously airy and bright. A heavy emphasis is placed on what Daniel calls the "rustic-industrial" vintage find: lots of china, kitchen supplies, utilitarian tools, and industrial cabinetry feature predominately. Prices are very comparable to Praha on Lincoln and, indeed, the two sites should be on the urban vintage collector's map. Also like Praha, the collection's carefully curated quirkiness and the owner's on-site excellent service are beyond anything you'll find at the mass-producing chains. Best of all, it's within walking distance of Gethsemane, so it's great for ideas on how to display those recently acquired plants without the astronomical prices of Anthropologie.It also works as a place to stop on a perfect Sunday itinerary around Uptown and Edgewater: Tweet on Sheridan for breakfast, over to Gethsemene for foliage, Roost for tools and art, then the deli, coffee shop, and bakery a few doors down for Sunday in the park picnic supplies.

1.description: Have been wanting to visit, but several times I've been and the store hasn't been open despite posted hours.Unfortunately it didn't live up to what I was hoping for.  Basically your typical overpriced used merchandise with staff that feel they have more important things to do than greet customers.  It is standard to at least greet someone as they walk in and ask if they need assistance.   There are nicer shops and much friendlier staff in other Andersonville locations.  Tried and didn't enjoy.  Won't be back and will be sure to let all of my friends know about this experience.

9.description: I had a good amount of time to spare before meeting friends for dinner, so I decided to do a little antiquing. I was heading to Good Deal Garage and this was right on the corner. My eyes locked onto all the owl figurines and I figured I could easily find a cute knickknack here.The shop is well laid out and the people working there are pretty friendly. They asked if I was looking for anything in particular, but I let them know I was simply browsing. I only stopped in for about 10 minutes or so and found many beautiful things I'd have loved to buy, but the price was just way too high. Ceramic owls were $29+. Granted, they were in spectacular shape, but I rarely spend more than $20 at a second-hand store and I usually walk away with multiple items. That's not going to happen here.If you're looking for a have-to-have item then this might be the place. They have a great selection of things like owls, serving plates and random vintage photographs. I just don't see myself "bargain" hunting here.

26.description: I'm on the fence about whether I should give Roost a fourth star. You see, they have everything under the sun...except the thing I was looking for the day I went. While I was tempted to buy an old medical cabinet, some apothecary jars, a bunch of old photographs, a metal sign from a boat, owl paraphernalia, and some vintage keys, I kept telling myself that if I didn't find a book shelf that would fit in my living room, I would have nowhere to put all that stuff. They did have book cases here, but they were all really large, with one exception. I liked the finish on it, but it had a couple chunks missing from it and cost not a whole lot less than what a similar items sells for new. I might just go back and check on that book shelf to see if the price goes down, because it was just the right size and I might be able to fill in the gashes. On another occasion, I had noticed some art in the window and went by later the same day to inquire about the price...and it was gone! You snooze you lose, I guess, so who knows if I will ever get that book shelf, after all....Overall, this is a great place to browse, with friendly staff, good music playing, and an incredible assortment of items. I can't think of another place where I could buy things to decorate a maritime-themed home, get a full set of vintage china, have a choice between six mid-century modern ashtrays, and find country-chic stuff to send my mom for her birthday. They could grab a fourth star from me very easily if I see more things suited for the size of your average Chicago apartment (who can fit all this huge furniture into their place?!?) and/or a little more price latitude. Just be careful that you don't go drinking at Hamburger Mary's down the street BEFORE you come here, or else you might give in to the temptation to buy half the store and wake up the next day wondering why you have three snake bite kits, a large wooden desk, and a wooden chest full of seashells.

25.description: Walked in & wanted to walk out with everything.  Some things are a lil pricey but so unique & individual.  For months I'd been on a mission to find a piece for my kitchen & when I arrived at Roost I knew I'd find it here.  Told the gentleman at the counter, what I was looking for & he suggest an old, large grain sifter that I could use to hang things from & double as a shelf.  SOLD!!!  Would of never thought of it & everyone comments on it when they see it

12.description: My fiancé and I have been here several times in the past few months and enjoy browsing for new items every time we stop in. Depending on your budget and what you are looking for, you can find something to meet your needs. The owners are very friendly and will take the time to chat with you and discuss what you are looking for, as well as suggest ideas. I will continue to keep coming back!

21.description: I had a good amount of time to spare before meeting friends for dinner, so I decided to do a little antiquing. I was heading to Good Deal Garage and this was right on the corner. My eyes locked onto all the owl figurines and I figured I could easily find a cute knickknack here.The shop is well laid out and the people working there are pretty friendly. They asked if I was looking for anything in particular, but I let them know I was simply browsing. I only stopped in for about 10 minutes or so and found many beautiful things I'd have loved to buy, but the price was just way too high. Ceramic owls were $29+. Granted, they were in spectacular shape, but I rarely spend more than $20 at a second-hand store and I usually walk away with multiple items. That's not going to happen here.If you're looking for a have-to-have item then this might be the place. They have a great selection of things like owls, serving plates and random vintage photographs. I just don't see myself "bargain" hunting here.

17.description: Very cool place, with beautiful things and friendly employees, just way too pricey.  I love coming into look but rarely buy because of the prices for second hand items.  It seems to be their downfall because there are several items I saw today that I really liked the last time I went in (6mo ago) , that still haven't sold.  For example there is a pretty ceramic egg holder that reminds me of the ones you can get at Anthropologie for $12.  Roost is asking $24!  Lower your prices and I'll take half your store home.

10.description: Brown elephant/  salvation merchandise= Neiman Marcus prices. Crazzzzzy,! And the owner is RUDE.

5.description: Unlike most antique shops, which comprise about 99% junk and the occasional gem, Roost is full of things that I would love to have in my theoretical home.  There is a fair variety, but generally they feature a vaguely rustic, sort of New-Englandey aesthetic.  Lots of simple wood furniture, sometimes painted; metal basins, buckets, washtubs, and the like; large glass canisters and Mason jars full of corks, marbles, seashells, pieces of coral, and so on.  And everything is in very good shape.This is a great shop for dishes.  There is an annex in the back called The Hutch which includes nothing but tasteful, charming vintage dishes of all kinds.  Most of them are very handsome or pretty:  Currier and Ives types showing country scenes, civic commemorations, floral and faunal motifs, and the like.  There are plates, bowls, mugs, teacups, saucers, platters, pitchers...the whole kit and caboodle.  If I were opening a country restaurant, I would go nuts in this room.The coolest thing that I saw in the whole shop was a 1927 Webster's New International Dictionary which really inflamed my biblio-lust.I believe that I was assisted by the owner Daniel, who is everything that you would want in an independent shopkeeper.  Besides the fact that he owns a great store, he will take good care of you, answering questions and showing you other items that you might be interested in.  He happened to mention that gift certificates are 25% off on their website right now.

3.description: This is another cute shop in Andersonville.  They have a lot of antique/vintage pieces for all you antique collectors out there.  The owner (I think) also has a dog, so you might see him walking around the store.

35.description: I love chickens.  I grew up with my own flock of Rhode Island Reds, and a variety of bantams, and since moving to the big-time city of Chicago, I find myself missing them more and more... so, I've taken to decorating every square inch of my tiny little kitchen in chickens of all shapes, sizes, colors, and purposes.  Call me corny (I know you will), I just can't help myself.So, Roost, with its many and varied decorative chicken pieces, is kind of like my little slice of heaven.  I pretty much love everything in this store.  The owner has, as many have said, a great eye... but more than anything, I love the chickens, and will probably have to start shopping here on a bi-weekly basis to satisfy my longing for my far-away feathered friends.

19.description: Rolled in here after a brunch up the street. Roost had caught our eye as we were parking and we wanted to check it out. I, personally, really welcome another home goods store on this street! Andersonville is really getting tons of nice places to shop!  One wander down the street and you can mentally (or if you have deep pockets, really) redo you house!All pillows were on sale, and Roost had some nice ones! They were knitted covers that went over the pillows themselves. I liked a couple, but alas, they would not have matched my place. Roost has some nice iron scroll work for sale. The pricing is good (much better than I have seen elsewhere) and they offer a few different styles. Yes, this is salvaged from somewhere, but the rust adds to the charm. I stopped myself from picking up a couple of pieces for gifts, and am now regretting it. It seems like things are a bit more organized than when the other two reviewers wrote. I like the place. Not necessarily my style of decor, but they have some neat things that could blend into any home design.

28.description: Really fantastic shop.  We just got a billiards table for our place, but it came with a plastic triangle for racking up the balls.  It was a perfect excuse to go hunting at Roost for a wooden triangle.  We found it right away (!) but spent half an hour in the shop just marveling over the items on offer.  I love this place.

45.description: So, I have a habit of buying things that I want and don't actually need. For instance : my vintage 40's Taylor Smith and Taylor "Pink Lace" Passover dishes. A full service for 12. Did I mention I'm single? So, today I decided to get out of the house. You know how it goes..you sit in the house, take too many naps and eat things because you can't decide if you're bored or hungry. I walked up the street to Roost, a place I've driven past dozens of times, but never went in. So today I did. And was greeted by Daniel. Now, I was nosey, and poked into the part of the store that he is expanding into. He's not actually in that part yet. But there it was. The test tube stand of my dreams. But I was a good boy, so decided I'd pass on it. I got home, and I could have screamed. You see, my entire bathroom is done in "Vintage Science Lab", think high school chemistry class, a la 1940. I called the shop at 8 pm on Sunday night, planning to leave a sad and soulfully homosexual message on the shop keepers answer phone - and to plead that he put it aside for me. Only Daniel answered the phone, and after a pleasant and cheerful chat - I am now going to be the proud owner of said test tube rack. Now you can be jealous that not only am I incredibly handsome, BUT my bathroom is better than yours.

33.description: this place is so crowded with vintage and new items that it is overwhelming. Finding anything worth buying is a daunting proposition. Visual overload! The store stocks predominantly vintage items, but it has random new things like t-shirts that are a complete disconnect from the vintage vibe. These new, non-vintage things take up valuable space for the main commodities. Where do they keep all of the stuff that overflows onto the street? The staff is great. Love Jerry and Daniel (owner). Jerry has a GREAT sense of humor. How anyone works there is beyond me - you'd have to have a great sense of humor and an encyclopedic memory!It is not wheelchair accessible at all - it is barely human upright walking accessible.  I cannot fathom trying to get a wheelchair there!!Prices are all over the map - some ridiculous, some reasonable.  Haggling is allowed.

43.description: I come in here to ogle, to buy, to sigh.  The bf found the place when I was out of the country in Greece and noted it for us to return to together to buy things for our future mutual home.  I'm so glad he told me about it.  I wanted EVERYTHING in there.  Their tableware is the perfect shades of mustard yellow, dark olive green, I could barely let go of the cream-colored plates with frosty-blue stars.  Maybe it was because we were watching all the Mad Men DVDs at the time--no, not just that, the stuff here really is remarkable.  We bought ourselves 4 dark-green glasses and went back a few days later to buy 2 more.  I swear by the gods of Andersonville, the water I drink from them is crystalline and sweet.And so what if the owner buys some of it at Brown Elephant and brings here and marks it up by a couple bucks?  You think all those cute hipster bloggers selling online the vintagey stuff they found in Brooklyn aren't doing the same thing?  Who wants to dig around Brown Elephant anyway?  Plus, I lack VISION.  The owner of this store has VISION.  It wasn't till my most recent visit last week, for example, that I understood just how amazing old-school, glass test tubes are (totally underestimated my mom's laboratory back when I was a little kid--why didn't I steal some of that stuff?).  This is a good place to visit often to pick up interesting, cool, inexpensive items for your home or as gifts.  Now ready....get set...go!

2.description: First visit, found the selection fascinating! Must come again when I have more time (I was between appointments in the area) as I'm sure there's new "stuff" every day.Nicely merchandised too, pretty store.

18.description: I was so excited to go into this place, and was so disappointed when I finally did. I walked in and the gal behind the counter looked up, didn't say a word and proceeded to give me the stink eye the whole time I was there. I had a question about a picture that was not priced, and when I asked her if she could tell me how much it cost she rolled her eyes at me and seemed totally annoyed that I was pulling her away from her perch at the register. Shit service, below average stuff, and overpriced.

41.description: When they first opened, I was in there and another customer wanted to purchase an item with a $3 price tag on it.  The guy at the register said it was something like $25.  What about the $3 price tag?  It was a tag from Goodwill that Roost forgot to take off.  Really the good thing would have been to let the lady have it for 3 bucks.  Bad business (and false advertising) that they didn't.  We also bought a lamp that had the thrift store price written on it for $20 less. So why do I still like this store?  I'm not interested in spending 3 Saturday afternoons driving to goodwills searching for the right lamp.  I'd rather pay the guys at Roost to do it for me.  Some of it is trash, some of it is treasure, but I have bought three things there that I really, really like so I'll keep on going back.  And, they have some really beautiful pieces that I have seen for three times the price at Scout.

52.description: I went back up to Home Accents again this weekend for some Christmas shopping and Roost, across the street caught my eye.  They had a nice, rural and vintage-y look that i had to investigate.  I imagine there is more back story to this place, like it just opened, or they had just gotten new stuff in, because it looked a little sparse and disorganized, though parts were nicely displayed.  I would describe the merchandise as mid-modern rustic... like the original stuff all the housewares sold in Anthorpologie are referencing.  I didn't find anything to buy, and nothing had a price tag, which is always intimidating, but that's not to say i'll never be back.  The store was really charming, i'll go there the next time i'm designing the set for a play that takes place in suburban Pennsylvania circa 1968... it could happen.

50.description: Rolled in here after a brunch up the street. Roost had caught our eye as we were parking and we wanted to check it out. I, personally, really welcome another home goods store on this street! Andersonville is really getting tons of nice places to shop!  One wander down the street and you can mentally (or if you have deep pockets, really) redo you house!All pillows were on sale, and Roost had some nice ones! They were knitted covers that went over the pillows themselves. I liked a couple, but alas, they would not have matched my place. Roost has some nice iron scroll work for sale. The pricing is good (much better than I have seen elsewhere) and they offer a few different styles. Yes, this is salvaged from somewhere, but the rust adds to the charm. I stopped myself from picking up a couple of pieces for gifts, and am now regretting it. It seems like things are a bit more organized than when the other two reviewers wrote. I like the place. Not necessarily my style of decor, but they have some neat things that could blend into any home design.

4.description: Just stopped in on a whim to explore a little. Andersonville is chock full of these sorts of shops but you can never get enough. We were able to get a great deal on old file and letter holder that goes perfectly in the new apartment. The owner was really pleasant and there was an adorable dog just sitting pleasantly in a chair. Definitely will be coming back to explore more!

6.description: I've tried to go here twice, arriving shortly after their advertised "open" hours. Both times the shop was closed. Both times I waited around for 15-20 minutes without any luck. Roost, it appears from your reviews that this is a recurring problem. Treat your customers' time with respect - change your hours, and stick to them.

22.description: Interesting selection of curiosities and fun to peruse.  The staff are kind although somewhat aloof to customer needs.  I found a little owl figurine which was interesting.  Upon turning it over to look for the price ($24) I was surprised to see a half rubbed off sharpie mark of 99 which indicates it was purchased at a thrift shop like Unique for $.99.  I understand that many stores in Andersonville get there stuff this way, but by leaving the price on not only does it ruin the allusion that I as a customer have found something special, but it also shows laziness and price gouging.

15.description: Great stuff. Lovely staff. But...It's the prices. They're exorbitant. I'm a barn/ rummage/ garage/ estate sale junkie, and I know what they're buying their stuff for. I just won't pay that kind of markup. Don't get me wrong, I'm also lazy, and if someone has done all the legwork for me, I will absolutely, happily even, pay a higher price just so I don't have to go to more than one place. Hell, with gas I might even save money. But this place wants too much for cool junk. I'd shop here all the time if not for the crazy markup. But I do love to window shop. And the place has been open for ages, so obviously there are folks ether lacking in savvy or rolling in dough so, there ya go. I'll hit Brown Elephant for my goodies, thanks.

20.description: I really liked the selection at this place.  Nice, well kept treasures from the past.  The inventory is wonderful.  The prices are a bit high but your talking about a well managed resale shop not a thrift store.  If you're looking for something to decorate your place that's unique and eye catching you might find it here.  I spoke to the shop keeper and she said the owner goes to 12 different states to get the stuff.  Seems dedicated and has a nice collection of goods.

36.description: The cutest!  I just popped in a couple weeks ago for the first time.  Everyone was incredibly friendly and I was totally inspired by the light fixtures (apple baskets!!!).  What's with Kurt M. and Daniel S. accusing the owner of wildly marking up Brown Elephant goods?  Just because this fellow enjoys a jaunt to the BE doesn't mean he's hacking their goods as his own.  I wouldn't worry about it - no one will spend their money at Roost if they are deeply concerned about paying for carefully selected pre-owned home accessories ;)

14.description: I love Roost and here's why:1) It's an obsessive collector's dream.  Ever since I was little I've had a habit of collecting things...first it was Hello Kitty stickers, then He-Man cards and iron on patches (my favorite was the NASA one), then stuffed animals, then rocks (yes, rocks), then shells, then....well, hotel pens, costumes, buttons, books, hats from the 40s, you name it.  Roost brings it all together in an artistic way.  It's a nicely decorated celebration of weird.2) My entire family collects odd things, so it's the perfect place to shop for gifts!  I found an entire box of 1950s multi-colored glass Christmas ornaments...in an ornament box from the 1950s.  Aweseome!  Now I just have to figure out how to convince myself not to keep it.3) They have the *best* smelling long-burning soy candles I've ever encountered.  I bought shea honey, which is on the sweeter end (along with carrot cake and autumn cake), but there's stuff that's savory & refreshing, too (like cucumber wasabi and...dirt!).  The small ones are $12 and the large (70 hours) are $26.  I'm not typically a big candle buyer, but they were too good to pass up.  You can even bring a container and have them fill it with whatever candle scent you'd like....they're handmade by the owner's friend. :)Overall, I'd say that Roost is Anthropologie's cooler older brother, the one who doesn't try so hard (and minus the ridiculously expensive girly clothes).

3.description: This place is awesome for Ethiopian food (take-out; they have like 5 tables, but take it and eat at home, or get it delivered). I'm often wary myself about a restaurant serving two really different cuisines (Ethiopian and Chinese), but the Ethiopian is delicious. I spoke with one of the owners who works weekends, Dobaro, and I encouraged him to stick with the Ethiopian, although I imagine Chinese would sell better. In any case, he told me that it's surprisingly hard to find a Chinese chef. When they do get one, then I would say it's good for Chinese as well. But Ethiopian food is generally better than Chinese anyway!So the food is awesome, and Dobaro is even more awesome. I think another big sell for this place is probably that it delivers! I don't know of any other Ethiopian places that deliver. Also, this isn't important to me, but this place is Halal! They buy their meat from a Halal butcher on Devon. So if Halal matters to you, then you finally have a place to eat some Ethiopian! If you're skeptical, they will show you the receipt from the Halal butcher. In summary: EAT (Ethiopian food) AT LAKE LANGANO!

1.description: This restaurant was my first experience with Ethiopian food. If I had the choice to choose another restaurant for my first experience, I would still choose Lake Langano. The food was excellent as well as the service was very personal. Watching the owner interact with a costumer that seemed like a regular while I was also there showed the nature of the restaurant being very homey. With having a limited number of seats and tables, this wasn't a problem since this allowed for the close interaction for all in the area. I had a great experience and look forward to many more at this restaurant.
