2.description: I had a craving for general tso's chicken and ordered from them on grubhub- it was a very bad experience.  The rice tasted like cigarettes and the chicken was soggy and gross.  The soup was good and the potstickers were greasy,  but decent.  I am writing this as a warning because I literally nearly threw up.  When I called, the lady was very nice, but kept saying she would keep sending out more food.  I told her I just wanted my money back and for them to come get the container- It reeked of cigarette.  It took grubhub intervention for me to get any happiness, but I still have the nasty cigarette 'food,' at my house and this business never refunded me.

5.description: A friend and I ordered two Chinese lunch specials for carry-out from Lake Langano, General Tso's chicken and Chicken with Brocolli. The food was not good. The chicken was breaded and soggy. The brocolli had an "off" flavor and was very hot/spicy. The egg drop soup looked and smelled strange so I didn't taste it. Maybe it was good but I doubt it. The hot and sour soup was not recognizable as hot and sour soup. My friend ate a few bites of the General Tso's chicken but we both wound up throwing almost all of it away. Maybe the Ethiopian food is better but I won't get Chinese food here again.

6.description: I shared a giant sample platter of delicious Ethiopian food (they serve both Ethiopian food and Chinese food-two separate chefs) with friends. It came with ample injera, the spongy pancake used for scooping up the food. There were a variety of vegetarian and meat dishes served. It was spicy and very tasty. Especially the lamb. The restaurant is small-so probably best for carry-out though my friends and I did eat in the restaurant itself which was fine.

0.description: While there is better Ethiopian food available in Chicago, you can't beat this place for price and for providing take-out.When you walk in you'll need to ask for the Ethiopian menu, which is behind the counter (they only display their Chinese menu).  Although the menu did not make it clear, my order came with two sides: I ordered shiro, and alongside my shiro and injera were gomen and a yellow split pea dish (kik alicha?).It was a ton of food, for less than $10.  I liked the shiro the best of the lot (the yellow split peas were pretty bland). This is a great choice when you are starving, want take-out, and want something more flavorful and more healthy (veggies!) than most take-out options.

4.description: I thought the Ethiopian food was delicious. Its more expensive than I was expecting but the food was good and tasted homemade. I also am intrigued by the idea of eating Chinese food with injera bread, an experiment for next time.

58.description: sorry guys... gave you a chance not one, but twice, just in case it was an off day. the last real deli in the 'hood was Thorndale Deli. (sadly closed a few years back.) This place doesn't even come close in quality, service, or variety.  and the soup...flavorless.

56.description: The lox plate is awesome....and the matzo ball soup is excellent.  The sandwiches are huge and well worth the price.  You won't be able to eat the entire thing.  They have a box you can take the remainder home with you.AND on the weekends they have salt bagels........yum.The staff is friendly too.  One reviewer berated one of the employees because she didn't know a certain type of jewish cookie.......are you kidding me?  You are just sad bordering on pathetic.Anyway --  check out the deli....... it's unique and such a nice change from everything else on the strip.Rock on JB's !!

29.description: Ordered delivery and was impressed! It arrived 10 minutes early, which I appreciated.Got the hand-sliced lox-platter and a cream herring app.  Got the wine herring instead, but still delicious so I didn't mind. It also came with a huuuuge bag of bagel chips, which is awesome.  The lox was delicious and fresh, and I totally loved that the bagels were all the top halves (no bread butts here), for proper open-faced sandwiches.  Only downside is that they forgot the CREAM CHEESE. Kind of integral to eating bagel and lox.... but I love lox enough that I still enjoyed myself.  Definitely a great experience, but -1 for the magically vanishing cream cheese.

42.description: I went curious to try the knishes, since I haven't eaten one since visiting New York City. These aren't real knishes as I understand them, more like filo pastries. My boyfriend loved the turkey pastrami sandwich. I liked the country store atmosphere, I saw they had black and white cookies and I would go back to try their soups. It's a unique place.

23.description: I`ve been a JBs regular for couple of years, and found this place a great gem in the deli world. Employees have been very helpfull and go out of their way to make guests feel at home. Couple of times i had a problem with my order, I contacted the mgr, Mark and he went out of his way to take care of the issues. I dont know of any establishments that are perfect at all times, but the folks @JBs try very hard. Who doesn`t have an occasional bad day?

47.description: $10 is a lot for a sandwich so it would be hard to make this an everyday lunch spot. There are quite a few places where a sandwich that expensive is large enough to split between two people and still be full and this isn't one of them. The pastrami sandwich is very delicious though and the service was very friendly. There is a huge selection of teas, sodas, chips and ice cream. Sandwiches come with a pickle and a side. This is not a place like Kaufman's - a Jewish deli wonderland - but it is fast and fresh and the potato salad is awesome.

8.description: We ordered JB's for delivery.  The food? Exactly what we wanted, it could not have been better.What did we try? Lots and lots of things! *The Reuben- I love nothing better than a hot, gooey breaded Reuben sandwich. I'm not a fan of crisp or dry bread, which is good because the sandwich had neither.  It was impressive, a mound of corned beef, tons of sauerkraut, hot melted Swiss cheese, and dressing. Exactly what I prefer!!*The coleslaw, or carrot slaw as we were calling it was delicious.*Two friends had bagels and were thrilled to find that the bagels had sesame seeds on the top and the bottom! Pretty fantastic!*Hard salami sandwich- I had a bite, I would happily order it.*Egg Salad Sandwich- tasty.*Chicken Noodle Soup- wonderful, hits the spot.*Lemon bars- these babies were exceptional! The four of us split two of these gigantic items, loved the sweet crust and the tart lemon flavor.It was worth the wait and we will happily order from here again! I've ordered since and have been pleased :)

31.description: Great real regular lox--the salty kind. Most other places only have the tasteless worthless salt-less "Nova" garbage. Great Matzo ball soup too, and extra lean corn beef sandwiches. Great cole slaw with carrots in it. Ten Stars!

34.description: Arrogant Bastard you say? I said yes and I ate the whole thing. A more than generous portion of high quality Pastrami between two nice potato pancakes with sour cream and applesauce. Comes with a side of perfect potato salad and a crisp deli pickle. Perfectly accompanied with a cold Ginger Ale. This Bastard was incredibly satisfying. Our party of three were in unanimous agreement that JB's Deli is the real deal. The guys behind the counter were very accommodating making my first visit to this gem one that will surely prompt a return visit.

16.description: Loved the matzo bowl soup. The chicken salad is amazing on matzo crackers. I thought the service was great and attentive. I would definitely come back here to try other items on the menu.

13.description: Calling this place an authentic Jewish deli is a joke. I was so disappointed with the quality and taste of the food here, I won't be back. I came in craving a pastrami sandwich and a potato knish, both of which were subpar. The deli meat and sides looked old and dried up like they had been sitting there for days and the knish was packed full of grease and not much else. Gross.

11.description: I heard this place has been here a while. Could have fooled me. My impression was that they opened few hours ago and are still figuring out this whole sandwich thing. Slooooow aaaaaasss service while place was empty. Person waiting on us seemed confused about the mystical varieties of bread that laid in front of her. 24$ for 2 turkey sandwiches seemed like a lot. But then I picked up the bag. It felt like a bowling ball in a plastic bag. I guess a turkey sandwich means a pound of turkey between 2 crackers. So the flavor of turkey meat was a bit overwhelming. But I finished it, felt ok about it, and was so full that I ate nothing else for the rest of the day. I can' t say that it was delicious. But it was filling in a good way, and overall solid. I might give it another shot.This place is a true 3-star.

39.description: I finally stopped in after friends insisted that this place was terrific.  I ordered a half sandwich and soup.  The half corned beef was okay but I've certainly had better.  The chicken noodle soup however was really, really good.  On food alone I'd rate it 3 stars. But the employees were so horrible I docked it a star.  I didn't see the half sandwich and soup option on the menu board so I asked for it.  The clerk rolled his eyes and said "Well of course." and then yelled out my order to another guy who put it together.   Sassy and bitchy counter help isn't what I expected here and it wasn't appreciated at all.  The second clerk had a similar attitude.  I asked if the corned beef sandwich had mustard on it and the clerk just ignored me.  After I asked again the guy turned to me and says, 'You asking or telling me?'  Whatever happened to good customer service?

37.description: Great service! Delicious brisket! Can't get enough of this place :)

0.description: We randomly learned about JB's during the Andersonville food crawl. The little tasting was so good that we decided that we had to return for an entire sandwich. We were not disappointed. Looks unsuspecting but the Reuben is DELICIOUS.

38.description: I came here a few years ago for a Reuben and did not have any bad memories. So my husband and I came in a couple weeks back on a Sunday afternoon to satisfy our Reuben cravings. It took 5 minutes for at least 2 employees to assemble the sandwiches. Then we were told it would be 8-10 minutes to heat them. Um, ok, guess that's fine. Add 5 minutes to that because the person put the sandwiches NEXT to the grill press, then later I hear another employee say, "Should these go on here?" We settled in for a longer wait. So going on 20 minutes, a guy behind the counter says to us, "Come on, guys, it can't be that bad." Basically the equivalent of telling someone on the street to smile. Maybe consider why your customers, who were all smiles when they walked in, look less than happy now. Finally they're done, and I go to pay. The sandwiches and two bags of chips (we wanted the good kind, not the ruffles) are $32. I stop and ask if that's right. Guy says they are really big sandwiches. They aren't that big. They tasted...ok? Kind of bland. I won't be back because of the poor service, wait, and price.

51.description: I have gotten food from here a few times and have always been very happy.  Yes, it is a bit on the expensive side, but I do think you get a lot of food.  I have read a few reviews saying you don't get much, but that has never been a problem for me.  Now on to the food.  You can't go wrong with the Matzo Ball soup.  It looks and tastes like homemade broth, and the kinadle is just the right size and tender.  The broth always comes with some veggies and pieces of chicken.  This really gives it that homemade taste.  Not as good as my ma's but it is tasty.  Sandwich wise they have what you are looking for in the Jewish deli fare. Pastrami, corned beef, brisket, chicken/tuna salad are all great.  A lot of it tastes house made.  The chicken and tuna salad are made daily I believe. They give you a choice of bread with your sandwich too, and their challah is especially good.  The potato pancakes are good too but it is better to order those if you are eating there rather than delivered.  And finally, their lox and bagel are legit.  Good bagels good lox, a bit expensive but well worth it.  Anytime I have been in there they have been very nice and chatty.  A good place and an excellent Jewish deli.  We need more of these types of places.

27.description: Just wanted to say thanks to the gang at JBs for a wonderful Passover meal.  Everything they make is fantastic. Truly delicious. The brisket was meltingly tender, chicken perfectly roasted, matzoh balls fluffy, gefilte fish delicious..... Better than Grandma used to make! ( Sorry Grandma.... )

32.description: Worst experience I've ever had. Took two hours to get my food delivered. The owner never told me there was mustard on my hot dogs and I can't eat mustard. Also, when we called to complain she did not offer any type of compensation for the meal. Oh and the food was GROSS! This place needs to get shutdown.

54.description: OK, if you are going in thinking it is Katz's Deli in NYC, it isnt. They probably should take the Jewish deli signage down. Dont get me wrong, they do have some great Jewish things in there, but the moniker of "Jewish Deli" gets the purists in an uproar. Once you get off your high horse, and actually look at what they have, its a great deli. Big, wonderful pastrami sandwiches that are stuffed with Vienna Beef pastrami. Also, the tuna salad and egg salad are fantastic as well. The people behind the counter are very friendly, and give good value for money. Sure, it isnt a $5 footlong, but quality ingredients cost money, and you get what you pay for. I really appreciate having this small neighborhood business here. A few people mentioned that there is quite a lot of things in there. Its true. I think it started out as just a pharmacy, but they added other things to make up for the dwindling profits that private pharmacies are making. Now with Walgreens across the street, if it wasnt for the ice cream and deli, they would probably be out of business. I say bravo for making a great decision.  Their great food and their other goodies will keep me coming back.

48.description: Why not five stars? Because it is not the ideal of a Jewish deli (trust this Brooklyn-bred Jewish princess), and certainly not a kosher one.  Chicago could sure use a kosher deli like those of my youth (and which still abound in NYC), but I realize that with the city's mostly African-American, Latino, and Catholic-ethnic demographic it ain't gonna  happen (except perhaps in West Rogers/West Ridge). For something a bit more authentic, it's worth the drive up to Max's in the Crossroads strip mall on Skokie & Lake-Cook.  (There also used to be a glatt kosher deli next door to it--they catered my son's bris back when dinosaurs roamed the earth).*But for those who want to keep it local, you can't do better than JB's unless you go to a Jewel with a kosher deli counter (like the one in the Howard-Kedzie strip mall). It is what it is, and it's a pretty good one of what it is. Having recently gone back on low-carb, I appreciate its meats & smoked fish even more. For those of you who can have starch, its breads & bagels are pretty authentic. To the reviewer who mentioned the potato knish having morphed into a meat knish that didn't taste like meat: are you sure it wasn't kasha (buckwheat)? I've never eaten there, just take the food home. Prices are on par with Jewish delis in Chicagoland.  For those not hung up on tradition and don't mind a melting-pot vibe, their gelato is killer.Re the naming confusion: the place was "Gordon Pharmacy;" when we first lived in A'ville when Osco was the only other game in town it was our neighborhood drugstore.  Then it was sold and became "Ok Pharmacy" (with additional lettering in Korean, suggesting to me that was the name of the owner who was likely Korean); when the deli was added up front it acquired both the JB's name for the deli and "Gordono" for the drugstore.* I understand the venerable Belden Deli has reopened in the basement of the building occupying its old Lincoln Park location. Worth checking out.

44.description: Get the hand sliced lox Get the chive cream cheeseGet the everything bagelAnd take home some smoked white fish salad forlaterHow can you go wrong(Some stuff is simply Vienna or other Chicago "quality" - so why bother buying here?Another idea - Turkey Pastrami on an onion roll with diet root beer?If you want a Roast Beef Sandwich - go to Jewel(And they even make Gefilte Fish something a person can eat - around Passover)

24.description: HORRIBLE BUSINESS! This was my first time ordering with JB's through GrubHub. Supposedly the restaurant could not deliver my food, even though I have never once had a problem with food delivery. The women at JB's, who shall remain nameless, that I spoke with to figure out the delivery problem was beyond ridiculous and rude and said they were charging me two delivery fees since they claim they could not vm deliver the food, as well as, charge me $41 for the food that they said they were not going to deliver. This is THEFT! You can't do this!  I have never in my life encountered such horrible customer service in my life. After calling GrubHub, who was excellent with handling the situation,  ensured the food would be delivered. As if 2 mins ago it was delivered and the extra delivery fee was taken off.  Do Not Deal With These People! It's too bad that I won't be dining with this business again and I suggest you don't either.

7.description: This is the best place in this neighborhood, if not beyond, to get a great bagel with cream cheese. Try the mush mosh (everything) toasted with chive cream cheese. Glad to have found a new go to bagel spot!!

49.description: Not the first time I've been in, but it has been a while though.Ordered a Reuben. Now, I have a particular LOVE for a good REUBEN sandwich and I can't explain it. It's really NOT that complicated of a sandwich: Corned Beef on Rye with Sauerkraut, Swiss and either Thousand island or Russian Dressing. The issue is; ALL the ingredients have to be GREAT, pilled HIGH and griddled properly.This is an OK Reuben.On the PLUS: Good bread and the Corned Beef is very tender, good flavor, fairly lean and freshly sliced. Could be piled a bit HIGHER and a bit more generously for the price.Swiss Cheese is fine.Kraut can use more ZING (as well as more of) and the 1K dressing isn't all that inspiring nor seemingly homemade. Honestly, a GOOD Reuben should have RUSSIAN (pretty much the same as 1K, but add: horseradish, grated onion, Worcestershire sauce and paprika).Cole slaw is overly sweet and I don't think it's entirely homemade either.GOOD coffee though. Overall, very nice people.

40.description: Typically I eat at the Bagel but as it was New Years Eve day and the Bagel closed early so I thought I would go to JB's for a matzo ball soup and chopped liver. Typically this is what I eat at the Bagel. I asked for chopped liver and when they asked how I wanted it initially I said on challah bread because I read the review that said the challah was good but they did not have any so I told them no bread I would just buy bagel chips. The Bagel gives you free bagel chips but here they charge $2.50. I got the last bag of bagel chips. The soup was very good. The matzo ball tasted like what I make at home. The chopped liver did not have any flavor, way too much schmaltz and not enough liver. But what made this a really bad visit was the poor customer service and the argument that followed. When I put the chopped liver on the bagel chips the chips in the bag were mostly cinnamon flavored and the others were burnt. I was told there was an assortment of chips in the bag but there were many burnt chips and many with cinnamon but none that would go well with the chopped liver. I told the person I would need a bagel because there were no chips in the bag that would go with the chopped liver. When I got the bill I was charged for a chopped liver sandwich, a bagel and a bag of chips. I asked the person to remove the charge for the bagel because I was being charged for the chopped liver sandwich and they would not do it because they told me the owner said they were to charge me for the bagel because I told them I did not want it. Had the chips been good I would not have wanted the bagel. But I needed the bagel because the chips would not go well with the chopped liver. Since I was being charged for a chopped liver sandwich I was entitled to the bagel even if it was served on the side. They told me the owner would not come to the register to speak with me. I thought this was poor customer service. None of it made any sense. Anyway I won't go back, the chopped liver wasn't tasty and I don't feel I was treated very well.

53.description: On one of the recent blistering hot days in Chicago, we ordered lunch from JB's via Grubhub. The food arrived promptly and we really enjoyed what we got. The lox plate was good, and certainly enough for the two of us. The corned beef was tasty, The matzo ball soup was a hit with Mom. I also got a scoop of chopped liver. That was my only disappointment. It needed a bit more flavor and I thought the scoop was kind of skimpy for the price.We will order from here again. Yes, it's a bit pricey, but for us it was worth it. I'm glad they deliver because to me, going to Andersonville these days is a big hassle. Too many people and too much congestion. This is like having your lox and eating it too.

30.description: I love this place. Good bagels and the only place in the area I can get real good lox. Service is always friendly. Good selection of beverages too.

46.description: Price update - 1/2 Dozen  $4.80 before tax/ $5.29 after tax.

1.description: Just received a delivery order from here this morning and was so disgusted by my moldy egg sandwich that I created a yelp account to warn the people!! I ordered an egg sandwich on a roll and - after eating half of it - when I opened the roll to take off some of the tomato (too mealy), I noticed a greenish gray spot and flipped it over and sure enough - fuzzy mold (see photos!). No excuses for this - especially for an item that I know somebody held in their hands to make the sandwich, noticed the mold, used it anyway, hoping I wouldn't notice. UNACCEPTABLE. I'm gonna go throw up now.

55.description: I just need to say it - this is NOT a deli. Sure, they have some items that would remind you of a deli, otherwise known as delicatessen, which by the way means fine, tasty food. I assure you, this is not it. A good deli sandwich is sensational. What you get here is tiny, dry, and rather awful tasting. Who said that pastrami should have the texture of beef jerky with extra salt added? People behind the counter were perfectly nice and the pickles were passable, but I would not recommend eating here even if you have a major craving for deli food. You'll feel disappointed if you have had better and will forever be turned off, if this is your first try.

9.description: I had been wanting to try a sandwich from here for a long time, ever since I noticed we had a Jewish deli in the neighborhood.  The service was not the best.  There were only 2 girls working the counter at lunch on a weekday, so even though I ordered ahead on grubhub, I still had to wait just to pick up carry out.That being said, the sandwich, a New York Cajun Reuben was gigantic and delicious.  The pickle and potato salad were also on point.  It's not the best sandwich in the city, but it might be the best in the area (which is saying something given the fact that Jerry's is just down the block.)

26.description: Definitely disappointed. Ordered a club, picked out some chips, asked for fruit. Waited. Started to pay, got talked out of the chips because "standard ruffles come with the sandwich". Got home, opened it up to a club sandwich made poorly pounds of turkey, at least an inch and a half of turkey and barely anything else. Way too big to even begin to bite into (had to fork it). No fruit. No chips. Just stale coleslaw. I love sandwiches and I love coleslaw because, to me, its hard to screw either of those things up. JB's is a corner shop that prides itself on its sandwiches. It shouldn't.

25.description: Pastrami was wonderful, still warm (delivered), tender and moist. The soup is NOT too salty like most deli soups, has lots of sweet carrots and light flavorful kreplach. Really -- not heavy! This was my first order and the beginning of a beautiful friendship.

12.description: don't try ordering from seamless for these jokers.  they are constantly out of something on the menu. Then when they call you, to tell you so, they're rude.

59.description: Your best bet is to have the bagels here, they come from a New York bagel place in Skokie and are delicious. Also only on Saturdays do they have fresh salt bagels made that day.

21.description: We ordered JB's for delivery.  The food? Exactly what we wanted, it could not have been better.What did we try? Lots and lots of things! *The Reuben- I love nothing better than a hot, gooey breaded Reuben sandwich. I'm not a fan of crisp or dry bread, which is good because the sandwich had neither.  It was impressive, a mound of corned beef, tons of sauerkraut, hot melted Swiss cheese, and dressing. Exactly what I prefer!!*The coleslaw, or carrot slaw as we were calling it was delicious.*Two friends had bagels and were thrilled to find that the bagels had sesame seeds on the top and the bottom! Pretty fantastic!*Hard salami sandwich- I had a bite, I would happily order it.*Egg Salad Sandwich- tasty.*Chicken Noodle Soup- wonderful, hits the spot.*Lemon bars- these babies were exceptional! The four of us split two of these gigantic items, loved the sweet crust and the tart lemon flavor.It was worth the wait and we will happily order from here again! I've ordered since and have been pleased :)

17.description: I know that some people on yelp object to the fact that JB's sells pharmaceuticals, bath products, and deli meat; however, in the words of Ron Swanson, "I do all my shopping at Food and Stuff. It is where I buy all my food, [dramatic pause] and stuff." I have no problem buying my lavender deodorant, some razor blades, Metropolis coffee, a pound rugelach, a side of lox, and a pastrami sandwich all at the same place from some of the nicest people you will meet on the northside. Just don't forget to say, "Please and thank you."

10.description: Definitely disappointed. Ordered a club, picked out some chips, asked for fruit. Waited. Started to pay, got talked out of the chips because "standard ruffles come with the sandwich". Got home, opened it up to a club sandwich made poorly pounds of turkey, at least an inch and a half of turkey and barely anything else. Way too big to even begin to bite into (had to fork it). No fruit. No chips. Just stale coleslaw. I love sandwiches and I love coleslaw because, to me, its hard to screw either of those things up. JB's is a corner shop that prides itself on its sandwiches. It shouldn't.

5.description: $17.95 for corned beef on a bagel, a pickle (which comes with the sandwich) and a small bottle of water. Yes you read that right, SEVENTEEN NINETY FIVE. The sandwich was just ok and the employees gave me an attitude. The extra seating area was dirty and had carpet with disgusting stains everywhere. I had high hopes and I am extremely disappointed with this place and their prices.

3.description: This afternoon our family thoroughly enjoyed the Salad Sampler, a Pastrami on eye, some chicken noodle soup and cinnamon knish . It vey what a scrumptious spread that was! A sweetie named Monica corralled our items, mustering her co-workers to pitch in and get our order out with all due speed, all the while wearing a beautiful smile!The cheerful banter she engaged in with me did not slow her down one little bit. Chatting later (with a gentleman I will assume is J.B. himself), was entertaining, warm and welcoming, as well as informative!Will we be back!?Just try and stop us! This place is a real gem - and they deliver farther than one might believe for such a small shop.(Caveat: watch for the occasional bone in the whitefish salad. Otherwise, savor it's smoky goodness!)Oh, and if you even just like cinnamon, the cinnamon-apple knish will ROCK your tastebuds!

35.description: Fantastic! The staff there (Jo) was very helpful and courteous, offering much information and recommendations. We were lucky to be there when they could spare the time to do all they did for us. Can't imagine any restaurant being that helpful during dinner or lunch rush. The food was delicious and plentiful, one sandwich is enough for two meals. Matzo ball soup was very tasty, corned beef was to die for, my husband had the My Cardiologist needs a new car sandwich, that was also very delicious. I loved the old building, tin ceiling and the pharmacy in the back, very eclectic.

19.description: Cannot WAIT to justify going back here again. I was so impressed with the fact that they actually had real bagels and they knew how to dress them. Sandwiches? score. I admit that there wasn't enough kraut on my Reuben, but man was it tasty otherwise. How about that mustard? The carrot slaw? The potato salad? I actually went online to see if they accidentally gave too much information about the ingredients in these side salads so I could try and recreate them at home! Had two bagels piled high with cream cheese (yes, that's how they do it back home in the tri-state area), rugelach, a Reuben, the chicken salad sandwich (insanely amazing and fresh) on a croissant (um this was excellent too), and a variety of sides and snacks. We were blown away by the freshness, quality, and authenticity. All the other reviewers out there bitching about service need to reevaluate the whining; you have to wait for good food, try standing in line at any awesome deli in NY/NJ/PA during lunch or anytime during brunch over the weekends, its worth the wait. Love this place, nice job guys, Ill be back or back on grubhub to order your delicious deli items. Stoked to have found this place.

28.description: Firstly, I love a good deli with home cooking style food.  The matzo ball soup was just right and the big deli pickles were perfectly crunchy. The cold veggie salad was okay but could have been better seasoned. The service was excellent and we will be coming back when we need a great cup of soup on a cold rainy day.

45.description: Ordered catering from them for a work event. It was AMAZING. THE QUALITY OF FOOD REFLECTS THE PRICE!!! Service went above and beyond what I was getting from other catering companies. I will use their service again. They did an outstanding job!!!

33.description: Matzo Ball Soup and potato salad-- If this was all I ordered this place would have gotten 5 stars. Unfortunately I decided to order stuffed cabbage too.  :(  HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!! DO NOT ORDER THE STUFFED CABBAGE!!!!!!!!!!!  They are basically extremely dense meat rocks wrapped in cabbage studded with uncooked rice. SUPER DRY. so sorry I ordered 4 of them for my family. waste of 20 bucks :(

43.description: I tried JB's because I needed Chicken Soup, and I am thrilled!  The soup was flavorful and full of chicken.  In addition, the Kugel was fantastic.  The Meat Combo (pastrami, corned beef) Plate and Spinach Pie were excellent, too.  There are so few deli delivery options, but JB's fills the bill.

2.description: May every sandwich be as delicious as the lox bagel sandwich I just had from JB's Deli. May every customer service interaction be as pleasant, helpful, and genuine. I can't believe I haven't been to this neighborhood spot before now. The women behind the counter were so friendly and helpful, even giving me a taste test of presliced and hand carved lox so I would not err. (That hand carved lox is more buttery and melts even more in your mouth.)Simply put, if you're in the neighborhood and looking for good food served by good people, go and ask the folks there for help--they will lead you to the right meal!

18.description: Amazing!!! Corned Beef and Pastrami are to die for. Perfect fat to meat ratio. Friendly service as well... I'll be back for the Lox and bagels :)

41.description: Pretty good. Split a Rachel and a New Yorker with my brother. The Rachel (a reuben with pastrami instead of corned beef) was fine, but nothing special.The New Yorker (turkey, muenster cheese, cole slaw, and thousand island, all on challah bread & grilled), however, was fantastic. The bread grilled perfectly and gave the sandwich a great flavor. The turkey was piled high, and the cole slaw and the thousand island brought it all together nicely. Highly recommended if you go here.

52.description: I'm really very disappointed in my experience with JB's because I was hoping for a good deli that would deliver to me.  The fact that it offered deli meats and salads by the pound and bagels by the dozen was great. Fortunately I decided to try a few individual dishes before I went nuts and ordered deli in for the week.The extra lean corned beef was extra lean, I can't fault them for that even given that I paid extra for it.  I'm willing to; I can't tolerate fat on corned beef.  I thought the portion was a bit skimpy even so, but the real fudge factors here were that it arrived ice cold, and it seemed like it had been so oddly sliced I couldn't figure out how to put the sandwich together properly.  Turns out that while I ordered it on an onion roll, I got it on a hot dog bun! I'm sorry, that's not acceptable.  If you don't have what the customer asks for, you find out what they want as a substitute.  Hot dog bun wouldn't have been at the top of my list by any stretch.  The CB itself was fine, though no great shakes in the flavor department.  It came with a small tub of potato salad which wasn't bad, though there was something odd in the dressing, some herb or spice that I wasn't nuts about.  That's not an issue; everyone's taste in potato salad is different.  It also came with two very nice pickles which were actually the best thing about the sandwich.I ordered kishke with gravy because I dearly love it.  This stuff was nothing to write home about and the gravy was not only gelatinous but so salty it proved inedible.  Clearly it had been made with some kind of flavoring and the chef used too much of it because the gravy was so dark it was nearly black and had a commercial flavor under all that salt.  Total wash.The potato knish dough was crumbly dry, the filling meager and pretty flavorless.  not a total wash but nothing to get excited about.  The matzoh soup which I got for supper and to make up the $20 minimum for delivery, is okay, but the matzoh ball is one of those light, fluffy, flavorless ones.  Me, I like the cannonball type.  While I'm not thrilled with the soup, it's decent and will make a decent dinner along with the rest of the knish.The delivery cost me $6 and was more than half an hour late.  I did get a call saying they'd be late, so I appreciated that.Basically what you've got here is fair to poor food at a rather high price point.  I won't be ordering from them again and that makes me sad because I wanted to like this place, I really did.  My best friend gave it four stars!  I love deli!  But I can't afford to spend this much to have so-so food delivered.ETA: I ate the rest of the knish today and discovered that it was a meat knish. I'd ordered a potato one.  Now normally I figure mistakes happen, but this is really significant for a couple of reasons.  First, given that I got a hot dog bun instead of an onion roll, the mistake may actually have been a substitution. This is problematic for anyone who doesn't eat meat.  However that's difficult to know so let me move on to the really icky part: I COULDN'T TELL IT WAS MEAT.  Not at first, not with the bite I took when it arrived.  When it was ice cold it was a kind of greyish brown and had no flavor at all.  I assumed it was potato with some kind of  (ineffective) flavoring mixed in.  Now I realize that it was meat, it still didn't have much flavor, and had been gray because of congealed fat.I'm sorry, that's too much.  One star is all this place deserves.

50.description: Yelpers weren't too far off on this one, and having experienced deli's from the Northeast and Florida, Chicago is not particularly the best with this stuff.  Though they still have a decent amount of good food and deli, it's just not good enough for a city in any capacity.  They do have a great location and could become a staple for many but start pricing better as well as providing Northeastern flavor.

4.description: An authentic jewish deli ???? Not even close.  Vienna corned beef , no water bagels,  a Reuben dough covered streudelNot jewish in the least Tuna looked and tasted like salty cat food.This is far from a real ny deli and if you know what that means then this isn't your kind of deli either.

6.description: One of my favorite delis to go to hands down. Great sandwiches and subs, and the most amazing Veggie cream cheese I have ever had the pleasure of eating! The only sad part is that the times listed on here are different than the times they're open. I'm not sure what their hours of operation are, but you should be solid if you go around noon. I'm not sure if they're open at consistent hours, but their food is to die for! And the people there have always been very kind to me! Would definitely recommend.

22.description: Personally, I would rather eat Potbelly than JBs. This is hardly a Jewish deli. Coming from NYC, I believe that all delis should make their own meats. Premade meat such as turkey, roast beef, and pastrami from suppliers is gross. If I'm paying $14 for a giant sandwich, that meat should be homemade. I ordered a roast beef sandwich from JBs. The roast beef was terrible. I waited nearly 20 minutes just to get two sandwiches made by two different people. I was the only one there ordering food so it made no sense to take that long. Also, the muenster cheese I ordered was missing from my sandwich.My experience at JBs was thoroughly disappointing and a waste of money.

15.description: This place has a lot of classic, Jewish deli staples done in a very authentic, delicious way. They greet you warmly and offer lots of samples. The friendly staff strives for a home atmosphere and by and large they succeed. Their classic reuben is reliable as is the matzo ball soup. I'll definitely be back.

57.description: Way, way, way too expensive for way too small of portions. I love kosher food. Its delcious, clean, and everything that good food should be. These sandwiches are no exception to deliciousness. However, they are just too small and too little meat content. Customer service was great and the deli stocked with interesting things. Its worth checking out if you are in the neighborhood but there are many other options in this city that have better portions and better prices.

20.description: Calling JB's an authentic Jewish deli is akin to calling Olive Garden an authentic Italian restaurant.  It's a very sub par deli.I just got home with a pound of extra lean corned beef and they cut it with the grain instead of against.  It's such a rookie mistake and I'm going back to return it tomorrow. It's awful. Their selection is super limited.... no lox spread... no smoked salmon.... no mandel bread.  I live so close to there and so want it to be decent but there's no way around the fact that it's just not.I'm typically not a know it all kind of guy but the people on here that claim it's good obviously just don't know what a good Jewish deli is.Go to Fannies in Lincolnwood, Mannies downtown, Max's in Higland Park, the Bagel in Skokie or Chicago.  Those are authentic Jewish deli's.  JB's is basically the same as the deli counter at your super market.

36.description: As much as I love the food here, if they don't improve their customer service--during the day it's ok, but in the evening it's abysmal--there are more than enough places in Andersonville that are willing to take my money.

14.description: This deli is everything is aspires to be: a purveyor of fine Jewish deli treats, a neighborhood hive which hosts old and young, hip and woefully normal (like me!), and an approachable, friendly, unfussy staff. Calorie fest notwithstanding, you must try the lemon bars. Wasn't a lemon bar girl but now I am.

58.description: 2 x 10 isn't close to my house, but I ended up here for a Sunday morning girls breakfast and pedi and I would drive out of my way to come back.  I like how they took reservations and when we arrived they were ready with a warm foot bath.  The pedicure chairs are modern, made of wood with big comfy cushions and pillows.   My pedi was great, the foot massage even better and the back massage was the BEST while my toes dried!! Ahhh... I'm relaxed now and all for $30 + Tip

56.description: I am so excited! This is my new place!  I'm really nervous about going to new nail place but I took the chance.  I went around 11 am during the week.  Parking was easy at that time of the day.  Everyone was friendly and welcoming.  The place was clean and not cheesy.  I was asked to pick out a color and they guided me to a perfectly hot tub.  I usually like the chairs that massage you but these were very comfy and modern.  The cutest guy that works there was the guy doing my pedi and mani.  I have to say that he rubbed my feet way better than my boyfriend ever could!   His feet and hand rubs were amazing and I'm upgrading next time.  He also did my mani which was wonderful.  I told him he was the boss and just to make my nails look pretty.  I have the cutest nails now.  Even my friends noticed how nice they were!  He also rubbed my shoulders while my nails were drying.  YEAH!!!!The price was 8 dollars more than my old place but that was fine.  I feel like I finally got pampered.  Most places rush you and barely give you a rub down.  I stand on my feet and use my hands all day.  (I also pamper people for a living.)  I have high standards and I expect more than most.  I was quite satisfied with my service.  I don't know how the others are there. The young man that works there is my guy and I will wait for him again!  Oh yeah bring cash for a tip.  Don't complain about it either.  It is ALWAYS proper to tip in cash if you didn't know!

29.description: I came here because my MIL bought me a gift card. She knows I LOVE manis & pedis, but without the gift card...I wouldn't have gone in. I went with my mom and sister. It's overpriced, they forgot about our arm and neck massages with our manis, and they didn't put lotion on my hands after my manicure. Hello, lotion?! They forgot it. Not to mention I had to put neosporin on 3 of my toes 'cause they nicked my cuticles. No thanks.They take walk-ins, but I suggest calling in ahead of time because they will tell you to come in an hour or two later...even if people are available. That was strange.

42.description: Leo's french pedi came out flawless. He also gave THE BEST leg massage ever! I'm usually too sensitive for the pressure that spas tend to put but he had it just right!I got a no chip french manicure and yep... it's all still looking good 10 days later!

23.description: So first of all I have to say that the service was excellent I love my mani-pedi and it has a great selection of polish.  So what happened to me from one of their employees will have me never....ever.....ever.....ever returning to this salon again.1. I've been here before and did not have enough cash for the "CASH ONLY TIPS" side note....I spent the morning at SVEA down on Clark where they are also cash only.  Didn't have enough to tip my nail artist but she did a fabulous job.2. I paid with my card and tipping on my card was not offered at anytime during my services as a way to say "Hey customer if you don't have cash we can place a tip on your card" at no time during my service was this offered to me or posted. Thus I did not ask for a tip to be placed on my card.An employee, one who did not give me service approaches me as I leave and very loudly says "You got good service where is your tip" I told her in the salon I don't have enough cash to tip her she gets louder and becomes very rude about I could have placed it on my card.  Now I have a meeting to get to and I'm entertaining this woman while the owner walks away as if he has nothing to say.  The woman follows me outside as I tell her I come here often and I don't appreciate her harassing me over a tip that is optional and why am I explaining myself to her when she was not my technician nor is a manager or owner....I attempt to go back in to speak with the guy at the register and the lady literally pushes me to stop me from going back in because I am obviously not happy with her following me and almost bullying me into a tip.  Now I can say that I could have pacified her and lied but I chose to be honest.  After paying $40 for a mani-pedi and I am a returning customer if I don't have cash I don't have cash. Anyhow I placed a tip on my card because my tech was a lovely young lady and if i would have known I could place a tip on my card I would have done so.  Places of business should not force me to carry cash for a tip or not receive services.  I'm irritated that the owner was told his employee pushed me and he attempted to make no types of concession for her inappropriate behavior.  I did have to catch myself from pushing her back and am pleased to say I left with great nails, a bad attitude and thank God no restraining order.  From now on I will be going to Sonni down on Clark where the shop is more updated, and she knows how to treat her clients!

47.description: I've been here maybe 7 or 8 times and must say that this is a nice place to go for a quick mani/pedi and all of the nail technicians are quite nice. I did have one pedicure that only lasted 2 days but I don't think that is the norm -- we can blame it on the polish ... or maybe my hyperactive toes.I only have two complaints. One is the girl who is always at the front desk on the weekends. Talk about someone who never seems like she's having a good day ... Don't expect a warm welcome. The other is space. Only once did someone offer to take my coat and frankly there is just not enough room for coats and purses -- boots, scarves and gloves in the winter. Even when you are sitting waiting for your nails to dry, if a single person goes to look at the polish wall, it gets cramped and there is no place to move.I've had better overall, but this place does the trick if you are looking for a quick fix and a fantastic shoulder rub to top it off. I will keep going but a day with the girls might be deserving of a bit more.

8.description: I probably wont be back I went to get a no chip on Saturday and by Monday it was already chipped. They were nice enough to fix it but the polish was still picking up. Too bad they were close to were I live but not worth the money

31.description: I am the owner of my own hair braiding salon in the neighborhood, that is well reviewed on YELP. I know good customer service because I give it.My regular nail place was closed and I needed a manicure before an event this Sunday. I was a walk-in and told them all I wanted was a manicure. They asked if I could come back in an hour, but I was pressed for time. She said go ahead and sit down and she took off my old polish, then she said to wash my hands and to pay first. I said No problem and even tipped the lady first. She began right away with merely painting my nails with the base coat  without any soaking, cuticle removal, filing, buffing, shaping , or smoothing my nails at all. As she was applying the base clear coat I observed the client at the next station getting all of the services one would expect in even a rudimentry manicure, but she did none of these and moved on with putting the polish. I felt cheated and uncomfortable so I just told her to stop and walked out. I will never be walking in the door again.

34.description: Nothing better than treating yourself to a pedi when you're on your feet for many hours every day. Location is key for me with this place... a few blocks from my apartment. Scheduled a pedi for 11am on Saturday - would definitely recommend an appointment if you want to get in on the weekends. When I got there, it was already fairly busy and a lot of people had started to come in.There was nothing extremely special about the pedicure I received, but sometimes you just want your toes to look pretty and that be that. Comfy seats, clean area, pretty typical polish selection (OPI, Essie, etc). Had my pedicure about three weeks ago, still looks fantastic.You can pay by credit card, but gratuity is cash only. Decent prices, will be happy to consider this place my local nail salon.

16.description: Busy on the monday holiday, still didn't have to wait or come back later. Excellent spa services

13.description: Went in today to get a mani/pedi and was very disappointed. I brought my own colors (grey with pink glitter). The woman first did my toes and I couldnt believe how light the grey looked. Then I realized that she only did 1 color of the grey, everywhere I go it is always two coats of the color-never had to even ask. Ok it was done. Looks fine (not great). Then asked for a manicure (which is what I said I wanted) and the woman looked really put out. They had some kind of issue that I didnt understand but then they lead me to the manicure station. She was really rough on my cuticles. I wanted the same thing on my nails. She started with the grey, put one coat and then moved to the top coat. I asked her for a second coat and again she looked put out and irritated.Then she finished the second coat and started on the top coat and I asked for the sparkles. She rolled her eyes and then put it on. Talk about rude.Wont becoming back.

11.description: I went back to 2 x 10 today and was again impressed.  It's the little things when it comes to a good mani/pedi, and these ladies really pay attention well.  Details:- The technician didn't rush through the food or shoulder massages.- They have added a hot stone massage to the legs, in addition to the exfoliating scrub.- Hot towels clean your hands and feet of lotion (no awkward walk to a sink for you).- And...a sign of a really great manicure: the technician used a paintbrush with nail polish remover to clean my nails before applying the base coat, which ensures that your polish will last longer.  Nicely done.They have since added new massage chairs which are less pretty than the colorful cushions, but are probably more comfortable.  I'll keep coming back for more...

39.description: I went and had a manicure yesterday-- it was my first time there. Whle the decor is cute, none of the employees seemed the least bit interested in being there and they seemed to have some trouble figuring out where to put me even though it was nearly empty. After waiting for a while, a man sat down without saying a word and started working on my hands. It was extremely awkward. He did not respond to my attempts at making conversation, and didn't really make any eye contact with me or welcome me. So while the hand and neck massages that followed felt amazing, it was uncomfortable. My nails are all different shapes, the polish job leaves much to be desired, and my $15 manicure was already chipping this morning. While the staff was pleasant enough,  I will not be returning.

37.description: Horrible!! The manicurist cut me, was then rude - I left mid-mani and went down the street to have my nails painted. I'm pretty low-key, but this place was awful.

0.description: Stopped by on a whim for a manicure tonight, and glad I did!I beat the evening "rush" and sat down right away with Yuna.  She did a great job cleaning up my cuticles (I often don't go back to places due to them not doing this well) and was very careful with the manicure.  I am not sure if the other reviewers had someone else,  but I will be asking for Yuna specifically in the future.I was happy with their wide selection of colors.  Everything seemed clean and not too worn down, exactly what I expected from the outside.

38.description: I tried this nail salon out one Saturday afternoon as the location was very convenient for me. I had a mani/pedi which was pretty nice. The nail salon was fairly crowded since it was Saturday afternoon. However with my appointment, I was able to get seated right away. The place definitely had a neighborhood feel, as everyone in the nail salon seemed to know each other and the nail techs seemed to know everyone.One drawback for me, was that the pedicure chairs were not massage chairs. The nail techs did give shoulder massages after the manicures which almost made up for the missing massage chairs. The salon had flat screen TVs which were easy to watch throughout the treatments. I would consider trying this salon again since it is convenient location wise. However, it didn't really stand out for me as different than any other nail salon.

51.description: You have to keep one thing in mind: this is an in-and-out nail salon and not a spa. If you come in knowing that, you won't be disappointed.We've been going to 2x10 for a few years now. Despite having tried the several nail salons that popped up on Clark St. in the past year--including one that is several blocks closer to our house--we still keep going back to 2x10.Why? Simple:1. The prices are the best in the 'hood.2. They've always been kind, and I've never felt rushed, undervalued or overlooked.3. The hand, shoulder and leg massages (especially the extra long ones that come with the "2x10" mani/pedis) are amazing. They really are better than many high-end spas we've been to. Also, the salon menu says that the pedicures come with a "10 minute massage." At many places I've been to, this really translates to a rushed 5-6 minute rub. At 2x10, you'll actually see that the women will look at the clock to make sure it lasts the full 10 minutes--and it always does.4. My manis/pedis last longer from here than from anywhere else. And, at the end of the day, that's the best test.We made this place our go-to long before the 2011 facelift. Now, it's a gorgeous and posh space. In my mind, it makes it an even better value!

27.description: Ya'll I've been to EVERY nail salon in Andersonville, including Jade's (SCARY), and this place is the best. I thought Nail Pallette was where it was AT, but I was wrong! 2x10 Nails had really great, friendly staff, the massage chairs are amazing, the nail techs are SUPER detailed-oriented and take. their. time. I hate feeling like the tech is rushing through my mani or pedi and I've felt that SO many times at other places. Not here. You basically get a whole body massage by the end of your time because they massage your legs during the pedi, arms during the mani and your shoulders as your nails dry. I mean, C'MON!I went in for a mani-pedi today on my day off (Wednesdays mani-pedis are $35!) and it was a great way to use a vacation day! I felt relaxed and left with GORGEOUS nails. Angie was my nail tech and she was sweet, attentive and did a fab job. 2x10 Nails is my new nail joint! As for folks saying it's too expensive, I feel like in this case, you get what you pay for. If you want to be rushed and have your nails look shitty, go to Jade's. If you want someone who is going to take his/her time, give you a stellar mani (and/or pedi) and find yourself in a super clean, relaxed environment, go to 2x10 Nails.

32.description: Came in for a pedi last week with a friend both as walk ins and they got us in right away. The first thing I noticed was the chairs were not the normal massage chairs that you would normally find in a nail salon. They were cushions with pillows. At first it wasn't a big deal and I was willing to try something else - but as a shorter person, I quickly realized that it definitely wasn't as comfortable for me as a massage chair normally is, simply for the fact that I somewhat had to lay down, resulting in a sore lower back and shoulders. The pedi itself was nice - nothing special - my technician seemed a bit rushed through it, but the pedi turned out nice, and ended with a quick shoulder rub while the nails were drying. For $30, I've have a better pedi experience, but it certainly wasn't bad. Probably wouldn't be my first choice for my next pedi in Andersonville, but would keep it as an option if my first choice was booked.

54.description: I have never felt rushed even when all the couches and chairs are completely filled with clientele. Not only do they take their time they are super friendly and cheerful. They also give the best massages while you wait for your polish to dry. I've never had the same employee twice which means I've had multiple different massages as well. Totally relaxing way to finish off a day at the office.I ding them one star based on the inventory of polish colors they offer. Sometimes a girl just wants more options.

48.description: I love this salon.  The price is excellent, the pedicures are so incredibly relaxing, and the five minute massage while your nails dry is just awesome.  Every time I go I walk out so incredibly relaxed and blissed out.  Also, their pedicures last easily a month, sometimes longer.  Incredibly good value, a pleasant environment and a friendly and efficient staff.

44.description: The last five times I've been here, I've received the best mani pedis ever. It is really relaxing. You get a nice shoulder massage and hot stones. Definitely the best place for nails in Andersonville.

24.description: Great little place. I headed over here a couple days ago to mix it up and see if there is another contender for Favorite Pedicure Place besides Magic Nails on Broadway.This place is it! Friendly nail technician made my toes look flawless. Foot and leg massage AND a shoulder rub while my toes were drying. I was in there for a long time, and it was very relaxing. Friendly, nice owner as well. The price - $30 for a pedicure, is standard. I was there on a Wednesday, and didn't take advantage of the $35 mani/pedi special, but I will in the future.Clean shop, and not an overwhelming polish smell. Oh, and they had NEWS on, instead of some insipid chick flick (not to say I don't enjoy on occasion) playing. For news-obsessed me, this was a good thing on this day.I will be back.

7.description: If you read the 1 stars here, they are quite consistent, with what I experienced today.  This is a backup to Nail Gallery in Bucktown on Damen (so worth the drive with the extras and service if you have the time) as it's in my neighborhood.When i first walked in there was no one there being serviced, great.  First of all all the nail colors looked like they hadn't been used in forever. When I sat down with Aya, no where did I see sterilizing solutions for their instruments.   File was old, buffer used, and nail equipment worn down.  She was to the point, very speedy.  While filing my nails, she stabbed me several times with her own nails, and while I told her to file only, and let her clip one that needed it, she started clipping others to get the filing done faster.  I actually had to stop her!Prior to the hand massage they put hand lotion on, she put so much on my hands, the lotion was dripping onto the paper towels below.  Then came the neck massage....skip it, unless you want to be in worse shape than you started!...I had to stop her as she literally pounded into my shoulder and I now have a kink in my neck.The capper was when it came time to pay prior to nail application, I paid exactly the amount of the manicure.  She came back and said 'you need me to make more change'  i.e.. b/c i haven't given any money for a tip.  Nope.  At this point, it was not earned.  So the nail application completes, I wait til nails dried, and then left...not before being accosted while she was giving a pedicure 'money for tip?'  So not once, but TWICE was I bullied to give this sub par service extra money.  I am a huge fan of the service industry and always tip well for GOOD SERVICE.  (ask the folks down in buck town), but I won't give a dime for the fact of pure entitlement for the fact that I paid for a service, and received poor service.There are other options in Andersonville on Clark St., I'd say they cannot be any worse than this.

49.description: I went in for a no chip manicure and it chipped later that night!!  I've had no chip manicures before and that's never happened.  They offered to fix it but I'm flying out of town for a wedding. :(

40.description: Best nail salon I have ever been to.  The extra touch of massage even just for a manicure is wonderful. $35 on Wednesday's for a mani and pedi. Gorgeous, clean, comfortable salon. Highly recommend. Staff is very friendly, especially the cashier guy. Great!!!

53.description: I just moved to andersonville and was walking around the neighborhood until I found this place. After I went in to get my nails done, I was very disappointed with this experience. When I first got there the lady asked me with very cool tone if I want to be part of the system. Then while they were offering other people if they can take your coat, they didn't offer me if they can take my coat. I felt like I wasn't even one of their customers. When I sat down on the pedicure chair, which didn't have a massage option, my technician turned on really hot water and I almost burnt my feet. At the same time I had all my stuff, including my coat and my bag, on the chair too, so I didn't even have enough space to relax while getting my nails done. I also felt like they were in a rush when there weren't busy at all. It seemed like she just wanted to get it over with. When I was drying my nails, it was freezing cold since it was right by the window, and 15 minutes later, my nails weren't even close to being dried, I asked them if this was normal and they checked the dryer again and said they forgot to turn on the dryer. Since I didn't have enough time to sit in the cold for another 15 minutes, I just asked them if they can wrap my toes, but they did it terribly and I could feel nail polish on my toe nails getting ruined. It was just an unpleasing experience overall. Oh, the only thing I liked is their fancy stone decoration that was framed behind the spa chairs.I am for sure looking for a new place in Andersonville now. I hope there is one near here..

30.description: While 2x10 is very nice, it's also expensive for a basic manicure.  I like my manis cheap and dirty.  Tis not the case with 2x10.

46.description: I loved the receptionist - he is a sweetheart! Very friendly and helpful! I had a no-chip and pedicure with Michelle and she was a sweetheart too. It was my 1st no-chip and she patiently answered all my questions. The shoulder massage at the end is a plus! I also saw one of the professionals (a male manicurist - the Leo mentioned below?) giving the clients amazing hand and shoulder massages. I want him next time! I am not giving 5 stars for 2 reasons - the regular pedicure is too expensive! It's worth if you have the regular mani-pedi package ($35 on Wed), but that was not my case (I was already paying $40 for the no-chip; $30 more??); and, I was asked to wash my hands in the bathroom after having my nails filed - I never had to do that before! But overall, great, and I intend to go back.

1.description: Tina is just the best... I've also gotten Euna and the older lady with curly hair. It's hard to just walk in and  get your nails done. Call ahead and ask for Tina!!

55.description: NOT WORTH THE PRICE.Sure, it's a pretty salon with modern couches in front of the pedicure tubs...but they RUSH everything....they didn't even use warm water in my tub......and when I got home, I had to fix the polish on two of my nails myself, which of course messed up my nail polish......I wish they would just limit the number of customers, instead of rushing through everything......I expected a pro job, and they did exactly what I do at home, except faster...I wanted them to make my feet feel pampered, and they didn't...

9.description: I am a fan of 2x10 on Montrose and someone gave me a gift card for the one on Clark.  It was not good. The pedicure was the worst I have ever had. They did nothing to buff my feet or remove any dry skin. So disappointing. My nail tech could not speak a word of English so I could not communicate with him at all.

26.description: I've tried this place a few times and unfortunately I've left dissapointed twice.  The people are friendly (which is why I want to love this place), but the outcome is less than desirable.  Mani/Pedi- Mani did not cut my cuticles.  Also, it wasnt that busy, and all the ladies were in the back of the room and were so loud!  Part of the experience is the EXPERIENCE! How can you relax with a bunch of cackling?!I found the experience to be unnerving  and I will have to re-do my mani myself.  I really wanted to love this place, but unfortunately i just dont.

25.description: This place is wonderful.  I've been getting my nails done in Chicago for 3 years now, at a number of places, and have yet to walk away saying "I enjoyed that."  To even find someone nice, and genuinely nice on top of that, in a nail salon nowadays seems impossible.  Firstly, I made an appt for a mani pedi.  I got Mary, which is important to this review and she made the experience what it was.  She went to do my feet and realized I had a no-chip pedi on  (not recommended btw).  It was almost impossible to get off and added an extra 30 mins, at least, to my appt time.  I felt terrible but she kept smiling and saying 'it's ok' all while calling for more people to come in and work because the schedule was screwed up.  I still feel terrible :(  I thought this would definitely ruin the experience or make her hurry on the actual pedi but instead she took her time AND gave an awesome massage. Strongest little fingers, and this is by far the best part of a pedicure!  Mary could also tell that I have been sick and kept using kleenexes from my purse so she brought over a box of kleenex and kept getting them for me when she thought I needed one.  I didn't ask and felt bad about it but she seemed so happy to help out.  The manicure went smoothly and included yet another awesome mini massage on the hands and shoulders which almost put me to sleep.  I would pay a lot extra for that to be longer which I noticed upon my exit you CAN do so WILL do next time!Lastly, the ambience is like no other little salon.  It's not tacky or chintzy, it's decorated so tastefully.  By far the nicest looking nail salon I've been in (keep in mind I don't go to high class places ie The Peninsula.  It was definitely decorated more for the customer with nice little touches. All staff were helpful upon leaving, putting oil on fingers, helping with purse.  It was a great experience and I highly recommend!

12.description: I'm a regular at this location and have always been content. Until today. My friend and I had reservations for 2 pedicures at 2 pm. The guy couldn't take us because he "didn't know it would be so busy." Huh? I guess reservations are meaningless.

59.description: This is a clean place, good service, can be packed sometimes, so I would recommend an appointment. Yes, I do get my feet done, I dont touch feet, especially my own. SO iIhave to pay people to touch my feet. They do a great job, buff and shine for me, no polish!!If you want value, go somewhere else in terms of getting a lower price. This place is clean, and I bring my daughters in here and we get peds together.Good local joint, dont go out of your way to come here because there are a ton of these all over the city.

21.description: This place clearly is more interested in making a quick buck then it is in keeping it's clients. I am new to the area and only have been in a few times. Each time it was so so. Nails turned out a little sloppy and it was kinda slow. Today I called ahead and asked if they could fit me in for a mani-pedi and if it could be done same time ( I"m a busy working mom). They lady on the phone told me it would be no problem. I arrived just when I said I would and she told me that they had to many walk in and I would have to to wait. She also laughed as she was telling me this. I reminded her that I had called and she told me I could come in. She laughed again and said "yeah but we had walk ins."I walked out and am never coming back. Went up the street to Palette. They were super nice, took me right away, and did a spectacular job.

17.description: I am going out of town tomorrow and needed a quick pedicure this afternoon.  It's Memorial Day and there weren't a lot of available options and to my pleasure 2 X 10 Nails answered the phone and confirmed they were open.I walked in and they were able to accommodate me immediately, but aside from the fact that they were open and available to take me, the positives stop.I could have done a better job on my toes had I been blindfolded and throwing toe nail polish in random directions.  There is polish all over my toes, my right pinky toe isn't completely covered and my right big toe looks like there are clumps of paint on it.This is a joke.  I paid $30 for this "pedicure" and it looks like a 2 year old painted my nails.Maybe Mary was trying to rush me out due to the holiday, but why open if this is the type of work you do?  She spent all of a minute scrubbing my feet and the luke warm towel did nothing to help.  My feet feel worse than they did before I walked in and my toes were better off without any polish.If I could give zero stars, I would.You will not receive my business again.

10.description: I will certainly never go back . Really unfortunate because they are right down the street from my house, have gone to them since I moved here a year ago at least 5 or 6 times. Would have been a regular there . I have given them several opportunities and have been disappointed each time. One time literally was yelled at in a different language , as the women stormed off the manager had to finish my nails. What I did wrong I'll never know . Also have literally never heard them say thank you after anyone tipped them ( and I always tip 20%) and finally this last time they rushed me so much they did mani and pedi at the same time ( which was fine ) but my nails looked awful. Uneven , hardly cut cuticles even after I asked her to go back and do a better job on them. And a 5 minute shoulder massage is supposed to be included ( says so on the description ) - they have skipped that for me several times . The staff is just extremely rude in general .I will travel somewhere else to get my nails done from now on.  I would not recommend anyone to go there . I certainly hope the business owner sees this review because if they want to keep people coming back they may want to address the poor attitude of the employees.

5.description: $35 ($42 with tip) no chip manicure chipped after one day. Went back after three days and they did fix the two chipped nails. Other nails started chipping and peeling 8 days after manicure. Clearly something was wrong with polish or application. I will not be back which is too bad because the complimentary neck massage is nice.

3.description: The woman who did my nails was very sweet, but sadly that is the only nice thing I can say.  This is one of the worst manicures I've ever had.  Nail polish was old and thick, which means it took forever to dry...and since I can't sit with my hands motionless for 4 hours, I had chips and smudges shortly after leaving.  I even asked her if it was too thick to use, but she assured me it was ok. Nails were filed unevenly, polish doesn't even come close to my cuticles (looks like it's had almost a week of growing out). Just looks incredibly dull and sad. Sigh. I got the mani less than 24 hours ago and have already taken the polish off. I feel bad writing this because she was so nice, but I will definitely not be back again.

35.description: I've gone to this salon several times in the past and received reasonable service.  Today I made an appt for myself and my sister who was visiting. Nika did my nails and her service and attitude left much to be desired.  I picked a pinky-peach color and requested a round shape.  She filed all my nails differently... some round, but most clearly square. I nicely requested that she refine a few. She was pretty rude about that, arguing that they were round already but, did oblige and fixed them with the file and gross, peeling block.  After filing I paid and tipped $5 for $15 service. Then she rushed through everything else. My sister's manicure started 5 minutes before mine and hers was done minutes after mine.  At the drying station I noticed that I had bubbles in the polish and the color had changed to a pumpkin orange.  Since this was not what I wanted I showed it to the receptionist and the manager, Mary came over apologizing.  She helped me pick a new color and sat me back with Nika who looked very annoyed. She said it would cost $10 to fix at which point, Mary came over again and said no, please just fix it because it wasn't right  Then when Mary left, Nika goes, "this always happens with this color, you should have known". To which, I said, "I'm sorry, but I didn't know and if you did maybe it would have been nice to share with me".  Then she got all snotty again and was like oh this is my fault then, huh, and kept saying, "what a waste". She then proceeded to say, "when I put the topcoat on this are you going to make me re-do it again". Seriously?! I looked over my shoulder and Mary was there, I told her that Nika was being very rude. She said sorry, but that she had been working all day, so basically give her a break. I'm sorry, but I didn't come here for a bad job and to pay to be mistreated.  I used to like coming here because it was close and I would get reasonable service, but no longer will I be supporting a place that allows their staff to act that way. Also the re-do looks bubbly again. Thanks, but no thanks!

19.description: I've been here three times for a basic manicure. The first one was good, the second was fine, and the third (yesterday) was terrible. The manicurist made me feel rushed, did not trim my cuticles at all, and did not listen when I politely asked her to please paint further back on the nail.I could have done a MUCH better job at home, and saved $17. I won't be back.

28.description: I used to be a loyal customer going every other week. Staff have changed over time and they have lost some of their best technicians. The owner is obviously trying to add to the business with new equipment and chairs. However she hires inept staff she is also very concerned with the $$ as she frequently has forgotten to use discounts, promotional programs and has overcharged as well. Used to be great. Now, they are no different than any other salon. Nothing here to set them at a higher level. They are losing a lot of nails with my four paws.

45.description: Just went here in Andersonville. Worst mani/pedi ever. Pedicures are NOT supposed to  hurt, well, this one did. Then, when she was doing my mani, she smeared the polish on one toe with her foot, didn't remove and redo, just went right over the smear. And, my cuticles look horrible. Didn't buff my nails. And, kept looking over my shoulder as though someone she wanted to do was waiting and just rushed with me. I will never go here again. I only wish I hadn't left a good tip.

33.description: Love this place.  I get the 2 x 10 pedi.  The service is stellar and the place is immaculate.  They also have a rewards program, they keep track of your purchases and you get credit towards dollars off your bill whenever you want to use them.   I have not had one person here who has not done a great job on my pedi, or no chip mani.  I come weekly.

43.description: I've been here a couple of times. The first time I came in I got a french manicure. The lady I won't say her name did an awesome job polishing my nails, maybe because my cuticle weren't that bad and the color was lite that it looked better.  Then I went in for a mani/pedi, a week and a half later. WOW. I was really disappointed. They were pretty busy and I had called and made an appointment. I went in and the lady said everyone was tired because they had a long day. I was like 'shit" now this service is going to suck cause she just admitted that she was tired. Her nippers were dull. I mean come on there are so many other nippers in the place can't you borrow someones. damn, barely took any cuticle off, at least push them back decently, Very disappointing. She polished my nails, did a good job with the polish but didn't really get to close. I did like the way she filled by nails. so props to her. I need my nails down so I just told myself just don't say anything and do it cause then I know they're going to talk smack in a different language and it's just going to get uncomfortable, My manicure took 30min. Then I had my pedicure. OMG!! I don't think they even sterilized the jacuzzi. I don't care if they soak my feet in barbicide which I think they did. But I didn't see anyone spraying anything or cleaning it after another person finished, I got a little worried. O.k. so my pedicure took 23 min. WTF!! at least give me 30 min. that really sucks. My cuticles weren't cut or pushed back, I didn't have a pedicure in 3 wks, that's just bogus. and then your gonna say I'm down. wow. wow. wow. I highly doubt im going to go back because after 2 days I had to cut my own cuticles after spending $40. to just do it myself.  Not a bad place if you don't want your cuticles cut or pushed back for a nice quicky.  By the way I also caught two of them talking about another girl who was having her nails dried. That's not nice. People might not speak the language and all but we know when there's shit talking going on. Oh and while the receptionist was sipping her drink she could have offered people magazines. Cause whats the point of a receptionist.

2.description: Took my wife here for her Birthday mani-pedi.  Service is excellent.  My following comment is regarding the pedicure (owners take notice):The tech had cut a small, thin strip of skin from the inner-side of the nail of her big toe and not soon after, was getting infected.  She went to her podiatrist and she told her next time she goes to not let them use any kind of sharp instrument to work on her nails.  Her reason was simple: they are not trained to do such procedures.  Her podiatrist doesn't even let her nail salon use anything other than a nail file.  That may be overboard for some of you, but being a podiatrist, she has excellent reason that I'm certain nobody wants to hear.  Thankfully the infection wasn't too bad, but it didn't come without a few shots to the toe and some more cutting to remove the infection.Despite the above, it's a nice place that looks modern and does nails well, meaning no streaks or over-painting the nail-to-cuticle..  A reviewer below complained of the dark brown wood/drab ambience.  Just stupid.  There are salons that look way worse; just head to any mall and pick one.

18.description: The service is ok but don't come hour and a half before close.  The nail tech's will rush you to leave before nails are dry, they will speak in a different language  and laugh in front of you to make you feel  and embarrassed. And most of all your they will skip buffing and cleaning the nail.
