I asked for the strawberries and whipped cream on my pancakes and I literally got like 4 thinly sliced slivers of strawberries and a dollop of whipped cream. My eggs were not cooked as I ordered but I ate them anyway. I would go again just because it is within walking distance of my house but the food and service were just okay. The information says that they don't take credit cards, but on the door they have a Visa, Mastercard, and Discover sticker so they apparently do now.

33.description: This place was a short walk from my old condo in Bowmanville. I frequented it occasionally when I was looking for a no frills, straight up breakfast place.  Now I am not a breakfast person, I am a brunch person. I think these are two very different types of people. I would classify this as a breakfast place. It has a cute diner meets grandma appeal.  I've had the cheddar bacon waffle which I found to be the perfect salty-sweet-savory combination to satisfy this brunch fiend.  Most of the other people I've been here with chose your more typical breakfast items: pancakes, eggs, etc. Everyone I've been here with has said they've enjoyed their food.  Pleasant waitstaff, affordable, and satisfying . . . even to a brunch person.

43.description: The food was decent. I had the country breakfast- gravy wasn't very flavorful and needed to more sausage. The biscuits tasted like they came from a can. Decent. Not great. The service was not good! Our waitress Gloria was so slow!!! I'm sure she's Sweet, but she never checked on us. Took forever to order or to get our check. The other waitrons helped us and they were more attentive to us. They were amazing! Especially the bald man with a hat- amazing service! Decent food. Good portions... Not great service from Gloria! The others were good though.

2.description: Kitschy cozy diner atmosphere in spades. The walls are a visual feast with all kinds of fun funky decor. Delicious simple breakfast that's well made and generous in size. Lumberjack special really hit the spot since I was starving and it was nearing mid-afternoon. Potatoes were well seasoned and mixed with roasted red peppers, steak and eggs were cooked perfectly. Coffee was very good. Nostalgia set in fast, it was like breakfast at Grandma's house. If you want retro and unpretentious, Pauline's is the place.The hostess told us to sit wherever we wanted, and service was prompt and friendly.  I've been wanting to try this place for a long time, and was really glad I finally did. There are *a lot* of whiny, delusional, and/or entitled reviews on here, which I recommend taking with a huge grain of salt or just ignoring altogether...

18.description: The breakfast was great, simple and fresh. The only thing that really bugged me was the bug catchers. The entire time I couldn't stop thinking of them, little disturbing, but nonetheless it wasn't bad, the bug thing is the only thing that would keep me from going back.

41.description: I just moved to the Chicago area and I had been interested in trying various brunch places. The problem is that I tried to find a brunch place open on a Monday afternoon. I looked for places that served brunch in the Rogers Park area in Chicago and stumbled upon Pauline's. When I first walked in, I noticed the smell. Being from the south, the smell of good Ol' country cuisine pervaded the air. The waitress was attentive, offering more coffee at least four times. I ordered the Salmon Omelette, which was divine. The food came very quickly, and being that I ate at 10:30am, everything was perfect. I would definitely recommend this place. It mixes the old diner kind of feel with comfort food and innovation. It is also located in a residential area, which makes it quite charming.

52.description: I had breakfast last saturday 1/18/14. I had the make your own omelet with feta cheese, spinach, and sundried tomatoes. Everything was hot and very tasty.MikeUpCycle with Michael

50.description: 3 basted eggs with potatoes, corned beef hash, and whole grain toast is what I ordered. Everything on the plate was very good and fresh tasting. I appreciate the portions (not too small and not too much) and the very reasonable price. My daughter and her friend also enjoyed their choices. The service was very good as well. Will be coming back more often.

4.description: Breakfast joint on the west side of Andersonville that doesn't compete well with the other local options in the area.   Interior goes for the retro vibe and has a very cramped feel to it.    The menu consists of primarily classic breakfast items.   The execution on the items is average at best.   No sticker shock on the prices, but hard to call them reasonable when the food is subpar.

6.description: Great food but the waiter was terrible I hope the owner of this place tells her something I had keep asking the the people who clean the tables  for more coffee and our waiter didn't Evan bother to ask if we needed anything else her name is Gloria I think

22.description: The best thing about the place is its location and a local guy who usually hangs out there with his two Macaw parrots. We ate there once and don't want to go back. The food was rather tasteless and the service ok. Basic dinner. If the chef was better, we would go back, as we like the location, but we don't like to pay for food that tastes bad!

15.description: My experience was not the best.  The waitress was very unpleasant, there was so many fruit flys that it was disgusting to eat.  The food was good the service sucked! You need to know that customers can tell when you are not happy to be doing your job.

57.description: Went there for Sunday brunch with my wife. Tables are way to small they are Bistro size we had to set some of the dishes on the next table.  My wife's first dish came out COLD, we sent it back and they did give her a fresh warm meal that was just ok.  We got the pumpkin pancakes which had little to no pumpkin in them. The food is just ok, the place is nicely decorated, it has the potential to be a good restaurant but they do need to work on the menu, as there are many better restaurants in Chicago. This review is for the Pauline's on Fullerton

20.description: Cozy, down home basic breakfast food. Staff is friendly, and the food is good, particularly the French toast. Nothing is going to blow you away with its greatness, but then nothing is bad, either.

36.description: An affordable, greasy spoon diner with some unexpected non-greasy spoon touches. It has everything you'd expect of a breakfast-and-lunch joint: big, overly cheesy omelettes (The Fresh Broccoli Crown And Asparagus, South American, and Country Time are favorites.), giant pancakes loaded with chocolate chips, crispy breakfast potatoes. Everything's cooked on a big griddle, with short-order cooks constantly in motion. The nice surprises are the fresh made juices - they'll juice anything! Try the beet, carrot & orange! - and the sunny, dog-friendly patio on a quiet corner (minus the occasionally passing Metra). Pauline is evidently a big dog lover, because there are also photos of dogs up for adoption posted all over the restaurant. It's cash-only, but has an ATM. If you go on a weekend, you'll see who I refer to as 'The Parrot Guy', a quiet, mustached man who pushes his two macaws, Sam and Bruno, around on a baby buggy throughout the neighborhood. If he's a fan of Pauline's, so am I.

14.description: I've been coming here since I was 2. Love coming here especially in the summer to eat on the patio with my doggies. They are pet friendly in the patio. They bring a water bowl for your furry family members. Breakfast is always good. French toast is the best I have ever had! It's a must have. They don't have a overwhelming menu, just the basics with few specialties, but the quality and ingredients are great. I really only go here for breakfast, lunch menu doesn't seem that big.I will probably keep coming here and maybe one day when I have kids will bring my kids here to. Its very family friendly and a tradition for me and my family on Sundays.

3.description: I have lunch here on occasion. I have never had a problem with service. The guys who serve me have always been pleasant and nice. Maybe because I go at a time where they aren't so busy. It's very quiet and clean. The bathroom is immaculate. My salads are always great. Wish they hadn't stopped serving spinach, though. But I will visit them again and have lunch.

1.description: Just went here for lunch today. It's been a while since I've had subway and just moved to the area, so I thought i would give our lovely neighborhood subway a try! .......the staff wasn't very friendly. The woman who took my order was very rude. I asked for spinach on my sandwich and she kind of huffed and puffed about it (sorry your shredded lettuce looks terrible).Then when I was checking out, she took my card, then rudely handed it back and walked away without even acknowledging me.Thanks?Maybe she was having a bad day? Nah, doubt it. She just seemed like and unfriendly human being. The sandwich was fine, tomatoes looked slightly yellow. Oh well. Maybe I'll go back if I'm ever having some intense subway craving, and hopefully things will be better..?

2.description: Staff was great! Place was clean but why was my bread hard as a brick and was stale as hell? The bread was so hard it was inedible. Im quiet sure I will not be back!

5.description: The food is your typical Subway stuff, but the service is less than desirable.  I realize that this is a almost brand new Subway location, however, wouldn't you assume that they would hire people who had some sort of "sandwich artist" experience.  Now I used to be an assistant manager of the Subway in my home town (holla to ma Harvard peeps!) so maybe I get annoyed easier than most when I see them cut the bread wrong, but come on, no one should have to repeat "lettuce" 4 times and it shouldn't take 4 minutes to put it on the sandwich.  I don't know if any of you reading this ever worked at Subway, but every time I'm at a crappy one I wanna jump over that counter, put on some plastic gloves and start workin the veggies myself.  Geeze.

0.description: Staff great. Love how clean and nice it is.  Service is quick.  Great location.

4.description: I work right around the corner from this Subway, so I ventured in one day when I needed something to eat quickly. The service was slowwwwwwwwwwwwww. Which I have noticed before walking by, it always has long lines.Right after school, it is filled with St. Gregory kids, and hard to get a table. When I was there, there were two Subway employees sitting at one table. No Subway is my favorite place to get food, but this okay service and okay food did the trick with my 20 minute window to get some food.

12.description: This review is long over due. I go to Chyla for everything!!! Hair, make-up, style tips, you name it. My make-up is always so flawless and it lasts for the whole day. She only uses high end makeup  so you are really getting a bang for your buck. I was amazed on how much make-up she brought. She's so organized and professional with an awesome personality. She's also done my hair for a wedding and I got so many compliments..I never wanted to take my hair down..lol. She is truly a master at her craft and anyone who goes to her will be more satisfied with her work. She really listens to what I want done and then puts her creative twist to my look. I love it! She's the best and if you landed her, look no more. This is your girl.

3.description: Chyla did my hair and makeup for my wedding in September. It was really easy to schedule a trial on a Saturday in the summer (before my July bridal shower), and it was then I recognized just how awesome she is! I have very fine hair that I was trying to grow out before the wedding in hopes of a curly, lush updo. She was able to take my ideas and transform my locks into a beautiful style that made my hair look so much more voluminous than it actually is. It lasted all night! Chyla had top of the line heating tools and an extensive makeup kit featuring Bobbi Brown. This was my first experience with airbrush makeup and I LOVED it. So natural, flawless, and long-lasting. Chyla styled five of us on her own the morning before my wedding and was so incredibly professional. I definitely recommend Chyla if you want a stress-free and fun getting ready experience.

1.description: *UPDATE from my wedding* The night before my wedding, I had a bit of nerves about how things were going to go down on the big day, but one thing was for sure, I had NO worries about my hair & makeup with Chyla. If I had any questions or concerns, she was wonderful about contacting me right away. On the big day, Chyla and the hairstylist arrived on time to the hotel suite. She brought all her tools, and had this wicked lighting stand that did wonders. She listened to what the bridesmaids wanted & did their makeup beautifully. They were all so pleased with her services and I couldn't be prouder to call these beauties my bridesmaids. When it was time for me to get dolled up, she started with my hair. Although I had my hair trials with her, I expressed that I wanted tighter curls that would last throughout the day. She agreed with me and discussed what she was going to do to make the curls last all day & all night. The photos attached is proof of her work. The curls & the complete hairstyle turned out better than I imagined, and it brought out my balayage/ombre highlights perfectly. As for makeup, she is a genius! She knows exactly what works my skin tone, my eye shape, etc. When I expressed that I wanted more coverage, she fixed that up right away. We went for a traditional makeup due to my combination/oily skin, she gave me a beautiful winged cat eyeliner, gorgeous shades of purple/lilac on my lids, soft/bronzy contour in my cheeks, and attached the fake lashes that I brought with me. I continue to get compliments on my wedding hair and makeup to this day, and when I look back at the photos, I couldn't be more pleased with Chyla. She is the best of the best, professional, passionate about her work, and listens to her clients. Ladies, you will not be disappointed.

2.description: Are you kidding me?  There is no other person I would trust to make me and my closest friends look amazing for my wedding!  She even did my mother and Godmother's make-up (they are really hard to please) and all they could do was rave about how great Chyla was!On the day of my wedding Chyla brought her Glam squad to get us all primped and ready.  She brought an additional make-up artist and our hair stylist for the day was Jeni.Chyla's extremely professional, friendly, and she's patient.  With all the stress and craziness that comes with a wedding, she's pretty much right by your side taking the journey with you and making sure you're at ease and happy with everything she's providing you.I loved my make up and hair the day of the wedding and got so many compliments!  The make up lasted all day and night and my hair looked so good. I couldn't be happier with how everything turned out and I will always go to Chyla whenever I need my hair and make up done =)If you need a hair and make up artist for your big day!  Look no further!

9.description: She was recommended to me by a friend and let me just say I was SUPER HAPPY! She did an amazing job with both my makeup and hair. She uses high end products and really takes her time doing what she does best. I've had bad experiences before with makeup artists that are in a rush and don't use good makeup. Chyla is very friendly, funny & and true artist! Will definitely use her in the future when I have a big event to go to!

10.description: I was referred by a friend to Chyla. She did my makeup for an event recently and I LOVED it. She is very professional, uses high quality products, and is very clean. She listened to what I wanted, and brought the vision to life. When she was done I felt so confident and beautiful. I made sure I snapped a ton of selfies! I'm excited to work with her again for my wedding. Thanks, Chyla!

13.description: I've seen Chyla's great work before and was so excited that she was going to do my makeup for a wedding I was attending. She is professional and very knowledgeable. I was very happy with the results!

16.description: I decided to use Chayla as the MUA for my big day after having my makeup done by her for my best friend's wedding in February. Chayla has both airbrush/traditional foundation and has a very impressive makeup kit! Chayla did my makeup as well as all of my bridesmaids, my mom/aunt/grandmother so she worked with a variety of ages/skin types. It was an extremely long day (she did 11 people's makeup plus myself, the bride) and from the first to the last person she did an incredible job. Everyone was very pleased with their makeup and looked absolutely beautiful. I felt like Chayla made me feel beautiful and like a bride but I still looked like myself (the look most brides go for!). In both of the weddings in which I worked with Chayla I felt like she did a wonderful job of listening to what people really wanted, making them look beautiful while honoring their wishes and putting on the type of makeup/look they felt comfortable with. Also, Chayla was just really sweet and enjoyable to work with. I would definitely recommend her to other brides!

6.description: I had a great experience using Chyla for my Bridal hair and makeup.  I had a trial session done the week prior, which helped decide on my hair options as well got to see the makeup applications and what colors I liked best.  Chyla comes to your home with the whole makeup kit and tools.   I had a standard makeup application done during my trial, but  decided to go with airbrush makeup application (which I've never done before) for the big day.Needless to say, on my wedding day, my makeup and hair turned out fabulous.  My face was flawless with the makeup Chyla did, made it look natural.  I also loved my hair. I wore it down that day, so I was very concerned with the curls and how long they would last.  Both my hair and makeup lasted me all day/night and hair even looked good the next day!  Since then, I've used Chyla for another makeup session for an event.  I will continue to use her for any special events I have.  Highly recommend using Chyla!

15.description: I'm so happy I choose Chyla to do my hair and makeup for my wedding. She did a great job and was also very personable. My hair turned out better than I imagined and my makeup was flawless and felt so light, I almost forgot to take it off that night.  I would definitely recommend her and use her services again!

0.description: Chyla does an amazing job! She completed hair and makeup services for my wedding day 12/12/15. I had a party of six (including bridesmaids, mom and grandma) and with her detailed timeline I knew there would be nothing to worry about. I was also pleased to complete a trial the month before as I realized I would need extensions for the day of. (Note, it's definitely worthwhile to complete a trial even if you think you know what you want!)Chyla listened and addressed all questions or concerns with professionalism and patience, she also delivered great results. In addition, she was well-organized and came very prepared to ensure a smooth and timely service for all. I highly recommend her services, you will be very satisfied!

5.description: Chyla did my hair and makeup for my wedding, as well as my mother and sister's hair.  She did a great job!  I don't have a lot of hair (about chin length), and she managed to create an up do for me that not only looked great, it survived my windy outdoor ceremony and a full day of my indoor/outdoor wedding.  She also did a great job on my makeup.  I asked to look as natural as possible, as I typically don't wear a lot of makeup, and she respected that while still making me look bridal and photo-ready.  She used airbrush on me, and it lasted all day.  She also gave me fake eyelashes, which stayed put even though I cried many times that day! I would definitely recommend Chyla.

11.description: I booked my hair and makeup last minute --just a week before my small wedding-- and Chyla, graciously enough, agreed to do my hair and makeup. Both my mom and I were very pleased with the results.I highly recommend Chylartistry! Chyla is super profesional, friendly and talented!

8.description: She was absolutely magnificent! I was super impressed. She did my make up for my bridal shower and it turned out so great and flawless. She was on time and very professional. I would recommend her to anyone and I would definitely hire her once again!

4.description: Chyla was able to fit me in pretty last minute for a bridal trial.  I was EXTREMELY impressed and happy with the trial so I booked her for my wedding.  She was patient with me and had ideas in terms of hair styles and makeup.  She carries top of the line makeup and tools.  I went with airbrush makeup and it looked flawless!Day of the wedding she was at my house bright and early.  Last minute, I added an additional two people for makeup and she squeezed them into our already jam packed day.  My hair and makeup were beautiful and looked flawless (I received so many compliments!).  Both hair and makeup lasted all night long and even into the next day.  Chyla is super sweet, personable and professional! I will definitely hire her again shall the need arise.  I highly recommend Chyla!

14.description: The amazing Chyla did my first fun professional shoot in Germany and she used high end makeup pigments,different colors, and even CANDY to create the awesome finished look. She also manages to do very cute hair styles in such a short time! I had a fun day and left feeling beautiful than ever!

7.description: Chyla is SUPER talented. She's got an amazing book and great experience, even internationally. From weddings, to models...Chyla KNOWS make up and hair. I recently hired her to do my hair and makeup for headshots and I was extremely thrilled with how amazing I looked!  Can't wait to get those pics!!

58.description: Love me some Bongo Room. What's not to like? It's just like the one on Milwaukee but in Andersonville.I don't even consider going to the one on Milwaukee because it's such a cluster down there. This location has some (but not a lot) of parking, so be mindful of when you go. However, the layout does handle more tables than the one in Wicker Park AND it has a patio. The new kitchen is chic too.Been here a few times and as you would expect, there is a wait so plan accordingly. Just remember the service and food is great!

56.description: Nice interior, but the food didn't live up to the hype.White chocolate and caramel pretzel pancakes ($11.25) - 1 star. Couldn't taste the white chocolate, just tasted like creme anglaise. Bland pancakes without the sauce, weird texture/mouthfeel to them, felt too heavy/doughy. I like my pancakes fluffy. Overpriced, no sides.Pass on the maple pork loin sandwich and sberry lemonade.Service was impersonally polite.Not a bongo believer.

29.description: Me and my guy have brunch here almost every weekend. We typically have an enjoyable meal and the waitstaff is usually friendly and attentive.Today, sadly, that was not the case.  We were seated behind a woman who was a "loud talker."  You know, someone who speaks so loudly that people in the next zip code can hear them crystal clear.  After enduring their loud prattle for about ten minutes, I got our server, Brittany, to come to our table. I asked her if she would ask the woman behind us to speak at a more appropriate level. She walked away and came back a couple minutes later and told my guy, not me, that she didn't feel comfortable asking her to be quiet and said we should tell her ourselves. I'm sorry, I didn't realize that it would be so painful for you to tell a person that someone asked that they keep it down.  And, Brittany, since you couldn't be bothered to give us the correct bill, probably because you were so distraught over the thought of doing part of your job, making me have to ask for the correct bill, I didn't really feel comfortable leaving you a nice tip for your total lack of customer service. My final comment is that Brittany needs to grow a pair and become a MUCH better server.I would have dealt with this privately with Bongo Room management via a private email, but, sadly, that link on their website has an error and did not allow me to send a private message.

42.description: Brunch here was amazing as always. The bloody Mary's and mimosas are a must have! Their eggs Benedicts, anyway you have them, are also a favorite of mine for brunch! I'll be back again and again!

23.description: The food was absolutely delicious , however the service not so much. Our waitress was somewhat rude , and I had to ask the busboy to go get her so we could order and so that could get more coffee (he brought it for us because she never even bothered to ask) . Also , I had noticed the other waitress asked another table if she wanted to rap the food up and our waitress said "I'll bring you a box" . Fortunately, for that bus boy he wrapped it up for us. I would only come back for the food , if we are in her section again I'll request another waitress.

47.description: I live right by the Bongo Room and have heard about it for years, so after moving a literal stone's throw away from it, I've finally checked it out a few times. First, it should be known that I don't have a tolerance for long brunch waits. The longer the wait, the greater my expectations become, so I've mostly dined here on work-from-home weekdays. This means I'm a big fan of the lunch menu. The smoked chicken Asian salad may sound like an odd combo (smoked chicken in an Asian salad? huh?) but it's actually a great flavor combo. Friends have enjoyed their lunch items as well. But the thing all the yuppie masses rave about is the brunch, right? Well that's a different story....Why do people wait sometimes great lengths to dine here on the weekends? I don't know about you, by my Saturday and Sunday mornings are usually a hazy hangover that requires food and coffee and/or booze immediately, so time is of the essence. I can't wait 30 minutes to be seated, only to wait another 30 minutes for food, and then have it be short of amazing, so this is why I tend to avoid Bongo Room and like establishments. Basically, food has to be astonishing to justify such waits, and, for the brunch menu at least, I don't think that it is. Most recently, I had an omelette. It was kind of dry and not very flavorful. My boyfriend had a breakfast burrito, which was 90% egg and 10% whatever the other ingredients were, making it kind of boring. The blackberry grapefruit mimosa is rather delicious, however. Previously I've had a breakfast sandwich with housemade Italian turkey sausage...which was incredibly bland. A pancake dish was also not very impressive. Again, nothing is bad. Some things are really good, but most of the stuff I have is just fine. The atmosphere is sleek and modern and the service is friendly as well. Also, major bonus points for the check-in process - they take your name & mobile number. You receive a text message with a link to view your position in line, which also includes some coupons to area businesses to explore while you wait - a very nice touch! Once the table is ready, you can reply to confirm or cancel. WHY DOESN'T EVERY RESTAURANT HAVE THIS? It's amazing. I'll stick to going to Bongo Room when the lines are non-existent and the space isn't overly crowded. I think it's overhyped, and doesn't stack up against nearby options like Big Jones, which delivers delicious food AND takes reservations. That's the way your weekend mornings should work - sail into a table and order with no excruciating wait times.

8.description: AMAZING! Came to this location for brunch last Saturday around 11am and was told there was a 20 minute wait. My friends and I put our name in the queue and went for a walk, and I was texted 9 minutes later that a table was ready for us--barely a wait at all! We ordered half an order of the white chocolate pretzel pancakes to share and each got a lobster Benedict. The benedicts were great--lots of lobster meat, delicious fluffy bread, perfectly poached eggs, and actually flavorful potatoes (at the Wicket Park location, my potatoes had been flavorless). The pancakes really stole the show, though! The white chocolate sauce was definitely not what I expected, and while it was very creamy and rich, not overwhelming or overpowering at all. The pancakes were fluffy and had the perfect amount of crunch to them because of the pretzel, and paired so perfectly with the sauce. We literally licked the plate clean! Overall really good brunch experience, and very chill and fun vibe in the restaurant as well. Will definitely be back!

31.description: The food was great. It was creative, and delicious and maybe if I would have come here under different circumstances we would have had a better experience. We probably arrived at a busy time for a Sunday, but we put our name down (party of 4) and were given a 40 minute wait time. That's fine. My problem is that parties of four were arriving AFTER us, being given shorter wait times and were being seated before us. A few parties FINISHED THEIR MEALS AND LEFT before we were even seated. We waited an hour and a half and finally only got a table because we complained. I guess they were hoping we would leave. The reason, I observed, was that we had a five year old with us and we couldn't possibly be seated in the front where people could be bothered by the sight of a child playing with her pancakes. THE HORROR! The whole experience ruined our breakfast and any chance of us returning. It's a pity, the food was really good and we only live a couple blocks away.

34.description: Meeting a great friend for bunch and she's running behind a little. The staff state no problem. I order a soy mocha and tomato juice and enjoy the morning while perusing the menu. Great start to a day.

16.description: The caramel white chocolate pretzel pancakes were the best I've ever had.  My date had the tomatillo salsa scramble and graciously let me have a bite.  This location has its own parking lot, too!

13.description: Nothing like getting attitude from the server when you complain about the meal you were served being cold. F*** you bongo room

11.description: Here's the thing - and this was advice from a friend before I came to visit the first time with which I must agree - you don't come to Bongo for a basic breakfast. Don't do the breakfast burrito. Don't do the scrambled eggs and bacon. Go Big and Sweet. Chocolate pancakes with Oreos type thing. Never tried the benedicts but they are probably great too.Their sweet offerings are out of this world. Other people whom I've brought who ordered more straight-up meals were left thinking "meh".

39.description: The service here is five stars. The guy busing tables was almost refilling my coffee TOO much. That being said, the food was just ok. Very expensive, small-ish portions. I had the special, which was a breakfast sandwich on a pretzel roll (genius) with sausage, mozzarella and pesto. The pretzel roll was the best part, everything else was just ok. My man friend got the croissant breakfast sandwich - which was served on a very stale croissant. That pretty much ruins it. We also tried one of the salted caramel pretzel pancakes, which was an interesting combination of a pancake and a soft pretzel. The texture almost makes you wonder if it's a fully cooked pancake... it was also just ok. Not worth 5 dollars for one pancake. Also, they open at 9:00 on Saturday's. What? How is a breakfast place even still in business that opens that late. We joined the line of others at 8:45 waiting for the door to open. All in all, it wasn't horrible, but nothing to write home about either.

37.description: The Bongo Room is probably my favorite brunch place that I had tried while visiting Chicago for a week. When I got there, there was no wait and I did not see a lot of people inside. I then realized that it was Monday, which explains all the available tables. Awesome! My BF and I split the White Chocolate Pretzel Pancakes and the Salsa Scramble. My BF also ordered a hot coffee. Food arrived pretty quickly and both of the dishes looked amazing!! We dug unto the scramble first, which had avocado, cheese, chicken, spinach, and of course salsa. It was very tasty and all the ingredients tasted really fresh. Dabbing some of the Cholula hot sauce on there really hit the spot also. We then moved on to the pancakes. OMGGGG they were to die for!! That white chocolate sauce with the pretzel pancakes was a match made in heaven. It was not too sweet and each bite just melted in my mouth. I'm drooling just thinking about it right now. :d The coffee that my BF got was surprisingly pretty good and rich in flavor. I usually don't drink black coffee but I didn't mind that one. The Bongo Room is a definite must try for any brunch lover. And get those pancakes, you won't regret it!!

0.description: Vanilla brioche French toast with raspberry coulis and topped with fresh raspberries and graham cracker crumble. Good Lord, I think I can die happy nowSo, upon my frequent trips to Chicago, a stop must be made to the Bongo room (I've only been to the Andersonville locale) for their delicious food and their coffee. I've yet to be disappointed by their food or service. The place is ALWAYS packed and the turnover rate seems to be quick, so these people are definitely doing it right! The menu is fairly limited in prospects but the items they do showcase are always quite flavorful. Even my picky, foodie kids love this place!

38.description: Went with a friend for a mid-week lunch. We had two sandwiches, the tuna and the crabmeat. Enjoyed them very much, really tasty, pretty big & on great bread. Service was nice from the time we came in and throughout. Next time I'll try one of the omelettes, they were HUGE and looked really good. Nice crowd, not too empty or too busy.

51.description: A+, pancakes were to die for! The right amount of sweet without overpowering your taste buds. A must for people looking for a place to have brunch with friends.

27.description: Simply amazing. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. Can't get enough of this place. Try the white chocolate caramel pretzel pancakes and deconstructed lobster benedict - and you will have your mind blown!

32.description: Local coffee, delicious food and fantastic service!!! this is my all time favorite breakfast spot in chicago.  There are several locations but this one is the cleanest and the service is outstanding.  The plus side on this location is that they have a outside area which is just beautiful and for the few summer months we get to enjoy its a fabulous to enjoy some yummy breakfast food out there and unlike others they have a small parking lot so no need to pay for street parking.  My all time breakfast favorites are  the white chocolate caramel pretzel pancake and for a savory dish the vegetarian croissant sandwich which has muenster cheese, spinach, tomato, mushrooms, cucumber, alfalfa sprouts & scallions topped with one egg any style & basil mayo served with house potatoes- i like to get the egg white and i get extra basil mayo spread on the side because its just well delicious :D

54.description: Eat well, travel often. Went to this gem of a place while in the city visiting some girlfriends. The white chocolate pretzel pancakes and deconstructed lobster Benedict. Seriously, the best I've ever had on both items. Each bite had a hurt of flavor and they gave generous chunks of lobster in the Benedict. I daydream of going back.

48.description: I've lived in the neighborhood for 3 years, and I've been to Bongo Room PLENTY of times. The food is fantastic--I love the croissant sandwich for breakfast, and I love any of the sandwiches for lunch. I recommend ordering a half order of specialty pancakes for a brunch appetizer for the table to split. The red velvet or salted caramel pretzel pancakes are to die for! I also love their coffee, their decor, and their outdoor patio. This place is bustling on the weekends and even busy during the week. So why the 2 star review?It's tough...because the servers and bus boys are attentive and friendly. I have never had a bad experience with service. However, the front of house is a rude mess. I have had numerous bad experiences with a male host who never seems to be busy, but loves to ignore people waiting for his attention at the door. It definitely makes for a bad first impression and is really unwelcoming. If it weren't for the fact that I KNOW dealing with the rudeness is worth it once you get past the crappy, rude gatekeeper and get to enjoy the food...then I'm not sure I would ever go to Bongo Room. Most recently, I attempted to grab lunch with my wife at Bongo Room. It was early afternoon in the middle of the week, and we walked inside and stood in front of the host stand. My wife had ACL surgery just a week before, so she was on crutches with a large leg brace. Even though there was no wait and not much going on in the front of the house, the male host and who I assume to be the male manager, stood there finishing a conversation. They both obviously knew we were there since we were standing right in front of them, but there was no "Just hold on one second" or "I'll be with you in just a minute." Instead, it was actually pretty awkward. We weren't acknowledged for a good minute or two, so we actually just turned around and left. There are too many good brunch places in Andersonville for anyone to put up with rudeness like that. I hope Bongo Room considers who they have working the host stand during the week and if they want that kind of first impression/representation. Some people don't belong in the service industry.

44.description: I was there on labor day- yes it was busy but it was completely worth it.They have a perfect set up to hold a spot in line and actually hold it! They'll send you a message when they are ready for you. The banana strawberry pancakes were amazing and the "whipped cream" was delicious No syrup needed! House potatoes (hash browns) are delicious too. It's all worth the while I promise!

24.description: Decided to go here on my last day instead of Wildberry Pancakes, and I did not regret my decision! Came in on a weekday and fortunately there was no wait; it was pretty much empty. We sat near the window table an I ordered a pomegranate blueberry mimosa, the pineapple upside down flapjacks, and the breakfast burrito. Mimosa was great- super flavorful and delectable! Wish I could have tried more flavors. The breakfast burrito was decent; the inside was mostly egg with a little bit of the other toppings. I would prefer more of an evenly distributed burrito, but it was good. The pineapple upside down flapjacks were what sold me. The outside was textured and crispy while the inside was hot, soft, and fluffy- it was everything I can ask for in a pancake. I'm typically not a big fan of pancakes, but these were amazing. The pineapple bits really added to the pancakes, and I didn't really even need maple syrup with these pancakes. Service was outstanding, as the lady was very friendly and checked up on us the right amount. She got everything we needed, and even brought over extra condiments just in case. Super sweet. So glad I got to come here before I leave!

7.description: I came across blog room per a friends suggestion one blurry eyed morning and I was definitely blown away. By far one of my favorite brunch places and favorite brunch experiences. Everyone's food was amazing. They have an amazing selection of Benedicts to choose from. And if you have ever met me, I can't turn down a Benedict. I got the deconstructed lobster roll Benedict and sweet mother of Jesus was it as phenomenal as it sounds. It was one of those meals that someone asks to taste and you really don't want to let them but you social norms suggest you have to. The food was great obviously that's a must but the staff at this Andersonville really made the experience. We roll in looking like hot messes I am sure and our server Coco comes over and jumps into our conversation as if he was with us the night before. He gave us all the tips and secrets of the menus and was really the icing on those delectable pancakes.

49.description: Yummy sandwich! Great outdoor seating. Don't come here if you are in a hurry to get served. The food comes out fast once you order but the wait staff is a little slow. Very friendly and delicious food though. We will be back!

40.description: I have been to the bongo room twice, and it is becoming a must-visit for me every time I visit Chicago. I have eaten 4 things at TBR: an omelette, the white chocolate pretzel pancakes, the deconstructed lobster roll eggs benedict, and the brioche French toast with white chocolate and berries.The omelette was by far the worst, but that's only in comparison. Even for an omelette, it was above average. Not much else to say about it, because it wasn't super special, just good.The brioche French toast comes in third - and it was so good. So fluffy, and the sauce was so creamy. I really really wish there had been more of the lemon crumble on top, but even with a minimal amount, it was like an A, maybe A- at worst.The white chocolate pretzel pancakes... So I actually ate these more than a year ago, but I remember them being absolutely unbelievable - so much so that I remembered to come back to the bongo room. They are seriously that good. I know the next time I'm back, I'll want them again, but I really should branch out. Ok. The finale. This last item is the deconstructed lobster roll. First of all, so much lobster. I do not feel like they gypped us on lobster, which they could've. Perfectly poached egg, great buttered buns. The potatoes are ok, but honestly I could've just not eaten them and been completely satisfied. This dish is a king of kings, a true champion, the one survivor, possibly actually heaven sent. So, so good.As always, the service was impeccable and my waitress was attentive and quick, while not intrusive. Fantastic experience.

53.description: I've been wanting to try this place forever and finally came here! The food was worth the wait, my stomach was very happy. The restaurant much bigger than it looks from the outside and has a very cool area with patio seating. We sat inside and I got the lobster benedict and a french toast dish to share with my boyfriend. The benedict was amazing, but the french toast almost brought tears to my eyes! The french toast was topped with berries, a berry coulis, and a Meyer lemon cream. It was sooo good that we overstuffed ourselves. FYI....you can get a smaller portion of their french toast instead of ordering the regular portion. We found that out after stuffing ourselves!!!

30.description: It was absolutely a great experience in here, everything was absolutely delicious, my friend had pancakes and i had the benedicts totally love there potatoes. Yummy!!Our server Jose was super pleasant also totally will b back.

46.description: I went for brunch this weekend. I was in the mood for something sweet but I don't like dessert like breakfast food. I asked the waitress if everything on sweet side of the menu was overwhelmingly sweet or if she had any recommendations.  Her response "if you look at the menu you'll see the ingredients and you can see that the food is sweet but we make food for adults not children".  I ordered French toast anyway but was only able to eat about 1/8 of my meal because it was too sweet.  Who wants to go to a restaurant to be treated poorly. Not me. So if you're in the mood for dessert for breakfast and to be spoken to in a rude and unprofessional manner this place is for you.

1.description: The food here is good, with the pancakes being the sole winner here.Eggs:Egg scramble with spinach, tomato and feta: 3Lobster Benedict: 3Spinach/Egg burrito: 4Pancakes:Banana: 4Choc chip: 4Coffee (Intelligentsia house blend): 1 (awful taste, and no offering of fresh cream)Ambiance: 5As lively as the atmosphere is, the food is simply too heavy to enjoy often. It never fails: every time I leave this place, whether eating "light" (an omelette w/ toast) or "heavy" (omelette and pancakes!), the feeling of unpleasant heaviness lingers on me well into the evening. Great spot for large or small groups. The wait is usually 45 to 90min on weekends.

55.description: What is not to love about the Bongo Room?!?  It has a really hip vibe when you walk in, and you just know there are going to be some unique items on the menu.  Looking for something sweet?  They have an incredible selection of pancakes and french toast with sinful toppings.  If savory is more your thing, there is a wide range of dishes to choose from as well.  Don't forget about breakfast cocktails... The mimosas are amazing!I didn't have to decide between sweet and savory since I got to taste a little bit of both.  After pouring over the menu for ages since I am super indecisive (and everything sounded amazing), I saw the people at the table next to us get their breakfast sandwiches on huge, toasted croissants and knew I had to have one of those.  Everything was cooked perfectly; the egg was fried medium so there was still a little bit of yummy yolk when you cut into it, but it was not a flood either, and the potatoes were done and seasoned well.  My boyfriend ordered the banana health pancakes, so of course I had to try those as well.  There are actual Heath pieces inside the pancakes which are SMOTHERED in a delicious praline cream sauce and topped with banana slices... delicious but way too rich for me to have more than a few bites (Bill, however, cleaned his plate!).  I also ordered 2 mimosas (pear for the first and black raspberry grapefruit for the second) which were both delicious.  The waiter was very pleasant and efficient.  The one tiny complaint I would make is that we were not informed that we were not able to split the bill, and with 8 of us, this made things a little tricky.  I understand it's a pain in the you-know-what for the restaurant to split bills too, but just a warning would have been helpful.  Overall, next time I'm in Chicago, I would love to come back!!

9.description: A favorite brunch spot! Decadent pancakes and French toast, typically covered a sweet, creamy sauce; delicious savory omelettes. I usually get a cocktail, something savory, and split something sweet, though I end up stuffed to the gills and take leftovers.The big plus of this Bongo Room compared to its Wicker Park and South Loop sisters is a shorter wait, better decor and seating, and a beautiful, enclosed, outdoor patio. Can't recommend it enough.

26.description: This was the perfect place to eat for my first time visiting the area. Granted, we went on a Sunday for brunch so there is almost always a wait but it's well worth it! I ordered the make your own omelet and it was huge yet insanely tasty! Not to mention the mimosas were delish! Props to our waitress/bartender (we chose bar seating), she was nonstop with those drinks to waiting customers and didn't skip a beat -- along with checking in on her seated guests. She's straight up awesome. I can't wait to come back :)

25.description: Bongo Room was a much needed breakfast/brunch place south of Foster.  They certainly have a following from their other locations and it appears the neighborhood has responded well to them.While you are able to procure a traditional American breakfast, they are also very creative when it comes to their sweet offerings.  While those are not really what I enjoy (I'm savory) one is typically ordered for the table to share.This place can get very busy on the weekends.  Friendly staff and good food will have us returning.

12.description: Bongo Room was a much needed breakfast/brunch place south of Foster.  They certainly have a following from their other locations and it appears the neighborhood has responded well to them.While you are able to procure a traditional American breakfast, they are also very creative when it comes to their sweet offerings.  While those are not really what I enjoy (I'm savory) one is typically ordered for the table to share.This place can get very busy on the weekends.  Friendly staff and good food will have us returning.

59.description: I have been to the Bongo Room twice now when visiting friends in Chicago! Since I am not from Chicago I love the variety of restaurants and the popularity of brunch!! The Bongo Room has a great brunch menu with sweet and savory items and some unique mimosas! On my recent trip to Chicago I had the breakfast bowl (which was a special) and a bloody Mary. There are several bloody Mary's listed but the difference is simply the quality of vodka. The house bloody Mary was great!! I also tried the Pear mimosa which was good but I would prefer the Bloody Mary. The Breakfast Bowl was delicious!! Potatoes, chorizo and chicken were topped with an egg, cheese and guacamole! The portion was more than generous and the potatoes made the dish very filling. I love avocados and the guacamole was a great topping for the dish. Another great meal at the Bongo Room with great service!!

21.description: Went to brunch here with a bunch of friends and they ended up losing my credit card. They offered their sincerest condolences and $15 off a $75 bill. Yeah, they lost my credit card and still expected me to pay for the rest of it. I left my number to call me in the morning in the event they found it. Didn't get a call back and had to call them at the close of business to figure out if they had found it. Food was meh. Atmosphere is that of an office conference room. "Drop It Like Its Hot" by Snoop Dogg came on while we were eating which was about the only redeeming quality of my visit.

17.description: I have been to the bongo room twice, and it is becoming a must-visit for me every time I visit Chicago. I have eaten 4 things at TBR: an omelette, the white chocolate pretzel pancakes, the deconstructed lobster roll eggs benedict, and the brioche French toast with white chocolate and berries.The omelette was by far the worst, but that's only in comparison. Even for an omelette, it was above average. Not much else to say about it, because it wasn't super special, just good.The brioche French toast comes in third - and it was so good. So fluffy, and the sauce was so creamy. I really really wish there had been more of the lemon crumble on top, but even with a minimal amount, it was like an A, maybe A- at worst.The white chocolate pretzel pancakes... So I actually ate these more than a year ago, but I remember them being absolutely unbelievable - so much so that I remembered to come back to the bongo room. They are seriously that good. I know the next time I'm back, I'll want them again, but I really should branch out. Ok. The finale. This last item is the deconstructed lobster roll. First of all, so much lobster. I do not feel like they gypped us on lobster, which they could've. Perfectly poached egg, great buttered buns. The potatoes are ok, but honestly I could've just not eaten them and been completely satisfied. This dish is a king of kings, a true champion, the one survivor, possibly actually heaven sent. So, so good.As always, the service was impeccable and my waitress was attentive and quick, while not intrusive. Fantastic experience.

10.description: Decided to go here on my last day instead of Wildberry Pancakes, and I did not regret my decision! Came in on a weekday and fortunately there was no wait; it was pretty much empty. We sat near the window table an I ordered a pomegranate blueberry mimosa, the pineapple upside down flapjacks, and the breakfast burrito. Mimosa was great- super flavorful and delectable! Wish I could have tried more flavors. The breakfast burrito was decent; the inside was mostly egg with a little bit of the other toppings. I would prefer more of an evenly distributed burrito, but it was good. The pineapple upside down flapjacks were what sold me. The outside was textured and crispy while the inside was hot, soft, and fluffy- it was everything I can ask for in a pancake. I'm typically not a big fan of pancakes, but these were amazing. The pineapple bits really added to the pancakes, and I didn't really even need maple syrup with these pancakes. Service was outstanding, as the lady was very friendly and checked up on us the right amount. She got everything we needed, and even brought over extra condiments just in case. Super sweet. So glad I got to come here before I leave!

5.description: This place was fantastic! The breakfast potatoes with cheese were addicting & I couldn't stop eating my Red Velvet pancakes!The service was also great! They were constantly stopping by for refills, swapping out dirty plates for clean ones, and making sure we were doing okay.I have to come back here one day because I've never had pancakes like these before!

3.description: I decided to visit this breakfast place yesterday after work as it was one of many on last month's Foursquares list of "15 best places for breakfast food in Chicago!" No wait time, thus we were seated right away! Since I was really hungry, I ordered the omelette with bacon, sausage and smoked ham (choose 3 ingredients, pay for each additional ingredient) and came with house potatoes and toast! I got my fill, food was fresh and service was good but I wasn't blown away by the flavor and it was abit pricey. Do they have a lunch menu but that was 30 mins away but something I might want to try next time...

35.description: We were four people and we all loved it!!Unfortunately we had to wait a long time to get a table, more than what we were told. To be fair  it was a sunny Sunday morning in Andersonville at 11.30 so...it was BRUNCH rush hour. Anyways, the staff was super nice and once we sat down, they served us extremly good french toast for free to apologize, although we didn't really complain very much.All of our dishes were served right away and despite the complicated orders (with almond milk, with soy milk and vainilla flavor, orange juice, mine with pommengranate too, etc..) they served everything right and to the right customer in a heartbit.  We were quite impressed cause they didnt even wrote down the orders!Tasty and fresh, and a very nice atmosphere, one of the best brunch I have tried in Chicago!

19.description: Nice interior, but the food didn't live up to the hype.White chocolate and caramel pretzel pancakes ($11.25) - 1 star. Couldn't taste the white chocolate, just tasted like creme anglaise. Bland pancakes without the sauce, weird texture/mouthfeel to them, felt too heavy/doughy. I like my pancakes fluffy. Overpriced, no sides.Pass on the maple pork loin sandwich and sberry lemonade.Service was impersonally polite.Not a bongo believer.

28.description: Wait was 45 minutes at around 10:30 on a Sunday, not bad when there are cool shops nearby (check out Foursided just down the street!). Foodwise, this rating is more so for the savory dishes, specifically the vegetarian croissant sandwich, which left a bad taste in my mouth. Had to wash it down with some of my friend's blueberry glazed pancakes (which, one the opposite end of the spectrum, were DELICIOUS wow). Note to self: stick to the sweet dishes here.

45.description: Went here for the first time at 11:30 on a Saturday. The wait was about an hour and 15 minutes, but once you put your name in, you can leave and they will text you when your table is ready which was nice. Once we finally got seated, the service was attentive and friendly. Our orders came out pretty quickly and everything looked amazing. I had an egg white scramble with chicken and avocado which was good, but had a bit more chicken than I would have preferred. I also had the opportunity to try the white chocolate caramel pretzel pancakes which were phenomenal! Definitely not something I would recommend eating all of unless you want to be in a sugar coma for the rest of the day, but perfect to split between a few friends. Since there were only three of us, we were able to split the check; however, I don't know if there is a limit to how many ways they will split. Overall, I had a good experience, but it probably isn't worth the hour plus wait unless you feel like walking around wicker park in the meantime. If I go back, it won't be during prime brunch hours.

33.description: Amazing brunch. Definitely be ready to wait, but trust me it's well worth it.

43.description: I did give more than 1 star (a whole 2) because the staff has always been pretty friendly and I've enjoyed the food when I've visited this location in the past.When I visited again Sunday, I did not have a great experience.My companion did say that her food was great and we both agreed the coffee was quite tasty.  Front of the house staff were polite and efficient.Now, to the horrible.  I have a soy allergy.  Trust me, it isn't something that I'm super happy about.  I hate being "that person" that has to question all the food and cooking methods and bother wait staff and chefs with my requirements.  I'd rather just be able to order anything I want off the menu and eat without fear.With that being said, I guess I should be happy I didn't end up inconveniencing staff because they were so unwilling to be nice, helpful, or accommodating that it was shocking.  They make all their grill items (eggs, pancakes, etc.) with soy margarine and meats (bacon, sausage, etc.) in a separate pans.  So, one would deduce that their talented chefs could toss a few eggs and some bacon in a separate, clean, soy-free pan but, alas, no.  They would do nothing for me other than shrug and sigh and say "no, there is nothing here that you can eat." The waitress did end up suggesting something that would be okay but then they still made the eggs with the soy margarine.  I just don't understand why they made such a huge deal about it when I really would have been happy with an egg and some bacon made without the margarine.To be fair, our waitress was sweet after the continued issues and apologetic but it was still a really unfortunate situation.  It was the first time since my diagnosis that a business actually made me feel bad about my allergy.I will never eat here again and I suggest anyone with any type of food allergy also avoid it.  With so many great restaurants in Chicago that are happy to make food allergy sufferers something that is safe for them to eat, don't waste your time on this place.

2.description: I went here on a recent Sunday after hearing hype here and there over the last couple years. My friend and I waited about 40 minutes for a table, which seemed typical for a Sunday brunch. It was helpful that they texted you a link so you could see what place you held in line. I ordered the croissant sandwich, which was HUGE and delicious. However, I wasn't a huge fan of the breakfast potatoes. They were seasoned with rosemary and rather soft, so they seemed more like dinner potatoes that you'd eat with chicken to me. My friend and I split one of the white chocolate pretzel caramel pancake to see what the hype was all about. It was good, but I definitely couldn't eat more than a half pancake. So glad they offer a single pancake as a serving! Overall, I enjoyed it, but I don't think I'll be rushing back anytime soon.Huge perk that there's a free parking lot next door!

18.description: We started our experience with a nice warm greeting from their host and was promptly seated.  They have an original breakfast menu with lots of selections and a great drink menu.  I ordered the Dreamsicle and it was good.  (The only minor issue is that they don't include any descriptions of their drinks so must depend on the server to describe each one.) I ended up sticking with the tried and true omelet... you pick your ingredients.  I went with Avocado, Bacon and White Cheddar... Not a bad omelet, but a bit pricey at $12.50 to start plus 1 to 1.50 for each ingredient.  It comes with potatoes and toast.  (Again, not listed on the menu.) And portion was good.  So for 2 people, 2 two drinks and 2 omelettes, with tax and tip came to $56.  A bit more than I'm used to spending on Breakfast, particularly when it's not that much out of the ordinary, but it's still not a bad place to visit once in awhile.  I give an extra star for the terrific staff and attentive service.

41.description: We started our experience with a nice warm greeting from their host and was promptly seated.  They have an original breakfast menu with lots of selections and a great drink menu.  I ordered the Dreamsicle and it was good.  (The only minor issue is that they don't include any descriptions of their drinks so must depend on the server to describe each one.) I ended up sticking with the tried and true omelet... you pick your ingredients.  I went with Avocado, Bacon and White Cheddar... Not a bad omelet, but a bit pricey at $12.50 to start plus 1 to 1.50 for each ingredient.  It comes with potatoes and toast.  (Again, not listed on the menu.) And portion was good.  So for 2 people, 2 two drinks and 2 omelettes, with tax and tip came to $56.  A bit more than I'm used to spending on Breakfast, particularly when it's not that much out of the ordinary, but it's still not a bad place to visit once in awhile.  I give an extra star for the terrific staff and attentive service.

52.description: Went to the Bongo room and thought it had great food! I had the Lobster Bisque and it was delicious paired with the potatoes. Although I found the potatoes to be exceptionally spicy, but that's a taste preference. It was a very busy restaurant so expect to wait almost every time you go. Worth the wait in my opinion.

50.description: A regular at The Bongo Room and I consistently get wonderful service - Josh being my most recent server. The pancakes are great as always but I usually fall into getting the Tomato Salsa Scramble. Pretty cool patio in the back but most importantly I always feel welcome.

4.description: If you don't mind paying a little extra for breakfast, this place may be worth a try. It's a bit pricy, but there are some unique things on the menu. I tried the lobster roll Benedict. It was pretty good. I'm not sure I'd order it again, but it was fun to try once. If you're going to order drinks with your breakfast you're looking at a $30 bill.

6.description: What an experience!  Very nice breakfast place decor was very modern and seats were super comfortable.  I ordered the breakfast burrito and red velvet hotcakes.  The breakfast burrito was super delicious the red velvet pancakes was super bland no sugar in the cakes.  Coffee was okay but service was excellent.

22.description: Carne asada breakfast burrito was awesome!  Also had the huevos rancheros-really good!  This place rocks!!!

15.description: I live in Uptown so my mornings are usually filled with the pungent aroma of urine. Having tired of this daily pleasantry I decided to venture forth toward the yuppie haven known as Andersonville.Fast fact: As a child I lived in Andersonville and one of my earliest memories is my mother being offered crack by a small child. Andersonville has definitely changed in my day.We decided on the Bongo Room mostly because the Golden House's parking was full. It isn't the first time we have gone to the Bongo Room but we didn't want to spend the $40 we usually do there.  We're a thrifty people but also lazy, apparently. We ended up waiting nearly an hour but they conveniently texted us when our table was ready (convenient!).I ordered a deconstructed lobster roll and my wife ordered the steak burrito. We agreed that our respective potatoes were cold and needed salt. While I thought that my meal was delicious, my wife thought that her burrito was lacking steak. It was an egg burrito with a slight steak suggestion. It was similar to Ben Carson and his sanity: you assume it is there but there is not enough evidence to prove it.Overall we should've stuck with Golden House.

57.description: Food is pretty good, but beware the pancakes - they are gigantic sugar bombs and cloyingly sweet.  I've yet to see anyone make their way through an entire stack.  Better to share!

20.description: I live in Uptown so my mornings are usually filled with the pungent aroma of urine. Having tired of this daily pleasantry I decided to venture forth toward the yuppie haven known as Andersonville.Fast fact: As a child I lived in Andersonville and one of my earliest memories is my mother being offered crack by a small child. Andersonville has definitely changed in my day.We decided on the Bongo Room mostly because the Golden House's parking was full. It isn't the first time we have gone to the Bongo Room but we didn't want to spend the $40 we usually do there.  We're a thrifty people but also lazy, apparently. We ended up waiting nearly an hour but they conveniently texted us when our table was ready (convenient!).I ordered a deconstructed lobster roll and my wife ordered the steak burrito. We agreed that our respective potatoes were cold and needed salt. While I thought that my meal was delicious, my wife thought that her burrito was lacking steak. It was an egg burrito with a slight steak suggestion. It was similar to Ben Carson and his sanity: you assume it is there but there is not enough evidence to prove it.Overall we should've stuck with Golden House.

36.description: I just walked in (wearing a suit no less) and asked if I could have a drink at the bar. Sure thing...no problem. As I started to sit, the bartender told me to leave the two seats open for diners. He suggested I order from the servers' station. Who the f@&$ treats customers like that? First time there and will never return. What a bunch of pretentious assholes.

14.description: I was surprised that the wait wasn't bad at all for Sunday brunch, but we did come a little late in the day. It's a much bigger place than I expected so there is ample seating. We came around noon and only had to wait 15-20 min to be seated. Grabbed some drinks at the bar while we waited, so no problem there. I definitely don't mind waiting as long as alcohol is involved. Solid Bloody Marys and the Orange Creamsicle (orange juice, whipped cream flavored vodka and whipped cream) is delicious and fun! My creamsicle was definitely a conversation starter at the bar. It's like drinking a milkshake for breakfast! S'cute. The drinks were a bit expensive, but most brunch cocktails in this area seem to be. My husband also had the St. Germaine Sunshine cocktail, which was refreshing but not very breakfast-y. Service was speedy. I had the Vanilla Brioche french toast, which I wasn't a huge fan of. It's good, but VERY sweet. I should have known better since I tend to be more of a savory gal, especially in the AM. Unfortunately, I didn't really see any savory items on the menu that tickled my fancy. They definitely seem to lean towards the indulgent, dessert-for-breakfast type crowd. If that's your thing, I would definitely give it a go!

1.description: How has this place stayed in business for so long?There are people who think this is the best pizza ever?! You've not had good pizza. This is not the best pizza, it's not even in the top 20 pizzas.The crust is CARDBOARD. Cardboard. Seriously, I wondered if there was a layer of the box stuck to the piece. The toppings were okay - Canadian bacon, mushrooms, olives and half spinach. Usually a favorite. Not this time. Tried repurposing the toppings the next day, discarding the cardboard crusts, as a frittata. Good plan, right? Nah. Still didn't save it. And it's SPENDY. Almost $30, including tip and delivery, for a large thin crust. Apart Pizza (which I'll stick to from now on, despite the protestations of my "Let's try something new!" boyfriend) has a virtually identical pie for at least $10 less.It also dovetails into my thinking that if a pizza place does a lot of different things, it doesn't do pizza. The name is Primo Pizza, I'm not likely to get a Gyros there. Sad this place didn't work out, as it is in my lovely hood. I'll find other new things to tempt the fab BF with, 'cos this place is gonna be a One and Done.

9.description: Not a fan.  Use to call for delivery on a regular basis.  Order would be correct and hot.  Called for delivery which ended up my last time.Order:1 Gyro w/ cheese fires1 Grilled chicken sandwich w/ friesWhat arrived:1 Gyro w/ cheese fries1 Fried Chicken SandwichPaid and tipped the delivery man and went into eat.  The BF went ballistic on me as I ordered the wrong sandwich.  I clearly know the difference between fried and grilled.Called up Primo and told them the issue.  I am told if i want a grilled chicken sandwich I would need to pay for it and the delivery fee.I told Primo to take a leap...haven't ordered from there since.  After 3 years of ordering from them you would think their service would have been better.  I clearly know what I ordered and they were in the wrong.

23.description: We lived in the neighborhood for two years before finally trying this place.  Not exactly an inviting storefront but the pizza's usually okay.  Fast delivery locally.  To avoid the heavy dough, stick with the thin crust.

12.description: Cheap, quick and okay in a pinch. Occasionally stop in for their polish sausage special. Comes with fries and a drink for under $5! Nothing much else to say about the place, other than it's convenient and has off-street parking.

21.description: We go to only the fanciest places.  I've lived in Andersonville for a total of three days and we've hit this place, White Castle and the local Mexican dive place. The Italian beef is good, better when it's dipped.  The fries are tasty.  Everything was really hot and fresh.  Good for you?  Not so much?  But it tastes good, isn't that enough?I'm happy that they deliver locally, too.

16.description: We go to only the fanciest places.  I've lived in Andersonville for a total of three days and we've hit this place, White Castle and the local Mexican dive place. The Italian beef is good, better when it's dipped.  The fries are tasty.  Everything was really hot and fresh.  Good for you?  Not so much?  But it tastes good, isn't that enough?I'm happy that they deliver locally, too.

17.description: Came here for lunch 2 days in a row with my co-workers.  They have daily specials.  I had the jumbo hot dog, fries, and a drink for $2.99!  What a deal!  They also have burgers, pizza, gyros, rib tips...etc.  Prices are great.  Good for a quick bite to eat.

10.description: After two years of living a block away from Primo Pizza, I finally decided to stop in. I guess I had always thought it was just a pizza place, but I was surprised when I walked in and the menu included all of the standard Chicago favorites.The Gyros, Italian Beef, and Pizza are all decent, but nothing is really spectacular. Just above middle of the road I guess. The staff is really awesome though. They are really friendly and are always watching a Chinese or Spanish TV station. One awesome thing about Primo is that they take credit cards with no complaints! Very rare for a Beef Stand.

5.description: This place sucks . Extremely rude staff .The food is ok . I'll give the second star just for the food. The place says that it's Italian , they serve gyros and all the staff is Asian ... Doesn't make any sense ...

11.description: PIZZA BY THE SLICE, I always love pizza by the slice, but not so much at Primos.From all of the restaurants on Clark st, you can really do better than Primos, but if you want cheap food thats not McDonalds which is less than 200 feet away, Primos can get the job done.The Pizza is alright, tasted like an upgraded version of those frozen pizzas you'd buy at Jewel. Your typical fast food joint, 3 stars.

22.description: Primo supplies typical junk food in a pretty clean environment and for not much money. The pizza is good, but not great, and you can get an RC cola with your carbolicious  gut bomb.

0.description: I've come here a lot and have no complaints. If your looking for atmosphere, modern decor, and state of the art equipment - stay away.  It's been around over 40 years. And don't let the name fool you.  In most places like this, Gyros comes from a bag. Primo slices it off the spit piece by piece.

20.description: primos is money in the bankpizza is cheap and good because pizza can't be bad. and if you think pizza is bad anywhere, they you, my little sally sue, need to have a one on one talk with your taste buds, like they were your children and you need to tell them the importance about sex and drugs.jumbo hot dog, fries, and pop for less than $4 is a great deal. everything they make is acceptably delicious and if primos had a stock option, i wouldn't get it, not because i don't believe in their business, but because i don't mess with the stock market.don't talk to strangers

19.description: primos is money in the bankpizza is cheap and good because pizza can't be bad. and if you think pizza is bad anywhere, they you, my little sally sue, need to have a one on one talk with your taste buds, like they were your children and you need to tell them the importance about sex and drugs.jumbo hot dog, fries, and pop for less than $4 is a great deal. everything they make is acceptably delicious and if primos had a stock option, i wouldn't get it, not because i don't believe in their business, but because i don't mess with the stock market.don't talk to strangers

2.description: This place is awful. On two seperate occasions now, I've received terrible food. The first time was a burger and fries.  The burger had relish and sport peppers on it. What happened to lettuce, tomato, onion?.....not here. Relish, ketchup, mustard and sport peppers. A burger with hot dog fixins'.Well tonight, I got a salad with grilled chicken and a slice of pizza. The salad was a basic ice burg lettuce salad, but my chicken was burnt. Completely burnt. Not to worry, still got that slice of pizza, right? The pizza tasted like melted cheese on top of cardboard. The pizza dough was hard and the cheese wasn't far off. All in all, I will never come back to this place again. I made the mistake of giving them a second try.

18.description: The pizza is actually pretty good, especially for the price.  However, I will never again turn to Primo's for pizza delivery.  Several months ago, I ordered nine pizzas from Primo's for an event.  The pizzas were to be delivered by 5:00 PM. They confirmed the order of nine pizzas on the phone and agreed to be at the location no later than 5:00.  At 5:15, the delivery man walked in the door with one pizza, insisting that that was the order I had placed.  Although he did return about 45 minutes later with the other eight pizzas, we were offered no apology for their mistake, and still had to pay for all nine pizzas, even though we were originally only given one.  Needless to say, this delay caused a lot of stress and prevented the event from running smoothly.  However, since the prices are so low, I decided I would give Primo's one more try.  At the next event the exact same thing happened.  I ordered 9 pizzas, they showed up with 1, and still charged me for the other pizzas that they brought over an hour later.Anyway, Primo's in a nutshell: decent pizza, awful delivery services and customer service

13.description: Cheap but the food's not bad, 2 of us ate there for less then 10 dollars, and we will go back.

4.description: Best pizza ever. Period.I used to be obsessed and ordered delivery like every week, but I'm sadly like .1 of a mile out of their delivery radius now so it's cut down my addiction, ha:(

6.description: I haven't had their pizza or ordered delivery from here, so I can't comment on those.I've ordered hot dogs and burgers from here many times, though, and would gladly stop by again. You're getting the stock Vienna Beef dogs/burgers you can get at dozens of spots in the city, but this place stands out in two ways: It's cheap and they char them.I haven't had my mind blown here, but it's solid and not bad.

15.description: This is one of those hole in the wall places that is located in a tiny plaza that you just stumble upon, and maybe because of proximity to where you live you figure that it will do.  You can get pizza and many other unhealthy related items here.  I was surprised by the choices and they do have salad here too.  It was decided by my boyfriend that we should get the baked mostaccoli with meat sauce here so we got 3 orders for each one of us.  It comes with garlic bread and a huge portion and it's entirely covered with mozzarella cheese that is just caked on top like it's frosting on a cake.  So, if you love baked cheese - this is the place to come to.  I actually like that there's a lot of sauce and that it's not dry.  The prices are pretty average, but I haven't had anything else here.  The people here don't talk much, but they'll get you what you want.

7.description: The heavy set Viet cashier dude is a crook! My first time here and he overcharged me and my 2 kids almost 2 bucks on cheese pizza slices. When I called him on the non-itemized receipt he gave me, he said oh, I'm so sorry, I made a mistake. I took my refund in a large fry.But I'm never going back to a scam place like this. Not a bad way to make 20% to 25% tax free on the innocent and math challenged.

8.description: Best local spot pizza ever! Something about the cheese that makes their pizza taste better the next day. Great square cut party/business pizzas. Dip the Italian beef, yum. They even char the hot dog for you if you like, ketchup on the hot dog though. Onion rings and fries are fresh to order. They're so good when I dip it with their secret hot sauce. Their BBQ sauce goes on everything. And it doesn't make sense to Go to McDonalds next door when the burgers here are fresh. The gyro sauce is the real deal, not the watered down kind at some places. They deliver pretty far out too. Hearty food for the great price with clean environment.

3.description: This place has no air conditioner. Eat outside, if you can get the one table they have out there or get takeout. Other than that the food looks and is good. Enjoy!

14.description: I'm a sucker for a sign that says pizza by the slice.  That sign and cash burning a hole in my pocket led me into this place.  With a few slices of cheese pizza ready and Telemundo blaring in the background, the question of whether or not I wanted to dine in or carry out was simple.  I'm staying.Two slices of cheese, their mystery hot sauce (Sriracha bottle....not Sriracha) and a can of Diet Coke and I was ready for my dining experience.  It was a "New York Style" slice of pizza that I was pleased with.  Nothing special, but the pizza is just good enough for them to stay around.  I'm sure they have a decent following and may do well later at night when the area bars and restaurants spill out onto Clark.  By the way, the mystery hot sauce was suprisingly decent.Would I go out of my way to eat here? NoWould I go back? YesIt is what it is.  A dive pizza place that has slightly better pizza then you would expect.Vitals:2 Slices of CheeseMystery hot sauceDiet Cokeless than $5

1.description: I was notified that I they were opening the facility for tours and I snapped up the chance to go. The process was simple and easy with no tickets, just put your name down on the list and show up the day of.
