The check in was easy I just showed my id to prove my age/identity and received a cup and went to taste their Krankshaft, Kolsch. To be frank, I wasn't that much of a fan of Flywheel or Dynamo but their Krankshaft and Ironworks, were really good. The beer making process is the same everywhere so the hearing how it was made was the same as the other brewery tours I've been to. However, Doug made some very funny remarks about 'triple-hopping' and 'cold-filtering' that added some interesting spice to the tour. The tour was short since it was basically a short walk from mash tun to fermenter to labeler and so it was a short 30 minutes-ish but still entertaining. I did enjoy Iron Works, which is going to be seasonal now. A pretty good tour and a respectable focus on a certain type of beer. Glad I came to the tour, and bought up a t-shirt too.

9.description: I love beer very much and was so excited when Metropolitan opened their doors just blocks from my house last year. I was only able to catch a tour recently and had a great time. Lots of generous pours of all their available beers while they talked about their dedication to beer and Star Wars.Doug and Tracy are passionate and approachable and led a fun tour. Metropolitan is their labor of love and it shows.

23.description: Dear Tracy and Doug,Thank you for genius brewmasters and being tremendously cool people.  Please don't ever stop.I promise I'll visit the brewery soon.Drink up and drink local!Love,Kellie K

5.description: I am very disappointed with this business and the people that ruined my plans. I emailed Metropolitan Brewery 6 weeks ago to plan a brewery tour for my best friend's bachelor party. It took more than two weeks to get a response. I had to physically go drive to the brewery and find someone to talk to because they would not return phone calls or emails. I emailed numerous times and called any number that I could find but got no response. Only after visiting in person and speaking with someone did I get a response.I set up the brewer tour, time and cost. I finalized all these plans with Jess (the minion). Five days before the bachelor party/brewer tour I received an email from Jess notifying me that they are canceling the scheduled tour. FIVE DAYS before!!!! I do not know how a business that can not keep its commitments stays in business. I would avoid this place and its people. I am again very, very disappointed with Metropolitan Brewery.

25.description: Doug & Tracy saw a gap in the armada of craft beer: Lager beers. (If you did not know: ales can be brewed, and sold, quicker than lagers. "Lager" is German for "to store".)So they began brewing lagers mostly out of their home. They found a location which used to be an auto repair shop on the *north* side of Chicago.If you visit Metropolitan's weblog [metrobrewing.blogspot.com ], you'll get the details.I have had both of their regular offerings. I prefer the Dynamo Copper Lager. It's a Vienna style beer (compare it to Dos Equis Amber, or Great Lakes Elliot Ness), of which there are not many brewed in North America.

12.description: Considering the craft beer market is primarily dominated by ales, it's a pleasure and a privilege to see a local brewery focusing on lager beers. It's even better that those beers are delicious!Metropolitan only brews a few beers, but they're all quite good. Flywheel Bright Lager is a crisp, refreshing beer that's great for the summer; Dynamo Copper Lager has a more malty, slightly sweeter body and flavor while still being extremely drinkable. Their kölsch, alt and doppelbock, though seasonal, are also very good. There's some minor variability between batches sometimes, but overall they're very consistent.Best of all, Doug and Tracy are two of the friendliest people you'll ever meet, even within the already-sociable brewing community. They participate in lots of local events and never hesitate to chat or talk shop. I hope Metropolitan sticks around Chicago for a long time to come.

21.description: Recently had the Dynamo Copper Lager at Hopleaf. I'm intrigued. Looking forward to tracking down and trying the other brews. Really dig that they are in the city and in my neighborhood. Drink Local!

16.description: At this time (July, 2010) they are unable to sell beer or merchandise directly to the public due to zoning regulations.  However, you *can* purchase items from their online store using a credit card or Paypal.Now on to the beer!  As the brewery is about as "micro" as they come, and the brewers at Metro focus exclusively on German-style beers, the selection at present is limited to three brews:  A kolsch, a copper lager, and a "bright" lager.  All are available in bottles and on draft all over Chicagoland (the website will help you find the closest location), and all are excellent.  Beer tastes best when it doesn't have to undergo the flavor-sapping pasteurization process required for shipment out of town/state/country - and the only way to drink fresh beer like this is to buy it locally produced.  Another reviewer recommended the tour, and I do as well.  For only $5, you can have samples and a tour given by the brewers themselves (the entire company has only 3 staff members).  Once you experience their passion for the art of brewing and taste the evidence, you'll find yourself watching out for their taps all over town!

17.description: Big fan of their kolsh! Great local brew!

10.description: Overall - Just went here for my birthday with friends... went on the tour and it was great. It's a very small, local brewery (owners were friendly & laid-back) - but similar to other brewery tours i've been too-- they show you where the beer's brewed and what goes in. They gave out 3 samples, which were delicious! My husband and I have since purchased their beer at Whole Foods, but I also saw it in World Market Plus. I wish they were a little more generous with the "tasting" portion of the tour. We had a small plastic cup and literally got a "taste" of the beer. I was hoping for refills, but unfortunately that wasn't the case. :( But we'll still buy the beer-- my fave is the kolsch style - Krank Shaft! Location - we took a cab here and it was a little difficult to find. He dropped us off a block away and we finally found it on the other end of the block!

11.description: Dear Tracy and Doug,Thank you for genius brewmasters and being tremendously cool people.  Please don't ever stop.I promise I'll visit the brewery soon.Drink up and drink local!Love,Kellie K

26.description: Big fan of both their Dynamo and Flywheel lagers (bottle or draft). Also a big fan of owners Tracy & Doug. Hard working, fun loving folks who are so very passionate about their brewery.And I would cut them slack on any alleged "supply issues" - its just been the two of 'em manning  the ship and their goods are in high demand.I wish them the best and can't wait to see what Metro has in store for Chicago!Two articles just published today that mention Metro:Trib: chicagotribune.com/featu…Wall Street Journal: online.wsj.com/article/S…

22.description: Righteous brews.  Fresh and flavorful.

0.description: One of the most informative brewery tours I've been on (and I've gone on quite a few) from a unique gem in the vastly growing crowd of craft breweries.  Many other brewers spend time talking about the amounts and types of hops they use in their brewing process, or their bottling line capacity, or how much wort can be run through their heat exchanger.  Yet not so much about what in the heck 'wort' is or why a heat exchanger is important.  Basically, what was going on inside all those different stainless steel tanks?Well Doug does a great job of walking both the uninitiated and informed through the process, which is very easy to follow in a small batch brewery (15BBL system) like Metro's.  You literally can see the hoses and pipes connecting everything and in a matter of less than 20 steps go from mashing to boiling to fermenting to filtering to bottling.  On top of the technical aspects he makes the story interesting and is sure to not only highlight the lagering process they use as opposed to the ubiquitous ales that nearly ever other brewing makes, but also to put in a few lighthearted jabs at macro brews and their silly marketing techniques.They also provide a hearty pour of each of their four beers for you to sample during the tour, and in the small group setting are open to answering any and all questions at the end of the tour.  And all this for $5, so if you are lucky enough to catch available tickets for tours on their website as they periodically open up I highly suggest it.Although I'm partial to hoppy American ales I love having ultra-fresh lagers right here in Chicago, not to mention these are my wife's favorite local craft beers as well.

20.description: Updating my review, tried the Flywheel and really liked it, hope they continue to make good beers like this, I'll have to check out the brewery some day.

19.description: This was an awesome brewery that I got to visit for an ACS tour. Doug and Tracy were amazingly friendly and willing to go over every intricate detail of their brewery and their operations. Let's not forgot about Phelps. Nothing like a brewery dog for mascot. My personal favorite is the Kolsch style beer followed by the Flywheel. If you get the chance visit the brewery. It's kind of interesting to have one in the middle of Ravenswood.

2.description: I had the rare opportunity to have a private tour of this brewery with a small group of Brew Geeks. I love hangin' with techies or scientific types and listening to them speak their techie language, and to be envious of their ability to do so. I also like to meet nice new doggie friends (which I did here) and sample beer. Yum!So this microbrewery has only been here since January  2009. It is owned by a young passionate and hard-working couple, Doug and Tracy, who lovingly produce several delicious German Lagers in their Ravenswood/Andersonville space. The three main beers are Dynamo Copper, Fly Wheel Bright and Krankshaft. I really enjoyed all of these, but the Dynamo was my favorite. Very clean and smooth going down, but still sportinig a rich and complex flavor. I also got to taste a Pilsner Doug was making, which was just as good as all the Czech ones I've tried, but without the slight bitterness or bite which is common in those. Again, being here with a bunch of brewmeisters impressed upon me the complexity of knowledge and technique required to make great beer. And Doug and Tracy do just that. You can sample their brews at The Hopleaf and their website has a list of retail outlets too.So support a local brewer (there are only 3 in Chicago) and pick up  a six-pack of Dynamo or Flywheel to share with your friends.

18.description: Amazing brews. Their staff is passionate, knowledgeable, experience, and incredibly welcoming! Dynamo and Flywheel are a must to try!Thanks!Jessica Dietrich

13.description: Recently had the Dynamo Copper Lager at Hopleaf. I'm intrigued. Looking forward to tracking down and trying the other brews. Really dig that they are in the city and in my neighborhood. Drink Local!

4.description: I took the tour of the brewery and found it to be well worth the $5.  Not only do you get to sample the beers, but the process of brewing is broken down as Doug does a very good job of explaining it and making it fun to listen to!  Through the tour, I've learned how important it is to drink local brews.  Not only is this particular group of folks pursuing their passion, and it's great to support people like them - but beer itself is something that loses it's flavor, the more you filter, and pasteurize it.  When you drink locally, this process isn't necessary any longer, so you get a product that tastes excellent!  So I would encourage everybody to drink Metropolitan!

24.description: Great beer, made right here in Chicago, by nice people.  What's not to like?  I am a big Flywheel fan (love the hops); Dynamo's OK too for an amber lager.  I saw a showing of "Beer" by the Neo-Futurists here, and came back to help Jess and Doug and Tracy bottle and box beer.Support your local brewmasters, drink Metro.

6.description: Doug & Tracy saw a gap in the armada of craft beer: Lager beers. (If you did not know: ales can be brewed, and sold, quicker than lagers. "Lager" is German for "to store".)So they began brewing lagers mostly out of their home. They found a location which used to be an auto repair shop on the *north* side of Chicago.If you visit Metropolitan's weblog [metrobrewing.blogspot.com ], you'll get the details.I have had both of their regular offerings. I prefer the Dynamo Copper Lager. It's a Vienna style beer (compare it to Dos Equis Amber, or Great Lakes Elliot Ness), of which there are not many brewed in North America.

15.description: Great beer, made right here in Chicago, by nice people.  What's not to like?  I am a big Flywheel fan (love the hops); Dynamo's OK too for an amber lager.  I saw a showing of "Beer" by the Neo-Futurists here, and came back to help Jess and Doug and Tracy bottle and box beer.Support your local brewmasters, drink Metro.

7.description: I went on the brewery tour here a couple of months ago and it was great!  A large group of us went and we had a great experience.  Upon arriving were let in and given our glasses for tasting.  After letting everyone try a few of the more popular beers they started the tour.  The brew-master was very passionate and he gave great insight as to how they run and maintain such a great local brewery in the city.  I learned a lot about the care they take in creating the recipes, obtaining the ingredients and the brewing process.  Not to mention the packaging and distribution, it's a big job!  I'm very proud to have such great brew coming out of my neighborhood in Chicago...I make sure to grab one whenever I see Metropolitan on tap.

8.description: If you get a chance, go on the brewery tour (under Store section of their website). For $5, you learn all things Metropolitan Brewing and get to sample several of their beers. Doug (studied in Germany for a bit) and Tracy know their stuff and have a passion for craft beer.Flywheel is my favorite of theirs and a map on their website shows all the places that sell their beer.A brewery in my neighborhood that has great tasting, FRESH beer? Yes, please!

3.description: One of my favorite brewery tours.

14.description: Big fan of both their Dynamo and Flywheel lagers (bottle or draft). Also a big fan of owners Tracy & Doug. Hard working, fun loving folks who are so very passionate about their brewery.And I would cut them slack on any alleged "supply issues" - its just been the two of 'em manning  the ship and their goods are in high demand.I wish them the best and can't wait to see what Metro has in store for Chicago!Two articles just published today that mention Metro:Trib: chicagotribune.com/featu…Wall Street Journal: online.wsj.com/article/S…

58.description: Completely the kind of place you'd drive past if you didn't know it was there. Yet inside is spa-like, very clean modern and relaxing atmosphere. Nice selection of polish to choose from.  The nail techs were very good at what they do.  I even got a nice shoulder message with my manicure.  I highly recommend this salon! Here is piece of advice: bring cash for the tip.

56.description: MAGNIFICENT!! Nice, clean, and relaxing atmosphere. LOVED IT!! The lady Sunny who answered the phone was very sweet and accommodating. I made an appointment for 3:30 pm on a Sunday and by goodness! They were ready for me when I arrived. :) The polish I chose for my toes was a really light neon green Orly polish  and unfortunately, it had a few "light spots" in it after my tech finished. I went back to her, pointed them out and she added another coat with NO PROBLEM AND NO ATTITUDE. I gave her a $10 tip just for that!  My toes look FABULOUS and the massage before and AFTER I got out the chair was also TO DIE FOR. You can find a decent pedicure almost anywhere, but GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE with NO ATTITUDE and A REAL MASSAGE to go along with it is VERY RARE. And, this place had it IN SPADES. If you just want a cheap $20 pedicure to "get it done keep it moving," I can totally understand that. But, if you have the time and an extra $10 bucks, this is the place for you. It will be the BEST sawbuck you have ever spent on your tootsies. TRUST. ;)NOTE: They accept credit cards but TIPS ARE PAID IN CASH ONLY.

29.description: I had a great experience here today. My bail tech ( Zuma ) was super sweet and efficient. Great atmosphere! Definitely plan on coming back.

42.description: I love the owner of this place, I followed her from her old place. She runs great business and because of my loyalty to her, I will follow her anywhere. My only complaint is some of the employees are not very friendly, while I appreciate not being bothered during my relaxing mani/pedi. I asked someone where a color was and her response was it should be there, which is a little irritating since I am a loyal customer.

23.description: Nail Lounge is a wonderful nail lounge.  Do a great job, friendly and great Mon - Wed. special.

47.description: Best kept secret!  Sunny and staff are all excellent.  The place is clean, quiet and just delightful.

8.description: Love it! Have been going for years. I have not had a problem with scheduling ever and always remember my cash for gratuity!!!! Also the weekday special is great!

31.description: Love this place! So quiet and relaxing and Sunny and her staff are really friendly and professional. I love Uka and Sara. I've been many places in and around Andersonville and this is the best place by far. Lots of OPI and Essie colors, Vinylux and 3 brands for no-chip. They don't do acrylics, so if that's your thing, sorry. I don't mind tho, it's all the more relaxing here without the smell or noise. If you are looking for a clean, quiet and relaxing mani/pedi with a free massage - this is the place!

34.description: This place was recommended by a friend and I will certainly be back! I am thrilled with my first gel nail manicure. I was there right when they opened on a Saturday morning. There was no wait, all the manicurists were so nice and helpful! And my nails are perfect! I would highly recommend this salon, and I think I will go back on a Monday, Tuesday, or Wednesday when you van get a mani/pedi for just $35! I can't wait.

16.description: Love this place.  Very quiet and relaxing.  All the nail techs are great and do wonderful jobs on both manis and pedis.

13.description: Great place for mani pedi. Very relaxing. Not loud and crowded like other salons.  Staff is very nice and patient.  Chairs and foot spas are clean.  I can't wait to go back.

11.description: Very clean, good prices, great colors. Just an excellent place all around. And the no chips last forever. i wish Sunny would open another one near Broadway and Granville.

39.description: This is my favorite nail salon in Chicago! The owner and technicians are super nice, very careful and extremely efficient for the great job they do. The salon itself is impeccably clean and always organized, and has a zen-like serenity. My favorite product that differentiates them for all the salons -- they use an amazing smelling lotion instead of that nasty smelling pink stuff.They have a $35 mani pedi special that runs Mon-Wed which I loved until I got hooked on the no chip manicure. I just can't go back to regular now for the shine and staying power, plus no fear of smudging post-appointment.

37.description: This place is sorta hidden, which is good for me because it's quiet inside. But bad for them, because I think people don't know it exists :(I had a manicure from Yvonne, & it was great. 1 of the best manicures! That's saying a lot. It was quiet inside, which I LOVED! The others workers, just sitting around looked so unhappy & bored :( I will for sure be back & spread the love to peeps so they can enjoy a great service.Btw, the price is exactly the same from 3 salons nearby

0.description: I went in today to get a no chip manicure. Staff was very friendly and they were fast. I didn't feel rushed but they did get me in and out and I like that when it comes to getting my nails done. My nails were in pretty bad shape due to breaking while moving, since I got the no chip manicure, I was told if they peeled to just come back by and they would fix it. I thought that was very nice as most places would not openly address that but rather ignore it.I got a quick shoulder and hand massage at the end of the service which was a very nice touch. I will be going back for a pedicure next Saturday.

38.description: I went to see Sunny and the folks at Nail Lounge to see if they could do a unique no-chip for my wedding. They were able to replicate exactly what I wanted and it lasted through the honeymoon and still looks awesome today, despite lots of pool and beach time. Uka did it, and as stated in other reviews, she's awesome. Here is the nail look they replicated for me: pinterest.com/pin/219057…

51.description: I was so happy when Sunny opened up a business close to my house though at first I was skeptical. I was very impressed with the establishment. It is clean and inviting. Love! the service and all the staff. I shamelessly bring my baby in when I don't think they are too busy and Sunny allows it --  *gasp* -- I recongnise that I am taking advantage of her kindness. My daughter was loud on my last visit, luckily all the ladies enjoying their mani/pedis were moms that day and were kind. I received a lot of help from her staff although I had to cut my visit short, of course.  I can't wait to get pampered today since I finally found someone to help me with my baby!!!! woohoo!!!I highly recommend Uko for the no chip nail service.

27.description: I get regular (vs. no-chip) manicures here, and they last at least a week! Everyone is also friendly.

32.description: Super unprofessional & unfriendly. Never going there again!! Not sure how they are in business.

54.description: Great place!! Everyone is super nice and the service is excellent. It was my first time here and they were closing in an hour but even with my mani/pedi done at the same time, it was a great experience. I would highly recommend coming here to anyone!

48.description: This has become my favorite nail spot ever. Yes, it took a while, but Nail Lounge did become my regular salon!Uka is amazing with no chip manicures. The 3 I've gotten from her have all lasted at least 20 days without peeling. Mostly my problem is just that I hate my nails going past my fingertip. If I didn't cut them, who knows how long it would last.Most of the nail techs are pretty quiet, but I think that's how Sunny likes it. Sunny (the owner) is very sweet, understanding, and accommodating.  She has gotten me in to see Uka on very short notice and always takes good care to be sure I'm having a good experience.My advice is to go on a Monday, Tuesday, or Wednesday evening. You'll want to make an appointment any other day.

44.description: BEST PEDICURE I HAVE EVER HAD.  Seriously amazing!  She worked on my dry heels until they were smooth as a baby's behind.  Very clean, quiet, and relaxing. HUGE selection of Essie and OPI polish and nice products.  Get the spa pedicure...you won't be disappointed!

24.description: I called ahead on a Wednesday evening to find out if they had space for two walk-in mani-pedis. They reluctantly agreed, so my bf & I headed over. We arrived a few minutes after 7pm and I thanked the technicians for taking us so near closing. I was met with silence. That was red flag number one. I almost turned around and walked out at that point. If they didn't want to take us that could have been communicated on the phone. My fear was that they would rush through our services in a hurry to leave for the evening. Well, my fears were realized...partially anyway. My bf loved his services. I, on the other hand, was not so pleased. My pedicurist, Ashley, zoomed through the service. There was almost no exfoliation and no attention to the actual care of my feet. Now as someone who gets pedicures regularly, I acknowledge that my feet didn't require intensive maintenance, but I would have liked for her to at least look for any problem areas. Never happened. Halfway thru my 'express' pedicure I was informed that because I came in so late someone was going to start on my manicure while the pedi was wrapping up. I was okay with this, so I allowed the manicurist to begin. The manicure was much better than the pedicure. Very thorough and attentive. My nails looked awesome after. The only downside was that I was cheated out of the complimentary shoulder and neck massage that comes standard with manicure services. I understand I was the last client of the day, but I still paid full price (and tipped well) so I expected full service. I would give them one more chance...my bf loved his services and from what I observed his technicians did a good job. The place seems clean and well kept. It's just a shame that every customer is  not made to feel special. I shouldn't have walked out of there feeling slighted, but I did. Hopefully, if I decide to try them out a second time, they will redeem themselves.

7.description: I have been going here for over a year for manis and pedis. Very clean and professional. I love their extra back massage. I have never been disappointed. A perfect manicure every time. I recommend this place to all my friends. And have taken friends and family here with me. I have been to other more expensive spas and they pass them in quality and cleanliness.

49.description: My new nail spot!  Very nice staff and yes it really is that clean!  Very easy to find street parking on that end of Clark.

40.description: Came in here with acrylics from another salon. One of the girls looked at my hands and then looked at me like I insulted her entire family... She seriously gave me the worst customer service I've ever received in a salon before. Got a pedicure from one of the male workers, didn't get his name but he didn't do a stellar job at all. My big toenail is cut diagonally and I still have a lot... A LOT of cuticle left. It'd been three months since my last pedicure so I was really hoping to get the works :(Sunny, who I love love love, left my hands soaking to get the acrylic off while I got my toesies done. Gave me an amazing manicure and I got a massage at the drying station. It was good, but not great. I'll give them another shot but I will see if I can have Sunny do my feet this time.I'm only going back cause Sunny is a pleasure to be around.

53.description: I've been here three times now and my experiences have varied from AMAZING to just OK. Jason was my first and last. The first was incredible, particularly the very deep shoulder and neck massage. It alone was worth the time and money. Unfortunately, my last visit with Jason was just ok and my manicure began to chip/peel from the bottom up about two days later. I saw someone else in between and she was "meh." The place itself is very new, nice, and clean. Parking is easy in this part of town.

30.description: I would give no stars if possible! DO NOT GET YOUR EYEBROWS WAXED THERE !!!!I had mine done by Ashley on Friday . Within hours, I had a 2 inch section on the orbital bone and an inch section on the right orbital bone where the skin  had been completely ripped off. It was bright red, raw and stinging. Very close to bleeding. WTF ! Not even close to my brow,,, why would there be there even be wax that far from brow ? I did notice that she ripped the cloth off against the direction the brows grow. I went back the next day and got my 12 dollars back . The owner didn't seem over concerned . I am furious!  I am constantly applying Neosporin and today they are  are starting to scab . It looks hideous and it is very obvious . I used to love this place for my nails - After this experience, I'm not going back. They have lost a customer! BEWARE do NOT get WAXED here!

46.description: My new favorite nail place. Prices are good and the sevice impeccable.

1.description: My nails looked really scary before I went in here and I think Jason did a good job fixing them up. He did nip me a little on one of my thumbs but he cleaned it up quickly. He gave me a shoulder and hand massage at the end, which isn't really my style, personally, but it added to the relaxation. I didn't wait and the service was thorough but quick. It was a little quiet for me - Jason is not much of a talker, but he did a good job on the nails and said I could come back and they'd fix them for free if anything happens to them.

55.description: My favorite place in Aville to get my nails done! I've been like 3-4 times now. Super friendly and very clean. They always do a fabulous job! I usually like to call about an hour ahead of time to make sure I can get an appt but many times people walk in and only have to wait a few minutes. Definitely very reasonably priced also.

9.description: People in airports and hotels and restaurants ask me where I get my nails done. I tell them Nail Lounge, and then I give them the address and the phone number.

26.description: Have decided to make this my official nail place. It's very convenient for me and the nail techs take their time and really do a great job. The owner is very nice, too.

25.description: Popped in on a Tuesday for a quick, pre-Grand Canyon hiking pedicure. Place was quiet and relaxing. Sat and watched Jeopardy! on the tv while the woman went to work on my (sorry about the upcoming description here) ugly, calloused, ingrown toenail- infested feet. She did a great job. So gentle and quick, yet thorough.  I got a great calf and foot massage, as well as a shoulder rub at the drying table. This was all in a matter of 45 mins. I noticed that it would've been cheaper to get the mani/pedi for $35 dollars (just the pedi plus color was $30), but having hiking- ready feet was more important than cute nails to match. Thank you, ladies. I will definitely be back!!!

12.description: Really pleasant ecperience. I came in for a no chip mani and I couldn't be happier with the service I received. My nail tech was absolutely wonderful. She was so precise and meticulous and did a beautiful job. I never got her name but I'll certainly be looking for her next time. The place was very clean and welcoming, and it wasn't freezing cold from AC like a lot of places! That's a huge perk for me. It's fairly priced for the service they provide. $35 for a no chip mani, $40 for a frenxh no tip mani. Love it here, I'll be back!

59.description: I followed Sunny and Degii from their old place to Sunny's bright, new salon, and I am still ecstatic about the service I receive. My pedicures last three weeks (including walking in the sand and swimming several times per week). The salon is gorgeous, quiet, and CLEAN! There is a TV, but it usually runs travel and nature shows with the closed captioning on, so it's a very peaceful experience. All the pedi chairs are massage chairs, which is a nice extra. Prices are reasonable, and everyone is friendly.

21.description: Went here on a Thursday afternoon. Should have come earlier in the week as it's a little cheaper, but the manicure/pedicure was done perfectly, plus I received a hand, foot/calf, and neck massage! I would definitely go to this place again. Sara did my mani/pedi. This place is clean, prices are good, nail polish looks fresh, and the staff is friendly.

17.description: Having just moved to the Edgewater area I have been looking for a nail salon. After looking at some places on Yelp I decided to give Nail Lounge a try. I'm SOLD!!! The reviews are correct that they have a Mon-Wed Mani/Pedi special for $35. The place really is serene and relaxing. I didn't notice the employees talking much if at all. They had a TV on but with the sound off and there was a local radio station playing in the background at a level that was just perfect. Lounge is a great way to describe this place. Two other patrons came in with a bottle of champagne as well and were offered glasses to enjoy their bubbly!!! How great is that!!I was impress with how they use a scrub on your legs and also you get a foot and leg massage but also when you get your manicure you get a neck rub and hand massage! All this for $35!!! It really was a nice and relaxing time and made me forget how dreary and cold it was outside. I'm definetly going back.

10.description: Love this place. Just north of the hullabaloo of Andersonville's other nail places that are more pricey.  The place is simply decorated a bit zen-like with great massage pedicure chairs, and nail stations that are spaced nicely without crowding. The vibe is always chill, even when it's filled. Very relaxing.I used to see Degii religiously--she gave amazing massages, but she left town. Now I see Sarah who is meticulous in her approach to manicures and pedicures and gives very nice massages. She's vigorous like Degii was! A big part of the service is a good massage and you'll get it here.

5.description: Despite the poor review on waxing I went in for a quick eyebrow wax while my boyfriend was at the dentist across the street. I did not like the results my brows look uneven and very round.  it was a nice environment but definitely will not come back for any waxing

3.description: I needed an emergency mani/pedi and after reading the reviews I was so glad they could get me in right away.  The first thing I noticed was, dang, it's so quiet in here!   Are we in a library zone?  There was a flat screen TV on with no volume and closed captions, and soft light-rock playing in the background.  No one really welcomed me or said hello, but one lady walked over a pointed to the rack of polishes.  Good thing I knew I was supposed to pick out polish because she didn't actually say anything to me.  Have we taken a vow of silence?  Finally Sarah walked me over to the pedicure chair without saying much, just kind of gestured.  That's pretty much the way the whole pedi was.  On the bright side I don't like when Nail Techs are gabby, so I guess the silence wasn't so bad.  Sarah's technique was very methodical and efficient.  I chose a deep, dark purple polish and my piggies looked and felt great!The manicure was also done very quietly and efficiently.  I chose a somewhat bright pink for my fingernails, and Sarah sat down with the pink and a sparkly silver.  I wondered what the silver was for.  She brilliantly used the silver as a base coat for the pink, and what I got was pure color genius.  The combination of the pink and sliver created an iridescent pink.  She never actually asked me if she could do this, but I put my trust in her and loved the results.  So now it's time for the nail equivalent of the blow dry.  Sarah lead me to the drying station and turned on the air, again not saying anything.  I sat there waiting in anticipation to admire my new nails, and before I knew it someone walked up behind me and turned off the air without saying a word,  then walked away.  I'll definitely go back to Nail Lounge for my mani/pedis.  I'm so happy with the way my digits look!  I just won't be surprised at the silent treatment next time.  Still, so weird.

35.description: Went in for a no chip manicure and had a great experience. I hadn't gone to a nail salon in years! Mostly because of my bad experiences. After reading the reviews of this salon I decided to give it a chance.What's not to love about this place!?-nice and very clean!-it doesn't have a smell like most salons-the people are quiet and friendly, nothing like going into a walk in salon with all the chatter going on in foreign language, you never know if they're talking about you-the manicure was great, the woman took her time and made sure it was done to perfection-the neck, back, and hand massage I got was just delightfulOverall my experience was a very relaxing one, I'm definitely planning on becoming a regular. I strongly recommend!

19.description: Booked a last minute mani and pedi for my daughter and I while visiting her in Chicago. It is located in a very nice area and it is beautifully decorated inside. The spa chairs were wonderful!  The atmosphere was very relaxing and the shoulder rub was an awesome touch.  The prices were very reasonable.  We will return for sure!

28.description: I've been here multiple times but I can't speak on behalf of any services other than nails and pedicure.  I get the no chip mani and regular pedi which have always been wonderful! The OPI no chip is amazing and typically lasts for 2.5-3 weeks.  There was one time when a couple nails chipped within a few days, I called them to complain and they had me come right in to repair the nails and stated that if there was another problem to please come back.  They seem to want to keep their customers happy!  The environment is great and clean and the mini massage you get during the mani is always a nice bonus! Thanks Nail Lounge for always making me happy with the quality of your nail services!

45.description: Just got my third manicure at Nail Lounge, and my first shellac in the city. This is my favorite nail salon in Chicago. Good prices ($35 for a shellac manicure, $60 for a shellac mani/pedi combo), clean, quiet, great color selection, close to my house AND they give you an awesome massage in the middle of the manicure. I love this place! It always puts me in a good mood.

33.description: Having just moved to the Edgewater area I have been looking for a nail salon. After looking at some places on Yelp I decided to give Nail Lounge a try. I'm SOLD!!! The reviews are correct that they have a Mon-Wed Mani/Pedi special for $35. The place really is serene and relaxing. I didn't notice the employees talking much if at all. They had a TV on but with the sound off and there was a local radio station playing in the background at a level that was just perfect. Lounge is a great way to describe this place. Two other patrons came in with a bottle of champagne as well and were offered glasses to enjoy their bubbly!!! How great is that!!I was impress with how they use a scrub on your legs and also you get a foot and leg massage but also when you get your manicure you get a neck rub and hand massage! All this for $35!!! It really was a nice and relaxing time and made me forget how dreary and cold it was outside. I'm definetly going back.

43.description: The place is clean and they give you a brief shoulder massage while your nails are drying, which are my two stars. But the nail tech doing my nails would not engage when i tried talking with her and my no-chip was peeling after a week. I'd go back in a pinch, but not if there are other options.

2.description: Really a disappointing experience after reading all the 5-star reviews.  I was the only customer with 4 tech's on hand . . not one said "hello" or acknowledged me when I entered or told me where to hang my coat.  There is no excuse for rudeness.My nails were chipped and breaking the next day.  I wanted to find a new place in my new neighborhood but this is not it.

18.description: I would give no stars if possible! DO NOT GET YOUR EYEBROWS WAXED THERE !!!!I had mine done by Ashley on Friday . Within hours, I had a 2 inch section on the orbital bone and an inch section on the right orbital bone where the skin  had been completely ripped off. It was bright red, raw and stinging. Very close to bleeding. WTF ! Not even close to my brow,,, why would there be there even be wax that far from brow ? I did notice that she ripped the cloth off against the direction the brows grow. I went back the next day and got my 12 dollars back . The owner didn't seem over concerned . I am furious!  I am constantly applying Neosporin and today they are  are starting to scab . It looks hideous and it is very obvious . I used to love this place for my nails - After this experience, I'm not going back. They have lost a customer! BEWARE do NOT get WAXED here!

41.description: I stopped in here recently, randomly too, and was very happy. It's super quiet, which I wasn't expecting but was very relaxing. The next time I am in need of a pedicure, I will definitely go here just for the calm atmosphere. The massage was also unexpected (should have read the reviews!) but so, so nice. I will definitely be back.

52.description: Highly recommend. Clean, good products, excellent color selection. If you like no-chip they offer a wide variety of shades and brands and they are the best I've experienced (most careful) at removing no-chip polish. Pedicure stations have massage chairs and all technicians do a good job with hand, shoulder massage for manicures.

50.description: Had a lovely pedicure here. Staff was all super friendly and wow -- this salon is clean, clean, clean! Really a step up from the regular walk-in salon and as someone new to the area, I'll definitely be back.PS: Bring cash for tip!

4.description: WOW, probably the best manicure I've ever had!  I made an appointment for a no-chip on a Saturday because the reviews were great.  It's my new favorite spot!  It doesn't look like much from the outside, but the premises are clean, spacious and organized and the service is great.I wish I had asked the girl's name, because she was fantastic.  Started with a neck massage that was very thorough, she has firm hands for the massage, but then quickly switches to the gentlest touch for the mani.  She was very thorough when applying my polish, making sure the tips got a little extra (this is what usually goes first for me).  The hand/forearm massage at the end was very unexpected and totally relaxing.  And all that for $35?  YES PLEASE!My only suggestion would be to play some music, it was very quiet in there.  Otherwise, I have nothing but positive things to say!  I will be back!

6.description: Love this place! quick in and out, quiet, peaceful and full service:)

22.description: Sunny the owner is always welcoming and I love this place. The best gel manicures anywhere--they never chip or peel, contrary to some other places I have been.  The best neck massages!!  Tips preferred in cash, but take credit/debit for services.

15.description: Sunny (owner) is the best if you can get her, but all are solid. Try to get in for mani/pedi monthly.

57.description: RUDE! Group of 3 arrived today at 6:30 for mani/pedi's, turned down. It states that they close at 8 but the lady at the front desk said they close soon. All the other workers stared at us rudely and the owner was nowhere to be found. I would never go back to an establishment like that. They weren't even busy! Shame on you guys.

20.description: Love this place. Just north of the hullabaloo of Andersonville's other nail places that are more pricey.  The place is simply decorated a bit zen-like with great massage pedicure chairs, and nail stations that are spaced nicely without crowding. The vibe is always chill, even when it's filled. Very relaxing.I used to see Degii religiously--she gave amazing massages, but she left town. Now I see Sarah who is meticulous in her approach to manicures and pedicures and gives very nice massages. She's vigorous like Degii was! A big part of the service is a good massage and you'll get it here.

36.description: YES. Great service, great massages (seriously), great prices, lasts forever.

14.description: Best place in Andersonville. It's consistent and the staff is kind and accommodating. Sunny who owns the salon is always welcoming. It's a gem in the neighborhood.

3.description: I've been to my fair share of antique stores, sometimes looking for something specific, sometimes just browsing.  I went into this place looking for a globe, really not intending to buy anything.  However, this shop was one of the best I have ever been in.  The woman who was working - Barb - was knowledgeable about the items in the store and not pushy.  I ended up seeing one of the most beautiful dining room tables I have ever seen.  The table was re-purposed wood from a 1922 schoolhouse in southern Illinois and it was GORGEOUS.  Well crafted, in good condition, and perfect for my little home.  When I came back the next day, the other owners, Mark and Ken (I think!) were equally as helpful as Barb.  This might be my favorite piece of furniture that I own and i am happy I was able to give this new shop some business.  I highly recommend checking it out - it's right near the Starbucks and Lady Gregory in Andersonville, easy to find parking, and the different items in there are worth a look.  Whether you are looking for something particular or looking to find something interesting, I'm confident you will find it here and meet the fantastic owners in the process.  Happy shopping!

1.description: Spoke to Mark, he was kind, thoughtful, knowledgeable and fair. I'll be by.

2.description: This place rocks really hard. It has lots of vintage suitcases, cameras, globes, maps, etc. I'm coming back to get things to build a gallery wall next. Also, Barb is the nicest.

0.description: Great selection and the friendliest service around!  I get lost in their interesting collection every few weeks.  Mark & Ken have an eye for some seriously unique and tasteful stuff.  I love their maps and custom made farmers tables, both of which I'm hoping to purchase at some point.  I'm excited to pick up an extremely comfortable and well built chair for my new apartment this week.  Go in to this spot and you won't be disappointed!

58.description: Had a lovely evening with my friends drinking some glögg and hanging out. Nice crowd for a Thursday and good service. Will be going back on a weekday.

56.description: It's a bar.  It is dark, it used to be really smoky, and it has a pickled herring neon sign.  Simon's is an Andersonville fixture, and deservedly so.  Simon's deserves your patronage, it is not fancy, so if you are among the "shiny shoe shaker mover" crowd you probably want to go somewheres else.  I have not experienced the bartender attitude issues about which others have expressed concerns.

29.description: Come on the wrong night and you'll get lost in a sea of bar crawl folks with LED plastic bead necklaces--this place seems to be a target for wayward drunkards. Come on the right night and you get to hear some fun live music!The staff here are incredible.  I was trapped in the rain in Andersonville, to quote Scissor Sisters--Lookin like a drowned harassed rat-- the owner of Simon's reached out to me in my hour of need and offered to lend me an umbrella for a few hours until it let up.  He said, "drunks leave em here all the time!  I'm sharing the wealth!" The umbrella he lent me was a golf umbrella--massive. Thank you Simon's for keeping me dry!

42.description: Best dive bar I've found east of the river.  Will definitely return.

23.description: This bar is exactly what you want your local bar to be.  Not trendy, inexpensive, great selection and great service.  It is cash only, but lots of bars are, as long as you know in advance, its not a problem!We went there during the holiday season and they served glogg as a holiday special!  It was so fun and festive!  And they dressed the place up with lights- it is just a great place to grab a drink (or five!) with a friend or a small group!  I will go back again and again.

47.description: It only took 33 years, but I'm finally giving in to my rural girl roots and have gone cuckoo for country music. I've always had a vague affection for Willie Nelson and Dolly Parton, but this year something happened to my soul and nothing but the white person's blues will do. So last Wednesday when I learned the Western Elstons were playing at Simon's that night, I cancelled my other plans (sitting on the couch watching Roseanne DVDs) and headed over to Andersonville. It was my first time at Simon's and I was immediately smitten. I like my bars like I like my men: long, narrow, and full of hardwood. Simon's delivered on all counts. I only had one drink, a Murphy stout, and it was decently priced. If it hadn't been a school night I'd've gotten a shot of whisky and a beer chaser, because that's the sort of boozin the Western Elstons' music calls for. Their drummer was double booked that evening so for the first set they rotated drumming duties and threw a whole lot of Beatles covers at us, which I was delighted by. After their drummer arrived, they went into full on honky tonk mode, and my fate was sealed: I had a new favorite band and another favorite bar to hold dear to my heart. Simon's is a bit far for me to make it a regular drinking spot, but I'll definitely be there every chance I get when they have live country music. And a few times besides that to ogle that hardwood, of course.

8.description: When the bartender tells you that Malort tastes like falling off your bike and eating the dirt/grass/sweat combo beneath your bloodied face, you've got to try it. And try it we did. After that, the details get a little hazy. We came here for 4 reasons:#1) it's close to home.#2) the jukebox has a solid mix of punk staples on rotation.#3) Anthony Bourdain gave this place a nod and well, I'm kind of a sucker for him and his shows. #4) they serve Malort. And after going to many a Chicago bar and asking the locals if they know where to find it, I was tired of getting confused faces and "what the hell is Malort?" responses. Pro Tip: Bring cash. You're gonna need it.

31.description: Neighborhood bars that are dark, cozy and mixes that one classic cocktail oh so damn well are the best in my book. Simon's Tavern is no exception to that rule. As soon as you walk in, the bartenders nod your way, the vibe is simply chill with a jukebox in the corner. The one drink that you simply cannot leave without having a gallon of is the housemade glogg. It's served with gingerbread snaps. You'll thank me later.

34.description: Simon's and Glugg has been a staple for quite some time for me.  But the service with trying to kick people out of the bar is seriously rude.  First of all, just because we had a drink in us, doesn't mean that we're wasted and you have to talk to us like we're children.  They were so condescending.  It was 1:30am and they close at 2 am.  Why are you kicking people and LYING about your closing time?  Secondly, the "bouncer" swears at you for trying to talk to the bartender and complains that he has to go home.  Well if you hate your job so much, then maybe you shouldn't be working as a late night bouncer.  I am so sad that this establishment has started to hire such disrespectful employees.  No matter now much the glugg may be good, the service just kills it.

16.description: I use to go to Simon's. Last time I went I ordered my gin and tonic and just before the bartender put it in front so me, evidently who is the owner yelled, "ID him", I am not young.I had my wallet in my car and he knew I was old enough and other customers weren't asked for their ID.So I left, wondering if he wanted to keep his bar a lighter shade of color.

13.description: Frozen Glugg! Get it. Awesome bartenders and divey atmosphere. I think there is a jukebox? I cant say because I was glugg-drunk. CASH ONLY. Update: Jukebox with a legit selection from punk to soul and even 90s one hit wonders. Live Jazz some nights too!

11.description: Typical dive bar but without the judgy staff/crowd.  The bartender was very friendly even though I was clearly out of my element.  I tried the glugg with raisins and almonds.  Can't forget the cookie for good luck.  I would definitely return!

39.description: We went there Friday night. It's a comfy environment, unfortunately the famous GLOGG won't be available after Thanksgiving (will come back to that for sure). The drinks were fine, we just had really normal cocktails. They seem to have a more specialty in beers. Heads up, cash only.

37.description: It's Glogg time and I realized that I have not reviewed Simons.  A long time staple in Andersonville whips up some good Glogg, the warm wine drink to warm you on the those cold holiday nights.  During Midsomarfest they now serve a frozen version so if you choose  to stay in rather than freeze you have that option.The bar is pretty popular and you will see some well seasoned regulars here.  Mostly neighborhood people but it also seems to be some what of a destination spot at times.Enjoy.

0.description: Read yelp reviews... Went for the Glogg, I had me some Glogg. the glogg is good. Go get yourself some glogg from here. It's stronger than whatever the other spots are serving. -A guy from California

38.description: Cute local bar that I stumbled upon with a friend looking for a late night drink on a Sunday night! Had live music (a man and a guitar - what more do you need?) and no cover!

51.description: I go here about once a week for good conversation, welcoming atmosphere, and delicious spirits (they carry my favorite, Templeton Rye). The live music is super fun and the jukebox is award-winning-good. Simon's is my favorite bar in the world, no joke.

27.description: Honestly this is the best dive bar in the city. I very much enjoy the ambiance, the people, the juke box, and the patio. Set in an awesome neighborhood, it's a great place to spend a night with friends.

32.description: I love Simon's.  It's a Christmas tradition to come here for Glogg, as I did on Saturday night.  It's a schlep to Andersonville, but make a night of it and grab some mussels and beers at Hopleaf first.  I actually prefer summer's glogg slushies, but it's splitting hairs!  Cash only.

54.description: This is my favourite fave dive bar in Chicago! It helps that it's in Andersonville, has the Swedish colours everywhere and is close by whenever I'm at the Swedish American Museum or buying my much needed Swedish food elsewhere in the neighbourhood.The drinks are really cheap ($5-6 for both beers and mixed drinks) and they serve a delicious glögg! Not only do they make it on location, but the owner, Scott, clearly takes pride in what he does and this year he had an additional white wine mulled wine that was just as good as the traditional one. I've had the pleasure of meeting both the owner and his fiancée and they are lovely people who really look after the bar well. If you get an opportunity, ask Scott about the history of the bar. There are more than a few hidden gems in there and you won't regret listening to it!I will continue bringing my friends here and even though it was the glögg that originally brought me in, it's not the only reason why I keep coming back!

48.description: Calling this a dive bar is like calling an antique a piece of shit cause it's old. But the bathrooms suck so maybe it is. This reminds of the bars I grew up in the hinterland of Wisconsin and Michigan.  It's actually beautiful in a way more modern homogenous places could never be.  In all honesty this is a more authentic bar experience than the HopLeaf down the street.  I say that because you can talk, be heard, and enjoy great music in an environment loaded with highly literate hipsters.

44.description: My great-grandparents used to come to this bar when they first came to this country. My grandparents used to hang out here in college. My parents, siblings, cousins, and I still frequent this establishment. Simon's is in my blood.  However, I make better glogg. Sorry, guys! ;)

24.description: This is a neighborhood bar.....dive bar. Was listed on a website for visitors to Chicago as the top 10 things to see/do during the holidays for their "Glogg". Mulled warm wine with raisins and almonds (in Germany referred to as gluhwein). It's quite a distance from downtown. If it wasn't for the Glogg and the very nice bartender (Jennifer) I would say don't bother.   We also were given each a circular ginger snap that you holdin the palm of your hand and apply pressure to the center with your other index finger. If it breaks into three parts you get your wish. Nice tradition, really good Glogg (4.5 stars) but that's it.

7.description: The best glogg ever is offered. The place hasn't changed in 40 years. Old man Roy would be proud!

49.description: I've heard they have glogg on Christmas! I've been there many times in all seasons but not yet for Christmas. Will be good to check! :)The other night we stopped by Simon's for drinks and as usual were welcomed with it's warm atmosphere, super nice staff and good mixed drinks. Super nice place. I normally don't hang out in Andersonville that much, unfortunately. But for this place I would make a trip there at any day.

40.description: Nice neighborhood bar,stopped in to have a few drinks before dinner, nice crowd,great place to relax and enjoy your beverages.

53.description: Man I want to like this place (dark/divie feel, good music - live and juke box etc)...but awful service. Hate to say it but probably the worst service in Andersonville. Those bartenders just don't like being there...or they hate life, not sure.

30.description: Cash only! Great juke box!I really like the atmosphere of this dive bar. Bar tender was really nice, struck up a conversation with a guy next to me and had a few beers, felt completely away from the coldness of January here.  No windows, dark, and kind of small, but all in the best way.

46.description: Simon's Tavern is a surprisingly great bar. It looks like a total dive, like maybe I don't want to go here and hang out with a bunch of old drunks but Simon's is much more than a dive. The staff is really friendly, they have a pretty good beer selection on tap that isn't just bud lite. They also have lots of ciders to choose from for people like me who don't really like beer and they have GLOGG SLUSHYS. Yes. Glogg. I know you know. Their juke box is somehow always playing the best music. Daft Punk followed by The Smiths followed by hip hop? Yes. I really have the greatest time here. It's random, its kinda dark inside, it's decorated rather eclectically and frequented by all walks of life, not just drunks. Yay! I kind of feel like this is the secret place-to-be. Also their bathrooms are surprisingly clean. Not gross bar bathrooms.Really friendly bartenders plus booze, good music and a 2 minute walk from my apartment is pretty much more than I can ask for. I love Simon's, it's a wonderful neighborhood bar.

1.description: Simon's is timeless.   They've been serving the same demographic of clientele for over 80 years, adjusting just enough to stay current without sacrificing their identity.   I've seen customers of all ages rub elbows at the long bar, chit-chatting with busy bartenders who somehow never seem jaded.   For a while I was worried that the rapidly gentrifying Clark Street strip in Andersonville would ruin this place somehow, but now I see I have nothing to worry about.    So much in the neighborhood has come and gone, and still Simon's is at least 95% of what it has always been.   (If you removed the Malort from the shelves and the electronic juke box from the wall, you'd have no idea what year it was.)Some bars are better places to start your evening, and some are great late spots.   Simon's is both, and everything in between.    You can come and go and talk to your friends and strangers and drink everything from $3 Schlitz to beers and other liquors more fancy.   And you will never be bombarded with overhead TV's or other gimmicks.   I'd like to say that Simon's is representative of so many old bars in Chicago have shut down, but honestly Simon's has always been out of their league.   I hope someday it gets landmark status.

55.description: When you head to Simon's it's one of those cut/dry bars - friendly bartenders that are just about beers and spirits, and yes, apparently some Glogg. Nothin' fancy about this neighborhood bar but divey it IS NOT. Sometimes you just don't need fancy shmancy cocktail. Been around forever, a staple it could claim. Hilariously if you didn't get your "holiday spirit" on during the november/december months, stop on by a few weeks into the year to bask in the holiday cheer hangin everywhere. :)

9.description: Solid local spot.Low key.Glogg and ginger cookies.Cash is king.Gets packed quick, so best to send some scouts early to grab a table or the back couch area.Juke box takes singles. Live band takes singles.Some married act like singles.cheers!

26.description: A lot of history at this Andersonville bar. The bar staff is always friendly and the place screams old city bar with the decor and jukebox. We had a shot of Mallort with our beers and much to our surprise the Reader article about Mallort was shot right where we were sitting having our shots. If you want a no frills, non pretentious beer in Andersonville go for Simon's.

25.description: This is nothing special. Just a cozy little dive bar. I would have rated more stars but in 2014 I cannot forgive any business that is cash only. I think cash is gross/dirty and do not carry it. I will probably not return.

12.description: Old school. Low key. Just an all around great bar.

59.description: I think Simon's finally clinches it. I'm just not into dive bars. There is nothing overly wrong with this place...aside from a slight odor that defines dive bars.  If you do like them, this is a pretty good one. I know that sounds like a weird review but there are strange things afoot in my brain!

21.description: This is my all-time, ultimate favorite dive bar in Andersonville; if not in Chicago. I don't even mind that it's cash only. First off, they have this winter specialty drink they serve called Glogg. It's one drink I have to have during the winter and it's really good. Think, spiced/mulled wine but really good and homemade. They serve it with a ginger cookie.(Also, there's a small patio in the back that is great during the summer for smokers).Secondly, the prices are great. Andersonville overall is more decently priced in the drink world and this place definitely fits in with that vibe. Beers are between 4-10$ depending on how craft-y you're getting and mixed drinks are similarly priced.Lastly, the beer selection is awesome as well, lots of good options on tap and bottles. If you're a cider drinker, they have plenty of those as well. Don't have much in the way of craft cocktails or a wine list, just the basics for those, but the beer list and price makes up for that.I've read some reviews that complain about the staff and service. I've never had an issue when it comes to that. But, it's a dive bar - if you want a flourish and a fake smile accompanying whatever15$ craft cocktail you ordered this isn't the place for you.

17.description: Great neighborhood spot, never pretentious, a great place to hang, especially over the winter months.  Bartenders are friendly and the prices are reasonable for the location.  Try the Glogg, it's a specialty of the house and a nod to the Swedish heritage of this A'ville institution.

10.description: I have nothing bad to say about this place! Great bar in Andersonville. The bartenders and staff are very friendly as well as the other patrons :)I will definitely be returning! Just make sure you have cash, but if you forget, there's plenty of banks/ATM's in walking distance.

5.description: Nice little dive bar.  Also came for the seasonal glogg and cookie.  Played some Erasure on the jukebox.  Very enjoyable experience.

3.description: This is exactly what a neighborhood pub should be. Cozy and dim without going to the sketchy side. Awesome decor that gave the authentic feel. Bartenders that were fun and inviting. I of course had to have some of their Traditional Glogg. It was strong warming and delicious. So glad I stopped by this very unassuming place.

35.description: Cheap beer and the seasonal Glogg! Good eclectic crowd and friendly staff. One of the best bars in the city as far as I see it but be warned it does got a bit steamy.*CASH ONLY (ATM available)

19.description: This is my all-time, ultimate favorite dive bar in Andersonville; if not in Chicago. I don't even mind that it's cash only. First off, they have this winter specialty drink they serve called Glogg. It's one drink I have to have during the winter and it's really good. Think, spiced/mulled wine but really good and homemade. They serve it with a ginger cookie.(Also, there's a small patio in the back that is great during the summer for smokers).Secondly, the prices are great. Andersonville overall is more decently priced in the drink world and this place definitely fits in with that vibe. Beers are between 4-10$ depending on how craft-y you're getting and mixed drinks are similarly priced.Lastly, the beer selection is awesome as well, lots of good options on tap and bottles. If you're a cider drinker, they have plenty of those as well. Don't have much in the way of craft cocktails or a wine list, just the basics for those, but the beer list and price makes up for that.I've read some reviews that complain about the staff and service. I've never had an issue when it comes to that. But, it's a dive bar - if you want a flourish and a fake smile accompanying whatever15$ craft cocktail you ordered this isn't the place for you.

28.description: In a nutshell: Malort. 'Nuff said.Came here at the end of a night or drinking on a Tuesday. Don't hate....I was on vacation. I had a buddy taking me around, and before dropping me off at the CTA station, I had to take a shot of Malort.For those of you who don't know what Malort is.....I'm not going to tell you. You just have to take a shot. Since I was already pretty drunk, I asked the bartender what I could have as a back following the shot. He said, "....um....::shakes head::....nothing." I then asked him what it tasted like and he replied with "....::shakes head::....death." After that awesome pep talk, my friend (who was WAY too excited to have a shot) and I took our shot. Malort tastes like dirty water, yet surprisingly clean on the front end of the shot. No burn, just awful. What follows is what makes Malort so memorable: the bitter taste of death. I can't describe what the bitterness reminded me of, but I know it lasted a LONG time. I can now say that I've had Malort, and will now sucker....I mean motivate my out-of-town friends to try it as well.Overall, this was a decent bar, and the bartender's character when describing Malort made it a memorable experience.

45.description: Staff is friendly, beer and spirit selection decent etc. I enjoy the atmosphere with smoke stained murals and old wood. It's pretty divey, but the jukebox is nice and so are most patrons.

33.description: I've had great times at Simons and I've had some of the worst.  End of the day I really don't want to go back again.What is it- it's a dirty hunting lodge themed dive.  The glugg comes at Christmas time.  Why is it good?  The drafts are nice and the glugg is good.Why is it bad?  The bouncer/staff pretends it is a way classier place and you feel talked down to ordering a drink.  When they stop serving after you come a long way to have that oh so limited glugg at 1:30 at this '2 am bar' and then give you a hard time because they want to go home you realize you really have been thinking too much of this place.I've held it up too high for too long.  Last three times I've been it's been a real hassle and I've been embarrassed dragging friends there.  Probably an afternoon works, but the Friday/Saturday service is simply too much to bear.  I won't be back until I hear of a service change- the place will likely be crowded without me.Skål Andersonville!

43.description: We just kind of "popped in", and ended up having a great afternoon. The barkeep was fantastic. She was stocking the bar, all the drinks were full, and she still made time enough to give us a pretty interesting, and funny, history of the place. She was obviously proud of the bar and it's past. They have a good selection of booze. The regulars were friendly, one even bought my daughter a drink to celebrate her birthday!And the owner sang her Happy Birthday in Swedish!The place had an old time, relaxed feeling that I didn't even realize I'd been missing. It was a great place to hang out and be with the family. Simons May not be for everyone, but, it's one of the best places of its kind I've been in.

2.description: I love Simon's. I wish I lived closer to Simon's. Or maybe I don't, because I would probably spend too much time here.I have yet to stumble across a better jukebox, really anywhere. One time I was here around the holidays and the bartender gave me a bunch of these delicious gingerbread cookies to eat with my glogg.

18.description: In a nutshell: Malort. 'Nuff said.Came here at the end of a night or drinking on a Tuesday. Don't hate....I was on vacation. I had a buddy taking me around, and before dropping me off at the CTA station, I had to take a shot of Malort.For those of you who don't know what Malort is.....I'm not going to tell you. You just have to take a shot. Since I was already pretty drunk, I asked the bartender what I could have as a back following the shot. He said, "....um....::shakes head::....nothing." I then asked him what it tasted like and he replied with "....::shakes head::....death." After that awesome pep talk, my friend (who was WAY too excited to have a shot) and I took our shot. Malort tastes like dirty water, yet surprisingly clean on the front end of the shot. No burn, just awful. What follows is what makes Malort so memorable: the bitter taste of death. I can't describe what the bitterness reminded me of, but I know it lasted a LONG time. I can now say that I've had Malort, and will now sucker....I mean motivate my out-of-town friends to try it as well.Overall, this was a decent bar, and the bartender's character when describing Malort made it a memorable experience.

41.description: So after seeing Simon's on whatever recent incarnation of Bourdain's smut show. I remembered the love I had for this place back when we would hit it up before or after "the Great Beer Palace" (R.I.P.) . I have had some great day drinking sessions in here too whilst the street festival outside raged in late summer fun.Just as Anthony waxes sardonic about everyplace he visits, my opinion of Chicago bars are extremely reverent because they all are great unto themselves.To the point where when I go to a great bar elsewhere, my reaction usually equates that establishment with feeling like a "Chicago Bar".This is a Chicago great , a little tattered but no worse for wear, it is a long bar even by "long bar extremes". If anyone is familiar with Doc's Clocks in San Francisco , this is it's older non-updated sister bar. If you consider yourself dive bar aficionado do yourself a favor , after having some supreme beer a block down at the Hopleaf, then pony up to Simon's for some cheaper beer and liquor.

52.description: Favorite place in Andersonville.  Excellent jukebox.  Friendly staff!

50.description: I still come here even though I moved out of Andersonville five years ago. The bartenders are quick and friendly (and two of the girls there have awesome Shera arms lol!)  They have a great beer selection. They have fun glogg during the freezing cold weather, and they give you a cute little cookie with it. They have an intelligent person's juke box.

4.description: Great local bar. Low key, dark enough but not too dark, bustling but not noisy--you can usually still have a conversation here. Just a very chill vibe in general. Also, great sign, and great glogg!

6.description: The best part about Simon's is the two IKEA sofas nestled into the back corner of the bar.  I planned at UYE here and grabbed the sofas as soon as I saw them.  The other tables aren't made for groups of more than 4 or 5.I wasn't thinking straight and ordered a lemon drop.  Simon's is a dive bar, so I wasn't surprised when the scruffy bartender, wearing track pants, wandered back to our table and asked, "exactly what is it you want?"  He was super cool and accommodating.  The results weren't bad, a lemon-y vodka drink for about $6. My second drink was HORRIBLE.  Again I'm not sure what I was thinking, but I ordered a Long Island.  It tasted like SKOL Vodka and...that's all.  It's a dive bar.  Stick to beer, or cocktails with no more than 2 ingredients, and you'll be fine.Simon's was a cool place to hang out.  As we lounged on the sofas, the soundtrack was all over the place with some EDM-tinged tunes, but mostly it was 80s goth, new wave sounding stuff, which I'm OK with.  This isn't the best bar for large groups, as some people in our group were on the "outskirts," which made it difficult to have a conversation.  The second bartender wasn't as friendly toward us.I was expecting more from Simon's, and I'm not referring to top shelf cocktails.Cash only.Paid street parking on Clark.

22.description: Solid local spot.Low key.Glogg and ginger cookies.Cash is king.Gets packed quick, so best to send some scouts early to grab a table or the back couch area.Juke box takes singles. Live band takes singles.Some married act like singles.cheers!

15.description: I enjoy sitting at the bar and having a cocktail or two at Simon's. My best friend's name is Simon and he lives in the neighborhood so we checked it out as a "gag" and have been going ever since. The legend and story of the mural on the wall is pretty cool. They have a good draft selection as well as a good selection of bottled beers. The bartenders are really nice and laid back, just like Simon's, just like Simon, and just the way we like it. Never went on a busy night and probably never will, we like to keep it simple at Simon's.

57.description: Simon's is a good spot for a cheap drink, tunes and hanging with friends.  The bartenders, however, can be cranky and more than a bit crazy.  Simon's is a neighborhood institution so it's worth checking out but it's best in small doses.

20.description: I have nothing bad to say about this place! Great bar in Andersonville. The bartenders and staff are very friendly as well as the other patrons :)I will definitely be returning! Just make sure you have cash, but if you forget, there's plenty of banks/ATM's in walking distance.

36.description: Simon says, "Drink Glogg the night before Thanksgiving and you will find yourself suddenly happy in a cold and snowy Chicago." It's a tradition at this point. This divey sweet spot releases it's winter Glogg every year the night before we stuff ourselves silly with Thanksgiving dinner.Remember gathering at a local pub when returning home from college over Thanksgiving the night you arrived home? You realize you can no longer tolerate 8 hours straight with the fam so you head out to meet old pals? Simon's is the place in Chicago to runaway but only 20 years later. I must mention they have one of the best juke boxes in town. Tonight I got to hear Hong Kong Garden. Between the always- friendly crowd, the winter drinks and the tunes, I was all smiles.

14.description: This is a neighborhood bar.....dive bar. Was listed on a website for visitors to Chicago as the top 10 things to see/do during the holidays for their "Glogg". Mulled warm wine with raisins and almonds (in Germany referred to as gluhwein). It's quite a distance from downtown. If it wasn't for the Glogg and the very nice bartender (Jennifer) I would say don't bother.   We also were given each a circular ginger snap that you holdin the palm of your hand and apply pressure to the center with your other index finger. If it breaks into three parts you get your wish. Nice tradition, really good Glogg (4.5 stars) but that's it.

1.description: If you are looking for affordable furniture with history and personality at an affordable price, then you need to check out this hidden gem. In an area where there are high end and consignment furniture businesses galore, Good Deal Garage has really hit the sweet spot for me because the prices are very low and the quality and variety of of the furniture is surprising stellar. If you have a DIY spirit to do some minor restorations, this place can save you a lot of money on great furniture pieces. I was able to find a nice quality mid-century writing desk for $80, plus $20 to deliver it to Lakeview. Elvis, who owns the place, was very open to bargaining, and agreed to bring the price down from $95. Very good doing business indeed. There is a trove of treasures that can be found here, especially when the prices for similar pieces would be 2-5 times as much at the higher end places next door.UPDATE: We found out that the writing desk that we purchased for $80 is a real by Drexel (original stamps still inside drawers and on underside), from its 1958 Biscayne line. Similar restored pieces from this line now retail between $2000-5000. Talk about a good deal garage!!!

9.description: If you love rooting through junk to find a cheap treasure, this is your spot. I adore it.  It's bigger than it appears from outside (Tardis, perhaps?)  We scored two small tables for $30  that hubby will refinish. Cash is king here.  Be prepared to bring your sanitizer and dig for treasure.

23.description: I stumbled upon this place on my way to get some tacos on Clark St.They opened up a couple months ago.I just love the name, as it really is a garage, albeit it one that opens into a much larger room, and the eastern european owners told me they will make a deal on anything, don't pay the marked price, bargain with them.some junky stuff but a lot of cool old basement type finds too

12.description: Elvis is the best. Been shopping there for the last two years+. Yes, the prices have gone up and it's less messy than it was but you still get waaaaaaaay better deals here than any place in Andersonville, (also love Merchandise M on Clark).

21.description: This was the greatest secret on the north side of Chicago. I love that people have found out about it but hate that fact I now have to deal with more people to get stuff. Thankfully I live close enough to visit every weekend because there is always new stuff

16.description: Wow, word gets out fast. I knew this place before they had the sign out front and sticker prices on stuff. They only took cash before too, I mean cash is king after all.They have old furniture, frames, kitchenware, suitcases, rugs, chairs, lamps, axes, everything. This is the kinda place you wanna go treasure hunting in cuz some of it is dirty, but once you find something, you gotta have it. The prices stay true to the store's name too. Stuff is garage sale cheap, priced to sell. Don't even hesitate to bargain either. Saving a dolla always makes me holla.Anyway, I love the European family that runs it. The old man is great. His wife is sweet and his son is there on the weekends; he's got that rugged thing going on =d... I have been there enough times in the past to assume the old man works the weekdays and the son does it for shits and giggles (have you seen his car?) on the weekends while his old man is rummaging around or shooting the breeze outside.This is a sweet spot to explore and come back to cuz they always get new stuff. PS. For anyone that's wondered what is under that tarp in the way back, it's a Rolls Royce but he won't sell it. Damnit, but it was nice to sit in!

17.description: I have been going to Good Deal garage ever since they opened and each time I walk ou with a full load of treasures! I can spend easy a couple of hours there, but is well worth it if you are willing to do some clean up and fixing.Elvis and his family are amazing, they are willing to help you with anything, he has even cleaned up a couple of pieces of funiture for me and even delivered them!
