10.description: Went shopping here today for some furniture. Found a few things I wanted & was able to make a deal with the owner on the price. They even helped me load the furniture into my van. I will definitely be back for more!

5.description: I've picked up both a terrific desk and dresser here - quality wood, $60-70/each. I like Elvis the owner quite a bit, super nice guy. I've also picked up things like mason jars, martini glasses, lamps, funky artwork...I think there's always treasures to be found here and much more reasonably priced than some of the surrounding antique shops.

11.description: One man's junk is another man's treasure.  This is a huge warehouse full of potential finds.  This is a hunt and peck place and you might have varying degrees of success on different days.  I think there is a lot of great potential here for some DIY projects.  This is a place where one must be able to see the big picture.  I fell in love with an original pram here, and although I have no use for it, I could see how pretty it could become if I did.  It was in not so good condition, but with some elbow grease, could be amazing.

22.description: Only one review for this amazing place? I have spent 2 weeks scouting the brown elephant and other thrift stores in the Andersonville area looking for an affordable but unique side table and mirror to go on my dresser with no luck. I found both of these things at Good Deal Garage within 2 days and for a good price.  The beautiful antique mirror was originally marked 35 and I got it for 25. The side table was only 15 and I paid full price bc it seemed like a good price.  Anyway, this place is huge and has a ton of furniture and the guy said they have a warehouse full of more stuff as well. I almost don't want to spread the word but I want this place to be successful so go check it out! You will not regret it.

0.description: I can't emphasize enough how much I love this place. First of all, delivery is $20, no matter how much stuff you get. (The cheapest I ever heard of for delivery is $40, and more like $60+ dollars.)The furniture is often cheaper than at a thrift store, and I can't find that they have any of that used Ikea/knockdown furniture.All of the furniture is either antique, or pre-knockdown furniture.The really great part is that there is stuff for all sorts of budgets. For instance, you can actually get a coffee table for $10, $20, or $40 bucks. Now, of course, the $10 is going to be sort of rickety and maybe have scratches. But sometimes, you just need a coffee table and are totally broke. But then there are also higher quality ones.I managed to get a cabinet/pantry that was just adorable, and it was $165. Like I said, all kinds of prices. The furniture is unique, and has character.This is truly a store for people like me who get mad just thinking of Ikea.Yay Elvis and his dad for running this awesome place!PS: Even though there were going to be closed on a Monday a couple of weeks ago, Elvis gave me his cell number, so I could simply come by with my  moving truck, and they would load up the cabinet/pantry I had bought. The ultimate family-owned, customer-friendly, place. Plus, Elvis is kind of hot.

20.description: I went to Good Deal Garage today and I met Elvis. OK, not the popular singer, but rather a handsome Balkan bargainer who had me All Shook Up over the fantastic finds hidden within the three solid walls of his family's goodie-filled garage.They say Fools Rush In, but you'll quickly Surrender to this shop, and That's Alright. It looks quite small from the street. The name includes "Garage," after all. It didn't appear to be much larger than your average car-park. Suspicious Minds should cast aside their skepticism and take a look. It's actually A Big Hunk o' Love. The front area just gives you a tease and a taste of what awaits you inside the actual store.Like a true treasure huntin' Hound Dog, I sniffed out deals too good to pass up. They carry ceramic tableware starting at $1. I found a giant navy blue coffee mug that says "Cafe Godiva" in gold lettering. It was all kinds of throwback fit for the Heartbreak Hotel or a personal collection of over-sized kitschy cups. I also came across a wonderful dresser. Its surface showed signs of a rough life In The Ghetto, but its Wooden Heart was beating strong. I Can't Help Falling In Love with well built furniture.I inquired about the price of the dresser and Elvis said it wasn't for sale yet because it needed more work. I thought, "Don't Be Cruel. I'm not in this area that often, so It's Now Or Never!" I convinced him that I could spruce it up easily and a few scrapes wouldn't drive me away - I'm a Hard Headed Woman. It didn't take Too Much arm twisting, because A Little Less Conversation in English and a little more Bosnian language did the trick (I really believe being bilingual is my Good Luck Charm). The piece was mine for $30!Elvis helped me out again by carrying the huge thing all the way from the middle of the store to the curb and loaded it into my car. He refused to let me lend a hand and got it all situated in the back of my Prius. I didn't break a nail, strain my back or scuff up my Blue Suede Shoes. So while he may not be the King of Rock and Roll, he's definitely the King of a Good Deal and Great Manners in my book.

19.description: All the great stuff people are saying is true, and then some. I bought a dresser and a huge cabinet (a little nicked up, but sturdy and solid - like they don't make anymore - for very cheap) so Elvis (definitely not the fat Elvis - but the white jumpsuit version) delivered them for free. He went well above-and-beyond, trying multiple times to navigate the narrow old staircase. Finally, he and his helper stacked the pieces on the ground and Elvis bent over the railing to lift them up to the second floor - amazing. His name could easily be Hercules! Super nice too!

2.description: I went here hoping to find something cheap and old for a conservation class. I didn't find a painting I wanted to buy, but I did find a small wooden horse/music box that I was pretty pleased with. And my friend found quite a few small items that she absolutely loved and bought for a way discounted price. The guy who helped us was very nice, and willing to work on the price. I would recommend this place and would shop here again.

18.description: I stumbled upon this place on my way to get some tacos on Clark St.They opened up a couple months ago.I just love the name, as it really is a garage, albeit it one that opens into a much larger room, and the eastern european owners told me they will make a deal on anything, don't pay the marked price, bargain with them.some junky stuff but a lot of cool old basement type finds too

13.description: I went to Good Deal Garage today and I met Elvis. OK, not the popular singer, but rather a handsome Balkan bargainer who had me All Shook Up over the fantastic finds hidden within the three solid walls of his family's goodie-filled garage.They say Fools Rush In, but you'll quickly Surrender to this shop, and That's Alright. It looks quite small from the street. The name includes "Garage," after all. It didn't appear to be much larger than your average car-park. Suspicious Minds should cast aside their skepticism and take a look. It's actually A Big Hunk o' Love. The front area just gives you a tease and a taste of what awaits you inside the actual store.Like a true treasure huntin' Hound Dog, I sniffed out deals too good to pass up. They carry ceramic tableware starting at $1. I found a giant navy blue coffee mug that says "Cafe Godiva" in gold lettering. It was all kinds of throwback fit for the Heartbreak Hotel or a personal collection of over-sized kitschy cups. I also came across a wonderful dresser. Its surface showed signs of a rough life In The Ghetto, but its Wooden Heart was beating strong. I Can't Help Falling In Love with well built furniture.I inquired about the price of the dresser and Elvis said it wasn't for sale yet because it needed more work. I thought, "Don't Be Cruel. I'm not in this area that often, so It's Now Or Never!" I convinced him that I could spruce it up easily and a few scrapes wouldn't drive me away - I'm a Hard Headed Woman. It didn't take Too Much arm twisting, because A Little Less Conversation in English and a little more Bosnian language did the trick (I really believe being bilingual is my Good Luck Charm). The piece was mine for $30!Elvis helped me out again by carrying the huge thing all the way from the middle of the store to the curb and loaded it into my car. He refused to let me lend a hand and got it all situated in the back of my Prius. I didn't break a nail, strain my back or scuff up my Blue Suede Shoes. So while he may not be the King of Rock and Roll, he's definitely the King of a Good Deal and Great Manners in my book.

4.description: I really like Good Deal Garage - it's a decent sized warehouse-y garage space (super inconspicuous from the street, looks actually a lot like an actual parking garage you can leave your car at) owned by an Eastern European family, although since I only go on the weekends, I always see the son, Elvis.  He is pretty great - funny, old-school chivalrous (will never let the ladies lift anything remotely 'heavy'), and completely willing to dicker on pricing, especially if you come in frequently.The shop has a whole medley of things, from pretty nice lightly used furniture to scruffier pieces to dining ware, decorations, and even a room with vintage clothing now.  Last year they did some remodeling and cleaned up the aisles a bit, I think they have a decorator/buyer of sorts on board, and I assume the prices have gone up a bit since then.  That being said,  you can find real gems in this place at outrageously affordable prices.  I've purchased a wine rack floor standing sleek metal wine rack (holds... 10 or so bottles, I've actually never really counted) for $15 from here, a in-good-condition coffee table for $20, and most recently a five drawer great condition dresser for $60.  Elvis actually delivered the dresser himself (and put it in the room I wanted and everything) the week I bought it for a flat fee of $10.  Not bad at all.Overall, I will be back again and again to Good Deal to peruse the aisles and see if there are any other goodies for my place.  It's especially fantastic if you like to do craftsy fixer-upper projects, as you can find things on the cheap that are just begging for a fresh coat of paint and VOILA great piece at an even better price.

6.description: Large selection of any thing you might want and lots of things you had no idea you wanted.Elvis is friendly and helpful.On my latest visit, the place looks amazing. Before it was like a rummage sale, now it looks like a showroom.Prices are pretty good and he'll work with you a bit on them as well. I really love checking out what they have at random times.

15.description: We came in here looking for wooden crates to build a bookshelf. They have a bunch of them sprinkled throughout the store, and we found some with cool markings and great character, some that were in great condition and others that needed a little TLC. The owner (I think he's the owner because we've seen him there before) worked with us on a price, and we walked away very happy with what we found. I would go back again in a heartbeat because a.) great selection b.) owner and employees very willing to help but also let you alone while you browse c.) very reasonable prices.

7.description: just go here. do it. it's affordable, the owner is really nice and helpful, and you never know what you'll find!

8.description: Super cool stuff, super nice guy, super reasonable prices. Really loved the chair I got from here and I can't wait to go back!

3.description: I was referred to Good Deal Garage by Sherman from Mercantile M. He said it was the place to find a new shelf for a crate bookcase. He was right. Elvis custom cut a board to fit the case perfectly. While I was there I also found the perfect height legs for a vintage suitcase I was turning into a table. You can't beat 4 legs for $10. The customer service is excellent and the pricing is very cheap. You can get some decent original artwork for under $30.

14.description: Here's how it works for me. I recently rehabbed my flat. I'll think "oh, I need a drink trolly" and I'll walk across the street to this place and boom- there it is. Do the pieces I buy need some loving? Gosh darn right they do. But was the piece $30 bucks and full of character? YES. My family and I go here when we need something and if we don't find what we need, we find something else fun or interesting. I do a lot of shopping here, Elvis and his dad are great. Its great that they take cards but they love it when you have cold hard cash. They work really hard and I'm glad something good has come out of that hideous apartment building.

58.description: Best. Dessert. Ever. Seriously. EVER!In fact, I can't even go here anymore. It's just not safe for my diet. And they've actually managed to ruin dessert anyplace else. It's just  a bitter disappointment when I order from another restaurant and I get a huge plate with a tiny slice of store-bought cheesecake. Everything at Taste is freshly prepared and delicious, the portions are huge, and the service is friendly.The cheesecake is truly heavenly, and you get a slab of it  - A FREAKIN' SLAB!!!

56.description: I went here for brunch since I haven't been back for a long while. This restaurant is not that big but a good enough size to eat at. I like their food and order a quiche which is so good accompanied a side salad. The waitstaff is attentive coming back from time to time to make sure we have everything we need. The service was great so I will come back here when I am in the neighborhood and I love this neighborhood.

29.description: I'm not usually one for sweet breakfasts but so happy I tried the coconut almond cakes! They were incredibly flavorful and came with banana slices and fresh whipped cream. Iced coffee refills were free and much appreciated during the hot morning. There was somewhat of a wait for the food but not appalling my any means. With the intriguing items on the menu, I will definitely come by for breakfast again.

42.description: Im here! I came to brunch with my family and people did not treat us right! Food are "whatever, nothing amazing"...

23.description: Not that great.Service was sloe even tho there weren't many customers. The food is WAY over priced. I think I paid almost 11 dollars for plain pancakes. Won't be back most likely.

47.description: One of the best diners in the city. Every meal I've had has been wonderful and the sweets are excellent. I'm always so full after the meal (read: great, big portions) that I have to get a sweet to go. Service has always been good. If we ever have friends or family visiting, this is where we take them for breakfast or lunch (or-if it was up to me-both). Try the hot chocolate- tastes like liquid gold. Check it out- you might see me there.

8.description: Simply delicious food! The atmosphere is cute and small and diner-like, but with a lot of cupcakes. It's great for sitting and hanging out, and the owner and servers are really nice, quick, and chill.I tried the roasted pear salad and iced coffee (both recommended from the server). The salad was awesome--big and filling, with crispy roasted chicken, delicious roasted pears, and goat cheese and cherries to keep things interesting. Salad dressing came on the side (which was thoughtful). The iced coffee was big, delicious, and FREE because it was a Wednesday! What a pleasant surprise!The prices seem high ($12 for the salad) but the quality of food was well worth it. Definitely check it out if you're in the area!

31.description: I had the steel cut oatmeal with peach compote. Who knew oatmeal could be so delicious! It was very filling as well. Everyone's dishes looked so good and hearty. It was a clean restaurant and our waitress was very friendly. I hope I can come back and taste the chicken and biscuit breakfast.

34.description: What a great find! I've walked past this place at least 100 times and have to say I should have ventured in sooner! No wait on a Sunday at brunch time and the biscuits and whipped cream was the best I've had in so long if not ever. This gem is well worth traveling halfway across the city for breakfast.

16.description: What a great breakfast! Great coffee and tea (although way too pricey for such beverages!). I had the Mike's Pesto Sandwich and it was amazing. Egg, tomato, spinach, bacon and pesto! Yum! The folks with me had the quiche and the omelet of the day. Once again, great portions, generous ingredients and fantastic flavors. We could've gone for less of the sides and a lower price, though. Very friendly service! And scrumptious looking baked goods and cupcakes if you're looking for something on the go!

13.description: Overall: Great little cafe with delicious eats and friendly service.The good: Great bakery treats to choose from with specialty cupcakes, cakes, brownies, etc. All were great. Good coffee and plenty of other options. Service was friendly and attentive. A good amount of seating. Cute decor.The bad: Not much!Atmosphere: 9/10Service: 9/10Food: 9/10

11.description: Everything is, was, and always will be the culinary equivalent of having your taste buds pass through them pearly gates.  As a customer you are paying for quality and ATOH delivers.  All of their desserts seem like a winners at least in the taste department if not caloric.  It's like stepping into a dessert brothel, there's a little something for everyone.  We chose the cream puff because we always choose the cream puff.  Wow!  I'll leave it at that.  I had this thanksgiving wrap which was as advertised minus mashed potatoes.  Solid.  The food is top notch but for three folks it'll be over sixty after tipping.  Support local businesses like this one owned by Dan, a swell guy who actually cares about his customers.

39.description: Get the coconut almond pancakes, you will NOT regret it! They are super generous with the whipped cream. Also: the cornmeal biscuits are AWESOME.

37.description: Great breakfast. I had the chorizo skillet - so tasty.  My boyfriend had the Carmel pancakes- sugary treat. Friendly staff. If you haven't tried this place give it a try.

0.description: I used to live down the street from Taste Of Heaven and would always stop in for dessert on the weekends but never ate an actual meal here. I finally did this past weekend after 7 years. Their menu isn't large but I wouldn't expect it to be for sure a small place. It's cozy and smells great inside. I ordered the Thanksgiving dinner Wrap. It was unbelievable! They brought the wrong dressing for my side salad but it was still good. As for their dessert, you can't go wrong. Their cakes are made in house and are sooooo good! Get something to go even if you aren't hungry. Downside was there was only one bathroom tucked away in the back for both genders. I waited about 15 minutes to use the bathroom.

38.description: Lovely meal that's perfect for a quick bite with a friend. Overall the service was nothing remarkable - the waitress checked in once or twice but we waited a bit to get our check. Water flowed quickly and often. I ordered the quiche and was satisfied. The quiche of the day was steak and cheese. The portion was generous and the side salad was fresh. The crust was light and flaky and had a hint of sweetness that complimented the salted egg and steak filling. The pie top wasn't as crunchy or chewy as I would've liked but still was nice!

51.description: We came across this place by accident one Sunday. Our original plan was to go to Big Jones but the wait time was almost two hours. Upon arrival, we were seated at the corner near the cupcake display. The place is some what small and very crowded. My boyfriend ordered some sandwich with peaches, it was okay. I had the steak and eggs, the steak was cooked medium like how I like it. I could only eat a couple of bites, it was too heavy for my taste. When we received our bill I'm was surprised at how much this breakfast had cost. For a sandwich, steak and eggs, coffee and tea $42 definitely was not worth our money. I'm not sure what the hype is all about maybe people haven't had real good breakfast. Nothing was special about this breakfast, glad I tried it. I would probably not come back. Overpriced.

27.description: I pass this place all the time and decided to check it out on a whim. I have a sweet tooth and this place was exactly what I needed. I tried the Oreo ice cream and oatmeal, cherry, white chocolate cookie. The ice cream was silky and just the right amout of sugar. I orded the cookie  because it had the three things I like the most in cookies. The cookie did not disappoint. Sweet from the white chocolate and little tart from the cherries. Perfect cookie.

32.description: The food was good the service was good neither great but all in all a good experience. I would definitely go here again. I would, however have to say that their banana pound cake was amazing, so 5 stars on that. Oh, and they never rushed us out the door, so my friends and I were able to catch up for 2.5 hours.

54.description: Breakfast all day is always a key to my heart. But breakfast all day AND PASTRY? That will get me every time. (Note: it will look just like a pastry shop when you walk in. The boards will say nothing about food, just pastry. But if you say you want to dine in, they will give you table service and a menu of delights. The best thing we tried was, surprisingly, the almond and coconut pancakes. Actual coconut. Actual homemade whipped cream. They were amazing. The grilled cheese sandwich was also great - lots of flavors and fresh bread. The roasted potatoes had almost no flavor, so skip those in favor of another side. For dessert we tried the cream puff with whipped cream (heavenly) and the moon pie cupcake (very good). I will admit, these cupcakes didn't stack up to Molly's or Sugar Bliss for me. They had just a little less flavor and creativity. But for a meal AND a cupcake, I was quite impressed.

48.description: Just love it here! Every single thing I've ever tried has been delicious, from their coffee to their entrees to their desserts....heaven.The servers are always very friendly and we've never had a problem being seated.We like to stop in here for brunch and we always get coffee(me-fancy coffee, him-straight black). I usually order the quiche because it's so good, but I have gotten their Durbin sandwich before, too. Both were so good. The quiche is my to-go-to though because they are such a pain in the ass to make yourself and they always get the texture right. They are always light and fluffy. My husband usually goes for something a bit more hearty. The last time he got a portobello sandwich which was really good. I never can leave without getting a cupcake, which I have a love/hate relationship with. Love, because they are so good. Hate because then I have to go to the gym later. It's worth it.

44.description: I had just moved into the neighborhood, and my sister decided to take me to brunch here. The restaurant decor is very eclectic, and gives it a "Grandma's house" vibe. Not to say this is a bad thing, because it is quite endearing. We both ordered the Mike's Pesto Sandwich, which will go down in history as one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have had. Our waitress was friendly, but towards the end seemed to be losing steam. Since I am a server, I understand. She didn't close out our check, but one of her colleagues did instead. Overall a very positive experience here.

24.description: What a great breakfast! Great coffee and tea (although way too pricey for such beverages!). I had the Mike's Pesto Sandwich and it was amazing. Egg, tomato, spinach, bacon and pesto! Yum! The folks with me had the quiche and the omelet of the day. Once again, great portions, generous ingredients and fantastic flavors. We could've gone for less of the sides and a lower price, though. Very friendly service! And scrumptious looking baked goods and cupcakes if you're looking for something on the go!

7.description: Dan's customer service (the owner) was incredible - upon reading my first review, he immediately contacted me to make my experience at Taste of Heaven right. He sympathized with wasting money and calories at a restaurant only to be disappointed and invited me to come back and give Taste another chance with a guest. I appreciated how FAST and KIND he was when responding to my concerns. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!  I was not disappointed during my return visit! Mike's pesto sandwich is hands-down one of the best breakfast sandwiches in Chicago. The thick cut, slightly sweet brioche is perfectly toasted and complemented by a mountain of goat cheese, pesto, tomato, bacon, spinach and 2 eggs. It is definitely big enough to be shared (or hoarded for second brunch later in the day)! It comes with a side of fresh fruit and potatoes. I also tried the sparkling lemonade - served in a big mason jar and not too sour or sweet, with the right amount of fizz. Perfect for a warm day! The place gets crowded during the weekend, but they also have a pretty big patio area on the southeast side of the restaurant to accommodate more patrons. It's nicely shaded and worth checking out!

49.description: I thought the food was decent.  My wife did not like her food at all.  She thought it was way too heavy.  Three stars from me and one star from my wife.  Therefore, two stars.

40.description: Simply delicious food! The atmosphere is cute and small and diner-like, but with a lot of cupcakes. It's great for sitting and hanging out, and the owner and servers are really nice, quick, and chill.I tried the roasted pear salad and iced coffee (both recommended from the server). The salad was awesome--big and filling, with crispy roasted chicken, delicious roasted pears, and goat cheese and cherries to keep things interesting. Salad dressing came on the side (which was thoughtful). The iced coffee was big, delicious, and FREE because it was a Wednesday! What a pleasant surprise!The prices seem high ($12 for the salad) but the quality of food was well worth it. Definitely check it out if you're in the area!

53.description: I have been wanting to try out this place for a while now and I finally did. We came on a Sunday around 1:30 and didn't have a problem getting a seat. The place is pretty small, but has a lot of homemade goods from cupcakes to cakes and bars, etc...My husband got the Steak and Eggs and I tried the Havar Ya Sandwich with a side of soup. The steak and eggs were ok and the potatoes were tasty, nice and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. My sandwich was okay as well. The homemade baguette bread was good and held the sandwich quite well. But it was kinda dry and perhaps could use some sauce to make it tastier. Service was also okay. Overall, this place is okay.

30.description: MMM- Been here 2x now and really impressed. Both times were for brunch. Great dog friendly patio, service is good and the staff is really friendly. The food is so fresh and tasty. I'm looking forward to trying lunch and dinner.

46.description: Great treasure of good food and coffee plus amazing deserts. Very cozy and warm environment with a twist of hip. Great place to meet a friend. Expect to wait for a table for weekend brunch times...but not very long.

1.description: Stopped here for after dinner desert last Sunday evening.    What is better then coffee and cupcakes?   About a dozen tables.   Very comfortable atmosphere.   The coffee was good.   The cupcakes were great.   They had a big selection, so we ordered 4 different types.   My favorite was the malted milk ball.   It was really yummy.   Next was the salted chocolate.   Pretty good.    Third was the key-lime.   Outstanding.   Fourth was a triple chocolate.   Not bad at all.  Cupcakes and coffee.... This place slam dunked it.  They have a full menu, so I'd like to go back.

55.description: Oh my goodness the Jeanine cake....just get the Jeanine cake! I think for the last (at least) 5 years I've requested a slice of the Jeanine cake here for my birthday and it never disappoints! And you can easily share one piece with several people because they're huge.Honestly there hasn't been anything from here that we haven't liked - they always have a good selection of cupcakes and they're ALL delicious. Can't say we've ever had anything else but sweets from here but who needs food when you can have cake?

9.description: Seriously amazing chocolate chip scone! Great Americano! Wonderful service with a smile! Wish I lived close by!

26.description: Biscuits and gravy are to die for.  Plenty of love from this place. Must go to in Chicago

25.description: Still the best breakfast place in Andersonville. Get the skillet. Or better yet an omelet w/caramelized onions, ham, asparagus and goat cheese. I was sad it ended. Can't wait to come back on our next visit!

12.description: This place strikes a difficult balance between being a popular brunch destination and a small community oriented place to get coffee and home style food.  Yes, if you come here for brunch at peak brunch time, be prepared to suffer all the inconveniences that come with getting brunch at peak time. This place is casual enough you can eat here alone with a book and sit with coffee afterwards.

59.description: Insanely good food in a simple, cozy cafe. Everything is fresh and homemade.. including their roasted turkey in their sandwiches...and their bread.  It's a must try.  I know we will be back!! Have had the egg, pesto, &bacon sandwich, the turkey , pear & havarti sandwich, great salad with homemade dressing,  and the to die for German Chocolate Cake!!

21.description: Love this place!! Have been here more than several times and I enjoy everyone one them. They have the best stuffed cupcakes which I get everytime I go! Their biscuits and gravy is amazing but, honestly so is everything else on the menu

17.description: I had just moved into the neighborhood, and my sister decided to take me to brunch here. The restaurant decor is very eclectic, and gives it a "Grandma's house" vibe. Not to say this is a bad thing, because it is quite endearing. We both ordered the Mike's Pesto Sandwich, which will go down in history as one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have had. Our waitress was friendly, but towards the end seemed to be losing steam. Since I am a server, I understand. She didn't close out our check, but one of her colleagues did instead. Overall a very positive experience here.

10.description: My mother worked here years ago they've changed a lot of stuff sense but the food is still top notch.

5.description: Plentiful of ridiculously delicious sounding Daily Specials.  Price is relative to food portion, ingredients, quality and preparation.FRENCH ONION SOUP ($3.75) -- comes with 3 pcs of housemade bread. Delicioso. Good balance of ingredients.  Broth is NOT dark brown. Yay!QUICHE ($10.75) -- a risky custard combination of ham and pineapple. Hawaiian pizza in a pie. Skip it! Soggy crust. Comes with default mixed green salad with vinaigrette.LEMONADE ($4.75) -- expensive with an impressive strong lemon flavor that is not sour.ELVIS CUPCAKE -- peanut butter icing was a tad sweet with banana cake. A version of Elvis' favorite food.COFFEE -- La Colombe brand.SERVICE -- excellent, well-informed, friendly, charming.VENUE -- the relax atmosphere of a cafe.  Lots of stuff that is neatly organized. Comfy. Welcoming.1-star less:- presence of housefly- box your own brown bag

3.description: One of my family's favorite places for breakfast. They are usually crowded and its difficult to get a table. Parking is notoriously bad in Andersonville, so be aware. The food is great though! The last time I was there we split the bacon, egg, and pesto sandwich, and the caramel apple french toast which had a mound of whipped cream. It was really sweet, but so good. Even with a half portion it was too much, so I would definitely share with the table next time!

35.description: Plentiful of ridiculously delicious sounding Daily Specials.  Price is relative to food portion, ingredients, quality and preparation.FRENCH ONION SOUP ($3.75) -- comes with 3 pcs of housemade bread. Delicioso. Good balance of ingredients.  Broth is NOT dark brown. Yay!QUICHE ($10.75) -- a risky custard combination of ham and pineapple. Hawaiian pizza in a pie. Skip it! Soggy crust. Comes with default mixed green salad with vinaigrette.LEMONADE ($4.75) -- expensive with an impressive strong lemon flavor that is not sour.ELVIS CUPCAKE -- peanut butter icing was a tad sweet with banana cake. A version of Elvis' favorite food.COFFEE -- La Colombe brand.SERVICE -- excellent, well-informed, friendly, charming.VENUE -- the relax atmosphere of a cafe.  Lots of stuff that is neatly organized. Comfy. Welcoming.1-star less:- presence of housefly- box your own brown bag

19.description: Our friends took us to this little cozy place by their home. It was small, but we didn't wait too long for a table for 4 on a Saturday morning. Food was delicious! I ordered the omlette of the day (a play on Philly Cheese Steak) AND French Toast with a side of No Regrets :) Sweet & savory - had to do both! Service was very friendly & the staff was so sweet!! There was also an abundance of pastries to choose from as well.

28.description: Three things:Space. Service. Food.Space Inside: I live a block away from here, but seldomly go because it's always crowded. Also, it's really small and tight; elbow to elbow. So I always eat outside.Space Outside: barley comfortable metallic chairs and unsteady tables makes the experience a bit off-putting.Service:The staff is really nice, but, often, they look stressed out, always seems like they're trying to comfort the people there without much success.Food:Delightful. Delicious. Well prepared. It's literally the only reason I like this place. If the aforementioned problems weren't there, this would be a 5-star joint. If you're in the area and it's not crowded, I'd say try the food. You won't regret it.

45.description: First experience at Taste of Heaven was disappointing. I had a Niçoise salad that was just not fresh. A throw together of pre-prepped items that had been in the walk-in several days too long, all tossed in a tarragon dressing that was supposed to be creamy, but which, extraordinarily, was dry. I ate about half of it and got a candy bar and protein shake on the way home. My husband's basic bacon and eggs breakfast was quite good, so he liked the place. On the whole, the ambience is good and I rate the service okay even though our meals were pretty slow coming out (probably took a while to find the salad makings in the back of the cooler ). I might go back if in the immediate area, but definitely would not order a salad there.

33.description: Poor service. Waited an hour for food. And waiter never refilled water until he gave the check. Waiter also didn't come by to ask how we were doing or how the food was.

43.description: Overall: Great little cafe with delicious eats and friendly service.The good: Great bakery treats to choose from with specialty cupcakes, cakes, brownies, etc. All were great. Good coffee and plenty of other options. Service was friendly and attentive. A good amount of seating. Cute decor.The bad: Not much!Atmosphere: 9/10Service: 9/10Food: 9/10

2.description: Found this gem under breakfast and brunch spots. It's a very cozy place that serves delicious foods. I ordered the almond pancakes and it definitely fulfilled all my sweet needs. What I enjoyed most about the pancakes was that it wasn't overly sweet. I think a lot of places have flavorless pancakes and depend on the syrup to drown out the flavor. However I didn't even use additional syrup on my pancakes. After ordering the pancakes I did regret not getting something more savory. I drooled with each dish that came out as the servers delivered it to surrounding tables. I already decided I would be back to try their pesto sandwich. There are also a plethora of breads, muffins, and cupcakes one could hope for. They web have a counter where you can order coffee and a muffin to go. I highly recommend taste of heaven. Although the name is a bit corny, it does deliver.

18.description: Just love it here! Every single thing I've ever tried has been delicious, from their coffee to their entrees to their desserts....heaven.The servers are always very friendly and we've never had a problem being seated.We like to stop in here for brunch and we always get coffee(me-fancy coffee, him-straight black). I usually order the quiche because it's so good, but I have gotten their Durbin sandwich before, too. Both were so good. The quiche is my to-go-to though because they are such a pain in the ass to make yourself and they always get the texture right. They are always light and fluffy. My husband usually goes for something a bit more hearty. The last time he got a portobello sandwich which was really good. I never can leave without getting a cupcake, which I have a love/hate relationship with. Love, because they are so good. Hate because then I have to go to the gym later. It's worth it.

41.description: Dan's customer service (the owner) was incredible - upon reading my first review, he immediately contacted me to make my experience at Taste of Heaven right. He sympathized with wasting money and calories at a restaurant only to be disappointed and invited me to come back and give Taste another chance with a guest. I appreciated how FAST and KIND he was when responding to my concerns. GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!  I was not disappointed during my return visit! Mike's pesto sandwich is hands-down one of the best breakfast sandwiches in Chicago. The thick cut, slightly sweet brioche is perfectly toasted and complemented by a mountain of goat cheese, pesto, tomato, bacon, spinach and 2 eggs. It is definitely big enough to be shared (or hoarded for second brunch later in the day)! It comes with a side of fresh fruit and potatoes. I also tried the sparkling lemonade - served in a big mason jar and not too sour or sweet, with the right amount of fizz. Perfect for a warm day! The place gets crowded during the weekend, but they also have a pretty big patio area on the southeast side of the restaurant to accommodate more patrons. It's nicely shaded and worth checking out!

52.description: My favorite brunch spot with my girlfriend. Omlettes are amazing and always get a side of the brioche bread. Very friendly staff!

50.description: I guess it all depends on your perception of "heaven" - but there is something quite  heavenly about this place. Excellent service, great food, tea and coffee and I have NEVER had to wait for a table! EVER! Its always busy, especially on the weekend but never seems to be a wait.

4.description: I came in after stopping at the stop light intersection and seeing lots of sweets inside the store. So like a true foodie, I found a parking spot and decided to explore what they had to offer. A Taste of Heaven is actually a restaurant (cafe style) that has a variety of options for sweets. The owner happened to be behind the register and was very sweet. I was craving something creamy and I love whipped cream. When I saw the piece of Chocolate Whipped Cream cake, I knew I couldn't leave without a piece. He said that it was his best cake so I was sold :) The piece of cake was $5.95 and is a good healthy portion that lasted me two days lol. The chocolate layers were not overly sweet - kind of reminded me of German chocolate cake. The whipped cream layers were heavenly and the frosting is nice and sweet for those who like their desserts a little sweeter. I can see why this place has such high ratings and I can't wait to come back and try more!

6.description: While doing some city shopping this weekend, my friends and I were looking for a quick brunch spot and A Taste of Heaven was our first option. With only a 10 minute wait, we decided to stick with it!The place is TINY, that is for sure. There are maybe 15 tables in the whole storefront and tables are packed in. It also didn't help that the thermostat was showing 84 degrees. During our wait, I asked if they had mimosas which they didn't but the waiter pointed to a "liquor store" across the street that I would get champagne to bring in. I was able to take a quick trip for some champagne and come back when the table was ready. The wait staff was super friendly but seemed a little disjointed. It took a while to get some OJ but everything seemed pretty smooth after that. The portions are huge, and the prices are pretty reasonable. I ordered Mike's Pesto Egg Sandwich which was incredible! If I'm in the neighborhood, I would definitely come back from some brunch and mimosas!

22.description: $3.50 for a cup of coffee? Is there gold in it, seriously? Also, got the corned beef hash and felt like crap afterwards; it that was around $13! Overpriced, mediocre; however, I would like to try their grilled cheese: it has three cheeses and I'm a fan of that.

15.description: One of my favorite places in the neighborhood.  Brunch, lunch or coffee with friends it is small and cozy.  I typically go in between busy times so it's not too crowded or loud.  Nothing on the menu has been disappointing, but I tend to gravitate towards the quiche of the day or the lemon butter bars!

57.description: I love their breakfast menu.. Everything made so delicious and fresh.. Workers are so sweet and helpful. They have the best cup cakes ever... They make everything from scratch.. I would recommend to anyone this wonderful place ..

20.description: Taste of Heaven is exactly that. The food is exceptional. I don't understand how the owner can possibly remain thin! It's one of my destination spots when I have out of town guests. I'm generally not a cake eater but all of their cakes are divine. These are seriously solid cakes. The best I've had. I've been a customer since they were located on Foster Ave.

36.description: This place is a hidden gem. Good service, good food, great location and the best lemonade in Chicago.

14.description: I stopped by this place just for desert on the go. I bought a big peanut butter cookie a bit pricey $4! But I must say it was really good it lasted a few days. They offer breakfast and lunch as well including baked goods. Overall ok spot for a snack on the go.

29.description: This is a comfortable little gay bar in Andersonville. It's relatively non-descript, but the staff is super friendly. The crowd was pretty small, which, in my book, is a plus. Like the others, I'm happy to see another gay bar in Andersonville.

42.description: I've been hoping that a gay country bar would open north of Boystown, so Cattle Call is an answer to a frustrated cowgirl's dreams.My friend Sarah and I checked it out on a hot Tuesday night, and had a fantastic experience. The bouncer was super friendly, and made a point of showing us where the ladies' room was so we wouldn't feel like we needed to use the unisex. The lady bartender was sweet, and offered to keep my leftovers behind the bar (for safekeeping, not for nibbling).The music was new and old country, the 15 or so patrons - all male but one woman - were low key and took good advantage of the great dance flloor. I'm not sure what happened with these other female patrons, but my friend and I felt nothing but welcomed and are excited to go back this weekend for Pride.

23.description: LOved it at first, but as i continued to go there - have to say don't like the staff at all (except for the bartender Richard -- he is great). the last night staff is rude. great videos and music and they will play your request but don't think i'll go back ----if you go - call ahead and ask if Richard is working - if he isn't stay home

47.description: Great new bar in Andersonville designed for us gays! Neat interior is very welcoming and the drinks are well poured. I went a couple weeks ago (possibly a soft open) with some friends and the line was out the door. I love this bar in the previous Salvation Army store building. Retro movies and commercials shown on the walls and good music piping throughout the joint! What gay man could ask for more!

8.description: What a great place. I always have a fun time there. The staff is great. Video and dance floor are a added plus. Daily Drink specials. great local hang out and party bar. Drag Factor on Mondays are Fun. Friday Retro Afterwork Videos are a fun way to get started on a great weekend.Check out there monthly Retro Video Dance Party.

31.description: Totally fun bar and crowd.. This is exactly what the hood needs.  Johnny  is the funniest sweetest cutest bartender there.. he totally makes going there a hilarious time... It's like your own personal episode of GLEE...They pour a mean drink and once the dancefloor gets going, it's a BLAST!!

34.description: Went there on a Friday night.  I REALLY wanted to like the bar, but honestly, I won't be going back.1) door person.  why? just to show it's there in the crappy strip mall across from jiffy lube and mcdonalds? ok, fine, but what about getting a visible sign.  That's usually a necessary investment.2) the smell.  Now, I realize it's a brand new bar, however my friend and I were spitting and choking when we came out of the bar.  The smell of rubber and chemicals hurt our throats!  Air that sucker out...3) Staff was OK.  Not unfriendly, but certainly not 'friendly' either.  When it's Friday night and there are 5 people in a new bar, how about trying to make a good impression.4) I would have liked the place much better if it had country music like the name implies.  I guess maybe they do other days in the week and not Fridays, but the club/pop music just wasn't doing it for me.5) Drinks were also OK, a little on the weak side.Hopefully things improve, otherwise this place won't be around much longer.

16.description: Well if you open a new bar in Andersonville I am gonna check it out. Stopped in a couple of Saturdays ago and had an enjoyable time. Two bars for your drinking pleasure and equally nice employees made the afternoon ideal. Good music playing as well as videos. While I am not a country music fan, the music was at an appropriate level which allowed us to reasonably talk to each other. Only open for a few weeks the place is very clean and tidy. I have heard that they do get crowded and although I have not been there late night, I have been told it is very fun. If you have the chance have a drink with Michael the bartender...he is very cool.You should check it out.

13.description: The bars are at opposite sides of the venue. A decent sized dance floor in the middle. Coat checks in the back behind the DJ. They have a capacity of around 200, I think, and they're pretty strict about this. The drinks were horrible -- I didn't really like the martini. It wasn't crisp enough for me. And then the long island iced tea... Bleh. I don't know why I agreed to it. I don't think I'd come here again on my own. It's too far and out of the way for me. But it's an okay GLBT establishment.

11.description: I've been to the call three times and it has yet to really make a good impression.The mixed drinks are so weak. I can't think of a time I've had such a light pour. And the bar always seems to be understaffed, because the bartender has been unable to make my drink properly on a couple ocassions. The first time, I went for a second round on my Jameson, and he said he didn't have time to get a new bottle, so I needed to pick a different whisky. Ok, fine, I went with Makers. Except he charged me the $8 for a Makers drink, not the $7 price of a Jameson. That would have been the typical thing to do, "I'm unable/unwilling to fulfill your request, through no fault of your own, so I'll give you a reasonable replacement at the cost of the item you actually wanted." Nope.Another time, I wanted a second round of martinis, and he told me they'd be in rocks glasses because he didn't have any more martini glasses. I said I could return mine if he liked, and he said no, he didn't have time to wash glasses for me. I might expect this kind of thing at a dive bar, not here. This bartender seems to have no time for anything, obviously he needs some help behind the bar! To me, this all indicates that the owners are struggling to turn a profit and cutting corners wherever possible. That's a mistake, as it effects the experience of their guests and won't make them any more money in the end.The decor is odd, outdated but not enough to be considered cool or retro. Just plain outdated. The mix of music is odd, the grouping of songs doesn't seem to make any sense.This place needs to figure it out. I wouldn't be surprised to learn that the owners have no experience in this industry, as they are making all the wrong moves. I'm not excited to return.

39.description: Cattle Call is one of my new favorite hang-out spots!  I agree the outside does look a bit too much like a strip-mall, but once you get inside, that all melts away.  I've been finding myself there about twice a week!First off, the place is brand-spanking-new, and so far, very well maintained.  There is a lot of room, so you don't get bumped and pushed around all night long; and there are actually comfortable places to sit down for awhile after a few rounds on the dance-floor.Second, the staff has been nothing but completely efficient, competent, and courteous.  Let's be honest, it never hurts to have a bartender recognize you (especially when you tip, as I've watched so many people 'forget' to do), but I have been treated with the same great service from every bartender, including the ones I had not met before.Finally, it's nice to have an Andersonville alternative to Charlie's.  Lets face it, may of the 'boyz' are moving further north these days, and Charlie's isn't what it used to be.  Not to mention, that Cattle Call offers different types of music on the off nights, which makes it a good place to stop in for a drink after dinner on a week night.Now, I've read a couple reviews from women who claim they were escorted out of the bar 'for no reason'...  And, personally, I get very tired (as a gay man) of heterosexual women who think that acting like a complete fool is not only acceptable, but expected in gay bars (then get upset for being asked to leave 'for no reason'!).  I have already witnessed this exact behavior at Cattle Call myself.  Some gay bars (and NOT Cattle Call as far as I'm aware of) have started banning bachelorette parties for this very reason... Guess what: You're not as much fun as you think you are, and we're tired of it!  Grow up and act like an adult!  I have yet to see ANYONE who was acting responsibly removed from the bar at Cattle Call.  I would also like to take the opportunity to point out that the manager of Cattle Call is women!So what would I suggest for improvement?  The place is very long and expansive, and I think that intimidates some people.  People seem to flock to the sides of the bar where there railings and intimate corners; people like to have something to lean up against.  I think maybe finding a way to break up the west side of the space a bit might help.  Perhaps a railing along that side of the dance floor; that would both help prevent people on the sideline from drifting on to the dance floor, and give people a place to put their drink when they go out to dance.  Also, I would turn the music up just a touch.  I TOTALLY appreciate that the lower volume allows for actual conversation, but during the Wednesday Night Drag show, and on Friday and Saturday nights, the volume could be a little bit higher.Ultimately, I think this place has some solid potential and I believe they're still working out some kinks, but I'll keep coming back to see what they come up with next!

37.description: Mark the bartender is totally hot and the BEST mixologist EVAR!

0.description: Some friends and I went here on a Saturday night and when we walked in, we were a little caught off guard.  The bar was empty.  As in no one was there except staff.  Granted, it was about 10:30 on a Saturday night but an empty bar?  Uh.......well we can't blame the bar on that one.The bartender that served us (Miguel?) was really really cool.  He engaged us in conversation, made us laugh, and (in my opinion) served up some pretty decent drinks.  It was $6 Absolut cocktail night, and he introduced me to the Absolut Acai Berry...now I'm hooked!Parking:  Be careful if you park on Ashland; the meters there are keyed until Midnight, and believe it or not we saw some meter people out right up until Midnight.I'll go back again.  Hopefully next time there will be some more people there.

38.description: what a nifty place an UPSCALE bar how fun is thatand a country feelhow tongue in cheekmoo!!!! wowo all fresh and smells so new and cleancan we say huggggggggggggggge  from the hot bartenders to the sexy gals who serve libations to the hot boiy behind the bars and what a nice placethere is a brand new dance floor i had to learn ettiquette so i could disco on the line dance floor what fun then i find out my freind anglique is one of the mngrs and and old freind michael and his partner micheal opened this high end place mike and i used to do musical theatre in the burbs way back when we both had lots of hair....hahahah and angelique as a mngr to over see she is the the new age house/bar momma she runs her house with a stern cattle prod she is the  nicest person in the world i just got to meet the other half micheal he is the other half of cattle call  he is so nice even gave me a free dance lesson to boot and now i hear they are hosting all kinds of community fund raisers too   stop by this place is huge in a a few months  this have the rafter packed tot he ceiling of hot boys and eevn the gals are welcome too nice staff....too yummy martunies too i got snoockered....i cant wait to see one of the new shows on wed nites now i know my gal angelique is the co host alog with miss ashley yahooo put ur boots on......ps they have great videis too

27.description: What happened? This place lost the crowd. They are playing oldies music videos from the 80's and 90's- crowd is really old. They even have employees posting ratings on here. Skip it, go to Big Chicks.

32.description: Cute, clean place in Andersonville. Great staff, great drink specials.Nice to have another gay bar up in Andersonville.

44.description: Very interesting bar for andersonville, i think it could be the sidetrack of andersonville if they play their cards right.  Im not a big fan of country but i like the fact that they play dance music inbetween the country music as well, makes for a nice mix. The staff was friendly and quick but i think the drinks could be a little stronger. i bought 4 vokda 7s and didnt even catch a buzz ( boo on that part) but i think with a little more time and a little more experience under their belt this place could be a gem. A diamond in the rough as they call it.

24.description: I love this place! My new favorite bartender!

7.description: Great charity drag shows the 3rd Saturday of every month! Nice bar with plenty of dance space in an unsuspecting strip mall kind of place. Drinks are pretty expensive though so be prepared to stick with the nightly specials or pay downtown prices for everything else.

40.description: A gorgeous bar with incredible shows and the friendliest staff in Chicago. And best of all, they are truly a part of the community, hosting fundraisers and giving back to local service organizations. A great addition to our community!

30.description: i'm not sure where the name cattle call came from. there was nothing country about the interior, exterior, clientele or the music. hrm... quite probably why they changed the name to just "the call." it was clean and open with two bars; one at either end. there were fairly few people inside even on halloween night, nothing particularly lively going on. we stayed around for the costume contest where we won a 3rd place prize of a $25 pizzeria uno gift certificate and left shortly after. not much else goin' on.

46.description: Well if you open a new bar in Andersonville I am gonna check it out. Stopped in a couple of Saturdays ago and had an enjoyable time. Two bars for your drinking pleasure and equally nice employees made the afternoon ideal. Good music playing as well as videos. While I am not a country music fan, the music was at an appropriate level which allowed us to reasonably talk to each other. Only open for a few weeks the place is very clean and tidy. I have heard that they do get crowded and although I have not been there late night, I have been told it is very fun. If you have the chance have a drink with Michael the bartender...he is very cool.You should check it out.

1.description: Currently at the call. Just watched my friends get a drink while in line for last call. Was denied as I watched my friends get a  drink in front of my face. And I watched him serve someone behind me.  Yay to drink 3 for the night. No wonder they are always dead!!!

9.description: I work seven days a week, so when I finally had a night off, all I wanted to do was go out and see my friend whom I hadn't seen in almost a year. Well, after my friend bailed on me, I wandered the streets of Andersonville alone and upset. I had dinner down the street and could see the the brightly lit sign of The Call...calling to me.It was a Monday night and very not-crowded, and I was immediately happy upon hearing it was request your song and music video Monday. Sitting at the bar, I was the only girl in the joint and the only one without a date or friends, but the bartender was incredibly nice and made a huge, excellent martini for me. The two guys sitting next to me had me request music videos when they couldn't think of a song to pick and everyone there was just super friendly! I will definitely be back, especially because I hear the Monday bartender makes a mean Bloody Mary.

26.description: I came here with a group of friends on a Saturday night and it was not too bad.  There was a good size dance floor.  The bartenders were very friendly, good crowd and the music not too bad either.  I  don't venture too far north, I usually stay in the lake-view area, but this was a decent, nice gay bar in the Andersonville area.

25.description: My new favorite neighborhood bar!  The bartender, Juan, makes great drinks and conversation.  The conversations will keep me coming back for more.  This is definitely a gay bar that doesnt leave me feeling out of place.  Love it!

12.description: It's......fine.  I guess.I have yet to find one bar in Andersonville that I love and it continues after visiting The Call.  We came after a concert on a Saturday night.  We were the only ones in there.  Lame. My vodka Sprite was super weak so I changed to beer so the bartender couldn't skimp me on my drinkin'!Friendly enough though with a tiny dance floor and an ODD mix of music.  I'm not sure what this place is.I'm sure we'll get dragged back in here on some other A-ville occasion and I'll go cause I love my friends.  But damn Andersonville.  No wonder your night scene blows.

21.description: Ok, this did used to be named "Cattle Call." I don't feel so crazy now...for the record it's now shortly referred to as "The Call." It's in the old Salvation Army building near the northern strip of Clark in Aville. I would've preferred a cowboy bar...c'mon!As in, calling all you drunk, dancing maniacs to view music videos (AWESOME) from the 90's and more, while drinking super sweet (and fairly inexpensive) martinis in Andersonville. Oh, and it's a gay bar. And not the crazy bachelorette-magnet sort that resides down in Boystown. This was a pretty chill place to grab a drink. Shirts sort of optional. The martinis ($7 with well liquor, $10 with Absolut) are fairly good...the watermelon (for my friend) and the peach (for me) certainly knocked me on my ass. So, there we go. Beers are about $4, standard. Credit cards accepted, friendly 'tenders, and two bars. We never waited for a drink. The dance floor: right out in the middle. Inhibitions left somewhere strewn between dinner and entrance...Brittany, En Vogue, Madonna, weird other 80's music I am unfamiliar with, MIley Cyrus...and the list goes on. If you want to dance, here you go...ain't no one judgin', and NO creepy dudes to hit on the girls. They aren't interested ladies. It's nice! And as long as everyone's respectful (they all are! bartenders, patrons)...this is one great place to dance, drink and kick back or kick up, or whatever!

17.description: I stopped in here last night (Wednesday) with some friends for their showtunes. We were looking for an alternative to the usual line-up at Sidetrack. Let me just point out that having TWO options where you can drink and watch showtunes at the same time is one of the reasons I love this city. The Call played some videos and tunes that were a little more obscure but still some of my favorites.The bar itself is very appealing - two different bar areas, a large dance floor and plenty of space to spread out. I say plenty of space because the place was pretty much dead. There were probably 10 people there at any given time (including our group of five). This could be a plus if you're looking for a quiet night out somewhere, but for us we were looking to sing loudly and act goofy so we felt a little uncomfortable belting out the tunes. We were also told that the drink special was three dollars off of martinis. We ordered some cosmos and dirties and the drinks were adequately strong and tasty. But the 7.50 price tag after the special didn't seem so special. Especially because there are many other Wednesday  night bar specials elsewhere that would only charge $5. I will come back to The Call sometime soon - hopefully this summer the crowds will increase so those of us who like to sing loudly will be drowned out.

10.description: I love coming here and do as often as I can.  The owners always make you feel welcome.   The drinks are always good and music you can dance to and sing along with.  Highly recommend this place!!!

5.description: I came here recently with some friends for a bachelorette party on a Sat. night. We arrived on the early side--a little after 9--and had the place entirely to ourselves. The space is nice, but that's about the only positive thing I can say. My friend ordered a double Jack and ginger and it cost 14.50! That's just nuts. It would have cost less for her to buy two separate drinks.Sat. night is the Call's video dance party, which sounds fun in theory, but really was not. Considering the fact that we were the only people there and it was clear we were interested in dancing, you would think the DJ would be open to requests, but no. He played a steady stream of undanceable music. Whitney Houston's "I Wanna Dance with Somebody" may be fun to sing along to, but it's not really something you bust a move to on the dance floor.We stayed for maybe an hour and then left to head elsewhere. I don't think any of us will be returning here.

3.description: Great, friendly bar. 9/10 would drink here again. Good music and dancing. Not many people on a Friday night, which is disappointing. Not sure if it's the location, or it gets busier later, but they've got a good vibe and friendly staff.

35.description: MMMMOOOOO! Well that's what i was thinking the place would be like... boring and not much going on. I like the smell of new constriction.... Very nice setup... this place should do well.

19.description: This was the first stop on my Saturday night Andersonville bar-crawl... and I was slightly underwhelmed. Saturday was 'retro' night which would have been cool... if there were more people. The crowd was probably right at a dozen people... drinks were okay, though. The bar can be a nice place, spacious with the dance floor. Is there a better night to go??Update: Showtunes night on Wednesdays.

28.description: The bars are at opposite sides of the venue. A decent sized dance floor in the middle. Coat checks in the back behind the DJ. They have a capacity of around 200, I think, and they're pretty strict about this. The drinks were horrible -- I didn't really like the martini. It wasn't crisp enough for me. And then the long island iced tea... Bleh. I don't know why I agreed to it. I don't think I'd come here again on my own. It's too far and out of the way for me. But it's an okay GLBT establishment.

45.description: You gotta love new construction. Cattle Call still has that new bar smell.I stopped by on a Saturday afternoon for some midday drinking. This place is huge! It's on the short stretch of Bryn Mawr between Clark and Ashland, in what used to be the Salvation Army store. Well, there's nothing used about this bar. If you don't believe me, the construction photos on their website offer proof. And rumor has it that once they get the licensing, they plan to open a patio and a rooftop deck.There are two bars at opposite ends of the large room, which mirror each other. Between them is a good-sized dance floor, which is wide and open for all your two-steppin' needs. I assume this is where the drag performers strut their stuff as well. That's right kids, on Weds nights the Cattle Call Revue hits the stage, presenting shows that run the gamut from "The Best of Stage and Screen" and "Highlights of Stage and Screen" to "Fabulous Moments from Stage and Screen." I kid because I love. And what would a country bar be without a drag show? In addition to country and drag, there are videos, videos, videos, on a plethora of screens behind the bars, as well as a big-ass screen behind the dance floor. On Saturday, they were showing mostly 80s stuff, which was fine with me.I didn't see it in full swing on my one visit, but overall, it seems like a comfortable place to grab a drink and hang with friends. There's nothing about the place that really says "country" -- no Dolly Parton posters or longhorns on the wall -- but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The staff is fun and accommodating, though that isn't tough when you're the only guest. I'm looking forward to going back.

33.description: I guess I'll join those in the I-don't-get-it category.  Having heard a lot of hype about this place, I stopped in last night (a Thursday) around midnight.  My observations, for my brief visit:a. strange location (in a brand-new strip mall that replaced my nasty old Salvation Army), and if I weren't looking for it, probably would have walked right by.b. Odd layout....you kinda walk into the dance floor, then have to climb up this weird maze-like ramp thing to get up to the bar.  A lil silly, considering the size of the space.c. there were MAYBE ten customers (again, this was Thursday night, before a holiday weekend, around midnight), butd. they had a doorman and TWO bartenders (both of whom were in their 20s)....overstaffed much?  One of the two bartenders couldn't card any of the 40 year-olds?e. no C/W music....this was supposed to be a C/W bar, no?f. laughable prices....my shot of Cuervo and bottle of Miller Lite was, I think, $10.50, a lil steep.  Then I noticed one of their 'specials' on a future night would be SIX DOLLAR (??) Amstel Light bottles.  Wow, that should really pack 'em in.If this place is losing money, it's not surprising:  A-ville doesn't exactly have a shortage of gay bars at this point (and this one's a little off the beaten path), and raising prices isn't gonna help.  I'll give this place another chance, I guess, so three stars for now (my visit deserved two).

43.description: This place has a lot working against it, IMHO.First, the name is... well, it's ridiculous.  Coupled with the "moo" on the sign, you may expect to find peanuts on the floor as though you're going to one of those strange, midwestern faux-Western chain steakhouses.The other poor item of note is the location.  Frankly, it looks like it's in a strip mall-- a type of place I'm trying to forget after leaving the world of them.All this being said, I still retain a 3-star rating because this place has potential.  The service was excellent (truly) and the ambience inside wonderful.  The name just doesn't match it.  Lots of TV screens playing RIDICULOUS old music videos gave us lots to laugh at as we had a few drinks.Also... this place is IMMACULATE.  Good god.I hope CC will make the few changes it needs to be a unique spot in AVille.

2.description: OMG. Service is so bad. Loosen up the purse strings and hire some bartenders. 15 min to order a drink is ridiculous.

18.description: We just love the Call!  A great mixed crowd of both guys and girls and a nice age range of 25 and older.  We have never been here without making new friends.  A casual warm place that outside of running a bit pricey and no kickbacks - this was the way it wasPresent day:One update here....too bad for you if you are a woman after 6pm or 7pm on the weekend as the bartenders are only interested in serving the men.  My girl cash is good everywhere, no sweat Call.  BTW you are in Andersenville, Boystown is a few miles south.

41.description: How gorgeous!  I too was hesitant about a bar named "Cattle Call" but do NOT let the name fool you!  Fabulous decor, clean as a whistle, very friendly staff, great music and videos, good drinks, drag shows, LOTS of handsome men (not the twinks and ghetto you get in Boystown) dancing, country to pop, easy to find parking, and a mere walk from the Bryn Mawr Redline or the #22 Clark bus drops you off at the door.... I predict this will be the HOTTEST place in Aville very soon!  For those that have stated they had a negative experience, please give them another try.. it will be well worth it....

4.description: For being a bar in the city, it's fairly decent in size.  It has two bars which is separated by 'the largest dance floor in Andersonville"; which isn't really saying much in comparison to bars in the burbs.  That being said, there is no reason you can't dance anywhere in the bar.The music was pretty good with mixes and mashups I personally have not heard before.  They sounded fresh and exciting and had me plenty sweaty by the end of the evening.  The DJs did an OK job playing what the club would thrive on, but a good bit of time the floors remained empty, which I would say more has to do with the bars locations than anything else (off the beaten path)The bar itself is cute enough, but if you're looking for the cute twinks or muscle hunks, you are in the wrong place.  Obviously there's nothing wrong with those who do attend the bar frequently ("It's my hot body, I'll do what I want" #BornThisWay); but you won't find much more than a 'cub' among the crowd of bears and lesbians.Would I venture here again?  Yes, but I wouldn't make it a point to drive the city to visit this particular club.  So Gather a group of friends and make an evening of dining at one of Andersonville's awesome restaurants, do a little shopping in their cute boutiques, then hit up the club to close our the night.

6.description: Ok, this did used to be named "Cattle Call." I don't feel so crazy now...for the record it's now shortly referred to as "The Call." It's in the old Salvation Army building near the northern strip of Clark in Aville. I would've preferred a cowboy bar...c'mon!As in, calling all you drunk, dancing maniacs to view music videos (AWESOME) from the 90's and more, while drinking super sweet (and fairly inexpensive) martinis in Andersonville. Oh, and it's a gay bar. And not the crazy bachelorette-magnet sort that resides down in Boystown. This was a pretty chill place to grab a drink. Shirts sort of optional. The martinis ($7 with well liquor, $10 with Absolut) are fairly good...the watermelon (for my friend) and the peach (for me) certainly knocked me on my ass. So, there we go. Beers are about $4, standard. Credit cards accepted, friendly 'tenders, and two bars. We never waited for a drink. The dance floor: right out in the middle. Inhibitions left somewhere strewn between dinner and entrance...Brittany, En Vogue, Madonna, weird other 80's music I am unfamiliar with, MIley Cyrus...and the list goes on. If you want to dance, here you go...ain't no one judgin', and NO creepy dudes to hit on the girls. They aren't interested ladies. It's nice! And as long as everyone's respectful (they all are! bartenders, patrons)...this is one great place to dance, drink and kick back or kick up, or whatever!

22.description: Glad this place is in the 'hood. See, this is why we love living in Andersonville. It doesn't matter who you're into. Come here, pull up a barstool, order a chilly beverage from a very warm and friendly bartender, munch on a hot dog and just hang out. Maybe dance. Dish and flirt. Come sit by me and my girls!

15.description: Great bar in Andersonville has a wonderful staff nice and friendly. Has a little bit of everything that the Boystown bars offer all in one place. Videos, dance floor, drag shows. How could you not go wrong. The Call is the place to be.

20.description: Andersonville's newest and lamest gay bar. Sorry to be a Negative Nancy, but this place is dull. It's a beautiful, modern space with a lot of potential but my sense on is that whoever runs it doesn't really know what to do with it. I guess it started out as a country western bar, but quickly changed into it's current incarnation. I never thought there could be a gay bar more boring than Atmosphere.

36.description: Yippe Yi Yo K-Y!!This is gay cowboy heaven.Only, I'm not a cowboy.I decided to finally investigate this bar, as it was close to my flat.I have to say first off, that the interior is fantastic.  The space is well planned, very comfy seats, great bars, and ample places to put your drinky.On the flat screen TV's (which are everywhere) there were country western videos playing, and loud country western music that went with the videos.  There were men dancing two step, and as the music changed a bunch of cowboys line danced.Perhaps it was because it was a Saturday night - but even in my flip flops and khaki shorts, I didn't feel out of place.  The guys here were probably the nicest bunch of guys I've encountered in a gay bar.  It was my own self conciousness that made me decide to leave.  I could have probably learned how to cowboy dance had I stayed.The drink prices were reasonable, and the bathrooms were totally immaculate.  I left around 1030...and it was just starting to fill up.I left this bar, and headed for Mary's Attic.Overall, a great addition to the neighborhood.  Now homos don't have to go all the way to Charlies to crack out their Stetsons and snakeskin cowboy boots.

14.description: You gotta love new construction. Cattle Call still has that new bar smell.I stopped by on a Saturday afternoon for some midday drinking. This place is huge! It's on the short stretch of Bryn Mawr between Clark and Ashland, in what used to be the Salvation Army store. Well, there's nothing used about this bar. If you don't believe me, the construction photos on their website offer proof. And rumor has it that once they get the licensing, they plan to open a patio and a rooftop deck.There are two bars at opposite ends of the large room, which mirror each other. Between them is a good-sized dance floor, which is wide and open for all your two-steppin' needs. I assume this is where the drag performers strut their stuff as well. That's right kids, on Weds nights the Cattle Call Revue hits the stage, presenting shows that run the gamut from "The Best of Stage and Screen" and "Highlights of Stage and Screen" to "Fabulous Moments from Stage and Screen." I kid because I love. And what would a country bar be without a drag show? In addition to country and drag, there are videos, videos, videos, on a plethora of screens behind the bars, as well as a big-ass screen behind the dance floor. On Saturday, they were showing mostly 80s stuff, which was fine with me.I didn't see it in full swing on my one visit, but overall, it seems like a comfortable place to grab a drink and hang with friends. There's nothing about the place that really says "country" -- no Dolly Parton posters or longhorns on the wall -- but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The staff is fun and accommodating, though that isn't tough when you're the only guest. I'm looking forward to going back.

58.description: Love this place.  We've eaten here several times and have never been disappointed -can't figure out why it's not busier.  The bacon wrapped dates, shopska salad, lamb chops, scallops, and roasted potatoes are some of the best we've ever had.  The outdoor space is a wonderful spot to sit and sip a glass of wine and enjoy the evening breeze.  Great staff and service.   Give it a try - you'll keep coming back.

56.description: Loved the service , food was awesome and the atmosphere was great.Will be going back in the future.

29.description: I have been here a few times now, and this is one of my favorite spots in Andersonville! The food is always delicious, service is exceptional, and drinks are strong and full of flavor! (They even grow their own mint!) Go there and sit in the back by the water. After you have taken the tranquil greenery in, you need to get the ginger mojito and spinach gnocchi appetizer. You will love it and you are welcome!

42.description: Overall this place is okay, but not worth the price point. They use char from the grill as their seasoning, and literally no salt or pepper, so expect most of the food to be bland.  Especially the grilled calamari and kabobs.  But the char is wonderful if they would just season the food, it would be closer to the price point. Lastly, under our scallops there was an 'apricot chutney' that tasted like it came out of a can. Pure corn syrup. The cucumber and tomato salad that comes with the kabob dish was delicious though!We sat outside, which was nice, however there are too many vines so it can be a bit buggy. Also, the tables were kinda awkward to eat on.If you are in the mood for underseasoned, overpriced food with a nice char, this is your place!!

23.description: I am Adriatic having the most wonderful, humane experience with my dog. I am so thrilled to find a lovely haven oasis of good food like the salmon crepes and antipasti, and good people with good attitudes about good dogs. This place is SO IMPORTANT and SO SPECIAL because people can come here with a dog and not have to "out themselves" as having a disability. What a relief! Thank you!!

47.description: The food in this establishment deserves 5 plus stars. It is so amazing. Very Mediterranean but with a contemporary twist. Our server was Adam. He had such a fun sense of humor. Was honest about what he liked and didnt like and what was popular. Very good with suggestions. I got the Adriatic chicken, which had bacon inside and was served with roasted mushrooms and peppers and 2 good size pieces of breaded kackavall cheese and my friend ordered the scallops which came with squash and spinach. I was such a pig I ate the whole thing. The one thing I didn't care for was the clientele. What is it about Europeans and not disciplining their kids. They are running around the restaurant, being loud and throwing tantrums. It really puts a damper on the atmosphere of the place. If it wasn't for that this place would get 5 stars.

8.description: I went against my instincts and half-heartedly entered this restaurant.
