The merchandise is really interesting and if you are looking for anything having to do with taxidermy this is your place.  Skulls, stuffed giraffes, bear rugs, bottles with snakes/sharks etc in formaldehyde......Beyond this, there are other really interesting oddities.  The owner was super nice and helped us find other GREAT shops in the area.    He was super chatty and made some suggestions about what we were buying too.  This is a small shop and you will be a bit eeked out at some of the merchandise, but all in all it is an experience.

36.description: Ok update, in a good way. I've been in here many more times and have picked up some truly unique and fantastic stuff. I have to up it another star for how wonderful and cool the couple are who own this place. They have all the strange things nightmares are made of, I have not seen it's equal in all my antique hunting.

14.description: I love this place even more now that they host taxidermy classes through The Detroit Academy of Taxidermy! I wish there was a Yelp listing for that. Anyway, it was a really interesting and fun class that I'd love to take again. Woolly Mammoth was the perfect spot for this since you could admire their taxidermy pieces and be inspired.

29.description: Absolutely my favorite yarn store. I've been visiting this store for over a year and a half and every single time I stop in the experience is no less than completely delightful. I'm from Cleveland, but I always make a point to stop in when I visit Chicago because the selection is just fantastic, not only in brands, but in range (few stores in my city carry more than one type of laceweight yarn). The store layout is open and airy and filled with natural light, and there are swatches of the yarns laid out below the displays. Sample projects are placed throughout the store-- including plenty of shawls in popular patterns kept on the chairs (spotted a Color Affection and a Hitchhiker on this visit) so you can pick them up and get a better idea of what your own project would look like. A lot of thought has been put into this store and it really shows. There's always a tablet in the middle of the store in a little seating area for looking up patterns-- such a great, functional detail. Prices are always clearly marked on the yarn and there's a great selection of instructional books and pattern collections. I've never had any trouble finding a specific yarn here-- it is always clean and organized. The store is pretty small, but the space is utilized so effectively that Windy Knitty manages to display a better selection than I've seen in yarn stores with twice the space.I can't finish this review without talking about Mandy, the owner. She is always incredibly helpful and gracious and her memory is remarkable! I doubt I get a chance to visit her store as much as most of her repeat customers, but even from the second visit she could recall that I was out of town and what yarn I've purchased or played with in the past. While I was browsing today, she stopped me to ask if I've seen new colors in a brand and weight that I purchased months and months ago-- I hadn't, so she took the time to pull the new colorways down from the shelf so I could take a look. She also didn't balk at winding the lace I'd picked up (I've been to many stores where employees groan at winding yarn), and explained it would just take a few minutes longer than usual since there was so much yardage. Regardless of the (awesome) selection, Mandy's amazing customer service will keep me shopping here whenever I'm in town.

42.description: This place has great yarn, and the owner is very nice and down-to-earth. There are a lot of brands here that I only see the on the internet so it's awesome to be able to actually touch and see the colors in life. The owner provides great service - she greets me, lets me know I can ask her any questions, then lets me browse in peace. Last time I went I hadn't been in a while but she seemed to remember me and we had a nice chat while she rung me up. The space is open yet full of yarn. My only wish is that the shelves weren't so high - some yarns I can't get to easily. Still, this is my favorite yarn store in Chicago. I always know I'll be able to find something inspiring.

23.description: I had some extra time on my schedule and thought I would hop the red line to Andersonville from the city. It was worth it.  Brent not only showed me to yarns I was looking for but he spent the time with me to educate me about any product I was interested in while throwing in a few laughs.  I wish I had brought my crochet project so I could stitch and chat more.  I am new to crochet so he was happy to answer all of my novice questions.  I would highly recommend this store for  artists.  I will definitely be a returning customer and send my friends there.  It is such a happy place!

47.description: This store is beautiful, comfortable, clean and organized. I walked in to check it out and walked out with Madelinetosh Lace.The owner is very helpful. She also has an ipad set up so that we customers can look up that pattern in our ravelry queue in case we forgot how many yards we need. I'm so happy there are new yarn stores in the area now that Arcadia is closed.

8.description: I really want to love Windy Knitty since it's the closest yarn shop to my house, but I've been really disappointed the last few months. The first issue was when I began knitting a pattern that was on display in the shop, ran into an issue, and came in to ask a question and was totally dismissed by the guy who had knitted the sample. He told me just to rip it out and start over. Look guys, I want to support my LYS, but it IS cheaper just to purchase yarn online, so if I can't come in and ask a simple question as a paying customer, what's the point? Secondly, and most frustratingly, three times, my balls of yarn that have been wound here have ended up containing a rat's nest of yarn in the middle, to be painstakingly and maddeningly detangled later when I'm halfway through a project. Simply, life is too short to be detangling yarn, so I'll be taking my business elsewhere.

31.description: It's hard to find a quality knitting place in the city that also has the space to showcase a wide variety of yarns and supplies.  Windy Knitty accomplishes this with the friendliness of a high quality local neighborhood vibe (even the customers we ran into were sweet, which I attribute to the open, airy vibe).  In particular, there were lots of cute gift ideas (packaged projects w/ matching nail polish, and intricate accessories) that I know I'll be back to peruse come Christmas/Birthday time.Visited with my friend, who is a choosy hardcore knitter, and there were no complaints to be had.  We purchased two books and a couple skeins of yarn (had to hold back on the Lorna's Laces and Madeline Tosh of course).  Looking forward to making the trip up to Andersonville again soon. Btw, we've been to 8+ various knitting stores (Chicago, Western Suburbs, Champaign) so have seen a lot out there.Btw, there's also a cute garden store and tasty Greek restaurant nearby, in case you make a half-day out of it.  Easy free street parking found right around the corner off the main streets.

34.description: Windy Knitty is one of the more beautifully organized knitting stores I have visited. The store is wide open and airy and yarns are displayed in shelves reaching up to the ceiling, organized by weight... In other words, knitter heaven!! I stopped in on a visit to Chicago, so I am not a regular. As far as I can tell, the store carries mostly higher end brands at average retail prices for those brands, but I was able to find Cascade 220 and Berrocco among the madeline.tosh and Debbie Bliss. The owner was very friendly and welcoming, and the store seems to be a wonderful place to just sit and work on a project. I recommend stopping in if you're ever in Chi-town, and hopefully I can make it back here someday.

16.description: I really want to give this yarn shop 5 stars. Here's what's AMAZING: locally-owned, in my neighborhood, good/solid selection, beautiful displays, excellent samples, spacious. I am quite glad this shop is in my neighborhood. I have a pretty good place to walk to when I need a yarn-fix, notion or just to browse. Staff is knowledgeable.What I don't like is the snobby, off-putting staff member. He happens to be male. I have NOTHING against male knitters, in fact, I love love love them. (I know many male knitters that get bad raps.) Anyway, this guy is so unfriendly. He has been so to me in person and over the phone. I don't understand what gives. Perhaps this is a Chicago thing...when I first moved here, I had trouble finding places that offered good customer service. I feel like I'm interrupting his knitting time or something when I have a question. Yikes, guy, the owner is paying you to help her customers, not for you to just sit there and knit. I used to work at a yarn shop in another city and I would have been fired if I had treated customers in the same way. Perhaps the novelty of having a male knitter work in the store allows him to get away with it.I like this store enough to either avoid him or just ignore his attitude problem. Other staff members are super-nice and extremely friendly.

13.description: I've been here twice and both times I've had a good experience. They had a wide selection of needles, yarn, and samples of patterns to peruse.I went in today to get a wool wash so I could block the shawl that I just finished knitting, and I ended up talking to the employee working who spent fifteen minutes with me guiding me through my next pattern. I was going to use one pattern for a hat, but when we went through reading the pattern together, she suggested that I either use different yarn or find a new pattern. She showed me a similar pattern on their computer on ravelry, as well as a sample in the store. I like the ambiance and selection of items here. I would highly recommend this shop.

11.description: 5 wooly stars.  Yarny Yarny blissful yarn.  Very good selection of yarns.  Very helpful ladies running this place. Patterns, needles, kits and yarn.  What more do you need?????

39.description: It's been a year and I can still say that this store rocks. They continue to have a huge selection of yarns in a large variety of colors. Recently I needed Cascade 220 in colors to match my existing stash for a project. They had a huge selection of complimentary colors to choose from.The atmosphere is still relaxed and friendly, the staff knowledgeable. They carry a lot of interesting brands of yarn. My favorites are Malabrigo, Three Irish Girls, Dream in Color, Madeline Tosh, and Fleur de Fiber.

37.description: This is my favorite yarn store in Chicago. I love it! Their selection is great, and their staff is so helpful. They really go out of their way to help you out. The store is easy to browse or to go grab exactly what you want, and the atmosphere is really pleasant.

0.description: To me, a yarn store is no good unless the staff is friendly and knowledgeable about yarn, and knows at least a little bit about knitting, crocheting, gauge, et cetera. (Ever been to one of those shops where the people who work there just sit on a couch working on a project, acting like you're intruding?) Windy Knitty carries a wide selection of yarn that's budget-minded, all the way to the high-end stuff. There are also classes and drop-in knit sessions. When I first moved to Chicago, I had such a nice interaction with the staff at the store, one of whom not only recommended an apartment in her building, and the other of whom walked me part way to my El station. Again, this is when I was new in Chicago! I emphasize the friendliest factor because anyone who has frequented a lot of yarn stores appreciates the difference between the snooty places where you feel dumb asking any questions  and the places where the staff is willing to help.Let's please support our local stores where the staff can give advice and help you learn how to knit or crochet, as opposed to the big-box stores selling the low-end stuff and whose staff can't really answer your questions.Windy Knitty is officially my favorite yarn store in Chicago!

38.description: I first came into Windy Knitty just after their grand opening last year (2011) and loved the store. The design of it, the way the yarns are showed off, everything was great. And the yarns? OMG, the yarns. Mandy has TONS of stock and options for everything you're looking for, and it goes from extremely reasonably priced (great for kids projects or big sweaters) to the super swanky, high end stuff that is all hand dyed and hand spun and makes you want to immediately start projects and never stop.Since I first went into the store, I've visited MANY times. Every time, I've walked out with something more than I went in for (always the sign of a good store). But what makes this a great store over a good yarn store is the people -- Mandy rocks. She knows her yarn, knows her customers and somehow knows exactly what to carry to make everyone happy. Her assistants are great and give you advice on what you're looking at, will tell you if the color you're trying out isn't quite for you, and they know their yarn materials and can make awesome suggestions for how to match something to a pre-selected pattern. I hope that this store will always be there because it's a beautiful addition to Andersonville, is within walking distance of my house (probably the most dangerous part) and is a haven for knitters and creative people.  If you're looking for a great store to buy yarn, knitting and crocheting accoutrements, stop in. You will not regret it.

51.description: I stopped in at this new knit shop today for their official grand opening and was pleasantly surprised to have stumbled into what can best be described as a yarn party.  YAY!   The owner was there answering questions and making sure everyone was finding everything they needed.  Everyone who was working there seemed super friendly.  They have a very good selection of different yarns at different price points.  My very unscientific eye-balling of the price tags revealed that their prices are comparable to what you would find online, with many skeins marked lower in price than what I've seen at other Chicago yarn shops.  Lace weight, DK, super chunky- I saw pretty, pretty yarn in all different weights.  I'm thrilled that they stock Three Irish Girls yarn, as no other yarn shops in Illinois have it.  They also carry a line that is made right here in Chicago.  I picked up a gorgeous skein of Fleur de Fiber sock yarn, which I had never seen before, and then literally bumped into the lady who hand dyes it in her home, not far from Windy Knitty.  Love it!  My only critique would be that they have so much yarn stacked on their cubby-style shelves that I felt bad digging to get at the different colorways that I could see layered under the ones on top. But really, that's not such a bad thing.   They offer classes, there's space to sit and room to browse without bumping into people, and I saw books, patterns, needles and other knitting notions for sale.  Plus their name is pun-tastically awesome.  This is a nice shop, and I'm sure I will be making trips here to ogle and buy the pretty yarn, even though I live on the opposite side of the city.

27.description: Worth the trek from Wicker Park. Cute and friendly, huge selection, lovely people.

32.description: The Windy Knitty is awesome and Tara was so helpful, authentic, and kind! I paid the store a visit because I was looking for some really unique buttons to update my winter coat. They have a fantastic selection of well priced, artful buttons. Looking forward to building upon my experience by taking a beginner's knitting class this autumn! Great atmosphere, brilliant display, and fantastic proprietor.

48.description: A lovely store, with great classes! I took Amy's sock knitting class, and am now the proud wearer of an actual pair of completed socks. This is very thrilling for me, a serial project-starter and an infrequent project-finisher. The steps were broken up well across the classes and Amy is fabulously patient. She also provided a lot of tips for ways to fix the mistakes that I am so creative in coming up with. Can't wait to go buy more yarn!

44.description: Super happy there's such a cute yarn store in Andersonville! The owner was very nice while we were browsing around and they carry a fair amount of cotton or bamboo yarn, which makes me super happy because wool makes me itchy. I can't WAIT to knit a billion cute things for my brother and sister-in-law's new baby!

24.description: I really want to give this yarn shop 5 stars. Here's what's AMAZING: locally-owned, in my neighborhood, good/solid selection, beautiful displays, excellent samples, spacious. I am quite glad this shop is in my neighborhood. I have a pretty good place to walk to when I need a yarn-fix, notion or just to browse. Staff is knowledgeable.What I don't like is the snobby, off-putting staff member. He happens to be male. I have NOTHING against male knitters, in fact, I love love love them. (I know many male knitters that get bad raps.) Anyway, this guy is so unfriendly. He has been so to me in person and over the phone. I don't understand what gives. Perhaps this is a Chicago thing...when I first moved here, I had trouble finding places that offered good customer service. I feel like I'm interrupting his knitting time or something when I have a question. Yikes, guy, the owner is paying you to help her customers, not for you to just sit there and knit. I used to work at a yarn shop in another city and I would have been fired if I had treated customers in the same way. Perhaps the novelty of having a male knitter work in the store allows him to get away with it.I like this store enough to either avoid him or just ignore his attitude problem. Other staff members are super-nice and extremely friendly.

7.description: Love finding local yarn shops on my explorations, and Windy Knitty is a gem. They stock a wide variety of gorgeous yarns at a wide range of prices. Lots of patterns, needles, and accessories too. The sales associate was friendly and helpful, but also just let me browse and wander at whim. As a veteran knitter (over 20 years), I appreciate a thoughtful, well lit, well organized store, and Windy Knitty gets it all right.

49.description: This store rocks!  Such a great selection of yarns, friendly and helpful owner, and an excellent selection of knitting books.  Knitters and non-knitters must pay a visit!

40.description: Fabulous yarn shop in Edgewater/Andersonville!  I can't believe that it took me so long to discover that it was there.  Most of the yarn here is hand dyed and all of it is beautiful.  The space is large, uncluttered and the yarn is organized by gauge.  The staff was helpful without being overbearing.  Can't recommend highly enough!

30.description: Bright, spacious, colorful shop, good selection of quality yarns, helpful and knowledgeable staff, moderate pricing. Unlike many small yarn stores in which the owners seem bent on carrying tons of unusual, exotic, and novelty yarns no one has ever heard of or can afford to regularly use, this shop has some good mid-range products, including lots of the usual go-to brands, like Berrocco and Cascade. Worth a look.

46.description: What a nice shop this is! They have a good selection of yarns, displayed beautifully. I love the two glass topped tables with the hilarious paintings on the canvas. I planned an afternoon around this shop, and I was not disappointed. The owner is very friendly and she had several books I have not seen elsewhere.

1.description: The owner, Mandy, totally grasps customer service and is very good to interact with; she will offer value-added info, website suggestions, etc.  Not exactly sure about how she chooses the other staff; I've encountered a new woman on weekdays and she seems kind of frosty and defensive (or overwhelmed) in interactions. Reading some of these other reviews, looks like some other staff stuff going on, too. I think Mandy needs to look at how she chooses/trains staff.  Good yarn selection, lots of fun stuff.  People do really want warm, with-it staff to interact with and in a boutique atmosphere they will go elsewhere. Knitting is meant to be a relaxing, fun experience-- including the store.

9.description: I love these guys! Excellent, well-curated and -priced selection of sumptuous yarns and --even better-- EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE. For some reason, people skills can be in short supply in a lot of yarn stores, but that is not the case here, and to that I say HOORAY. You CAN be nice and sell pretty yarns. These folks are proof. I knit a lot, and they get all my business.

26.description: A friend and I just completed the beginning knitting class. It's once a week for four weeks. They give you metal needles and some nice yarn and teach you basic skills. We learned to cast on, cast off, knit, purl, read a basic pattern, do increases, decreases and gained confidence with every step. Our teacher, Grace, was smart, patient, funny and very supportive. I'm looking forward to taking a round needle class there and hope to come back again and again. Thank you Grace, and Windy Knitty, for such a great experience.

25.description: Windy Knitty is great! I almost get overwhelmed because the yarn selection goes up to the ceiling. But the staff has always been very helpful in finding me the correct yarn for my projects.They have a great selection: along with some smaller indie labels, they have staples like Cascade and Berroco. I took a class there with Jill and we had a great time. She's an excellent teacher and we have the same sense of humor. Mandy, the owner, is friendly and helpful without being overbearing.  It's a great lace to spend your fiber dollars.

12.description: I stopped here after brunch with a friend and he willingly went in with me and didn't seem tortured by the experience. I loved this shop. I liked that parking was easy, the staff was nice without being annoying, and they had an awesome selection of yarn. I'm sort of on a yarn diet but was traveling for work and needed to get yarn for a class I'm taking, and they had lots of options here. I didn't ask for help but I saw them helping others and they were very knowledgeable and helpful without being annoying (I hate it when you ask one question and then have a salesperson attached to your side until you leave). I love that they have spud and chloe, malabrigo, and neighborhood fiber co., which is what I bought. Also, the lighting in here was awesome--I don't understand yarn stores that have dim lighting, how do they expect us to SEE the colors like that?? I've started to be picky about that in my old age. Overall, great store.

21.description: Windy Knitty was my first Chicago local yarn store experience and I have to say it didn't disappoint.  The store is bright and colorful and has more yarn than I've ever seen in one place.  It also seems as if Windy Knitty has done a very good job in cultivating a strong community of loyal clients.  Since I'm both a fairly novice knitter and a very poor grad student, most of their incredible selection was out of my budget, but I will definitely be returning here to buy a special skein or two every now and then.

17.description: Cute place, nice staff and lots of events. They even have knitting classes here.

10.description: Just love. I learned to knit here two years ago and I've been knitting ever since. Yes, online yarn shopping can be a bit cheaper and I've even checked out other local knitting stores. But even if Windy Knitty wasn't my closest knitting store, I would keep shopping here because I've always felt welcomed and the store is well-stocked, CLEAN as a whistle, and competitively priced.And, of course, I've received lots of expert advice from Tara and Grace. These are people with wool in their blood and they happily share their time, care, and advice!Apologies in advance for feeding your knitting addiction and your stash. You'll thank me later.

5.description: Windy Knitty is the best yarn shop in the city. The staff is so friendly and they really know their stuff. They're super helpful when it comes to picking out colors and figuring what yarn would work best for a project. They have a vast selection of yarns, all ethically sourced and reasonably priced. So many beautiful colors! They also have a great selection of books, tools (hooks, needles, buttons, etc) and everything else you might need to complete your project.They also offer a number of crochet and knitting classes, which are super awesome. I've taken a few and learned so much! Jill is an awesome crochet teacher! :)

3.description: I travel a lot and go to yarn stores wherever I land, and this is one of my favorites! Sometimes yarn stores can be a little too upscale fancy in the brands that they carry but this was not the case at Knitty City. It's beautifully curated for the trendy city knitter, and they carry everything from basics like Cascade to niche faves like Brooklyn Tweed and Mad Tosh. The must like color because the color selection was awesome. There aren't too many sample garments, but they do have a lot of swatches to help see how the yarns knit up.

35.description: Great shop!!!  Trouble is, I don't have the time to learn how to knit in time for XMas (which is what I'd set out to do).  Anyone out there who'd be willing to knit a hat or two for me (or as many as you can get out of one skein) for hire?  Nothing special--just your basic hat.  Should be easy money for all those more gifted and more dedicated to knitting than I am c. December 2011!!!

19.description: I have tried my best, but I give up. Although this store has a great selection, the staff muck it up. I went here recently to find a specific yarn I needed to complete a project and the guy was totally unhelpful and dismissive, with just a touch of rude. Sifu here I come...

28.description: I have tried my best, but I give up. Although this store has a great selection, the staff muck it up. I went here recently to find a specific yarn I needed to complete a project and the guy was totally unhelpful and dismissive, with just a touch of rude. Sifu here I come...

45.description: I'm so happy there's a new yarn shop in my area. The owner is very nice and stocks a great selection of yarn, including lovely hand-dyed yarns that I love so much!

33.description: I have been taking Crochet classes here with Jill for the past couple of months and I love it!Jill is wonderful and patient and extremely talented. The store has an enormous variety to offer and both Brent and Mandy are always happy to help.

43.description: This store is great and has an excellent selection. Their prices are lower than most yarn stores and the customer service is excellent. I spoke with one of the people that worked there, and I told them about the project I had in mind. Not only did she pull out a swatch book so I could see what could work, she also offered to order yarn that she didn't have in stock. I will probably come back on a regular basis.

2.description: I love Windy Knitty so hard. It's on my way home. Which is full of win. I also love the selection that they have. I find myself walking around, fondling yarn, looking at tags and thinking to myself, " AHHHH! So this is what all the fuss is about with *insertpopularyarncompanynamehere*! It's where my mom wants to go look at yarn when she is in town. And she always finds something to buy. I have always had good experiences with the staff there too. I had a friend visiting from the UK. She also loved Windy Knitty. And loved it even more after we had gone down to the South Loop to yarn shop. That was super sad and super disappointing. Said friend was quite glad that she had purchased yarn at Windy Knitty. Oh and I don't know if they still charge a dollar to wind skeins that you don't buy there, as stated in another review, but I fully support their decision to do so. Seriously? You bring in yarn from another store, or worse, that you bought online, and you want them to wind it for you for free? NO. Just. NO.

18.description: Windy Knitty is great! I almost get overwhelmed because the yarn selection goes up to the ceiling. But the staff has always been very helpful in finding me the correct yarn for my projects.They have a great selection: along with some smaller indie labels, they have staples like Cascade and Berroco. I took a class there with Jill and we had a great time. She's an excellent teacher and we have the same sense of humor. Mandy, the owner, is friendly and helpful without being overbearing.  It's a great lace to spend your fiber dollars.

41.description: This place is better each time.  I've been trying to locate a particular Malabrigo yarn in a very particular colour and shade and Mandy, the owner, actually had it in a recent shipment.  She let me know, and now I'll be able to knit the exact scarf that a friend of mine wants (much longer story).  I really like the uncluttered and unfussy interior and attitudes here, and I have to force myself to not spend all my disposable income on yarn and notions.  Everything is arranged so that you can see the yarn clearly, and they're good about working with your price range. Like the decor, the folks who work here are smart and efficient, and don't make promises they can't keep - Mandy was really good about cautioning me about not expecting a lot colour to be exactly the same as I had back home.  This will definitely be my definitely Local Yarn Store of choice.

50.description: I just love it here! This is honestly one of the most lovely yarn stores I have been in for quite some time. It is spacious and brightly lit with more yarn than you could shake your KnitPicks interchangeables at.The amount of space Mandy has devoted to encouraging knitters to sit a spell while knitting is amazing. The space is very well thought out and designed.You will always feel welcome at Windy Knitty and I highly encourage you to check it out!

4.description: Lovely place with a nice selection of yarn that ranges in price. They're very helpful here. I walked in with a pattern that required aran weight, which I learned is a European weight, and they helped me find a good substitute.

6.description: They have a nice enough yarn selection but wow are they rude and unhelpful.  My friend and I had planned our whole evening around starting new knitting projects. We showed up about a half hour before closing and spent several minutes picking out about $80 worth of yarn. We went up to pay and were told extremely rudely by the male clerk that he wouldn't wind our yarn (some of which was lace, so there is NO way to reasonably wind at home) because they were "technically closed."  At that point I looked at my phone and saw it was indeed 3 minutes past closing. However there'd been no warning, and there was no reason for him to be so rude. They were happy to take our money, so I'm not sure what he meant by "closed."  Obviously we left without buying anything. I'll be ordering my yarn online now!

22.description: I've been in there several times, and although the yarn selection is impressive, the service has always been less than impressive.  A couple of Sundays ago, I went there with some friends, and although there was only one other customer in the store when we entered, neither employee (and there were two working) set down their knitting nor offered to help.  To the credit of the male employee, he did greet us, but that was it.  The staff comes across as pretentious and I will only shop there as a last resort.

15.description: I bought 4 balls of yarn to make a baby blanket. They were already wound, but the way were wound was really poor.  I don't know what they did, but I had to unwind, untangle  and then rewind two of the four.  It wasted hours of my time.  It's apparent they didn't use a winder, and even if they did it by hand, it shouldn't have turned out with this tangled mess.  I will never go back to this store.

20.description: GREAT yarn store!  They have an amazing selection of yarns here, many of which are high-end silk and alpaca blends, but they also have really nice cotton and wool yarns that can fit a tighter budget.  The selection is MUCH bigger than Sifu and MUCH nicer.  The store is also organized nicely and not as crazily frenetic as Sifu.  The staff at Windy Knitty is generally very friendly (I can think of one exception) and they have a rewards program, so if you spend a certain amount (I forget how much) you get money back.  I definitely think this is the best yarn store on the North Side and far and away kicks Sifu's ass.  My one major complaint is that Windy Knitty charges you a dollar to wind balls of yarn that you didn't purchase in the store, which is unneighborly.

36.description: I consider myself to be a somewhat critical person and I have yet to find a negative with this store.  Mandy, who owns the store, is super friendly and helpful.  The selection here is awesome.  The prices are competitive.  I kick myself for not going here more often, especially since it isn't very far away.  Every time I go here I love this store more.

14.description: I love Windy Knitty.  They are a friendly group of knitters and very helpful.  This was my first shop to go to for yarn.  Now I have come to the dark side.  Yarn everywhere.

58.description: Great atmosphere, great margarita and mojito, and great sidewalk seating.

56.description: I'm giving one star and that's being generous.  This review is based on not just 1 visit but several, each of which was increasingly worse and finally infuriating to seal the deal on my determination to never return.  Perhaps they have more business than they want, so I'll happily take mine elsewhere. Now I love a good wine bar and I'll splurge on a fancy delicious cocktail but never again at this hole.   Not only is the staff discriminatory, but so are all the customers - is it that obvious I'm not a lesbian? I didn't realize that was a necessity to enter your space or partake of a beverage, particularly when I'm not some douche being an ass.  I was with a group of about 8 people celebrating a birthday, armed with cash to purchase rounds and ensure a good evening.  Oh- wait!  Too fast straighty.  Not only did the bartenders blatantly give me the twice over and go to the next customer more than once because I wasn't gay, but patrons at the bar shoved me aside to belly up.  The seated guests decided they'd like my seat and threw my coat and bag on the floor to take it.  And the bathroom?  Forget it - I just went home.  Don't waste your time on such a pretentious spot - much better bars for gays AND straights than this.   Spend your money at a place that gives 2 furry shits about their customers, and less about their sexual orientation.

29.description: Usually when you call someplace a hidden neighborhood gem, you're full of it. Well Joie De Vine epitomizes hidden neighborhood gem and I'm not full of it.Cocktails easily on par with some of the best I've had in the city. One I had last night (bourbon, coffe liqueur, cardamom, barbecue spices) easily beat out my old favorite at The Whistler.There's no cocktail list here, you just tell the bartender what kind of flavors/spirits you like and then she disappears and comes back with liquid amazing.Also an astounding beer list for such an out-of-the-way joint.New favorite.PRO TIP: You can feel free to walk your dog by this bar. Lots of people do. In fact, there's a little bowl of water out front for your dog. There's also ample bike-locking-up right outside the door.

42.description: JDV is the bomb.  The drinks are personalized and the staff is friendly and there is no shortage of amazing female clientele.  There are so few specifically lady owned, lady friendly establishments that cater to the non-dance party crowd like me.  It's classy, you can hear your friends, and you are guaranteed a good time.  By me, not them, although I'm sure staff will see to it that this promise is fulfilled.  GO!

23.description: Stopped in at this neighborhood bar and had a wonderful evening. Leah the bartender was engaging and interested. I came here solo and believe it is/would be a great place for a date or group as well solo. I will be headed back. The tequila cocktails I had were outstanding.

47.description: I have lived in Ravenswood and Andersonville for 5 years, and last night was my first trip to Joie De Vine. I regret not finding it sooner, but am elated I found a neighborhood gem! Andrea, the bartender, was fantastic! She explained that although they started as a wine bar, they focus more on spirits and craft beer now. She has traveled to Midwestern breweries and handpicked a great selection of 60 craft brews. She also explained that she handpicked some great, small batch and local spirits (including Koval, the distillery just down the street). She said: tell me what kind of liquor I wanted and she'll craft a drink. I asked for gin and she made two great options, one was sour (with something "quila", but was grain, not agave, based) with a little lavender infusion and the other was sweeter with an orange rind. So good! And the drinks are $10, much more reasonable than the $12-$14 drinks I've had lately. I loved the ambiance, the passion they obviously have for quality, local offerings and the fact that it's stumbling distance to my house. This may be dangerous, but I found my new fave spot!

8.description: Andrea no longer works here.  Sigh!  She was my favorite. I do, however, have a new favorite.  If you go, make sure to go on a night when Leah is working.  She is AWESOME!  I LOVE the tequila watermelon shots!  What I love about Leah is that she is a mixologist; you tell her what you like as far as base alcohol, and flavors you like, and she will go make you a custom drink that is to die for!  This place has outdoor and indoor seating.  It is laid back and chill.  The service, Leah at least, is awesome!  This place has quickly become one of my favorite places to go and to bring visitors.

31.description: First off, this place is a five minute walk from our new place, so I just had to check it out.  My husband and I arrived here about 9.30pm last Saturday night and while it was busy, it wasn't packed and we were able to get a couple of seats at the bar.  I'd read about Joie de Vine in Chicago Magazine and we'd walked past it on Balmoral, so I knew that they did custom cocktails - mine was delicious!  It had prosecco, lavender infused gin and other delicious ingredients that I can't remember - $10 too, which is very reasonable for a cocktail.  My husband was really pleased with the long and unusual beer list.  My second drink was a glass of red, not on the menu but the barmaid had recommended it - it was fantastic!!  We ate a couple of their small plates too - the polish sausage and grilled cheese with popcorn - both were super delicious and prefect sized portions.  The music was good, but some of it a little clubby for my taste.  Really great spot though - staff are super friendly and attentive.  My only reason for the lack of 5 stars is decor.  It's nice enough, perhaps just a little dated and not the cosy vibe that I really like in a wine bar.  How and ever, I'll definitely be back here for the great drinks and even better service.

34.description: Nothing compares to Joie de Vine. Nothing in the entire city of Chicago. The bartenders - Angela and Tanis - will take total care of you. Expect custom made drinks, with an eye for adventure, flavor and style.  JDV has come a long way over the years - I think it's finally grown into itself. But, as all good bars do, they are attentive to the hood, to their clientele and to the trends - and they evolve accordingly. If you haven't been to JDV, you are missing out on one of the best possible Andersonville experiences available. Cozy, friendly, great music, great staff, great drinks, great location.  Do it.

16.description: This is exactly what I want out of a bar.  A good selection of interesting cocktail ingredients, a creative bartender who enjoys making custom cocktails based on complex customer ideas, not too crowded,  good atmosphere,  and great prices. I got some very creative & delicious drinks,  great conversation, and a wonderful time overall.

13.description: Woo Woo is spot on!  Friday Fun Day with my sista's from a different mista! Ya, we're that close. After a day of shopping, walking, walking and walking , we hit Joie De Vine for a cocktail. I am usually a champagne / wine person but decided after Tasting my friends cocktails to try something new. Seriously one of the best drinks I've ever enjoyed. Enjoyed doesn't really express how amazing it was. We loved the ambience , the bartender and the casual ,comfortable feel. This is going to be a destination place, often. A treck from Oak Park but totally worth it!

11.description: I have lived in Ravenswood and Andersonville for 5 years, and last night was my first trip to Joie De Vine. I regret not finding it sooner, but am elated I found a neighborhood gem! Andrea, the bartender, was fantastic! She explained that although they started as a wine bar, they focus more on spirits and craft beer now. She has traveled to Midwestern breweries and handpicked a great selection of 60 craft brews. She also explained that she handpicked some great, small batch and local spirits (including Koval, the distillery just down the street). She said: tell me what kind of liquor I wanted and she'll craft a drink. I asked for gin and she made two great options, one was sour (with something "quila", but was grain, not agave, based) with a little lavender infusion and the other was sweeter with an orange rind. So good! And the drinks are $10, much more reasonable than the $12-$14 drinks I've had lately. I loved the ambiance, the passion they obviously have for quality, local offerings and the fact that it's stumbling distance to my house. This may be dangerous, but I found my new fave spot!

39.description: In fairness, I made it up to Andersonville on a Tuesday night, so I shouldn't have been surprised to be one of two customers in the bar at 8pm.  That said, I can't speak to the quality of the crowd this place gets because, well, there wasn't one.  The cocktails, however, are amazing.  I had heard good things, but I'm not too picky about my drinks, so I didn't think it would be a big deal.  Wrong!  Andrea's creative invention given my request for "something savory" was the best cocktail I've ever had (and I drink mostly cocktails at bars, since I'm an oddball who doesn't like beer).  Completely worth the $10 she charges for her creations (there are cheaper options, but I highly recommend coughing up the $10 at least once - I doubt you'll be disappointed).  Andrea herself was very nice and personable, and I had a pleasant time chatting with her while I enjoyed my drink.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago, hopefully on a more hopping night of the week.

37.description: Amazing cocktails that pack a (smooth) punch and coast around $10 a pop -- what's not to like? This bartender is impressive: you tell her an alcohol and a flavor, and she'll make you a delicious cocktail. Here are the three things my bf and I tried (LHS is what we requested, RHS is what she made):"something watermelon" - cucumber-flavored cocktail with watermelon balls "strawberry maybe?" - awesome strawberry-ginger concoction"bourbon" - stiff bourbon cocktail with burnt orange peel and orange zestAlso, if cocktails aren't your thing, this bar features a wide selection of craft beers. All in all, Joie de Vine is the place to go if you want to enjoy good drinks at a nice and casual place.

0.description: Friday night grown and sexy. I love this bar it's intimate, the bar tender is great, the music and atmosphere is definitely great for date night.

38.description: I really want to give Joie de Vine more stars: they have a lovely light display in the window, a great patio, it's located on a quiet, leafy street and a has a great atmosphere inside. Drinks are on the pricey side, especially if you want to try one of the custom cocktails they're famous for, but the selection is very good. Unfortunately, the service is kind of shitty. It's incredibly difficult to get the attention of the folks behind the bar - and it was *not* a busy night in there! - whether you're trying to place your order or close your tab or sign your credit card receipt. I'll definitely try the place again, but this is something the staff needs to work on. If you want your tips, you have to earn them.

51.description: Personalized service with drinks tailored to your likes. That's what's important about this place. i wouldn't consider it a wine bar, although apparently they consider(ed?) themselves as such. I've only been twice, the first time was pretty dead so we got good service; second time  crowded up a bit towards end of the night so it was a bit slow with the time it takes to mix such great cocktails - and there's only one bartender.  But trust me, this isn't really a place where you wanna pound drinks anyway, so waiting a few extra minutes for your expertly tailored cocktail is not a problem. Let Andrea be creative and you cannot leave unsatisfied.  However, it *can* be a little frustrating when she is fully engaged with other customers and you're like...yo, i want some more nectar of the gods. double edged sword, that good customer service is....A little hard to get to but well worth the trek. Andrea can concoct the most perfect drinks, has a great memory for what you like - which is good, because half the time i have no idea what i'm drinking, just that i like it, or i REALLY REALLY like it - and is very engaging and friendly.  Can't wait to go here when the weather isn't horrible so I can drink on their patio.  Attention D-Bags: don't expect to take any chicks home from this place...just don't even bother coming, you probably wouldnt' appreciate what's being served anyway.

27.description: I was here last night and while it wasn't my first time there, it was in years. WOW!!! Tanis the only bartender last night, kept me supplied in a never ending parade of cocktail loving. Besides being so cute I wanted to put her in my pocket, she knows how to wield a mean shaker. I have already told a few peeps this morning they must go.To me it is ultimate service and catering to my needs (yes its all about me), to describe what Im feeling (whiskey/bourbons, smokey/spicy tones not sweet) and have a seriously hot drink temptress concoct nummies all night is my ultimate good time.Honestly I can't recall the names and ingredients I know I started with bourbon,with coffee something and bbq bitters...my friends b-day who we were celebrating called it a mans drink from a black and white movie. It was manly!!I know there was a yummy rye concoction and then it gets a little hazy. I cannot wait to return and see what she does with Gin.

32.description: I am glad to have found out about this place.  I've been in the neighborhood for a couple of years and didn't know about it, until Yelp reviews led me here.  They have an impressive selection of beers and spirits which are toted to be up to their quality standards as they're not "brand driven".  So, you can choose a drink from the menu or you can tell the bartender/server what drink you typically like or a kind of booze, and she'll create a drink for you.  I was in a party of 4, and we all got specialty drinks.  The drinks were impressive in list of ingredients and the novelty of feeling like the drink didn't exist before your presence inspired its creation.  The atmosphere is dark, intimate, and on the quiet side to match the fact that if you were walking by you wouldn't notice it.  When I went to use one of their restrooms, the server-bartender was walking by and checked to make sure things were tidy before I went in.  She asked me to wait a second and wiped the counters and brought in towels, which I thought was above and beyond good service.  The drinks aren't designed to get you crunk, so when you go expect to enjoy a unique cocktail in a fun, relaxed setting.

54.description: Okay, not a lesbian, but still love this bar and the people who run it.  We had a large group coming in so we called in advance to give them the head's up.  The owner is very accommodating and the drinks are delish.  I think it is funny that the other reviewer complained about discrimination.  Give me a break.  Go to Wrigleyville if you want to be pawed by drunk guys.

48.description: Great place to hang with friends and meet new ones.  The gay chicks are hip and hot. Wines and endless beer.  That is correct you can get beer!  Great outdoor patio and they now serve food. Great happening' place for my birthday party.  See you there.

44.description: Amazing place.  Went there for the first time last night. The bartender was amazing and very helpful.

24.description: Such a lovely place - it's debatable as to whether the ambience is to every one's taste though I really dig the lights flickering in the front window.  The bartenders/servers are super-friendly and knowledgeable about their craft, always good drinks.  Good place off the beaten path from Andersonville...

7.description: Wonderful music, killer drinks, good atmosphere and one of the best actual alcohol varieties out there. This place simply doesn't have a well or house drink. Quality. Quality throughout.The staff are friendly and knowledgeable, and I'll definitely be going back. One of my new favorite places.Hidden gem. Been there for years I guess!

49.description: love love love this place !  Great music, great service and some pretty sweet events.. "sometimes you wanna go...where everybody knows your naaame", except cleaner..and sexier.

40.description: Great atmosphere. Lovely neighborhood. pleasant Bar tender.

53.description: Love. this. place.Good wine, great ambiance, even better service.  I only wish I lived around the corner from this sweet little neighborhood gem.  Will most definitely be back!

30.description: This is by far my favorite cocktail bar in the city.Reasonably priced, amazing drinks.The owner/workers generally care about their service and the quality of your cocktails. They also have snack plates available

46.description: This is going to be my new place. Well because the group that I was with were greeted by the bartender and basically told us she could make us an amazing cocktail. And she did! This place has a good feel to it. So bring your friends! There is a nice ambiance to this place. This is a perfect place to bring a date or just come drink by yourself because the bartender's cocktails are amazing lol. A nice perk is I just like their clean bathrooms! Never had an issue here. During the summer time they put out tables outside so its good for small groups. The inside is intimate so probably not best for large groups.

1.description: This place is more like Pire de Vin.There's only been a few bars and bar keep wich have really disappointed me and this combination was the worst I've ever experienced. This was our first time and last. My husband and I met some friends there on Tuesday night. We thought about having some wine, we tried a couple and tasted as if there had been open for a while. After asking the bartender how old they had been open he reply..."oh, not long! two or three days..."And yes this is a wine bar.One of my friends ordered a cosmo. Bartender took over 10 minutes to make it and we were the only ones there. It looked like he was actually looking at a recipe to make it. Really???I really wanted this place to work out but I'm sorry to say I'll never be back there again.Oh! and I don't think hard core Punk Rock is  appropriate music to play at a wine bar.

55.description: Well isn't this place adorable? Modern and cool with a great display of their alcohol.. When we went there it was at 1:30 on a Saturday night and it was pretty dead, we had just missed rush supposedly. Let me break it down for you.Pros: Cute. Lesbian hot spot ( Chicago seems to lack lesbian hang outs) Very neat beer and liqueur collection. Friendly bartender. Cons: a little too far off the beaten path, move to Clark and Balmoral and we'll have a winner. The wine selection was pretty small..like..6 different wines which i think is pretty bleak for what most would consider a wine bar. Also.. the bartender said they weren't doing the burlesque shows anymore :( . As mentioned in another review. there were not any drink/deals/price listings that I saw so that's a downside. It was really neat space with a neat selection and a friendly bartender but with a few little changes it could be a 5 star kinda spot. I'm interested to see what it's like on a busy night!

9.description: It's really a shame that I had such high expectations after reading so many great reviews for this place. My partner and I stopped in on a Friday evening for a nightcap and left disgusted by the awful service. At first, we arrived around 10:30 and thought the place was closed, but saw that there were a few patrons inside. Walked in, perused our options then proceeded to wait several minutes for the bartender to take her sweet time taking orders and making drinks for a group of 4 people. She never acknowledged us.     I saw the two owners sitting down at the bar with about 6-8 bottles of wine which they were testing. I reached next to one of the owners to look at a cocktail menu when  she looked at me and grabbed her personal belongings as if she were afraid that I was going to steal them. First of all, why the hell are you using up real estate at your bar where I, the patron, could be siting? Second, why didn't you make us feel welcome by greeting us? I'm not looking to make your place my Cheers hangout, but for crying out loud, have the decency to train your staff and acknowledge your patrons. Finally, the group of four realized we were trying to order and they moved. Even the bartender looked at us and continued to walk away. We had to flag her down for an order. There were a total of 7 of us inside and 6 people outside. I was fuming and we both decided to stay for just 1 drink. I can't imagine how hard it is to get a drink at this place when they're busy?!   We sat outside for our drinks which was nice. The decor was modern, music was fantastic, and their drink selection was excellent. They managed to get 2 stars out of me. 1 for decor and 1 for music selection.   Ladies, next time make sure to welcome all that come through the door and hire more personable staff. I don't think I'll be recommending this place to my friends.

26.description: Fantastic little place that's a bit off the beaten path, but well worth it. Tanis was very nice and made us feel comfortable. She made us some really nice drinks that fit exactly what we were craving at the moment. Totally worth the two-block 'hike' off of Clark!

25.description: Went to Joie De Vine last week and looooved it.  Met up with some coworkers for a drink on Thursday evening.  Went around 730 and it wasn't busy and we got a table outside. Its not a crazy busy area--its a hidden jem. The bartender, Leah asked what kind of drink I'd like and based on my vague response of flavors she mixed up something snazzy! It was pretty and tasted too good.  I don't even like ginger but Leah mixed my drink perfectly.  I was able to appreciate the drink and the ginger -infused-something-that-was-amazing.  Leah made solid drinks all night long.  Ask for the watermelon ball shots.  Fantastic and picture worthy. I had so much fun ordering a drink based on a few suggestions and waiting to see what was special made.   I will definitely be back.

12.description: Read that it was a lesbian bar but my heterosexual friends were having their bash there, so what the heck!  We made the trek about 3-4 blocks off of clark and in the darkness of the neighborhood, just when we said, 'there can't be a bar this far down...' there it was!  Super cute inside, pretty dead until about 10.  Didn't experience the "no menu they make what you say you like" because there is a menu....and a giant chalk board of drink specials.  I had some $3 sangria, which was good, but in a very skinny tall glass, so it was gone fast. Cool that they let our friends bring in catered food, but I think the guests that weren't part of the bash were confused about the food table in the back.  It wasn't a private party and if I was a regular guest I would think,  'geese,  this bar was rad for having goodies out!'Probably wouldn't return, but if that is your hood, go for it.

59.description: I wanted to like this place.Cute wine bar, tucked away on Balmoral in Andersonville, within walking (stumbling) distance from my home. I was very excited.I stopped in with a friend early on a Wednesday evening. The decor was very modern and dark. We were the only 2 customers for quite a while.Unfortunately, the service was really disappointing. The list of information we didn't receive includes: the available specials, the price of our drinks, the food menu option. Our bartender spent most of the evening sitting at the far end of the bar on her laptop. I chatted with a co-worker about my disappointing experience and she mentioned that when she visited she also saw the bartender sitting all night on her laptop!My one glass of wine was good, but I couldn't bring myself to support bad service by ordering another one.Still looking for a great wine bar in the Andersonville area!

21.description: I cannot believe I have not reviewed this Andersonville gem!  This is the place for amazing custom cocktails and unique spirits. The bartenders specialize in finding out what you like and giving you the drink you're looking for. I have had Tannis make me some unforgettable tangy creations. Not too sweet or bitter, exactly right!  What a perfect place in the neighborhood. Weekday nights are my favorite because it tends to be fairly chill and I can chat with whatever friendly bartender is working. Oh, I almost forgot the small plates...elotes popcorn or a mini melting pot of delicious, they have just the snack you are looking for. Last tip, if watermelon is in season ask them for a shot, they'll know what to give you!

17.description: I've been here a few times, and really enjoy this place. It's a little out of the way off of Clark, so it hasn't been busy in my experience. Great decor, and the French jazz playing is really pleasant; not too loud, so you can actually have a conversation. The cocktails are absolutely delicious.

10.description: A little small... er narrow I should say but this just provides allows for a cozy atmosphere.  Great drinks and some fun events go on here.  This place is a must for classy ladies who love ladies.

5.description: Joie De Vine - what a local neighborhood gem... and I didn't know about it until 72 hours ago!Joie De Vine is next to Pauline's Restauraunt in Andersonville - tucked away right off of Ravenswood.  Their sign isn't very big - so it's easy to miss - but it's one of those places you don't want to miss.It's a cozy atmosphere, with a nice sidewalk patio - great cocktails and friendly bartenders.  The prices are really affordable - and it was a perfect spot for post family 30th party.  Highly reccomended local spot!

3.description: Really good cocktails in a low-key atmosphere with great music. Mia, the mixologist behind the bar, is engaging and personable and very adept at her craft. Last time I was there they had twinkle lights (Mia said that was over 2 years ago so clearly I don't get out much) -- The twinkle lights weren't there tonight but they should bring them back because the world needs more twinkle lights.

35.description: If you can't find me this winter, be sure to check here.  Most likely I'll be hibernating at the bar with a tasty yet potent Old Fashioned in one hand and a candle in the other.I am super bummed that I held off from coming in to Joie de Vine's for so long!  In part because it is a lesbian bar and I was afraid of all the evil looks I could have received being a gay male.  After all, the gays did take over Big Chicks, Star Gaze closed, and all the gay couples have staked and claimed Andersonville as their home.  I don't want them to beat me up for trying to take one of their last existing venues...  No to mention that my bestie claimed that it looked a bit sketch with the tinted dark windows and butch lesbians smoking like chimneys outside.  Heck, I think that's more of a reason to go in and explore!!We walked in, James Bond movie playing in black and white in the candlelit background, easy listening music, and a greeting by the amazing bartender/mixologist, Tanis.  Tanis is friendly, fierce and simply talented.  While the bar offers a variety of beers and wines, I can't help myself from tailoring a drink creation of what I like.  All you have to do is tell Tanis what liquor and/or characteristics (e.g. bitter, sweet, tangy, etc) you're feeling, and she will mix up one hell of a drink to please your taste buds.  Just $10 a pop!  Colin B. describe Joie de Vine quite perfectly, "Personalized service with drinks tailored to your likes."  I have been on a manhattan kick so she created the perfect cocktail with an amazing West Virginian bourbon.  Then, I had a taste for something seasonal and ended up with a tasty egg nog concoction with a chocolate-vanilla pirouette stick.  She makes these stellar and complicated drinks that I can't even begin to describe.  As a welcome gift, Tanis treated us to a bowl of their "elote-style" popcorn.  Perfectly sweet and salt with a kick of spice.  I was in heaven!I recommend coming in early as I do.  I go to bed before 10:30 pm, like an old man, so it works out perfectly.  I hear it does get busy later in the night and they only have one bartender working at a time and making all the drinks and food.A week later, I found myself back again...simply addicted and in a trance.  I think I have a crush on Tanis' skills that keep me coming back for more.Awarded Review of the Day in Chicago, Illinois on 04/2/2013!

19.description: I'm definitely a fan of this place! I'm not a big wine person, but the beer selection here is very good and I like the atmosphere. It's romantic and classy -- nice dim lights and candles, attractive decor -- yet friendly and not stuffy. The food is delightful, too; I love the popcorn and grilled cheese.The cocktail situation is mostly hits with the occasional miss. There's no cocktail menu; instead, you give the bartender an idea of what liquor/flavor you are in the mood for and she dreams something up for you. The bartenders are clearly mixology geniuses -- most of the cocktails I've tried here were fantastic and inspired. But the downside is that they don't run the cocktail idea by you between dreaming it up and making it, so if there are certain ingredients you dislike you run the risk of finding them in your drink unless you tick off a list of "no x, y, or z, please" when you order. It's not a big deal but it can be a bit awkward or risky depending on how picky a drinker you are. If you are very picky, though, you certainly won't do badly here either asking for something specific or just enjoying the beer selection.Joie de Vine is out of the way, but totally worth making the trip now and then. Now that T's is gone it's also one of the last lesbian hangouts left in the city so I definitely consider this place a treasure.

28.description: Went here with a bunch of girls to try out the "one of a kind" cocktails.  It was such a cool experience if you're open to trying new drinks.  We went on a Sat. night and the place was relatively dead in the 6-7pm hour and slowly picked up.  It seemed like the bar tender was the only person working...so as business picked up our service got slower, which was a little disappointing but I'm excited to go back.  Highly recommended if you're not in a hurry.

45.description: I've been there a couple of times and had pretty good experiences. Service was good, drinks were pricey but the atmosphere was worth it. I'll be back.

33.description: Would have been a 5 if didn't have to wait so long....Super cute, super chill, not "off the beaten path" at all if your not opposed to walking a few small city blocks in Andersonville to feel like your in a downtown lounge. One must take advantage of the awesome "crafted to your taste" cocktails...they're fabulous.Only downside, WAY understaffed. Was there on a Friday night at 9:00 and there was only 1 person on staff! She was taking orders, making drinks, running like crazy! While I felt bad for her I was a little annoyed waiting so long for a dink and cheese plate.

43.description: My girlfriend and I dropped in last night, and we had a very nice time.  Andrea is a charismatic, creative bartender who made it into a great experience.  She made us several custom cocktails with very unusual ingredients (e.g. elderflower liqeur) that were quite delicious.Some of the reviewers claim discrimination.  We are a straight couple, and for what it's worth, we didn't run into any of that, although it was clear that there is a regular crowd that is insular in nature.  We were dismayed when they all showed up, because then we didn't have Andrea to ourselves anymore!Almost forgot - we ordered the sausage/apple/pear plate, and it was tremendous.  Try it.

2.description: Cute neighborhood bar. Not huge - maybe 10-12 seats at the bar, and another 10-12 at the counter behind. They were understaffed when we went, but drinks for $6 .... yes please.They have a solid sangria for $6 - and it's a huge glass. My friend loved that. I got a hard cider, also for $6, and it was solid (but filling, so I couldn't drink it all). It was a little warm, but I think in a few months, people will flock here for that reason.

18.description: Usually when you call someplace a hidden neighborhood gem, you're full of it. Well Joie De Vine epitomizes hidden neighborhood gem and I'm not full of it.Cocktails easily on par with some of the best I've had in the city. One I had last night (bourbon, coffe liqueur, cardamom, barbecue spices) easily beat out my old favorite at The Whistler.There's no cocktail list here, you just tell the bartender what kind of flavors/spirits you like and then she disappears and comes back with liquid amazing.Also an astounding beer list for such an out-of-the-way joint.New favorite.PRO TIP: You can feel free to walk your dog by this bar. Lots of people do. In fact, there's a little bowl of water out front for your dog. There's also ample bike-locking-up right outside the door.

41.description: I usually hate most gay or lesbian spots (mediocre food and drink, over priced covers, pissy biphobes, too loud, divey, etc), but I really like this bar. If I still lived in Chicago then it would be a regular spot for me. The bartenders were friendly and made great cocktails and the bar is very modern and upscale without being uptight. There's outside seating for the warmer months as well. The only down side is that the bar is on the smaller side and can get packed. Definitely a spot to check out.

52.description: I love this bar, the atmosphere, the neighborhood.  I love the bartenders, their conversation, and their taste when it comes to recommendations. I brought some girlfriends here for a fun random weeknight, and the doors were locked.  They must have just closed and seen us through the windows, because they ran to unlock the door and let us in. That's cool.I love that it's a safe place from creepy straight dudes.  LOL!Oh yeah, and these girls know their whiskey.  That's hot.

50.description: A sign of a good bartender is one that takes your request and succeeds on the first try.  Take one bartender that's never made an old fashioned before and toss them my way and before you know it, they're a pro.  This is a swank, hidden gem in my neighborhood and, thankfully, fairly close to home.  I can't even explain why I hadn't made it a regular hangout when I lived even closer.The drinks are pricier than other neighborhood bars, but not over-the-top.  You'll find yourself with a hefty drink selection and bartenders that know their stuff.  The whisk(e)y choices are more than just standard and they do a nice pour.Now, pass the bitters this way, because I have another drink in mind.

4.description: I had a great time here and thoroughly enjoyed my Moscow mule... One of the best. The bartenders were very friendly and offered us a free shot. It was an off night and not overly crowded but we still had fun anyway!

6.description: Great little bar/lounge off the beaten path.I read somewhere that although Joie De Vine is known as a wine bar (duh, it's in the name), that it's also a wonderful place for cocktails. I decided to put it to the test this past Saturday evening.There was a small, seasonal cocktail list, but then it was explained to me that drinks are based on whatever your preference is, so the sky's the limit. Just tell the bartender what flavors and spirits you like, and they'll come up a drink tailor made just for you. I ordered a cucumber collins and it was fantastic and perfectly balanced. That's my kinda place!The atmosphere is chic, but cozy. I loved the music and the staff was so congenial. Supposedly this is a lesbian bar, but we heteros didn't feel at all out of place. The crowd was a good mix of groups and people on dates.Cocktails run about $10, which I find to be fair, based on the quality of ingredients. JdV is on par with the likes of Scofflaw or The Whistler, or any bar devoted to craft cocktails.Joie De Vine is sleek, stylish, sexy, and stimulating. I am so coming back here.

22.description: I'm definitely a fan of this place! I'm not a big wine person, but the beer selection here is very good and I like the atmosphere. It's romantic and classy -- nice dim lights and candles, attractive decor -- yet friendly and not stuffy. The food is delightful, too; I love the popcorn and grilled cheese.The cocktail situation is mostly hits with the occasional miss. There's no cocktail menu; instead, you give the bartender an idea of what liquor/flavor you are in the mood for and she dreams something up for you. The bartenders are clearly mixology geniuses -- most of the cocktails I've tried here were fantastic and inspired. But the downside is that they don't run the cocktail idea by you between dreaming it up and making it, so if there are certain ingredients you dislike you run the risk of finding them in your drink unless you tick off a list of "no x, y, or z, please" when you order. It's not a big deal but it can be a bit awkward or risky depending on how picky a drinker you are. If you are very picky, though, you certainly won't do badly here either asking for something specific or just enjoying the beer selection.Joie de Vine is out of the way, but totally worth making the trip now and then. Now that T's is gone it's also one of the last lesbian hangouts left in the city so I definitely consider this place a treasure.

15.description: Amazing bartender. Leah asked me two questions about my drink preferences and made the best cocktail I've had.  Awesome.  Can't wait to come back!

57.description: I've been in this place when it was packed to the core and I still had a good time. The owners are super nice, the wine is...well..its wine (read: YUM). oh and the bathrooms are clean, which is always a plus.I went here on my 25th birthday this past year and had a really nice time. Delicious chocolate cake shots too.The performances they have there are awesome, and certainly draw a big crowd, so if you plan to attend one get there early for a good spot.

20.description: Andrea no longer works here.  Sigh!  She was my favorite. I do, however, have a new favorite.  If you go, make sure to go on a night when Leah is working.  She is AWESOME!  I LOVE the tequila watermelon shots!  What I love about Leah is that she is a mixologist; you tell her what you like as far as base alcohol, and flavors you like, and she will go make you a custom drink that is to die for!  This place has outdoor and indoor seating.  It is laid back and chill.  The service, Leah at least, is awesome!  This place has quickly become one of my favorite places to go and to bring visitors.

36.description: The place is overall quiet, chill, layback, relaxing and comfortable. The bartender was friendly and welcoming.This place was started as a wine bar. It's our first time so I wanted to try their signature wines. We had two of white and two of red. I enjoyed all. The price is about $7-15, so reasonable. Next time, as others recommend, I like to try cocktails.

14.description: I cannot believe I have not reviewed this Andersonville gem!  This is the place for amazing custom cocktails and unique spirits. The bartenders specialize in finding out what you like and giving you the drink you're looking for. I have had Tannis make me some unforgettable tangy creations. Not too sweet or bitter, exactly right!  What a perfect place in the neighborhood. Weekday nights are my favorite because it tends to be fairly chill and I can chat with whatever friendly bartender is working. Oh, I almost forgot the small plates...elotes popcorn or a mini melting pot of delicious, they have just the snack you are looking for. Last tip, if watermelon is in season ask them for a shot, they'll know what to give you!

3.description: Lovely community gallery that is very spacious. If you have a favorite artist of need to rent the spot for an event, I would definitely suggest it.

1.description: I had defended this place for a long time, but that time is up. Not only do they not know how to run a business they do not know how to properly store and care for art! My work as well as many others have been damaged or even lost because of their ignorance and general laziness towards art handling. They have shunned former employees, neighbors, framers who used to work with them, customers, and artists alike! They claim to be there for local artists but it's really just for the owner and her work! I have herd from many many people in the past how during a show (of other artists work) she will move aside theirs to make room for her own work and no matter the theme, some how manages to squeeze in hers. Its disrespectful and appalling. She even lets her girl friend (someone who knows nothing about art or art handling) instal and handle art improperly! It goes to show you how little they actually care for their artists. If you want to see your work, dropped, broken, bent, smashed, chipped, and cracked, show here!The owner blame mistakes on past employees instead of taking responsibility for her own ineptitude! Many big time buyers now despise her and vow to never come back, which just ends up hurting the artists instead. Past employees were barley paid, if at all, despite being worked like dogs! And asked to go above and beyond what they originally were hired to do. Even after she has fired someone she will still beg them to do work for her (for free of corse) Its always great to have a local gallery but this place does not deserve it!  They can't even figure out how to maintain their website, blog, facebook, or this yelp page(how do I know, cause is was my job!)  The address shown above is actually an old one, their current address is 1515 W Foster. They moved years ago and can't figure out how to update their information. No one knows they have moved, years after the fact, as a result of their complete lack of business handling. Case and point, the one 3 "reviews" are 3 or more years old! Just goes to show you how few people go to this gallery! Calling it a gallery would be unfair! This place is a joke!

2.description: I can't add anything more about the art or artists except that this is a decent gallery that everyone seems to like.  I've bought at least one thing there, and the gallery owner was pleasant.Having wrote that, I really wish they'd bump up their professionalism a notch or two.  For a gallery that's only open two days a week, I think it's strange that the gallery doesn't have bio information on all seven of their represented artists.  They need to have a better answer than, "Sorry, I don't think we have anything about him."

5.description: I was lured in here the other day by a sign stating that "coffee makes you queer." My friends and I had to buy it for a co-worker, it was too perfect. Anyway, they have a wall of silk screened phrases that are quirky, fun, and meaningful.  Most of the art appears to center around Chicago, especially the lakefront. There were a few things besides the coffee makes you queer sign that I wanted to purchase. Interesting place...

6.description: Small but dense with variety, this gallery features the local, the young, and the most seasoned talents.  They seem to have a liking for works on paper and always have a few things that are cheaper than the cost of framing your favorite poster.  It's more inviting than many places (no one breathes down your neck while you look at works on glass, for example) and always has a few surprises.  Most recently, they've been showing works on paper and it was refreshing to see handcrafted pieces, full of passion and without pretense.

0.description: I've walked past this gallery a million times, yet never stopped in. Until Roger (KELLIE K.!!) and Don headed up to Clark Street one night, for some carousing. Hey! There's a lot of people in there, and they look fun, and have drinks in hand!Minutes later, we were clutching cold cans of Pabst (though we're not hipsters) and checking out the art. A wide array, some good some . . . well, nice try. They had some old boom boxes that were decorated all crazy, and those were pretty cool. Some of the stuff was not mounted all that well - no frames whatsoever. There was a wide variety of art, and for that reason alone, it's worth checking out this little gallery. They really did have  lot to look at in there.One of the many storefront gems that make Andersonville such a great place.

4.description: Don't miss this gallery.  Michelle Peterson-Albandoz, artist and owner, has brought together an amazing group of talent.  The Gallery has periodic Friday evening opening on various themes which are great fun and will expose you to many up and coming talents in Chicago.  I have to say that our condominium looks like their gallery, which will tell you something about how much we enjoy getting to know the artists and enjoying their work in our home.  A high point for us was a commissioned piece Michelle did for us.  We had an old step ladder that belonged to a deceased parent.  We didn't know what to do with it and could not throw it away.  Michelle transformed the ladder into an amazing work of art that we enjoy every day in our living room.  It is a tribute to my father and a treasure we will have forever.  Recently we purchased an amazing photograph by Lara Dorsett.  It is still in the gallery in their most recent show.  We will have it in our home soon.   Go in.  Enjoy.  Realize you can have wonderful art by talented artists in your home.  The gallery is a treasure.

58.description: It was a beautiful walk to Kopi for a quick breakfast before leaving town. The decor is chaotic and bohemian, but the atmosphere was very relaxed and enjoyable. I didn't know whether I should be seated or order at the register, and the nice lady who answered all my other questions didn't tell me either way, so I just took a few moments to pursue the menu and ordered at the register before finding a seat.
