I bought a funky coffee mug and the Meggsicano breakfast with potatoes. LOVED the potatoes (buttery with herbs) but wasn't sold on the Meggsicano dish. It was bland but okay. Maybe that's why they offer the hot sauce. Would I eat there again? I wouldn't jump at the chance, but you could find me there sparingly.

56.description: I thank the owners of this establishment and, of course, paradoxurus hermaphroditus for eating, and defecating, the amazing little beans which make this coffee so pleasing to the palate. I enjoy your droppings immensely. A big shot out to the poor pheasants that have to sift through the the large piles of dung as well. I'm forever grateful to all who participate in this operation.

29.description: I had there croissant which was delicious!! I like this place but one time I had a lox bagel which was 12.95 and that's to pricey for a damn bagel... But it's a nice little place

42.description: Love, love,  love. Great atmosphere,  cozy and laid back and a surprisingly great menu! All vegetarian which im not but regardless very impressive. Thought it was just a coffee house but they have a delicious list of alcoholic beverages too. Cant wait to go back!

23.description: My wife and I have been eating here from time to time for a hundred years.  That's a small exaggeration, but she has been going there since the 1990s and introduced me to Kopi.  When we have out of town guests, we often take them to Kopi for breakfast on weekends.  In addition to good food, there is a useful travel books section and a gift shop.  I have found a few good gifts for people there over the years.  Service is always good although there seems to be some kind of moral objection to spoons for tasks such as stirring coffee. My wife always orders the challa French toast and always loves it.  Most recently, I ordered the salty Madame salmon sandwich.  This was basically an egg and salmon sandwich.  It was good, but not very salty and left a lot of salmon stuck in my teeth.  As we often do, we ordered the salmon patties, which, of course, are not meat.  They  are always delicious.  I usually don't drink alcohol here, but since it was a federal holiday had the house Bloody Mary.  It was good.My wife says the coffee is the best she can get without going to an overpriced fancy coffee shop. You don't have to get a fancy coffee for it to taste good.

47.description: I like this place and often stop here for a cozy mid-week lunch or an afternoon snack with coffee.  It gets crowded on the weekends and in the evenings, so I am lucky as a freelancer to be able to stop by during off hours.The menu is large, with an array of teas, cafe drinks, alcoholic beverages, breakfast items, soups, sandwiches and desserts.  They even have vegan options.  I am a big fan of their sandwiches and snack platters (i.e. Hummus).  The coffee is good and their standout cafe beverage is the dirty chai (hot or iced).  I don't order dessert much but the selection is plentiful and they look so good in the display cases!The decor is eclectic and interesting, with the seating a bit cramped and claustrophobic for some.  But I find it to be part of Kopi's charm.  The boutique in the back is also fun to browse through.The service is attentive and fair, if not a bit reserved/aloof.  Still, they do their job well and don't pester you too much.  It makes it a good place to read or study (sans the use of Internet connection), or have a lunch date with an old friend.  Definitely one of the more charming establishments in Andersonville.

8.description: Love this place when it's not too busy.  The portion with the cushions is always a nice place to go, sit, drink some coffee, and read.  It has a lot of character, a pretty good food selection (though nothing has every struck me as amazing) and great coffee.It's a four because these days sometimes a person just needs to have wifi and not having wifi at a coffee shop is a bit odd.  At least make it very clear to customers before they sit down that there is no wifi if you're not going to have it.

31.description: This place is awesome!  The store in the back has really neat stuff to buy, and the food is different and delicious!  The drinks are the best.  They have Gilligan'r lemonade (lemonade with coconut) and hot cherry cider!  I wasn't feeling well once when I went and they had hot Emergen-C on the menu.  It's the best in the summer when you can sit outside.

34.description: Great coffee, good music, and amazing selection of vegetarian food. The prices are very reasonable for the quality food you get. The store in the back is a nice touch and carries fun, unique items. Lunch for 2 people with coffee is easily $30 or less.

16.description: Kopi, what a wonderful find during a Sunday afternoon stroll! The atmosphere is inviting and casual, service friendly and food delicious  great for vegans, vegetarians and carnivores alike. Delicious sangria and a cute shop in the back. I will definitely be back..

13.description: A charming place to go for good food solo or with friends. The staff was friendly and accommodating, the downgrade is because they haven't realized that tacos come best in threes, and they make their drinks heavy on the sweet side. They lack WiFi so it's best for reading or writing if you're planning to work.

11.description: Cute cafe! I went i to get the green smoothie and i couldn't help but go towards the back of the cafe to browse in their gift shop, its really cute. Cant wait to go back there again! Thumbs up!

39.description: Fool me once, shame on you.Fool me twice, shame on me.Fool me three times . . . I've been to Kopi several times over the past year (2013-2014) without updating my review. Until now. Each time I've visited Kopi, the quality of food and service have been hit-or-miss. I've been going to Kopi for 20 years, so I was willing to overlook a few mediocre experiences. After years and years of enjoying Kopi's food, service, and atmosphere, I have a history with this business. It's like an old friend. Sometimes that friend is a little moody, but you forgive her and continue with the friendship. There comes a time, though, when that friend abuses the relationship so much, you have to say good-bye forever. That time has come for me and Kopi.The atmosphere is still good. When I went in for breakfast recently, I noticed that some updating had been done, but it still held the same artsy vibe it always had. I sat down and was quickly given menus and waters for two, since I told the waiter I was waiting for a friend. When the friend arrived, she and the waiter exchanged a friendly hug and familiar greetings. Clearly, she'd been going to Kopi even more than I had, over the years.Despite that friendly greeting, once we ordered and received the food, the waiter disappeared. Not in a Halloween-type way, like vanished into a puff of smoke. No, he hung around the bar area, he chatted with another employee, he went into the back for some mysterious purpose. He never checked with us on our food, never refilled coffee or tea, just never did much waiter service at all. There were only three other tables occupied while we were there. It's not like he was so busy.Then there's the food. I ordered a tofu scramble with vegetables for $6.95. I got a tiny soup cup -- you know the kind, what you get when you order a cup of soup in a restaurant instead of a bowl? -- of entrée, and a piece of French bread. That's it. That wasn't even appetizer size. I also ordered the vegetarian sausage. For $3.00, I got three over-cooked pieces of something, each of which was the size of a silver dollar. For $3.00. There were so hard, the tines of my fork actually bent trying to pick one up. I tried eating it just by putting it in my mouth. Burned. Dry. That was $10.00 worth of breakfast.My friend ordered a bagel and asked for extra cream cheese. She did get her bagel, and she did get the cream cheese. The waiter gave her two packets, charging her $.75 for each. She didn't know about the charge until we looked at the check.I was still hungry at the end of breakfast. I saw a treat in the counter, a peanut butter/chocolate muffin. That was $5.50. I scarfed it down on the walk to the car, because I was still so hungry. With tip, I ended up paying $20.00 for a poorly-cooked, tiny portion breakfast. $20.00!!  I am not kidding or exaggerating when I tell you, the tofu scramble and sausage were not enough to feed your 3-year-old. You get a small amount of mediocre food for high prices.No more second chances, Kopi. It took a year of bad experiences, but now, after this final visit, I'm done. From now on, it's M. Henry or Taste of Heaven. I get better more and better food, and better service, for less money.

37.description: I've eaten here a few times and every time I've been happy with the food and the welcoming atmosphere. The staff is friendly and efficient. I visited Kopi's gift shop with my husband, son and daughter-in-law yesterday (Monday) evening to find a last minute, unique gift for my mother. I asked if they had any hand mirrors. The woman behind the counter checked in a cabinet and found two lovely hand mirrors. She carried the two mirrors behind the counter with pretext of cleaning them. As I watched, I saw her remove a price sticker that showed $18, and attempt to surreptitiously replace it with a new price tag that had $24 on it. I didn't say anything, but I felt slightly insulted. I told her I wanted to look around a bit more, but that I would take the mirror. As I was looking at other items, I saw her approach the owner(?) and whisper something to him. It was odd, but I ignored it. I returned to the counter and paid for the mirror. I would have understood if she told me she had to mark up the price for any reason; however, changing a price tag in such a secretive manner, without saying anything to me, was offensive. You didn't get away with anything, sweetheart. Thing is, I would have happily paid the $24, even if you'd been open about it. I'll still visit for the food, and maybe even for the gift store. But last night left a bad taste in my mouth.

0.description: Kopi Travelers Cafe is a cute little spot on Clark that is the perfect mix of coffee shop and cafe. There is a little area in the front where you can sit on the ground (ample cushions and pillows to sit on) where you can sip your drink and have your snacks at low tables. The section in the middle has standard tables that you can grab a bite to eat at, and the very back section has some cute local and non-local goods for purchase (think eclectic jewelry, soaps, etc).I've never had a full meal here, but instead typically pop in for some tea (their russian tea with sour cherries is very tasty), hot chocolate, or wine, along with a dessert or snack. Of the snacks I've tried, their multigrain bread and butter is REALLY good, so much flavor in the crust and loaded with grains and seeds.Definitely a cute spot to relax over drinks with some friends or on your own with a book - will continue to pop in whenever I get a chance.

38.description: I love Kopi Cafe!  I brought my students there and they were very accommodating in terms of seating and checks.  They were also very friendly as well.  I love the pole with the international dollars, one of my students from Kazakhstan left a bill on there and it makes me happy when I go back and see it.  The food is pretty delicious too, I love the carrot cake and their panini's!

51.description: Kopi is my neighborhood cafe, the true definition of a meet-up place for socializing and not being rushed out after the plate is cleared.  I  haven't had a bad meal here, the wait staff is great at recommendations of what to try based on your mood.  Could there be cosmetic improvements?  Sure, but then the atmosphere would probably not be as relaxed, either.  As more places open in Andersonville that are trendy/pricy, I am happy Kopi is still its eclectic self.

27.description: Tons of cool beverage options like a match a martini or yerba mate. Wasn't into the floor seating by the window because I'm a very long legged lady. Kind servers that will let you relax. Cute kitschy shop in the back, full of hipstery books and travel books.

32.description: I was referred to the store by another bookstore. I was looking for some books on travel, but was in awe of all the amazing, unique gifts, jewelry, clothes and books. Loved it!!

54.description: I really wanted to love this place. I've been in Andersonville for about a year now, and finally had a vegetarian friend visit and thought this would be a great excuse to try. I've walked by thousands of times to see the people with delicious smelling food in the small outdoor seating on Clark, or see them relaxing at the low tables and pillows in the front window. So, I was very excited for my first Kopi experience. We went on a Tuesday night so the place was pretty open and we were able to sit at the low tables which was very nice, especially when relaxing and catching up with old friends.However, things started to get weird with our server almost immediately. He is doing this place a complete disservice. One of my friends asked about the "natural soda" and exactly what that meant (she is a huge Kombucha fan and was thinking maybe they fermented their own bevs here), he told her "it just uses natural sugar, they just say that to make it sound better". Now I've never worked in the service industry before, but I'm know you don't want to insult the restaurant's menu like that. Then there was a misunderstanding with the soup of the day. It turns out we were there the only day of the week that you can't order the soup of the day in a traditional (bowl or cup as a side) manner. This was very poorly explained and once a meal-sized portion of soup arrived to my friend, the waiter became defensive and wouldn't listen to our comments on how he didn't explain this to all of us. So our impression of the place was is now spiraling out of control. He argued with us for a couple of minutes before I asked to speak to a manager, who immediately said to charge us just for a bowl rather than the meal sized portion (about a $3 price difference - which is nothing to fuss over it was just the principle of good service at that point). So it's good that management at least knows how to deal with customers, as we were ready to walk out at this point. We are three indecisive ladies, and it did take us a while to make a final choice for our main orders. One of my friends asked the waiter a couple of questions about the dishes, like what how the tempeh burger is seasoned, to which he replied "I don't know, definitely soy sauce, some other spices. We don't make anything in house". He repeated this same type of answer for all of our other questions about ingredients or seasoning. The entire interaction was just bizarre and he ended up coming off as rude and that he didn't care about the food at all. Which is fine I guess he doesn't have to care, but if you want to give a good impression and not to mention upsell customers, you better be able to describe what is put into the food and what makes it delicious.We ended up getting the black bean burger, the tempeh burger, and the libido burrito (all highly recommended on Yelp). The food was really good, and despite our server repeatedly telling us that nothing was made in house (still not sure where exactly it is made), it tasted like it was. My burrito had a ton of seasoning and the soup (mentioned earlier) was especially delicious. Unfortunately I don't remember the name. All in all, it was a bit of an off-putting experience no thanks to our server. I gave 3 stars since the food was actually very good, and I may return one day to try other dishes, the coffee drinks, and dessert.

48.description: Kopi is a cute little place that's great to go for a break. Grab a coffee, a bakery item, or order a meal from their eclectic menu. The staff here is very friendly and attentive!Whenever I go I usually order a mocha (hot or iced, depends on the weather), hot chocolate, or the Mexican hot chocolate. All three drinks are excellent!What's also great about this place is they get all their baked goods from local bakeries, and they select what items they want from them, so they're only ordering the best of the best from roughly 7 local bake shops.They also have a cute little shop tucked in the back of the store. They have a wide array of items to purchase - jewelry, women's clothing, scarves, purses, soaps and lotions, etc. They have some cute finds in there. It's quite eclectic.

44.description: Excellent place with great food and service. And the little shop in the back is filled with many fun things to purchase, as well. Love this place. :)

24.description: The ambiance was the best part: an atmosphere that is varied enough to appeal to all tastes. There is outdoor sidewalk-adjacent seating, as well as big windows in the front with pillows in front where patrons can sit on the floor if they would like. Inside there are tables and a general store/artsy market area. Restrooms were exceptionally clean. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable. Unfortunately there was no wi-fi, but that is probably a positive attribute because it keeps tables open for those whose priority is eating, drinking, and socializing. Reasonable selection of craft beers too.

7.description: This is our favorite place to go for breakfast, lunch, And dinner! Laid back ambiance with always friendly staff. I've yet to find a dish that I didn't like here. The coffee is flavorful and prepared well. Service is fast. Cost is reasonable. And I always end up finding something adorable in the shop at the back of the store. Love Kopi Cafe

49.description: Love this place. The food is delicious, mostly vegetarian with a few fish options. Great Bloody Mary. Friendly and attentive staff. Check out the cute little shop at the back of the room.

40.description: I go there because it's cozy it's filled with interesting gifts I love their food and I especially love their coffee with Nutella on the bottom. A must try. One of my favorite sandwiches now is the grilled cheese with salmon. Always look forward to going there

53.description: This is a great place to grab something to eat if you are looking for a vegetarian option.  The prices are also very fair.  I got the breakfast burrito and was yummy.  I like how they steam their eggs.  This had a store in the back and a small patio area.  I would definitely come here again to try their extensive menu.   A great place to grab a drink or desserts as well, because they have lots of options.

30.description: I just stopped in for a small Mexican hot chocolate with whipped cream to go, on one of the last cold days this winter, and was really impressed by Kopi. My order was taken and prepared by chatty, friendly adults. The hot cocoa was tasty.Overall, a solid to-go experience!

46.description: My new favorite Andersonville Spot. Everything edible is to die for. Love me some (Apple)-Green Juice. And their constant, mouth-watering array of pastries and desserts.... (Hold on... I'mSlobbering just thinking about it) IS TO DIE FOR... AND You can take Their coffee home to brew yourself. ANNNND... They have The Cutest Shop in the back. A Yogi/Buddha/Hamsa Lovers' Dream Nook. Everything from books on travel spots, journals and Nish-Nash gifts, statues, jewelry and clothing.. To hand-crafted purses, soaps, candles & incense!! I'm IN LOVE!!!! Next on my list... Dig an underground tunnel from my house to Kopi!! Quicker Access, right? Lol

1.description: Made an account just for this. There is ONE waiter for the whole place. Poor guy.The panini I ordered was disgustingly salty, with clearly frozen ingredients.My child's french toast order came out long after mine did, it was mushy and undercooked. I looked back into the kitchen just to see a dark greasy grill  and a couple of microwaves.I have a microwave at home. And I can cook better with it. No thanks Kopi.

55.description: Five stars for their enormous carrot cake and a lovely after work wine and dessert experience. It was warm, we sat outside in the sun and enjoyed people and dog watching. Kopi is in a great location with a lot going on, and the carrot cake is wonderful, but way too big for one person. Our waiter was friendly, fun, and attentive. I have been here twice (admittedly just for dessert), and I loved it both times.

9.description: This is literally the first coffee shop I went to in Chicago, 20+ years ago, and it has absolutely held up.Now that I live in the neighborhood, it's my go-to spot for vegetarian comfort food.  It actually took me a number of years before I noticed that they were veg.Favorite items:* Salmon Tartine Sandwich* Carrot Cake* Mexican Hot Chocolate Latte

26.description: This is a great place with good coffee and good food. The servers are nice, but slow, so don't go if you're in a hurry. My only reason for giving it less than five stars is because there is no mobile phone connectivity there and no wifi access, so if you want to go there to do some work and need Internet access, you're out of luck. I must say I find it curious that there is not mobile reception and there is no wifi access. I hope that they are not blocking phone access, for if they did that, they could be fined by the FCC, and they could be held liable in the event of an emergency and a patron cannot be reached.

25.description: Been coming here for decades and the coffee is always good and strong.The decor is cool and world-ish.The back area has slowly become an over loaded pile of crap...ok I don't mean crap like junk I mean crap like I can't figure out what's there because there's a mountain of it and moving too quickly might trigger an avalanche. The food is good but over-priced - always has been and always will be.Staff has always been easy, friendly and awesome.One last thing- it's awesome that they got a liquor license and have some nice selections present.

12.description: looked forward to returning as soon as I made it back to chicago. management/owners were perfectly attentive, yet hands off last time I visited. i'm here once a month. walked in, found a seat in the chill space. the woman who greeted me to take my order could not have been more rude. not sure what she's going through, although the manager on duty wasn't too much more empathetic to her crisis, nor my having been treated so poorly. really wanted this to be my new favorite place in the world. it's ok to acknowledge you're having a bad day. it's also ok to apologize & start all over. plenty of people in the cafe around the corner. unfortunate.

59.description: The coffee here lacks robust flavor, as do the dated sweets for sale. The claustrophobic space makes it that much less appealing.The only decency here is in regard to the hyper-friendly owner. If it were't for his impressive hospitality, I'd find this place a mere disaster.

21.description: It's a cute store. Unfortunately the iced coffee was really weak, the Thai iced coffee isn't Thai iced coffee (it was just weak coffee with some milk in it), and the cake was really oily. The server and staff were super nice, though. I could hang out there but I'd probably just get tea or something.

17.description: Absolutely love this adorable, kitch-y and warm little coffee & tea place! I got their house blend tea and it was so good! I'm also obsessed with the shop in the very back as well as the whole shelf of Lonely Planet travel guides and adorable and unique journals and notebooks for sale! They have a great selection of vegan items and baked goods as well which are not to be missed!

10.description: This is my favorite cafe in Chicago. The food is consistently creative and satisfying, the coffee is remarkable in all of it's glorious configurations, the groovy boutique in the back is like a little world traveling road trip, the folks that work there are sweet and attentive. love love love it.

5.description: This is a great venue for multiple different reasons. First, the coffee is utterly delicious. If you are on the run, don't let the setup of the venue throw you off. Approach the cash register. You can order there and get coffee to go, even if it doesn't feel right. It is right. And delicious. And well worth your money. But if you have the time, please sit down and try the food. My breakfast pizza was incredible. Their vegetarian (technically pescatarian) menu is extremely creative and delicious. Also, it is a great location to come with a friend or friends and catch up. Very intimate and cozy. Overall, this is a fantastic place to eat, visit and drink. Just know that its greatness takes time. So don't come if you are in a rush!

3.description: Minus a point for the waitstaff. There's leaving us alone to enjoy our food...and then again there's making sure we get what we ordered WHEN we ordered it in the order we ordered it.Minus a point for tripping over other diners when Kopi's busy. No, not kidding here. Tripping over one another. Though thankfully all the other diners have been phenomenally good-humored about that! I mean, shuffling coats and bags about to make sure that we all have a place to sit. Lovely.However, plus a point because I do love the steamed eggs! I'm fussy about eggs. And the steaming process leaves the eggs both fluffy and tender. No, really. (Did I mention I"m fussy about eggs?) And because the coffee's good. (If you can get the waiter's attention. Try tripping him!)And plus a purely personal point because it reminds me of the pre-hipster grubby Haight-Ashbury where I grew up. i'll be back.

35.description: This rating is for the Staff plus Ambiance plus Food...mostly for the food. Staff and Ambiance get a 4.5. Food gets a 2.5, here's why:Organic Fried Tofu- I should know better than to get something Asian at a coffee shop. Texture was dry like microwaved tofu. The peanut sauce was okay, but nothing special. Nachos: huge portion. Share this as dinner with 1 person if you're not ordering anything else and 2 or 3 people if you're ordering other items. Good flavor on the beans. Chips are too dense and a bit on the burnt side. Salsa is good, needed more to cover up the burnt chip flavor. Jalapeños are spicy,  good for cold weather days. $10 bucks...yikes on the price for what would typically be an appetizer item. I drove 35 min to try this place, so I won't be back. If I were within walking distance, is give it one more shot.

19.description: This rating is for the Staff plus Ambiance plus Food...mostly for the food. Staff and Ambiance get a 4.5. Food gets a 2.5, here's why:Organic Fried Tofu- I should know better than to get something Asian at a coffee shop. Texture was dry like microwaved tofu. The peanut sauce was okay, but nothing special. Nachos: huge portion. Share this as dinner with 1 person if you're not ordering anything else and 2 or 3 people if you're ordering other items. Good flavor on the beans. Chips are too dense and a bit on the burnt side. Salsa is good, needed more to cover up the burnt chip flavor. Jalapeños are spicy,  good for cold weather days. $10 bucks...yikes on the price for what would typically be an appetizer item. I drove 35 min to try this place, so I won't be back. If I were within walking distance, is give it one more shot.

28.description: This is a go to spot for delish food when I'm in A-villle. Everything I have had has been spot on. And the little shop is irresistible...I never need any of those things but yet always find a few things I *have* to have. If you are in the area, stop in you won't be disappointed

45.description: The atmosphere of this place is amazing and you can tell it is a focus of theirs. The menu is diverse and great for brunch or really any meal. Their coffee program doesn't seem to be as much of a priority to them. Darker roasted beans for their espresso, I didn't get a chance to see where from, but whoever the barista was still made great drinks with what they were working with. Chai is great and on the sweeter side which I don't mind. Service was attentive and all in all a great experience. Will probably go again and hopefully update this with more detail.

33.description: I was greeted by two very nice staff members when I walked in to order food, and decided to shop in the back section for a candle while I waited.  The older lady working behind the counter was chatting it up with some chic about her flight coming up and carrying on and on about who knows what, but obviously she was busy and not able to step away from her convo to help me out.  The thing that really pissed me off, is that when I went pay the lady, she looked at me like I was I was crazy, and did not even have the decency to quit talking to this Jessica chic while I was paying. Then she did not thank me when I paid for a $34 candle, I had to say something to her. I hope that she is not a manager or owner, because she does not know the first steps of customer service. Then, not to mention when I got home and opened up my food, the sandwich I ordered looked like a kid threw it together in 1 minute with grapes that were all shriveled and gross for $10.  Listen to all the other Yelp reviews, and go somewhere else!!

43.description: Disclaimer : VeganStrictly OK place.. Had some Vegan burger that they claimed to be one of the best options at the cafe. Have had better one's at soo many other places.I was let down! but may be its a better place for non-vegans....

2.description: Kopi Travelers Cafe is the definition of small coffee shop and cafe. Upon entering there is a nook with four tables that are close to the ground. There are many different colored pillows so that you can sit comfortably on the ground while eating your food or drinking a beverage. There is a small gift section in the back that is filled with accessories, books, and other knick knacks. The drink menu is extensive. They have both non-alcoholic and alcoholic beverages. I had the Oregan Chai which was spiced nicely with Cinnamon and others. My friend had the Peppermint Latte which tasted like a melted down Peppermint Patty! It wasn't too sweet, but it had a more authentic mint taste than other lattes. The menu offers all day breakfast, soups, sandwiches, appetizers, and salads. Kopi offers a many deserts and pastries. I had the Challa French toast. Absolutely delightful! I asked the waitress to leave the maple syrup and the triple berry capote on the side so I could taste the bread on its own. My friend ordered the fluffy eggs with salmon and dill sour cream on multi grain bread. The sour cream pulled the dish together when spread on the bread and eaten with the eggs. A unique thing about Kopi is that there is one waitress that brings drinks and food to customers at tables. One does not go up and pick their food up from the counter like other cafes. The waitress also brings water and buses the table. Yet there is no expectation to tip him or her. I would recommend Kopi to those who would like a warm, laid back, and intimate place to drink coffee and casually dine.

18.description: Been coming here for decades and the coffee is always good and strong.The decor is cool and world-ish.The back area has slowly become an over loaded pile of crap...ok I don't mean crap like junk I mean crap like I can't figure out what's there because there's a mountain of it and moving too quickly might trigger an avalanche. The food is good but over-priced - always has been and always will be.Staff has always been easy, friendly and awesome.One last thing- it's awesome that they got a liquor license and have some nice selections present.

41.description: I have been eating at Kopi since I was a baby. My mom always reminisces about 2-year-old me prancing around the pillow-filled seating area by the front window, loving that I was allowed to eat my lunch barefoot and sitting on the floor. Fast forward 20+ years and Kopi is still one of my favorite spots in the city. The Chèvre Chaud salad is TO DIE FOR, as are all the yummy coffee drinks, smoothies, and desserts. In fact, I can't think of anything I've ordered that I didn't gobble down with gusto. The homemade hummus is really good too. And they have some of the best carrot cake I've ever had. I could go on. But what really brings me back to Kopi is the atmosphere. It's very comfortable, with an old hippie vibe that never fails to transport me into another world. Staff are always kind and helpful. Can't recommend highly enough!

52.description: Kopi is a nice little A-ville spot for any meal or just a coffee to go.  For a while, I used to come here for the brunch and coffee, meggsicano and soy lattee, but finally made the trip for dinner.  While it is not strictly vegetarian it's definitely geared that way.  I had a big salad and they one thing I didn't like is that all of the veggies were enormous and no cut up making it hard to eat.  My husband loved his egg plant sandwich.  If you are the dinner sort, keep in mind that any bottle of wine, even on special days, can be corked and taken with you to go.

50.description: I love love love the coffee but I have hated the service every time I've come. Every server I've had has been extremely impatient and expresses with their body language how much they hate their job. You win some, you lose some. If you are only coming for coffee, they pester you into trying to get food as well. I will still get coffee here, but probably to go, or maybe I'll just pay first to be left alone.I'm a huge chai fan and it's difficult to find a place that doesn't use something boxed. Their chia is on point, their coffee is never too hot or burned, and they have a really nice selection of desserts!If you're into overpriced hippy clothing and accessories, they have that as well.

4.description: My wife and I have been eating here from time to time for a hundred years.  That's a small exaggeration, but she has been going there since the 1990s and introduced me to Kopi.  When we have out of town guests, we often take them to Kopi for breakfast on weekends.  In addition to good food, there is a useful travel books section and a gift shop.  I have found a few good gifts for people there over the years.  Service is always good although there seems to be some kind of moral objection to spoons for tasks such as stirring coffee. My wife always orders the challa French toast and always loves it.  Most recently, I ordered the salty Madame salmon sandwich.  This was basically an egg and salmon sandwich.  It was good, but not very salty and left a lot of salmon stuck in my teeth.  As we often do, we ordered the salmon patties, which, of course, are not meat.  They  are always delicious.  I usually don't drink alcohol here, but since it was a federal holiday had the house Bloody Mary.  It was good.My wife says the coffee is the best she can get without going to an overpriced fancy coffee shop. You don't have to get a fancy coffee for it to taste good.

6.description: Very comfortable atmosphere and presumably ethical food makes up for portions on the smaller side. The green juice with cherry cider is very tasty as are the lox and eggs.

22.description: Spacious yet cozy cafe made for a great stop on our trip through Andersonville.  Nice tea selection and we also enjoyed a chocolate thing.  Great spot to unwind.

15.description: Fool me once, shame on you.Fool me twice, shame on me.Fool me three times . . . I've been to Kopi several times over the past year (2013-2014) without updating my review. Until now. Each time I've visited Kopi, the quality of food and service have been hit-or-miss. I've been going to Kopi for 20 years, so I was willing to overlook a few mediocre experiences. After years and years of enjoying Kopi's food, service, and atmosphere, I have a history with this business. It's like an old friend. Sometimes that friend is a little moody, but you forgive her and continue with the friendship. There comes a time, though, when that friend abuses the relationship so much, you have to say good-bye forever. That time has come for me and Kopi.The atmosphere is still good. When I went in for breakfast recently, I noticed that some updating had been done, but it still held the same artsy vibe it always had. I sat down and was quickly given menus and waters for two, since I told the waiter I was waiting for a friend. When the friend arrived, she and the waiter exchanged a friendly hug and familiar greetings. Clearly, she'd been going to Kopi even more than I had, over the years.Despite that friendly greeting, once we ordered and received the food, the waiter disappeared. Not in a Halloween-type way, like vanished into a puff of smoke. No, he hung around the bar area, he chatted with another employee, he went into the back for some mysterious purpose. He never checked with us on our food, never refilled coffee or tea, just never did much waiter service at all. There were only three other tables occupied while we were there. It's not like he was so busy.Then there's the food. I ordered a tofu scramble with vegetables for $6.95. I got a tiny soup cup -- you know the kind, what you get when you order a cup of soup in a restaurant instead of a bowl? -- of entrée, and a piece of French bread. That's it. That wasn't even appetizer size. I also ordered the vegetarian sausage. For $3.00, I got three over-cooked pieces of something, each of which was the size of a silver dollar. For $3.00. There were so hard, the tines of my fork actually bent trying to pick one up. I tried eating it just by putting it in my mouth. Burned. Dry. That was $10.00 worth of breakfast.My friend ordered a bagel and asked for extra cream cheese. She did get her bagel, and she did get the cream cheese. The waiter gave her two packets, charging her $.75 for each. She didn't know about the charge until we looked at the check.I was still hungry at the end of breakfast. I saw a treat in the counter, a peanut butter/chocolate muffin. That was $5.50. I scarfed it down on the walk to the car, because I was still so hungry. With tip, I ended up paying $20.00 for a poorly-cooked, tiny portion breakfast. $20.00!!  I am not kidding or exaggerating when I tell you, the tofu scramble and sausage were not enough to feed your 3-year-old. You get a small amount of mediocre food for high prices.No more second chances, Kopi. It took a year of bad experiences, but now, after this final visit, I'm done. From now on, it's M. Henry or Taste of Heaven. I get better more and better food, and better service, for less money.

57.description: I really like this place, and is a nice spot to study or read. Go for tea, which is plentiful and lovely, and not coffee, which is pretty bad for some odd reason. Nice cakes, and very gluten-free/vegan friendly. There is no wireless internet here, and I would go more often otherwise.

20.description: Very comfortable atmosphere and presumably ethical food makes up for portions on the smaller side. The green juice with cherry cider is very tasty as are the lox and eggs.

36.description: This place is super comfortable not to mention the nice staff. The menu is perfect for everyone no matter what your in the mood for. The Mexican latte is to die for!

14.description: Delish vegetable with roasted pepper, avocado, goat cheese with pesto sandwich and jasmine tea. I do see it has many ranges of stuffs like tea, coffee and alcoholic drinks to choose!

12.description: It's really clean, I suppose because it is so new.BLT is my fav.  I asked for cucumbers to be added and they forgot them, no biggie.  Otherwise, everything tasted great.  His Beach Club was delicious.I would go back to this location.

3.description: I like Jimmy Johns better than Subway. Fresh and fast subs. Healthy options and alternatives. The bread is better than other sandwich joints. Love the turkey and bacon.

1.description: Ripoff Alert!  Don't get it delivered!We have been ordering from this JJ for several years.Tonight we ordered 5 Giant Club Sandwiches and 4 bags of chips.  The total was over $50!  When we inquired, they said a $1.50 DELIVERY CHARGE IS ADDED TO EACH SANDWICH!  In addition, they charge another $.05 DELIVERY CHARGE PER BAG OF CHIPS!Looking at the receipt now.     Subtotal:  $42.11     Delivery Charge: $5.89      THAT'S A   14%   DELIVERY CHARGE!That's over $10 each person to eat. Sorry Jimmy Johns in Andersonville, there are way too many better delivery restaurants.And it's not like I am not going to tip the delivery person, I am sure they don't get the extra $$.Given the delivery radius of this store, that is highway robbery!(BTW - with all of that said, it was actually freaky fast)PROs:+  It's Jimmy Johns, it is what it isCons:-  Outrageous delivery fee

2.description: They are fast but it would be nice if they got my order correct especially when I paid extra for the extras. The sandwich makers made it so fast they didn't bother to listen to what I was ordering. It seemed they just wanted to get the day over with.

9.description: Their delivery sucks ....they are not freaky fast.... They get an attitude on the phone when you call to inquire why your freaky fast sub is an hour late!! Go to the Wilson jj.......supernice!

10.description: I don't get delivery from here which seems to be the hot topic here.  The staff is always nice, and they make a good sammich.

13.description: The food is fine. Just like any other Jimmy John's.  It is the wait that made me give them only 1 star.  I work literally 1 block from this location.  I'm not able to leave the building during business hours.  So, if I order food quite often.  The past 2 times I've ordered from here it has taken over an hour to get my sandwich. Yes, just one sandwich.  One block away. Ridiculous!

16.description: Im a pretty big Jimmy Johns fan.  Love the tuna sandwich, whatever they are calling it these days.  Well, my last 5-6 visits to this location, Im finding there's a LOT more lettuce in my sandwich and very little tuna.  And whatever tuna is in the sandwich tastes like a salt lick.  They also used to put cucumbers and alfalfa sprouts on their sandwiches, no more.  These sandwiches arent really cheap to begin with but I'm no longer going to pay $5 for a sandwich full of lettuce.  Sorry Charlie,errr Jimmy!  TRY ANOTHER JIMMY JOHNS LOCATION!!

6.description: This is probably going to be the most ridiculous review I have written. Why? Well first of all its because its a Jimmy John's review and secondly, I really shouldn't care that much. But, alas, I do and I am livid with this establishment. This review definitely deserves a preface. So here are essential facts to consider: 1. I am slightly obsessed with Jimmy Johns. I eat Jimmy Johns at least once a week. Go ahead. Judge me, call me a fatty. Its cool. 2. This location is approximately five blocks from my house. I could literally walk there with a broken leg and make it in less than 10 minutes. But let's leave my laziness out of this. 3. Im on a first name basis with the two delivery drivers. So whats my problem? I have been ordering from this Jimmy Johns on an almost weekly basis and they deliver my food quickly and I tip well and everyone is happy. So I decide to order last night because I was exhausted and hungry. They tell me theyre not supposed to deliver to me because the Lawrence store is my store. I was surprised by that because that store is seriously, super close to me. Plus the Lawrence store had told me in the past that they do NOT deliver to me. Anyway,the guy agrees to deliver it to me. Fast forward an hour later....HEY! WHERE THE F is my food?! Its usually there within 15 minutes. I call the store back. Dallas- "Hey are you guys going to deliver my sandwich?"JJ Guy- "Yes, its on the way".Hmm even more time elapses. Dallas-" Seriously Jimmy Johns, are you gonna deliver my food?!"JJ Guy- "No."Dallas-"What do you mean no, you said it was on the way."JJ Guy- "We transferred it to the other store." (PLUS-he had serious attitude)I call the other store. They had not in fact transferred it to the other store. Yet they lied to me and told me they did and basically left me to starve.

15.description: I LOVE sandwich places and I usually love Jimmy Johns. Unless you like your roast beef dripping blood and soaking the bun I would choose something else. Prices are pretty good though. I would love to have more than 2 pieces of cold bacon on my sandwiches every time I go here.

0.description: Who ARE these people giving Jimmy John's anything less than 5 stars?! I was shocked to see these poor reviews...and people complaining about the price? Come on! The sandwiches are HUGE, and they don't skimp on ANYTHING. That's the price you pay for an awesome sandwich. I always order online, and my order is always delivered freaky fast. I couldn't be happier with my local Jimmy John's. I normally go between the Big John and the Beach Club depending on my mood. I love the Jalapeño Jimmy Chips and the pickles. I have to admit...I developed my Jimmy John's habit in college, so I've been a fan for over 10 years. To date....this is the only meal that truly helps me recover from hangovers. Highly recommended!

5.description: Probably my least favorite review to write to date.  I am a huge Jimmy John's fan and have been a loyal customer for years.  I am only writing the review and giving 2 stars to THIS Jimmy John's establishment due solely on the fact that; This is the SECOND time that it's taken them over and hour to deliver me my food.  Each time I have had to call and ask where my food was.  This last excuse was; "Sorry, we got a little busy."  Great that you guys have tons of business but sorry you lost mine. All in all, food was great, the delivery guy was very apologetic (both times) I still tipped but can't understand their slogan. You are in fact, NOT, freaky fast...so cut the crap.  Maybe when I am standing there waiting for my sub but i guess you could careless about the people outside the shop ordering.  At least when I am in Roger's Park and it's lunchtime at work, I know I'll receive my sandwich in plenty of time; not so I have to choke it down like I have a minute to eat. Good food, Freakishly FALSE pace.

11.description: Yeah, I feel a little goony reviewing Jimmy John's. I know people like Potbelly better, and the cutesy marketing of the chain is enough to kill. But I've picked up a few sammiches from this place, and I love 'em.This is a new location, which may account for part of my satisfaction. The store is still clean and in good condition, and the staff don't hate their jobs yet. They're always very friendly to me, and do their work quickly and efficiently.I like the 7 grain bread they use for their club sandwiches. I like the size of the sandwiches. I like the fact that they're always cutting fresh meat and cheese when I go in. There's a Subway down the street -- at Clark and Montrose -- and I'm sick of their pre-portioned meat and cheese packs. At Jimmy John's, I feel like I'm getting the same quality meat I would get at a grocery store. Maybe not deli quality, but good.Basically, these are the sandwiches you would make if you would get off your lazy butt and make them.

8.description: Most people are very specific about whether they like Jimmy John's, Potbelly's or Subway Sandwich Shop.  I of course like all three, the sandwich-monger that I am.  This Jimmy John's knows me pretty well by now because I'm the one that orders a sandwich the way most people order their Starbucks.  Number 9, French, no cheese, no salami, no onions, extra lettuce, sliced, combo, to go.  It's me and a capicola sandwich in a little bubble of happiness walking briskly back home before I freeze to death.

4.description: Typical Jimmy John's.  There is an annoying obviously gay young guy that works here that is a little over the top.  He has hit on me and my partner both separately and it isn't really called for in a place your trying to grab a sandwich - come on!  Fire that fool and we may come again.

14.description: I recently places a order online at 10:30 a.m. then brushed my teeth, and took out the garbage. When I walked back into my house in those few minutes it took to do those things the doorbell rang and bam Jimmy Johns...it really was freakishly fast! The food as expected was great as well.

7.description: Their food is good, but the wait is unbearable.  The last time I ordered from here it took them 45 mins to get me my food, and now here I sit again, 20 mins after ordering and there is not sandwich here. Freaky fast?  I think not.

58.description: I'm very surprised to see that this place has so many high ratings. Yes the ambience is nice and the employees are nice, but they don't give very good pedicures. First the woman (don't know her name) filed my toe nails so aggressively that she broken the skin around my nail, 10 minutes later, knowing that she had done this, she proceeded to rub nail polish remover right on the area with the broken skin. Ouch! The foot massage (usually the best part and the whole reason I get pedicures) was pathetic... A quick rub and pat pat, no pressure or anything. Definitely not worth $30.

56.description: The service was excellent and Lisa, who did my nails, was incredibly friendly. I was the only guy getting his nails done but was made to feel welcome (it is Andersonville, after all). I'll definitely be going back!

29.description: Real rating: 3.5Great selection of colors. I've gotten the same guy a few time that I've gone and get compliments each time. I gone twice as a walk-in and they accommodates each time and w/o a wait. Good massage chairs.  Other technicians are good, too. Prices are on par with neighborhood salons. Unless I'm in a bind, prolly won't stray away from this place unless I find cheaper and same quality nails somewhere else.They have a discount/rewards program if u pay in cash.  They also prefer cash tips.

42.description: It's ok at best. The decor makes you think you're in a high end place, but the receptionist was rude and yelled across the salon about charging extra to remove my no-chip. The manicure lasted about two weeks, much shorter than I'm used to with no-chips. The many signs about tips and credit cards are tacky. My search for a perfect nail place in A-vile continues.

23.description: This is my favorite place for a mani or pedi. Consistently the technicians do a great job and they give you a great shoulder massage during your mani that feels so good!They offer no-chip and weekly polish for a $5 upgrade. Wednesday is $35 for a mani + pedi. They track your spending so you can earn points towards a free manicure.

47.description: I was SO excited when we first walked in, they were SO nice & so many fun colors for polish! However, I had gel on my toes. Which is powder like acrylic (but not a fake nail) and then gel over it, which is cured under the UV light. So first I tell the nice girl doing my toes that its gel-she tells me it's an extra charge of $10 and they call it 'no chip polish'. Annoying, but ok. Then she realizes it isn't coming off- BECAUSE IT ISN'T POLISH, LIKE I SAID. Then the owner comes over and starts speaking in another language, you can tell she's SUPER annoyed and then starts telling the girl why product is on my toes. Now they get it and start removing it. The owner continues to be extremely rude, then the tech tells me the charge is now an additional $15!! Well, what a great experience... NOT!

8.description: I've been going here for years and i loved it. Not only did they do a wonderful job on my nails each time, but their hot towel shoulder massages we're incredible. I'm a preschool teacher and a mom and I always looked forward to my bi weekly pampering sessions because they were much needed.Well, they must have changed management as well as their employees because I don't see anyone who used to work there anymore and their new method of massage is horrible. The last two times I've been, which was just in the past month or so, I've gotten the same girl, who's definitely new because I've never seen her, and I really didn't like her. She did my nails fine but when it came time for my favorite part, the massage, she was horrible!They used to have you lay your head down and they would give a thorough shoulder massage, under you shirt, then add a hot towel and massage through that as well for more muscle relaxation. This girl just had me sit up the way I was while my nails were drying and just gave me a half assed massage through my layers of clothing.  She didn't even use a hot towel afterward. I'm someone who gave extra tip just for those massages, but this massage was worse than any I've ever gotten. Needless to say, after two years of being a dedicated customer, I will not be returning. If you're looking for a good place just for nails, then they're still good. But the quality of customer care has drastically dropped in the past two months and that's just not acceptable for me.

31.description: Just popped in for a regular pedicure and gel manicure ($65... pricey is an understatement). Oyuka was my nail tech. She was awesome!!! Paid attention to detail, very pleasant, and did a wonderful job. Salon is super cute, modern, CLEAN, & relaxing. They have 6 pedicure stations and 6 manicure stations. The shop was really hard to find. . I went around the block twice before I found it.Id love to go back, but its way out of my price range... even with the stellar service.

34.description: A lovely salon, but, strangely, it was empty on a Friday afternoon.  Maybe because the signage is not good?  I got a nice (and quick) manicure but it only lasted 4 days before it began to chip.  Maybe it was the base coat they used?  The staff is somewhat unfriendly and they give you a very fast manicure (30 minutes and out the door), but it's ok.

16.description: Gave this place a second chance..... I will not be going back. My first visit  August 2014 - I moved into the area and was looking for a nail salon closer to my house.  Service was 'ok'; mani/pedi was 'ok' Second visit  March 2015- Not impressed.  Here is a tip to the nail technician who was doing my nails... smile and be nice because you work in a service industry.  Remember it is not about you, it is about the customer.    And it wasn't even busy!  I was the only one in there!Besides the attitude.  CONS:  sloppy application of the nail polish.  Polish still on my fingers; No exfoliation on the heels or Vitamin E application. Polish were old and left streak marks when applied.  Still have dead skin on my feet PROS: Their tools were sealed separately.

13.description: I love this place.  I've gotten a few no chip manicures here and they've always been great.  They have tons of color options.  They have never made me wait even when I don't have an appointment.  They give a great neck massage after every session.  If you're sick of bargain places that don't do a good job, go to nail palette.  They are professional, clean, quiet, and they do a great job!

11.description: I wanted to like it here. 1) I specifically asked her to smooth the ridges on my big toe nails. I also asked her if she had done it. Both times she said yes. Why can I see ridges shining through the polish?2) the no chip polish application is uneven. She put on 3 coats, thicker in some spots and thinner in others. 3) my fingernails were filed unevenly - different lengths and some slanted4) she rolled her eyes at me when I asked her to fix things eg "will you please cut the big toe nail a little bit more" - simple things!5) I got my nails done on Thursday. Today is Sunday. The tips are already cracking and look darkened. The nail tech was pretty surly. Although she warmed up by the end, I'm not going back. I'm not a big complainer and just decide "it's good enough" because I don't want to make a scene or be there longer than I need to. But $65 plus tip is too expensive to be worth it for the quality of the work.

39.description: Like the other reviewers, I also thought the receptionist was rude with very bad eye contact, but because I knew this beforehand it didn't bother me as much. The technician Lina did a good job, but I believe the polish she used was very old and thick and didn't dry properly. I have a big gouge on one of my toes that I cannot fix because I don't have the color (despite wearing flip flops most of the day). Yeah, never dried. The only reason I went here was because it's close and Nail Bar on Southport closed. Guess I will be going to the Nail Bar on Broadway now!

37.description: I was a loyal customer for a at least two years and referred countless friends and strangers to this salon. The terrible experience I had a while back changed all of that. I suffer from psoriasis and have been going to the doctor for years to treat it. It is a non contagious autoimmune disease and can be socially crippling and stressful. I finally found a place that treated me normally and would not make me feel uncomfortable to get a pedicure and I was so grateful for that. One day I went in and was not able to get my usual angel of a tech, rose, and settled for someone new. Immediately upon sitting down the tech pointed at my legs and yelled for the owner, sue, to come over. Keep in mind that I had been coming regularly once a week for two years and knew sue by name. She somehow got amnesia and was suddenly concerned for my safety and refused to allow the tech to exfoliate my legs. I was used to these types of conversations and calmly explained, again, that it was not contagious, good for me, and my doctor would approve a scrub. I also asked her why it was suddenly a problem, now, with a full salon of patrons watching, because it had never been an issue before. She began rolling her eyes at me at I became so uncomfortable and emotional I began to cry. The people in the chairs were staring and I was devastated because I came to this place as a sort of safety place where I could enjoy the services judgement free. Sue continued badgering me and I left with wet feet and shoes in hand in tears. I don't blame her for my emotions because they run deep with this issue, but I do blame her for terrible customer service skills. She did not have the compassion or intelligence to listen to what I was telling her or consider that I was a customer who paid for services once a week. I have never gone back since and still have negative thoughts even looking at the store front. the technicians there are all sweet and deal with the terrible treatment from the owner and I feel for them so this is in no way a review of services. Thankfully I started medication that has eliminated this from my skin and I now go to two by ten nails on montrose who do an amazing job and never once made me feel out of place. Just keep this in mind before visiting.

0.description: Unlike most other nail salons, Nail Palette is a reprieve from the frenetic energy of the city: with no television in sight to poison the atmosphere with trash tv or endless streams of fake news, Nail Palette is unpretentious and subtle in its approach to offer a soothing, calming experience. Their techniques are unmatched: all of their technicians do good work, although some are definitely more gifted than others in the pressure department (when it comes to the force they apply during exfoliation). The results are always terrific, no matter which tech you get, because of the standards and safeguards they have in place (they'll swab your toes with an oily solution and wrap them in baggies before they help you put on your shoes before departing to prevent any polish rub-away). And since their tools and stations are spic-and-span, you really can throw your head back and close your eyes. Free massages, too. Seasonal complimentary services like paraffin waxing, etc. Once after a very intense house project the day after a manicure, I called ahead and asked if they'd help me retouch and they were very accommodating and gracious.

38.description: I loved that they were able to get my group of 5 girls in an hour after I called for my best friends birthday! They were so accommodating. We were not able to participate in the $40 special as there were a lot of customers and they did wonders just fitting in our pedicures, but I was very excited about the ambiance. They also provide massages! I will go again!

51.description: I came in as a walk-in wanting a mani/ pedi($40). They were able to fit me in for a Pedi ($30)only which was perfectly fine given that i didn't make an appointment and they seem very busy. My nail tech is name ,Rose and she did an excellent job! She was gentle, we get a hot towel,  the leg massage was nice, too.The place is very clean and the staff is very friendly. They have a large varieties of colors which I love ! Tip is cash preferred. I was told that I was finished at the drying station after a short time (they needed the station for another client). I don't think my nails are dry yet but I do have on sandals-whew. I will come back for a Mani /pedi next time!

27.description: Made an appt for a party of 4 for mani-pedis on a slow, snowy Tues afternoon. We were 20 minutes late, all of us were traveling the next day & life was very hectic for us all. I apologized profusely via phone & when I arrived. But the nail technicians were visibly upset, unkind & the most unfriendly service professionals we'd ever seen. Not once did they make eye contact & none of them smiled once. It was almost comical how odd it was. There were NO other customers before, during or after our services that provided over $250 of revenue for this place.After we left, one of my friends told me she was yelled at upon arrival for being late. I wasn't there. Had I known, I would gladly have taken my party across the street. I'm sure there is a legion of loyal customers that have different experiences. But this was ours and it really stunk. 2.5 hours of their unpleasant behavior. We still had fun together.But needless to say, we will never come back to the Nail Palette... the environment was a negative, toxic environment with obviously low morale.

32.description: I paid $75 for a manicure, pedicure and to be insulted by the owner!!I was told a different price over the phone and charged a different price in store. When I questioned it the owner was very rude. OVERPRICED especially for the BELOW AVERAGE work they do.

54.description: I went in for a mani/pedi since its close by but left knowing that I will definitely be back on a consistent basis. Clean environment and friendly employees made it a great 1 hour nail service. Go try them out!

48.description: I wasn't too happy about my mani/pedi here. It was rushed, my polish is sloppy and the technician was rude. Not planning on going back. Even the receptionist was rude, rolled her eyes at me and the group I came with.

44.description: Decent manicures. Pedicure was neither comforting nor complete. Woman who runs the front desk is rude, brusque, and unprofessional. And she's mean to customers too!

24.description: I decided to try out Nail Palette's $35 deal on Wednesdays for a mani pedi before a vacation to Florida. This Chicago winter has been long and rough and my nails needed some TLC! I made an appointment a couple of days before visiting (though not sure if it was necessary, I would recommend for a Wednesday evening because the salon got quite busy) without issue. The receptionist was very friendly, and was happy to help me decide whether to upgrade to a no-chip mani, which I did. My nail technician was friendly enough but mostly quiet, which I appreciate. She did a great job on my pedicure as well as my no-chip mani. It was my first time doing a no-chip and I had a good experience. They have plenty of polish colors to choose from and I spent a good 20 minutes picking my nail color out! I settled on a nice orangey-red that I think was OPI. I was able to match it pretty well to my pedicure. Here it is nearly 13 days later and my mani still looks mainly flawless although I can tell it is just now starting to separate from my nails, and of course it has grown out a bit. I am very pleased and would definitely recommend this salon.

7.description: I have gone here a couple of times...both times I have left incredibly happy. The salon is clean, everyone is super polite...the pedicures and manicures I have gotten have been spot on. I've come in here last minute without making an appointment and they have been able to fit me in. Will continue coming here.

49.description: Although the technicians there are wonderfully nice, the owner's policy on no chip is a double talk mess! The sign in the window guarantees no-chip manicure for "at least" two weeks. Well, mine chipped in 10. I went in today at day 12 because it was my first opportunity to return. I was told that the guarantee is for 10 days. Not only is that never communicated to you during your service (I've been 3 times), but when I pointed out that the sign in the window clearly states two weeks the owner's response to me was "we mean 10 days" and then she proceeded to tell me it would cost me xx dollar per nail to repair!!  I'm sorry. You are NOT the post office. In the real world and in real time two weeks has always and will always be 14 days. Not to mention there are at least 3 other salons in walking distance that don't charge as much, and this place even charges to remove your no chip if they didn't do it!! Despite being spoken to as if I were slow on the uptake as to what 2 weeks is, I stood my ground and she begrudgingly had a tech repair my thumb damage. Amazingly insulting, I can pay my good money to go somewhere else. Too bad, because the techs are very nice.

40.description: My experience has changed :(  If I want to get treated crappy, I can go down the street for a cheaper price, & be treated the same. The owner/manager (not sure) is nice to people she recognizes. Same with the employees. No tech looks happy to be there. Jade, sure wasn't happy to give me a manicure. Hey, a job is a job. And Andersonville has wonderful & kind customers. So be nice to the good guys like me :)Also, the 1st time I went in it was a nice surprise to not have all the tech's speaking in their language the entire time. Well, that has changed :( Bummer!Manicures=4 starsCustomer Service=1 starPrice=3 starsIf the employees, including the owner is more considerate & happy to get business, this place would be great. Come on, this is an easy fix

53.description: I used to love this place.....even have received a few gift certificates from friends as gifts, because they knew how much I liked it. It's clean, they have good music and a nice ambiance. And, they USED to have great service. This place has gone down down down hill the last few visits, and today was my last for sure. If you are going to charge $40 for a mani/pedi (not the most expensive place, but about $5 more than the joints down the street) then, give a little better service. The whole process is quick, they seem annoyed and its uncomfortable. The "massage" is literally less than 30 sec.......why even offer one? The most enjoyable part of a pedi to me, is the one moment when you get a little rub down.......blink and you'll miss it here. Don't waste your money. Go to a more down to earth place, where they remember how to take care of their clients.

30.description: This place is really cute, the ambiance was great, wonderful music selection. They had tons of polish options and nice equipment. The problem came in with the actual service. My cousin and my pedicures were not good. Our feet were barely soaked. They didn't even turn on the jacuzzi in the basin like we saw them do with everyone else. I'm actually home now and I still have dead skin on my feet. My no chip was done fine but still not great as there is polish in my cuticles. There was a nice shoulder massage but it didn't even last three minutes. I know this because it didn't last a whole light rotation for my no chip. The whole experience was lacking. We won't go back.

46.description: Amazing! Love the location. It's right near all sorts of cute Andersonville shops and restaurants. Decided to go with my friend on a lazy Sunday and we got appointments for 30 minutes from the time we called. Service was great and they go a little extra mile for you with the neck massage at the end of the mani/pedi.  Best is that for all this it was only $40 for both services and the of course a tip. Will be back again!

1.description: I went to The Salon today to do the nail chip. The lady was very nice and polite But she very difficult to deal with. The first thing I told her was that I didn't want her to file my nails at all! She started insisting saying she was gonna do it just a little bit to make them more even. I didn't want to argue with her so I said " just a little bit, keep the size it is. I don't want them shorter at all". Well... She wanted to use the nail clipper to do a little bit???I said NO! Anyways.. She started filing my nails a bit and as she was not satisfied she decided to file the corners of my nails, which I hate! It makes the nail rounded and it looks weird and ugly. Again I had to tell her, "don't do it. It's ok the way it's". . And all the time she started explaining why she was doing that as if she was the one who would decide what to do on my nail!!! Not yet satisfied, she decided to use a nail clipper to cut the corner of my nails!!! What??? It's the worst thing I've ever seen! Again, it makes the nail be rounded, uneven like a triangle.. Horrible. I was clear I like it square and to leave it the way it was!! After all, I asked her to cover one of the nails better as I still could see the white of it and the nail polish was red. I tried to keep checking all the nails to ask her to cover the sides better or the top of the nail because I know that all of these people don't cover 100% of The NAil with The Nail Polish just to make IT easier to clean up! Well, she didn't let me check, asking to put my hands back inside the little neon machine. I understand but then in the end my nails were done and I found many parts of them that were not covered with the nail polish !!! I was not satisfied at all. Her massage was good but honestly... To spend almost $50, I expected to have my nails done EXACTLY the way I want and not the way they like it. It's so frustrating. In 3 days I'm sure my nails will look like as if I had done them a week ago just because she didn't want to cover the full nail with the no chip polish. Not happy at all!!!

55.description: I will definitely go back to Nail Palette.  It's close to my apt, and I was able to make an appt for the same day I called.  The personnel were very nice (esp the receptionist).  It was an easy, relaxed environment - exactly what I'm looking for when I get my nails done. I received a manicure, and it came out well.  I'll go back again for another, and possibly try a pedicure next time too. I would absolutely recommend this location to others. Thanks!

9.description: I decided to try out Nail Palette's $35 deal on Wednesdays for a mani pedi before a vacation to Florida. This Chicago winter has been long and rough and my nails needed some TLC! I made an appointment a couple of days before visiting (though not sure if it was necessary, I would recommend for a Wednesday evening because the salon got quite busy) without issue. The receptionist was very friendly, and was happy to help me decide whether to upgrade to a no-chip mani, which I did. My nail technician was friendly enough but mostly quiet, which I appreciate. She did a great job on my pedicure as well as my no-chip mani. It was my first time doing a no-chip and I had a good experience. They have plenty of polish colors to choose from and I spent a good 20 minutes picking my nail color out! I settled on a nice orangey-red that I think was OPI. I was able to match it pretty well to my pedicure. Here it is nearly 13 days later and my mani still looks mainly flawless although I can tell it is just now starting to separate from my nails, and of course it has grown out a bit. I am very pleased and would definitely recommend this salon.

26.description: Gave this place a second chance..... I will not be going back. My first visit  August 2014 - I moved into the area and was looking for a nail salon closer to my house.  Service was 'ok'; mani/pedi was 'ok' Second visit  March 2015- Not impressed.  Here is a tip to the nail technician who was doing my nails... smile and be nice because you work in a service industry.  Remember it is not about you, it is about the customer.    And it wasn't even busy!  I was the only one in there!Besides the attitude.  CONS:  sloppy application of the nail polish.  Polish still on my fingers; No exfoliation on the heels or Vitamin E application. Polish were old and left streak marks when applied.  Still have dead skin on my feet PROS: Their tools were sealed separately.

25.description: Little gem! Moved out of the neighborhood a couple years ago but I still make the trek to this location, well worth it. I won't go elsewhere! Very clean and comfortable, great ambience. Professional staff. And who doesn't love an added treat of a shoulder massage?! This place is the best!

12.description: Reasonable price. First timer but had a wonderful experience. Jurie was so sweet! I might've just found my nail salon in the city!

59.description: My first experience was good.  In preparation for my scuba diving trip, I was on the look out for a place that does acrylic nails (apparently, not too many places on the North-side uses it).  My two thumbs were damaged and I wanted to smooth them out without putting on a fake/press-on nail.  In doing some research (thanks youtube) I stumbled upon using acrylic. When they told me they could, I booked immediately.After arriving, I told them I was interested in a mani/pedi.  I was sat in your typical chair (massage) and the process began.  The special for the month of Feb was with a pedi you get a mud scrub or heal cream.  I went for the mud.  Very nice.  With the mani you get neck/shoulder massage or paraffin wax..  Of course, I went for the paraffin wax treatment.  My hands felt so soft after it. With regards to the acrylic, it turned out very well.  After the application, you couldn't even tell that my thumbnails were damaged. The guy that performed the service did an amazing job.  He was friendly, gentle, and very skillful.

21.description: Was pleasantly surprised when I walked into this tiny salon. It was clean and organized. Truly disappointed in the no chip manicure I received though. I have never had one last less than a week. By day 4 it started to peel. Not acceptable when you're paying 40+ for the service!

17.description: Just popped in for a regular pedicure and gel manicure ($65... pricey is an understatement). Oyuka was my nail tech. She was awesome!!! Paid attention to detail, very pleasant, and did a wonderful job. Salon is super cute, modern, CLEAN, & relaxing. They have 6 pedicure stations and 6 manicure stations. The shop was really hard to find. . I went around the block twice before I found it.Id love to go back, but its way out of my price range... even with the stellar service.

10.description: There are so many nail options on in Andersonville, and I think I've tried them all. Nail Palette exceeded my expectations. Prices were reasonable for the area ($65 for pedi and no chip mani), and they had a winter special when I was there that included a choice of free treatment with each pedicure and each manicure. I opted for the heal scrub and hand paraffin dip. The environment is clean and friendly. Give them a try!

5.description: I love this nail salon! It is a bit small, but not too much smaller than a typical nail salon. I think this place has very nice and sophisticated charm. It's not quite as "fancy" as Salon O or 2x10, but it's still nice and clean. With that being said, I actually like this salon because there are no televisions in the background. As for the treatment, I got a mani/pedi and both were fabulous. The woman really cleaned up my feet and there was a seasonal special, so I got a bonus heel scrub. For my manicure, I also got a free bonus neck massage. In addition, I thought my nails liked great -- no paint on my skin, no cuticles out of line, and perfectly square with rounded edges. I definitely recommend using nail palette.

3.description: I got an essie no-chip mani on May 12. Today is June 8 and it still hasn't chipped. I'm impressed equally by the longevity of this manicure as by the demonstration, in the manner of my 6th grade science experiments on Lima beans, that nails grow only from the quick. I paid full price for this manicure as I did not have time to go on discount day- worth every penny!The lotion/skin treatment aspects weren't as great as other places I've tried, but I'll make a few more visits and nail palette could definitely be a 5-star spot.

35.description: The owner refused to honor a gift certificate purchased over the phone.  The owner texted a photo of the gift certificate that had my name & the gift certificate number and the credit card customer and store receipts.  Both receipts had our names and phone numbers on it. The photo was taken on their counter.  The owner never mailed the hard copies. The owner refused to honor the text photo she sent and she also refused to look up the gift certificate. This was a birthday gift.  My friend is filing a credit card dispute.  She is also making a report to the Better Business Bureau.  Eek is the right word for this salon.

19.description: After moving and trying to like several other salons, I'm driving the extra time for nail palette. My tech was super detailed. The massage during your manicure is a nice touch. And I honestly feel like they care about their job, the place is super clean and no attitude. With two kids and constant dishes, laundry etc, my manicures always last.

28.description: After years, I still love this place. I only go to Nail Palette for manicures & pedicures.

45.description: I had a HORRIBLE experience here! The front desk was completely apathetic to me and at one point, when I asked a DIRECT question about other services, after my mani-pedi, while I was drying (and they were not busy with other people), I was stared at right in the eye and was refused an answer. I was LIVID with anger! Just shocking. The nail tech was soooooo rude to me. No listening skills whatsoever. I kept having to repeat myself. I also experienced a couple eyerolls. I had JUST recovered from years of a painful illness that almost took my life. I could not have massages, and one of my toenails was infected and a a little warped in the middle. Not that bad, just evident. I was nervous and explained about being bedridden for a couple years. I was actually MADE FUN OF BY THE EMPLOYEES OUT LOUD AS THEY MOCKED MY TOENAIL AND ME EXPLAINING THAT I HAD ALMOST DIED!!! I've never been so angry or treated with such horrific disrespect in my life, apart from a hair salon down Clark St. where a psycho stylist held her scissors to my throat and threatened me, "as a joke', because I seemed "too passive" (she lost her job). The nail tech (a male) also GRABBED AND YANKED my hands several times, after I'd just explained for the 10th time that I was in agony from a crippling illness, and then he cut me from being too rough, and laughed that I got scared to continue.So, If you want to be openly abused and pay for a crappy mani-pedi-head on over to Nail Palette.
