33.description: This friendly factor here is hit or miss, depending on how your check-in goes and who does your nails. The products are always very nice, especially for the pedicures, but often I feel like the technician is rushing or is irritated with the place in general.

43.description: Nail tech was very unfriendly. No eye contact, no smile. She must hate her job. I'm used to unfriendly service from going to Korean restaurants and it doesn't normally bother me but this nail tech was insufferable.  She didn't massage my feet or hands which I found unusual. All these I could have been ok with but the straw that broke the camel's back was that my fingernail polish only lasted 2 days before major chipping happened. I have gotten my nails done at nail salons on Argyle and they normally last 7 to 10 days before they start to look bad. Totally unacceptable. Will not be going back.

2.description: Nice staff, but terrible eyebrow wax. I left with my eyebrows looking too short and uneven. My brows have a strong shape and are not hard to work with-- I'm very surprised and disappointed in what they turned them into.

18.description: This is my favorite place for a mani or pedi. Consistently the technicians do a great job and they give you a great shoulder massage during your mani that feels so good!They offer no-chip and weekly polish for a $5 upgrade. Wednesday is $35 for a mani + pedi. They track your spending so you can earn points towards a free manicure.

41.description: Great when you can get an appointment but unfortunately I don't plan my mani/pedi a week in advance. And is it just me or is the owner questionably unkind to the technicians?

52.description: I hate to say this but I have never had a stellar experience here. Every time my appointment has been messed up and then the receptionist tells me I was wrong when I arrive.  Pedi was ok, not great.  The nail tech was rude. There is a guy there that does a GREAT job.  Not impressed.  I am not going back.

50.description: This is my favorite place to get a mani-pedi!  They are fantastic and always do a top-notch job.   Very clean and the staff is personable and sweet. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

4.description: I ended up going to Nail Palette after the nail place I was originally going to go to was closed. Nail Palette is very clean, the service is great, I really liked my nail technician, and loved the little hot towel massage at the end of my manicure. What I didn't love was this: the price is ridiculous. At first I thought, "Well, I'm treating myself! It was worth it this one time." But then it wasn't worth it. Within a couple of days, my no-chip manicure was cracking and had taken on a very dirty color. What I was so excited about originally, I ended up hating. If I could afford it, I would probably give Nail Palette another chance because I did enjoy my experience there, but unfortunately that won't be happening.

6.description: My no chip manicure started peeling off after 5 days. For the amount of $$ this manicure cost, I would not return.

22.description: No-chip manicures are very pricey 40+ dollars. I was willing to pay this until the second time around when my no-chip lasted less then 24 hours. Unfortunately I was on a flight to Italy therefore unable to go back and resolve this matter. It started out with one nail on the plane ride and soon most of the polish came off shortly after. Colors are great but definitely wouldn't go back to the place. Even in the dinky places no-chip manicures last more than 24 hours. If you want to pay $$ then be my guest. No guarantees if will last longer than 24 hours though. I'm still in Italy less than 6 days into my 12 day trip, thankfully there are places to buy nail polish to fix my no-chip disaster from nail palette.

15.description: The lady who was doing my nails was very nice and friendly, she was trying to do a good job, no problem with that. However, it's one of the most expensive no chip in the area, other places in the neighborhood charge $30-35 for no chip, while it's $40 there, and there is no price list which would be visible enough. I paid $55 with the tip for no chip French manicure, and on day 4 it chipped. For expensive service like that such poor quality is unacceptable. Never coming back.

57.description: My friends and I called on a Friday afternoon hoping we could get some last minute appointments around the same time.  Luckily we were able to get 3 appointments togther 30 minutes later!$40 gets you a great mani-pedi: foot soak, cleanup, foot and leg massage and scrub,  polish, hand massage, NECK massage (yes, you read correctly!) and great service.  $5 more for french.  They dry your toes under the the manicure desk so they are completely dry by the time you leave...they have awesome fingernail dryers that you pop your hands in for a few minutes before you leave.  I'm the type of person who has to do her nails right before bedtime because I'm afraid of messing them up (which I somehow tend to do in my sleep anyway).  I left and my nails were completely dry and I was not afraid of messing them up.When I get my nails done I like to read a magazine, putz around on my phone and not make conversation...and that's exactly what I did.I will return!

20.description: I wanted to like it here. 1) I specifically asked her to smooth the ridges on my big toe nails. I also asked her if she had done it. Both times she said yes. Why can I see ridges shining through the polish?2) the no chip polish application is uneven. She put on 3 coats, thicker in some spots and thinner in others. 3) my fingernails were filed unevenly - different lengths and some slanted4) she rolled her eyes at me when I asked her to fix things eg "will you please cut the big toe nail a little bit more" - simple things!5) I got my nails done on Thursday. Today is Sunday. The tips are already cracking and look darkened. The nail tech was pretty surly. Although she warmed up by the end, I'm not going back. I'm not a big complainer and just decide "it's good enough" because I don't want to make a scene or be there longer than I need to. But $65 plus tip is too expensive to be worth it for the quality of the work.

36.description: I am really happy with this salon. They are always consistent in their service and they have always done an outstanding job on my nails. A bit pricey but well worth it for pampering yourself.  ( as we all should)

14.description: First time here but so excited to say I have finally found my permanent nail salon. Great experience! I have been to all the others in Andersonville and this one is the best by far!! Great customer service with excellent skills and great atmosphere !!

1.description: This is one of the nice-looking new Walgreens, but the pharmacists here seem like they couldn't care less about the people they serve. By and large they treat customers like anonymous problems they need to quickly get past, rather than people in need of informed healthcare professionals. I've been here many times to pick up prescriptions but I've never had a pharmacist here offer any information about the medicine he or she was handing to me, other than to say something like, You have any questions? In fact, a number of times I've had to ask for clarification about my medication, while they just stare numbly at me and then give a terse answer, despite the fact that there are rarely long lines. Is being a pharmacist here really that unpleasant?

9.description: I think we've all been to a lot of Walgreen's and the like over the course of our lives. This one has been consistently great, but yesterday pushed it over the top. A cashier went completely out of her way to find me a coupon and give me a discount, and it showed me that she knows the products, what coupons are currently available, and she actually wants to help people out and save money. Way above and beyond. In the past, I've gotten a flu shot here as well and that was a quick, painless, smooth, and sanitary process. Chain stores do vary based on management and personnel, and if you need a local pharmacy and necessities store, this is a great one to choose.

12.description: Thank you Walgreens!  This location is huge, it has everything expected and it's very well organized. Everything is easy to find and I love the fresh sandwiches and salads.  The best part is I never have walk into that disgusting Jewel ever again. You have filled the need for the neighborhood!  For that, I am eternally grateful!

21.description: Ouch. Harsh reviews for this Walgreens...It's a Walgreens. It's like every other Walgreens I've been to. The store was clean and organized. Nice wrapping paper selection. I bought some wrapping paper, paid for it and left. I didn't have to wait long in line. Other than that, no out of the ordinary experiences here.

16.description: I went to pick up my prescription before work today and despite the store opening at 8am the pharmacy was not. I waited 5 minutes but had to get to work on time. You'd think the staff would get there prior to opening!

17.description: I heart my neighborhood Walgreens. The store is always clean, great sales, and the workers are both friendly and available to answer any questions.

10.description: I love this store! It's clean, big, and carries things I never knew I would need. Cute jewelry for 2.99!A big reason for my review was how friendly the staff is. I have never had such a pleasant time at a Walgreens. I hope it never changes. As long as its like this I will make it my home store!

5.description: I have recently had a problem with the pharmacy. I have a broken arm, my Dr. wrote a RX for tylenol with codeine. I understand it is a controlled substance...but, Last refill I was told that they only have generic not the brand name. No problem, they called around to other stores and located the drugs. They said they couldn't just transfer the drugs to Clark st. That i had to go to the other store. We  had to drive to that store, wait,  finally got the RX. I just went to Clark for another refill. Same story, I really don't understand why they can't just get the drug in stock. I was told to tell my Dr. to re-write the RX. Really.I am the one with the broken arm. I need to get a ride each time  and now have to be present since they now want my drivers license to process my RX. Not good customer service!

11.description: This is the cleanest Walgreens I have ever been in. Even the little sale signs are all individually straightened. It's like they are ready to film a commercial in there at any moment. On my first trip I even asked if they had just opened-- nope. Over a year ago.The pharmacy is amazing. The people who work there always are friendly, and almost talk me into a discussion with the pharmacist just to make sure I am comfortable with my medications. If you are shopping for something in the toiletries/cosmetics area, a cosmetics specialist will find you, and make sure that you do not require any additional help. I have seen a woman in the store that likes the grocery section so much that she has a hard time carrying all of her grocery bags by herself when she leaves. Pretty amazing considering the Walgreens is ACROSS FROM JEWEL.If you are looking for someone to hold your hand or curtsy when you present yourself maybe not for you. [other reviewers] For a convenience store it really owns all.

22.description: This is a combined review for the Pharmacy section and the store section. First of all, the store looked wonderful (but, it's new, so no surprise there) but the staff was horrible. We walked in, happy to have a Walgreens closer and excited about the opening. I never expect much from drug store employees; it's tedious work and I always see them dealing with jerk customers, so, we just stick to ourselves. However, we got shunted aside by some employee who apparently desperately needed to fill the fridges with two energy drinks. No excuse me, no nothing. When we went to pay for our items, there was a line and only one clerk. When the other appeared he just stood there for about two minutes, not saying anything. He jerked his head towards us, like we were some sort of 1950s lackey, and I guess that meant he had been waiting for us to step over. Uh, what? How was I supposed to know your register was open? You were just standing there, staring straight ahead like a zombie, dude. The Pharmacy was even worse. We were helped by this female pharmacist named Aidelyn (I'm sure I'm arranging the letters wrong, but her name was either this or something quite similar), who was incredibly rude, lazy, and generally unhelpful. She was unnecessarily sharp, couldn't be bothered to check with other male pharmacist about our medication, and didn't even give us the medicine she said she was giving us. We called an hour earlier, trying to switch our prescription, and talked to a male pharmacist, who said all of them would be switched. They weren't. When we came in and mentioned this, she claimed that she had no idea who we talked to (uh, there's only you and one other guy, lady... soooooo e_O) and acted like it was a big pain in her ass to try and fill them. Honey, if you don't like your job or DOING your job, I suggest you get another one.

0.description: Love that there's a Walgreens right down the street from us, but the pharmacy hours kinda blow. Why have the pharmacy close hours before the rest of the store?

20.description: No, really, so far the place has earned it's lame reviews, even for Walgreens. What's up with the pharmacy? For years, I got prescriptions filled at the Broadway-Ridge location without a hitch. I switched here when it opened because it's more convenient. In a few short months I've had more problems than I had in years at the other location: prescriptions delayed because they were out of stock, prescriptions delayed because they were slow to followup with a doctor when they had a question for him, and being shorted on the number of pills that I was prescribed (I guess I have to stop, open the bottle and count before I leave the store here?). Management needs to get its act together at this store. Period.

19.description: Love this Walgreens. Its brand new, well stocked, super clean and the people are super nice-- especially in photo!

2.description: I was contemplating writing this review but decided there were definitelya few things worth mentioning here regarding this store/location.So, here goes!This is actually one of the nicer Walgreens I have seen, now granted theyare one of the newer stores and they still look/play that part which is definitelya good thing, this is a well stocked store with prepared food items thatyou can just pick up to go, fresh fruits, salads, sandwiches, and otherassorted items.The aisles are merchandised well, although the layout of the store kind ofconfuses me sometimes for some of the aisles run North and South, and thenEast and West and I was looking for Softsoap yesterday and finally foundit on the back wall, but, hey, I was just happy I found it!Okay, also just had to say if Hostess ever decides to go out of businessagain you can come to this Walgreens and get your very own HostessTwinkie and Cupcake Makers, yes, this is true, I found these  at Walgreensyesterday for the price of $19.99!God, I hope it never comes down to having to make my own Twinkies when I get the urge but I guess this is good to know!Really, this is a great Walgreens, and I don't mind upon entering beingtold  Welcome to Walgreens at all..However, yesterday I did get a little irked when the cashier/associate told meto stay/ be well upon leaving because I have a cold right now and I guessI'm just being crabby..Anyway, FYI, Good Sales, always make sure to check out the Walgreens Ad.although those darn points seem to take forever before they add up..Free parking lot at the door, and a Redbox that usually has a betterselection of movies/choices than the Jewel across the street..So, 4 stars goes out to this Walgreens..And, I think I will put that Twinkie Maker on my Christmas Wish List...

18.description: This is a great, very friendly Walgreens! I was extremely appreciative of the pharmacy staff who were thorough and helpful in helping me with my prescriptions and talked to me anytime something came up. The store is very organized and clean as well with a variety of sections. Great place!

13.description: This is one of the nicest Walgreens stores I have ever been in.  It is large, well organized, and clean.  The location is good in a busy part of Andersonville, and I've always been reasonably impressed by customer service.  Not that I would go out of my way to go here rather than another pharmacy, but I do enjoy this store when I'm in the neighborhood.

4.description: This Walgreens is arguably my favorite in the city due to the warm spirited greeting I always get as I walk in the front door as well as the waiting time, or lack thereof at the pharmacy. Every time I visit I am in and out in a timely fashion and leave satisfied. I would recommend this location over other nearby locations in the city.

6.description: This is about pharmacy only. I came to pick up prescribed eye drops for my 2 year old. Lady working there ( big bones, brown hair) started giving me instructions how to apply ointment. It's tragically funny that somebody who works in pharmacy doesn't know the difference between eye drops and ointment. Older guy looked at prescription and corrected her. She told me to sit down and wait a couple of minutes. 25 minutes later I got the message that my meds are ready for the pick up. I asked them and they tell me to wait more. 30 min after the big bone lady comes out to register again. I told her that I'm still waiting and that I got the message my meds are ready. She tells me to stand in line. After all my waiting for pick up only!When I told her  that I have sick child at home and that she should have told me it will take a long time, so I can do something else instead of sitting there, she ignored me. The guy with strange mustaches that works there apologized to me, but the big bone was totally not interested. She couldn't care less. I really think she should be fired. She had no knowledge, no interest for her job and was totally unprofessional. Maybe on her next job she will care more. Fire her.

15.description: This is a combined review for the Pharmacy section and the store section. First of all, the store looked wonderful (but, it's new, so no surprise there) but the staff was horrible. We walked in, happy to have a Walgreens closer and excited about the opening. I never expect much from drug store employees; it's tedious work and I always see them dealing with jerk customers, so, we just stick to ourselves. However, we got shunted aside by some employee who apparently desperately needed to fill the fridges with two energy drinks. No excuse me, no nothing. When we went to pay for our items, there was a line and only one clerk. When the other appeared he just stood there for about two minutes, not saying anything. He jerked his head towards us, like we were some sort of 1950s lackey, and I guess that meant he had been waiting for us to step over. Uh, what? How was I supposed to know your register was open? You were just standing there, staring straight ahead like a zombie, dude. The Pharmacy was even worse. We were helped by this female pharmacist named Aidelyn (I'm sure I'm arranging the letters wrong, but her name was either this or something quite similar), who was incredibly rude, lazy, and generally unhelpful. She was unnecessarily sharp, couldn't be bothered to check with other male pharmacist about our medication, and didn't even give us the medicine she said she was giving us. We called an hour earlier, trying to switch our prescription, and talked to a male pharmacist, who said all of them would be switched. They weren't. When we came in and mentioned this, she claimed that she had no idea who we talked to (uh, there's only you and one other guy, lady... soooooo e_O) and acted like it was a big pain in her ass to try and fill them. Honey, if you don't like your job or DOING your job, I suggest you get another one.

7.description: The Clark/Catalpa store (known locally as The IC-3 Store) is a hit or miss. If you're lucky you are there when the good staff is working, they couldn't be friendlier or more helpful. If you hear the IC-3 page over and over while you are shopping just leave your items where you are and walk out. It means the lazy staff is on duty and can't be bothered.

8.description: This Walgreens was a big deal when it opened in Andersonville!  I didn't really think I'd like it, but so far it has been there when I've been in the area and need a quick stop for a soda, some trash bags, or some Rips candy.  Their parking lot is huge and feels like a real treat for any establishment on Clark St.  The employees are friendly, and things are well stocked.  They also have a modernized pharmacy section with big screen televisions, chairs where you can wait for prescriptions, and magazines to read!  The lines can get long quickly at the front registers, but they're pretty good about getting people out of there in a timely manner.

3.description: The manager Diane was super helpful and very neighborhood oriented. I really appreciated her help and friendliness.

14.description: Ouch. Harsh reviews for this Walgreens...It's a Walgreens. It's like every other Walgreens I've been to. The store was clean and organized. Nice wrapping paper selection. I bought some wrapping paper, paid for it and left. I didn't have to wait long in line. Other than that, no out of the ordinary experiences here.

28.description: Being from out of town, and never having been to Giordano's before, I was unsure what to expect and honestly chose Giordano's for the open curbside eatery experience. But wow -- the staff was welcoming, and the waiter and gave me all kinds of tourism tips, as well as delivering superior service in terms of timeliness of table service. The pizza was incredibly rich. Yum! I had the personal stuffed cheese pizza, which is more like a thick crust pie packed with flavor. Haven't had anything like it before, and now that I'm back in Kansas City I long for it! Thanks for making this visitor feel like royalty!

1.description: No joke, in one visit at this giordanos, we experienced:- a special needs customer with a special needs dog get turned away for dinner by the manager - someone in our party never got their order in time, so we told the waitress to forget the order since the salad never came in time... The waitress brought it anyways as we were getting the check and she charged us for the salad that arrived late and was actually canceled. - poor service all around, too many examples to list - inappropriately dressed hostesses (wear a bra) This was all in one hour and a half dinner. Not a great experience, step it up and get it together.

39.description: I've had Giordano's pizza countless times in the past from various locations around the city. This location is on par, if not better than the rest.It has street-level windows which open to Clark street. Nice for people watching and enjoying the warm weather while you wait for your pizza. They also have four split TV's over the bar with different sports playing. If a big game is on, the TV changes to one huge picture. I caught this feature when the Kentucky Derby started.The staff was extra nice and attentive. Genuinely friendly, fast and accommodating.We ordered a thin crust pizza which was on point with my previous experiences with Giordano's. It came quick and was delicious as always. Washed it down with a 312 draft.All and all, our group of four left happy and satisfied. A Chicago staple welcomed to Andersonville.

9.description: I've had Giordano's pizza countless times in the past from various locations around the city. This location is on par, if not better than the rest.It has street-level windows which open to Clark street. Nice for people watching and enjoying the warm weather while you wait for your pizza. They also have four split TV's over the bar with different sports playing. If a big game is on, the TV changes to one huge picture. I caught this feature when the Kentucky Derby started.The staff was extra nice and attentive. Genuinely friendly, fast and accommodating.We ordered a thin crust pizza which was on point with my previous experiences with Giordano's. It came quick and was delicious as always. Washed it down with a 312 draft.All and all, our group of four left happy and satisfied. A Chicago staple welcomed to Andersonville.

29.description: This was my first Chicago pizza experience, and I was blown away.  Had a mushroom and sausage stuffed pizza, and a blood orange mojito.  The drink was sweet, more like a sugary cocktail than a traditional mojito, but was exactly what I had been looking for.But the pizza.  We ordered a small and barely finished it between the two of us.  It was really great. Cheesy and sausagy and tomatoey in all the right ways.  It was so good that when I told my buddies staying in the hotel with me about it they promptly went and ordered one from another location.There was no wait for seating, which was nice on a Tuesday night, though food did take a bit of time to arrive, though I think that has more to do with the size of the stuffed pizza and less about the service.  The open kitchen was fun to look in and see how hard those guys worked.

23.description: Nice addition to the neighborhood . Nice space, good service . Good option if you have little ones. If you do bring children, order the pizzas ahead of time!!!

5.description: Super yummy in the tummy here!  The staff is always very friendly and personable.  I always feel comforable ordering ESPECIALLY when Mikey is there.  Get the sampler! YUMMMM.

31.description: THE ABSOLUTE WORST. If you call to order a pizza, a recorded message encourages you to do so online. BEWARE. I tried to order via phone but attempts to "press 3 to speak to somebody" were met with an immediate drop in the call. Finally, I shrugged and ordered carry out online. Order is accepted and I'm told it will be an hour. Then I get an order confirmation and it notes the pick-up time for 5pm...THE NEXT DAY. Their system took my order despite the restaurant being closed. I call the next morning, explain the error & ask that the order be cancelled. I'm assured this will be handled. Fast forward to 4:55pm, Giordano's calls to let me know that my order is "ready to rock & roll." I explain that I cancelled the order and why I had to do so, they employee assures me that the charge will be cancelled and they'll take care of everything. I put this out of mind, assuming it's taken care of. A couple weeks later, I notice the charge on my credit card bill. They did NOT cancel it. I call to ask for a refund and the manager says they can give me store credit (ugh, no thanks) or call corporate to get a form, then call me to fill it out, then send it to corporate, then I'll get my refund. This is entirely ridiculous, so I just processed a dispute with my credit card to avoid this runaround. Also, between the initial order and finding the charge on my card, I placed another order - online, again. After placing the order, I realized I never got an email confirmation. Call the restaurant and they assume my name is something other than what it is and disappear to investigate. After telling me there is no order under that name, I tell them they had it wrong and what my real name is...which they still don't hear correctly. After 3 minutes of just trying to give them my freaking name, they finally figure it out and see that there is indeed no record of the order which I placed.  Apparently the "easiest way to order" is not online because they screw it up every time. Also, the pizza is not that great. Lou Malnati's delivers to Andersonville now and that's better pizza. Also, Ranalli's is cheaper and also better. I will never go back to this hot mess of an establishment. Giordano's is by no means a new player in the pizza business, but based on my experience and that of my friends, this place can't tell their ass from a hole in the ground.

25.description: ORIGINAL CHICAGO CHICKEN CHOPPED SALAD. My mouth was watering for this salad the day after eating Giordano's because it was THAT good. It's the perfect blend of everything you could want in a salad. It's also the perfect appetizer as you wait 45 minutes for your deep dish pizza. Other appetizers that we ordered were the garlic parmesan fries and chicken wings. All of the appetizers were so delicious that I almost forgot what we went to Giordano's for in the first place! As a first timer to Chicago, I can't compare the pizza to other locations in the city, but it sure was yummy!I haven't been to any of the other Giordano's locations, but I was very satisfied with this location. We went at around 7:30 or 8pm and expected to be waiting outside for a table. There was actually no wait for our party of four and there were several empty tables around us. There's a bunch of seating upstairs, which is probably why we didn't have to wait. I also heard that this location is fairly new. If I was ever back in Chicago, I wouldn't mind coming back here, but I would also want to try other deep dish pizza restaurants.

12.description: I love Giordano's My favorite is the deep Special.  It's just the best pizza anywhere!  Always fresh, hot and just perfect!  I wish they would open a location in Virginia where I currently live!

37.description: Ordered online tonight, and the scheduled wait time for delivery was an hour and 45 minutes. Ok, whatever. 2 hours 15 minutes later, still nothing. I call. "Your pizza has been sitting here. We are waiting for the driver to come back and pick up your order. Shouldn't be more than another 30 minutes." F that. No one needs to wait 3 hours for a (what will probably be) cold pizza. I understand this location is new, but this is Andersonville. If you can't keep up with the high quality standards of the area, then Bye, Felicia.

21.description: This location opened on my birthday, April 28, and I couldn't think of a better present!  Had a great birthday dinner there, and have been back several times.  Recently my friend was visiting from Atlanta and was craving stuffed pizza, so we headed here after work.  I work in the neighborhood, and it wasn't very busy, so we sat for a good 2 1/2 hours.  Eating, drinking, and laughing.  No one tried to rush us or get us out.  The ONLY thing I wasn't a fan of is the stool style seating at some tables.  It's really uncomfortable.

16.description: I've had two experiences with this location:DINE-IN:  I LOVE the decor.  It deviates from the standard Giordano's decor and I love the Chicago-feel.  The bar is a big plus as well as the big screen TV.  I can watch my favorite Bulls/Blackhawks games and enjoy a slize of za!  Bonus... the pizza rocks!DELIVERY:  Had no issues with delivery and my pizza came hot and fresh.  Delivery time is good based on the popularity of the Giordano's chain.  No complains and I was happy I got to enjoy it at home.Tip:  get garlic on your pizza!  Never thought to do it... tried it based on an employee's recommendation and it's delicious!

17.description: This was Giordano's last chance to redeem themselves. Ordered pizza for delivery. Was told it would be an hour and a half.  Fair enough given it is Friday night, a little before 6pm and the World Series is coming on soon. Over two hours later, still no pizza.  It had better kiss me on the lips and call me "Mommy!" when it arrives or I may walk up to their store and throw the damn pizza at their window!

10.description: Came here for lunch today and loved my experience. Due to the wonderful weather they hit a button and the windows closest to the street open up and it feels like you're sitting outside. I sat down and enjoyed a personal pan pizza (which was filling), fries and a Matilda Pale Ale. This spot is a good addition to the neighborhood.  There are other Giordanos' locations up north that are comparable in terms of food and service.  But none of them have the aesthetic awesomeness of this place

11.description: If you like to WAIT HOURS for delivery then this is the restaurant for you! Best idea is to make a snack to hold you over because you are going to be WAITING FOR HOURS! Go ahead, walk the dog, watch a movie, start working on your honey-do list because you aren't eating any time soon. If you want Giordano's for dinner order at lunch and you should be good.

26.description: Same great Giordano's stuffed pizza in a slightly-closer-to-home location.  It's too bad that they have finally come to the neighborhood just as we are getting ready to leave!  We have been well served by the Damen/Montrose location over the years, but we threw Clark/Foster some business before moving.It seems like a cool Giordano's in which to dine, if you are so inclined.  There is a neat CTA map and a garage-style door that opens up the front nicely on warm days.  My household is a strictly take-out pizza household, and we did not have any problems with ordering or delays as other reviewers have noted.They sent some coupons to my home shortly after opening:  the standard Giordano's duo--$2 off an order over $10, and $5 off an order over $25--plus a new one--a free house or caesar salad with any pizza purchase.  That is by far the best value, as those salads retail for eight bucks.  And it's not the standard, crappy pizza-shop house salad; it features nice greens, radiccio, fennel, tomatoes, and shaved asiago with lemon vinaigrette.  It is a damn good salad!

27.description: Decided to drop by during the Andersonville festival as it started to rain, the host were friendly and we were immediately seated in their upstairs dining room. Fast forward 25mins, no one has greeted our table. Finally someone comes by apologized for the delay and ask if he can start us with drinks, another 20 mins goes by and he brings out drinks. While setting them on the table he spills a nice portion on my drink on my friends phone. Ok mistakes happen and he agrees to comp our first round. I then hurry to put a food order in as who knows when they will come back. 10 mins later our server finally approached my friends decide to order additional items, I let him know that I already ordered pizza he says he will check on it. Another 20 mins pass and the guy who spilled the drink, who I later found out was the GM, says that my pizza will be up soon. Another 20 mins later the server comes back and says that the order was never put in as my friends wings come but still no pizza that I ordered over 1hr ago. We were convinced that the guy who spilled the drink didn't even work there and we were in the twilight zone or someone was going to jump out and say we were on a tv show, or that the GM was high on something. It was overall just weird and lengthy. We were informed of a rush due to the rain but it was Saturday evening and an event night I would think they would have adequate coverage of the dining area. But we got a free round and they comped my pizza, the food was all good and hot and we liked our drinks so I'll give 3 stars but the service needs to be reevaluated

35.description: I'm so happy Giordanos has made it to Andersonville!  I love the fact that you can get pizza but also more healthy options. It's also great to see what they have done to the space. It's nice to see an old favorite adjust to modern times. We ate there last week with the kids and they had fun and I had a margarita in a "hip" feeling spot.  The servers were super nice and accommodating. We definitely will be back!

8.description: Where to begin? I have had a few terrible experiences with this restaurant, which is my own fault for giving them multiple chances. I've had numerous delivery problems with this place. One time, they did not deliver my pizza because after ordering, I did not call them to "confirm" the time. When I called, asking where the pizza was, they hung up on me. When I called back, upset that I had been treated so rudely, I was told that I would be comped a pizza next time around. I am sure this was to entice me to order from there again, which I did. Of course, when I called back they had never heard of this comped pizza.The next time, we ordered carry out (because you cannot trust your food will ever arrive if you order delivery), and when my husband got there, they could not process any kind of payment. He even offered to pay cash, and that would not work. After about 15 minutes, I called to check on the order and asked if they could give him the food and call for payment later, as we have young children and it had been a while. They quite rudely told me that they could resolve the issue quicker if they did not have to be on the phone with me. I have given this place about four chances, all of which have been a mess. I will absolutely never eat or order from here (or any other Giordano's) again. The food is no better than anywhere else, and even if it is close by, it's not worth the hassle and rude service.

0.description: On the north side of the city, this newer Giordano's location is by far the best to order takeout from. I'd been going to Montrose for many years and just eventually became disgusted with their terrible service, lack of communication on accurate wait-times for delivery, and cold pizza delivered. THIS place has been awesome!! Ordered here several times now and they are clear when delivery will be a long wait, they are friendly, and the pizza is delicious; just what I've loved about Giordano's for so many years.

38.description: I've had two experiences with this location:DINE-IN:  I LOVE the decor.  It deviates from the standard Giordano's decor and I love the Chicago-feel.  The bar is a big plus as well as the big screen TV.  I can watch my favorite Bulls/Blackhawks games and enjoy a slize of za!  Bonus... the pizza rocks!DELIVERY:  Had no issues with delivery and my pizza came hot and fresh.  Delivery time is good based on the popularity of the Giordano's chain.  No complains and I was happy I got to enjoy it at home.Tip:  get garlic on your pizza!  Never thought to do it... tried it based on an employee's recommendation and it's delicious!

20.description: My friend and I went up to Andersonville for a change of scenery and were surprised to see a Giordano's. After pricing the other area restaurants (way too high) we decided to eat there. Turned out we should have chosen a higher priced option (not that this place is cheap). We ordered a pizza on regular crust, we waited about an hour, they served us the right topping on a thin crust. The pizza itself was mediocre. Service was acceptable, waitress pleasant. But the worst part was the overall atmosphere. The acoustics in the place are horrible. Sound ricochets off the walls and you can hardly hear the person across the table speaking. It's one cacophony of blurry sound. Neither my friend nor I are super sensitive to loud noises, but after more than an hour we couldn't wait to get out of there. We asked for check and box (that also took way too long) and ran for quiet Clark Street. We weren't the only ones annoyed with the poor acoustics either. Two parties asked to be moved somewhere more quiet. There is no where quiet in that place. I've been to bars that are loud, but the sound doesn't hammer inside your head. I'd never return to that location again.

19.description: I guess I'm giving up on Giordano's for delivery.  Since they opened this locale last spring, I have attempted to order a delivery four or five times but was unable.The problem always starts with a "no delivery times available" message on the on-line system, which is odd  given I always order early to mid-evening.  This happened a few times and I just gave up and ordered elsewhere.   A few months later I tried again and same thing, only this time I called and asked if there was a problem with their system. The curt, obviously put off woman who answered said they had turned off the on-line system because they were backed up.  Wha? I sensed she expected me to just say, "thanks, bye."  Instead I asked if I could place an order, to which she replied that it would be three hours. I said fine, and she proceeded to take my order with all the warmth of a prison warden.  This was a Saturday around 8:00 PM, three hours before closing.  I got the pizza in about one hour.  A couple months later here I am again--tonight--and same thing.  I tried to re-direct to the Sheridan location this time (they make a better pie anyway), but the system wouldn't allow it.  So, I called again and was told that they weren't taking delivery orders tonight--at all!  Saturday evening before 8:00 PM and they aren't delivering pizzas?This time I wasn't very nice, which I sort of feel bad about..but not really.  What the hell...isn't delivering pizza pretty basic to operating a pizzeria, especially when they  offer this service?  Aren't delivered orders a large chunk of a pizzeria's revenue?  Or am I just crazy?With my five stifled orders, that's $150 from this customer alone that went to the competition. I like Giordano's, but now have been cut off from their delivery because they opened this lousy location and I can no longer order from Sheridan--or the Clark locale either, apparently.  Hell, even Calo's a few doors down, a primarily dining in kind of place, gets their pies delivered without issue.It's wet and 25 degrees out and I wanted a pizza delivered!

33.description: This Giordanos is the best representation of Chicago pizza dining experience both architechturally and from a palate perspective.  The chopped salad and calarmari was simple yet robust in flavor.  The pizza?  Well what can I say---we ordered a little bit of everything since we had large group.  It was all fantastic.  The neighborhood is fun too.  You can shop before and walk off your calories after! Dont forget to try the smore pizza.

2.description: We ordered a pizza at 3:30 --we received it at 5:20. They said it would take an hour and fifteen minutes. I am not great at math but...After an hour and a half we called to ask and they said it was out for delivery and should be there in 10-15 min. Not true. We now have cold pizza and are wondering why we didn't just order from Calo's.

34.description: The new Giordanos location in Andersonville is fabulous. Great look just perfect for the location. We had a large group and shared an amazing Chicago-style stuffed pizza, north AND south- side Italian Beef sandwiches, chicken carbonara rigatoni plus a few salads. We really liked that the salads came in 3 different sizes so we could choose a little of some and a lot of some others. My personal fave was the Original Chopped Chicken salad. We'll be back!

32.description: Maybe 2 and a half stars.This was our first time at a Giordano's and since we aren't from Chicago, one of our few deep dish experiences.  Pizza was good, service was very friendly, if inexperienced (I get it, this is a new location).  Greek salad was good.But the drinks were horrendous, and if we can't even get one drinkable glass of wine, then what's the point in going out?  The dining experience was ruined by the horrible drinks.  I tried to order a Negroni but no Campari and only one type of gin.  So cocktails aren't really their specialty, no problem, but if you are going to serve cocktails and put them on a cocktail list, then at least make them correctly.  The cocktails we ordered from their cocktail list were watered down and undrinkable -- a mojito in a large iced tea glass that was 3/4 club soda and the rest what tasted like Hawaiian Punch -- not sure there was even any rum in it.  The Lakeshore Effect (a cocktail on the menu) equally watered down.   We also tried four different red wines by the glass and they were all rot gut.  It is 2015 -- put at least one drinkable glass of wine on the menu.

18.description: Can I give this place negative stars? I decided to give them another try since they are in the neighborhood. I figured third times a charm. This time I ordered on giordanos.com. (Which is annoying that they are not on grubhub but that's a whole other story). I ordered at 6:30. Figured it should be here in an hour.  7:35 rolls around no pizza. I call them up. Guess what, they only have one driver! Really?? And there's a two hour wait on pizzas. So I won't get my thin crust pizza till 8:30. No! I will not try you again Giordano's, never again. I'll go to Calo's or Johnny Brown Bag or any one of the hundreds of other places that know how to deliver food. Done!

13.description: Online order placed at 5:37. Requested delivery time 7:00At 6:15 I received a call from Giordanos asking me if I wanted my pizza a early. I said yes. It's now 7:27 and I still don't have my food.

4.description: This location is so disappointing. I love Giordano's pizza. It's been my favorite deep dish for years. But, this location sucks. I have not had the extensive delivery times or service issues  that it seems most people have had because I've only eaten 2 pizzas from there. One in the restaurant and one that we ordered and picked up. The pizza itself is VERY sub-standard at best. I don't understand how the other 3 or so Giordano's I have eaten at in the city have such good stuffed pizza but this Andersonville locations does not!!!!Save your palate, save your money and order from the Giordano's at Montrose and Damen. They deliver on time and their pizza is 100% better.

24.description: This is the best Giordano's I've ever been to. I get delivery frequently, it comes within the timeframe hot and fresh. The chicken sausage is the most amazing, delicious taste. The wings are good as well!

6.description: 2Pac vs. BiggieApple vs. AndroidThe Green Power Ranger vs. the Blue Power RangerThese are the battles that have shaped the common eraNow: Giordano's vs. Lou Malnati'sI choose Giordano's.Why? Reason #1: When I'm eating carbs, I want to FEEL the carbs. I want to feel them in my hands, I want to feel them in my mouth, I want to feel them as I digest them. And trust me, readers, digestion of this stuffed pizza will take you DAYS. Giordano's has the carbs game down. The crust is crispy yet gentle and flavorful in a way that Lou Malnati's simply isn't.Reason #2: That SAUCE. It's hearty, zesty, and has a great consistency. There's always enough and there aren't chunks of tomato on your pizza that you have to try not to bite in just such a way that makes them fall on your lap (I'm looking at you Lou).My vote? Giordano's all the way.

22.description: I was very disappointed in the service at this particular Giordano's restaurant. My father in law called ahead to make our reservation and place the order, per the request of the restaurant. We arrived on time, and were promptly seated. Our group was fairly large, around 12 people, but I didn't expect that would be a problem as we had a reservation, and placed orders prior to arrival. ................Boy, was I wrong. Some of the group ordered appetizers and drinks, which were not served until well after the pizzas were delivered. That's right. We got our pizza first, then our appetizers and drinks. We also were not checked on by our server until about halfway through the meal. It was so bad that at one point, my father in law walked back to the kitchen to ask for water and the progress of the rest of the food. As this was a family outing, I was pretty annoyed. My family lives in Michigan and were excited to experience what is supposed to be the best pizza in town. Unfortunately, the disorganization of the crew working overshadowed what was actually "not bad" pizza.I have eaten at other locations, and would recommend each one over this one. It is a shame really, as I enjoyed the way the place decorated. But, I would rather eat in a poorly designed establishment than eat a poorly executed meal.:-/

15.description: I was very disappointed in the service at this particular Giordano's restaurant. My father in law called ahead to make our reservation and place the order, per the request of the restaurant. We arrived on time, and were promptly seated. Our group was fairly large, around 12 people, but I didn't expect that would be a problem as we had a reservation, and placed orders prior to arrival. ................Boy, was I wrong. Some of the group ordered appetizers and drinks, which were not served until well after the pizzas were delivered. That's right. We got our pizza first, then our appetizers and drinks. It is a shame really, as I enjoyed the way the place decorated. But, I would rather eat in a poorly designed establishment than eat a poorly executed meal.:-/
